when they were gone out of the city,  were not yet far off, Joseph said to his steward, Up, follow after the men,  when thou overtake them, say to them, Why have ye rewarded evil for good?
Is not this that in which my lord drinks,  how he indeed divines? Ye have done evil in so doing.
he overtook them,  he spoke to them these words.
they said to him, Why does my lord speak such words as these? Far be it from thy servants that they should do such a thing.
Behold, the money, which we found in our sacks' mouths, we brought again to thee out of the land of Canaan. How then would we steal out of thy lord's house silver or gold?
With whomever of thy servants it be found, let him die,  we also will be my lord's bondmen.
he said, Now also let it be according to your words. He with whom it is found shall be my bondman,  ye shall be blameless.
Then they hurried,  took down every man his sack to the ground,  opened every man his sack.
he searched,  began at the eldest,  left off at the youngest. And the cup was found in Benjamin's sack.
Then they tore their clothes,  every man loaded his donkey,  returned to the city.
Judah and his brothers came to Joseph's house. And he was yet there,  they fell before him on the ground.
Joseph said to them, What deed is this that ye have done? Know ye not that such a man as I can indeed divine?

he said, Far be it from me that I should do so. The man in whose hand the cup is found, he shall be my bondman,  as for you, get you up in peace to your father.
Then Judah came near to him,  said, Oh, my lord, let thy servant, I pray thee, speak a word in my lord's ears,  let not thine anger burn against thy servant, for thou are even as Pharaoh.
My lord asked his servants, saying, Have ye a father, or a brother?
we said to my lord, We have a father, an old man,  a child of his old age, a little one. And his brother is dead,  he alone is left of his mother,  his father loves him.
thou said to thy servants, Bring him down to me, that I may set my eyes upon him.
we said to my lord, The young man cannot leave his father, for if he should leave his father, his father would die.
thou said to thy servants, Unless your youngest brother come down with you, ye shall see my face no more.
it came to pass when we came up to thy servant my father, we told him the words of my lord.
our father said, Go again, buy us a little food.
we said, We cannot go down. If our youngest brother be with us, then will we go down, for we may not see the man's face unless our youngest brother be with us.
thy servant my father said to us, Ye know that my wife bore me two sons.
the one went out from me,  I said, Surely he is torn in pieces,  I have not seen him since.
if ye take this one also from me,  harm befall him, ye will bring down my gray hairs with sorrow to Sheol.
Now therefore when I come to thy servant my father,  the young man is not with us, since his life is bound up in the young man's life,
it will come to pass, when he sees that the young man is not with us, that he will die. And thy servants will bring down the gray hairs of thy servant our father with sorrow to Sheol.
For thy servant became surety for the young man to my father, saying, If I do not bring him to thee, then I shall bear the blame to my father forever.
Now therefore, let thy servant, I pray thee, abide a bondman to my lord instead of the young man,  let the young man go up with his brothers.
For how shall I go up to my father, if the young man be not with me? Lest I see the evil that shall come on my father.
Then Joseph could not restrain himself before all those who stood before him,  he cried out, Cause every man to go out from me. And no man stood with him while Joseph made himself known to his brothers.
he wept aloud,  the Egyptians heard,  the house of Pharaoh heard.

now be not grieved, nor angry with yourselves, that ye sold me here, for God sent me before you to preserve life.
For the famine has been in the land these two years,  there are yet five years, in which there shall be neither plowing nor harvest.
God sent me before you to preserve for you a remnant on the earth,  to save you alive by a great deliverance.
So now it was not you that sent me here,  God,  he has made me a father to Pharaoh,  lord of all his house,  ruler over all the land of Egypt.

So Joseph bought all the land of Egypt for Pharaoh. For the Egyptians, every man, sold his field, because the famine was severe upon them. And the land became Pharaoh's.

they said, Thou have saved our lives. Let us find favor in the sight of my lord,  we will be Pharaoh's servants.
Joseph made it a statute concerning the land of Egypt to this day, that Pharaoh should have the fifth. Only the land of the priests alone did not become Pharaoh's.

the time drew near that Israel must die. And he called his son Joseph,  said to him, If now I have found favor in thy sight, put thy hand, I pray thee, under my thigh,  deal kindly and truly with me. Bury me not, I pray thee, in Egypt,
but when I sleep with my fathers, thou shall carry me out of Egypt,  bury me in their burying place. And he said, I will do as thou have said.
he said, Swear to me,  he swore to him. And Israel bowed himself upon the head of the bed.
it came to pass after these things, that it was reported to Joseph, Behold, thy father is sick. And he took with him his two sons, Manasseh and Ephraim.
it was reported to Jacob, saying, Behold, thy son Joseph comes to thee. And Israel strengthened himself,  sat upon the bed.
Jacob said to Joseph, God Almighty appeared to me at Luz in the land of Canaan,  blessed me,
said to me, Behold, I will make thee fruitful,  multiply thee,  I will make of thee a company of peoples,  will give this land to thy seed after thee for an everlasting possession.
now thy two sons, who were born to thee in the land of Egypt before I came to thee into Egypt, are mine, Ephraim and Manasseh, even as Reuben and Simeon, shall be mine.
thy issue, which thou beget after them, shall be thine, they shall be called after the name of their brothers in their inheritance.
as for me, when I came from Paddan, Rachel died by me in the land of Canaan on the way, when there was still some distance to come to Ephrath. And I buried her there on the way to Ephrath (the same is Bethlehem).
Israel beheld Joseph's sons,  said, Who are these?
Joseph said to his father, They are my sons, whom God has given me here. And he said, Bring them, I pray thee, to me,  I will bless them.
Now the eyes of Israel were dim for age, so that he could not see. And he brought them near to him,  he kissed them,  embraced them.
Israel said to Joseph, I had not thought to see thy face, , lo, God has let me see thy seed also.
Joseph brought them out from between his knees,  he bowed himself with his face to the earth.
Joseph took them both, Ephraim in his right hand toward Israel's left hand,  Manasseh in his left hand toward Israel's right hand,  brought them near to him.
Israel stretched out his right hand,  laid it upon Ephraim's head, who was the younger,  his left hand upon Manasseh's head, guiding his hands deliberately, for Manasseh was the firstborn.
he blessed Joseph,  said, The God before whom my fathers Abraham and Isaac walked, the God who has fed me all my life long to this day,
the agent who has redeemed me from all evil, bless the lads,  let my name be named on them,  the name of my fathers Abraham and Isaac,  let them grow into a multitude in the midst of the earth.
when Joseph saw that his father laid his right hand upon the head of Ephraim, it displeased him. And he held up his father's hand, to remove it from Ephraim's head to Manasseh's head.
Joseph said to his father, Not so, my father, for this is the firstborn, put thy right hand upon his head.
his father refused,  said, I know, my son, I know. He also shall become a people,  he also shall be great. However, his younger brother shall be greater than he,  his seed shall become a multitude of nations.
he blessed them that day, saying, In thee will Israel bless, saying, God make thee as Ephraim and as Manasseh. And he set Ephraim before Manasseh.
Israel said to Joseph, Behold, I die,  God will be with you,  bring you again to the land of your fathers.
Moreover I have given to thee one portion above thy brothers, which I took out of the hand of the Amorite with my sword and with my bow.
Jacob called to his sons,  said, gather yourselves together, that I may tell you that which shall befall you in the latter days.
Assemble yourselves,  hear, ye sons of Jacob,  hearken to Israel your father.
Reuben, thou are my firstborn, my might,  the beginning of my strength, the pre-eminence of dignity,  the pre-eminence of power.
Boiling over as water, thou shall not have the pre-eminence, because thou went up to thy father's bed, then thou defiled it; he went up to my couch.
Simeon and Levi are brothers, weapons of violence are their swords.
O my soul, come not thou into their council, to their assembly, my glory, be not thou united, for in their anger they slew a man,  in their self-will they hocked an ox.
Cursed be their anger, for it was fierce,  their wrath, for it was cruel. I will divide them in Jacob,  scatter them in Israel.
Judah, thy brothers shall praise thee. Thy hand shall be on the neck of thine enemies. Thy father's sons shall bow down before thee.
Judah is a lion's whelp. From the prey, my son, thou have gone up. He stooped down, he couched as a lion,  as a lioness, who shall rouse him up?
The scepter shall not depart from Judah, nor the ruler's staff from between his feet, until he comes to whom it belongs,  to him shall the obedience of the peoples be.
Binding his foal to the vine,  his donkey's colt to the choice vine, he has washed his garments in wine,  his vesture in the blood of grapes.
His eyes shall be red with wine,  his teeth white with milk.
Zebulun shall dwell at the haven of the sea,  he shall be for a haven of ships. And his border shall be upon Sidon.
Issachar is a strong donkey, couching down between the sheepfolds.
he saw a resting place that it was good,  the land that it was pleasant. And he bowed his shoulder to bear,  became a servant under task work.
Dan shall judge his people, as one of the tribes of Israel.
Dan shall be a serpent in the way, an adder in the path, that bites the horse's heels, so that his rider falls backward.
I have waited for thy salvation, O Jehovah.
Gad, a troop shall press upon him,  he shall press upon their heel.
Out of the Asher his bread shall be fat,  he shall yield royal dainties.
Naphtali is a hind let loose. He gives goodly words.
Joseph is a fruitful bough, a fruitful bough by a fountain, his branches run over the wall.
The archers have sorely grieved him,  shot at him,  persecute him,
but his bow abode in strength. And the arms of his hands were made strong by the hands of the Mighty One of Jacob (From there is the shepherd, the stone of Israel),
even by the God of thy father, who shall help thee,  by the Almighty, who shall bless thee with blessings of heaven above, blessings of the deep that couches beneath, blessings of the breasts,  of the womb.
The blessings of thy father have prevailed above the blessings of my forefathers to the utmost bound of the everlasting hills. They shall be on the head of Joseph,  on the crown of the head of him who was separate from his brothers.
Benjamin is a wolf that ravens. In the morning he shall devour the prey,  at evening he shall divide the spoil.
All these are the twelve tribes of Israel,  this is it that their father spoke to them and blessed them; every man according to his blessing he blessed them.
he ordered them,  said to them, I am to be gathered to my people. Bury me with my fathers in the cave that is in the field of Ephron the Hittite,
in the cave that is in the field of Machpelah, which is before Mamre, in the land of Canaan, which Abraham bought with the field from Ephron the Hittite for a possession of a burying place.
There they buried Abraham and Sarah his wife, there they buried Isaac and Rebekah his wife,  there I buried Leah,
the field and the cave that is in it, which was purchased from the sons of Heth.
when Jacob made an end of charging his sons, he gathered up his feet into the bed,  yielded up the spirit,  was gathered to his people.
Joseph fell upon his father's face,  wept upon him,  kissed him.
Joseph commanded his servants the physicians to embalm his father. And the physicians embalmed Israel.
forty days were fulfilled for him, for so are fulfilled the days of embalming. And the Egyptians wept for him seventy days.
when the days of weeping for him were past, Joseph spoke to the house of Pharaoh, saying, If now I have found favor in your eyes, speak, I pray you, in the ears of Pharaoh, saying,
My father made me swear, saying, Lo, I die. In my grave which I have dug for me in the land of Canaan, there shall thou bury me. Now therefore let me go up, I pray thee,  bury my father,  I will come again.
Pharaoh said, Go up,  bury thy father, according as he made thee swear.
Joseph went up to bury his father,  with him went up all the servants of Pharaoh, the elders of his house,  all the elders of the land of Egypt,
all the house of Joseph,  his brothers,  his father's house. Only their little ones,  their flocks,  their herds, they left in the land of Goshen.
there went up with him both chariots and horsemen. And it was a very great company.
they came to the threshing floor of Atad, which is beyond the Jordan. And there they lamented with a very great and sore lamentation. And he made a mourning for his father seven days.
when the inhabitants of the land, the Canaanites, saw the mourning in the floor of Atad, they said, This is a grievous mourning to the Egyptians. Therefore the name of it was called Abel-mizraim, which is beyond the Jordan.
his sons did to him according as he commanded them.
For his sons carried him into the land of Canaan,  buried him in the cave of the field of Machpelah, which Abraham bought with the field, for a possession of a burying place, of Ephron the Hittite, before Mamre.
Joseph returned into Egypt, he,  his brothers,  all who went up with him to bury his father, after he had buried his father.
when Joseph's brothers saw that their father was dead, they said, It may be that Joseph will hate us,  will fully requite us all the evil which we did to him.
they sent a message to Joseph, saying, Thy father commanded before he died, saying,
So shall ye say to Joseph, Forgive, I pray thee now, the transgression of thy brothers,  their sin, because they did to thee evil. And now, we pray thee, forgive the transgression of the servants of the God of thy father. And Joseph wept when they spoke to him.
his brothers also went and fell down before his face,  they said, Behold, we are thy servants.
Joseph said to them, Fear not, for am I in the place of God?
as for you, ye meant evil against me,  God meant it for good, to bring to pass, as it is this day, to save much people alive.
Now therefore fear ye not. I will nourish you,  your little ones. And he comforted them,  spoke kindly to them.
Joseph dwelt in Egypt, he,  his father's house. And Joseph lived a hundred and ten years.
Joseph saw Ephraim's sons of the third generation. Also the sons of Machir the son of Manasseh were born upon Joseph's knees.
Joseph said to his brothers, I die,  God will surely visit you,  bring you up out of this land to the land which he swore to Abraham, to Isaac,  to Jacob.
Joseph took an oath of the sons of Israel, saying, God will surely visit you,  ye shall carry up my bones from here.
So Joseph died, being a hundred and ten years old,  they embalmed him,  he was put in a coffin in Egypt.
Exodus
Exod. Now these are the names of the sons of Israel who came into Egypt (every man and his household who came with Jacob):
Exod. Reuben, Simeon, Levi,  Judah,
Exod. Issachar, Zebulun,  Benjamin,
Exod. Dan and Naphtali, Gad and Asher.
Exod. And all the souls who came out of the loins of Jacob were seventy souls. And Joseph was in Egypt already.
Exod. And Joseph died,  all his brothers,  all that generation.
Exod. And the sons of Israel were fruitful,  increased abundantly,  multiplied,  grew exceedingly mighty,  the land was filled with them.
Exod. Now there arose a new king over Egypt, who knew not Joseph.
Exod. And he said to his people, Behold, the people of the sons of Israel are more and mightier than we.
Exod. Come, let us deal craftily with them, lest they multiply,  it come to pass, that, when war happens, they also join themselves to our enemies,  fight against us,  get them up out of the land.
Exod. Therefore they set taskmasters over them to afflict them with their burdens. And they built store-cities for Pharaoh, Pithom and Rameses.
Exod. But the more they afflicted them, the more they multiplied and the more they spread out. And they were grieved because of the sons of Israel.
Exod. And the Egyptians made the sons of Israel to serve with rigor.
Exod. And they made their lives bitter with hard service, in mortar and in brick,  in all manner of service in the field, all their service, with which they made them serve with rigor.
Exod. And the king of Egypt spoke to the Hebrew midwives, of whom the name of the one was Shiphrah,  the name of the other Puah.
Exod. And he said, When ye do the office of a midwife to the Hebrew women,  see them upon the birth-stool, if it be a son, then ye shall kill him,  if it be a daughter, then she shall live.
Exod. But the midwives feared God,  did not do as the king of Egypt commanded them,  saved the male children alive.
Exod. And the king of Egypt called for the midwives,  said to them, Why have ye done this thing,  have saved the male children alive?
Exod. And the midwives said to Pharaoh, Because the Hebrew women are not as the Egyptian women, for they are lively,  are delivered before the midwife comes to them.
Exod. And God dealt well with the midwives. And the people multiplied,  grew very mighty.
Exod. And it came to pass, because the midwives feared God, that he made them households.
Exod. And Pharaoh ordered all his people, saying, Every son that is born ye shall cast into the river,  every daughter ye shall save alive.
Exod. And there went a man of the house of Levi,  took to wife a daughter of Levi.
Exod. And the woman conceived,  bore a son. And when she saw him that he was a goodly child, she hid him three months.
Exod. And when she could no longer hide him, she took for him an ark of bulrushes,  daubed it with slime and with pitch. And she put the child in it,  laid it in the reeds by the river's edge.
Exod. And his sister stood afar off, to know what would be done to him.
Exod. And the daughter of Pharaoh came down to bathe at the river,  her maidens walked along by the riverside. And she saw the ark among the reeds,  sent her handmaid to fetch it.
Exod. And she opened it,  saw the child, , behold, the babe wept. And she had compassion on him,  said, This is one of the Hebrews' children.
Exod. Then his sister said to Pharaoh's daughter, Shall I go and call a nurse for thee from the Hebrew women, that she may nurse the child for thee?
Exod. And Pharaoh's daughter said to her, Go. And the maiden went and called the child's mother.
Exod. And Pharaoh's daughter said to her, Take this child away,  nurse it for me,  I will give thee thy wages. And the woman took the child,  nursed it.
Exod. And the child grew,  she brought him to Pharaoh's daughter,  he became her son. And she called his name Moses,  said, Because I drew him out of the water.
Exod. And it came to pass in those days, when Moses was grown up, that he went out to his brothers,  looked on their burdens. And he saw an Egyptian smiting a Hebrew, one of his brothers.
Exod. And he looked this way and that way,  when he saw that there was no man, he smote the Egyptian,  hid him in the sand.
Exod. And he went out the second day, , behold, two men of the Hebrews were striving together. And he said to him who did the wrong, Why do thou smite thy neighbor?
Exod. And he said, Who made thee a prince and a judge over us? Do thou think to kill me, as thou killed the Egyptian? And Moses feared,  said, Surely the thing is known.
Exod. Now when Pharaoh heard this thing, he sought to kill Moses. But Moses fled from the face of Pharaoh,  dwelt in the land of Midian,  he sat down by a well.
Exod. Now the priest of Midian had seven daughters. And they came and drew water,  filled the troughs to water their father's flock.
Exod. And the shepherds came and drove them away,  Moses stood up and helped them,  watered their flock.
Exod. And when they came to Reuel their father, he said, How is it that ye have come so soon today?
Exod. And they said, An Egyptian delivered us out of the hand of the shepherds,  moreover he drew water for us,  watered the flock.
Exod. And he said to his daughters, And where is he? Why is it that ye have left the man? Call him, that he may eat bread.
Exod. And Moses was content to dwell with the man,  he gave Moses Zipporah his daughter.
Exod. And she bore a son,  he called his name Gershom, for he said, I have been a sojourner in a foreign land.
Exod. And it came to pass in the course of those many days, that the king of Egypt died. And the sons of Israel sighed because of the bondage,  they cried,  their cry came up to God because of the bondage.
Exod. And God heard their groaning,  God remembered his covenant with Abraham, with Isaac,  with Jacob.
Exod. And God saw the sons of Israel,  God took knowledge of them.
Exod. Now Moses was keeping the flock of Jethro his father-in-law, the priest of Midian. And he led the flock to the back of the wilderness,  came to the mountain of God, to Horeb.
Exod. And the agent of Jehovah appeared to him in a flame of fire out of the midst of a bush. And he looked, , behold, the bush burned with fire,  the bush was not consumed.
Exod. And Moses said, I will turn aside now,  see this great sight, why the bush is not burnt.
Exod. And when Jehovah saw that he turned aside to see, God called to him out of the midst of the bush,  said, Moses, Moses. And he said, Here I am.
Exod. And he said, Do not draw near here. Put off thy shoes from off thy feet, for the place on which thou stand is holy ground.
Exod. Moreover he said, I am the God of thy father, the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac,  the God of Jacob. And Moses hid his face, for he was afraid to look upon God.
Exod. And Jehovah said, I have surely seen the affliction of my people who are in Egypt,  have heard their cry because of their taskmasters, for I know their sorrows.
Exod. And I have come down to deliver them out of the hand of the Egyptians,  to bring them up out of that land to a good and large land, to a land flowing with milk and honey, to the place of the Canaanite,  the Hittite,  the Amorite,  the Perizzite,  the Hivite,  the Jebusite.
Exod. And now, behold, the cry of the sons of Israel has come to me. Moreover I have seen the oppression with which the Egyptians oppress them.
Exod. Come now therefore,  I will send thee to Pharaoh, that thou may bring forth my people the sons of Israel out of Egypt.
Exod. And Moses said to God, Who am I, that I should go to Pharaoh,  that I should bring forth the sons of Israel out of Egypt?
Exod. And he said, I will certainly be with thee. And this shall be the sign to thee, that I have sent thee: When thou have brought forth the people out of Egypt, ye shall serve God upon this mountain.
Exod. And Moses said to God, Behold, when I come to the sons of Israel,  shall say to them, The God of your fathers has sent me to you,  they shall say to me, What is his name? What shall I say to them?
Exod. And God said to Moses, I AM WHO I AM. And he said, Thus shall thou say to the sons of Israel, I AM has sent me to you.
Exod. And God said moreover to Moses, Thus shall thou say to the sons of Israel, Jehovah, the God of your fathers, the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac,  the God of Jacob, has sent me to you. This is my name forever,  this is my memorial to all generations.
Exod. Go,  gather the elders of Israel together,  say to them, Jehovah, the God of your fathers, the God of Abraham, of Isaac,  of Jacob, has appeared to me, saying, I have surely visited you,  seen that which is done to you in Egypt.
Exod. And I have said, I will bring you up out of the affliction of Egypt to the land of the Canaanite,  the Hittite,  the Amorite,  the Perizzite,  the Hivite,  the Jebusite, to a land flowing with milk and honey.
Exod. And they shall hearken to thy voice. And thou shall come, thou and the elders of Israel, to the king of Egypt,  ye shall say to him, Jehovah, the God of the Hebrews, has met with us. And now let us go, we pray thee, three days' journey into the wilderness, that we may sacrifice to Jehovah our God.
Exod. And I know that the king of Egypt will not give you leave to go, no, not by a mighty hand.
Exod. And I will put forth my hand,  smite Egypt with all my wonders which I will do in the midst of it,  after that he will let you go.
Exod. And I will give this people favor in the sight of the Egyptians. And it shall come to pass, that, when ye go, ye shall not go empty.
Exod. But every woman shall ask of her neighbor,  of her who sojourns in her house, jewels of silver,  jewels of gold,  raiment. And ye shall put them upon your sons,  upon your daughters,  ye shall despoil the Egyptians.
Exod. And Moses answered and said, But behold, they will not believe me, nor hearken to my voice, for they will say, Jehovah has not appeared to thee.
Exod. And Jehovah said to him, What is that in thy hand? And he said, A rod.
Exod. And he said, Cast in on the ground. And he cast it on the ground. And it became a serpent,  Moses fled from before it.
Exod. And Jehovah said to Moses, Put forth thy hand,  take it by the tail (and he put forth his hand,  laid hold of it,  it became a rod in his hand),
Exod. that they may believe that Jehovah, the God of their fathers, the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac,  the God of Jacob, has appeared to thee.
Exod. And Jehovah said furthermore to him, Put now thy hand into thy bosom. And he put his hand into his bosom. And when he took it out, behold, his hand was leprous, as snow.
Exod. And he said, Put thy hand into thy bosom again. (And he put his hand into his bosom again,  when he took it out of his bosom, behold, it was turned again as his other flesh.)
Exod. And it shall come to pass, if they will not believe thee, nor hearken to the voice of the first sign, that they will believe the voice of the latter sign.
Exod. And it shall come to pass, if they will not believe even these two signs, nor hearken to thy voice, that thou shall take of the water of the river,  pour it upon the dry land. And the water which thou take out of the river shall become blood upon the dry land.
Exod. And Moses said to Jehovah, Oh, Lord, I am not eloquent, neither heretofore, nor since thou have spoken to thy servant, for I am slow of speech,  of a slow tongue.
Exod. And Jehovah said to him, Who has made man's mouth? Or who makes a man dumb, or deaf, or seeing, or blind? Is it not I, Jehovah?
Exod. Now therefore go,  I will be with thy mouth,  teach thee what thou shall speak.
Exod. And he said, Oh, Lord, send, I pray thee, by the hand of him whom thou will send.
Exod. And the anger of Jehovah was kindled against Moses,  he said, Is there not Aaron thy brother the Levite? I know that he can speak well. And also, behold, he comes forth to meet thee,  when he sees thee, he will be glad in his heart.
Exod. And thou shall speak to him,  put the words in his mouth. And I will be with thy mouth,  with his mouth,  will teach you what ye shall do,
Exod. and he shall be thy spokesman to the people. And it shall come to pass, that he shall be to thee a mouth,  thou shall be to him as God.
Exod. And thou shall take this rod in thy hand, with which thou shall do the signs.
Exod. And Moses went and returned to Jethro his father-in-law,  said to him, Let me go, I pray thee,  return to my brothers who are in Egypt,  see whether they be yet alive. And Jethro said to Moses, Go in peace.
Exod. And Jehovah said to Moses in Midian, Go, return into Egypt, for all the men are dead who sought thy life.
Exod. And Moses took his wife and his sons,  set them upon a donkey,  he returned to the land of Egypt. And Moses took the rod of God in his hand.
Exod. And Jehovah said to Moses, When thou go back into Egypt, see that thou do before Pharaoh all the wonders which I have put in thy hand,  I will harden his heart and he will not let the people go.
Exod. And thou shall say to Pharaoh, Thus says Jehovah, Israel is my son, my firstborn,
Exod. and I have said to thee, Let my son go, that he may serve me,  thou have refused to let him go. Behold, I will slay thy son, thy firstborn.
Exod. And it came to pass on the way at the lodging-place, that Jehovah met him,  sought to kill him.
Exod. Then Zipporah took a flint,  cut off the foreskin of her son,  cast it at his feet. And she said, Surely a bridegroom of blood thou are to me.
Exod. So he let him alone. Then she said, A bridegroom of blood thou are, because of the circumcision.
Exod. And Jehovah said to Aaron, Go into the wilderness to meet Moses. And he went,  met him on the mountain of God,  kissed him.
Exod. And Moses told Aaron all the words of Jehovah with which he had sent him,  all the signs with which he had ordered him.
Exod. And Moses and Aaron went and gathered together all the elders of the sons of Israel.
Exod. And Aaron spoke all the words which Jehovah had spoken to Moses,  did the signs in the sight of the people.
Exod. And the people believed. And when they heard that Jehovah had visited the sons of Israel,  that he had seen their affliction, then they bowed their heads and worshiped.
Exod. And afterward Moses and Aaron came,  said to Pharaoh, Thus says Jehovah, the God of Israel, Let my people go, that they may hold a feast to me in the wilderness.
Exod. And Pharaoh said, Who is Jehovah, that I should hearken to his voice to let Israel go? I do not know Jehovah,  moreover I will not let Israel go.
Exod. And they said, The God of the Hebrews has met with us. Let us go, we pray thee, three days' journey into the wilderness,  sacrifice to Jehovah our God, lest he fall upon us with pestilence, or with the sword.
Exod. And the king of Egypt said to them, Therefore do ye, Moses and Aaron, loose the people from their works? Get you to your burdens.
Exod. And Pharaoh said, Behold, the people of the land are now many,  ye make them rest from their burdens.
Exod. And the same day Pharaoh commanded the taskmasters of the people,  their officers, saying,
Exod. Ye shall no more give the people straw to make brick as formerly. Let them go and gather straw for themselves.
Exod. And the number of the bricks, which they made formerly, ye shall lay upon them. Ye shall not diminish any of it. For they are idle, therefore they cry, saying, Let us go and sacrifice to our God.
Exod. Let heavier work be laid upon the men, that they may labor in it,  let them not regard lying words.
Exod. And the taskmasters of the people went out,  their officers,  they spoke to the people, saying, Thus says Pharaoh, I will not give you straw.
Exod. Go yourselves, get you straw where ye can find it, for none of your work shall be diminished.
Exod. So the people were scattered abroad throughout all the land of Egypt to gather stubble for straw.
Exod. And the taskmasters were urgent saying, Fulfill your works, your daily tasks, as when there was straw.
Exod. And the officers of the sons of Israel, whom Pharaoh's taskmasters had set over them, were beaten,  demanded, Why have ye not fulfilled your task both yesterday and today, in making brick as formerly?
Exod. Then the officers of the sons of Israel came and cried to Pharaoh, saying, Why do thou deal thus with thy servants?
Exod. There is no straw given to thy servants,  they say to us, Make brick. And, behold, thy servants are beaten,  the fault it in thine own people.
Exod. But he said, Ye are idle, ye are idle. Therefore ye say, Let us go and sacrifice to Jehovah.
Exod. Go therefore now,  work, for there shall no straw be given you, yet ye shall deliver the number of bricks.
Exod. And the officers of the sons of Israel saw that they were in affliction, when it was said, Ye shall not diminish anything from your bricks, your daily tasks.
Exod. And they met Moses and Aaron, who stood in the way, as they came forth from Pharaoh,
Exod. and they said to them, Jehovah look upon you,  judge, because ye have made our fragrance to be abhorred in the eyes of Pharaoh,  in the eyes of his servants, to put a sword in their hand to slay us.
Exod. And Moses returned to Jehovah,  said, Lord, why have thou dealt ill with this people? Why is it that thou have sent me?
Exod. For since I came to Pharaoh to speak in thy name, he has dealt ill with this people, neither have thou delivered thy people at all.
Exod. And Jehovah said to Moses, Now thou shall see what I will do to Pharaoh. For by a strong hand he shall let them go,  by a strong hand he shall drive them out of his land.
Exod. And God spoke to Moses,  said to him, I am Jehovah.
Exod. And I appeared to Abraham, to Isaac,  to Jacob, as God Almighty,  I was not known by them by my name Jehovah.
Exod. And I also established my covenant with them, to give them the land of Canaan, the land of their sojourning, in which they sojourned.
Exod. And moreover I have heard the groaning of the sons of Israel, whom the Egyptians keep in bondage,  I have remembered my covenant.
Exod. Therefore say to the sons of Israel, I am Jehovah. And I will bring you out from under the burdens of the Egyptians,  I will rid you out of their bondage,  I will redeem you with an outstretched arm,  with great judgments.
Exod. And I will take you to me for a people,  I will be to you a God,  ye shall know that I am Jehovah your God, who brings you out from under the burdens of the Egyptians.
Exod. And I will bring you in to the land which I swore to give to Abraham, to Isaac,  to Jacob,  I will give it to you for a heritage. I am Jehovah.
Exod. And Moses spoke so to the sons of Israel,  they did not hearken to Moses for anguish of spirit,  for cruel bondage.
Exod. And Jehovah spoke to Moses, saying,
Exod. Go in, speak to Pharaoh king of Egypt, that he let the sons of Israel go out of his land.
Exod. And Moses spoke before Jehovah, saying, Behold, the sons of Israel have not hearkened to me, how then shall Pharaoh hear me, who am of uncircumcised lips?
Exod. And Jehovah spoke to Moses and to Aaron,  gave them an order to the sons of Israel,  to Pharaoh king of Egypt, to bring the sons of Israel out of the land of Egypt.
Exod. These are the heads of their fathers' houses. The sons of Reuben the firstborn of Israel: Hanoch,  Pallu, Hezron,  Carmi, these are the families of Reuben.
Exod. And the sons of Simeon: Jemuel,  Jamin,  Ohad,  Jachin,  Zohar,  Shaul the son of a Canaanite woman, these are the families of Simeon.
Exod. And these are the names of the sons of Levi according to their generations: Gershon,  Kohath,  Merari. And the years of the life of Levi were a hundred thirty-seven years.
Exod. The sons of Gershon: Libni and Shimei, according to their families.
Exod. And the sons of Kohath: Amram,  Izhar,  Hebron,  Uzziel. And the years of the life of Kohath were a hundred thirty-three years.
Exod. And the sons of Merari: Mahli and Mushi. These are the families of the Levites according to their generations.
Exod. And Amram took him Jochebed his father's sister to wife,  she bore him Aaron and Moses. And the years of the life of Amram were a hundred and thirty-seven years.
Exod. And the sons of Izhar: Korah,  Nepheg,  Zichri.
Exod. And the sons of Uzziel: Mishael,  Elzaphan,  Sithri.
Exod. And Aaron took him Elisheba, the daughter of Amminadab, the sister of Nahshon, to wife,  she bore him Nadab and Abihu, Eleazar and Ithamar.
Exod. And the sons of Korah: Assir,  Elkanah,  Abiasaph. These are the families of the Korahites.
Exod. And Eleazar Aaron's son took to him one of the daughters of Putiel to wife,  she bore to him Phinehas. These are the heads of the fathers of the Levites according to their families.
Exod. These are that Aaron and Moses, to whom Jehovah said, Bring out the sons of Israel from the land of Egypt according to their armies.
Exod. These are those who spoke to Pharaoh king of Egypt, to bring out the sons of Israel from Egypt. These are that Moses and Aaron.
Exod. And it came to pass on the day when Jehovah spoke to Moses in the land of Egypt,
Exod. that Jehovah spoke to Moses, saying, I am Jehovah. Speak thou to Pharaoh king of Egypt all that I speak to thee.
Exod. And Moses said before Jehovah, Behold, I am of uncircumcised lips,  how shall Pharaoh hearken to me?
Exod. And Jehovah said to Moses, See, I have made thee as God to Pharaoh,  Aaron thy brother shall be thy prophet.
Exod. Thou shall speak all that I command thee,  Aaron thy brother shall speak to Pharaoh, that he let the sons of Israel go out of his land.
Exod. And I will harden Pharaoh's heart,  multiply my signs and my wonders in the land of Egypt.
Exod. But Pharaoh will not hearken to you. And I will lay my hand upon Egypt,  bring forth my armies, my people the sons of Israel, out of the land of Egypt by great judgments.
Exod. And the Egyptians shall know that I am Jehovah, when I stretch forth my hand upon Egypt,  bring out the sons of Israel from among them.
Exod. And Moses and Aaron did so, as Jehovah commanded them, so they did.
Exod. And Moses was eighty years old,  Aaron eighty-three years old, when they spoke to Pharaoh.
Exod. And Jehovah spoke to Moses and to Aaron, saying,
Exod. When Pharaoh shall speak to you, saying, Show a wonder for you, then thou shall say to Aaron, Take thy rod,  cast it down before Pharaoh, that it become a serpent.
Exod. And Moses and Aaron went in to Pharaoh. And they did so, as Jehovah had commanded,  Aaron cast down his rod before Pharaoh and before his servants,  it became a serpent.
Exod. Then Pharaoh also called for the wise men and the sorcerers. And they also, the magicians of Egypt, did in like manner with their enchantments.
Exod. For they cast down every man his rod,  they became serpents,  Aaron's rod swallowed up their rods.
Exod. And Pharaoh's heart was hardened,  he did not hearken to them, as Jehovah had spoken.
Exod. And Jehovah said to Moses, Pharaoh's heart is stubborn; he refuses to let the people go.
Exod. Get thee to Pharaoh in the morning, lo, he goes out to the water,  thou shall stand by the river's edge to meet him,  the rod which was turned to a serpent thou shall take in thy hand.
Exod. And thou shall say to him, Jehovah, the God of the Hebrews, has sent me to thee, saying, Let my people go, that they may serve me in the wilderness. And, behold, until now thou have not hearkened.
Exod. Thus says Jehovah, In this thou shall know that I am Jehovah. Behold, I will smite with the rod that is in my hand upon the waters which are in the river,  they shall be turned to blood.
Exod. And the fish that are in the river shall die,  the river shall become foul,  the Egyptians shall loathe to drink water from the river.
Exod. And Jehovah said to Moses, Say to Aaron, Take thy rod,  stretch out thy hand over the waters of Egypt, over their rivers, over their streams,  over their pools,  over all their ponds of water, that they may become blood,  there shall be blood throughout all the land of Egypt, both in vessels of wood and in vessels of stone.
Exod. And Moses and Aaron did so, as Jehovah commanded. And he lifted up the rod,  smote the waters that were in the river, in the sight of Pharaoh,  in the sight of his servants,  all the waters that were in the river were turned to blood.
Exod. And the fish that were in the river died,  the river became foul,  the Egyptians could not drink water from the river. And the blood was throughout all the land of Egypt.
Exod. And the magicians of Egypt did in like manner with their enchantments. And Pharaoh's heart was hardened,  he did not hearken to them, as Jehovah had spoken.
Exod. And Pharaoh turned and went into his house, neither did he lay even this to heart.
Exod. And all the Egyptians dug round about the river for water to drink, for they could not drink of the water of the river.
Exod. And seven days were fulfilled, after Jehovah had smitten the river.
Exod. And Jehovah spoke to Moses, Go in to Pharaoh,  say to him, Thus says Jehovah, Let my people go, that they may serve me.
Exod. And if thou refuse to let them go, behold, I will smite all thy borders with frogs.
Exod. And the river shall swarm with frogs, which shall go up and come into thy house,  into thy bedchamber,  upon thy bed,  into the house of thy servants,  upon thy people,  into thine ovens,  into thy kneading-troughs.
Exod. And the frogs shall come up both upon thee,  upon thy people,  upon all thy servants.
Exod. And Jehovah said to Moses, Say to Aaron, Stretch forth thy hand with thy rod over the rivers, over the streams,  over the pools,  cause frogs to come up upon the land of Egypt.
Exod. And Aaron stretched out his hand over the waters of Egypt,  the frogs came up,  covered the land of Egypt.
Exod. And the magicians did in like manner with their enchantments,  brought up frogs upon the land of Egypt.
Exod. Then Pharaoh called for Moses and Aaron,  said, Entreat Jehovah, that he take away the frogs from me,  from my people,  I will let the people go, that they may sacrifice to Jehovah.
Exod. And Moses said to Pharaoh, Have this honor over me: When shall I entreat for thee,  for thy servants,  for thy people, that the frogs be destroyed from thee and thy houses,  remain in the river only?
Exod. And he said, Tomorrow. And he said, Be it according to thy word, that thou may know that there is none like Jehovah our God.
Exod. And the frogs shall depart from thee,  from thy houses,  from thy servants,  from thy people, they shall remain in the river only.
Exod. And Moses and Aaron went out from Pharaoh. And Moses cried to Jehovah concerning the frogs which he had brought upon Pharaoh.
Exod. And Jehovah did according to the word of Moses. And the frogs died out of the houses, out of the courts,  out of the fields.
Exod. And they gathered them together in heaps,  the land stank.
Exod. But when Pharaoh saw that there was relief, he hardened his heart,  did not hearken to them, as Jehovah had spoken.
Exod. And Jehovah said to Moses, Say to Aaron, Stretch out thy rod,  smite the dust of the earth, that it may become lice throughout all the land of Egypt.
Exod. And they did so. And Aaron stretched out his hand with his rod,  smote the dust of the earth. And there were lice upon man,  upon beast; all the dust of the earth became lice throughout all the land of Egypt.
Exod. And the magicians did so with their enchantments to bring forth lice,  they could not. And there were lice upon man,  upon beast.
Exod. Then the magicians said to Pharaoh, This is the finger of God. And Pharaoh's heart was hardened,  he did not hearken to them, as Jehovah had spoken.
Exod. And Jehovah said to Moses, Rise up early in the morning,  stand before Pharaoh. Lo, he comes forth to the water. And say to him, Thus says Jehovah, Let my people go, that they may serve me.
Exod. Else, if thou will not let my people go, behold, I will send swarms of flies upon thee,  upon they servants,  upon thy people,  into thy houses. And the houses of the Egyptians shall be full of swarms of flies,  also the ground on which they are.
Exod. And in that day I will set apart the land of Goshen, in which my people dwell, that no swarms of flies shall be there, to the end thou may know that I am Jehovah in the midst of the earth.
Exod. And I will put a division between my people and thy people. This sign shall be by tomorrow.
Exod. And Jehovah did so,  there came grievous swarms of flies into the house of Pharaoh,  into his servants' houses. And in all the land of Egypt the land was corrupted because of the swarms of flies.
Exod. And Pharaoh called for Moses and for Aaron,  said, Go ye, sacrifice to your God in the land.
Exod. And Moses said, It is not right to do so, for we shall sacrifice the abomination of the Egyptians to Jehovah our God. Lo, shall we sacrifice the abomination of the Egyptians before their eyes,  will they not stone us?
Exod. We will go three days' journey into the wilderness,  sacrifice to Jehovah our God, as he shall command us.
Exod. And Pharaoh said, I will let you go, that ye may sacrifice to Jehovah your God in the wilderness, only ye shall not go very far away. Entreat for me.
Exod. And Moses said, Behold, I go out from thee,  I will entreat Jehovah that the swarms of flies may depart from Pharaoh, from his servants,  from his people, tomorrow. Only let not Pharaoh deal deceitfully any more in not letting the people go to sacrifice to Jehovah.
Exod. And Moses went out from Pharaoh,  entreated Jehovah.
Exod. And Jehovah did according to the word of Moses,  he removed the swarms of flies from Pharaoh, from his servants,  from his people; there remained not one.
Exod. And Pharaoh hardened his heart this time also,  he did not let the people go.
Exod. Then Jehovah said to Moses, Go in to Pharaoh,  tell him, Thus says Jehovah, the God of the Hebrews, Let my people go, that they may serve me.
Exod. For if thou refuse to let them go,  will still hold them,
Exod. behold, the hand of Jehovah is upon thy cattle which are in the field, upon the horses, upon the donkeys, upon the camels, upon the herds,  upon the flocks-a very grievous pestilence.
Exod. And Jehovah shall make a distinction between the cattle of Israel and the cattle of Egypt,  there shall nothing die of all that belongs to the sons of Israel.
Exod. And Jehovah appointed a set time, saying, Tomorrow Jehovah shall do this thing in the land.
Exod. And Jehovah did that thing on the morrow,  all the cattle of Egypt died,  of the cattle of the sons of Israel not one died.
Exod. And Pharaoh sent, , behold, there was not so much as one of the cattle of the Israelites dead. But the heart of Pharaoh was stubborn,  he did not let the people go.
Exod. And Jehovah said to Moses and to Aaron, Take to you handfuls of ashes of the furnace,  let Moses sprinkle it toward heaven in the sight of Pharaoh.
Exod. And it shall become small dust over all the land of Egypt,  shall be a boil breaking forth with sores upon man and upon beast, throughout all the land of Egypt.
Exod. And they took ashes of the furnace,  stood before Pharaoh,  Moses sprinkled it up toward heaven,  it became a boil breaking forth with sores upon man and upon beast.
Exod. And the magicians could not stand before Moses because of the boils, for the boils were upon the magicians,  upon all the Egyptians.
Exod. And Jehovah hardened the heart of Pharaoh,  he did not hearken to them, as Jehovah had spoken to Moses.
Exod. And Jehovah said to Moses, Rise up early in the morning,  stand before Pharaoh,  say to him, Thus says Jehovah, the God of the Hebrews, Let my people go, that they may serve me.
Exod. For this time I will send all my plagues upon thy heart,  upon thy servants,  upon thy people, that thou may know that there is none like me in all the earth.
Exod. For now I have put forth my hand,  smitten thee and thy people with pestilence,  thou have been cut off from the earth.
Exod. But indeed for this cause I have raised thee up, to display in thee my power,  that my name may be proclaimed in all the earth.
Exod. As yet thou exalt thyself against my people, that thou will not let them go?
Exod. Behold, tomorrow about this time I will cause it to rain a very grievous hail, such as has not been in Egypt since the day it was founded even until now.
Exod. Now therefore send, hasten in thy cattle and all that thou have in the field, for every man and beast that shall be found in the field,  shall not be brought home, the hail shall come down upon them,  they shall die.
Exod. He who feared the word of Jehovah among the servants of Pharaoh made his servants and his cattle flee into the houses.
Exod. And he who did not regard the word of Jehovah left his servants and his cattle in the field.
Exod. And Jehovah said to Moses, Stretch forth thy hand toward heaven, that there may be hail in all the land of Egypt, upon man,  upon beast,  upon every herb of the field, throughout the land of Egypt.
Exod. And Moses stretched forth his rod toward heaven,  Jehovah sent thunder and hail,  fire ran down to the earth,  Jehovah rained hail upon the land of Egypt.
Exod. So there was hail,  fire mingled with the hail, very grievous, such as had not been in all the land of Egypt since it became a nation.
Exod. And throughout all the land of Egypt the hail smote all that was in the field, both man and beast,  the hail smote every herb of the field,  broke every tree of the field.
Exod. Only in the land of Goshen, where the sons of Israel were, was there no hail.
Exod. And Pharaoh sent,  called for Moses and Aaron,  said to them, I have sinned this time. Jehovah is righteous,  I and my people are wicked.
Exod. Entreat Jehovah, for there has been enough of these mighty thunderings and hail,  I will let you go,  ye shall stay no longer.
Exod. And Moses said to him, As soon as I am gone out of the city, I will spread abroad my hands to Jehovah. The thunders shall cease, neither shall there be any more hail, that thou may know that the earth is Jehovah's.
Exod. But as for thee and thy servants, I know that ye will not yet fear Jehovah God.
Exod. And the flax and the barley were smitten, for the barley was in the ear,  the flax was in bloom.
Exod. But the wheat and the rye were not smitten, for they were not grown up.
Exod. And Moses went out of the city from Pharaoh,  spread abroad his hands to Jehovah,  the thunders and hail ceased,  the rain was not poured upon the earth.
Exod. And when Pharaoh saw that the rain and the hail and the thunders were ceased, he sinned yet more,  hardened his heart, he and his servants.
Exod. And the heart of Pharaoh was hardened,  he did not let the sons of Israel go, as Jehovah had spoken by Moses.
Exod. And Jehovah said to Moses, Go in to Pharaoh, for I have hardened his heart,  the heart of his servants, that I may show these my signs in the midst of them,
Exod. and that thou may tell in the ears of thy son,  of thy son's son, what things I have wrought upon Egypt,  my signs which I have done among them, that ye may know that I am Jehovah.
Exod. And Moses and Aaron went in to Pharaoh,  said to him, Thus says Jehovah, the God of the Hebrews, How long will thou refuse to humble thyself before me? Let my people go, that they may serve me.
Exod. Else, if thou refuse to let my people go, behold, tomorrow I will bring locusts into thy border.
Exod. And they shall cover the face of the earth, so that no man is able to see the ground. And they shall eat the residue of that which is escaped, which remains to you from the hail,  shall eat every tree which grows for you out of the field.
Exod. And thy houses shall be filled,  the houses of all thy servants,  the houses of all the Egyptians, as neither thy fathers nor thy fathers' fathers have seen, since the day that they were upon the earth to this day. And he turned,  went out from Pharaoh.
Exod. And Pharaoh's servants said to him, How long shall this man be a snare to us? Let the men go, that they may serve Jehovah their God. Do thou not yet know that Egypt is destroyed?
Exod. And Moses and Aaron were brought again to Pharaoh. And he said to them, Go, serve Jehovah your God,  who are those who shall go?
Exod. And Moses said, We will go with our young and with our old, with our sons and with our daughters, with our flocks and with our herds will we go, for we must hold a feast to Jehovah.
Exod. And he said to them, So be Jehovah with you, as I will let you go,  your little ones. Look, evil is before you.
Exod. Not so. Go ye now who are men,  serve Jehovah, for that is what ye desire. And they were driven out from Pharaoh's presence.
Exod. And Jehovah said to Moses, Stretch out thy hand over the land of Egypt for the locusts, that they may come up upon the land of Egypt,  eat every herb of the land, even all that the hail has left.
Exod. And Moses stretched forth his rod over the land of Egypt,  Jehovah brought an east wind upon the land all that day,  all the night,  when it was morning, the east wind brought the locusts.
Exod. And the locusts went up over all the land of Egypt,  rested in all the borders of Egypt, very grievous were they, before them there were no such locusts as they, neither after them shall be such.
Exod. For they covered the face of the whole ground, so that the land was darkened,  they ate every herb of the land,  all the fruit of the trees which the hail had left. And there remained not any green thing, either tree nor herb of the field, through all the land of Egypt.
Exod. Then Pharaoh called for Moses and Aaron in haste,  he said, I have sinned against Jehovah your God,  against you.
Exod. Now therefore forgive, I pray thee, my sin only this once,  entreat Jehovah your God, that he may only take away from me this death.
Exod. And he went out from Pharaoh,  entreated Jehovah.
Exod. And Jehovah turned an exceedingly strong west wind, which took up the locusts,  drove them into the Red Sea. There remained not one locust in all the border of Egypt.
Exod. But Jehovah hardened Pharaoh's heart,  he did not let the sons of Israel go.
Exod. And Jehovah said to Moses, Stretch out thy hand toward heaven, that there may be darkness over the land of Egypt, even darkness which may be felt.
Exod. And Moses stretched forth his hand toward heaven,  there was a thick darkness in all the land of Egypt three days,
Exod. they did not see each other, neither did anyone rise from his place for three days,  all the sons of Israel had light in their dwellings.
Exod. And Pharaoh called to Moses,  said, Go ye, serve Jehovah, only let your flocks and your herds stay. Let your little ones also go with you.
Exod. And Moses said, Thou must also give into our hand sacrifices and burnt offerings, that we may sacrifice to Jehovah our God.
Exod. Our cattle shall also go with us, there shall not a hoof be left behind, for we must take of it to serve Jehovah our God,  we do not know with what we must serve Jehovah, until we come there.
Exod. But Jehovah hardened Pharaoh's heart,  he would not let them go.
Exod. And Pharaoh said to him, Get thee from me. Take heed to thyself, see my face no more, for in the day thou see my face thou shall die.
Exod. And Moses said, Thou have spoken well. I will see thy face again no more.
Exod. And Jehovah said to Moses, Yet one plague more I will bring upon Pharaoh,  upon Egypt, afterwards he will let you go from here. When he shall let you go, he shall surely thrust you out from here altogether.
Exod. Speak now in the ears of the people,  let them ask every man of his neighbor,  every woman of her neighbor, jewels of silver,  jewels of gold.
Exod. And Jehovah gave the people favor in the sight of the Egyptians. Moreover the man Moses was very great in the land of Egypt, in the sight of Pharaoh's servants,  in the sight of the people.
Exod. And Moses said, Thus says Jehovah, About midnight I will go out into the midst of Egypt,
Exod. and all the firstborn in the land of Egypt shall die, from the firstborn of Pharaoh who sits upon his throne, even to the firstborn of the maid-servant that is behind the mill,  all the firstborn of cattle.
Exod. And there shall be a great cry throughout all the land of Egypt, such as there has not been, nor shall be any more.
Exod. But against any of the sons of Israel shall not a dog move his tongue, against man or beast, that ye may know how that Jehovah makes a distinction between the Egyptians and Israel.
Exod. And all these thy servants shall come down to me,  bow themselves down to me, saying, Get thee out,  all the people who follow thee. And after that I will go out. And he went out from Pharaoh in hot anger.
Exod. And Jehovah said to Moses, Pharaoh will not hearken to you, that my wonders may be multiplied in the land of Egypt.
Exod. And Moses and Aaron did all these wonders before Pharaoh. And Jehovah hardened Pharaoh's heart,  he did not let the sons of Israel go out of his land.
Exod. And Jehovah spoke to Moses and Aaron in the land of Egypt, saying,
Exod. This month shall be to you the beginning of months; it shall be the first month of the year to you.
Exod. Speak ye to all the congregation of Israel, saying, In the tenth day of this month they shall take to them every man a lamb, according to their fathers' houses, a lamb for a household.
Exod. And if the household be too little for a lamb, then he and his neighbor next to his house shall take one according to the number of the souls, according to every man's eating ye shall make your count for the lamb.
Exod. Your lamb shall be without blemish, a male a year old. Ye shall take it from the sheep, or from the goats.
Exod. And ye shall keep it until the fourteenth day of the same month,  the whole assembly of the congregation of Israel shall kill it at evening.
Exod. And they shall take of the blood,  put it on the two side-posts and on the lintel upon the houses in which they shall eat it.
Exod. And they shall eat the flesh in that night, roasted with fire,  unleavened bread, with bitter herbs they shall eat it.
Exod. Do not eat of it raw, nor boiled at all with water,  roasted with fire, its head with its legs and with the inwards of it.
Exod. And ye shall let nothing of it remain until the morning,  that which remains of it until the morning ye shall burn with fire.
Exod. And thus ye shall eat it: with your loins girded, your shoes on your feet,  your staff in your hand. And ye shall eat it in haste. It is Jehovah's Passover.
Exod. For I will go through the land of Egypt in that night,  will smite all the firstborn in the land of Egypt, both man and beast,  against all the gods of Egypt I will execute judgments. I am Jehovah.
Exod. And the blood shall be to you for a sign upon the houses where ye are. And when I see the blood, I will pass over you,  there shall no plague be upon you to destroy you, when I smite the land of Egypt.
Exod. And this day shall be to you for a memorial,  ye shall keep it a feast to Jehovah; throughout your generations ye shall keep it a feast by an ordinance forever.
Exod. Seven days ye shall eat unleavened bread, even the first day ye shall put away leaven out of your houses, for whoever eats leavened bread from the first day until the seventh day, that soul shall be cut off from Israel.
Exod. And in the first day there shall be to you a holy convocation,  in the seventh day a holy convocation, no manner of work shall be done in them, except that which every man must eat, that only may be done by you.
Exod. And ye shall observe the feast of unleavened bread, for in this selfsame day I have brought your armies out of the land of Egypt. Therefore ye shall observe this day throughout your generations by an ordinance forever.
Exod. In the first month, on the fourteenth day of the month at evening, ye shall eat unleavened bread, until the twenty-first day of the month at evening.
Exod. Seven days there shall be no leaven found in your houses, for whoever eats that which is leavened, that soul shall be cut off from the congregation of Israel, whether he be a sojourner, or one who is born in the land.
Exod. Ye shall eat nothing leavened, in all your habitations ye shall eat unleavened bread.
Exod. Then Moses called for all the elders of Israel,  said to them, Draw out,  take to you lambs according to your families,  kill the Passover.
Exod. And ye shall take a bunch of hyssop,  dip it in the blood that is in the basin,  strike the lintel and the two side-posts with the blood that is in the basin,  none of you shall go out of the door of his house until the morning.
Exod. For Jehovah will pass through to smite the Egyptians,  when he sees the blood upon the lintel,  on the two side-posts, Jehovah will pass over the door,  will not allow the destroyer to come in to your houses to smite you.
Exod. And ye shall observe this thing for an ordinance to thee and to thy sons forever.
Exod. And it shall come to pass, when ye have come to the land which Jehovah will give you, according as he has promised, that ye shall keep this service.
Exod. And it shall come to pass, when your sons shall say to you, What do ye mean by this service?
Exod. that ye shall say, It is the sacrifice of Jehovah's Passover, who passed over the houses of the sons of Israel in Egypt, when he smote the Egyptians,  delivered our houses. And the people bowed the head and worshiped.
Exod. And the sons of Israel went and did so, as Jehovah had commanded Moses and Aaron, so did they.
Exod. And it came to pass at midnight, that Jehovah smote all the firstborn in the land of Egypt, from the firstborn of Pharaoh who sat on his throne to the firstborn of the captive who was in the dungeon,  all the firstborn of cattle.
Exod. And Pharaoh rose up in the night, he,  all his servants,  all the Egyptians,  there was a great cry in Egypt, for there was not a house where there was not one dead.
Exod. And he called for Moses and Aaron by night,  said, Rise up, get you forth from among my people, both ye and the sons of Israel,  go, serve Jehovah, as ye have said.
Exod. Take both your flocks and your herds, as ye have said,  be gone,  bless me also.
Exod. And the Egyptians were urgent upon the people, to send them out of the land in haste, for they said, We are all dead men.
Exod. And the people took their dough before it was leavened, their kneading-troughs being bound up in their clothes upon their shoulders.
Exod. And the sons of Israel did according to the word of Moses,  they asked of the Egyptians jewels of silver,  jewels of gold,  raiment.
Exod. And Jehovah gave the people favor in the sight of the Egyptians, so that they let them have what they asked. And they despoiled the Egyptians.
Exod. And the sons of Israel journeyed from Rameses to Succoth, about six hundred thousand on foot who were men, besides children.
Exod. And a mixed multitude also went up with them,  flocks,  herds, even very much cattle.
Exod. And they baked unleavened cakes of the dough which they brought forth out of Egypt, for it was not leavened, because they were thrust out of Egypt,  could not tarry, neither had they prepared for themselves any provisions.
Exod. Now the time that the sons of Israel dwelt in the land of Egypt and the land of Canaan was four hundred and thirty years.
Exod. And it came to pass at the end of four hundred and thirty years, even the selfsame day it came to pass, that all the armies of Jehovah went out from the land of Egypt.
Exod. It is a night to be much observed to Jehovah for bringing them out from the land of Egypt. This is that night of Jehovah, to be much observed of all the sons of Israel throughout their generations.
Exod. And Jehovah said to Moses and Aaron, This is the ordinance of the Passover. There shall no foreigner eat of it,
Exod. but every man's servant who is bought for money, when thou have circumcised him, then he shall eat of it.
Exod. A sojourner and a hired servant shall not eat of it.
Exod. In one house it shall be eaten. Thou shall not carry forth any of the flesh abroad out of the house, neither shall ye break a bone of it.
Exod. All the congregation of Israel shall keep it.
Exod. And when a stranger shall sojourn with thee,  will keep the Passover to Jehovah, let all his males be circumcised,  then let him come near and keep it,  he shall be as one who is born in the land,  no uncircumcised man shall eat of it.
Exod. One law shall be to him who is home-born,  to the stranger who sojourns among you.
Exod. Thus did all the sons of Israel, as Jehovah commanded Moses and Aaron, so did they.
Exod. And it came to pass the selfsame day, that Jehovah brought the sons of Israel out of the land of Egypt by their armies.
Exod. And Jehovah spoke to Moses, saying,
Exod. Sanctify to me all the firstborn, whatever opens the womb among the sons of Israel. Both of man and of beast, it is mine.
Exod. And Moses said to the people, Remember this day, in which ye came out from Egypt, out of the house of bondage, for by strength of hand Jehovah brought you out from this place. There shall no leavened bread be eaten.
Exod. This day ye go forth in the month Abib.
Exod. And it shall be, when Jehovah shall bring thee into the land of the Canaanite,  the Hittite,  the Amorite,  the Hivite,  the Jebusite, which he swore to thy fathers to give thee, a land flowing with milk and honey, that thou shall keep this service in this month.
Exod. Seven days thou shall eat unleavened bread,  in the seventh day shall be a feast to Jehovah.
Exod. Unleavened bread shall be eaten throughout the seven days,  there shall no leavened bread be seen with thee, neither shall there be leaven seen with thee in all thy borders.
Exod. And thou shall tell thy son in that day, saying, It is because of that which Jehovah did for me when I came forth out of Egypt.
Exod. And it shall be for a sign to thee upon thy hand,  for a memorial between thine eyes, that the law of Jehovah may be in thy mouth, for with a strong hand has Jehovah brought thee out of Egypt.
Exod. Thou shall therefore keep this ordinance in its season from year to year.
Exod. And it shall be, when Jehovah shall bring thee into the land of the Canaanite, as he swore to thee and to thy fathers,  shall give it to thee,
Exod. that thou shall set apart to Jehovah all that opens the womb. And every firstling which thou have that comes of a beast, the males shall be Jehovah's.
Exod. And every firstling of a donkey thou shall redeem with a lamb,  if thou will not redeem it, then thou shall break its neck. And all the firstborn of man among thy sons thou shall redeem.
Exod. And it shall be, when thy son asks thee in time to come, saying, What is this? that thou shall say to him, By strength of hand Jehovah brought us out from Egypt, from the house of bondage.
Exod. And it came to pass, when Pharaoh would hardly let us go, that Jehovah slew all the firstborn in the land of Egypt, both the firstborn of man,  the firstborn of beast. Therefore I sacrifice to Jehovah all that opens the womb, being males,  all the firstborn of my sons I redeem.
Exod. And it shall be for a sign upon thy hand,  for frontlets between thine eyes, for by strength of hand Jehovah brought us forth out of Egypt.
Exod. And it came to pass, when Pharaoh had let the people go, that God led them not by the way of the land of the Philistines, although that was near. For God said, Lest perhaps the people regret when they see war,  they return to Egypt.
Exod. But God led the people about, by the way of the wilderness by the Red Sea. And the sons of Israel went up armed out of the land of Egypt.
Exod. And Moses took the bones of Joseph with him, for he had strictly sworn the sons of Israel, saying, God will surely visit you,  ye shall carry up my bones away from here with you.
Exod. And they took their journey from Succoth,  encamped in Etham, in the edge of the wilderness.
Exod. And Jehovah went before them by day in a pillar of cloud, to lead them the way,  by night in a pillar of fire, to give them light, that they might go by day and by night.
Exod. The pillar of cloud by day,  the pillar of fire by night departed not from before the people.
Exod. And Jehovah spoke to Moses, saying,
Exod. Speak to the sons of Israel, that they turn back and encamp before Pihahiroth, between Migdol and the sea, before Baal-zephon. Ye shall encamp opposite it by the sea.
Exod. And Pharaoh will say of the sons of Israel, They are entangled in the land; the wilderness has shut them in.
Exod. And I will harden Pharaoh's heart,  he shall follow after them,  I will get for me honor upon Pharaoh,  upon all his army,  the Egyptians shall know that I am Jehovah. And they did so.
Exod. And it was told the king of Egypt that the people were fled. And the heart of Pharaoh and of his servants was changed towards the people,  they said, What is this we have done, that we have let Israel go from serving us?
Exod. And he made ready his chariot,  took his people with him.
Exod. And he took six hundred chosen chariots,  all the chariots of Egypt,  captains over all of them.
Exod. And Jehovah hardened the heart of Pharaoh king of Egypt,  he pursued after the sons of Israel, for the sons of Israel went out with a high hand.
Exod. And the Egyptians pursued after them, all the horses and chariots of Pharaoh,  his horsemen,  his army,  overtook them encamping by the sea, beside Pihahiroth, before Baal-zephon.
Exod. And when Pharaoh drew near, the sons of Israel lifted up their eyes, , behold, the Egyptians were marching after them,  they were very afraid. And the sons of Israel cried out to Jehovah,
Exod. and they said to Moses, Because there were no graves in Egypt, have thou taken us away to die in the wilderness? Why have thou dealt thus with us, to bring us forth out of Egypt?
Exod. Is not this the word that we spoke to thee in Egypt, saying, Let us alone, that we may serve the Egyptians? For it were better for us to serve the Egyptians, than that we should die in the wilderness.
Exod. And Moses said to the people, Fear ye not. Stand still,  see the salvation of Jehovah, which he will work for you today, for the Egyptians whom ye have seen today, ye shall see them again no more forever.
Exod. Jehovah will fight for you,  ye shall keep silent.
Exod. And Jehovah said to Moses, Why do thou cry to me? Speak to the sons of Israel, that they go forward.
Exod. And lift thou up thy rod,  stretch out thy hand over the sea,  divide it,  the sons of Israel shall go into the midst of the sea on dry ground.
Exod. And I, behold, I will harden the hearts of the Egyptians,  they shall go in after them,  I will get for me honor upon Pharaoh,  upon all his army, upon his chariots,  upon his horsemen.
Exod. And the Egyptians shall know that I am Jehovah, when I have gotten for me honor upon Pharaoh, upon his chariots,  upon his horsemen.
Exod. And the agent of God, who went before the camp of Israel, moved and went behind them,  the pillar of cloud moved from before them,  stood behind them.
Exod. And it came between the camp of Egypt and the camp of Israel. And the cloud and the darkness was there, yet it gave light by night. And the one did not come near the other all the night.
Exod. And Moses stretched out his hand over the sea,  Jehovah caused the sea to go back by a strong east wind all the night,  made the sea dry land,  the waters were divided.
Exod. And the sons of Israel went into the midst of the sea upon the dry ground,  the waters were a wall to them on their right hand,  on their left.
Exod. And the Egyptians pursued,  went in after them into the midst of the sea, all Pharaoh's horses, his chariots,  his horsemen.
Exod. And it came to pass in the morning watch, that Jehovah looked forth upon the army of the Egyptians through the pillar of fire and of cloud,  troubled the army of the Egyptians.
Exod. And he took off their chariot wheels,  they drove them with difficulty, so that the Egyptians said, Let us flee from the face of Israel, for Jehovah fights for them against the Egyptians.
Exod. And Jehovah said to Moses, Stretch out thy hand over the sea, that the waters may come again upon the Egyptians, upon their chariots,  upon their horsemen.
Exod. And Moses stretched forth his hand over the sea,  the sea returned to its strength when the morning appeared,  the Egyptians fled against it,  Jehovah overthrew the Egyptians in the midst of the sea.
Exod. And the waters returned,  covered the chariots,  the horsemen, even all the army of Pharaoh who went in after them into the sea, there remained not so much as one of them.
Exod. But the sons of Israel walked upon dry land in the midst of the sea,  the waters were a wall to them on their right hand,  on their left.
Exod. Thus Jehovah saved Israel that day out of the hand of the Egyptians,  Israel saw the Egyptians dead upon the sea-shore.
Exod. And Israel saw the great work which Jehovah did upon the Egyptians. And the people feared Jehovah,  they believed in Jehovah,  in his servant Moses.
Exod. Then Moses and the sons of Israel sang this song to Jehovah,  spoke, saying, I will sing to Jehovah, for he has triumphed gloriously. The horse and his rider he has thrown into the sea.
Exod. Jehovah is my strength and song,  he has become my salvation. This is my God,  I will praise him, my father's God,  I will exalt him.
Exod. Jehovah is a man of war. Jehovah is his name.
Exod. Pharaoh's chariots and his army he has cast into the sea,  his chosen captains are sunk in the Red Sea.
Exod. The deeps cover them. They went down into the depths like a stone.
Exod. Thy right hand, O Jehovah, is glorious in power. Thy right hand, O Jehovah, dashes the enemy in pieces.
Exod. And in the greatness of thine excellency thou overthrow those who rise up against thee. Thou send forth thy wrath, it consumes them as stubble.
Exod. And with the blast of thy nostrils the waters were piled up. The floods stood up as a heap. The deeps were congealed in the heart of the sea.
Exod. The enemy said, I will pursue, I will overtake, I will divide the spoil, my desire shall be satisfied upon them. I will draw my sword, my hand shall destroy them.
Exod. Thou did blow with thy wind, the sea covered them. They sank as lead in the mighty waters.
Exod. Who is like thee, O Jehovah, among the gods? Who is like thee, glorious in holiness, fearful in praises, doing wonders?
Exod. Thou stretched out thy right hand, the earth swallowed them.
Exod. Thou in thy loving kindness have led the people that thou have redeemed. Thou have guided them in thy strength to thy holy habitation.
Exod. The peoples have heard, they tremble. Pangs have taken hold on the inhabitants of Philistia.
Exod. Then the chiefs of Edom were dismayed, the mighty men of Moab. Trembling takes hold upon them. All the inhabitants of Canaan are melted away.
Exod. Terror and dread falls upon them. By the greatness of thine arm they are as still as a stone, till thy people pass over, O Jehovah, till the people pass over whom thou have purchased.
Exod. Thou will bring them in,  plant them on the mountain of thine inheritance, the place, O Jehovah, which thou have made for thee to dwell in, the sanctuary, O Lord, which thy hands have established.
Exod. Jehovah shall reign forever and ever.
Exod. For the horses of Pharaoh went in with his chariots and with his horsemen into the sea,  Jehovah brought back the waters of the sea upon them,  the sons of Israel walked on dry land in the midst of the sea.
Exod. And Miriam the prophetess, the sister of Aaron, took a timbrel in her hand,  all the women went out after her with timbrels and with dances.
Exod. And Miriam answered them, Sing ye to Jehovah, for he has triumphed gloriously. The horse and his rider he has thrown into the sea.
Exod. And Moses led Israel onward from the Red Sea,  they went out into the wilderness of Shur. And they went three days in the wilderness,  found no water.
Exod. And when they came to Marah, they could not drink of the waters of Marah, for they were bitter. Therefore the name of it was called Marah.
Exod. And the people murmured against Moses, saying, What shall we drink?
Exod. And he cried to Jehovah. And Jehovah showed him a tree,  he cast it into the waters,  the waters were made sweet. There he made for them a statute and an ordinance,  there he proved them,
Exod. and he said, If thou will diligently hearken to the voice of Jehovah thy God,  will do that which is right in his eyes,  will give ear to his commandments,  keep all his statutes, I will put none of the diseases upon thee, which I have put upon the Egyptians, for I am Jehovah who heals thee.
Exod. And they came to Elim, where were twelve springs of water,  seventy palm trees,  they encamped there by the waters.
Exod. And they took their journey from Elim. And all the congregation of the sons of Israel came to the wilderness of Sin, which is between Elim and Sinai, on the fifteenth day of the second month after their departing out of the land of Egypt.
Exod. And the whole congregation of the sons of Israel murmured against Moses and against Aaron in the wilderness.
Exod. And the sons of Israel said to them, Would that we had died by the hand of Jehovah in the land of Egypt, when we sat by the flesh-pots, when we ate bread to the full, for ye have brought us forth into this wilderness, to kill this whole assembly with hunger.
Exod. Then Jehovah said to Moses, Behold, I will rain bread from heaven for you,  the people shall go out and gather a day's portion every day, that I may prove them, whether they will walk in my law, or not.
Exod. And it shall come to pass on the sixth day, that they shall prepare that which they bring in,  it shall be twice as much as they gather daily.
Exod. And Moses and Aaron said to all the sons of Israel, At evening, then ye shall know that Jehovah has brought you out from the land of Egypt,
Exod. and in the morning, then ye shall see the glory of Jehovah, for he hears your murmurings against Jehovah. And what are we, that ye murmur against us?
Exod. And Moses said, This shall be when Jehovah shall give you flesh to eat in the evening,  bread to the full in the morning, for that Jehovah hears your murmurings which ye murmur against him. And what are we? Your murmurings are not against us,  against Jehovah.
Exod. And Moses said to Aaron, Say to all the congregation of the sons of Israel, Come near before Jehovah, for he has heard your murmurings.
Exod. And it came to pass, as Aaron spoke to the whole congregation of the sons of Israel, that they looked toward the wilderness, , behold, the glory of Jehovah appeared in the cloud.
Exod. And Jehovah spoke to Moses, saying,
Exod. I have heard the murmurings of the sons of Israel. Speak to them, saying, At evening ye shall eat flesh,  in the morning ye shall be filled with bread. And ye shall know that I am Jehovah your God.
Exod. And it came to pass at evening, that the quails came up,  covered the camp. And in the morning the dew lay round about the camp,
Exod. and when the dew that lay was gone up, behold, upon the face of the wilderness a small round thing, small as the hoarfrost on the ground.
Exod. And when the sons of Israel saw it, they said one to another, What is it? For they knew not what it was. And Moses said to them, It is the bread which Jehovah has given you to eat.
Exod. This is the thing which Jehovah has commanded, Gather ye of it every man according to his eating, an omer a head. According to the number of your persons, ye shall take it, every man for those who are in his tent.
Exod. And the sons of Israel did so,  gathered, some more, some less.
Exod. And when they measured it with an omer, he who gathered much had nothing over,  he who gathered little had no lack; they gathered every man according to his eating.
Exod. And Moses said to them, Let no man leave of it till the morning.
Exod. Notwithstanding they did not hearken to Moses,  some of them left of it until the morning,  it bred worms,  became foul,  Moses was angry with them.
Exod. And they gathered it morning by morning, every man according to his eating. And when the sun grew hot, it melted.
Exod. And it came to pass, that on the sixth day they gathered twice as much bread, two omers for each one. And all the rulers of the congregation came and told Moses.
