Exod. And he said to them, This is that which Jehovah has spoken, Tomorrow is a solemn rest, a holy sabbath to Jehovah. Bake that which ye will bake,  boil that which ye will boil,  all that remains over lay up for you to be kept until the morning.
Exod. And they laid it up till the morning, as Moses bade,  it did not become foul, neither was there any worm in it.
Exod. And Moses said, Eat that today, for today is a sabbath to Jehovah. Today ye shall not find it in the field.
Exod. Six days ye shall gather it,  on the seventh day is the sabbath, there shall be none in it.
Exod. And it came to pass on the seventh day, that some of the people went out to gather,  they found none.
Exod. And Jehovah said to Moses, How long do ye refuse to keep my commandments and my laws?
Exod. See, because Jehovah has given you the sabbath, therefore he gives you on the sixth day the bread of two days. Abide ye every man in his place. Let no man go out of his place on the seventh day.
Exod. So the people rested on the seventh day.
Exod. And the house of Israel called the name of it Manna. And it was like coriander seed, white,  the taste of it was like wafers with honey.
Exod. And Moses said, This is the thing which Jehovah has commanded. Let an omerful of it be kept throughout your generations, that they may see the bread with which I fed you in the wilderness, when I brought you forth from the land of Egypt.
Exod. And Moses said to Aaron, Take a pot,  put an omerful of manna in it,  lay it up before Jehovah, to be kept throughout your generations.
Exod. As Jehovah commanded Moses, so Aaron laid it up before the Testimony, to be kept.
Exod. And the sons of Israel ate the manna forty years, until they came to a land inhabited. They ate the manna until they came to the borders of the land of Canaan.
Exod. Now an omer is the tenth part of an ephah.
Exod. And all the congregation of the sons of Israel journeyed from the wilderness of Sin, by their journeys, according to the commandment of Jehovah,  encamped in Rephidim. And there was no water for the people to drink.
Exod. Therefore the people contended with Moses,  said, Give us water that we may drink. And Moses said to them, Why do ye contend with me? Why do ye challenge Jehovah?
Exod. And the people thirsted there for water. And the people murmured against Moses,  said, Why have thou brought us up out of Egypt, to kill us and our sons and our cattle with thirst?
Exod. And Moses cried to Jehovah, saying, What shall I do to this people? They are almost ready to stone me.
Exod. And Jehovah said to Moses, Pass on before the people,  take with thee from the elders of Israel,  thy rod, with which thou smote the river, take in thy hand,  go.
Exod. Behold, I will stand before thee there upon the rock in Horeb,  thou shall smite the rock,  there shall come water out of it, that the people may drink. And Moses did so in the sight of the elders of Israel.
Exod. And he called the name of the place Massah and Meribah, because of the contending of the sons of Israel,  because they challenged Jehovah, saying, Is Jehovah among us, or not?
Exod. Then Amalek came,  fought with Israel in Rephidim.
Exod. And Moses said to Joshua, Choose us out men,  go out, fight with Amalek. Tomorrow I will stand on the top of the hill with the rod of God in my hand.
Exod. So Joshua did as Moses had said to him,  fought with Amalek. And Moses, Aaron,  Hur went up to the top of the hill.
Exod. And it came to pass, when Moses held up his hand, that Israel prevailed,  when he let down his hand, Amalek prevailed.
Exod. But Moses' hands were heavy. And they took a stone,  put it under him,  he sat on it. and Aaron and Hur held up his hands, the one on the one side,  the other on the other side. And his hands were steady until the going down of the sun.
Exod. And Joshua weakened Amalek and his people with the edge of the sword.
Exod. And Jehovah said to Moses, Write this for a memorial in a book,  rehearse it in the ears of Joshua: that I will utterly blot out the remembrance of Amalek from under heaven.
Exod. And Moses built an altar,  called the name of it Jehovah-nissi.
Exod. And he said, Jehovah has sworn, Jehovah will have war with Amalek from generation to generation.
Exod. Now Jethro, the priest of Midian, Moses' father-in-law, heard of all that God had done for Moses,  for Israel his people, how that Jehovah had brought Israel out of Egypt.
Exod. And Jethro, Moses' father-in-law, took Zipporah, Moses' wife, after he had sent her away,
Exod. and her two sons, of whom the name of the one was Gershom, for he said, I have been a sojourner in a foreign land.
Exod. And the name of the other was Eliezer, for he said, The God of my father was my help,  delivered me from the sword of Pharaoh.
Exod. And Jethro, Moses' father-in-law, came with his sons and his wife to Moses into the wilderness where he was encamped, at the mount of God.
Exod. And he said to Moses, I, thy father-in-law Jethro, have come to thee,  thy wife,  her two sons with her.
Exod. And Moses went out to meet his father-in-law,  did obeisance,  kissed him. And they asked each other of their welfare,  they came into the tent.
Exod. And Moses told his father-in-law all that Jehovah had done to Pharaoh and to the Egyptians for Israel's sake, all the travail that had come upon them by the way,  how Jehovah delivered them.
Exod. And Jethro rejoiced for all the goodness which Jehovah had done to Israel, in that he had delivered them out of the hand of the Egyptians.
Exod. And Jethro said, Blessed be Jehovah, who has delivered you out of the hand of the Egyptians,  out of the hand of Pharaoh, who has delivered the people from under the hand of the Egyptians.
Exod. Now I know that Jehovah is greater than all gods, yea, in the thing wherein they dealt proudly against them.
Exod. And Jethro, Moses' father-in-law, took a burnt offering and sacrifices for God. And Aaron came,  all the elders of Israel, to eat bread with Moses' father-in-law before God.
Exod. And it came to pass on the morrow, that Moses sat to judge the people,  the people stood about Moses from the morning to the evening.
Exod. And when Moses' father-in-law saw all that he did to the people, he said, What is this thing that thou do to the people? Why do thou sit by thyself,  all the people stand about thee from morning to evening?
Exod. And Moses said to his father-in-law, Because the people come to me to inquire of God.
Exod. When they have a matter, they come to me,  I judge between a man and his neighbor. And I make them know the statutes of God,  his laws.
Exod. And Moses' father-in-law said to him, The thing that thou do is not good.
Exod. Thou will surely wear away, both thou,  this people that is with thee, for the thing is too heavy for thee. Thou are not able to perform it thyself alone.
Exod. Hearken now to my voice. I will give thee counsel,  God be with thee. Be thou for the people toward God,  bring thou the cases to God.
Exod. And thou shall teach them the statutes and the laws,  shall show them the way in which they must walk,  the work that they must do.
Exod. Moreover thou shall provide out of all the people able men, such as fear God, men of truth, hating unjust gain,  place such over them, to be rulers of thousands, rulers of hundreds, rulers of fifties,  rulers of tens,
Exod. and let them judge the people at all seasons. And it shall be, that every great matter they shall bring to thee,  every small matter they shall judge themselves. So shall it be easier for thyself,  they shall bear the burden with thee.
Exod. If thou shall do this thing,  God command thee so, then thou shall be able to endure,  all this people also shall go to their place in peace.
Exod. So Moses hearkened to the voice of his father-in-law,  did all that he had said.
Exod. And Moses chose able men out of all Israel,  made them heads over the people, rulers of thousands, rulers of hundreds, rulers of fifties,  rulers of tens,
Exod. and they judged the people at all seasons. The hard cases they brought to Moses,  every small matter they judged themselves.
Exod. And Moses let his father-in-law depart,  he went his way into his own land.
Exod. In the third month after the sons of Israel were gone forth out of the land of Egypt, the same day they came into the wilderness of Sinai.
Exod. And when they were departed from Rephidim,  came to the wilderness of Sinai, they encamped in the wilderness,  there Israel encamped before the mount.
Exod. And Moses went up to God. And Jehovah called to him out of the mountain, saying, Thus thou shall say to the house of Jacob,  tell the sons of Israel:
Exod. Ye have seen what I did to the Egyptians,  how I bore you on eagles' wings,  brought you to myself.
Exod. Now therefore, if ye will obey my voice indeed,  keep my covenant, then ye shall be my own possession from among all peoples, for all the earth is mine,
Exod. and ye shall be to me a kingdom of priests,  a holy nation. These are the words which thou shall speak to the sons of Israel.
Exod. And Moses came and called for the elders of the people,  set before them all these words which Jehovah commanded him.
Exod. And all the people answered together,  said, All that Jehovah has spoken we will do. And Moses reported the words of the people to Jehovah.
Exod. And Jehovah said to Moses, Lo, I come to thee in a thick cloud, that the people may hear when I speak with thee,  may also believe thee forever. And Moses told the words of the people to Jehovah.
Exod. And Jehovah said to Moses, Go to the people,  sanctify them today and tomorrow,  let them wash their garments,
Exod. and be ready for the third day, for the third day Jehovah will come down in the sight of all the people upon mount Sinai.
Exod. And thou shall set bounds to the people round about, saying, Take heed to yourselves, that ye not go up onto the mount, or touch the border of it. Whoever touches the mount shall be surely put to death;
Exod. no hand shall touch him,  he shall surely be stoned, or shot through, whether it be beast or man, he shall not live. When the trumpet sounds long, they shall come up to the mount.
Exod. And Moses went down from the mount to the people,  sanctified the people,  they washed their garments.
Exod. And he said to the people, Be ready for the third day. Come not near a woman.
Exod. And it came to pass on the third day, when it was morning, that there were thunders and lightnings,  a thick cloud upon the mount,  the voice of an exceedingly loud trumpet. And all the people who were in the camp trembled.
Exod. And Moses brought forth the people out of the camp to meet God,  they stood at the lower part of the mount.
Exod. And mount Sinai, the whole of it, smoked, because Jehovah descended upon it in fire,  the smoke of it ascended as the smoke of a furnace. And the whole mount quaked greatly.
Exod. And when the voice of the trumpet grew louder and louder, Moses spoke,  God answered him by a voice.
Exod. And Jehovah came down upon mount Sinai, to the top of the mount. And Jehovah called Moses to the top of the mount,  Moses went up.
Exod. And Jehovah said to Moses, Go down, command the people, lest they break through to Jehovah to gaze,  many of them perish.
Exod. And let the priests also, who come near to Jehovah, sanctify themselves, lest Jehovah break forth upon them.
Exod. And Moses said to Jehovah, The people cannot come up to mount Sinai, for thou commanded us, saying, Set bounds about the mount,  sanctify it.
Exod. And Jehovah said to him, Go, get thee down. And thou shall come up, thou,  Aaron with thee,  do not let the priests and the people break through to come up to Jehovah, lest he break forth upon them.
Exod. So Moses went down to the people,  told them.
Exod. And God spoke all these words, saying,
Exod. I am Jehovah thy God, who brought thee out of the land of Egypt, out of the house of bondage.
Exod. Thou shall have no other gods before me.
Exod. Thou shall not make to thee a graven image, nor any likeness of anything that is in heaven above, or that is on the earth beneath, or that is in the water under the earth.
Exod. Thou shall not bow down thyself to them, nor serve them, for I, Jehovah thy God, am a jealous God, visiting the iniquity of the fathers upon the sons, upon the third and upon the fourth generation of those who hate me,
Exod. and showing loving kindness to thousands of those who love me and keep my commandments.
Exod. Thou shall not take the name of Jehovah thy God in vain, for Jehovah will not hold him guiltless who takes his name in vain.
Exod. Remember the sabbath day, to keep it holy.
Exod. Six days thou shall labor,  do all thy work,
Exod. but the seventh day is a sabbath to Jehovah thy God. Thou shall not do any work, thou, nor thy son, nor thy daughter, thy man-servant, nor thy maid-servant, nor thy cattle, nor thy stranger that is within thy gates,
Exod. for in six days Jehovah made heaven and earth, the sea,  all that is in them,  rested the seventh day. Therefore Jehovah blessed the sabbath day,  hallowed it.
Exod. Honor thy father and thy mother, that thy days may be long in the land which Jehovah thy God gives thee.
Exod. Thou shall not murder.
Exod. Thou shall not commit adultery.
Exod. Thou shall not steal.
Exod. Thou shall not bear false witness against thy neighbor.
Exod. Thou shall not covet thy neighbor's house. Thou shall not covet thy neighbor's wife, nor his man-servant, nor his maid-servant, nor his ox, nor his donkey, nor anything that is thy neighbor's.
Exod. And all the people perceived the thunderings,  the lightnings,  the voice of the trumpet,  the mountain smoking. And when the people saw it, they trembled,  stood afar off.
Exod. And they said to Moses, Speak thou with us,  we will hear,  let not God speak with us, lest we die.
Exod. And Moses said to the people, Fear not, for God has come to prove you,  that his fear may be before you, that ye not sin.
Exod. And the people stood afar off,  Moses drew near to the thick darkness where God was.
Exod. And Jehovah said to Moses, Thus thou shall say to the sons of Israel, Ye yourselves have seen that I have talked with you from heaven.
Exod. Ye shall not make other gods with me; gods of silver, or gods of gold, ye shall not make to you.
Exod. An altar of earth thou shall make to me,  shall sacrifice on it thy burnt offerings,  thy peace offerings, thy sheep,  thine oxen. In every place where I record my name I will come to thee and I will bless thee.
Exod. And if thou make to me an altar of stone, thou shall not build it of hewn stones, for if thou lift up thy tool upon it, thou have polluted it.
Exod. Neither shall thou go up by steps to my altar, that thy nakedness be not uncovered on it.
Exod. Now these are the ordinances which thou shall set before them.
Exod. If thou buy a Hebrew servant, six years he shall serve,  in the seventh he shall go out free for nothing.
Exod. If he comes in by himself, he shall go out by himself. If he be married, then his wife shall go out with him.
Exod. If his master gives him a wife and she bears him sons or daughters, the wife and her sons shall be her master's,  he shall go out by himself.
Exod. But if the servant shall plainly say, I love my master, my wife,  my sons, I will not go out free,
Exod. then his master shall bring him to God,  shall bring him to the door, or to the door-post,  his master shall bore his ear through with an awl,  he shall serve him forever.
Exod. And if a man sells his daughter to be a maid-servant, she shall not go out as the men-servants do.
Exod. If she does not please her master, who has espoused her to himself, then he shall let her be redeemed. He shall have no power to sell her to a foreign people, since he has dealt deceitfully with her.
Exod. And if he espouses her to his son, he shall deal with her according to the manner of daughters.
Exod. If he takes him another wife, her food, her raiment,  her duty of marriage, he shall not diminish.
Exod. And if he does not do these three things to her, then she shall go out for nothing, without money.
Exod. He who smites a man, so that he dies, shall surely be put to death.
Exod. And if a man does not lie in wait,  God delivers him into his hand, then I will appoint for thee a place where he shall flee.
Exod. And if a man comes presumptuously upon his neighbor, to kill him with guile, thou shall take him from my altar, that he may die.
Exod. And he who smites his father or his mother, shall surely be put to death.
Exod. And he who steals a man,  sells him, or if he be found in his hand, he shall surely be put to death.
Exod. And he who curses his father or his mother, shall surely be put to death.
Exod. And if men contend,  one smites the other with a stone, or with his fist,  he does not die,  keeps his bed,
Exod. if he rises again,  walks abroad upon his staff, then he who smote him shall be acquitted. Only he shall pay for the loss of his time,  shall cause him to be thoroughly healed.
Exod. And if a man smites his servant, or his maid, with a rod,  he dies under his hand, he shall surely be punished.
Exod. Notwithstanding, if he continues a day or two, he shall not be punished, for he is his money.
Exod. And if men strive together,  hurt a woman with child, so that her fruit depart,  yet no harm follow, he shall be surely fined, according as the woman's husband shall lay upon him,  he shall pay as the judges determine.
Exod. But if any harm follows, then thou shall give life for life,
Exod. eye for eye, tooth for tooth, hand for hand, foot for foot,
Exod. burning for burning, wound for wound, stripe for stripe.
Exod. And if a man smites the eye of his servant, or the eye of his maid,  destroys it, he shall let him go free for his eye's sake.
Exod. And if he knocks out his man-servant's tooth, or his maid-servant's tooth, he shall let him go free for his tooth's sake.
Exod. And if an ox gores a man or a woman to death, the ox shall surely be stoned,  its flesh shall not be eaten,  the owner of the ox shall be acquitted.
Exod. But if the ox was accustomed to gore in time past,  it has been testified to its owner,  he has not kept it in,  it has killed a man or a woman, the ox shall be stoned,  its owner shall also be put to death.
Exod. If a ransom is laid on him, then he shall give for the redemption of his life whatever is laid upon him.
Exod. Whether it has gored a son, or has gored a daughter, according to this judgment it shall be done to him.
Exod. If the ox gores a man-servant or a maid-servant, there shall be given to their master thirty shekels of silver,  the ox shall be stoned.
Exod. And if a man shall open a pit, or if a man shall dig a pit and not cover it,  an ox or a donkey falls in it,
Exod. the owner of the pit shall make it good; he shall give money to the owner of it,  the dead beast shall be his.
Exod. And if one man's ox hurts another's, so that it dies, then they shall sell the live ox,  divide the price of it,  the dead they shall also divide.
Exod. Or if it be known that the ox was accustomed to gore in time past,  its owner has not kept it in, he shall surely pay ox for ox,  the dead beast shall be his own.
Exod. If a man shall steal an ox, or a sheep,  kill it, or sell it, he shall pay five oxen for an ox,  four sheep for a sheep.
Exod. If the thief is found breaking in,  be smitten so that he dies, there shall be no bloodguiltiness for him.
Exod. If the sun be risen upon him, there shall be bloodguiltiness for him. A thief shall make restitution. If he has nothing, then he shall be sold for his theft.
Exod. If the theft is found in his hand alive, whether it be ox, or donkey, or sheep, he shall pay double.
Exod. If a man shall cause a field or vineyard to be eaten,  shall let his beast loose,  it feeds in another man's field, he shall make restitution of the best of his own field,  of the best of his own vineyard.
Exod. If fire breaks out,  catches in thorns, so that the shocks of grain, or the standing grain, or the field are consumed, he who kindled the fire shall surely make restitution.
Exod. If a man shall deliver to his neighbor money or stuff to keep,  it be stolen out of the man's house, if the thief be found, he shall pay double.
Exod. If the thief is not found, then the master of the house shall come near to God, to see whether he has not put his hand to his neighbor's goods.
Exod. For every matter of trespass, whether it be for ox, for donkey, for sheep, for raiment, or for any manner of lost thing, of which a man says, This is it, the case of both parties shall come before God. He whom God shall condemn shall pay double to his neighbor.
Exod. If a man delivers to his neighbor a donkey, or an ox, or a sheep, or any beast, to keep,  it dies, or be hurt, or driven away, no man seeing it,
Exod. the oath of Jehovah shall be between them both, whether he has not put his hand to his neighbor's goods. And the owner of it shall accept it,  he shall not make restitution.
Exod. But if it is stolen from him, he shall make restitution to the owner of it.
Exod. If it is torn in pieces, let him bring it for evidence. He shall not make good that which was torn.
Exod. And if a man borrows anything of his neighbor,  it be hurt, or die, the owner of it not being with it, he shall surely make restitution.
Exod. If the owner of it is with it, he shall not make it good. If it be a hired thing, it came for its hire.
Exod. And if a man entices a virgin who is not betrothed,  lies with her, he shall surely pay a dowry for her to be his wife.
Exod. If her father utterly refuses to give her to him, he shall pay money according to the dowry of virgins.
Exod. Thou shall not allow a sorceress to live.
Exod. Whoever lies with a beast shall surely be put to death.
Exod. He who sacrifices to any god, except to Jehovah only, shall be utterly destroyed.
Exod. And thou shall not wrong a sojourner, neither shall thou oppress him, for ye were sojourners in the land of Egypt.
Exod. Ye shall not afflict any widow, or fatherless child.
Exod. If thou afflict them at all,  they cry at all to me, I will surely hear their cry,
Exod. and my wrath shall grow hot,  I will kill you with the sword,  your wives shall be widows,  your sons fatherless.
Exod. If thou lend money to any of my people with thee who is poor, thou shall not be to him as a creditor, neither shall ye lay upon him interest.
Exod. If thou at all take thy neighbor's garment to pledge, thou shall restore it to him before the sun goes down,
Exod. for that is his only covering. It is his garment for his skin. How shall he sleep? And it shall come to pass, when he cries to me, that I will hear, for I am gracious.
Exod. Thou shall not revile God, nor speak ill of a ruler of thy people.
Exod. Thou shall not delay to offer from thy harvest,  from the outflow of thy presses. The firstborn of thy sons thou shall give to me.
Exod. Likewise thou shall do with thine oxen,  with thy sheep. Seven days it shall be with its dam. On the eighth day thou shall give it me.
Exod. And ye shall be holy men to me. Therefore ye shall not eat any flesh that is torn of beasts in the field. Ye shall cast it to the dogs.
Exod. Thou shall not take up a false report. Do not put thy hand with the wicked man to be an unrighteous witness.
Exod. Thou shall not follow a multitude to do evil, neither shall thou speak in a case to turn aside after a multitude to distort justice,
Exod. neither shall thou favor a poor man in his case.
Exod. If thou meet thine enemy's ox or his donkey going astray, thou shall surely bring it back to him again.
Exod. If thou see the donkey of him who hates thee lying under his burden, thou shall refrain leaving him. Thou shall surely release it with him.
Exod. Thou shall not distort the justice due to thy poor in his case.
Exod. Keep thee far from a false matter. And do not kill an innocent and righteous man, for I will not justify a wicked man.
Exod. And thou shall take no bribe, for a bribe blinds those who have sight,  perverts the words of the righteous.
Exod. And thou shall not oppress a sojourner, for ye know the heart of a sojourner, since ye were sojourners in the land of Egypt.
Exod. And six years thou shall sow thy land,  shall gather in the increase of it,
Exod. but the seventh year thou shall let it rest and lie fallow, that the poor of thy people may eat,  what they leave the beast of the field shall eat. In like manner thou shall deal with thy vineyard,  with thy oliveyard.
Exod. Six days thou shall do thy work,  on the seventh day thou shall rest, that thine ox and thy donkey may have rest,  the son of thy handmaid,  the sojourner, may be refreshed.
Exod. And in all things that I have said to you take ye heed,  make no mention of the name of other gods, neither let it be heard out of thy mouth.
Exod. Three times thou shall keep a feast to me in the year.
Exod. Thou shall keep the feast of unleavened bread (Seven days thou shall eat unleavened bread, as I commanded thee, at the time appointed in the month Abib, for in it thou came out from Egypt,  none shall appear before me empty),
Exod. and the feast of harvest, the first-fruits of thy labors, which thou sow in the field,  the feast of ingathering at the end of the year, when thou gather in thy labors out of the field.
Exod. Three times in the year all thy males shall appear before the lord Jehovah.
Exod. Thou shall not offer the blood of my sacrifice with leavened bread, neither shall the fat of my feast remain all night until the morning.
Exod. The first of the first-fruits of thy ground thou shall bring into the house of Jehovah thy God. Thou shall not boil a kid in its mother's milk.
Exod. Behold, I send an agent before thee, to keep thee by the way,  to bring thee into the place which I have prepared.
Exod. Take ye heed before him,  hearken to his voice, provoke him not. For he will not pardon your transgression, for my name is in him.
Exod. But if thou shall indeed hearken to his voice,  do all that I speak, then I will be an enemy to thine enemies,  an adversary to thine adversaries.
Exod. For my agent shall go before thee,  bring thee in to the Amorite,  the Hittite,  the Perizzite,  the Canaanite, the Hivite,  the Jebusite,  I will cut them off.
Exod. Thou shall not bow down to their gods, nor serve them, nor do after their works,  thou shall utterly overthrow them,  break their pillars in pieces.
Exod. And ye shall serve Jehovah your God,  he will bless thy bread,  thy water,  I will take sickness away from the midst of thee.
Exod. There shall none cast her young, nor be barren, in thy land; I will fulfill the number of thy days.
Exod. I will send my terror before thee,  will destroy all the people to whom thou shall come,  I will make all thine enemies turn their backs to thee.
Exod. And I will send the hornet before thee, which shall drive out the Hivite, the Canaanite,  the Hittite, from before thee.
Exod. I will not drive them out from before thee in one year, lest the land become desolate,  the beasts of the field multiply against thee.
Exod. Little by little I will drive them out from before thee, until thou be increased,  inherit the land.
Exod. And I will set thy border from the Red Sea even to the sea of the Philistines,  from the wilderness to the River. For I will deliver the inhabitants of the land into your hand,  thou shall drive them out before thee.
Exod. Thou shall make no covenant with them, nor with their gods.
Exod. They shall not dwell in thy land, lest they make thee sin against me, for if thou serve their gods, it will surely be a snare to thee.
Exod. And he said to Moses, Come up to Jehovah, thou,  Aaron, Nadab,  Abihu,  seventy of the elders of Israel,  worship ye afar off.
Exod. And Moses alone shall come near to Jehovah,  they shall not come near, neither shall the people go up with him.
Exod. And Moses came and told the people all the words of Jehovah,  all the ordinances. And all the people answered with one voice,  said, All the words which Jehovah has spoken will we do.
Exod. And Moses wrote all the words of Jehovah,  rose up early in the morning,  built an altar below the mount,  twelve pillars, according to the twelve tribes of Israel.
Exod. And he sent young men of the sons of Israel, who offered burnt offerings,  sacrificed peace offerings of oxen to Jehovah.
Exod. And Moses took half of the blood,  put it in basins,  half of the blood he sprinkled on the altar.
Exod. And he took the book of the covenant,  read in the audience of the people. And they said, All that Jehovah has spoken will we do,  be obedient.
Exod. And Moses took the blood,  sprinkled it on the people,  said, Behold the blood of the covenant that Jehovah has made with you concerning all these words.
Exod. Then Moses,  Aaron, Nadab,  Abihu,  seventy of the elders of Israel went up.
Exod. And they saw the God of Israel. And there was under his feet as it were a paved work of sapphire stone,  as it were the very heaven for clearness.
Exod. And he laid not his hand upon the nobles of the sons of Israel. And they beheld God,  ate and drank.
Exod. And Jehovah said to Moses, Come up to me onto the mount,  be there,  I will give thee the tablets of stone,  the law and the commandment, which I have written, that thou may teach them.
Exod. And Moses rose up,  Joshua his minister,  Moses went up onto the mount of God.
Exod. And he said to the elders, Tarry ye here for us, until we come again to you. And, behold, Aaron and Hur are with you; whoever has a case, let him come near to them.
Exod. And Moses went up onto the mount,  the cloud covered the mount.
Exod. And the glory of Jehovah abode upon mount Sinai,  the cloud covered it six days. And the seventh day he called to Moses out of the midst of the cloud.
Exod. And the appearance of the glory of Jehovah was like devouring fire on the top of the mount in the eyes of the sons of Israel.
Exod. And Moses entered into the midst of the cloud,  went up onto the mount. And Moses was on the mount forty days and forty nights.
Exod. And Jehovah spoke to Moses, saying,
Exod. Speak to the sons of Israel, that they take for me an offering; of every man whose heart makes him willing ye shall take my offering.
Exod. And this is the offering which ye shall take of them: gold,  silver,  brass,
Exod. and blue,  purple,  scarlet,  fine linen,  goats' hair,
Exod. and rams' skins dyed red,  certain skins,  acacia wood,
Exod. oil for the light, spices for the anointing oil and for the sweet incense,
Exod. onyx stones,  stones to be set for the ephod and for the breastplate.
Exod. And let them make me a sanctuary, that I may dwell among them.
Exod. According to all that I show thee: the pattern of the tabernacle,  the pattern of all the furniture of it, even so shall ye make it.
Exod. And they shall make an ark of acacia wood. Two cubits and a half shall be the length of it,  a cubit and a half the breadth of it,  a cubit and a half the height of it.
Exod. And thou shall overlay it with pure gold. Inside and outside thou shall overlay it,  shall make upon it a crown of gold round about.
Exod. And thou shall cast four rings of gold for it,  put them in the four feet of it. And two rings shall be on the one side of it,  two rings on the other side of it.
Exod. And thou shall make staves of acacia wood,  overlay them with gold.
Exod. And thou shall put the staves into the rings on the sides of the ark, with which to bear the ark.
Exod. The staves shall be in the rings of the ark; they shall not be taken from it.
Exod. And thou shall put into the ark the testimony which I shall give thee.
Exod. And thou shall make a mercy-seat of pure gold: two cubits and a half the length of it,  a cubit and a half the breadth of it.
Exod. And thou shall make two cherubim of gold; of beaten work shall thou make them, at the two ends of the mercy-seat.
Exod. And make one cherub at the one end,  one cherub at the other end; of one piece with the mercy-seat ye shall make the cherubim on the two ends of it.
Exod. And the cherubim shall spread out their wings on high, covering the mercy-seat with their wings, with their faces one to another; the faces of the cherubim shall be toward the mercy-seat.
Exod. And thou shall put the mercy-seat above upon the ark. And in the ark thou shall put the testimony that I shall give thee.
Exod. And there I will meet with thee. And I will commune with thee from above the mercy-seat, from between the two cherubim which are upon the ark of the testimony, of all things which I will give thee in commandment to the sons of Israel.
Exod. And thou shall make a table of acacia wood, two cubits the length of it,  a cubit the breadth of it,  a cubit and a half the height of it.
Exod. And thou shall overlay it with pure gold,  make thereto a crown of gold round about.
Exod. And thou shall make to it a border of a handbreadth round about,  thou shall make a golden crown to the border of it round about.
Exod. And thou shall make for it four rings of gold,  put the rings in the four corners that are on the four feet of it.
Exod. The rings shall be close by the border, for places for the staves to bear the table.
Exod. And thou shall make the staves of acacia wood,  overlay them with gold, that the table may be borne with them.
Exod. And thou shall make the dishes of it,  the spoons of it,  the pitchers of it,  the bowls of it, with which to pour out, of pure gold thou shall make them.
Exod. And thou shall set upon the table showbread before me always.
Exod. And thou shall make a lampstand of pure gold. Of beaten work shall the lampstand be made, even its base,  its shaft, its cups, its knobs,  its flowers, shall be of one piece with it.
Exod. And there shall be six branches going out of the sides of it, three branches of the lampstand out of the one side of it,  three branches of the lampstand out of the other side of it:
Exod. three cups made like almond-blossoms in one branch, a knob and a flower,  three cups made like almond-blossoms in the other branch, a knob and a flower, so for the six branches going out of the lampstand,
Exod. and in the lampstand four cups made like almond-blossoms, the knobs of it,  the flowers of it.
Exod. And a knob under two branches of one piece with it,  a knob under two branches of one piece with it,  a knob under two branches of one piece with it, for the six branches going out of the lampstand.
Exod. Their knobs and their branches shall be of one piece with it, the whole of it one beaten work of pure gold.
Exod. And thou shall make the lamps of it, seven. And they shall light the lamps of it, to give light in front of it.
Exod. And the snuffers of it,  the snuff dishes of it, shall be of pure gold.
Exod. Of a talent of pure gold shall it be made, with all these vessels.
Exod. And see that thou make them according to their pattern that has been shown thee on the mountain.
Exod. Moreover thou shall make the tabernacle with ten curtains, of fine twined linen,  blue,  purple,  scarlet, with cherubim the work of the skilful workman shall thou make them.
Exod. The length of each curtain shall be twenty-eight cubits,  the breadth of each curtain four cubits. All the curtains shall have one measure.
Exod. Five curtains shall be coupled together one to another,  the other five curtains shall be coupled one to another.
Exod. And thou shall make loops of blue upon the edge of the one curtain from the selvedge in the coupling,  likewise thou shall make in the edge of the curtain that is outmost in the second coupling.
Exod. Fifty loops thou shall make in the one curtain,  fifty loops thou shall make in the edge of the curtain that is in the second coupling; the loops shall be opposite one to another.
Exod. And thou shall make fifty clasps of gold,  couple the curtains one to another with the clasps. And the tabernacle shall be one whole.
Exod. And thou shall make curtains of goats' hair for a tent over the tabernacle. Eleven curtains thou shall make them.
Exod. The length of each curtain shall be thirty cubits,  the breadth of each curtain four cubits. The eleven curtains shall have one measure.
Exod. And thou shall couple five curtains by themselves,  six curtains by themselves,  shall double over the sixth curtain in the forefront of the tent.
Exod. And thou shall make fifty loops on the edge of the one curtain that is outmost in the coupling,  fifty loops upon the edge of the curtain which is outmost in the second coupling.
Exod. And thou shall make fifty clasps of brass,  put the clasps into the loops,  couple the tent together, that it may be one.
Exod. And the overhanging part that remains of the curtains of the tent, the half curtain that remains, shall hang over the back of the tabernacle.
Exod. And the cubit on the one side,  the cubit on the other side, of that which remains in the length of the curtains of the tent, shall hang over the sides of the tabernacle on this side and on that side, to cover it.
Exod. And thou shall make a covering for the tent of rams' skins dyed red,  a covering of certain skins above.
Exod. And thou shall make the boards for the tabernacle of acacia wood, standing up.
Exod. Ten cubits shall be the length of a board,  a cubit and a half the breadth of each board.
Exod. There shall be two tenons in each board, joined one to another. Thus thou shall make for all the boards of the tabernacle.
Exod. And thou shall make the boards for the tabernacle, twenty boards for the south side southward.
Exod. And thou shall make forty sockets of silver under the twenty boards: two sockets under one board for its two tenons,  two sockets under another board for its two tenons.
Exod. And for the second side of the tabernacle, on the north side, twenty boards,
Exod. and their forty sockets of silver: two sockets under one board,  two sockets under another board.
Exod. And for the hinder part of the tabernacle westward thou shall make six boards.
Exod. And thou shall make two boards for the corners of the tabernacle in the hinder part.
Exod. And they shall be double beneath,  in like manner they shall be entire to the top of it to one ring. Thus shall it be for them both, they shall be for the two corners.
Exod. And there shall be eight boards,  their sockets of silver, sixteen sockets: two sockets under one board,  two sockets under another board.
Exod. And thou shall make bars of acacia wood: five for the boards of the one side of the tabernacle,
Exod. and five bars for the boards of the other side of the tabernacle,  five bars for the boards of the side of the tabernacle, for the hinder part westward.
Exod. And the middle bar in the midst of the boards shall pass through from end to end.
Exod. And thou shall overlay the boards with gold,  make their rings of gold for places for the bars. And thou shall overlay the bars with gold.
Exod. And thou shall raise up the tabernacle according to the fashion of it which has been shown thee on the mount.
Exod. And thou shall make a veil of blue,  purple,  scarlet,  fine twined linen. With cherubim the work of the skilful workman shall it be made.
Exod. And thou shall hang it upon four pillars of acacia overlaid with gold, their hooks shall be of gold, upon four sockets of silver.
Exod. And thou shall hang up the veil under the clasps,  shall bring in there within the veil the ark of the testimony. And the veil shall separate to you between the holy place and the most holy.
Exod. And thou shall put the mercy-seat upon the ark of the testimony in the most holy place.
Exod. And thou shall set the table outside the veil,  the lampstand opposite the table on the side of the tabernacle toward the south. And thou shall put the table on the north side.
Exod. And thou shall make a screen for the door of the tent, of blue,  purple,  scarlet,  fine twined linen, the work of the embroiderer.
Exod. And thou shall make for the screen five pillars of acacia,  overlay them with gold. Their hooks shall be of gold,  thou shall cast five sockets of brass for them.
Exod. And thou shall make the altar of acacia wood, five cubits long,  five cubits broad (the altar shall be foursquare),  the height of it shall be three cubits.
Exod. And thou shall make the horns of it upon the four corners of it. The horns of it shall be of one piece with it,  thou shall overlay it with brass.
Exod. And thou shall make its pots to take away its ashes,  its shovels,  its basins,  its flesh-hooks,  its firepans; all the vessels of it thou shall make of brass.
Exod. And thou shall make for it a grating of network of brass,  upon the network thou shall make four brazen rings in the four corners of it.
Exod. And thou shall put it under the ledge round the altar beneath, that the network may reach halfway up the altar.
Exod. And thou shall make staves for the altar, staves of acacia wood,  overlay them with brass.
Exod. And the staves of it shall be put into the rings,  the staves shall be upon the two sides of the altar, in bearing it.
Exod. Thou shall make it hollow with planks. As it has been shown thee on the mount, so shall they make it.
Exod. And thou shall make the court of the tabernacle. For the south side southward there shall be hangings for the court of fine twined linen a hundred cubits long for one side.
Exod. And the pillars of it shall be twenty,  their sockets twenty, of brass. The hooks of the pillars and their bands shall be of silver.
Exod. And likewise for the north side in length there shall be hangings a hundred cubits long,  the pillars of it twenty,  their sockets twenty, of brass, the hooks of the pillars and their bands, of silver.
Exod. And for the breadth of the court on the west side shall be hangings of fifty cubits, their pillars ten,  their sockets ten.
Exod. And the breadth of the court on the east side eastward shall be fifty cubits.
Exod. The hangings for the one side of the gate shall be fifteen cubits, their pillars three,  their sockets three.
Exod. And for the other side shall be hangings of fifteen cubits, their pillars three,  their sockets three.
Exod. And for the gate of the court shall be a screen of twenty cubits, of blue,  purple,  scarlet,  fine twined linen, the work of the embroiderer, their pillars four,  their sockets four.
Exod. All the pillars of the court round about shall be banded with silver, their hooks of silver,  their sockets of brass.
Exod. The length of the court shall be a hundred cubits,  the breadth fifty everywhere,  the height five cubits, of fine twined linen,  their sockets of brass.
Exod. All the instruments of the tabernacle in all the service of it,  all the pegs of it,  all the pegs of the court, shall be of brass.
Exod. And thou shall command the sons of Israel, that they bring to thee pure beaten olive oil for the light, to cause a lamp to burn continually
Exod. in the tent of meeting, outside the veil which is before the testimony. Aaron and his sons shall keep it in order from evening to morning before Jehovah. It shall be a statute forever throughout their generations on the behalf of the sons of Israel.
Exod. And bring thou near to thee Aaron thy brother,  his sons with him, from among the sons of Israel, that he may minister to me in the priest's office, even Aaron, Nadab and Abihu, Eleazar and Ithamar, Aaron's sons.
Exod. And thou shall make holy garments for Aaron thy brother, for glory and for beauty.
Exod. And thou shall speak to all who are wise-hearted, whom I have filled with the spirit of wisdom, that they make Aaron's garments to sanctify him, that he may minister to me in the priest's office.
Exod. And these are the garments which they shall make: a breastplate,  an ephod,  a robe,  a tunic of checker work, a miter,  a sash. And they shall make holy garments for Aaron thy brother,  his sons, that he may minister to me in the priest's office.
Exod. And they shall take the gold,  the blue,  the purple,  the scarlet,  the fine linen.
Exod. And they shall make the ephod of gold, of blue,  purple, scarlet,  fine twined linen, the work of the skilful workman.
Exod. It shall have two shoulder-pieces joined to the two ends of it, that it may be joined together.
Exod. And the skillfully woven band, which is upon it, with which to gird it on, shall be like the work of it and of the same piece, of gold, of blue,  purple,  scarlet,  fine twined linen.
Exod. And thou shall take two onyx stones,  engrave on them the names of the sons of Israel:
Exod. six of their names on the one stone,  the names of the six that remain on the other stone, according to their birth.
Exod. With the work of an engraver in stone, like the engravings of a signet, thou shall engrave the two stones, according to the names of the sons of Israel. Thou shall make them to be enclosed in settings of gold.
Exod. And thou shall put the two stones upon the shoulder-pieces of the ephod, to be stones of memorial for the sons of Israel. And Aaron shall bear their names before Jehovah upon his two shoulders for a memorial.
Exod. And thou shall make settings of gold,
Exod. and two chains of pure gold, like cords shall thou make them, of wreathen work. And thou shall put the wreathen chains on the settings.
Exod. And thou shall make a breastplate of judgment, the work of the skilful workman. Thou shall make it like the work of the ephod: of gold, of blue,  purple,  scarlet,  fine twined linen, thou shall make it.
Exod. It shall be foursquare and double, a span shall be the length of it,  a span the breadth of it.
Exod. And thou shall set in it settings of stones, four rows of stones: a row of sardius, topaz,  carbuncle shall be the first row,
Exod. and the second row an emerald, a sapphire,  a diamond,
Exod. and the third row a jacinth, an agate,  an amethyst,
Exod. and the fourth row a beryl,  an onyx,  a jasper. They shall be enclosed in gold in their settings.
Exod. And the stones shall be according to the names of the sons of Israel, twelve, according to their names, like the engravings of a signet, every one according to his name; they shall be for the twelve tribes.
Exod. And thou shall make upon the breastplate chains like cords, of wreathen work of pure gold.
Exod. And thou shall make upon the breastplate two rings of gold,  shall put the two rings on the two ends of the breastplate.
Exod. And thou shall put the two wreathen chains of gold in the two rings at the ends of the breastplate.
Exod. And the other two ends of the two wreathen chains thou shall put on the two settings,  put them on the shoulder-pieces of the ephod in the forepart of it.
Exod. And thou shall make two rings of gold,  thou shall put them upon the two ends of the breastplate, upon the edge of it, which is toward the side of the ephod inward.
Exod. And thou shall make two rings of gold,  shall put them on the two shoulder-pieces of the ephod underneath, in the forepart of it, close by the coupling of it, above the skillfully woven band of the ephod.
Exod. And they shall bind the breastplate by the rings of it to the rings of the ephod with a lace of blue, that it may be upon the skillfully woven band of the ephod,  that the breastplate be not loosed from the ephod.
Exod. And Aaron shall bear the names of the sons of Israel in the breastplate of judgment upon his heart, when he goes in to the holy place, for a memorial before Jehovah continually.
Exod. And thou shall put in the breastplate of judgment the Urim and the Thummim,  they shall be upon Aaron's heart, when he goes in before Jehovah. And Aaron shall bear the judgment of the sons of Israel upon his heart before Jehovah continually.
Exod. And thou shall make the robe of the ephod all of blue.
Exod. And it shall have a hole for the head in the midst of it. It shall have a binding of woven work round about the hole of it, as it were the hole of a coat of mail, that it be not torn.
Exod. And upon the skirts of it thou shall make pomegranates of blue,  of purple,  of scarlet, round about the skirts of it,  bells of gold between them round about:
Exod. a golden bell and a pomegranate, a golden bell and a pomegranate, upon the skirts of the robe round about.
Exod. And it shall be upon Aaron to minister. And the sound of it shall be heard when he goes in to the holy place before Jehovah,  when he comes out, that he does not die.
Exod. And thou shall make a plate of pure gold,  engrave upon it, like the engravings of a signet, HOLY TO JEHOVAH.
Exod. And thou shall put it on a lace of blue,  it shall be upon the miter. It shall be upon the forefront of the miter.
Exod. And it shall be upon Aaron's forehead. And Aaron shall bear the iniquity of the holy things, which the sons of Israel shall hallow in all their holy gifts. And it shall always be upon his forehead, that they may be accepted before Jehovah.
Exod. And thou shall weave the tunic in checker work of fine linen. And thou shall make a miter of fine linen. And thou shall make a sash, the work of the embroiderer.
Exod. And for Aaron's sons thou shall make tunics. And thou shall make for them sashes,  head-coverings thou shall make for them, for glory and for beauty.
Exod. And thou shall put them upon Aaron thy brother,  upon his sons with him,  shall anoint them,  consecrate them,  sanctify them, that they may minister to me in the priest's office.
Exod. And thou shall make for them linen breeches to cover the flesh of their nakedness, from the loins even to the thighs they shall reach.
Exod. And they shall be upon Aaron,  upon his sons, when they go in to the tent of meeting, or when they come near to the altar to minister in the holy place, that they not bear iniquity,  die. It shall be a statute forever to him and to his seed after him.
Exod. And this is the thing that thou shall do to them to hallow them, to minister to me in the priest's office: Take one young bullock and two rams without blemish,
Exod. and unleavened bread,  cakes unleavened mingled with oil,  wafers unleavened anointed with oil, of fine wheaten flour shall thou make them,
Exod. and thou shall put them into one basket,  bring them in the basket, with the bullock and the two rams.
Exod. And Aaron and his sons thou shall bring to the door of the tent of meeting,  shall wash them with water.
Exod. And thou shall take the garments,  put upon Aaron the tunic,  the robe of the ephod,  the ephod,  the breastplate,  gird him with the skillfully woven band of the ephod.
Exod. And thou shall set the miter upon his head,  put the holy crown upon the miter.
Exod. Then thou shall take the anointing oil,  pour it upon his head,  anoint him.
Exod. And thou shall bring his sons,  put tunics upon them.
Exod. And thou shall gird them with sashes, Aaron and his sons,  bind head-coverings on them. And they shall have the priesthood by a perpetual statute. And thou shall consecrate Aaron and his sons.
Exod. And thou shall bring the bullock before the tent of meeting. And Aaron and his sons shall lay their hands upon the head of the bullock,
Exod. and thou shall kill the bullock before Jehovah, at the door of the tent of meeting.
Exod. And thou shall take of the blood of the bullock,  put it upon the horns of the altar with thy finger,  thou shall pour out all the blood at the base of the altar.
Exod. And thou shall take all the fat that covers the inwards,  the caul upon the liver,  the two kidneys,  the fat that is upon them,  burn them upon the altar.
Exod. But the flesh of the bullock,  its skin,  it dung, thou shall burn with fire outside the camp. It is a sin offering.
Exod. Thou shall also take the one ram,  Aaron and his sons shall lay their hands upon the head of the ram.
Exod. And thou shall slay the ram,  thou shall take its blood,  sprinkle it round about upon the altar.
Exod. And thou shall cut the ram into its pieces,  wash its inwards,  its legs,  put them with its pieces,  with its head,
Exod. and thou shall burn the whole ram upon the altar. It is a burnt offering to Jehovah. It is a sweet savor, an offering made by fire to Jehovah.
Exod. And thou shall take the other ram,  Aaron and his sons shall lay their hands upon the head of the ram.
Exod. Then thou shall kill the ram,  take of its blood,  put it upon the tip of the right ear of Aaron,  upon the tip of the right ear of his sons,  upon the thumb of their right hand,  upon the great toe of their right foot,  sprinkle the blood upon the altar round about.
Exod. And thou shall take of the blood that is upon the altar,  of the anointing oil,  sprinkle it upon Aaron,  upon his garments,  upon his sons,  upon the garments of his sons with him. And he shall be hallowed,  his garments,  his sons,  his sons' garments with him.
Exod. Also thou shall take from the ram the fat,  the fat tail,  the fat that covers the inwards,  the caul of the liver,  the two kidneys,  the fat that is upon them,  the right thigh (for it is a ram of consecration),
Exod. and one loaf of bread,  one cake of oiled bread,  one wafer, out of the basket of unleavened bread that is before Jehovah,
Exod. and thou shall put the whole upon the hands of Aaron,  upon the hands of his sons,  shall wave them for a wave offering before Jehovah.
Exod. And thou shall take them from their hands,  burn them on the altar upon the burnt offering, for a sweet savor before Jehovah. It is an offering made by fire to Jehovah.
Exod. And thou shall take the breast of Aaron's ram of consecration,  wave it for a wave offering before Jehovah,  it shall be thy portion.
Exod. And thou shall sanctify the breast of the wave offering,  the thigh of the heave offering, which is waved,  which is heaved up, of the ram of consecration, even of that which is for Aaron,  of that which is for his sons,
Exod. and it shall be for Aaron and his sons as their portion forever from the sons of Israel, for it is a heave offering. And it shall be a heave offering from the sons of Israel of the sacrifices of their peace offerings, even their heave offering to Jehovah.
Exod. And the holy garments of Aaron shall be for his sons after him, to be anointed in them,  to be consecrated in them.
Exod. Seven days shall the son that is priest in his stead put them on, when he comes into the tent of meeting to minister in the holy place.
Exod. And thou shall take the ram of consecration,  boil its flesh in a holy place.
Exod. And Aaron and his sons shall eat the flesh of the ram,  the bread that is in the basket, at the door of the tent of meeting.
Exod. And they shall eat those things with which atonement was made, to consecrate and to sanctify them,  a stranger shall not eat of it, because they are holy.
Exod. And if any of the flesh of the consecration, or of the bread, remains to the morning, then thou shall burn the remainder with fire. It shall not be eaten, because it is holy.
Exod. And thus thou shall do to Aaron,  to his sons, according to all that I have commanded thee. Seven days thou shall consecrate them.
Exod. And every day thou shall offer the bullock of sin offering for atonement. And thou shall cleanse the altar when thou make atonement for it,  thou shall anoint it, to sanctify it.
Exod. Seven days thou shall make atonement for the altar,  sanctify it. And the altar shall be most holy. Whatever touches the altar shall be holy.
Exod. Now this is that which thou shall offer upon the altar: two lambs a year old day by day continually.
Exod. The one lamb thou shall offer in the morning,  the other lamb thou shall offer at evening.
Exod. And with the one lamb a tenth part of an ephah of fine flour mingled with the fourth part of a hin of beaten oil,  the fourth part of a hin of wine for a drink offering.
Exod. And the other lamb thou shall offer at evening,  shall do thereto according to the meal offering of the morning,  according to the drink offering of it, for a sweet savor, an offering made by fire to Jehovah.
Exod. It shall be a continual burnt offering throughout your generations at the door of the tent of meeting before Jehovah, where I will meet with you, to speak to thee there.
Exod. And there I will meet with the sons of Israel,  the tent shall be sanctified by my glory.
Exod. And I will sanctify the tent of meeting,  the altar. I will also sanctify Aaron and his sons to minister to me in the priest's office.
Exod. And I will dwell among the sons of Israel,  will be their God.
Exod. And they shall know that I am Jehovah their God, who brought them forth out of the land of Egypt, that I might dwell among them. I am Jehovah their God.
Exod. And thou shall make an altar to burn incense upon. Thou shall make it of acacia wood.
Exod. A cubit shall be the length of it,  a cubit the breadth of it (it shall be foursquare),  two cubits shall be the height of it. The horns of it shall be of one piece with it.
Exod. And thou shall overlay it with pure gold, the top of it,  the sides of it round about,  the horns of it. And thou shall make to it a crown of gold round about.
Exod. And two golden rings thou shall make for it under the crown of it, upon the two ribs of it, upon the two sides of it thou shall make them. And they shall be for places for staves with which to bear it.
Exod. And thou shall make the staves of acacia wood,  overlay them with gold.
Exod. And thou shall put it before the veil that is by the ark of the testimony, before the mercy-seat that is over the testimony, where I will meet with thee.
Exod. And Aaron shall burn in it incense of sweet spices. Every morning, when he dresses the lamps, he shall burn it.
Exod. And when Aaron lights the lamps at evening, he shall burn it, a perpetual incense before Jehovah throughout your generations.
Exod. Ye shall offer no strange incense on it, nor burnt offering, nor meal offering. And ye shall pour no drink offering on it.
Exod. And Aaron shall make atonement upon the horns of it once in the year, with the blood of the sin offering of atonement. Once in the year he shall make atonement for it throughout your generations. It is most holy to Jehovah.
Exod. And Jehovah spoke to Moses, saying,
Exod. When thou take the sum of the sons of Israel, according to those who are numbered of them, then they shall give every man a ransom for his soul to Jehovah when thou number them, that there be no plague among them when thou number them.
Exod. This they shall give, everyone who passes over to those who are numbered: half a shekel after the shekel of the sanctuary, (the shekel is twenty gerahs,) half a shekel for an offering to Jehovah.
Exod. Everyone who passes over to those who are numbered, from twenty years old and upward, shall give the offering of Jehovah.
Exod. The rich shall not give more,  the poor shall not give less, than the half shekel, when they give the offering of Jehovah, to make atonement for your souls.
Exod. And thou shall take the atonement money from the sons of Israel,  shall appoint it for the service of the tent of meeting, that it may be a memorial for the sons of Israel before Jehovah, to make atonement for your souls.
Exod. And Jehovah spoke to Moses, saying,
Exod. Thou shall also make a laver of brass,  the base of it of brass for washing. And thou shall put it between the tent of meeting and the altar,  thou shall put water in it.
Exod. And Aaron and his sons shall wash their hands and their feet there.
Exod. When they go into the tent of meeting, they shall wash with water, that they not die, or when they come near to the altar to minister, to burn an offering made by fire to Jehovah.
Exod. So they shall wash their hands and their feet, that they not die. And it shall be a statute forever to them, even to him and to his seed throughout their generations.
Exod. Moreover Jehovah spoke to Moses, saying,
Exod. Take thou also to thee the chief spices: of flowing myrrh five hundred shekels,  of sweet cinnamon half so much, even two hundred and fifty,  of sweet calamus two hundred and fifty,
Exod. and of cassia five hundred, after the shekel of the sanctuary,  of olive oil a hin.
Exod. And thou shall make it a holy anointing oil, a perfume compounded after the art of the perfumer. It shall be a holy anointing oil.
Exod. And thou shall anoint with it the tent of meeting,  the ark of the testimony,
Exod. and the table and all the vessels of it,  the lampstand and the vessels of it,  the altar of incense,
Exod. and the altar of burnt offering with all the vessels of it,  the laver and the base of it.
Exod. And thou shall sanctify them, that they may be most holy. Whatever touches them shall be holy.
Exod. And thou shall anoint Aaron and his sons,  sanctify them, that they may minister to me in the priest's office.
Exod. And thou shall speak to the sons of Israel, saying, This shall be a holy anointing oil to me throughout your generations.
Exod. Upon the flesh of man it shall not be poured, neither shall ye make any like it, according to the composition of it. It is holy,  it shall be holy to you.
Exod. Whoever compounds any like it, or whoever puts any of it upon a stranger, he shall be cut off from his people.
Exod. And Jehovah said to Moses, Take to thee sweet spices, stacte,  onycha,  galbanum, sweet spices with pure frankincense, of each shall there be a like weight.
Exod. And thou shall make of it incense, a perfume after the art of the perfumer, seasoned with salt, pure and holy.
Exod. And thou shall beat some of it very small,  put of it before the testimony in the tent of meeting, where I will meet with thee. It shall be to you most holy.
Exod. And the incense which thou shall make, ye shall not make for yourselves according to the composition of it. It shall be to thee holy for Jehovah.
Exod. Whoever shall make like that, to smell of it, he shall be cut off from his people.
Exod. And Jehovah spoke to Moses, saying,
Exod. See, I have called by name Bezalel the son of Uri, the son of Hur, of the tribe of Judah,
Exod. and I have filled him with the Spirit of God, in wisdom,  in understanding,  in knowledge,  in all manner of workmanship,
Exod. to devise skilful works, to work in gold,  in silver,  in brass,
Exod. and in cutting of stones for setting,  in carving of wood, to work in all manner of workmanship.
Exod. And I, behold, I have appointed with him Oholiab, the son of Ahisamach, of the tribe of Dan. And in the heart of all who are wise-hearted I have put wisdom, that they may make all that I have commanded thee:
Exod. the tent of meeting,  the ark of the testimony,  the mercy-seat that is on it,  all the furniture of the tent,
Exod. and the table and its vessels,  the pure lampstand with all its vessels,  the altar of incense,
Exod. and the altar of burnt offering with all its vessels,  the laver and its base,
Exod. and the finely wrought garments,  the holy garments for Aaron the priest,  the garments of his sons, to minister in the priest's office,
Exod. and the anointing oil,  the incense of sweet spices for the holy place. According to all that I have commanded thee they shall do.
Exod. And Jehovah spoke to Moses, saying,
Exod. Speak thou also to the sons of Israel, saying, Truly ye shall keep my sabbaths, for it is a sign between me and you throughout your generations, that ye may know that I am Jehovah who sanctifies you.
Exod. Ye shall keep the sabbath therefore, for it is holy to you. Everyone who profanes it shall surely be put to death, for whoever does any work on it, that soul shall be cut off from among his people.
Exod. Six days shall work be done,  on the seventh day is a sabbath of solemn rest, holy to Jehovah. Whoever does any work on the sabbath day, he shall surely be put to death.
Exod. Therefore the sons of Israel shall keep the sabbath, to observe the sabbath throughout their generations, for a perpetual covenant.
Exod. It is a sign between me and the sons of Israel forever. For in six days Jehovah made heaven and earth,  on the seventh day he rested,  was refreshed.
Exod. And he gave to Moses, when he had made an end of communing with him upon mount Sinai, the two tablets of the testimony, tablets of stone, written with the finger of God.
Exod. And when the people saw that Moses delayed to come down from the mount, the people gathered themselves together to Aaron,  said to him, Up, make gods for us, which shall go before us. For as for this Moses, the man that brought us up out of the land of Egypt, we know not what has become of him.
Exod. And Aaron said to them, Break off the golden rings, which are in the ears of your wives, of your sons,  of your daughters,  bring them to me.
Exod. And all the people broke off the golden rings which were in their ears,  brought them to Aaron.
Exod. And he received it at their hand,  fashioned it with a graving tool,  made it a molten calf. And they said, These are thy gods, O Israel, which brought thee up out of the land of Egypt.
Exod. And when Aaron saw this, he built an altar before it. And Aaron made proclamation,  said, Tomorrow shall be a feast to Jehovah.
Exod. And they rose up early on the morrow,  offered burnt offerings,  brought peace offerings. And the people sat down to eat and to drink,  rose up to revel.
Exod. And Jehovah spoke to Moses, Go, get thee down. For thy people, that thou brought up out of the land of Egypt, have corrupted themselves.
Exod. They have turned aside quickly out of the way which I commanded them. They have made for them a molten calf,  have worshiped it,  have sacrificed to it,  said, These are thy gods, O Israel, which brought thee up out of the land of Egypt.
Exod. And Jehovah said to Moses, I have seen this people, , behold, it is a stiff-necked people.
Exod. Now therefore let me alone, that my wrath may grow hot against them,  that I may consume them. And I will make of thee a great nation.
Exod. And Moses besought Jehovah his God,  said, Jehovah, why does thy wrath grow hot against thy people, whom thou have brought forth out of the land of Egypt with great power and with a mighty hand?
Exod. Why should the Egyptians speak, saying, He brought them forth for evil, to kill them on the mountains,  to consume them from the face of the earth? Turn from thy fierce wrath,  relent of this evil against thy people.
Exod. Remember Abraham, Isaac,  Israel, thy servants, to whom thou swore by thine own self,  said to them, I will multiply your seed as the stars of heaven. And all this land that I have spoken of I will give to your seed,  they shall inherit it forever.
Exod. And Jehovah relented of the evil which he said he would do to his people.
Exod. And Moses turned,  went down from the mount, with the two tablets of the testimony in his hand, tablets that were written on both their sides; on the one side and on the other were they written.
Exod. And the tablets were the work of God,  the writing was the writing of God, engraved upon the tablets.
Exod. And when Joshua heard the noise of the people as they shouted, he said to Moses, There is a noise of war in the camp.
Exod. And he said, It is not the voice of those who shout for mastery, neither is it the voice of those who cry for being overcome,  the noise of those who sing do I hear.
Exod. And it came to pass, as soon as he came near to the camp, that he saw the calf and the dancing. And Moses' anger grew hot,  he cast the tablets out of his hands,  broke them beneath the mount.
Exod. And he took the calf which they had made,  burnt it with fire,  ground it to powder,  scattered it upon the water,  made the sons of Israel drink of it.
Exod. And Moses said to Aaron, What did this people do to thee, that thou have brought a great sin upon them?
Exod. And Aaron said, Let not the anger of my lord grow hot. Thou know the people, that they are set on evil.
Exod. For they said to me, Make gods for us, which shall go before us. For as for this Moses, the man who brought us up out of the land of Egypt, we know not what has become of him.
Exod. And I said to them, Whoever has any gold, let them break it off. So they gave it to me,  I cast it into the fire,  there came out this calf.
Exod. And when Moses saw that the people were broken loose, (for Aaron had let them loose for a derision among their enemies,)
Exod. then Moses stood in the gate of the camp,  said, Whoever is on Jehovah's side, come to me. And all the sons of Levi gathered themselves together to him.
Exod. And he said to them, Thus says Jehovah, the God of Israel, Put ye every man his sword upon his thigh,  go to and fro from gate to gate throughout the camp,  slay every man his brother,  every man his companion,  every man his neighbor.
Exod. And the sons of Levi did according to the word of Moses. And there fell of the people that day about three thousand men.
Exod. And Moses said, Consecrate yourselves today to Jehovah, yea, every man against his son,  against his brother, that he may bestow upon you a blessing this day.
Exod. And it came to pass on the morrow, that Moses said to the people, Ye have sinned a great sin. And now I will go up to Jehovah, perhaps I shall make atonement for your sin.
Exod. And Moses returned to Jehovah,  said, Oh, this people have sinned a great sin,  have made gods of gold for them.
Exod. Yet now, if thou will forgive their sin-,  if not, blot me, I pray thee, out of thy book which thou have written.
Exod. And Jehovah said to Moses, Whoever has sinned against me, him will I blot out of my book.
Exod. And now go, lead the people to the place of which I have spoken to thee. Behold, my agent shall go before thee. Nevertheless in the day when I visit, I will visit their sin upon them.
Exod. And Jehovah smote the people, because they made the calf, which Aaron made.
Exod. And Jehovah spoke to Moses, Depart, go up from here, thou and the people that thou have brought up out of the land of Egypt, to the land of which I swore to Abraham, to Isaac,  to Jacob, saying, To thy seed will I give it.
Exod. And I will send an agent before thee,  I will drive out the Canaanite, the Amorite,  the Hittite,  the Perizzite, the Hivite,  the Jebusite-
Exod. to a land flowing with milk and honey. For I will not go up in the midst of thee, for thou are a stiff-necked people, lest I consume thee on the way.
Exod. And when the people heard these evil tidings, they mourned,  no man put his ornaments on him.
Exod. And Jehovah said to Moses, Say to the sons of Israel, Ye are a stiff-necked people. If I go up into the midst of thee for one moment, I shall consume thee. Therefore now put off thy ornaments from thee, that I may know what to do to thee.
Exod. And the sons of Israel stripped themselves of their ornaments from mount Horeb onward.
Exod. Now Moses used to take the tent and to pitch it outside the camp, afar off from the camp,  he called it, The tent of meeting. And it came to pass, that everyone who sought Jehovah went out to the tent of meeting, which was outside the camp.
Exod. And it came to pass, when Moses went out to the tent, that all the people rose up,  stood, every man at his tent door,  looked after Moses, until he was gone into the tent.
Exod. And it came to pass, when Moses entered into the tent, the pillar of cloud descended,  stood at the door of the tent,  Jehovah spoke with Moses.
Exod. And all the people saw the pillar of cloud stand at the door of the tent. And all the people rose up and worshiped, every man at his tent door.
Exod. And Jehovah spoke to Moses face to face, as a man speaks to his friend,  he turned again into the camp. But his minister Joshua, the son of Nun, a young man, did not depart out of the tent.
Exod. And Moses said to Jehovah, See, thou say to me, Bring up this people,  thou have not let me know whom thou will send with me. Yet thou have said, I know thee by name,  thou have also found favor in my sight.
Exod. Now therefore, I pray thee, if I have found favor in thy sight, show me now thy ways, that I may know thee, to the end that I may find favor in thy sight. And consider that this nation is thy people.
Exod. And he said, My presence shall go with thee,  I will give thee rest.
Exod. And Moses said to him, If thy presence go not, do not carry us up from here.
Exod. For how shall it now be known that I have found favor in thy sight, I and thy people? Is it not in that thou go with us, so that we are separated, I and thy people, from all the people that are upon the face of the earth?
Exod. And Jehovah said to Moses, I will do this thing also that thou have spoken, for thou have found favor in my sight,  I know thee by name.
Exod. And he said, Show me, I pray thee, thy glory.
Exod. And he said, I will make all my goodness pass before thee,  will proclaim the name of Jehovah before thee. I will be merciful to whom I may be merciful,  I will be compassionate to whomever I may be compassionate.
Exod. And he said, Thou cannot see my face, for man shall not see me and live.
Exod. And Jehovah said, Behold, there is a place by me,  thou shall stand upon the rock.
Exod. And it shall come to pass, while my glory passes by, that I will put thee in a cleft of the rock,  will cover thee with my hand until I have passed by.
Exod. And I will take away my hand,  thou shall see my back,  my face shall not be seen.
Exod. And Jehovah said to Moses, Hew thee two tablets of stone like the first,  I will write upon the tablets the words that were on the first tablets, which thou broke.
Exod. And be ready by the morning,  come up in the morning to mount Sinai,  present thyself there to me on the top of the mount.
Exod. And no man shall come up with thee, neither let any man be seen throughout all the mount, neither let the flocks nor herds feed before that mount.
Exod. And he hewed two tablets of stone like the first. And Moses rose up early in the morning,  went up to mount Sinai, as Jehovah had commanded him,  took in his hand two tablets of stone.
Exod. And Jehovah descended in the cloud,  stood with him there,  proclaimed the name of Jehovah.
Exod. And Jehovah passed by before him,  proclaimed, Jehovah, Jehovah, a God merciful and gracious, slow to anger,  abundant in loving kindness and truth,
Exod. keeping loving kindness for thousands, forgiving iniquity and transgression and sin,  who will by no means clear the guilty, visiting the iniquity of the fathers upon the sons,  upon the sons's sons, upon the third and upon the fourth generation.
Exod. And Moses made haste,  bowed his head toward the earth,  worshiped.
Exod. And he said, If now I have found favor in thy sight, O Lord, let the Lord, I pray thee, go in the midst of us, for it is a stiff-necked people,  pardon our iniquity and our sin,  take us for thine inheritance.
Exod. And he said, Behold, I make a covenant. Before all thy people I will do marvels, such as have not been wrought in all the earth, nor in any nation,  all the people among which thou are shall see the work of Jehovah, for it is an awesome thing that I do with thee.
Exod. Observe thou that which I command thee this day. Behold, I drive out before thee the Amorite,  the Canaanite,  the Hittite,  the Perizzite,  the Hivite,  the Jebusite.
Exod. Take heed to thyself, lest thou make a covenant with the inhabitants of the land where thou go, lest it be for a snare in the midst of thee.
Exod. But ye shall break down their altars,  dash in pieces their pillars,  ye shall cut down their Asherim,
Exod. for thou shall worship no other god. For Jehovah, whose name is Jealous, is a jealous God.
Exod. Lest thou make a covenant with the inhabitants of the land,  they play the harlot after their gods,  sacrifice to their gods,  a man calls thee and thou eat of his sacrifice,
Exod. and thou take of their daughters to thy sons,  their daughters play the harlot after their gods,  make thy sons play the harlot after their gods.
Exod. Thou shall make thee no molten gods.
Exod. Thou shall keep the feast of unleavened bread. Seven days thou shall eat unleavened bread, as I commanded thee, at the time appointed in the month Abib, for in the month Abib thou came out from Egypt.
Exod. All that opens the womb is mine,  all thy cattle that is male, the firstlings of cow and sheep.
Exod. And the firstling of a donkey thou shall redeem with a lamb,  if thou will not redeem it, then thou shall break its neck. All the firstborn of thy sons thou shall redeem. And none shall appear before me empty.
Exod. Six days thou shall work,  on the seventh day thou shall rest; in plowing time and in harvest thou shall rest.
Exod. And thou shall observe the feast of weeks, even of the first-fruits of wheat harvest,  the feast of ingathering in the middle of the year.
Exod. Three times in the year all thy males shall appear before the lord Jehovah, the God of Israel.
Exod. For I will cast out nations before thee,  enlarge thy borders. Neither shall any man desire thy land, when thou go up to appear before Jehovah thy God three times in the year.
Exod. Thou shall not offer the blood of my sacrifice with leavened bread, nor shall the sacrifice of the feast of the Passover be left to the morning.
Exod. The first of the first-fruits of thy ground thou shall bring to the house of Jehovah thy God. Thou shall not boil a kid in its mother's milk.
Exod. And Jehovah said to Moses, Write thou these words, for after the tenor of these words I have made a covenant with thee and with Israel.
Exod. And he was there with Jehovah forty days and forty nights. He neither ate bread, nor drank water,  he wrote upon the tablets the words of the covenant, the ten commandments.
Exod. And it came to pass, when Moses came down from mount Sinai with the two tablets of the testimony in Moses' hand, when he came down from the mount, that Moses did not know that the skin of his face shone by reason of his speaking with him.
Exod. And when Aaron and all the sons of Israel saw Moses, behold, the skin of his face shone,  they were afraid to come near him.
Exod. And Moses called to them. And Aaron and all the rulers of the congregation returned to him,  Moses spoke to them.
Exod. And afterward all the sons of Israel came near,  he gave them in commandment all that Jehovah had spoken with him on mount Sinai.
Exod. And when Moses was done speaking with them, he put a veil on his face.
Exod. But when Moses went in before Jehovah to speak with him, he took the veil off, until he came out. And he came out,  spoke to the sons of Israel that which he was commanded.
Exod. And the sons of Israel saw the face of Moses, that the skin of Moses' face shone. And Moses put the veil upon his face again until he went in to speak with him.
Exod. And Moses assembled all the congregation of the sons of Israel,  said to them, These are the words which Jehovah has commanded, that ye should do them.
Exod. Six days work shall be done,  on the seventh day there shall be to you a holy day, a sabbath of solemn rest to Jehovah. Whoever does any work in it shall be put to death.
Exod. Ye shall kindle no fire throughout your habitations upon the sabbath day.
Exod. And Moses spoke to all the congregation of the sons of Israel, saying, This is the thing which Jehovah commanded, saying,
Exod. Take ye from among you an offering to Jehovah. Whoever is of a willing heart, let him bring it-Jehovah's offering: gold,  silver,  brass,
Exod. and blue,  purple,  scarlet,  fine linen,  goats' hair,
Exod. and rams' skins dyed red,  certain skins,  acacia wood,
Exod. and oil for the light,  spices for the anointing oil,  for the sweet incense,
Exod. and onyx stones,  stones to be set, for the ephod,  for the breastplate.
Exod. And let every wise-hearted man among you come,  make all that Jehovah has commanded:
Exod. the tabernacle, its tent,  its covering, its clasps,  its boards, its bars, its pillars,  its sockets,
Exod. the ark,  the staves of it, the mercy-seat,  the veil of the screen,
Exod. the table,  its staves,  all its vessels,  the showbread,
Exod. the lampstand also for the light,  its vessels,  its lamps,  the oil for the light,
