Exod. and the altar of incense,  its staves,  the anointing oil,  the sweet incense,  the screen for the door, at the door of the tabernacle,
Exod. the altar of burnt offering, with its grating of brass, its staves,  all its vessels, the laver and its base,
Exod. the hangings of the court, the pillars of it,  their sockets,  the screen for the gate of the court,
Exod. the pegs of the tabernacle,  the pegs of the court,  their cords,
Exod. the finely wrought garments, for ministering in the holy place, the holy garments for Aaron the priest,  the garments of his sons, to minister in the priest's office.
Exod. And all the congregation of the sons of Israel departed from the presence of Moses.
Exod. And they came, everyone whose heart stirred him up,  everyone whom his spirit made willing,  brought Jehovah's offering, for the work of the tent of meeting,  for all the service of it,  for the holy garments.
Exod. And they came, both men and women, as many as were willing-hearted,  brought brooches,  earrings,  signet-rings,  armlets, all jewels of gold, even every man who offered an offering of gold to Jehovah.
Exod. And every man, with whom was found blue,  purple,  scarlet,  fine linen,  goats' hair,  rams' skins dyed red,  certain skins, brought them.
Exod. Everyone who offered an offering of silver and brass brought Jehovah's offering,  every man, with whom was found acacia wood for any work of the service, brought it.
Exod. And all the women who were wise-hearted spun with their hands,  brought that which they had spun: the blue,  the purple, the scarlet,  the fine linen.
Exod. And all the women whose heart stirred them up in wisdom spun the goats' hair.
Exod. And the rulers brought the onyx stones,  the stones to be set, for the ephod,  for the breastplate,
Exod. and the spice,  the oil, for the light,  for the anointing oil,  for the sweet incense.
Exod. The sons of Israel brought a freewill offering to Jehovah, every man and woman, whose heart made them willing to bring for all the work, which Jehovah had commanded to be made by Moses.
Exod. And Moses said to the sons of Israel, See, Jehovah has called by name Bezalel the son of Uri, the son of Hur, of the tribe of Judah.
Exod. And he has filled him with the Spirit of God, in wisdom, in understanding,  in knowledge,  in all manner of workmanship,
Exod. and to devise skilful works, to work in gold,  in silver,  in brass,
Exod. and in cutting of stones for setting,  in carving of wood, to work in all manner of skilful workmanship.
Exod. And he has put in his heart that he may teach, both he,  Oholiab, the son of Ahisamach, of the tribe of Dan.
Exod. He has filled them with wisdom of heart, to work all manner of workmanship, of the engraver,  of the skilful workman,  of the embroiderer, in blue,  in purple, in scarlet,  in fine linen,  of the weaver, even of those who do any workmanship,  of those who devise skilful works.
Exod. And Bezalel and Oholiab shall work,  every wise-hearted man, in whom Jehovah has put wisdom and understanding to know how to work all the work for the service of the sanctuary, according to all that Jehovah has commanded.
Exod. And Moses called Bezalel and Oholiab,  every wise-hearted man, in whose heart Jehovah had put wisdom, even everyone whose heart stirred him up to come to the work to do it,
Exod. and they received from Moses all the offering which the sons of Israel had brought for the work of the service of the sanctuary, with which to make it. And they brought yet to him freewill offerings every morning.
Exod. And all the wise men, who wrought all the work of the sanctuary, came every man from his work which they wrought.
Exod. And they spoke to Moses, saying, The people bring much more than enough for the service of the work which Jehovah commanded to make.
Exod. And Moses gave commandment,  they caused it to be proclaimed throughout the camp, saying, Let neither man nor woman make any more work for the offering of the sanctuary. So the people were restrained from bringing.
Exod. For the stuff they had was sufficient for all the work to make it,  too much.
Exod. And all the wise-hearted men among them who wrought the work made the tabernacle with ten curtains, of fine twined linen,  blue,  purple,  scarlet, with cherubim; the work of the skilful workman made them.
Exod. The length of each curtain was twenty-eight cubits,  the breadth of each curtain four cubits. All the curtains had one measure.
Exod. And he coupled five curtains one to another,  the other five curtains he coupled one to another.
Exod. And he made loops of blue upon the edge of the one curtain from the selvedge in the coupling. Likewise he made in the edge of the curtain that was outmost in the second coupling.
Exod. Fifty loops he made in the one curtain,  fifty loops he made in the edge of the curtain that was in the second coupling; the loops were opposite one to another.
Exod. And he made fifty clasps of gold,  coupled the curtains one to another with the clasps, so the tabernacle was one.
Exod. And he made curtains of goats' hair for a tent over the tabernacle. Eleven curtains he made them.
Exod. The length of each curtain was thirty cubits,  four cubits the breadth of each curtain. The eleven curtains had one measure.
Exod. And he coupled five curtains by themselves,  six curtains by themselves.
Exod. And he made fifty loops on the edge of the curtain that was outmost in the coupling,  fifty loops he made upon the edge of the curtain which was outmost in the second coupling.
Exod. And he made fifty clasps of brass to couple the tent together, that it might be one.
Exod. And he made a covering for the tent of rams' skins dyed red,  a covering of certain skins above.
Exod. And he made the boards for the tabernacle, of acacia wood, standing up.
Exod. Ten cubits was the length of a board,  a cubit and a half the breadth of each board.
Exod. Each board had two tenons, joined one to another. Thus he made for all the boards of the tabernacle.
Exod. And he made the boards for the tabernacle. Twenty boards for the south side southward.
Exod. And he made forty sockets of silver under the twenty boards, two sockets under one board for its two tenons,  two sockets under another board for its two tenons.
Exod. And for the second side of the tabernacle, on the north side, he made twenty boards,
Exod. and their forty sockets of silver, two sockets under one board,  two sockets under another board.
Exod. And for the hinder part of the tabernacle westward he made six boards.
Exod. And he made two boards for the corners of the tabernacle in the hinder part.
Exod. And they were double beneath,  in like manner they were entire to the top of it to one ring. Thus he did to both of them in the two corners.
Exod. And there were eight boards,  their sockets of silver, sixteen sockets, under every board two sockets.
Exod. And he made bars of acacia wood, five for the boards of the one side of the tabernacle,
Exod. and five bars for the boards of the other side of the tabernacle,  five bars for the boards of the tabernacle for the hinder part westward.
Exod. And he made the middle bar to pass through in the midst of the boards from the one end to the other.
Exod. And he overlaid the boards with gold. And made their rings of gold for places for the bars,  overlaid the bars with gold.
Exod. And he made the veil of blue,  purple,  scarlet,  fine twined linen. He made it with cherubim, the work of the skilful workman.
Exod. And he made for it four pillars of acacia,  overlaid them with gold. Their hooks were of gold,  he cast for them four sockets of silver.
Exod. And he made a screen for the door of the tent, of blue,  purple,  scarlet,  fine twined linen, the work of the embroiderer,
Exod. and the five pillars of it with their hooks. And he overlaid their capitals and their bands with gold,  their five sockets were of brass.
Exod. And Bezalel made the ark of acacia wood; two cubits and a half was the length of it,  a cubit and a half the breadth of it,  a cubit and a half the height of it.
Exod. And he overlaid it with pure gold inside and outside,  made a crown of gold to it round about.
Exod. And he cast four rings of gold for it, in the four feet of it, even two rings on the one side of it,  two rings on the other side of it.
Exod. And he made staves of acacia wood,  overlaid them with gold.
Exod. And he put the staves into the rings on the sides of the ark, to bear the ark.
Exod. And he made a mercy-seat of pure gold, two cubits and a half the length of it,  a cubit and a half the breadth of it.
Exod. And he made two cherubim of gold, of beaten work he made them, at the two ends of the mercy-seat,
Exod. one cherub at the one end,  one cherub at the other end, of one piece with the mercy-seat. He made the cherubim at the two ends of it.
Exod. And the cherubim spread out their wings on high, covering the mercy-seat with their wings, with their faces one to another. The faces of the cherubim were toward the mercy-seat.
Exod. And he made the table of acacia wood, two cubits the length of it,  a cubit the breadth of it,  a cubit and a half the height of it.
Exod. And he overlaid it with pure gold,  made thereunto a crown of gold round about.
Exod. And he made to it a border of a handbreadth round about,  made a golden crown to the border of it round about.
Exod. And he cast four rings of gold for it,  put the rings in the four corners that were on the four feet of it,
Exod. close by the border were the rings, the places for the staves to bear the table.
Exod. And he made the staves of acacia wood,  overlaid them with gold, to bear the table.
Exod. And he made the vessels which were upon the table, the dishes of it,  the spoons of it,  the bowls of it,  the flagons of it, with which to pour out, of pure gold.
Exod. And he made the lampstand of pure gold. He made the lampstand of beaten work, even its base,  its shaft, its cups, its knobs,  its flowers, were of one piece with it.
Exod. And there were six branches going out of the sides of it, three branches of the lampstand out of the one side of it,  three branches of the lampstand out of the other side of it,
Exod. three cups made like almond-blossoms in one branch, a knob and a flower,  three cups made like almond-blossoms in the other branch, a knob and a flower, so for the six branches going out of the lampstand.
Exod. And in the lampstand were four cups made like almond-blossoms, the knobs of it,  the flowers of it,
Exod. and a knob under two branches of one piece with it,  a knob under two branches of one piece with it,  a knob under two branches of one piece with it, for the six branches going out of it.
Exod. Their knobs and their branches were of one piece with it. The whole of it was one beaten work of pure gold.
Exod. And he made the lamps of it, seven,  the snuffers of it,  the snuff dishes of it, of pure gold.
Exod. He made it of a talent of pure gold,  all the vessels of it.
Exod. And he made the altar of incense of acacia wood: a cubit was the length of it,  a cubit the breadth of it, foursquare,  two cubits was the height of it. The horns of it were of one piece with it.
Exod. And he overlaid it with pure gold, the top of it,  the sides of it round about,  the horns of it. And he made to it a crown of gold round about.
Exod. And he made for it two golden rings under the crown of it, upon the two ribs of it, upon the two sides of it, for places for staves with which to bear it.
Exod. And he made the staves of acacia wood,  overlaid them with gold.
Exod. And he made the holy anointing oil,  the pure incense of sweet spices, after the art of the perfumer.
Exod. And he made the altar of burnt offering of acacia wood: five cubits was the length of it,  five cubits the breadth of it, foursquare,  three cubits the height of it.
Exod. And he made the horns of it upon the four corners of it. The horns of it were of one piece with it,  he overlaid it with brass.
Exod. And he made all the vessels of the altar: the pots,  the shovels,  the basins, the flesh-hooks,  the firepans. All the vessels of it he made of brass.
Exod. And he made for the altar a grating of network of brass, under the ledge around it beneath, reaching halfway up.
Exod. And he cast four rings for the four ends of the grating of brass, to be places for the staves.
Exod. And he made the staves of acacia wood,  overlaid them with brass.
Exod. And he put the staves into the rings on the sides of the altar, with which to bear it; he made it hollow with planks.
Exod. And he made the laver of brass,  the base of it of brass, from the mirrors of the women who fasted, who fasted by the doors of the tabernacle of witness, in the day in which he set it up.
Exod. And he made the court. For the south side southward the hangings of the court were of fine twined linen, a hundred cubits,
Exod. their pillars were twenty,  their sockets twenty, of brass. The hooks of the pillars and their bands were of silver.
Exod. And for the north side a hundred cubits, their pillars twenty,  their sockets twenty, of brass, the hooks of the pillars,  their bands, of silver.
Exod. And for the west side were hangings of fifty cubits, their pillars ten,  their sockets ten, the hooks of the pillars,  their bands, of silver.
Exod. And for the east side eastward fifty cubits.
Exod. The hangings for the one side of the gate were fifteen cubits, their pillars three,  their sockets three,
Exod. and so for the other side. On this hand and that hand by the gate of the court were hangings of fifteen cubits, their pillars three,  their sockets three.
Exod. All the hangings of the court round about were of fine twined linen.
Exod. And the sockets for the pillars were of brass, the hooks of the pillars,  their bands, of silver,  the overlaying of their capitals, of silver. And all the pillars of the court were banded with silver.
Exod. And the screen for the gate of the court was the work of the embroiderer, of blue,  purple,  scarlet,  fine twined linen. And twenty cubits was the length,  the height in the breadth was five cubits, answerable to the hangings of the court.
Exod. And their pillars were four,  their sockets four, of brass, their hooks of silver,  the overlaying of their capitals,  their bands, of silver.
Exod. And all the pegs of the tabernacle,  of the court round about, were of brass.
Exod. This is the sum of the tabernacle, even the tabernacle of the testimony, as they were counted, according to the commandment of Moses, for the service of the Levites, by the hand of Ithamar, the son of Aaron the priest.
Exod. And Bezalel the son of Uri, the son of Hur, of the tribe of Judah, made all that Jehovah commanded Moses.
Exod. And with him was Oholiab, the son of Ahisamach, of the tribe of Dan, an engraver,  a skilful workman,  an embroiderer in blue,  in purple,  in scarlet,  in fine linen.
Exod. All the gold that was used for the work in all the work of the sanctuary, even the gold of the offering, was twenty-nine talents,  seven hundred and thirty shekels, after the shekel of the sanctuary.
Exod. And the silver from those who were numbered of the congregation was a hundred talents,  a thousand seven hundred and seventy-five shekels, after the shekel of the sanctuary,
Exod. a beka a head, that is, half a shekel, after the shekel of the sanctuary, for everyone who passed over to those who were numbered, from twenty years old and upward, for six hundred and three thousand and five hundred and fifty men.
Exod. And the hundred talents of silver were for casting the sockets of the sanctuary,  the sockets of the veil, a hundred sockets for the hundred talents, a talent for a socket.
Exod. And of the thousand seven hundred seventy-five shekels he made hooks for the pillars,  overlaid their capitals,  made bands for them.
Exod. And the brass of the offering was seventy talents,  two thousand and four hundred shekels.
Exod. And with it he made the sockets to the door of the tent of meeting,  the brazen altar,  the brazen grating for it,  all the vessels of the altar,
Exod. and the sockets of the court round about,  the sockets of the gate of the court,  all the pegs of the tabernacle,  all the pegs of the court round about.
Exod. And of the blue,  purple,  scarlet, they made finely wrought garments, for ministering in the holy place,  made the holy garments for Aaron, as Jehovah commanded Moses.
Exod. And he made the ephod of gold, blue,  purple,  scarlet,  fine twined linen.
Exod. And they beat the gold into thin plates,  cut it into wires, to work it in the blue,  in the purple,  in the scarlet,  in the fine linen, the work of the skilful workman.
Exod. They made shoulder-pieces for it, joined together. It was joined together at the two ends.
Exod. And the skillfully woven band, that was upon it with which to gird it on, was of the same piece and like the work of it, of gold, of blue,  purple,  scarlet,  fine twined linen, as Jehovah commanded Moses.
Exod. And they wrought the onyx stones, enclosed in settings of gold, engraved with the engravings of a signet, according to the names of the sons of Israel.
Exod. And he put them on the shoulder-pieces of the ephod, to be stones of memorial for the sons of Israel, as Jehovah commanded Moses.
Exod. And he made the breastplate, the work of the skilful workman, like the work of the ephod, of gold, of blue,  purple,  scarlet,  fine twined linen.
Exod. It was foursquare. They made the breastplate double; a span was the length of it,  a span the breadth of it, being double.
Exod. And they set four rows of stones in it. A row of sardius, topaz,  carbuncle was the first row,
Exod. and the second row, an emerald, a sapphire,  a diamond,
Exod. and the third row, a jacinth, an agate,  an amethyst,
Exod. and the fourth row, a beryl, an onyx,  a jasper. They were set in enclosures of gold in their settings.
Exod. And the stones were according to the names of the sons of Israel, twelve, according to their names, like the engravings of a signet, each one according to his name, for the twelve tribes.
Exod. And they made upon the breastplate chains like cords, of wreathen work of pure gold.
Exod. And they made two settings of gold,  two gold rings,  put the two rings on the two ends of the breastplate.
Exod. And they put the two wreathen chains of gold in the two rings at the ends of the breastplate.
Exod. And the other two ends of the two wreathen chains they put on the two settings,  put them on the shoulder-pieces of the ephod, in the forepart of it.
Exod. And they made two rings of gold,  put them upon the two ends of the breastplate, upon the edge of it, which was toward the side of the ephod inward.
Exod. And they made two rings of gold,  put them on the two shoulder-pieces of the ephod underneath, in the forepart of it, close by the coupling of it, above the skillfully woven band of the ephod.
Exod. And they bound the breastplate by the rings of it to the rings of the ephod with a lace of blue, that it might be upon the skillfully woven band of the ephod,  that the breastplate might not be loosed from the ephod, as Jehovah commanded Moses.
Exod. And he made the robe of the ephod of woven work, all of blue.
Exod. And the hole of the robe in the midst of it, as the hole of a coat of mail, with a binding round about the hole of it, that it should not be torn.
Exod. And they made upon the skirts of the robe pomegranates of blue,  purple,  scarlet, twined.
Exod. And they made bells of pure gold,  put the bells between the pomegranates upon the skirts of the robe round about, between the pomegranates,
Exod. a bell and a pomegranate, a bell and a pomegranate, upon the skirts of the robe round about, to minister in, as Jehovah commanded Moses.
Exod. And they made the tunics of fine linen of woven work for Aaron,  for his sons,
Exod. and the miter of fine linen,  the goodly head-coverings of fine linen,  the linen breeches of fine twined linen,
Exod. and the sash of fine twined linen,  blue,  purple,  scarlet, the work of the embroiderer, as Jehovah commanded Moses.
Exod. And they made the plate of the holy crown of pure gold,  wrote upon it a writing, like the engravings of a signet, HOLY TO JEHOVAH.
Exod. And they tied to it a lace of blue, to fasten it upon the miter above, as Jehovah commanded Moses.
Exod. Thus was finished all the work of the tabernacle of the tent of meeting. And the sons of Israel did according to all that Jehovah commanded Moses, so did they.
Exod. And they brought the tabernacle to Moses, the tent,  all its furniture: its clasps, its boards, it bars,  its pillars,  it sockets,
Exod. and the covering of rams' skins dyed red,  the covering of certain skins,  the veil of the screen,
Exod. the ark of the testimony,  the staves of it,  the mercy-seat,
Exod. the table, all the vessels of it,  the showbread,
Exod. the pure lampstand, the lamps of it, even the lamps to be set in order,  all the vessels of it,  the oil for the light,
Exod. and the golden altar,  the anointing oil,  the sweet incense,  the screen for the door of the tent,
Exod. the brazen altar,  its grating of brass, its staves,  all its vessels, the laver and its base,
Exod. the hangings of the court, its pillars,  its sockets,  the screen for the gate of the court, the cords of it,  the pegs of it,  all the instruments of the service of the tabernacle, for the tent of meeting,
Exod. the finely wrought garments for ministering in the holy place,  the holy garments for Aaron the priest,  the garments of his sons, to minister in the priest's office.
Exod. According to all that Jehovah commanded Moses, so the sons of Israel did all the work.
Exod. And Moses saw all the work, , behold, they had done it, as Jehovah had commanded, even so they had done it. And Moses blessed them.
Exod. And Jehovah spoke to Moses, saying,
Exod. On the first day of the first month thou shall raise up the tabernacle of the tent of meeting.
Exod. And thou shall put the ark of the testimony in it,  thou shall screen the ark with the veil.
Exod. And thou shall bring in the table,  set in order the things that are upon it,  thou shall bring in the lampstand,  light the lamps of it.
Exod. And thou shall set the golden altar for incense before the ark of the testimony,  put the screen of the door to the tabernacle.
Exod. And thou shall set the altar of burnt offering before the door of the tabernacle of the tent of meeting.
Exod. And thou shall set the laver between the tent of meeting and the altar,  shall put water in it.
Exod. And thou shall set up the court round about,  hang up the screen of the gate of the court.
Exod. And thou shall take the anointing oil,  anoint the tabernacle,  all that is in it,  shall hallow it,  all the furniture of it. And it shall be holy.
Exod. And thou shall anoint the altar of burnt offering,  all its vessels,  sanctify the altar. And the altar shall be most holy.
Exod. And thou shall anoint the laver and its base,  sanctify it.
Exod. And thou shall bring Aaron and his sons to the door of the tent of meeting,  shall wash them with water.
Exod. And thou shall put upon Aaron the holy garments,  thou shall anoint him,  sanctify him, that he may minister to me in the priest's office.
Exod. And thou shall bring his sons,  put tunics upon them,
Exod. and thou shall anoint them, as thou anointed their father, that they may minister to me in the priest's office. And their anointing shall be to them for an everlasting priesthood throughout their generations.
Exod. Thus did Moses. According to all that Jehovah commanded him, so did he.
Exod. And it came to pass in the first month in the second year, on the first day of the month, that the tabernacle was raised up.
Exod. And Moses raised up the tabernacle,  laid its sockets,  set up the boards of it,  put in the bars of it,  raised up its pillars.
Exod. And he spread the tent over the tabernacle,  put the covering of the tent above upon it, as Jehovah commanded Moses.
Exod. And he took and put the testimony into the ark,  set the staves on the ark,  put the mercy-seat above upon the ark.
Exod. And he brought the ark into the tabernacle,  set up the veil of the screen,  screened the ark of the testimony, as Jehovah commanded Moses.
Exod. And he put the table in the tent of meeting, upon the side of the tabernacle northward, outside the veil.
Exod. And he set the bread in order upon it before Jehovah, as Jehovah commanded Moses.
Exod. And he put the lampstand in the tent of meeting, opposite the table, on the side of the tabernacle southward.
Exod. And he lit the lamps before Jehovah, as Jehovah commanded Moses.
Exod. And he put the golden altar in the tent of meeting before the veil,
Exod. and he burnt incense of sweet spices on it, as Jehovah commanded Moses.
Exod. And he put the screen of the door to the tabernacle.
Exod. And he set the altar of burnt offering at the door of the tabernacle of the tent of meeting,  offered upon it the burnt offering and the meal offering, as Jehovah commanded Moses.
Exod. And he set the laver between the tent of meeting and the altar,  put water in it, with which to wash.
Exod. And Moses and Aaron and his sons washed their hands and their feet there.
Exod. They washed when they went into the tent of meeting,  when they came near to the altar, as Jehovah commanded Moses.
Exod. And he raised up the court round about the tabernacle and the altar,  set up the screen of the gate of the court. So Moses finished the work.
Exod. Then the cloud covered the tent of meeting,  the glory of Jehovah filled the tabernacle.
Exod. And Moses was not able to enter into the tent of meeting, because the cloud abode thereupon,  the glory of Jehovah filled the tabernacle.
Exod. And when the cloud was taken up from over the tabernacle, the sons of Israel went onward, throughout all their journeys,
Exod. but if the cloud was not taken up, then they did not journey till the day that it was taken up.
Exod. For the cloud of Jehovah was upon the tabernacle by day,  there was fire therein by night, in the sight of all the house of Israel, throughout all their journeys.
Leviticus
Jehovah called to Moses,  spoke to him out of the tent of meeting, saying,
Speak to the sons of Israel,  say to them, When any man of you offers an oblation to Jehovah, ye shall offer your oblation of the cattle, even of the herd and of the flock.
If his oblation be a burnt offering of the herd, he shall offer it a male without blemish. He shall offer it at the door of the tent of meeting, that he may be accepted before Jehovah.
he shall lay his hand upon the head of the burnt offering,  it shall be accepted for him to make atonement for him.
he shall kill the bullock before Jehovah,  Aaron's sons, the priests, shall present the blood,  sprinkle the blood round about upon the altar that is at the door of the tent of meeting.
he shall skin the burnt offering,  cut it into its pieces.
the sons of Aaron the priest shall put fire upon the altar,  lay wood in order upon the fire.
Aaron's sons, the priests, shall lay the pieces, the head,  the fat, in order upon the wood that is on the fire which is upon the altar,
but its innards and its legs he shall wash with water. And the priest shall burn the whole on the altar, for a burnt offering, an offering made by fire, of a sweet savor to Jehovah.
if his oblation be of the flock, of the sheep, or of the goats, for a burnt offering, he shall offer it a male without blemish.
he shall kill it on the side of the altar northward before Jehovah,  Aaron's sons, the priests, shall sprinkle its blood upon the altar round about.
he shall cut it into its pieces, with its head and its fat,  the priest shall lay them in order on the wood that is on the fire which is upon the altar,
but the innards and the legs he shall wash with water. And the priest shall offer the whole,  burn it upon the altar. It is a burnt offering, an offering made by fire, of a sweet savor to Jehovah.
if his oblation to Jehovah be a burnt offering of birds, then he shall offer his oblation of turtle-doves, or of young pigeons.
the priest shall bring it to the altar,  wring off its head,  burn it on the altar. And the blood of it shall be drained out on the side of the altar.
he shall take away its crop with the filth of it,  cast it beside the altar on the east part, in the place of the ashes.
he shall rend it by the wings of it,  shall not divide it apart,  the priest shall burn it upon the altar, upon the wood that is upon the fire. It is a burnt offering, an offering made by fire, of a sweet savor to Jehovah.
when anyone offers an oblation of a meal offering to Jehovah, his oblation shall be of fine flour,  he shall pour oil upon it,  put frankincense on it.
he shall bring it to Aaron's sons the priests,  he shall take out of it his handful of the fine flour of it,  of the oil of it, with all the frankincense of it. And the priest shall burn the memorial of it upon the altar, an offering made by fire, of a sweet savor to Jehovah.
that which is left of the meal offering shall be Aaron's and his sons'. It is a thing most holy of the offerings of Jehovah made by fire.
when thou offer an oblation of a meal offering baked in the oven, it shall be unleavened cakes of fine flour mingled with oil, or unleavened wafers anointed with oil.
if thy oblation be a meal offering of the baking-pan, it shall be of fine flour unleavened, mingled with oil.
Thou shall part it in pieces,  pour oil in it. It is a meal offering.
if thy oblation be a meal offering of the frying-pan, it shall be made of fine flour with oil.
thou shall bring the meal offering that is made of these things to Jehovah,  it shall be presented to the priest,  he shall bring it to the altar.
the priest shall take up from the meal offering the memorial of it,  shall burn it upon the altar, an offering made by fire, of a sweet savor to Jehovah.
that which is left of the meal offering shall be Aaron's and his sons'. It is a thing most holy of the offerings of Jehovah made by fire.
No meal offering, which ye shall offer to Jehovah, shall be made with leaven, for ye shall burn no leaven, nor any honey, as an offering made by fire to Jehovah.
As an oblation of first-fruits ye shall offer them to Jehovah,  they shall not come up for a sweet savor on the altar.
every oblation of thy meal offering thou shall season with salt, nor shall thou allow the salt of the covenant of thy God to be lacking from thy meal offering. With all thine oblations thou shall offer salt.
if thou offer a meal offering of first-fruits to Jehovah, thou shall offer for the meal offering of thy first-fruits grain in the ear parched with fire, crushed grain of the fresh ear.
thou shall put oil upon it,  lay frankincense on it. It is a meal offering.
the priest shall burn the memorial of it, part of the crushed grain of it,  part of the oil of it, with all the frankincense of it. It is an offering made by fire to Jehovah.
if his oblation be a sacrifice of peace offerings, if he offer of the herd, whether male or female, he shall offer it without blemish before Jehovah.
he shall lay his hand upon the head of his oblation,  kill it at the door of the tent of meeting. And Aaron's sons the priests shall sprinkle the blood upon the altar round about.
he shall offer of the sacrifice of peace offerings an offering made by fire to Jehovah, he shall take away the fat that covers the innards,  all the fat that is upon the innards,
the two kidneys,  the fat that is on them, which is by the loins,  the caul upon the liver, with the kidneys.
Aaron's sons shall burn it on the altar upon the burnt offering, which is upon the wood that is on the fire. It is an offering made by fire, of a sweet savor to Jehovah.
if his oblation for a sacrifice of peace offerings to Jehovah be of the flock, male or female, he shall offer it without blemish.
If he offers a lamb for his oblation, then he shall offer it before Jehovah.
he shall lay his hand upon the head of his oblation,  kill it before the tent of meeting. And Aaron's sons shall sprinkle the blood of it upon the altar round about.
he shall offer of the sacrifice of peace offerings an offering made by fire to Jehovah. The fat of it, the entire fat tail, he shall take away close by the backbone. And he shall take away the fat that covers the innards,  all the fat that is upon the innards,
the two kidneys,  the fat that is upon them, which is by the loins,  the caul upon the liver, with the kidneys.
the priest shall burn it upon the altar. It is the food of the offering made by fire to Jehovah.
if his oblation be a goat, then he shall offer it before Jehovah.
he shall lay his hand upon the head of it,  kill it before the tent of meeting. And the sons of Aaron shall sprinkle the blood of it upon the altar round about.
he shall offer his oblation from it, even an offering made by fire to Jehovah. He shall take away the fat that covers the innards,  all the fat that is upon the innards,
the two kidneys,  the fat that is upon them, which is by the loins,  the caul upon the liver, with the kidneys.
the priest shall burn them upon the altar. It is the food of the offering made by fire, for a sweet savor. All the fat is Jehovah's.
It shall be a perpetual statute throughout your generations in all your dwellings, that ye shall eat neither fat nor blood.
Jehovah spoke to Moses, saying,
Speak to the sons of Israel, saying, If a soul shall sin unwittingly, in any of the things which Jehovah has commanded not to be done,  shall do any one of them,
if the anointed priest shall sin so as to bring guilt on the people, then let him offer for his sin, which he has sinned, a young bullock without blemish to Jehovah for a sin offering.
he shall bring the bullock to the door of the tent of meeting before Jehovah. And he shall lay his hand upon the head of the bullock,  kill the bullock before Jehovah.
the anointed priest shall take of the blood of the bullock,  bring it to the tent of meeting.
the priest shall dip his finger in the blood,  sprinkle of the blood seven times before Jehovah, before the veil of the sanctuary.
the priest shall put of the blood upon the horns of the altar of sweet incense before Jehovah, which is in the tent of meeting,  all the blood of the bullock he shall pour out at the base of the altar of burnt offering, which is at the door of the tent of meeting.
all the fat of the bullock of the sin offering he shall take off from it. The fat that covers the innards,  all the fat that is upon the innards,
the two kidneys,  the fat that is upon them, which is by the loins,  the caul upon the liver, with the kidneys, he shall take away,
as it is taken off from the ox of the sacrifice of peace offerings. And the priest shall burn them upon the altar of burnt offering.
the skin of the bullock,  all its flesh, with its head,  with its legs,  its innards,  its dung,
even the whole bullock he shall carry forth outside the camp to a clean place, where the ashes are poured out,  burn it on wood with fire. It shall be burnt where the ashes are poured out.
if the whole congregation of Israel err,  the thing be hid from the eyes of the assembly,  they have done any of the things which Jehovah has commanded not to be done,  are guilty,
when the sin by which they have sinned is known, then the assembly shall offer a young bullock for a sin offering,  bring it before the tent of meeting.
the elders of the congregation shall lay their hands upon the head of the bullock before Jehovah,  the bullock shall be killed before Jehovah.
the anointed priest shall bring of the blood of the bullock to the tent of meeting.
the priest shall dip his finger in the blood,  sprinkle it seven times before Jehovah, before the veil.
he shall put of the blood upon the horns of the altar which is before Jehovah, that is in the tent of meeting,  all the blood he shall pour out at the base of the altar of burnt offering, which is at the door of the tent of meeting.
all the fat of it he shall take off from it,  burn it upon the altar.
Thus he shall do with the bullock, as he did with the bullock of the sin offering, so he shall do with this. And the priest shall make atonement for them,  they shall be forgiven.
he shall carry forth the bullock outside the camp,  burn it as he burned the first bullock. It is the sin offering for the assembly.
When a ruler sins,  does unwittingly any one of all the things which Jehovah his God has commanded not to be done,  is guilty,
if his sin, by which he has sinned, be made known to him, he shall bring for his oblation a goat, a male without blemish.
he shall lay his hand upon the head of the goat,  kill it in the place where they kill the burnt offering before Jehovah. It is a sin offering.
the priest shall take of the blood of the sin offering with his finger,  put it upon the horns of the altar of burnt offering,  the blood of it he shall pour out at the base of the altar of burnt offering.
all the fat of it he shall burn upon the altar, as the fat of the sacrifice of peace offerings. And the priest shall make atonement for him as concerning his sin,  he shall be forgiven.
if any soul of the common people sin unwittingly, in doing any of the things which Jehovah has commanded not to be done,  be guilty,
if his sin, which he has sinned, be made known to him, then he shall bring for his oblation a goat, a female without blemish, for his sin which he has sinned.
he shall lay his hand upon the head of the sin offering,  kill the sin offering in the place of burnt offering.
the priest shall take of the blood of it with his finger,  put it upon the horns of the altar of burnt offering,  all the blood of it he shall pour out at the base of the altar.
all the fat of it he shall take away, as the fat is taken away from off the sacrifice of peace offerings,  the priest shall burn it upon the altar for a sweet savor to Jehovah. And the priest shall make atonement for him,  he shall be forgiven.
if he brings a lamb as his oblation for a sin offering, he shall bring it a female without blemish.
he shall lay his hand upon the head of the sin offering,  kill it for a sin offering in the place where they kill the burnt offering.
the priest shall take of the blood of the sin offering with his finger,  put it upon the horns of the altar of burnt offering,  all the blood of it he shall pour out at the base of the altar.
all the fat of it he shall take away, as the fat of the lamb is taken away from the sacrifice of peace offerings,  the priest shall burn them on the altar, upon the offerings of Jehovah made by fire. And the priest shall make atonement for him concerning his sin that he has sinned,  he shall be forgiven.
if a soul sins, in that he hears the voice of an oath, he being a witness, whether he has seen or known, if he does not testify, then he shall bear his iniquity.
Or if a soul touches any unclean thing, whether it be the carcass of an unclean beast, or the carcass of unclean cattle, or the carcass of unclean creeping things,  it be hidden from him,  he be unclean, then he shall be guilty.
Or if he touch the uncleanness of man, whatever his uncleanness be with which he is unclean,  it be hid from him, when he knows of it, then he shall be guilty.
Or if a soul swears rashly with his lips to do evil, or to do good, whatever it be that a man shall utter rashly with an oath,  it be hid from him, when he realizes it, then he shall be guilty in one of these.
it shall be, when he shall be guilty in one of these, that he shall confess that by which he has sinned.
he shall bring his trespass offering to Jehovah for his sin which he has sinned, a female from the flock, a lamb or a goat, for a sin offering. And the priest shall make atonement for him as concerning his sin.
if his means is not sufficient for a lamb, then he shall bring his trespass offering for that by which he has sinned, two turtle-doves, or two young pigeons, to Jehovah, one for a sin offering,  the other for a burnt offering.
he shall bring them to the priest, who shall offer that which is for the sin offering first,  wring off its head from its neck,  shall not divide it apart.
he shall sprinkle of the blood of the sin offering upon the side of the altar,  the rest of the blood shall be drained out at the base of the altar. It is a sin offering.
he shall offer the second for a burnt offering, according to the ordinance. And the priest shall make atonement for him as concerning his sin which he has sinned,  he shall be forgiven.
But if his means is not sufficient for two turtle-doves, or two young pigeons, then he shall bring his oblation for that by which he has sinned, the tenth part of an ephah of fine flour for a sin offering. He shall put no oil upon it, nor shall he put any frankincense on it, for it is a sin offering.
he shall bring it to the priest,  the priest shall take his handful of it as the memorial of it,  burn it on the altar, upon the offerings of Jehovah made by fire. It is a sin offering.
the priest shall make atonement for him concerning his sin that he has sinned in any of these things,  he shall be forgiven. And the remnant shall be the priest's, as the meal offering.
Jehovah spoke to Moses, saying,
If a soul commits a trespass,  sins unwittingly in the holy things of Jehovah, then he shall bring his trespass offering to Jehovah, a ram without blemish out of the flock, according to thy estimation in silver by shekels, after the shekel of the sanctuary, for a trespass offering.
he shall make restitution for that which he has done amiss in the holy thing,  shall add the fifth part to it,  give it to the priest. And the priest shall make atonement for him with the ram of the trespass offering,  he shall be forgiven.
if a soul sins,  does any of the things which Jehovah has commanded not to be done, though he did not know it, yet he is guilty,  shall bear his iniquity.
he shall bring a ram without blemish out of the flock, according to thy estimation, for a trespass offering, to the priest. And the priest shall make atonement for him concerning the thing by which he erred unwittingly and knew it not,  he shall be forgiven.
It is a trespass offering. He is certainly guilty before Jehovah.
Jehovah spoke to Moses, saying,
If a soul sins,  commits a trespass against Jehovah,  deals falsely with his neighbor in a matter of deposit, or of bargain, or of robbery, or have oppressed his neighbor,
or has found that which was lost,  deal falsely by it,  swears to a lie, in any of all these things that a man does, sinning by it,
then it shall be, if he has sinned,  is guilty, that he shall restore that which he took by robbery, or the thing which he has gotten by oppression, or the deposit which was committed to him, or the lost thing which he found,
or anything about which he has sworn falsely, he shall even restore it in full,  shall add the fifth part more to it. He shall give it to him to whom it pertains, in the day of his being found guilty.
he shall bring his trespass offering to Jehovah, a ram without blemish out of the flock, according to thy estimation, for a trespass offering, to the priest.
the priest shall make atonement for him before Jehovah,  he shall be forgiven concerning whatever he does so as to be guilty by it.
Jehovah spoke to Moses, saying,
Command Aaron and his sons, saying, This is the law of the burnt offering: The burnt offering shall be on the hearth upon the altar all night to the morning,  the fire of the altar shall be kept burning on it.
the priest shall put on his linen garment,  he shall put his linen breeches upon his flesh,  he shall take up the ashes of the fire which has consumed the burnt offering on the altar,  he shall put them beside the altar.
he shall put off his garments,  put on other garments,  carry forth the ashes outside the camp to a clean place.
the fire upon the altar shall be kept burning on it; it shall not go out. And the priest shall burn wood on it every morning,  he shall lay the burnt offering in order upon it,  shall burn the fat of the peace offerings on it.
Fire shall be kept burning upon the altar continually; it shall not go out.
this is the law of the meal offering: The sons of Aaron shall offer it before Jehovah, before the altar.
he shall take up his handful from it, of the fine flour of the meal offering,  of the oil of it,  all the frankincense which is upon the meal offering,  shall burn it upon the altar for a sweet savor, as the memorial of it, to Jehovah.
that which is left of it Aaron and his sons shall eat. It shall be eaten without leaven in a holy place. They shall eat it in the court of the tent of meeting.
It shall not be baked with leaven. I have given it as their portion of my offerings made by fire, it is most holy, as the sin offering,  as the trespass offering.
Every male among the sons of Aaron shall eat of it, as a portion forever throughout your generations, from the offerings of Jehovah made by fire. Whoever touches them shall be holy.
Jehovah spoke to Moses, saying,
This is the oblation of Aaron and of his sons, which they shall offer to Jehovah in the day when he is anointed: the tenth part of an ephah of fine flour for a meal offering perpetually, half of it in the morning,  half of it in the evening.
It shall be made with oil on a baking-pan. Thou shall bring it in when it is soaked. Thou shall offer the meal offering in baked pieces for a sweet savor to Jehovah.
the anointed priest who shall be in his stead from among his sons shall offer it. It shall be wholly burnt to Jehovah by a statute forever.
every meal offering of the priest shall be wholly burnt; it shall not be eaten.
Jehovah spoke to Moses, saying,
Speak to Aaron and to his sons, saying, This is the law of the sin offering: In the place where the burnt offering is killed the sin offering shall be killed before Jehovah. It is most holy.
The priest who offers it for sin shall eat it. It shall be eaten in a holy place, in the court of the tent of meeting.
Whatever shall touch the flesh of it shall be holy. And when there is of the blood sprinkled upon any garment, thou shall wash that on which it was sprinkled in a holy place.
But the earthen vessel in which it is boiled shall be broken,  if it be boiled in a brazen vessel, it shall be scoured,  rinsed in water.
Every male among the priests shall eat of it. It is most holy.
no sin offering, from which any of the blood is brought into the tent of meeting to make atonement in the holy place, shall be eaten; it shall be burnt with fire.
this is the law of the trespass offering. It is most holy.
In the place where they kill the burnt offering they shall kill the trespass offering,  the blood of it he shall sprinkle upon the altar round about.
he shall offer from it all the fat of it. He shall take away the fat tail,  the fat that covers the innards,
the two kidneys,  the fat that is on them, which is by the loins,  the caul upon the liver, with the kidneys.
the priest shall burn them upon the altar for an offering made by fire to Jehovah. It is a trespass offering.
Every male among the priests shall eat of it. It shall be eaten in a holy place; it is most holy.
As is the sin offering, so is the trespass offering, there is one law for them. The priest who makes atonement with it, he shall have it.
the priest who offers any man's burnt offering, even the priest shall have to himself the skin of the burnt offering which he has offered.
every meal offering that is baked in the oven,  all that is dressed in the frying-pan,  on the baking-pan, shall be the priest's who offers it.
every meal offering, mingled with oil, or dry, all the sons of Aaron shall have, one as well as another.
this is the law of the sacrifice of peace offerings, which he shall offer to Jehovah.
If he offers it for a thanksgiving, then he shall offer with the sacrifice of thanksgiving unleavened cakes mingled with oil,  unleavened wafers anointed with oil,  cakes mingled with oil, of fine flour soaked.
He shall offer his oblation with the sacrifice of his peace offerings for thanksgiving with cakes of leavened bread.
from it he shall offer one out of each oblation for a heave offering to Jehovah. It shall be the priest's who sprinkles the blood of the peace offerings.
the flesh of the sacrifice of his peace offerings for thanksgiving shall be eaten on the day of his oblation; he shall not leave any of it until the morning.
But if the sacrifice of his oblation be a vow, or a freewill offering, it shall be eaten on the day that he offers his sacrifice,  on the morrow that which remains of it shall be eaten,
but that which remains of the flesh of the sacrifice on the third day shall be burnt with fire.
if any of the flesh of the sacrifice of his peace offerings is eaten on the third day, it shall not be accepted, nor shall it be imputed to him who offers it. It shall be an abomination,  the soul that eats of it shall bear his iniquity.
the flesh that touches any unclean thing shall not be eaten; it shall be burnt with fire. And as for the flesh, every clean man shall eat of it,
but the soul that eats of the flesh of the sacrifice of peace offerings, that pertain to Jehovah, having his uncleanness upon him, that soul shall be cut off from his people.
when a soul shall touch any unclean thing, the uncleanness of man, or an unclean beast, or any unclean abomination,  eats of the flesh of the sacrifice of peace offerings, which pertain to Jehovah, that soul shall be cut off from his people.
Jehovah spoke to Moses, saying,
Speak to the sons of Israel, saying, Ye shall eat no fat, of ox, or sheep, or goat.
the fat of that which dies of itself,  the fat of that which is torn of beasts, may be used for any other service,  ye shall certainly not eat of it.
For whoever eats the fat of the beast, of which men offer an offering made by fire to Jehovah, even the soul that eats it shall be cut off from his people.
ye shall eat no manner of blood, whether it be of bird or of beast, in any of your dwellings.
Whoever it is who eats any blood, that soul shall be cut off from his people.
Jehovah spoke to Moses, saying,
Speak to the sons of Israel, saying, He who offers the sacrifice of his peace offerings to Jehovah shall bring his oblation to Jehovah out of the sacrifice of his peace offerings.
His own hands shall bring the offerings of Jehovah made by fire. He shall bring the fat with the breast, that the breast may be waved for a wave offering before Jehovah.
the priest shall burn the fat upon the altar,  the breast shall be Aaron's and his sons'.
the right thigh ye shall give to the priest for a heave offering out of the sacrifices of your peace offerings.
He among the sons of Aaron who offers the blood of the peace offerings,  the fat, shall have the right thigh for a portion.
For I have taken the wave-breast and the heave-thigh from the sons of Israel out of the sacrifices of their peace offerings,  have given them to Aaron the priest and to his sons as a portion forever from the sons of Israel.
This is the anointing-portion of Aaron,  the anointing-portion of his sons, out of the offerings of Jehovah made by fire, in the day when he presented them to minister to Jehovah in the priest's office,
which Jehovah commanded to be given them from the sons of Israel, in the day that he anointed them. It is a portion forever throughout their generations.
This is the law of the burnt offering, of the meal offering,  of the sin offering,  of the trespass offering,  of the consecration,  of the sacrifice of peace offerings,
which Jehovah commanded Moses at mount Sinai, in the day that he commanded the sons of Israel to offer their oblations to Jehovah, in the wilderness of Sinai.
Jehovah spoke to Moses, saying,
Take Aaron and his sons with him,  the garments,  the anointing oil,  the bullock of the sin offering,  the two rams,  the basket of unleavened bread,
assemble thou all the congregation at the door of the tent of meeting.
Moses did as Jehovah commanded him,  the congregation was assembled at the door of the tent of meeting.
Moses said to the congregation, This is the thing which Jehovah has commanded to be done.
Moses brought Aaron and his sons,  washed them with water.
he put upon him the tunic,  girded him with the sash,  clothed him with the robe,  put the ephod upon him,  he girded him with the skillfully woven band of the ephod,  bound it to him therewith.
he placed the breastplate upon him,  he put the Urim and the Thummim in the breastplate.
he set the miter upon his head. And upon the miter, in front, he set the golden plate, the holy crown, as Jehovah commanded Moses.
Moses took the anointing oil,  anointed the tabernacle and all that was in it,  sanctified them.
he sprinkled of it upon the altar seven times,  anointed the altar and all its vessels,  the laver and its base, to sanctify them.
he poured of the anointing oil upon Aaron's head,  anointed him, to sanctify him.
Moses brought Aaron's sons,  clothed them with tunics,  girded them with sashes,  bound head-coverings upon them, as Jehovah commanded Moses.
he brought the bullock of the sin offering. And Aaron and his sons laid their hands upon the head of the bullock of the sin offering,
he killed it. And Moses took the blood,  put it upon the horns of the altar round about with his finger,  purified the altar,  poured out the blood at the base of the altar,  sanctified it, to make atonement for it.
he took all the fat that was upon the innards,  the caul of the liver,  the two kidneys,  their fat,  Moses burned it upon the altar.
But the bullock,  its skin,  its flesh,  its dung, he burnt with fire outside the camp, as Jehovah commanded Moses.
he presented the ram of the burnt offering. And Aaron and his sons laid their hands upon the head of the ram,
he killed it. And Moses sprinkled the blood upon the altar round about.
he cut the ram into its pieces,  Moses burnt the head,  the pieces,  the fat.
he washed the innards and the legs with water. And Moses burnt the whole ram upon the altar. It was a burnt offering for a sweet savor. It was an offering made by fire to Jehovah, as Jehovah commanded Moses.
he presented the other ram, the ram of consecration. And Aaron and his sons laid their hands upon the head of the ram,
he killed it. And Moses took of the blood of it,  put it upon the tip of Aaron's right ear,  upon the thumb of his right hand,  upon the great toe of his right foot.
he brought Aaron's sons,  Moses put of the blood upon the tip of their right ear,  upon the thumb of their right hand,  upon the great toe of their right foot. And Moses sprinkled the blood upon the altar round about.
he took the fat,  the fat tail,  all the fat that was upon the innards,  the caul of the liver,  the two kidneys,  their fat,  the right thigh,
out of the basket of unleavened bread, that was before Jehovah, he took one unleavened cake,  one cake of oiled bread,  one wafer,  placed them on the fat,  upon the right thigh.
he put the whole upon the hands of Aaron,  upon the hands of his sons,  waved them for a wave offering before Jehovah.
Moses took them from off their hands,  burnt them on the altar upon the burnt offering. They were a consecration for a sweet savor. It was an offering made by fire to Jehovah.
Moses took the breast,  waved it for a wave offering before Jehovah. It was Moses' portion of the ram of consecration, as Jehovah commanded Moses.
Moses took of the anointing oil,  of the blood which was upon the altar,  sprinkled it upon Aaron, upon his garments,  upon his sons,  upon his sons' garments with him,  sanctified Aaron, his garments,  his sons,  his sons' garments with him.
Moses said to Aaron and to his sons, Boil the flesh at the door of the tent of meeting,  there eat it and the bread that is in the basket of consecration, as I commanded, saying, Aaron and his sons shall eat it.
that which remains of the flesh and of the bread ye shall burn with fire.
ye shall not go out from the door of the tent of meeting seven days, until the days of your consecration be fulfilled, for he shall consecrate you seven days.
As has been done this day, so Jehovah has commanded to do, to make atonement for you.
ye shall remain at the door of the tent of meeting day and night seven days,  keep the charge of Jehovah, that ye not die, for so I am commanded.
Aaron and his sons did all the things which Jehovah commanded by Moses.
it came to pass on the eighth day, that Moses called Aaron and his sons,  the elders of Israel,
he said to Aaron, Take thee a calf of the herd for a sin offering,  a ram for a burnt offering, without blemish,  offer them before Jehovah.
thou shall speak to the sons of Israel, saying, Take ye a he-goat for a sin offering,  a calf and a lamb, both a year old, without blemish, for a burnt offering,
an ox and a ram for peace offerings, to sacrifice before Jehovah,  a meal offering mingled with oil. For today Jehovah appears to you.
they brought that which Moses commanded before the tent of meeting,  all the congregation drew near and stood before Jehovah.
Moses said, This is the thing which Jehovah commanded that ye should do,  the glory of Jehovah shall appear to you.
Moses said to Aaron, Draw near to the altar,  offer thy sin offering,  thy burnt offering,  make atonement for thyself,  for the people. And offer the oblation of the people,  make atonement for them, as Jehovah commanded.
So Aaron drew near to the altar,  killed the calf of the sin offering, which was for himself.
the sons of Aaron presented the blood to him,  he dipped his finger in the blood,  put it upon the horns of the altar,  poured out the blood at the base of the altar,
but he burnt the fat,  the kidneys,  the caul from the liver of the sin offering, upon the altar, as Jehovah commanded Moses.
he burnt the flesh and the skin with fire outside the camp.
he killed the burnt offering. And Aaron's sons delivered to him the blood,  he sprinkled it upon the altar round about.
they delivered the burnt offering to him, piece by piece,  the head,  he burnt them upon the altar.
he washed the innards and the legs,  burnt them upon the burnt offering on the altar.
he presented the people's oblation. And took the goat of the sin offering which was for the people,  killed it,  offered it for sin, as the first.
he presented the burnt offering,  offered it according to the ordinance.
he presented the meal offering,  filled his hand from it,  burnt it upon the altar, besides the burnt offering of the morning.
He also killed the ox and the ram, the sacrifice of peace offerings, which was for the people. And Aaron's sons delivered to him the blood, which he sprinkled upon the altar round about,
the fat of the ox and of the ram, the fat tail,  that which covers the innards,  the kidneys,  the caul of the liver.
they put the fat upon the breasts,  he burnt the fat upon the altar.
the breasts and the right thigh Aaron waved for a wave offering before Jehovah, as Moses commanded.
Aaron lifted up his hands toward the people,  blessed them. And he came down from offering the sin offering,  the burnt offering,  the peace offerings.
Moses and Aaron went into the tent of meeting,  came out,  blessed the people. And the glory of Jehovah appeared to all the people.
there came forth fire from before Jehovah,  consumed the burnt offering and the fat upon the altar. And when all the people saw it, they shouted,  fell on their faces.
Nadab and Abihu, the sons of Aaron, each of them took his censer,  put fire in it,  laid incense on it,  offered strange fire before Jehovah, which he had not commanded them.
there came forth fire from before Jehovah,  devoured them,  they died before Jehovah.
Then Moses said to Aaron, This is it that Jehovah spoke, saying, I will be sanctified in those who come near me. And I will be glorified before all the people. And Aaron remained silent.
Moses called Mishael and Elzaphan, the sons of Uzziel the uncle of Aaron,  said to them, Draw near. Carry your brothers from before the sanctuary out of the camp.
So they drew near,  carried them in their tunics out of the camp, as Moses had said.
Moses said to Aaron,  to Eleazar and to Ithamar, his sons, Let not the hair of your heads go loose, neither tear your clothes, that ye not die,  that he not be angry with all the congregation,  let your brothers, the whole house of Israel, bewail the burning which Jehovah has kindled.
ye shall not go out from the door of the tent of meeting, lest ye die, for the anointing oil of Jehovah is upon you. And they did according to the word of Moses.
Jehovah spoke to Aaron, saying,
Drink no wine nor strong drink, thou, nor thy sons with thee, when ye go into the tent of meeting, that ye not die-it shall be a statute forever throughout your generations-
that ye may make a distinction between the holy and the common,  between the unclean and the clean,
that ye may teach the sons of Israel all the statutes which Jehovah has spoken to them by Moses.
Moses spoke to Aaron,  to Eleazar and to Ithamar, his sons who were left, Take the meal offering that remains of the offerings of Jehovah made by fire,  eat it without leaven beside the altar, for it is most holy.
ye shall eat it in a holy place, because it is thy portion,  thy sons' portion, of the offerings of Jehovah made by fire. For so I am commanded.
ye shall eat the wave-breast and the heave-thigh in a clean place, thou,  thy sons,  thy daughters with thee. For they are given as thy portion,  thy sons' portion, out of the sacrifices of the peace offerings of the sons of Israel.
They shall bring the heave-thigh and the wave-breast with the offerings made by fire of the fat, to wave it for a wave offering before Jehovah,  it shall be thine,  thy sons' with thee, as a portion forever, as Jehovah has commanded.
Moses diligently sought the goat of the sin offering, , behold, it was burnt. And he was angry with Eleazar and with Ithamar, the sons of Aaron who were left, saying,
Why have ye not eaten the sin offering in the place of the sanctuary, seeing it is most holy,  he has given it to you to bear the iniquity of the congregation, to make atonement for them before Jehovah?
Behold, the blood of it was not brought into the sanctuary inside. Ye should certainly have eaten it in the sanctuary, as I commanded.
Aaron spoke to Moses, Behold, this day they have offered their sin offering and their burnt offering before Jehovah,  there have befallen me such things as these. And if I had eaten the sin offering today, would it have been well-pleasing in the sight of Jehovah?
when Moses heard, it was well-pleasing in his sight.
Jehovah spoke to Moses and to Aaron, saying to them,
Speak to the sons of Israel, saying, These are the living things which ye may eat among all the beasts that are on the earth.
Whatever parts the hoof,  is cloven footed,  chews the cud, among the beasts, that may ye eat.
Nevertheless these shall ye not eat of those that chew the cud, or of those that part the hoof: the camel, because he chews the cud but does not part the hoof, he is unclean to you.
the coney, because he chews the cud but does not part the hoof, he is unclean to you.
the hare, because she chews the cud but does not part the hoof, she is unclean to you.
the swine, because he parts the hoof,  is cloven footed,  does not chew the cud, he is unclean to you.
Of their flesh ye shall not eat,  their carcasses ye shall not touch, they are unclean to you.
These may ye eat of all that are in the waters: whatever has fins and scales in the waters, in the seas,  in the rivers, that may ye eat.
all that have no fins and scales in the seas,  in the rivers, of all that move in the waters,  of all the living creatures that are in the waters, they are an abomination to you,
they shall be an abomination to you. Ye shall not eat of their flesh,  their carcasses ye shall have in abomination.
Whatever has no fins nor scales in the waters, that is an abomination to you.
these ye shall have in abomination among the birds, they shall not be eaten, they are an abomination: the eagle,  the vulture,  the osprey,
the kite,  the falcon after its kind,
every raven after its kind,
the ostrich,  the night-hawk,  the sea-gull,  the hawk after its kind,
the little owl,  the cormorant,  the great owl,
the horned owl,  the pelican,  the carrion vulture,
the stork, the heron after its kind,  the hoopoe,  the bat.
All winged creeping things that go upon all fours are an abomination to you.
Yet these ye may eat of all winged creeping things that go upon all fours, which have legs above their feet, with which to leap upon the earth,
even these of them ye may eat: the locust after its kind,  the bald locust after its kind,  the cricket after its kind,  the grasshopper after its kind.
But all winged creeping things, which have four feet, are an abomination to you,
by these ye shall become unclean. Whoever touches the carcass of them shall be unclean until the evening.
whoever bears any of the carcass of them shall wash his clothes,  be unclean until the evening.
Every beast which parts the hoof,  is not cloven footed, nor chews the cud, is unclean to you. Everyone who touches them shall be unclean.
whatever goes upon its paws, among all beasts that go on all fours, they are unclean to you. Whoever touches their carcass shall be unclean until the evening.
he who bears the carcass of them shall wash his clothes,  be unclean until the evening; they are unclean to you.
these are those which are unclean to you among the creeping things that creep upon the earth: the weasel,  the mouse,  the great lizard after its kind,
the gecko,  the land-crocodile,  the lizard,  the sand-lizard,  the chameleon.
These are those which are unclean to you among all that creep. Whoever touches them, when they are dead, shall be unclean until the evening.
upon whatever any of them falls when they are dead, it shall be unclean, whether it be any vessel of wood, or raiment, or skin, or sack. Whatever vessel it be, with which any work is done, it must be put into water,  it shall be unclean until the evening, then it shall be clean.
every earthen vessel, into which any of them falls, whatever is in it shall be unclean,  ye shall break it.
All food therein which may be eaten, that on which water comes, shall be unclean,  all drink that may be drunk in every such vessel shall be unclean.
everything upon which any part of their carcass falls shall be unclean, whether oven, or range for pots, it shall be broken in pieces; they are unclean,  shall be unclean to you.
Nevertheless a fountain or a pit in which is a gathering of water shall be clean,  that which touches their carcass shall be unclean.
if any of their carcass falls upon any sowing seed which is to be sown, it is clean.
But if water is put upon the seed,  any of their carcass falls in it, it is unclean to you.
if any beast, of which ye may eat, dies, he who touches the carcass of it shall be unclean until the evening.
he who eats of the carcass of it shall wash his clothes,  be unclean until the evening. He also who bears the carcass of it shall wash his clothes,  be unclean until the evening.
every creeping thing that creeps upon the earth is an abomination; it shall not be eaten.
Whatever goes upon the belly,  whatever goes upon all fours, or whatever has many feet, even all creeping things that creep upon the earth, them ye shall not eat, for they are an abomination.
Ye shall not make yourselves abominable with any creeping thing that creeps, nor shall ye make yourselves unclean with them, that ye should be defiled by it.
For I am Jehovah your God. Sanctify yourselves therefore,  become ye holy, since I am holy. Neither shall ye defile yourselves with any manner of creeping thing that moves upon the earth.
For I am Jehovah who brought you up out of the land of Egypt, to be your God. Ye shall therefore be holy, for I am holy.
This is the law of the beast,  of the bird,  of every living creature that moves in the waters,  of every creature that creeps upon the earth,
to make a distinction between the unclean and the clean,  between the living thing that may be eaten and the living thing that may not be eaten.
Jehovah spoke to Moses, saying,
Speak to the sons of Israel, saying, If a woman conceives seed,  bears a man-child, then she shall be unclean seven days, as in the days of the impurity of her sickness she shall be unclean.
in the eighth day the flesh of his foreskin shall be circumcised.
she shall continue in the blood of her purifying thirty-three days. She shall touch no hallowed thing, nor come into the sanctuary, until the days of her purifying be fulfilled.
But if she bears a maid-child, then she shall be unclean two weeks, as in her impurity,  she shall continue in the blood of her purifying sixty-six days.
when the days of her purifying are fulfilled, for a son, or for a daughter, she shall bring a lamb a year old for a burnt offering,  a young pigeon, or a turtle-dove, for a sin offering, to the door of the tent of meeting, to the priest.
he shall offer it before Jehovah,  make atonement for her,  she shall be cleansed from the fountain of her blood. This is the law for her who bears, whether a male or a female.
if her means are not sufficient for a lamb, then she shall take two turtle-doves, or two young pigeons, the one for a burnt offering,  the other for a sin offering. And the priest shall make atonement for her,  she shall be clean.
Jehovah spoke to Moses and to Aaron, saying,
When a man shall have in the skin of his flesh a rising, or a scab, or a bright spot,  it becomes in the skin of his flesh a leprous disease, then he shall be brought to Aaron the priest, or to one of his sons the priests.
the priest shall look on the disease in the skin of the flesh,  if the hair in the disease has turned white,  the appearance of the disease is deeper than the skin of his flesh, it is a leprous disease. And the priest shall look on him,  pronounce him unclean.
if the bright spot is white in the skin of his flesh,  the appearance of it is not deeper than the skin,  the hair of it has not turned white, then the priest shall shut up the disease seven days.
the priest shall look on him the seventh day, , behold, if in his eyes the disease is arrested,  the disease is not spread in the skin, then the priest shall shut him up seven days more.
the priest shall look on him again the seventh day, , behold, if the disease is dim,  the disease has not spread in the skin, then the priest shall pronounce him clean. It is a scab,  he shall wash his clothes,  be clean.
But if the scab spreads abroad in the skin after he has shown himself to the priest for his cleansing, he shall show himself to the priest again.
the priest shall look, , behold, if the scab is spread in the skin, then the priest shall pronounce him unclean. It is a leprous disease.
When the leprous disease is in a man, then he shall be brought to the priest.
the priest shall look, , behold, if there is a white rising in the skin,  it has turned the hair white,  there is quick raw flesh in the rising,
it is an old leprous disease in the skin of his flesh,  the priest shall pronounce him unclean. He shall not shut him up, for he is unclean.
if the leprous disease breaks out abroad in the skin,  the leprous disease covers all the skin of the disease from his head even to his feet, as far as appears to the priest,
then the priest shall look. And, behold, if the leprous disease has covered all his flesh, he shall pronounce him clean of the disease. It is all turned white; he is clean.
But whenever raw flesh appears in him, he shall be unclean.
the priest shall look on the raw flesh,  pronounce him unclean. The raw flesh is unclean; it is a leprous disease.
Or if the raw flesh turns again,  is changed to white, then he shall come to the priest.
the priest shall look on him, , behold, if the disease is turned into white, then the priest shall pronounce him clean of the disease; he is clean.
when the flesh has a boil in the skin of it,  it is healed,
in the place of the boil there is a white rising, or a bright spot, reddish-white, then it shall be shown to the priest.
the priest shall look, , behold, if the appearance of it is deeper than the skin,  the hair of it has turned white, then the priest shall pronounce him unclean. It is a leprous disease; it has broken out in the boil.
But if the priest looks on it, , behold, there are no white hairs in it,  it is not deeper than the skin,  is dim, then the priest shall shut him up seven days.
if it spreads abroad in the skin, then the priest shall pronounce him unclean; it is a disease.
But if the bright spot stays in its place,  has not spread, it is the scar of the boil,  the priest shall pronounce him clean.
Or when the flesh has a burning by fire in the skin of it,  the quick of the burning become a bright spot, reddish-white, or white,
then the priest shall look upon it. And, behold, if the hair in the bright spot has turned white,  the appearance of it is deeper than the skin, it is a leprous disease. It has broken out in the burning,  the priest shall pronounce him unclean; it is a leprous disease.
But if the priest looks on it, , behold, there is no white hair in the bright spot,  it is no deeper than the skin,  is dim, then the priest shall shut him up seven days.
the priest shall look upon him the seventh day. If it spread abroad in the skin, then the priest shall pronounce him unclean; it is a leprous disease.
if the bright spot stays in its place,  has not spread in the skin,  is dim, it is the rising of the burning,  the priest shall pronounce him clean, for it is the scar of the burning.
when a man or woman has a disease upon the head or upon the beard,
then the priest shall look on the disease. And, behold, if the appearance of it is deeper than the skin,  there is yellow thin hair in it, then the priest shall pronounce him unclean; it is a scall. It is a leprous disease of the head or of the beard.
if the priest looks on the disease of the scall, , behold, the appearance of it is not deeper than the skin,  there is no black hair in it, then the priest shall shut up the disease of the scall seven days.
in the seventh day the priest shall look on the disease, , behold, if the scall has not spread,  there is in it no yellow hair,  the appearance of the scall is not deeper than the skin,
then he shall be shaven,  the scall he shall not shave,  the priest shall shut up him who has the scall seven days more.
in the seventh day the priest shall look on the scall, , behold, if the scall has not spread in the skin,  the appearance of it is not deeper than the skin, then the priest shall pronounce him clean. And he shall wash his clothes,  be clean.
But if the scall spreads abroad in the skin after his cleansing,
then the priest shall look on him. And, behold, if the scall has spread in the skin, the priest shall not seek for the yellow hair, he is unclean.
But if in his eyes the scall is arrested,  black hair is grown up in it, the scall is healed. He is clean,  the priest shall pronounce him clean.
when a man or a woman has bright spots in the skin of the flesh, even white bright spots,
then the priest shall look. And, behold, if the bright spots in the skin of their flesh are of a dull white, it is a tetter. It has broken out in the skin; he is clean.
if a man's hair is fallen off his head, he is bald; he is clean.
if his hair is fallen off from the front part of his head, he is forehead bald; he is clean.
But if there is a reddish-white disease in the bald head, or the bald forehead, it is a leprous disease breaking out in his bald head, or his bald forehead.
Then the priest shall look upon him, , behold, if the rising of the disease is reddish-white in his bald head, or in his bald forehead, as the appearance of a leprous disease in the skin of the flesh,
he is a leprous man; he is unclean. The priest shall surely pronounce him unclean; his disease is on his head.
the man with a leprous disease in whom the disease is, his clothes shall be torn,  the hair of his head shall go loose,  he shall cover his upper lip,  shall cry, Unclean, unclean.
All the days in which the disease is in him he shall be unclean; he is unclean. He shall dwell alone; his dwelling shall be outside the camp.
The garment also that a leprous disease is in, whether it be a woolen garment, or a linen garment,
whether it be in warp, or woof, of linen, or of woolen, whether in a skin, or in anything made of skin,
if the disease is greenish or reddish in the garment, or in the skin, or in the warp, or in the woof, or in anything of skin, it is a leprous disease,  shall be shown to the priest.
the priest shall look upon the disease,  shut up the disease seven days.
he shall look on the disease on the seventh day. If the disease has spread in the garment, either in the warp, or in the woof, or in the skin, whatever service skin is used for, the disease is a fretting leprosy, it is unclean.
he shall burn the garment, whether the warp or the woof, in woolen or in linen, or anything of skin, in which the disease is, for it is a fretting leprosy. It shall be burnt in the fire.
if the priest shall look, , behold, the disease has not spread in the garment, either in the warp, or in the woof, or in anything of skin,
then the priest shall command that they wash the thing in which the disease is,  he shall shut it up seven more days.
the priest shall look, after the disease is washed, , behold, if the disease has not changed its color,  the disease has not spread, it is unclean. Thou shall burn it in the fire. It is a fret, whether the bareness be inside or outside.
if the priest looks, , behold, the disease is dim after the washing of it, then he shall tear it out of the garment, or out of the skin, or out of the warp, or out of the woof.
if it still appears in the garment, either in the warp, or in the woof, or in anything of skin, it is breaking out. Thou shall burn that in which the disease is with fire.
the garment, either the warp, or the woof, or whatever thing of skin it be, which thou shall wash, if the disease has departed from them, then it shall be washed the second time,  shall be clean.
This is the law of a leprous disease in a garment of woolen or linen, either in the warp, or the woof, or anything of skin, to pronounce it clean, or to pronounce it unclean.
Jehovah spoke to Moses, saying,
This shall be the law of the man with a leprous disease in the day of his cleansing: He shall be brought to the priest,
the priest shall go forth out of the camp. And the priest shall look, , behold, if a leprous disease be healed in the man with a leprous disease,
then the priest shall command to take two living clean birds,  cedar wood,  scarlet,  hyssop for him who is to be cleansed.
the priest shall command to kill one of the birds in an earthen vessel over running water.
As for the living bird, he shall take it,  the cedar wood,  the scarlet,  the hyssop,  shall dip them and the living bird in the blood of the bird that was killed over the running water.
he shall sprinkle seven times upon him who is to be cleansed from the leprous disease,  shall pronounce him clean,  shall let the living bird go into the open field.
he who is to be cleansed shall wash his clothes,  shave off all his hair,  bathe himself in water,  he shall be clean. And after that he shall come into the camp,  shall dwell outside his tent seven days.
it shall be on the seventh day, that he shall shave all his hair off his head and his beard and his eyebrows, even all his hair he shall shave off. And he shall wash his clothes,  he shall bathe his flesh in water,  he shall be clean.
