Deut. Rise ye up, take your journey,  pass over the valley of the Arnon. Behold, I have given into thy hand Sihon the Amorite, king of Heshbon,  his land. Begin to possess it,  contend with him in battle.
Deut. This day I will begin to put the dread of thee and the fear of thee upon the peoples who are under the whole heaven, who shall hear the report of thee,  shall tremble,  be in anguish because of thee.
Deut. And I sent messengers out of the wilderness of Kedemoth to Sihon king of Heshbon with words of peace, saying,
Deut. Let me pass through thy land. I will go along by the highway, I will turn neither to the right hand nor to the left.
Deut. Thou shall sell me food for money, that I may eat,  give me water for money, that I may drink. Only let me pass through on my feet,
Deut. as the sons of Esau who dwell in Seir,  the Moabites who dwell in Ar, did to me, until I shall pass over the Jordan into the land which Jehovah our God gives us.
Deut. But Sihon king of Heshbon would not let us pass by him, for Jehovah thy God hardened his spirit,  made his heart obstinate, that he might deliver him into thy hand, as at this day.
Deut. And Jehovah said to me, Behold, I have begun to deliver up Sihon and his land before thee. Begin to possess, that thou may inherit his land.
Deut. Then Sihon came out against us, he and all his people, to battle at Jahaz.
Deut. And Jehovah our God delivered him up before us. And we smote him,  his sons,  all his people.
Deut. And we took all his cities at that time,  utterly destroyed every inhabited city, with the women and the little ones; we left none remaining.
Deut. We only took the cattle for a prey to ourselves, with the spoil of the cities which we had taken.
Deut. From Aroer, which is on the edge of the valley of the Arnon,  from the city that is in the valley, even to Gilead, there was not a city too high for us. Jehovah our God delivered up all before us.
Deut. Only to the land of the sons of Ammon thou did not come near, all the side of the river Jabbok,  the cities of the hill-country,  wherever Jehovah our God forbad us.
Deut. Then we turned,  went up the way to Bashan. And Og the king of Bashan came out against us, he and all his people, to battle at Edrei.
Deut. And Jehovah said to me, Fear him not, for I have delivered him,  all his people,  his land, into thy hand. And thou shall do to him as thou did to Sihon king of the Amorites, who dwelt at Heshbon.
Deut. So Jehovah our God delivered into our hand Og also, the king of Bashan,  all his people,  we smote him until none was left to him remaining.
Deut. And we took all his cities at that time. There was not a city which we did not take from them, sixty cities, all the region of Argob, the kingdom of Og in Bashan.
Deut. All these were cities fortified with high walls, gates,  bars; besides the un-walled towns a great many.
Deut. And we utterly destroyed them, as we did to Sihon king of Heshbon, utterly destroying every inhabited city, with the women and the little ones.
Deut. But all the cattle,  the spoil of the cities, we took for a prey to ourselves.
Deut. And we took the land at that time out of the hand of the two kings of the Amorites who were beyond the Jordan, from the valley of the Arnon to mount Hermon
Deut. (the Sidonians call Hermon, Sirion,  the Amorites call it Senir),
Deut. all the cities of the plain,  all Gilead,  all Bashan, to Salecah and Edrei, cities of the kingdom of Og in Bashan.
Deut. (For only Og king of Bashan remained of the remnant of the Rephaim. Behold, his bedstead was a bedstead of iron. Is it not in Rabbah of the sons of Ammon? Nine cubits was the length of it,  four cubits the breadth of it, after the cubit of a man.)
Deut. And we took this land in possession at that time. From Aroer, which is by the valley of the Arnon,  half the hill-country of Gilead,  the cities of it, I gave to the Reubenites and to the Gadites.
Deut. And the rest of Gilead,  all Bashan, the kingdom of Og, I gave to the half-tribe of Manasseh, all the region of Argob, even all Bashan. The same is called the land of Rephaim.
Deut. (Jair the son of Manasseh took all the region of Argob, to the border of the Geshurites and the Maacathites,  called them, even Bashan, after his own name, Havvoth-jair, to this day.)
Deut. And I gave Gilead to Machir.
Deut. And I gave to the Reubenites and to the Gadites from Gilead even to the valley of the Arnon, the middle of the valley,  the border of it, even to the river Jabbok, which is the border of the sons of Ammon,
Deut. also the Arabah,  the Jordan and the border of it, from Chinnereth even to the sea of the Arabah, the Salt Sea, under the slopes of Pisgah eastward.
Deut. And I commanded you at that time, saying, Jehovah your God has given you this land to possess it. Ye shall pass over armed before your brothers the sons of Israel, all the men of valor.
Deut. But your wives,  your little ones,  your cattle, (I know that ye have much cattle,) shall abide in your cities which I have given you
Deut. until Jehovah gives rest to your brothers, as to you,  they also possess the land which Jehovah your God gives them beyond the Jordan, then ye shall return every man to his possession, which I have given you.
Deut. And I commanded Joshua at that time, saying, Thine eyes have seen all that Jehovah your God has done to these two kings. So shall Jehovah do to all the kingdoms where thou go over.
Deut. Ye shall not fear them, for Jehovah your God, he it is who fights for you.
Deut. And I besought Jehovah at that time, saying,
Deut. O lord Jehovah, thou have begun to show thy servant thy greatness,  thy strong hand, for what god is there in heaven or in earth, that can do according to thy works,  according to thy mighty acts?
Deut. Let me go over, I pray thee,  see the good land that is beyond the Jordan, that goodly mountain,  Lebanon.
Deut. But Jehovah was angry with me because of you,  did not hearken to me. And Jehovah said to me, It shall be enough for thee. Speak no more to me of this matter.
Deut. Get thee up to the top of Pisgah,  lift up thine eyes westward,  northward,  southward,  eastward,  behold with thine eyes, for thou shall not go over this Jordan.
Deut. But charge Joshua,  encourage him,  strengthen him, for he shall go over before this people,  he shall cause them to inherit the land which thou shall see.
Deut. So we abode in the valley opposite Beth-peor.
Deut. And now, O Israel, hearken to the statutes and to the ordinances, which I teach you, to do them, that ye may live,  go in and possess the land which Jehovah, the God of your fathers, gives you.
Deut. Ye shall not add to the word which I command you, neither shall ye diminish from it, that ye may keep the commandments of Jehovah your God which I command you.
Deut. Your eyes have seen what Jehovah did because of Baal-peor. For all the men who followed Baal-peor, Jehovah thy God has destroyed them from the midst of thee.
Deut. But ye who clung to Jehovah your God are alive every one of you this day.
Deut. Behold, I have taught you statutes and ordinances, even as Jehovah my God commanded me, that ye should do so in the midst of the land where ye go in to possess it.
Deut. Keep therefore and do them, for this is your wisdom and your understanding in the sight of the peoples, who shall hear all these statutes,  say, Surely this great nation is a wise and understanding people.
Deut. For what great nation is there that has a god so near to them, as Jehovah our God is whenever we call upon him?
Deut. And what great nation is there that has statutes and ordinances so righteous as all this law, which I set before you this day?
Deut. Only take heed to thyself,  keep thy soul diligently, lest thou forget the things which thine eyes saw,  lest they depart from thy heart all the days of thy life,  make them known to thy sons and thy son's sons-
Deut. the day that thou stood before Jehovah thy God in Horeb, when Jehovah said to me, Assemble the people to me,  I will make them hear my words, that they may learn to fear me all the days that they live upon the earth,  that they may teach their sons.
Deut. And ye came near and stood under the mountain,  the mountain burned with fire to the heart of heaven, with darkness, cloud,  thick darkness.
Deut. And Jehovah spoke to you out of the midst of the fire. Ye heard the voice of words,  ye saw no form, only a voice.
Deut. And he declared to you his covenant, which he commanded you to perform, even the ten commandments. And he wrote them upon two tablets of stone.
Deut. And Jehovah commanded me at that time to teach you statutes and ordinances, that ye might do them in the land where ye go over to possess it.
Deut. Take ye therefore good heed to yourselves, for ye saw no manner of form on the day that Jehovah spoke to you in Horeb out of the midst of the fire.
Deut. Lest ye corrupt yourselves,  make for you a graven image in the form of any figure, the likeness of male or female,
Deut. the likeness of any beast that is on the earth, the likeness of any winged bird that flies in the sky,
Deut. the likeness of anything that creeps on the ground, the likeness of any fish that is in the water under the earth.
Deut. And lest thou lift up thine eyes to heaven,  when thou see the sun and the moon and the stars, even all the host of heaven, thou be drawn away and worship them,  serve them, which Jehovah thy God has allotted to all the peoples under the whole heaven.
Deut. But Jehovah has taken you,  brought you forth out of the iron furnace, out of Egypt, to be to him a people of inheritance, as at this day.
Deut. Furthermore Jehovah was angry with me because of you,  swore that I would not go over the Jordan,  that I would not go in to that good land, which Jehovah thy God gives thee for an inheritance,
Deut. but I must die in this land. I must not go over the Jordan,  ye shall go over,  possess that good land.
Deut. Take heed to yourselves, lest ye forget the covenant of Jehovah your God, which he made with you,  make you a graven image in the form of anything which Jehovah thy God has forbidden thee.
Deut. For Jehovah thy God is a consuming fire, a jealous God.
Deut. When thou shall beget sons,  son's sons,  ye shall have been long in the land,  shall corrupt yourselves,  make a graven image in the form of anything,  shall do that which is evil in the sight of Jehovah thy God, to provoke him to anger,
Deut. I call heaven and earth to witness against you this day, that ye shall soon utterly perish from off the land to which ye go over the Jordan to possess it. Ye shall not prolong your days upon it,  shall be utterly destroyed.
Deut. And Jehovah will scatter you among the peoples,  ye shall be left few in number among the nations where Jehovah shall lead you away.
Deut. And there ye shall serve gods, the work of men's hands, wood and stone, which neither see, nor hear, nor eat, nor smell.
Deut. But from there ye shall seek Jehovah thy God. And thou shall find him when thou search after him with all thy heart and with all thy soul.
Deut. When thou are in tribulation,  all these things have come upon thee, in the latter days thou shall return to Jehovah thy God,  hearken to his voice.
Deut. For Jehovah thy God is a merciful God. He will not fail thee, neither destroy thee, nor forget the covenant of thy fathers which he swore to them.
Deut. For ask now of the days that are past, which were before thee, since the day that God created man upon the earth,  from the one end of heaven to the other, whether there has been anything as this great thing is, or has been heard like it?
Deut. Did a people ever hear the voice of God speaking out of the midst of the fire, as thou have heard,  live?
Deut. Or has God assayed to go and take for him a nation from the midst of another nation, by trials, by signs,  by wonders,  by war,  by a mighty hand,  by an outstretched arm,  by great terrors, according to all that Jehovah your God did for you in Egypt before your eyes?
Deut. It was shown to thee, that thou might know that Jehovah he is God. There is none else besides him.
Deut. Out of heaven he made thee to hear his voice, that he might instruct thee. And upon earth he made thee to see his great fire,  thou heard his words out of the midst of the fire.
Deut. And because he loved thy fathers, therefore he chose their seed after them,  brought thee out with his presence, with his great power, out of Egypt,
Deut. to drive out nations from before thee greater and mightier than thou, to bring thee in, to give thee their land for an inheritance, as at this day.
Deut. Know therefore this day,  lay it to thy heart, that Jehovah he is God in heaven above and upon the earth beneath. There is none else.
Deut. And thou shall keep his statutes,  his commandments, which I command thee this day, that it may go well with thee,  with thy sons after thee,  that thou may prolong thy days in the land, which Jehovah thy God gives thee, forever.
Deut. Then Moses set apart three cities beyond the Jordan toward the sunrise,
Deut. that the manslayer might flee there, who kills his neighbor unawares,  did not hate him in time past,  that fleeing to one of these cities he might live:
Deut. namely, Bezer in the wilderness, in the plain country, for the Reubenites; and Ramoth in Gilead, for the Gadites; and Golan in Bashan, for the Manassites.
Deut. And this is the law which Moses set before the sons of Israel.
Deut. These are the testimonies,  the statutes,  the ordinances, which Moses spoke to the sons of Israel, when they came forth out of Egypt,
Deut. beyond the Jordan, in the valley opposite Beth-peor, in the land of Sihon king of the Amorites, who dwelt at Heshbon, whom Moses and the sons of Israel smote when they came forth out of Egypt.
Deut. And they took his land in possession,  the land of Og king of Bashan, the two kings of the Amorites, who were beyond the Jordan toward the sunrise,
Deut. from Aroer, which is on the edge of the valley of the Arnon, even to mount Sion (the same is Hermon),
Deut. and all the Arabah beyond the Jordan eastward, even to the sea of the Arabah, under the slopes of Pisgah.
Deut. And Moses called to all Israel,  said to them, Hear, O Israel, the statutes and the ordinances which I speak in your ears this day, that ye may learn them,  observe to do them.
Deut. Jehovah our God made a covenant with us in Horeb.
Deut. Jehovah did not make this covenant with our fathers,  with us, even us, who are all of us here alive this day.
Deut. Jehovah spoke with you face to face in the mount out of the midst of the fire
Deut. (I stood between Jehovah and you at that time, to show you the word of Jehovah, for ye were afraid because of the fire,  did not go up onto the mount), saying,
Deut. I am Jehovah thy God who brought thee out of the land of Egypt, out of the house of bondage.
Deut. Thou shall have no other gods before me.
Deut. Thou shall not make to thee a graven image: any likeness that is in heaven above, or that is on the earth beneath, or that is in the water under the earth.
Deut. Thou shall not bow down thyself to them, nor serve them, for I, Jehovah thy God, am a jealous God, visiting the iniquity of the fathers upon the sons,  upon the third and upon the fourth generation of those who hate me,
Deut. and showing loving kindness to thousands of those who love me and keep my commandments.
Deut. Thou shall not take the name of Jehovah thy God in vain, for Jehovah will not hold him guiltless who takes his name in vain.
Deut. Observe the sabbath day, to keep it holy, as Jehovah thy God commanded thee.
Deut. Six days thou shall labor,  do all thy work,
Deut. but the seventh day is a sabbath to Jehovah thy God: thou shall not do any work, thou, nor thy son, nor thy daughter, nor thy man-servant, nor thy maid-servant, nor thine ox, nor thy donkey, nor any of thy cattle, nor thy stranger that is within thy gates, that thy man-servant and thy maid-servant may rest as well as thou.
Deut. And thou shall remember that thou were a servant in the land of Egypt,  Jehovah thy God brought thee out from there by a mighty hand and by an outstretched arm, therefore Jehovah thy God commanded thee to keep the sabbath day.
Deut. Honor thy father and thy mother, as Jehovah thy God commanded thee, that thy days may be long,  that it may go well with thee in the land which Jehovah thy God gives thee.
Deut. Thou shall not murder.
Deut. Neither shall thou commit adultery.
Deut. Neither shall thou steal.
Deut. Neither shall thou bear false witness against thy neighbor.
Deut. Neither shall thou covet thy neighbor's wife. Neither shall thou desire thy neighbor's house, his field, or his man-servant, or his maid-servant, his ox, or his donkey, or anything that is thy neighbor's.
Deut. These words Jehovah spoke to all your assembly on the mount out of the midst of the fire, of the cloud,  of the thick darkness, with a great voice,  he added no more. And he wrote them upon two tablets of stone,  gave them to me.
Deut. And it came to pass, when ye heard the voice out of the midst of the darkness, while the mountain was burning with fire, that ye came near to me, even all the heads of your tribes,  your elders.
Deut. And ye said, Behold, Jehovah our God has shown us his glory and his greatness,  we have heard his voice out of the midst of the fire. We have seen this day that God speaks with man,  he lives.
Deut. Now therefore why should we die? For this great fire will consume us. If we hear the voice of Jehovah our God any more, then we shall die.
Deut. For who is there of all flesh, who has heard the voice of the living God speaking out of the midst of the fire, as we have,  lived?
Deut. Go thou near,  hear all that Jehovah our God shall say. And speak thou to us all that Jehovah our God shall speak to thee,  we will hear it,  do it.
Deut. And Jehovah heard the voice of your words, when ye spoke to me. And Jehovah said to me, I have heard the voice of the words of this people, which they have spoken to thee. They have well said all that they have spoken.
Deut. Oh that there were such a heart in them that they would fear me,  keep all my commandments always, that it might be well with them,  with their sons forever!
Deut. Go say to them, Return ye to your tents.
Deut. But as for thee, stand thou here by me,  I will speak to thee all the commandment,  the statutes,  the ordinances, which thou shall teach them, that they may do them in the land which I give them to possess it.
Deut. Ye shall observe to do therefore as Jehovah your God has commanded you. Ye shall not turn aside to the right hand or to the left.
Deut. Ye shall walk in all the way which Jehovah your God has commanded you, that ye may live,  that it may be well with you,  that ye may prolong your days in the land which ye shall possess.
Deut. Now this is the commandment, the statutes and the ordinances, which Jehovah your God commanded to teach you, that ye might do them in the land where ye go over to possess it,
Deut. that thou might fear Jehovah thy God, to keep all his statutes and his commandments, which I command thee, thou,  thy son,  thy son's son, all the days of thy life,  that thy days may be prolonged.
Deut. Hear therefore, O Israel,  observe to do it, that it may be well with thee,  that ye may increase mightily, as Jehovah, the God of thy fathers, has promised to thee, in a land flowing with milk and honey.
Deut. Hear, O Israel: Jehovah our God is one Jehovah.
Deut. And thou shall love Jehovah thy God with all thy heart,  with all thy soul,  with all thy might.
Deut. And these words, which I command thee this day, shall be upon thy heart.
Deut. And thou shall teach them diligently to thy sons,  shall talk of them when thou sit in thy house,  when thou walk by the way,  when thou lie down,  when thou rise up.
Deut. And thou shall bind them for a sign upon thy hand,  they shall be for frontlets between thine eyes.
Deut. And thou shall write them upon the door-posts of thy house,  upon thy gates.
Deut. And it shall be, when Jehovah thy God shall bring thee into the land which he swore to thy fathers, to Abraham, to Isaac,  to Jacob, to give thee, great and goodly cities, which thou did not build,
Deut. and houses full of all good things, which thou did not fill,  cisterns hewn out, which thou did not hew, vineyards and olive trees, which thou did not plant,  thou shall eat and be full,
Deut. then beware lest thou forget Jehovah, who brought thee forth out of the land of Egypt, out of the house of bondage.
Deut. Thou shall fear Jehovah thy God,  him thou shall serve,  shall swear by his name.
Deut. Ye shall not go after other gods, of the gods of the peoples that are round about you,
Deut. for Jehovah thy God in the midst of thee is a jealous God, lest the anger of Jehovah thy God be kindled against thee,  he destroy thee from off the face of the earth.
Deut. Ye shall not challenge Jehovah your God, as ye challenged him in Massah.
Deut. Ye shall diligently keep the commandments of Jehovah your God,  his testimonies,  his statutes, which he has commanded thee.
Deut. And thou shall do that which is right and good in the sight of Jehovah, that it may be well with thee,  that thou may go in and possess the good land which Jehovah swore to thy fathers,
Deut. to thrust out all thine enemies from before thee, as Jehovah has spoken.
Deut. When thy son asks thee in time to come, saying, What is the meaning of the testimonies,  the statutes,  the ordinances, which Jehovah our God has commanded you?
Deut. Then thou shall say to thy son, We were Pharaoh's bondmen in Egypt,  Jehovah brought us out of Egypt with a mighty hand.
Deut. And Jehovah showed signs and wonders, great and grievous, upon Egypt, upon Pharaoh,  upon all his house, before our eyes.
Deut. And he brought us out from there that he might bring us in to give us the land which he swore to our fathers.
Deut. And Jehovah commanded us to do all these statutes, to fear Jehovah our God for our good always, that he might preserve us alive as at this day.
Deut. And it shall be righteousness to us, if we observe to do all this commandment before Jehovah our God as he has commanded us.
Deut. When Jehovah thy God shall bring thee into the land where thou go to possess it,  shall cast out many nations before thee, the Hittite,  the Girgashite,  the Amorite,  the Canaanite,  the Perizzite,  the Hivite,  the Jebusite, seven nations greater and mightier than thou,
Deut. and when Jehovah thy God shall deliver them up before thee,  thou shall smite them, then thou shall utterly destroy them. Thou shall make no covenant with them, nor show mercy to them.
Deut. Neither shall thou make marriages with them. Thy daughter thou shall not give to his son, nor his daughter shall thou take to thy son.
Deut. For he will turn away thy son from following me, that they may serve other gods, so the anger of Jehovah will be kindled against you,  he will destroy thee quickly.
Deut. But thus shall ye deal with them: Ye shall break down their altars,  dash in pieces their pillars,  hew down their Asherim,  burn their graven images with fire.
Deut. For thou are a holy people to Jehovah thy God. Jehovah thy God has chosen thee to be a people for his own possession, above all peoples that are upon the face of the earth.
Deut. Jehovah did not set his love upon you, nor choose you, because ye were more in number than any people, for ye were the fewest of all peoples,
Deut. but because Jehovah loves you. And because he would keep the oath which he swore to your fathers, Jehovah has brought you out with a mighty hand,  redeemed you out of the house of bondage, from the hand of Pharaoh king of Egypt.
Deut. Know therefore that Jehovah thy God, he is God, the faithful God, who keeps covenant and loving kindness with those who love him and keep his commandments to a thousand generations,
Deut. and repays those who hate him to their face, to destroy them. He will not be slack to him who hates him. He will repay him to his face.
Deut. Thou shall therefore keep the commandment,  the statutes,  the ordinances, which I command thee this day, to do them.
Deut. And it shall come to pass, because ye hearken to these ordinances,  keep and do them, that Jehovah thy God will keep with thee the covenant and the loving kindness which he swore to thy fathers.
Deut. And he will love thee,  bless thee,  multiply thee. He will also bless the fruit of thy body and the fruit of thy ground, thy grain and thy new wine and thine oil, the increase of thy cattle and the young of thy flock, in the land which he swore to thy fathers to give thee.
Deut. Thou shall be blessed above all peoples. There shall not be male or female barren among you, or among your cattle.
Deut. And Jehovah will take away from thee all sickness. And none of the evil diseases of Egypt, which thou know, will he put upon thee,  will lay them upon all those who hate thee.
Deut. And thou shall consume all the peoples that Jehovah thy God shall deliver to thee. Thine eye shall not pity them. Neither shall thou serve their gods, for that will be a snare to thee.
Deut. If thou shall say in thy heart, These nations are more than I. How can I dispossess them?
Deut. Thou shall not be afraid of them. Thou shall remember well what Jehovah thy God did to Pharaoh,  to all Egypt:
Deut. the great trials which thine eyes saw,  the signs,  the wonders,  the mighty hand,  the outstretched arm by which Jehovah thy God brought thee out. So shall Jehovah thy God do to all the peoples of whom thou are afraid.
Deut. Moreover Jehovah thy God will send the hornet among them until those who are left and hide themselves perish from before thee.
Deut. Thou shall not be frightened at them, for Jehovah thy God is in the midst of thee, a great God and awesome.
Deut. And Jehovah thy God will cast out those nations before thee little by little. Thou may not consume them at once, lest the beasts of the field increase upon thee.
Deut. But Jehovah thy God will deliver them up before thee,  will discomfit them with a great confusion until they be destroyed.
Deut. And he will deliver their kings into thy hand,  thou shall make their name to perish from under heaven. There shall no man be able to stand before thee, until thou have destroyed them.
Deut. Ye shall burn the graven images of their gods with fire. Thou shall not covet the silver or the gold that is on them, nor take it to thee, lest thou be snared by it, for it is an abomination to Jehovah thy God.
Deut. And thou shall not bring an abomination into thy house,  become a devoted thing like it. Thou shall utterly detest it,  thou shall utterly abhor it, for it is a cursed thing.
Deut. All the commandment which I command thee this day ye shall observe to do, that ye may live,  multiply,  go in and possess the land which Jehovah swore to your fathers.
Deut. And thou shall remember all the way which Jehovah thy God has led thee these forty years in the wilderness, that he might humble thee, to prove thee, to know what was in thy heart, whether thou would keep his commandments, or not.
Deut. And he humbled thee,  allowed thee to hunger,  fed thee with manna, which thou knew not, neither did thy fathers know, that he might make thee know that man does not live by bread alone,  man lives by everything that proceeds out of the mouth of Jehovah.
Deut. Thy raiment did not grow old upon thee, neither did thy foot swell, these forty years.
Deut. And thou shall consider in thy heart, that, as a man chastens his son, so Jehovah thy God chastens thee.
Deut. And thou shall keep the commandments of Jehovah thy God, to walk in his ways,  to fear him.
Deut. For Jehovah thy God brings thee into a good land, a land of brooks of water, of fountains and springs, flowing forth in valleys and hills;
Deut. a land of wheat and barley,  vines and fig trees and pomegranates, a land of olive trees and honey,
Deut. a land in which thou shall eat bread without scarceness. Thou shall not lack anything in it, a land whose stones are iron,  out of whose hills thou may dig copper.
Deut. And thou shall eat and be full,  thou shall bless Jehovah thy God for the good land which he has given thee.
Deut. Beware lest thou forget Jehovah thy God, in not keeping his commandments,  his ordinances,  his statutes, which I command thee this day.
Deut. Lest, when thou have eaten and are full,  have built goodly houses,  dwelt in it,
Deut. and when thy herds and thy flocks multiply,  thy silver and thy gold is multiplied,  all that thou have is multiplied,
Deut. then thy heart be lifted up,  thou forget Jehovah thy God, who brought thee forth out of the land of Egypt, out of the house of bondage,
Deut. who led thee through the great and terrible wilderness-fiery serpents and scorpions,  thirsty ground where was no water-who brought thee forth water out of the rock of flint,
Deut. who fed thee in the wilderness with manna, which thy fathers did not know, that he might humble thee,  that he might prove thee, to do thee good at thy latter end.
Deut. And lest thou say in thy heart, My power and the might of my hand has gotten me this wealth.
Deut. But thou shall remember Jehovah thy God, for it is he who gives thee power to get wealth, that he may establish his covenant which he swore to thy fathers, as at this day.
Deut. And it shall be, if thou shall forget Jehovah thy God,  walk after other gods,  serve them,  worship them, I testify against you this day that ye shall surely perish.
Deut. As the nations that Jehovah makes to perish before you, so shall ye perish, because ye would not hearken to the voice of Jehovah your God.
Deut. Hear, O Israel: Thou are to pass over the Jordan this day, to go in to dispossess nations greater and mightier than thyself, cities great and fortified up to heaven,
Deut. a people great and tall, the sons of the Anakim, whom thou know,  of whom thou have heard say, Who can stand before the sons of Anak?
Deut. Know therefore this day, that Jehovah thy God is he who goes over before thee as a devouring fire. He will destroy them,  he will bring them down before thee. So thou shall drive them out,  make them to perish quickly, as Jehovah has spoken to thee.
Deut. Do not speak thou in thy heart, after Jehovah thy God has thrust them out from before thee, saying, For my righteousness Jehovah has brought me in to possess this land. Whereas for the wickedness of these nations Jehovah drives them out from before thee.
Deut. Not for thy righteousness, or for the uprightness of thy heart, do thou go in to possess their land,  for the wickedness of these nations Jehovah thy God drives them out from before thee,  that he may establish the word which Jehovah swore to thy fathers, to Abraham, to Isaac,  to Jacob.
Deut. Know therefore, that Jehovah thy God does not give thee this good land to possess it for thy righteousness, for thou are a stiff-necked people.
Deut. Remember, do not thou forget how thou provoked Jehovah thy God to wrath in the wilderness. From the day that thou went forth out of the land of Egypt, until ye came to this place, ye have been rebellious against Jehovah.
Deut. Also in Horeb ye provoked Jehovah to wrath,  Jehovah was angry with you to destroy you.
Deut. When I was gone up onto the mount to receive the tablets of stone, even the tablets of the covenant which Jehovah made with you, then I abode on the mount forty days and forty nights. I neither ate bread nor drank water.
Deut. And Jehovah delivered to me the two tablets of stone written with the finger of God. And on them was according to all the words, which Jehovah spoke with you in the mount out of the midst of the fire in the day of the assembly.
Deut. And it came to pass, at the end of forty days and forty nights, that Jehovah gave me the two tablets of stone, even the tablets of the covenant.
Deut. And Jehovah said to me, Arise, get thee down quickly from here, for thy people that thou have brought forth out of Egypt have corrupted themselves. They have quickly turned aside out of the way which I commanded them. They have made them a molten image.
Deut. Furthermore Jehovah spoke to me, saying, I have seen this people, , behold, it is a stiff-necked people.
Deut. Let me alone, that I may destroy them,  blot out their name from under heaven,  I will make of thee a nation mightier and greater than they.
Deut. So I turned and came down from the mount,  the mount was burning with fire. And the two tablets of the covenant were in my two hands.
Deut. And I looked, , behold, ye had sinned against Jehovah your God. Ye had made you a molten calf. Ye had turned aside quickly out of the way which Jehovah had commanded you.
Deut. And I took hold of the two tablets,  cast them out of my two hands,  broke them before your eyes.
Deut. And I fell down before Jehovah, as at the first, forty days and forty nights. I neither ate bread nor drank water, because of all your sin which ye sinned, in doing that which was evil in the sight of Jehovah, to provoke him to anger.
Deut. For I was afraid of the anger and hot displeasure with which Jehovah was angry against you to destroy you. But Jehovah hearkened to me that time also.
Deut. And Jehovah was very angry with Aaron to destroy him. And I prayed for Aaron also at the same time.
Deut. And I took your sin, the calf which ye had made,  burnt it with fire,  stamped it, grinding it very small, until it was as fine as dust. And I cast the dust of it into the brook that descended out of the mount.
Deut. And at Taberah,  at Massah,  at Kibroth-hattaavah, ye provoked Jehovah to wrath.
Deut. And when Jehovah sent you from Kadesh-barnea, saying, Go up and possess the land which I have given you, then ye rebelled against the commandment of Jehovah your God,  ye did not believe him, nor hearken to his voice.
Deut. Ye have been rebellious against Jehovah from the day that I knew you.
Deut. So I fell down before Jehovah the forty days and forty nights that I fell down, because Jehovah had said he would destroy you.
Deut. And I prayed to Jehovah,  said, O lord Jehovah, destroy not thy people and thine inheritance, that thou have redeemed through thy greatness, that thou have brought forth out of Egypt with a mighty hand.
Deut. Remember thy servants, Abraham, Isaac,  Jacob. Look not to the stubbornness of this people, nor to their profaneness, nor to their sin,
Deut. lest the land from where thou brought us out say, Because Jehovah was not able to bring them into the land which he promised to them,  because he hated them, he has brought them out to kill them in the wilderness.
Deut. Yet they are thy people and thine inheritance, which thou brought out by thy great power and by thine outstretched arm.
Deut. At that time Jehovah said to me, Hew thee two tablets of stone like the first,  come up to me onto the mount,  make thee an ark of wood.
Deut. And I will write on the tablets the words that were on the first tablets which thou broke,  thou shall put them in the ark.
Deut. So I made an ark of acacia wood,  hewed two tablets of stone like the first,  went up onto the mount, having the two tablets in my hand.
Deut. And he wrote on the tablets according to the first writing, the ten commandments, which Jehovah spoke to you in the mount out of the midst of the fire in the day of the assembly,  Jehovah gave them to me.
Deut. And I turned and came down from the mount,  put the tablets in the ark which I had made. And they are there as Jehovah commanded me.
Deut. (And the sons of Israel journeyed from Beeroth Bene-jaakan to Moserah. There Aaron died,  there he was buried,  Eleazar his son ministered in the priest's office in his stead.
Deut. From there they journeyed to Gudgodah,  from Gudgodah to Jotbathah, a land of brooks of water.
Deut. At that time Jehovah set apart the tribe of Levi, to bear the ark of the covenant of Jehovah, to stand before Jehovah to minister to him,  to bless in his name, to this day.
Deut. Therefore Levi has no portion nor inheritance with his brothers. Jehovah is his inheritance, according as Jehovah thy God spoke to him.)
Deut. And I stayed on the mount as at the first time, forty days and forty nights,  Jehovah hearkened to me that time also: Jehovah would not destroy thee.
Deut. And Jehovah said to me, Arise, take thy journey before the people,  they shall go in and possess the land, which I swore to their fathers to give to them.
Deut. And now, Israel, what does Jehovah thy God require of thee,  to fear Jehovah thy God, to walk in all his ways,  to love him,  to serve Jehovah thy God with all thy heart and with all thy soul,
Deut. to keep the commandments of Jehovah,  his statutes, which I command thee this day for thy good?
Deut. Behold, to Jehovah thy God belongs heaven and the heaven of heavens, the earth, with all that is in it.
Deut. Only Jehovah had a delight in thy fathers to love them,  he chose their seed after them, even you above all peoples as at this day.
Deut. Circumcise therefore the foreskin of your heart,  be no more stiff-necked.
Deut. For Jehovah your God, he is God of gods,  Lord of lords, the great God, the mighty,  the awesome, who regards not persons, nor takes reward.
Deut. He executes justice for the fatherless and widow,  loves the sojourner in giving him food and raiment.
Deut. Love ye therefore the sojourner, for ye were sojourners in the land of Egypt.
Deut. Thou shall fear Jehovah thy God. Him thou shall serve,  to him thou shall cling,  by his name thou shall swear.
Deut. He is thy praise,  he is thy God, who has done for thee these great and awesome things, which thine eyes have seen.
Deut. Thy fathers went down into Egypt, in souls, seventy. And now Jehovah thy God has made thee as the stars of heaven for multitude.
Deut. Therefore thou shall love Jehovah thy God,  keep his charge,  his statutes,  his ordinances,  his commandments, always.
Deut. And ye know this day, for it is not with your sons who have not known,  who have not seen the chastisement of Jehovah your God, his greatness, his mighty hand,  his outstretched arm,
Deut. and his signs,  his works, which he did in the midst of Egypt to Pharaoh the king of Egypt,  to all his land,
Deut. and what he did to the army of Egypt, to their horses,  to their chariots, how he made the water of the Red Sea to overflow them as they pursued after you,  how Jehovah has destroyed them to this day,
Deut. and what he did to you in the wilderness, until ye came to this place,
Deut. and what he did to Dathan and Abiram, the sons of Eliab, the son of Reuben, how the earth opened its mouth,  swallowed them up,  their households,  their tents,  every living thing that followed them, in the midst of all Israel,
Deut. but your eyes have seen all the great work of Jehovah which he did.
Deut. Therefore ye shall keep all the commandment which I command thee this day, that ye may be strong,  go in and possess the land, where ye go over to possess it,
Deut. and that ye may prolong your days in the land, which Jehovah swore to your fathers to give to them and to their seed, a land flowing with milk and honey.
Deut. For the land, where thou go in to possess it, is not as the land of Egypt, from where ye came out, where thou sowed thy seed,  watered it with thy foot, as a garden of herbs,
Deut. but the land, where ye go over to possess it, is a land of hills and valleys,  drinks water from the rain of heaven,
Deut. a land which Jehovah thy God cares for. The eyes of Jehovah thy God are always upon it, from the beginning of the year even to the end of the year.
Deut. And it shall come to pass, if ye shall hearken diligently to my commandments which I command you this day, to love Jehovah your God,  to serve him with all your heart and with all your soul,
Deut. that I will give the rain of your land in its season, the former rain and the latter rain, that thou may gather in thy grain,  thy new wine,  thine oil.
Deut. And I will give grass in thy fields for thy cattle,  thou shall eat and be full.
Deut. Take heed to yourselves, lest your heart be deceived,  ye turn aside,  serve other gods,  worship them,
Deut. and the anger of Jehovah be kindled against you,  he shut up the heavens, so that there shall be no rain,  the land shall not yield its fruit,  ye perish quickly from off the good land which Jehovah gives you.
Deut. Therefore ye shall lay up these my words in your heart and in your soul. And ye shall bind them for a sign upon your hand,  they shall be for frontlets between your eyes.
Deut. And ye shall teach them to your sons, talking of them when thou sit in thy house,  when thou walk by the way,  when thou lie down,  when thou rise up.
Deut. And thou shall write them upon the door-posts of thy house,  upon thy gates,
Deut. that your days may be multiplied,  the days of your sons, in the land which Jehovah swore to your fathers to give them, as the days of the heavens above the earth.
Deut. For if ye shall diligently keep all this commandment which I command you, to do it, to love Jehovah your God, to walk in all his ways,  to cling to him,
Deut. then will Jehovah drive out all these nations from before you,  ye shall dispossess nations greater and mightier than yourselves.
Deut. Every place on which the sole of your foot shall tread shall be yours, from the wilderness,  Lebanon, from the river, the river Euphrates, even to the hinder sea shall be your border.
Deut. There shall no man be able to stand before you. Jehovah your God shall lay the fear of you and the dread of you upon all the land that ye shall tread upon, as he has spoken to you.
Deut. Behold, I set before you this day a blessing and a curse:
Deut. the blessing, if ye shall hearken to the commandments of Jehovah your God, which I command you this day,
Deut. and the curse, if ye shall not hearken to the commandments of Jehovah your God,  turn aside out of the way which I command you this day to go after other gods, which ye have not known.
Deut. And it shall come to pass, when Jehovah thy God shall bring thee into the land where thou go to possess it, that thou shall set the blessing upon mount Gerizim,  the curse upon mount Ebal.
Deut. Are they not beyond the Jordan, behind the way of the going down of the sun, in the land of the Canaanites who dwell in the Arabah, opposite Gilgal, beside the oaks of Moreh?
Deut. For ye are to pass over the Jordan to go in to possess the land which Jehovah your God gives you,  ye shall possess it,  dwell in it.
Deut. And ye shall observe to do all the statutes and the ordinances which I set before you this day.
Deut. These are the statutes and the ordinances which ye shall observe to do in the land which Jehovah, the God of thy fathers, has given thee to possess it all the days that ye live upon the earth.
Deut. Ye shall surely destroy all the places in which the nations that ye shall dispossess served their gods, upon the high mountains,  upon the hills,  under every green tree.
Deut. And ye shall break down their altars,  dash in pieces their pillars,  burn their Asherim with fire. And ye shall hew down the graven images of their gods,  ye shall destroy their name out of that place.
Deut. Ye shall not do so to Jehovah your God.
Deut. But to the place which Jehovah your God shall choose out of all your tribes, to put his name there, even to his habitation ye shall seek,  there thou shall come.
Deut. And there ye shall bring your burnt offerings,  your sacrifices,  your tithes,  the heave offering of your hand,  your vows,  your freewill offerings,  the firstlings of your herd and of your flock.
Deut. And there ye shall eat before Jehovah your God,  ye shall rejoice in all that ye put your hand to, ye and your households, in which Jehovah thy God has blessed thee.
Deut. Ye shall not do after all the things that we do here this day, every man whatever is right in his own eyes.
Deut. For ye are not as yet come to the rest and to the inheritance, which Jehovah thy God gives thee.
Deut. But when ye go over the Jordan,  dwell in the land which Jehovah your God causes you to inherit,  he gives you rest from all your enemies round about, so that ye dwell in safety,
Deut. then it shall come to pass that to the place which Jehovah your God shall choose to cause his name to dwell there, there ye shall bring all that I command you: your burnt offerings,  your sacrifices, your tithes,  the heave offering of your hand,  all your choice vows which ye vow to Jehovah.
Deut. And ye shall rejoice before Jehovah your God, ye,  your sons,  your daughters,  your men-servants,  your maid-servants,  the Levite who is within your gates-inasmuch as he has no portion nor inheritance with you.
Deut. Take heed to thyself that thou offer not thy burnt offerings in every place that thou see,
Deut. but in the place which Jehovah shall choose in one of thy tribes. There thou shall offer thy burnt offerings,  there thou shall do all that I command thee.
Deut. Notwithstanding, thou may kill and eat flesh within all thy gates, after all the desire of thy soul, according to the blessing of Jehovah thy God which he has given thee, the unclean and the clean may eat of it, as of the gazelle,  as of the hart.
Deut. Only ye shall not eat the blood. Thou shall pour it out upon the ground as water.
Deut. Thou may not eat within thy gates the tithe of thy grain, or of thy new wine, or of thine oil, or the firstlings of thy herd or of thy flock, nor any of thy vows which thou vow, nor thy freewill offerings, nor the heave offering of thy hand.
Deut. But thou shall eat them before Jehovah thy God in the place which Jehovah thy God shall choose, thou,  thy son,  thy daughter,  thy man-servant,  thy maid-servant,  the Levite who is within thy gates. And thou shall rejoice before Jehovah thy God in all that thou put thy hand to.
Deut. Take heed to thyself that thou not forsake the Levite as long as thou live in thy land.
Deut. When Jehovah thy God shall enlarge thy border, as he has promised thee,  thou shall say, I will eat flesh, because thy soul desires to eat flesh, thou may eat flesh, after all the desire of thy soul.
Deut. If the place which Jehovah thy God shall choose, to put his name there, be too far from thee, then thou shall kill of thy herd and of thy flock, which Jehovah has given thee, as I have commanded thee,  thou may eat within thy gates, according to all the desire of thy soul.
Deut. Even as the gazelle and as the hart is eaten, so thou shall eat of it. The unclean and the clean may eat of it alike.
Deut. Only be sure that thou not eat the blood. For the blood is the life,  thou shall not eat the life with the flesh.
Deut. Thou shall not eat it. Thou shall pour it out upon the ground as water.
Deut. Thou shall not eat it, that it may go well with thee,  with thy sons after thee, when thou shall do that which is right in the eyes of Jehovah.
Deut. Only thy holy things which thou have,  thy vows, thou shall take,  go to the place which Jehovah shall choose.
Deut. And thou shall offer thy burnt offerings, the flesh and the blood, upon the altar of Jehovah thy God,  the blood of thy sacrifices shall be poured out upon the altar of Jehovah thy God,  thou shall eat the flesh.
Deut. Observe and hear all these words which I command thee, that it may go well with thee,  with thy sons after thee forever, when thou do that which is good and right in the eyes of Jehovah thy God.
Deut. When Jehovah thy God shall cut off the nations from before thee, where thou go in to dispossess them,  thou dispossess them,  dwell in their land,
Deut. take heed to thyself that thou be not ensnared to follow them, after they are destroyed from before thee,  that thou not inquire after their gods, saying, How do these nations serve their gods? Even so I will do likewise.
Deut. Thou shall not do so to Jehovah thy God. For every abomination to Jehovah, which he hates, they have done to their gods, for they even burn their sons and their daughters in the fire to their gods.
Deut. Whatever thing I command you, that shall ye observe to do. Thou shall not add to it, nor diminish from it.
Deut. If there arise in the midst of thee a prophet, or a dreamer of dreams,  he gives thee a sign or a wonder,
Deut. and the sign or the wonder comes to pass, of which he spoke to thee, saying, Let us go after other gods, which thou have not known,  let us serve them,
Deut. thou shall not hearken to the words of that prophet, or to that dreamer of dreams, for Jehovah your God proves you, to know whether ye love Jehovah your God with all your heart and with all your soul.
Deut. Ye shall walk after Jehovah your God,  fear him,  keep his commandments,  obey his voice,  ye shall serve him,  cling to him.
Deut. And that prophet, or that dreamer of dreams, shall be put to death, because he has spoken rebellion against Jehovah your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt,  redeemed thee out of the house of bondage, to draw thee aside out of the way which Jehovah thy God commanded thee to walk in. So shall thou put away the evil from the midst of thee.
Deut. If thy brother, the son of thy mother, or thy son, or thy daughter, or the wife of thy bosom, or thy friend, who is as thine own soul, entices thee secretly, saying, Let us go and serve other gods, which thou have not known, thou, nor thy fathers,
Deut. of the gods of the peoples that are round about you, near to thee, or far off from thee, from the one end of the earth even to the other end of the earth,
Deut. thou shall not consent to him, nor hearken to him. Neither shall thine eye pity him, neither shall thou spare, neither shall thou conceal him,
Deut. but thou shall surely kill him. Thy hand shall be first upon him to put him to death,  afterwards the hand of all the people.
Deut. And thou shall stone him to death with stones, because he has sought to draw thee away from Jehovah thy God, who brought thee out of the land of Egypt, out of the house of bondage.
Deut. And all Israel shall hear,  fear,  shall no more do any such wickedness as this is in the midst of thee.
Deut. If thou shall hear tell concerning one of thy cities, which Jehovah thy God gives thee to dwell there, saying,
Deut. Certain base fellows have gone out from the midst of thee,  have drawn away the inhabitants of their city, saying, Let us go and serve other gods, which ye have not known,
Deut. then thou shall inquire,  make search,  ask diligently. And, behold, if it be true,  the thing certain, that such abomination is wrought in the midst of thee,
Deut. thou shall surely smite the inhabitants of that city with the edge of the sword, destroying it utterly,  all that is in it,  the cattle in it, with the edge of the sword.
Deut. And thou shall gather all the spoil of it into the midst of the street of it,  shall burn the city with fire,  all the spoil of it, every whit, to Jehovah thy God,  it shall be a heap forever. It shall not be built again.
Deut. And nothing of the devoted thing shall cling to thy hand, that Jehovah may turn from the fierceness of his anger,  show thee mercy,  have compassion upon thee,  multiply thee, as he has sworn to thy fathers,
Deut. when thou shall hearken to the voice of Jehovah thy God, to keep all his commandments which I command thee this day, to do that which is right in the eyes of Jehovah thy God.
Deut. Ye are the sons of Jehovah your God. Ye shall not cut yourselves, nor make any baldness between your eyes for the dead.
Deut. For thou are a holy people to Jehovah thy God,  Jehovah has chosen thee to be a people for his own possession, above all peoples that are upon the face of the earth.
Deut. Thou shall not eat any abominable thing.
Deut. These are the beasts which ye may eat: the ox, the sheep,  the goat,
Deut. the hart,  the gazelle,  the roebuck,  the wild goat,  the ibex,  the antelope,  the chamois.
Deut. And every beast that parts the hoof,  has the hoof cloven in two,  chews the cud, among the beasts, that may ye eat.
Deut. Nevertheless of those that chew the cud, or of those that have the hoof cloven, these ye shall not eat: the camel,  the hare,  the coney, because they chew the cud but do not part the hoof, they are unclean to you,
Deut. and the swine, because he parts the hoof but does not chew the cud, he is unclean to you. Of their flesh ye shall not eat,  their carcasses ye shall not touch.
Deut. These ye may eat of all that are in the waters: whatever has fins and scales ye may eat.
Deut. And whatever does not have fins and scales ye shall not eat; it is unclean to you.
Deut. Of all clean birds ye may eat,
Deut. but these are those of which ye shall not eat: the eagle,  the ossifrage,  the osprey,
Deut. and the glede,  the falcon,  the kite according to its kind,
Deut. and every raven after its kind,
Deut. and the ostrich,  the night-hawk,  the sea-gull,  the hawk according to its kind,
Deut. the little owl,  the great owl,  the horned owl,
Deut. and the pelican,  the vulture,  the cormorant,
Deut. and the stork,  the heron according to its kind,  the hoopoe,  the bat.
Deut. And all winged creeping things are unclean to you. They shall not be eaten.
Deut. Of all clean birds ye may eat.
Deut. Ye shall not eat of anything that dies of itself. Thou may give it to the sojourner who is within thy gates, that he may eat it, or thou may sell it to a foreigner, for thou are a holy people to Jehovah thy God. Thou shall not boil a kid in its mother's milk.
Deut. Thou shall surely tithe all the increase of thy seed; that which comes forth from the field year by year.
Deut. And thou shall eat before Jehovah thy God, in the place which he shall choose to cause his name to dwell there, the tithe of thy grain, of thy new wine,  of thine oil,  the firstlings of thy herd and of thy flock, that thou may learn to fear Jehovah thy God always.
Deut. And if the way is too long for thee, so that thou are not able to carry it, because the place is too far from thee, which Jehovah thy God shall choose to set his name there when Jehovah thy God shall bless thee,
Deut. then thou shall turn it into money,  bind up the money in thy hand,  shall go to the place which Jehovah thy God shall choose.
Deut. And thou shall bestow the money for whatever thy soul desires, for oxen, or for sheep, or for wine, or for strong drink, or for whatever thy soul asks of thee. And thou shall eat there before Jehovah thy God,  thou shall rejoice, thou and thy household.
Deut. And the Levite who is within thy gates, thou shall not forsake him, for he has no portion nor inheritance with thee.
Deut. At the end of every three years thou shall bring forth all the tithe of thine increase in the same year,  shall lay it up within thy gates.
Deut. And the Levite, because he has no portion nor inheritance with thee,  the sojourner,  the fatherless,  the widow, who are within thy gates, shall come,  shall eat and be satisfied, that Jehovah thy God may bless thee in all the work of thy hand which thou do.
Deut. At the end of every seven years thou shall make a release.
Deut. And this is the manner of the release: Every creditor shall release that which he has lent to his neighbor. He shall not exact it from his neighbor and his brother, because Jehovah's release has been proclaimed.
Deut. From a foreigner thou may exact it,  whatever of thine is with thy brother, thy hand shall release.
Deut. However there shall be no poor with thee (for Jehovah will surely bless thee in the land which Jehovah thy God gives thee for an inheritance to possess it),
Deut. if only thou diligently hearken to the voice of Jehovah thy God, to observe to do all this commandment which I command thee this day.
Deut. For Jehovah thy God will bless thee as he promised thee,  thou shall lend to many nations,  thou shall not borrow,  thou shall rule over many nations,  they shall not rule over thee.
Deut. If there be with thee a poor man, one of thy brothers, within any of thy gates in thy land which Jehovah thy God gives thee, thou shall not harden thy heart, nor shut thy hand from thy poor brother,
Deut. but thou shall surely open thy hand to him,  shall surely lend him sufficient for his need which he wants.
Deut. Beware that there not be a base thought in thy heart, saying, The seventh year, the year of release, is at hand,  thine eye be evil against thy poor brother,  thou give him nothing,  he cry to Jehovah against thee,  it be sin to thee.
Deut. Thou shall surely give him,  thy heart shall not be grieved when thou give to him, because for this thing Jehovah thy God will bless thee in all thy work,  in all that thou put thy hand to.
Deut. For the poor will never cease out of the land. Therefore I command thee, saying, Thou shall surely open thy hand to thy brother, to thy needy,  to thy poor, in thy land.
Deut. If thy brother, a Hebrew man, or a Hebrew woman, is sold to thee,  serves thee six years, then in the seventh year thou shall let him go free from thee.
Deut. And when thou let him go free from thee, thou shall not let him go empty.
Deut. Thou shall furnish him liberally out of thy flock,  out of thy threshing-floor,  out of thy winepress. As Jehovah thy God has blessed thee thou shall give to him.
Deut. And thou shall remember that thou were a bondman in the land of Egypt,  Jehovah thy God redeemed thee. Therefore I command thee this thing today.
Deut. And it shall be, if he says to thee, I will not go out from thee, because he loves thee and thy house, because he is well with thee,
Deut. then thou shall take an awl,  thrust it through his ear to the door,  he shall be thy servant forever. And also to thy maid-servant thou shall do likewise.
Deut. It shall not seem hard to thee when thou let him go free from thee, for he has been worth a double hired servant to thee, in serving thee six years. And Jehovah thy God will bless thee in all that thou do.
Deut. All the firstling males that are born of thy herd and of thy flock thou shall sanctify to Jehovah thy God. Thou shall do no work with the firstling of thy herd, nor shear the firstling of thy flock.
Deut. Thou shall eat it before Jehovah thy God year by year in the place which Jehovah shall choose, thou and thy household.
Deut. And if it has any blemish, as lame or blind, any ill blemish whatever, thou shall not sacrifice it to Jehovah thy God.
Deut. Thou shall eat it within thy gates. The unclean man and the clean man alike, as the gazelle,  as the hart.
Deut. Only thou shall not eat the blood of it. Thou shall pour it out upon the ground as water.
Deut. Observe the month of Abib,  keep the Passover to Jehovah thy God, for in the month of Abib Jehovah thy God brought thee forth out of Egypt by night.
Deut. And thou shall sacrifice the Passover to Jehovah thy God, of the flock and the herd, in the place which Jehovah shall choose to cause his name to dwell there.
Deut. Thou shall eat no leavened bread with it. Seven days thou shall eat unleavened bread with it, even the bread of affliction, for thou came forth out of the land of Egypt in haste, that thou may remember the day when thou came forth out of the land of Egypt all the days of thy life.
Deut. And there shall be no leaven seen with thee in all thy borders seven days. Neither shall any of the flesh, which thou sacrifice the first day at evening, remain all night until the morning.
Deut. Thou may not sacrifice the Passover within any of thy gates, which Jehovah thy God gives thee,
Deut. but at the place which Jehovah thy God shall choose to cause his name to dwell in, there thou shall sacrifice the Passover at evening, at the going down of the sun, at the season that thou came forth out of Egypt.
Deut. And thou shall roast and eat it in the place which Jehovah thy God shall choose,  thou shall turn in the morning,  go to thy tents.
Deut. Six days thou shall eat unleavened bread,  on the seventh day shall be a solemn assembly to Jehovah thy God. Thou shall do no work.
Deut. Thou shall number to thee seven weeks. From the time thou begin to put the sickle to the standing grain thou shall begin to number seven weeks.
Deut. And thou shall keep the feast of weeks to Jehovah thy God with a tribute of a freewill offering from thy hand, which thou shall give, according as Jehovah thy God blesses thee.
Deut. And thou shall rejoice before Jehovah thy God, thou,  thy son,  thy daughter,  thy man-servant,  thy maid-servant,  the Levite who is within thy gates,  the sojourner,  the fatherless,  the widow, who are in the midst of thee, in the place which Jehovah thy God shall choose to cause his name to dwell there,
Deut. and thou shall remember that thou were a bondman in Egypt. And thou shall observe and do these statutes.
Deut. Thou shall keep the feast of tabernacles seven days after thou have gathered in from thy threshing-floor and from thy winepress.
Deut. And thou shall rejoice in thy feast, thou,  thy son,  thy daughter,  thy man-servant,  thy maid-servant,  the Levite,  the sojourner,  the fatherless,  the widow, who are within thy gates.
Deut. Seven days thou shall keep a feast to Jehovah thy God in the place which Jehovah shall choose, because Jehovah thy God will bless thee in all thine increase,  in all the work of thy hands,  thou shall be altogether joyful.
Deut. Three times in a year all thy males shall appear before Jehovah thy God in the place which he shall choose: in the feast of unleavened bread,  in the feast of weeks,  in the feast of tabernacles. And they shall not appear before Jehovah empty.
Deut. Every man shall give as he is able, according to the blessing of Jehovah thy God which he has given thee.
Deut. Thou shall make judges and officers for thee in all thy gates, which Jehovah thy God gives thee, according to thy tribes,  they shall judge the people with righteous judgment.
Deut. Thou shall not distort justice. Thou shall not respect persons, neither shall thou take a bribe, for a bribe blinds the eyes of the wise,  perverts the words of the righteous.
Deut. Thou shall follow that which is altogether just, that thou may live,  inherit the land which Jehovah thy God gives thee.
Deut. Thou shall not plant for thee an Asherah of any kind of tree beside the altar of Jehovah thy God, which thou shall make for thee.
Deut. Neither shall thou set up a pillar for thee, which Jehovah thy God hates.
Deut. Thou shall not sacrifice to Jehovah thy God an ox, or a sheep, in which is a blemish or anything bad, for that is an abomination to Jehovah thy God.
Deut. If there be found in the midst of thee, within any of thy gates which Jehovah thy God gives thee, man or woman, who does that which is evil in the sight of Jehovah thy God, in transgressing his covenant,
Deut. and has gone and served other gods,  worshiped them, or the sun, or the moon, or any of the host of heaven, which I have not commanded,
Deut. and it be told thee,  thou have heard of it, then shall thou inquire diligently. And, behold, if it be true,  the thing certain, that such abomination is wrought in Israel,
Deut. then thou shall bring forth that man or that woman, who has done this evil thing, to thy gates, even the man or the woman,  thou shall stone them to death with stones.
Deut. At the mouth of two witnesses, or three witnesses, shall he who is to die be put to death. He shall not be put to death at the mouth of one witness.
Deut. The hand of the witnesses shall be first upon him to put him to death,  afterward the hand of all the people. So thou shall put away the evil from the midst of thee.
Deut. If there arise a matter too hard for thee in judgment, between blood and blood, between plea and plea,  between stroke and stroke, being matters of controversy within thy gates, then thou shall arise,  get thee up to the place which Jehovah thy God shall choose.
Deut. And thou shall come to the priests the Levites,  to the judge who shall be in those days,  thou shall inquire. And they shall show thee the sentence of judgment.
Deut. And thou shall do according to the tenor of the sentence which they shall show thee from that place which Jehovah shall choose. And thou shall observe to do according to all that they shall teach thee,
Deut. according to the tenor of the law which they shall teach thee,  according to the judgment which they shall tell thee, thou shall do. Thou shall not turn aside from the sentence, which they shall show thee, to the right hand, nor to the left.
Deut. And the man who does presumptuously, in not hearkening to the priest who stands to minister there before Jehovah thy God, or to the judge, even that man shall die,  thou shall put away the evil from Israel.
Deut. And all the people shall hear,  fear,  do no more presumptuously.
Deut. When thou have come to the land which Jehovah thy God gives thee,  shall possess it,  shall dwell in it,  shall say, I will set a king over me like all the nations that are round about me,
Deut. thou shall surely set him king over thee whom Jehovah thy God shall choose. Thou shall set a king over thee from among thy brothers. Thou may not put a foreigner over thee who is not thy brother.
Deut. Only he shall not multiply horses to himself, nor cause the people to return to Egypt, to the end that he may multiply horses, inasmuch as Jehovah has said to you, Ye shall henceforth return no more that way.
Deut. Neither shall he multiply wives to himself, that his heart turn not away. Neither shall he greatly multiply to himself silver and gold.
Deut. And it shall be, when he sits upon the throne of his kingdom, that he shall write for him a copy of this law in a book, out of it before the priests the Levites,
Deut. and it shall be with him. And he shall read in it all the days of his life, that he may learn to fear Jehovah his God, to keep all the words of this law and these statutes, to do them,
Deut. that his heart not be lifted up above his brothers,  that he turn not aside from the commandment, to the right hand, or to the left, to the end that he may prolong his days in his kingdom, he and his sons, in the midst of Israel.
Deut. The priests the Levites, even all the tribe of Levi, shall have no portion nor inheritance with Israel. They shall eat the offerings of Jehovah made by fire,  his inheritance.
Deut. And they shall have no inheritance among their brothers. Jehovah is their inheritance as he has spoken to them.
Deut. And this shall be the priests' due from the people, from those who offer a sacrifice, whether it be ox or sheep: that they shall give to the priest the shoulder,  the two cheeks,  the maw.
Deut. The first-fruits of thy grain, of thy new wine,  of thine oil,  the first of the fleece of thy sheep, thou shall give him.
Deut. For Jehovah thy God has chosen him out of all thy tribes to stand to minister in the name of Jehovah, him and his sons forever.
Deut. And if a Levite comes from any of thy gates out of all Israel, where he sojourns,  comes with all the desire of his soul to the place which Jehovah shall choose,
Deut. then he shall minister in the name of Jehovah his God, as all his brothers the Levites do who stand there before Jehovah.
Deut. They shall have like portions to eat, besides that which comes of the sale of his patrimony.
Deut. When thou have come into the land, which Jehovah thy God gives thee, thou shall not learn to do according to the abominations of those nations.
Deut. There shall not be found with thee anyone who makes his son or his daughter to pass through the fire, a psychic, he who practices augury, or an enchanter, or a sorcerer,
Deut. or a charmer, or a medium, or a spiritist, or a necromancer.
Deut. For whoever does these things is an abomination to Jehovah. And because of these abominations Jehovah thy God drives them out from before thee.
Deut. Thou shall be perfect with Jehovah thy God.
Deut. For these nations, that thou shall dispossess, hearken to those who practice augury,  to psychics. But as for thee, Jehovah thy God has not allowed thee to do so.
Deut. Jehovah thy God will raise up for thee a prophet from the midst of thee, of thy brothers, like me. Ye shall hearken to him,
Deut. according to all that thou desired of Jehovah thy God in Horeb in the day of the assembly, saying, Let me not hear again the voice of Jehovah my God, neither let me see this great fire any more, that I not die.
Deut. And Jehovah said to me, They have well said that which they have spoken.
Deut. I will raise up a prophet for them from among their brothers, like thee. And I will put my words in his mouth,  he shall speak to them all that I shall command him.
Deut. And it shall come to pass, that whoever will not hearken to my words which he shall speak in my name, I will require it of him.
Deut. But the prophet, who shall speak a word presumptuously in my name, which I have not commanded him to speak, or who shall speak in the name of other gods, that same prophet shall die.
Deut. And if thou say in thy heart, How shall we know the word which Jehovah has not spoken?
Deut. When a prophet speaks in the name of Jehovah, if the thing does not follow, nor come to pass, that is the thing which Jehovah has not spoken. The prophet has spoken it presumptuously. Thou shall not be afraid of him.
Deut. When Jehovah thy God shall cut off the nations, whose land Jehovah thy God gives thee,  thou succeed them,  dwell in their cities,  in their houses,
Deut. thou shall set apart three cities for thee in the midst of thy land, which Jehovah thy God gives thee to possess it.
Deut. Thou shall prepare for thee the way,  divide the borders of thy land, which Jehovah thy God causes thee to inherit, into three parts, that every manslayer may flee there.
Deut. And this is the case of the manslayer, who shall flee there and live: Whoever kills his neighbor unawares,  did not hate him in time past,
Deut. as when a man goes into the forest with his neighbor to hew wood,  his hand fetches a stroke with the axe to cut down the tree,  the head slips from the helve,  lands upon his neighbor, so that he dies, he shall flee to one of these cities and live.
Deut. Lest the avenger of blood pursue the manslayer, while his heart is hot,  overtake him, because the way is long,  smite him mortally, whereas he was not worthy of death, inasmuch as he did not hate him in time past.
Deut. Therefore I command thee, saying, Thou shall set apart three cities for thee.
Deut. And if Jehovah thy God enlarge thy border, as he has sworn to thy fathers,  give thee all the land which he promised to give to thy fathers,
Deut. if thou shall keep all this commandment to do it, which I command thee this day, to love Jehovah thy God,  to walk ever in his ways, then shall thou add three more cities for thee, besides these three,
Deut. that innocent blood not be shed in the midst of thy land, which Jehovah thy God gives thee for an inheritance,  so blood be upon thee.
Deut. But if any man hates his neighbor,  lies in wait for him,  rises up against him,  smites him mortally so that he dies,  he flees into one of these cities,
Deut. then the elders of his city shall send and fetch him from there,  deliver him into the hand of the avenger of blood, that he may die.
Deut. Thine eye shall not pity him,  thou shall put away the innocent blood from Israel, that it may go well with thee.
Deut. Thou shall not remove thy neighbor's landmark, which they of old time have set, in thine inheritance which thou shall inherit, in the land that Jehovah thy God gives thee to possess it.
Deut. One witness shall not rise up against a man for any iniquity, or for any sin, in any sin that he sins. At the mouth of two witnesses, or at the mouth of three witnesses, shall a matter be established.
Deut. If an unrighteous witness rises up against any man to testify against him of wrong-doing,
Deut. then both the men, between whom the controversy is, shall stand before Jehovah, before the priests and the judges that shall be in those days,
Deut. and the judges shall make diligent inquiry. And, behold, if the witness is a false witness,  has testified falsely against his brother,
Deut. then ye shall do to him, as he had thought to do to his brother. So shall thou put away the evil from the midst of thee.
Deut. And those who remain shall hear,  fear,  shall henceforth commit no more any such evil in the midst of thee.
Deut. And thine eyes shall not pity: life for life, eye for eye, tooth for tooth, hand for hand, foot for foot.
Deut. When thou go forth to battle against thine enemies,  see horses,  chariots,  a people more than thou, thou shall not be afraid of them, for Jehovah thy God is with thee, who brought thee up out of the land of Egypt.
Deut. And it shall be, when ye draw near to the battle, that the priest shall approach and speak to the people,
Deut. and shall say to them, Hear, O Israel, ye draw near this day to battle against your enemies. Let not your heart faint. Fear not, nor tremble, neither be ye frightened at them.
Deut. For Jehovah your God is he who goes with you, to fight for you against your enemies, to save you.
Deut. And the officers shall speak to the people, saying, What man is there who has built a new house,  has not dedicated it? Let him go and return to his house, lest he die in the battle,  another man dedicate it.
Deut. And what man is there who has planted a vineyard,  has not used the fruit of it? Let him go and return to his house, lest he die in the battle,  another man use the fruit of it.
Deut. And what man is there who has betrothed a wife,  has not taken her? Let him go and return to his house, lest he die in the battle,  another man take her.
Deut. And the officers shall speak further to the people,  they shall say, What man is there who is fearful and faint-hearted? Let him go and return to his house, lest his brother's heart melt as his heart.
Deut. And it shall be, when the officers have made an end of speaking to the people, that they shall appoint captains of armies at the head of the people.
Deut. When thou draw near to a city to fight against it, then proclaim peace to it.
Deut. And it shall be, if it makes to thee an answer of peace,  opens to thee, then it shall be, that all the people that are found in it shall become tributary to thee,  shall serve thee.
Deut. And if it will make no peace with thee,  will make war against thee, then thou shall besiege it.
Deut. And when Jehovah thy God delivers it into thy hand, thou shall smite every male of it with the edge of the sword,
Deut. but the women,  the little ones,  the cattle,  all that is in the city, even all the spoil of it, thou shall take for a prey to thyself. And thou shall eat the spoil of thine enemies, which Jehovah thy God has given thee.
Deut. Thus thou shall do to all the cities which are very far off from thee, which are not of the cities of these nations.
Deut. But of the cities of these peoples, that Jehovah thy God gives thee for an inheritance, thou shall save alive nothing that breathes,
Deut. but thou shall utterly destroy them-the Hittite,  the Amorite, the Canaanite,  the Perizzite, the Hivite,  the Jebusite-as Jehovah thy God has commanded thee,
Deut. that they not teach you to do after all their abominations, which they have done to their gods, so ye would sin against Jehovah your God.
Deut. When thou shall besiege a city a long time, in making war against it to take it, thou shall not destroy the trees of it by wielding an axe against them, for thou may eat of them. And thou shall not cut them down, for is the tree of the field a man, that it should be besieged by thee?
Deut. Only the trees of which thou know that they are not trees for food, thou shall destroy and cut them down. And thou shall build bulwarks against the city that makes war with thee, until it falls.
Deut. If a man is found slain in the land which Jehovah thy God gives thee to possess it, lying in the field,  it not be known who has smitten him,
Deut. then thy elders and thy judges shall come forth. And they shall measure to the cities which are round about him who is slain,
Deut. and it shall be, that the city which is nearest to the slain man, even the elders of that city shall take a heifer of the herd, which has not been worked with,  which has not drawn in the yoke,
Deut. and the elders of that city shall bring down the heifer to a valley with running water, which is neither plowed nor sown,  shall break the heifer's neck there in the valley.
Deut. And the priests the sons of Levi shall come near, for Jehovah thy God has chosen them to minister to him,  to bless in the name of Jehovah,  according to their word shall every controversy and every stroke be.
Deut. And all the elders of that city, who are nearest to the slain man, shall wash their hands over the heifer whose neck was broken in the valley,
Deut. and they shall answer and say, Our hands have not shed this blood, neither have our eyes seen it.
Deut. Forgive, O Jehovah, thy people Israel whom thou have redeemed,  allow no innocent blood to remain in the midst of thy people Israel. And the blood shall be forgiven them.
Deut. So shall thou put away the innocent blood from the midst of thee when thou shall do that which is right in the eyes of Jehovah.
Deut. When thou go forth to battle against thine enemies,  Jehovah thy God delivers them into thy hands,  thou carry them away captive,
Deut. and see among the captives a beautiful woman,  thou have a desire for her,  would take her to thee to wife,
Deut. then thou shall bring her home to thy house. And she shall shave her head,  pare her nails,
Deut. and she shall put the raiment of her captivity from off her,  shall remain in thy house,  bewail her father and her mother a full month. And after that thou shall go in to her,  be her husband,  she shall be thy wife.
Deut. And it shall be, if thou have no delight in her, then thou shall let her go where she will,  thou shall not sell her at all for money. Thou shall not deal with her harshly, because thou have humbled her.
Deut. If a man has two wives, the one beloved,  the other regarded inferior,  they have borne him sons, both the beloved and the one regarded inferior,  if the firstborn son be hers who was regarded inferior,
Deut. then it shall be, in the day that he causes his sons to inherit that which he has, that he may not make the son of the beloved the firstborn before the son of the one regarded inferior, who is the firstborn.
Deut. But he shall acknowledge the firstborn, the son of the one regarded inferior, by giving him a double portion of all that he has, for he is the beginning of his strength. The right of the firstborn is his.
Deut. If a man has a stubborn and rebellious son, who will not obey the voice of his father, or the voice of his mother, , though they chasten him, will not hearken to them,
Deut. then his father and his mother shall lay hold on him,  bring him out to the elders of his city,  to the gate of his place.
Deut. And they shall say to the elders of his city, This our son is stubborn and rebellious, he will not obey our voice. He is a glutton,  a drunkard.
Deut. And all the men of his city shall stone him to death with stones. So thou shall put away the evil from the midst of thee,  all Israel shall hear,  fear.
Deut. And if a man has committed a sin worthy of death,  he be put to death,  thou hang him on a tree,
Deut. his body shall not remain all night upon the tree,  thou shall surely bury him the same day, for he who is hanged is accursed of God, that thou not defile thy land which Jehovah thy God gives thee for an inheritance.
Deut. Thou shall not see thy brother's ox or his sheep go astray,  hide thyself from them. Thou shall surely bring them again to thy brother.
Deut. And if thy brother be not near to thee, or if thou do not know him, then thou shall bring it home to thy house,  it shall be with thee until thy brother seeks after it,  thou shall restore it to him.
