Deut. And so shall thou do with his donkey,  so shall thou do with his garment,  so shall thou do with every lost thing of thy brother's, which he has lost,  thou have found. Thou may not hide thyself.
Deut. Thou shall not see thy brother's donkey or his ox fallen down by the way,  hide thyself from them. Thou shall surely help him to lift them up again.
Deut. A woman shall not wear that which pertains to a man, neither shall a man put on a woman's garment, for whoever does these things is an abomination to Jehovah thy God.
Deut. If a bird's nest chance to be before thee in the way, in any tree or on the ground, with young ones or eggs,  the dam sitting upon the young or upon the eggs, thou shall not take the dam with the young.
Deut. Thou shall surely let the dam go,  the young thou may take to thyself, that it may be well with thee,  that thou may prolong thy days.
Deut. When thou build a new house, then thou shall make a guard rail for thy roof, that thou not bring blood upon thy house, if any man falls from there.
Deut. Thou shall not sow thy vineyard with two kinds of seed, lest the whole fruit be forfeited: the seed which thou have sown,  the increase of the vineyard.
Deut. Thou shall not plow with an ox and a donkey together.
Deut. Thou shall not wear a mingled stuff, wool and linen together.
Deut. Thou shall make for thee hems upon the four borders of thy clothing, with which thou cover thyself.
Deut. If any man takes a wife,  goes in to her,  dislikes her,
Deut. and charges her with shameful things,  brings up an evil name upon her,  says, I took this woman,  when I came near to her, I did not find in her the tokens of virginity,
Deut. then the father of the damsel,  her mother, shall take and bring forth the tokens of the damsel's virginity to the elders of the city in the gate.
Deut. And the damsel's father shall say to the elders, I gave my daughter to this man to wife,  he dislikes her.
Deut. And, lo, he has charged her with shameful things, saying, I did not find in thy daughter the tokens of virginity,  yet these are the tokens of my daughter's virginity. And they shall spread the garment before the elders of the city.
Deut. And the elders of that city shall take the man and chastise him,
Deut. and they shall fine him a hundred shekels of silver,  give them to the father of the damsel, because he has brought up an evil name upon a virgin of Israel,  she shall be his wife. He may not put her away all his days.
Deut. But if this thing be true, that the tokens of virginity were not found in the damsel,
Deut. then they shall bring the damsel out to the door of her father's house,  the men of her city shall stone her to death with stones, because she has wrought folly in Israel, to play the harlot in her father's house. So shall thou put away the evil from the midst of thee.
Deut. If a man be found lying with a woman married to a husband, then they shall both of them die, the man that lay with the woman,  the woman. So shall thou put away the evil from Israel.
Deut. If there be a damsel who is a virgin betrothed to a husband,  a man finds her in the city,  lies with her,
Deut. then ye shall bring them both out to the gate of that city. And ye shall stone them to death with stones, the damsel, because she did not cry out, being in the city,  the man, because he has humbled his neighbor's wife. So thou shall put away the evil from the midst of thee.
Deut. But if the man finds the damsel who is betrothed in the field,  the man forces her,  lies with her, then only the man who lay with her shall die,
Deut. but to the damsel thou shall do nothing. There is in the damsel no sin worthy of death. For as when a man rises against his neighbor,  kills him, even so is this matter,
Deut. for he found her in the field, the betrothed damsel cried out,  there was none to save her.
Deut. If a man finds a damsel who is a virgin, who is not betrothed,  lays hold on her,  lies with her,  they be found,
Deut. then the man who lay with her shall give to the damsel's father fifty shekels of silver,  she shall be his wife, because he has humbled her. He may not put her away all his days.
Deut. A man shall not take his father's wife,  shall not uncover his father's skirt.
Deut. He who is wounded in the testicles, or has his private part cut off, shall not enter into the assembly of Jehovah.
Deut. A bastard shall not enter into the assembly of Jehovah, even to the tenth generation none of his shall enter into the assembly of Jehovah.
Deut. An Ammonite or a Moabite shall not enter into the assembly of Jehovah, even to the tenth generation none belonging to them shall enter into the assembly of Jehovah forever,
Deut. because they met you not with bread and with water on the way, when ye came forth out of Egypt,  because they hired against thee Balaam the son of Beor from Pethor of Mesopotamia, to curse thee.
Deut. Nevertheless Jehovah thy God would not hearken to Balaam,  Jehovah thy God turned the curse into a blessing to thee, because Jehovah thy God loved thee.
Deut. Thou shall not seek their peace nor their prosperity all thy days forever.
Deut. Thou shall not abhor an Edomite, for he is thy brother. Thou shall not abhor an Egyptian, because thou were a sojourner in his land.
Deut. The sons of the third generation who are born to them shall enter into the assembly of Jehovah.
Deut. When the army goes forth against thine enemies, then thou shall keep thee from every evil thing.
Deut. If there be among you any man, who is not clean by reason of an accident by night, then he shall go abroad out of the camp. He shall not come inside the camp.
Deut. But it shall be, when evening comes on, he shall bathe himself in water,  when the sun is down, he shall come inside the camp.
Deut. Thou shall have a place also outside the camp, where thou shall go forth abroad.
Deut. And thou shall have a paddle among thy weapons,  it shall be, when thou sit down abroad, thou shall dig with it,  shall turn back and cover that which comes from thee.
Deut. For Jehovah thy God walks in the midst of thy camp, to deliver thee,  to give up thine enemies before thee. Therefore thy camp shall be holy, that he may not see an unclean thing in thee,  turn away from thee.
Deut. Thou shall not deliver to his master a servant who is escaped from his master to thee.
Deut. He shall dwell with thee, in the midst of thee, in the place which he shall choose within one of thy gates, where it pleases him best. Thou shall not oppress him.
Deut. There shall be no prostitute of the daughters of Israel, neither shall there be a sodomite of the sons of Israel.
Deut. Thou shall not bring the hire of a harlot, or the wages of a dog, into the house of Jehovah thy God for any vow, for even both these are an abomination to Jehovah thy God.
Deut. Thou shall not lend upon interest to thy brother: interest of money, interest of food, interest of anything that is lent upon interest.
Deut. To a foreigner thou may lend upon interest,  to thy brother thou shall not lend upon interest, that Jehovah thy God may bless thee in all that thou put thy hand to, in the land where thou go in to possess it.
Deut. When thou shall vow a vow to Jehovah thy God, thou shall not be slack to pay it. For Jehovah thy God will surely require it of thee,  it would be sin in thee.
Deut. But if thou shall forbear to vow, it shall be no sin in thee.
Deut. That which has gone out of thy lips thou shall observe and do, according as thou have vowed to Jehovah thy God, a freewill offering, which thou have promised with thy mouth.
Deut. When thou come into thy neighbor's vineyard, then thou may eat thy fill of grapes at thine own pleasure,  thou shall not put any in thy vessel.
Deut. When thou come into thy neighbor's standing grain, then thou may pluck the ears with thy hand,  thou shall not move a sickle to thy neighbor's standing grain.
Deut. When a man takes a wife,  marries her, then it shall be, if she finds no favor in his eyes, because he has found some unseemly thing in her, that he shall write her a bill of divorcement,  give it in her hand,  send her out of his house.
Deut. And when she has departed out of his house, she may go and be another man's.
Deut. And if the latter husband dislikes her,  writes her a bill of divorcement,  gives it in her hand,  sends her out of his house, or if the latter husband dies, who took her to be his wife,
Deut. her former husband, who sent her away, may not take her again to be his wife after she is defiled. For that is abomination before Jehovah,  thou shall not cause the land to sin, which Jehovah thy God gives thee for an inheritance.
Deut. When a man takes a new wife, he shall not go out in the army, neither shall he be charged with any business. He shall be free at home one year,  shall cheer his wife whom he has taken.
Deut. No man shall take the mill or the upper millstone to pledge, for he takes life to pledge.
Deut. If a man is found stealing any of his brothers of the sons of Israel,  he deals with him harshly, or sells him, then that thief shall die. So shall thou put away the evil from the midst of thee.
Deut. Take heed in the disease of leprosy, that thou observe diligently,  do according to all that the priests the Levites shall teach you. As I commanded them, so ye shall observe to do.
Deut. Remember what Jehovah thy God did to Miriam by the way as ye came forth out of Egypt.
Deut. When thou do lend thy neighbor any manner of loan, thou shall not go into his house to fetch his pledge.
Deut. Thou shall stand outside,  the man to whom thou lend shall bring forth the pledge outside to thee.
Deut. And if he is a poor man, thou shall not sleep with his pledge.
Deut. Thou shall surely restore to him the pledge when the sun goes down, that he may sleep in his garment,  bless thee. And it shall be righteousness to thee before Jehovah thy God.
Deut. Thou shall not oppress a hired servant who is poor and needy, whether he be of thy brothers, or of thy sojourners that are in thy land within thy gates.
Deut. Thou shall give him his hire in his day, neither shall the sun go down upon it, for he is poor,  sets his heart upon it, lest he cry against thee to Jehovah,  it be sin to thee.
Deut. The fathers shall not be put to death for the sons, neither shall the sons be put to death for the fathers. Every man shall be put to death for his own sin.
Deut. Thou shall not distort the justice due to the sojourner, or to the fatherless, nor take the widow's raiment to pledge,
Deut. but thou shall remember that thou were a bondman in Egypt,  Jehovah thy God redeemed thee from there. Therefore I command thee to do this thing.
Deut. When thou reap thy harvest in thy field,  have forgotten a sheaf in the field, thou shall not go again to fetch it. It shall be for the sojourner, for the fatherless,  for the widow, that Jehovah thy God may bless thee in all the work of thy hands.
Deut. When thou beat thine olive tree, thou shall not go over the boughs again. It shall be for the sojourner, for the fatherless,  for the widow.
Deut. When thou gather of thy vineyard, thou shall not glean it behind thee. It shall be for the sojourner, for the fatherless,  for the widow.
Deut. And thou shall remember that thou were a bondman in the land of Egypt. Therefore I command thee to do this thing.
Deut. If there be a controversy between men,  they come to judgment,  they judge them, then they shall justify the righteous,  condemn the iniquitous.
Deut. And it shall be, if the iniquitous man is deserving to be beaten, that the judge shall cause him to lie down,  to be beaten before his face, according to his iniquity, by number.
Deut. He may give him forty stripes. He shall not exceed, lest, if he should exceed,  beat him above these with many stripes, then thy brother should seem debased to thee.
Deut. Thou shall not muzzle the ox when he treads out the grain.
Deut. If brothers dwell together,  one of them dies,  has no son, the wife of the dead man shall not be married outside to a stranger. Her husband's brother shall go in to her,  take her to him to wife,  perform the duty of a husband's brother to her.
Deut. And it shall be, that the firstborn who she bears shall succeed in the name of his brother who is dead, that his name be not blotted out of Israel.
Deut. And if the man does not want to take his brother's wife, then his brother's wife shall go up to the gate to the elders,  say, My husband's brother refuses to raise up to his brother a name in Israel. He will not perform the duty of a husband's brother to me.
Deut. Then the elders of his city shall call him,  speak to him. And if he stands,  says, I do not want to take her,
Deut. then his brother's wife shall come to him in the presence of the elders,  loose his shoe from off his foot,  spit in his face. And she shall answer and say, So shall it be done to the man who does not build up his brother's house.
Deut. And his name shall be called in Israel, The house of him who has his shoe loosed.
Deut. When men strive together one with another,  the wife of the one draws near to deliver her husband out of the hand of him who smites him,  puts forth her hand,  takes him by the privates,
Deut. then thou shall cut off her hand. Thine eye shall have no pity.
Deut. Thou shall not have in thy bag diverse weights, a great and a small.
Deut. Thou shall not have in thy house diverse measures, a great and a small.
Deut. A perfect and just weight thou shall have, a perfect and just measure thou shall have, that thy days may be long in the land which Jehovah thy God gives thee.
Deut. For all who do such things, even all who do unrighteously, are an abomination to Jehovah thy God.
Deut. Remember what Amalek did to thee by the way as ye came forth out of Egypt,
Deut. how he met thee by the way,  smote the hindmost of thee, all who were feeble behind thee, when thou were faint and weary,  he feared not God.
Deut. Therefore it shall be, when Jehovah thy God has given thee rest from all thine enemies round about, in the land which Jehovah thy God gives thee for an inheritance to possess it, that thou shall blot out the remembrance of Amalek from under heaven. Thou shall not forget.
Deut. And it shall be, when thou have come in to the land which Jehovah thy God gives thee for an inheritance,  possess it,  dwell in it,
Deut. that thou shall take of the first of all the fruit of the ground, which thou shall bring in from thy land that Jehovah thy God gives thee,  thou shall put it in a basket,  shall go to the place which Jehovah thy God shall choose to cause his name to dwell there.
Deut. And thou shall come to the priest who shall be in those days,  say to him, I profess this day to Jehovah thy God, that I have come to the land which Jehovah swore to our fathers to give us.
Deut. And the priest shall take the basket out of thy hand,  set it down before the altar of Jehovah thy God.
Deut. And thou shall answer and say before Jehovah thy God, My father was a Syrian ready to perish,  he went down into Egypt,  sojourned there, few in number. And he became there a nation, great, mighty,  populous.
Deut. And the Egyptians dealt ill with us,  afflicted us,  laid upon us hard bondage.
Deut. And we cried to Jehovah, the God of our fathers,  Jehovah heard our voice,  saw our affliction,  our toil,  our oppression.
Deut. And Jehovah brought us forth out of Egypt with a mighty hand,  with an outstretched arm,  with great terribleness,  with signs,  with wonders.
Deut. And he has brought us into this place,  has given us this land, a land flowing with milk and honey.
Deut. And now, behold, I have brought the first of the fruit of the ground, which thou, O Jehovah, have given me. And thou shall set it down before Jehovah thy God,  worship before Jehovah thy God.
Deut. And thou shall rejoice in all the good which Jehovah thy God has given to thee,  to thy house, thou,  the Levite,  the sojourner who is in the midst of thee.
Deut. When thou have made an end of tithing all the tithe of thine increase in the third year, which is the year of tithing, then thou shall give it to the Levite, to the sojourner, to the fatherless,  to the widow, that they may eat within thy gates,  be filled.
Deut. And thou shall say before Jehovah thy God, I have put away the hallowed things out of my house,  also have given them to the Levite,  to the sojourner, to the fatherless,  to the widow, according to all thy commandment which thou have commanded me. I have not transgressed any of thy commandments, neither have I forgotten them.
Deut. I have not eaten of it in my mourning, neither have I put away from it, being unclean, nor given of it for the dead. I have hearkened to the voice of Jehovah my God. I have done according to all that thou have commanded me.
Deut. Look down from thy holy habitation, from heaven,  bless thy people Israel,  the ground which thou have given us, as thou swore to our fathers, a land flowing with milk and honey.
Deut. This day Jehovah thy God commands thee to do these statutes and ordinances. Thou shall therefore keep and do them with all thy heart,  with all thy soul.
Deut. Thou have avouched Jehovah this day to be thy God,  that thou would walk in his ways,  keep his statutes,  his commandments,  his ordinances,  hearken to his voice.
Deut. And Jehovah has avouched thee this day to be a people for his own possession, as he has promised thee,  that thou should keep all his commandments,
Deut. and to make thee high above all nations that he has made, in praise,  in name,  in honor,  that thou may be a holy people to Jehovah thy God, as he has spoken.
Deut. And Moses and the elders of Israel commanded the people, saying, Keep all the commandment which I command you this day.
Deut. And it shall be on the day when ye shall pass over the Jordan to the land which Jehovah thy God gives thee, that thou shall set up for thee great stones,  plaster them with plaster.
Deut. And thou shall write upon them all the words of this law when thou have passed over, that thou may go in to the land which Jehovah thy God gives thee, a land flowing with milk and honey, as Jehovah, the God of thy fathers, has promised thee.
Deut. And it shall be, when ye have passed over the Jordan, that ye shall set up these stones, which I command you this day, in mount Ebal,  thou shall plaster them with plaster.
Deut. And there thou shall build an altar to Jehovah thy God, an altar of stones. Thou shall lift up no iron upon them.
Deut. Thou shall build the altar of Jehovah thy God of unhewn stones. And thou shall offer burnt offerings on it to Jehovah thy God.
Deut. And thou shall sacrifice peace offerings,  shall eat there,  thou shall rejoice before Jehovah thy God.
Deut. And thou shall write upon the stones all the words of this law very plainly.
Deut. And Moses and the priests the Levites spoke to all Israel, saying, Keep silence,  hearken, O Israel. This day thou have become the people of Jehovah thy God.
Deut. Thou shall therefore obey the voice of Jehovah thy God,  do his commandments and his statutes, which I command thee this day.
Deut. And Moses charged the people the same day, saying,
Deut. These shall stand upon mount Gerizim to bless the people, when ye have passed over the Jordan: Simeon,  Levi,  Judah,  Issachar,  Joseph,  Benjamin.
Deut. And these shall stand upon mount Ebal for the curse: Reuben, Gad,  Asher,  Zebulun, Dan,  Naphtali.
Deut. And the Levites shall answer,  say to all the men of Israel with a loud voice,
Deut. Cursed be the man who makes a graven or molten image, an abomination to Jehovah, the work of the hands of the craftsman,  sets it up in secret. And all the people shall answer and say, Truly.
Deut. Cursed be he who dishonors his father or his mother. And all the people shall say, Truly.
Deut. Cursed be he who removes his neighbor's landmark. And all the people shall say, Truly.
Deut. Cursed be he who makes the blind to wander out of the way. And all the people shall say, Truly.
Deut. Cursed be he who distorts the justice to the sojourner, fatherless,  widow. And all the people shall say, Truly.
Deut. Cursed be he who lies with his father's wife, because he has uncovered his father's skirt. And all the people shall say, Truly.
Deut. Cursed be he who lies with any manner of beast. And all the people shall say, Truly.
Deut. Cursed be he who lies with his sister, the daughter of his father, or the daughter of his mother. And all the people shall say, Truly.
Deut. Cursed be he who lies with his mother-in-law. And all the people shall say, Truly.
Deut. Cursed be he who smites his neighbor in secret. And all the people shall say, Truly.
Deut. Cursed be he who takes a bribe to kill an innocent man. And all the people shall say, Truly.
Deut. Cursed is every man who does not continue in all the words of this law to do them. And all the people shall say, Truly.
Deut. And it shall come to pass, if thou shall hearken diligently to the voice of Jehovah thy God, to observe to do all his commandments which I command thee this day, that Jehovah thy God will set thee on high above all the nations of the earth,
Deut. and all these blessings shall come upon thee,  overtake thee, if thou shall hearken to the voice of Jehovah thy God:
Deut. Blessed shall thou be in the city,  blessed shall thou be in the field.
Deut. Blessed shall be the fruit of thy body,  the fruit of thy ground,  the fruit of thy beasts, the increase of thy cattle,  the young of thy flock.
Deut. Blessed shall be thy basket and thy kneading-trough.
Deut. Blessed shall thou be when thou come in,  blessed shall thou be when thou go out.
Deut. Jehovah will cause thine enemies that rise up against thee to be smitten before thee. They shall come out against thee one way,  shall flee before thee seven ways.
Deut. Jehovah will command the blessing upon thee in thy barns,  in all that thou put thy hand to. And he will bless thee in the land which Jehovah thy God gives thee.
Deut. Jehovah will establish thee for a holy people to himself, as he has sworn to thee, if thou shall keep the commandments of Jehovah thy God,  walk in his ways.
Deut. And all the peoples of the earth shall see that thou are called by the name of Jehovah,  they shall be afraid of thee.
Deut. And Jehovah will make thee plenteous for good, in the fruit of thy body,  in the fruit of thy cattle,  in the fruit of thy ground, in the land which Jehovah swore to thy fathers to give thee.
Deut. Jehovah will open to thee his good treasure the heavens, to give the rain of thy land in its season,  to bless all the work of thy hand. And thou shall lend to many nations,  thou shall not borrow.
Deut. And Jehovah will make thee the head,  not the tail. And thou shall only be above,  thou shall not be beneath, if thou shall hearken to the commandments of Jehovah thy God, which I command thee this day, to observe and to do,
Deut. and shall not turn aside from any of the words which I command you this day, to the right hand, or to the left, to go after other gods to serve them.
Deut. But it shall come to pass, if thou will not hearken to the voice of Jehovah thy God, to observe to do all his commandments and his statutes which I command thee this day, that all these curses shall come upon thee,  overtake thee:
Deut. Cursed shall thou be in the city,  cursed shall thou be in the field.
Deut. Cursed shall be thy basket and thy kneading-trough.
Deut. Cursed shall be the fruit of thy body,  the fruit of thy ground, the increase of thy cattle,  the young of thy flock.
Deut. Cursed shall thou be when thou come in,  cursed shall thou be when thou go out.
Deut. Jehovah will send upon thee cursing, discomfiture,  rebuke, in all that thou put thy hand to do, until thou be destroyed,  until thou perish quickly, because of the evil of thy doings, by which thou have forsaken me.
Deut. Jehovah will make the pestilence cling to thee, until he has consumed thee from off the land, where thou go in to possess it.
Deut. Jehovah will smite thee with consumption,  with fever,  with inflammation,  with fiery heat,  with the sword,  with blight,  with mildew. And they shall pursue thee until thou perish.
Deut. And thy sky that is over thy head shall be brass,  the earth that is under thee shall be iron.
Deut. Jehovah will make the rain of thy land powder and dust. From the sky it shall come down upon thee, until thou be destroyed.
Deut. Jehovah will cause thee to be smitten before thine enemies. Thou shall go out one way against them,  shall flee seven ways before them. And thou shall be tossed to and fro among all the kingdoms of the earth.
Deut. And thy dead body shall be food to all birds of the sky,  to the beasts of the earth,  there shall be none to frighten them away.
Deut. Jehovah will smite thee with the boil of Egypt,  with the emerods,  with the scurvy,  with the itch, of which thou cannot be healed.
Deut. Jehovah will smite thee with madness,  with blindness,  with confusion of mind,
Deut. and thou shall grope at noonday, as the blind man gropes in darkness. And thou shall not prosper in thy ways. And thou shall only be oppressed and robbed always,  there shall be none to save thee.
Deut. Thou shall betroth a wife,  another man shall lie with her. Thou shall build a house,  thou shall not dwell in it. Thou shall plant a vineyard,  shall not use the fruit of it.
Deut. Thine ox shall be slain before thine eyes,  thou shall not eat of it. Thy donkey shall be violently taken away from before thy face,  shall not be restored to thee. Thy sheep shall be given to thine enemies,  thou shall have none to save thee.
Deut. Thy sons and thy daughters shall be given to another people. And thine eyes shall look,  fail with longing for them all the day,  there shall be nothing in the power of thy hand.
Deut. The fruit of thy ground,  all thy labors, shall a nation eat up which thou know not. And thou shall only be oppressed and crushed always,
Deut. so that thou shall be mad because of the sight of thine eyes which thou shall see.
Deut. Jehovah will smite thee in the knees,  in the legs, with a sore boil, of which thou cannot be healed, from the sole of thy foot to the crown of thy head.
Deut. Jehovah will bring thee,  thy king whom thou shall set over thee, to a nation that thou have not known, thou nor thy fathers. And there thou shall serve other gods, wood and stone.
Deut. And thou shall become an astonishment, a proverb,  a byword, among all the peoples where Jehovah shall lead thee away.
Deut. Thou shall carry much seed out into the field,  shall gather little in, for the locust shall consume it.
Deut. Thou shall plant vineyards and dress them,  thou shall neither drink of the wine, nor gather, for the worm shall eat them.
Deut. Thou shall have olive trees throughout all thy borders,  thou shall not anoint thyself with the oil, for thine olive shall drop off.
Deut. Thou shall beget sons and daughters,  they shall not be thine, for they shall go into captivity.
Deut. All thy trees and the fruit of thy ground shall the locust possess.
Deut. The sojourner who is in the midst of thee shall mount up above thee higher and higher,  thou shall come down lower and lower.
Deut. He shall lend to thee,  thou shall not lend to him. He shall be the head,  thou shall be the tail.
Deut. And all these curses shall come upon thee,  shall pursue thee,  overtake thee, till thou be destroyed, because thou hearkened not to the voice of Jehovah thy God, to keep his commandments and his statutes which he commanded thee,
Deut. and they shall be upon thee for a sign and for a wonder,  upon thy seed forever.
Deut. Because thou served not Jehovah thy God with joyfulness,  with gladness of heart, by reason of the abundance of all things,
Deut. therefore thou shall serve thine enemies that Jehovah shall send against thee, in hunger,  in thirst,  in nakedness,  in want of all things. And he shall put a yoke of iron upon thy neck, until he has destroyed thee.
Deut. Jehovah will bring a nation against thee from far, from the end of the earth, as the eagle flies, a nation whose tongue thou shall not understand,
Deut. a nation of fierce countenance, that shall not regard the person of the old, nor show favor to the young,
Deut. and shall eat the fruit of thy cattle,  the fruit of thy ground, until thou be destroyed, that also shall not leave thee grain, new wine, or oil, the increase of thy cattle, or the young of thy flock, until they have caused thee to perish.
Deut. And they shall besiege thee in all thy gates, until thy high and fortified walls come down, in which thou trusted, throughout all thy land. And they shall besiege thee in all thy gates throughout all thy land, which Jehovah thy God has given thee.
Deut. And thou shall eat the fruit of thine own body, the flesh of thy sons and of thy daughters, whom Jehovah thy God has given thee, in the siege and in the distress with which thine enemies shall distress thee.
Deut. The man who is tender among you,  very delicate, his eye shall be evil toward his brother,  toward the wife of his bosom,  toward the remnant of his sons whom he has remaining,
Deut. so that he will not give to any of them of the flesh of his sons whom he shall eat, because he has nothing left to him, in the siege and in the distress with which thine enemy shall distress thee in all thy gates.
Deut. The tender and delicate woman among you, who would not adventure to set the sole of her foot upon the ground for delicateness and tenderness, her eye shall be evil toward the husband of her bosom,  toward her son,  toward her daughter,
Deut. and toward her young one who comes out from between her feet,  toward her sons whom she shall bear, for she shall eat them secretly for want of all things, in the siege and in the distress with which thine enemy shall distress thee in thy gates.
Deut. If thou will not observe to do all the words of this law that are written in this book, that thou may fear this glorious and fearful name, JEHOVAH THY GOD,
Deut. then Jehovah will make thy calamities extraordinary,  the calamities of thy seed, even great calamities and of long continuance,  severe sicknesses and of long continuance.
Deut. And he will bring upon thee again all the diseases of Egypt, which thou were afraid of,  they shall cling to thee.
Deut. Also every sickness,  every calamity, which is not written in the book of this law, them Jehovah will bring upon thee, until thou be destroyed.
Deut. And ye shall be left few in number, whereas ye were as the stars of heaven for multitude, because thou did not hearken to the voice of Jehovah thy God.
Deut. And it shall come to pass, that, as Jehovah rejoiced over you to do you good,  to multiply you, so Jehovah will rejoice over you to cause you to perish,  to destroy you. And ye shall be plucked from off the land where thou go in to possess it.
Deut. And Jehovah will scatter thee among all peoples, from the one end of the earth even to the other end of the earth. And there thou shall serve other gods, which thou have not known, thou nor thy fathers, even wood and stone.
Deut. And among these nations thou shall find no ease,  there shall be no rest for the sole of thy foot,  Jehovah will give thee there a trembling heart,  failing of eyes,  pining of soul.
Deut. And thy life shall hang in doubt before thee,  thou shall fear night and day,  shall have no assurance of thy life.
Deut. In the morning thou shall say, Would it were evening! and at evening thou shall say, Would it were morning! for the fear of thy heart which thou shall fear,  for the sight of thine eyes which thou shall see.
Deut. And Jehovah will bring thee into Egypt again with ships, by the way of which I said to thee, Thou shall see it no more again. And there ye shall sell yourselves to your enemies for bondmen and for bondwomen,  no man shall buy you.
Deut. These are the words of the covenant which Jehovah commanded Moses to make with the sons of Israel in the land of Moab, besides the covenant which he made with them in Horeb.
Deut. And Moses called to all Israel,  said to them, Ye have seen all that Jehovah did before your eyes in the land of Egypt to Pharaoh,  to all his servants,  to all his land,
Deut. the great trials which thine eyes saw, the signs,  those great wonders,
Deut. yet Jehovah has not given you a heart to know,  eyes to see,  ears to hear, to this day.
Deut. And I have led you forty years in the wilderness. Your clothes have not grown old upon you,  thy shoe has not grown old upon thy foot.
Deut. Ye have not eaten bread, neither have ye drunk wine or strong drink, that ye may know that I am Jehovah your God.
Deut. And when ye came to this place, Sihon the king of Heshbon,  Og the king of Bashan, came out against us to battle,  we smote them.
Deut. And we took their land,  gave it for an inheritance to the Reubenites,  to the Gadites,  to the half-tribe of the Manassites.
Deut. Keep therefore the words of this covenant,  do them, that ye may prosper in all that ye do.
Deut. Ye stand this day all of you before Jehovah your God-your heads, your tribes, your elders,  your officers, even all the men of Israel,
Deut. your little ones, your wives,  thy sojourner who is in the midst of thy camps, from the hewer of thy wood to the drawer of thy water-
Deut. that thou may enter into the covenant of Jehovah thy God,  into his oath, which Jehovah thy God makes with thee this day,
Deut. that he may establish thee this day to himself for a people,  that he may be to thee a God, as he spoke to thee,  as he swore to thy fathers, to Abraham, to Isaac,  to Jacob.
Deut. Neither with you only do I make this covenant and this oath,
Deut. but with him who stands here with us this day before Jehovah our God,  also with him who is not here with us this day
Deut. (for ye know how we dwelt in the land of Egypt,  how we came through the midst of the nations through which ye passed,
Deut. and ye have seen their abominations,  their idols, wood and stone, silver and gold, which were among them).
Deut. Lest there should be among you man, or woman, or family, or tribe, whose heart turns away this day from Jehovah our God, to go to serve the gods of those nations. Lest there should be among you a root that bears gall and wormwood,
Deut. and it comes to pass, when he hears the words of this curse, that he blesses himself in his heart, saying, I shall have peace, though I walk in the stubbornness of my heart, to destroy the moist with the dry.
Deut. Jehovah will not pardon him,  then the anger of Jehovah and his jealousy will smoke against that man,  all the curse that is written in this book shall lie upon him,  Jehovah will blot out his name from under heaven.
Deut. And Jehovah will set him apart to evil out of all the tribes of Israel, according to all the curses of the covenant that is written in this book of the law.
Deut. And the generation to come, your sons who shall rise up after you,  the foreigner who shall come from a far land, shall say, when they see the calamities of that land,  the sicknesses with which Jehovah has made it sick.
Deut. The whole land of it is brimstone,  salt, a burning. It is not sown, nor bears, nor any grass grows in it, like the overthrow of Sodom and Gomorrah, Admah and Zeboiim, which Jehovah overthrew in his anger,  in his wrath,
Deut. even all the nations shall say, Why has Jehovah done thus to this land? What is the meaning of the heat of this great anger?
Deut. Then men shall say, Because they forsook the covenant of Jehovah, the God of their fathers, which he made with them when he brought them forth out of the land of Egypt,
Deut. and went and served other gods,  worshiped them, gods that they knew not,  that he had not given to them.
Deut. Therefore the anger of Jehovah was kindled against this land, to bring upon it all the curse that is written in this book.
Deut. And Jehovah rooted them out of their land in anger,  in wrath,  in great indignation,  cast them into another land, as at this day.
Deut. The secret things belong to Jehovah our God,  the things that are revealed belong to us and to our sons forever, that we may do all the words of this law.
Deut. And it shall come to pass, when all these things have come upon thee, the blessing and the curse, which I have set before thee,  thou shall call them to mind among all the nations, where Jehovah thy God has driven thee,
Deut. and shall return to Jehovah thy God,  shall obey his voice according to all that I command thee this day, thou and thy sons, with all thy heart,  with all thy soul,
Deut. that then Jehovah thy God will turn thy captivity,  have compassion upon thee,  will return and gather thee from all the peoples where Jehovah thy God has scattered thee.
Deut. If any of thine outcasts be in the outermost parts of heaven, from there Jehovah thy God will gather thee,  from there he will fetch thee.
Deut. And Jehovah thy God will bring thee into the land which thy fathers possessed,  thou shall possess it,  he will do thee good,  multiply thee above thy fathers.
Deut. And Jehovah thy God will circumcise thy heart,  the heart of thy seed, to love Jehovah thy God with all thy heart,  with all thy soul, that thou may live.
Deut. And Jehovah thy God will put all these curses upon thine enemies,  on those who hate thee, who persecuted thee.
Deut. And thou shall return and obey the voice of Jehovah,  do all his commandments which I command thee this day.
Deut. And Jehovah thy God will make thee plenteous in all the work of thy hand, in the fruit of thy body,  in the fruit of thy cattle,  in the fruit of thy ground, for good. For Jehovah will again rejoice over thee for good, as he rejoiced over thy fathers,
Deut. if thou shall obey the voice of Jehovah thy God, to keep his commandments and his statutes which are written in this book of the law; if thou turn to Jehovah thy God with all thy heart,  with all thy soul.
Deut. For this commandment which I command thee this day, it is not too hard for thee, neither is it far off.
Deut. It is not in heaven, that thou should say, Who shall go up for us to heaven,  bring it to us,  make us to hear it, that we may do it?
Deut. Neither is it beyond the sea, that thou should say, Who shall go over the sea for us,  bring it to us,  make us to hear it, that we may do it?
Deut. But the word is very near to thee, in thy mouth,  in thy heart, that thou may do it.
Deut. See, I have set before thee this day life and good,  death and evil,
Deut. in that I command thee this day to love Jehovah thy God, to walk in his ways,  to keep his commandments and his statutes and his ordinances, that thou may live and multiply,  that Jehovah thy God may bless thee in the land where thou go in to possess it.
Deut. But if thy heart turns away,  thou will not hear,  shall be drawn away,  worship other gods,  serve them,
Deut. I declare to you this day, that ye shall surely perish. Ye shall not prolong your days in the land where thou pass over the Jordan to go in to possess it.
Deut. I call heaven and earth to witness against you this day, that I have set before thee life and death, the blessing and the curse. Therefore choose life, that thou may live, thou and thy seed,
Deut. to love Jehovah thy God, to obey his voice,  to cling to him, for he is thy life,  the length of thy days, that thou may dwell in the land which Jehovah swore to thy fathers, to Abraham, to Isaac,  to Jacob, to give them.
Deut. And Moses went and spoke these words to all Israel.
Deut. And he said to them, I am a hundred and twenty years old this day. I can no more go out and come in. And Jehovah has said to me, Thou shall not go over this Jordan.
Deut. Jehovah thy God, he will go over before thee. He will destroy these nations from before thee,  thou shall dispossess them. Joshua, he shall go over before thee, as Jehovah has spoken.
Deut. And Jehovah will do to them as he did to Sihon and to Og, the kings of the Amorites,  to their land, whom he destroyed.
Deut. And Jehovah will deliver them up before you,  ye shall do to them according to all the commandment which I have commanded you.
Deut. Be strong and of good courage, fear not, nor be frightened at them, for Jehovah thy God, he it is who goes with thee. He will not leave thee, nor forsake thee.
Deut. And Moses called to Joshua,  said to him in the sight of all Israel, Be strong and of good courage. For thou shall go with this people into the land which Jehovah has sworn to their fathers to give them,  thou shall cause them to inherit it.
Deut. And Jehovah, he it is who goes before thee. He will be with thee. He will not fail thee, nor forsake thee. Fear not, neither be dismayed.
Deut. And Moses wrote this law,  delivered it to the priests the sons of Levi, who bore the ark of the covenant of Jehovah,  to all the elders of Israel.
Deut. And Moses commanded them, saying, At the end of every seven years, in the set time of the year of release, in the feast of tabernacles,
Deut. when all Israel has come to appear before Jehovah thy God in the place which he shall choose, thou shall read this law before all Israel in their hearing.
Deut. Assemble the people, the men and the women and the little ones,  thy sojourner who is within thy gates, that they may hear,  that they may learn,  fear Jehovah your God,  observe to do all the words of this law,
Deut. and that their sons who have not known may hear,  learn to fear Jehovah your God as long as ye live in the land where ye go over the Jordan to possess it.
Deut. And Jehovah said to Moses, Behold, thy days approach that thou must die. Call Joshua,  present yourselves in the tent of meeting, that I may give him a command. And Moses and Joshua went,  presented themselves in the tent of meeting.
Deut. And Jehovah appeared in the tent in a pillar of cloud,  the pillar of cloud stood over the door of the tent.
Deut. And Jehovah said to Moses, Behold, thou shall sleep with thy fathers. And this people will rise up,  play the harlot after the strange gods of the land where they go to be among them,  will forsake me,  break my covenant which I have made with them.
Deut. Then my anger shall be kindled against them in that day,  I will forsake them,  I will hide my face from them,  they shall be devoured,  many evils and troubles shall come upon them, so that they will say in that day, Have not these evils come upon us because our God is not among us?
Deut. And I will surely hide my face in that day for all the evil which they shall have wrought, in that they have turned to other gods.
Deut. Now therefore write ye this song for you,  teach thou it the sons of Israel. Put it in their mouths, that this song may be a witness for me against the sons of Israel.
Deut. For when I shall have brought them into the land which I swore to their fathers, flowing with milk and honey,  they shall have eaten and filled themselves,  grown fat, then they will turn to other gods,  serve them,  despise me,  break my covenant.
Deut. And it shall come to pass, when many evils and troubles have come upon them, that this song shall testify before them as a witness, for it shall not be forgotten out of the mouths of their seed. For I know their imagination which they frame this day, before I have brought them into the land which I swore.
Deut. So Moses wrote this song the same day,  taught it to the sons of Israel.
Deut. And he gave Joshua the son of Nun a command,  said, Be strong and of good courage, for thou shall bring the sons of Israel into the land which I swore to them,  I will be with thee.
Deut. And it came to pass, when Moses had made an end of writing the words of this law in a book, until they were finished,
Deut. that Moses commanded the Levites, who bore the ark of the covenant of Jehovah, saying,
Deut. Take this book of the law,  put it by the side of the ark of the covenant of Jehovah your God, that it may be there for a witness against thee.
Deut. For I know thy rebellion,  thy stiff neck. Behold, while I am yet alive with you this day, ye have been rebellious against Jehovah,  how much more after my death?
Deut. Assemble to me all the elders of your tribes,  your officers, that I may speak these words in their ears,  call heaven and earth to witness against them.
Deut. For I know that after my death ye will utterly corrupt yourselves,  turn aside from the way which I have commanded you. And evil will befall you in the latter days, because ye will do that which is evil in the sight of Jehovah, to provoke him to anger through the work of your hands.
Deut. And Moses spoke in the ears of all the assembly of Israel the words of this song, until they were finished:
Deut. Give ear, ye heavens,  I will speak,  let the earth hear the words of my mouth.
Deut. My doctrine shall drop as the rain. My speech shall distil as the dew, as the small rain upon the tender grass,  as the showers upon the herb.
Deut. For I will proclaim the name of Jehovah. Ascribe ye greatness to our God.
Deut. The Rock, his work is perfect, for all his ways are justice, a God of faithfulness and without iniquity, just and right is he.
Deut. They have dealt corruptly with him. They are not his sons, it is their blemish, a perverse and crooked generation.
Deut. Do ye thus requite Jehovah, O foolish people and unwise? Is not he thy father who has bought thee? He has made thee,  established thee.
Deut. Remember the days of old. Consider the years of many generations. Ask thy father,  he will show thee, thine elders,  they will tell thee.
Deut. When the Most High gave to the nations their inheritance, when he separated the sons of men, he set the bounds of the peoples according to the number of the sons of Israel.
Deut. For Jehovah's portion is his people. Jacob is the lot of his inheritance.
Deut. He found him in a desert land,  in the waste howling wilderness. He compassed him about. He cared for him. He kept him as the apple of his eye.
Deut. As an eagle that stirs up her nest, that flutters over her young, he spread abroad his wings. He took them. He bore them on his pinions.
Deut. Jehovah alone led him,  there was no foreign god with him.
Deut. He made him ride on the high places of the earth,  he ate the increase of the field,  he made him to suck honey out of the rock,  oil out of the flinty rock,
Deut. butter of the herd,  milk of the flock, with fat of lambs,  rams of the breed of Bashan,  goats, with the finest of the wheat,  of the blood of the grape thou drank wine.
Deut. But Jeshurun grew fat,  kicked. Thou have grown fat. Thou have grown thick. Thou have become sleek. Then he forsook God who made him,  lightly esteemed the Rock of his salvation.
Deut. They moved him to jealousy with strange gods. With abominations they provoked him to anger.
Deut. They sacrificed to demons, not God, to gods that they knew not, to new gods that came up of late, which your fathers did not dread.
Deut. Thou are unmindful of the Rock that begot thee,  have forgotten God who gave thee birth.
Deut. And Jehovah saw,  abhorred, because of the provocation of his sons and his daughters.
Deut. And he said, I will hide my face from them. I will see what their end shall be. For they are a very perverse generation, sons in whom is no faithfulness.
Deut. They have moved me to jealousy with that which is not God. They have provoked me to anger with their vanities,  I will move them to jealousy with a non-nation. I will provoke them to anger with a foolish nation.
Deut. For a fire is kindled in my anger,  burns to the lowest Sheol,  devours the earth with its increase,  sets on fire the foundations of the mountains.
Deut. I will heap evils upon them. I will spend my arrows upon them,
Deut. to be wasted with hunger,  devoured with burning heat and bitter destruction. And I will send upon them the teeth of beasts, with the poison of crawling things of the dust.
Deut. Outside the sword shall bereave,  in the chambers terror, to both young man and virgin, the suckling with the man of gray hairs.
Deut. I said, I would scatter them afar, I would make the remembrance of them to cease from among men,
Deut. were it not that I feared the provocation of the enemy, lest their adversaries should judge amiss, lest they should say, Our hand is exalted,  Jehovah has not done all this.
Deut. For they are a nation void of counsel,  there is no understanding in them.
Deut. Oh that they were wise, that they understood this, that they would consider their latter end!
Deut. How should one chase a thousand,  two put ten thousand to flight unless their Rock had sold them,  Jehovah had delivered them up?
Deut. For their rock is not as our Rock, even our enemies themselves being judges.
Deut. For their vine is of the vine of Sodom,  of the fields of Gomorrah. Their grapes are grapes of gall, their clusters are bitter.
Deut. Their wine is the poison of serpents,  the cruel venom of asps.
Deut. Is not this laid up in store with me, sealed up among my treasures?
Deut. Vengeance is for me,  recompense at the time when their foot shall slide. For the day of their calamity is at hand,  the things that are to come upon them shall make haste.
Deut. For Jehovah will judge his people,  regrets for his servants, when he sees that their power is gone,  there is none remaining, shut up or left at large.
Deut. And he will say, Where are their gods, the rock in which they took refuge,
Deut. which ate the fat of their sacrifices,  drank the wine of their drink offering? Let them rise up and help you, let them be your protection.
Deut. See now that I, even I, am he,  there is no god with me. I kill,  I make alive. I wound,  I heal. And there is none that can deliver out of my hand.
Deut. For I lift up my hand to heaven,  say, As I live forever,
Deut. if I whet my glittering sword,  my hand takes hold on judgment, I will render vengeance to my adversaries,  will recompense those who hate me.
Deut. I will make my arrows drunk with blood,  my sword shall devour flesh, with the blood of the slain and the captives, from the head of the leaders of the enemy.
Deut. Rejoice, O ye Gentiles, with his people. For he will avenge the blood of his servants,  will render vengeance to his adversaries,  will recompense those who hate him,  will make expiation for his land, for his people.
Deut. And Moses came and spoke all the words of this song in the ears of the people, he and Joshua the son of Nun.
Deut. And Moses made an end of speaking all these words to all Israel.
Deut. And he said to them, Set your heart to all the words which I testify to you this day, which ye shall command your sons to observe to do, even all the words of this law.
Deut. For it is no vain thing for you, because it is your life,  through this thing ye shall prolong your days in the land where ye go over the Jordan to possess it.
Deut. And Jehovah spoke to Moses that selfsame day, saying,
Deut. Get thee up onto this mountain of Abarim, to mount Nebo, which is in the land of Moab, that is opposite Jericho,  behold the land of Canaan, which I give to the sons of Israel for a possession.
Deut. And die on the mount where thou go up,  be gathered to thy people, as Aaron thy brother died in mount Hor,  was gathered to his people,
Deut. because ye trespassed against me in the midst of the sons of Israel at the waters of Meribah of Kadesh, in the wilderness of Zin, because ye did not sanctify me in the midst of the sons of Israel.
Deut. For thou shall see the land before thee,  thou shall not go there into the land which I give the sons of Israel.
Deut. And this is the blessing with which Moses the man of God blessed the sons of Israel before his death.
Deut. And he said, Jehovah came from Sinai,  rose from Seir to them. He shined forth from mount Paran,  he came from the ten thousands of holy ones. At his right hand was a fiery law for them.
Deut. Yea, he loves the people. All his sanctified are in thy hand,  they sat down at thy feet. He shall receive from thy words.
Deut. Moses commanded for us a law, an inheritance for the assembly of Jacob.
Deut. And he was king in Jeshurun when the heads of the people were gathered, all the tribes of Israel together.
Deut. Let Reuben live,  not die, nor let his men be few.
Deut. And this is of Judah: And he said, Hear, Jehovah, the voice of Judah,  bring him into his people. With his hands he contended for himself,  thou shall be a help against his adversaries.
Deut. And of Levi he said, Thy Thummim and thy Urim are with thy holy man, whom thou proved at Massah, with whom thou strove at the waters of Meribah,
Deut. who said of his father,  of his mother, I have not seen him, neither did he acknowledge his brothers, nor knew he his own sons, for they have observed thy word,  keep thy covenant.
Deut. They shall teach Jacob thine ordinances,  Israel thy law. They shall put incense before thee,  whole burnt offering upon thine altar.
Deut. Bless, Jehovah, his substance,  accept the work of his hands. Smite through the loins of those who rise up against him,  of those who hate him, that they not rise again.
Deut. Of Benjamin he said, The beloved of Jehovah shall dwell in safety by him. He covers him all the day long,  he dwells between his shoulders.
Deut. And of Joseph he said, Blessed of Jehovah be his land, for the precious things of heaven, for the dew,  for the deep that couches beneath,
Deut. and for the precious things of the fruits of the sun,  for the precious things of the growth of the moons,
Deut. and for the chief things of the ancient mountains,  for the precious things of the everlasting hills,
Deut. and for the precious things of the earth and the fullness of it,  the good will of him who dwelt in the bush. Let it come upon the head of Joseph,  upon the crown of the head of him who was separate from his brothers.
Deut. The firstling of his herd, majesty is his. And his horns are the horns of the wild-ox. With them he shall push the peoples, all of them, even the ends of the earth. And they are the ten thousands of Ephraim,  they are the thousands of Manasseh.
Deut. And of Zebulun he said, Rejoice, Zebulun, in thy going out, , Issachar, in thy tents.
Deut. They shall call the peoples to the mountain. There they shall offer sacrifices of righteousness, for they shall suck the abundance of the seas,  the hidden treasures of the sand.
Deut. And of Gad he said, Blessed be he who enlarges Gad. He dwells as a lioness,  tears the arm, yea, the crown of the head.
Deut. And he provided the first part for himself, for there was the lawgiver's portion reserved. And he came with the heads of the people. He executed the righteousness of Jehovah,  his ordinances with Israel.
Deut. And of Dan he said, Dan is a lion's whelp that leaps forth from Bashan.
Deut. And of Naphtali he said, O Naphtali, satisfied with favor,  full with the blessing of Jehovah, possess thou the west and the south.
Deut. And of Asher he said, Blessed be Asher with sons. Let him be acceptable to his brothers,  let him dip his foot in oil.
Deut. Thy bars shall be iron and brass,  as thy days, so shall thy strength be.
Deut. There is none like God, O Jeshurun, who rides upon the heavens for thy help,  in his excellency on the skies.
Deut. The eternal God is thy dwelling-place,  underneath are the everlasting arms. And he thrust out the enemy from before thee,  said, Destroy.
Deut. And Israel dwells in safety, the fountain of Jacob alone, in a land of grain and new wine. Yea, his heavens drop down dew.
Deut. Happy are thou, O Israel. Who is like thee, a people saved by Jehovah, the shield of thy help,  the sword of thy excellency! And thine enemies shall submit themselves to thee,  thou shall tread upon their high places.
Deut. And Moses went up from the plains of Moab to mount Nebo, to the top of Pisgah, that is opposite Jericho. And Jehovah showed him all the land of Gilead, to Dan,
Deut. and all Naphtali,  the land of Ephraim and Manasseh,  all the land of Judah, to the farther sea,
Deut. and the South,  the Plain of the valley of Jericho the city of palm trees, to Zoar.
Deut. And Jehovah said to him, This is the land which I swore to Abraham, to Isaac,  to Jacob, saying, I will give it to thy seed. I have caused thee to see it with thine eyes,  thou shall not go over there.
Deut. So Moses the servant of Jehovah died there in the land of Moab, according to the word of Jehovah.
Deut. And he buried him in the valley in the land of Moab opposite Beth-peor,  no man knows of his sepulcher to this day.
Deut. And Moses was a hundred and twenty years old when he died. His eye was not dim, nor his natural force abated.
Deut. And the sons of Israel wept for Moses in the plains of Moab thirty days. So the days of weeping and mourning for Moses were ended.
Deut. And Joshua the son of Nun was full of the spirit of wisdom, for Moses had laid his hands upon him. And the sons of Israel hearkened to him,  did as Jehovah commanded Moses.
Deut. And there has not arisen a prophet since in Israel like Moses, whom Jehovah knew face to face,
Deut. in all the signs and the wonders, which Jehovah sent him to do in the land of Egypt, to Pharaoh,  to all his servants,  to all his land,
Deut. and in all the mighty hand,  in all the great terror, which Moses wrought in the sight of all Israel.
Joshua
Josh. Now it came to pass after the death of Moses the servant of Jehovah, that Jehovah spoke to Joshua the son of Nun, Moses' minister, saying,
Josh. Moses my servant is dead. Now therefore arise, go over this Jordan, thou,  all this people, to the land which I give to them, even to the sons of Israel.
Josh. Every place that the sole of your foot shall tread upon, to you I have given it, as I spoke to Moses.
Josh. From the wilderness,  this Lebanon, even to the great river, the river Euphrates, all the land of the Hittites,  to the great sea toward the going down of the sun, shall be your border.
Josh. There shall not any man be able to stand before thee all the days of thy life. As I was with Moses, so I will be with thee. I will not fail thee, nor forsake thee.
Josh. Be strong and of good courage, for thou shall cause this people to inherit the land which I swore to their fathers to give them.
Josh. Only be strong and very courageous to observe to do according to all the law, which Moses my servant commanded thee. Turn not from it to the right hand or to the left, that thou may have good success wherever thou go.
Josh. This book of the law shall not depart out of thy mouth,  thou shall meditate on it day and night, that thou may observe to do according to all that is written in it, for then thou shall make thy way prosperous,  then thou shall have good success.
Josh. Have I not commanded thee? Be strong and of good courage. Be not frightened, neither be thou dismayed, for Jehovah thy God is with thee wherever thou go.
Josh. Then Joshua commanded the officers of the people, saying,
Josh. Pass through the midst of the camp,  command the people, saying, Prepare food for you, for within three days ye are to pass over this Jordan to go in to possess the land, which Jehovah your God gives you to possess it.
Josh. And to the Reubenites,  to the Gadites,  to the half-tribe of Manasseh, Joshua spoke, saying,
Josh. Remember the word which Moses the servant of Jehovah commanded you, saying, Jehovah your God gives you rest,  will give you this land.
Josh. Your wives, your little ones,  your cattle, shall abide in the land which Moses gave you beyond the Jordan,  ye shall pass over before your brothers armed, all the mighty men of valor,  shall help them
Josh. until Jehovah has given your brothers rest, as you,  they also have possessed the land which Jehovah your God gives them. Then ye shall return to the land of your possession,  possess it, which Moses the servant of Jehovah gave you beyond the Jordan toward the sunrise.
Josh. And they answered Joshua, saying, All that thou have commanded us we will do,  wherever thou send us we will go.
Josh. According as we hearkened to Moses in all things, so will we hearken to thee. Only Jehovah thy God be with thee, as he was with Moses.
Josh. Whoever he is who shall rebel against thy commandment,  shall not hearken to thy words in all that thou command him, he shall be put to death. Only be strong and of good courage.
Josh. And Joshua the son of Nun sent out of Shittim two men as spies secretly, saying, Go, view the land,  Jericho. And they went and came into the house of a harlot whose name was Rahab,  lay down there.
Josh. And it was told the king of Jericho, saying, Behold, men came in here tonight of the sons of Israel to search out the land.
Josh. And the king of Jericho sent to Rahab, saying, Bring forth the men who came to thee, who have entered into thy house, for they have come to search out all the land.
Josh. And the woman took the two men,  hid them. And she said, Yes, the men came to me,  I did not know from where they were.
Josh. And it came to pass about the time of the shutting of the gate, when it was dark, that the men went out. Where the men went I know not. Pursue after them quickly, for ye will overtake them.
Josh. But she had brought them up to the roof,  hid them with the stalks of flax, which she had laid in order upon the roof.
Josh. And the men pursued after them the way to the Jordan to the fords,  as soon as those who pursued after them were gone out, they shut the gate.
Josh. And before they were laid down, she came up to them upon the roof.
Josh. And she said to the men, I know that Jehovah has given you the land,  that the fear of you has fallen upon us. And that all the inhabitants of the land melt away before you.
Josh. For we have heard how Jehovah dried up the water of the Red Sea before you when ye came out of Egypt,  what ye did to the two kings of the Amorites who were beyond the Jordan, to Sihon and to Og, whom ye utterly destroyed.
Josh. And as soon as we had heard it, our hearts melted, neither did there remain any more spirit in any man because of you, for Jehovah your God, he is God in heaven above,  on earth beneath.
Josh. Now therefore, I pray you, swear to me by Jehovah, since I have dealt kindly with you, that ye also will deal kindly with my father's house,  give me a true token,
Josh. and that ye will save alive my father,  my mother,  my brothers,  my sisters,  all that they have,  will deliver our lives from death.
Josh. And the men said to her, Our life for yours if ye do not utter this our business. And it shall be, when Jehovah gives us the land, that we will deal kindly and truly with thee.
Josh. Then she let them down by a cord through the window, for her house was upon the side of the wall,  she dwelt upon the wall.
Josh. And she said to them, Get you to the mountain lest the pursuers come upon you. And hide yourselves there three days, until the pursuers be returned,  afterward ye may go your way.
Josh. And the men said to her, We will be guiltless of this thine oath which thou have made us to swear.
Josh. Behold, when we come into the land, thou shall bind this line of scarlet cord in the window which thou let us down by. And thou shall gather to thee into the house thy father,  thy mother,  thy brothers,  all thy father's household.
Josh. And it shall be, that whoever shall go out of the doors of thy house into the street, his blood shall be upon his head,  we shall be guiltless. And whoever shall be with thee in the house, his blood shall be on our head if any hand be upon him.
Josh. But if thou utter this our business, then we shall be guiltless of thine oath which thou have made us to swear.
Josh. And she said, According to your words, so be it. And she sent them away,  they departed. And she bound the scarlet line in the window.
Josh. And they went,  came to the mountain,  abode there three days, until the pursuers were returned. And the pursuers sought them throughout all the way,  did not find them.
Josh. Then the two men returned,  descended from the mountain,  passed over,  came to Joshua the son of Nun. And they told him all that had befallen them.
Josh. And they said to Joshua, Truly Jehovah has delivered into our hands all the land,  moreover all the inhabitants of the land melt away before us.
Josh. And Joshua rose up early in the morning. And they moved from Shittim,  came to the Jordan, he and all the sons of Israel,  they lodged there before they passed over.
Josh. And it came to pass after three days, that the officers went through the midst of the camp,
Josh. and they commanded the people, saying, When ye see the ark of the covenant of Jehovah your God,  the priests the Levites bearing it, then ye shall move from your place,  go after it.
Josh. Yet there shall be a space between you and it, about two thousand cubits by measure. Do not come near to it, that ye may know the way by which ye must go, for ye have not passed this way heretofore.
Josh. And Joshua said to the people, Sanctify yourselves, for tomorrow Jehovah will do wonders among you.
Josh. And Joshua spoke to the priests, saying, Take up the ark of the covenant,  pass over before the people. And they took up the ark of the covenant,  went before the people.
Josh. And Jehovah said to Joshua, This day I will begin to magnify thee in the sight of all Israel, that they may know that, as I was with Moses, so I will be with thee.
Josh. And thou shall command the priests who bear the ark of the covenant, saying, When ye have come to the brink of the waters of the Jordan, ye shall stand still in the Jordan.
Josh. And Joshua said to the sons of Israel, Come here,  hear the words of Jehovah your God.
Josh. And Joshua said, Hereby ye shall know that the living God is among you,  that he will without fail drive out from before you the Canaanite,  the Hittite,  the Hivite,  the Perizzite,  the Girgashite,  the Amorite,  the Jebusite.
Josh. Behold, the ark of the covenant of the Lord of all the earth passes over before you into the Jordan.
Josh. Now therefore take for you twelve men out of the tribes of Israel, for every tribe a man.
Josh. And it shall come to pass, when the soles of the feet of the priests who bear the ark of Jehovah, the Lord of all the earth, shall rest in the waters of the Jordan, that the waters of the Jordan shall be cut off, even the waters that come down from above,  they shall stand in one heap.
Josh. And it came to pass, when the people moved from their tents to pass over the Jordan-the priests who bore the ark of the covenant being before the people-
Josh. and when those who bore the ark came to the Jordan,  the feet of the priests who bore the ark were dipped in the brink of the water (for the Jordan overflows all its banks all the time of harvest),
Josh. that the waters which came down from above, stood,  rose up in one heap a great way off, at Adam, the city that is beside Zarethan,  those that went down toward the sea of the Arabah, even the Salt Sea, were wholly cut off. And the people passed over right against Jericho.
Josh. And the priests who bore the ark of the covenant of Jehovah stood firm on dry ground in the midst of the Jordan,  all Israel passed over on dry ground until all the nation were passed clean over the Jordan.
Josh. And it came to pass, when all the nation were clean passed over the Jordan, that Jehovah spoke to Joshua, saying,
Josh. Take for you twelve men out of the people, a man out of every tribe,
Josh. and command ye them, saying, Take for you here out of the midst of the Jordan, out of the place where the priests' feet stood firm, twelve stones,  carry them over with you,  lay them down in the lodging-place where ye shall lodge this night.
Josh. Then Joshua called the twelve men, whom he had prepared of the sons of Israel, a man out of every tribe.
Josh. And Joshua said to them, Pass over before the ark of Jehovah your God into the midst of the Jordan,  take ye up every man of you a stone upon his shoulder, according to the number of the tribes of the sons of Israel,
Josh. that this may be a sign among you, that, when your children ask in time to come, saying, What do ye mean by these stones?
Josh. Then ye shall say to them, Because the waters of the Jordan were cut off before the ark of the covenant of Jehovah. When it passed over the Jordan, the waters of the Jordan were cut off. And these stones shall be for a memorial to the sons of Israel forever.
Josh. And the sons of Israel did so as Joshua commanded,  took up twelve stones out of the midst of the Jordan, as Jehovah spoke to Joshua, according to the number of the tribes of the sons of Israel,  they carried them over with them to the place where they lodged,  laid them down there.
Josh. And Joshua set up twelve stones in the midst of the Jordan, in the place where the feet of the priests who bore the ark of the covenant stood,  they are there to this day.
Josh. For the priests who bore the ark stood in the midst of the Jordan until everything was finished that Jehovah commanded Joshua to speak to the people, according to all that Moses commanded Joshua. And the people hastened and passed over.
Josh. And it came to pass, when all the people were clean passed over, that the ark of Jehovah passed over,  the priests, in the presence of the people.
Josh. And the sons of Reuben,  the sons of Gad,  the half-tribe of Manasseh, passed over armed before the sons of Israel, as Moses spoke to them.
Josh. About forty thousand ready armed for war passed over before Jehovah to battle, to the plains of Jericho.
Josh. On that day Jehovah magnified Joshua in the sight of all Israel,  they feared him, as they feared Moses, all the days of his life.
Josh. And Jehovah spoke to Joshua, saying,
Josh. Command the priests who bear the ark of the testimony, that they come up out of the Jordan.
Josh. Joshua therefore commanded the priests, saying, Come ye up out of the Jordan.
Josh. And it came to pass, when the priests who bore the ark of the covenant of Jehovah came up out of the midst of the Jordan,  the soles of the priests' feet were lifted up to the dry ground, that the waters of the Jordan returned to their place,  went over all its banks, as formerly.
Josh. And the people came up out of the Jordan on the tenth day of the first month,  encamped in Gilgal on the east border of Jericho.
Josh. And those twelve stones, which they took out of the Jordan, Joshua set up in Gilgal.
Josh. And he spoke to the sons of Israel, saying, When your sons shall ask their fathers in time to come, saying, What do these stones mean?
Josh. Then ye shall let your sons know, saying, Israel came over this Jordan on dry land.
Josh. For Jehovah your God dried up the waters of the Jordan from before you, until ye were passed over, as Jehovah your God did to the Red Sea, which he dried up from before us, until we were passed over,
Josh. that all the peoples of the earth may know the hand of Jehovah, that it is mighty, that ye may fear Jehovah your God forever.
Josh. And it came to pass, when all the kings of the Amorites, who were beyond the Jordan westward,  all the kings of the Canaanites, who were by the sea, heard how that Jehovah had dried up the waters of the Jordan from before the sons of Israel until we were passed over, that their heart melted, neither was there spirit in them any more, because of the sons of Israel.
Josh. At that time Jehovah said to Joshua, Make for thee knives of flint,  circumcise again the sons of Israel the second time.
Josh. And Joshua made him knives of flint,  circumcised the sons of Israel at the hill of the foreskins.
Josh. And this is the reason why Joshua circumcised: All the people who came forth out of Egypt, who were males, even all the men of war, died in the wilderness by the way after they came forth out of Egypt.
Josh. For all the people who came out were circumcised,  all the people who were born in the wilderness by the way as they came forth out of Egypt, they had not circumcised.
Josh. For the sons of Israel walked forty years in the wilderness till all the nation, even the men of war who came forth out of Egypt, were consumed, because they did not hearken to the voice of Jehovah, to whom Jehovah swore that he would not let them see the land which Jehovah swore to their fathers that he would give us, a land flowing with milk and honey.
Josh. And their sons, whom he raised up in their stead, them Joshua circumcised, for they were uncircumcised because they had not circumcised them by the way.
Josh. And it came to pass, when they had done circumcising all the nation, that they abode in their places in the camp, till they were recovered.
Josh. And Jehovah said to Joshua, This day I have rolled away the reproach of Egypt from off you. Therefore the name of that place was called Gilgal, to this day.
Josh. And the sons of Israel encamped in Gilgal. And they kept the Passover on the fourteenth day of the month at evening in the plains of Jericho.
Josh. And they ate of the produce of the land on the morrow after the Passover, unleavened cakes and parched grain, in the selfsame day.
Josh. And the manna ceased on the morrow, after they had eaten of the produce of the land. Neither had the sons of Israel manna any more,  they ate of the fruit of the land of Canaan that year.
Josh. And it came to pass, when Joshua was by Jericho, that he lifted up his eyes and looked, , behold, there stood a man opposite him with his sword drawn in his hand. And Joshua went to him,  said to him, Are thou for us, or for our adversaries?
Josh. And he said, No,  as captain of the army of Jehovah I have now come. And Joshua fell on his face to the earth,  worshiped,  said to him, What does my lord say to his servant?
Josh. And the captain of Jehovah's army said to Joshua, Put off thy shoe from off thy foot, for the place on which thou stand is holy. And Joshua did so.
Josh. Now Jericho was shut up tight because of the sons of Israel. None went out,  none came in.
Josh. And Jehovah said to Joshua, See, I have given Jericho into thy hand,  the king of it,  the mighty men of valor.
Josh. And ye shall encompass the city, all the men of war, going around the city once. Thus shall thou do six days.
Josh. And seven priests shall bear seven trumpets of rams' horns before the ark. And the seventh day ye shall encompass the city seven times,  the priests shall blow the trumpets.
Josh. And it shall be, that, when they make a long blast with the ram's horn,  when ye hear the sound of the trumpet, all the people shall shout with a great shout. And the wall of the city shall fall down flat,  the people shall go up every man straight before him.
Josh. And Joshua the son of Nun called the priests,  said to them, Take up the ark of the covenant,  let seven priests bear seven trumpets of rams' horns before the ark of Jehovah.
Josh. And they said to the people, Pass on,  encompass the city,  let the armed men pass on before the ark of Jehovah.
Josh. And it was so, that, when Joshua had spoken to the people, the seven priests bearing the seven trumpets of rams' horns before Jehovah passed on,  blew the trumpets. And the ark of the covenant of Jehovah followed them.
Josh. And the armed men went before the priests who blew the trumpets,  the rearward went behind the ark, the priests blowing the trumpets as they went.
Josh. And Joshua commanded the people, saying, Ye shall not shout, nor let your voice be heard, neither shall any word proceed out of your mouth until the day I bid you shout. Then ye shall shout.
Josh. So he caused the ark of Jehovah to encompass the city, going around it once. And they came into the camp,  lodged in the camp.
Josh. And Joshua rose early in the morning,  the priests took up the ark of Jehovah.
Josh. And the seven priests bearing the seven trumpets of rams' horns before the ark of Jehovah went on continually,  blew the trumpets. And the armed men went before them,  the rearward came behind the ark of Jehovah, the priests blowing the trumpets as they went.
Josh. And the second day they encompassed the city once,  returned into the camp. So they did six days.
Josh. And it came to pass on the seventh day, that they rose early at the dawning of the day,  encompassed the city according to the same manner seven times. Only on that day they encompassed the city seven times.
Josh. And it came to pass at the seventh time, when the priests blew the trumpets, Joshua said to the people, Shout, for Jehovah has given you the city.
Josh. And the city shall be set apart, even it and all that is in it, to Jehovah. Only Rahab the harlot shall live, she and all who are with her in the house, because she hid the messengers that we sent.
Josh. But as for you, only keep yourselves from what is set apart, lest when ye have set it apart, ye take from what is set apart. So ye would make the camp of Israel accursed,  trouble it.
Josh. But all the silver,  gold,  vessels of brass and iron, are holy to Jehovah. They shall come into the treasury of Jehovah.
Josh. So the people shouted,  the priests blew the trumpets. And it came to pass, when the people heard the sound of the trumpet, that the people shouted with a great shout,  the wall fell down flat, so that the people went up into the city, every man straight before him,  they took the city.
Josh. And they utterly destroyed all that was in the city, both man and woman, both young and old,  ox,  sheep,  donkey, with the edge of the sword.
Josh. And Joshua said to the two men who had spied out the land, Go into the harlot's house,  bring out from there the woman,  all that she has, as ye swore to her.
Josh. And the young men, the spies, went in,  brought out Rahab,  her father,  her mother,  her brothers,  all that she had. They also brought out all her kindred,  they set them outside the camp of Israel.
Josh. And they burnt the city with fire,  all that was in it. Only the silver,  the gold,  the vessels of brass and of iron, they put into the treasury of the house of Jehovah.
Josh. But Joshua saved alive Rahab the harlot,  her father's household,  all that she had. And she dwelt in the midst of Israel to this day, because she hid the messengers whom Joshua sent to spy out Jericho.
Josh. And Joshua charged them with an oath at that time, saying, Cursed be the man before Jehovah who rises up and builds this city Jericho. With the loss of his firstborn he shall lay the foundation of it,  with the loss of his youngest son he shall set up the gates of it.
Josh. So Jehovah was with Joshua,  his fame was in all the land.
Josh. But the sons of Israel committed a trespass in what was set apart. For Achan, the son of Carmi, the son of Zabdi, the son of Zerah, of the tribe of Judah, took from what was set apart,  the anger of Jehovah was kindled against the sons of Israel.
Josh. And Joshua sent men from Jericho to Ai, which is beside Beth-aven, on the east side of Bethel,  spoke to them, saying, Go up and spy out the land. And the men went up and spied out Ai.
Josh. And they returned to Joshua,  said to him, Let not all the people go up,  let about two or three thousand men go up and smite Ai. Do not make all the people to toil there, for they are but few.
Josh. So there went up there of the people about three thousand men. And they fled before the men of Ai.
Josh. And the men of Ai smote of them about thirty-six men. And they chased them from before the gate even to Shebarim,  smote them at the descent. And the hearts of the people melted,  became as water.
Josh. And Joshua tore his clothes,  fell to the earth upon his face before the ark of Jehovah until the evening, he and the elders of Israel,  they put dust upon their heads.
Josh. And Joshua said, Alas, O lord Jehovah, why have thou at all brought this people over the Jordan, to deliver us into the hand of the Amorites, to cause us to perish? Would that we had been content and dwelt beyond the Jordan!
Josh. Oh, Lord, what shall I say after Israel has turned their backs before their enemies!
