Josh. For the Canaanites and all the inhabitants of the land will hear of it,  will encompass us around,  cut off our name from the earth,  what will thou do for thy great name?
Josh. And Jehovah said to Joshua, Get thee up. Why are thou thus fallen upon thy face?
Josh. Israel has sinned. Yes, they have even transgressed my covenant which I commanded them. Yes, they have even taken from what was set apart,  have also stolen,  also dissembled. And they have even put it among their own stuff.
Josh. Therefore the sons of Israel cannot stand before their enemies. They turn their backs before their enemies because they have become accursed. I will not be with you any more unless ye destroy what was set apart from among you.
Josh. Up, sanctify the people,  say, Sanctify yourselves against tomorrow. For thus says Jehovah, the God of Israel, There is what has been set apart in the midst of thee, O Israel. Thou cannot stand before thine enemies until ye take away the devoted thing from among you.
Josh. In the morning therefore ye shall be brought near by your tribes,  it shall be, that the tribe which Jehovah takes shall come near by families,  the family which Jehovah shall take shall come near by households,  the household which Jehovah shall take shall come near man by man.
Josh. And it shall be, that he who is taken with the devoted thing shall be burnt with fire, he and all that he has, because he has transgressed the covenant of Jehovah,  because he has wrought folly in Israel.
Josh. So Joshua rose up early in the morning,  brought Israel near by their tribes,  the tribe of Judah was taken.
Josh. And he brought near the family of Judah,  he took the family of the Zerahites. And he brought near the family of the Zerahites man by man,  Zabdi was taken.
Josh. And he brought near his household man by man,  Achan, the son of Carmi, the son of Zabdi, the son of Zerah, of the tribe of Judah, was taken.
Josh. And Joshua said to Achan, My son, give, I pray thee, glory to Jehovah, the God of Israel,  make confession to him,  tell me now what thou have done. Hide it not from me.
Josh. And Achan answered Joshua,  said, Of a truth I have sinned against Jehovah, the God of Israel,  thus and thus have I done:
Josh. When I saw among the spoil a goodly Babylonian mantle,  two hundred shekels of silver,  a wedge of gold of fifty shekels weight, then I coveted them,  took them. And, behold, they are hid in the ground in the midst of my tent,  the silver under it.
Josh. So Joshua sent messengers,  they ran to the tent. And, behold, it was hid in his tent,  the silver under it.
Josh. And they took them from the midst of the tent,  brought them to Joshua,  to all the sons of Israel,  they laid them down before Jehovah.
Josh. And Joshua,  all Israel with him, took Achan the son of Zerah,  the silver,  the mantle,  the wedge of gold,  his sons,  his daughters,  his oxen,  his donkeys,  his sheep,  his tent,  all that he had,  they brought them up to the valley of Achor.
Josh. And Joshua said, Why have thou troubled us? Jehovah shall trouble thee this day. And all Israel stoned him with stones,  they burned them with fire,  stoned them with stones.
Josh. And they raised over him a great heap of stones, to this day,  Jehovah turned from the fierceness of his anger. Therefore the name of that place was called the valley of Achor to this day.
Josh. And Jehovah said to Joshua, Fear not, neither be thou dismayed. Take all the people of war with thee,  arise, go up to Ai. See, I have given into thy hand the king of Ai,  his people,  his city,  his land.
Josh. And thou shall do to Ai and its king as thou did to Jericho and its king. Only the spoil of it,  the cattle of it, ye shall take for a prey to yourselves. Set thee an ambush for the city behind it.
Josh. So Joshua arose,  all the people of war, to go up to Ai. And Joshua chose out thirty thousand men, the mighty men of valor,  sent them forth by night.
Josh. And he commanded them, saying, Behold, ye shall lie in ambush against the city, behind the city. Go not very far from the city,  be ye all ready,
Josh. and I,  all the people that are with me, will approach to the city. And it shall come to pass, when they come out against us, as at the first, that we will flee before them.
Josh. And they will come out after us, till we have drawn them away from the city, for they will say, They flee before us, as at the first. So we will flee before them.
Josh. And ye shall rise up from the ambush,  take possession of the city, for Jehovah your God will deliver it into your hand.
Josh. And it shall be, when ye have seized upon the city, that ye shall set the city on fire. According to the word of Jehovah shall ye do. See, I have commanded you.
Josh. And Joshua sent them forth,  they went to the ambushment,  abode between Bethel and Ai, on the west side of Ai,  Joshua lodged that night among the people.
Josh. And Joshua arose up early in the morning,  mustered the people,  went up, he and the elders of Israel, before the people to Ai.
Josh. And all the people, even the men of war who were with him, went up,  drew near,  came before the city,  encamped on the north side of Ai. Now there was a valley between him and Ai.
Josh. And he took about five thousand men,  set them in ambush between Bethel and Ai, on the west side of the city.
Josh. So they set the people, even all the army that was on the north of the city,  their ambushment that were on the west of the city,  Joshua went that night into the midst of the valley.
Josh. And it came to pass, when the king of Ai saw it, that they hastened and rose up early,  the men of the city went out against Israel to battle, he and all his people, at the time appointed, before the Arabah,  he did not know that there was an ambush against him behind the city.
Josh. And Joshua and all Israel made as if they were beaten before them,  fled by the way of the wilderness.
Josh. And all the people that were in the city were called together to pursue after them,  they pursued after Joshua,  were drawn away from the city.
Josh. And there was not a man left in Ai or Bethel who did not go out after Israel. And they left the city open,  pursued after Israel.
Josh. And Jehovah said to Joshua, Stretch out the javelin that is in thy hand toward Ai, for I will give it into thy hand. And Joshua stretched out the javelin that was in his hand toward the city.
Josh. And the ambush arose quickly out of their place,  they ran as soon as he had stretched out his hand,  entered into the city,  took it. And they hastened and set the city on fire.
Josh. And when the men of Ai looked behind them, they saw, , behold, the smoke of the city ascended up to heaven,  they had no power to flee this way or that way. And the people who fled to the wilderness turned back upon the pursuers.
Josh. And when Joshua and all Israel saw that the ambush had taken the city,  that the smoke of the city ascended, then they turned again,  killed the men of Ai.
Josh. And the others came forth out of the city against them, so they were in the midst of Israel, some on this side,  some on that side. And they smote them so that they let none of them remain or escape.
Josh. And they took the king of Ai alive,  brought him to Joshua.
Josh. And it came to pass, when Israel had made an end of killing all the inhabitants of Ai in the field, in the wilderness in which they pursued them,  they were all fallen by the edge of the sword until they were consumed, that all Israel returned to Ai,  smote it with the edge of the sword.
Josh. And all who fell that day, both of men and women, were twelve thousand, even all the men of Ai.
Josh. For Joshua did not draw back his hand, with which he stretched out the javelin, until he had utterly destroyed all the inhabitants of Ai.
Josh. Only the cattle and the spoil of that city Israel took for prey to themselves, according to the word of Jehovah which he commanded Joshua.
Josh. So Joshua burnt Ai,  made it a heap forever, even a desolation, to this day.
Josh. And he hanged the king of Ai on a tree until the evening. And at the going down of the sun Joshua commanded,  they took his body down from the tree,  cast it at the entrance of the gate of the city,  raised a great heap of stones on it, to this day.
Josh. Then Joshua built an altar to Jehovah, the God of Israel, in mount Ebal,
Josh. as Moses the servant of Jehovah commanded the sons of Israel, as it is written in the book of the law of Moses, an altar of unhewn stones, upon which no man had lifted up any iron. And they offered burnt offerings on it to Jehovah,  sacrificed peace offerings.
Josh. And he wrote there upon the stones a copy of the law of Moses, which he wrote, in the presence of the sons of Israel.
Josh. And all Israel,  their elders and officers,  their judges, stood on this side of the ark and on that side before the priests the Levites, who bore the ark of the covenant of Jehovah, as well the sojourner as the home born, half of them in front of mount Gerizim,  half of them in front of mount Ebal, as Moses the servant of Jehovah had commanded at the first, that they should bless the people of Israel.
Josh. And afterward he read all the words of the law, the blessing and the curse, according to all that is written in the book of the law.
Josh. There was not a word of all that Moses commanded, which Joshua did not read before all the assembly of Israel,  the women,  the little ones,  the sojourners who were among them.
Josh. And it came to pass, when all the kings who were beyond the Jordan, in the hill-country,  in the lowland,  on all the shore of the great sea in front of Lebanon-the Hittite,  the Amorite, the Canaanite, the Perizzite, the Hivite,  the Jebusite-heard of it,
Josh. that they gathered themselves together to fight with Joshua and with Israel with one accord.
Josh. But when the inhabitants of Gibeon heard what Joshua had done to Jericho and to Ai,
Josh. they also worked shrewdly,  went and made as if they had been ambassadors,  took old sacks upon their donkeys,  wine-skins, old and torn and bound up,
Josh. and old and patched shoes upon their feet,  old garments upon them,  all the bread of their provision was dry and became moldy.
Josh. And they went to Joshua to the camp at Gilgal,  said to him,  to the men of Israel, We have come from a far country, now therefore make ye a covenant with us.
Josh. And the men of Israel said to the Hivites, Perhaps ye dwell among us,  how shall we make a covenant with you?
Josh. And they said to Joshua, We are thy servants. And Joshua said to them, Who are ye,  from where do ye come?
Josh. And they said to him, From a very far country. Thy servants have come because of the name of Jehovah thy God, for we have heard the fame of him,  all that he did in Egypt,
Josh. and all that he did to the two kings of the Amorites who were beyond the Jordan, to Sihon king of Heshbon,  to Og king of Bashan, who was at Ashtaroth.
Josh. And our elders and all the inhabitants of our country spoke to us, saying, Take provision in your hand for the journey,  go to meet them,  say to them, We are your servants,  now make ye a covenant with us.
Josh. This our bread we took hot for our provision out of our houses on the day we came forth to go to you,  now, behold, it is dry,  has become moldy.
Josh. And these wine-skins, which we filled, were new, , behold, they are torn. And these our garments and our shoes have become old by reason of the very long journey.
Josh. And the men took of their provision,  did not ask counsel at the mouth of Jehovah.
Josh. And Joshua made peace with them,  made a covenant with them to let them live,  the rulers of the congregation swore to them.
Josh. And it came to pass at the end of three days after they had made a covenant with them, that they heard that they were their neighbors,  that they dwelt among them.
Josh. And the sons of Israel journeyed,  came to their cities on the third day. Now their cities were Gibeon,  Chephirah,  Beeroth,  Kiriath-jearim.
Josh. And the sons of Israel did not smite them, because the rulers of the congregation had sworn to them by Jehovah, the God of Israel. And all the congregation murmured against the rulers.
Josh. But all the rulers said to all the congregation, We have sworn to them by Jehovah, the God of Israel, now therefore we may not touch them.
Josh. This we will do to them,  let them live, lest wrath be upon us because of the oath which we swore to them.
Josh. And the rulers said to them, Let them live. So they became hewers of wood and drawers of water to all the congregation, as the rulers had spoken to them.
Josh. And Joshua called for them,  he spoke to them, saying, Why have ye beguiled us, saying, We are very far from you, when ye dwell among us?
Josh. Now therefore ye are cursed,  there shall never fail to be bondmen of you, both hewers of wood and drawers of water for the house of my God.
Josh. And they answered Joshua,  said, Because it was certainly told thy servants, how that Jehovah thy God commanded his servant Moses to give you all the land,  to destroy all the inhabitants of the land from before you. Therefore we were very afraid for our lives because of you,  have done this thing.
Josh. And now, behold, we are in thy hand. As it seems good and right to thee to do to us, do.
Josh. And so he did to them,  delivered them out of the hand of the sons of Israel, that they did not kill them.
Josh. And Joshua made them that day hewers of wood and drawers of water for the congregation,  for the altar of Jehovah to this day in the place which he should choose.
Josh. Now it came to pass, when Adoni-zedek king of Jerusalem heard how Joshua had taken Ai,  had utterly destroyed it, as he had done to Jericho and its king, so he had done to Ai and its king,  how the inhabitants of Gibeon had made peace with Israel,  were among them,
Josh. that they feared greatly, because Gibeon was a great city, as one of the royal cities,  because it was greater than Ai,  all the men of it were mighty.
Josh. Therefore Adoni-zedek king of Jerusalem sent to Hoham king of Hebron,  to Piram king of Jarmuth,  to Japhia king of Lachish,  to Debir king of Eglon, saying,
Josh. Come up to me,  help me,  let us smite Gibeon, for it has made peace with Joshua and with the sons of Israel.
Josh. Therefore the five kings of the Amorites, the king of Jerusalem, the king of Hebron, the king of Jarmuth, the king of Lachish, the king of Eglon, gathered themselves together,  went up, they and all their armies,  encamped against Gibeon,  made war against it.
Josh. And the men of Gibeon sent to Joshua to the camp to Gilgal, saying, Slack not thy hand from thy servants. Come up to us quickly,  save us,  help us, for all the kings of the Amorites who dwell in the hill-country are gathered together against us.
Josh. So Joshua went up from Gilgal, he,  all the people of war with him,  all the mighty men of valor.
Josh. And Jehovah said to Joshua, Fear them not, for I have delivered them into thy hands. There shall not a man of them stand before thee.
Josh. Joshua therefore came upon them suddenly, for he went up from Gilgal all the night.
Josh. And Jehovah discomfited them before Israel,  he killed them with a great slaughter at Gibeon,  chased them by the way of the ascent of Beth-horon,  smote them to Azekah,  to Makkedah.
Josh. And it came to pass, as they fled from before Israel, while they were at the descent of Beth-horon, that Jehovah cast down great stones from heaven upon them to Azekah,  they died. More died with the hailstones than those whom the sons of Israel killed with the sword.
Josh. Then Joshua spoke to Jehovah in the day when Jehovah delivered up the Amorites before the sons of Israel. And he said in the sight of Israel, Sun, stand thou still upon Gibeon,  thou, Moon, in the valley of Aijalon.
Josh. And the sun stood still,  the moon stayed, until the nation had avenged themselves of their enemies. Is not this written in the book of Jashar? And the sun stayed in the midst of heaven,  hastened not to go down about a whole day.
Josh. And there was no day like that before it or after it, that Jehovah hearkened to the voice of a man, for Jehovah fought for Israel.
Josh. And Joshua returned,  all Israel with him, to the camp at Gilgal.
Josh. And these five kings fled,  hid themselves in the cave at Makkedah.
Josh. And it was told Joshua, saying, The five kings are found hidden in the cave at Makkedah.
Josh. And Joshua said, Roll great stones to the mouth of the cave,  set men by it to keep them,
Josh. but stay ye not. Pursue after your enemies,  smite the hindmost of them. Do not allow them to enter into their cities, for Jehovah your God has delivered them into your hand.
Josh. And it came to pass, when Joshua and the sons of Israel had made an end of killing them with a very great slaughter, till they were consumed,  the remnant which remained of them had entered into the fortified cities,
Josh. that all the people returned to the camp to Joshua at Makkedah in peace. No man moved his tongue against any of the sons of Israel.
Josh. Then Joshua said, Open the mouth of the cave,  bring forth those five kings to me out of the cave.
Josh. And they did so,  brought forth those five kings to him out of the cave, the king of Jerusalem, the king of Hebron, the king of Jarmuth, the king of Lachish, the king of Eglon.
Josh. And it came to pass, when they brought forth those kings to Joshua, that Joshua called for all the men of Israel,  said to the chiefs of the men of war who went with him, Come near, put your feet upon the necks of these kings. And they came near,  put their feet upon the necks of them.
Josh. And Joshua said to them, Fear not, nor be dismayed. Be strong and of good courage, for thus shall Jehovah do to all your enemies against whom ye fight.
Josh. And afterward Joshua smote them,  put them to death,  hanged them on five trees. And they were hanging upon the trees until the evening.
Josh. And it came to pass at the time of the going down of the sun, that Joshua commanded,  they took them down off the trees,  cast them into the cave in which they had hidden themselves,  laid great stones on the mouth of the cave, to this very day.
Josh. And Joshua took Makkedah on that day,  smote it with the edge of the sword,  the king of it. He utterly destroyed them and all the souls that were in it. He left none remaining,  he did to the king of Makkedah as he had done to the king of Jericho.
Josh. And Joshua passed from Makkedah,  all Israel with him, to Libnah,  fought against Libnah.
Josh. And Jehovah delivered it also,  the king of it, into the hand of Israel. And he smote it with the edge of the sword,  all the souls that were in it. He left none remaining in it,  he did to the king of it as he had done to the king of Jericho.
Josh. And Joshua passed from Libnah,  all Israel with him, to Lachish,  encamped against it,  fought against it.
Josh. And Jehovah delivered Lachish into the hand of Israel. And he took it on the second day,  smote it with the edge of the sword,  all the souls that were in it, according to all that he had done to Libnah.
Josh. Then Horam king of Gezer came up to help Lachish. And Joshua smote him and his people until he had left him none remaining.
Josh. And Joshua passed from Lachish,  all Israel with him, to Eglon. And they encamped against it,  fought against it.
Josh. And they took it on that day,  smote it with the edge of the sword. And all the souls that were in it he utterly destroyed that day, according to all that he had done to Lachish.
Josh. And Joshua went up from Eglon,  all Israel with him, to Hebron. And they fought against it,
Josh. and they took it,  smote it with the edge of the sword,  the king of it,  all the cities of it,  all the souls that were in it. He left none remaining, according to all that he had done to Eglon,  he utterly destroyed it,  all the souls that were in it.
Josh. And Joshua returned,  all Israel with him, to Debir,  fought against it.
Josh. And he took it,  the king of it,  all the cities of it. And they smote them with the edge of the sword,  utterly destroyed all the souls that were in it. He left none remaining. As he had done to Hebron, so he did to Debir,  to the king of it, as he had done also to Libnah,  to the king of it.
Josh. So Joshua smote all the land, the hill-country,  the South,  the lowland,  the slopes,  all their kings. He left none remaining,  he utterly destroyed all that breathed, as Jehovah, the God of Israel, commanded.
Josh. And Joshua smote them from Kadesh-barnea even to Gaza,  all the country of Goshen, even to Gibeon.
Josh. And all these kings and their land Joshua took at one time, because Jehovah, the God of Israel, fought for Israel.
Josh. And Joshua returned,  all Israel with him, to the camp to Gilgal.
Josh. And it came to pass, when Jabin king of Hazor heard of it, that he sent to Jobab king of Madon,  to the king of Shimron,  to the king of Achshaph,
Josh. and to the kings who were on the north, in the hill-country,  in the Arabah south of Chinneroth,  in the lowland,  in the heights of Dor on the west,
Josh. to the Canaanite on the east and on the west,  the Amorite,  the Hittite,  the Perizzite,  the Jebusite in the hill-country,  the Hivite under Hermon in the land of Mizpah,
Josh. and they went out, they and all their armies with them, much people, even as the sand that is upon the sea-shore in multitude, with horses and chariots, very many.
Josh. And all these kings met together. And they came and encamped together at the waters of Merom, to fight with Israel.
Josh. And Jehovah said to Joshua, Be not afraid because of them, for tomorrow at this time I will deliver them up all slain before Israel. Thou shall hock their horses,  burn their chariots with fire.
Josh. So Joshua came,  all the people of war with him, against them by the waters of Merom suddenly,  fell upon them.
Josh. And Jehovah delivered them into the hand of Israel,  they smote them,  chased them to great Sidon,  to Misrephoth-maim,  to the valley of Mizpeh eastward. And they smote them until they left them none remaining.
Josh. And Joshua did to them as Jehovah bade him. He hocked their horses,  burnt their chariots with fire.
Josh. And Joshua turned back at that time,  took Hazor,  smote the king of it with the sword, for Hazor was formerly the head of all those kingdoms.
Josh. And they smote all the souls who were in it with the edge of the sword, utterly destroying them. There was none left that breathed,  he burnt Hazor with fire.
Josh. And all the cities of those kings,  all the kings of them, Joshua took,  he smote them with the edge of the sword,  utterly destroyed them, as Moses the servant of Jehovah commanded.
Josh. But as for the cities that stood on their mounds, Israel burned none of them, except only Hazor. Joshua burned that.
Josh. And all the spoil of these cities,  the cattle, the sons of Israel took for a prey to themselves,  every man they smote with the edge of the sword until they had destroyed them, neither did they leave any who breathed.
Josh. As Jehovah commanded Moses his servant, so Moses commanded Joshua,  so Joshua did. He left nothing undone of all that Jehovah commanded Moses.
Josh. So Joshua took all that land, the hill-country,  all the South,  all the land of Goshen,  the lowland,  the Arabah,  the hill-country of Israel,  the lowland of the same,
Josh. from mount Halak, that goes up to Seir, even to Baal-gad in the valley of Lebanon under mount Hermon. And he took all their kings,  smote them,  put them to death.
Josh. Joshua made war a long time with all those kings.
Josh. There was not a city that made peace with the sons of Israel, except the Hivites the inhabitants of Gibeon. They took all in battle.
Josh. For it was of Jehovah to harden their hearts, to come against Israel in battle, that he might utterly destroy them, that they might have no favor,  that he might destroy them as Jehovah commanded Moses.
Josh. And Joshua came at that time,  cut off the Anakim from the hill-country, from Hebron, from Debir, from Anab,  from all the hill-country of Judah,  from all the hill-country of Israel. Joshua utterly destroyed them with their cities.
Josh. There was none of the Anakim left in the land of the sons of Israel. Only in Gaza, in Gath,  in Ashdod some remained.
Josh. So Joshua took the whole land, according to all that Jehovah spoke to Moses. And Joshua gave it for an inheritance to Israel according to their divisions by their tribes. And the land had rest from war.
Josh. Now these are the kings of the land, whom the sons of Israel smote,  possessed their land beyond the Jordan toward the sunrise, from the valley of the Arnon to mount Hermon,  all the Arabah eastward:
Josh. Sihon king of the Amorites, who dwelt in Heshbon,  ruled from Aroer, which is on the edge of the valley of the Arnon,  the middle of the valley,  half Gilead, even to the river Jabbok, the border of the sons of Ammon,
Josh. and the Arabah to the sea of Chinneroth, eastward,  to the sea of the Arabah, even the Salt Sea, eastward, the way to Beth-jeshimoth,  on the south, under the slopes of Pisgah,
Josh. and the border of Og king of Bashan, of the remnant of the Rephaim, who dwelt at Ashtaroth and at Edrei,
Josh. and ruled in mount Hermon,  in Salecah,  in all Bashan, to the border of the Geshurites and the Maacathites,  half Gilead, the border of Sihon king of Heshbon.
Josh. Moses the servant of Jehovah and the sons of Israel smote them. And Moses the servant of Jehovah gave it for a possession to the Reubenites,  the Gadites,  the half-tribe of Manasseh.
Josh. And these are the kings of the land whom Joshua and the sons of Israel smote beyond the Jordan westward, from Baal-gad in the valley of Lebanon even to mount Halak, that goes up to Seir,  Joshua gave it to the tribes of Israel for a possession according to their divisions,
Josh. in the hill-country,  in the lowland,  in the Arabah,  in the slopes,  in the wilderness,  in the South, the Hittite, the Amorite,  the Canaanite, the Perizzite, the Hivite,  the Jebusite:
Josh. The king of Jericho, one; the king of Ai, which is beside Bethel, one;
Josh. the king of Jerusalem, one; the king of Hebron, one;
Josh. the king of Jarmuth, one; the king of Lachish, one;
Josh. the king of Eglon, one; the king of Gezer, one;
Josh. the king of Debir, one; the king of Geder, one;
Josh. the king of Hormah, one; the king of Arad, one;
Josh. the king of Libnah, one; the king of Adullam, one;
Josh. the king of Makkedah, one; the king of Bethel, one;
Josh. the king of Tappuah, one; the king of Hepher, one;
Josh. the king of Aphek, one; the king of Lassharon, one;
Josh. the king of Madon, one; the king of Hazor, one;
Josh. the king of Shimron-meron, one; the king of Achshaph, one;
Josh. the king of Taanach, one; the king of Megiddo, one;
Josh. the king of Kedesh, one; the king of Jokneam in Carmel, one;
Josh. the king of Dor in the height of Dor, one; the king of Goiim in Gilgal, one;
Josh. the king of Tirzah, one: all the kings thirty-one.
Josh. Now Joshua was old and well stricken in years,  Jehovah said to him, Thou are old and well stricken in years,  there remains yet very much land to be possessed.
Josh. This is the land that yet remains: all the regions of the Philistines,  all the Geshurites;
Josh. from the Shihor, which is before Egypt, even to the border of Ekron northward, which is reckoned to the Canaanites; the five lords of the Philistines; the Gazites,  the Ashdodites, the Ashkelonites, the Gittites,  the Ekronites; also the Avvim
Josh. on the south; all the land of the Canaanites,  Mearah that belongs to the Sidonians, to Aphek, to the border of the Amorites;
Josh. and the land of the Gebalites,  all Lebanon, toward the sunrise, from Baal-gad under mount Hermon to the entrance of Hamath;
Josh. all the inhabitants of the hill-country from Lebanon to Misrephoth-maim, even all the Sidonians. I will drive them out from before the sons of Israel, only allot thou it to Israel for an inheritance as I have commanded thee.
Josh. Now therefore divide this land for an inheritance to the nine tribes,  the half-tribe of Manasseh.
Josh. With him the Reubenites and the Gadites received their inheritance, which Moses gave them, beyond the Jordan eastward, even as Moses the servant of Jehovah gave them:
Josh. from Aroer, that is on the edge of the valley of the Arnon,  the city that is in the middle of the valley,  all the plain of Medeba to Dibon;
Josh. and all the cities of Sihon king of the Amorites, who reigned in Heshbon, to the border of the sons of Ammon;
Josh. and Gilead,  the border of the Geshurites and Maacathites,  all mount Hermon,  all Bashan to Salecah;
Josh. all the kingdom of Og in Bashan, who reigned in Ashtaroth and in Edrei (the same was left of the remnant of the Rephaim), for these Moses smote,  drove them out.
Josh. Nevertheless the sons of Israel did not drive out the Geshurites, nor the Maacathites,  Geshur and Maacath dwell in the midst of Israel to this day.
Josh. Only to the tribe of Levi he gave no inheritance. The offerings of Jehovah, the God of Israel, made by fire are his inheritance as he spoke to him.
Josh. And Moses gave to the tribe of the sons of Reuben according to their families.
Josh. And their border was from Aroer, that is on the edge of the valley of the Arnon,  the city that is in the middle of the valley,  all the plain by Medeba;
Josh. Heshbon,  all its cities that are in the plain; Dibon,  Bamoth-baal,  Beth-baal-meon,
Josh. and Jahaz,  Kedemoth,  Mephaath,
Josh. and Kiriathaim,  Sibmah,  Zereth-shahar in the mount of the valley,
Josh. and Beth-peor,  the slopes of Pisgah,  Beth-jeshimoth,
Josh. and all the cities of the plain,  all the kingdom of Sihon king of the Amorites who reigned in Heshbon, whom Moses smote with the chiefs of Midian, Evi,  Rekem,  Zur,  Hur,  Reba, the rulers of Sihon who dwelt in the land.
Josh. The sons of Israel also killed Balaam the son of Beor, the diviner, with the sword among the rest of their slain.
Josh. And the border of the sons of Reuben was the Jordan,  the border of it. This was the inheritance of the sons of Reuben according to their families, the cities and the villages of it.
Josh. And Moses gave to the tribe of Gad, to the sons of Gad, according to their families.
Josh. And their border was Jazer,  all the cities of Gilead,  half the land of the sons of Ammon, to Aroer that is before Rabbah,
Josh. and from Heshbon to Ramath-mizpeh,  Betonim,  from Mahanaim to the border of Debir,
Josh. and in the valley, Beth-haram,  Beth-nimrah,  Succoth,  Zaphon, the rest of the kingdom of Sihon king of Heshbon, the Jordan and the border of it, to the outermost part of the sea of Chinnereth beyond the Jordan eastward.
Josh. This is the inheritance of the sons of Gad according to their families, the cities and the villages of it.
Josh. And Moses gave to the half-tribe of Manasseh,  it was for the half-tribe of the sons of Manasseh according to their families.
Josh. And their border was from Mahanaim, all Bashan, all the kingdom of Og king of Bashan,  all the towns of Jair, which are in Bashan, sixty cities.
Josh. And half Gilead,  Ashtaroth,  Edrei, the cities of the kingdom of Og in Bashan, were for the sons of Machir the son of Manasseh, even for the half of the sons of Machir according to their families.
Josh. These are the inheritances which Moses distributed in the plains of Moab, beyond the Jordan at Jericho, eastward.
Josh. But to the tribe of Levi Moses gave no inheritance. Jehovah, the God of Israel, is their inheritance, as he spoke to them.
Josh. And these are the inheritances which the sons of Israel took in the land of Canaan, which Eleazar the priest,  Joshua the son of Nun,  the heads of the fathers of the tribes of the sons of Israel, distributed to them,
Josh. by the lot of their inheritance, as Jehovah commanded by Moses, for the nine tribes,  for the half-tribe.
Josh. For Moses had given the inheritance of the two tribes and the half-tribe beyond the Jordan,  to the Levites he gave no inheritance among them.
Josh. For the sons of Joseph were two tribes, Manasseh and Ephraim. And they gave no portion to the Levites in the land except cities to dwell in with the suburbs of it for their cattle and for their substance.
Josh. As Jehovah commanded Moses, so the sons of Israel did,  they divided the land.
Josh. Then the sons of Judah drew near to Joshua in Gilgal. And Caleb the son of Jephunneh the Kenizzite said to him, Thou know the thing that Jehovah spoke to Moses the man of God concerning me and concerning thee in Kadesh-barnea.
Josh. I was forty years old when Moses the servant of Jehovah sent me from Kadesh-barnea to spy out the land,  I brought him word again as it was in my heart.
Josh. Nevertheless my brothers who went up with me made the heart of the people melt,  I wholly followed Jehovah my God.
Josh. And Moses swore on that day, saying, Surely the land in which thy foot has trodden shall be an inheritance to thee and to thy sons forever because thou have wholly followed Jehovah my God.
Josh. And now, behold, Jehovah has kept me alive, as he spoke, these forty-five years, from the time that Jehovah spoke this word to Moses, while Israel walked in the wilderness. And now, lo, I am this day eighty-five years old.
Josh. As yet I am as strong this day as I was in the day that Moses sent me. As my strength was then, even so is my strength now, for war,  to go out and to come in.
Josh. Now therefore give me this hill-country of which Jehovah spoke in that day. For thou heard in that day how the Anakim were there,  cities great and fortified. It may be that Jehovah will be with me,  I shall drive them out, as Jehovah spoke.
Josh. And Joshua blessed him,  he gave Hebron to Caleb the son of Jephunneh for an inheritance.
Josh. Therefore Hebron became the inheritance of Caleb the son of Jephunneh the Kenizzite to this day because he wholly followed Jehovah, the God of Israel.
Josh. Now the name of Hebron was formerly Kiriath-arba. Arba was the greatest man among the Anakim. And the land had rest from war.
Josh. And the lot for the tribe of the sons of Judah according to their families was to the border of Edom, even to the wilderness of Zin southward, at the outermost part of the south.
Josh. And their south border was from the outermost part of the Salt Sea, from the bay that looks southward.
Josh. And it went out southward of the ascent of Akrabbim,  passed along to Zin,  went up by the south of Kadesh-barnea,  passed along by Hezron,  went up to Addar,  turned about to Karka,
Josh. and it passed along to Azmon,  went out at the brook of Egypt. And the goings out of the border were at the sea. This shall be your south border.
Josh. And the east border was the Salt Sea, even to the end of the Jordan. And the border of the north quarter was from the bay of the sea at the end of the Jordan,
Josh. and the border went up to Beth-hoglah,  passed along by the north of Beth-arabah,  the border went up to the stone of Bohan the son of Reuben,
Josh. and the border went up to Debir from the valley of Achor,  so northward, looking toward Gilgal, that is opposite the ascent of Adummim, which is on the south side of the river,  the border passed along to the waters of En-shemesh. And the goings out of it were at En-rogel,
Josh. and the border went up by the valley of the son of Hinnom to the side of the Jebusite southward (the same is Jerusalem),  the border went up to the top of the mountain that lies before the valley of Hinnom westward, which is at the outermost part of the vale of Rephaim northward,
Josh. and the border extended from the top of the mountain to the fountain of the waters of Nephtoah,  went out to the cities of mount Ephron,  the border extended to Baalah (the same is Kiriath-jearim),
Josh. and the border turned about from Baalah westward to mount Seir,  passed along to the side of mount Jearim on the north (the same is Chesalon),  went down to Beth-shemesh,  passed along by Timnah,
Josh. and the border went out to the side of Ekron northward,  the border extended to Shikkeron,  passed along to mount Baalah,  went out at Jabneel. And the goings out of the border were at the sea.
Josh. And the west border was to the great sea,  the border of it. This is the border of the sons of Judah round about according to their families.
Josh. And to Caleb the son of Jephunneh he gave a portion among the sons of Judah, according to the commandment of Jehovah to Joshua, even Kiriath-arba. Arba was the father of Anak (the same is Hebron).
Josh. And Caleb drove out from there the three sons of Anak: Sheshai,  Ahiman,  Talmai, the sons of Anak.
Josh. And he went up from there against the inhabitants of Debir. Now the name of Debir formerly was Kiriath-sepher.
Josh. And Caleb said, He who smites Kiriath-sepher,  takes it, to him I will give Achsah my daughter to wife.
Josh. And Othniel the son of Kenaz, the brother of Caleb, took it,  he gave him Achsah his daughter to wife.
Josh. And it came to pass, when she came, that she moved him to ask of her father a field. And she alighted from off her donkey,  Caleb said, What would thou?
Josh. And she said, Give me a blessing, because thou have set me in the land of the South, give me also springs of water. And he gave her the upper springs and the nether springs.
Josh. This is the inheritance of the tribe of the sons of Judah according to their families.
Josh. And the outermost cities of the tribe of the sons of Judah toward the border of Edom in the South were thus: Kabzeel,  Eder,  Jagur,
Josh. and Kinah,  Dimonah,  Adadah,
Josh. and Kedesh,  Hazor,  Ithnan,
Josh. Ziph,  Telem,  Bealoth,
Josh. and Hazor-hadattah,  Kerioth-hezron (the same is Hazor),
Josh. Amam,  Shema,  Moladah,
Josh. and Hazar-gaddah,  Heshmon,  Beth-pelet,
Josh. and Hazar-shual,  Beersheba,  Biziothiah,
Josh. Baalah,  Iim,  Ezem,
Josh. and Eltolad,  Chesil,  Hormah,
Josh. and Ziklag,  Madmannah,  Sansannah,
Josh. and Lebaoth,  Shilhim,  Ain,  Rimmon. All the cities are twenty-nine, with their villages.
Josh. In the lowland, Eshtaol,  Zorah,  Ashnah,
Josh. and Zanoah,  En-gannim, Tappuah,  Enam,
Josh. Jarmuth,  Adullam, Socoh,  Azekah,
Josh. and Shaaraim,  Adithaim,  Gederah,  Gederothaim; fourteen cities with their villages.
Josh. Zenan,  Hadashah,  Migdal-gad,
Josh. and Dilean,  Mizpeh,  Joktheel,
Josh. Lachish,  Bozkath,  Eglon,
Josh. and Cabbon,  Lahmam,  Chitlish,
Josh. and Gederoth, Beth-dagon,  Naamah,  Makkedah; sixteen cities with their villages.
Josh. Libnah,  Ether,  Ashan,
Josh. and Iphtah,  Ashnah,  Nezib,
Josh. and Keilah,  Achzib,  Mareshah; nine cities with their villages.
Josh. Ekron, with its towns and its villages,
Josh. from Ekron even to the sea, all that were by the side of Ashdod, with their villages.
Josh. Ashdod, its towns and its villages, Gaza, its towns and its villages, to the brook of Egypt,  the great sea,  the border of it.
Josh. And in the hill-country, Shamir,  Jattir,  Socoh,
Josh. and Dannah,  Kiriath-sannah (the same is Debir),
Josh. and Anab,  Eshtemoh,  Anim,
Josh. and Goshen,  Holon,  Giloh; eleven cities with their villages.
Josh. Arab,  Dumah,  Eshan,
Josh. and Janim,  Beth-tappuah,  Aphekah,
Josh. and Humtah,  Kiriath-arba (the same is Hebron),  Zior; nine cities with their villages.
Josh. Maon, Carmel,  Ziph,  Jutah,
Josh. and Jezreel,  Jokdeam,  Zanoah,
Josh. Kain, Gibeah,  Timnah; ten cities with their villages.
Josh. Halhul, Beth-zur,  Gedor,
Josh. and Maarath,  Beth-anoth,  Eltekon; six cities with their villages.
Josh. Kiriath-baal (the same is Kiriath-jearim),  Rabbah; two cities with their villages.
Josh. In the wilderness, Beth-arabah, Middin,  Secacah,
Josh. and Nibshan,  the City of Salt,  En-gedi; six cities with their villages.
Josh. And as for the Jebusites, the inhabitants of Jerusalem, the sons of Judah could not drive them out,  the Jebusites dwell with the sons of Judah at Jerusalem to this day.
Josh. And the lot came out for the sons of Joseph from the Jordan at Jericho, at the waters of Jericho on the east, even the wilderness, going up from Jericho through the hill-country to Bethel.
Josh. And it went out from Bethel to Luz,  passed along to the border of the Archites to Ataroth,
Josh. and it went down westward to the border of the Japhletites, to the border of Beth-horon the nether, even to Gezer. And the goings out of it were at the sea.
Josh. And the sons of Joseph, Manasseh and Ephraim, took their inheritance.
Josh. And the border of the sons of Ephraim according to their families was thus: the border of their inheritance eastward was Ataroth-addar, to Beth-horon the upper,
Josh. and the border went out westward at Michmethath on the north,  the border turned about eastward to Taanath-shiloh,  passed along it on the east of Janoah,
Josh. and it went down from Janoah to Ataroth,  to Naarah,  reached to Jericho,  went out at the Jordan.
Josh. From Tappuah the border went along westward to the brook of Kanah. And the goings out of it were at the sea. This is the inheritance of the tribe of the sons of Ephraim according to their families,
Josh. together with the cities which were set apart for the sons of Ephraim in the midst of the inheritance of the sons of Manasseh, all the cities with their villages.
Josh. And they did not drive out the Canaanites who dwelt in Gezer,  the Canaanites dwell in the midst of Ephraim to this day,  have become servants to do task work.
Josh. And this was the lot for the tribe of Manasseh, for he was the firstborn of Joseph. As for Machir the firstborn of Manasseh, the father of Gilead, because he was a man of war, therefore he had Gilead and Bashan.
Josh. So it was for the rest of the sons of Manasseh according to their families: for the sons of Abiezer,  for the sons of Helek,  for the sons of Asriel,  for the sons of Shechem,  for the sons of Hepher,  for the sons of Shemida. These were the male children of Manasseh the son of Joseph according to their families.
Josh. But Zelophehad, the son of Hepher, the son of Gilead, the son of Machir, the son of Manasseh, had no sons,  daughters. And these are the names of his daughters: Mahlah,  Noah, Hoglah, Milcah,  Tirzah.
Josh. And they came near before Eleazar the priest,  before Joshua the son of Nun,  before the rulers, saying, Jehovah commanded Moses to give us an inheritance among our brothers. Therefore according to the commandment of Jehovah he gave them an inheritance among the brothers of their father.
Josh. And there fell ten parts to Manasseh, besides the land of Gilead and Bashan, which is beyond the Jordan,
Josh. because the daughters of Manasseh had an inheritance among his sons. And the land of Gilead belonged to the rest of the sons of Manasseh.
Josh. And the border of Manasseh was from Asher to Michmethath, which is before Shechem. And the border went along to the right hand, to the inhabitants of En-tappuah.
Josh. The land of Tappuah belonged to Manasseh,  Tappuah on the border of Manasseh belonged to the sons of Ephraim.
Josh. And the border went down to the brook of Kanah, southward of the brook. These cities belonged to Ephraim among the cities of Manasseh. And the border of Manasseh was on the north side of the brook. And the goings out of it were at the sea.
Josh. Southward it was Ephraim's,  northward it was Manasseh's,  the sea was his border,  they reached to Asher on the north,  to Issachar on the east.
Josh. And Manasseh had in Issachar and in Asher, Beth-shean and its towns,  Ibleam and its towns,  the inhabitants of Dor and its towns,  the inhabitants of Endor and its towns,  the inhabitants of Taanach and its towns,  the inhabitants of Megiddo and its towns, even the three heights.
Josh. Yet the sons of Manasseh could not drive out those cities,  the Canaanites would dwell in that land.
Josh. And it came to pass, when the sons of Israel grew strong, that they put the Canaanites to task work,  did not utterly drive them out.
Josh. And the sons of Joseph spoke to Joshua, saying, Why have thou given me but one lot and one part for an inheritance, seeing I am a great people, inasmuch as until now Jehovah has blessed me?
Josh. And Joshua said to them, If thou be a great people, get thee up to the forest,  cut down for thyself there in the land of the Perizzites and of the Rephaim, since the hill-country of Ephraim is too narrow for thee.
Josh. And the sons of Joseph said, The hill-country is not enough for us,  all the Canaanites who dwell in the land of the valley have chariots of iron, both those who are in Beth-shean and its towns,  those who are in the valley of Jezreel.
Josh. And Joshua spoke to the house of Joseph, even to Ephraim and to Manasseh, saying, Thou are a great people,  have great power. Thou shall not have only one lot,
Josh. but the hill-country shall be thine, for though it is a forest, thou shall cut it down,  the goings out of it shall be thine. For thou shall drive out the Canaanites, though they have chariots of iron,  though they are strong.
Josh. And the whole congregation of the sons of Israel assembled themselves together at Shiloh,  set up the tent of meeting there,  the land was subdued before them.
Josh. And seven tribes remained among the sons of Israel, which had not yet divided their inheritance.
Josh. And Joshua said to the sons of Israel, How long are ye slack to go in to possess the land, which Jehovah, the God of your fathers, has given you?
Josh. Appoint for you three men of each tribe. And I will send them,  they shall arise,  walk through the land,  describe it according to their inheritance,  they shall come to me.
Josh. And they shall divide it into seven portions: Judah shall abide in his border on the south,  the house of Joseph shall abide in their border on the north.
Josh. And ye shall describe the land into seven portions,  bring it here to me. And I will cast lots for you here before Jehovah our God.
Josh. For the Levites have no portion among you, for the priesthood of Jehovah is their inheritance,  Gad and Reuben and the half-tribe of Manasseh have received their inheritance beyond the Jordan eastward, which Moses the servant of Jehovah gave them.
Josh. And the men arose,  went. And Joshua charged those who went to describe the land, saying, Go and walk through the land,  describe it,  come again to me. And I will cast lots for you here before Jehovah in Shiloh.
Josh. And the men went and passed through the land,  described it by cities into seven portions in a book. And they came to Joshua to the camp at Shiloh.
Josh. And Joshua cast lots for them in Shiloh before Jehovah. And there Joshua divided the land to the sons of Israel according to their divisions.
Josh. And the lot of the tribe of the sons of Benjamin came up according to their families,  the border of their lot went out between the sons of Judah and the sons of Joseph.
Josh. And their border on the north quarter was from the Jordan,  the border went up to the side of Jericho on the north,  went up through the hill-country westward. And the goings out of it were at the wilderness of Beth-aven.
Josh. And the border passed along from there to Luz, to the side of Luz (the same is Bethel), southward,  the border went down to Ataroth-addar, by the mountain that lies on the south of Beth-horon the nether.
Josh. And the border extended,  turned around on the west quarter southward, from the mountain that lies before Beth-horon southward. And the goings out of it were at Kiriath-baal (the same is Kiriath-jearim), a city of the sons of Judah. This was the west quarter.
Josh. And the south quarter was from the uttermost part of Kiriath-jearim,  the border went out westward,  went out to the fountain of the waters of Nephtoah,
Josh. and the border went down to the uttermost part of the mountain that lies before the valley of the son of Hinnom, which is in the vale of Rephaim northward,  it went down to the valley of Hinnom, to the side of the Jebusite southward,  went down to En-rogel,
Josh. and it extended northward,  went out at En-shemesh,  went out to Geliloth, which is opposite the ascent of Adummim,  it went down to the stone of Bohan the son of Reuben,
Josh. and it passed along to the side opposite the Arabah northward,  went down to the Arabah,
Josh. and the border passed along to the side of Beth-hoglah northward. And the goings out of the border were at the north bay of the Salt Sea, at the south end of the Jordan. This was the south border.
Josh. And the Jordan was the border of it on the east quarter. This was the inheritance of the sons of Benjamin, by the borders of it round about, according to their families.
Josh. Now the cities of the tribe of the sons of Benjamin according to their families were: Jericho,  Beth-hoglah,  Emek-keziz,
Josh. and Beth-arabah,  Zemaraim,  Bethel,
Josh. and Avvim,  Parah,  Ophrah,
Josh. and Chephar-ammoni,  Ophni,  Geba; twelve cities with their villages.
Josh. Gibeon,  Ramah,  Beeroth,
Josh. and Mizpeh,  Chephirah,  Mozah,
Josh. and Rekem,  Irpeel,  Taralah,
Josh. and Zelah, Eleph,  the Jebusite (the same is Jerusalem), Gibeath,  Kiriath; fourteen cities with their villages. This is the inheritance of the sons of Benjamin according to their families.
Josh. And the second lot came out for Simeon, even for the tribe of the sons of Simeon according to their families. And their inheritance was in the midst of the inheritance of the sons of Judah.
Josh. And they had for their inheritance Beersheba, or Sheba,  Moladah,
Josh. and Hazar-shual,  Balah,  Ezem,
Josh. and Eltolad,  Bethul,  Hormah,
Josh. and Ziklag,  Beth-marcaboth,  Hazar-susah,
Josh. and Beth-lebaoth,  Sharuhen; thirteen cities with their villages.
Josh. Ain, Rimmon,  Ether,  Ashan; four cities with their villages;
Josh. and all the villages that were round about these cities to Baalath-beer, Ramah of the South. This is the inheritance of the tribe of the sons of Simeon according to their families.
Josh. The inheritance of the sons of Simeon was out of the part of the sons of Judah, for the portion of the sons of Judah was too much for them. Therefore the sons of Simeon had inheritance in the midst of their inheritance.
Josh. And the third lot came up for the sons of Zebulun according to their families. And the border of their inheritance was to Sarid,
Josh. and their border went up westward, even to Maralah,  reached to Dabbesheth,  it reached to the brook that is before Jokneam,
Josh. and it turned from Sarid eastward toward the sunrising to the border of Chisloth-tabor,  it went out to Daberath,  went up to Japhia.
Josh. And from there it passed along eastward to Gath-hepher, to Eth-kazin,  it went out at Rimmon which stretches to Neah,
Josh. and the border turned about it on the north to Hannathon. And the goings out of it were at the valley of Iph-tah-el,
Josh. and Kattath,  Nahalal,  Shimron,  Idalah,  Bethlehem; twelve cities with their villages.
Josh. This is the inheritance of the sons of Zebulun according to their families, these cities with their villages.
Josh. The fourth lot came out for Issachar, even for the sons of Issachar according to their families.
Josh. And their border was to Jezreel,  Chesulloth,  Shunem,
Josh. and Hapharaim,  Shion,  Anaharath,
Josh. and Rabbith,  Kishion,  Ebez,
Josh. and Remeth,  Engannim,  En-haddah,  Beth-pazzez,
Josh. and the border reached to Tabor,  Shahazumah,  Beth-shemesh. And the goings out of their border were at the Jordan; sixteen cities with their villages.
Josh. This is the inheritance of the tribe of the sons of Issachar according to their families, the cities with their villages.
Josh. And the fifth lot came out for the tribe of the sons of Asher according to their families.
Josh. And their border was Helkath,  Hali,  Beten,  Achshaph,
Josh. and Allammelech,  Amad,  Mishal,  it reached to Carmel westward,  to Shihor-libnath,
Josh. and it turned toward the sunrising to Beth-dagon,  reached to Zebulun,  to the valley of Iph-tah-el northward to Beth-emek and Neiel,  it went out to Cabul on the left hand,
Josh. and Ebron,  Rehob,  Hammon,  Kanah, even to great Sidon,
Josh. and the border turned to Ramah,  to the fortified city of Tyre,  the border turned to Hosah. And the goings out of it were at the sea by the region of Achzib,
Josh. also Ummah,  Aphek,  Rehob; twenty-two cities with their villages.
Josh. This is the inheritance of the tribe of the sons of Asher according to their families, these cities with their villages.
Josh. The sixth lot came out for the sons of Naphtali, even for the sons of Naphtali according to their families.
Josh. And their border was from Heleph, from the oak in Zaanannim,  Adam-inekeb,  Jabneel, to Lakkum. And the goings out of it were at the Jordan.
Josh. And the border turned westward to Aznoth-tabor,  went out from there to Hukkok,  it reached to Zebulun on the south,  reached to Asher on the west,  to Judah at the Jordan toward the sunrising.
Josh. And the fortified cities were Ziddim, Zer,  Hammath, Rakkath,  Chinnereth,
Josh. and Adamah,  Ramah,  Hazor,
Josh. and Kedesh,  Edrei,  En-hazor,
Josh. and Iron,  Migdal-el, Horem,  Beth-anath,  Beth-shemesh; nineteen cities with their villages.
Josh. This is the inheritance of the tribe of the sons of Naphtali according to their families, the cities with their villages.
Josh. The seventh lot came out for the tribe of the sons of Dan according to their families.
Josh. And the border of their inheritance was Zorah,  Eshtaol,  Ir-shemesh,
Josh. and Shaalabbin,  Aijalon,  Ithlah,
Josh. and Elon,  Timnah,  Ekron,
Josh. and Eltekeh,  Gibbethon,  Baalath,
Josh. and Jehud,  Bene-berak,  Gath-rimmon,
Josh. and Me-jarkon,  Rakkon, with the border opposite Joppa.
Josh. And the border of the sons of Dan went out beyond them, for the sons of Dan went up and fought against Leshem,  took it,  smote it with the edge of the sword,  possessed it,  dwelt in it,  called Leshem, Dan, after the name of Dan their father.
Josh. This is the inheritance of the tribe of the sons of Dan according to their families, these cities with their villages.
Josh. So they made an end of distributing the land for inheritance by the borders of it. And the sons of Israel gave an inheritance to Joshua the son of Nun in the midst of them.
Josh. According to the commandment of Jehovah they gave him the city which he asked, even Timnath-serah in the hill-country of Ephraim. And he built the city,  dwelt in it.
Josh. These are the inheritances, which Eleazar the priest,  Joshua the son of Nun,  the heads of the fathers of the tribes of the sons of Israel, distributed for inheritance by lot in Shiloh before Jehovah, at the door of the tent of meeting. So they made an end of dividing the land.
Josh. And Jehovah spoke to Joshua, saying,
Josh. Speak to the sons of Israel, saying, Assign for you the cities of refuge, of which I spoke to you by Moses,
Josh. that the manslayer who kills any soul unwittingly and unawares may flee there. And they shall be to you for a refuge from the avenger of blood.
Josh. And he shall flee to one of those cities,  shall stand at the entrance of the gate of the city,  declare his case in the ears of the elders of that city. And they shall take him into the city to them,  give him a place, that he may dwell among them.
Josh. And if the avenger of blood pursues after him, then they shall not deliver up the manslayer into his hand, because he smote his neighbor unawares,  did not hate him formerly.
Josh. And he shall dwell in that city, until he stands before the congregation for judgment, until the death of the high priest who shall be in those days. Then the manslayer shall return,  come to his own city,  to his own house, to the city from where he fled.
Josh. And they set apart Kedesh in Galilee in the hill-country of Naphtali,  Shechem in the hill-country of Ephraim,  Kiriath-arba (the same is Hebron) in the hill-country of Judah.
Josh. And beyond the Jordan at Jericho eastward, they assigned Bezer in the wilderness in the plain out of the tribe of Reuben,  Ramoth in Gilead out of the tribe of Gad,  Golan in Bashan out of the tribe of Manasseh.
Josh. These were the appointed cities for all the sons of Israel,  for the stranger who sojourns among them, that whoever kills any soul unwittingly might flee there,  not die by the hand of the avenger of blood until he stood before the congregation.
Josh. Then the heads of fathers of the Levites came near to Eleazar the priest,  to Joshua the son of Nun,  to the heads of fathers of the tribes of the sons of Israel.
Josh. And they spoke to them at Shiloh in the land of Canaan, saying, Jehovah commanded Moses to give us cities to dwell in, with the suburbs of it for our cattle.
Josh. And the sons of Israel gave to the Levites out of their inheritance, according to the commandment of Jehovah, these cities with their suburbs:
Josh. And the lot came out for the families of the Kohathites. And the sons of Aaron the priest, who were of the Levites, had by lot out of the tribe of Judah,  out of the tribe of the Simeonites,  out of the tribe of Benjamin, thirteen cities.
Josh. And the rest of the sons of Kohath had by lot out of the families of the tribe of Ephraim,  out of the tribe of Dan,  out of the half-tribe of Manasseh, ten cities.
Josh. And the sons of Gershon had by lot out of the families of the tribe of Issachar,  out of the tribe of Asher,  out of the tribe of Naphtali,  out of the half-tribe of Manasseh in Bashan, thirteen cities.
Josh. The sons of Merari according to their families had out of the tribe of Reuben,  out of the tribe of Gad,  out of the tribe of Zebulun, twelve cities.
Josh. And the sons of Israel gave these cities by lot to the Levites with their suburbs, as Jehovah commanded by Moses.
Josh. And they gave out of the tribe of the sons of Judah,  out of the tribe of the sons of Simeon, these cities which are here mentioned by name,
Josh. and they were for the sons of Aaron, of the families of the Kohathites, who were of the sons of Levi, for theirs was the first lot.
Josh. And they gave them Kiriath-arba, Arba was the father of Anak (the same is Hebron), in the hill-country of Judah, with the suburbs of it round about it.
Josh. But the fields of the city,  the villages of it, gave they to Caleb the son of Jephunneh for his possession.
Josh. And to the sons of Aaron the priest they gave Hebron with its suburbs, the city of refuge for the manslayer,  Libnah with its suburbs,
Josh. and Jattir with its suburbs,  Eshtemoa with its suburbs,
Josh. and Holon with its suburbs,  Debir with its suburbs,
Josh. and Ain with its suburbs,  Juttah with its suburbs,  Beth-shemesh with its suburbs; nine cities out of those two tribes.
Josh. And out of the tribe of Benjamin, Gibeon with its suburbs, Geba with its suburbs,
Josh. Anathoth with its suburbs,  Almon with its suburbs; four cities.
Josh. All the cities of the sons of Aaron, the priests, were thirteen cities with their suburbs.
Josh. And the families of the sons of Kohath, the Levites, even the rest of the sons of Kohath, they had the cities of their lot out of the tribe of Ephraim.
Josh. And they gave them Shechem with its suburbs in the hill-country of Ephraim, the city of refuge for the manslayer,  Gezer with its suburbs,
Josh. and Kibzaim with its suburbs,  Beth-horon with its suburbs; four cities.
Josh. And out of the tribe of Dan, Elteke with its suburbs, Gibbethon with its suburbs,
Josh. Aijalon with its suburbs, Gath-rimmon with its suburbs; four cities.
Josh. And out of the half-tribe of Manasseh, Taanach with its suburbs,  Gath-rimmon with its suburbs; two cities.
Josh. All the cities of the families of the rest of the sons of Kohath were ten with their suburbs.
Josh. And to the sons of Gershon, of the families of the Levites, out of the half-tribe of Manasseh they gave Golan in Bashan with its suburbs, the city of refuge for the manslayer,  Be-eshterah with its suburbs; two cities.
Josh. And out of the tribe of Issachar, Kishion with its suburbs, Daberath with its suburbs,
Josh. Jarmuth with its suburbs, En-gannim with its suburbs; four cities.
Josh. And out of the tribe of Asher, Mishal with its suburbs, Abdon with its suburbs,
Josh. Helkath with its suburbs,  Rehob with its suburbs; four cities.
Josh. And out of the tribe of Naphtali, Kedesh in Galilee with its suburbs, the city of refuge for the manslayer,  Hammoth-dor with its suburbs,  Kartan with its suburbs; three cities.
Josh. All the cities of the Gershonites according to their families were thirteen cities with their suburbs.
Josh. And to the families of the sons of Merari, the rest of the Levites, out of the tribe of Zebulun, Jokneam with its suburbs,  Kartah with its suburbs,
Josh. Dimnah with its suburbs, Nahalal with its suburbs; four cities.
Josh. And out of the tribe of Reuben, Bezer with its suburbs,  Jahaz with its suburbs,
Josh. Kedemoth with its suburbs,  Mephaath with its suburbs; four cities.
Josh. And out of the tribe of Gad, Ramoth in Gilead with its suburbs, the city of refuge for the manslayer,  Mahanaim with its suburbs,
Josh. Heshbon with its suburbs, Jazer with its suburbs; four cities in all.
Josh. All these were the cities of the sons of Merari according to their families, even the rest of the families of the Levites; and their lot was twelve cities.
Josh. All the cities of the Levites in the midst of the possession of the sons of Israel were forty-eight cities with their suburbs.
Josh. These cities were every one with their suburbs round about them. Thus it was with all these cities.
Josh. So Jehovah gave to Israel all the land which he swore to give to their fathers,  they possessed it,  dwelt in it.
Josh. And Jehovah gave them rest round about, according to all that he swore to their fathers. And there stood not a man of all their enemies before them. Jehovah delivered all their enemies into their hand.
Josh. There failed not anything of any good thing which Jehovah had spoken to the house of Israel; all came to pass.
Josh. Then Joshua called the Reubenites,  the Gadites,  the half-tribe of Manasseh,
Josh. and said to them, Ye have kept all that Moses the servant of Jehovah commanded you,  have hearkened to my voice in all that I commanded you.
Josh. Ye have not left your brothers these many days to this day,  have kept the charge of the commandment of Jehovah your God.
Josh. And now Jehovah your God has given rest to your brothers, as he spoke to them. Therefore now turn ye,  get you to your tents, to the land of your possession, which Moses the servant of Jehovah gave you beyond the Jordan.
Josh. Only take diligent heed to do the commandment and the law which Moses the servant of Jehovah commanded you, to love Jehovah your God,  to walk in all his ways,  to keep his commandments,  to cling to him,  to serve him with all your heart and with all your soul.
Josh. So Joshua blessed them,  sent them away,  they went to their tents.
Josh. Now to the one half-tribe of Manasseh Moses had given in Bashan,  to the other half Joshua gave among their brothers beyond the Jordan westward. Moreover when Joshua sent them away to their tents, he blessed them,
Josh. and spoke to them, saying, Return with much wealth to your tents,  with very much cattle, with silver,  with gold,  with brass,  with iron,  with very much raiment. Divide the spoil of your enemies with your brothers.
Josh. And the sons of Reuben and the sons of Gad and the half-tribe of Manasseh returned,  departed from the sons of Israel out of Shiloh, which is in the land of Canaan, to go to the land of Gilead, to the land of their possession, of which they were possessed, according to the commandment of Jehovah by Moses.
Josh. And when they came to the region about the Jordan that is in the land of Canaan, the sons of Reuben and the sons of Gad and the half-tribe of Manasseh built there an altar by the Jordan, a great altar to look upon.
Josh. And the sons of Israel heard say, Behold, the sons of Reuben and the sons of Gad and the half-tribe of Manasseh have built an altar in the forefront of the land of Canaan, in the region about the Jordan, on the side that pertains to the sons of Israel.
Josh. And when the sons of Israel heard of it, the whole congregation of the sons of Israel gathered themselves together at Shiloh, to go up against them to war.
Josh. And the sons of Israel sent Phinehas, the son of Eleazar the priest, to the sons of Reuben,  to the sons of Gad,  to the half-tribe of Manasseh, into the land of Gilead,
Josh. and with him ten rulers, one ruler of a fathers' house for each of the tribes of Israel. And they were each man of them head of their fathers' houses among the thousands of Israel.
Josh. And they came to the sons of Reuben,  to the sons of Gad,  to the half-tribe of Manasseh, to the land of Gilead,  they spoke with them, saying,
Josh. Thus says the whole congregation of Jehovah, What trespass is this that ye have committed against the God of Israel, to turn away this day from following Jehovah, in that ye have built for you an altar, to rebel this day against Jehovah?
Josh. Is the iniquity of Peor too little for us, from which we have not cleansed ourselves to this day, although there came a plague upon the congregation of Jehovah,
Josh. that ye must turn away this day from following Jehovah? And it will be, seeing ye rebel today against Jehovah, that tomorrow he will be angry with the whole congregation of Israel.
Josh. However, if the land of your possession is unclean, then pass ye over to the land of the possession of Jehovah, in which Jehovah's tabernacle dwells,  take possession among us,  do not rebel against Jehovah, nor rebel against us, in building for you an altar besides the altar of Jehovah our God.
Josh. Did not Achan the son of Zerah commit a trespass in what was set apart,  wrath fell upon all the congregation of Israel? And that man did not perish alone in his iniquity.
Josh. Then the sons of Reuben and the sons of Gad and the half-tribe of Manasseh answered,  spoke to the heads of the thousands of Israel,
Josh. The Mighty One, God, Jehovah, the Mighty One, God, Jehovah, he knows,  Israel he shall know, if it is in rebellion, or if in trespass against Jehovah (do not save us this day),
Josh. that we have built us an altar to turn away from following Jehovah, or if to offer burnt offering or meal offering on it, or if to offer sacrifices of peace offerings on it, let Jehovah himself require it,
Josh. and if we have not rather out of carefulness done this, from purpose, saying, In time to come your sons might speak to our sons, saying, What have ye to do with Jehovah, the God of Israel?
Josh. For Jehovah has made the Jordan a border between us and you, ye sons of Reuben and sons of Gad. Ye have no portion in Jehovah. So your sons might make our sons cease from fearing Jehovah.
Josh. Therefore we said, Let us now prepare to build us an altar, not for burnt offering, nor for sacrifice,
Josh. but it shall be a witness between us and you,  between our generations after us, that we may do the service of Jehovah before him with our burnt offerings,  with our sacrifices,  with our peace offerings, that your sons may not say to our sons in time to come, Ye have no portion in Jehovah.
Josh. Therefore we said, It shall be, when they so say to us or to our generations in time to come, that we shall say, Behold the pattern of the altar of Jehovah, which our fathers made, not for burnt offering, nor for sacrifice,  it is a witness between us and you.
Josh. Far be it from us that we should rebel against Jehovah,  turn away this day from following Jehovah, to build an altar for burnt offering, for meal offering, or for sacrifice, besides the altar of Jehovah our God that is before his tabernacle.
Josh. And when Phinehas the priest,  the rulers of the congregation, even the heads of the thousands of Israel that were with him, heard the words that the sons of Reuben and the sons of Gad and the sons of Manasseh spoke, it pleased them well.
Josh. And Phinehas the son of Eleazar the priest said to the sons of Reuben,  to the sons of Gad,  to the sons of Manasseh, This day we know that Jehovah is in the midst of us, because ye have not committed this trespass against Jehovah. Now ye have delivered the sons of Israel out of the hand of Jehovah.
Josh. And Phinehas the son of Eleazar the priest,  the rulers, returned from the sons of Reuben,  from the sons of Gad, out of the land of Gilead, to the land of Canaan, to the sons of Israel,  brought them word again.
Josh. And the thing pleased the sons of Israel. And the sons of Israel blessed God,  spoke no more of going up against them to war, to destroy the land in which the sons of Reuben and the sons of Gad dwelt.
Josh. And the sons of Reuben and the sons of Gad called the altar Witness. For, they said, it is a witness between us that Jehovah is God.
Josh. And it came to pass after many days, when Jehovah had given rest to Israel from all their enemies round about,  Joshua was old and well stricken in years,
Josh. that Joshua called for all Israel, for their elders,  for their heads,  for their judges,  for their officers,  said to them, I am old and well stricken in years,
Josh. and ye have seen all that Jehovah your God has done to all these nations because of you, for Jehovah your God, he it is who has fought for you.
Josh. Behold, I have allotted to you these nations that remain, to be an inheritance for your tribes, from the Jordan, with all the nations that I have cut off, even to the great sea toward the going down of the sun.
Josh. And Jehovah your God, he will thrust them out from before you,  drive them from out of your sight. And ye shall possess their land, as Jehovah your God spoke to you.
Josh. Therefore be ye very courageous to keep and to do all that is written in the book of the law of Moses, that ye not turn aside therefrom to the right hand or to the left;
Josh. that ye do not come among these nations, these that remain among you, neither make mention of the name of their gods, nor cause to swear by them, neither serve them, nor bow yourselves down to them,
Josh. but cling to Jehovah your God as ye have done to this day.
Josh. For Jehovah has driven out from before you great nations and strong. But as for you, no man has stood before you to this day.
Josh. One man of you shall chase a thousand, for Jehovah your God, he it is who fights for you, as he spoke to you.
Josh. Take good heed therefore to yourselves, that ye love Jehovah your God.
Josh. Else if ye do at all go back,  cling to the remnant of these nations, even these that remain among you,  make marriages with them,  go in to them,  they to you,
Josh. know for a certainty that Jehovah your God will no more drive these nations from out of your sight,  they shall be a snare and a trap to you,  a scourge in your sides,  thorns in your eyes, until ye perish from off this good land which Jehovah your God has given you.
Josh. And, behold, this day I am going the way of all the earth. And ye know in all your hearts and in all your souls, that not one thing has failed of all the good things which Jehovah your God spoke concerning you. All have come to pass to you; not one thing has failed of it.
Josh. And it shall come to pass, that as all the good things have come upon you of which Jehovah your God spoke to you, so will Jehovah bring upon you all the evil things, until he has destroyed you from off this good land which Jehovah your God has given you.
Josh. When ye transgress the covenant of Jehovah your God, which he commanded you,  go and serve other gods,  bow down yourselves to them, then the anger of Jehovah will be kindled against you,  ye shall perish quickly from off the good land which he has given to you.
Josh. And Joshua gathered all the tribes of Israel to Shechem,  called for the elders of Israel,  for their heads,  for their judges,  for their officers; and they presented themselves before God.
Josh. And Joshua said to all the people, Thus says Jehovah, the God of Israel: Your fathers dwelt of old time beyond the River, even Terah, the father of Abraham,  the father of Nahor,  they served other gods.
Josh. And I took your father Abraham from beyond the River,  led him throughout all the land of Canaan,  multiplied his seed,  gave him Isaac.
Josh. And I gave to Isaac, Jacob and Esau. And I gave to Esau mount Seir to possess it. And Jacob and his sons went down into Egypt.
Josh. And I sent Moses and Aaron,  I plagued Egypt, according to that which I did in the midst of it,  afterward I brought you out.
Josh. And I brought your fathers out of Egypt. And ye came to the sea,  the Egyptians pursued after your fathers with chariots and with horsemen to the Red Sea.
Josh. And when they cried out to Jehovah, he put darkness between you and the Egyptians,  brought the sea upon them,  covered them. And your eyes saw what I did in Egypt,  ye dwelt in the wilderness many days.
Josh. And I brought you into the land of the Amorites, who dwelt beyond the Jordan. And they fought with you. And I gave them into your hand,  ye possessed their land,  I destroyed them from before you.
Josh. Then Balak the son of Zippor, king of Moab, arose and fought against Israel. And he sent and called Balaam the son of Beor to curse you,
Josh. but I would not hearken to Balaam. Therefore he blessed you greatly. So I delivered you out of his hand.
Josh. And ye went over the Jordan,  came to Jericho. And the men of Jericho fought against you, the Amorite,  the Perizzite,  the Canaanite,  the Hittite,  the Girgashite, the Hivite,  the Jebusite. And I delivered them into your hand.
Josh. And I sent the hornet before you, which drove them out from before you, even the two kings of the Amorites, not with thy sword, nor with thy bow.
Josh. And I gave you a land in which thou had not labored,  cities which ye did not build,  ye dwell in it. Ye eat of vineyards and oliveyards which ye did not plant.
Josh. Now therefore fear Jehovah,  serve him in sincerity and in truth. And put away the gods which your fathers served beyond the River,  in Egypt,  serve ye Jehovah.
Josh. And if it seems evil to you to serve Jehovah, choose you this day whom ye will serve: whether the gods which your fathers served that were beyond the River, or the gods of the Amorites, in whose land ye dwell. But as for me and my house, we will serve Jehovah.
Josh. And the people answered and said, Far be it from us that we should forsake Jehovah, to serve other gods.
Josh. For Jehovah our God, he it is who brought us and our fathers up out of the land of Egypt, from the house of bondage,  who did those great signs in our sight,  preserved us in all the way in which we went,  among all the peoples through the midst of whom we passed.
Josh. And Jehovah drove out from before us all the peoples, even the Amorites who dwelt in the land. Therefore we also will serve Jehovah, for he is our God.
Josh. And Joshua said to the people, Ye cannot serve Jehovah, for he is a holy God. He is a jealous God. He will not forgive your transgression nor your sins.
Josh. If ye forsake Jehovah,  serve foreign gods, then he will turn and do you evil,  consume you, after he has done you good.
Josh. And the people said to Joshua, No,  we will serve Jehovah.
Josh. And Joshua said to the people, Ye are witnesses against yourselves that ye have chosen for you, Jehovah, to serve him. And they said, We are witnesses.
Josh. Now therefore, he said, put away the foreign gods which are among you,  incline your heart to Jehovah, the God of Israel.
Josh. And the people said to Joshua, we will serve Jehovah our God,  we will hearken to his voice.
Josh. So Joshua made a covenant with the people that day,  set them a statute and an ordinance in Shechem.
Josh. And Joshua wrote these words in the book of the law of God. And he took a great stone,  set it up there under the oak that was by the sanctuary of Jehovah.
Josh. And Joshua said to all the people, Behold, this stone shall be a witness against us, for it has heard all the words of Jehovah which he spoke to us. It shall be therefore a witness against you, lest ye deny your God.
Josh. So Joshua sent the people away, every man to his inheritance.
Josh. And it came to pass after these things, that Joshua the son of Nun, the servant of Jehovah, died, being a hundred and ten years old.
Josh. And they buried him in the border of his inheritance in Timnathserah, which is in the hill-country of Ephraim, on the north of the mountain of Gaash.
Josh. And Israel served Jehovah all the days of Joshua,  all the days of the elders who outlived Joshua,  had known all the work of Jehovah that he had wrought for Israel.
Josh. And they buried the bones of Joseph, which the sons of Israel brought up out of Egypt, in Sicima, in the portion of the land which Jacob bought from the Amorites who dwelt in Sicima for a hundred ewe-lambs. And he gave it to Joseph for a portion.
Josh. And Eleazar the son of Aaron died. And they buried him in the hill of Phinehas his son, which was given him in the hill-country of Ephraim.
Judges
Judg. And it came to pass after the death of Joshua, that the sons of Israel asked of Jehovah, saying, Who shall go up for us first against the Canaanites, to fight against them?
Judg. And Jehovah said, Judah shall go up. Behold, I have delivered the land into his hand.
Judg. And Judah said to Simeon his brother, Come up with me into my lot, that we may fight against the Canaanites,  I likewise will go with thee into thy lot. So Simeon went with him.
Judg. And Judah went up,  Jehovah delivered the Canaanites and the Perizzites into their hand,  they smote of them in Bezek ten thousand men.
Judg. And they found Adoni-bezek in Bezek,  they fought against him,  they smote the Canaanites and the Perizzites.
Judg. But Adoni-bezek fled,  they pursued after him,  caught him,  cut off his thumbs and his great toes.
Judg. And Adoni-bezek said, Seventy kings, having their thumbs and their great toes cut off, gathered scraps under my table. As I have done, so God has requited me. And they brought him to Jerusalem,  he died there.
Judg. And the sons of Judah fought against Jerusalem,  took it,  smote it with the edge of the sword,  set the city on fire.
Judg. And afterward the sons of Judah went down to fight against the Canaanites who dwelt in the hill-country,  in the South,  in the lowland.
Judg. And Judah went against the Canaanites who dwelt in Hebron (now the name of Hebron was formerly Kiriath-arba),  they smote Sheshai,  Ahiman,  Talmai.
Judg. And from there he went against the inhabitants of Debir. (Now the name of Debir was formerly Kiriath-sepher.)
Judg. And Caleb said, He who smites Kiriath-sepher,  takes it, I will give to him Achsah my daughter to wife.
Judg. And Othniel the son of Kenaz, Caleb's younger brother, took it,  he gave him Achsah his daughter to wife.
Judg. And it came to pass, when she came to him, that she moved him to ask of her father a field. And she alighted from off her donkey,  Caleb said to her, What would thou?
Judg. And she said to him, Give me a blessing, since thou have set me in the land of the South, give me also springs of water. And Caleb gave her the upper springs and the nether springs.
Judg. And the sons of the Kenite, Moses' brother-in-law, went up out of the city of palm trees with the sons of Judah into the wilderness of Judah, which is in the south of Arad,  they went and dwelt with the people.
Judg. And Judah went with Simeon his brother,  they smote the Canaanites that inhabited Zephath,  utterly destroyed it. And the name of the city was called Hormah.
Judg. Also Judah took Gaza with the border of it,  Ashkelon with the border of it,  Ekron with the border of it.
