Then the woman went to all the people in her wisdom. And they cut off the head of Sheba the son of Bichri,  threw it out to Joab. And he blew the trumpet,  they were dispersed from the city, every man to his tent. And Joab returned to Jerusalem to the king.
Now Joab was over all the army of Israel,  Benaiah the son of Jehoiada was over the Cherethites and over the Pelethites,
and Adoram was over the men subject to task work,  Jehoshaphat the son of Ahilud was the recorder,
and Sheva was scribe,  Zadok and Abiathar were priests,
and also Ira the Jairite was chief minister to David.
And there was a famine in the days of David three years, year after year; and David sought the face of Jehovah. And Jehovah said, It is for Saul,  for his bloody house, because he put to death the Gibeonites.
And the king called the Gibeonites,  spoke to them (now the Gibeonites were not of the sons of Israel,  of the remnant of the Amorites,  the sons of Israel had sworn to them,  yet Saul sought to kill them in his zeal for the sons of Israel and Judah),
and David said to the Gibeonites, What shall I do for you? And with what shall I make atonement that ye may bless the inheritance of Jehovah?
And the Gibeonites said to him, It is no matter of silver or gold between us and Saul or his house, neither is it for us to put any man to death in Israel. And he said, What ye shall say, that I will do for you.
And they said to the king, The man who consumed us,  who devised against us, that we should be destroyed from remaining in any of the borders of Israel,
let seven men of his sons be delivered to us,  we will hang them up to Jehovah in Gibeah of Saul, the chosen of Jehovah. And the king said, I will give them.
But the king spared Mephibosheth, the son of Jonathan the son of Saul, because of Jehovah's oath that was between them, between David and Jonathan the son of Saul.
But the king took the two sons of Rizpah the daughter of Aiah whom she bore to Saul, Armoni and Mephibosheth,  the five sons of Merab the daughter of Saul whom she bore to Adriel the son of Barzillai the Meholathite.
And he delivered them into the hands of the Gibeonites. And they hanged them in the mountain before Jehovah,  they fell all seven together. And they were put to death in the days of harvest, in the first days, at the beginning of barley harvest.
And Rizpah the daughter of Aiah took sackcloth,  spread it for her upon the rock, from the beginning of harvest until water was poured upon them from heaven. And she neither allowed the birds of the heaven to rest on them by day, nor the beasts of the field by night.
And it was told David what Rizpah the daughter of Aiah, the concubine of Saul, had done.
And David went and took the bones of Saul and the bones of Jonathan his son from the men of Jabesh-gilead, who had stolen them from the street of Beth-shan where the Philistines had hanged them in the day that the Philistines killed Saul in Gilboa,
and he brought up from there the bones of Saul and the bones of Jonathan his son,  they gathered the bones of those who were hanged.
And they buried the bones of Saul and Jonathan his son in the country of Benjamin in Zela, in the sepulcher of Kish his father. And they performed all that the king commanded. And after that God was entreated for the land.
And the Philistines had war again with Israel. And David went down,  his servants with him,  fought against the Philistines. And David grew faint,
and Ishbibenob, who was of the sons of the giant, the weight of whose spear was three hundred shekels of brass in weight, he being girded with a new sword, thought to have slain David.
But Abishai the son of Zeruiah helped him,  smote the Philistine,  killed him. Then the men of David swore to him, saying, Thou shall no more go out with us to battle, that thou not quench the lamp of Israel.
And it came to pass after this, that there was again war with the Philistines at Gob. Then Sibbecai the Hushathite killed Saph, who was of the sons of the giant.
And there was again war with the Philistines at Gob. And Elhanan the son of Jaareoregim the Bethlehemite killed Goliath the Gittite, the staff of whose spear was like a weaver's beam.
And there was again war at Gath, where there was a man of great stature who had on every hand six fingers,  on every foot six toes, twenty-four in number,  he also was born to the giant.
And when he defied Israel, Jonathan the son of Shimei, David's brother, killed him.
These four were born to the giant in Gath,  they fell by the hand of David,  by the hand of his servants.
And David spoke to Jehovah the words of this song in the day that Jehovah delivered him out of the hand of all his enemies,  out of the hand of Saul:
And he said, Jehovah is my rock,  my fortress,  my deliverer, even mine.
God, my rock, in him I will take refuge, my shield,  the horn of my salvation, my high tower,  my refuge, my savior. Thou save me from violence.
I will call upon Jehovah, who is worthy to be praised. So I shall be saved from my enemies.
For the waves of death encompassed me. The floods of ungodliness made me afraid.
The cords of Sheol were round about me. The snares of death came upon me.
In my distress I called upon Jehovah. Yea, I called to my God. And he heard my voice out of his temple,  my cry came into his ears.
Then the earth shook and trembled, the foundations of heaven quaked and were shaken, because he was angry.
There went up a smoke out of his nostrils,  fire out of his mouth devoured. Coals were kindled by it.
He bowed the heavens also,  came down,  thick darkness was under his feet.
And he rode upon a cherub,  flew. Yea, he was seen upon the wings of the wind.
And he made darkness pavilions round about him, gathering of waters, thick clouds of the skies.
At the brightness before him coals of fire were kindled.
Jehovah thundered from heaven,  the Most High uttered his voice.
And he sent out arrows,  scattered them, lightning,  discomfited them.
Then the channels of the sea appeared. The foundations of the world were laid bare by the rebuke of Jehovah, at the blast of the breath of his nostrils.
He sent from on high, he took me. He drew me out of many waters.
He delivered me from my strong enemy, from those who hated me, for they were too mighty for me.
They came upon me in the day of my calamity,  Jehovah was my support.
He brought me forth also into a large place. He delivered me, because he delighted in me.
Jehovah rewarded me according to my righteousness. According to the cleanness of my hands he has rewarded me.
For I have kept the ways of Jehovah,  have not wickedly departed from my God.
For all his ordinances were before me. And as for his statutes, I did not depart from them.
I was also perfect toward him,  I kept myself from my iniquity.
Therefore Jehovah has recompensed me according to my righteousness, according to my cleanness in his eyesight.
With the merciful thou will show thyself merciful. With the perfect man thou will show thyself perfect.
With the pure thou will show thyself pure. And with the perverse thou will show thyself contrary.
And the afflicted people thou will save,  thine eyes are upon the haughty, that thou may bring them down.
For thou are my lamp, O Jehovah. And Jehovah will lighten my darkness.
For by thee I run upon a troop. By my God do I leap over a wall.
As for God, his way is perfect. The word of Jehovah is tried. He is a shield to all those who take refuge in him.
For who is God, except Jehovah? And who is a rock, except our God?
God is my strong fortress,  he guides the perfect in his way.
He makes his feet like hinds' feet,  sets me upon my high places.
He teaches my hands to war, so that my arms bend a bow of brass.
Thou have also given me the shield of thy salvation,  thy gentleness has made me great.
Thou have enlarged my steps under me,  my feet have not slipped.
I have pursued my enemies,  destroyed them, neither did I turn again till they were consumed.
And I have consumed them,  smitten them through, so that they cannot arise. Yea, they are fallen under my feet.
For thou have girded me with strength to the battle. Thou have subdued under me those who rose up against me.
Thou have also made my enemies turn their backs to me, that I might cut off those who hate me.
They looked,  there was none to save; even to Jehovah,  he did not answer them.
Then I beat them small as the dust of the earth. I crushed them as the mire of the streets,  spread them abroad.
Thou have also delivered me from the strivings of my people. Thou have kept me to be the head of the nations. A people whom I have not known shall serve me.
The foreigners shall submit themselves to me. As soon as they hear of me, they shall obey me.
The foreigners shall fade away,  shall come trembling out of their hiding places.
Jehovah lives. And blessed be my rock. And exalted be God, the rock of my salvation,
Even the God who executes vengeance for me,  who brings down peoples under me,
and who brings me forth from my enemies. Yea, thou lift me up above those who rise up against me. Thou deliver me from the violent man.
Therefore I will give thanks to thee, O Jehovah, among gentiles,  will sing praises to thy name.
He gives great deliverance to his king,  shows loving kindness to his anointed, to David and to his seed, for evermore.
Now these are the last words of David. David the son of Jesse says,  the man who was raised on high says, the anointed of the God of Jacob,  the sweet psalmist of Israel:
The Spirit of Jehovah spoke by me,  his word was upon my tongue.
The God of Israel said, The Rock of Israel spoke to me. He who rules over men righteously, who rules in the fear of God,
he shall be as the light of the morning, when the sun rises, a morning without clouds, when the tender grass springs out of the earth, through clear shining after rain.
Truly my house is not so with God. Yet he has made with me an everlasting covenant, ordered in all things,  sure. For it is all my salvation,  all my desire, though he does not make it to grow.
But the worthless shall be as thorns to be thrust away, all of them, because they cannot be taken with the hand.
But the man who touches them must be armed with iron and the staff of a spear,  they shall be utterly burned with fire in their place.
These are the names of the mighty men whom David had: Josheb-basshebeth a Tahchemonite, chief of the captains, the same was Adino the Eznite, against eight hundred slain at one time.
And after him was Eleazar the son of Dodai the son of an Ahohite, one of the three mighty men with David when they defied the Philistines who were there gathered together to battle,  the men of Israel were gone away.
He arose,  smote the Philistines until his hand was weary,  his hand clung to the sword. And Jehovah wrought a great victory that day,  the people returned after him only to take spoil.
And after him was Shammah the son of Agee a Hararite. And the Philistines were gathered together into a troop where was a plot of ground full of lentils,  the people fled from the Philistines.
But he stood in the midst of the plot,  defended it,  killed the Philistines. And Jehovah wrought a great victory.
And three of the thirty chief men went down,  came to David in the harvest time to the cave of Adullam,  the troop of the Philistines was encamped in the valley of Rephaim.
And David was then in the stronghold,  the garrison of the Philistines was then in Bethlehem.
And David longed,  said, Oh that someone would give me water to drink from the well of Bethlehem, which is by the gate!
And the three mighty men broke through the army of the Philistines,  drew water out of the well of Bethlehem that was by the gate,  took it,  brought it to David. But he would not drink of it,  poured it out to Jehovah.
And he said, Be it far from me, O Jehovah, that I should do this, to drink the blood of the men who went in jeopardy of their lives? Therefore he would not drink it. These things the three mighty men did.
And Abishai, the brother of Joab, the son of Zeruiah, was chief of the three. And he lifted up his spear against three hundred and killed them,  had a name among the three.
Was he not most honorable of the three? Therefore he was made their captain. However he did not attain to the first three.
And Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, the son of a valiant man of Kabzeel, who had done mighty deeds, he killed the two sons of Ariel of Moab. He also went down and killed a lion in the midst of a pit in time of snow.
And he killed an Egyptian, a good-looking man. And the Egyptian had a spear in his hand,  he went down to him with a staff,  plucked the spear out of the Egyptian's hand,  killed him with his own spear.
These things Benaiah the son of Jehoiada did,  had a name among the three mighty men.
He was more honorable than the thirty,  he did not attain to the first three. And David set him over his guard.
Asahel the brother of Joab was one of the thirty; Elhanan the son of Dodo of Bethlehem,
Shammah the Harodite, Elika the Harodite,
Helez the Paltite, Ira the son of Ikkesh the Tekoite,
Abiezer the Anathothite, Mebunnai the Hushathite,
Zalmon the Ahohite, Maharai the Netophathite,
Heleb the son of Baanah the Netophathite, Ittai the son of Ribai of Gibeah of the sons of Benjamin,
Benaiah a Pirathonite, Hiddai of the brooks of Gaash.
Abialbon the Arbathite, Azmaveth the Barhumite,
Eliahba the Shaalbonite (of the sons of Jashen), Jonathan,
Shammah the Hararite, Ahiam the son of Sharar the Ararite,
Eliphelet the son of Ahasbai, the son of the Maacathite, Eliam the son of Ahithophel the Gilonite,
Hezro the Carmelite, Paarai the Arbite,
Igal the son of Nathan of Zobah, Bani the Gadite,
Zelek the Ammonite, Naharai the Beerothite, armorbearers to Joab the son of Zeruiah,
Ira the Ithrite, Gareb the Ithrite,
Uriah the Hittite: thirty-seven in all.
And again the anger of Jehovah was kindled against Israel,  he moved David against them, saying, Go, number Israel and Judah.
And the king said to Joab the captain of the army, who was with him, Go now to and fro through all the tribes of Israel, from Dan even to Beersheba,  number ye the people, that I may know the sum of the people.
And Joab said to the king, Now Jehovah thy God add to the people, however many they may be, a hundredfold,  may the eyes of my lord the king see it,  why does my lord the king delight in this thing?
Notwithstanding, the king's word prevailed against Joab,  against the captains of the army. And Joab and the captains of the army went out from the presence of the king to number the people of Israel.
And they passed over the Jordan,  encamped in Aroer on the right side of the city that is in the middle of the valley of Gad,  to Jazer.
Then they came to Gilead,  to the land of Tahtim-hodshi. And they came to Dan-jaan,  round about to Sidon,
and came to the stronghold of Tyre,  to all the cities of the Hivites,  of the Canaanites. And they went out to the south of Judah, at Beersheba.
So when they had gone to and fro through all the land, they came to Jerusalem at the end of nine months and twenty days.
And Joab gave the sum of the numbering of the people to the king. And there were in Israel eight hundred thousand valiant men who drew the sword,  the men of Judah were five hundred thousand men.
And David's heart smote him after he had numbered the people. And David said to Jehovah, I have sinned greatly in that which I have done,  now, O Jehovah, put away, I beseech thee, the iniquity of thy servant, for I have done very foolishly.
And when David rose up in the morning, the word of Jehovah came to the prophet Gad, David's seer, saying,
Go and speak to David, Thus says Jehovah, I offer thee three things. Choose thee one of them, that I may do it to thee.
So Gad came to David,  told him,  said to him, Shall seven years of famine come to thee in thy land? Or will thou flee three months before thy foes while they pursue thee? Or shall there be three days' pestilence in thy land? Now decide,  see what answer I shall return to him who sent me.
And David said to Gad, I am in a great strait. Let us fall now into the hand of Jehovah, for his mercies are great,  let me not fall into the hand of man.
So Jehovah sent a pestilence upon Israel from the morning even to the time appointed. And there died of the people from Dan even to Beersheba seventy thousand men.
And when the agent stretched out his hand toward Jerusalem to destroy it, Jehovah relented of the evil,  said to the agent who destroyed the people, It is enough. Now stay thy hand. And the agent of Jehovah was by the threshing-floor of Araunah the Jebusite.
And David spoke to Jehovah when he saw the agent who smote the people,  said, Lo, I have sinned,  I have done perversely,  these sheep, what have they done? Let thy hand, I pray thee, be against me,  against my father's house.
And Gad came that day to David,  said to him, Go up, rear an altar to Jehovah in the threshing-floor of Araunah the Jebusite.
And David went up according to the saying of Gad, as Jehovah commanded.
And Araunah looked forth,  saw the king and his servants coming on toward him. And Araunah went out,  bowed himself before the king with his face to the ground.
And Araunah said, Why has my lord the king come to his servant? And David said, To buy the threshing-floor from thee, to build an altar to Jehovah that the plague may be halted from the people.
And Araunah said to David, Let my lord the king take and offer up what seems good to him. Behold, the oxen for the burnt offering,  the threshing instruments and the yokes of the oxen for the wood.
All this, O king, Araunah gives to the king. And Araunah said to the king, Jehovah thy God accept thee.
And the king said to Araunah, No,  I will truly buy it from thee at a price. Neither will I offer burnt offerings to Jehovah my God which cost me nothing. So David bought the threshing-floor and the oxen for fifty shekels of silver.
And David built there an altar to Jehovah,  offered burnt offerings and peace offerings. So Jehovah was entreated for the land,  the plague was halted from Israel.
I Kings
Kgs. Now king David was old and stricken in years,  they covered him with clothes,  he did not get warm.
Kgs. Therefore his servants said to him, Let there be sought for my lord the king a young virgin. And let her stand before the king,  take care of him. And let her lie in thy bosom, that my lord the king may get warmth.
Kgs. So they sought for a fair damsel throughout all the borders of Israel,  found Abishag the Shunammite,  brought her to the king.
Kgs. And the damsel was very fair. And she took care of the king,  ministered to him,  the king knew her not.
Kgs. Then Adonijah the son of Haggith exalted himself, saying, I will be king. And he prepared chariots for him,  horsemen,  fifty men to run before him.
Kgs. And his father had not displeased him at any time in saying, Why have thou done so? And he was also a very handsome man. And he was born after Absalom.
Kgs. And he conferred with Joab the son of Zeruiah,  with Abiathar the priest. And, following Adonijah, they helped him.
Kgs. But Zadok the priest,  Benaiah the son of Jehoiada,  Nathan the prophet,  Shimei,  Rei,  the mighty men who belonged to David, were not with Adonijah.
Kgs. And Adonijah killed sheep and oxen and fatlings by the stone of Zoheleth, which is beside En-rogel. And he called all his brothers, the king's sons,  all the men of Judah, the king's servants.
Kgs. But he did not call Nathan the prophet,  Benaiah,  the mighty men,  Solomon his brother.
Kgs. Then Nathan spoke to Bathsheba the mother of Solomon, saying, Have thou not heard that Adonijah the son of Haggith reigns,  David our lord does not know it?
Kgs. Now therefore come, let me, I pray thee, give thee counsel, that thou may save thine own life,  the life of thy son Solomon.
Kgs. Go and get thee in to king David,  say to him, Did thou not, my lord, O king, swear to thy handmaid, saying, Assuredly Solomon thy son shall reign after me,  he shall sit upon my throne? Why then does Adonijah reign?
Kgs. Behold, while thou yet talk there with the king, I also will come in after thee,  confirm thy words.
Kgs. And Bathsheba went in to the king into the chamber. And the king was very old,  Abishag the Shunammite was ministering to the king.
Kgs. And Bathsheba bowed,  did obeisance to the king. And the king said, What do thou want?
Kgs. And she said to him, My lord, thou swore by Jehovah thy God to thy handmaid, saying, Assuredly Solomon thy son shall reign after me,  he shall sit upon my throne.
Kgs. And now, behold, Adonijah reigns,  thou, my lord the king, do not know it.
Kgs. And he has slain oxen and fatlings and sheep in abundance,  has called all the sons of the king,  Abiathar the priest,  Joab the captain of the army,  he has not called Solomon thy servant.
Kgs. And thou, my lord the king, the eyes of all Israel are upon thee, that thou should tell them who shall sit on the throne of my lord the king after him.
Kgs. Otherwise it will come to pass, when my lord the king shall sleep with his fathers, that I and my son Solomon shall be considered offenders.
Kgs. And, lo, while she yet talked with the king, Nathan the prophet came in.
Kgs. And they told the king, saying, Behold, Nathan the prophet. And when he came in before the king, he bowed himself before the king with his face to the ground.
Kgs. And Nathan said, My lord, O king, have thou said, Adonijah shall reign after me,  he shall sit upon my throne?
Kgs. For he has gone down this day,  has slain oxen and fatlings and sheep in abundance,  has called all the king's sons,  the captains of the army,  Abiathar the priest. And, behold, they are eating and drinking before him,  say, Live, king Adonijah.
Kgs. But me, even me thy servant,  Zadok the priest,  Benaiah the son of Jehoiada,  thy servant Solomon, he has not called.
Kgs. Is this thing done by my lord the king,  thou have not shown to thy servants who should sit on the throne of my lord the king after him?
Kgs. Then king David answered and said, Call Bathsheba to me. And she came into the king's presence,  stood before the king.
Kgs. And the king swore,  said, As Jehovah lives, who has redeemed my soul out of all adversity,
Kgs. truly as I swore to thee by Jehovah, the God of Israel, saying, Assuredly Solomon thy son shall reign after me,  he shall sit upon my throne in my stead. Surely so I will do this day.
Kgs. Then Bathsheba bowed with her face to the earth,  did obeisance to the king,  said, Let my lord king David live forever.
Kgs. And king David said, Call to me Zadok the priest,  Nathan the prophet,  Benaiah the son of Jehoiada. And they came before the king.
Kgs. And the king said to them, Take with you the servants of your lord,  cause Solomon my son to ride upon my own mule,  bring him down to Gihon.
Kgs. And let Zadok the priest and Nathan the prophet anoint him there king over Israel. And blow ye the trumpet,  say, Live, king Solomon.
Kgs. Then ye shall come up after him,  he shall come and sit upon my throne, for he shall be king in my stead. And I have appointed him to be prince over Israel and over Judah.
Kgs. And Benaiah the son of Jehoiada answered the king,  said, Truly. Jehovah, the God of my lord the king, say so too.
Kgs. As Jehovah has been with my lord the king, even so be he with Solomon,  make his throne greater than the throne of my lord king David.
Kgs. So Zadok the priest,  Nathan the prophet,  Benaiah the son of Jehoiada,  the Cherethites and the Pelethites, went down,  caused Solomon to ride upon king David's mule,  brought him to Gihon.
Kgs. And Zadok the priest took the horn of oil out of the tent,  anointed Solomon. And they blew the trumpet,  all the people said, Live, king Solomon.
Kgs. And all the people came up after him,  the people piped with pipes,  rejoiced with great joy, so that the earth quivered with the sound of them.
Kgs. And Adonijah and all the guests who were with him heard it as they had made an end of eating. And when Joab heard the sound of the trumpet, he said, Why is this noise of the city being in an uproar?
Kgs. While he yet spoke, behold, Jonathan the son of Abiathar the priest came. And Adonijah said, Come in, for thou are a worthy man,  bring good news.
Kgs. And Jonathan answered and said to Adonijah, Truly our lord king David has made Solomon king.
Kgs. And the king has sent with him Zadok the priest,  Nathan the prophet,  Benaiah the son of Jehoiada,  the Cherethites and the Pelethites. And they have caused him to ride upon the king's mule.
Kgs. And Zadok the priest and Nathan the prophet have anointed him king in Gihon. And they have come up from there rejoicing, so that the city rang again. This is the noise that ye have heard.
Kgs. And also Solomon sits on the throne of the kingdom.
Kgs. And moreover the king's servants came to bless our lord king David, saying, Thy God make the name of Solomon better than thy name,  make his throne greater than thy throne. And the king bowed himself upon the bed.
Kgs. And also thus said the king, Blessed be Jehovah, the God of Israel, who has given one of my seed to sit on my throne this day, my eyes even seeing it.
Kgs. And all the guests of Adonijah were afraid,  rose up,  every man went his way.
Kgs. And Adonijah feared because of Solomon. And he arose,  went,  caught hold on the horns of the altar.
Kgs. And it was told Solomon, saying, Behold, Adonijah fears king Solomon, for, lo, he has laid hold on the horns of the altar, saying, Let king Solomon swear to me first that he will not kill his servant with the sword.
Kgs. And Solomon said, If he shall show himself a worthy man, there shall not a hair of him fall to the earth,  if wickedness be found in him, he shall die.
Kgs. So king Solomon sent,  they brought him down from the altar. And he came and did obeisance to king Solomon. And Solomon said to him, Go to thy house.
Kgs. Now the days of David drew near that he should die. And he charged Solomon his son, saying,
Kgs. I am going the way of all the earth. Be thou strong therefore,  show thyself a man,
Kgs. and keep the charge of Jehovah thy God, to walk in his ways, to keep his statutes,  his commandments,  his ordinances,  his testimonies, according to that which is written in the law of Moses, that thou may prosper in all that thou do,  wherever thou turn thyself.
Kgs. That Jehovah may establish his word which he spoke concerning me, saying, If thy sons take heed to their way, to walk before me in truth with all their heart and with all their soul, there shall not fail thee a man on the throne of Israel.
Kgs. Moreover thou also know what Joab the son of Zeruiah did to me, even what he did to the two captains of the armies of Israel, to Abner the son of Ner,  to Amasa the son of Jether, whom he killed,  shed the blood of war in peace,  put the blood of war upon his belt that was about his loins,  in his shoes that were on his feet.
Kgs. Do therefore according to thy wisdom,  do not let his hoar head go down to Sheol in peace.
Kgs. But show kindness to the sons of Barzillai the Gileadite,  let them be of those who eat at thy table, for so they came to me when I fled from Absalom thy brother.
Kgs. And, behold, there is with thee Shimei the son of Gera, the Benjamite, of Bahurim, who cursed me with a grievous curse in the day when I went to Mahanaim. But he came down to meet me at the Jordan,  I swore to him by Jehovah, saying, I will not put thee to death with the sword.
Kgs. Now therefore do not hold him guiltless, for thou are a wise man,  thou will know what thou ought to do to him,  thou shall bring his hoar head down to Sheol with blood.
Kgs. And David slept with his fathers,  was buried in the city of David.
Kgs. And the days that David reigned over Israel were forty years. He reigned seven years in Hebron,  he reigned thirty-three years in Jerusalem.
Kgs. And Solomon sat upon the throne of David his father,  his kingdom was established greatly.
Kgs. Then Adonijah the son of Haggith came to Bathsheba the mother of Solomon. And she said, Do thou come peaceably? And he said, Peaceably.
Kgs. He said moreover, I have something to say to thee. And she said, Say on.
Kgs. And he said, Thou know that the kingdom was mine,  that all Israel set their faces on me, that I should reign. However the kingdom is turned about,  has become my brother's, for it was his from Jehovah.
Kgs. And now I ask one petition of thee; do not deny me. And she said to him, Say on.
Kgs. And he said, Speak, I pray thee, to Solomon the king (for he will not say no thee), that he give me Abishag the Shunammite to wife.
Kgs. And Bathsheba said, Well, I will speak for thee to the king.
Kgs. Bathsheba therefore went to king Solomon to speak to him for Adonijah. And the king rose up to meet her,  bowed himself to her,  sat down on his throne,  caused a throne to be set for the king's mother. And she sat on his right hand.
Kgs. Then she said, I ask one small petition of thee; do not deny me. And the king said to her, Ask on, my mother, for I will not deny thee.
Kgs. And she said, Let Abishag the Shunammite be given to Adonijah thy brother to wife.
Kgs. And king Solomon answered and said to his mother, And why do thou ask Abishag the Shunammite for Adonijah? Ask for him the kingdom also, for he is my elder brother, even for him,  for Abiathar the priest,  for Joab the son of Zeruiah.
Kgs. Then king Solomon swore by Jehovah, saying, God do so to me,  more also, if Adonijah has not spoken this word against his own life.
Kgs. Now therefore as Jehovah lives, who has established me,  set me on the throne of David my father,  who has made me a house as he promised, surely Adonijah shall be put to death this day.
Kgs. And king Solomon sent by Benaiah the son of Jehoiada,  he fell upon him so that he died.
Kgs. And the king said to Abiathar the priest, Get thee to Anathoth, to thine own fields, for thou are worthy of death. But I will not at this time put thee to death, because thou bore the ark of the lord Jehovah before David my father,  because thou were afflicted in all wherein my father was afflicted.
Kgs. So Solomon thrust out Abiathar from being priest to Jehovah, that he might fulfill the word of Jehovah, which he spoke concerning the house of Eli in Shiloh.
Kgs. And the news came to Joab, for Joab had turned after Adonijah, though he did not turn after Absalom. And Joab fled to the tent of Jehovah,  caught hold on the horns of the altar.
Kgs. And it was told king Solomon, Joab has fled to the tent of Jehovah, , behold, he is by the altar. Then Solomon sent Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, saying, Go, fall upon him.
Kgs. And Benaiah came to the tent of Jehovah,  said to him, Thus says the king, Come forth. And he said, No,  I will die here. And Benaiah brought the king word again, saying, Thus said Joab,  thus he answered me.
Kgs. And the king said to him, Do as he has said,  fall upon him,  bury him, that thou may take away the blood, which Joab shed without cause, from me and from my father's house.
Kgs. And Jehovah will return his blood upon his own head, because he fell upon two men more righteous and better than he,  killed them with the sword,  my father David did not know it, namely, Abner the son of Ner, captain of the army of Israel,  Amasa the son of Jether, captain of the army of Judah.
Kgs. So shall their blood return upon the head of Joab,  upon the head of his seed forever. But to David,  to his seed,  to his house,  to his throne, there shall be peace forever from Jehovah.
Kgs. Then Benaiah the son of Jehoiada went up,  fell upon him,  killed him. And he was buried in his own house in the wilderness.
Kgs. And the king put Benaiah the son of Jehoiada in his room over the army. And the king put Zadok the priest in the place of Abiathar.
Kgs. And the king sent and called for Shimei,  said to him, Build for thee a house in Jerusalem,  dwell there,  go not forth from there anywhere.
Kgs. For on the day thou go out,  pass over the brook Kidron, know thou for certain that thou shall surely die; thy blood shall be upon thine own head.
Kgs. And Shimei said to the king, The saying is good. As my lord the king has said, so will thy servant do. And Shimei dwelt in Jerusalem many days.
Kgs. And it came to pass at the end of three years, that two of the servants of Shimei ran away to Achish, son of Maacah, king of Gath. And they told Shimei, saying, Behold, thy servants are in Gath.
Kgs. And Shimei arose,  saddled his donkey,  went to Gath to Achish to seek his servants. And Shimei went,  brought his servants from Gath.
Kgs. And it was told Solomon that Shimei had gone from Jerusalem to Gath,  was come again.
Kgs. And the king sent and called for Shimei,  said to him, Did I not adjure thee by Jehovah,  protest to thee, saying, Know for certain, that on the day thou go out,  walk abroad anywhere, thou shall surely die? And thou said to me, The saying that I have heard is good.
Kgs. Why then have thou not kept the oath of Jehovah,  the commandment that I have charged thee with?
Kgs. The king said moreover to Shimei, Thou know all the iniquity which thy heart is privy to, what thou did to David my father. Therefore Jehovah shall return thy iniquity upon thine own head.
Kgs. But king Solomon shall be blessed,  the throne of David shall be established before Jehovah forever.
Kgs. So the king commanded Benaiah the son of Jehoiada. And he went out,  fell upon him so that he died. And the kingdom was established in the hand of Solomon.
Kgs. And Solomon made affinity with Pharaoh king of Egypt,  took Pharaoh's daughter,  brought her into the city of David until he had made an end of building his own house,  the house of Jehovah,  the wall of Jerusalem round about.
Kgs. Only the people sacrificed in the high places, because there was no house built for the name of Jehovah until those days.
Kgs. And Solomon loved Jehovah, walking in the statutes of David his father. Only he sacrificed and burnt incense in the high places.
Kgs. And the king went to Gibeon to sacrifice there, for that was the great high place. Solomon offered a thousand burnt offerings upon that altar.
Kgs. In Gibeon Jehovah appeared to Solomon in a dream by night,  God said, Ask what I shall give thee.
Kgs. And Solomon said, Thou have shown to thy servant David my father great loving kindness, according as he walked before thee in truth,  in righteousness,  in uprightness of heart with thee. And thou have kept for him this great loving kindness, that thou have given him a son to sit on his throne as it is this day.
Kgs. And now, O Jehovah my God, thou have made thy servant king instead of David my father. And I am but a little child; I know not how to go out or come in.
Kgs. And thy servant is in the midst of thy people which thou have chosen, a great people that cannot be numbered nor counted for multitude.
Kgs. Give thy servant therefore an understanding heart to judge thy people, that I may discern between good and evil, for who is able to judge this thy great people?
Kgs. And the speech pleased the Lord, that Solomon had asked this thing.
Kgs. And God said to him, Because thou have asked this thing,  have not asked for thyself long life, neither have asked riches for thyself, nor have asked the life of thine enemies,  have asked for thyself understanding to discern justice,
Kgs. behold, I have done according to thy word. Lo, I have given thee a wise and an understanding heart, so that there has been none like thee before thee, neither after thee shall any arise like thee.
Kgs. And I have also given thee that which thou have not asked, both riches and honor, so that there shall not be any among the kings like thee all thy days.
Kgs. And if thou will walk in my ways, to keep my statutes and my commandments, as thy father David walked, then I will lengthen thy days.
Kgs. And Solomon awoke, , behold, it was a dream. And he came to Jerusalem,  stood before the ark of the covenant of Jehovah,  offered up burnt offerings,  offered peace offerings,  made a feast to all his servants.
Kgs. Then two women who were harlots came to the king,  stood before him.
Kgs. And the one woman said, Oh, my lord, I and this woman dwell in one house. And I was delivered of a child with her in the house.
Kgs. And it came to pass the third day after I was delivered, that this woman was delivered also. And we were together; there was no stranger with us in the house, except we two in the house.
Kgs. And this woman's child died in the night, because she lay upon it.
Kgs. And she arose at midnight,  took my son from beside me while thy handmaid slept,  laid it in her bosom,  laid her dead child in my bosom.
Kgs. And when I rose in the morning to give my child suck, behold, it was dead. But when I had looked at it in the morning, behold, it was not my son whom I bore.
Kgs. And the other woman said, No,  the living is my son,  the dead is thy son. And the other woman said, No,  the dead is thy son,  the living is my son. Thus they spoke before the king.
Kgs. Then the king said, The one says, This is my son that lives,  thy son is the dead. And the other says, No,  thy son is the dead,  my son is the living.
Kgs. And the king said, Fetch me a sword. And they brought a sword before the king.
Kgs. And the king said, Divide the living child in two,  give half to the one,  half to the other.
Kgs. Then the woman whose the living child was spoke to the king, for her heart yearned over her son,  she said, Oh, my lord, give her the living child,  by no means kill it. But the other said, It shall be neither mine nor thine. Divide it.
Kgs. Then the king answered and said, Give her the living child,  by no means kill it; she is the mother of it.
Kgs. And all Israel heard of the judgment which the king had judged. And they feared the king, for they saw that the wisdom of God was in him, to do justice.
Kgs. And king Solomon was king over all Israel.
Kgs. And these were the rulers whom he had: Azariah the son of Zadok, the priest;
Kgs. Elihoreph and Ahijah, the sons of Shisha, scribes; Jehoshaphat the son of Ahilud, the recorder;
Kgs. and Benaiah the son of Jehoiada was over the army; and Zadok and Abiathar were priests;
Kgs. and Azariah the son of Nathan was over the officers; and Zabud the son of Nathan was chief minister,  the king's friend;
Kgs. and Ahishar was over the household; and Adoniram the son of Abda was over the men subject to task work.
Kgs. And Solomon had twelve officers over all Israel who provided provisions for the king and his household. Each man had to make provision for a month in the year.
Kgs. And these are their names: Ben-hur, in the hill-country of Ephraim;
Kgs. Ben-deker, in Makaz,  in Shaalbim,  Beth-shemesh,  Elon-beth-hanan;
Kgs. Ben-hesed, in Arubboth (to him pertained Socoh,  all the land of Hepher);
Kgs. Ben-abinadab, in all the height of Dor (he had Taphath the daughter of Solomon to wife);
Kgs. Baana the son of Ahilud, in Taanach and Megiddo,  all Beth-shean which is beside Zarethan, beneath Jezreel, from Beth-shean to Abel-meholah, as far as beyond Jokmeam;
Kgs. Ben-geber, in Ramoth-gilead (to him pertained the towns of Jair the son of Manasseh, which are in Gilead; even to him pertained the region of Argob, which is in Bashan, sixty great cities with walls and brazen bars);
Kgs. Ahinadab the son of Iddo, in Mahanaim;
Kgs. Ahimaaz, in Naphtali (he also took Basemath the daughter of Solomon to wife);
Kgs. Baana the son of Hushai, in Asher and Bealoth;
Kgs. Jehoshaphat the son of Paruah, in Issachar;
Kgs. Shimei the son of Ela, in Benjamin;
Kgs. Geber the son of Uri, in the land of Gilead, the country of Sihon king of the Amorites and of Og king of Bashan,  he was the only officer who was in the land.
Kgs. Judah and Israel were as many as the sand which is by the sea in multitude, eating and drinking and making merry.
Kgs. And Solomon ruled over all the kingdoms from the River to the land of the Philistines,  to the border of Egypt. They brought tribute,  served Solomon all the days of his life.
Kgs. And Solomon's provision for one day was thirty measures of fine flour,  sixty measures of meal,
Kgs. ten fat oxen,  twenty oxen out of the pastures,  a hundred sheep, besides harts,  gazelles,  roebucks,  fatted fowl.
Kgs. For he had dominion over all the region on this side the River, from Tiphsah even to Gaza, over all the kings on this side of the River. And he had peace on all sides round about him.
Kgs. And Judah and Israel dwelt safely, every man under his vine and under his fig tree, from Dan even to Beersheba, all the days of Solomon.
Kgs. And Solomon had forty thousand stalls of horses for his chariots,  twelve thousand horsemen.
Kgs. And those officers provided provisions for king Solomon,  for all who came to king Solomon's table, every man in his month; they let nothing be lacking.
Kgs. Barley also and straw for the horses and swift steeds they brought to the place where the officers were, every man according to his charge.
Kgs. And God gave Solomon exceedingly much wisdom and understanding,  largeness of heart, even as the sand that is on the sea-shore.
Kgs. And Solomon's wisdom excelled the wisdom of all the sons of the east,  all the wisdom of Egypt.
Kgs. For he was wiser than all men: than Ethan the Ezrahite,  Heman,  Calcol,  Darda, the sons of Mahol. And his fame was in all the nations round about.
Kgs. And he spoke three thousand proverbs,  his songs were a thousand and five.
Kgs. And he spoke of trees, from the cedar that is in Lebanon even to the hyssop that springs out of the wall. He spoke also of beasts,  of birds,  of creeping things,  of fishes.
Kgs. And there came of all peoples to hear the wisdom of Solomon, from all kings of the earth who had heard of his wisdom.
Kgs. And Hiram king of Tyre sent his servants to Solomon, for he had heard that they had anointed him king in the place of his father, for Hiram was ever a devotee of David.
Kgs. And Solomon sent to Hiram, saying,
Kgs. Thou know how that David my father could not build a house for the name of Jehovah his God for the wars which were about him on every side, until Jehovah put them under the soles of his feet.
Kgs. But now Jehovah my God has given me rest on every side; there is neither adversary, nor evil occurrence.
Kgs. And, behold, I purpose to build a house for the name of Jehovah my God, as Jehovah spoke to David my father, saying, Thy son, whom I will set upon thy throne in thy place, he shall build the house for my name.
Kgs. Now therefore command thou that they cut for me cedar trees out of Lebanon. And my servants shall be with thy servants. And I will give thee wages for thy servants according to all that thou shall say, for thou know that there is not among us any that knows how to cut timber like the Sidonians.
Kgs. And it came to pass, when Hiram heard the words of Solomon, that he rejoiced greatly,  said, Blessed be Jehovah this day, who has given to David a wise son over this great people.
Kgs. And Hiram sent to Solomon, saying, I have heard that which thou have sent to me. I will do all thy desire concerning timber of cedar,  concerning timber of fir.
Kgs. My servants shall bring them down from Lebanon to the sea. And I will make them into rafts to go by sea to the place that thou shall appoint me,  will cause them to be broken up there,  thou shall receive them. And thou shall accomplish my desire in giving food for my household.
Kgs. So Hiram gave Solomon timber of cedar and timber of fir according to all his desire.
Kgs. And Solomon gave Hiram twenty thousand measures of wheat for food to his household,  twenty measures of pure oil; thus Solomon gave to Hiram year by year.
Kgs. And Jehovah gave Solomon wisdom, as he promised him. And there was peace between Hiram and Solomon,  the two made a league together.
Kgs. And king Solomon raised a conscription out of all Israel,  the conscription was thirty thousand men.
Kgs. And he sent them to Lebanon, ten thousand a month by courses. They were in Lebanon a month,  at home two months. And Adoniram was over the men subject to task work.
Kgs. And Solomon had seventy thousand who bore burdens,  eighty thousand who were hewers in the mountains,
Kgs. besides Solomon's chief officers who were over the work: three thousand and three hundred who bore rule over the people that labored in the work.
Kgs. And the king commanded,  they hewed out great stones, costly stones, to lay the foundation of the house with shaped stone.
Kgs. And Solomon's builders and Hiram's builders and the Gebalites fashioned them,  prepared the timber and the stones to build the house.
Kgs. And it came to pass in the four hundred and eightieth year after the sons of Israel came out of the land of Egypt, in the fourth year of Solomon's reign over Israel, in the month Ziv, which is the second month, that he began to build the house of Jehovah.
Kgs. And the house which king Solomon built for Jehovah, the length of it was sixty cubits,  the breadth of it twenty,  the height of it thirty cubits,
Kgs. and the porch in front of the temple of the house, twenty cubits was the length of it, according to the breadth of the house,  ten cubits was the breadth of it in front of the house.
Kgs. And he made windows of fixed lattice-work for the house.
Kgs. And against the wall of the house he built stories round about, against the walls of the house round about, both of the temple and of the oracle. And he made side-chambers round about.
Kgs. The lowest story was five cubits broad,  the middle was six cubits broad,  the third was seven cubits broad, for on the outside he made offsets in the wall of the house round about, that the beams should not be fastened in the walls of the house.
Kgs. And the house, when it was being built, was built of stone made ready at the quarry. And there was neither hammer nor axe nor any tool of iron heard in the house, while it was being built.
Kgs. The door for the middle side-chambers was in the right side of the house. And they went up by winding stairs into the middle story,  out of the middle into the third.
Kgs. So he built the house,  finished it. And he covered the house with beams and planks of cedar.
Kgs. And he built the stories against all the house, each five cubits high: and they rested on the house with timber of cedar.
Kgs. And the word of Jehovah came to Solomon, saying,
Kgs. Concerning this house that thou are building, if thou will walk in my statutes,  execute my ordinances,  keep all my commandments to walk in them, then I will establish my word with thee, which I spoke to David thy father.
Kgs. And I will dwell among the sons of Israel,  will not forsake my people Israel.
Kgs. So Solomon built the house,  finished it.
Kgs. And he built the walls of the house inside with boards of cedar. From the floor of the house to the walls of the ceiling, he covered them on the inside with wood. And he covered the floor of the house with boards of fir.
Kgs. And he built twenty cubits on the hinder part of the house with boards of cedar from the floor to the walls of the ceiling. He built them for it inside, for an oracle, even for the most holy place.
Kgs. And the house, that is, the temple in front of the oracle, was forty cubits long.
Kgs. And there was cedar on the house inside, carved with knops and open flowers. All was cedar; there was no stone seen.
Kgs. And he prepared an oracle in the midst of the house inside, to set there the ark of the covenant of Jehovah.
Kgs. And inside the oracle was a space of twenty cubits in length,  twenty cubits in breadth,  twenty cubits in the height of it. And he overlaid it with pure gold. And he covered the altar with cedar.
Kgs. So Solomon overlaid the house inside with pure gold. And he drew chains of gold across before the oracle,  he overlaid it with gold.
Kgs. And the whole house he overlaid with gold until all the house was finished. Also the whole altar that belonged to the oracle he overlaid with gold.
Kgs. And in the oracle he made two cherubim of olive-wood, each ten cubits high.
Kgs. And five cubits was the one wing of the cherub,  five cubits the other wing of the cherub. From the outermost part of the one wing to the outermost part of the other were ten cubits.
Kgs. And the other cherub was ten cubits; both of the cherubim were of one measure and one form.
Kgs. The height of the one cherub was ten cubits,  so it was of the other cherub.
Kgs. And he set the cherubim inside the inner house. And the wings of the cherubim were stretched forth, so that the wing of the one touched the one wall,  the wing of the other cherub touched the other wall. And their wings touched each another in the middle of the house.
Kgs. And he overlaid the cherubim with gold.
Kgs. And he carved all the walls of the house round about with carved figures of cherubim and palm trees and open flowers, inside and outside.
Kgs. And the floor of the house he overlaid with gold, inside and outside.
Kgs. And for the entrance of the oracle he made doors of olive-wood. The lintel and door-posts were a fifth part of the wall.
Kgs. So he made two doors of olive-wood. And he carved upon them carvings of cherubim and palm trees and open flowers,  overlaid them with gold. And he spread the gold upon the cherubim,  upon the palm trees.
Kgs. So he also made for the entrance of the temple door-posts of olive-wood out of a fourth part of the wall,
Kgs. and two doors of fir-wood. The two leaves of the one door were folding,  the two leaves of the other door were folding.
Kgs. And he carved thereon cherubim and palm trees and open flowers. And he overlaid them with gold fitted upon the graven work.
Kgs. And he built the inner court with three courses of hewn stone,  a course of cedar beams.
Kgs. In the fourth year the foundation of the house of Jehovah was laid, in the month Ziv.
Kgs. And in the eleventh year, in the month Bul, which is the eighth month, the house was finished throughout all the parts of it,  according to all the fashion of it. So he was seven years in building it.
Kgs. And Solomon was thirteen years building his own house,  he finished all his house.
Kgs. For he built the house of the forest of Lebanon. The length of it was a hundred cubits,  the breadth of it fifty cubits,  the height of it thirty cubits, upon four rows of cedar pillars, with cedar beams upon the pillars.
Kgs. And it was covered with cedar above over the forty-five beams that were upon the pillars, fifteen in a row.
Kgs. And there were beams in three rows,  window was opposite window in three ranks.
Kgs. And all the doors and posts were made square with beams,  window was opposite window in three ranks.
Kgs. And he made the porch of pillars. The length of it was fifty cubits,  the breadth of it thirty cubits,  a porch in front of them,  pillars and a threshold in front of them.
Kgs. And he made the porch of the throne where he was to judge, even the porch of judgment. And it was covered with cedar from floor to floor.
Kgs. And his house where he was to dwell, the other court within the porch was of the like work. He also made a house for Pharaoh's daughter (whom Solomon had taken to wife), like this porch.
Kgs. All these were of costly stones, even of hewn stone, according to measure, sawed with saws, inside and outside, even from the foundation to the coping,  so on the outside to the great court.
Kgs. And the foundation was of costly stones, even great stones, stones of ten cubits,  stones of eight cubits.
Kgs. And above were costly stones, even hewn stone, according to measure,  cedar-wood.
Kgs. And the great court round about had three courses of hewn stone,  a course of cedar beams, like the inner court of the house of Jehovah,  the porch of the house.
Kgs. And king Solomon sent and fetched Hiram out of Tyre.
Kgs. He was the son of a widow of the tribe of Naphtali,  his father was a man of Tyre, a workman in brass. And he was filled with wisdom and understanding and skill, to work all works in brass. And he came to king Solomon,  wrought all his work.
Kgs. For he fashioned the two pillars of brass, eighteen cubits high apiece. And a line of twelve cubits encompassed each of them around.
Kgs. And he made two capitals of molten brass to set upon the tops of the pillars. The height of the one capital was five cubits,  the height of the other capital was five cubits.
Kgs. There were nets of checker-work,  wreaths of chain-work, for the capitals which were upon the top of the pillars; seven for the one capital,  seven for the other capital.
Kgs. So he made the pillars. And there were two rows round about upon the one network to cover the capitals that were upon the top of the pillars. And so he did for the other capital.
Kgs. And the capitals that were upon the top of the pillars in the porch were of lily-work, four cubits.
Kgs. And there were capitals also above upon the two pillars, close by the protuberance which was beside the network. And the pomegranates were two hundred, in rows round about upon the other capital.
Kgs. And he set up the pillars at the porch of the temple. And he set up the right pillar,  called the name of it Jachin,  he set up the left pillar,  called the name of it Boaz.
Kgs. And upon the top of the pillars was lily-work: so was the work of the pillars finished.
Kgs. And he made the molten sea of ten cubits from brim to brim, round in compass,  the height of it was five cubits. And a line of thirty cubits encompassed it round about.
Kgs. And under the brim of it round about there were knops which encompassed it, for ten cubits, encompassing the sea round about. The knops were in two rows, cast when it was cast.
Kgs. It stood upon twelve oxen, three looking toward the north,  three looking toward the west,  three looking toward the south,  three looking toward the east. And the sea was set upon them above,  all their hinder parts were inward.
Kgs. And it was a handbreadth thick. And the brim of it was wrought like the brim of a cup, like the flower of a lily. It held two thousand baths.
Kgs. And he made the ten bases of brass; four cubits was the length of one base,  four cubits the breadth of it,  three cubits the height of it.
Kgs. And the work of the bases was on this manner: They had panels,  there were panels between the ledges.
Kgs. And on the panels that were between the ledges were lions, oxen,  cherubim. And upon the ledges there was a pedestal above. And beneath the lions and oxen were wreaths of hanging work.
Kgs. And every base had four brazen wheels,  axles of brass. And the four corners of it had supports. Beneath the laver were the molten supports with wreaths at the side of each.
Kgs. And the mouth of it within the capital and above was a cubit. And the mouth of it was round after the work of a pedestal, a cubit and a half. And also upon the mouth of it were engravings. And their panels were foursquare, not round.
Kgs. And the four wheels were underneath the panels. And the axletrees of the wheels were in the base. And the height of a wheel was a cubit and half a cubit.
Kgs. And the work of the wheels was like the work of a chariot wheel. Their axletrees,  their felloes,  their spokes,  their naves, were all molten.
Kgs. And there were four supports at the four corners of each base. The supports of it were of the base itself.
Kgs. And in the top of the base there was a round band half a cubit high. And on the top of the base the ledges of it and the panels of it were of the same.
Kgs. And on the plates of the ledges of it,  on the panels of it, he engraved cherubim, lions,  palm trees, according to the space of each, with wreaths round about.
Kgs. After this manner he made the ten bases: all of them had one casting, one measure,  one form.
Kgs. And he made ten basins of brass. One basin contained forty baths. And every basin was four cubits. And upon every one of the ten bases one basin.
Kgs. And he set the bases, five on the right side of the house,  five on the left side of the house. And he set the sea on the right side of the house eastward, toward the south.
Kgs. And Hiram made the basins,  the shovels,  the bowls. So Hiram made an end of doing all the work that he wrought for king Solomon in the house of Jehovah:
Kgs. the two pillars,  the two bowls of the capitals that were on the top of the pillars,  the two networks to cover the two bowls of the capitals that were on the top of the pillars,
Kgs. and the four hundred pomegranates for the two networks, two rows of pomegranates for each network, to cover the two bowls of the capitals that were upon the pillars,
Kgs. and the ten bases,  the ten basins on the bases,
Kgs. and the one sea,  the twelve oxen under the sea,
Kgs. and the pots,  the shovels,  the bowls. And all these vessels, which Hiram made for king Solomon in the house of Jehovah were of burnished brass.
Kgs. The king cast them in the plain of the Jordan, in the clay ground between Succoth and Zarethan.
Kgs. And Solomon left all the vessels unweighed because they were very many; the weight of the brass could not be found out.
Kgs. And Solomon made all the vessels that were in the house of Jehovah: the golden altar,  the table whereupon the showbread was, of gold,
Kgs. and the lampstands, five on the right side,  five on the left, before the oracle, of pure gold,  the flowers,  the lamps,  the tongs, of gold,
Kgs. and the cups,  the snuffers,  the basins,  the spoons,  the firepans, of pure gold,  the hinges, both for the doors of the inner house, the most holy place,  for the doors of the house, namely, of the temple, of gold.
Kgs. Thus all the work that king Solomon wrought in the house of Jehovah was finished. And Solomon brought in the things which David his father had dedicated-the silver,  the gold,  the vessels-and put them in the treasuries of the house of Jehovah.
Kgs. Then Solomon assembled the elders of Israel,  all the heads of the tribes, the princes of the fathers of the sons of Israel, to king Solomon in Jerusalem, to bring up the ark of the covenant of Jehovah out of the city of David, which is Zion.
Kgs. And all the men of Israel assembled themselves to king Solomon at the feast, in the month Ethanim, which is the seventh month.
Kgs. And all the elders of Israel came,  the priests took up the ark.
Kgs. And they brought up the ark of Jehovah,  the tent of meeting,  all the holy vessels that were in the tent; even these the priests and the Levites brought up.
Kgs. And king Solomon and all the congregation of Israel, that were assembled to him, were with him before the ark, sacrificing sheep and oxen that could not be counted nor numbered for multitude.
Kgs. And the priests brought in the ark of the covenant of Jehovah to its place, into the oracle of the house, to the most holy place, even under the wings of the cherubim.
Kgs. For the cherubim spread forth their wings over the place of the ark,  the cherubim covered the ark and the staves of it above.
Kgs. And the staves were so long that the ends of the staves were seen from the holy place before the oracle. But they were not seen outside. And there they are to this day.
Kgs. There was nothing in the ark except the two tablets of stone which Moses put there at Horeb when Jehovah made a covenant with the sons of Israel, when they came out of the land of Egypt.
Kgs. And it came to pass, when the priests came out of the holy place, that the cloud filled the house of Jehovah,
Kgs. so that the priests could not stand to minister by reason of the cloud, for the glory of Jehovah filled the house of Jehovah.
Kgs. Then Solomon spoke, Jehovah has said that he would dwell in the thick darkness.
Kgs. I have surely built thee a house of habitation, a place for thee to dwell in forever.
Kgs. And the king turned his face around,  blessed all the assembly of Israel. And all the assembly of Israel stood.
Kgs. And he said, Blessed be Jehovah, the God of Israel, who spoke with his mouth to David my father,  has with his hand fulfilled it, saying,
Kgs. Since the day that I brought forth my people Israel out of Egypt, I chose no city out of all the tribes of Israel to build a house, that my name might be there,  I chose David to be over my people Israel.
Kgs. Now it was in the heart of David my father to build a house for the name of Jehovah, the God of Israel.
Kgs. But Jehovah said to David my father, Whereas it was in thy heart to build a house for my name, thou did well that it was in thy heart.
Kgs. Nevertheless thou shall not build the house,  thy son that shall come forth out of thy loins, he shall build the house for my name.
Kgs. And Jehovah has established his word that he spoke, for I have risen up in the place of David my father,  sit on the throne of Israel, as Jehovah promised,  have built the house for the name of Jehovah, the God of Israel.
Kgs. And there I have set a place for the ark, in which is the covenant of Jehovah, which he made with our fathers when he brought them out of the land of Egypt.
Kgs. And Solomon stood before the altar of Jehovah in the presence of all the assembly of Israel,  spread forth his hands toward heaven.
Kgs. And he said, O Jehovah, the God of Israel, there is no God like thee, in heaven above, or on earth beneath, who keeps covenant and loving kindness with thy servants, who walk before thee with all their heart,
Kgs. who have kept with thy servant David my father that which thou did promise him. Yea, thou spoke with thy mouth,  have fulfilled it with thy hand, as it is this day.
Kgs. Now therefore, O Jehovah, the God of Israel, keep with thy servant David my father that which thou have promised him, saying, There shall not fail thee a man in my sight to sit on the throne of Israel, if only thy sons take heed to their way, to walk before me as thou have walked before me.
Kgs. Now therefore, O God of Israel, let thy word, I pray thee, be verified, which thou spoke to thy servant David my father.
Kgs. But will God indeed dwell on the earth? Behold, heaven and the heaven of heavens cannot contain thee. How much less this house that I have built!
Kgs. Yet have thou respect to the prayer of thy servant,  to his supplication, O Jehovah my God, to hearken to the cry and to the prayer which thy servant prays before thee this day,
Kgs. that thine eyes may be open toward this house night and day, even toward the place whereof thou have said, My name shall be there, to hearken to the prayer which thy servant shall pray toward this place.
Kgs. And hearken thou to the supplication of thy servant,  of thy people Israel, when they shall pray toward this place. Yea, hear thou in heaven thy dwelling-place,  when thou hear, forgive.
Kgs. If a man sins against his neighbor,  an oath be laid upon him to cause him to swear,  he comes and swears before thine altar in this house,
Kgs. then hear thou in heaven,  do,  judge thy servants, condemning the wicked, to bring his way upon his own head,  justifying the righteous, to give him according to his righteousness.
Kgs. When thy people Israel are smitten down before the enemy because they have sinned against thee, if they turn again to thee,  confess thy name,  pray and make supplication to thee in this house,
Kgs. then hear thou in heaven,  forgive the sin of thy people Israel,  bring them again to the land which thou gave to their fathers.
Kgs. When heaven is shut up,  there is no rain because they have sinned against thee, if they pray toward this place,  confess thy name,  turn from their sin when thou afflict them,
Kgs. then hear thou in heaven,  forgive the sin of thy servants,  of thy people Israel, when thou teach them the good way wherein they should walk,  send rain upon thy land, which thou have given to thy people for an inheritance.
Kgs. If there be famine in the land, if there be pestilence, if there be blight, mildew, locust or caterpillar, if their enemy besiege them in the land of their cities, whatever plague, whatever sickness there be,
Kgs. whatever prayer and supplication be made by any man, or by all thy people Israel, who shall know every man the plague of his own heart,  spread forth his hands toward this house,
Kgs. then hear thou in heaven thy dwelling-place,  forgive,  do,  render to every man according to all his ways, whose heart thou know (for thou, even thou only, know the hearts of all the sons of men),
Kgs. that they may fear thee all the days that they live in the land which thou gave to our fathers.
Kgs. Moreover concerning the foreigner who is not of thy people Israel, when he shall come out of a far country for thy name's sake
Kgs. (for they shall hear of thy great name,  of thy mighty hand,  of thine outstretched arm), when he shall come and pray toward this house,
Kgs. hear thou in heaven thy dwelling-place,  do according to all that the foreigner calls to thee for, that all the peoples of the earth may know thy name, to fear thee, as does thy people Israel,  that they may know that this house which I have built is called by thy name.
Kgs. If thy people go out to battle against their enemy, by whatever way thou shall send them,  they pray to Jehovah toward the city which thou have chosen,  toward the house which I have built for thy name,
Kgs. then hear thou in heaven their prayer and their supplication,  maintain their cause.
Kgs. If they sin against thee (for there is no man that sins not),  thou be angry with them,  deliver them to the enemy, so that they carry them away captive to the land of the enemy, afar off or near,
Kgs. yet if they shall rethink themselves in the land where they are carried captive,  turn again,  make supplication to thee in the land of those who carried them captive, saying, We have sinned,  have done perversely, we have dealt wickedly,
Kgs. if they return to thee with all their heart and with all their soul in the land of their enemies who carried them captive,  pray to thee toward their land, which thou gave to their fathers, the city which thou have chosen,  the house which I have built for thy name,
Kgs. then hear thou their prayer and their supplication in heaven thy dwelling-place,  maintain their case,
Kgs. and forgive thy people who have sinned against thee,  all their transgressions by which they have transgressed against thee,  give them compassion before those who carried them captive, that they may have compassion on them
Kgs. (for they are thy people,  thine inheritance, which thou brought forth out of Egypt, from the midst of the furnace of iron);
Kgs. that thine eyes may be open to the supplication of thy servant,  to the supplication of thy people Israel, to hearken to them whenever they cry to thee.
Kgs. For thou separated them from among all the peoples of the earth, to be thine inheritance, as thou spoke by Moses thy servant when thou brought our fathers out of Egypt, O lord Jehovah.
Kgs. And it was so, that, when Solomon had made an end of praying all this prayer and supplication to Jehovah, he arose from before the altar of Jehovah, from kneeling on his knees with his hands spread forth toward heaven.
Kgs. And he stood,  blessed all the assembly of Israel with a loud voice, saying,
Kgs. Blessed be Jehovah, who has given rest to his people Israel according to all that he promised. There has not failed one word of all his good promise, which he promised by Moses his servant.
Kgs. Jehovah our God be with us as he was with our fathers. Let him not leave us, nor forsake us,
Kgs. that he may incline our hearts to him, to walk in all his ways,  to keep his commandments,  his statutes,  his ordinances, which he commanded our fathers.
Kgs. And let these my words, with which I have made supplication before Jehovah, be near to Jehovah our God day and night, that he maintain the cause of his servant,  the cause of his people Israel, as every day shall require,
Kgs. that all the peoples of the earth may know that Jehovah, he is God; there is none else.
Kgs. Let your heart therefore be perfect with Jehovah our God, to walk in his statutes,  to keep his commandments, as at this day.
Kgs. And the king,  all Israel with him, offered sacrifice before Jehovah.
Kgs. And Solomon offered for the sacrifice of peace offerings, which he offered to Jehovah, twenty-two thousand oxen,  a hundred and twenty thousand sheep. So the king and all the sons of Israel dedicated the house of Jehovah.
Kgs. The same day the king hallowed the middle of the court that was before the house of Jehovah, for there he offered the burnt offering,  the meal offering,  the fat of the peace offerings, because the brazen altar that was before Jehovah was too little to receive the burnt offering,  the meal offering,  the fat of the peace offerings.
Kgs. So Solomon held the feast at that time,  all Israel with him, a great assembly, from the entrance of Hamath to the brook of Egypt, before Jehovah our God, seven days and seven days, even fourteen days.
Kgs. On the eighth day he sent the people away. And they blessed the king,  went to their tents joyful and glad of heart for all the goodness that Jehovah had shown to David his servant,  to Israel his people.
Kgs. And it came to pass, when Solomon had finished the building of the house of Jehovah,  the king's house,  all Solomon's desire which he was pleased to do,
Kgs. that Jehovah appeared to Solomon the second time, as he had appeared to him at Gibeon.
Kgs. And Jehovah said to him, I have heard thy prayer and thy supplication, which thou have made before me. I have hallowed this house, which thou have built, to put my name there forever. And my eyes and my heart shall be there perpetually.
Kgs. And as for thee, if thou will walk before me, as David thy father walked, in integrity of heart,  in uprightness, to do according to all that I have commanded thee,  will keep my statutes and my ordinances,
Kgs. then I will establish the throne of thy kingdom over Israel forever, according as I promised to David thy father, saying, There shall not fail thee a man upon the throne of Israel.
Kgs. But if ye shall turn away from following me, ye or your sons,  not keep my commandments and my statutes which I have set before you,  shall go and serve other gods,  worship them,
Kgs. then will I cut off Israel out of the land which I have given them. And this house, which I have hallowed for my name, will I cast out of my sight. And Israel shall be a proverb and a byword among all peoples.
Kgs. And though this house is so high, yet shall every man who passes by it be astonished,  shall hiss. And they shall say, Why has Jehovah done thus to this land,  to this house?
Kgs. and they shall answer, Because they forsook Jehovah their God, who brought forth their fathers out of the land of Egypt,  laid hold on other gods,  worshiped them,  served them; therefore has Jehovah brought all this evil upon them.
Kgs. And it came to pass at the end of twenty years, in which Solomon had built the two houses, the house of Jehovah and the king's house
Kgs. (now Hiram the king of Tyre had furnished Solomon with cedar trees and fir trees,  with gold, according to all his desire), that king Solomon then gave Hiram twenty cities in the land of Galilee.
Kgs. And Hiram came out from Tyre to see the cities which Solomon had given him. And they did not please him.
Kgs. And he said, What cities are these which thou have given me, my brother? And he called them the land of Cabul to this day.
Kgs. And Hiram sent to the king one hundred and twenty talents of gold.
Kgs. And this is the reason for the conscription which king Solomon raised: to build the house of Jehovah,  his own house,  Millo,  the wall of Jerusalem,  Hazor,  Megiddo,  Gezer.
Kgs. Pharaoh king of Egypt had gone up,  taken Gezer,  burnt it with fire,  slain the Canaanites who dwelt in the city,  given it for a portion to his daughter, Solomon's wife.
Kgs. And Solomon built Gezer,  Beth-horon the nether,
Kgs. and Baalath,  Tamar in the wilderness, in the land,
Kgs. and all the store-cities that Solomon had,  the cities for his chariots,  the cities for his horsemen,  that which Solomon desired to build for his pleasure in Jerusalem,  in Lebanon,  in all the land of his dominion.
Kgs. As for all the people who were left of the Amorites, the Hittites, the Perizzites, the Hivites,  the Jebusites, who were not of the sons of Israel,
Kgs. their sons who were left after them in the land, whom the sons of Israel were not able utterly to destroy, of them Solomon raised a conscription of bondservants to this day.
Kgs. But of the sons of Israel Solomon made no bondservants,  they were the men of war,  his servants,  his rulers,  his captains,  rulers of his chariots and of his horsemen.
Kgs. These were the chief officers who were over Solomon's work, five hundred and fifty, who bore rule over the people that labored in the work.
Kgs. But Pharaoh's daughter came up out of the city of David to her house which Solomon had built for her. Then he built Millo.
Kgs. And three times a year Solomon offered burnt offerings and peace offerings upon the altar which he built to Jehovah, burning incense therewith, upon the altar that was before Jehovah. So he finished the house.
Kgs. And king Solomon made a navy of ships in Ezion-geber, which is beside Eloth, on the shore of the Red Sea, in the land of Edom.
Kgs. And Hiram sent in the navy his servants, shipmen who had knowledge of the sea, with the servants of Solomon.
Kgs. And they came to Ophir,  fetched gold from there, four hundred and twenty talents,  brought it to king Solomon.
Kgs. And when the queen of Sheba heard of the fame of Solomon concerning the name of Jehovah, she came to prove him with hard questions.
Kgs. And she came to Jerusalem with a very great train, with camels that bore spices,  very much gold,  precious stones. And when she came to Solomon, she conversed with him of all that was in her heart.
Kgs. And Solomon answered to her all her questions; there was not anything hid from the king which he did not answer.
Kgs. And when the queen of Sheba had seen all the wisdom of Solomon,  the house that he had built,
Kgs. and the food of his table,  the seating of his servants,  the attendance of his ministers,  their apparel,  his cupbearers,  his ascent by which he went up to the house of Jehovah, there was no more spirit in her.
Kgs. And she said to the king, It was a true report that I heard in my own land of thine acts,  of thy wisdom.
Kgs. However I did not believe the words until I came,  my eyes had seen it. And, behold, the half was not told me; thy wisdom and prosperity exceed the fame which I heard.
Kgs. Happy are thy men, happy are these thy servants, who stand continually before thee, who hear thy wisdom.
Kgs. Blessed be Jehovah thy God, who delighted in thee to set thee on the throne of Israel. Because Jehovah loved Israel forever, therefore he made thee king, to do justice and righteousness.
Kgs. And she gave the king a hundred and twenty talents of gold,  of spices a very great store,  precious stones. There came no more such abundance of spices as these which the queen of Sheba gave to king Solomon.
Kgs. And the navy also of Hiram, that brought gold from Ophir, brought in from Ophir great plenty of almug trees and precious stones.
Kgs. And the king made pillars of the almug trees for the house of Jehovah,  for the king's house, also harps and psalteries for the singers. There have come no such almug trees, nor were seen, to this day.
Kgs. And king Solomon gave to the queen of Sheba all her desire, whatever she asked, besides that which Solomon gave her of his royal bounty. So she turned,  went to her own land, she and her servants.
Kgs. Now the weight of gold that came to Solomon in one year was six hundred sixty and six talents of gold,
Kgs. besides that which the traders brought,  the traffic of the merchants,  of all the kings of Arabia,  of the governors of the country.
Kgs. And king Solomon made two hundred bucklers of beaten gold; six hundred shekels of gold went to one buckler.
Kgs. And he made three hundred shields of beaten gold; three pounds of gold went to one shield. And the king put them in the house of the forest of Lebanon.
Kgs. Moreover the king made a great throne of ivory,  overlaid it with the finest gold.
Kgs. There were six steps to the throne,  the top of the throne was round behind. And there were supports on either side by the place of the seat,  two lions standing beside the supports.
Kgs. And twelve lions stood there on the one side and on the other upon the six steps. There was not the like made in any kingdom.
Kgs. And all king Solomon's drinking vessels were of gold,  all the vessels of the house of the forest of Lebanon were of pure gold. None were of silver; it was accounted of nothing in the days of Solomon.
Kgs. For the king had at sea a navy of Tarshish with the navy of Hiram. Once every three years the navy of Tarshish came, bringing gold,  silver, ivory,  apes,  peacocks.
Kgs. So king Solomon exceeded all the kings of the earth in riches and in wisdom.
Kgs. And all the earth sought the presence of Solomon, to hear his wisdom, which God had put in his heart.
Kgs. And every man brought his tribute, vessels of silver,  vessels of gold,  raiment,  armor,  spices, horses,  mules, a rate year by year.
Kgs. And Solomon gathered together chariots and horsemen. And he had a thousand and four hundred chariots,  twelve thousand horsemen, that he bestowed in the chariot cities,  with the king at Jerusalem.
Kgs. And the king made silver to be in Jerusalem as stones,  cedars he made to be as the sycamore trees that are in the lowland, for abundance.
Kgs. And the horses which Solomon had were brought out of Egypt. And the king's merchants received them in herds, each herd at a price.
Kgs. And a chariot came up and went out of Egypt for six hundred shekels of silver,  a horse for a hundred and fifty. And so for all the kings of the Hittites,  for the kings of Syria, they brought them out by their means.
Kgs. Now king Solomon loved many foreign women, together with the daughter of Pharaoh, women of the Moabites, Ammonites, Edomites, Sidonians,  Hittites,
Kgs. of the nations concerning which Jehovah said to the sons of Israel, Ye shall not go among them, neither shall they come among you, for surely they will turn away your heart after their gods. Solomon clave to these in love.
Kgs. And he had seven hundred wives, princesses,  three hundred concubines. And his wives turned away his heart.
Kgs. For it came to pass, when Solomon was old, that his wives turned away his heart after other gods. And his heart was not perfect with Jehovah his God as was the heart of David his father.
Kgs. For Solomon went after Ashtoreth the goddess of the Sidonians,  after Milcom the abomination of the Ammonites.
Kgs. And Solomon did that which was evil in the sight of Jehovah,  went not fully after Jehovah as did David his father.
Kgs. Then Solomon built a high place for Chemosh the abomination of Moab on the mount that is before Jerusalem,  for Molech the abomination of the sons of Ammon.
Kgs. And so he did for all his foreign wives, who burnt incense and sacrificed to their gods.
Kgs. And Jehovah was angry with Solomon because his heart was turned away from Jehovah, the God of Israel, who had appeared to him twice,
Kgs. and had commanded him concerning this thing, that he should not go after other gods. But he did not keep that which Jehovah commanded.
Kgs. Therefore Jehovah said to Solomon, Forasmuch as this is done by thee,  thou have not kept my covenant and my statutes, which I have commanded thee, I will surely rend the kingdom from thee,  will give it to thy servant.
Kgs. Notwithstanding I will not do it in thy days, for David thy father's sake,  I will rend it out of the hand of thy son.
Kgs. However I will not rend away all the kingdom,  I will give one tribe to thy son, for David my servant's sake,  for Jerusalem's sake which I have chosen.
