Kgs. And Jehovah raised up an adversary to Solomon, Hadad the Edomite. He was of the king's seed in Edom.
Kgs. For it came to pass, when David was in Edom,  Joab the captain of the army was gone up to bury the slain,  had smitten every male in Edom
Kgs. (for Joab and all Israel remained there six months until he had cut off every male in Edom),
Kgs. that Hadad fled, he and certain Edomites of his father's servants with him, to go into Egypt, Hadad being yet a little child.
Kgs. And they arose out of Midian,  came to Paran. And they took men with them out of Paran,  they came to Egypt, to Pharaoh king of Egypt, who gave him a house,  appointed him provisions,  gave him land.
Kgs. And Hadad found great favor in the sight of Pharaoh, so that he gave him to wife the sister of his own wife, the sister of Tahpenes the queen.
Kgs. And the sister of Tahpenes bore him Genubath his son, whom Tahpenes weaned in Pharaoh's house. And Genubath was in Pharaoh's house among the sons of Pharaoh.
Kgs. And when Hadad heard in Egypt that David slept with his fathers,  that Joab the captain of the army was dead, Hadad said to Pharaoh, Let me depart that I may go to my own country.
Kgs. Then Pharaoh said to him, But what have thou lacked with me, that, behold, thou seek to go to thine own country? And he answered, Nothing, however only let me depart.
Kgs. And God raised up another adversary to him, Rezon the son of Eliada, who had fled from his lord Hadadezer king of Zobah.
Kgs. And he gathered men to him,  became captain over a troop when David killed them of Zobah. And they went to Damascus,  dwelt therein,  reigned in Damascus.
Kgs. And he was an adversary to Israel all the days of Solomon, besides the mischief that Hadad did. And he abhorred Israel,  reigned over Syria.
Kgs. And Jeroboam the son of Nebat, an Ephraimite of Zeredah, a servant of Solomon whose mother's name was Zeruah, a widow, he also lifted up his hand against the king.
Kgs. And this was the reason why he lifted up his hand against the king: Solomon built Millo,  repaired the breach of the city of David his father.
Kgs. And the man Jeroboam was a mighty man of valor. And Solomon saw the young man that he was industrious,  he gave him charge over all the labor of the house of Joseph.
Kgs. And it came to pass at that time, when Jeroboam went out of Jerusalem, that the prophet Ahijah the Shilonite found him in the way. Now Ahijah had clad himself with a new garment,  the two were alone in the field.
Kgs. And Ahijah laid hold of the new garment that was on him,  tore it in twelve pieces.
Kgs. And he said to Jeroboam, Take thee ten pieces, for thus says Jehovah, the God of Israel, Behold, I will rend the kingdom out of the hand of Solomon,  will give ten tribes to thee
Kgs. (but he shall have one tribe, for my servant David's sake and for Jerusalem's sake, the city which I have chosen out of all the tribes of Israel),
Kgs. because that they have forsaken me,  have worshiped Ashtoreth the goddess of the Sidonians, Chemosh the god of Moab,  Milcom the god of the sons of Ammon. And they have not walked in my ways, to do that which is right in my eyes,  to keep my statutes and my ordinances as David his father did.
Kgs. However I will not take the whole kingdom out of his hand,  I will make him prince all the days of his life, for David my servant's sake whom I chose, who kept my commandments and my statutes.
Kgs. But I will take the kingdom out of his son's hand,  will give it to thee, even ten tribes.
Kgs. And I will give one tribe to his son, that David my servant may have a lamp always before me in Jerusalem, the city which I have chosen for me to put my name there.
Kgs. And I will take thee,  thou shall reign according to all that thy soul desires,  shall be king over Israel.
Kgs. And it shall be, if thou will hearken to all that I command thee,  will walk in my ways,  do that which is right in my eyes, to keep my statutes and my commandments, as David my servant did. That I will be with thee,  will build thee a sure house as I built for David,  will give Israel to thee.
Kgs. And for this I will afflict the seed of David,  not forever.
Kgs. Solomon therefore sought to kill Jeroboam. But Jeroboam arose,  fled into Egypt, to Shishak king of Egypt,  was in Egypt until the death of Solomon.
Kgs. Now the rest of the acts of Solomon,  all that he did,  his wisdom, are they not written in the book of the acts of Solomon?
Kgs. And the time that Solomon reigned in Jerusalem over all Israel was forty years.
Kgs. And Solomon slept with his fathers,  was buried in the city of David his father. And Rehoboam his son reigned in his stead.
Kgs. And Rehoboam went to Shechem, for all Israel came to Shechem to make him king.
Kgs. And it came to pass, when Jeroboam the son of Nebat heard of it (for he was yet in Egypt where he had fled from the presence of king Solomon,  Jeroboam dwelt in Egypt,
Kgs. and they sent and called him), that Jeroboam and all the assembly of Israel came,  spoke to Rehoboam, saying,
Kgs. Thy father made our yoke grievous. Now therefore make thou lighter the grievous service of thy father,  his heavy yoke which he put upon us,  we will serve thee.
Kgs. And he said to them, Depart yet for three days, then come again to me. And the people departed.
Kgs. And king Rehoboam took counsel with the old men who had stood before Solomon his father while he yet lived, saying, What counsel give ye to me to return an answer to this people?
Kgs. And they spoke to him, saying, If thou will be a servant to this people this day,  will serve them,  answer them,  speak good words to them, then they will be thy servants forever.
Kgs. But he forsook the counsel of the old men, which they had given him,  took counsel with the young men that grew up with him, who stood before him.
Kgs. And he said to them, What counsel give ye, that we may return an answer to this people who have spoken to me, saying, Make the yoke that thy father put upon us lighter?
Kgs. And the young men that grew up with him spoke to him, saying, Thus shall thou say to this people that spoke to thee, saying, Thy father made our yoke heavy,  make thou it lighter to us; thus shall thou speak to them, My little finger is thicker than my father's loins.
Kgs. And now whereas my father burdened you with a heavy yoke, I will add to your yoke. My father chastised you with whips,  I will chastise you with scorpions.
Kgs. So Jeroboam and all the people came to Rehoboam the third day, as the king bade, saying, Come to me again the third day.
Kgs. And the king answered the people roughly,  forsook the counsel of the old men which they had given him,
Kgs. and spoke to them after the counsel of the young men, saying, My father made your yoke heavy,  I will add to your yoke. My father chastised you with whips,  I will chastise you with scorpions.
Kgs. So the king did not hearken to the people, for it was a thing brought about by Jehovah, that he might establish his word, which Jehovah spoke by Ahijah the Shilonite to Jeroboam the son of Nebat.
Kgs. And when all Israel saw that the king did not hearken to them, the people answered the king, saying, What portion have we in David? Neither have we inheritance in the son of Jesse. To your tents, O Israel. Now see to thine own house, David. So Israel departed to their tents.
Kgs. But as for the sons of Israel who dwelt in the cities of Judah, Rehoboam reigned over them.
Kgs. Then king Rehoboam sent Adoram who was over the men subject to task work. And all Israel stoned him to death with stones. And king Rehoboam made speed to get up to his chariot, to flee to Jerusalem.
Kgs. So Israel rebelled against the house of David to this day.
Kgs. And it came to pass, when all Israel heard that Jeroboam was returned, that they sent and called him to the congregation,  made him king over all Israel. There was none that followed the house of David,  only the tribe of Judah.
Kgs. And when Rehoboam came to Jerusalem, he assembled all the house of Judah,  the tribe of Benjamin, a hundred and eighty thousand chosen men, who were warriors, to fight against the house of Israel, to bring the kingdom again to Rehoboam the son of Solomon.
Kgs. But the word of God came to Shemaiah the man of God, saying,
Kgs. Speak to Rehoboam the son of Solomon, king of Judah,  to all the house of Judah and Benjamin,  to the rest of the people, saying,
Kgs. Thus says Jehovah, Ye shall not go up, nor fight against your brothers the sons of Israel. Return every man to his house, for this thing is of me. So they hearkened to the word of Jehovah,  returned and went their way according to the word of Jehovah.
Kgs. Then Jeroboam built Shechem in the hill-country of Ephraim,  dwelt therein. And he went out from there,  built Penuel.
Kgs. And Jeroboam said in his heart, Now the kingdom will return to the house of David.
Kgs. If this people go up to offer sacrifices in the house of Jehovah at Jerusalem, then the heart of this people will turn again to their lord, even to Rehoboam king of Judah. And they will kill me,  return to Rehoboam king of Judah.
Kgs. Whereupon the king took counsel,  made two calves of gold. And he said to them, It is too much for you to go up to Jerusalem. Behold thy gods, O Israel, which brought thee up out of the land of Egypt.
Kgs. And he set the one in Bethel,  the other he put in Dan.
Kgs. And this thing became a sin, for the people went to worship before the one, even to Dan.
Kgs. And he made houses of high places,  made priests from among all the people who were not of the sons of Levi.
Kgs. And Jeroboam ordained a feast in the eighth month, on the fifteenth day of the month, like the feast that is in Judah,  he went up to the altar. So he did in Bethel, sacrificing to the calves that he had made. And he placed in Bethel the priests of the high places that he had made.
Kgs. And he went up to the altar which he had made in Bethel on the fifteenth day in the eighth month, even in the month which he had devised of his own heart. And he ordained a feast for the sons of Israel,  went up to the altar to burn incense.
Kgs. And, behold, there came a man of God out of Judah by the word of Jehovah to Bethel. And Jeroboam was standing by the altar to burn incense.
Kgs. And he cried against the altar by the word of Jehovah,  said, O altar, altar, thus says Jehovah: Behold, a son shall be born to the house of David, Josiah by name. And upon thee shall he sacrifice the priests of the high places that burn incense upon thee,  men's bones they shall burn upon thee.
Kgs. And he gave a sign the same day, saying, This is the sign which Jehovah has spoken: Behold, the altar shall be torn,  the ashes that are upon it shall be poured out.
Kgs. And it came to pass, when the king heard the saying of the man of God, which he cried against the altar in Bethel, that Jeroboam put forth his hand from the altar, saying, Lay hold on him. And his hand, which he put forth against him, dried up, so that he could not draw it back again to him.
Kgs. The altar also was torn,  the ashes poured out from the altar, according to the sign which the man of God had given by the word of Jehovah.
Kgs. And the king answered and said to the man of God, Entreat now the favor of Jehovah thy God,  pray for me that my hand may be restored to me again. And the man of God entreated Jehovah,  the king's hand was restored to him again,  became as it was before.
Kgs. And the king said to the man of God, Come home with me,  refresh thyself,  I will give thee a reward.
Kgs. And the man of God said to the king, If thou will give me half thy house, I will not go in with thee, neither will I eat bread nor drink water in this place;
Kgs. for so it was charged me by the word of Jehovah, saying, Thou shall eat no bread, nor drink water, neither return by the way that thou came.
Kgs. So he went another way,  returned not by the way that he came to Bethel.
Kgs. Now there dwelt an old prophet in Bethel. And one of his sons came and told him all the works that the man of God had done that day in Bethel. The words which he had spoken to the king, they also told them to their father.
Kgs. And their father said to them, What way did he go? Now his sons had seen what way the man of God went, who came from Judah.
Kgs. And he said to his sons, Saddle the donkey for me. So they saddled him the donkey,  he rode on it.
Kgs. And he went after the man of God,  found him sitting under an oak. And he said to him, Are thou the man of God who came from Judah? And he said, I am.
Kgs. Then he said to him, Come home with me,  eat bread.
Kgs. And he said, I may not return with thee, nor go in with thee. Neither will I eat bread nor drink water with thee in this place;
Kgs. for it was said to me by the word of Jehovah, Thou shall eat no bread nor drink water there, nor turn again to go by the way that thou came.
Kgs. And he said to him, I also am a prophet as thou are. And an agent spoke to me by the word of Jehovah, saying, Bring him back with thee into thy house that he may eat bread and drink water. But he lied to him.
Kgs. So he went back with him,  ate bread in his house,  drank water.
Kgs. And it came to pass, as they sat at the table, that the word of Jehovah came to the prophet who brought him back.
Kgs. And he cried out to the man of God who came from Judah, saying, Thus says Jehovah, Forasmuch as thou have been disobedient to the mouth of Jehovah,  have not kept the commandment which Jehovah thy God commanded thee,
Kgs. but came back,  have eaten bread and drunk water in the place of which he said to thee, Eat no bread,  drink no water, thy body shall not come to the sepulcher of thy fathers.
Kgs. And it came to pass, after he had eaten bread,  after he had drunk, that he saddled the donkey for him, namely, for the prophet whom he had brought back.
Kgs. And when he was gone, a lion met him by the way,  killed him. And his body was cast in the way,  the donkey stood by it. The lion also stood by the body.
Kgs. And, behold, men passed by,  saw the body cast in the way,  the lion standing by the body. And they came and told it in the city where the old prophet dwelt.
Kgs. And when the prophet who brought him back from the way heard of it, he said, It is the man of God who was disobedient to the mouth of Jehovah. Therefore Jehovah has delivered him to the lion, which has torn him,  slain him, according to the word of Jehovah which he spoke to him.
Kgs. And he spoke to his sons, saying, Saddle the donkey for me. And they saddled it.
Kgs. And he went and found his body cast in the way,  the donkey and the lion standing by the body. The lion had not eaten the body, nor torn the donkey.
Kgs. And the prophet took up the body of the man of God,  laid it upon the donkey,  brought it back. And he came to the city of the old prophet, to mourn,  to bury him.
Kgs. And he laid his body in his own grave. And they mourned over him, saying, Alas, my brother!
Kgs. And it came to pass, after he had buried him, that he spoke to his sons, saying, When I am dead, then bury me in the sepulcher in which the man of God is buried. Lay my bones beside his bones.
Kgs. For the saying which he cried by the word of Jehovah against the altar in Bethel,  against all the houses of the high places which are in the cities of Samaria, shall surely come to pass.
Kgs. After this thing Jeroboam did not return from his evil way,  again made from among all the people priests of the high places. Whoever would, he consecrated him, that there might be priests of the high places.
Kgs. And this thing became sin to the house of Jeroboam, even to cut it off,  to destroy it from off the face of the earth.
Kgs. At that time Abijah the son of Jeroboam fell sick.
Kgs. And Jeroboam said to his wife, Arise, I pray thee,  disguise thyself that thou not be known to be the wife of Jeroboam,  get thee to Shiloh. Behold, there is Ahijah the prophet who spoke concerning me that I should be king over this people.
Kgs. And take with thee ten loaves,  cakes,  a cruse of honey,  go to him. He will tell thee what shall become of the child.
Kgs. And Jeroboam's wife did so,  arose,  went to Shiloh,  came to the house of Ahijah. Now Ahijah could not see, for his eyes were set because of his age.
Kgs. And Jehovah said to Ahijah, Behold, the wife of Jeroboam comes to inquire of thee concerning her son, for he is sick. Thus and thus thou shall say to her, for it will be, when she comes in, that she will feign herself to be another woman.
Kgs. And it was so, when Ahijah heard the sound of her feet, as she came in at the door, that he said, Come in, thou wife of Jeroboam. Why feign thou thyself to be another? For I am sent to thee with heavy news.
Kgs. Go, tell Jeroboam, Thus says Jehovah, the God of Israel: Forasmuch as I exalted thee from among the people,  made thee prince over my people Israel,
Kgs. and tore the kingdom away from the house of David,  gave it thee,  yet thou have not been as my servant David, who kept my commandments,  who followed me with all his heart to do only that which was right in my eyes,
Kgs. but have done evil above all who were before thee,  have gone and made thee other gods,  molten images to provoke me to anger,  have cast me behind thy back,
Kgs. therefore, behold, I will bring evil upon the house of Jeroboam,  will cut off from Jeroboam every man-child, he who is shut up and he who is left at large in Israel,  will utterly sweep away the house of Jeroboam as a man sweeps away dung, till it be all gone.
Kgs. He who dies of Jeroboam in the city shall the dogs eat,  he who dies in the field shall the birds of the heavens eat, for Jehovah has spoken it.
Kgs. Arise thou therefore, get thee to thy house. When thy feet enter into the city, the child shall die.
Kgs. And all Israel shall mourn for him,  bury him, for he only of Jeroboam shall come to the grave, because in him there is found some good thing toward Jehovah, the God of Israel, in the house of Jeroboam.
Kgs. Moreover Jehovah will raise up a king for him over Israel who shall cut off the house of Jeroboam that day. But what? Even now.
Kgs. For Jehovah will smite Israel as a reed is shaken in the water. And he will root up Israel out of this good land which he gave to their fathers,  will scatter them beyond the River because they have made their Asherim, provoking Jehovah to anger.
Kgs. And he will give Israel up because of the sins of Jeroboam, which he has sinned,  with which he has made Israel to sin.
Kgs. And Jeroboam's wife arose,  departed,  came to Tirzah. As she came to the threshold of the house, the child died.
Kgs. And all Israel buried him,  mourned for him, according to the word of Jehovah, which he spoke by his servant Ahijah the prophet.
Kgs. And the rest of the acts of Jeroboam, how he warred,  how he reigned, behold, they are written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel.
Kgs. And the days which Jeroboam reigned were twenty-two years,  he slept with his fathers. And Nadab his son reigned in his stead.
Kgs. And Rehoboam the son of Solomon reigned in Judah. Rehoboam was forty-one years old when he began to reign,  he reigned seventeen years in Jerusalem, the city which Jehovah had chosen out of all the tribes of Israel to put his name there. And his mother's name was Naamah the Ammonitess.
Kgs. And Judah did that which was evil in the sight of Jehovah,  they provoked him to jealousy with their sins which they committed, above all that their fathers had done.
Kgs. For they also built for them high places,  pillars,  Asherim, on every high hill,  under every green tree.
Kgs. And there were also sodomites in the land. They did according to all the abominations of the nations which Jehovah drove out before the sons of Israel.
Kgs. And it came to pass in the fifth year of king Rehoboam, that Shishak king of Egypt came up against Jerusalem.
Kgs. And he took away the treasures of the house of Jehovah,  the treasures of the king's house. He even took away all. And he took away all the shields of gold which Solomon had made.
Kgs. And king Rehoboam made in their stead shields of brass,  committed them to the hands of the captains of the guard who kept the door of the king's house.
Kgs. And it was so, that, as often as the king went into the house of Jehovah, the guard bore them,  brought them back into the guard-chamber.
Kgs. Now the rest of the acts of Rehoboam,  all that he did, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah?
Kgs. And there was war between Rehoboam and Jeroboam continually.
Kgs. And Rehoboam slept with his fathers,  was buried with his fathers in the city of David. And his mother's name was Naamah the Ammonitess. And Abijah his son reigned in his stead.
Kgs. Now in the eighteenth year of king Jeroboam the son of Nebat, Abijah began to reign over Judah.
Kgs. He reigned three years in Jerusalem. And his mother's name was Maacah the daughter of Abishalom.
Kgs. And he walked in all the sins of his father, which he had done before him. And his heart was not perfect with Jehovah his God as the heart of David his father.
Kgs. Nevertheless for David's sake Jehovah his God gave him a lamp in Jerusalem, to set up his son after him,  to establish Jerusalem,
Kgs. because David did that which was right in the eyes of Jehovah,  did not turn aside from anything that he commanded him all the days of his life, except only in the matter of Uriah the Hittite.
Kgs. Now there was war between Rehoboam and Jeroboam all the days of his life.
Kgs. And the rest of the acts of Abijah,  all that he did, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah? And there was war between Abijah and Jeroboam.
Kgs. And Abijah slept with his fathers,  they buried him in the city of David. And Asa his son reigned in his stead.
Kgs. And in the twentieth year of Jeroboam king of Israel, Asa began to reign over Judah.
Kgs. And he reigned forty-one years in Jerusalem. And his grandmother's name was Maacah the daughter of Abishalom.
Kgs. And Asa did that which was right in the eyes of Jehovah as David his father did.
Kgs. And he put away the sodomites out of the land,  removed all the idols that his fathers had made.
Kgs. And also he removed Maacah his grandmother from being queen because she had made an abominable image for an Asherah. And Asa cut down her image,  burnt it at the brook Kidron.
Kgs. But the high places were not taken away. Nevertheless the heart of Asa was perfect with Jehovah all his days.
Kgs. And he brought into the house of Jehovah the things that his father had dedicated,  the things that he himself had dedicated, silver,  gold,  vessels.
Kgs. And there was war between Asa and Baasha king of Israel all their days.
Kgs. And Baasha king of Israel went up against Judah,  built Ramah, that he might not allow anyone to go out or come in to Asa king of Judah.
Kgs. Then Asa took all the silver and the gold that were left in the treasures of the house of Jehovah,  the treasures of the king's house,  delivered them into the hand of his servants. And king Asa sent them to Ben-hadad, the son of Tabrimmon, the son of Hezion, king of Syria, who dwelt at Damascus, saying,
Kgs. There is a league between me and thee, between my father and thy father. Behold, I have sent to thee a present of silver and gold. Go, break thy league with Baasha king of Israel, that he may depart from me.
Kgs. And Ben-hadad hearkened to king Asa,  sent the captains of his armies against the cities of Israel,  smote Ijon,  Dan,  Abel-beth-maacah,  all Chinneroth, with all the land of Naphtali.
Kgs. And it came to pass, when Baasha heard of it, that he left off building Ramah,  dwelt in Tirzah.
Kgs. Then king Asa made a proclamation to all Judah; none was exempted. And they carried away the stones of Ramah,  the timber of it, with which Baasha had built. And king Asa built with it Geba of Benjamin,  Mizpah.
Kgs. Now the rest of all the acts of Asa,  all his might,  all that he did,  the cities which he built, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah? But in the time of his old age he was diseased in his feet.
Kgs. And Asa slept with his fathers,  was buried with his fathers in the city of David his father. And Jehoshaphat his son reigned in his stead.
Kgs. And Nadab the son of Jeroboam began to reign over Israel in the second year of Asa king of Judah. And he reigned over Israel two years.
Kgs. And he did that which was evil in the sight of Jehovah,  walked in the way of his father,  in his sin with which he made Israel to sin.
Kgs. And Baasha the son of Ahijah, of the house of Issachar, conspired against him. And Baasha smote him at Gibbethon, which belonged to the Philistines, for Nadab and all Israel were laying siege to Gibbethon.
Kgs. Baasha killed him in the third year of Asa king of Judah,  reigned in his stead.
Kgs. And it came to pass that, as soon as he was king, he smote all the house of Jeroboam. He left to Jeroboam not any who breathed, until he had destroyed him according to the saying of Jehovah, which he spoke by his servant Ahijah the Shilonite,
Kgs. for the sins of Jeroboam which he sinned,  with which he made Israel to sin, because of his provocation with which he provoked Jehovah, the God of Israel, to anger.
Kgs. Now the rest of the acts of Nadab,  all that he did, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel?
Kgs. And there was war between Asa and Baasha king of Israel all their days.
Kgs. In the third year of Asa king of Judah, Baasha the son of Ahijah began to reign over all Israel in Tirzah,  reigned twenty-four years.
Kgs. And he did that which was evil in the sight of Jehovah,  walked in the way of Jeroboam,  in his sin with which he made Israel to sin.
Kgs. And the word of Jehovah came to Jehu the son of Hanani against Baasha, saying,
Kgs. Forasmuch as I exalted thee out of the dust,  made thee prince over my people Israel,  thou have walked in the way of Jeroboam,  have made my people Israel to sin, to provoke me to anger with their sins,
Kgs. behold, I will utterly sweep away Baasha and his house,  I will make thy house like the house of Jeroboam the son of Nebat.
Kgs. He of Baasha who dies in the city shall the dogs eat,  he of his who dies in the field shall the birds of the heavens eat.
Kgs. Now the rest of the acts of Baasha,  what he did,  his might, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel?
Kgs. And Baasha slept with his fathers,  was buried in Tirzah,  Elah his son reigned in his stead.
Kgs. And moreover the word of Jehovah came against Baasha by the prophet Jehu the son of Hanani,  against his house, both because of all the evil that he did in the sight of Jehovah, to provoke him to anger with the work of his hands in being like the house of Jeroboam,  because he smote him.
Kgs. In the twenty-sixth year of Asa king of Judah, Elah the son of Baasha began to reign over Israel in Tirzah,  reigned two years.
Kgs. And his servant Zimri, captain of half his chariots, conspired against him. Now he was in Tirzah, drinking himself drunk in the house of Arza, who was over the household in Tirzah.
Kgs. And Zimri went in and smote him,  killed him in the twenty-seventh year of Asa king of Judah,  reigned in his stead.
Kgs. And it came to pass, when he began to reign, as soon as he sat on his throne, that he smote all the house of Baasha. He left him not a single man-child, neither of his kinfolks, nor of his friends.
Kgs. Thus Zimri destroyed all the house of Baasha according to the word of Jehovah, which he spoke against Baasha by Jehu the prophet,
Kgs. for all the sins of Baasha,  the sins of Elah his son, which they sinned,  with which they made Israel to sin, to provoke Jehovah, the God of Israel, to anger with their vanities.
Kgs. Now the rest of the acts of Elah,  all that he did, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel?
Kgs. In the twenty-seventh year of Asa king of Judah Zimri reigned seven days in Tirzah. Now the people were encamped against Gibbethon, which belonged to the Philistines.
Kgs. And the people who were encamped heard say, Zimri has conspired,  has also smitten the king. Therefore all Israel made Omri, the captain of the army, king over Israel that day in the camp.
Kgs. And Omri went up from Gibbethon,  all Israel with him,  they besieged Tirzah.
Kgs. And it came to pass, when Zimri saw that the city was taken, that he went into the castle of the king's house,  burnt the king's house over him with fire,
Kgs. and died for his sins which he sinned in doing that which was evil in the sight of Jehovah, in walking in the way of Jeroboam,  in his sin which he did to make Israel to sin.
Kgs. Now the rest of the acts of Zimri,  his treason that he wrought, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel?
Kgs. Then the people of Israel were divided into two parts; half of the people followed Tibni the son of Ginath, to make him king,  half followed Omri.
Kgs. But the people who followed Omri prevailed against the people who followed Tibni the son of Ginath. So Tibni died,  Omri reigned.
Kgs. In the thirty-first year of Asa king of Judah, Omri began to reign over Israel,  reigned twelve years. He reigned six years in Tirzah.
Kgs. And he bought the hill Samaria of Shemer for two talents of silver. And he built on the hill,  called the name of the city which he built after the name of Shemer, the owner of the hill, Samaria.
Kgs. And Omri did that which was evil in the sight of Jehovah,  dealt wickedly above all who were before him.
Kgs. For he walked in all the way of Jeroboam the son of Nebat,  in his sins with which he made Israel to sin, to provoke Jehovah, the God of Israel, to anger with their vanities.
Kgs. Now the rest of the acts of Omri which he did,  his might that he showed, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel?
Kgs. So Omri slept with his fathers,  was buried in Samaria,  Ahab his son reigned in his stead.
Kgs. And in the thirty-eighth year of Asa king of Judah, Ahab the son of Omri began to reign over Israel. And Ahab the son of Omri reigned over Israel in Samaria twenty-two years.
Kgs. And Ahab the son of Omri did that which was evil in the sight of Jehovah above all who were before him.
Kgs. And it came to pass, as if it had been a light thing for him to walk in the sins of Jeroboam the son of Nebat, that he took to wife Jezebel the daughter of Ethbaal king of the Sidonians,  went and served Baal,  worshiped him.
Kgs. And he reared up an altar for Baal in the house of Baal, which he had built in Samaria.
Kgs. And Ahab made the Asherah. And Ahab did yet more to provoke Jehovah, the God of Israel, to anger than all the kings of Israel who were before him.
Kgs. In his days did Hiel the Bethelite build Jericho. He laid the foundation of it with the loss of Abiram his firstborn,  set up the gates of it with the loss of his youngest son Segub, according to the word of Jehovah, which he spoke by Joshua the son of Nun.
Kgs. And Elijah the Tishbite, who was of the sojourners of Gilead, said to Ahab, As Jehovah, the God of Israel, lives, before whom I stand, there shall not be dew nor rain these years,  according to my word.
Kgs. And the word of Jehovah came to him, saying,
Kgs. Get thee from here,  turn thee eastward,  hide thyself by the brook Cherith that is before the Jordan.
Kgs. And it shall be, that thou shall drink of the brook,  I have commanded the ravens to feed thee there.
Kgs. So he went and did according to the word of Jehovah, for he went and dwelt by the brook Cherith that is before the Jordan.
Kgs. And the ravens brought him bread and flesh in the morning,  bread and flesh in the evening,  he drank of the brook.
Kgs. And it came to pass after a while, that the brook dried up because there was no rain in the land.
Kgs. And the word of Jehovah came to him, saying,
Kgs. Arise, get thee to Zarephath, which belongs to Sidon,  dwell there. Behold, I have commanded a widow there to sustain thee.
Kgs. So he arose and went to Zarephath. And when he came to the gate of the city, behold, a widow was there gathering sticks. And he called to her,  said, Fetch me, I pray thee, a little water in a vessel that I may drink.
Kgs. And as she was going to fetch it, he called to her,  said, Bring me, I pray thee, a morsel of bread in thy hand.
Kgs. And she said, As Jehovah thy God lives, I do not have a cake,  a handful of meal in the jar,  a little oil in the cruse. And, behold, I am gathering two sticks, that I may go in and dress it for me and my son that we may eat it,  die.
Kgs. And Elijah said to her, Fear not, go and do as thou have said. But make me of it a little cake first,  bring it forth to me,  afterward make for thee and for thy son.
Kgs. For thus says Jehovah, the God of Israel, The jar of meal shall not be used up, neither shall the cruse of oil fail, until the day that Jehovah sends rain upon the earth.
Kgs. And she went and did according to the saying of Elijah. And she,  he,  her house, ate many days.
Kgs. The jar of meal was not used up, neither did the cruse of oil fail, according to the word of Jehovah, which he spoke by Elijah.
Kgs. And it came to pass after these things, that the son of the woman, the mistress of the house, fell sick,  his sickness was so severe that there was no breath left in him.
Kgs. And she said to Elijah, What have I to do with thee, O thou man of God? Thou have come to me to bring my sin to remembrance,  to kill my son!
Kgs. And he said to her, Give me thy son. And he took him out of her bosom,  carried him up into the chamber where he abode,  laid him upon his own bed.
Kgs. And he cried to Jehovah,  said, O Jehovah my God, have thou also brought evil upon the widow with whom I sojourn by slaying her son?
Kgs. And he stretched himself upon the child three times,  cried to Jehovah,  said, O Jehovah my God, I pray thee, let this child's soul come into him again.
Kgs. And Jehovah hearkened to the voice of Elijah,  the soul of the child came into him again,  he revived.
Kgs. And Elijah took the child,  brought him down out of the chamber into the house,  delivered him to his mother. And Elijah said, See, thy son lives.
Kgs. And the woman said to Elijah, Now I know that thou are a man of God,  that the word of Jehovah in thy mouth is truth.
Kgs. And it came to pass after many days, that the word of Jehovah came to Elijah, in the third year, saying, Go, show thyself to Ahab,  I will send rain upon the earth.
Kgs. And Elijah went to show himself to Ahab. And the famine was severe in Samaria.
Kgs. And Ahab called Obadiah, who was over the household. (Now Obadiah feared Jehovah greatly;
Kgs. for it was so, when Jezebel cut off the prophets of Jehovah, that Obadiah took a hundred prophets,  hid them by fifties in a cave,  fed them with bread and water.)
Kgs. And Ahab said to Obadiah, Go through the land, to all the fountains of water,  to all the brooks. Perhaps we may find grass and save the horses and mules alive, that we not lose all the beasts.
Kgs. So they divided the land between them to pass throughout it; Ahab went one way by himself,  Obadiah went another way by himself.
Kgs. And as Obadiah was in the way, behold, Elijah met him. And he knew him,  fell on his face,  said, Is it thou, my lord Elijah?
Kgs. And he answered him, It is I. Go, tell thy lord, Behold, Elijah is here.
Kgs. And he said, How have I sinned that thou would deliver thy servant into the hand of Ahab to kill me?
Kgs. As Jehovah thy God lives, there is no nation or kingdom where my lord has not sent to seek thee. And when they said, He is not here, he took an oath from the kingdom and nation that they did not find thee.
Kgs. And now thou say, Go, tell thy lord, Behold, Elijah is here.
Kgs. And it will come to pass, as soon as I am gone from thee, that the Spirit of Jehovah will carry thee where I know not. And so when I come and tell Ahab,  he cannot find thee, he will kill me. But I thy servant fear Jehovah from my youth.
Kgs. Was it not told my lord what I did when Jezebel killed the prophets of Jehovah, how I hid a hundred men of Jehovah's prophets by fifties in a cave,  fed them with bread and water?
Kgs. And now thou say, Go, tell thy lord, Behold, Elijah is here,  he will kill me.
Kgs. And Elijah said, As Jehovah of hosts lives, before whom I stand, I will surely show myself to him today.
Kgs. So Obadiah went to meet Ahab,  told him,  Ahab went to meet Elijah.
Kgs. And it came to pass, when Ahab saw Elijah, that Ahab said to him, Is it thou, thou troubler of Israel?
Kgs. And he answered, I have not troubled Israel,  thou,  thy father's house, in that ye have forsaken the commandments of Jehovah,  thou have followed the Baalim.
Kgs. Now therefore send,  gather to me all Israel to mount Carmel,  the prophets of Baal four hundred and fifty,  the prophets of the Asherah four hundred, who eat at Jezebel's table.
Kgs. So Ahab sent to all the sons of Israel,  gathered the prophets together to mount Carmel.
Kgs. And Elijah came near to all the people,  said, How long do ye go limping between the two sides? If Jehovah be God, follow him,  if Baal, then follow him. And the people answered him not a word.
Kgs. Then Elijah said to the people, I, even I only, am left a prophet of Jehovah,  Baal's prophets are four hundred and fifty men.
Kgs. Let them therefore give us two bullocks,  let them choose one bullock for themselves,  cut it in pieces,  lay it on the wood,  put no fire under. And I will dress the other bullock,  lay it on the wood,  put no fire under.
Kgs. And call ye on the name of your god,  I will call on the name of Jehovah. And the God that answers by fire, let him be God. And all the people answered and said, It is well spoken.
Kgs. And Elijah said to the prophets of Baal, Choose you one bullock for yourselves,  dress it first, for ye are many,  call on the name of your god,  put no fire under.
Kgs. And they took the bullock which was given them,  they dressed it,  called on the name of Baal from morning even until noon, saying, O Baal, hear us. But there was no voice, nor any that answered. And they leaped about the altar which was made.
Kgs. And it came to pass at noon, that Elijah mocked them,  said, Cry aloud, for he is a god. Either he is meditating, or he is gone aside, or he is on a journey, or perhaps he sleeps and must be awakened.
Kgs. And they cried aloud,  cut themselves after their manner with knives and lances, till the blood gushed out upon them.
Kgs. And it was so, when midday was past, that they prophesied until the time of the offering of the evening oblation,  there was neither voice, nor any to answer, nor any that regarded.
Kgs. And Elijah said to all the people, Come near to me. And all the people came near to him. And he repaired the altar of Jehovah that was thrown down.
Kgs. And Elijah took twelve stones, according to the number of the tribes of the sons of Jacob to whom the word of Jehovah came, saying, Israel shall be thy name.
Kgs. And with the stones he built an altar in the name of Jehovah. And he made a trench around the altar, as great as would contain two measures of seed.
Kgs. And he put the wood in order,  cut the bullock in pieces,  laid it on the wood. And he said, Fill four jars with water,  pour it on the burnt offering,  on the wood.
Kgs. And he said, Do it the second time,  they did it the second time. And he said, Do it the third time,  they did it the third time.
Kgs. And the water ran round about the altar,  he also filled the trench with water.
Kgs. And it came to pass at the time of the offering of the evening oblation, that Elijah the prophet came near,  said, O Jehovah, the God of Abraham, of Isaac,  of Israel, let it be known this day that thou are God in Israel,  that I am thy servant,  that I have done all these things at thy word.
Kgs. Hear me, O Jehovah, hear me, that this people may know that thou, Jehovah, are God,  that thou have turned their heart back again.
Kgs. Then the fire of Jehovah fell,  consumed the burnt offering,  the wood,  the stones,  the dust,  licked up the water that was in the trench.
Kgs. And when all the people saw it, they fell on their faces. And they said, Jehovah, he is God, Jehovah, he is God.
Kgs. and Elijah said to them, Take the prophets of Baal; let not one of them escape. And they took them,  Elijah brought them down to the brook Kishon,  killed them there.
Kgs. And Elijah said to Ahab, Get thee up, eat and drink, for there is the sound of abundance of rain.
Kgs. So Ahab went up to eat and to drink. And Elijah went up to the top of Carmel,  he bowed himself down upon the earth,  put his face between his knees.
Kgs. And he said to his servant, Go up now, look toward the sea. And he went up,  looked,  said, There is nothing. And he said, Go again seven times.
Kgs. And it came to pass at the seventh time, that he said, Behold, a cloud rises out of the sea, as small as a man's hand. And he said, Go up, say to Ahab, Make ready thy chariot,  get thee down, that the rain not stop thee.
Kgs. And it came to pass in a little while, that the heavens grew black with clouds and wind,  there was a great rain. And Ahab rode,  went to Jezreel.
Kgs. And the hand of Jehovah was on Elijah,  he girded up his loins,  ran before Ahab to the entrance of Jezreel.
Kgs. And Ahab told Jezebel all that Elijah had done,  also how he had slain all the prophets with the sword.
Kgs. Then Jezebel sent a messenger to Elijah, saying, So let the gods do to me,  more also, if I do not make thy life as the life of one of them by tomorrow about this time.
Kgs. And when he saw that, he arose,  went for his life. And he came to Beersheba, which belongs to Judah,  left his servant there.
Kgs. But he himself went a day's journey into the wilderness,  came and sat down under a juniper tree. And he requested for himself that he might die,  said, It is enough, now, O Jehovah, take away my life, for I am no better than my fathers.
Kgs. And he lay down and slept under a juniper tree, , behold, an agent touched him,  said to him, Arise and eat.
Kgs. And he looked, , behold, there was at his head a cake baked on the coals,  a cruse of water. And he ate and drank,  laid him down again.
Kgs. And the agent of Jehovah came again the second time,  touched him,  said, Arise and eat because the journey is too great for thee.
Kgs. And he arose,  ate and drank,  went in the strength of that food forty days and forty nights to Horeb the mount of God.
Kgs. And he came to a cave there,  lodged there. And, behold, the word of Jehovah came to him,  he said to him, What are thou doing here, Elijah?
Kgs. And he said, I have been very jealous for Jehovah, the God of hosts. For the sons of Israel have forsaken thy covenant, thrown down thine altars,  slain thy prophets with the sword. And I, even I only, am left,  they seek my life, to take it away.
Kgs. And he said, Go forth,  stand upon the mount before Jehovah. And, behold, Jehovah passed by,  a great and strong wind tore the mountains,  broke in pieces the rocks before Jehovah,  Jehovah was not in the wind. And after the wind an earthquake,  Jehovah was not in the earthquake.
Kgs. And after the earthquake a fire,  Jehovah was not in the fire. And after the fire a still small voice.
Kgs. And it was so, when Elijah heard it, that he wrapped his face in his mantle,  went out,  stood in the entrance of the cave. And, behold, there came a voice to him,  said, What are thou doing here, Elijah?
Kgs. And he said, I have been very jealous for Jehovah, the God of hosts. For the sons of Israel have forsaken thy covenant, thrown down thine altars,  slain thy prophets with the sword. And I, even I only, am left,  they seek my life to take it away.
Kgs. And Jehovah said to him, Go, return on thy way to the wilderness of Damascus. And when thou come, thou shall anoint Hazael to be king over Syria.
Kgs. And thou shall anoint Jehu the son of Nimshi to be king over Israel. And thou shall anoint Elisha the son of Shaphat of Abel-meholah to be prophet in thy place.
Kgs. And it shall come to pass, that he who escapes from the sword of Hazael, Jehu shall kill. And he who escapes from the sword of Jehu, Elisha shall kill.
Kgs. Yet I have reserved for me seven thousand in Israel, all the knees which have not bowed to Baal,  every mouth which has not kissed him.
Kgs. So he departed from there,  found Elisha the son of Shaphat who was plowing with twelve yoke of oxen before him,  he with the twelfth. And Elijah passed over to him,  cast his mantle upon him.
Kgs. And he left the oxen,  ran after Elijah,  said, Let me, I pray thee, kiss my father and my mother,  then I will follow thee. And he said to him, Go back again, for what have I done to thee?
Kgs. And he returned from following him,  took the yoke of oxen,  killed them,  boiled their flesh with the instruments of the oxen,  gave to the people,  they ate. Then he arose,  went after Elijah,  ministered to him.
Kgs. And Ben-hadad the king of Syria gathered all his army together. And there were thirty-two kings with him,  horses and chariots. And he went up and besieged Samaria,  fought against it.
Kgs. And he sent messengers to Ahab king of Israel, into the city,  said to him, Thus says Ben-hadad,
Kgs. Thy silver and thy gold is mine, thy wives also and thy sons, even the best, are mine.
Kgs. And the king of Israel answered and said, It is according to thy saying, my lord, O king, I am thine,  all that I have.
Kgs. And the messengers came again,  said, Thus speaks Ben-hadad, saying, I indeed sent to thee, saying, Thou shall deliver to me thy silver,  thy gold,  thy wives,  thy sons.
Kgs. But I will send my servants to thee tomorrow about this time,  they shall search thy house,  the houses of thy servants. And it shall be, that whatever is pleasant in thine eyes, they shall put it in their hand,  take it away.
Kgs. Then the king of Israel called all the elders of the land,  said, Mark, I pray you,  see how this man seeks mischief, for he sent to me for my wives,  for my sons,  for my silver,  for my gold,  I did not deny him.
Kgs. And all the elders and all the people said to him, Do thou not hearken, nor consent.
Kgs. Therefore he said to the messengers of Ben-hadad, Tell my lord the king, All that thou sent for to thy servant at the first I will do,  this thing I may not do. And the messengers departed,  brought him word again.
Kgs. And Ben-hadad sent to him,  said, The gods do so to me,  more also, if the dust of Samaria shall suffice for handfuls for all the people that follow me.
Kgs. And the king of Israel answered and said, Tell him, Let not him who girds on his armor boast himself as he who puts it off.
Kgs. And it came to pass, when Ben-hadad heard this message as he was drinking, he and the kings, in the pavilions, that he said to his servants, Set yourselves in array. And they set themselves in array against the city.
Kgs. And, behold, a prophet came near to Ahab king of Israel,  said, Thus says Jehovah, Have thou seen all this great multitude? Behold, I will deliver it into thy hand this day,  thou shall know that I am Jehovah.
Kgs. And Ahab said, By whom? And he said, Thus says Jehovah, By the young men of the rulers of the provinces. Then he said, Who shall begin the battle? And he answered, Thou.
Kgs. Then he mustered the young men of the rulers of the provinces,  they were two hundred and thirty-two. And after them he mustered all the people, even all the sons of Israel, being seven thousand.
Kgs. And they went out at noon. But Ben-hadad was drinking himself drunk in the pavilions, he and the kings, the thirty-two kings who helped him.
Kgs. And the young men of the rulers of the provinces went out first. And Ben-hadad sent out,  they told him, saying, There are men come out from Samaria.
Kgs. And he said, Whether they come out for peace, take them alive, or whether they come out for war, take them alive.
Kgs. So these went out of the city, the young men of the rulers of the provinces,  the army which followed them.
Kgs. And they killed everyone his man. And the Syrians fled,  Israel pursued them. And Ben-hadad the king of Syria escaped on a horse with horsemen.
Kgs. And the king of Israel went out,  smote the horses and chariots,  killed the Syrians with a great slaughter.
Kgs. And the prophet came near to the king of Israel,  said to him, Go, strengthen thyself. And mark,  see what thou do, for at the return of the year the king of Syria will come up against thee.
Kgs. And the servants of the king of Syria said to him, Their god is a god of the hills, therefore they were stronger than we. But let us fight against them in the plain,  surely we shall be stronger than they.
Kgs. And do this thing: Take the kings away, every man out of his place,  put captains in their place.
Kgs. And number thee an army, like the army that thou have lost, horse for horse,  chariot for chariot. And we will fight against them in the plain,  surely we shall be stronger than they. And he hearkened to their voice,  did so.
Kgs. And it came to pass at the return of the year, that Ben-hadad mustered the Syrians,  went up to Aphek to fight against Israel.
Kgs. And the sons of Israel were mustered,  were supported,  went against them. And the sons of Israel encamped before them like two little flocks of kids,  the Syrians filled the country.
Kgs. And a man of God came near and spoke to the king of Israel,  said, Thus says Jehovah, Because the Syrians have said, Jehovah is a god of the hills,  he is not a god of the valleys, therefore I will deliver all this great multitude into thy hand,  ye shall know that I am Jehovah.
Kgs. And they encamped one opposite the other seven days. And so it was, that in the seventh day the battle was joined. And the sons of Israel killed of the Syrians a hundred thousand footmen in one day.
Kgs. But the rest fled to Aphek, into the city,  the wall fell upon twenty-seven thousand men who were left. And Ben-hadad fled,  came into the city, into an inner chamber.
Kgs. And his servants said to him, Behold now, we have heard that the kings of the house of Israel are merciful kings. Let us, we pray thee, put sackcloth on our loins,  ropes upon our heads,  go out to the king of Israel. Perhaps he will save thy life.
Kgs. So they girded sackcloth on their loins,  put ropes on their heads,  came to the king of Israel,  said, Thy servant Ben-hadad says, I pray thee, let me live. And he said, Is he yet alive? He is my brother.
Kgs. Now the men observed diligently whether anything would come from him. And they quickly caught it,  they said, Thy brother Ben-hadad. Then he said, Go ye, bring him. Then Ben-hadad came forth to him,  he caused him to come up into the chariot.
Kgs. And Ben-hadad said to him, The cities which my father took from thy father I will restore,  thou shall make streets for thee in Damascus as my father made in Samaria. And I, said Ahab, will let thee go with this covenant. So he made a covenant with him,  let him go.
Kgs. And a certain man of the sons of the prophets said by the word of Jehovah to his fellow, Smite me, I pray thee. And the man refused to smite him.
Kgs. Then said he to him, Because thou have not obeyed the voice of Jehovah, behold, as soon as thou are departed from me, a lion shall kill thee. And as soon as he was departed from him, a lion found him,  killed him.
Kgs. Then he found another man,  said, Smite me, I pray thee. And the man smote him, smiting and wounding him.
Kgs. So the prophet departed,  waited for the king by the way,  disguised himself with his headband over his eyes.
Kgs. And as the king passed by, he cried out to the king,  he said, Thy servant went out into the midst of the battle, , behold, a man turned aside,  brought a man to me,  said, Keep this man. If by any means he is missing, then shall thy life be for his life, or else thou shall pay a talent of silver.
Kgs. And as thy servant was busy here and there, he was gone. And the king of Israel said to him, So shall thy judgment be, thyself have decided it.
Kgs. And he hastened,  took the headband away from his eyes,  the king of Israel discerned him that he was of the prophets.
Kgs. And he said to him, Thus says Jehovah, Because thou have let go out of thy hand the man whom I had devoted to destruction, therefore thy life shall go for his life,  thy people for his people.
Kgs. And the king of Israel went to his house heavy and displeased,  came to Samaria.
Kgs. And it came to pass after these things, that Naboth the Jezreelite had a vineyard, which was in Jezreel, near by the palace of Ahab king of Samaria.
Kgs. And Ahab spoke to Naboth, saying, Give me thy vineyard that I may have it for a garden of herbs because it is near to my house. And I will give thee for it a better vineyard than it, or, if it seem good to thee, I will give thee the worth of it in money.
Kgs. And Naboth said to Ahab, Jehovah forbid it of me that I should give the inheritance of my fathers to thee.
Kgs. And Ahab came into his house heavy and displeased because of the word which Naboth the Jezreelite had spoken to him, for he had said, I will not give thee the inheritance of my fathers. And he laid himself down upon his bed,  turned away his face,  would eat no bread.
Kgs. But Jezebel his wife came to him,  said to him, Why is thy spirit so sad that thou eat no bread?
Kgs. And he said to her, Because I spoke to Naboth the Jezreelite,  said to him, Give me thy vineyard for money, or else, if it please thee, I will give thee another vineyard for it. And he answered, I will not give thee my vineyard.
Kgs. And Jezebel his wife said to him, Do thou now govern the kingdom of Israel? Arise,  eat bread,  let thy heart be merry. I will give thee the vineyard of Naboth the Jezreelite.
Kgs. So she wrote letters in Ahab's name,  sealed them with his seal,  sent the letters to the elders and to the nobles who were in his city,  who dwelt with Naboth.
Kgs. And she wrote in the letters, saying, Proclaim a fast,  set Naboth on high among the people.
Kgs. And set two men, base fellows, before him,  let them bear witness against him, saying, Thou cursed God and the king. And then carry him out,  stone him to death.
Kgs. And the men of his city, even the elders and the nobles who dwelt in his city, did as Jezebel had sent to them, according as it was written in the letters which she had sent to them.
Kgs. They proclaimed a fast,  set Naboth on high among the people.
Kgs. And the two men, the base fellows, came in and sat before him. And the base fellows bore witness against him, even against Naboth, in the presence of the people, saying, Naboth cursed God and the king. Then they carried him forth out of the city,  stoned him to death with stones.
Kgs. Then they sent to Jezebel, saying, Naboth is stoned,  is dead.
Kgs. And it came to pass, when Jezebel heard that Naboth was stoned,  was dead, that Jezebel said to Ahab, Arise, take possession of the vineyard of Naboth the Jezreelite, which he refused to give thee for money, for Naboth is not alive,  dead.
Kgs. And it came to pass, when Ahab heard that Naboth was dead, that Ahab rose up to go down to the vineyard of Naboth the Jezreelite to take possession of it.
Kgs. And the word of Jehovah came to Elijah the Tishbite, saying,
Kgs. Arise, go down to meet Ahab king of Israel, who dwells in Samaria. Behold, he is in the vineyard of Naboth where he has gone down to take possession of it.
Kgs. And thou shall speak to him, saying, Thus says Jehovah, Have thou killed and also taken possession? And thou shall speak to him, saying, Thus says Jehovah, In the place where dogs licked the blood of Naboth shall dogs lick thy blood, even thine.
Kgs. And Ahab said to Elijah, Have thou found me, O my enemy? And he answered, I have found thee because thou have sold thyself to do that which is evil in the sight of Jehovah.
Kgs. Behold, I will bring evil upon thee,  will utterly sweep thee away and will cut off from Ahab every man-child,  he who is shut up and he who is left at large in Israel.
Kgs. And I will make thy house like the house of Jeroboam the son of Nebat,  like the house of Baasha the son of Ahijah for the provocation with which thou have provoked me to anger,  have made Israel to sin.
Kgs. And Jehovah spoke also of Jezebel, saying, The dogs shall eat Jezebel by the rampart of Jezreel.
Kgs. He who dies of Ahab in the city the dogs shall eat,  he who dies in the field shall the birds of the heavens eat.
Kgs. (But there was none like Ahab, who sold himself to do that which was evil in the sight of Jehovah, whom Jezebel his wife stirred up.
Kgs. And he did very abominably in following idols, according to all that the Amorites did whom Jehovah cast out before the sons of Israel.)
Kgs. And it came to pass, when Ahab heard those words, that he tore his clothes,  put sackcloth upon his flesh,  fasted,  lay in sackcloth,  went softly.
Kgs. And the word of Jehovah came to Elijah the Tishbite, saying,
Kgs. See thou how Ahab humbles himself before me? Because he humbles himself before me, I will not bring the evil in his days,  in his son's days will I bring the evil upon his house.
Kgs. And they continued three years without war between Syria and Israel.
Kgs. And it came to pass in the third year, that Jehoshaphat the king of Judah came down to the king of Israel.
Kgs. And the king of Israel said to his servants, Know ye that Ramoth-gilead is ours,  we are still,  do not take it out of the hand of the king of Syria?
Kgs. And he said to Jehoshaphat, Will thou go with me to battle to Ramoth-gilead? And Jehoshaphat said to the king of Israel, I am as thou are, my people as thy people, my horses as thy horses.
Kgs. And Jehoshaphat said to the king of Israel, Inquire first, I pray thee, for the word of Jehovah.
Kgs. Then the king of Israel gathered the prophets together, about four hundred men,  said to them, Shall I go against Ramoth-gilead to battle, or shall I forbear? And they said, Go up, for the Lord will deliver it into the hand of the king.
Kgs. But Jehoshaphat said, Is there not here a prophet of Jehovah besides, that we may inquire of him?
Kgs. And the king of Israel said to Jehoshaphat, there is yet one man by whom we may inquire of Jehovah, Micaiah the son of Imlah,  I hate him, for he does not prophesy good concerning me,  evil. And Jehoshaphat said, Let not the king say so.
Kgs. Then the king of Israel called an officer,  said, Fetch quickly Micaiah the son of Imlah.
Kgs. Now the king of Israel and Jehoshaphat the king of Judah were sitting each on his throne, arrayed in their robes, in an open place at the entrance of the gate of Samaria. And all the prophets were prophesying before them.
Kgs. And Zedekiah the son of Chenaanah made for him horns of iron,  said, Thus says Jehovah, With these thou shall push the Syrians until they be consumed.
Kgs. And all the prophets prophesied so, saying, Go up to Ramoth-gilead,  prosper, for Jehovah will deliver it into the hand of the king.
Kgs. And the messenger who went to call Micaiah spoke to him, saying, Behold now, the words of the prophets declare good to the king with one mouth. Let thy word, I pray thee, be like the word of one of them,  speak thou good.
Kgs. And Micaiah said, As Jehovah lives, what Jehovah says to me, that I will speak.
Kgs. And when he came to the king, the king said to him, Micaiah, shall we go to Ramoth-gilead to battle, or shall we forbear? And he answered him, Go up and prosper,  Jehovah will deliver it into the hand of the king.
Kgs. And the king said to him, How many times shall I adjure thee that thou speak to me nothing but the truth in the name of Jehovah?
Kgs. And he said, I saw all Israel scattered upon the mountains, as sheep that have no shepherd. And Jehovah said, These have no master, let them return every man to his house in peace.
Kgs. And the king of Israel said to Jehoshaphat, Did I not tell thee that he would not prophesy good concerning me,  evil?
Kgs. And Micaiah said, Therefore hear thou the word of Jehovah. I saw Jehovah sitting on his throne,  all the host of heaven standing by him on his right hand and on his left.
Kgs. And Jehovah said, Who shall entice Ahab, that he may go up and fall at Ramoth-gilead? And one said on this manner,  another said on that manner.
Kgs. And there came forth a spirit,  stood before Jehovah,  said, I will entice him.
Kgs. And Jehovah said to him, With what? And he said, I will go forth,  will be a lying spirit in the mouth of all his prophets. And he said, Thou shall entice him,  shall also prevail. Go forth,  do so.
Kgs. Now therefore, behold, Jehovah has put a lying spirit in the mouth of all these thy prophets,  Jehovah has spoken evil concerning thee.
Kgs. Then Zedekiah the son of Chenaanah came near,  smote Micaiah on the cheek,  said, Which way did the Spirit of Jehovah go from me to speak to thee?
Kgs. And Micaiah said, Behold, thou shall see on that day when thou shall go into an inner chamber to hide thyself.
Kgs. And the king of Israel said, Take Micaiah,  carry him back to Amon the governor of the city,  to Joash the king's son,
Kgs. and say, Thus says the king, Put this fellow in the prison,  feed him with bread of affliction and with water of affliction until I come in peace.
Kgs. And Micaiah said, If thou return at all in peace, Jehovah has not spoken by me. And he said, Hear, ye peoples, all of you.
Kgs. So the king of Israel and Jehoshaphat the king of Judah went up to Ramoth-gilead.
Kgs. And the king of Israel said to Jehoshaphat, I will disguise myself,  go into the battle,  put thou on thy robes. And the king of Israel disguised himself,  went into the battle.
Kgs. Now the king of Syria had commanded the thirty-two captains of his chariots, saying, Fight neither with small nor great, except only with the king of Israel.
Kgs. And it came to pass, when the captains of the chariots saw Jehoshaphat, that they said, Surely it is the king of Israel,  they turned aside to fight against him. And Jehoshaphat cried out.
Kgs. And it came to pass, when the captains of the chariots saw that it was not the king of Israel, that they turned back from pursuing him.
Kgs. And a certain man drew his bow at a venture,  smote the king of Israel between the joints of the armor. Therefore he said to the driver of his chariot, Turn thy hand,  carry me out of the army, for I am severely wounded.
Kgs. And the battle increased that day. And the king was propped up in his chariot against the Syrians. And he died at evening,  the blood ran out of the wound into the bottom of the chariot.
Kgs. And there went a cry throughout the army about the going down of the sun, saying, Every man to his city,  every man to his country.
Kgs. So the king died,  was brought to Samaria,  they buried the king in Samaria.
Kgs. And they washed the chariot by the pool of Samaria,  the dogs licked up his blood (now the harlots washed themselves there), according to the word of Jehovah which he spoke.
Kgs. Now the rest of the acts of Ahab,  all that he did,  the ivory house which he built,  all the cities that he built, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel?
Kgs. So Ahab slept with his fathers,  Ahaziah his son reigned in his stead.
Kgs. And Jehoshaphat the son of Asa began to reign over Judah in the fourth year of Ahab king of Israel.
Kgs. Jehoshaphat was thirty-five years old when he began to reign,  he reigned twenty-five years in Jerusalem. And his mother's name was Azubah the daughter of Shilhi.
Kgs. And he walked in all the way of Asa his father. He turned not aside from it, doing that which was right in the eyes of Jehovah. However the high places were not taken away; the people still sacrificed and burnt incense in the high places.
Kgs. And Jehoshaphat made peace with the king of Israel.
Kgs. Now the rest of the acts of Jehoshaphat,  his might that he showed,  how he warred, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah?
Kgs. And he put away out of the land the remnant of the sodomites, who remained in the days of his father Asa.
Kgs. And there was no king in Edom; a deputy was king.
Kgs. Jehoshaphat made ships of Tarshish to go to Ophir for gold,  they did not go, for the ships were broken at Ezion-geber.
Kgs. Then Ahaziah the son of Ahab said to Jehoshaphat, Let my servants go with thy servants in the ships. But Jehoshaphat would not.
Kgs. And Jehoshaphat slept with his fathers,  was buried with his fathers in the city of David his father. And Jehoram his son reigned in his stead.
Kgs. Ahaziah the son of Ahab began to reign over Israel in Samaria in the seventeenth year of Jehoshaphat king of Judah,  he reigned two years over Israel.
Kgs. And he did that which was evil in the sight of Jehovah,  walked in the way of his father,  in the way of his mother,  in the way of Jeroboam the son of Nebat, how he made Israel to sin.
Kgs. And he served Baal,  worshiped him,  provoked to anger Jehovah, the God of Israel, according to all that his father had done.
II Kings
Kgs. And Moab rebelled against Israel after the death of Ahab.
Kgs. And Ahaziah fell down through the lattice in his upper chamber that was in Samaria,  was sick. And he sent messengers,  said to them, Go, inquire of Baal-zebub, the god of Ekron, whether I shall recover of this sickness.
Kgs. But the agent of Jehovah said to Elijah the Tishbite, Arise, go up to meet the messengers of the king of Samaria,  say to them, Is it because there is no God in Israel that ye go to inquire of Baal-zebub, the god of Ekron?
Kgs. Now therefore thus says Jehovah, Thou shall not come down from the bed where thou have gone up,  shall surely die. And Elijah departed.
Kgs. And the messengers returned to him,  he said to them, Why is it that ye are returned?
Kgs. And they said to him, There came up a man to meet us,  said to us, Go, turn again to the king that sent you,  say to him, Thus says Jehovah, Is it because there is no God in Israel that thou send to inquire of Baal-zebub, the god of Ekron? Therefore thou shall not come down from the bed where thou have gone up,  shall surely die.
Kgs. And he said to them, What manner of man was he who came up to meet you,  told you these words?
Kgs. And they answered him, He was a hairy man,  girt with a belt of leather about his loins. And he said, It is Elijah the Tishbite.
Kgs. Then the king sent to him a captain of fifty with his fifty. And he went up to him, , behold, he was sitting on the top of the hill. And he spoke to him, O man of God, the king has said, Come down.
Kgs. And Elijah answered and said to the captain of fifty, If I be a man of God, let fire come down from heaven,  consume thee and thy fifty. And there came down fire from heaven,  consumed him and his fifty.
Kgs. And again he sent to him another captain of fifty and his fifty. And he answered and said to him, O man of God, thus has the king said, Come down quickly.
Kgs. And Elijah answered and said to them, If I be a man of God, let fire come down from heaven,  consume thee and thy fifty. And the fire of God came down from heaven,  consumed him and his fifty.
Kgs. And again he sent the captain of a third fifty with his fifty. And the third captain of fifty went up,  came and fell on his knees before Elijah,  besought him,  said to him, O man of God, I pray thee, let my life,  the life of these fifty thy servants, be precious in thy sight.
Kgs. Behold, there came fire down from heaven,  consumed the two former captains of fifty with their fifties,  now let my life be precious in thy sight.
Kgs. And the agent of Jehovah said to Elijah, Go down with him; do not be afraid of him. And he arose,  went down with him to the king.
Kgs. And he said to him, Thus says Jehovah, Inasmuch as thou have sent messengers to inquire of Baal-zebub, the god of Ekron, is it because there is no God in Israel to inquire of his word? Therefore thou shall not come down from the bed where thou have gone up,  shall surely die.
Kgs. So he died according to the word of Jehovah which Elijah had spoken. And Jehoram began to reign in his stead in the second year of Jehoram the son of Jehoshaphat king of Judah, because he had no son.
Kgs. Now the rest of the acts of Ahaziah which he did, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel?
Kgs. And it came to pass, when Jehovah would take up Elijah by a whirlwind into heaven, that Elijah went with Elisha from Gilgal.
Kgs. And Elijah said to Elisha, Remain here, I pray thee, for Jehovah has sent me as far as Bethel. And Elisha said, As Jehovah lives,  as thy soul lives, I will not leave thee. So they went down to Bethel.
Kgs. And the sons of the prophets who were at Bethel came forth to Elisha,  said to him, Do thou know that Jehovah will take away thy master from thy head today? And he said, Yes, I know it; hold ye your peace.
Kgs. And Elijah said to him, Elisha, remain here, I pray thee, for Jehovah has sent me to Jericho. And he said, As Jehovah lives,  as thy soul lives, I will not leave thee. So they came to Jericho.
Kgs. And the sons of the prophets who were at Jericho came near to Elisha,  said to him, Do thou know that Jehovah will take away thy master from thy head today? And he answered, Yes, I know it; hold ye your peace.
Kgs. And Elijah said to him, Remain here, I pray thee, for Jehovah has sent me to the Jordan. And he said, As Jehovah lives,  as thy soul lives, I will not leave thee. And the two went on.
Kgs. And fifty men of the sons of the prophets went,  stood opposite them afar off. And the two stood by the Jordan.
Kgs. And Elijah took his mantle,  wrapped it together,  struck the waters,  they were divided here and there, so that the two went over on dry ground.
Kgs. And it came to pass, when they were gone over, that Elijah said to Elisha, Ask what I shall do for thee before I am taken from thee. And Elisha said, I pray thee, let a double portion of thy spirit be upon me.
Kgs. And he said, Thou have asked a hard thing. Nevertheless, if thou see me when I am taken from thee, it shall be so to thee,  if not, it shall not be so.
Kgs. And it came to pass, as they still went on,  talked, that, behold, there appeared a chariot of fire,  horses of fire, which divided them both apart. And Elijah went up by a whirlwind into heaven.
Kgs. And Elisha saw it,  he cried, My father, my father, the chariots of Israel and the horsemen of it! And he saw him no more. And he took hold of his own clothes,  tore them in two pieces.
Kgs. He also took up the mantle of Elijah that fell from him,  went back,  stood by the bank of the Jordan.
Kgs. And he took the mantle of Elijah that fell from him,  struck the waters,  said, Where is Jehovah, the God of Elijah? And when he also had smitten the waters, they were divided here and there,  Elisha went over.
Kgs. And when the sons of the prophets who were at Jericho opposite him saw him, they said, The spirit of Elijah rests on Elisha. And they came to meet him,  bowed themselves to the ground before him.
Kgs. And they said to him, Behold now, there are fifty strong men with thy servants. Let them go, we pray thee,  seek thy master, lest the Spirit of Jehovah has taken him up,  cast him upon some mountain, or into some valley. And he said, Ye shall not send.
Kgs. And when they urged him till he was ashamed, he said, Send. Therefore they sent fifty men. And they sought three days,  did not find him.
Kgs. And they came back to him while he remained at Jericho. And he said to them, Did I not say to you, Do not go?
Kgs. And the men of the city said to Elisha, Behold, we pray thee, the situation of this city is pleasant, as my lord sees,  the water is bad,  the ground barren.
Kgs. And he said, Bring me a new cruse,  put salt therein. And they brought it to him.
Kgs. And he went forth to the spring of the waters,  cast salt therein,  said, Thus says Jehovah, I have healed these waters. There shall not be from there any more death or barren land.
Kgs. So the waters were healed to this day, according to the word of Elisha which he spoke.
Kgs. And he went up from there to Bethel. And as he was going up by the way, there came forth young lads out of the city,  mocked him,  said to him, Go up, thou baldhead; go up, thou baldhead.
Kgs. And he looked behind him and saw them,  cursed them in the name of Jehovah. And there came forth two she-bears out of the wood,  tore forty-two lads of them.
Kgs. And he went from there to mount Carmel,  from there he returned to Samaria.
Kgs. Now Jehoram the son of Ahab began to reign over Israel in Samaria in the eighteenth year of Jehoshaphat king of Judah,  reigned twelve years.
Kgs. And he did that which was evil in the sight of Jehovah,  not like his father and like his mother, for he put away the pillar of Baal that his father had made.
Kgs. Nevertheless he clung to the sins of Jeroboam the son of Nebat, with which he made Israel to sin; he did not depart therefrom.
Kgs. Now Mesha king of Moab was a sheep-master. And he rendered to the king of Israel the wool of a hundred thousand lambs,  of a hundred thousand rams.
Kgs. But it came to pass, when Ahab was dead, that the king of Moab rebelled against the king of Israel.
Kgs. And king Jehoram went out of Samaria at that time,  mustered all Israel.
Kgs. And he went and sent to Jehoshaphat the king of Judah, saying, The king of Moab has rebelled against me. Will thou go with me against Moab to battle? And he said, I will go up. I am as thou are, my people as thy people, my horses as thy horses.
Kgs. And he said, Which way shall we go up? And he answered, The way of the wilderness of Edom.
Kgs. So the king of Israel went,  the king of Judah,  the king of Edom. And they made a circuit of seven days' journey,  there was no water for the army, nor for the beasts that followed them.
Kgs. And the king of Israel said, Alas! For Jehovah has called these three kings together to deliver them into the hand of Moab.
Kgs. But Jehoshaphat said, Is there not here a prophet of Jehovah, that we may inquire of Jehovah by him? And one of the king of Israel's servants answered and said, Elisha the son of Shaphat is here, who poured water on the hands of Elijah.
Kgs. And Jehoshaphat said, The word of Jehovah is with him. So the king of Israel and Jehoshaphat and the king of Edom went down to him.
Kgs. And Elisha said to the king of Israel, What have I to do with thee? Get thee to the prophets of thy father,  to the prophets of thy mother. And the king of Israel said to him, No, for Jehovah has called these three kings together to deliver them into the hand of Moab.
Kgs. And Elisha said, As Jehovah of hosts lives, before whom I stand, surely, were it not that I regard the presence of Jehoshaphat the king of Judah, I would not look toward thee, nor see thee.
Kgs. But now bring me a minstrel. And it came to pass, when the minstrel played, that the hand of Jehovah came upon him.
Kgs. And he said, Thus says Jehovah, Make this valley full of trenches.
Kgs. For thus says Jehovah, Ye shall not see wind, neither shall ye see rain, yet that valley shall be filled with water,  ye shall drink, both ye and your cattle and your beasts.
Kgs. And this is but a light thing in the sight of Jehovah. He will also deliver the Moabites into your hand.
Kgs. And ye shall smite every fortified city,  every choice city,  shall fell every good tree,  stop all fountains of water,  mar every good piece of land with stones.
Kgs. And it came to pass in the morning, about the time of offering the oblation, that, behold, there came water by the way of Edom,  the country was filled with water.
Kgs. Now when all the Moabites heard that the kings came up to fight against them, they gathered themselves together, all that were able to put on armor,  upward,  stood on the border.
Kgs. And they rose up early in the morning,  the sun shone upon the water,  the Moabites saw the water opposite them as red as blood.
Kgs. And they said, This is blood. The kings are surely destroyed,  they have smitten each man his fellow. Now therefore, Moab, to the spoil.
Kgs. And when they came to the camp of Israel, the Israelites rose up and smote the Moabites, so that they fled before them,  they went forward into the land smiting the Moabites.
Kgs. And they beat down the cities. And on every good piece of land they cast every man his stone,  filled it. And they stopped all the fountains of water,  felled all the good trees, until in Kir-hareseth only they left the stones of it. However the slingers went about it,  smote it.
Kgs. And when the king of Moab saw that the battle was too hard for him, he took with him seven hundred men that drew sword to break through to the king of Edom,  they could not.
Kgs. Then he took his eldest son who should have reigned in his stead,  offered him for a burnt offering upon the wall. And there was great wrath against Israel,  they departed from him,  returned to their own land.
Kgs. Now a certain woman of the wives of the sons of the prophets cried out to Elisha, saying, Thy servant my husband is dead,  thou know that thy servant feared Jehovah,  the creditor has come to take my two children to him to be bondmen.
Kgs. And Elisha said to her, What shall I do for thee? Tell me, what have thou in the house? And she said, Thy handmaid has not anything in the house except a pot of oil.
Kgs. Then he said, Go, borrow for thee vessels abroad from all thy neighbors, even empty vessels; borrow not a few.
Kgs. And thou shall go in,  shut the door upon thee and upon thy sons,  pour out into all those vessels,  thou shall set aside that which is full.
Kgs. So she went from him,  shut the door upon her and upon her sons. They brought the vessels to her,  she poured out.
Kgs. And it came to pass, when the vessels were full, that she said to her son, Bring me yet a vessel. And he said to her, There is no more a vessel. And the oil halted.
Kgs. Then she came and told the man of God. And he said, Go, sell the oil,  pay thy debt,  live thou and thy sons from the rest.
Kgs. And it fell on a day that Elisha passed to Shunem where there was a prominent woman. And she constrained him to eat bread. And so it was, that as often as he passed by he turned in there to eat bread.
Kgs. And she said to her husband, Behold now, I perceive that this is a holy man of God who passes by us continually.
Kgs. Let us make, I pray thee, a little chamber on the wall. And let us set a bed for him there,  a table,  a seat,  a lampstand. And it shall be, when he comes to us, that he shall turn in there.
Kgs. And it fell on a day that he came there,  he turned into the chamber and lay there.
Kgs. And he said to Gehazi his servant, Call this Shunammite. And when he had called her, she stood before him.
Kgs. And he said to him, Say now to her, Behold, thou have been caring for us with all this care. What is to be done for thee? Would thou be spoken for to the king, or to the captain of the army? And she answered, I dwell among my own people.
Kgs. And he said, What then is to be done for her? And Gehazi answered, Truly she has no son,  her husband is old.
Kgs. And he said, Call her. And when he had called her, she stood in the door.
Kgs. And he said, At this season, when the time comes round, thou shall embrace a son. And she said, No, my lord, thou man of God, do not lie to thy handmaid.
Kgs. And the woman conceived,  bore a son at that season, when the time came round, as Elisha had said to her.
Kgs. And when the child was grown, it fell on a day that he went out to his father to the reapers.
Kgs. And he said to his father, My head, my head. And he said to his servant, Carry him to his mother.
Kgs. And when he had taken him,  brought him to his mother, he sat on her knees till noon,  then died.
