Kgs. And she went up and laid him on the bed of the man of God,  shut the door upon him,  went out.
Kgs. And she called to her husband,  said, Send me, I pray thee, one of the servants,  one of the donkeys, that I may run to the man of God,  come again.
Kgs. And he said, Why will thou go to him today? It is neither new moon nor sabbath. And she said, It shall be well.
Kgs. Then she saddled a donkey,  said to her servant, Drive,  go forward. Do not restrain my riding unless I bid thee.
Kgs. So she went,  came to the man of God to mount Carmel. And it came to pass, when the man of God saw her afar off, that he said to Gehazi his servant, Behold, yonder is the Shunammite.
Kgs. Run now, I pray thee, to meet her,  say to her, Is it well with thee? Is it well with thy husband? Is it well with the child? And she answered, It is well.
Kgs. And when she came to the man of God to the hill, she caught hold of his feet. And Gehazi came near to thrust her away,  the man of God said, Let her alone, for her soul is vexed within her,  Jehovah has hid it from me,  has not told me.
Kgs. Then she said, Did I desire a son of my lord? Did I not say, do not deceive me?
Kgs. Then he said to Gehazi, Gird up thy loins,  take my staff in thy hand,  go thy way. If thou meet any man, do not salute him,  if any salute thee, do not answer him again. And lay my staff upon the face of the child.
Kgs. And the mother of the child said, As Jehovah lives,  as thy soul lives, I will not leave thee. And he arose,  followed her.
Kgs. And Gehazi passed on before them,  laid the staff upon the face of the child,  there was neither voice, nor hearing. Therefore he returned to meet him,  told him, saying, The child has not awakened.
Kgs. And when Elisha came into the house, behold, the child was dead,  laid upon his bed.
Kgs. He went in therefore,  shut the door upon the two of them,  prayed to Jehovah.
Kgs. And he went up,  lay upon the child,  put his mouth upon his mouth,  his eyes upon his eyes,  his hands upon his hands. And he stretched himself upon him,  the flesh of the child grew warm.
Kgs. Then he returned,  walked in the house once to and fro,  went up,  stretched himself upon him. And the child sneezed seven times,  the child opened his eyes.
Kgs. And he called Gehazi,  said, Call this Shunammite. So he called her. And when she came in to him, he said, Take up thy son.
Kgs. Then she went in,  fell at his feet,  bowed herself to the ground. And she took up her son,  went out.
Kgs. And Elisha came again to Gilgal. And there was a dearth in the land,  the sons of the prophets were sitting before him. And he said to his servant, Set on the great pot,  boil pottage for the sons of the prophets.
Kgs. And one went out into the field to gather herbs,  found a wild vine,  gathered wild gourds from it, his lap full,  came and shred them into the pot of pottage, for they did not know them.
Kgs. So they poured out for the men to eat. And it came to pass, as they were eating of the pottage, that they cried out,  said, O man of God, there is death in the pot. And they could not eat of it.
Kgs. But he said, Then bring meal. And he cast it into the pot,  he said, Pour out for the people, that they may eat. And there was no harm in the pot.
Kgs. And a man came from Baal-shalishah,  brought the man of God bread of the first-fruits, twenty loaves of barley,  fresh ears of grain in his sack. And he said, Give to the people that they may eat.
Kgs. And his servant said, What, should I set this before a hundred men? But he said, Give to the people that they may eat, for thus says Jehovah, They shall eat,  shall leave of it.
Kgs. So he set it before them,  they ate,  left of it according to the word of Jehovah.
Kgs. Now Naaman, captain of the army of the king of Syria, was a great man with his master,  honorable, because by him Jehovah had given victory to Syria. He was also a mighty man of valor,  he was a leper.
Kgs. And the Syrians had gone out in bands,  had brought away captive out of the land of Israel a little maiden,  she waited on Naaman's wife.
Kgs. And she said to her mistress, Would that my lord were with the prophet who is in Samaria! Then he would heal him of his leprosy.
Kgs. And a man went in,  told his lord, saying, Thus and thus said the maiden who is of the land of Israel.
Kgs. And the king of Syria said, Go now,  I will send a letter to the king of Israel. And he departed,  took with him ten talents of silver,  six thousand pieces of gold,  ten changes of raiment.
Kgs. And he brought the letter to the king of Israel, saying, And now when this letter has come to thee, behold, I have sent Naaman my servant to thee that thou may heal him of his leprosy.
Kgs. And it came to pass, when the king of Israel had read the letter, that he tore his clothes,  said, Am I God, to kill and to make alive, that this man sends to me to heal a man of his leprosy? But consider, I pray you,  see how he seeks a quarrel against me.
Kgs. And it was so, when Elisha the man of God heard that the king of Israel had torn his clothes, that he sent to the king, saying, Why have thou torn thy clothes? Let him come now to me,  he shall know that there is a prophet in Israel.
Kgs. So Naaman came with his horses and with his chariots,  stood at the door of the house of Elisha.
Kgs. And Elisha sent a messenger to him, saying, Go and wash in the Jordan seven times,  thy flesh shall come again to thee,  thou shall be clean.
Kgs. But Naaman was angry,  went away,  said, Behold, I thought he will surely come out to me,  stand,  call on the name of Jehovah his God,  wave his hand over the place,  heal the leper.
Kgs. Are not Abanah and Pharpar, the rivers of Damascus, better than all the waters of Israel? May I not wash in them,  be clean? So he turned and went away in a rage.
Kgs. And his servants came near,  spoke to him,  said, My father, if the prophet had bid thee do some great thing, would thou not have done it? How much rather then, when he says to thee, Wash,  be clean?
Kgs. Then went he down,  dipped himself seven times in the Jordan, according to the saying of the man of God. And his flesh came again like the flesh of a little child,  he was clean.
Kgs. And he returned to the man of God, he and all his company,  came,  stood before him. And he said, Behold, now I know that there is no God in all the earth,  in Israel. Now therefore, I pray thee, take a present from thy servant.
Kgs. But he said, As Jehovah lives, before whom I stand, I will receive none. And he urged him to take it,  he refused.
Kgs. And Naaman said, If not, yet, I pray thee, let there be given to thy servant two mules' burden of dirt, for thy servant will henceforth offer neither burnt offering nor sacrifice to other gods,  to Jehovah.
Kgs. In this thing Jehovah pardon thy servant: when my master goes into the house of Rimmon to worship there,  he leans on my hand,  I bow myself in the house of Rimmon, when I bow myself in the house of Rimmon, Jehovah pardon thy servant in this thing.
Kgs. And he said to him, Go in peace. So he departed from him a little way.
Kgs. But Gehazi the servant of Elisha the man of God, said, Behold, my master has spared this Naaman the Syrian, in not receiving at his hands that which he brought. As Jehovah lives, I will run after him,  take something from him.
Kgs. So Gehazi followed after Naaman. And when Naaman saw him running after him, he alighted from the chariot to meet him,  said, Is all well?
Kgs. And he said, All is well. My master has sent me, saying, Behold, even now there come to me from the hill-country of Ephraim two young men of the sons of the prophets. Give them, I pray thee, a talent of silver,  two changes of raiment.
Kgs. And Naaman said, Be pleased to take two talents. And he urged him,  bound two talents of silver in two bags, with two changes of raiment,  laid them upon two of his servants,  they bore them before him.
Kgs. And when he came to the hill, he took them from their hand,  bestowed them in the house,  he let the men go,  they departed.
Kgs. But he went in,  stood before his master. And Elisha said to him, From where did thou come, Gehazi? And he said, Thy servant went nowhere.
Kgs. And he said to him, Did not my heart go with thee when the man turned from his chariot to meet thee? Is it a time to receive money,  to receive garments,  oliveyards and vineyards,  sheep and oxen,  men-servants and maid-servants?
Kgs. The leprosy therefore of Naaman shall cling to thee,  to thy seed forever. And he went out from his presence a leper as white as snow.
Kgs. And the sons of the prophets said to Elisha, Behold now, the place where we dwell before thee is too confined for us.
Kgs. Let us go, we pray thee, to the Jordan,  every man take a beam from there,  let us make us a place there, where we may dwell. And he answered, Go ye.
Kgs. And one said, Be pleased, I pray thee, to go with thy servants. And he answered, I will go.
Kgs. So he went with them. And when they came to the Jordan, they cut down wood.
Kgs. But as one was felling a beam, the axe-head fell into the water. And he cried,  said, Alas, my master! For it was borrowed.
Kgs. And the man of God said, Where did it fall? And he showed him the place. And he cut down a stick,  cast it in there,  made the iron to float.
Kgs. And he said, Take it up to thee. So he put out his hand,  took it.
Kgs. Now the king of Syria was warring against Israel,  he took counsel with his servants, saying, In such and such a place shall be my camp.
Kgs. And the man of God sent to the king of Israel, saying, Beware that thou not pass such a place, for the Syrians are coming down there.
Kgs. And the king of Israel sent to the place which the man of God told him and warned him of. And he saved himself there, not once nor twice.
Kgs. And the heart of the king of Syria was greatly troubled for this thing,  he called his servants,  said to them, Will ye not show me which of us is for the king of Israel?
Kgs. And one of his servants said, No, my lord, O king,  Elisha, the prophet who is in Israel tells the king of Israel the words that thou speak in thy bedchamber.
Kgs. And he said, Go and see where he is that I may send and fetch him. And it was told him, saying, Behold, he is in Dothan.
Kgs. Therefore he sent there horses,  chariots,  a great army. And they came by night,  encompassed the city about.
Kgs. And when the servant of the man of God was risen early,  gone forth, behold, an army with horses and chariots was round about the city. And his servant said to him, Alas, my master! What shall we do?
Kgs. And he answered, Fear not, for those who are with us are more than those who are with them.
Kgs. And Elisha prayed,  said, Jehovah, I pray thee, open his eyes that he may see. And Jehovah opened the eyes of the young man,  he saw. And, behold, the mountain was full of horses and chariots of fire round about Elisha.
Kgs. And when they came down to him, Elisha prayed to Jehovah,  said, Smite this people, I pray thee, with blindness. And he smote them with blindness according to the word of Elisha.
Kgs. And Elisha said to them, This is not the way, neither is this the city. Follow me,  I will bring you to the man whom ye seek. And he led them to Samaria.
Kgs. And it came to pass, when they came into Samaria, that Elisha said, Jehovah, open the eyes of these men that they may see. And Jehovah opened their eyes,  they saw. And, behold, they were in the midst of Samaria.
Kgs. And the king of Israel said to Elisha, when he saw them, My father, shall I smite them? Shall I smite them?
Kgs. And he answered, Thou shall not smite them. Would thou smite those whom thou have taken captive with thy sword and with thy bow? Set bread and water before them that they may eat and drink,  go to their master.
Kgs. And he prepared great provision for them. And when they had eaten and drunk, he sent them away,  they went to their master. And the bands of Syria came no more into the land of Israel.
Kgs. And it came to pass after this, that Benhadad king of Syria gathered all his army,  went up,  besieged Samaria.
Kgs. And there was a great famine in Samaria. And, behold, they besieged it until a donkey's head was sold for eighty pieces of silver,  the fourth part of a kab of dove's dung for five pieces of silver.
Kgs. And as the king of Israel was passing by upon the wall, a woman cried out to him, saying, Help, my lord, O king.
Kgs. And he said, If Jehovah does not help thee, from where shall I help thee? Out of the threshing-floor, or out of the winepress?
Kgs. And the king said to her, What troubles thee? And she answered, This woman said to me, Give thy son that we may eat him today,  we will eat my son tomorrow.
Kgs. So we boiled my son,  ate him. And I said to her on the next day, Give thy son that we may eat him. And she has hid her son.
Kgs. And it came to pass, when the king heard the words of the woman, that he tore his clothes (now he was passing by upon the wall). And the people looked, , behold, he had sackcloth inside upon his flesh.
Kgs. Then he said, God do so to me,  more also, if the head of Elisha the son of Shaphat shall stand on him this day.
Kgs. But Elisha was sitting in his house,  the elders were sitting with him. And the king sent a man from before him,  before the messenger came to him, he said to the elders, Do ye see how this son of a murderer has sent to take away my head? Look, when the messenger comes, shut the door,  hold the door fast against him. Is not the sound of his master's feet behind him?
Kgs. And while he was yet talking with them, behold, the messenger came down to him,  he said, Behold, this evil is of Jehovah. Why should I wait for Jehovah any longer?
Kgs. And Elisha said, Hear ye the word of Jehovah. Thus says Jehovah, Tomorrow about this time a measure of fine flour shall be sold for a shekel,  two measures of barley for a shekel, in the gate of Samaria.
Kgs. Then the captain on whose hand the king leaned answered the man of God,  said, Behold, if Jehovah should make windows in heaven, might this thing be? And he said, Behold, thou shall see it with thine eyes,  shall not eat of it.
Kgs. Now there were four leprous men at the entrance of the gate,  they said one to another, Why do we sit here until we die?
Kgs. If we say, We will enter into the city, then the famine is in the city,  we shall die there. And if we sit still here, we die also. Now therefore come,  let us fall to the army of the Syrians. If they save us alive, we shall live,  if they kill us, we shall but die.
Kgs. And they rose up in the twilight, to go to the camp of the Syrians. And when they came to the outermost part of the camp of the Syrians, behold, there was no man there.
Kgs. For the Lord had made the army of the Syrians to hear a noise of chariots,  a noise of horses, even the noise of a great army. And they said one to another, Lo, the king of Israel has hired against us the kings of the Hittites,  the kings of the Egyptians, to come upon us.
Kgs. Therefore they arose and fled in the twilight,  left their tents,  their horses,  their donkeys, even the camp as it was,  fled for their life.
Kgs. And when these lepers came to the outermost part of the camp, they went into one tent,  ate and drank,  carried from there silver,  gold,  raiment,  went and hid it. And they came back,  entered into another tent,  carried from there also,  went and hid it.
Kgs. Then they said one to another, We are not doing right. This day is a day of good news,  we keep silent. If we delay till the morning light, punishment will overtake us. Now therefore come, let us go and tell the king's household.
Kgs. So they came and called to the porter of the city. And they told them, saying, We came to the camp of the Syrians, , behold, there was no man there, neither voice of man,  the horses tied,  the donkeys tied,  the tents as they were.
Kgs. And he called the porters,  they told it to the king's household within.
Kgs. And the king arose in the night,  said to his servants, I will now show you what the Syrians have done to us. They know that we are hungry. Therefore they have gone out of the camp to hide themselves in the field, saying, When they come out of the city we shall take them alive,  get into the city.
Kgs. And one of his servants answered and said, Let, I pray thee, some men take five of the horses that remain, which are left in the city (behold, they are as all the multitude of Israel that are left in it; behold, they are as all the multitude of Israel that are consumed),  let us send and see.
Kgs. Therefore they took two chariots with horses. And the king sent after the army of the Syrians, saying, Go and see.
Kgs. And they went after them to the Jordan. And, lo, all the way was full of garments and vessels, which the Syrians had cast away in their haste. And the messengers returned,  told the king.
Kgs. And the people went out,  plundered the camp of the Syrians. So a measure of fine flour was sold for a shekel,  two measures of barley for a shekel, according to the word of Jehovah.
Kgs. And the king appointed the captain on whose hand he leaned to have the charge of the gate. And the people trampled upon him in the gate,  he died as the man of God had said, who spoke when the king came down to him.
Kgs. And it came to pass, as the man of God had spoken to the king, saying, Two measures of barley for a shekel,  a measure of fine flour for a shekel, shall be tomorrow about this time in the gate of Samaria.
Kgs. And that captain answered the man of God,  said, Now, behold, if Jehovah should make windows in heaven, might such a thing be? And he said, Behold, thou shall see it with thine eyes,  shall not eat of it.
Kgs. It came to pass even so to him, for the people trampled upon him in the gate,  he died.
Kgs. Now Elisha had spoken to the woman, whose son he had restored to life, saying, Arise,  go thou and thy household,  sojourn wherever thou can sojourn, for Jehovah has called for a famine,  it shall also come upon the land seven years.
Kgs. And the woman arose,  did according to the word of the man of God. And she went with her household,  sojourned in the land of the Philistines seven years.
Kgs. And it came to pass at the end of seven years, that the woman returned out of the land of the Philistines,  she went forth to cry to the king for her house and for her land.
Kgs. Now the king was talking with Gehazi the servant of the man of God, saying, Tell me, I pray thee, all the great things that Elisha has done.
Kgs. And it came to pass, as he was telling the king how he had restored to life him who was dead, that, behold, the woman, whose son he had restored to life, cried to the king for her house and for her land. And Gehazi said, My lord, O king, this is the woman,  this is her son whom Elisha restored to life.
Kgs. And when the king asked the woman, she told him. So the king appointed to her a certain officer, saying, Restore all that was hers,  all the fruits of the field since the day that she left the land, even until now.
Kgs. And Elisha came to Damascus,  Benhadad the king of Syria was sick. And it was told him, saying, The man of God has come here.
Kgs. And the king said to Hazael, Take a present in thy hand,  go, meet the man of God,  inquire of Jehovah by him, saying, Shall I recover of this sickness?
Kgs. So Hazael went to meet him,  took a present with him, even of every good thing of Damascus, forty camels' burden,  came and stood before him,  said, Thy son Benhadad king of Syria has sent me to thee, saying, Shall I recover of this sickness?
Kgs. And Elisha said to him, Go, say to him, Thou shall surely recover. However Jehovah has shown me that he shall surely die.
Kgs. And he settled his countenance steadfastly upon him, until he was ashamed. And the man of God wept.
Kgs. And Hazael said, Why do thou weep my lord? And he answered, Because I know the evil that thou will do to the sons of Israel: their strongholds thou will set on fire,  their young men thou will kill with the sword,  will dash in pieces their little ones,  rip up their women with child.
Kgs. And Hazael said, But what is thy servant, who is but a dog, that he should do this great thing? And Elisha answered, Jehovah has shown me that thou shall be king over Syria.
Kgs. Then he departed from Elisha,  came to his master, who said to him, What did Elisha say to thee? And he answered, He told me that thou would surely recover.
Kgs. And it came to pass on the morrow, that he took the coverlet,  dipped it in water,  spread it on his face, so that he died. And Hazael reigned in his stead.
Kgs. And in the fifth year of Joram the son of Ahab king of Israel, Jehoshaphat being then king of Judah, Jehoram the son of Jehoshaphat king of Judah began to reign.
Kgs. He was thirty-two years old when he began to reign,  he reigned eight years in Jerusalem.
Kgs. And he walked in the way of the kings of Israel, as did the house of Ahab, for he had the daughter of Ahab to wife. And he did that which was evil in the sight of Jehovah.
Kgs. However Jehovah would not destroy Judah, for David his servant's sake, as he promised him to give to him a lamp for his sons always.
Kgs. In his days Edom revolted from under the hand of Judah,  made a king over themselves.
Kgs. Then Joram passed over to Zair,  all his chariots with him. And he rose up by night,  smote the Edomites that encompassed him about,  the captains of the chariots. And the people fled to their tents.
Kgs. So Edom revolted from under the hand of Judah to this day. Then Libnah revolted at the same time.
Kgs. And the rest of the acts of Joram,  all that he did, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah?
Kgs. And Joram slept with his fathers,  was buried with his fathers in the city of David,  Ahaziah his son reigned in his stead.
Kgs. In the twelfth year of Joram the son of Ahab king of Israel, Ahaziah the son of Jehoram king of Judah began to reign.
Kgs. Ahaziah was twenty-two years old when he began to reign,  he reigned one year in Jerusalem. And his mother's name was Athaliah the daughter of Omri king of Israel.
Kgs. And he walked in the way of the house of Ahab,  did that which was evil in the sight of Jehovah, as did the house of Ahab, for he was the son-in-law of the house of Ahab.
Kgs. And he went with Joram the son of Ahab to war against Hazael king of Syria at Ramoth-gilead,  the Syrians wounded Joram.
Kgs. And king Joram returned to be healed in Jezreel of the wounds which the Syrians had given him at Ramah when he fought against Hazael king of Syria. And Ahaziah the son of Jehoram king of Judah went down to see Joram the son of Ahab in Jezreel, because he was sick.
Kgs. And Elisha the prophet called one of the sons of the prophets,  said to him, Gird up thy loins,  take this vial of oil in thy hand,  go to Ramoth-gilead.
Kgs. And when thou come there, look out there for Jehu the son of Jehoshaphat the son of Nimshi,  go in,  make him arise up from among his brothers,  carry him to an inner chamber.
Kgs. Then take the vial of oil,  pour it on his head,  say, Thus says Jehovah, I have anointed thee king over Israel. Then open the door,  flee,  delay not.
Kgs. So the young man, even the young man the prophet, went to Ramoth-gilead.
Kgs. And when he came, behold, the captains of the army were sitting. And he said, I have an errand to thee, O captain. And Jehu said, To which of us all? And he said, To thee, O captain.
Kgs. And he arose,  went into the house. And he poured the oil on his head,  said to him, Thus says Jehovah, the God of Israel, I have anointed thee king over the people of Jehovah, even over Israel.
Kgs. And thou shall smite the house of Ahab thy master, that I may avenge the blood of my servants the prophets,  the blood of all the servants of Jehovah, at the hand of Jezebel.
Kgs. For the whole house of Ahab shall perish. And I will cut off from Ahab every man-child,  him who is shut up and him who is left at large in Israel.
Kgs. And I will make the house of Ahab like the house of Jeroboam the son of Nebat,  like the house of Baasha the son of Ahijah.
Kgs. And the dogs shall eat Jezebel in the portion of Jezreel,  there shall be none to bury her. And he opened the door,  fled.
Kgs. Then Jehu came forth to the servants of his lord,  one said to him, Is all well? Why did this mad fellow come to thee? And he said to them, Ye know the man and what his talk was.
Kgs. And they said, It is not true; tell us now. And he said, Thus and thus he spoke to me, saying, Thus says Jehovah, I have anointed thee king over Israel.
Kgs. Then they hastened,  every man took his garment,  put it under him on the top of the stairs,  blew the trumpet, saying, Jehu is king.
Kgs. So Jehu the son of Jehoshaphat the son of Nimshi conspired against Joram. (Now Joram was keeping Ramoth-gilead, he and all Israel, because of Hazael king of Syria.
Kgs. But king Joram was returned to be healed in Jezreel of the wounds which the Syrians had given him when he fought with Hazael king of Syria.) And Jehu said, If this be your mind, then let none escape and go forth out of the city to go to tell it in Jezreel.
Kgs. So Jehu rode in a chariot,  went to Jezreel, for Joram lay there. And Ahaziah king of Judah came down to see Joram.
Kgs. Now the watchman was standing on the tower in Jezreel,  he spied the company of Jehu as he came,  said, I see a company. And Joram said, Take a horseman,  send to meet them,  let him say, Is it peace?
Kgs. So one went on horseback to meet him,  said, Thus says the king, Is it peace? And Jehu said, What have thou to do with peace? Turn thee behind me. And the watchman told, saying, The messenger came to them,  he does not come back.
Kgs. Then he sent out a second on horseback who came to them,  said, Thus says the king, Is it peace? And Jehu answered, What have thou to do with peace? Turn thee behind me.
Kgs. And the watchman told, saying, He came to them,  does not come back. And the driving is like the driving of Jehu the son of Nimshi, for he drives furiously.
Kgs. And Joram said, Make ready. And they made his chariot ready. And Joram king of Israel and Ahaziah king of Judah went out, each in his chariot,  they went out to meet Jehu,  found him in the portion of Naboth the Jezreelite.
Kgs. And it came to pass, when Joram saw Jehu, that he said, Is it peace, Jehu? And he answered, What peace, so long as the whoredoms of thy mother Jezebel and her witchcrafts are so many?
Kgs. And Joram turned his hands,  fled,  said to Ahaziah, There is treachery, O Ahaziah.
Kgs. And Jehu drew his bow with his full strength,  smote Joram between his arms. And the arrow went out at his heart,  he sank down in his chariot.
Kgs. Then Jehu said to Bidkar his captain, Take up,  cast him in the portion of the field of Naboth the Jezreelite. For remember how that, when I and thou rode together after Ahab his father, Jehovah laid this burden upon him:
Kgs. Surely I have seen yesterday the blood of Naboth,  the blood of his sons, says Jehovah,  I will requite thee in this plot, says Jehovah. Now therefore take and cast him into the plot of ground, according to the word of Jehovah.
Kgs. But when Ahaziah the king of Judah saw this, he fled by the way of the garden-house. And Jehu followed after him,  said, Smite him also in the chariot. And they smote him at the ascent of Gur, which is by Ibleam. And he fled to Megiddo,  died there.
Kgs. And his servants carried him in a chariot to Jerusalem,  buried him in his sepulcher with his fathers in the city of David.
Kgs. (And it was in the eleventh year of Joram the son of Ahab Ahaziah began to reign over Judah.)
Kgs. And when Jehu came to Jezreel, Jezebel heard of it. And she painted her eyes,  attired her head,  looked out at the window.
Kgs. And as Jehu entered in at the gate, she said, Is it peace, thou Zimri, thy master's murderer?
Kgs. And he lifted up his face to the window,  said, Who is on my side? Who? And two or three eunuchs looked out to him.
Kgs. And he said, Throw her down. So they threw her down. And some of her blood was sprinkled on the wall,  on the horses. And he trampled her under foot.
Kgs. And when he came in, he ate and drank,  he said, Now see to this cursed woman,  bury her, for she is a king's daughter.
Kgs. And they went to bury her,  they found no more of her than the skull,  the feet,  the palms of her hands.
Kgs. Therefore they came back,  told him. And he said, This is the word of Jehovah, which he spoke by his servant Elijah the Tishbite, saying, In the portion of Jezreel shall the dogs eat the flesh of Jezebel,
Kgs. and the body of Jezebel shall be as dung upon the face of the field in the portion of Jezreel, so that they shall not say, This is Jezebel.
Kgs. Now Ahab had seventy sons in Samaria. And Jehu wrote letters,  sent to Samaria, to the rulers of Jezreel, even the elders,  to those who brought up the sons of Ahab, saying,
Kgs. And now as soon as this letter comes to you, seeing your master's sons are with you,  there are with you chariots and horses, also a fortified city,  armor,
Kgs. look ye out for the best and fittest of your master's sons,  set him on his father's throne,  fight for your master's house.
Kgs. But they were exceedingly afraid,  said, Behold, the two kings did not stand before him. How then shall we stand?
Kgs. And he who was over the household,  he who was over the city, the elders also,  those who brought up the sons, sent to Jehu, saying, We are thy servants,  will do all that thou shall bid us. We will not make any man king. Do thou that which is good in thine eyes.
Kgs. Then he wrote a letter the second time to them, saying, If ye be on my side,  if ye will hearken to my voice, take ye the heads of the men your master's sons,  come to me to Jezreel by tomorrow this time. Now the king's sons, being seventy persons, were with the great men of the city who reared them.
Kgs. And it came to pass, when the letter came to them, that they took the king's sons,  killed them, even seventy persons,  put their heads in baskets,  sent them to him to Jezreel.
Kgs. And a messenger came,  told him, saying, They have brought the heads of the king's sons. And he said, Lay ye them in two heaps at the entrance of the gate until the morning.
Kgs. And it came to pass in the morning, that he went out,  stood,  said to all the people, Ye are righteous. Behold, I conspired against my master,  killed him. But who smote all these?
Kgs. Know now that there shall fall to the earth nothing of the word of Jehovah, which Jehovah spoke concerning the house of Ahab, for Jehovah has done that which he spoke by his servant Elijah.
Kgs. So Jehu smote all who remained of the house of Ahab in Jezreel,  all his great men,  his familiar friends,  his priests, until he left to him none remaining.
Kgs. And he arose and departed,  went to Samaria. And as he was at the shearing-house of the shepherds in the way,
Kgs. Jehu met with the brothers of Ahaziah king of Judah,  said, Who are ye? And they answered, We are the brothers of Ahaziah,  we go down to salute the sons of the king and the sons of the queen.
Kgs. And he said, Take them alive. And they took them alive,  killed them at the pit of the shearing-house, even forty-two men; neither did he leave any of them.
Kgs. And when he was departed from there, he came upon on Jehonadab the son of Rechab coming to meet him. And he saluted him,  said to him, Is thy heart right, as my heart is with thy heart? And Jehonadab answered, It is. If it be, give me thy hand. And he gave him his hand,  he took him up to him into the chariot.
Kgs. And he said, Come with me,  see my zeal for Jehovah. So they made him ride in his chariot.
Kgs. And when he came to Samaria, he smote all who remained to Ahab in Samaria, till he had destroyed him, according to the word of Jehovah, which he spoke to Elijah.
Kgs. And Jehu gathered all the people together,  said to them, Ahab served Baal a little,  Jehu will serve him much.
Kgs. Now therefore call to me all the prophets of Baal, all his worshippers,  all his priests. Let none be lacking, for I have a great sacrifice to do to Baal. Whoever shall be lacking, he shall not live. But Jehu did it in subtlety, to the intent that he might destroy the worshippers of Baal.
Kgs. And Jehu said, Sanctify a solemn assembly for Baal. And they proclaimed it.
Kgs. And Jehu sent through all Israel. And all the worshippers of Baal came, so that there was not a man left who did not come. And they came into the house of Baal,  the house of Baal was filled from one end to another.
Kgs. And he said to him who was over the vestry, Bring forth vestments for all the worshippers of Baal. And he brought forth for them vestments.
Kgs. And Jehu went,  Jehonadab the son of Rechab, into the house of Baal. And he said to the worshippers of Baal, Search,  look that there be here with you none of the servants of Jehovah,  the worshippers of Baal only.
Kgs. And they went in to offer sacrifices and burnt offerings. Now Jehu had appointed for him eighty men outside,  said, If any of the men whom I bring into your hands escape, he who lets him go, his life shall be for the life of him.
Kgs. And it came to pass, as soon as he had made an end of offering the burnt offering, that Jehu said to the guard and to the captains, Go in,  kill them; let none come forth. And they smote them with the edge of the sword. And the guard and the captains cast them out,  went to the city of the house of Baal.
Kgs. And they brought forth the pillars that were in the house of Baal,  burned them.
Kgs. And they broke down the pillar of Baal,  broke down the house of Baal,  made it an out-house to this day.
Kgs. Thus Jehu destroyed Baal out of Israel.
Kgs. However from the sins of Jeroboam the son of Nebat, with which he made Israel to sin, Jehu did not depart from after them, namely, the golden calves that were in Bethel,  that were in Dan.
Kgs. And Jehovah said to Jehu, Because thou have done well in executing that which is right in my eyes,  have done to the house of Ahab according to all that was in my heart, thy sons of the fourth generation shall sit on the throne of Israel.
Kgs. But Jehu did not take heed to walk in the law of Jehovah, the God of Israel, with all his heart. He did not depart from the sins of Jeroboam, with which he made Israel to sin.
Kgs. In those days Jehovah began to cut off from Israel. And Hazael smote them in all the borders of Israel,
Kgs. from the Jordan eastward, all the land of Gilead, the Gadites,  the Reubenites,  the Manassites, from Aroer, which is by the valley of the Arnon, even Gilead and Bashan.
Kgs. Now the rest of the acts of Jehu,  all that he did,  all his might, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel?
Kgs. And Jehu slept with his fathers,  they buried him in Samaria. And Jehoahaz his son reigned in his stead.
Kgs. And the time that Jehu reigned over Israel in Samaria was twenty-eight years.
Kgs. Now when Athaliah the mother of Ahaziah saw that her son was dead, she arose and destroyed all the royal seed.
Kgs. But Jehosheba, the daughter of king Joram, sister of Ahaziah, took Joash the son of Ahaziah,  stole him away from among the king's sons who were slain, even him and his nurse,  put them in the bedchamber. And they hid him from Athaliah, so that he was not slain.
Kgs. And he was with her hidden in the house of Jehovah six years. And Athaliah reigned over the land.
Kgs. And in the seventh year Jehoiada sent and fetched the captains over hundreds of the Carites and of the guard,  brought them to him into the house of Jehovah. And he made a covenant with them,  took an oath of them in the house of Jehovah,  showed them the king's son.
Kgs. And he commanded them, saying, This is the thing that ye shall do: a third part of you, who come in on the sabbath, shall be keepers of the watch of the king's house;
Kgs. and a third part shall be at the gate Sur; and a third part at the gate behind the guard. So shall ye keep the watch of the house,  be a barrier.
Kgs. And the two companies of you, even all who go forth on the sabbath, shall keep the watch of the house of Jehovah around the king.
Kgs. And ye shall encompass the king round about, every man with his weapons in his hand. And he who comes within the ranks, let him be slain. And be ye with the king when he goes out,  when he comes in.
Kgs. And the captains over hundreds did according to all that Jehoiada the priest commanded. And every man took his men, those who were to come in on the sabbath, with those who were to go out on the sabbath,  came to Jehoiada the priest.
Kgs. And the priest delivered to the captains over hundreds the spears and shields that had been king David's, which were in the house of Jehovah.
Kgs. And the guard stood, every man with his weapons in his hand, from the right side of the house to the left side of the house, along by the altar and the house, by the king round about.
Kgs. Then he brought out the king's son,  put the crown upon him,  gave him the testimony. And they made him king,  anointed him. And they clapped their hands,  said, Live, O king.
Kgs. And when Athaliah heard the noise of the guard and of the people, she came to the people into the house of Jehovah.
Kgs. And she looked, , behold, the king stood by the pillar, as the manner was,  the captains and the trumpets by the king. And all the people of the land rejoiced,  blew trumpets. Then Athaliah tore her clothes,  cried, Treason! treason!
Kgs. And Jehoiada the priest commanded the captains of hundreds who were set over the army,  said to them, Have her forth between the ranks,  kill with the sword the man who follows her. For the priest said, Let her not be slain in the house of Jehovah.
Kgs. So they made way for her. And she went by the way of the horses' entry to the king's house,  there was she slain.
Kgs. And Jehoiada made a covenant between Jehovah and the king and the people, that they should be Jehovah's people; between the king also and the people.
Kgs. And all the people of the land went to the house of Baal,  broke it down. They broke in pieces his altars and his images thoroughly,  killed Mattan the priest of Baal before the altars. And the priest appointed officers over the house of Jehovah.
Kgs. And he took the captains over hundreds,  the Carites,  the guard,  all the people of the land,  they brought down the king from the house of Jehovah,  came by the way of the gate of the guard to the king's house. And he sat on the throne of the kings.
Kgs. So all the people of the land rejoiced,  the city was quiet. And they had slain Athaliah with the sword at the king's house.
Kgs. Joash was seven years old when he began to reign.
Kgs. Joash began to reign in the seventh year of Jehu. And he reigned forty years in Jerusalem,  his mother's name was Zibiah of Beersheba.
Kgs. And Joash did that which was right in the eyes of Jehovah all his days in which Jehoiada the priest instructed him.
Kgs. However the high places were not taken away; the people still sacrificed and burnt incense in the high places.
Kgs. And Joash said to the priests, All the money of the hallowed things that is brought into the house of Jehovah, in current money, the money of the persons for whom each man is rated,  all the money that it comes into any man's heart to bring into the house of Jehovah,
Kgs. let the priests take it to them, every man from his acquaintance,  they shall repair the broken parts of the house wherever any breach shall be found.
Kgs. But it was so, that in the twenty-third year of king Joash the priests had not repaired the broken parts of the house.
Kgs. Then king Joash called for Jehoiada the priest,  for the other priests,  said to them, Why do ye not repair the broken parts of the house? Now therefore take no more money from your acquaintance,  deliver it for the broken parts of the house.
Kgs. And the priests consented that they should take no more money from the people, neither repair the broken parts of the house.
Kgs. But Jehoiada the priest took a chest,  bored a hole in the lid of it,  set it beside the altar, on the right side as a man comes into the house of Jehovah. And the priests who kept the threshold put in it all the money that was brought into the house of Jehovah.
Kgs. And it was so, when they saw that there was much money in the chest, that the king's scribe and the high priest came up,  they put up in bags and counted the money that was found in the house of Jehovah.
Kgs. And they gave the money that was weighed out into the hands of those who did the work, who had the oversight of the house of Jehovah. And they paid it out to the carpenters and the builders who worked upon the house of Jehovah,
Kgs. and to the masons and the hewers of stone,  for buying timber and hewn stone to repair the broken parts of the house of Jehovah,  for all that was laid out for the house to repair it.
Kgs. But there were not made for the house of Jehovah cups of silver, snuffers, basins, trumpets, any vessels of gold, or vessels of silver, of the money that was brought into the house of Jehovah,
Kgs. for they gave that to those who did the work,  with it repaired the house of Jehovah.
Kgs. Moreover they did not reckon with the men into whose hand they delivered the money to give to those who did the work, for they dealt faithfully.
Kgs. The money for the trespass offerings,  the money for the sin offerings, was not brought into the house of Jehovah; it was the priests'.
Kgs. Then Hazael king of Syria went up,  fought against Gath,  took it. And Hazael set his face to go up to Jerusalem.
Kgs. And Joash king of Judah took all the hallowed things that Jehoshaphat and Jehoram and Ahaziah, his fathers, kings of Judah, had dedicated,  his own hallowed things,  all the gold that was found in the treasures of the house of Jehovah,  of the king's house,  sent it to Hazael king of Syria. And he went away from Jerusalem.
Kgs. Now the rest of the acts of Joash,  all that he did, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah?
Kgs. And his servants arose,  made a conspiracy,  smote Joash at the house of Millo, on the way that goes down to Silla.
Kgs. For Jozacar the son of Shimeath,  Jehozabad the son of Shomer, his servants, smote him,  he died. And they buried him with his fathers in the city of David. And Amaziah his son reigned in his stead.
Kgs. In the twenty-third year of Joash the son of Ahaziah, king of Judah, Jehoahaz the son of Jehu began to reign over Israel in Samaria,  reigned seventeen years.
Kgs. And he did that which was evil in the sight of Jehovah,  followed the sins of Jeroboam the son of Nebat, with which he made Israel to sin. He did not depart from it.
Kgs. And the anger of Jehovah was kindled against Israel,  he delivered them into the hand of Hazael king of Syria,  into the hand of Benhadad the son of Hazael, continually.
Kgs. And Jehoahaz besought Jehovah,  Jehovah hearkened to him, for he saw the oppression of Israel, how that the king of Syria oppressed them.
Kgs. (And Jehovah gave Israel a savior, so that they went out from under the hand of the Syrians,  the sons of Israel dwelt in their tents as beforetime.
Kgs. Nevertheless they did not depart from the sins of the house of Jeroboam, with which he made Israel to sin,  walked therein. And the Asherah also remained in Samaria.)
Kgs. For he did not leave to Jehoahaz of the people except fifty horsemen,  ten chariots,  ten thousand footmen, for the king of Syria destroyed them,  made them like the dust in threshing.
Kgs. Now the rest of the acts of Jehoahaz,  all that he did,  his might, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel?
Kgs. And Jehoahaz slept with his fathers,  they buried him in Samaria. And Joash his son reigned in his stead.
Kgs. In the thirty-seventh year of Joash king of Judah, Jehoash the son of Jehoahaz began to reign over Israel in Samaria,  reigned sixteen years.
Kgs. And he did that which was evil in the sight of Jehovah. He did not depart from all the sins of Jeroboam the son of Nebat, with which he made Israel to sin,  he walked therein.
Kgs. Now the rest of the acts of Joash,  all that he did,  his might with which he fought against Amaziah king of Judah, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel?
Kgs. And Joash slept with his fathers,  Jeroboam sat upon his throne. And Joash was buried in Samaria with the kings of Israel.
Kgs. Now Elisha was fallen sick of his sickness of which he died. And Joash the king of Israel came down to him,  wept over him,  said, My father, my father, the chariots of Israel and the horsemen of it!
Kgs. And Elisha said to him, Take bow and arrows. And he took to him bow and arrows.
Kgs. And he said to the king of Israel, Put thy hand upon the bow. And he put his hand upon it. And Elisha laid his hands upon the king's hands.
Kgs. And he said, Open the window eastward. And he opened it. Then Elisha said, Shoot. And he shot. And he said, Jehovah's arrow of victory, even the arrow of victory over Syria, for thou shall smite the Syrians in Aphek till thou have consumed them.
Kgs. And he said, Take the arrows. And he took them. And he said to the king of Israel, Smite upon the ground. And he smote thrice,  stopped.
Kgs. And the man of God was angry with him,  said, Thou should have smitten five or six times. Then thou would have smitten Syria till thou had consumed it, whereas now thou shall smite Syria but thrice.
Kgs. And Elisha died,  they buried him. Now the bands of the Moabites invaded the land at the coming in of the year.
Kgs. And it came to pass, as they were burying a man, that, behold, they spied a band,  they cast the man into the sepulcher of Elisha. And as soon as the man touched the bones of Elisha, he revived,  stood up on his feet.
Kgs. And Hazael king of Syria oppressed Israel all the days of Jehoahaz.
Kgs. But Jehovah was gracious to them,  had compassion on them,  had respect to them, because of his covenant with Abraham, Isaac,  Jacob,  would not destroy them, neither did he cast them from his presence as yet.
Kgs. And Hazael king of Syria died,  Benhadad his son reigned in his stead.
Kgs. And Jehoash the son of Jehoahaz again took out of the hand of Benhadad the son of Hazael the cities, which he had taken out of the hand of Jehoahaz his father by war. Three times Joash smote him,  recovered the cities of Israel.
Kgs. In the second year of Joash son of Joahaz king of Israel, Amaziah the son of Joash king of Judah began to reign.
Kgs. He was twenty-five years old when he began to reign,  he reigned twenty-nine years in Jerusalem. And his mother's name was Jehoaddin of Jerusalem.
Kgs. And he did that which was right in the eyes of Jehovah, yet not like David his father. He did according to all that Joash his father had done.
Kgs. However the high places were not taken away; the people still sacrificed and burnt incense in the high places.
Kgs. And it came to pass, as soon as the kingdom was established in his hand, that he killed his servants who had slain the king his father,
Kgs. but he did not put to death the sons of the murderers, according to that which is written in the book of the law of Moses, as Jehovah commanded, saying, The fathers shall not be put to death for the sons, nor the sons be put to death for the fathers,  every man shall die for his own sin.
Kgs. He killed ten thousand of Edom in the Valley of Salt,  took Sela by war,  called the name of it Joktheel, to this day.
Kgs. Then Amaziah sent messengers to Jehoash, the son of Jehoahaz son of Jehu, king of Israel, saying, Come, let us look each other in the face.
Kgs. And Jehoash the king of Israel sent to Amaziah king of Judah, saying, The thistle that was in Lebanon sent to the cedar that was in Lebanon, saying, Give thy daughter to my son to wife. And a wild beast that was in Lebanon passed by,  trampled the thistle.
Kgs. Thou have indeed smitten Edom,  thy heart has lifted thee up. Glory by it,  abide at home, for why should thou meddle to thy hurt, that thou should fall, even thou,  Judah with thee?
Kgs. But Amaziah would not hear. So Jehoash king of Israel went up. And he and Amaziah king of Judah looked each other in the face at Beth-shemesh, which belongs to Judah.
Kgs. And Judah was put to the worse before Israel,  they fled every man to his tent.
Kgs. And Jehoash king of Israel took Amaziah king of Judah, the son of Jehoash the son of Ahaziah, at Beth-shemesh,  came to Jerusalem,  broke down the wall of Jerusalem from the gate of Ephraim to the corner gate, four hundred cubits.
Kgs. And he took all the gold and silver,  all the vessels that were found in the house of Jehovah,  in the treasures of the king's house, the hostages also,  returned to Samaria.
Kgs. Now the rest of the acts of Jehoash which he did,  his might,  how he fought with Amaziah king of Judah, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel?
Kgs. And Jehoash slept with his fathers,  was buried in Samaria with the kings of Israel. And Jeroboam his son reigned in his stead.
Kgs. And Amaziah the son of Joash king of Judah lived fifteen years after the death of Jehoash son of Jehoahaz king of Israel.
Kgs. Now the rest of the acts of Amaziah, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah?
Kgs. And they made a conspiracy against him in Jerusalem. And he fled to Lachish. But they sent after him to Lachish,  killed him there.
Kgs. And they brought him upon horses,  he was buried at Jerusalem with his fathers in the city of David.
Kgs. And all the people of Judah took Azariah, who was sixteen years old,  made him king in the place of his father Amaziah.
Kgs. He built Elath,  restored it to Judah, after the king slept with his fathers.
Kgs. In the fifteenth year of Amaziah the son of Joash king of Judah, Jeroboam the son of Joash king of Israel began to reign in Samaria,  reigned forty-one years.
Kgs. And he did that which was evil in the sight of Jehovah. He did not depart from all the sins of Jeroboam the son of Nebat, with which he made Israel to sin.
Kgs. He restored the border of Israel from the entrance of Hamath to the sea of the Arabah, according to the word of Jehovah, the God of Israel, which he spoke by his servant Jonah the son of Amittai, the prophet, who was of Gath-hepher.
Kgs. For Jehovah saw the affliction of Israel, that it was very bitter, for there was none shut up nor left at large, neither was there any helper for Israel.
Kgs. And Jehovah did not say that he would blot out the name of Israel from under heaven,  he saved them by the hand of Jeroboam the son of Joash.
Kgs. Now the rest of the acts of Jeroboam,  all that he did,  his might, how he warred,  how he recovered Damascus,  Hamath, which had belonged to Judah, for Israel, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel?
Kgs. And Jeroboam slept with his fathers, even with the kings of Israel,  Zechariah his son reigned in his stead.
Kgs. In the twenty-seventh year of Jeroboam king of Israel, Azariah son of Amaziah king of Judah began to reign.
Kgs. He was sixteen years old when he began to reign,  he reigned fifty-two years in Jerusalem. And his mother's name was Jecoliah of Jerusalem.
Kgs. And he did that which was right in the eyes of Jehovah, according to all that his father Amaziah had done.
Kgs. However the high places were not taken away; the people still sacrificed and burnt incense in the high places.
Kgs. And Jehovah smote the king, so that he was a leper to the day of his death,  dwelt in a separate house. And Jotham the king's son was over the household, judging the people of the land.
Kgs. Now the rest of the acts of Azariah,  all that he did, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah?
Kgs. And Azariah slept with his fathers,  they buried him with his fathers in the city of David. And Jotham his son reigned in his stead.
Kgs. In the thirty-eighth year of Azariah king of Judah, Zechariah the son of Jeroboam reigned over Israel in Samaria six months.
Kgs. And he did that which was evil in the sight of Jehovah, as his fathers had done. He did not depart from the sins of Jeroboam the son of Nebat, with which he made Israel to sin.
Kgs. And Shallum the son of Jabesh conspired against him,  smote him before the people,  killed him,  reigned in his stead.
Kgs. Now the rest of the acts of Zechariah, behold, they are written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel.
Kgs. This was the word of Jehovah which he spoke to Jehu, saying, Thy sons to the fourth generation shall sit upon the throne of Israel. And so it came to pass.
Kgs. Shallum the son of Jabesh began to reign in the thirty-ninth year of Uzziah king of Judah,  he reigned the space of a month in Samaria.
Kgs. And Menahem the son of Gadi went up from Tirzah,  came to Samaria,  smote Shallum the son of Jabesh in Samaria,  killed him,  reigned in his stead.
Kgs. Now the rest of the acts of Shallum,  his conspiracy which he made, behold, they are written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel.
Kgs. Then Menahem smote Tiphsah,  all that were therein,  the borders of it, from Tirzah, because they did not open to him, therefore he smote it. And all the women in it who were with child he ripped up.
Kgs. In the thirty-ninth year of Azariah king of Judah, Menahem the son of Gadi began to reign over Israel,  reigned ten years in Samaria.
Kgs. And he did that which was evil in the sight of Jehovah. He did not depart all his days from the sins of Jeroboam the son of Nebat, with which he made Israel to sin.
Kgs. Pul the king of Assyria came against the land. And Menahem gave Pul a thousand talents of silver that his hand might be with him to confirm the kingdom in his hand.
Kgs. And Menahem exacted the money from Israel, even of all the mighty men of wealth, of each man fifty shekels of silver, to give to the king of Assyria. So the king of Assyria turned back,  did not stay there in the land.
Kgs. Now the rest of the acts of Menahem,  all that he did, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel?
Kgs. And Menahem slept with his fathers,  Pekahiah his son reigned in his stead.
Kgs. In the fiftieth year of Azariah king of Judah, Pekahiah the son of Menahem began to reign over Israel in Samaria,  reigned two years.
Kgs. And he did that which was evil in the sight of Jehovah. He did not depart from the sins of Jeroboam the son of Nebat, with which he made Israel to sin.
Kgs. And Pekah the son of Remaliah, his captain, conspired against him,  smote him in Samaria, in the castle of the king's house, with Argob and Arieh. And fifty men of the Gileadites with him were there. And he killed him,  reigned in his stead.
Kgs. Now the rest of the acts of Pekahiah,  all that he did, behold, they are written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel.
Kgs. In the fifty-second year of Azariah king of Judah, Pekah the son of Remaliah began to reign over Israel in Samaria,  reigned twenty years.
Kgs. And he did that which was evil in the sight of Jehovah. He did not depart from the sins of Jeroboam the son of Nebat, with which he made Israel to sin.
Kgs. In the days of Pekah king of Israel, Tiglath-pileser king of Assyria came,  took Ijon,  Abel-beth-maacah,  Janoah,  Kedesh,  Hazor,  Gilead,  Galilee, all the land of Naphtali. And he carried them captive to Assyria.
Kgs. And Hoshea the son of Elah made a conspiracy against Pekah the son of Remaliah,  smote him,  killed him,  reigned in his stead in the twentieth year of Jotham the son of Uzziah.
Kgs. Now the rest of the acts of Pekah,  all that he did, behold, they are written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel.
Kgs. In the second year of Pekah the son of Remaliah king of Israel, Jotham the son of Uzziah king of Judah began to reign.
Kgs. He was twenty-five years old when he began to reign,  he reigned sixteen years in Jerusalem. And his mother's name was Jerusha the daughter of Zadok.
Kgs. And he did that which was right in the eyes of Jehovah. He did according to all that his father Uzziah had done.
Kgs. However the high places were not taken away. The people still sacrificed and burned incense in the high places. He built the upper gate of the house of Jehovah.
Kgs. Now the rest of the acts of Jotham,  all that he did, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah?
Kgs. In those days Jehovah began to send against Judah Rezin the king of Syria,  Pekah the son of Remaliah.
Kgs. And Jotham slept with his fathers,  was buried with his fathers in the city of David his father. And Ahaz his son reigned in his stead.
Kgs. In the seventeenth year of Pekah the son of Remaliah, Ahaz the son of Jotham king of Judah began to reign.
Kgs. Ahaz was twenty years old when he began to reign,  he reigned sixteen years in Jerusalem. And he did not do that which was right in the eyes of Jehovah his God, like David his father.
Kgs. But he walked in the way of the kings of Israel. Yes,  made his son to pass through the fire, according to the abominations of the nations whom Jehovah cast out from before the sons of Israel.
Kgs. And he sacrificed and burnt incense in the high places,  on the hills,  under every green tree.
Kgs. Then Rezin king of Syria and Pekah son of Remaliah king of Israel came up to Jerusalem to war,  they besieged Ahaz,  could not overcome him.
Kgs. At that time Rezin king of Syria recovered Elath to Syria,  drove the Jews from Elath. And the Syrians came to Elath,  dwelt there to this day.
Kgs. So Ahaz sent messengers to Tiglath-pileser king of Assyria, saying, I am thy servant and thy son. Come up,  save me out of the hand of the king of Syria,  out of the hand of the king of Israel, who rise up against me.
Kgs. And Ahaz took the silver and gold that was found in the house of Jehovah,  in the treasures of the king's house,  sent it for a present to the king of Assyria.
Kgs. And the king of Assyria hearkened to him. And the king of Assyria went up against Damascus,  took it,  carried the people of it captive to Kir,  killed Rezin.
Kgs. And king Ahaz went to Damascus to meet Tiglath-pileser king of Assyria,  saw the altar that was at Damascus. And king Ahaz sent to Urijah the priest the form of the altar,  the pattern of it, according to all the workmanship of it.
Kgs. And Urijah the priest built an altar. According to all that king Ahaz had sent from Damascus, so Urijah the priest made it until the coming of king Ahaz from Damascus.
Kgs. And when the king came from Damascus, the king saw the altar. And the king drew near to the altar,  offered thereon.
Kgs. And he burnt his burnt offering and his meal offering,  poured his drink offering,  sprinkled the blood of his peace offerings, upon the altar.
Kgs. And the brazen altar, which was before Jehovah, he brought from the forefront of the house, from between his altar and the house of Jehovah,  put it on the north side of his altar.
Kgs. And king Ahaz commanded Urijah the priest, saying, Upon the great altar burn the morning burnt offering,  the evening meal offering,  the king's burnt offering,  his meal offering, with the burnt offering of all the people of the land,  their meal offering,  their drink offerings. And sprinkle upon it all the blood of the burnt offering,  all the blood of the sacrifice. But the brazen altar shall be for me to inquire by.
Kgs. Thus did Urijah the priest, according to all that king Ahaz commanded.
Kgs. And king Ahaz cut off the panels of the bases,  removed the laver from off them,  took down the sea from off the brazen oxen that were under it,  put it upon a pavement of stone.
Kgs. And the covered place for the sabbath that they had built in the house,  the king's entry outside, he turned from the house of Jehovah, because of the king of Assyria.
Kgs. Now the rest of the acts of Ahaz which he did, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah?
Kgs. And Ahaz slept with his fathers,  was buried with his fathers in the city of David. And Hezekiah his son reigned in his stead.
Kgs. In the twelfth year of Ahaz king of Judah, Hoshea the son of Elah began to reign in Samaria over Israel,  reigned nine years.
Kgs. And he did that which was evil in the sight of Jehovah, yet not as the kings of Israel who were before him.
Kgs. Shalmaneser king of Assyria came up against him. And Hoshea became his servant,  brought him tribute.
Kgs. And the king of Assyria found conspiracy in Hoshea, for he had sent messengers to So king of Egypt,  offered no tribute to the king of Assyria, as he had done year by year. Therefore the king of Assyria shut him up,  bound him in prison.
Kgs. Then the king of Assyria came up throughout all the land,  went up to Samaria,  besieged it three years.
Kgs. In the ninth year of Hoshea, the king of Assyria took Samaria,  carried Israel away to Assyria,  placed them in Halah,  on the Habor, the river of Gozan,  in the cities of the Medes.
Kgs. And it was so, because the sons of Israel had sinned against Jehovah their God who brought them up out of the land of Egypt from under the hand of Pharaoh king of Egypt,  had feared other gods,
Kgs. and walked in the statutes of the nations, whom Jehovah cast out from before the sons of Israel,  of the kings of Israel, which they made.
Kgs. And the sons of Israel did things secretly that were not right against Jehovah their God. And they built for them high places in all their cities, from the tower of the watchmen to the fortified city.
Kgs. And they set up for them pillars and Asherim upon every high hill,  under every green tree,
Kgs. and there they burnt incense in all the high places, as the nations did whom Jehovah carried away before them. And they wrought wicked things to provoke Jehovah to anger.
Kgs. And they served idols, of which Jehovah had said to them, Ye shall not do this thing.
Kgs. Yet Jehovah testified to Israel,  to Judah, by every prophet,  every seer, saying, Turn ye from your evil ways,  keep my commandments and my statutes, according to all the law which I commanded your fathers,  which I sent to you by my servants the prophets.
Kgs. Notwithstanding, they would not hear,  stiffened their neck, like the neck of their fathers who did not believe in Jehovah their God.
Kgs. And they rejected his statutes,  his covenant that he made with their fathers,  his testimonies which he testified to them. And they followed vanity,  became vain,  went after the nations that were round about them, concerning whom Jehovah had charged them that they should not do like them.
Kgs. And they forsook all the commandments of Jehovah their God,  made for them molten images, even two calves,  made an Asherah,  worshiped all the host of heaven,  served Baal.
Kgs. And they caused their sons and their daughters to pass through the fire,  used divination and enchantments,  sold themselves to do that which was evil in the sight of Jehovah to provoke him to anger.
Kgs. Therefore Jehovah was very angry with Israel,  removed them out of his sight. There was none left but only the tribe of Judah.
Kgs. Also Judah did not keep the commandments of Jehovah their God,  walked in the statutes of Israel which they made.
Kgs. And Jehovah rejected all the seed of Israel,  afflicted them,  delivered them into the hand of spoilers, until he had cast them out of his sight.
Kgs. For he tore Israel from the house of David. And they made Jeroboam the son of Nebat king. And Jeroboam drove Israel from following Jehovah,  made them sin a great sin.
Kgs. And the sons of Israel walked in all the sins of Jeroboam which he did. They did not depart from them
Kgs. until Jehovah removed Israel out of his sight, as he spoke by all his servants the prophets. So Israel was carried away out of their own land to Assyria to this day.
Kgs. And the king of Assyria brought men from Babylon,  from Cuthah,  from Avva,  from Hamath and Sepharvaim,  placed them in the cities of Samaria instead of the sons of Israel. And they possessed Samaria,  dwelt in the cities of it.
Kgs. And so it was, at the beginning of their dwelling there, that they were not afraid of Jehovah. Therefore Jehovah sent lions among them, which killed some of them.
Kgs. Therefore they spoke to the king of Assyria, saying, The nations which thou have carried away,  placed in the cities of Samaria know not the law of the god of the land. Therefore he has sent lions among them, , behold, they kill them, because they do not know the law of the god of the land.
Kgs. Then the king of Assyria commanded, saying, Carry there one of the priests whom ye brought from there,  let them go and dwell there. And let him teach them the law of the god of the land.
Kgs. So one of the priests whom they had carried away from Samaria came and dwelt in Bethel,  taught them how they should fear Jehovah.
Kgs. However every nation made gods of their own,  put them in the houses of the high places which the Samaritans had made, every nation in their cities wherein they dwelt.
Kgs. And the men of Babylon made Succoth-benoth,  the men of Cuth made Nergal,  the men of Hamath made Ashima,
Kgs. and the Avvites made Nibhaz and Tartak. And the Sepharvites burnt their sons in the fire to Adrammelech and Anammelech, the gods of Sepharvaim.
Kgs. So they were afraid of Jehovah,  made for them priests of the high places from among themselves, who sacrificed for them in the houses of the high places.
Kgs. They were afraid of Jehovah,  served their own gods, after the manner of the nations from among whom they had been carried away.
Kgs. To this day they do after the former manner. They do not fear Jehovah, neither do they after their statutes, or after their ordinances, or after the law or after the commandment which Jehovah commanded the sons of Jacob, whom he named Israel,
Kgs. with whom Jehovah had made a covenant,  charged them, saying, Ye shall not fear other gods, nor bow yourselves to them, nor serve them, nor sacrifice to them.
Kgs. But Jehovah, who brought you up out of the land of Egypt with great power and with an outstretched arm, him ye shall fear,  to him ye shall bow yourselves,  to him ye shall sacrifice.
Kgs. And the statutes and the ordinances,  the law and the commandment, which he wrote for you, ye shall observe to do for evermore. And ye shall not fear other gods.
Kgs. And the covenant that I have made with you ye shall not forget. Neither shall ye fear other gods,
Kgs. but ye shall ye fear Jehovah your God,  he will deliver you out of the hand of all your enemies.
Kgs. However they did not hearken,  they did after their former manner.
Kgs. So these nations were afraid of Jehovah,  served their graven images, their sons likewise,  their son's sons, as did their fathers, so do they to this day.
Kgs. Now it came to pass in the third year of Hoshea son of Elah king of Israel, that Hezekiah the son of Ahaz king of Judah began to reign.
Kgs. He was twenty-five years old when he began to reign,  he reigned twenty-nine years in Jerusalem. And his mother's name was Abi the daughter of Zechariah.
Kgs. And he did that which was right in the eyes of Jehovah, according to all that David his father had done.
Kgs. He removed the high places,  broke the pillars,  cut down the Asherah,  he broke in pieces the brazen serpent that Moses had made. For to those days the sons of Israel burned incense to it,  he called it Nehushtan.
Kgs. He trusted in Jehovah, the God of Israel, so that there was none like him among all the kings of Judah after him, nor among those who were before him.
Kgs. For he clung to Jehovah. He did not depart from following him,  kept his commandments, which Jehovah commanded Moses.
Kgs. And Jehovah was with him. Wherever he went forth he prospered. And he rebelled against the king of Assyria,  did not serve him.
Kgs. He smote the Philistines to Gaza and the borders of it, from the tower of the watchmen to the fortified city.
Kgs. And it came to pass in the fourth year of king Hezekiah, which was the seventh year of Hoshea son of Elah king of Israel, that Shalmaneser king of Assyria came up against Samaria,  besieged it.
Kgs. And at the end of three years they took it. Samaria was taken in the sixth year of Hezekiah, which was the ninth year of Hoshea king of Israel.
Kgs. And the king of Assyria carried Israel away to Assyria,  put them in Halah,  on the Habor, the river of Gozan,  in the cities of the Medes,
Kgs. because they did not obey the voice of Jehovah their God,  transgressed his covenant, even all that Moses the servant of Jehovah commanded,  would not hear it, nor do it.
Kgs. Now in the fourteenth year of king Hezekiah, Sennacherib king of Assyria came up against all the fortified cities of Judah,  took them.
Kgs. And Hezekiah king of Judah sent to the king of Assyria to Lachish, saying, I have offended. Return from me. That which thou put on me I will bear. And the king of Assyria appointed to Hezekiah king of Judah three hundred talents of silver and thirty talents of gold.
Kgs. And Hezekiah gave him all the silver that was found in the house of Jehovah,  in the treasures of the king's house.
Kgs. At that time Hezekiah cut off the gold from the doors of the temple of Jehovah,  from the pillars which Hezekiah king of Judah had overlaid,  gave it to the king of Assyria.
Kgs. And the king of Assyria sent Tartan and Rab-saris and Rabshakeh from Lachish to king Hezekiah with a great army to Jerusalem. And they went up and came to Jerusalem. And when they came up, they came and stood by the conduit of the upper pool, which is on the highway of the fuller's field.
Kgs. And when they had called to the king, there came out to them Eliakim the son of Hilkiah, who was over the household,  Shebnah the scribe,  Joah the son of Asaph the recorder.
Kgs. And Rabshakeh said to them, Say ye now to Hezekiah, Thus says the great king, the king of Assyria, What confidence is this in which thou trust?
Kgs. Thou say (but they are but vain words), There is counsel and strength for the war. Now on whom do thou trust that thou have rebelled against me?
Kgs. Now, behold, thou trust upon the staff of this bruised reed, even upon Egypt, on which if a man leans it will go into his hand,  pierce it. So is Pharaoh king of Egypt to all who trust on him.
Kgs. But if ye say to me, We trust in Jehovah our God, is that not he whose high places and whose altars Hezekiah has taken away,  has said to Judah and to Jerusalem, Ye shall worship before this altar in Jerusalem?
Kgs. Now therefore, I pray thee, give pledges to my master the king of Assyria,  I will give thee two thousand horses, if thou be able on thy part to set riders upon them.
Kgs. How then can thou turn away the face of one captain of the least of my master's servants,  put thy trust on Egypt for chariots and for horsemen?
Kgs. Have I now come up without Jehovah against this place to destroy it? Jehovah said to me, Go up against this land,  destroy it.
Kgs. Then Eliakim the son of Hilkiah,  Shebnah,  Joah, said to Rabshakeh, Speak, I pray thee, to thy servants in the Syrian language, for we understand it. And do not speak with us in the Jews' language, in the ears of the people who are on the wall.
Kgs. But Rabshakeh said to them, Has my master sent me to thy master,  to thee, to speak these words? Has he not sent me to the men who sit on the wall, to eat their own dung,  to drink their own urine with you?
Kgs. Then Rabshakeh stood,  cried with a loud voice in the Jews' language,  spoke, saying, Hear ye the word of the great king, the king of Assyria.
Kgs. Thus says the king, Let not Hezekiah deceive you, for he will not be able to deliver you out of his hand.
Kgs. Neither let Hezekiah make you trust in Jehovah, saying, Jehovah will surely deliver us,  this city shall not be given into the hand of the king of Assyria.
Kgs. Do not hearken to Hezekiah. For thus says the king of Assyria, Make your peace with me,  come out to me. And eat ye every man of his vine,  every man of his fig tree,  drink ye every man the waters of his own cistern,
Kgs. until I come and take you away to a land like your own land, a land of grain and new wine, a land of bread and vineyards, a land of olive trees and of honey, that ye may live,  not die. And do not hearken to Hezekiah when he persuades you, saying, Jehovah will deliver us.
Kgs. Have any of the gods of the nations ever delivered his land out of the hand of the king of Assyria?
Kgs. Where are the gods of Hamath,  of Arpad? Where are the gods of Sepharvaim, of Hena,  Ivvah? Have they delivered Samaria out of my hand?
Kgs. Who are they among all the gods of the countries that have delivered their country out of my hand, that Jehovah should deliver Jerusalem out of my hand?
Kgs. But the people were silent,  did not answer him a word, for the king's commandment was, saying, Do not answer him.
Kgs. Then Eliakim the son of Hilkiah, who was over the household,  Shebna the scribe,  Joah the son of Asaph the recorder, came to Hezekiah with their clothes torn,  told him the words of Rabshakeh.
Kgs. And it came to pass, when king Hezekiah heard it, that he tore his clothes,  covered himself with sackcloth,  went into the house of Jehovah.
Kgs. And he sent Eliakim, who was over the household,  Shebna the scribe,  the elders of the priests (covered with sackcloth) to Isaiah the prophet the son of Amoz.
Kgs. And they said to him, Thus says Hezekiah, This day is a day of trouble,  of rebuke,  of blasphemy, for the sons have come to the birth,  there is no strength to bring forth.
Kgs. It may be that Jehovah thy God will hear all the words of Rabshakeh whom the king of Assyria his master has sent to defy the living God,  will rebuke the words which Jehovah thy God has heard. Therefore lift up thy prayer for the remnant that is left.
Kgs. So the servants of king Hezekiah came to Isaiah.
Kgs. And Isaiah said to them, Thus shall ye say to your master, Thus says Jehovah, Do not be afraid of the words that thou have heard, with which the servants of the king of Assyria have blasphemed me.
Kgs. Behold, I will put a spirit in him,  he shall hear news,  shall return to his own land. And I will cause him to fall by the sword in his own land.
Kgs. So Rabshakeh returned,  found the king of Assyria warring against Libnah, for he had heard that he was departed from Lachish.
Kgs. And when he heard say of Tirhakah king of Ethiopia, Behold, he comes out to fight against thee, he sent messengers again to Hezekiah, saying,
Kgs. Thus shall ye speak to Hezekiah king of Judah, saying, Do not let thy God in whom thou trust deceive thee, saying, Jerusalem shall not be given into the hand of the king of Assyria.
Kgs. Behold, thou have heard what the kings of Assyria have done to all lands, by destroying them utterly. And shall thou be delivered?
Kgs. Have the gods of the nations delivered them, which my fathers have destroyed, Gozan,  Haran,  Rezeph,  the sons of Eden that were in Telassar?
Kgs. Where is the king of Hamath,  the king of Arpad,  the king of the city of Sepharvaim, of Hena,  Ivvah?
Kgs. And Hezekiah received the letter from the hand of the messengers,  read it. And Hezekiah went up to the house of Jehovah,  spread it before Jehovah.
Kgs. And Hezekiah prayed before Jehovah,  said, O Jehovah, the God of Israel, who sits above the cherubim, thou are the God, even thou alone, of all the kingdoms of the earth. Thou have made heaven and earth.
Kgs. Incline thine ear, O Jehovah,  hear. Open thine eyes, O Jehovah,  see. And hear the words of Sennacherib, with which he has sent for him to defy the living God.
Kgs. Of a truth, Jehovah, the kings of Assyria have laid waste the nations and their lands,
Kgs. and have cast their gods into the fire, for they were no gods,  the work of men's hands, wood and stone. Therefore they have destroyed them.
Kgs. Now therefore, O Jehovah our God, save thou us, I beseech thee, out of his hand, that all the kingdoms of the earth may know that thou Jehovah are God alone.
Kgs. Then Isaiah the son of Amoz sent to Hezekiah, saying, Thus says Jehovah, the God of Israel, Whereas thou have prayed to me against Sennacherib king of Assyria, I have heard.
Kgs. This is the word that Jehovah has spoken concerning him: The virgin daughter of Zion has despised thee and laughed thee to scorn. The daughter of Jerusalem has shaken her head at thee.
Kgs. Whom have thou defied and blasphemed? And against whom have thou exalted thy voice and lifted up thine eyes on high? Even against the Holy One of Israel.
Kgs. By thy messengers thou have defied the Lord,  have said, With the multitude of my chariots I have come up to the height of the mountains, to the innermost parts of Lebanon. And I will cut down the tall cedars of it,  the choice fir trees of it. And I will enter into his farthest lodging-place, the forest of his fruitful field.
Kgs. I have dug and drunk strange waters,  with the sole of my feet I will dry up all the rivers of Egypt.
Kgs. Have thou not heard how I have done it long ago,  formed it of ancient times? Now I have brought it to pass, that thou should be to lay waste fortified cities into ruinous heaps.
Kgs. Therefore their inhabitants were of small power, they were dismayed and confounded. They were as the grass of the field,  as the green herb, as the grass on the housetops,  as grain blasted before it is grown up.
Kgs. But I know thy sitting down,  thy going out,  thy coming in,  thy raging against me.
Kgs. Because of thy raging against me,  because thine arrogance has come up into my ears, therefore I will put my hook in thy nose,  my bridle in thy lips,  I will turn thee back by the way by which thou came.
Kgs. And this shall be the sign to thee: Ye shall eat this year that which grows of itself,  in the second year that which springs of the same. And in the third year sow ye,  reap,  plant vineyards,  eat the fruit of it.
Kgs. And the remnant that is escaped of the house of Judah shall again take root downward,  bear fruit upward.
Kgs. For out of Jerusalem shall go forth a remnant,  out of mount Zion those who shall escape. The zeal of Jehovah shall perform this.
Kgs. Therefore thus says Jehovah concerning the king of Assyria, He shall not come to this city, nor shoot an arrow there, neither shall he come before it with shield, nor cast up a mound against it.
Kgs. By the way that he came, by the same shall he return,  he shall not come to this city, says Jehovah.
Kgs. For I will defend this city to save it, for my own sake,  for my servant David's sake.
Kgs. And it came to pass that night, that the agent of Jehovah went forth,  smote in the camp of the Assyrians a hundred eighty-five thousand. And when men arose early in the morning, behold, these were all dead bodies.
Kgs. So Sennacherib king of Assyria departed,  went and returned,  dwelt at Nineveh.
Kgs. And it came to pass, as he was worshiping in the house of Nisroch his god, that Adrammelech and Sharezer smote him with the sword,  they escaped into the land of Ararat. And Esar-haddon his son reigned in his stead.
Kgs. In those days Hezekiah was sick to death. And Isaiah the prophet the son of Amoz came to him,  said to him, Thus says Jehovah, Set thy house in order, for thou shall die,  not live.
Kgs. Then he turned his face to the wall,  prayed to Jehovah, saying,
Kgs. Remember now, O Jehovah, I beseech thee, how I have walked before thee in truth and with a perfect heart,  have done that which is good in thy sight. And Hezekiah wept greatly.
Kgs. And it came to pass, before Isaiah was gone out into the middle part of the city, that the word of Jehovah came to him, saying,
