Kgs. Turn back,  say to Hezekiah the prince of my people, Thus says Jehovah, the God of David thy father, I have heard thy prayer, I have seen thy tears. Behold, I will heal thee. On the third day thou shall go up to the house of Jehovah.
Kgs. And I will add to thy days fifteen years. And I will deliver thee and this city out of the hand of the king of Assyria. And I will defend this city for my own sake,  for my servant David's sake.
Kgs. And Isaiah said, Take a cake of figs. And they took and laid it on the boil,  he recovered.
Kgs. And Hezekiah said to Isaiah, What shall be the sign that Jehovah will heal me,  that I shall go up to the house of Jehovah the third day?
Kgs. And Isaiah said, This shall be the sign to thee from Jehovah, that Jehovah will do the thing that he has spoken: Shall the shadow go forward ten steps, or go back ten steps?
Kgs. And Hezekiah answered, It is a light thing for the shadow to go forward ten steps. No,  let the shadow return backward ten steps.
Kgs. And Isaiah the prophet cried to Jehovah,  he brought the shadow ten steps backward, by which it had gone down on the dial of Ahaz.
Kgs. At that time Berodach-baladan the son of Baladan, king of Babylon, sent letters and a present to Hezekiah, for he had heard that Hezekiah had been sick.
Kgs. And Hezekiah hearkened to them,  showed them all the house of his precious things, the silver,  the gold,  the spices,  the precious oil,  the house of his armor,  all that was found in his treasures. There was nothing in his house, nor in all his dominion, that Hezekiah did not show them.
Kgs. Then Isaiah the prophet came to king Hezekiah,  said to him, What did these men say,  from where did they come to thee? And Hezekiah said, They have come from a far country, even from Babylon.
Kgs. And he said, What have they seen in thy house? And Hezekiah answered, They have seen all that is in my house. There is nothing among my treasures that I have not shown them.
Kgs. And Isaiah said to Hezekiah, Hear the word of Jehovah.
Kgs. Behold, the days come that all that is in thy house,  that which thy fathers have laid up in store to this day, shall be carried to Babylon. Nothing shall be left, says Jehovah.
Kgs. And of thy sons who shall issue from thee, whom thou shall beget, they shall take away. And they shall be eunuchs in the palace of the king of Babylon.
Kgs. Then Hezekiah said to Isaiah, The word of Jehovah which thou have spoken is good. He said moreover, Is it not so, if peace and truth shall be in my days?
Kgs. Now the rest of the acts of Hezekiah,  all his might,  how he made the pool,  the conduit,  brought water into the city, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah?
Kgs. And Hezekiah slept with his fathers,  Manasseh his son reigned in his stead.
Kgs. Manasseh was twelve years old when he began to reign,  he reigned fifty-five years in Jerusalem. And his mother's name was Hephzibah.
Kgs. And he did that which was evil in the sight of Jehovah, according to the abominations of the nations whom Jehovah cast out before the sons of Israel.
Kgs. For he built again the high places which Hezekiah his father had destroyed. And he reared up altars for Baal,  made an Asherah, as did Ahab king of Israel,  worshiped all the host of heaven,  served them.
Kgs. And he built altars in the house of Jehovah, of which Jehovah said, In Jerusalem I will put my name.
Kgs. And he built altars for all the host of heaven in the two courts of the house of Jehovah.
Kgs. And he made his son to pass through the fire,  practiced augury,  used enchantments,  dealt with psychics,  with sorcery. He wrought much evil in the sight of Jehovah to provoke him to anger.
Kgs. And he set the graven image of Asherah, that he had made, in the house of which Jehovah said to David and to Solomon his son, In this house,  in Jerusalem, which I have chosen out of all the tribes of Israel, I will put my name forever.
Kgs. Neither will I cause the feet of Israel to wander any more out of the land which I gave their fathers, if only they will observe to do according to all that I have commanded them,  according to all the law that my servant Moses commanded them.
Kgs. But they did not hearken. And Manasseh seduced them to do that which is evil more than did the nations whom Jehovah destroyed before the sons of Israel.
Kgs. And Jehovah spoke by his servants the prophets, saying,
Kgs. Because Manasseh king of Judah has done these abominations,  has done wickedly above all that the Amorites did who were before him,  has made Judah also to sin with his idols,
Kgs. therefore thus says Jehovah, the God of Israel, Behold, I bring such evil upon Jerusalem and Judah, that whoever hears of it, both his ears shall tingle.
Kgs. And I will stretch over Jerusalem the line of Samaria,  the plummet of the house of Ahab. And I will wipe Jerusalem as a man wipes a dish, wiping it and turning it upside down.
Kgs. And I will cast off the remnant of my inheritance,  deliver them into the hand of their enemies. And they shall become a prey and a spoil to all their enemies,
Kgs. because they have done that which is evil in my sight,  have provoked me to anger, since the day their fathers came forth out of Egypt even to this day.
Kgs. Moreover Manasseh shed very much innocent blood till he had filled Jerusalem from one end to another, besides his sin with which he made Judah to sin in doing that which was evil in the sight of Jehovah.
Kgs. Now the rest of the acts of Manasseh,  all that he did,  his sin that he sinned, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah?
Kgs. And Manasseh slept with his fathers,  was buried in the garden of his own house, in the garden of Uzza,  Amon his son reigned in his stead.
Kgs. Amon was twenty-two years old when he began to reign,  he reigned two years in Jerusalem. And his mother's name was Meshullemeth the daughter of Haruz of Jotbah.
Kgs. And he did that which was evil in the sight of Jehovah as did Manasseh his father.
Kgs. And he walked in all the way that his father walked in,  served the idols that his father served,  worshiped them.
Kgs. And he forsook Jehovah, the God of his fathers,  did not walk in the way of Jehovah.
Kgs. And the servants of Amon conspired against him,  put the king to death in his own house.
Kgs. But the people of the land killed all those who had conspired against king Amon. And the people of the land made Josiah his son king in his stead.
Kgs. Now the rest of the acts of Amon which he did, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah?
Kgs. And he was buried in his sepulcher in the garden of Uzza,  Josiah his son reigned in his stead.
Kgs. Josiah was eight years old when he began to reign,  he reigned thirty-one years in Jerusalem. And his mother's name was Jedidah the daughter of Adaiah of Bozkath.
Kgs. And he did that which was right in the eyes of Jehovah,  walked in all the way of David his father,  did not turn aside to the right hand or to the left.
Kgs. And it came to pass, in the eighteenth year of king Josiah, that the king sent Shaphan, the son of Azaliah the son of Meshullam, the scribe, to the house of Jehovah, saying,
Kgs. Go up to Hilkiah the high priest that he may sum the money which is brought into the house of Jehovah, which the keepers of the threshold have gathered of the people.
Kgs. And let them deliver it into the hand of the workmen who have the oversight of the house of Jehovah. And let them give it to the workmen who are in the house of Jehovah, to repair the broken parts of the house,
Kgs. to the carpenters,  to the builders,  to the masons,  for buying timber and hewn stone to repair the house.
Kgs. However there was no reckoning made with them of the money that was delivered into their hand, for they dealt faithfully.
Kgs. And Hilkiah the high priest said to Shaphan the scribe, I have found the book of the law in the house of Jehovah. And Hilkiah delivered the book to Shaphan,  he read it.
Kgs. And Shaphan the scribe came to the king,  brought the king word again,  said, Thy servants have emptied out the money that was found in the house,  have delivered it into the hand of the workmen who have the oversight of the house of Jehovah.
Kgs. And Shaphan the scribe told the king, saying, Hilkiah the priest has delivered to me a book. And Shaphan read it before the king.
Kgs. And it came to pass, when the king had heard the words of the book of the law, that he tore his clothes.
Kgs. And the king commanded Hilkiah the priest,  Ahikam the son of Shaphan,  Achbor the son of Micaiah,  Shaphan the scribe,  Asaiah the king's servant, saying,
Kgs. Go ye, inquire of Jehovah for me,  for the people,  for all Judah, concerning the words of this book that is found, for great is the wrath of Jehovah that is kindled against us, because our fathers have not hearkened to the words of this book to do according to all that which is written concerning us.
Kgs. So Hilkiah the priest,  Ahikam,  Achbor,  Shaphan,  Asaiah, went to Huldah the prophetess, the wife of Shallum the son of Tikvah, the son of Harhas, keeper of the wardrobe (now she dwelt in Jerusalem in the second quarter),  they conversed with her.
Kgs. And she said to them, Thus says Jehovah, the God of Israel: Tell ye the man who sent you to me,
Kgs. Thus says Jehovah, Behold, I will bring evil upon this place,  upon the inhabitants of it, even all the words of the book which the king of Judah has read.
Kgs. Because they have forsaken me,  have burned incense to other gods, that they might provoke me to anger with all the work of their hands, therefore my wrath shall be kindled against this place,  it shall not be quenched.
Kgs. But to the king of Judah, who sent you to inquire of Jehovah, thus shall ye say to him, Thus says Jehovah, the God of Israel: As concerning the words which thou have heard,
Kgs. because thy heart was tender,  thou humbled thyself before Jehovah when thou heard what I spoke against this place,  against the inhabitants of it, that they should become a desolation and a curse,  have torn thy clothes,  wept before me, I also have heard thee, says Jehovah.
Kgs. Therefore, behold, I will gather thee to thy fathers,  thou shall be gathered to thy grave in peace, neither shall thine eyes see all the evil which I will bring upon this place. And they brought the king word again.
Kgs. And the king sent,  they gathered to him all the elders of Judah and of Jerusalem.
Kgs. And the king went up to the house of Jehovah,  all the men of Judah and all the inhabitants of Jerusalem with him,  the priests,  the prophets,  all the people, both small and great. And he read in their ears all the words of the book of the covenant which was found in the house of Jehovah.
Kgs. And the king stood by the pillar,  made a covenant before Jehovah to walk after Jehovah,  to keep his commandments,  his testimonies,  his statutes, with all his heart,  all his soul, to confirm the words of this covenant that were written in this book. And all the people stood to the covenant.
Kgs. And the king commanded Hilkiah the high priest,  the priests of the second order,  the keepers of the threshold, to bring forth out of the temple of Jehovah all the vessels that were made for Baal,  for the Asherah,  for all the host of heaven,  he burned them outside Jerusalem in the fields of the Kidron,  carried the ashes of them to Bethel.
Kgs. And he put down the idolatrous priests, whom the kings of Judah had ordained to burn incense in the high places in the cities of Judah,  in the places round about Jerusalem; those also who burned incense to Baal, to the sun,  to the moon,  to the planets,  to all the host of heaven.
Kgs. And he brought out the Asherah from the house of Jehovah, outside Jerusalem, to the brook Kidron,  burned it at the brook Kidron,  beat it to dust,  cast the dust of it upon the graves of the common people.
Kgs. And he broke down the houses of the sodomites that were in the house of Jehovah where the women wove hangings for the Asherah.
Kgs. And he brought all the priests out of the cities of Judah,  defiled the high places where the priests had burned incense, from Geba to Beersheba. And he broke down the high places of the gates that were at the entrance of the gate of Joshua the governor of the city, which were on a man's left hand at the gate of the city.
Kgs. Nevertheless the priests of the high places did not come up to the altar of Jehovah in Jerusalem,  they ate unleavened bread among their brothers.
Kgs. And he defiled Topheth, which is in the valley of the sons of Hinnom, that no man might make his son or his daughter to pass through the fire to Molech.
Kgs. And he took away the horses that the kings of Judah had given to the sun, at the entrance of the house of Jehovah, by the chamber of Nathan-melech the chamberlain, which was in the suburbs. And he burned the chariots of the sun with fire.
Kgs. And the altars that were on the roof of the upper chamber of Ahaz, which the kings of Judah had made,  the altars which Manasseh had made in the two courts of the house of Jehovah, the king broke down,  beat them down from there,  cast the dust of them into the brook Kidron.
Kgs. And the king defiled the high places that were before Jerusalem, which were on the right hand of the mount of corruption, which Solomon the king of Israel had built for Ashtoreth the abomination of the Sidonians,  for Chemosh the abomination of Moab,  for Milcom the abomination of the sons of Ammon.
Kgs. And he broke in pieces the pillars,  cut down the Asherim,  filled their places with the bones of men.
Kgs. Moreover the altar that was at Bethel,  the high place which Jeroboam the son of Nebat, who made Israel to sin, had made, even that altar and the high place he broke down. And he burned the high place and beat it to dust,  burned the Asherah.
Kgs. And as Josiah turned himself, he noticed the sepulchers that were there in the mount. And he sent,  took the bones out of the sepulchers,  burned them upon the altar,  defiled it, according to the word of Jehovah which the man of God proclaimed, who proclaimed these things.
Kgs. Then he said, What monument is that which I see? And the men of the city told him, It is the sepulcher of the man of God who came from Judah,  proclaimed these things that thou have done against the altar of Bethel.
Kgs. And he said, Let him be; let no man move his bones. So they let his bones alone, with the bones of the prophet who came out of Samaria.
Kgs. And Josiah also took away all the houses of the high places that were in the cities of Samaria, which the kings of Israel had made to provoke Jehovah to anger. And he did to them according to all the acts that he had done in Bethel.
Kgs. And he killed all the priests of the high places that were there, upon the altars,  burned men's bones upon them. And he returned to Jerusalem.
Kgs. And the king commanded all the people, saying, Keep the Passover to Jehovah your God, as it is written in this book of the covenant.
Kgs. Surely such a Passover was not kept from the days of the judges who judged Israel, nor in all the days of the kings of Israel, nor of the kings of Judah.
Kgs. But in the eighteenth year of king Josiah this Passover was kept to Jehovah in Jerusalem.
Kgs. Moreover Josiah put away the psychics,  the wizards,  the teraphim,  the idols,  all the abominations that were seen in the land of Judah and in Jerusalem, that he might perform the words of the law which were written in the book that Hilkiah the priest found in the house of Jehovah.
Kgs. And there was no king before him like him, who turned to Jehovah with all his heart,  with all his soul,  with all his might, according to all the law of Moses; neither arose any like him after him.
Kgs. Notwithstanding, Jehovah did not turn from the fierceness of his great wrath, with which his anger was kindled against Judah, because of all the provocations with which Manasseh had provoked him.
Kgs. And Jehovah said, I will remove Judah also out of my sight as I have removed Israel,  I will cast off this city which I have chosen, even Jerusalem,  the house of which I said, My name shall be there.
Kgs. Now the rest of the acts of Josiah,  all that he did, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah?
Kgs. In his days Pharaoh-necoh king of Egypt went up against the king of Assyria to the river Euphrates,  king Josiah went against him. And Pharaoh-necoh killed him at Megiddo when he had seen him.
Kgs. And his servants carried him in a chariot dead from Megiddo,  brought him to Jerusalem,  buried him in his own sepulcher. And the people of the land took Jehoahaz the son of Josiah,  anointed him,  made him king in his father's stead.
Kgs. Jehoahaz was twenty-three years old when he began to reign,  he reigned three months in Jerusalem. And his mother's name was Hamutal the daughter of Jeremiah of Libnah.
Kgs. And he did that which was evil in the sight of Jehovah, according to all that his fathers had done.
Kgs. And Pharaoh-necoh put him in bonds at Riblah in the land of Hamath, that he might not reign in Jerusalem. And he put the land to a tribute of a hundred talents of silver,  a talent of gold.
Kgs. And Pharaoh-necoh made Eliakim the son of Josiah king in the place of Josiah his father,  changed his name to Jehoiakim. But he took Jehoahaz away,  he came to Egypt,  died there.
Kgs. And Jehoiakim gave the silver and the gold to Pharaoh,  he taxed the land to give the money according to the commandment of Pharaoh. He exacted the silver and the gold from the people of the land, of every one according to his taxation, to give it to Pharaoh-necoh.
Kgs. Jehoiakim was twenty-five years old when he began to reign,  he reigned eleven years in Jerusalem. And his mother's name was Zebidah the daughter of Pedaiah of Rumah.
Kgs. And he did that which was evil in the sight of Jehovah, according to all that his fathers had done.
Kgs. In his days Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon came up,  Jehoiakim became his servant three years. Then he turned and rebelled against him.
Kgs. And Jehovah sent against him bands of the Chaldeans,  bands of the Syrians,  bands of the Moabites,  bands of the sons of Ammon,  sent them against Judah to destroy it, according to the word of Jehovah, which he spoke by his servants the prophets.
Kgs. Surely at the commandment of Jehovah this came upon Judah, to remove them out of his sight, for the sins of Manasseh, according to all that he did,
Kgs. and also for the innocent blood that he shed, for he filled Jerusalem with innocent blood,  Jehovah would not pardon.
Kgs. Now the rest of the acts of Jehoiakim,  all that he did, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah?
Kgs. So Jehoiakim slept with his fathers,  Jehoiachin his son reigned in his stead.
Kgs. And the king of Egypt did not come again any more out of his land, for the king of Babylon had taken, from the brook of Egypt to the river Euphrates, all that pertained to the king of Egypt.
Kgs. Jehoiachin was eighteen years old when he began to reign,  he reigned in Jerusalem three months. And his mother's name was Nehushta the daughter of Elnathan of Jerusalem.
Kgs. And he did that which was evil in the sight of Jehovah, according to all that his father had done.
Kgs. At that time the servants of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon came up to Jerusalem,  the city was besieged.
Kgs. And Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon came to the city while his servants were besieging it.
Kgs. And Jehoiachin the king of Judah went out to the king of Babylon, he,  his mother,  his servants,  his princes,  his officers. And the king of Babylon took him in the eighth year of his reign.
Kgs. And he carried out from there all the treasures of the house of Jehovah,  the treasures of the king's house,  cut in pieces all the vessels of gold, which Solomon king of Israel had made in the temple of Jehovah, as Jehovah had said.
Kgs. And he carried away all Jerusalem,  all the rulers,  all the mighty men of valor, even ten thousand captives,  all the craftsmen and the blacksmiths. None remained except the poorest sort of the people of the land.
Kgs. And he carried away Jehoiachin to Babylon. And the king's mother,  the king's wives,  his officers,  the chief men of the land, he carried into captivity from Jerusalem to Babylon.
Kgs. And all the men of might, even seven thousand,  the craftsmen and the blacksmiths a thousand, all of them strong and apt for war, even them the king of Babylon brought captive to Babylon.
Kgs. And the king of Babylon made Mattaniah, Jehoiachin's father's brother, king is his stead,  changed his name to Zedekiah.
Kgs. Zedekiah was twenty-one years old when he began to reign,  he reigned eleven years in Jerusalem. And his mother's name was Hamutal the daughter of Jeremiah of Libnah.
Kgs. And he did that which was evil in the sight of Jehovah, according to all that Jehoiakim had done.
Kgs. For it came to pass in Jerusalem and Judah through the anger of Jehovah, until he had cast them out from his presence. And Zedekiah rebelled against the king of Babylon.
Kgs. And it came to pass in the ninth year of his reign, in the tenth month, in the tenth day of the month, that Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon came, he and all his army, against Jerusalem,  encamped against it. And they built forts against it round about.
Kgs. So the city was besieged to the eleventh year of king Zedekiah.
Kgs. On the ninth day of the fourth month the famine was severe in the city, so that there was no bread for the people of the land.
Kgs. Then a breach was made in the city,  all the men of war fled by night by the way of the gate between the two walls, which was by the king's garden (now the Chaldeans were against the city round about),  the king went by the way of the Arabah.
Kgs. But the army of the Chaldeans pursued after the king,  overtook him in the plains of Jericho. And all his army was scattered from him.
Kgs. Then they took the king,  carried him up to the king of Babylon to Riblah. And they gave judgment upon him.
Kgs. And they killed the sons of Zedekiah before his eyes,  put out the eyes of Zedekiah,  bound him in fetters,  carried him to Babylon.
Kgs. Now in the fifth month, on the seventh day of the month, which was the nineteenth year of king Nebuchadnezzar, king of Babylon, Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard, a servant of the king of Babylon, came to Jerusalem.
Kgs. And he burnt the house of Jehovah,  the king's house. And all the houses of Jerusalem, even every great house, he burnt with fire.
Kgs. And all the army of the Chaldeans, that were with the captain of the guard, broke down the walls of Jerusalem round about.
Kgs. And the remnant of the people that were left in the city,  those that fell away, that fell to the king of Babylon,  the remnant of the multitude, Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard carried away captive.
Kgs. But the captain of the guard left of the poorest of the land to be vinedressers and husbandmen.
Kgs. And the pillars of brass that were in the house of Jehovah,  the bases and the brazen sea that were in the house of Jehovah, the Chaldeans broke in pieces,  carried the brass of them to Babylon.
Kgs. And they took away the pots,  the shovels,  the snuffers,  the spoons,  all the vessels of brass with which they ministered.
Kgs. And the captain of the guard took away the firepans,  the basins, that which was of gold, in gold,  that which was of silver, in silver.
Kgs. The two pillars, the one sea,  the bases, which Solomon had made for the house of Jehovah, the brass of all these vessels was without weight.
Kgs. The height of the one pillar was eighteen cubits,  a capital of brass was upon it. And the height of the capital was three cubits, with network and pomegranates upon the capital round about, all of brass. And the second pillar had like these with network.
Kgs. And the captain of the guard took Seraiah the chief priest,  Zephaniah the second priest,  the three keepers of the threshold.
Kgs. And he took an officer out of the city who was set over the men of war; and five men of those who saw the king's face, who were found in the city; and the scribe, the captain of the army, who mustered the people of the land; and sixty men of the people of the land who were found in the city.
Kgs. And Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard took them,  brought them to the king of Babylon to Riblah.
Kgs. And the king of Babylon smote them,  put them to death at Riblah in the land of Hamath. So Judah was carried away captive out of his land.
Kgs. And as for the people who were left in the land of Judah, whom Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon had left, he made Gedaliah the son of Ahikam, the son of Shaphan, governor over them.
Kgs. Now when all the captains of the forces, they and their men, heard that the king of Babylon had made Gedaliah governor, they came to Gedaliah to Mizpah, even Ishmael the son of Nethaniah,  Johanan the son of Kareah,  Seraiah the son of Tanhumeth the Netophathite,  Jaazaniah the son of the Maacathite, they and their men.
Kgs. And Gedaliah swore to them and to their men,  said to them, Fear not because of the servants of the Chaldeans. Dwell in the land,  serve the king of Babylon,  it shall be well with you.
Kgs. But it came to pass in the seventh month, that Ishmael the son of Nethaniah, the son of Elishama, of the royal seed, came,  ten men with him,  smote Gedaliah, so that he died,  the Jews and the Chaldeans who were with him at Mizpah.
Kgs. And all the people, both small and great,  the captains of the forces, arose,  came to Egypt, for they were afraid of the Chaldeans.
Kgs. And it came to pass in the thirty-seventh year of the captivity of Jehoiachin king of Judah, in the twelfth month, on the twenty-seventh day of the month, that Evil-merodach king of Babylon, in the year that he began to reign, lifted up the head of Jehoiachin king of Judah out of prison.
Kgs. And he spoke kindly to him,  set his throne above the throne of the kings that were with him in Babylon,
Kgs. and changed his prison garments. And Jehoiachin ate bread before him continually all the days of his life,
Kgs. and for his allowance. There was a continual allowance given him from the king, every day a portion, all the days of his life.
I Chronicles
Chr. Adam, Seth, Enosh,

Chr. And the sons of Gomer: Ashkenaz,  Diphath,  Togarmah.
Chr. And the sons of Javan: Elishah,  Tarshish, Kittim,  Rodanim.
Chr. The sons of Ham: Cush,  Mizraim, Put,  Canaan.
Chr. And the sons of Cush: Seba,  Havilah,  Sabta,  Raama,  Sabteca. And the sons of Raamah: Sheba,  Dedan.
Chr. And Cush begot Nimrod; he began to be a mighty one on the earth.
Chr. And Mizraim begot Ludim,  Anamim,  Lehabim,  Naphtuhim,
Chr. and Pathrusim,  Casluhim (from whence came the Philistines),  Caphtorim.
Chr. And Canaan begot Sidon his firstborn,  Heth,
Chr. and the Jebusite,  the Amorite,  the Girgashite,
Chr. and the Hivite,  the Arkite,  the Sinite,
Chr. and the Arvadite,  the Zemarite,  the Hamathite.
Chr. The sons of Shem: Elam,  Asshur,  Arphaxad,  Lud,  Aram,  Uz,  Hul,  Gether,  Meshech.
Chr. And Arphaxad begot Shelah,  Shelah begot Eber.
Chr. And to Eber were born two sons. The name of the one was Peleg, for in his days the earth was divided. And his brother's name was Joktan.
Chr. And Joktan begot Almodad,  Sheleph,  Hazarmaveth,  Jerah,
Chr. and Hadoram,  Uzal,  Diklah,
Chr. and Ebal,  Abimael,  Sheba,
Chr. and Ophir,  Havilah,  Jobab; all these were the sons of Joktan.
Chr. Shem, Arphaxad, Shelah,
Chr. Eber, Peleg, Reu,
Chr. Serug, Nahor, Terah,
Chr. Abram (the same is Abraham).
Chr. The sons of Abraham: Isaac and Ishmael.
Chr. These are their generations: the firstborn of Ishmael, Nebaioth, then Kedar,  Adbeel,  Mibsam,
Chr. Mishma,  Dumah, Massa, Hadad,  Tema,
Chr. Jetur, Naphish,  Kedemah. These are the sons of Ishmael.
Chr. And the sons of Keturah, Abraham's concubine: she bore Zimran,  Jokshan,  Medan,  Midian,  Ishbak,  Shuah. And the sons of Jokshan: Sheba,  Dedan.
Chr. And the sons of Midian: Ephah,  Epher,  Hanoch,  Abida,  Eldaah. All these were the sons of Keturah.
Chr. And Abraham begot Isaac. The sons of Isaac: Esau and Israel.
Chr. The sons of Esau: Eliphaz, Reuel,  Jeush,  Jalam,  Korah.
Chr. The sons of Eliphaz: Teman,  Omar, Zephi,  Gatam, Kenaz,  Timna,  Amalek.
Chr. The sons of Reuel: Nahath, Zerah, Shammah,  Mizzah.
Chr. And the sons of Seir: Lotan,  Shobal,  Zibeon,  Anah,  Dishon,  Ezer,  Dishan.
Chr. And the sons of Lotan: Hori,  Homam. And Timna was Lotan's sister.
Chr. The sons of Shobal: Alian,  Manahath,  Ebal, Shephi,  Onam. And the sons of Zibeon: Aiah,  Anah.
Chr. The sons of Anah: Dishon. And the sons of Dishon: Hamran,  Eshban,  Ithran,  Cheran.
Chr. The sons of Ezer: Bilhan,  Zaavan, Jaakan. The sons of Dishan: Uz,  Aran.
Chr. Now these are the kings that reigned in the land of Edom before any king reigned over the sons of Israel: Bela the son of Beor. And the name of his city was Dinhabah.
Chr. And Bela died,  Jobab the son of Zerah of Bozrah reigned in his stead.
Chr. And Jobab died,  Husham of the land of the Temanites reigned in his stead.
Chr. And Husham died,  Hadad the son of Bedad, who smote Midian in the field of Moab, reigned in his stead. And the name of his city was Avith.
Chr. And Hadad died,  Samlah of Masrekah reigned in his stead.
Chr. And Samlah died,  Shaul of Rehoboth by the River reigned in his stead.
Chr. And Shaul died,  Baal-hanan the son of Achbor reigned in his stead.
Chr. And Baal-hanan died,  Hadad reigned in his stead. And the name of his city was Pai,  his wife's name was Mehetabel, the daughter of Matred, the daughter of Me-zahab.
Chr. And Hadad died. And the chiefs of Edom were: chief Timna, chief Aliah, chief Jetheth,
Chr. chief Oholibamah, chief Elah, chief Pinon,
Chr. chief Kenaz, chief Teman, chief Mibzar,
Chr. chief Magdiel, chief Iram. These are the chiefs of Edom.
Chr. These are the sons of Israel: Reuben, Simeon, Levi,  Judah, Issachar,  Zebulun,
Chr. Dan, Joseph,  Benjamin, Naphtali, Gad,  Asher.
Chr. The sons of Judah: Er,  Onan,  Shelah, which three were born to him of Shua's daughter the Canaanitess. And Er, Judah's firstborn, was wicked in the sight of Jehovah,  he killed him.
Chr. And Tamar his daughter-in-law bore for him Perez and Zerah. All the sons of Judah were five.
Chr. The sons of Perez: Hezron,  Hamul.
Chr. And the sons of Zerah: Zimri,  Ethan,  Heman,  Calcol,  Dara; five of them in all.
Chr. And the sons of Carmi: Achar, the troubler of Israel who committed a trespass in the devoted thing.
Chr. And the sons of Ethan: Azariah.
Chr. The sons also of Hezron who were born to him: Jerahmeel,  Ram,  Chelubai.
Chr. And Ram begot Amminadab,  Amminadab begot Nahshon, ruler of the sons of Judah.
Chr. And Nahshon begot Salmon,  Salmon begot Boaz,
Chr. and Boaz begot Obed,  Obed begot Jesse,
Chr. and Jesse begot his firstborn Eliab,  Abinadab the second,  Shimea the third,
Chr. Nethanel the fourth, Raddai the fifth,
Chr. Ozem the sixth, David the seventh.
Chr. And their sisters were Zeruiah and Abigail. And the sons of Zeruiah: Abishai,  Joab,  Asahel, three.
Chr. And Abigail bore Amasa. And the father of Amasa was Jether the Ishmaelite.
Chr. And Caleb the son of Hezron begot sons of Azubah his wife,  of Jerioth. And these were her sons: Jesher,  Shobab,  Ardon.
Chr. And Azubah died,  Caleb took to him Ephrath, who bore for him Hur.
Chr. And Hur begot Uri,  Uri begot Bezalel.
Chr. And afterward Hezron went in to the daughter of Machir the father of Gilead, whom he took to wife when he was sixty years old,  she bore for him Segub.
Chr. And Segub begot Jair, who had twenty-three cities in the land of Gilead.
Chr. And Geshur and Aram took the towns of Jair from them, with Kenath,  the villages of it, even sixty cities. All these were the sons of Machir the father of Gilead.
Chr. And after that Hezron was dead in Caleb-ephrathah, then Abijah, Hezron's wife bore for him Ashhur the father of Tekoa.
Chr. And the sons of Jerahmeel the firstborn of Hezron were Ram the firstborn,  Bunah,  Oren,  Ozem, Ahijah.
Chr. And Jerahmeel had another wife, whose name was Atarah; she was the mother of Onam.
Chr. And the sons of Ram the firstborn of Jerahmeel were Maaz,  Jamin,  Eker.
Chr. And the sons of Onam were Shammai,  Jada. And the sons of Shammai: Nadab,  Abishur.
Chr. And the name of the wife of Abishur was Abihail,  she bore for him Ahban,  Molid.
Chr. And the sons of Nadab: Seled,  Appaim; but Seled died without sons.
Chr. And the sons of Appaim: Ishi. And the sons of Ishi: Sheshan. And the sons of Sheshan: Ahlai.
Chr. And the sons of Jada the brother of Shammai: Jether,  Jonathan; and Jether died without sons.
Chr. And the sons of Jonathan: Peleth,  Zaza. These were the sons of Jerahmeel.
Chr. Now Sheshan had no sons,  daughters. And Sheshan had a servant, an Egyptian, whose name was Jarha.
Chr. And Sheshan gave his daughter to Jarha his servant to wife,  she bore for him Attai.
Chr. And Attai begot Nathan,  Nathan begot Zabad,
Chr. and Zabad begot Ephlal,  Ephlal begot Obed,
Chr. and Obed begot Jehu,  Jehu begot Azariah,
Chr. and Azariah begot Helez,  Helez begot Eleasah,
Chr. and Eleasah begot Sismai,  Sismai begot Shallum,
Chr. and Shallum begot Jekamiah,  Jekamiah begot Elishama.
Chr. And the sons of Caleb the brother of Jerahmeel were Mesha his firstborn, who was the father of Ziph,  the sons of Mareshah the father of Hebron.
Chr. And the sons of Hebron: Korah,  Tappuah,  Rekem,  Shema.
Chr. And Shema begot Raham, the father of Jorkeam,  Rekem begot Shammai.
Chr. And the son of Shammai was Maon,  Maon was the father of Beth-zur.
Chr. And Ephah, Caleb's concubine, bore Haran,  Moza,  Gazez. And Haran begot Gazez.
Chr. And the sons of Jahdai: Regem,  Jothan,  Geshan,  Pelet,  Ephah,  Shaaph.
Chr. Maacah, Caleb's concubine, bore Sheber and Tirhanah.
Chr. She also bore Shaaph the father of Madmannah, Sheva the father of Machbena,  the father of Gibea. And the daughter of Caleb was Achsah.
Chr. These were the sons of Caleb. The sons of Hur, the firstborn of Ephrathah: Shobal the father of Kiriath-jearim,
Chr. Salma the father of Bethlehem, Hareph the father of Beth-gader.
Chr. And Shobal the father of Kiriath-jearim had sons: Haroeh, half of the Menuhothites,
Chr. and the families of Kiriath-jearim: The Ithrites,  the Puthites,  the Shumathites,  the Mishraites; of them came the Zorathites and the Eshtaolites.
Chr. The sons of Salma: Bethlehem,  the Netophathites, Atroth-beth-joab,  half of the Manahathites, the Zorites.
Chr. And the families of scribes who dwelt at Jabez: the Tirathites, the Shimeathites, the Sucathites. These are the Kenites who came of Hammath, the father of the house of Rechab.
Chr. Now these were the sons of David who were born to him in Hebron: the firstborn, Amnon, of Ahinoam the Jezreelitess; the second, Daniel, of Abigail the Carmelitess;
Chr. the third, Absalom the son of Maacah the daughter of Talmai king of Geshur; the fourth, Adonijah the son of Haggith;
Chr. the fifth, Shephatiah of Abital; the sixth, Ithream by Eglah his wife.
Chr. Six were born to him in Hebron,  he reigned there seven years and six months. And in Jerusalem he reigned thirty-three years.
Chr. And these were born to him in Jerusalem: Shimea,  Shobab,  Nathan,  Solomon, four, of Bathsheba the daughter of Ammiel;
Chr. and Ibhar,  Elishama,  Eliphelet,
Chr. and Nogah,  Nepheg,  Japhia,
Chr. and Elishama,  Eliada,  Eliphelet, nine.
Chr. All these were the sons of David, besides the sons of the concubines. And Tamar was their sister.
Chr. And Solomon's son was Rehoboam, Abijah his son, Asa his son, Jehoshaphat his son,
Chr. Joram his son, Ahaziah his son, Joash his son,

Chr. And Ashhur the father of Tekoa had two wives, Helah and Naarah.

Chr. And Hakkoz begot Anub,  Zobebah,  the families of Aharhel the son of Harum.
Chr. And Jabez was more honorable than his brothers. And his mother called his name Jabez, saying, Because I bore him with sorrow.
Chr. And Jabez called on the God of Israel, saying, Oh that thou would bless me indeed,  enlarge my border,  that thy hand might be with me,  that thou would keep me from evil, that it not be to my sorrow! And God granted him that which he requested.
Chr. And Chelub the brother of Shuhah begot Mehir, who was the father of Eshton.

Chr. And Meonothai begot Ophrah. And Seraiah begot Joab the father of Ge-harashim, for they were craftsmen.
Chr. And the sons of Caleb the son of Jephunneh: Iru, Elah,  Naam. And the sons of Elah: Kenaz.
Chr. And the sons of Jehallelel: Ziph,  Ziphah, Tiria,  Asarel.
Chr. And the sons of Ezrah: Jether,  Mered,  Epher,  Jalon. And she bore Miriam,  Shammai,  Ishbah the father of Eshtemoa.
Chr. And his wife the Jewess bore Jered the father of Gedor,  Heber the father of Soco,  Jekuthiel the father of Zanoah. And these are the sons of Bithiah the daughter of Pharaoh, whom Mered took.
Chr. And the sons of the wife of Hodiah, the sister of Naham, were the fathers of Keilah the Garmite,  Eshtemoa the Maacathite.
Chr. And the sons of Shimon: Amnon,  Rinnah, Ben-hanan,  Tilon. And the sons of Ishi: Zoheth,  Ben-zoheth.

Chr. and Jokim,  the men of Cozeba,  Joash,  Saraph, who had dominion in Moab,  Jashubilehem. And the records are ancient.
Chr. These were the potters,  the inhabitants of Netaim and Gederah. They dwelt there with the king for his work.
Chr. The sons of Simeon: Nemuel,  Jamin, Jarib, Zerah, Shaul;
Chr. Shallum his son, Mibsam his son, Mishma his son.
Chr. And the sons of Mishma: Hammuel his son, Zaccur his son, Shimei his son.
Chr. And Shimei had sixteen sons and six daughters,  his brothers did not have many sons, neither did all their family multiply like the sons of Judah.
Chr. And they dwelt at Beersheba,  Moladah,  Hazarshual,
Chr. and at Bilhah,  at Ezem,  at Tolad,
Chr. and at Bethuel,  at Hormah,  at Ziklag,
Chr. and at Beth-marcaboth,  Hazar-susim,  at Beth-biri,  at Shaaraim. These were their cities to the reign of David.
Chr. And their villages were Etam,  Ain, Rimmon,  Tochen,  Ashan, five cities.
Chr. And all their villages that were round about the same cities, to Baal. These were their habitations,  they have their genealogy.
Chr. And Meshobab,  Jamlech,  Joshah the son of Amaziah,
Chr. and Joel,  Jehu the son of Joshibiah, the son of Seraiah, the son of Asiel,
Chr. and Elioenai,  Jaakobah,  Jeshohaiah,  Asaiah,  Adiel,  Jesimiel,  Benaiah,
Chr. and Ziza the son of Shiphi, the son of Allon, the son of Jedaiah, the son of Shimri, the son of Shemaiah-
Chr. these mentioned by name were rulers in their families,  their fathers' houses increased greatly.
Chr. And they went to the entrance of Gedor, even to the east side of the valley, to seek pasture for their flocks.
Chr. And they found lush and good pasture,  the land was wide and quiet and peaceable, for those who dwelt there formerly were of Ham.
Chr. And these written by name came in the days of Hezekiah king of Judah,  smote their tents,  the Meunim who were found there,  destroyed them utterly to this day,  dwelt in their stead because there was pasture there for their flocks.
Chr. And some of them, even of the sons of Simeon, five hundred men, went to mount Seir, having for their captains Pelatiah,  Neariah,  Rephaiah,  Uzziel, the sons of Ishi.
Chr. And they smote the remnant of the Amalekites who escaped,  have dwelt there to this day.
Chr. And the sons of Reuben the firstborn of Israel (for he was the firstborn, , inasmuch as he defiled his father's couch, his birthright was given to the sons of Joseph the son of Israel,  so the genealogy is not to be reckoned after the birthright.
Chr. Now Judah prevailed above his brothers,  the ruler came from him,  the birthright was Joseph's),
Chr. the sons of Reuben the firstborn of Israel: Hanoch,  Pallu, Hezron,  Carmi.
Chr. The sons of Joel: Shemaiah his son, Gog his son, Shimei his son,
Chr. Micah his son, Reaiah his son, Baal his son,
Chr. Beerah his son, whom Tilgath-pilneser king of Assyria carried away captive. He was ruler of the Reubenites.
Chr. And his brothers by their families, when the genealogy of their generations was reckoned: the chief, Jeiel,  Zechariah,
Chr. and Bela the son of Azaz, the son of Shema, the son of Joel, who dwelt in Aroer, even to Nebo and Baal-meon.
Chr. And eastward he dwelt even to the entrance of the wilderness from the river Euphrates, because their cattle were multiplied in the land of Gilead.
Chr. And in the days of Saul they made war with the Hagrites, who fell by their hand,  they dwelt in their tents throughout all the land east of Gilead.
Chr. And the sons of Gad dwelt opposite them, in the land of Bashan to Salecah:
Chr. Joel the chief,  Shapham the second,  Janai,  Shaphat in Bashan.
Chr. And their brothers of their fathers' houses: Michael,  Meshullam,  Sheba,  Jorai,  Jacan,  Zia,  Eber, seven.
Chr. These were the sons of Abihail, the son of Huri, the son of Jaroah, the son of Gilead, the son of Michael, the son of Jeshishai, the son of Jahdo, the son of Buz.
Chr. Ahi the son of Abdiel, the son of Guni, was chief of their fathers' houses.
Chr. And they dwelt in Gilead in Bashan,  in its towns,  in all the suburbs of Sharon, as far as their borders.
Chr. All these were reckoned by genealogies in the days of Jotham king of Judah,  in the days of Jeroboam king of Israel.
Chr. The sons of Reuben,  the Gadites,  the half-tribe of Manasseh, of valiant men, men able to bear buckler and sword,  to shoot with bow,  skilful in war, were forty-four thousand seven hundred and sixty, who were able to go forth to war.
Chr. And they made war with the Hagrites, with Jetur,  Naphish,  Nodab.
Chr. And they were helped against them,  the Hagrites were delivered into their hand,  all that were with them, for they cried to God in the battle,  he was entreated by them because they put their trust in him.
Chr. And they took away their cattle: of their camels fifty thousand,  of sheep two hundred and fifty thousand,  of donkeys two thousand,  of men a hundred thousand.
Chr. For there fell many slain, because the war was of God. And they dwelt in their stead until the captivity.
Chr. And the sons of the half-tribe of Manasseh dwelt in the land. They increased from Bashan to Baal-hermon and Senir and mount Hermon.
Chr. And these were the heads of their fathers' houses: even Epher,  Ishi,  Eliel,  Azriel,  Jeremiah,  Hodaviah,  Jahdiel, mighty men of valor, famous men, heads of their fathers' houses.
Chr. And they trespassed against the God of their fathers,  played the harlot after the gods of the peoples of the land, whom God destroyed before them.
Chr. And the God of Israel stirred up the spirit of Pul king of Assyria,  the spirit of Tilgath-pilneser king of Assyria,  he carried them away, even the Reubenites,  the Gadites,  the half-tribe of Manasseh,  brought them to Halah,  Habor,  Hara,  to the river of Gozan to this day.
Chr. The sons of Levi: Gershon, Kohath,  Merari.
Chr. And the sons of Kohath: Amram, Izhar,  Hebron,  Uzziel.
Chr. And the sons of Amram: Aaron,  Moses,  Miriam. And the sons of Aaron: Nadab,  Abihu, Eleazar,  Ithamar.

Chr. Also the Shuppim,  the Huppim, the sons of Ir,  the Hushim, the sons of Aher.

Chr. And Maacah the wife of Machir bore a son,  she called his name Peresh. And the name of his brother was Sheresh,  his sons were Ulam and Rakem.

Chr. So all Israel were reckoned by genealogies. And, behold, they are written in the book of the kings of Israel. And Judah was carried away captive to Babylon for their transgression.
Chr. Now the first inhabitants who dwelt in their possessions in their cities were Israelites, the priests, the Levites,  the Nethinim.
Chr. And in Jerusalem dwelt of the sons of Judah,  of the sons of Benjamin,  of the sons of Ephraim and Manasseh:

Chr. And of the priests: Jedaiah,  Jehoiarib, Jachin,

Chr. and Bakbakkar, Heresh,  Galal,  Mattaniah the son of Mica, the son of Zichri, the son of Asaph,
Chr. and Obadiah the son of Shemaiah, the son of Galal, the son of Jeduthun,  Berechiah the son of Asa, the son of Elkanah, who dwelt in the villages of the Netophathites.
Chr. And the porters: Shallum,  Akkub,  Talmon,  Ahiman,  their brothers (Shallum was the chief),
Chr. who formerly served in the king's gate eastward. They were the porters for the camp of the sons of Levi.
Chr. And Shallum the son of Kore, the son of Ebiasaph, the son of Korah,  his brothers, of his father's house, the Korahites, were over the work of the service, keepers of the thresholds of the tent. And their fathers had been over the camp of Jehovah, keepers of the entry.
Chr. And Phinehas the son of Eleazar was ruler over them in time past,  Jehovah was with him.
Chr. Zechariah the son of Meshelemiah was porter of the door of the tent of meeting.
Chr. All these who were chosen to be porters in the thresholds were two hundred and twelve. These were reckoned by genealogy in their villages, whom David and Samuel the seer ordained in their office of trust.
Chr. So they and their sons had the oversight of the gates of the house of Jehovah, even the house of the tent, by wards.
Chr. On the four sides were the porters, toward the east, west, north,  south.
Chr. And their brothers, in their villages, were to come in every seven days from time to time to be with them;
Chr. for the four chief porters, who were Levites, were in an office of trust,  were over the chambers and over the treasuries in the house of God.
Chr. And they lodged round about the house of God, because the charge of it was upon them,  to them pertained the opening of it morning by morning.
Chr. And certain of them had charge of the vessels of service, for by count were these brought in,  by count were these taken out.
Chr. Some of them were also appointed over the furniture,  over all the vessels of the sanctuary,  over the fine flour,  the wine,  the oil,  the frankincense,  the spices.
Chr. And some of the sons of the priests prepared the confection of the spices.
Chr. And Mattithiah, one of the Levites, who was the firstborn of Shallum the Korahite, had the office of trust over the things that were baked in pans.
Chr. And some of their brothers, of the sons of the Kohathites, were over the showbread to prepare it every sabbath.
Chr. And these are the singers, heads of fathers of the Levites, who dwelt in the chambers and were free from other service, for they were employed in their work day and night.
Chr. These were heads of fathers of the Levites, throughout their generations, chief men; these dwelt at Jerusalem.
Chr. And in Gibeon there dwelt the father of Gibeon, Jeiel, whose wife's name was Maacah,
Chr. and his firstborn son Abdon,  Zur,  Kish,  Baal,  Ner,  Nadab,
Chr. and Gedor,  Ahio,  Zechariah,  Mikloth.
Chr. And Mikloth begot Shimeam. And they also dwelt with their brothers in Jerusalem, opposite their brothers.
Chr. And Ner begot Kish,  Kish begot Saul,  Saul begot Jonathan,  Malchi-shua,  Abinadab,  Eshbaal.
Chr. And the son of Jonathan was Merib-baal,  Merib-baal begot Micah.
Chr. And the sons of Micah: Pithon,  Melech,  Tahrea,  Ahaz.
Chr. And Ahaz begot Jarah,  Jarah begot Alemeth,  Azmaveth,  Zimri; and Zimri begot Moza,
Chr. and Moza begot Binea,  Rephaiah his son, Eleasah his son, Azel his son.
Chr. And Azel had six sons, whose names are these: Azrikam, Bocheru,  Ishmael,  Sheariah,  Obadiah,  Hanan; these were the sons of Azel.
Chr. Now the Philistines fought against Israel. And the men of Israel fled from before the Philistines,  fell down slain in mount Gilboa.
Chr. And the Philistines followed hard after Saul and after his sons. And the Philistines killed Jonathan,  Abinadab,  Malchi-shua, the sons of Saul.
Chr. And the battle went hard against Saul,  the archers overtook him. And he was wounded because of the archers.
Chr. Then Saul said to his armor bearer, Draw thy sword,  thrust me through therewith, lest these uncircumcised come and abuse me. But his armor bearer would not, for he was very afraid. Therefore Saul took his sword,  fell upon it.
Chr. And when his armor bearer saw that Saul was dead, he likewise fell upon his sword,  died.
Chr. So Saul died,  his three sons. And all his house died together.
Chr. And when all the men of Israel who were in the valley saw that they fled,  that Saul and his sons were dead, they forsook their cities,  fled. And the Philistines came and dwelt in them.
Chr. And it came to pass on the morrow, when the Philistines came to strip the slain, that they found Saul and his sons fallen in mount Gilboa.
Chr. And they stripped him,  took his head,  his armor,  sent into the land of the Philistines round about to carry the news to their idols,  to the people.
Chr. And they put his armor in the house of their gods,  fastened his head in the house of Dagon.
Chr. And when all Jabesh-gilead heard all that the Philistines had done to Saul,
Chr. all the valiant men arose,  took away the body of Saul,  the bodies of his sons,  brought them to Jabesh,  buried their bones under the oak in Jabesh,  fasted seven days.
Chr. So Saul died for his trespass which he committed against Jehovah, because of the word of Jehovah, which he did not keep,  also because he asked counsel of a spiritist, to inquire thereby,
Chr. and did not inquire of Jehovah. Therefore he killed him,  turned the kingdom to David the son of Jesse.
Chr. Then all Israel gathered themselves to David to Hebron, saying, Behold, we are thy bone and thy flesh.
Chr. In times past, even when Saul was king, it was thou who led out and brought in Israel. And Jehovah thy God said to thee, Thou shall be shepherd of my people Israel,  thou shall be ruler over my people Israel.
Chr. So all the elders of Israel came to the king to Hebron. And David made a covenant with them in Hebron before Jehovah. And they anointed David king over Israel, according to the word of Jehovah by Samuel.
Chr. And David and all Israel went to Jerusalem (the same is Jebus),  the Jebusites, the inhabitants of the land, were there.
Chr. And the inhabitants of Jebus said to David, Thou shall not come in here. Nevertheless David took the stronghold of Zion; the same is the city of David.
Chr. And David said, Whoever smites the Jebusites first shall be chief and captain. And Joab the son of Zeruiah went up first,  was made chief.
Chr. And David dwelt in the stronghold. Therefore they called it the city of David.
Chr. And he built the city round about, from Millo even round about. And Joab repaired the rest of the city.
Chr. And David grew greater and greater, for Jehovah of hosts was with him.
Chr. Now these are the chief of the mighty men whom David had, who showed themselves strong with him in his kingdom, together with all Israel, to make him king, according to the word of Jehovah concerning Israel.
Chr. And this is the number of the mighty men whom David had: Jashobeam, the son of a Hachmonite, the chief of the thirty. He lifted up his spear against three hundred and killed them at one time.
Chr. And after him was Eleazar the son of Dodo, the Ahohite, who was one of the three mighty men.
Chr. He was with David at Pasdammim,  there the Philistines were gathered together to battle, where was a plot of ground full of barley. And the people fled from before the Philistines.
Chr. And they stood in the midst of the plot,  defended it,  killed the Philistines. And Jehovah saved them by a great victory.
Chr. And three of the thirty chief men went down to the rock to David into the cave of Adullam. And the army of the Philistines was encamped in the valley of Rephaim.
Chr. And David was then in the stronghold,  the garrison of the Philistines was then in Bethlehem.
Chr. And David longed,  said, Oh that a man would give me water to drink of the well of Bethlehem, which is by the gate!
Chr. And the three broke through the army of the Philistines,  drew water out of the well of Bethlehem, that was by the gate,  took it,  brought it to David. But David would not drink of it,  poured it out to Jehovah,
Chr. and said, My God forbid it of me, that I should do this. Shall I drink the blood of these men who have put their lives in jeopardy? For with the jeopardy of their lives they brought it. Therefore he would not drink it. These things the three mighty men did.
Chr. And Abishai, the brother of Joab, he was chief of the three, for he lifted up his spear against three hundred and killed them,  had a name among the three.
Chr. Of the three, he was more famous than the two,  was made their captain. However he did not attain to the first three.
Chr. Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, the son of a valiant man of Kabzeel, who had done mighty deeds, he killed the two sons of Ariel of Moab. He also went down and killed a lion in the midst of a pit in time of snow.
Chr. And he killed an Egyptian, a man of great stature, five cubits high. And in the Egyptian's hand was a spear like a weaver's beam. And he went down to him with a staff,  plucked the spear out of the Egyptian's hand,  killed him with his own spear.
Chr. These things Benaiah the son of Jehoiada did,  had a name among the three mighty men.
Chr. Behold, he was more famous than the thirty,  he did not attain to the first three. And David set him over his guard.
Chr. Also the mighty men of the armies: Asahel the brother of Joab, Elhanan the son of Dodo of Bethlehem,
Chr. Shammoth the Harorite, Helez the Pelonite,
Chr. Ira the son of Ikkesh the Tekoite, Abiezer the Anathothite,
Chr. Sibbecai the Hushathite, Ilai the Ahohite,
Chr. Maharai the Netophathite, Heled the son of Baanah the Netophathite,
Chr. Ithai the son of Ribai of Gibeah of the sons of Benjamin, Benaiah the Pirathonite,
Chr. Hurai of the brooks of Gaash, Abiel the Arbathite,
Chr. Azmaveth the Baharumite, Eliahba the Shaalbonite,
Chr. the sons of Hashem the Gizonite, Jonathan the son of Shagee the Hararite,
Chr. Ahiam the son of Sacar the Hararite, Eliphal the son of Ur,
Chr. Hepher the Mecherathite, Ahijah the Pelonite,
Chr. Hezro the Carmelite, Naarai the son of Ezbai,
Chr. Joel the brother of Nathan, Mibhar the son of Hagri,
Chr. Zelek the Ammonite, Naharai the Berothite, the armor bearer of Joab the son of Zeruiah,
Chr. Ira the Ithrite, Gareb the Ithrite,
Chr. Uriah the Hittite, Zabad the son of Ahlai,
Chr. Adina the son of Shiza the Reubenite, a chief of the Reubenites,  thirty with him,
Chr. Hanan the son of Maacah,  Joshaphat the Mithnite,
Chr. Uzzia the Ashterathite, Shama and Jeiel the sons of Hotham the Aroerite,
Chr. Jediael the son of Shimri,  Joha his brother, the Tizite,
Chr. Eliel the Mahavite,  Jeribai,  Joshaviah, the sons of Elnaam,  Ithmah the Moabite,
Chr. Eliel,  Obed,  Jaasiel the Mezobaite.
Chr. Now these are those who came to David to Ziklag while he yet kept himself close because of Saul the son of Kish. And they were among the mighty men, his helpers in war.
Chr. They were armed with bows,  could use both the right hand and the left in slinging stones and in shooting arrows from the bow. They were of Saul's brothers of Benjamin.
Chr. The chief was Ahiezer, then Joash, the sons of Shemaah the Gibeathite,  Jeziel,  Pelet, the sons of Azmaveth,  Beracah,  Jehu the Anathothite,
Chr. and Ishmaiah the Gibeonite, a mighty man among the thirty,  over the thirty,  Jeremiah,  Jahaziel,  Johanan,  Jozabad the Gederathite,
Chr. Eluzai,  Jerimoth,  Bealiah,  Shemariah,  Shephatiah the Haruphite,
Chr. Elkanah,  Isshiah,  Azarel,  Joezer,  Jashobeam, the Korahites,
Chr. and Joelah,  Zebadiah, the sons of Jeroham of Gedor.
Chr. And of the Gadites there separated themselves to David to the stronghold in the wilderness, mighty men of valor, men trained for war, who could handle shield and spear, whose faces were like the faces of lions,  they were as swift as the roes upon the mountains:
Chr. Ezer the chief, Obadiah the second, Eliab the third,
Chr. Mishmannah the fourth, Jeremiah the fifth,
Chr. Attai the sixth, Eliel the seventh,
Chr. Johanan the eighth, Elzabad the ninth,
Chr. Jeremiah the tenth, Machbannai the eleventh.
Chr. These of the sons of Gad were captains of the army. He who was least was equal to a hundred,  the greatest to a thousand.
Chr. These are those who went over the Jordan in the first month when it had overflowed all its banks. And they put to flight all those of the valleys, both toward the east,  toward the west.
Chr. And there came of the sons of Benjamin and Judah to the stronghold to David.
Chr. And David went out to meet them,  answered and said to them, If ye have come peaceably to me to help me, my heart shall be knit to you,  if ye be come to betray me to my adversaries, seeing there is no wrong in my hands, the God of our fathers look thereon,  rebuke it.
Chr. Then the Spirit came upon Amasai, who was chief of the thirty,  he said, We are thine, David,  on thy side, thou son of Jesse. Peace, peace be to thee,  peace be to thy helpers, for thy God helps thee. Then David received them,  made them captains of the band.
Chr. From Manasseh also there fell away some to David when he came with the Philistines against Saul to battle. But they did not help them, for the lords of the Philistines sent him away upon advisement, saying, He will fall away to his master Saul to the jeopardy of our heads.
Chr. As he went to Ziklag, there came to him from Manasseh, Adnah,  Jozabad,  Jediael,  Michael,  Jozabad,  Elihu,  Zillethai, captains of thousands who were of Manasseh.
Chr. And they helped David against the band of rovers, for they were all mighty men of valor,  were captains in the army.
Chr. For from day to day men came to David to help him, until there was a great host, like the host of God.
Chr. And these are the numbers of the heads of those who were armed for war, who came to David to Hebron, to turn the kingdom of Saul to him, according to the word of Jehovah.
Chr. The sons of Judah who bore shield and spear were six thousand and eight hundred, armed for war.
Chr. Of the sons of Simeon, mighty men of valor for the war, seven thousand and one hundred.
Chr. Of the sons of Levi four thousand and six hundred.
Chr. And Jehoiada was the leader of the house of Aaron. And with him were three thousand and seven hundred,
Chr. and Zadok, a young man mighty of valor,  of his father's house twenty-two captains.
Chr. And of the sons of Benjamin, the brothers of Saul, three thousand, for hitherto the greatest part of them had kept their allegiance to the house of Saul.
Chr. And of the sons of Ephraim twenty thousand and eight hundred, mighty men of valor, famous men in their fathers' houses.
Chr. And of the half-tribe of Manasseh eighteen thousand, who were mentioned by name, to come and make David king.
Chr. And of the sons of Issachar, men who had understanding of the times to know what Israel ought to do, the heads of them were two hundred. And all their brothers were at their commandment.
Chr. Of Zebulun, such as were able to go out in the army, who could set the battle in array, with all manner of instruments of war, fifty thousand,  who could order the battle array,  were not of double heart.
Chr. And of Naphtali a thousand captains,  with them thirty-seven thousand with shield and spear.
Chr. And of the Danites who could set the battle in array, twenty-eight thousand and six hundred.
Chr. And of Asher, such as were able to go out in the army, who could set the battle in array, forty thousand.
Chr. And on the other side of the Jordan, of the Reubenites,  the Gadites,  of the half-tribe of Manasseh, with all manner of instruments of war for the battle, a hundred and twenty thousand.
Chr. All these being men of war, who could order the battle array, came with a perfect heart to Hebron, to make David king over all Israel. And all the rest also of Israel were of one heart to make David king.
Chr. And they were there with David three days, eating and drinking, for their brothers had made preparation for them.
Chr. Moreover those who were near to them, even as far as Issachar and Zebulun and Naphtali, brought bread on donkeys,  on camels,  on mules,  on oxen, provisions of meal, cakes of figs,  clusters of raisins,  wine,  oil,  oxen,  sheep in abundance, for there was joy in Israel.
Chr. And David consulted with the captains of thousands and of hundreds, even with every leader.
Chr. And David said to all the assembly of Israel, If it seems good to you,  if it be of Jehovah our God, let us send abroad everywhere to our brothers who are left in all the land of Israel, with whom the priests and Levites are in their cities that have suburbs, that they may gather themselves to us.
Chr. And let us bring again the ark of our God to us, for we did not inquire from it in the days of Saul.
Chr. And all the assembly said that they would do so, for the thing was right in the eyes of all the people.
Chr. So David assembled all Israel together, from the Shihor the brook of Egypt even to the entrance of Hamath, to bring the ark of God from Kiriath-jearim.
Chr. And David went up,  all Israel, to Baalah, that is to Kiriath-jearim, which belonged to Judah, to bring up from there the ark of God, Jehovah who sits above the cherubim that is called by the Name.
Chr. And they carried the ark of God upon a new cart,  brought it out of the house of Abinadab. And Uzza and Ahio drove the cart.
Chr. And David and all Israel played before God with all their might, even with songs,  with harps,  with psalteries,  with timbrels,  with cymbals,  with trumpets.
Chr. And when they came to the threshing-floor of Chidon, Uzza put forth his hand to hold the ark, for the oxen stumbled.
Chr. And the anger of Jehovah was kindled against Uzza,  he smote him because he put forth his hand to the ark. And there he died before God.
Chr. And David was displeased, because Jehovah had broken forth upon Uzza. And he called that place Perez-uzza, to this day.
Chr. And David was afraid of God that day, saying, How shall I bring the ark of God home to me?
Chr. So David did not move the ark to him into the city of David,  carried it aside into the house of Obed-edom the Gittite.
Chr. And the ark of God remained with the family of Obed-edom in his house three months. And Jehovah blessed the house of Obed-edom,  all that he had.
Chr. And Hiram king of Tyre sent messengers to David,  cedar trees,  masons,  carpenters, to build for him a house.
Chr. And David perceived that Jehovah had established him king over Israel, for his kingdom was exalted on high for his people Israel's sake.
Chr. And David took more wives at Jerusalem,  David begot more sons and daughters.
Chr. And these are the names of the children whom he had in Jerusalem: Shammua,  Shobab, Nathan,  Solomon,
Chr. and Ibhar,  Elishua,  Elpelet,
Chr. and Nogah,  Nepheg,  Japhia,
Chr. and Elishama,  Beeliada,  Eliphelet.
Chr. And when the Philistines heard that David was anointed king over all Israel, all the Philistines went up to seek David. And David heard of it,  went out against them.
Chr. Now the Philistines had come and made a raid in the valley of Rephaim.
Chr. And David inquired of God, saying, Shall I go up against the Philistines? And will thou deliver them into my hand? And Jehovah said to him, Go up, for I will deliver them into thy hand.
Chr. So they came up to Baal-perazim,  David smote them there. And David said, God has broken my enemies by my hand like the breach of waters. Therefore they called the name of that place Baal-perazim.
Chr. And they left their gods there. And David gave commandment,  they were burned with fire.
Chr. And the Philistines yet again made a raid in the valley.
Chr. And David inquired again of God. And God said to him, Thou shall not go up after them. Turn away from them,  come upon them opposite the mulberry trees.
Chr. And it shall be, when thou hear the sound of marching in the tops of the mulberry trees, that then thou shall go out to battle. For God has gone out before thee to smite the army of the Philistines.
Chr. And David did as God commanded him,  they smote the army of the Philistines from Gibeon even to Gezer.
Chr. And the fame of David went out into all lands. And Jehovah brought the fear of him upon all nations.
Chr. And David made for him houses in the city of David. And he prepared a place for the ark of God,  pitched a tent for it.
Chr. Then David said, None ought to carry the ark of God but the Levites, for Jehovah has them chosen to carry the ark of God,  to minister to him forever.
Chr. And David assembled all Israel at Jerusalem to bring up the ark of Jehovah to its place, which he had prepared for it.
Chr. And David gathered together the sons of Aaron,  the Levites:
Chr. of the sons of Kohath, Uriel the chief,  his brothers a hundred and twenty;
Chr. of the sons of Merari, Asaiah the chief,  his brothers two hundred and twenty;
Chr. of the sons of Gershom, Joel the chief,  his brothers a hundred and thirty;
Chr. of the sons of Elizaphan, Shemaiah the chief,  his brothers two hundred;
Chr. of the sons of Hebron, Eliel the chief,  his brothers eighty;
Chr. of the sons of Uzziel, Amminadab the chief,  his brothers a hundred and twelve.
Chr. And David called for Zadok and Abiathar the priests,  for the Levites, for Uriel, Asaiah,  Joel, Shemaiah,  Eliel,  Amminadab.
Chr. And said to them, Ye are the heads of the fathers of the Levites. Sanctify yourselves, both ye and your brothers, that ye may bring up the ark of Jehovah, the God of Israel, to the place that I have prepared for it.
Chr. For because ye did not at the first, Jehovah our God made a breach upon us, because we did not seek him according to the ordinance.
Chr. So the priests and the Levites sanctified themselves to bring up the ark of Jehovah, the God of Israel.
Chr. And the sons of the Levites bore the ark of God upon their shoulders with the staves thereon, as Moses commanded according to the word of Jehovah.
Chr. And David spoke to the chief of the Levites to appoint their brothers the singers, with instruments of music, psalteries and harps and cymbals, sounding aloud and lifting up the voice with joy.
Chr. So the Levites appointed Heman the son of Joel. And of his brothers, Asaph the son of Berechiah. And of the sons of Merari their brothers, Ethan the son of Kushaiah.
Chr. And with them their brothers of the second degree, Zechariah, Ben,  Jaaziel,  Shemiramoth,  Jehiel,  Unni, Eliab,  Benaiah,  Maaseiah,  Mattithiah,  Eliphelehu,  Mikneiah,  Obed-edom,  Jeiel, the porters.
Chr. So the singers, Heman, Asaph,  Ethan, were appointed with cymbals of brass to sound aloud.
Chr. And Zechariah,  Aziel,  Shemiramoth,  Jehiel,  Unni,  Eliab,  Maaseiah,  Benaiah, with psalteries set to Alamoth.
Chr. And Mattithiah,  Eliphelehu,  Mikneiah,  Obed-edom,  Jeiel,  Azaziah, with harps set to the Sheminith, to lead.
Chr. And Chenaniah, chief of the Levites, was over the song. He instructed about the song because he was skilful.
Chr. And Berechiah and Elkanah were porters for the ark.
Chr. And Shebaniah,  Joshaphat,  Nethanel,  Amasai,  Zechariah,  Benaiah,  Eliezer, the priests, blew the trumpets before the ark of God. And Obed-edom and Jehiah were porters for the ark.
Chr. So David,  the elders of Israel,  the captains over thousands, went to bring up the ark of the covenant of Jehovah out of the house of Obed-edom with joy.
Chr. And it came to pass, when God helped the Levites who bore the ark of the covenant of Jehovah, that they sacrificed seven bullocks and seven rams.
Chr. And David was clothed with a robe of fine linen,  all the Levites who bore the ark,  the singers,  Chenaniah the master of the song with the singers. And David had upon him an ephod of linen.
Chr. Thus all Israel brought up the ark of the covenant of Jehovah with shouting,  with sound of the cornet,  with trumpets,  with cymbals, sounding aloud with psalteries and harps.
Chr. And it came to pass, as the ark of the covenant of Jehovah came to the city of David, that Michal the daughter of Saul looked out at the window,  saw king David dancing and playing. And she despised him in her heart.
Chr. And they brought in the ark of God,  set it in the midst of the tent that David had pitched for it. And they offered burnt offerings and peace offerings before God.
Chr. And when David had made an end of offering the burnt offering and the peace offerings, he blessed the people in the name of Jehovah.
Chr. And he dealt to every one of Israel, both man and woman, to every one a loaf of bread,  a portion of flesh,  a cake of raisins.
Chr. And he appointed certain of the Levites to minister before the ark of Jehovah,  to celebrate and to thank and praise Jehovah, the God of Israel:
Chr. Asaph the chief,  second to him Zechariah, Jeiel,  Shemiramoth,  Jehiel,  Mattithiah,  Eliab,  Benaiah,  Obed-edom,  Jeiel, with psalteries and with harps,  Asaph with cymbals, sounding aloud,
Chr. and Benaiah and Jahaziel the priests with trumpets continually, before the ark of the covenant of God.
Chr. Then on that day David first ordained to give thanks to Jehovah by the hand of Asaph and his brothers.
Chr. O give thanks to Jehovah. Call upon his name. Make known his doings among the peoples.
Chr. Sing to him. Sing praises to him. Talk ye of all his marvelous works.
Chr. Glory ye in his holy name. Let the heart of those who seek Jehovah rejoice.
Chr. Seek ye Jehovah and his strength. Seek his face evermore.
Chr. Remember his marvelous works that he has done, his wonders,  the judgments of his mouth,
Chr. O ye seed of Israel his servant, ye sons of Jacob, his chosen ones.
Chr. He is Jehovah our God. His judgments are in all the earth.
Chr. Remember his covenant forever, the word which he commanded to a thousand generations,
Chr. the covenant which he made with Abraham,  his oath to Isaac,
Chr. and confirmed the same to Jacob for a statute, to Israel for an everlasting covenant,
Chr. saying, To thee I will give the land of Canaan, the lot of your inheritance,
Chr. when ye were but a few men in number, yea, very few,  sojourners in it,
Chr. and they went about from nation to nation,  from one kingdom to another people.
Chr. He allowed no man to do them wrong. Yea, he reproved kings for their sakes,
Chr. saying, Touch not my anointed ones,  do my prophets no harm.
Chr. Sing to Jehovah, all the earth. Show forth his salvation from day to day.
Chr. Declare his glory among the nations, his marvelous works among all the peoples.
Chr. For great is Jehovah,  greatly to be praised. He also is to be feared above all gods.
Chr. For all the gods of the peoples are idols. But Jehovah made the heavens.
Chr. Honor and majesty are before him. Strength and gladness are in his place.
Chr. Ascribe to Jehovah, ye kindred of the peoples. Ascribe to Jehovah glory and strength.
Chr. Ascribe to Jehovah the glory due to his name. Bring an offering,  come before him. Worship Jehovah in holy array.
Chr. Tremble before him, all the earth. The world also is established that it cannot be moved.
Chr. Let the heavens be glad,  let the earth rejoice. And let them say among the nations, Jehovah reigns.
Chr. Let the sea roar,  the fullness of it. Let the field exult,  all that is therein.
Chr. Then shall the trees of the wood sing for joy before Jehovah, for he comes to judge the earth.
Chr. O give thanks to Jehovah, for he is good, for his loving kindness is forever.
Chr. And say ye, Save us, O God of our salvation. And gather us together and deliver us from the nations, to give thanks to thy holy name,  to triumph in thy praise.
Chr. Blessed be Jehovah, the God of Israel, from everlasting even to everlasting. And all the people said, Truly,  praised Jehovah.
Chr. So he left there, before the ark of the covenant of Jehovah, Asaph and his brothers, to minister before the ark continually, as every day's work required,
Chr. and Obed-edom with their sixty-eight brothers. And Obed-edom the son of Jeduthun and Hosah were to be porters,
Chr. and Zadok the priest,  his brothers the priests, before the tabernacle of Jehovah in the high place that was at Gibeon,
Chr. to offer burnt offerings to Jehovah upon the altar of burnt offering continually morning and evening, even according to all that is written in the law of Jehovah, which he commanded to Israel.
Chr. And with them Heman and Jeduthun,  the rest that were chosen, who were mentioned by name, to give thanks to Jehovah because his loving kindness is forever.
Chr. And with them Heman and Jeduthun with trumpets and cymbals for those who should sound aloud,  with instruments for the songs of God,  the sons of Jeduthun to be at the gate.
Chr. And all the people departed every man to his house. And David returned to bless his house.
Chr. And it came to pass, when David dwelt in his house, that David said to Nathan the prophet, Lo, I dwell in a house of cedar,  the ark of the covenant of Jehovah dwells under curtains.
Chr. And Nathan said to David, Do all that is in thy heart, for God is with thee.
Chr. And it came to pass the same night, that the word of God came to Nathan, saying,
Chr. Go and tell David my servant, Thus says Jehovah, Thou shall not build for me a house to dwell in.
Chr. For I have not dwelt in a house since the day that I brought up Israel, to this day,  have gone from tent to tent,  from one tabernacle to another.
Chr. In all places wherein I have walked with all Israel, did I speak a word with any of the judges of Israel, whom I commanded to be shepherd of my people, saying, Why have ye not built for me a house of cedar?
Chr. Now therefore thus thou shall say to my servant David, Thus says Jehovah of hosts, I took thee from the sheepfold, from following the sheep, that thou should be prince over my people Israel.
Chr. And I have been with thee wherever thou have gone,  have cut off all thine enemies from before thee. And I will make thee a name like the name of the great ones who are on the earth.
Chr. And I will appoint a place for my people Israel,  will plant them, that they may dwell in their own place,  be moved no more. Neither shall the sons of wickedness waste them any more, as at the first,
Chr. and as from the day that I commanded judges to be over my people Israel. And I will subdue all thine enemies. Moreover I tell thee that Jehovah will build for thee a house.
Chr. And it shall come to pass, when thy days are fulfilled that thou must go to be with thy fathers, that I will set up thy seed after thee, who shall be of thy sons. And I will establish his kingdom.
Chr. He shall build for me a house,  I will establish his throne forever.
Chr. I will be his father,  he shall be my son. And I will not take my loving kindness away from him as I took it from him who was before thee.
Chr. But I will settle him in my house and in my kingdom forever,  his throne shall be established forever.
Chr. According to all these words,  according to all this vision, so Nathan spoke to David.
Chr. Then David the king went in,  sat before Jehovah. And he said, Who am I, O Jehovah God,  what is my house, that thou have brought me thus far?
Chr. And this was a small thing in thine eyes, O God. But thou have spoken of thy servant's house for a great while to come,  have regarded me according to the estate of a man of high degree, O Jehovah God.
Chr. What can David say yet more to thee concerning the honor which is done to thy servant? For thou know thy servant.
Chr. O Jehovah, for thy servant's sake,  according to thine own heart, thou have wrought all this greatness, to make known all these great things.
Chr. O Jehovah, there is none like thee, neither is there any God besides thee, according to all that we have heard with our ears.
Chr. And what one nation on the earth is like thy people Israel, whom God went to redeem to himself for a people, to make thee a name by great and awesome things, in driving out nations from before thy people whom thou redeemed out of Egypt?
Chr. For thy people Israel thou made thine own people forever. And thou, Jehovah, became their God.
Chr. And now, O Jehovah, let the word that thou have spoken concerning thy servant,  concerning his house, be established forever,  do as thou have spoken.
Chr. And let thy name be established and magnified forever, saying, Jehovah of hosts is the God of Israel, even a God to Israel,  the house of David thy servant is established before thee.
Chr. For thou, O my God, have revealed to thy servant that thou will build him a house. Therefore thy servant has found in his heart to pray before thee.
Chr. And now, O Jehovah, thou are God,  have promised this good thing to thy servant,
Chr. and now it has pleased thee to bless the house of thy servant, that it may continue for ever before thee; for thou, O Jehovah, have blessed,  it is blessed forever.
Chr. And after this it came to pass, that David smote the Philistines,  subdued them,  took Gath and its towns out of the hand of the Philistines.
Chr. And he smote Moab,  the Moabites became servants to David,  brought tribute.
Chr. And David smote Hadarezer king of Zobah to Hamath, as he went to establish his dominion by the river Euphrates.
Chr. And David took from him a thousand chariots,  seven thousand horsemen,  twenty thousand footmen. And David hocked all the chariot horses,  reserved from them for a hundred chariots.
Chr. And when the Syrians of Damascus came to aid Hadarezer king of Zobah, David smote of the Syrians twenty-two thousand men.
Chr. Then David put garrisons in Syria of Damascus. And the Syrians became servants to David,  brought tribute. And Jehovah gave victory to David wherever he went.
Chr. And David took the shields of gold that were on the servants of Hadarezer,  brought them to Jerusalem.
Chr. And from Tibhath and from Cun, cities of Hadarezer, David took very much brass, with which Solomon made the brazen sea,  the pillars,  the vessels of brass.
Chr. And when Tou king of Hamath heard that David had smitten all the army of Hadarezer king of Zobah,
Chr. he sent Hadoram his son to king David, to salute him,  to bless him, because he had fought against Hadarezer and smitten him (for Hadarezer had wars with Tou),  he had with him all manner of vessels of gold and silver and brass.
Chr. These also king David dedicated to Jehovah, with the silver and the gold that he carried away from all the nations: from Edom,  from Moab,  from the sons of Ammon,  from the Philistines,  from Amalek.
Chr. Moreover Abishai the son of Zeruiah smote eighteen thousand of the Edomites in the Valley of Salt.
Chr. And he put garrisons in Edom,  all the Edomites became servants to David. And Jehovah gave victory to David wherever he went.
Chr. And David reigned over all Israel,  he executed justice and righteousness to all his people.
Chr. And Joab the son of Zeruiah was over the army,  Jehoshaphat the son of Ahilud was recorder,
Chr. and Zadok the son of Ahitub,  Abimelech the son of Abiathar, were priests,  Shavsha was scribe,
Chr. and Benaiah the son of Jehoiada was over the Cherethites and the Pelethites,  the sons of David were chief about the king.
Chr. And it came to pass after this, that Nahash the king of the sons of Ammon died,  his son reigned in his stead.
Chr. And David said, I will show kindness to Hanun the son of Nahash, because his father showed kindness to me. So David sent messengers to comfort him concerning his father. And David's servants came into the land of the sons of Ammon to Hanun, to comfort him.
Chr. But the rulers of the sons of Ammon said to Hanun, Do thou think that David honors thy father, in that he has sent comforters to thee? Have not his servants come to thee to search,  to overthrow,  to spy out the land?
Chr. So Hanun took David's servants,  shaved them,  cut off their garments in the middle, even to their buttocks,  sent them away.
