Chr. And they came and informed David about the men. And he sent to meet them, for the men were greatly ashamed. And the king said, Remain at Jericho until your beards be grown,  then return.
Chr. And when the sons of Ammon saw that they had made themselves odious to David, Hanun and the sons of Ammon sent a thousand talents of silver to hire for them chariots and horsemen out of Mesopotamia,  out of Arammaacah,  out of Zobah.
Chr. So they hired for them thirty-two thousand chariots,  the king of Maacah and his people, who came and encamped before Medeba. And the sons of Ammon gathered themselves together from their cities,  came to battle.
Chr. And when David heard of it, he sent Joab,  all the army of the mighty men.
Chr. And the sons of Ammon came out,  put the battle in array at the gate of the city. And the kings that came were by themselves in the field.
Chr. Now when Joab saw that the battle was set against him in front and behind, he chose from all the choice men of Israel,  put them in array against the Syrians.
Chr. And the rest of the company he committed into the hand of Abishai his brother,  they put themselves in array against the sons of Ammon.
Chr. And he said, If the Syrians be too strong for me, then thou shall help me,  if the sons of Ammon be too strong for thee, then I will help thee.
Chr. Be of good courage,  let us act the man for our people,  for the cities of our God. And Jehovah do that which seems good to him.
Chr. So Joab and the company that were with him drew near before the Syrians to the battle,  they fled before him.
Chr. And when the sons of Ammon saw that the Syrians had fled, they likewise fled before Abishai his brother,  entered into the city. Then Joab came to Jerusalem.
Chr. And when the Syrians saw that they were put to the worse before Israel, they sent messengers,  drew forth the Syrians that were beyond the River, with Shophach the captain of the army of Hadarezer at their head.
Chr. And it was told David. And he gathered all Israel together,  passed over the Jordan,  came upon them,  set the battle in array against them. So when David had put the battle in array against the Syrians, they fought with him.
Chr. And the Syrians fled before Israel. And David killed of the Syrians the men of seven thousand chariots,  forty thousand footmen,  killed Shophach the captain of the army.
Chr. And when the servants of Hadarezer saw that they were put to the worse before Israel, they made peace with David,  served him, neither would the Syrians help the sons of Ammon any more.
Chr. And it came to pass, at the time of the return of the year, at the time when kings go out to battle, that Joab led forth the army,  wasted the country of the sons of Ammon,  came and besieged Rabbah,  David remained at Jerusalem. And Joab smote Rabbah,  overthrew it.
Chr. And David took the crown of their king from off his head,  found it to weigh a talent of gold,  there were precious stones in it. And it was set upon David's head,  he brought forth the spoil of the city, exceedingly much.
Chr. And he brought forth the people that were therein,  cut with saws,  with harrows of iron,  with axes. And thus David did to all the cities of the sons of Ammon. And David and all the people returned to Jerusalem.
Chr. And it came to pass after this, that there arose war at Gezer with the Philistines. Then Sibbecai the Hushathite killed Sippai of the sons of the giant,  they were subdued.
Chr. And there was again war with the Philistines. And Elhanan the son of Jair killed Lahmi the brother of Goliath the Gittite, the staff of whose spear was like a weaver's beam.
Chr. And there was again war at Gath, where was a man of great stature whose fingers and toes were twenty-four, six on each hand,  six on each foot. And he also was born to the giant.
Chr. And when he defied Israel, Jonathan the son of Shimea David's brother killed him.
Chr. These were born to the giant in Gath,  they fell by the hand of David,  by the hand of his servants.
Chr. And Satan stood up against Israel,  moved David to number Israel.
Chr. And David said to Joab and to the princes of the people, Go, number Israel from Beersheba even to Dan,  bring me word that I may know the sum of them.
Chr. And Joab said, Jehovah make his people a hundred times as many as they are. But, my lord the king, are they not all my lord's servants? Why does my lord require this thing? Why will he be a cause of guilt to Israel?
Chr. Nevertheless the king's word prevailed against Joab. Therefore Joab departed,  went throughout all Israel,  came to Jerusalem.
Chr. And Joab gave up the sum of the numbering of the people to David. And all those of Israel were a million and a hundred thousand men who drew a sword. And Judah was four hundred seventy thousand men who drew a sword.
Chr. But he did not count Levi and Benjamin among them, for the king's word was abominable to Joab.
Chr. And God was displeased with this thing, therefore he smote Israel.
Chr. And David said to God, I have sinned greatly, in that I have done this thing. But now, put away, I beseech thee, the iniquity of thy servant, for I have done very foolishly.
Chr. And Jehovah spoke to Gad, David's seer, saying,
Chr. Go and speak to David, saying, Thus says Jehovah, I offer thee three things. Choose thee one of them, that I may do it to thee.
Chr. So Gad came to David,  said to him, Thus says Jehovah, Take which thou will:
Chr. either three years of famine, or three months to be consumed before thy foes while the sword of thine enemies overtakes thee, or else three days the sword of Jehovah, even pestilence in the land,  the agent of Jehovah destroying throughout all the borders of Israel. Now therefore consider what answer I shall return to him who sent me.
Chr. And David said to Gad, I am in a great strait. Let me fall, I pray, into the hand of Jehovah, for his mercies are very great,  let me not fall into the hand of man.
Chr. So Jehovah sent a pestilence upon Israel,  there fell of Israel seventy thousand men.
Chr. And God sent an agent to Jerusalem to destroy it. And as he was about to destroy, Jehovah beheld,  he relented of the evil,  said to the destroying agent, It is enough. Now halt thy hand. And the agent of Jehovah was standing by the threshing-floor of Ornan the Jebusite.
Chr. And David lifted up his eyes,  saw the agent of Jehovah standing between earth and heaven, having a drawn sword in his hand stretched out over Jerusalem. Then David and the elders, clothed in sackcloth, fell upon their faces.
Chr. And David said to God, Is it not I who commanded the people to be numbered? Even I it is who have sinned and done very badly. But these sheep, what have they done? Let thy hand, I pray thee, O Jehovah my God, be against me,  against my father's house,  not against thy people, that they should be plagued.
Chr. Then the agent of Jehovah commanded Gad to say to David that David should go up,  rear an altar to Jehovah in the threshing-floor of Ornan the Jebusite.
Chr. And David went up at the saying of Gad, which he spoke in the name of Jehovah.
Chr. And Ornan turned back,  saw the agent,  his four sons who were with him hid themselves. Now Ornan was threshing wheat.
Chr. And as David came to Ornan, Ornan looked and saw David,  went out of the threshing-floor,  bowed himself to David with his face to the ground.
Chr. Then David said to Ornan, Give me the place of this threshing-floor, that I may build thereon an altar to Jehovah. For the full price thou shall give it me, that the plague may be stopped from the people.
Chr. And Ornan said to David, Take it to thee,  let my lord the king do that which is good in his eyes. Lo, I give thee the oxen for burnt offerings,  the threshing instruments for wood,  the wheat for the meal offering. I give it all.
Chr. And king David said to Ornan, No,  I will truly buy it for the full price. For I will not take that which is thine for Jehovah, nor offer a burnt offering without cost.
Chr. So David gave to Ornan for the place six hundred shekels of gold by weight.
Chr. And David built there an altar to Jehovah,  offered burnt offerings and peace offerings,  called upon Jehovah. And he answered him from heaven by fire upon the altar of burnt offering.
Chr. And Jehovah commanded the agent,  he put up his sword again into the sheath of it.
Chr. At that time, when David saw that Jehovah had answered him in the threshing-floor of Ornan the Jebusite, then he sacrificed there.
Chr. For the tabernacle of Jehovah, which Moses made in the wilderness,  the altar of burnt offering, were at that time in the high place at Gibeon.
Chr. But David could not go before it to inquire of God, for he was afraid because of the sword of the agent of Jehovah.
Chr. Then David said, This is the house of Jehovah God,  this is the altar of burnt offering for Israel.
Chr. And David commanded to gather together the sojourners that were in the land of Israel. And he set masons to hew wrought stones to build the house of God.
Chr. And David prepared iron in abundance for the nails for the doors of the gates,  for the couplings,  brass in abundance without weight,
Chr. and cedar trees without number. For the Sidonians and those of Tyre brought cedar trees in abundance to David.
Chr. And David said, Solomon my son is young and tender,  the house that is to be built for Jehovah must be exceedingly magnificent, of fame and of glory throughout all countries. I will therefore make preparation for it. So David prepared abundantly before his death.
Chr. Then he called for Solomon his son,  charged him to build a house for Jehovah, the God of Israel.
Chr. And David said to Solomon his son, As for me, it was in my heart to build a house to the name of Jehovah my God.
Chr. But the word of Jehovah came to me, saying, Thou have shed blood abundantly,  have made great wars. Thou shall not build a house to my name because thou have shed much blood upon the earth in my sight.
Chr. Behold, a son shall be born to thee, who shall be a man of rest. And I will give him rest from all his enemies round about, for his name shall be Solomon. And I will give peace and quietness to Israel in his days.
Chr. He shall build a house for my name. And he shall be my son,  I will be his father,  I will establish the throne of his kingdom over Israel forever.
Chr. Now, my son, Jehovah be with thee,  prosper thou,  build the house of Jehovah thy God as he has spoken concerning thee.
Chr. Only Jehovah give thee discretion and understanding,  give thee charge concerning Israel, so that thou may keep the law of Jehovah thy God.
Chr. Then thou shall prosper, if thou observe to do the statutes and the ordinances which Jehovah charged Moses with concerning Israel. Be strong,  of good courage. Fear not, neither be dismayed.
Chr. Now, behold, in my affliction I have prepared for the house of Jehovah a hundred thousand talents of gold,  a million talents of silver,  of brass and iron without weight, for it is in abundance. Also I have prepared timber and stone,  thou may add thereto.
Chr. Moreover there are workmen with thee in abundance, hewers and workers of stone and timber,  all men who are skilful in every manner of work.
Chr. Of the gold, the silver,  the brass,  the iron, there is no number. Arise and be doing,  Jehovah be with thee.
Chr. David also commanded all the rulers of Israel to help Solomon his son, saying,
Chr. Is not Jehovah your God with you? And has he not given you rest on every side? For he has delivered the inhabitants of the land into my hand,  the land is subdued before Jehovah,  before his people.
Chr. Now set your heart and your soul to seek after Jehovah your God. Arise therefore,  build ye the sanctuary of Jehovah God, to bring the ark of the covenant of Jehovah,  the holy vessels of God, into the house that is to be built to the name of Jehovah.
Chr. Now David was old and full of days,  he made Solomon his son king over Israel.
Chr. And he gathered together all the rulers of Israel, with the priests and the Levites.
Chr. And the Levites were numbered from thirty years old and upward. And their number by their polls, man by man, was thirty-eight thousand.
Chr. Of these, twenty-four thousand were to oversee the work of the house of Jehovah. And six thousand were officers and judges,
Chr. and four thousand were porters,  four thousand praised Jehovah with the instruments which I made, David said, to praise therewith.
Chr. And David divided them into divisions according to the sons of Levi: Gershon, Kohath,  Merari.
Chr. Of the Gershonites: Ladan and Shimei.
Chr. The sons of Ladan: Jehiel the chief,  Zetham,  Joel, three.
Chr. The sons of Shimei: Shelomoth,  Haziel,  Haran, three. These were the heads of the fathers of Ladan.
Chr. And the sons of Shimei: Jahath, Zina,  Jeush,  Beriah. These four were the sons of Shimei.
Chr. And Jahath was the chief,  Zizah the second. But Jeush and Beriah had not many sons. Therefore they became a fathers' house in one reckoning.
Chr. The sons of Kohath: Amram, Izhar, Hebron,  Uzziel, four.
Chr. The sons of Amram: Aaron and Moses. And Aaron was separated that he should sanctify the most holy things, he and his sons, forever, to burn incense before Jehovah, to minister to him,  to bless in his name, forever.
Chr. But as for Moses the man of God, his sons were named among the tribe of Levi.
Chr. The sons of Moses: Gershom and Eliezer.
Chr. The sons of Gershom: Shebuel the chief.
Chr. And the sons of Eliezer were: Rehabiah the chief. And Eliezer had no other sons,  the sons of Rehabiah were very many.
Chr. The sons of Izhar: Shelomith the chief.
Chr. The sons of Hebron: Jeriah the chief, Amariah the second, Jahaziel the third,  Jekameam the fourth.
Chr. The sons of Uzziel: Micah the chief,  Isshiah the second.
Chr. The sons of Merari: Mahli and Mushi. The sons of Mahli: Eleazar and Kish.
Chr. And Eleazar died,  had no sons,  daughters only. And their brothers the sons of Kish took them to wife.
Chr. The sons of Mushi: Mahli,  Eder,  Jeremoth, three.
Chr. These were the sons of Levi after their fathers' houses, even the heads of the fathers of those of them that were counted, in the number of names by their polls, who did the work for the service of the house of Jehovah, from twenty years old and upward.
Chr. For David said, Jehovah, the God of Israel, has given rest to his people,  he dwells in Jerusalem forever.
Chr. And also the Levites shall no more have need to carry the tabernacle and all the vessels of it for the service of it.
Chr. For by the last words of David the sons of Levi were numbered, from twenty years old and upward.
Chr. For their office was to wait on the sons of Aaron for the service of the house of Jehovah, in the courts,  in the chambers,  in the purifying of all holy things, even the work of the service of the house of God, also
Chr. for the showbread,  for the fine flour for a meal offering, whether of unleavened wafers, or of that which is baked in the pan, or of that which is soaked,  for all manner of measure and size.
Chr. And to stand every morning to thank and praise Jehovah,  likewise at evening.
Chr. And to offer all burnt offerings to Jehovah, on the sabbaths, on the new moons,  on the set feasts, in number according to the ordinance concerning them, continually before Jehovah.
Chr. And that they should keep the charge of the tent of meeting,  the charge of the holy place,  the charge of the sons of Aaron their brothers, for the service of the house of Jehovah.
Chr. And the divisions of the sons of Aaron were these. The sons of Aaron: Nadab and Abihu, Eleazar and Ithamar.
Chr. But Nadab and Abihu died before their father,  had no sons. Therefore Eleazar and Ithamar executed the priest's office.
Chr. And David with Zadok of the sons of Eleazar,  Ahimelech of the sons of Ithamar, divided them according to their ordering in their service.
Chr. And there were more chief men found of the sons of Eleazar than of the sons of Ithamar. And thus were they divided: of the sons of Eleazar there were sixteen heads of fathers' houses,  of the sons of Ithamar, according to their fathers' houses, eight.
Chr. Thus they were divided by lot, one sort with another. For there were rulers of the sanctuary,  rulers for God, both of the sons of Eleazar,  of the sons of Ithamar.
Chr. And Shemaiah the son of Nethanel the scribe, who was of the Levites, wrote them in the presence of the king,  the princes,  Zadok the priest,  Ahimelech the son of Abiathar,  the heads of the fathers of the priests and of the Levites, one fathers' house being taken for Eleazar,  one taken for Ithamar.
Chr. Now the first lot came forth to Jehoiarib, the second to Jedaiah,
Chr. the third to Harim, the fourth to Seorim,
Chr. the fifth to Malchijah, the sixth to Mijamin,
Chr. the seventh to Hakkoz, the eighth to Abijah,
Chr. the ninth to Jeshua, the tenth to Shecaniah,
Chr. the eleventh to Eliashib, the twelfth to Jakim,
Chr. the thirteenth to Huppah, the fourteenth to Jeshebeab,
Chr. the fifteenth to Bilgah, the sixteenth to Immer,
Chr. the seventeenth to Hezir, the eighteenth to Happizzez,
Chr. the nineteenth to Pethahiah, the twentieth to Jehezkel,
Chr. the twenty-first to Jachin, the twenty-second to Gamul,
Chr. the twenty-third to Delaiah, the twenty-fourth to Maaziah.
Chr. This was the ordering of them in their service, to come into the house of Jehovah according to the ordinance given to them by Aaron their father, as Jehovah, the God of Israel, had commanded him.
Chr. And of the rest of the sons of Levi: Of the sons of Amram, Shubael. Of the sons of Shubael, Jehdeiah.
Chr. Of Rehabiah: of the sons of Rehabiah, Isshiah the chief.
Chr. Of the Izharites, Shelomoth. Of the sons of Shelomoth, Jahath.
Chr. And the sons of Hebron: Jeriah the chief, Amariah the second, Jahaziel the third, Jekameam the fourth.
Chr. The sons of Uzziel, Micah. Of the sons of Micah, Shamir.
Chr. The brother of Micah, Isshiah. Of the sons of Isshiah, Zechariah.
Chr. The sons of Merari: Mahli and Mushi. The sons of Jaaziah: Beno.
Chr. The sons of Merari: Of Jaaziah, Beno,  Shoham,  Zaccur,  Ibri.
Chr. Of Mahli: Eleazar, who had no sons.
Chr. Of Kish, the sons of Kish: Jerahmeel.
Chr. And the sons of Mushi: Mahli,  Eder,  Jerimoth. These were the sons of the Levites after their fathers' houses.
Chr. These likewise cast lots even as their brothers the sons of Aaron in the presence of David the king,  Zadok,  Ahimelech,  the heads of the fathers of the priests and of the Levites, the fathers of the chief even as those of his younger brother.
Chr. Moreover David and the captains of the army set apart for the service certain of the sons of Asaph,  of Heman,  of Jeduthun, who should prophesy with harps, with psalteries,  with cymbals. And the number of those who did the work according to their service was:
Chr. of the sons of Asaph: Zaccur,  Joseph,  Nethaniah,  Asharelah, the sons of Asaph, under the hand of Asaph, who prophesied after the order of the king.
Chr. Of Jeduthun, the sons of Jeduthun: Gedaliah,  Zeri,  Jeshaiah, Hashabiah,  Mattithiah, six, under the hands of their father Jeduthun with the harp, who prophesied in giving thanks and praising Jehovah.
Chr. Of Heman, the sons of Heman: Bukkiah, Mattaniah, Uzziel, Shebuel,  Jerimoth, Hananiah, Hanani, Eliathah, Giddalti,  Romamtiezer, Joshbekashah, Mallothi, Hothir, Mahazioth.
Chr. All these were the sons of Heman the king's seer in the words of God, to lift up the horn. And God gave to Heman fourteen sons and three daughters.
Chr. All these were under the hands of their father for song in the house of Jehovah, with cymbals, psalteries,  harps, for the service of the house of God; Asaph, Jeduthun,  Heman being under the order of the king.
Chr. And the number of them, with their brothers who were instructed in singing to Jehovah, even all who were skilful, was two hundred eighty-eight.
Chr. And they cast lots for their offices, all alike, as well the small as the great, the teacher as the scholar.
Chr. Now the first lot came forth for Asaph to Joseph, the second to Gedaliah (he and his brothers and sons were twelve),
Chr. the third to Zaccur, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
Chr. the fourth to Izri, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
Chr. the fifth to Nethaniah, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
Chr. the sixth to Bukkiah, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
Chr. the seventh to Jesharelah, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
Chr. the eighth to Jeshaiah, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
Chr. the ninth to Mattaniah, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
Chr. the tenth to Shimei, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
Chr. the eleventh to Azarel, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
Chr. the twelfth to Hashabiah, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
Chr. for the thirteenth, Shubael, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
Chr. for the fourteenth, Mattithiah, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
Chr. for the fifteenth to Jeremoth, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
Chr. for the sixteenth to Hananiah, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
Chr. for the seventeenth to Joshbekashah, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
Chr. for the eighteenth to Hanani, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
Chr. for the nineteenth to Mallothi, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
Chr. for the twentieth to Eliathah, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
Chr. for the twenty-first to Hothir, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
Chr. for the twenty-second to Giddalti, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
Chr. for the twenty-third to Mahazioth, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
Chr. for the twenty-fourth to Romamtiezer, his sons and his brothers, twelve.
Chr. For the divisions of the porters: of the Korahites, Meshelemiah the son of Kore, of the sons of Asaph.
Chr. And Meshelemiah had sons: Zechariah the firstborn, Jediael the second, Zebadiah the third, Jathniel the fourth,
Chr. Elam the fifth, Jehohanan the sixth, Eliehoenai the seventh.
Chr. And Obed-edom had sons: Shemaiah the firstborn, Jehozabad the second, Joah the third,  Sacar the fourth,  Nethanel the fifth,
Chr. Ammiel the sixth, Issachar the seventh, Peullethai the eighth, for God blessed him.
Chr. Also sons were born to Shemaiah his son, who ruled over the house of their father, for they were mighty men of valor.
Chr. The sons of Shemaiah: Othni,  Rephael,  Obed, Elzabad, whose brothers were valiant men, Elihu,  Semachiah.
Chr. All these were of the sons of Obed-edom, they and their sons and their brothers, able men in strength for the service, sixty-two of Obed-edom.
Chr. And Meshelemiah had sons and brothers, valiant men, eighteen.
Chr. Also Hosah, of the sons of Merari, had sons: Shimri the chief (for though he was not the firstborn, yet his father made him chief),
Chr. Hilkiah the second, Tebaliah the third, Zechariah the fourth. All the sons and brothers of Hosah were thirteen.
Chr. Of these were the divisions of the porters, even of the chief men, having offices like their brothers to minister in the house of Jehovah.
Chr. And they cast lots, the small as well as the great, according to their fathers' houses for every gate.
Chr. And the lot eastward fell to Shelemiah. Then for Zechariah his son, a discreet counselor, they cast lots,  his lot came out northward.
Chr. To Obed-edom southward,  to his sons the store-house.
Chr. To Shuppim and Hosah westward, by the gate of Shallecheth, at the causeway that goes up, watch against watch.
Chr. Eastward were six Levites, four a day northward, four a day southward,  for the store-house two by two.
Chr. For Parbar westward, four at the highway,  two at Parbar.
Chr. These were the divisions of the porters, of the sons of the Korahites,  of the sons of Merari.
Chr. And of the Levites, Ahijah was over the treasures of the house of God,  over the treasures of the dedicated things.
Chr. The sons of Ladan, the sons of the Gershonites belonging to Ladan, the heads of the fathers belonging to Ladan the Gershonite: Jehieli.
Chr. The sons of Jehieli: Zetham,  Joel his brother, over the treasures of the house of Jehovah.
Chr. Of the Amramites, of the Izharites, of the Hebronites, of the Uzzielites:
Chr. Shebuel the son of Gershom, the son of Moses, was ruler over the treasures.
Chr. And his brothers: of Eliezer came Rehabiah his son,  Jeshaiah his son,  Joram his son,  Zichri his son,  Shelomoth his son.
Chr. This Shelomoth and his brothers were over all the treasures of the dedicated things, which David the king,  the heads of the fathers, the captains over thousands and hundreds,  the captains of the army, had dedicated.
Chr. They dedicated to repair the house of Jehovah out of the spoil won in battles.
Chr. And all that Samuel the seer,  Saul the son of Kish,  Abner the son of Ner,  Joab the son of Zeruiah, had dedicated, whoever had dedicated anything, it was under the hand of Shelomoth,  of his brothers.
Chr. Of the Izharites, Chenaniah and his sons were for the outer business over Israel, for officers and judges.
Chr. Of the Hebronites, Hashabiah and his brothers, men of valor, a thousand and seven hundred, had the oversight of Israel beyond the Jordan westward, for all the business of Jehovah,  for the service of the king.
Chr. Of the Hebronites was Jerijah the chief, even of the Hebronites, according to their generations by fathers. In the fortieth year of the reign of David they were sought for,  there were found among them mighty men of valor at Jazer of Gilead.
Chr. And his brothers, men of valor, were two thousand and seven hundred, heads of fathers, whom king David made overseers over the Reubenites,  the Gadites,  the half-tribe of the Manassites, for every matter pertaining to God,  for the affairs of the king.
Chr. Now the sons of Israel after their number, namely, the heads of fathers and the captains of thousands and of hundreds,  their officers who served the king, in any matter of the divisions which came in and went out month by month throughout all the months of the year-of every division were twenty-four thousand.
Chr. Jashobeam the son of Zabdiel was over the first division for the first month,  in his division were twenty-four thousand.
Chr. He was of the sons of Perez, the chief of all the captains of the army for the first month.
Chr. And over the division of the second month was Dodai the Ahohite,  his division. And Mikloth was the ruler. And in his division were twenty-four thousand.
Chr. The third captain of the army for the third month was Benaiah, the son of Jehoiada the priest, being chief. And in his division were twenty-four thousand.
Chr. This is that Benaiah who was the mighty man of the thirty,  over the thirty. And of his division was Ammizabad his son.
Chr. The fourth captain for the fourth month was Asahel the brother of Joab,  Zebadiah his son after him. And in his division were twenty-four thousand.
Chr. The fifth captain for this fifth month was Shamhuth the Izrahite. And in his division were twenty-four thousand.
Chr. The sixth captain for the sixth month was Ira the son of Ikkesh the Tekoite. And in his division were twenty-four thousand.
Chr. The seventh captain for the seventh month was Helez the Pelonite, of the sons of Ephraim. And in his division were twenty-four thousand.
Chr. The eighth captain for the eighth month was Sibbecai the Hushathite, of the Zerahites. And in his division were twenty-four thousand.
Chr. The ninth captain for the ninth month was Abiezer the Anathothite, of the Benjamites. And in his division were twenty-four thousand.
Chr. The tenth captain for the tenth month was Maharai the Netophathite, of the Zerahites. And in his division were twenty-four thousand.
Chr. The eleventh captain for the eleventh month was Benaiah the Pirathonite, of the sons of Ephraim. And in his division were twenty-four thousand.
Chr. The twelfth captain for the twelfth month was Heldai the Netophathite, of Othniel. And in his division were twenty-four thousand.
Chr. Furthermore over the tribes of Israel: of the Reubenites was Eliezer the son of Zichri the ruler; of the Simeonites, Shephatiah the son of Maacah;
Chr. of Levi, Hashabiah the son of Kemuel; of Aaron, Zadok;
Chr. of Judah, Elihu, one of the brothers of David; of Issachar, Omri the son of Michael;
Chr. of Zebulun, Ishmaiah the son of Obadiah; of Naphtali, Jeremoth the son of Azriel;
Chr. of the sons of Ephraim, Hoshea the son of Azaziah; of the half-tribe of Manasseh, Joel the son of Pedaiah;
Chr. of the half-tribe of Manasseh in Gilead, Iddo the son of Zechariah; of Benjamin, Jaasiel the son of Abner;
Chr. of Dan, Azarel the son of Jeroham. These were the captains of the tribes of Israel.
Chr. But David did not take the number of them from twenty years old and under, because Jehovah had said he would increase Israel like the stars of heaven.
Chr. Joab the son of Zeruiah began to number,  did not finish. And wrath came for this upon Israel. Neither was the number put into the account in the chronicles of king David.
Chr. And over the king's treasures was Azmaveth the son of Adiel. And over the treasures in the fields, in the cities,  in the villages,  in the castles, was Jonathan the son of Uzziah.
Chr. And over those who did the work of the field for tillage of the ground was Ezri the son of Chelub.
Chr. And over the vineyards was Shimei the Ramathite. And over the increase of the vineyards for the wine-cellars was Zabdi the Shiphmite.
Chr. And over the olive trees and the sycamore trees that were in the lowland was Baal-hanan the Gederite. And over the cellars of oil was Joash.
Chr. And over the herds that fed in Sharon was Shitrai the Sharonite. And over the herds that were in the valleys was Shaphat the son of Adlai.
Chr. And over the camels was Obil the Ishmaelite. And over the donkeys was Jehdeiah the Meronothite. And over the flocks was Jaziz the Hagrite.
Chr. All these were the rulers of the substance which was king David's.
Chr. Also Jonathan, David's uncle, was a counselor, a man of understanding,  a scribe. And Jehiel the son of Hachmoni was with the king's sons.
Chr. And Ahithophel was the king's counselor. And Hushai the Archite was the king's friend.
Chr. And after Ahithophel was Jehoiada the son of Benaiah,  Abiathar. And the captain of the king's army was Joab.
Chr. And David assembled all the rulers of Israel, the rulers of the tribes,  the captains of the companies that served the king by division,  the captains of thousands,  the captains of hundreds,  the rulers over all the substance and possessions of the king and of his sons, with the officers,  the mighty men, even all the mighty men of valor, to Jerusalem.
Chr. Then David the king stood up upon his feet,  said, Hear me, my brothers,  my people. As for me, it was in my heart to build a house of rest for the ark of the covenant of Jehovah,  for the footstool of our God. And I had made ready for the building.
Chr. But God said to me, Thou shall not build a house for my name, because thou are a man of war,  have shed blood.
Chr. However Jehovah, the God of Israel, chose me out of all the house of my father to be king over Israel forever. For he has chosen Judah to be ruler,  in the house of Judah, the house of my father,  among the sons of my father he took pleasure in me to make me king over all Israel.
Chr. And of all my sons (for Jehovah has given me many sons), he has chosen Solomon my son to sit upon the throne of the kingdom of Jehovah over Israel.
Chr. And he said to me, Solomon thy son, he shall build my house and my courts, for I have chosen him to be my son,  I will be his father.
Chr. And I will establish his kingdom forever, if he is constant to do my commandments and my ordinances, as at this day.
Chr. Now therefore, in the sight of all Israel, the assembly of Jehovah,  in the audience of our God, observe and seek out all the commandments of Jehovah your God, that ye may possess this good land,  leave it for an inheritance to your sons after you forever.
Chr. And thou, Solomon my son, know thou the God of thy father,  serve him with a perfect heart and with a willing mind, for Jehovah searches all hearts,  understands all the imaginations of the thoughts. If thou seek him, he will be found by thee,  if thou forsake him, he will cast thee off forever.
Chr. Take heed now, for Jehovah has chosen thee to build a house for the sanctuary. Be strong,  do it.
Chr. Then David gave to Solomon his son the pattern of the porch of the temple,  of the houses of it,  of the treasuries of it,  of the upper rooms of it,  of the inner chambers of it,  of the place of the mercy-seat,
Chr. and the pattern of all that he had by the Spirit, for the courts of the house of Jehovah,  for all the chambers round about, for the treasuries of the house of God,  for the treasuries of the dedicated things,
Chr. also for the divisions of the priests and the Levites,  for all the work of the service of the house of Jehovah,  for all the vessels of service in the house of Jehovah,
Chr. of gold by weight for the vessels of gold, for all vessels of every kind of service; of silver for all the vessels of silver by weight, for all vessels of every kind of service,
Chr. by weight also for the lampstands of gold,  for the lamps of it, of gold, by weight for every lampstand and for the lamps of it,  for the lampstands of silver, silver by weight for every lampstand and for the lamps of it, according to the use of every lampstand,
Chr. and the gold by weight for the tables of showbread, for every table,  silver for the tables of silver,
Chr. and the flesh-hooks,  the basins,  the cups, of pure gold,  for the golden bowls by weight for every bowl,  for the silver bowls by weight for every bowl,
Chr. and for the altar of incense refined gold by weight,  gold for the pattern of the chariot, even the cherubim that spread out their wings,  covered the ark of the covenant of Jehovah.
Chr. All this, David said, I have been made to understand in writing from the hand of Jehovah, even all the works of this pattern.
Chr. And David said to Solomon his son, Be strong and of good courage,  do it. Fear not, nor be dismayed, for Jehovah God, even my God, is with thee. He will not fail thee, nor forsake thee, until all the work for the service of the house of Jehovah be finished.
Chr. And, behold, there are the courses of the priests and the Levites for all the service of the house of God. And there shall be with thee in all manner of work every willing man who has skill, for any manner of service. Also the captains and all the people will be wholly at thy commandment.
Chr. And David the king said to all the assembly, Solomon my son, whom alone God has chosen, is yet young and tender,  the work is great, for the palace is not for man,  for Jehovah God.
Chr. Now I have prepared with all my might for the house of my God the gold for the things of gold,  the silver for the things of silver,  the brass for the things of brass, the iron for the things of iron,  wood for the things of wood, onyx stones,  stones to be set, stones for inlaid work,  of divers colors,  all manner of precious stones,  marble stones in abundance.
Chr. Moreover also, because I have set my affection on the house of my God, seeing that I have a treasure of my own of gold and silver, I give it to the house of my God over and above all that I have prepared for the holy house,
Chr. even three thousand talents of gold, of the gold of Ophir,  seven thousand talents of refined silver, with which to overlay the walls of the houses,
Chr. of gold for the things of gold,  of silver for the things of silver,  for all manner of work to be made by the hands of artisans. Who then offers willingly to consecrate himself this day to Jehovah?
Chr. Then the rulers of the fathers,  the rulers of the tribes of Israel,  the captains of thousands and of hundreds, with the rulers over the king's work, offered willingly.
Chr. And they gave for the service of the house of God of gold five thousand talents and ten thousand darics,  of silver ten thousand talents,  of brass eighteen thousand talents,  of iron a hundred thousand talents.
Chr. And those with whom precious stones were found gave them to the treasure of the house of Jehovah under the hand of Jehiel the Gershonite.
Chr. Then the people rejoiced, because they offered willingly, because with a perfect heart they offered willingly to Jehovah. And David the king also rejoiced with great joy.
Chr. Therefore David praised Jehovah before all the assembly. And David said, Blessed be thou, O Jehovah, the God of Israel our father, forever and ever.
Chr. Thine, O Jehovah, is the greatness,  the power,  the glory,  the victory,  the majesty, for all that is in the heavens and on the earth is thine. Thine is the kingdom, O Jehovah,  thou are exalted as head above all.
Chr. Both riches and honor come of thee,  thou rule over all. And in thy hand is power and might. And in thy hand it is to make great,  to give strength to all.
Chr. Now therefore, our God, we thank thee,  praise thy glorious name.
Chr. But who am I,  what is my people, that we should be able to offer so willingly after this sort? For all things come of thee,  of thine own have we given thee.
Chr. For we are strangers before thee,  sojourners, as all our fathers were. Our days on the earth are as a shadow,  there is no abiding.
Chr. O Jehovah our God, all this store that we have prepared to build thee a house for thy holy name comes of thy hand,  is all thine own.
Chr. I know also, my God, that thou try the heart,  have pleasure in uprightness. As for me, in the uprightness of my heart I have willingly offered all these things. And now I have seen with joy thy people, who are present here, offer willingly to thee.
Chr. O Jehovah, the God of Abraham, of Isaac,  of Israel, our fathers, keep this forever in the imagination of the thoughts of the heart of thy people,  prepare their heart to thee.
Chr. And give to Solomon my son a perfect heart, to keep thy commandments, thy testimonies,  thy statutes,  to do all these things,  to build the palace for thee, for which I have made provision.
Chr. And David said to all the assembly, Now praise Jehovah your God. And all the assembly praised Jehovah, the God of their fathers,  bowed down their heads,  did obeisance to Jehovah,  the king.
Chr. And they sacrificed sacrifices to Jehovah,  offered burnt offerings to Jehovah on the morrow after that day, even a thousand bullocks, a thousand rams,  a thousand lambs, with their drink offerings,  sacrifices in abundance for all Israel,
Chr. and ate and drank before Jehovah on that day with great gladness. And they made Solomon the son of David king the second time,  anointed him to Jehovah to be prince,  Zadok to be priest.
Chr. Then Solomon sat on the throne of Jehovah as king instead of David his father,  prospered,  all Israel obeyed him.
Chr. And all the rulers,  the mighty men,  all the sons likewise of king David, submitted themselves to Solomon the king.
Chr. And Jehovah magnified Solomon exceedingly in the sight of all Israel,  bestowed upon him such royal majesty as had not been on any king before him in Israel.
Chr. Now David the son of Jesse reigned over all Israel.
Chr. And the time that he reigned over Israel was forty years. He reigned seven years in Hebron,  he reigned thirty-three years in Jerusalem.
Chr. And he died in a good old age, full of days, riches,  honor. And Solomon his son reigned in his stead.
Chr. Now the acts of David the king, first and last, behold, they are written in the history of Samuel the seer,  in the history of Nathan the prophet,  in the history of Gad the seer,
Chr. with all his reign and his might,  the times that went over him,  over Israel,  over all the kingdoms of the countries.
II Chronicles
Chr. And Solomon the son of David was strengthened in his kingdom. And Jehovah his God was with him,  magnified him exceedingly.
Chr. And Solomon spoke to all Israel, to the captains of thousands and of hundreds,  to the judges,  to every ruler in all Israel, the heads of the fathers.
Chr. So Solomon,  all the assembly with him, went to the high place that was at Gibeon. For the tent of meeting of God was there, which Moses the servant of Jehovah had made in the wilderness.
Chr. But the ark of God David had brought up from Kiriath-jearim to the place that David had prepared for it. For he had pitched a tent for it at Jerusalem.
Chr. Moreover the brazen altar, that Bezalel the son of Uri, the son of Hur, had made, was there before the tabernacle of Jehovah. And Solomon and the assembly sought to it.
Chr. And Solomon went up there to the brazen altar before Jehovah, which was at the tent of meeting,  offered a thousand burnt offerings upon it.
Chr. In that night God appeared to Solomon,  said to him, Ask what I shall give thee.
Chr. And Solomon said to God, Thou have shown great loving kindness to David my father,  have made me king in his stead.
Chr. Now, O Jehovah God, let thy promise to David my father be established. For thou have made me king over a people like the dust of the earth in multitude.
Chr. Give me now wisdom and knowledge, that I may go out and come in before this people. For who can judge this thy people, that is so great?
Chr. And God said to Solomon, Because this was in thy heart,  thou have not asked riches, wealth, or honor, nor the life of those who hate thee, neither yet have asked long life,  have asked wisdom and knowledge for thyself, that thou may judge my people over whom I have made thee king,
Chr. wisdom and knowledge are granted to thee. And I will give thee riches,  wealth,  honor, such as none of the kings have had who have been before thee, neither shall any after thee have the like.
Chr. So Solomon came from the high place that was at Gibeon, from before the tent of meeting, to Jerusalem,  he reigned over Israel.
Chr. And Solomon gathered chariots and horsemen. And he had a thousand and four hundred chariots,  twelve thousand horsemen, that he placed in the chariot cities,  with the king at Jerusalem.
Chr. And the king made silver and gold to be in Jerusalem as stones,  cedars he made to be as the sycamore trees that are in the lowland, for abundance.
Chr. And the horses which Solomon had were brought out of Egypt. The king's merchants received them in herds, each herd at a price.
Chr. And they went after and brought out of Egypt a chariot for six hundred shekels of silver,  a horse for a hundred and fifty. And so they brought them out by their means for all the kings of the Hittites,  the kings of Syria.
Chr. Now Solomon purposed to build a house for the name of Jehovah,  a house for his kingdom.
Chr. And Solomon counted out seventy thousand men to bear burdens,  eighty thousand men who were hewers in the mountains,  three thousand and six hundred to oversee them.
Chr. And Solomon sent to Huram the king of Tyre, saying, As thou dealt with David my father,  sent him cedars to build for him a house to dwell therein, so with me.
Chr. Behold, I am about to build a house for the name of Jehovah my God, to dedicate it to him,  to burn before him incense of sweet spices,  for the continual showbread,  for the burnt offerings morning and evening, on the sabbaths,  on the new moons,  on the set feasts of Jehovah our God. This is an ordinance forever to Israel.
Chr. And the house which I build is great. For our God is great above all gods.
Chr. But who is able to build for him a house, seeing heaven and the heaven of heavens cannot contain him? Who am I then, that I should build for him a house, except only to burn incense before him?
Chr. Now therefore send me a man skilful to work in gold,  in silver,  in brass,  in iron,  in purple,  crimson,  blue,  who knows how to engrave engravings, to be with the skilful men who are with me in Judah and in Jerusalem, whom David my father provided.
Chr. Send to me also cedar trees, fir trees,  algum trees, out of Lebanon. For I know that thy servants know how to cut timber in Lebanon. And, behold, my servants shall be with thy servants,
Chr. even to prepare for me timber in abundance. For the house which I am about to build shall be great and wonderful.
Chr. And, behold, I will give to thy servants, the hewers who cut timber, twenty thousand measures of beaten wheat,  twenty thousand measures of barley,  twenty thousand baths of wine,  twenty thousand baths of oil.
Chr. Then Huram the king of Tyre answered in writing, which he sent to Solomon, Because Jehovah loves his people, he has made thee king over them.
Chr. Huram said moreover, Blessed be Jehovah, the God of Israel, that made heaven and earth, who has given to David the king a wise son, endued with discretion and understanding, that should build a house for Jehovah,  a house for his kingdom.
Chr. And now I have sent a skilful man, endued with understanding, of Huram my father's,
Chr. the son of a woman of the daughters of Dan. And his father was a man of Tyre, skilful to work in gold,  in silver, in brass, in iron, in stone,  in timber, in purple, in blue,  in fine linen,  in crimson, also to engrave any manner of engraving,  to devise any device, that there may be a place appointed to him with thy skilful men,  with the skilful men of my lord David thy father.
Chr. Now therefore the wheat and the barley, the oil and the wine, which my lord has spoken of, let him send to his servants.
Chr. And we will cut wood out of Lebanon, as much as thou shall need. And we will bring it to thee in floats by sea to Joppa,  thou shall carry it up to Jerusalem.
Chr. And Solomon numbered all the aliens that were in the land of Israel, after the numbering with which David his father had numbered them. And they were found a hundred and fifty-three thousand and six hundred.
Chr. And he set seventy thousand of them to bear burdens,  eighty thousand who were hewers in the mountains,  three thousand and six hundred overseers to set the people to work.
Chr. Then Solomon began to build the house of Jehovah at Jerusalem on mount Moriah, where Jehovah appeared to David his father, which he made ready in the place that David had appointed, in the threshing-floor of Ornan the Jebusite.
Chr. And he began to build in the second day of the second month, in the fourth year of his reign.
Chr. Now these are the foundations which Solomon laid for the building of the house of God. The length by cubits after the first measure was sixty cubits,  the breadth twenty cubits.
Chr. And the porch that was before the house, the length of it, according to the breadth of the house, was twenty cubits,  the height a hundred and twenty. And he overlaid it inside with pure gold.
Chr. And the greater house he ceiled with fir-wood, which he overlaid with fine gold,  wrought thereon palm trees and chains.
Chr. And he garnished the house with precious stones for beauty. And the gold was gold of Parvaim.
Chr. He also overlaid the house, the beams, the thresholds,  the walls of it,  the doors of it, with gold,  engraved cherubim on the walls.
Chr. And he made the most holy house; the length of it, according to the breadth of the house, was twenty cubits,  the breadth of it twenty cubits. And he overlaid it with fine gold, amounting to six hundred talents.
Chr. And the weight of the nails was fifty shekels of gold. And he overlaid the upper chambers with gold.
Chr. And in the most holy house he made two cherubim of image work,  they overlaid them with gold.
Chr. And the wings of the cherubim were twenty cubits long; the wing of the one was five cubits, reaching to the wall of the house,  the other wing was likewise five cubits, reaching to the wing of the other cherub.
Chr. And the wing of the other cherub was five cubits, reaching to the wall of the house,  the other wing was five cubits also, joining to the wing of the other cherub.
Chr. The wings of these cherubim spread themselves forth twenty cubits. And they stood on their feet,  their faces were toward the house.
Chr. And he made the veil of blue,  purple,  crimson,  fine linen,  wrought cherubim thereon.
Chr. Also he made two pillars before the house of thirty-five cubits in length,  the capital that was on the top of each of them was five cubits.
Chr. And he made chains in the oracle,  put them on the tops of the pillars. And he made a hundred pomegranates,  put them on the chains.
Chr. And he set up the pillars before the temple, one on the right hand,  the other on the left. And called the name of that on the right hand Jachin,  the name of that on the left Boaz.
Chr. Moreover he made an altar of brass, twenty cubits the length of it,  twenty cubits the breadth of it,  ten cubits the height of it.
Chr. Also he made the molten sea of ten cubits from brim to brim, round in compass. And the height of it was five cubits,  a line of thirty cubits encompassed it round about.
Chr. And under it was the likeness of oxen, which compassed it round about for ten cubits, encompassing the sea round about. The oxen were in two rows, cast when it was cast.
Chr. It stood upon twelve oxen, three looking toward the north,  three looking toward the west,  three looking toward the south,  three looking toward the east. And the sea was set upon them above,  all their hinder parts were inward.
Chr. And it was a handbreadth thick. And the brim of it was wrought like the brim of a cup, like the flower of a lily. It received and held three thousand baths.
Chr. He also made ten basins,  put five on the right hand,  five on the left, to wash in them. They washed in them such things as belonged to the burnt offering,  the sea was for the priests to wash in.
Chr. And he made the ten lampstands of gold according to the ordinance concerning them. And he set them in the temple, five on the right hand,  five on the left.
Chr. He made also ten tables,  placed them in the temple, five on the right side,  five on the left. And he made a hundred basins of gold.
Chr. Furthermore he made the court of the priests,  the great court,  doors for the court,  overlaid the doors of them with brass.
Chr. And he set the sea on the right side of the house eastward, toward the south.
Chr. And Huram made the pots,  the shovels,  the basins. So Huram made an end of doing the work that he wrought for king Solomon in the house of God:
Chr. the two pillars,  the bowls,  the two capitals which were on the top of the pillars,  the two networks to cover the two bowls of the capitals that were on the top of the pillars,
Chr. and the four hundred pomegranates for the two networks, two rows of pomegranates for each network to cover the two bowls of the capitals that were upon the pillars.
Chr. He also made the bases,  he made the lavers upon the bases,
Chr. one sea,  the twelve oxen under it.
Chr. Also the pots,  the shovels,  the flesh-hooks,  all the vessels of it, Huram his father made of bright brass for king Solomon for the house of Jehovah.
Chr. The king cast them in the plain of the Jordan, in the clay ground between Succoth and Zeredah.
Chr. Thus Solomon made all these vessels in great abundance. For the weight of the brass could not be found out.
Chr. And Solomon made all the vessels that were in the house of God, also the golden altar,  the tables on which was the showbread,
Chr. and the lampstands with their lamps, to burn according to the ordinance before the oracle, of pure gold,
Chr. and the flowers,  the lamps,  the tongs, of gold,  that perfect gold,
Chr. and the snuffers,  the basins,  the spoons,  the fire pans, of pure gold. And as for the entry of the house, the inner doors of it for the most holy place,  the doors of the house, namely, of the temple, were of gold.
Chr. Thus all the work that Solomon wrought for the house of Jehovah was finished. And Solomon brought in the things that David his father had dedicated, even the silver,  the gold,  all the vessels,  put them in the treasuries of the house of God.
Chr. Then Solomon assembled the elders of Israel,  all the heads of the tribes, the rulers of the fathers of the sons of Israel, to Jerusalem, to bring up the ark of the covenant of Jehovah out of the city of David, which is Zion.
Chr. And all the men of Israel assembled themselves to the king at the feast, which was in the seventh month.
Chr. And all the elders of Israel came. And the Levites took up the ark.
Chr. And they brought up the ark,  the tent of meeting,  all the holy vessels that were in the tent. These the priests the Levites brought up.
Chr. And king Solomon and all the congregation of Israel that were assembled to him, were before the ark, sacrificing sheep and oxen that could not be counted nor numbered for multitude.
Chr. And the priests brought in the ark of the covenant of Jehovah to its place, into the oracle of the house, to the most holy place, even under the wings of the cherubim.
Chr. For the cherubim spread forth their wings over the place of the ark,  the cherubim covered the ark and the staves of it above.
Chr. And the staves were so long that the ends of the staves were seen from the ark before the oracle,  they were not seen outside. And there it is to this day.
Chr. There was nothing in the ark except the two tablets which Moses put there at Horeb when Jehovah made a covenant with the sons of Israel, when they came out of Egypt.
Chr. And it came to pass, when the priests came out of the holy place, (for all the priests that were present had sanctified themselves,  did not keep their divisions.
Chr. Also the Levites who were the singers, all of them, even Asaph, Heman, Jeduthun,  their sons and their brothers, arrayed in fine linen, with cymbals and psalteries and harps, stood at the east end of the altar,  with them a hundred and twenty priests sounding with trumpets),
Chr. it came to pass, when the trumpeters and singers were as one, to make one sound to be heard in praising and thanking Jehovah. And when they lifted up their voice with the trumpets and cymbals and instruments of music,  praised Jehovah, saying, For he is good. For his loving kindness is forever, that the house was then filled with a cloud, even the house of Jehovah,
Chr. so that the priests could not stand to minister because of the cloud. For the glory of Jehovah filled the house of God.
Chr. Then Solomon spoke, Jehovah has said that he would dwell in the thick darkness.
Chr. But I have built for thee a house of habitation,  a place for thee to dwell in forever.
Chr. And the king turned his face,  blessed all the assembly of Israel. And all the assembly of Israel stood.
Chr. And he said, Blessed be Jehovah, the God of Israel, who spoke with his mouth to David my father,  has with his hands fulfilled it, saying,
Chr. Since the day that I brought forth my people out of the land of Egypt, I chose no city out of all the tribes of Israel to build a house in that my name might be there. Neither did I choose any man to be ruler over my people Israel.
Chr. But I have chosen Jerusalem that my name might be there. And have chosen David to be over my people Israel.
Chr. Now it was in the heart of David my father to build a house for the name of Jehovah, the God of Israel.
Chr. But Jehovah said to David my father, Whereas it was in thy heart to build a house for my name, thou did well that it was in thy heart.
Chr. Nevertheless thou shall not build the house,  thy son who shall come forth out of thy loins, he shall build the house for my name.
Chr. And Jehovah has performed his word that he spoke. For I have risen up in the place of David my father,  sit on the throne of Israel, as Jehovah promised,  have built the house for the name of Jehovah, the God of Israel.
Chr. And there I have set the ark in which is the covenant of Jehovah, which he made with the sons of Israel.
Chr. And he stood before the altar of Jehovah in the presence of all the assembly of Israel,  spread forth his hands.
Chr. For Solomon had made a brazen scaffold, five cubits long,  five cubits broad,  three cubits high,  had set it in the midst of the court. And upon it he stood,  knelt down upon his knees before all the assembly of Israel,  spread forth his hands toward heaven.
Chr. And he said, O Jehovah, the God of Israel, there is no God like thee, in heaven, or on earth, who keep covenant and loving kindness with thy servants, who walk before thee with all their heart,
Chr. who have kept with thy servant David my father that which thou promised him. Yea, thou spoke with thy mouth,  have fulfilled it with thy hand, as it is this day.
Chr. Now therefore, O Jehovah, the God of Israel, keep with thy servant David my father that which thou have promised him, saying, There shall not fail thee a man in my sight to sit on the throne of Israel, if only thy sons take heed to their way, to walk in my law as thou have walked before me.
Chr. Now therefore, O Jehovah, the God of Israel, let thy word be verified, which thou spoke to thy servant David.
Chr. But will God in very deed dwell with men on the earth? Behold, heaven and the heaven of heavens cannot contain thee. How much less this house which I have built!
Chr. Yet have thou respect to the prayer of thy servant,  to his supplication, O Jehovah my God, to hearken to the cry and to the prayer which thy servant prays before thee,
Chr. that thine eyes may be open toward this house day and night, even toward the place of which thou have said that thou would put thy name there, to hearken to the prayer which thy servant shall pray toward this place.
Chr. And hearken thou to the supplications of thy servant,  of thy people Israel, when they shall pray toward this place. Yea, hear thou from thy dwelling-place, even from heaven,  when thou hear forgive.
Chr. If a man sins against his neighbor,  an oath be laid upon him to cause him to swear,  he comes and swears before thine altar in this house,
Chr. then hear thou from heaven,  do,  judge thy servants, requiting the wicked, to bring his way upon his own head,  justifying the righteous, to give him according to his righteousness.
Chr. And if thy people Israel be smitten down before the enemy because they have sinned against thee,  shall turn again and confess thy name,  pray and make supplication before thee in this house,
Chr. then hear thou from heaven,  forgive the sin of thy people Israel,  bring them again to the land which thou gave to them and to their fathers.
Chr. When the heavens are shut up,  there is no rain, because they have sinned against thee, if they pray toward this place,  confess thy name,  turn from their sin when thou do afflict them,
Chr. then hear thou in heaven,  forgive the sin of thy servants,  of thy people Israel, when thou teach them the good way wherein they should walk,  send rain upon thy land, which thou have given to thy people for an inheritance.
Chr. If there be in the land famine, if there be pestilence, if there be blight or mildew, locust or caterpillar, if their enemies besiege them in the land of their cities, whatever plague or whatever sickness there be,
Chr. whatever prayer and supplication be made by any man, or by all thy people Israel, who shall know every man his own plague and his own sorrow,  shall spread forth his hands toward this house,
Chr. then hear thou from heaven thy dwelling-place and forgive,  render to every man according to all his ways, whose heart thou know, (for thou, even thou only, know the hearts of the sons of men),
Chr. that they may fear thee, to walk in thy ways so long as they live in the land which thou gave to our fathers.
Chr. Moreover concerning the foreigner, who is not of thy people Israel, when he shall come from a far country for thy great name's sake,  thy mighty hand,  thine outstretched arm, when they shall come and pray toward this house,
Chr. then hear thou from heaven, even from thy dwelling-place,  do according to all that the foreigner calls to thee for, that all the peoples of the earth may know thy name,  fear thee, as do thy people Israel,  that they may know that this house which I have built is called by thy name.
Chr. If thy people go out to battle against their enemies, by whatever way thou shall send them,  they pray to thee toward this city which thou have chosen,  the house which I have built for thy name,
Chr. then hear thou from heaven their prayer and their supplication,  maintain their cause.
Chr. If they sin against thee (for there is no man that sins not),  thou be angry with them,  deliver them to the enemy, so that they carry them away captive to a land far off or near,
Chr. yet if they shall rethink themselves in the land where they are carried captive,  turn again,  make supplication to thee in the land of their captivity, saying, We have sinned, we have done perversely,  have dealt wickedly,
Chr. if they return to thee with all their heart and with all their soul in the land of their captivity where they have carried them captive,  pray toward their land, which thou gave to their fathers,  the city which thou have chosen,  toward the house which I have built for thy name,
Chr. then hear thou from heaven, even from thy dwelling-place, their prayer and their supplications,  maintain their case,  forgive thy people who have sinned against thee.
Chr. Now, O my God, let, I beseech thee, thine eyes be open,  let thine ears be attendant to the prayer that is made in this place.
Chr. Now therefore arise, O Jehovah God, into thy resting-place, thou,  the ark of thy strength. Let thy priests, O Jehovah God, be clothed with salvation,  let thy sanctified rejoice in goodness.
Chr. O Jehovah God, do not turn away the face of thine anointed. Remember thy loving kindnesses to David thy servant.
Chr. Now when Solomon had made an end of praying, the fire came down from heaven,  consumed the burnt offering and the sacrifices. And the glory of Jehovah filled the house.
Chr. And the priests could not enter into the house of Jehovah, because the glory of Jehovah filled Jehovah's house.
Chr. And all the sons of Israel looked on when the fire came down,  the glory of Jehovah was upon the house. And they bowed themselves with their faces to the ground upon the pavement,  worshiped,  gave thanks to Jehovah, saying, For he is good. For his loving kindness is forever.
Chr. Then the king and all the people offered sacrifice before Jehovah.
Chr. And king Solomon offered a sacrifice of twenty-two thousand oxen,  a hundred and twenty thousand sheep. So the king and all the people dedicated the house of God.
Chr. And the priests stood according to their offices, also the Levites with instruments of music of Jehovah, which David the king had made to give thanks to Jehovah (for his loving kindness is forever) when David praised by their ministry,  the priests sounded trumpets before them. And all Israel stood.
Chr. Moreover Solomon hallowed the middle of the court that was before the house of Jehovah. For there he offered the burnt offerings,  the fat of the peace offerings, because the brazen altar which Solomon had made was not able to receive the burnt offering,  the meal offering,  the fat.
Chr. So Solomon held the feast at that time seven days,  all Israel with him, a very great assembly, from the entrance of Hamath to the brook of Egypt.
Chr. And on the eighth day they held a solemn assembly. For they kept the dedication of the altar seven days,  the feast seven days.
Chr. And on the twenty-third day of the seventh month he sent the people away to their tents, joyful and glad of heart for the goodness that Jehovah had shown to David,  to Solomon,  to Israel his people.
Chr. Thus Solomon finished the house of Jehovah,  the king's house. And all that came into Solomon's heart to make in the house of Jehovah,  in his own house, he caused to prosper.
Chr. And Jehovah appeared to Solomon by night,  said to him, I have heard thy prayer,  have chosen this place to myself for a house of sacrifice.
Chr. If I shut up the heavens so that there is no rain, or if I command the locust to devour the land, or if I send pestilence among my people,
Chr. if my people, who are called by my name, shall humble themselves,  pray,  seek my face,  turn from their wicked ways, then I will hear from heaven,  will forgive their sin,  will heal their land.
Chr. Now my eyes shall be open,  my ears attend to the prayer that is made in this place.
Chr. For now I have chosen and hallowed this house, that my name may be there forever,  my eyes and my heart shall be there perpetually.
Chr. And as for thee, if thou will walk before me as David thy father walked,  do according to all that I have commanded thee,  will keep my statutes and mine ordinances,
Chr. then I will establish the throne of thy kingdom, according as I covenanted with David thy father, saying, There shall not fail thee a man to be ruler in Israel.
Chr. But if ye turn away,  forsake my statutes and my commandments which I have set before you,  shall go and serve other gods,  worship them,
Chr. then I will pluck them up by the roots out of my land which I have given them. And this house, which I have hallowed for my name, I will cast out of my sight,  I will make it a proverb and a byword among all peoples.
Chr. And this house, which is so high, everyone who passes by it shall be astonished,  shall say, Why has Jehovah done thus to this land,  to this house?
Chr. And they shall answer, Because they forsook Jehovah, the God of their fathers, who brought them forth out of the land of Egypt,  laid hold on other gods,  worshiped them,  served them; therefore he has brought all this evil upon them.
Chr. And it came to pass at the end of twenty years, in which Solomon had built the house of Jehovah,  his own house,
Chr. that the cities which Huram had given to Solomon, Solomon built them,  caused the sons of Israel to dwell there.
Chr. And Solomon went to Hamath-zobah,  prevailed against it.
Chr. And he built Tadmor in the wilderness,  all the store-cities, which he built in Hamath.
Chr. Also he built Beth-horon the upper,  Beth-horon the lower, fortified cities, with walls, gates,  bars,
Chr. and Baalath,  all the store-cities that Solomon had,  all the cities for his chariots,  the cities for his horsemen,  all that Solomon desired to build for his pleasure in Jerusalem,  in Lebanon,  in all the land of his dominion.
Chr. As for all the people who were left of the Hittites,  the Amorites,  the Perizzites,  the Hivites,  the Jebusites, that were not of Israel,
Chr. of their sons who were left after them in the land whom the sons of Israel did not consumed, of them Solomon raised a levy of bondservants to this day.
Chr. But Solomon made no servants of the sons of Israel for his work,  they were men of war,  chief of his captains,  rulers of his chariots and of his horsemen.
Chr. And these were the chief officers of king Solomon, even two hundred and fifty that bore rule over the people.
Chr. And Solomon brought up the daughter of Pharaoh out of the city of David to the house that he had built for her. For he said, My wife shall not dwell in the house of David king of Israel, because the places are holy in which the ark of Jehovah has come.
Chr. Then Solomon offered burnt offerings to Jehovah on the altar of Jehovah, which he had built before the porch,
Chr. even as the duty of every day required, offering according to the commandment of Moses, on the sabbaths,  on the new moons,  on the set feasts, three times in the year, even in the feast of unleavened bread,  in the feast of weeks,  in the feast of tabernacles.
Chr. And he appointed, according to the ordinance of David his father, the divisions of the priests to their service,  the Levites to their offices, to praise,  to minister before the priests, as the duty of every day required, also the porters by their divisions at every gate. For so David the man of God had commanded.
Chr. And they did not depart from the commandment of the king to the priests and Levites concerning any matter, or concerning the treasures.
Chr. Now all the work of Solomon was prepared from the day of the foundation of the house of Jehovah,  until it was finished. So the house of Jehovah was completed.
Chr. Then Solomon went to Ezion-geber,  to Eloth, on the seashore in the land of Edom.
Chr. And Huram sent ships to him by the hands of his servants,  servants who had knowledge of the sea. And they came with the servants of Solomon to Ophir,  fetched from there four hundred and fifty talents of gold,  brought them to king Solomon.
Chr. And when the queen of Sheba heard of the fame of Solomon, she came to test Solomon with hard questions at Jerusalem, with a very great caravan,  camels that bore spices,  gold in abundance,  precious stones. And when she came to Solomon, she conversed with him of all that was in her heart.
Chr. And Solomon answered to her all her questions. And there was not anything hid from Solomon that he did not answer her.
Chr. And when the queen of Sheba had seen the wisdom of Solomon,  the house that he had built,
Chr. and the food of his table,  the seating of his servants,  the attendance of his ministers,  their apparel, also his cupbearers,  their apparel,  his ascent by which he went up to the house of Jehovah, there was no more spirit in her.
Chr. And she said to the king, It was a true report that I heard in my own land of thine acts,  of thy wisdom.
Chr. However I did not believe their words until I came,  my eyes had seen it. And, behold, the half of the greatness of thy wisdom was not told me. Thou exceed the fame that I heard.
Chr. Happy are thy men,  happy are these thy servants, who stand continually before thee,  hear thy wisdom.
Chr. Blessed be Jehovah thy God, who delighted in thee, to set thee on his throne to be king for Jehovah thy God. Because thy God loved Israel, to establish them forever, therefore he made thee king over them, to do justice and righteousness.
Chr. And she gave the king a hundred and twenty talents of gold,  spices in great abundance,  precious stones. Neither was there any such spice as the queen of Sheba gave to king Solomon.
Chr. And also the servants of Huram,  the servants of Solomon, who brought gold from Ophir, brought algum trees and precious stones.
Chr. And the king made of the algum trees terraces for the house of Jehovah,  for the king's house,  harps and psalteries for the singers. And there were none such seen before in the land of Judah.
Chr. And king Solomon gave to the queen of Sheba all her desire, whatever she asked, besides that which she had brought to the king. So she turned,  went to her own land, she and her servants.
Chr. Now the weight of gold that came to Solomon in one year was six hundred and sixty-six talents of gold,
Chr. besides that which the traders and merchants brought. And all the kings of Arabia and the governors of the country brought gold and silver to Solomon.
Chr. And king Solomon made two hundred bucklers of beaten gold; six hundred shekels of beaten gold went to one buckler.
Chr. And he made three hundred shields of beaten gold; three hundred shekels of gold went to one shield. And the king put them in the house of the forest of Lebanon.
Chr. Moreover the king made a great throne of ivory,  overlaid it with pure gold.
Chr. And there were six steps to the throne, with a footstool of gold, which were fastened to the throne,  supports on either side by the place of the seat,  two lions standing beside the supports.
Chr. And twelve lions stood there on the one side and on the other upon the six steps. There was not the like made in any kingdom.
Chr. And all king Solomon's drinking vessels were of gold,  all the vessels of the house of the forest of Lebanon were of pure gold; silver was accounted of nothing in the days of Solomon.
Chr. For the king had ships that went to Tarshish with the servants of Huram. Once every three years the ships of Tarshish came, bringing gold,  silver, ivory,  apes,  peacocks.
Chr. So king Solomon exceeded all the kings of the earth in riches and wisdom.
Chr. And all the kings of the earth sought the presence of Solomon, to hear his wisdom, which God had put in his heart.
Chr. And they brought every man his tribute, vessels of silver,  vessels of gold,  raiment, armor,  spices, horses,  mules, a rate year by year.
Chr. And Solomon had four thousand stalls for horses and chariots,  twelve thousand horsemen, that he bestowed in the chariot cities,  with the king at Jerusalem.
Chr. And he ruled over all the kings from the River even to the land of the Philistines,  to the border of Egypt.
Chr. And the king made silver to be in Jerusalem as stones,  he made cedars to be as the sycamore trees that are in the lowland, for abundance.
Chr. And they brought horses for Solomon out of Egypt,  out of all lands.
Chr. Now the rest of the acts of Solomon, first and last, are they not written in the history of Nathan the prophet,  in the prophecy of Ahijah the Shilonite,  in the visions of Iddo the seer concerning Jeroboam the son of Nebat?
Chr. And Solomon reigned in Jerusalem over all Israel forty years.
Chr. And Solomon slept with his fathers,  he was buried in the city of David his father. And Rehoboam his son reigned in his stead.
Chr. And Rehoboam went to Shechem. For all Israel came to Shechem to make him king.
Chr. And it came to pass, when Jeroboam the son of Nebat heard of it, (for he was in Egypt, from where he had fled from the presence of king Solomon), that Jeroboam returned out of Egypt.
Chr. And they sent and called him. And Jeroboam and all Israel came,  they spoke to Rehoboam, saying,
Chr. Thy father made our yoke grievous. Now therefore make thou the grievous service of thy father,  his heavy yoke which he put upon us, lighter,  we will serve thee.
Chr. And he said to them, Come again to me after three days. And the people departed.
Chr. And king Rehoboam took counsel with the old men that had stood before Solomon his father while he yet lived, saying, What counsel do ye give me to return an answer to this people?
Chr. And they spoke to him, saying, If thou be kind to this people,  please them,  speak good words to them, then they will be thy servants forever.
Chr. But he forsook the counsel of the old men which they had given him,  took counsel with the young men that grew up with him, who stood before him.
Chr. And he said to them, What counsel do ye give, that we may return an answer to this people who have spoken to me, saying, Make the yoke that thy father put upon us lighter?
Chr. And the young men that grew up with him spoke to him, saying, Thus shall thou say to the people who spoke to thee, saying, Thy father made our yoke heavy,  make thou it lighter to us. Thus shall thou say to them, My little finger is thicker than my father's loins.
Chr. And now whereas my father burdened you with a heavy yoke, I will add to your yoke. My father chastised you with whips,  I with scorpions.
Chr. So Jeroboam and all the people came to Rehoboam the third day, as the king bade, saying, Come to me again the third day.
Chr. And the king answered them roughly. And king Rehoboam forsook the counsel of the old men,
Chr. and spoke to them after the counsel of the young men, saying, My father made your yoke heavy,  I will add thereto. My father chastised you with whips,  I with scorpions.
Chr. So the king did not hearken to the people. For it was brought about by God, that Jehovah might establish his word, which he spoke by Ahijah the Shilonite to Jeroboam the son of Nebat.
Chr. And when all Israel saw that the king did not hearken to them, the people answered the king, saying, What portion have we in David? Neither have we inheritance in the son of Jesse. Every man to your tents, O Israel. Now see to thine own house, David. So all Israel departed to their tents.
Chr. But as for the sons of Israel who dwelt in the cities of Judah, Rehoboam reigned over them.
Chr. Then king Rehoboam sent Hadoram, who was over the men subject to task work. And the sons of Israel stoned him to death with stones. And king Rehoboam made speed to get him up to his chariot, to flee to Jerusalem.
Chr. So Israel rebelled against the house of David to this day.
Chr. And when Rehoboam came to Jerusalem, he assembled the house of Judah and Benjamin, a hundred and eighty thousand chosen men, who were warriors, to fight against Israel, to bring the kingdom again to Rehoboam.
Chr. But the word of Jehovah came to Shemaiah the man of God, saying,
Chr. Speak to Rehoboam the son of Solomon, king of Judah,  to all Israel in Judah and Benjamin, saying,
Chr. Thus says Jehovah, Ye shall not go up, nor fight against your brothers. Return every man to his house. For this thing is of me. So they hearkened to the words of Jehovah,  returned from going against Jeroboam.
Chr. And Rehoboam dwelt in Jerusalem,  built cities for defense in Judah.
Chr. He built Bethlehem,  Etam,  Tekoa,
Chr. And Beth-zur,  Soco,  Adullam,
Chr. and Gath,  Mareshah,  Ziph,
Chr. and Adoraim,  Lachish,  Azekah,
Chr. and Zorah,  Aijalon,  Hebron, which are in Judah and in Benjamin, fortified cities.
Chr. And he fortified the strongholds,  put captains in them,  stores of victuals,  oil and wine.
Chr. And in every city he put shields and spears,  made them exceedingly strong. And Judah and Benjamin belonged to him.
Chr. And the priests and the Levites who were in all Israel resorted to him out of all their border.
Chr. For the Levites left their suburbs and their possession,  came to Judah and Jerusalem. For Jeroboam and his sons cast them off, that they should not execute the priest's office to Jehovah.
Chr. And he appointed priests for him for the high places,  for the he-goats,  for the calves which he had made.
Chr. And after them, such as set their hearts to seek Jehovah, the God of Israel, came to Jerusalem out of all the tribes of Israel to sacrifice to Jehovah, the God of their fathers.
Chr. So they strengthened the kingdom of Judah,  made Rehoboam the son of Solomon strong three years. For they walked three years in the way of David and Solomon.
Chr. And Rehoboam took him a wife, Mahalath the daughter of Jerimoth the son of David,  of Abihail the daughter of Eliab the son of Jesse.
Chr. And she bore sons for him: Jeush,  Shemariah,  Zaham.
Chr. And after her he took Maacah the daughter of Absalom. And she bore for him Abijah,  Attai,  Ziza,  Shelomith.
Chr. And Rehoboam loved Maacah the daughter of Absalom above all his wives and his concubines. For he took eighteen wives,  thirty concubines,  begot twenty-eight sons and thirty daughters.
Chr. And Rehoboam appointed Abijah the son of Maacah to be chief, the ruler among his brothers. For he intended to make him king.
Chr. And he dealt wisely,  dispersed all his sons throughout all the lands of Judah and Benjamin, to every fortified city. And he gave them provisions in abundance. And he sought for them many wives.
Chr. And it came to pass, when the kingdom of Rehoboam was established,  he was strong, that he forsook the law of Jehovah,  all Israel with him.
Chr. And it came to pass in the fifth year of king Rehoboam, that Shishak king of Egypt came up against Jerusalem, because they had trespassed against Jehovah,
Chr. with twelve hundred chariots,  thirty thousand horsemen. And the people were without number who came with him out of Egypt: the Lubim, the Sukkiim,  the Ethiopians.
Chr. And he took the fortified cities which pertained to Judah,  came to Jerusalem.
Chr. Now Shemaiah the prophet came to Rehoboam,  to the rulers of Judah, who were gathered together to Jerusalem because of Shishak,  said to them, Thus says Jehovah, Ye have forsaken me, therefore I have also left you in the hand of Shishak.
Chr. Then the rulers of Israel and the king humbled themselves,  they said, Jehovah is righteous.
Chr. And when Jehovah saw that they humbled themselves, the word of Jehovah came to Shemaiah, saying, They have humbled themselves. I will not destroy them,  I will grant them some deliverance,  my wrath shall not be poured out upon Jerusalem by the hand of Shishak.
