Chr. Nevertheless they shall be his servants, that they may know my service,  the service of the kingdoms of the countries.
Chr. So Shishak king of Egypt came up against Jerusalem,  took away the treasures of the house of Jehovah,  the treasures of the king's house; he took all away. He also took away the shields of gold which Solomon had made.
Chr. And king Rehoboam made in their stead shields of brass,  committed them to the hands of the captains of the guard that kept the door of the king's house.
Chr. And it was so, that, as often as the king entered into the house of Jehovah, the guard came and bore them,  brought them back into the guard-chamber.
Chr. And when he humbled himself, the wrath of Jehovah turned from him, so as not to destroy him altogether. And moreover in Judah there were good things.
Chr. So king Rehoboam strengthened himself in Jerusalem,  reigned. For Rehoboam was forty-one years old when he began to reign,  he reigned seventeen years in Jerusalem, the city which Jehovah had chosen out of all the tribes of Israel to put his name there. And his mother's name was Naamah the Ammonitess.
Chr. And he did that which was evil, because he did not set his heart to seek Jehovah.
Chr. Now the acts of Rehoboam, first and last, are they not written in the histories of Shemaiah the prophet and of Iddo the seer, after the manner of genealogies? And there were wars between Rehoboam and Jeroboam continually.
Chr. And Rehoboam slept with his fathers,  was buried in the city of David. And Abijah his son reigned in his stead.
Chr. In the eighteenth year of king Jeroboam, Abijah began to reign over Judah.
Chr. He reigned three years in Jerusalem. And his mother's name was Micaiah the daughter of Uriel of Gibeah. And there was war between Abijah and Jeroboam.
Chr. And Abijah joined battle with an army of valiant men of war, even four hundred thousand chosen men. And Jeroboam set the battle in array against him with eight hundred thousand chosen men who were mighty men of valor.
Chr. And Abijah stood up upon mount Zemaraim, which is in the hill-country of Ephraim,  said, Hear me, O Jeroboam and all Israel.
Chr. Should ye not know that Jehovah, the God of Israel, gave the kingdom over Israel to David forever, even to him and to his sons by a covenant of salt?
Chr. Yet Jeroboam the son of Nebat, the servant of Solomon the son of David, rose up,  rebelled against his lord.
Chr. And there were gathered to him worthless men, base fellows, who strengthened themselves against Rehoboam the son of Solomon when Rehoboam was young and tender-hearted,  could not withstand them.
Chr. And now ye think to withstand the kingdom of Jehovah in the hand of the sons of David,  ye are a great multitude,  there are with you the golden calves which Jeroboam made you for gods.
Chr. Have ye not driven out the priests of Jehovah, the sons of Aaron,  the Levites,  made priests for you after the manner of the peoples of other lands? So that whoever comes to consecrate himself with a young bullock and seven rams, the same may be a priest of them that are no gods.
Chr. But as for us, Jehovah is our God,  we have not forsaken him. And we have priests ministering to Jehovah, the sons of Aaron,  the Levites in their work.
Chr. And they burn to Jehovah every morning and every evening burnt offerings and sweet incense. Also they set the showbread in order upon the pure table,  the lampstand of gold with the lamps of it to burn every evening. For we keep the charge of Jehovah our God,  ye have forsaken him.
Chr. And, behold, God is with us at our head,  his priests with the trumpets of alarm to sound an alarm against you. O sons of Israel, fight ye not against Jehovah, the God of your fathers. For ye shall not prosper.
Chr. But Jeroboam caused an ambushment to come around behind them, so they were before Judah,  the ambushment was behind them.
Chr. And when Judah looked back, behold, the battle was before and behind them. And they cried to Jehovah,  the priests sounded with the trumpets.
Chr. Then the men of Judah gave a shout. And as the men of Judah shouted, it came to pass, that God smote Jeroboam and all Israel before Abijah and Judah.
Chr. And the sons of Israel fled before Judah,  God delivered them into their hand.
Chr. And Abijah and his people killed them with a great slaughter. So there fell down slain of Israel five hundred thousand chosen men.
Chr. Thus the sons of Israel were brought under at that time,  the sons of Judah prevailed, because they relied upon Jehovah, the God of their fathers.
Chr. And Abijah pursued after Jeroboam,  took cities from him, Bethel with the towns of it,  Jeshanah with the towns of it,  Ephron with the towns of it.
Chr. Neither did Jeroboam recover strength again in the days of Abijah. And Jehovah smote him,  he died.
Chr. But Abijah grew mighty,  took to himself fourteen wives,  begot twenty-two sons,  sixteen daughters.
Chr. And the rest of the acts of Abijah,  his ways,  his sayings, are written in the commentary of the prophet Iddo.
Chr. So Abijah slept with his fathers,  they buried him in the city of David. And Asa his son reigned in his stead. In his days the land was quiet ten years.
Chr. And Asa did that which was good and right in the eyes of Jehovah his God.
Chr. For he took away the foreign altars,  the high places,  broke down the pillars,  hewed down the Asherim,
Chr. and commanded Judah to seek Jehovah, the God of their fathers,  to do the law and the commandment.
Chr. Also he took away out of all the cities of Judah the high places and the sun-images. And the kingdom was quiet before him.
Chr. And he built fortified cities in Judah. For the land was quiet,  he had no war in those years, because Jehovah had given him rest.
Chr. For he said to Judah, Let us build these cities,  make about them walls,  towers, gates,  bars. The land is yet before us, because we have sought Jehovah our God. We have sought him,  he has given us rest on every side. So they built and prospered.
Chr. And Asa had an army that bore bucklers and spears, out of Judah three hundred thousand,  out of Benjamin, that bore shields and drew bows, two hundred and eighty thousand. All these were mighty men of valor.
Chr. And there came out against them Zerah the Ethiopian with an army of a million,  three hundred chariots. And he came to Mareshah.
Chr. Then Asa went out to meet him,  they set the battle in array in the valley of Zephathah at Mareshah.
Chr. And Asa cried to Jehovah his God,  said, Jehovah, there is none besides thee to help, between the mighty and him who has no strength. Help us, O Jehovah our God. For we rely on thee,  in thy name we come against this multitude. O Jehovah, thou are our God. Let not man prevail against thee.
Chr. So Jehovah smote the Ethiopians before Asa,  before Judah. And the Ethiopians fled.
Chr. And Asa and the people who were with him pursued them to Gerar. And there fell of the Ethiopians so many that they could not recover themselves. For they were destroyed before Jehovah,  before his army. And they carried away very much booty.
Chr. And they smote all the cities round about Gerar. For the fear of Jehovah came upon them. And they despoiled all the cities. For there was much spoil in them.
Chr. They also smote the tents of cattle,  carried away sheep in abundance,  camels,  returned to Jerusalem.
Chr. And the Spirit of God came upon Azariah the son of Oded.
Chr. And he went out to meet Asa,  said to him, Hear ye me, Asa,  all Judah and Benjamin. Jehovah is with you while ye are with him. And if ye seek him, he will be found of you,  if ye forsake him, he will forsake you.
Chr. Now for a long time Israel was without the true God,  without a teaching priest,  without law.
Chr. But when in their distress they turned to Jehovah, the God of Israel,  sought him, he was found by them.
Chr. And in those times there was no peace to him who went out, nor to him who came in,  great vexations were upon all the inhabitants of the lands.
Chr. And they were broken in pieces, nation against nation,  city against city. For God vexed them with all adversity.
Chr. But be ye strong,  let not your hands be slack. For your work shall be rewarded.
Chr. And when Asa heard these words,  the prophecy of Oded the prophet, he took courage,  put away the abominations out of all the land of Judah and Benjamin,  out of the cities which he had taken from the hill-country of Ephraim. And he renewed the altar of Jehovah, that was before the porch of Jehovah.
Chr. And he gathered all Judah and Benjamin,  those who sojourned with them out of Ephraim and Manasseh,  out of Simeon, for they came to him out of Israel in abundance when they saw that Jehovah his God was with him.
Chr. So they gathered themselves together at Jerusalem in the third month, in the fifteenth year of the reign of Asa.
Chr. And they sacrificed to Jehovah in that day of the spoil which they had brought, seven hundred oxen and seven thousand sheep.
Chr. And they entered into the covenant to seek Jehovah, the God of their fathers, with all their heart and with all their soul.
Chr. And that whoever would not seek Jehovah, the God of Israel, should be put to death, whether small or great, whether man or woman.
Chr. And they swore to Jehovah with a loud voice,  with shouting,  with trumpets,  with cornets.
Chr. And all Judah rejoiced at the oath. For they had sworn with all their heart,  sought him with their whole desire,  he was found by them. And Jehovah gave them rest round about.
Chr. And also he removed Maacah, the mother of Asa the king, from being queen, because she had made an abominable image for an Asherah. And Asa cut down her image,  made dust of it,  burnt it at the brook Kidron.
Chr. But the high places were not taken away out of Israel. Nevertheless the heart of Asa was perfect all his days.
Chr. And he brought into the house of God the things that his father had dedicated,  that he himself had dedicated, silver,  gold,  vessels.
Chr. And there was no more war to the thirty-fifth year of the reign of Asa.
Chr. In the thirty-sixth year of the reign of Asa, Baasha king of Israel went up against Judah,  built Ramah, that he might not allow anyone to go out or come in to Asa king of Judah.
Chr. Then Asa brought out silver and gold out of the treasures of the house of Jehovah and of the king's house,  sent to Ben-hadad king of Syria, who dwelt at Damascus, saying,
Chr. There is a league between me and thee, as between my father and thy father. Behold, I have sent thee silver and gold. Go, break thy league with Baasha king of Israel that he may depart from me.
Chr. And Ben-hadad hearkened to king Asa,  sent the captains of his armies against the cities of Israel. And they smote Ijon,  Dan,  Abel-maim,  all the store-cities of Naphtali.
Chr. And it came to pass, when Baasha heard of it, that he left off building Ramah,  let his work cease.
Chr. Then Asa the king took all Judah,  they carried away the stones of Ramah,  the timber of it, with which Baasha had built. And he built Geba and Mizpah with it.
Chr. And at that time Hanani the seer came to Asa king of Judah,  said to him, Because thou have relied on the king of Syria,  have not relied on Jehovah thy God, therefore the army of the king of Syria has escaped out of thy hand.
Chr. Were not the Ethiopians and the Lubim a huge army, with chariots and horsemen exceedingly many? Yet, because thou relied on Jehovah, he delivered them into thy hand.
Chr. For the eyes of Jehovah run to and fro throughout the whole earth, to show himself strong on behalf of those whose heart is perfect toward him. In this thou have done foolishly, for from henceforth thou shall have wars.
Chr. Then Asa was angry with the seer,  put him in the prison-house. For he was in a rage with him because of this thing. And Asa oppressed some of the people at the same time.
Chr. And, behold, the acts of Asa, first and last, lo, they are written in the book of the kings of Judah and Israel.
Chr. And in the thirty-ninth year of his reign Asa was diseased in his feet. His disease was exceedingly great, yet in his disease he did not seek for Jehovah,  to the physicians.
Chr. And Asa slept with his fathers,  died in the forty-first year of his reign.
Chr. And they buried him in his own sepulchers, which he had hewn out for himself in the city of David,  laid him in the bed which was filled with sweet odors and various kinds of spices prepared by the perfumers' art. And they made a very great burning for him.
Chr. And Jehoshaphat his son reigned in his stead,  strengthened himself against Israel.
Chr. And he placed forces in all the fortified cities of Judah,  set garrisons in the land of Judah,  in the cities of Ephraim, which Asa his father had taken.
Chr. And Jehovah was with Jehoshaphat, because he walked in the former ways of his father David,  did not seek for the Baalim,
Chr. but sought for the God of his father,  walked in his commandments,  not after the doings of Israel.
Chr. Therefore Jehovah established the kingdom in his hand. And all Judah brought to Jehoshaphat tribute,  he had riches and honor in abundance.
Chr. And his heart was lifted up in the ways of Jehovah. And furthermore he took away the high places and the Asherim out of Judah.
Chr. Also in the third year of his reign he sent his rulers, even Ben-hail,  Obadiah,  Zechariah,  Nethanel,  Micaiah, to teach in the cities of Judah;
Chr. and with them the Levites, even Shemaiah,  Nethaniah,  Zebadiah,  Asahel,  Shemiramoth,  Jehonathan,  Adonijah,  Tobijah,  Tob-adonijah, the Levites; and with them Elishama and Jehoram, the priests.
Chr. And they taught in Judah, having the book of the law of Jehovah with them. And they went about throughout all the cities of Judah,  taught among the people.
Chr. And the fear of Jehovah fell upon all the kingdoms of the lands that were round about Judah, so that they made no war against Jehoshaphat.
Chr. And some of the Philistines brought Jehoshaphat presents,  silver for tribute. The Arabians also brought him flocks, seven thousand and seven hundred rams,  seven thousand and seven hundred he-goats.
Chr. And Jehoshaphat grew exceedingly great. And he built in Judah castles and cities of storage.
Chr. And he had many works in the cities of Judah,  men of war, mighty men of valor, in Jerusalem.
Chr. And this was the numbering of them according to their fathers' houses. Of Judah, the captains of thousands: Adnah the captain,  with him three hundred thousand mighty men of valor;
Chr. and next to him Jehohanan the captain,  with him two hundred and eighty thousand;
Chr. and next to him Amasiah the son of Zichri, who willingly offered himself to Jehovah,  with him two hundred thousand mighty men of valor.
Chr. And of Benjamin: Eliada a mighty man of valor,  with him two hundred thousand armed with bow and shield;
Chr. and next to him Jehozabad,  with him a hundred and eighty thousand ready prepared for war.
Chr. These were those who waited on the king, besides those whom the king put in the fortified cities throughout all Judah.
Chr. Now Jehoshaphat had riches and honor in abundance. And he joined affinity with Ahab.
Chr. And after certain years he went down to Ahab to Samaria. And Ahab killed sheep and oxen for him in abundance,  for the people who were with him,  moved him to go up with him to Ramoth-gilead.
Chr. And Ahab king of Israel said to Jehoshaphat king of Judah, Will thou go with me to Ramoth-gilead? And he answered him, I am as thou are,  my people as thy people,  will be with thee in the war.
Chr. And Jehoshaphat said to the king of Israel, Inquire first, I pray thee, for the word of Jehovah.
Chr. Then the king of Israel gathered the prophets together, four hundred men,  said to them, Shall we go to Ramoth-gilead to battle, or shall I forbear? And they said, Go up. For God will deliver it into the hand of the king.
Chr. But Jehoshaphat said, Is there not here a prophet of Jehovah besides, that we may inquire of him?
Chr. And the king of Israel said to Jehoshaphat, There is yet one man by whom we may inquire of Jehovah,  I hate him. For he never prophesies good concerning me,  always evil; the same is Micaiah the son of Imla. And Jehoshaphat said, Let not the king say so.
Chr. Then the king of Israel called an officer,  said, Fetch quickly Micaiah the son of Imla.
Chr. Now the king of Israel and Jehoshaphat the king of Judah each sat on his throne, arrayed in their robes. And they were sitting in an open place at the entrance of the gate of Samaria,  all the prophets were prophesying before them.
Chr. And Zedekiah the son of Chenaanah made for him horns of iron,  said, Thus says Jehovah, With these thou shall push the Syrians until they be consumed.
Chr. And all the prophets prophesied so, saying, Go up to Ramoth-gilead,  prosper. For Jehovah will deliver it into the hand of the king.
Chr. And the messenger who went to call Micaiah spoke to him, saying, Behold, the words of the prophets are good to the king with one mouth. Let thy word therefore, I pray thee, be like one of theirs,  speak thou good.
Chr. And Micaiah said, As Jehovah lives, what my God says, that will I speak.
Chr. And when he came to the king, the king said to him, Micaiah, shall we go to Ramoth-gilead to battle, or shall I forbear? And he said, Go ye up,  prosper,  they shall be delivered into your hand.
Chr. And the king said to him, How many times shall I adjure thee that thou speak to me nothing but the truth in the name of Jehovah?
Chr. And he said, I saw all Israel scattered upon the mountains, as sheep that have no shepherd. And Jehovah said, These have no master. Let them return every man to his house in peace.
Chr. And the king of Israel said to Jehoshaphat, Did I not tell thee that he would not prophesy good concerning me,  evil?
Chr. And Micaiah said, Therefore hear ye the word of Jehovah. I saw Jehovah sitting upon his throne,  all the host of heaven standing at his right hand and at his left.
Chr. And Jehovah said, Who shall entice Ahab king of Israel, that he may go up and fall at Ramoth-gilead? And one spoke saying after this manner,  another saying after that manner.
Chr. And there came forth a spirit,  stood before Jehovah,  said, I will entice him. And Jehovah said to him, With what?
Chr. And he said, I will go forth,  will be a lying spirit in the mouth of all his prophets. And he said, Thou shall entice him,  shall also prevail. Go forth,  do so.
Chr. Now therefore, behold, Jehovah has put a lying spirit in the mouth of these thy prophets. And Jehovah has spoken evil concerning thee.
Chr. Then Zedekiah the son of Chenaanah came near,  smote Micaiah upon the cheek,  said, Which way did the Spirit of Jehovah go from me to speak to thee?
Chr. And Micaiah said, Behold, thou shall see on that day when thou shall go into an inner chamber to hide thyself.
Chr. And the king of Israel said, Take ye Micaiah,  carry him back to Amon the governor of the city,  to Joash the king's son,
Chr. and say, Thus says the king, Put this fellow in the prison,  feed him with bread of affliction and with water of affliction, until I return in peace.
Chr. And Micaiah said, If thou return at all in peace, Jehovah has not spoken by me. And he said, Hear, ye peoples, all of you.
Chr. So the king of Israel and Jehoshaphat the king of Judah went up to Ramoth-gilead.
Chr. And the king of Israel said to Jehoshaphat, I will disguise myself,  go into the battle,  put thou on thy robes. So the king of Israel disguised himself,  they went into the battle.
Chr. Now the king of Syria had commanded the captains of his chariots, saying, Fight neither with small nor great, except only with the king of Israel.
Chr. And it came to pass, when the captains of the chariots saw Jehoshaphat, that they said, It is the king of Israel. Therefore they turned around to fight against him. But Jehoshaphat cried out. And Jehovah helped him,  God moved them from him.
Chr. And it came to pass, when the captains of the chariots saw that it was not the king of Israel, that they turned back from pursuing him.
Chr. And a certain man drew his bow at a venture,  smote the king of Israel between the joints of the armor. Therefore he said to the driver of the chariot, Turn thy hand,  carry me out of the army. For I am severely wounded.
Chr. And the battle increased that day. However the king of Israel propped himself up in his chariot against the Syrians until the evening. And about the time of the going down of the sun he died.
Chr. And Jehoshaphat the king of Judah returned to his house in peace to Jerusalem.
Chr. And Jehu the son of Hanani the seer went out to meet him,  said to king Jehoshaphat, Should thou help the wicked,  love those who hate Jehovah? For this thing wrath is upon thee from before Jehovah.
Chr. Nevertheless there are good things found in thee, in that thou have put away the Asheroth out of the land,  have set thy heart to seek God.
Chr. And Jehoshaphat dwelt at Jerusalem. And he went out again among the people from Beersheba to the hill-country of Ephraim,  brought them back to Jehovah, the God of their fathers.
Chr. And he set judges in the land throughout all the fortified cities of Judah, city by city,
Chr. and said to the judges, Consider what ye do. For ye judge not for man,  for Jehovah,  he is with you in the judgment.
Chr. Now therefore let the fear of Jehovah be upon you. Take heed and do it. For there is no iniquity with Jehovah our God, nor respect of persons, nor taking of bribes.
Chr. Moreover in Jerusalem Jehoshaphat set from the Levites and the priests,  from the heads of the fathers of Israel for the judgment of Jehovah,  for controversies. And they returned to Jerusalem.
Chr. And he charged them, saying, Thus ye shall do in the fear of Jehovah, faithfully,  with a perfect heart.
Chr. And whenever any controversy shall come to you from your brothers who dwell in their cities, between blood and blood, between law and commandment, statutes and ordinances, ye shall warn them, that they not be guilty towards Jehovah,  so wrath come upon you and upon your brothers. Do this,  ye shall not be guilty.
Chr. And, behold, Amariah the chief priest is over you in all matters of Jehovah,  Zebadiah the son of Ishmael, the ruler of the house of Judah, in all the king's matters. The Levites shall also be officers before you. Deal courageously,  Jehovah be with the good.
Chr. And it came to pass after this, that the sons of Moab,  the sons of Ammon,  with them some of the Minaeans, came against Jehoshaphat to battle.
Chr. Then there came some who told Jehoshaphat, saying, There comes a great multitude against thee from beyond the sea from Syria. And, behold, they are in Hazazon-tamar (the same is En-gedi).
Chr. And Jehoshaphat was afraid,  set himself to seek for Jehovah. And he proclaimed a fast throughout all Judah.
Chr. And Judah gathered themselves together, to seek help from Jehovah, even out of all the cities of Judah they came to seek Jehovah.
Chr. And Jehoshaphat stood in the assembly of Judah and Jerusalem in the house of Jehovah before the new court.
Chr. And he said, O Jehovah, the God of our fathers, are thou not God in heaven? And are thou not ruler over all the kingdoms of the nations? And in thy hand is power and might, so that none is able to withstand thee.
Chr. Did thou not, O our God, drive out the inhabitants of this land before thy people Israel,  give it to the seed of Abraham thy friend forever?
Chr. And they dwelt therein,  have built for thee a sanctuary in it for thy name, saying,
Chr. If evil comes upon us, the sword, judgment, or pestilence, or famine, we will stand before this house,  before thee, (for thy name is in this house,) and cry out to thee in our affliction,  thou will hear and save.
Chr. And now, behold, the sons of Ammon and Moab and mount Seir (whom thou would not let Israel invade when they came out of the land of Egypt,  they turned aside from them,  did not destroy them),
Chr. behold, how they reward us, to come to cast us out of thy possession, which thou have given us to inherit.
Chr. O our God, will thou not judge them? For we have no might against this great company that comes against us. Neither do we know what to do,  our eyes are upon thee.
Chr. And all Judah stood before Jehovah, with their little ones, their wives,  their sons.
Chr. Then upon Jahaziel the son of Zechariah, the son of Benaiah, the son of Jeiel, the son of Mattaniah, the Levite, of the sons of Asaph, came the Spirit of Jehovah in the midst of the assembly.
Chr. And he said, Hearken ye, all Judah,  ye inhabitants of Jerusalem,  thou king Jehoshaphat. Thus says Jehovah to you, Fear ye not, neither be dismayed because of this great multitude. For the battle is not yours,  God's.
Chr. Tomorrow go ye down against them. Behold, they come up by the ascent of Ziz. And ye shall find them at the end of the valley, before the wilderness of Jeruel.
Chr. Ye shall not need to fight in this battle. Set yourselves, stand ye still,  see the salvation of Jehovah with you, O Judah and Jerusalem. Fear not, nor be dismayed. Tomorrow go out against them, for Jehovah is with you.
Chr. And Jehoshaphat bowed his head with his face to the ground. And all Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem fell down before Jehovah, worshiping Jehovah.
Chr. And the Levites, of the sons of the Kohathites and of the sons of the Korahites, stood up to praise Jehovah, the God of Israel, with an exceedingly loud voice.
Chr. And they rose early in the morning,  went forth into the wilderness of Tekoa. And as they went forth, Jehoshaphat stood and said, Hear me, O Judah,  ye inhabitants of Jerusalem. Believe in Jehovah your God, so shall ye be established. Believe his prophets, so shall ye prosper.
Chr. And when he had taken counsel with the people, he appointed those who should sing to Jehovah,  give praise in holy array, as they went out before the army,  say, Give thanks to Jehovah. For his loving kindness is forever.
Chr. And when they began to sing and to praise, Jehovah set an ambushment against the sons of Ammon, Moab,  mount Seir who came against Judah,  they were smitten.
Chr. For the sons of Ammon and Moab stood up against the inhabitants of mount Seir, to slay and destroy them utterly. And when they had made an end of the inhabitants of Seir, every one helped to destroy another of themselves.
Chr. And when Judah came to the watch-tower of the wilderness, they looked upon the multitude. And, behold, they were dead bodies fallen to the earth,  there were none who escaped.
Chr. And when Jehoshaphat and his people came to take the spoil of them, they found among them in abundance both riches and dead bodies,  precious jewels, which they stripped off for themselves, more than they could carry away. And they were three days in taking the spoil, it was so much.
Chr. And on the fourth day they assembled themselves in the valley of Beracah, for there they blessed Jehovah. Therefore the name of that place was called The valley of Beracah to this day.
Chr. Then they returned, every man of Judah and Jerusalem,  Jehoshaphat in the forefront of them, to go again to Jerusalem with joy. For Jehovah had made them to rejoice over their enemies.
Chr. And they came to Jerusalem with psalteries and harps and trumpets to the house of Jehovah.
Chr. And the fear of God was on all the kingdoms of the countries, when they heard that Jehovah fought against the enemies of Israel.
Chr. So the realm of Jehoshaphat was quiet. For his God gave him rest round about.
Chr. And Jehoshaphat reigned over Judah. He was thirty-five years old when he began to reign. And he reigned twenty-five years in Jerusalem. And his mother's name was Azubah the daughter of Shilhi.
Chr. And he walked in the way of Asa his father,  did not turn aside from it, doing that which was right in the eyes of Jehovah.
Chr. However the high places were not taken away. Neither as yet had the people set their hearts to the God of their fathers.
Chr. Now the rest of the acts of Jehoshaphat, first and last, behold, they are written in the history of Jehu the son of Hanani, which is inserted in the book of the kings of Israel.
Chr. And after this Jehoshaphat king of Judah joined himself with Ahaziah king of Israel. The same did very wickedly.
Chr. And he joined himself with him to make ships to go to Tarshish. And they made the ships in Ezion-geber.
Chr. Then Eliezer the son of Dodavahu of Mareshah prophesied against Jehoshaphat, saying, Because thou have joined thyself with Ahaziah, Jehovah has destroyed thy works. And the ships were broken, so that they were not able to go to Tarshish.
Chr. And Jehoshaphat slept with his fathers,  was buried with his fathers in the city of David. And Jehoram his son reigned in his stead.
Chr. And he had brothers, the sons of Jehoshaphat: Azariah,  Jehiel,  Zechariah,  Azariah,  Michael,  Shephatiah. All these were the sons of Jehoshaphat king of Israel.
Chr. And their father gave them great gifts, of silver,  of gold,  of precious things, with fortified cities in Judah. But the kingdom he gave to Jehoram, because he was the firstborn.
Chr. Now when Jehoram was risen up over the kingdom of his father,  had strengthened himself, he killed all his brothers with the sword,  also various of the rulers of Israel.
Chr. Jehoram was thirty-two years old when he began to reign,  he reigned eight years in Jerusalem.
Chr. And he walked in the way of the kings of Israel, as did the house of Ahab, for he had the daughter of Ahab to wife. And he did that which was evil in the sight of Jehovah.
Chr. However Jehovah would not destroy the house of David, because of the covenant that he had made with David,  as he promised to give a lamp to him and to his sons always.
Chr. In his days Edom revolted from under the hand of Judah,  made a king over themselves.
Chr. Then Jehoram passed over with his captains,  all his chariots with him. And he rose up by night,  smote the Edomites that encompassed him around,  the captains of the chariots.
Chr. So Edom revolted from under the hand of Judah to this day. Then Libnah revolted at the same time from under his hand because he had forsaken Jehovah, the God of his fathers.
Chr. Moreover he made high places in the mountains of Judah,  made the inhabitants of Jerusalem to play the harlot,  led Judah astray.
Chr. And there came a writing to him from Elijah the prophet, saying, Thus says Jehovah, the God of David thy father, Because thou have not walked in the ways of Jehoshaphat thy father, nor in the ways of Asa king of Judah,
Chr. but have walked in the way of the kings of Israel,  have made Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem to play the harlot, like the house of Ahab did,  also have slain thy brothers of thy father's house who were better than thyself,
Chr. behold, Jehovah will smite thy people with a great plague,  thy sons,  thy wives,  all thy substance.
Chr. And thou shall have great sickness by disease of thy bowels until thy bowels fall out by reason of the sickness, day by day.
Chr. And Jehovah stirred up against Jehoram the spirit of the Philistines,  of the Arabians who are beside the Ethiopians.
Chr. And they came up against Judah,  broke into it,  carried away all the substance that was found in the king's house,  his sons also,  his wives, so that there has not been left a son to him, except Jehoahaz, the youngest of his sons.
Chr. And after all this Jehovah smote him in his bowels with an incurable disease.
Chr. And it came to pass, in process of time, at the end of two years, that his bowels fell out because of his sickness,  he died of severe diseases. And his people made no burning for him like the burning of his fathers.
Chr. He was thirty-two years old when he began to reign,  he reigned in Jerusalem eight years. And he departed without being wanted. And they buried him in the city of David,  not in the sepulchers of the kings.
Chr. And the inhabitants of Jerusalem made Ahaziah his youngest son king in his stead, for the band of men who came with the Arabians to the camp had slain all the eldest. So Ahaziah the son of Jehoram king of Judah reigned.
Chr. Ahaziah was twenty-two years old when he began to reign,  he reigned one year in Jerusalem. And his mother's name was Athaliah the daughter of Omri.
Chr. He also walked in the ways of the house of Ahab. For his mother was his counselor to do wickedly.
Chr. And he did that which was evil in the sight of Jehovah, as did the house of Ahab. For they were his counselors after the death of his father, to his destruction.
Chr. He walked also after their counsel,  went with Jehoram the son of Ahab king of Israel to war against Hazael king of Syria at Ramoth-gilead. And the Syrians wounded Joram.
Chr. And he returned to be healed in Jezreel of the wounds which they had given him at Ramah when he fought against Hazael king of Syria. And Azariah the son of Jehoram king of Judah went down to see Jehoram the son of Ahab in Jezreel because he was sick.
Chr. Now the destruction of Ahaziah was of God, in that he went to Joram, for when he came he went out with Jehoram against Jehu the son of Nimshi, whom Jehovah had anointed to cut off the house of Ahab.
Chr. And it came to pass, when Jehu was executing judgment upon the house of Ahab, that he found the rulers of Judah,  the sons of the brothers of Ahaziah, ministering to Ahaziah,  killed them.
Chr. And he sought Ahaziah,  they caught him (now he was hiding in Samaria). And they brought him to Jehu,  killed him. And they buried him, for they said, He is the son of Jehoshaphat, who sought Jehovah with all his heart. And the house of Ahaziah had no power to hold the kingdom.
Chr. Now when Athaliah the mother of Ahaziah saw that her son was dead, she arose and destroyed all the royal seed of the house of Judah.
Chr. But Jehoshabeath, the daughter of the king, took Joash the son of Ahaziah,  stole him away from among the king's sons who were slain,  put him and his nurse in the bedchamber. So Jehoshabeath, the daughter of king Jehoram, the wife of Jehoiada the priest (for she was the sister of Ahaziah), hid him from Athaliah, so that she did not kill him.
Chr. And he was with them hid in the house of God six years,  Athaliah reigned over the land.
Chr. And in the seventh year Jehoiada strengthened himself,  took the captains of hundreds, Azariah the son of Jeroham,  Ishmael the son of Jehohanan,  Azariah the son of Obed,  Maaseiah the son of Adaiah,  Elishaphat the son of Zichri, into covenant with him.
Chr. And they went about in Judah,  gathered the Levites out of all the cities of Judah,  the heads of fathers of Israel,  they came to Jerusalem.
Chr. And all the assembly made a covenant with the king in the house of God. And he said to them, Behold, the king's son shall reign, as Jehovah has spoken concerning the sons of David.
Chr. This is the thing that ye shall do: A third part of you who come in on the sabbath, of the priests and of the Levites, shall be porters of the thresholds,
Chr. and a third part shall be at the king's house,  a third part at the gate of the foundation. And all the people shall be in the courts of the house of Jehovah.
Chr. But let none come into the house of Jehovah except the priests,  those who minister of the Levites. They shall come in for they are holy,  all the people shall keep the charge of Jehovah.
Chr. And the Levites shall encompass the king round about, every man with his weapons in his hand. And whoever comes into the house, let him be slain. And be ye with the king when he comes in,  when he goes out.
Chr. So the Levites and all Judah did according to all that Jehoiada the priest commanded. And they took every man his men, those who were to come in on the sabbath, with those who were to go out on the sabbath. For Jehoiada the priest did not dismiss the divisions.
Chr. And Jehoiada the priest delivered to the captains of hundreds the spears,  bucklers,  shields, that had been king David's, which were in the house of God.
Chr. And he set all the people, every man with his weapon in his hand, from the right side of the house to the left side of the house, along by the altar and the house, by the king round about.
Chr. Then they brought out the king's son,  put the crown upon him,  gave him the testimony,  made him king. And Jehoiada and his sons anointed him. And they said, Live, O king.
Chr. And when Athaliah heard the noise of the people running and praising the king, she came to the people into the house of Jehovah.
Chr. And she looked, , behold, the king stood by his pillar at the entrance,  the captains and the trumpets by the king. And all the people of the land rejoiced,  blew trumpets. The singers also played on instruments of music,  led the singing of praise. Then Athaliah tore her clothes,  said, Treason! treason!
Chr. And Jehoiada the priest brought out the captains of hundreds who were set over the army,  said to them, Have her forth between the ranks. And whoever follows her, let him be slain with the sword, for the priest said, Do not slay her in the house of Jehovah.
Chr. So they made way for her. And she went to the entrance of the horse gate to the king's house,  they killed her there.
Chr. And Jehoiada made a covenant between himself,  all the people,  the king, that they should be Jehovah's people.
Chr. And all the people went to the house of Baal,  broke it down,  broke his altars and his images in pieces,  killed Mattan the priest of Baal before the altars.
Chr. And Jehoiada appointed the officers of the house of Jehovah under the hand of the priests the Levites, whom David had distributed in the house of Jehovah, to offer the burnt offerings of Jehovah, as it is written in the law of Moses, with rejoicing and with singing, according to the order of David.
Chr. And he set the porters at the gates of the house of Jehovah that no man who was unclean in anything should enter in.
Chr. And he took the captains of hundreds,  the mighty men,  the governors of the people,  all the people of the land,  brought down the king from the house of Jehovah. And they came through the upper gate to the king's house,  set the king upon the throne of the kingdom.
Chr. So all the people of the land rejoiced,  the city was quiet. And they had slain Athaliah with the sword.
Chr. Joash was seven years old when he began to reign,  he reigned forty years in Jerusalem. And his mother's name was Zibiah, of Beersheba.
Chr. And Joash did that which was right in the eyes of Jehovah all the days of Jehoiada the priest.
Chr. And Jehoiada took two wives for him,  he begot sons and daughters.
Chr. And it came to pass after this, that Joash was minded to restore the house of Jehovah.
Chr. And he gathered together the priests and the Levites,  said to them, Go out to the cities of Judah,  gather money from all Israel to repair the house of your God from year to year. And see that ye hasten the matter. However the Levites did not hasten it.
Chr. And the king called for Jehoiada the chief,  said to him, Why have thou not required of the Levites to bring in out of Judah and out of Jerusalem the tax of Moses the servant of Jehovah,  of the assembly of Israel, for the tent of the testimony?
Chr. For the sons of Athaliah, that wicked woman, had broken up the house of God,  also all the dedicated things of the house of Jehovah they bestowed upon the Baalim.
Chr. So the king commanded,  they made a chest,  set it outside at the gate of the house of Jehovah.
Chr. And they made a proclamation through Judah and Jerusalem, to bring in for Jehovah the tax that Moses the servant of God laid upon Israel in the wilderness.
Chr. And all the rulers and all the people rejoiced,  brought in,  cast into the chest, until they had made an end.
Chr. And it was so, that, at what ever time the chest was brought to the king's officers by the hand of the Levites,  when they saw that there was much money, the king's scribe and the chief priest's officer came and emptied the chest,  took it,  carried it to its place again. Thus they did day by day,  gathered money in abundance.
Chr. And the king and Jehoiada gave it to such as did the work of the service of the house of Jehovah. And they hired masons and carpenters to restore the house of Jehovah,  also such as wrought iron and brass to repair the house of Jehovah.
Chr. So the workmen labored,  the work of repairing went forward in their hands,  they set up the house of God in its state,  strengthened it.
Chr. And when they had made an end, they brought the rest of the money before the king and Jehoiada, from which were made vessels for the house of Jehovah, even vessels with which to minister and to offer,  spoons,  vessels of gold and silver. And they offered burnt offerings in the house of Jehovah continually all the days of Jehoiada.
Chr. But Jehoiada grew old and was full of days,  he died. He was a hundred and thirty years old when he died.
Chr. And they buried him in the city of David among the kings, because he had done good in Israel,  toward God and his house.
Chr. Now after the death of Jehoiada the rulers of Judah came,  made obeisance to the king. Then the king hearkened to them.
Chr. And they forsook the house of Jehovah, the God of their fathers,  served the Asherim and the idols. And wrath came upon Judah and Jerusalem for this their guiltiness.
Chr. Yet he sent prophets to them to bring them again to Jehovah. And they testified against them,  they would not give ear.
Chr. And the Spirit of God came upon Zechariah the son of Jehoiada the priest. And he stood above the people,  said to them, Thus says God, Why do ye transgress the commandments of Jehovah, so that ye cannot prosper? Because ye have forsaken Jehovah, he has also forsaken you.
Chr. And they conspired against him,  stoned him with stones at the commandment of the king in the court of the house of Jehovah.
Chr. Thus Joash the king did not remember the kindness which Jehoiada his father had done to him,  killed his son. And when he died, he said, Jehovah look upon it,  require it.
Chr. And it came to pass at the end of the year, that the army of the Syrians came up against him. And they came to Judah and Jerusalem,  destroyed all the rulers of the people from among the people,  sent all the spoil of them to the king of Damascus.
Chr. For the army of the Syrians came with a small company of men. And Jehovah delivered a very great host into their hand because they had forsaken Jehovah, the God of their fathers. So they executed judgment upon Joash.
Chr. And when they were departed from him (for they left him very sick), his own servants conspired against him for the blood of the sons of Jehoiada the priest,  killed him on his bed,  he died. And they buried him in the city of David,  they did not bury him in the sepulchers of the kings.
Chr. And these are those who conspired against him: Zabad the son of Shimeath the Ammonitess,  Jehozabad the son of Shimrith the Moabitess.
Chr. Now concerning his sons,  the greatness of the burdens laid upon him,  the rebuilding of the house of God, behold, they are written in the commentary of the book of the kings. And Amaziah his son reigned in his stead.
Chr. Amaziah was twenty-five years old when he began to reign,  he reigned twenty-nine years in Jerusalem. And his mother's name was Jehoaddan, of Jerusalem.
Chr. And he did that which was right in the eyes of Jehovah,  not with a perfect heart.
Chr. Now it came to pass, when the kingdom was established to him, that he killed his servants who had killed the king his father.
Chr. But he did not put their sons to death,  did according to that which is written in the law in the book of Moses, as Jehovah commanded, saying, The fathers shall not die for the sons, neither shall the sons die for the fathers,  every man shall die for his own sin.
Chr. Moreover Amaziah gathered Judah together,  appointed them according to their fathers' houses, for heads of thousands and heads of hundreds, even all Judah and Benjamin. And he numbered them from twenty years old and upward,  found them three hundred thousand chosen men, able to go forth to war, who could handle spear and shield.
Chr. He also hired a hundred thousand mighty men of valor out of Israel for a hundred talents of silver.
Chr. But there came a man of God to him, saying, O king, let not the army of Israel go with thee. For Jehovah is not with Israel, namely, with all the sons of Ephraim.
Chr. But if thou are going, do it. Be strong for the battle, because God will cast thee down before the enemy, for God has power to help,  to cast down.
Chr. And Amaziah said to the man of God, But what shall we do for the hundred talents which I have given to the army of Israel? And the man of God answered, Jehovah is able to give thee much more than this.
Chr. Then Amaziah separated them, namely, the army that came to him out of Ephraim, to go home again. Therefore their anger was greatly kindled against Judah,  they returned home in fierce anger.
Chr. And Amaziah took courage,  led forth his people,  went to the Valley of Salt,  smote ten thousand of the sons of Seir.
Chr. And the sons of Judah carried away ten thousand alive,  brought them to the top of the rock,  cast them down from the top of the rock, so that they all were broken in pieces.
Chr. But the men of the army whom Amaziah sent back, that they should not go with him to battle, fell upon the cities of Judah, from Samaria even to Beth-horon,  smote three thousand of them,  took much spoil.
Chr. Now it came to pass, after Amaziah came from the slaughter of the Edomites, that he brought the gods of the sons of Seir,  set them up to be his gods,  bowed down himself before them,  burned incense to them.
Chr. Therefore the anger of Jehovah was kindled against Amaziah. And he sent a prophet to him, who said to him, Why have thou sought after the gods of the people, which have not delivered their own people out of thy hand?
Chr. And it came to pass, as he talked with him, that the king said to him, Have we made thee of the king's counsel? Cease. Why should thou be smitten? Then the prophet ceased,  said, I know that God has determined to destroy thee, because thou have done this,  have not hearkened to my counsel.
Chr. Then Amaziah king of Judah took advice,  sent to Joash, the son of Jehoahaz the son of Jehu, king of Israel, saying, Come, let us look each other in the face.
Chr. And Joash king of Israel sent to Amaziah king of Judah, saying, The thistle that was in Lebanon sent to the cedar that was in Lebanon, saying, Give thy daughter to my son to wife. And there passed by a wild beast that was in Lebanon,  trampled down the thistle.
Chr. Thou say, Lo, I have smitten Edom. And thy heart lifts thee up to boast. Remain now at home. Why should thou meddle to thy hurt, that thou should fall, even thou,  Judah with thee?
Chr. But Amaziah would not hear, for it was of God, that he might deliver them into the hand of their enemies, because they had sought after the gods of Edom.
Chr. So Joash king of Israel went up. And he and Amaziah king of Judah looked each other in the face at Beth-shemesh, which belongs to Judah.
Chr. And Judah was put to the worse before Israel,  they fled every man to his tent.
Chr. And Joash king of Israel took Amaziah king of Judah, the son of Joash the son of Jehoahaz, at Beth-shemesh,  brought him to Jerusalem,  broke down the wall of Jerusalem from the gate of Ephraim to the corner gate, four hundred cubits.
Chr. And he took all the gold and silver,  all the vessels that were found in the house of God with Obed-edom,  the treasures of the king's house, also the hostages,  returned to Samaria.
Chr. And Amaziah the son of Joash king of Judah lived fifteen years after the death of Joash son of Jehoahaz king of Israel.
Chr. Now the rest of the acts of Amaziah, first and last, behold, are they not written in the book of the kings of Judah and Israel?
Chr. Now from the time that Amaziah turned away from following Jehovah they made a conspiracy against him in Jerusalem,  he fled to Lachish. But they sent after him to Lachish,  killed him there.
Chr. And they brought him upon horses,  buried him with his fathers in the city of Judah.
Chr. And all the people of Judah took Uzziah, who was sixteen years old,  made him king in the place of his father Amaziah.
Chr. He built Eloth,  restored it to Judah, after that the king slept with his fathers.
Chr. Uzziah was sixteen years old when he began to reign,  he reigned fifty-two years in Jerusalem. And his mother's name was Jechiliah, of Jerusalem.
Chr. And he did that which was right in the eyes of Jehovah, according to all that his father Amaziah had done.
Chr. And he set himself to seek God in the days of Zechariah, who had understanding in the vision of God. And as long as he sought Jehovah, God made him to prosper.
Chr. And he went forth and warred against the Philistines,  broke down the wall of Gath,  the wall of Jabneh,  the wall of Ashdod. And he built cities in the country of Ashdod,  among the Philistines.
Chr. And God helped him against the Philistines,  against the Arabians who dwelt in Gur-baal,  the Meunim.
Chr. And the Ammonites gave tribute to Uzziah. And his name spread abroad even to the entrance of Egypt, for he grew exceedingly strong.
Chr. Moreover Uzziah built towers in Jerusalem at the corner gate,  at the valley gate,  at the turning of the wall,  fortified them.
Chr. And he built towers in the wilderness,  hewed out many cisterns, for he had much cattle, also in the lowland and in the plain. And he had husbandmen and vinedressers in the mountains and in the fruitful fields, for he loved husbandry.
Chr. Moreover Uzziah had an army of fighting men who went out to war by bands, according to the number of their reckoning made by Jeiel the scribe and Maaseiah the officer, under the hand of Hananiah, one of the king's captains.
Chr. The whole number of the heads of fathers, even the mighty men of valor, was two thousand and six hundred.
Chr. And under their hand was an army, three hundred seven thousand and five hundred, that made war with mighty power, to help the king against the enemy.
Chr. And Uzziah prepared for them, even for all the army, shields,  spears,  helmets,  coats of mail,  bows,  stones for slinging.
Chr. And he made engines in Jerusalem, invented by skilful men, to be on the towers and upon the battlements, with which to shoot arrows and great stones. And his name spread far abroad. For he was marvelously helped, till he was strong.
Chr. But when he was strong, his heart was lifted up, so that he did corruptly,  he trespassed against Jehovah his God. For he went into the temple of Jehovah to burn incense upon the altar of incense.
Chr. And Azariah the priest went in after him,  with him eighty priests of Jehovah, who were valiant men.
Chr. And they withstood Uzziah the king,  said to him, It does not pertain to thee, Uzziah, to burn incense to Jehovah,  to the priests the sons of Aaron who are consecrated to burn incense. Go out of the sanctuary. For thou have trespassed, neither shall it be for thine honor from Jehovah God.
Chr. Then Uzziah was angry. And he had a censer in his hand to burn incense. And while he was angry with the priests, the leprosy broke forth in his forehead before the priests in the house of Jehovah, beside the altar of incense.
Chr. And Azariah the chief priest,  all the priests, looked upon him, , behold, he was leprous in his forehead. And they thrust him out quickly from there. Yea, he himself also hastened to go out, because Jehovah had smitten him.
Chr. And Uzziah the king was a leper to the day of his death,  dwelt in a separate house, being a leper. For he was cut off from the house of Jehovah,  Jotham his son was over the king's house, judging the people of the land.
Chr. Now the rest of the acts of Uzziah, first and last, Isaiah the prophet, the son of Amoz, wrote.
Chr. So Uzziah slept with his fathers,  they buried him with his fathers in the field of burial which belonged to the kings. For they said, He is a leper. And Jotham his son reigned in his stead.
Chr. Jotham was twenty-five years old when he began to reign,  he reigned sixteen years in Jerusalem. And his mother's name was Jerushah the daughter of Zadok.
Chr. And he did that which was right in the eyes of Jehovah, according to all that his father Uzziah had done. However he did not enter into the temple of Jehovah. And the people still did corruptly.
Chr. He built the upper gate of the house of Jehovah,  on the wall of Ophel he built much.
Chr. Moreover he built cities in the hill-country of Judah,  in the forests he built castles and towers.
Chr. Also he fought with the king of the sons of Ammon,  prevailed against them. And the sons of Ammon gave him the same year a hundred talents of silver,  ten thousand measures of wheat,  ten thousand of barley. So much did the sons of Ammon render to him, in the second year also,  in the third.
Chr. So Jotham became mighty, because he ordered his ways before Jehovah his God.
Chr. Now the rest of the acts of Jotham,  all his wars,  his ways, behold, they are written in the book of the kings of Israel and Judah.
Chr. He was twenty-five years old when he began to reign,  reigned sixteen years in Jerusalem.
Chr. And Jotham slept with his fathers,  they buried him in the city of David. And Ahaz his son reigned in his stead.
Chr. Ahaz was twenty years old when he began to reign,  he reigned sixteen years in Jerusalem. And he did not do that which was right in the eyes of Jehovah like David his father,
Chr. but he walked in the ways of the kings of Israel,  also made molten images for the Baalim.
Chr. Moreover he burnt incense in the valley of the son of Hinnom,  burnt his sons in the fire, according to the abominations of the nations whom Jehovah cast out before the sons of Israel.
Chr. And he sacrificed and burnt incense in the high places,  on the hills,  under every green tree.
Chr. Therefore Jehovah his God delivered him into the hand of the king of Syria. And they smote him,  carried away of his a great multitude of captives,  brought them to Damascus. And he was also delivered into the hand of the king of Israel, who smote him with a great slaughter.
Chr. For Pekah the son of Remaliah killed in Judah a hundred and twenty thousand in one day, all of them valiant men, because they had forsaken Jehovah, the God of their fathers.
Chr. And Zichri, a mighty man of Ephraim, killed Maaseiah the king's son,  Azrikam the ruler of the house,  Elkanah who was next to the king.
Chr. And the sons of Israel carried away captive of their brothers two hundred thousand, women, sons,  daughters,  also took away much spoil from them,  brought the spoil to Samaria.
Chr. But a prophet of Jehovah was there, whose name was Oded. And he went out to meet the army that came to Samaria,  said to them, Behold, because Jehovah, the God of your fathers, was angry with Judah, he has delivered them into your hand. And ye have slain them in a rage which has reached up to heaven.
Chr. And now ye propose to keep under the sons of Judah and Jerusalem for bondmen and bondwomen to you. Are there not even with you trespasses of your own against Jehovah your God?
Chr. Now hear me therefore,  send back the captives that ye have taken captive of your brothers. For the fierce wrath of Jehovah is upon you.
Chr. Then certain of the heads of the sons of Ephraim, Azariah the son of Johanan, Berechiah the son of Meshillemoth,  Jehizkiah the son of Shallum,  Amasa the son of Hadlai, stood up against those who came from the war,
Chr. and said to them, Ye shall not bring in the captives here. For ye propose that which will bring upon us a trespass against Jehovah, to add to our sins and to our trespass. For our trespass is great,  there is fierce wrath against Israel.
Chr. So the armed men left the captives and the spoil before the rulers and all the assembly.
Chr. And the men who have been mentioned by name rose up,  took the captives,  with the spoil clothed all who were naked among them,  dressed them,  shod them,  gave them to eat and to drink,  anointed them,  carried all the feeble of them upon donkeys,  brought them to Jericho, the city of palm trees, to their brothers. Then they returned to Samaria.
Chr. At that time king Ahaz sent to the kings of Assyria to help him.
Chr. For again the Edomites had come and smitten Judah,  carried away captives.
Chr. The Philistines also had invaded the cities of the lowland,  of the South of Judah,  had taken Beth-shemesh,  Aijalon,  Gederoth,  Soco with the towns of it,  Timnah with the towns of it, also Gimzo and the towns of it. And they dwelt there.
Chr. For Jehovah brought Judah low because of Ahaz king of Israel, for he had dealt wantonly in Judah,  trespassed severely against Jehovah.
Chr. And Tilgath-pilneser king of Assyria came to him,  distressed him,  did not strengthen him.
Chr. For Ahaz took away a portion out of the house of Jehovah,  out of the house of the king and of the rulers,  gave it to the king of Assyria,  it did not help him.
Chr. And in the time of his distress he trespassed yet more against Jehovah, this same king Ahaz.
Chr. For he sacrificed to the gods of Damascus, which smote him. And he said, Because the gods of the kings of Syria helped them, therefore I will sacrifice to them, that they may help me. But they were the ruin of him,  of all Israel.
Chr. And Ahaz gathered together the vessels of the house of God,  cut in pieces the vessels of the house of God,  shut up the doors of the house of Jehovah. And he made altars for him in every corner of Jerusalem.
Chr. And in every city of Judah he made high places to burn incense to other gods,  provoked to anger Jehovah, the God of his fathers.
Chr. Now the rest of his acts,  all his ways, first and last, behold, they are written in the book of the kings of Judah and Israel.
Chr. And Ahaz slept with his fathers,  they buried him in the city, even in Jerusalem. For they did not bring him into the sepulchers of the kings of Israel. And Hezekiah his son reigned in his stead.
Chr. Hezekiah began to reign when he was twenty-five years old,  he reigned twenty-nine years in Jerusalem. And his mother's name was Abijah, the daughter of Zechariah.
Chr. And he did that which was right in the eyes of Jehovah, according to all that David his father had done.
Chr. In the first year of his reign, in the first month, he opened the doors of the house of Jehovah,  repaired them.
Chr. And he brought in the priests and the Levites,  gathered them together into the broad place on the east,
Chr. and said to them, Hear me, ye Levites. Now sanctify yourselves,  sanctify the house of Jehovah, the God of your fathers,  carry forth the filthiness out of the holy place.
Chr. For our fathers have trespassed,  done that which was evil in the sight of Jehovah our God,  have forsaken him,  have turned away their faces from the habitation of Jehovah,  turned their backs.
Chr. Also they have shut up the doors of the porch,  put out the lamps,  have not burned incense nor offered burnt offerings in the holy place to the God of Israel.
Chr. Therefore the wrath of Jehovah was upon Judah and Jerusalem,  he has delivered them to be tossed to and fro, to be an astonishment,  a hissing, as ye see with your eyes.
Chr. For, lo, our fathers have fallen by the sword,  our sons and our daughters and our wives are in captivity for this.
Chr. Now it is in my heart to make a covenant with Jehovah, the God of Israel, that his fierce anger may turn away from us.
Chr. My sons, be not now negligent. For Jehovah has chosen you to stand before him, to minister to him,  that ye should be his ministers,  burn incense.
Chr. Then the Levites arose: Mahath, the son of Amasai,  Joel the son of Azariah, of the sons of the Kohathites,  of the sons of Merari, Kish the son of Abdi,  Azariah the son of Jehallelel,  of the Gershonites, Joah the son of Zimmah,  Eden the son of Joah;
Chr. and of the sons of Elizaphan, Shimri and Jeuel,  of the sons of Asaph, Zechariah and Mattaniah,
Chr. and of the sons of Heman, Jehuel and Shimei,  of the sons of Jeduthun, Shemaiah and Uzziel.
Chr. And they gathered their brothers,  sanctified themselves,  went in, according to the commandment of the king by the words of Jehovah, to cleanse the house of Jehovah.
Chr. And the priests went in to the inner part of the house of Jehovah to cleanse it,  brought out all the uncleanness that they found in the temple of Jehovah into the court of the house of Jehovah. And the Levites took it, to carry it out abroad to the brook Kidron.
Chr. Now they began on the first day of the first month to sanctify,  on the eighth day of the month they came to the porch of Jehovah. And they sanctified the house of Jehovah in eight days,  on the sixteenth day of the first month they made an end.
Chr. Then they went in to Hezekiah the king within the palace,  said, We have cleansed all the house of Jehovah,  the altar of burnt offering with all the vessels of it,  the table of showbread with all the vessels of it.
Chr. Moreover all the vessels, which king Ahaz in his reign cast away when he trespassed, we have prepared and sanctified. And, behold, they are before the altar of Jehovah.
Chr. Then Hezekiah the king arose early,  gathered the rulers of the city,  went up to the house of Jehovah.
Chr. And they brought seven bullocks,  seven rams,  seven lambs,  seven he-goats, for a sin offering for the kingdom and for the sanctuary and for Judah. And he commanded the priests the sons of Aaron to offer them on the altar of Jehovah.
Chr. So they killed the bullocks. And the priests received the blood,  sprinkled it on the altar. And they killed the rams,  sprinkled the blood upon the altar. They also killed the lambs,  sprinkled the blood upon the altar.
Chr. And they brought near the he-goats for the sin offering before the king and the assembly. And they laid their hands upon them,
Chr. and the priests killed them. And they made a sin offering with their blood upon the altar, to make atonement for all Israel. For the king commanded that the burnt offering and the sin offering should be made for all Israel.
Chr. And he set the Levites in the house of Jehovah with cymbals, with psalteries,  with harps, according to the commandment of David,  of Gad the king's seer,  Nathan the prophet. For the commandment was of Jehovah by his prophets.
Chr. And the Levites stood with the instruments of David,  the priests with the trumpets.
Chr. And Hezekiah commanded to offer the burnt offering upon the altar. And when the burnt offering began, the song of Jehovah began also,  the trumpets, together with the instruments of David king of Israel.
Chr. And all the assembly worshiped,  the singers sang,  the trumpeters sounded. All this until the burnt offering was finished.
Chr. And when they had made an end of offering, the king and all who were present with him bowed themselves and worshiped.
Chr. Moreover Hezekiah the king and the rulers commanded the Levites to sing praises to Jehovah with the words of David,  of Asaph the seer. And they sang praises with gladness,  they bowed their heads and worshiped.
Chr. Then Hezekiah answered and said, Now ye have consecrated yourselves to Jehovah. Come near and bring sacrifices and thank offerings into the house of Jehovah. And the assembly brought in sacrifices and thank offerings; and as many as were of a willing heart brought burnt offerings.
Chr. And the number of the burnt offerings which the assembly brought was seventy bullocks, a hundred rams,  two hundred lambs. All these were for a burnt offering to Jehovah.
Chr. And the consecrated things were six hundred oxen and three thousand sheep.
Chr. But the priests were too few, so that they could not skin all the burnt offerings. Therefore their brothers the Levites helped them till the work was ended,  until the priests had sanctified themselves. For the Levites were more upright in heart to sanctify themselves than the priests.
Chr. And also the burnt offerings were in abundance, with the fat of the peace offerings,  with the drink offerings for every burnt offering. So the service of the house of Jehovah was set in order.
Chr. And Hezekiah rejoiced,  all the people, because of that which God had prepared for the people; for the thing was done suddenly.
Chr. And Hezekiah sent to all Israel and Judah,  wrote letters also to Ephraim and Manasseh, that they should come to the house of Jehovah at Jerusalem, to keep the Passover to Jehovah, the God of Israel.
Chr. For the king had taken counsel,  his rulers,  all the assembly in Jerusalem, to keep the Passover in the second month.
Chr. For they could not keep it at that time, because the priests had not sanctified themselves in sufficient number, neither had the people gathered themselves together to Jerusalem.
Chr. And the thing was right in the eyes of the king and of all the assembly.
Chr. So they established a decree to make proclamation throughout all Israel, from Beersheba even to Dan, that they should come to keep the Passover to Jehovah, the God of Israel, at Jerusalem. For they had not kept it in great numbers in such sort as it is written.
Chr. So the posts went with the letters from the king and his rulers throughout all Israel and Judah,  according to the commandment of the king, saying, Ye sons of Israel, turn again to Jehovah, the God of Abraham, Isaac,  Israel, that he may return to the remnant of you who escaped out of the hand of the kings of Assyria.
Chr. And be ye not like your fathers,  like your brothers, who trespassed against Jehovah, the God of their fathers, so that he gave them up to desolation, as ye see.
Chr. Now be ye not stiff-necked, as your fathers were,  yield yourselves to Jehovah,  enter into his sanctuary, which he has sanctified forever,  serve Jehovah your God, that his fierce anger may turn away from you.
Chr. For if ye turn again to Jehovah, your brothers and your sons shall find compassion before those who led them captive,  shall come again into this land. For Jehovah your God is gracious and merciful,  will not turn away his face from you, if ye return to him.
Chr. So the posts passed from city to city through the country of Ephraim and Manasseh, even to Zebulun. But they laughed them to scorn,  mocked them.
Chr. Nevertheless certain men of Asher and Manasseh and of Zebulun humbled themselves,  came to Jerusalem.
Chr. Also the hand of God came upon Judah to give them one heart, to do the commandment of the king and of the rulers by the word of Jehovah.
Chr. And many people assembled at Jerusalem to keep the feast of unleavened bread in the second month, a very great assembly.
Chr. And they arose and took away the altars that were in Jerusalem,  all the altars for incense they took away,  cast them into the brook Kidron.
Chr. Then they killed the Passover on the fourteenth day of the second month. And the priests and the Levites were ashamed,  sanctified themselves,  brought burnt offerings into the house of Jehovah.
Chr. And they stood in their place after their order, according to the law of Moses the man of God; the priests sprinkled the blood which they received from the hand of the Levites.
Chr. For there were many in the assembly who had not sanctified themselves. Therefore the Levites had charge of killing the Passovers for everyone who was not clean, to sanctify them to Jehovah.
Chr. For a multitude of the people, even many of Ephraim and Manasseh, Issachar and Zebulun, had not cleansed themselves, yet they ate the Passover otherwise than it is written. For Hezekiah had prayed for them, saying, The good Jehovah pardon everyone
Chr. who sets his heart to seek God, Jehovah, the God of his fathers, though he be not according to the purification of the sanctuary.
Chr. And Jehovah hearkened to Hezekiah,  healed the people.
Chr. And the sons of Israel who were present at Jerusalem kept the feast of unleavened bread seven days with great gladness. And the Levites and the priests praised Jehovah day by day, with loud instruments to Jehovah.
Chr. And Hezekiah spoke encouragingly to all the Levites who had good understanding in the service of Jehovah. So they ate throughout the feast for the seven days, offering sacrifices of peace offerings,  making confession to Jehovah, the God of their fathers.
Chr. And the whole assembly took counsel to keep another seven days. And they kept those seven days with gladness.
Chr. For Hezekiah king of Judah gave to the assembly for offerings a thousand bullocks and seven thousand sheep. And the rulers gave to the assembly a thousand bullocks and ten thousand sheep. And a great number of priests sanctified themselves.
Chr. And all the assembly of Judah, with the priests and the Levites,  all the assembly that came out of Israel,  the sojourners who came out of the land of Israel,  who dwelt in Judah, rejoiced.
Chr. So there was great joy in Jerusalem. For since the time of Solomon the son of David king of Israel there was not the like in Jerusalem.
Chr. Then the priests the Levites arose and blessed the people. And their voice was heard,  their prayer came up to his holy habitation, even to heaven.
Chr. Now when all this was finished, all Israel that were present went out to the cities of Judah,  broke in pieces the pillars,  hewed down the Asherim,  broke down the high places and the altars out of all Judah and Benjamin, also in Ephraim and Manasseh, until they had destroyed them all. Then all the sons of Israel returned, every man to his possession, into their own cities.
Chr. And Hezekiah appointed the divisions of the priests and the Levites after their divisions, every man according to his service, both the priests and the Levites, for burnt offerings and for peace offerings, to minister,  to give thanks,  to praise in the gates of the camp of Jehovah.
Chr. Also he appointed the king's portion of his substance for the burnt offerings, namely, for the morning and evening burnt offerings,  the burnt offerings for the sabbaths,  for the new moons,  for the set feasts, as it is written in the law of Jehovah.
Chr. Moreover he commanded the people who dwelt in Jerusalem to give the portion of the priests and the Levites, that they might give themselves to the law of Jehovah.
Chr. And as soon as the commandment came abroad, the sons of Israel gave in abundance the first-fruits of grain, new wine,  oil,  honey,  of all the increase of the field. And they brought in the tithe of all things abundantly.
Chr. And the sons of Israel and Judah, who dwelt in the cities of Judah, they also brought in the tithe of oxen and sheep,  the tithe of dedicated things which were consecrated to Jehovah their God,  laid them by heaps.
Chr. In the third month they began to lay the foundation of the heaps,  finished them in the seventh month.
Chr. And when Hezekiah and the rulers came and saw the heaps, they blessed Jehovah,  his people Israel.
Chr. Then Hezekiah questioned the priests and the Levites concerning the heaps.
Chr. And Azariah the chief priest, of the house of Zadok, answered him and said, Since they began to bring the oblations into the house of Jehovah, we have eaten and had enough,  have plenty left. For Jehovah has blessed his people,  that which is left is this great store.
Chr. Then Hezekiah commanded to prepare chambers in the house of Jehovah,  they prepared them.
Chr. And they brought in the oblations and the tithes and the dedicated things faithfully. And Conaniah the Levite was ruler over them,  Shimei his brother was second.
Chr. And Jehiel,  Azaziah,  Nahath,  Asahel,  Jerimoth,  Jozabad,  Eliel,  Ismachiah,  Mahath,  Benaiah, were overseers under the hand of Conaniah and Shimei his brother, by the appointment of Hezekiah the king,  Azariah the ruler of the house of God.
Chr. And Kore the son of Imnah the Levite, the porter at the east gate, was over the freewill offerings of God, to distribute the oblations of Jehovah,  the most holy things.
Chr. And under him were Eden,  Miniamin,  Jeshua,  Shemaiah, Amariah,  Shecaniah, in the cities of the priests, in their office of trust, to give to their brothers by divisions, as well to the great as to the small,
Chr. besides those who were reckoned by genealogy of males, from three years old and upward, even everyone that entered into the house of Jehovah, as the duty of every day required, for their service in their offices according to their divisions,
Chr. and those who were reckoned by genealogy of the priests by their fathers' houses,  the Levites from twenty years old and upward, in their offices by their divisions,
Chr. and those who were reckoned by genealogy of all their little ones, their wives,  their sons,  their daughters, through all the congregation. For in their office of trust they sanctified themselves in holiness.
Chr. Also for the sons of Aaron the priests, who were in the fields of the suburbs of their cities, in every city, there were men who were mentioned by name, to give portions to all the males among the priests,  to all who were reckoned by genealogy among the Levites.
Chr. And thus Hezekiah did throughout all Judah. And he wrought that which was good and right and faithful before Jehovah his God.
Chr. And in every work that he began in the service of the house of God,  in the law,  in the commandments, to seek his God, he did it with all his heart,  prospered.
Chr. After these things,  this faithfulness, Sennacherib king of Assyria came,  entered into Judah,  encamped against the fortified cities,  thought to win them for himself.
Chr. And when Hezekiah saw that Sennacherib came,  that he intended to fight against Jerusalem,
Chr. he took counsel with his rulers and his mighty men to stop the waters of the fountains which were outside the city. And they helped him.
Chr. So there was gathered together many people. And they stopped all the fountains,  the brook that flowed through the midst of the land, saying, Why should the kings of Assyria come,  find much water?
Chr. And he took courage,  built up all the wall that was broken down,  raised it up to the towers,  the other wall outside,  strengthened Millo in the city of David,  made weapons and shields in abundance.
Chr. And he set captains of war over the people,  gathered them together to him in the broad place at the gate of the city,  spoke encouragingly to them, saying,
Chr. Be strong and of good courage, be not afraid nor dismayed of the king of Assyria, nor of all the multitude that is with him. For there is a greater with us than with him.
Chr. With him is an arm of flesh,  with us is Jehovah our God to help us,  to fight our battles. And the people rested themselves upon the words of Hezekiah king of Judah.
Chr. After this Sennacherib king of Assyria sent his servants to Jerusalem (now he was before Lachish,  all his power with him) to Hezekiah king of Judah,  to all Judah that were at Jerusalem, saying,
Chr. Thus says Sennacherib king of Assyria, On what do ye trust that ye remain in the siege in Jerusalem?
Chr. Does not Hezekiah persuade you, to give you over to die by famine and by thirst, saying, Jehovah our God will deliver us out of the hand of the king of Assyria?
Chr. Has not the same Hezekiah taken away his high places and his altars,  commanded Judah and Jerusalem, saying, Ye shall worship before one altar,  upon it ye shall burn incense?
Chr. Know ye not what I and my fathers have done to all the peoples of the lands? Were the gods of the nations of the lands in any way able to deliver their land out of my hand?
Chr. Who was there among all the gods of those nations, which my fathers utterly destroyed, that could deliver his people out of my hand that your God should be able to deliver you out of my hand?
Chr. Now therefore let not Hezekiah deceive you, nor persuade you after this manner, neither believe ye him. For no god of any nation or kingdom was able to deliver his people out of my hand,  out of the hand of my fathers. How much less shall your God deliver you out of my hand?
Chr. And his servants spoke yet more against Jehovah God,  against his servant Hezekiah.
Chr. He also wrote letters, to rail on Jehovah, the God of Israel,  to speak against him, saying, As the gods of the nations of the lands, which have not delivered their people out of my hand, so shall the God of Hezekiah not deliver his people out of my hand.
Chr. And they cried with a loud voice in the Jews' language to the people of Jerusalem who were on the wall, to frighten them,  to trouble them, that they might take the city.
Chr. And they spoke of the God of Jerusalem, as of the gods of the peoples of the earth, which are the work of men's hands.
Chr. And Hezekiah the king,  Isaiah the prophet the son of Amoz, prayed because of this,  cried out to heaven.
Chr. And Jehovah sent an agent who cut off all the mighty men of valor,  the leaders and captains, in the camp of the king of Assyria. So he returned with shame of face to his own land. And when he came into the house of his god, those who came forth from his own bowels killed him there with the sword.
Chr. Thus Jehovah saved Hezekiah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem from the hand of Sennacherib the king of Assyria,  from the hand of all others,  guided them on every side.
Chr. And many brought gifts to Jehovah to Jerusalem,  precious things to Hezekiah king of Judah. So that he was exalted in the sight of all nations from thenceforth.
Chr. In those days Hezekiah was sick even to death,  he prayed to Jehovah. And he spoke to him,  gave him a sign.
Chr. But Hezekiah did not render again according to the benefit done to him. For his heart was lifted up. Therefore there was wrath upon him,  upon Judah and Jerusalem.
Chr. Notwithstanding Hezekiah humbled himself for the pride of his heart, both he and the inhabitants of Jerusalem, so that the wrath of Jehovah did not come upon them in the days of Hezekiah.
Chr. And Hezekiah had exceedingly much riches and honor. And he provided for him treasuries for silver,  for gold,  for precious stones,  for spices,  for shields,  for all manner of goodly vessels,
Chr. also store-houses for the increase of grain and new wine and oil,  stalls for all manner of beasts,  flocks in folds.
Chr. Moreover he provided for him cities,  possessions of flocks and herds in abundance. For God had given him very much substance.
Chr. This same Hezekiah also stopped the upper spring of the waters of Gihon,  brought them straight down on the west side of the city of David. And Hezekiah prospered in all his works.
Chr. However in the business of the ambassadors of the rulers of Babylon, who sent to him to inquire of the wonder that was done in the land, God left him, to try him, that he might know all that was in his heart.
Chr. Now the rest of the acts of Hezekiah,  his good deeds, behold, they are written in the vision of Isaiah the prophet the son of Amoz, in the book of the kings of Judah and Israel.
Chr. And Hezekiah slept with his fathers,  they buried him in the ascent of the sepulchers of the sons of David. And all Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem honored him at his death. And Manasseh his son reigned in his stead.
Chr. Manasseh was twelve years old when he began to reign,  he reigned fifty-five years in Jerusalem.
Chr. And he did that which was evil in the sight of Jehovah after the abominations of the nations whom Jehovah cast out before the sons of Israel.
Chr. For he built again the high places which Hezekiah his father had broken down. And he reared up altars for the Baalim,  made Asheroth,  worshiped all the host of heaven,  served them.
Chr. And he built altars in the house of Jehovah, of which Jehovah said, In Jerusalem shall my name be forever.
Chr. And he built altars for all the host of heaven in the two courts of the house of Jehovah.
