Chr. He also made his sons to pass through the fire in the valley of the son of Hinnom. And he practiced augury,  used enchantments,  practiced sorcery,  dealt with psychics,  with wizards. He wrought much evil in the sight of Jehovah, to provoke him to anger.
Chr. And he set the graven image of the idol which he had made, in the house of God, of which God said to David and to Solomon his son, In this house,  in Jerusalem, which I have chosen out of all the tribes of Israel, I will put my name forever,
Chr. neither will I any more remove the foot of Israel from off the land which I have appointed for your fathers, if only they will observe to do all that I have commanded them, even all the law and the statutes and the ordinances given by Moses.
Chr. And Manasseh seduced Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem, so that they did evil more than the nations did whom Jehovah destroyed before the sons of Israel.
Chr. And Jehovah spoke to Manasseh,  to his people,  they gave no heed.
Chr. Therefore Jehovah brought upon them the captains of the army of the king of Assyria, who took Manasseh in chains,  bound him with fetters,  carried him to Babylon.
Chr. And when he was in distress, he besought Jehovah his God,  humbled himself greatly before the God of his fathers.
Chr. And he prayed to him. And he was entreated of him,  heard his supplication,  brought him again to Jerusalem into his kingdom. Then Manasseh knew that Jehovah he was God.
Chr. Now after this he built an outer wall to the city of David, on the west side of Gihon, in the valley, even to the entrance at the fish gate. And he encompassed Ophel around with it,  raised it up to a very great height. And he put valiant captains in all the fortified cities of Judah.
Chr. And he took away the foreign gods,  the idol out of the house of Jehovah,  all the altars that he had built in the mount of the house of Jehovah,  in Jerusalem,  cast them out of the city.
Chr. And he built up the altar of Jehovah,  offered on it sacrifices of peace offerings and of thanksgiving,  commanded Judah to serve Jehovah, the God of Israel.
Chr. Nevertheless the people still sacrificed in the high places,  only to Jehovah their God.
Chr. Now the rest of the acts of Manasseh,  his prayer to his God,  the words of the seers who spoke to him in the name of Jehovah, the God of Israel, behold, they are written among the acts of the kings of Israel.
Chr. Also his prayer,  how God was entreated by him,  all his sin and his trespass,  the places in which he built high places,  set up the Asherim and the graven images, before he humbled himself, behold, they are written in the history of Hozai.
Chr. So Manasseh slept with his fathers,  they buried him in his own house. And Amon his son reigned in his stead.
Chr. Amon was twenty-two years old when he began to reign,  he reigned two years in Jerusalem.
Chr. And he did that which was evil in the sight of Jehovah, as did Manasseh his father. And Amon sacrificed to all the graven images which Manasseh his father had made,  served them.
Chr. And he did not humble himself before Jehovah, as Manasseh his father had humbled himself,  this same Amon trespassed more and more.
Chr. And his servants conspired against him,  put him to death in his own house.
Chr. But the people of the land killed all those who had conspired against king Amon. And the people of the land made Josiah his son king in his stead.
Chr. Josiah was eight years old when he began to reign,  he reigned thirty-one years in Jerusalem.
Chr. And he did that which was right in the eyes of Jehovah,  walked in the ways of David his father,  turned not aside to the right hand or to the left.
Chr. For in the eighth year of his reign, while he was yet young, he began to seek after the God of David his father. And in the twelfth year he began to purge Judah and Jerusalem from the high places,  the Asherim,  the graven images,  the molten images.
Chr. And they broke down the altars of the Baalim in his presence,  the sun-images that were on high above them he hewed down,  the Asherim,  the graven images,  the molten images, he broke in pieces,  made dust of them,  strewed it upon the graves of those who had sacrificed to them.
Chr. And he burnt the bones of the priests upon their altars,  purged Judah and Jerusalem.
Chr. And so also in the cities of Manasseh and Ephraim and Simeon, even to Naphtali, in their ruins round about.
Chr. And he broke down the altars,  beat the Asherim and the graven images into powder,  hewed down all the sun-images throughout all the land of Israel,  returned to Jerusalem.
Chr. Now in the eighteenth year of his reign, when he had purged the land and the house, he sent Shaphan the son of Azaliah,  Maaseiah the governor of the city,  Joah the son of Joahaz the recorder, to repair the house of Jehovah his God.
Chr. And they came to Hilkiah the high priest,  delivered the money that was brought into the house of God, which the Levites, the keepers of the threshold, had gathered by the hand of Manasseh and Ephraim,  by all the remnant of Israel,  by all Judah and Benjamin,  by the inhabitants of Jerusalem.
Chr. And they delivered it into the hand of the workmen who had the oversight of the house of Jehovah. And the workmen who labored in the house of Jehovah gave it to mend and repair the house.
Chr. Even to the carpenters and to the builders they gave it, to buy hewn stone,  timber for couplings,  to make beams for the houses which the kings of Judah had destroyed.
Chr. And the men did the work faithfully. And the overseers of them were Jahath and Obadiah, the Levites, of the sons of Merari,  Zechariah and Meshullam, of the sons of the Kohathites, to set it forward,  others of the Levites, all who were skilful with instruments of music.
Chr. Also they were over the bearers of burdens,  set forward all who did the work in every manner of service. And of the Levites there were scribes,  officers,  porters.
Chr. And when they brought out the money that was brought into the house of Jehovah, Hilkiah the priest found the book of the law of Jehovah given by Moses.
Chr. And Hilkiah answered and said to Shaphan the scribe, I have found the book of the law in the house of Jehovah. And Hilkiah delivered the book to Shaphan.
Chr. And Shaphan carried the book to the king,  moreover brought back word to the king, saying, All that was committed to thy servants, they are doing.
Chr. And they have emptied out the money that was found in the house of Jehovah,  have delivered it into the hand of the overseers,  into the hand of the workmen.
Chr. And Shaphan the scribe told the king, saying, Hilkiah the priest has delivered a book to me. And Shaphan read therein before the king.
Chr. And it came to pass, when the king had heard the words of the law, that he tore his clothes.
Chr. And the king commanded Hilkiah,  Ahikam the son of Shaphan,  Abdon the son of Micah,  Shaphan the scribe,  Asaiah the king's servant, saying,
Chr. Go ye, inquire of Jehovah for me,  for those who are left in Israel and in Judah, concerning the words of the book that is found. For great is the wrath of Jehovah that is poured out upon us, because our fathers have not kept the word of Jehovah, to do according to all that is written in this book.
Chr. So Hilkiah,  those whom the king had commanded, went to Huldah the prophetess, the wife of Shallum the son of Tokhath, the son of Hasrah, keeper of the wardrobe (now she dwelt in Jerusalem in the second quarter),  they spoke to her to that effect.
Chr. And she said to them, Thus says Jehovah, the God of Israel: Tell ye the man who sent you to me,
Chr. Thus says Jehovah, Behold, I will bring evil upon this place,  upon the inhabitants of it, even all the curses that are written in the book which they have read before the king of Judah.
Chr. Because they have forsaken me,  have burned incense to other gods, that they might provoke me to anger with all the works of their hands. Therefore my wrath is poured out upon this place,  it shall not be quenched.
Chr. But to the king of Judah, who sent you to inquire of Jehovah, thus ye shall say to him, Thus says Jehovah, the God of Israel: As concerning the words which thou have heard,
Chr. because thy heart was tender,  thou humbled thyself before God when thou heard his words against this place,  against the inhabitants of it,  have humbled thyself before me,  have torn thy clothes,  wept before me, I also have heard thee, says Jehovah.
Chr. Behold, I will gather thee to thy fathers,  thou shall be gathered to thy grave in peace, neither shall thine eyes see all the evil that I will bring upon this place,  upon the inhabitants of it. And they brought back word to the king.
Chr. Then the king sent and gathered together all the elders of Judah and Jerusalem.
Chr. And the king went up to the house of Jehovah,  all the men of Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem,  the priests,  the Levites,  all the people, both great and small. And he read in their ears all the words of the book of the covenant that was found in the house of Jehovah.
Chr. And the king stood in his place,  made a covenant before Jehovah, to walk after Jehovah,  to keep his commandments,  his testimonies,  his statutes, with all his heart,  with all his soul, to perform the words of the covenant that were written in this book.
Chr. And he caused all who were found in Jerusalem and Benjamin to stand to it. And the inhabitants of Jerusalem did according to the covenant of God, the God of their fathers.
Chr. And Josiah took away all the abominations out of all the countries that pertained to the sons of Israel,  made all who were found in Israel to serve, even to serve Jehovah their God. All his days they did not depart from following Jehovah, the God of their fathers.
Chr. And Josiah kept a Passover to Jehovah in Jerusalem. And they killed the Passover on the fourteenth day of the first month.
Chr. And he set the priests in their offices,  encouraged them to the service of the house of Jehovah.
Chr. And he said to the Levites who taught all Israel, who were holy to Jehovah, Put the holy ark in the house which Solomon the son of David king of Israel built. There shall no more be a burden upon your shoulders. Now serve Jehovah your God,  his people Israel.
Chr. And prepare yourselves after your fathers' houses by your divisions, according to the writing of David king of Israel,  according to the writing of Solomon his son.
Chr. And stand in the holy place according to the divisions of the fathers' houses of your brothers the sons of the people,  the portion of a fathers' house of the Levites.
Chr. And kill the Passover,  sanctify yourselves,  prepare for your brothers, to do according to the word of Jehovah by Moses.
Chr. And Josiah gave to the sons of the people, of the flock, lambs and kids, all of them for the Passover offerings, to all who were present, to the number of thirty thousand,  also three thousand bullocks; these were of the king's substance.
Chr. And his rulers gave for a freewill offering to the people, to the priests,  to the Levites. Hilkiah and Zechariah and Jehiel, the rulers of the house of God, gave to the priests for the Passover offerings two thousand and six hundred small cattle,  three hundred oxen.
Chr. Conaniah also,  Shemaiah and Nethanel, his brothers,  Hashabiah and Jeiel and Jozabad, the chiefs of the Levites, gave to the Levites for the Passover offerings five thousand small cattle,  five hundred oxen.
Chr. So the service was prepared,  the priests stood in their place,  the Levites by their divisions, according to the king's commandment.
Chr. And they killed the Passover,  the priests sprinkled the blood by their hand,  the Levites skinned them.
Chr. And they removed the burnt offerings that they might give them according to the divisions of the fathers' houses of the sons of the people, to offer to Jehovah as it is written in the book of Moses. And so they did with the oxen.
Chr. And they roasted the Passover with fire according to the ordinance. And the holy offerings they boiled in pots,  in caldrons,  in pans,  carried them quickly to all the sons of the people.
Chr. And afterward they prepared for themselves,  for the priests, because the priests the sons of Aaron were busy in offering the burnt offerings and the fat until night. Therefore the Levites prepared for themselves,  for the priests the sons of Aaron.
Chr. And the singers the sons of Asaph were in their place according to the commandment of David,  Asaph,  Heman,  Jeduthun the king's seer. And the porters were at every gate. They did not need to depart from their service, for their brothers the Levites prepared for them.
Chr. So all the service of Jehovah was prepared the same day, to keep the Passover,  to offer burnt offerings upon the altar of Jehovah, according to the commandment of king Josiah.
Chr. And the sons of Israel who were present kept the Passover at that time,  the feast of unleavened bread seven days.
Chr. And there was no Passover like to that kept in Israel from the days of Samuel the prophet. Neither did any of the kings of Israel keep such a Passover as Josiah kept,  the priests,  the Levites,  all Judah and Israel that were present,  the inhabitants of Jerusalem.
Chr. In the eighteenth year of the reign of Josiah this Passover was kept.
Chr. After all this, when Josiah had prepared the temple, Neco king of Egypt went up to fight against Carchemish by the Euphrates,  Josiah went out against him.
Chr. But he sent ambassadors to him, saying, What have I to do with thee, thou king of Judah? I come not against thee this day,  against the house with which I have war,  God has commanded me to make haste. Cease thee from meddling with God, who is with me, that he not destroy thee.
Chr. Nevertheless Josiah would not turn his face from him,  disguised himself that he might fight with him. And he did not hearken to the words of Neco from the mouth of God,  came to fight in the valley of Megiddo.
Chr. And the archers shot at king Josiah. And the king said to his servants, Remove me, for I am severely wounded.
Chr. So his servants took him out of the chariot,  put him in the second chariot that he had,  brought him to Jerusalem. And he died,  was buried in the sepulchers of his fathers. And all Judah and Jerusalem mourned for Josiah.
Chr. And Jeremiah lamented for Josiah. And all the singing men and singing women spoke of Josiah in their lamentations to this day. And they made them an ordinance in Israel, , behold, they are written in the lamentations.
Chr. Now the rest of the acts of Josiah,  his good deeds, according to that which is written in the law of Jehovah,
Chr. and his acts, first and last, behold, they are written in the book of the kings of Israel and Judah.
Chr. Then the people of the land took Jehoahaz the son of Josiah,  made him king in his father's stead in Jerusalem.
Chr. Joahaz was twenty-three years old when he began to reign,  he reigned three months in Jerusalem.
Chr. And the king of Egypt deposed him at Jerusalem,  fined the land a hundred talents of silver and a talent of gold.
Chr. And the king of Egypt made Eliakim his brother king over Judah and Jerusalem,  changed his name to Jehoiakim. And Neco took Joahaz his brother,  carried him to Egypt.
Chr. Jehoiakim was twenty-five years old when he began to reign,  he reigned eleven years in Jerusalem. And he did that which was evil in the sight of Jehovah his God.
Chr. Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon came up against him,  bound him in fetters to carry him to Babylon.
Chr. Nebuchadnezzar also carried of the vessels of the house of Jehovah to Babylon,  put them in his temple at Babylon.
Chr. Now the rest of the acts of Jehoiakim,  his abominations which he did,  that which was found in him, behold, they are written in the book of the kings of Israel and Judah. And Jehoiachin his son reigned in his stead.
Chr. Jehoiachin was eight years old when he began to reign,  he reigned three months and ten days in Jerusalem. And he did that which was evil in the sight of Jehovah.
Chr. And at the return of the year king Nebuchadnezzar sent,  brought him to Babylon, with the good vessels of the house of Jehovah,  made Zedekiah his brother king over Judah and Jerusalem.
Chr. Zedekiah was twenty-one years old when he began to reign,  he reigned eleven years in Jerusalem.
Chr. And he did that which was evil in the sight of Jehovah his God. He did not humble himself before Jeremiah the prophet speaking from the mouth of Jehovah.
Chr. And he also rebelled against king Nebuchadnezzar, who had made him swear by God. But he stiffened his neck,  hardened his heart against turning to Jehovah, the God of Israel.
Chr. Moreover all the chiefs of the priests,  the people, trespassed very greatly after all the abominations of the nations. And they polluted the house of Jehovah which he had hallowed in Jerusalem.
Chr. And Jehovah, the God of their fathers, sent to them by his messengers, rising up early and sending, because he had compassion on his people,  on his dwelling-place.
Chr. But they mocked the messengers of God,  despised his words,  scoffed at his prophets, until the wrath of Jehovah arose against his people, till there was no remedy.
Chr. Therefore he brought upon them the king of the Chaldeans, who killed their young men with the sword in the house of their sanctuary,  had no compassion upon young man or virgin, old man or hoary-headed. He gave them all into his hand.
Chr. And all the vessels of the house of God, great and small,  the treasures of the house of Jehovah,  the treasures of the king,  of his rulers, all these he brought to Babylon.
Chr. And they burnt the house of God,  broke down the wall of Jerusalem,  burnt all the palaces of it with fire,  destroyed all the good vessels of it.
Chr. And those who had escaped from the sword he carried away to Babylon,  they were servants to him and his sons until the reign of the kingdom of Persia,
Chr. to fulfill the word of Jehovah by the mouth of Jeremiah, until the land had enjoyed its sabbaths; as long as it lay desolate it kept sabbath, to fulfill seventy years.
Chr. Now in the first year of Cyrus king of Persia, that the word of Jehovah by the mouth of Jeremiah might be accomplished, Jehovah stirred up the spirit of Cyrus king of Persia, so that he made a proclamation throughout all his kingdom,  put it also in writing, saying,
Chr. Thus says Cyrus king of Persia, All the kingdoms of the earth has Jehovah, the God of heaven, given me. And he has charged me to build a house for him in Jerusalem, which is in Judah. Whoever there is among you of all his people, Jehovah his God be with him,  let him go up.
Ezra
Ezra. Now in the first year of Cyrus king of Persia, that the word of Jehovah by the mouth of Jeremiah might be accomplished, Jehovah stirred up the spirit of Cyrus king of Persia, so that he made a proclamation throughout all his kingdom,  put it also in writing, saying,
Ezra. Thus says Cyrus king of Persia, All the kingdoms of the earth has Jehovah, the God of heaven, given me,  he has charged me to build him a house in Jerusalem, which is in Judah.
Ezra. Whoever there is among you of all his people, his God be with him,  let him go up to Jerusalem, which is in Judah,  build the house of Jehovah, the God of Israel (he is God), which is in Jerusalem.
Ezra. And whoever is left, in any place where he sojourns, let the men of his place help him with silver,  with gold,  with goods,  with beasts, besides the freewill offering for the house of God which is in Jerusalem.
Ezra. Then the heads of fathers of Judah and Benjamin,  the priests,  the Levites, even all whose spirit God had stirred, rose up to go up to build the house of Jehovah which is in Jerusalem.
Ezra. And all those who were round about them strengthened their hands with vessels of silver, with gold, with goods,  with beasts,  with precious things, besides all that was willingly offered.
Ezra. Also Cyrus the king brought forth the vessels of the house of Jehovah, which Nebuchadnezzar had brought forth out of Jerusalem,  had put in the house of his gods,
Ezra. even those Cyrus king of Persia brought forth by the hand of Mithredath the treasurer,  numbered them to Sheshbazzar, the ruler of Judah.
Ezra. And this is the number of them: thirty platters of gold, a thousand platters of silver, twenty-nine knives,
Ezra. thirty bowls of gold, four hundred and ten silver bowls of a second sort,  a thousand other vessels.
Ezra. All the vessels of gold and of silver were five thousand and four hundred. All these Sheshbazzar brought up when those of the captivity were brought up from Babylon to Jerusalem.
Ezra. Now these are the sons of the province who went up out of the captivity of those who had been carried away, whom Nebuchadnezzar the king of Babylon had carried away to Babylon,  who returned to Jerusalem and Judah, every man to his city,
Ezra. who came with Zerubbabel, Jeshua, Nehemiah, Seraiah, Reelaiah, Mordecai, Bilshan, Mispar, Bigvai, Rehum, Baanah. The number of the men of the people of Israel:
Ezra. The sons of Parosh, two thousand a hundred seventy-two.
Ezra. The sons of Shephatiah, three hundred seventy-two.
Ezra. The sons of Arah, seven hundred seventy-five.
Ezra. The sons of Pahath-moab, of the sons of Jeshua and Joab, two thousand eight hundred and twelve.
Ezra. The sons of Elam, a thousand two hundred fifty-four.
Ezra. The sons of Zattu, nine hundred forty-five.
Ezra. The sons of Zaccai, seven hundred and sixty.
Ezra. The sons of Bani, six hundred forty-two.
Ezra. The sons of Bebai, six hundred twenty-three.
Ezra. The sons of Azgad, a thousand two hundred twenty-two.
Ezra. The sons of Adonikam, six hundred sixty-six.
Ezra. The sons of Bigvai, two thousand fifty-six.
Ezra. The sons of Adin, four hundred fifty-four.
Ezra. The sons of Ater, of Hezekiah, ninety-eight.
Ezra. The sons of Bezai, three hundred twenty-three.
Ezra. The sons of Jorah, a hundred and twelve.
Ezra. The sons of Hashum, two hundred twenty-three.
Ezra. The sons of Gibbar, ninety-five.
Ezra. The sons of Bethlehem, a hundred twenty-three.
Ezra. The men of Netophah, fifty-six.
Ezra. The men of Anathoth, a hundred twenty-eight.
Ezra. The sons of Azmaveth, forty-two.
Ezra. The sons of Kiriath-arim, Chephirah,  Beeroth, seven hundred and forty-three.
Ezra. The sons of Ramah and Geba, six hundred twenty-one.
Ezra. The men of Michmas, a hundred twenty-two.
Ezra. The men of Bethel and Ai, two hundred twenty-three.
Ezra. The sons of Nebo, fifty-two.
Ezra. The sons of Magbish, a hundred fifty-six.
Ezra. The sons of the other Elam, a thousand two hundred fifty-four.
Ezra. The sons of Harim, three hundred and twenty.
Ezra. The sons of Lod, Hadid,  Ono, seven hundred twenty-five.
Ezra. The sons of Jericho, three hundred forty-five.
Ezra. The sons of Senaah, three thousand and six hundred and thirty.
Ezra. The priests: the sons of Jedaiah, of the house of Jeshua, nine hundred seventy-three.
Ezra. The sons of Immer, a thousand fifty-two.
Ezra. The sons of Pashhur, a thousand two hundred forty-seven.
Ezra. The sons of Harim, a thousand and seventeen.
Ezra. The Levites: the sons of Jeshua and Kadmiel, of the sons of Hodaviah, seventy-four.
Ezra. The singers: the sons of Asaph, a hundred twenty-eight.
Ezra. The sons of the porters: the sons of Shallum, the sons of Ater, the sons of Talmon, the sons of Akkub, the sons of Hatita, the sons of Shobai, in all a hundred thirty-nine.
Ezra. The Nethinim: the sons of Ziha, the sons of Hasupha, the sons of Tabbaoth,
Ezra. the sons of Keros, the sons of Siaha, the sons of Padon,
Ezra. the sons of Lebanah, the sons of Hagabah, the sons of Akkub,
Ezra. the sons of Hagab, the sons of Shamlai, the sons of Hanan,
Ezra. the sons of Giddel, the sons of Gahar, the sons of Reaiah,
Ezra. the sons of Rezin, the sons of Nekoda, the sons of Gazzam,
Ezra. the sons of Uzza, the sons of Paseah, the sons of Besai,
Ezra. the sons of Asnah, the sons of Meunim, the sons of Nephisim,
Ezra. the sons of Bakbuk, the sons of Hakupha, the sons of Harhur,
Ezra. the sons of Bazluth, the sons of Mehida, the sons of Harsha,
Ezra. the sons of Barkos, the sons of Sisera, the sons of Temah,
Ezra. the sons of Neziah, the sons of Hatipha.
Ezra. The sons of Solomon's servants: the sons of Sotai, the sons of Hassophereth, the sons of Peruda,
Ezra. the sons of Jaalah, the sons of Darkon, the sons of Giddel,
Ezra. the sons of Shephatiah, the sons of Hattil, the sons of Pochereth-hazzebaim, the sons of Ami.
Ezra. All the Nethinim and the sons of Solomon's servants were three hundred ninety-two.
Ezra. And these were those who went up from Tel-melah, Tel-harsha, Cherub, Addan,  Immer,  they could not show their fathers' houses,  their seed, whether they were of Israel:
Ezra. the sons of Delaiah, the sons of Tobiah, the sons of Nekoda, six hundred fifty and two.
Ezra. And of the sons of the priests: the sons of Habaiah, the sons of Hakkoz, the sons of Barzillai who took a wife of the daughters of Barzillai the Gileadite,  was called after their name.
Ezra. These sought their registration among those that were reckoned by genealogy,  they were not found. Therefore they were deemed polluted and put away from the priesthood.
Ezra. And the governor said to them that they should not eat of the most holy things till there stood up a priest with Urim and with Thummim.
Ezra. The whole assembly together was forty-two thousand three hundred and sixty,
Ezra. besides their men-servants and their maid-servants, of whom there were seven thousand three hundred thirty-seven. And they had two hundred singing men and singing women.
Ezra. Their horses were seven hundred thirty-six, their mules, two hundred forty-five,
Ezra. their camels, four hundred thirty-five, their donkeys, six thousand seven hundred and twenty.
Ezra. And some of the heads of fathers, when they came to the house of Jehovah which is in Jerusalem, offered willingly for the house of God to set it up in its place.
Ezra. They gave after their ability into the treasury of the work sixty-one thousand darics of gold,  five thousand pounds of silver,  one hundred priests' garments.
Ezra. So the priests,  the Levites,  some of the people,  the singers,  the porters,  the Nethinim, dwelt in their cities,  all Israel in their cities.
Ezra. And when the seventh month came,  the sons of Israel were in the cities, the people gathered themselves together as one man to Jerusalem.
Ezra. Then Jeshua the son of Jozadak,  his brothers the priests,  Zerubbabel the son of Shealtiel,  his brothers, stood up and built the altar of the God of Israel, to offer burnt offerings on it as it is written in the law of Moses the man of God.
Ezra. And they set the altar upon its base, for fear was upon them because of the peoples of the countries. And they offered burnt offerings on it to Jehovah, even burnt offerings morning and evening.
Ezra. And they kept the feast of tabernacles as it is written,  offered the daily burnt offerings by number according to the ordinance, as the duty of every day required.
Ezra. And afterward the continual burnt offering,  the offerings of the new moons,  of all the set feasts of Jehovah that were consecrated,  of everyone who willingly offered a freewill offering to Jehovah.
Ezra. From the first day of the seventh month they began to offer burnt offerings to Jehovah. But the foundation of the temple of Jehovah was not yet laid.
Ezra. Also they gave money to the masons,  to the carpenters,  food,  drink,  oil, to those of Sidon,  to those of Tyre, to bring cedar trees from Lebanon to the sea, to Joppa, according to the grant that they had of Cyrus king of Persia.
Ezra. Now in the second year of their coming to the house of God at Jerusalem, in the second month, Zerubbabel the son of Shealtiel,  Jeshua the son of Jozadak,  the rest of their brothers the priests and the Levites,  all those who came out of the captivity to Jerusalem, began. And they appointed the Levites, from twenty years old and upward, to have the oversight of the work of the house of Jehovah.
Ezra. Then Jeshua with his sons and his brothers, Kadmiel and his sons, the sons of Judah, stood together to have the oversight of the workmen in the house of God: the sons of Henadad, with their sons and their brothers the Levites.
Ezra. And when the builders laid the foundation of the temple of Jehovah, they set the priests in their apparel with trumpets,  the Levites the sons of Asaph with cymbals, to praise Jehovah, after the order of David king of Israel.
Ezra. And they sang one to another in praising and giving thanks to Jehovah, saying, For he is good, for his loving kindness is forever toward Israel. And all the people shouted with a great shout, when they praised Jehovah, because the foundation of the house of Jehovah was laid.
Ezra. But many of the priests and Levites and heads of fathers, the old men who had seen the first house, when the foundation of this house was laid before their eyes, wept with a loud voice,  many shouted aloud for joy.
Ezra. So that the people could not discern the noise of the shout of joy from the noise of the weeping of the people, for the people shouted with a loud shout,  the noise was heard afar off.
Ezra. Now when the adversaries of Judah and Benjamin heard that the sons of the captivity were building a temple to Jehovah, the God of Israel,
Ezra. then they drew near to Zerubbabel,  to the heads of fathers,  said to them, Let us build with you, for we seek your God, as ye do,  we sacrifice to him since the days of Esar-haddon king of Assyria who brought us up here.
Ezra. But Zerubbabel,  Jeshua,  the rest of the heads of fathers of Israel, said to them, Ye have nothing to do with us in building a house to our God,  we ourselves together will build to Jehovah, the God of Israel, as king Cyrus the king of Persia has commanded us.
Ezra. Then the people of the land weakened the hands of the people of Judah,  troubled them in building,
Ezra. and hired counselors against them to frustrate their purpose all the days of Cyrus king of Persia, even until the reign of Darius king of Persia.
Ezra. And in the reign of Ahasuerus, in the beginning of his reign, they wrote an accusation against the inhabitants of Judah and Jerusalem.
Ezra. And in the days of Artaxerxes, Bishlam, Mithredath, Tabeel,  the rest of his companions, wrote to Artaxerxes king of Persia. And the writing of the letter was written in the Syrian character,  set forth in the Syrian tongue.
Ezra. Rehum the chancellor,  Shimshai the scribe wrote a letter against Jerusalem to Artaxerxes the king in this way.
Ezra. Then wrote Rehum the chancellor,  Shimshai the scribe,  the rest of their companions, the Dinaites,  the Apharsathchites, the Tarpelites, the Apharsites, the Archevites, the Babylonians, the Shushanchites, the Dehaites, the Elamites,
Ezra. and the rest of the nations whom the great and noble Osnappar brought over,  set in the city of Samaria,  in the rest beyond the River,  so forth.
Ezra. This is a copy of the letter that they sent to Artaxerxes the king: Thy servants the men beyond the River,  so forth.
Ezra. Be it known to the king, that the Jews who came up from thee have come to us to Jerusalem. They are building the rebellious and the evil city,  have finished the walls,  repaired the foundations.
Ezra. Be it known now to the king, that, if this city be built,  the walls finished, they will not pay tribute, custom, or toll,  in the end it will be hurtful to the kings.
Ezra. Now because we eat the salt of the palace,  it is not fitting for us to see the king's dishonor, therefore we have sent and certified to the king,
Ezra. that search may be made in the book of the records of thy fathers. So thou shall find in the book of the records,  know that this city is a rebellious city,  hurtful to kings and provinces. And that they have made sedition within the same of old time, for which cause this city was laid waste.
Ezra. We certify to the king that, if this city be built,  the walls finished, by this means thou shall have no portion beyond the River.
Ezra. Then the king sent an answer to Rehum the chancellor,  to Shimshai the scribe,  to the rest of their companions who dwell in Samaria,  in the rest beyond the River: Peace,  so forth.
Ezra. The letter which ye sent to us has been plainly read before me.
Ezra. And I decreed,  search has been made. And it is found that this city of old time has made insurrection against kings,  that rebellion and sedition have been made in it.
Ezra. There have also been mighty kings over Jerusalem who have ruled over all the country beyond the River,  tribute, custom,  toll, was paid to them.
Ezra. Make ye now a decree to cause these men to cease,  that this city not be built until a decree shall be made by me.
Ezra. And take heed that ye be not slack in this matter. Why should damage grow to the hurt of the kings?
Ezra. Then when the copy of king Artaxerxes' letter was read before Rehum,  Shimshai the scribe,  their companions, they went in haste to Jerusalem to the Jews,  made them cease by force and power.
Ezra. Then the work of the house of God which is at Jerusalem ceased,  it ceased until the second year of the reign of Darius king of Persia.
Ezra. Now the prophets, Haggai the prophet,  Zechariah the son of Iddo, prophesied to the Jews who were in Judah and Jerusalem, in the name of the God of Israel, to them.
Ezra. Then Zerubbabel the son of Shealtiel,  Jeshua the son of Jozadak, rose up and began to build the house of God which is at Jerusalem,  with them were the prophets of God, helping them.
Ezra. At the same time Tattenai, the governor beyond the River,  Shethar-bozenai,  their companions, came to them,  said thus to them, Who gave you a decree to build this house,  to finish this wall?
Ezra. Then we told them after this manner, namely, what the names of the men were who were making this building.
Ezra. But the eye of their God was upon the elders of the Jews,  they did not make them cease till the matter should come to Darius,  then answer should be returned by letter concerning it.
Ezra. The copy of the letter that Tattenai, the governor beyond the River,  Shethar-bozenai,  his companions the Apharsachites, who were beyond the River, sent to Darius the king;
Ezra. they sent a letter to him, in which was written thus: To Darius the king, all peace.
Ezra. Be it known to the king, that we went into the province of Judah to the house of the great God, which is built with great stones,  timber is laid in the walls. And this work goes on with diligence and prospers in their hands.
Ezra. Then we asked those elders,  said to them thus: Who gave you a decree to build this house,  to finish this wall?
Ezra. Also, we asked them their names, to certify to thee, that we might write the names of the men who were at the head of them.
Ezra. And thus they returned us an answer, saying, We are the servants of the God of heaven and earth. And are building the house that was built these many years ago, which a great king of Israel built and finished.
Ezra. But after that our fathers had provoked the God of heaven to wrath. He gave them into the hand of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, the Chaldean, who destroyed this house,  carried the people away into Babylon.
Ezra. But in the first year of Cyrus king of Babylon, Cyrus the king made a decree to build this house of God.
Ezra. And also the gold and silver vessels of the house of God, which Nebuchadnezzar took out of the temple that was in Jerusalem,  brought into the temple of Babylon, those Cyrus the king took out of the temple of Babylon,  they were delivered to one whose name was Sheshbazzar whom he had made governor.
Ezra. And he said to him, Take these vessels. Go put them in the temple that is in Jerusalem,  let the house of God be built in its place.
Ezra. Then the same Sheshbazzar came,  laid the foundations of the house of God which is in Jerusalem. And since that time even until now it has been in building,  yet it is not completed.
Ezra. Now therefore, if it seems good to the king, let there be search made in the king's treasure-house, which is there at Babylon, whether it be so, that a decree was made from Cyrus the king to build this house of God at Jerusalem,  let the king send his pleasure to us concerning this matter.
Ezra. Then Darius the king made a decree,  search was made in the house of the archives where the treasures were laid up in Babylon.
Ezra. And there was found at Achmetha, in the palace that is in the province of Media, a roll,  in it was thus written for a record:
Ezra. In the first year of Cyrus the king, Cyrus the king made a decree: Concerning the house of God at Jerusalem, let the house be built-the place where they offer sacrifices-and let the foundations of it be strongly laid, the height of it sixty cubits,  the breadth of it sixty cubits,
Ezra. with three courses of great stones,  a course of new timber. And let the expenses be given out of the king's house.
Ezra. And also let the gold and silver vessels of the house of God, which Nebuchadnezzar took forth out of the temple which is at Jerusalem,  brought to Babylon, be restored,  brought again to the temple which is at Jerusalem, every one to its place. And thou shall put them in the house of God.
Ezra. Now therefore, Tattenai, governor beyond the River, Shethar-bozenai,  your companions the Apharsachites, who are beyond the River, be ye far from there:
Ezra. Let the work of this house of God alone. Let the governor of the Jews and the elders of the Jews build this house of God in its place.
Ezra. Moreover I make a decree what ye shall do to these elders of the Jews for the building of this house of God: That of the king's goods, even of the tribute beyond the River, expenses be given with all diligence to these men, that they not be hindered.
Ezra. And that which they have need of, both young bullocks,  rams,  lambs, for burnt offerings to the God of heaven, also wheat, salt, wine,  oil, according to the word of the priests who are at Jerusalem, let it be given them day by day without fail
Ezra. that they may offer sacrifices of sweet savor to the God of heaven,  pray for the life of the king,  of his sons.
Ezra. Also I have made a decree, that whoever shall alter this word, let a beam be pulled out from his house,  let him be lifted up and fastened thereon,  let his house be made a dunghill for this.
Ezra. And the God who has caused his name to dwell there overthrow all kings and peoples who shall put forth their hand to alter the same, to destroy this house of God which is at Jerusalem. I Darius have made a decree, let it be done with all diligence.
Ezra. Then Tattenai, the governor beyond the River, Shethar-bozenai,  their companions, because of what Darius the king had sent, did accordingly with all diligence.
Ezra. And the elders of the Jews built and prospered, through the prophesying of Haggai the prophet and Zechariah the son of Iddo. And they built and finished it according to the commandment of the God of Israel,  according to the decree of Cyrus,  Darius,  Artaxerxes king of Persia.
Ezra. And this house was finished on the third day of the month Adar, which was in the sixth year of the reign of Darius the king.
Ezra. And the sons of Israel, the priests,  the Levites,  the rest of the sons of the captivity, kept the dedication of this house of God with joy.
Ezra. And they offered at the dedication of this house of God a hundred bullocks, two hundred rams, four hundred lambs. And for a sin offering for all Israel, twelve he-goats, according to the number of the tribes of Israel.
Ezra. And they set the priests in their divisions,  the Levites in their divisions, for the service of God, which is at Jerusalem, as it is written in the book of Moses.
Ezra. And the sons of the captivity kept the Passover upon the fourteenth day of the first month.
Ezra. For the priests and the Levites had purified themselves together, all of them were pure. And they killed the Passover for all the sons of the captivity,  for their brothers the priests,  for themselves.
Ezra. And the sons of Israel who came again out of the captivity,  all such as had separated themselves to them from the filthiness of the nations of the land, to seek Jehovah, the God of Israel, ate,
Ezra. and kept the feast of unleavened bread seven days with joy. For Jehovah had made them joyful,  had turned the heart of the king of Assyria to them, to strengthen their hands in the work of the house of God, the God of Israel.
Ezra. Now after these things, in the reign of Artaxerxes king of Persia, Ezra the son of Seraiah, the son of Azariah, the son of Hilkiah,
Ezra. the son of Shallum, the son of Zadok, the son of Ahitub,
Ezra. the son of Amariah, the son of Azariah, the son of Meraioth,
Ezra. the son of Zerahiah, the son of Uzzi, the son of Bukki,
Ezra. the son of Abishua, the son of Phinehas, the son of Eleazar, the son of Aaron the chief priest,
Ezra. this Ezra went up from Babylon. And he was a skilled scribe in the law of Moses, which Jehovah, the God of Israel, had given. And the king granted him all his request, according to the hand of Jehovah his God upon him.
Ezra. And some of the sons of Israel,  of the priests,  the Levites,  the singers,  the porters,  the Nethinim, went up to Jerusalem in the seventh year of Artaxerxes the king.
Ezra. And he came to Jerusalem in the fifth month, which was in the seventh year of the king.
Ezra. For upon the first day of the first month he began to go up from Babylon,  on the first day of the fifth month he came to Jerusalem, according to the good hand of his God upon him.
Ezra. For Ezra had set his heart to seek the law of Jehovah,  to do it,  to teach in Israel statutes and ordinances.
Ezra. Now this is the copy of the letter that the king Artaxerxes gave to Ezra the priest, the scribe, even the scribe of the words of the commandments of Jehovah,  of his statutes to Israel:
Ezra. Artaxerxes, king of kings, to Ezra the priest, the scribe of the law of the God of heaven, perfect and so forth.
Ezra. I make a decree, that all those of the people of Israel,  their priests and the Levites, in my realm, who are minded of their own free will to go to Jerusalem, go with thee.
Ezra. Forasmuch as thou are sent from the king and his seven counselors, to inquire concerning Judah and Jerusalem, according to the law of thy God which is in thy hand,
Ezra. and to carry the silver and gold, which the king and his counselors have freely offered to the God of Israel, whose habitation is in Jerusalem,
Ezra. and all the silver and gold that thou shall find in all the province of Babylon, with the freewill offering of the people,  of the priests, offering willingly, for the house of their God which is in Jerusalem.
Ezra. Therefore thou shall with all diligence buy with this money bullocks, rams, lambs, with their meal offerings and their drink offerings,  shall offer them upon the altar of the house of your God which is in Jerusalem.
Ezra. And whatever shall seem good to thee and to thy brothers to do with the rest of the silver and the gold, that do ye after the will of your God.
Ezra. And the vessels that are given thee for the service of the house of thy God, deliver thou before the God of Jerusalem.
Ezra. And whatever more shall be needful for the house of thy God, which thou shall have occasion to bestow, bestow it out of the king's treasure-house.
Ezra. And I, even I Artaxerxes the king, do make a decree to all the treasurers who are beyond the River, that whatever Ezra the priest, the scribe of the law of the God of heaven, shall require of you, it be done with all diligence,
Ezra. to a hundred talents of silver,  to a hundred measures of wheat,  to a hundred baths of wine,  to a hundred baths of oil,  salt without prescribing how much.
Ezra. Whatever is commanded by the God of heaven, let it be done exactly for the house of the God of heaven; for why should there be wrath against the realm of the king and his sons?
Ezra. Also we certify to you, that concerning any of the priests and Levites, the singers, porters, Nethinim, or servants of this house of God, it shall not be lawful to impose tribute, custom, or toll, upon them.
Ezra. And thou, Ezra, according to the wisdom of thy God, that is in thy hand, appoint magistrates and judges, who may judge all the people who are beyond the River, all such as know the laws of thy God,  teach ye him who does not know them.
Ezra. And whoever will not do the law of thy God,  the law of the king, let judgment be executed upon him with all diligence, whether it be to death, or to banishment, or to confiscation of goods, or to imprisonment.
Ezra. Blessed be Jehovah, the God of our fathers, who has put such a thing as this in the king's heart, to beautify the house of Jehovah which is in Jerusalem,
Ezra. and has extended loving kindness to me before the king,  his counselors,  before all the king's mighty rulers. And I was strengthened according to the hand of Jehovah my God upon me,  I gathered together out of Israel chief men to go up with me.
Ezra. Now these are the heads of their fathers,  this is the genealogy of those who went up with me from Babylon, in the reign of Artaxerxes the king:
Ezra. of the sons of Phinehas, Gershom; of the sons of Ithamar, Daniel; of the sons of David, Hattush;
Ezra. of the sons of Shecaniah, of the sons of Parosh, Zechariah,  with him were reckoned by genealogy of the males a hundred and fifty;
Ezra. of the sons of Pahath-moab, Eliehoenai the son of Zerahiah,  with him two hundred males;
Ezra. of the sons of Shecaniah, the son of Jahaziel,  with him three hundred males;
Ezra. and of the sons of Adin, Ebed the son of Jonathan,  with him fifty males;
Ezra. and of the sons of Elam, Jeshaiah the son of Athaliah,  with him seventy males;
Ezra. and of the sons of Shephatiah, Zebadiah the son of Michael,  with him eighty males;
Ezra. of the sons of Joab, Obadiah the son of Jehiel,  with him two hundred and eighteen males;
Ezra. and of the sons of Shelomith, the son of Josiphiah,  with him a hundred and sixty males;
Ezra. and of the sons of Bebai, Zechariah the son of Bebai,  with him twenty-eight males;
Ezra. and of the sons of Azgad, Johanan the son of Hakkatan,  with him a hundred and ten males;
Ezra. And of the sons of Adonikam, who were the last,  these are their names: Eliphelet, Jeuel,  Shemaiah,  with them sixty males;
Ezra. and of the sons of Bigvai, Uthai and Zabbud,  with them seventy males.
Ezra. And I gathered them together to the river that runs to Ahava,  there we encamped three days. And I viewed the people,  the priests,  found there none of the sons of Levi.
Ezra. Then I sent for Eliezer, for Ariel, for Shemaiah,  for Elnathan,  for Jarib,  for Elnathan,  for Nathan,  for Zechariah,  for Meshullam, chief men, also for Joiarib,  for Elnathan, who were teachers.
Ezra. And I sent them forth to Iddo the chief at the place Casiphia,  I told them what they should say to Iddo,  his brothers the Nethinim, at the place Casiphia, that they should bring to us ministers for the house of our God.
Ezra. And according to the good hand of our God upon us they brought us a man of discretion, of the sons of Mahli, the son of Levi, the son of Israel,  Sherebiah, with his sons and his brothers, eighteen,
Ezra. and Hashabiah,  with him Jeshaiah of the sons of Merari, his brothers and their sons, twenty,
Ezra. and of the Nethinim, whom David and the rulers had given for the service of the Levites, two hundred and twenty Nethinim. All of them were mentioned by name.
Ezra. Then I proclaimed a fast there, at the river Ahava, that we might humble ourselves before our God, to seek of him a straight way for us,  for our little ones,  for all our substance.
Ezra. For I was ashamed to ask of the king a band of soldiers and horsemen to help us against the enemy in the way, because we had spoken to the king, saying, The hand of our God is upon all those who seek him, for good,  his power and his wrath are against all those who forsake him.
Ezra. So we fasted and besought our God for this,  he was entreated by us.
Ezra. Then I set apart twelve of the chiefs of the priests, even Sherebiah, Hashabiah,  ten of their brothers with them,
Ezra. and weighed to them the silver,  the gold,  the vessels, even the offering for the house of our God, which the king,  his counselors,  his rulers,  all Israel there present, had offered.
Ezra. I weighed into their hand six hundred and fifty talents of silver,  a hundred talents of silver vessels, a hundred talents of gold,
Ezra. and twenty bowls of gold, of a thousand darics,  two vessels of fine bright brass, precious as gold.
Ezra. And I said to them, Ye are holy to Jehovah,  the vessels are holy,  the silver and the gold are a freewill offering to Jehovah, the God of your fathers.
Ezra. Watch ye,  keep them, until ye weigh them before the chiefs of the priests and the Levites,  the rulers of the fathers of Israel, at Jerusalem, in the chambers of the house of Jehovah.
Ezra. So the priests and the Levites received the weight of the silver and the gold,  the vessels, to bring them to Jerusalem to the house of our God.
Ezra. Then we departed from the river Ahava on the twelfth day of the first month, to go to Jerusalem. And the hand of our God was upon us,  he delivered us from the hand of the enemy and the ambushment by the way.
Ezra. And we came to Jerusalem,  abode there three days.
Ezra. And on the fourth day the silver and the gold and the vessels were weighed in the house of our God into the hand of Meremoth the son of Uriah the priest,  with him was Eleazar the son of Phinehas,  with them was Jozabad the son of Jeshua,  Noadiah the son of Binnui, the Levite,
Ezra. the whole by number and by weight. And all the weight was written at that time.
Ezra. The sons of the captivity, who came out of exile, offered burnt offerings to the God of Israel, twelve bullocks for all Israel, ninety-six rams, seventy-seven lambs, twelve he-goats for a sin offering. All this was a burnt offering to Jehovah.
Ezra. And they delivered the king's commissions to the king's satraps,  to the governors beyond the River. And they furthered the people and the house of God.
Ezra. Now when these things were done, the rulers drew near to me, saying, The people of Israel,  the priests and the Levites, have not separated themselves from the peoples of the lands, doing according to their abominations, even of the Canaanites, the Hittites, the Perizzites, the Jebusites, the Ammonites, the Moabites, the Egyptians,  the Amorites.
Ezra. For they have taken of their daughters for themselves and for their sons, so that the holy seed have mingled themselves with the peoples of the lands. Yea, the hand of the heads and rulers has been chief in this trespass.
Ezra. And when I heard this thing, I tore my garment and my robe,  plucked off the hair of my head and of my beard,  sat down confounded.
Ezra. Then everyone who trembled at the words of the God of Israel were assembled to me, because of the trespass of those of the captivity,  I sat confounded until the evening oblation.
Ezra. And at the evening oblation I arose up from my humiliation, even with my garment and my robe torn,  I fell upon my knees,  spread out my hands to Jehovah my God,
Ezra. and I said, O my God, I am ashamed and blush to lift up my face to thee, my God, for our iniquities are increased over our head,  our guiltiness has grown up to the heavens.
Ezra. Since the days of our fathers we have been exceedingly guilty to this day. And for our iniquities have we, our kings,  our priests, been delivered into the hand of the kings of the lands, to the sword, to captivity,  to plunder,  to confusion of face, as it is this day.
Ezra. And now for a little moment grace has been shown from Jehovah our God, to leave us a remnant to escape,  to give us a nail in his holy place, that our God may lighten our eyes,  give us a little reviving in our bondage.
Ezra. For we are bondmen, yet our God has not forsaken us in our bondage,  has extended loving kindness to us in the sight of the kings of Persia, to give us a reviving, to set up the house of our God,  to repair the ruins of it,  to give us a wall in Judah and in Jerusalem.
Ezra. And now, O our God, what shall we say after this? For we have forsaken thy commandments,
Ezra. which thou have commanded by thy servants the prophets, saying, The land, to which ye go to possess it, is an unclean land through the uncleanness of the peoples of the lands, through their abominations, which have filled it from one end to another with their filthiness.
Ezra. Now therefore do not give your daughters to their sons, neither take their daughters to your sons, nor seek their peace or their prosperity forever, that ye may be strong,  eat the good of the land,  leave it for an inheritance to your sons forever.
Ezra. And after all that has come upon us for our evil deeds,  for our great guilt, seeing that thou our God have punished us less than our iniquities deserve,  have given us such a remnant,
Ezra. shall we again break thy commandments,  join in affinity with the peoples who do these abominations? Would thou not be angry with us till thou had consumed us, so that there should be no remnant, nor any to escape?
Ezra. O Jehovah, the God of Israel, thou are righteous, for we are left a remnant that is escaped, as it is this day. Behold, we are before thee in our guiltiness, for none can stand before thee because of this.
Ezra. Now while Ezra prayed and made confession, weeping and casting himself down before the house of God, there was gathered together to him out of Israel a very great assembly of men and women and children, for the people wept very much.
Ezra. And Shecaniah the son of Jehiel, one of the sons of Elam, answered and said to Ezra, We have trespassed against our God,  have married foreign women of the peoples of the land. Yet now there is hope for Israel concerning this thing.
Ezra. Now therefore let us make a covenant with our God to put away all the wives,  such as are born of them, according to the counsel of my lord,  of those who tremble at the commandment of our God,  let it be done according to the law.
Ezra. Arise, for the matter belongs to thee,  we are with thee. Be of good courage,  do it.
Ezra. Then Ezra arose,  made the chiefs of the priests, the Levites,  all Israel, to swear that they would do according to this word. So they swore.
Ezra. Then Ezra rose up from before the house of God,  went into the chamber of Jehohanan the son of Eliashib. And when he came there, he ate no bread, nor drank water, for he mourned because of the trespass of those of the captivity.
Ezra. And they made proclamation throughout Judah and Jerusalem to all the sons of the captivity, that they should gather themselves together to Jerusalem.
Ezra. And that whoever did not come within three days, according to the counsel of the rulers and the elders, all his substance should be forfeited,  himself separated from the assembly of the captivity.
Ezra. Then all the men of Judah and Benjamin gathered themselves together to Jerusalem within the three days. It was the ninth month, on the twentieth day of the month,  all the people sat in the broad place before the house of God, trembling because of this matter,  for the great rain.
Ezra. And Ezra the priest stood up,  said to them, Ye have trespassed,  have married foreign women to increase the guilt of Israel.
Ezra. Now therefore make confession to Jehovah, the God of your fathers,  do his pleasure,  separate yourselves from the peoples of the land,  from the foreign women.
Ezra. Then all the assembly answered and said with a loud voice, As thou have said concerning us, so must we do.
Ezra. But the people are many,  it is a time of much rain,  we are not able to stand outside. Neither is this a work of one day or two, for we have greatly transgressed in this matter.
Ezra. Let now our rulers be appointed for all the assembly,  let all those who are in our cities who have married foreign women come at appointed times,  with them the elders of every city,  the judges thereof, until the fierce wrath of our God be turned from us, until this matter be dispatched.
Ezra. Only Jonathan the son of Asahel and Jahzeiah the son of Tikvah stood up against this,  Meshullam and Shabbethai the Levite helped them.
Ezra. And the sons of the captivity did so. And Ezra the priest, with certain heads of fathers, after their fathers' houses,  all of them by their names, were set apart. And they sat down in the first day of the tenth month to examine the matter.
Ezra. And they made an end with all the men who had married foreign women by the first day of the first month.
Ezra. And among the sons of the priests there were found who had married foreign women, namely, of the sons of Jeshua, the son of Jozadak,  his brothers, Maaseiah,  Eliezer,  Jarib,  Gedaliah.
Ezra. And they gave their hand that they would put away their wives. And being guilty, they offered a ram of the flock for their guilt.
Ezra. And of the sons of Immer: Hanani and Zebadiah.
Ezra. And of the sons of Harim: Maaseiah,  Elijah,  Shemaiah,  Jehiel,  Uzziah.
Ezra. And of the sons of Pashhur: Elioenai, Maaseiah, Ishmael, Nethanel, Jozabad,  Elasah.
Ezra. And of the Levites: Jozabad,  Shimei,  Kelaiah (the same is Kelita), Pethahiah, Judah,  Eliezer.
Ezra. And of the singers: Eliashib. And of the porters: Shallum,  Telem,  Uri.
Ezra. And of Israel: Of the sons of Parosh, Ramiah,  Izziah,  Malchijah,  Mijamin,  Eleazar,  Malchijah,  Benaiah.
Ezra. And of the sons of Elam: Mattaniah, Zechariah,  Jehiel,  Abdi,  Jeremoth,  Elijah.
Ezra. And of the sons of Zattu: Elioenai, Eliashib, Mattaniah,  Jeremoth,  Zabad,  Aziza.
Ezra. And of the sons of Bebai: Jehohanan, Hananiah, Zabbai, Athlai.
Ezra. And of the sons of Bani: Meshullam, Malluch,  Adaiah, Jashub,  Sheal, Jeremoth.
Ezra. And of the sons of Pahath-moab: Adna,  Chelal, Benaiah, Maaseiah, Mattaniah, Bezalel,  Binnui,  Manasseh.
Ezra. And of the sons of Harim: Eliezer, Isshijah, Malchijah, Shemaiah, Shimeon,
Ezra. Benjamin, Malluch, Shemariah.
Ezra. Of the sons of Hashum: Mattenai, Mattattah, Zabad, Eliphelet, Jeremai, Manasseh, Shimei.
Ezra. Of the sons of Bani: Maadai, Amram,  Uel,
Ezra. Benaiah, Bedeiah, Cheluhi,
Ezra. Vaniah, Meremoth, Eliashib,
Ezra. Mattaniah, Mattenai,  Jaasu,
Ezra. and Bani,  Binnui, Shimei,
Ezra. and Shelemiah,  Nathan,  Adaiah,
Ezra. Machnadebai, Shashai, Sharai,
Ezra. Azarel,  Shelemiah, Shemariah,
Ezra. Shallum, Amariah, Joseph.
Ezra. Of the sons of Nebo: Jeiel, Mattithiah, Zabad, Zebina, Iddo,  Joel, Benaiah.
Ezra. All these had taken foreign wives,  some of them had wives by whom they had sons.
Nehemiah
The words of Nehemiah the son of Hacaliah. Now it came to pass in the month Chislev, in the twentieth year, as I was in Shushan the palace,
that Hanani, one of my brothers, came, he and certain men out of Judah. And I asked them concerning the Jews who had escaped, that were left of the captivity,  concerning Jerusalem.
they said to me, The remnant who are left of the captivity there in the province are in great affliction and reproach. Also the wall of Jerusalem is broken down,  the gates of it are burned with fire.
it came to pass, when I heard these words, that I sat down and wept,  mourned certain days. And I fasted and prayed before the God of heaven,
said, I beseech thee, O Jehovah, the God of heaven, the great and awesome God, who keeps covenant and loving kindness with those who love him and keep his commandments:
Let thine ear now be attentive,  thine eyes open, that thou may hearken to the prayer of thy servant, which I pray before thee at this time, day and night, for the sons of Israel thy servants while I confess the sins of the sons of Israel, which we have sinned against thee. Yea, I and my father's house have sinned.
We have dealt very corruptly against thee,  have not kept the commandments, nor the statutes, nor the ordinances, which thou commanded thy servant Moses.
Remember, I beseech thee, the word that thou commanded thy servant Moses, saying, If ye trespass, I will scatter you abroad among the peoples,
but if ye return to me,  keep my commandments and do them, though your outcasts were in the outermost part of the heavens, yet I will gather them from there,  will bring them to the place that I have chosen, to cause my name to dwell there.
Now these are thy servants and thy people whom thou have redeemed by thy great power,  by thy strong hand.
O Lord, I beseech thee, let now thine ear be attentive to the prayer of thy servant,  to the prayer of thy servants, who delight to fear thy name, , I pray thee, prosper thy servant this day,  grant him mercy in the sight of this man. Now I was cupbearer to the king.
it came to pass in the month Nisan, in the twentieth year of Artaxerxes the king, when wine was before him, that I took up the wine,  gave it to the king. Now I had not formerly been sad in his presence.
the king said to me, Why is thy countenance sad, seeing thou are not sick? This is nothing else but sorrow of heart. Then I was very much afraid.
I said to the king, Let the king live forever. Why should not my countenance be sad, when the city, the place of my fathers' sepulchers, lies waste,  the gates of it are consumed with fire?
Then the king said to me, For what do thou make request? So I prayed to the God of heaven.
I said to the king, If it please the king,  if thy servant has found favor in thy sight, that thou would send me to Judah, to the city of my fathers' sepulchers, that I may build it.
the king said to me (the queen also sitting by him), For how long shall thy journey be? And when will thou return? So it pleased the king to send me,  I set him a time.
Moreover I said to the king, If it please the king, let letters be given to me to the governors beyond the River, that they may let me pass through till I come to Judah,
a letter to Asaph the keeper of the king's forest, that he may give me timber to make beams for the gates of the castle which appertains to the house,  for the wall of the city,  for the house that I shall enter into. And the king granted me, according to the good hand of my God upon me.
Then I came to the governors beyond the River,  gave them the king's letters. Now the king had sent with me captains of the army and horsemen.
when Sanballat the Horonite,  Tobiah the servant, the Ammonite, heard of it, it grieved them exceedingly that there came a man to seek the welfare of the sons of Israel.
So I came to Jerusalem,  was there three days.
I arose in the night, I and some few men with me. I neither told any man what my God put into my heart to do for Jerusalem, nor was there any beast with me except the beast that I rode upon.
I went out by night by the valley gate, even toward the jackal's well and to the dung gate,  viewed the walls of Jerusalem, which were broken down,  the gates of it were consumed with fire.
Then I went on to the fountain gate and to the king's pool,  there was no place for the beast that was under me to pass.
Then I went up in the night by the brook,  viewed the wall. And I turned back,  entered by the valley gate,  so returned.
the rulers did not know where I went, or what I did, neither had I as yet told it to the Jews, nor to the priests, nor to the ranking men, nor to the rulers, nor to the rest who did the work.
Then I said to them, Ye see the evil condition that we are in, how Jerusalem lies waste,  the gates of it are burned with fire. Come,  let us build up the wall of Jerusalem that we be no more a reproach.
I told them of the hand of my God which was good upon me, as also of the king's words that he had spoken to me. And they said, Let us rise up and build. So they strengthened their hands for the good work.
But when Sanballat the Horonite,  Tobiah the servant, the Ammonite,  Geshem the Arabian, heard it, they laughed us to scorn,  despised us,  said, What is this thing that ye do? Will ye rebel against the king?
Then I answered them,  said to them, The God of heaven, he will prosper us. Therefore we his servants will arise and build,  ye have no portion, nor right, nor memorial, in Jerusalem.
Then Eliashib the high priest rose up with his brothers the priests,  they built the sheep gate. They sanctified it,  set up the doors of it, even to the tower of Hammeah they sanctified it, to the tower of Hananel.
next to him the men of Jericho built. And next to them Zaccur the son of Imri built.
the sons of Hassenaah built the fish gate. They laid the beams of it,  set up the doors of it, the bolts of it,  the bars of it.
next to them Meremoth the son of Uriah, the son of Hakkoz repaired. And next to them Meshullam the son of Berechiah, the son of Meshezabel repaired. And next to them Zadok the son of Baana repaired.
next to them the Tekoites repaired,  their ranking men did not put their necks to the work of their lord.
the old gate Joiada the son of Paseah and Meshullam the son of Besodeiah repaired. They laid the beams of it,  set up the doors of it,  the bolts of it,  the bars of it.
next to them Melatiah the Gibeonite,  Jadon the Meronothite, the men of Gibeon,  of Mizpah, who pertained to the throne of the governor beyond the River, repaired.
Next to him Uzziel the son of Harhaiah, goldsmiths, repaired. And next to him Hananiah one of the perfumers repaired. And they fortified Jerusalem even to the broad wall.
next to them Rephaiah the son of Hur, the ruler of half the district of Jerusalem, repaired.
next to them Jedaiah the son of Harumaph, repaired opposite his house. And next to him Hattush the son of Hashabneiah repaired.
Malchijah the son of Harim,  Hasshub the son of Pahath-moab, repaired another portion,  the tower of the furnaces.
next to him Shallum the son of Hallohesh, the ruler of half the district of Jerusalem, repaired, he and his daughters.
Hanun,  the inhabitants of Zanoah, repaired the valley gate. They built it,  set up the doors of it, the bolts of it,  the bars of it,  a thousand cubits of the wall to the dung gate.
Malchijah the son of Rechab, the ruler of the district of Beth-haccherem, repaired the dung gate. He built it,  set up the doors of it, the bolts of it,  the bars of it.
Shallun the son of Col-hozeh, the ruler of the district of Mizpah, repaired the fountain gate. He built it,  covered it,  set up the doors of it, the bolts of it,  the bars of it,  the wall of the pool of Shelah by the king's garden, even to the stairs that go down from the city of David.
After him Nehemiah the son of Azbuk, the ruler of half the district of Beth-zur, repaired to the place opposite the sepulchers of David,  to the pool that was made,  to the house of the mighty men.
After him the Levites, Rehum the son of Bani, repaired. Next to him Hashabiah, the ruler of half the district of Keilah, repaired for his district.
After him their brothers, Bavvai the son of Henadad, the ruler of half the district of Keilah, repaired.
next to him Ezer the son of Jeshua, the ruler of Mizpah, repaired another portion opposite the ascent to the armory at the turning of the wall.
After him Baruch the son of Zabbai earnestly repaired another portion, from the turning of the wall to the door of the house of Eliashib the high priest.
After him Meremoth the son of Uriah the son of Hakkoz repaired another portion, from the door of the house of Eliashib even to the end of the house of Eliashib.
after him the priests, the men of the Plain, repaired.
After them Benjamin and Hasshub repaired opposite their house. After them Azariah the son of Maaseiah the son of Ananiah repaired beside his own house.
After him Binnui the son of Henadad repaired another portion, from the house of Azariah to the turning of the wall,  to the corner.
Palal the son of Uzai repaired opposite the turning of the wall,  the tower that stands out from the upper house of the king, which is by the court of the guard. After him Pedaiah the son of Parosh repaired.
Now the Nethinim dwelt in Ophel, to the place opposite the water gate toward the east,  the tower that stands out.)
After him the Tekoites repaired another portion, opposite the great tower that stands out,  to the wall of Ophel.
The priests repaired above the horse gate, every man opposite his own house.
After them Zadok the son of Immer repaired opposite his own house. And after him Shemaiah the son of Shecaniah, the keeper of the east gate, repaired.
After him Hananiah the son of Shelemiah,  Hanun the sixth son of Zalaph, repaired another portion. After him Meshullam the son of Berechiah repaired opposite his chamber.
After him Malchijah one of the goldsmiths to the house of the Nethinim,  of the merchants, repaired opposite the gate of Hammiphkad,  to the ascent of the corner.
between the ascent of the corner and the sheep gate the goldsmiths and the merchants repaired.
But it came to pass that, when Sanballat heard that we were building the wall, he was angry,  took great indignation,  mocked the Jews.
he spoke before his brothers and the army of Samaria,  said, What are these feeble Jews doing? Will they fortify themselves? Will they sacrifice? Will they finish in a day? Will they revive the stones out of the heaps of rubbish, seeing they are burnt?
Now Tobiah the Ammonite was by him,  he said, Even that which they are building, if a fox goes up he shall break down their stone wall.
Hear, O our God, for we are despised,  so turn back their reproach upon their own head,  give them up for a spoil in a land of captivity,
do not cover their iniquity,  let not their sin be blotted out from before thee, for they have provoked thee to anger before the builders.
So we built the wall,  all the wall was joined together to half the height of it, for the people had a mind to work.
But it came to pass that, when Sanballat,  Tobiah,  the Arabians,  the Ammonites,  the Ashdodites, heard that the repairing of the walls of Jerusalem went forward,  that the breaches began to be stopped, then they were very angry,
all of them together conspired to come and fight against Jerusalem,  to cause confusion therein.
But we made our prayer to our God,  set a watch against them day and night, because of them.
Judah said, The strength of the bearers of burdens has become feeble,  there is much rubbish, so that we are not able to build the wall.
our adversaries said, They shall not know, neither see, till we come into the midst of them,  kill them,  cause the work to cease.
it came to pass that, when the Jews who dwelt by them came, they said to us ten times, From all places from where ye shall return to us they will be upon you.
Therefore I set in the lowest parts of the space behind the wall, in the open places, I set there the people after their families with their swords, their spears,  their bows.
I looked,  rose up,  said to the ranking men,  to the rulers,  to the rest of the people, Be not ye afraid of them. Remember the Lord, who is great and awesome,  fight for your brothers, your sons,  your daughters, your wives,  your houses.
it came to pass, when our enemies heard that it was known to us,  God had brought their counsel to naught, that we returned all of us to the wall, every man to his work.
it came to pass from that time forth, that half of my servants labored in the work,  half of them held the spears, the shields,  the bows,  the coats of mail. And the rulers were behind all the house of Judah.
They all built the wall,  those who bore burdens loaded themselves, every man with one of his hands labored in the work,  with the other held his weapon,
the builders, every man had his sword girded by his side,  so built. And he who sounded the trumpet was by me.
I said to the ranking men,  to the rulers and to the rest of the people, The work is great and large,  we are separated upon the wall, one far from another.
In whatever place ye hear the sound of the trumpet, gather ye there to us, our God will fight for us.
So we labored in the work,  half of them held the spears from the rising of the morning till the stars appeared.
Likewise at the same time I said to the people, Let each with his servant lodge within Jerusalem that in the night they may be a guard to us,  may labor in the day.
So neither I, nor my brothers, nor my servants, nor the men of the guard who followed me, none of us put off our clothes, everyone went with his weapon to the water.
Then there arose a great cry of the people and of their wives against their brothers the Jews.
For there were who said, We, our sons and our daughters, are many. Let us get grain that we may eat and live.
There were some also who said, We are mortgaging our fields,  our vineyards,  our houses. Let us get grain because of the dearth.
There were also who said, We have borrowed money for the king's tribute upon our fields and our vineyards.
Yet now our flesh is as the flesh of our brothers, our sons as their sons. And, lo, we bring into bondage our sons and our daughters to be servants,  some of our daughters are brought into bondage already. Neither is it in our power to help it, for other men have our fields and our vineyards.
I was very angry when I heard their cry and these words.
Then I consulted with myself,  contended with the ranking men and the rulers,  said to them, Ye exact usury, everyone of his brother. And I held a great assembly against them.
I said to them, According to our ability we have redeemed our brothers the Jews, who were sold to the nations,  would ye even sell your brothers,  should they be sold to us? Then they were silent,  found not a word.
Also I said, The thing that ye do is not good. Ought ye not to walk in the fear of our God, because of the reproach of the nations our enemies?
I likewise, my brothers and my servants, lend them money and grain. I pray you, let us leave off this usury.
Restore, I pray you, to them, even this day, their fields, their vineyards, their oliveyards,  their houses, also the hundredth part of the money,  of the grain, the new wine,  the oil, that ye exact of them.
Then they said, We will restore them,  will require nothing of them, so will we do, even as thou say. Then I called the priests,  took an oath from them that they would do according to this promise.
Also I shook out my lap,  said, So God shake out every man from his house,  from his labor, who does not perform this promise, even thus be he shaken out and emptied. And all the assembly said, Truly,  praised Jehovah. And the people did according to this promise.
Moreover from the time that I was appointed to be their governor in the land of Judah, from the twentieth year even to the thirty-second year of Artaxerxes the king, that is, twelve years, I and my brothers have not eaten the bread of the governor.
But the former governors who were before me charged the people,  took bread and wine from them, besides forty shekels of silver. Yes, even their servants bore rule over the people. But I did not so, because of the fear of God.
Yea, also I continued in the work of this wall, neither did we buy any land. And all my servants were gathered there to the work.
Moreover there were at my table, of the Jews and the rulers, a hundred and fifty men, besides those who came to us from among the nations that were round about us.
Now that which was prepared for one day was one ox and six choice sheep, also fowls were prepared for me,  once in ten days store of all sorts of wine. Yet for all this I did not demand the bread of the governor, because the bondage was heavy upon this people.
Remember to me, O my God, for good, all that I have done for this people.
Now it came to pass, when it was reported to Sanballat and Tobiah,  to Geshem the Arabian,  to the rest of our enemies, that I had built the wall,  that there was no breach left in it, (though even to that time I had not set up the doors in the gates),
that Sanballat and Geshem sent to me, saying, Come, let us meet together in one of the villages in the plain of Ono. But they thought to do me mischief.
I sent messengers to them, saying, I am doing a great work, so that I cannot come down. Why should the work cease while I leave it,  come down to you?
they sent to me four times after this sort,  I answered them after the same manner.
Then Sanballat sent his servant to me in like manner the fifth time with an open letter in his hand
in which was written, It is reported among the nations,  Gashmu says it, that thou and the Jews think to rebel, for which cause thou are building the wall. And thou would be their king according to these words.
thou have also appointed prophets to preach of thee at Jerusalem, saying, There is a king in Judah. And now it shall be reported to the king according to these words. Come now therefore,  let us take counsel together.
Then I sent to him, saying, There are no such things done as thou say,  thou imagine them out of thine own heart.
For they all would have made us afraid, saying, Their hands shall be weakened from the work that it not be done. But now, O God, strengthen thou my hands.
I went to the house of Shemaiah the son of Delaiah the son of Mehetabel, who was shut up,  he said, Let us meet together in the house of God, within the temple,  let us shut the doors of the temple. For they will come to kill thee, yea, they will come to kill thee in the night.
I said, Should such a man as I flee? And who is there, that, being such as I, would go into the temple to save his life? I will not go in.
I discerned, , lo, God had not sent him,  he pronounced this prophecy against me,  Tobiah and Sanballat had hired him.
For this cause he was hired, that I should be afraid,  do so,  sin,  that they might have matter for an evil report, that they might reproach me.
Remember, O my God, Tobiah and Sanballat according to these their works,  also the prophetess Noadiah,  the rest of the prophets, who would have put me in fear.
So the wall was finished in the twenty-fifth day of the month Elul, in fifty-two days.
it came to pass, when all our enemies heard of it, that all the nations that were around us feared,  were much cast down in their own eyes, for they perceived that this work was wrought of our God.
Moreover in those days the ranking men of Judah sent many letters to Tobiah,  the letters of Tobiah came to them.
For there were many in Judah sworn to him because he was the son-in-law of Shecaniah the son of Arah,  his son Jehohanan had taken the daughter of Meshullam the son of Berechiah to wife.
Also they spoke of his good deeds before me,  reported my words to him. And Tobiah sent letters to put me in fear.
Now it came to pass, when the wall was built,  I had set up the doors,  the porters and the singers and the Levites were appointed,
that I gave my brother Hanani,  Hananiah the governor of the castle, charge over Jerusalem, for he was a faithful man,  feared God above many.
I said to them, Let not the gates of Jerusalem be opened until the sun be hot,  while they stand on guard, let them shut the doors,  bar ye them. And appoint watchmen of the inhabitants of Jerusalem, everyone in his watch,  everyone to be opposite his house.
Now the city was wide and large,  the people in it were few,  the houses were not built.
my God put into my heart to gather together the ranking men,  the rulers,  the people, that they might be reckoned by genealogy. And I found the book of the genealogy of those who came up at the first. And I found written therein:
These are the sons of the province who went up out of the captivity of those who had been carried away, whom Nebuchadnezzar the king of Babylon had carried away,  who returned to Jerusalem and to Judah, everyone to his city,
