Ps. Depart from me, all ye workers of iniquity, for Jehovah has heard the voice of my weeping.
Ps. Jehovah has heard my supplication. Jehovah will receive my prayer.
Ps. All my enemies shall be put to shame and greatly troubled. They shall turn back. They shall be put to shame suddenly.
Ps. O Jehovah my God, in thee do I take refuge. Save me from all those who pursue me,  deliver me,
Ps. lest they tear my soul like a lion, rending it in pieces, while there is none to deliver.
Ps. O Jehovah my God, if I have done this, if there be iniquity in my hands,
Ps. if I have rewarded evil to him who was at peace with me, (yea, I have delivered him without cause who was my adversary),
Ps. let the enemy pursue my soul,  overtake it. Yea, let him tread my life down to the earth,  lay my glory in the dust. Selah.
Ps. Arise, O Jehovah, in thine anger. Lift up thyself against the rage of my adversaries,  awake for me the justice thou have commanded.
Ps. And let the congregation of the peoples encompass thee about,  return thou on high over them.
Ps. Jehovah shall judge the peoples. Judge me, O Jehovah, according to my righteousness,  to my integrity that is in me.
Ps. O let the wickedness of the wicked man come to an end,  establish thou the righteous man. For the righteous God tries the minds and hearts.
Ps. My shield is with God, who saves the upright in heart.
Ps. God is a righteous judge. Yea, a God who has indignation every day.
Ps. If a man does not repent, he will whet his sword. He has bent his bow,  made it ready.
Ps. He has also prepared for him the instruments of death. He makes his arrows fiery.
Ps. Behold the wicked man, he travails with iniquity. Yea, he has conceived mischief,  brought forth falsehood.
Ps. He has made a pit,  dug it,  is fallen into the ditch which he made.
Ps. His mischief shall return upon his own head,  his violence shall come down upon his own scalp.
Ps. I will give thanks to Jehovah according to his righteousness,  will sing praise to the name of Jehovah Most High.
Ps. O Jehovah, our Lord, how excellent is thy name in all the earth, who has set thy glory upon the heavens!
Ps. Out of the mouth of babes and sucklings thou have perfected praise, because of thine adversaries, that thou might still the enemy and the avenger.
Ps. When I consider thy heavens, the work of thy fingers, the moon and the stars, which thou have ordained,
Ps. what is man that thou remember him? And the son of man that thou succor him?
Ps. For thou have made him but little lower than agents,  crowned him with glory and honor.
Ps. Thou make him to have dominion over the works of thy hands. Thou have put all things under his feet.
Ps. All sheep and oxen, yea,  the beasts of the field,
Ps. the birds of the heavens,  the fish of the sea, whatever passes through the paths of the seas.
Ps. O Jehovah, our Lord, how excellent is thy name in all the earth!
Ps. I will give thanks to Jehovah with my whole heart. I will show forth all thy marvelous works.
Ps. I will be glad and exult in thee. I will sing praise to thy name, O thou Most High.
Ps. When my enemies turn back, they stumble and perish at thy presence.
Ps. For thou have maintained my right and my cause. Thou sit in the throne judging righteously.
Ps. Thou have rebuked the nations. Thou have destroyed the wicked. Thou have blotted out their name forever and ever.
Ps. The enemy have come to an end. They are desolate forever,  the cities which thou have overthrown. The very memory of them is perished,
Ps. but Jehovah will endure forever. He has prepared his throne for judgment,
Ps. and he will judge the world in righteousness. He will minister justice to the peoples in uprightness.
Ps. Jehovah will also be a high tower for the oppressed, a high tower in times of trouble.
Ps. And those who know thy name will put their trust in thee, for thou, Jehovah, have not forsaken those who seek thee.
Ps. Sing praises to Jehovah, who dwells in Zion. Declare among the people his doings.
Ps. For he who makes inquiry for blood remembers them. He does not forget the cry of the poor.
Ps. Have mercy upon me, O Jehovah. Behold my affliction from those who hate me, thou who lifts me up from the gates of death
Ps. that I may show forth all thy praise. In the gates of the daughter of Zion I will rejoice in thy salvation.
Ps. The nations are sunk down in the pit that they made. In the net which they hid, their own foot is taken.
Ps. Jehovah has made himself known. He has executed justice. The wicked man is snared in the work of his own hands. Higgaion. Selah.
Ps. Wicked men shall be turned back to Sheol, even all the nations that forget God.
Ps. For a needy man shall not always be forgotten, nor the expectation of the poor perish forever.
Ps. Arise, O Jehovah, let not man prevail. Let the nations be judged in thy sight.
Ps. Put them in fear, O Jehovah. Let the nations know themselves to be but men. Selah.
Ps. Why do thou stand afar off, O Jehovah? Why do thou hide thyself in times of trouble?
Ps. In the pride of the wicked man the poor man is hotly pursued. Let them be taken in the devices that they have conceived.
Ps. For the wicked man boasts of his heart's desire. And the greedy man renounces, yea, despises Jehovah.
Ps. The wicked man, in the pride of his countenance, says, He will not require it. All his thoughts are, There is no God.
Ps. His ways are profane at all times. Thy judgments are far above out of his sight. As for all his adversaries, he puffs at them.
Ps. He says in his heart, I shall not be moved. To all generations I shall not be in adversity.
Ps. His mouth is full of cursing and deceit and oppression. Under his tongue is mischief and iniquity.
Ps. He sits in the lurking-places of the villages. In the covert places he murders the innocent man. His eyes are secretly set against the poor man.
Ps. He lurks in secret as a lion in his covert. He lies in wait to catch the poor man. He catches the poor man when he draws him in his net.
Ps. He crouches, he bows down,  helpless men fall by his strong men.
Ps. He says in his heart, God has forgotten. He hides his face. He will never see it.
Ps. Arise, O Jehovah, O God, lift up thy hand. Do not forget the poor.
Ps. Why does the wicked man despise God,  say in his heart, Thou will not require it?
Ps. Thou have seen. For thou behold mischief and spite, to repay with thy hand. The poor man commits himself to thee. Thou have been the helper of the fatherless.
Ps. Break thou the arm of the sinner and the evil man. His wickedness shall be sought,  shall not be found.
Ps. Jehovah is King forever and ever. The nations have perished out of his land.
Ps. Jehovah, thou have heard the desire of the humble. Thou will prepare their heart, thou will cause thine ear to hear,
Ps. to judge the fatherless and the oppressed, that man who is of the earth may no more be terrible.
Ps. In Jehovah I take refuge. How will ye say to my soul, Flee as a bird to your mountain.
Ps. For, lo, the wicked bend the bow. They make ready their arrow upon the string that they may shoot in darkness at the upright in heart.
Ps. If the foundations be destroyed, what can a righteous man do?
Ps. Jehovah is in his holy temple. Jehovah's throne is in heaven. His eyes, behold, his eyelids try, the sons of men.
Ps. Jehovah tries the righteous man,  his soul hates the wicked man and him who loves violence.
Ps. He will rain snares upon sinners. Fire and brimstone and burning wind shall be the portion of their cup.
Ps. For Jehovah is righteous. He loves righteousness. The upright man shall behold his face.
Ps. Help, Jehovah, for the holy man ceases, for the faithful fail from among the sons of men.
Ps. They speak falsehood everyone with his neighbor. With flattering lip,  with a double heart, they speak.
Ps. Jehovah will cut off all flattering lips, the tongue that speaks great things,
Ps. who have said, With our tongue will we prevail. Our lips are our own. Who is lord over us?
Ps. Because of the oppression of the poor, because of the sighing of the needy, now I will arise, says Jehovah. I will set him in the safety he gasps for.
Ps. The words of Jehovah are pure words, as silver tried in a furnace on the earth, purified seven times.
Ps. Thou will keep them, O Jehovah. Thou will preserve them from this generation forever.
Ps. The wicked walk on every side when vileness is exalted among the sons of men.
Ps. How long, O Jehovah? Will thou forget me forever? How long will thou hide thy face from me?
Ps. How long shall I take counsel in my soul, having sorrow in my heart all the day? How long shall my enemy be exalted over me?
Ps. Consider and answer me, O Jehovah my God. Lighten my eyes, lest I sleep the death,
Ps. lest my enemy say, I have prevailed against him, lest my adversaries rejoice when I am moved.
Ps. But I have trusted in thy loving kindness. My heart shall rejoice in thy salvation.
Ps. I will sing to Jehovah because he has dealt bountifully with me.
Ps. The fool has said in his heart, There is no God. They are corrupt. They have done abominable works. There is none that does good.
Ps. Jehovah looked down from heaven upon the sons of men to see if there were any who understood, who sought after God.
Ps. They are all gone aside. They are together become filthy. There is none who does good, no, not one.
Ps. Have all the workers of iniquity no knowledge, who eat up my people as they eat bread,  call not upon Jehovah?
Ps. There they were in great fear, for God is in the generation of the righteous.
Ps. Ye put to shame the counsel of the poor because Jehovah is his refuge.
Ps. O that the salvation of Israel came out of Zion! When Jehovah brings back the captivity of his people, then Jacob shall rejoice,  Israel shall be glad.
Ps. Jehovah, who shall sojourn in thy tabernacle? Who shall dwell in thy holy hill?
Ps. He who walks uprightly,  works righteousness,  speaks truth in his heart,
Ps. he who does no slander with his tongue, nor does evil to his friend, nor takes up a reproach against his neighbor,
Ps. in whose eyes a reprobate is despised,  who honors those who fear Jehovah, he that swears to his own hurt,  changes not,
Ps. he who puts not his money out to interest, nor takes a bribe against the innocent. He who does these things shall never be moved.
Ps. Preserve me, O God, for in thee do I take refuge.
Ps. Thou my soul have said to Jehovah, Thou are my Lord. I have no good beyond thee.
Ps. As for the sanctified who are in the earth, they are the excellent in whom is all my delight.
Ps. Their sorrows shall be multiplied who give gifts for another god. Their drink offerings of blood I will not offer, nor take their names upon my lips.
Ps. Jehovah is the portion of my inheritance and of my cup. Thou maintain my lot.
Ps. The lines are fallen to me in pleasant places. Yea, I have a fine heritage.
Ps. I will bless Jehovah, who has given me counsel. Yea, my heart instructs me in the night seasons.
Ps. I beheld Jehovah always before me. Because he is at my right hand, I shall not be moved.
Ps. Therefore my heart is glad,  my glory rejoices. My flesh also shall dwell in hope.
Ps. For thou will not leave my soul to Sheol, nor will thou allow thy holy man to see corruption.
Ps. Thou made known to me the path of life. Thou will fill me of joy with thy countenance.
Ps. Hear the right, O Jehovah, attend to my cry. Give ear to my prayer, that goes not out of feigned lips.
Ps. Let my justice come forth from thy presence. Let thine eyes look upon equity.
Ps. Thou have proved my heart. Thou have visited me in the night. Thou have tried me,  find nothing. I have purposed that my mouth shall not transgress.
Ps. As for the works of men, by the word of thy lips I have kept from the ways of a violent man.
Ps. My steps have held fast to thy paths. My feet have not slipped.
Ps. I have called upon thee, for thou will answer me, O God. Incline thine ear to me,  hear my speech.
Ps. Show thy marvelous loving kindness, O thou who saves by thy right hand those who take refuge from those who rise up.
Ps. Keep me as the apple of the eye. Hide me under the shadow of thy wings,
Ps. from the wicked who oppress me, my deadly enemies, who encompass me around.
Ps. They are enclosed in their own fat. With their mouth they speak proudly.
Ps. They have now encompassed us in our steps. They set their eyes to cast down to the earth.
Ps. He is like a lion that is greedy of his prey,  as it were a young lion lurking in secret places.
Ps. Arise, O Jehovah, confront him. Cast him down. Deliver my soul from the wicked by thy sword,
Ps. from men by thy hand, O Jehovah, from men of the world whose portion is in this life,  whose belly thou fill with thy treasure. They are satisfied with sons,  leave the rest of their substance to their babes.
Ps. As for me, I shall behold thy face in righteousness. I shall be satisfied, when I awake, with thy form.
Ps. I love thee, O Jehovah, my strength.
Ps. Jehovah is my rock,  my fortress,  my deliverer, my God, my rock, in whom I will take refuge, my shield,  the horn of my salvation, my high tower.
Ps. I will call upon Jehovah, who is worthy to be praised. So I shall be saved from my enemies.
Ps. The cords of death encompassed me,  the floods of lawlessness made me afraid.
Ps. The cords of Sheol were round about me. The snares of death came upon me.
Ps. In my distress I called upon Jehovah,  cried to my God. He heard my voice out of his temple,  my cry before him came into his ears.
Ps. Then the earth shook and trembled. The foundations also of the mountains quaked and were shaken because he was angry.
Ps. There went up a smoke out of his nostrils,  fire out of his mouth devoured. Coals were kindled by it.
Ps. He also bowed the heavens,  came down,  thick darkness was under his feet.
Ps. And he rode upon a cherub,  flew. Yea, he soared upon the wings of the wind.
Ps. He made darkness his hiding-place, his pavilion round about him, darkness of waters, thick clouds of the skies.
Ps. At the brightness before him his thick clouds passed, hailstones and coals of fire.
Ps. Jehovah also thundered in the heavens,  the Most High uttered his voice, hailstones and coals of fire.
Ps. And he sent out his arrows,  scattered them, Yea, lightnings manifold,  discomfited them.
Ps. Then the channels of waters appeared,  the foundations of the world were laid bare at thy rebuke, O Jehovah, at the blast of the breath of thy nostrils.
Ps. He sent from on high, he took me, he drew me out of many waters.
Ps. He delivered me from my strong enemy,  from those who hated me, for they were too mighty for me.
Ps. They came upon me in the day of my calamity,  Jehovah was my stay.
Ps. He also brought me forth into a large place. He delivered me because he delighted in me.
Ps. Jehovah has rewarded me according to my righteousness. According to the cleanness of my hands he has recompensed me.
Ps. For I have kept the ways of Jehovah,  have not wickedly departed from my God.
Ps. For all his ordinances were before me,  I put not away his statutes from me.
Ps. I was also perfect with him,  I kept myself from my iniquity.
Ps. Therefore Jehovah has recompensed me according to my righteousness, according to the cleanness of my hands in his eyesight.
Ps. With the merciful thou will show thyself merciful. With the perfect man thou will show thyself perfect.
Ps. With the pure thou will show thyself pure. And with the perverse thou will show thyself contrary.
Ps. For thou will save the afflicted people,  the haughty eyes thou will bring down.
Ps. For thou will light my lamp. Jehovah my God will lighten my darkness.
Ps. For by thee I run upon a troop,  by my God I leap over a wall.
Ps. As for God, his way is perfect. The word of Jehovah is tried. He is a shield to all those who take refuge in him.
Ps. For who is God, except Jehovah? And who is a rock, besides our God,
Ps. the God who girds me with strength,  makes my way perfect?
Ps. He makes my feet like hinds' feet,  sets me upon my high places.
Ps. He teaches my hands to war, so that my arms bend a bow of brass.
Ps. Thou have also given me the shield of thy salvation,  thy right hand has held me up,  thy gentleness has made me great.
Ps. Thou have enlarged my steps under me,  my feet have not slipped.
Ps. I will pursue my enemies,  overtake them. Neither will I turn again till they are consumed.
Ps. I will smite them through, so that they shall not be able to rise. They shall fall under my feet.
Ps. For thou have girded me with strength to the battle. Thou have subdued under me those who rose up against me.
Ps. Thou have also made my enemies turn their backs to me, that I might cut off those who hate me.
Ps. They cried,  there was none to save, even to Jehovah,  he answered them not.
Ps. Then I beat them small as the dust before the wind. I cast them out as the mire of the streets.
Ps. Thou have delivered me from the strivings of the people. Thou have made me the head of the nations. A people whom I have not known shall serve me.
Ps. As soon as they hear of me they shall obey me. The foreigners shall submit themselves to me.
Ps. The foreigners shall fade away,  shall come trembling out of their close places.
Ps. Jehovah lives,  blessed be my rock,  exalted be the God of my salvation,
Ps. even the God who executes vengeance for me,  subdues peoples under me.
Ps. He rescues me from my enemies. Yea, thou lift me up above those who rise up against me. Thou deliver me from the violent man.
Ps. Therefore I will give thanks to thee, O Jehovah, among the Gentiles,  will sing praises to thy name.
Ps. He gives great deliverance to his king,  shows loving kindness to his anointed, to David and to his seed, for evermore.
Ps. The heavens declare the glory of God,  the firmament shows his handiwork.
Ps. Day to day utters speech,  night to night shows knowledge.
Ps. There is no speech nor language in which their voice is not heard.
Ps. Their line has gone out through all the earth,  their words to the end of the world. In them he has set a tabernacle for the sun,
Ps. which is as a bridegroom coming out of his chamber,  rejoices as a strong man to run his course.
Ps. His going forth is from the end of the heavens,  his circuit to the ends of it,  there is nothing hid from the heat of it.
Ps. The law of Jehovah is perfect, restoring the soul. The testimony of Jehovah is sure, making a simple man wise.
Ps. The precepts of Jehovah are right, rejoicing the heart. The commandment of Jehovah is pure, enlightening the eyes.
Ps. The fear of Jehovah is clean, enduring forever. The ordinances of Jehovah are true,  righteous altogether.
Ps. More to be desired are they than gold, yea, than much fine gold. Sweeter also than honey and the droppings of the honeycomb.
Ps. Moreover by them thy servant is warned. In keeping them there is great reward.
Ps. Who can discern his errors? Clear thou me from hidden faults.
Ps. Keep back thy servant also from presumptuous sins. Let them not have dominion over me. Then I shall be upright,  I shall be clear from great transgression.
Ps. Let the words of my mouth and the meditation of my heart be acceptable in thy sight, O Jehovah, my rock,  my redeemer.
Ps. Jehovah answer thee in the day of trouble. The name of the God of Jacob set thee up on high,
Ps. send thee help from the sanctuary,  strengthen thee out of Zion,
Ps. remember all thy offerings,  accept thy burnt-sacrifice (Selah),
Ps. grant thee thy heart's desire,  fulfill all thy counsel.
Ps. We will triumph in thy salvation,  in the name of our God we will set up our banners. Jehovah fulfill all thy petitions.
Ps. Now I know that Jehovah saves his anointed. He will answer him from his holy heaven with the saving strength of his right hand.
Ps. Some trust in chariots,  some in horses,  we will make mention of the name of Jehovah our God.
Ps. They are bowed down and fallen,  we are risen,  stand upright.
Ps. Save, Jehovah! Let the King answer us when we call.
Ps. The king shall joy in thy strength, O Jehovah. And in thy salvation how greatly he shall rejoice!
Ps. Thou have given him his heart's desire,  have not withheld the request of his lips. Selah.
Ps. For thou meet him with the blessings of goodness. Thou set a crown of fine gold on his head.
Ps. He asked life from thee. Thou gave it him, even length of days forever and ever.
Ps. His glory is great in thy salvation. Honor and majesty thou do lay upon him.
Ps. For thou make him most blessed forever. Thou make him glad with joy in thy presence.
Ps. For the king trusts in Jehovah. And through the loving kindness of the Most High he shall not be moved.
Ps. Thy hand will find out all thine enemies. Thy right hand will find out those who hate thee.
Ps. Thou will make them as a fiery furnace in the time of thine anger. Jehovah will swallow them up in his wrath,  the fire shall devour them.
Ps. Thou will destroy their fruit from the earth,  their seed from among the sons of men.
Ps. For they intended evil against thee. They conceived a device which they are not able to perform.
Ps. For thou will make them turn their back. Thou will make ready with thy bowstrings against their face.
Ps. Be thou exalted, O Jehovah, in thy strength. We will sing and praise thy power.
Ps. My God, my God, why have thou forsaken me, far from helping me,  the words of my groaning?
Ps. O my God, I cry in the daytime,  thou answer not,  in the night season,  I am not silent.
Ps. But thou are holy, O thou who inhabit the praises of Israel.
Ps. Our fathers trusted in thee. They trusted,  thou delivered them.
Ps. They cried to thee,  were delivered. They trusted in thee,  were not put to shame.
Ps. But I am a worm,  no man, a reproach of men,  despised by the people.
Ps. All those who see me laugh me to scorn. They shoot out the lip. They shake the head, saying,
Ps. He trusted on Jehovah. Let him deliver him. Let him rescue him, since he delights in him.
Ps. But thou are he who took me out of the womb. Thou made me trust upon my mother's breasts.
Ps. I was cast upon thee from the womb. Thou are my God since my mother bore me.
Ps. Be not far from me, for trouble is near, for there is none to help.
Ps. Many bulls have encompassed me. Strong bulls of Bashan have beset me around.
Ps. They gape upon me with their mouth, as a ravening and a roaring lion.
Ps. I am poured out like water,  all my bones are out of joint. My heart is like wax; it is melted within me.
Ps. My strength is dried up like a potsherd,  my tongue clings to my jaws,  thou have brought me into the dust of death.
Ps. For dogs have encompassed me. A company of evildoers have enclosed me. They pierced my hands and my feet.
Ps. I may count all my bones. They look and stare upon me.
Ps. They part my garments among them,  upon my vesture do they cast a lot.
Ps. But be thou not far off, O Jehovah. O thou my succor, hasten thee to help me.
Ps. Deliver my soul from the sword, the only one of me from the power of the dog.
Ps. Save me from the lion's mouth, yea, from the horns of the wild-oxen. Thou have answered me.
Ps. I will declare thy name to my brothers. In the midst of the congregation I will praise thee.
Ps. Ye who fear Jehovah, praise him. All ye the seed of Jacob, glorify him,  stand in awe of him, all ye the seed of Israel.
Ps. For he has not despised nor abhorred the affliction of the afflicted, neither has he hid his face from him,  when he cried to him, he heard.
Ps. From thee comes my praise in the great assembly. I will pay my vows before those who fear him.
Ps. The meek shall eat and be satisfied. They shall praise Jehovah who seek after him. Let your heart live forever.
Ps. All the ends of the earth shall remember and turn to Jehovah,  all the kinfolk of the nations shall worship before thee.
Ps. For the kingdom is Jehovah's,  he is the ruler over the nations.
Ps. All the fat ones of the earth shall eat and worship. All those who go down to the dust shall bow before him, even he who cannot keep his soul alive.
Ps. A seed shall serve him. It shall be told of the Lord to the next generation.
Ps. They shall come and shall declare his righteousness to a people that shall be born, that he has done it.
Ps. Jehovah is my shepherd, I shall not want.
Ps. He makes me to lie down in green pastures. He leads me beside still waters.
Ps. He restores my soul. He guides me in the paths of righteousness for his name's sake.
Ps. Yea, tho I walk through the valley of the shadow of death, I will fear no evil, for thou are with me, thy rod and thy staff, they comfort me.
Ps. Thou prepare a table before me in the presence of my enemies. Thou have anointed my head with oil. My cup runs over.
Ps. Surely goodness and loving kindness shall follow me all the days of my life,  I shall dwell in the house of Jehovah forever.
Ps. The earth is Jehovah's,  the fullness thereof, the world,  those who dwell therein.
Ps. For he has founded it upon the seas,  established it upon the floods.
Ps. Who shall ascend into the hill of Jehovah? And who shall stand in his holy place?
Ps. He who has clean hands,  a pure heart, who has not lifted up his soul to falsehood,  has not sworn deceitfully.
Ps. He shall receive a blessing from Jehovah,  righteousness from the God of his salvation.
Ps. This is the generation of those who seek after him, who seek thy face, even Jacob. Selah.
Ps. Lift up your heads, O ye gates,  be ye lifted up, ye everlasting doors,  the King of glory will come in.
Ps. Who is the King of glory? Jehovah strong and mighty, Jehovah mighty in battle.
Ps. Lift up your heads, O ye gates. Yea, lift them up, ye everlasting doors,  the King of glory will come in.
Ps. Who is this King of glory? Jehovah of hosts, He is the King of glory. Selah.
Ps. To thee, O Jehovah, do I lift up my soul.
Ps. O my God, in thee I have trusted. Let me not be put to shame. Let not my enemies triumph over me.
Ps. Yea, none who wait for thee shall be put to shame. They shall be put to shame who deal treacherously without cause.
Ps. Show me thy ways, O Jehovah. Teach me thy paths.
Ps. Guide me in thy truth,  teach me. For thou are the God of my salvation. For thee do I wait all the day.
Ps. Remember, O Jehovah, thy tender mercies and thy loving kindness. For they have been ever of old.
Ps. Remember not the sins of my youth, nor my transgressions. According to thy loving kindness remember thou me, for thy goodness' sake, O Jehovah.
Ps. Good and upright is Jehovah. Therefore he will instruct sinners in the way.
Ps. The meek he will guide in justice,  the meek he will teach his way.
Ps. All the paths of Jehovah are loving kindness and truth to such as keep his covenant and his testimonies.
Ps. For thy name's sake, O Jehovah, pardon my iniquity, for it is great.
Ps. What man is he who fears Jehovah? Him he shall instruct in the way that he shall choose.
Ps. His soul shall dwell at ease,  his seed shall inherit the land.
Ps. The friendship of Jehovah is with those who fear him,  he will show them his covenant.
Ps. My eyes are ever toward Jehovah, for he will pluck my feet out of the net.
Ps. Turn thee to me,  have mercy upon me, for I am desolate and afflicted.
Ps. The troubles of my heart are enlarged. O bring thou me out of my distresses.
Ps. Consider my affliction and my travail,  forgive all my sins.
Ps. Consider my enemies, for they are many. And they hate me with cruel hatred.
Ps. O keep my soul,  deliver me. Let me not be put to shame, for I take refuge in thee.
Ps. Let integrity and uprightness preserve me, for I wait for thee.
Ps. Redeem Israel, O God, out of all of his troubles.
Ps. Judge me, O Jehovah, for I have walked in my integrity. I have also trusted in Jehovah without wavering.
Ps. Examine me, O Jehovah,  prove me. Try my heart and my mind.
Ps. For thy loving kindness is before my eyes,  I have walked in thy truth.
Ps. I have not sat with men of falsehood, nor will I go in with dissemblers.
Ps. I hate the assembly of evildoers,  will not sit with the wicked.
Ps. I will wash my hands in innocence, so I will encompass thine altar, O Jehovah,
Ps. that I may make the voice of thanksgiving to be heard,  tell of all thy wondrous works.
Ps. Jehovah, I love the habitation of thy house,  the place where thy glory dwells.
Ps. Gather not my soul with sinners, nor my life with men of blood,
Ps. in whose hands is wickedness,  their right hand is full of bribes.
Ps. But as for me, I will walk in my integrity. Redeem me,  be merciful to me.
Ps. My foot stands in an even place. In the congregations I will bless Jehovah.
Ps. Jehovah is my light and my salvation, whom shall I fear? Jehovah is the strength of my life, of whom shall I be afraid?
Ps. When evildoers came upon me to eat up my flesh, even my adversaries and my foes, they stumbled and fell.
Ps. Though an army should encamp against me, my heart shall not fear. Though war should rise against me, even then I will be confident.
Ps. One thing I have asked of Jehovah, that I will seek after, that I may dwell in the house of Jehovah all the days of my life, to behold the beauty of Jehovah,  to inquire in his temple.
Ps. For in the day of trouble he will hide me in his pavilion. In the covert of his tabernacle he will hide me. He will lift me up upon a rock.
Ps. And now my head shall be lifted up above my enemies round about me. And I will offer in his tabernacle sacrifices of joy. I will sing, yea, I will sing praises to Jehovah.
Ps. Hear, O Jehovah, when I cry with my voice. Have mercy also upon me,  answer me.
Ps. My heart said to thee, I have sought thy face. O Jehovah, I will seek thy face.
Ps. Hide not thy face from me. Put not thy servant away in anger. Thou have been my help. Cast me not off, nor forsake me, O God of my salvation.
Ps. When my father and my mother forsake me, then Jehovah will take me up.
Ps. Teach me thy way, O Jehovah,  lead me in a plain path, because of my enemies.
Ps. Deliver me not over to the will of my adversaries. For false witnesses are risen up against me,  such as breathe out cruelty.
Ps. I believe that I shall see the goodness of Jehovah in the land of the living.
Ps. Wait for Jehovah. Be strong,  let thy heart take courage. Yea, wait thou for Jehovah.
Ps. To thee, O Jehovah, I will call. My rock, be not thou deaf to me, lest, if thou be silent to me, I become like those who go down into the pit.
Ps. Hear the voice of my supplications when I cry to thee, when I lift up my hands toward thy holy oracle.
Ps. Draw me not away with the wicked,  with the workers of iniquity, who speak peace with their neighbors,  mischief is in their hearts.
Ps. Give them according to their work,  according to the wickedness of their doings. Give them after the operation of their hands. Render to them their recompense,
Ps. because they regard not the works of Jehovah, nor the operation of his hands. He will break them down and not build them up.
Ps. Blessed be Jehovah, because he has heard the voice of my supplications.
Ps. Jehovah is my strength and my shield. My heart has trusted in him,  I am helped. Therefore my heart greatly rejoices,  with my song I will praise him.
Ps. Jehovah is their strength,  he is a stronghold of salvation to his anointed.
Ps. Save thy people,  bless thine inheritance. Be their shepherd also,  bear them up forever.
Ps. Ascribe to Jehovah, O ye sons of the mighty, ascribe to Jehovah glory and strength.
Ps. Ascribe to Jehovah the glory due to his name. Worship Jehovah in holy array.
Ps. The voice of Jehovah is upon the waters. The God of glory thunders, even Jehovah upon many waters.
Ps. The voice of Jehovah is powerful. The voice of Jehovah is full of majesty.
Ps. The voice of Jehovah breaks the cedars. Yea, Jehovah breaks in pieces the cedars of Lebanon.
Ps. He makes them also to skip like a calf, Lebanon and Sirion like a young wild-ox.
Ps. The voice of Jehovah splits the flames of fire.
Ps. The voice of Jehovah shakes the wilderness. Jehovah shakes the wilderness of Kadesh.
Ps. The voice of Jehovah makes the hinds to calve,  strips the forests bare. And in his temple everything says, Glory.
Ps. Jehovah sat as King at the Flood. Yea, Jehovah sits as King forever.
Ps. Jehovah will give strength to his people. Jehovah will bless his people with peace.
Ps. I will extol thee, O Jehovah, for thou have raised me up,  have not made my foes to rejoice over me.
Ps. O Jehovah my God, I cried to thee,  thou have healed me.
Ps. O Jehovah, thou have brought up my soul from Sheol. Thou have kept me alive, that I should not go down to the pit.
Ps. Sing praise to Jehovah, O ye sanctified of his,  give thanks to his holiness.
Ps. For his anger is but for a moment. His favor is for a lifetime. Weeping may tarry for the night,  joy is in the morning.
Ps. As for me, I said in my prosperity, I shall never be moved.
Ps. Thou, Jehovah, of thy favor had made my mountain to stand strong. Thou hid thy face; I was troubled.
Ps. I cried to thee, O Jehovah,  to Jehovah I made supplication.
Ps. What profit is there in my blood when I go down to the pit? Shall the dust praise thee? Shall it declare thy truth?
Ps. Hear, O Jehovah,  have mercy upon me. Jehovah, be thou my helper.
Ps. Thou have turned for me my mourning into dancing. Thou have loosed my sackcloth,  girded me with gladness,
Ps. to the end that my glory may sing praise to thee,  not be silent. O Jehovah my God, I will give thanks to thee forever.
Ps. In thee, O Jehovah, do I take refuge. Let me never be put to shame. Deliver me in thy righteousness.
Ps. Bow down thine ear to me. Deliver me speedily. Be thou to me a strong rock, a house of defense to save me.
Ps. For thou are my rock and my fortress. Therefore for thy name's sake lead me and guide me.
Ps. Pluck me out of the net that they have laid secretly for me, for thou are my stronghold.
Ps. Into thy hand I commend my spirit. Thou have redeemed me, O Jehovah, thou God of truth.
Ps. I hate those who regard lying vanities,  I trust in Jehovah.
Ps. I will be glad and rejoice in thy loving kindness, for thou have seen my affliction. Thou have known my soul in adversities,
Ps. and thou have not shut me up into the hand of the enemy. Thou have set my feet in a large place.
Ps. Have mercy upon me, O Jehovah, for I am in distress. My eye wastes away with grief, yea, my soul and my body.
Ps. For my life is spent with sorrow,  my years with sighing. My strength fails because of my iniquity,  my bones are wasted away.
Ps. I have become a reproach because of all my adversaries, yea, to my neighbors exceedingly,  a fear to my acquaintances. Those who saw me outside fled from me.
Ps. I am forgotten as a dead man out of mind. I am like a broken vessel.
Ps. For I have heard the slander of many. Fear was on every side, while they took counsel together against me. They devised to take away my life.
Ps. But I trusted in thee, O Jehovah. I said, Thou are my God.
Ps. My times are in thy hand. Deliver me from the hand of my enemies,  from those who persecute me.
Ps. Make thy face to shine upon thy servant. Save me in thy loving kindness.
Ps. Let me not be put to shame, O Jehovah, for I have called upon thee. Let the wicked be put to shame. Let them be silent in Sheol.
Ps. Let the lying lips be dumb, which speak against the righteous man insolently, with pride and contempt.
Ps. O how great is thy goodness, which thou have laid up for those who fear thee, which thou have wrought for those who take refuge in thee before the sons of men!
Ps. In the covert of thy presence thou will hide them from the plotting of man. Thou will keep them secretly in a pavilion from the strife of tongues.
Ps. Blessed be Jehovah, for he has shown me his marvelous loving kindness in a strong city.
Ps. As for me, I said in my haste, I am cut off from before thine eyes. Nevertheless thou heard the voice of my supplications when I cried to thee.
Ps. O love Jehovah, all ye his sanctified. Jehovah preserves the faithful,  plentifully repays him who deals proudly.
Ps. Be strong,  let your heart take courage, all ye who hope in Jehovah.
Ps. Blessed are those whose transgression is forgiven, whose sin is covered.
Ps. Blessed is the man to whom Jehovah does not impute sin,  in whose spirit there is no deceit.
Ps. When I kept silence, my bones wasted away through my groaning all the day long.
Ps. For day and night thy hand was heavy upon me. My moisture was changed as with the drought of summer. Selah.
Ps. I acknowledged my sin to thee,  I did not hide my iniquity. I said, I will confess my transgressions to Jehovah,  thou forgave the iniquity of my sin. Selah.
Ps. For this let everyone who is devout pray to thee in a time when thou may be found. Surely when the great waters overflow they shall not reach to him.
Ps. Thou are my hiding-place. Thou will preserve me from trouble. Thou will encompass me around with songs of deliverance. Selah.
Ps. I will instruct thee and teach thee in the way which thou shall go. I will counsel thee with my eye upon thee.
Ps. Become ye not as the horse, or as the mule, which have no understanding, whose trappings must be bit and bridle to hold them in, else they will not come near to thee.
Ps. Many sorrows shall be to the wicked,  he who trusts in Jehovah, loving kindness shall encompass him about.
Ps. Be glad in Jehovah,  rejoice, ye righteous. And shout for joy, all ye who are upright in heart.
Ps. Rejoice in Jehovah, O ye righteous. Praise is comely for the upright.
Ps. Give thanks to Jehovah with the harp. Sing praises to him with the psaltery of ten strings.
Ps. Sing to him a new song. Play skillfully with a loud noise.
Ps. For the word of Jehovah is right,  all his work is done in faithfulness.
Ps. He loves righteousness and justice. The earth is full of the loving kindness of Jehovah.
Ps. By the word of Jehovah were the heavens made,  all the host of them by the breath of his mouth.
Ps. He gathers the waters of the sea together as a heap. He lays up the deeps in store-houses.
Ps. Let all the earth fear Jehovah. Let all the inhabitants of the world stand in awe of him.
Ps. For he spoke,  it was done. He commanded,  it stood fast.
Ps. Jehovah brings the counsel of the nations to naught. He makes the thoughts of the peoples to be of no effect.
Ps. The counsel of Jehovah stands fast forever, the thoughts of his heart to all generations.
Ps. Blessed is the nation whose God is Jehovah, the people whom he has chosen for his own inheritance.
Ps. Jehovah looks from heaven. He beholds all the sons of men.
Ps. From the place of his habitation he looks forth upon all the inhabitants of the earth;
Ps. he who fashions the hearts of them all, who considers all their works.
Ps. There is no king saved by the multitude of an army. A mighty man is not delivered by great strength.
Ps. A horse is a vain thing for safety, nor does he deliver any by his great power.
Ps. Behold, the eye of Jehovah is upon those who fear him, upon those who hope in his loving kindness,
Ps. to deliver their soul from death,  to keep them alive in famine.
Ps. Our soul has waited for Jehovah. He is our help and our shield.
Ps. For our heart shall rejoice in him because we have trusted in his holy name.
Ps. Let thy loving kindness, O Jehovah, be upon us, according as we have hoped in thee.
Ps. I will bless Jehovah at all times. His praise shall continually be in my mouth.
Ps. My soul shall make its boast in Jehovah. The humble shall hear of it,  be glad.
Ps. O magnify Jehovah with me,  let us exalt his name together.
Ps. I sought Jehovah,  he answered me,  delivered me from all my fears.
Ps. They looked to him,  were radiant,  their faces shall never be confounded.
Ps. This poor man cried,  Jehovah heard him,  saved him out of all his troubles.
Ps. The agent of Jehovah encamps round about those who fear him,  delivers them.
Ps. O taste and see that Jehovah is good. Blessed is the man who takes refuge in him.
Ps. O fear Jehovah, ye his sanctified, for there is no want to those who fear him.
Ps. The young lions do lack,  suffer hunger,  those who seek Jehovah shall not want any good thing.
Ps. Come, ye children, hearken to me. I will teach you the fear of Jehovah.
Ps. What man is he who desires life,  loves many days, that he may see good?
Ps. Keep thy tongue from evil,  thy lips from speaking deceit.
Ps. Depart from evil,  do good. Seek peace,  pursue it.
Ps. The eyes of Jehovah are toward the righteous,  his ears are open to their prayer.
Ps. (The face of Jehovah is against those who do evil, to cut off the remembrance of them from the earth.)
Ps. They cried,  Jehovah heard,  delivered them out of all their troubles.
Ps. Jehovah is near to those who are of a broken heart,  saves such as are of a contrite spirit.
Ps. Many are the afflictions of the righteous,  Jehovah delivers him out of them all.
Ps. He keeps all his bones. Not one of them is broken.
Ps. Evil shall kill the wicked,  those who hate the righteous shall be condemned.
Ps. Jehovah redeems the soul of his servants,  none of those who take refuge in him shall be condemned.
Ps. Strive thou, O Jehovah, with those who strive with me. Fight thou against those who fight against me.
Ps. Take hold of shield and buckler,  stand up for my help.
Ps. Draw out the spear also,  stop the way against those who pursue me. Say to my soul, I am thy salvation.
Ps. Let them be put to shame and brought to dishonor who seek after my soul. Let them be turned back and confounded who devise my hurt.
Ps. Let them be as chaff before the wind,  the agent of Jehovah driving them on.
Ps. Let their way be dark and slippery,  the agent of Jehovah pursuing them.
Ps. For without cause they have hid their net for me in a pit. Without cause they have dug a pit for my soul.
Ps. Let destruction come upon him unawares,  let his net that he has hid catch himself. Let him fall in it with destruction.
Ps. And my soul shall be joyful in Jehovah. It shall rejoice in his salvation.
Ps. All my bones shall say, Jehovah, who is like thee, who delivers a poor man from him who is too strong for him, yea, a poor and needy man from him who robs him?
Ps. Unrighteous witnesses rise up, they ask me of things that I know not.
Ps. They reward me evil for good, to the bereaving of my soul.
Ps. But as for me, when they were sick my clothing was sackcloth. I afflicted my soul with fasting,  my prayer returned into my own bosom.
Ps. I behaved myself as though it had been my friend or my brother. I bowed down mourning, as he who bewails his mother.
Ps. But in my adversity they rejoiced,  gathered themselves together. The wretches gathered themselves together against me,  I knew it not. They tore me,  ceased not.
Ps. Like the profane mockers in feasts, they gnashed upon me with their teeth.
Ps. Lord, how long will thou look on? Rescue my soul from their destructions, my darling from the lions.
Ps. I will give thee thanks in the great assembly. I will praise thee among much people.
Ps. Let not those who are my enemies wrongfully rejoice over me. Neither let them wink with the eye who hate me without a cause.
Ps. For they speak not peace,  they devise deceitful words against those who are quiet in the land.
Ps. Yea, they opened their mouth wide against me. They said, Aha, aha, our eye has seen it.
Ps. Thou have seen it, O Jehovah. Keep not silence. O Lord, be not far from me.
Ps. Stir up thyself,  awake to the justice to me, to my cause, my God and my Lord.
Ps. Judge me, O Jehovah my God, according to thy righteousness,  let them not rejoice over me.
Ps. Let them not say in their heart, Aha, so would we have it. Let them not say, We have swallowed him up.
Ps. Let them be put to shame and confounded together who rejoice at my hurt. Let them be clothed with shame and dishonor who magnify themselves against me.
Ps. Let them shout for joy,  be glad, who favor my righteous cause. Yea, let them say continually, Jehovah be magnified, who has pleasure in the prosperity of his servant.
Ps. And my tongue shall talk of thy righteousness and of thy praise all the day long.
Ps. The transgression of the wicked man says within my heart, There is no fear of God before his eyes.
Ps. For he flatters himself in his own eyes, that his iniquity will not be found out and be hated.
Ps. The words of his mouth are iniquity and deceit. He has ceased to be wise and to do good.
Ps. He devises iniquity upon his bed. He sets himself in a way that is not good. He does not abhor evil.
Ps. Thy loving kindness, O Jehovah, is in the heavens, thy faithfulness to the skies.
Ps. Thy righteousness is like the mountains of God. Thy judgments are a great deep. O Jehovah, thou preserve man and beast.
Ps. How precious is thy loving kindness, O God,  the sons of men take refuge under the shadow of thy wings.
Ps. They shall be abundantly satisfied with the fatness of thy house,  thou will make them drink of the river of thy pleasures.
Ps. For with thee is the fountain of life. In thy light we shall see light.
Ps. O continue thy loving kindness to those who know thee,  thy righteousness to the upright in heart.
Ps. Let not the foot of pride come against me,  let not the hand of sinners drive me away.
Ps. There are the workers of iniquity fallen. They are thrust down,  shall not be able to rise.
Ps. Fret not thyself because of evildoers, nor be thou envious against those who work unrighteousness.
Ps. For they shall soon be cut down like the grass,  wither as the green herb.
Ps. Trust in Jehovah,  do good. Dwell in the land,  feed on his faithfulness.
Ps. Delight thyself also in Jehovah,  he will give thee the desires of thy heart.
Ps. Commit thy way to Jehovah. Trust also in him,  he will bring it to pass.
Ps. And he will make thy righteousness to go forth as the light,  thy justice as the noon-day.
Ps. Rest in Jehovah,  wait patiently for him. Fret not thyself because of him who prospers in his way, because of the man who brings wicked devices to pass.
Ps. Cease from anger,  forsake wrath. Fret not thyself, it tends only to evil-doing.
Ps. For evildoers shall be cut off,  those who wait for Jehovah, they shall inherit the land.
Ps. For yet a little while,  the wicked man shall not be. Yea, thou shall diligently consider his place,  he shall not be.
Ps. But the meek shall inherit the land,  shall delight themselves in the abundance of peace.
Ps. The wicked man plots against the righteous man,  gnashes upon him with his teeth.
Ps. The Lord will laugh at him, for he sees that his day is coming.
Ps. The wicked have drawn out the sword,  have bent their bow, to cast down the poor and needy, to kill such as are upright in the way.
Ps. Their sword shall enter into their own heart,  their bows shall be broken.
Ps. Better is a little that the righteous man has than the abundance of many wicked men.
Ps. For the arms of the wicked shall be broken,  Jehovah upholds the righteous.
Ps. Jehovah knows the days of the perfect,  their inheritance shall be forever.
Ps. They shall not be put to shame in the time of evil,  in the days of famine they shall be satisfied.
Ps. But the wicked shall perish,  the enemies of Jehovah is as the fat of lambs: they shall disintegrate; they shall disintegrate away into smoke.
Ps. The wicked man borrows,  pays not again,  the righteous man deals graciously,  gives.
Ps. For such as are blessed by him shall inherit the land,  those who are cursed by him shall be cut off.
Ps. A man's goings are established by Jehovah,  he delights in his way.
Ps. Though he fall, he shall not be utterly cast down, for Jehovah upholds him with his hand.
Ps. I have been young,  now am old, yet I have not seen a righteous man forsaken, nor his seed begging bread.
Ps. All the day long he deals graciously,  lends,  his seed is blessed.
Ps. Depart from evil,  do good,  dwell for evermore.
Ps. For Jehovah loves justice,  forsakes not his sanctified. They are preserved forever,  the seed of the wicked shall be cut off.
Ps. The righteous shall inherit the land,  dwell in it forever.
Ps. The mouth of a righteous man talks of wisdom,  his tongue speaks justice.
Ps. The law of his God is in his heart. None of his steps shall slide.
Ps. A wicked man watches a righteous man,  seeks to kill him.
Ps. Jehovah will not leave him in his hand, nor condemn him when he is judged.
Ps. Wait for Jehovah,  keep his way,  he will exalt thee to inherit the land. When sinners are cut off, thou shall see it.
Ps. I have seen a wicked man in great power,  spreading himself like a green tree in its native soil.
Ps. But I passed by, , lo, he was not. Yea, I sought him,  he could not be found.
Ps. Mark the perfect man,  behold the upright, for there is a happy end to the man of peace.
Ps. As for transgressors, they shall be destroyed together. The end of the wicked shall be cut off.
Ps. But the salvation of the righteous is of Jehovah. He is their stronghold in the time of trouble,
Ps. and Jehovah helps them,  rescues them. He rescues them from sinners,  saves them, because they have taken refuge in him.
Ps. O Jehovah, rebuke me not in thy wrath, nor chasten me in thy hot displeasure.
Ps. For thine arrows stick fast in me,  thy hand presses me severely.
Ps. There is no soundness in my flesh because of thine indignation, nor is there any health in my bones because of my sin.
Ps. For my iniquities have gone over my head. As a heavy burden they are too heavy for me.
Ps. My wounds are loathsome and corrupt, because of my foolishness.
Ps. I am pained and bowed down greatly. I go mourning all the day long.
Ps. For my loins are filled with burning,  there is no soundness in my flesh.
Ps. I am faint and severely bruised. I have groaned because of the disquietness of my heart.
Ps. Lord, all my desire is before thee,  my groaning is not hid from thee.
Ps. My heart throbs, my strength fails me. As for the light of my eyes, it also is gone from me.
Ps. Those I love and my friends stand aloof from my plague,  my kinsmen stand afar off.
Ps. Those also who seek after my life lay snares for me. And those who seek my hurt speak mischievous things,  meditate deceits all the day long.
Ps. But I, as a deaf man, hear not. And I am as a mute man who opens not his mouth.
Ps. Yea, I am as a man who hears not,  in whose mouth are no reproofs.
Ps. For in thee, O Jehovah, do I hope. Thou will answer, O Lord my God.
Ps. For I said, Lest they rejoice over me. When my foot slips, they magnify themselves against me.
Ps. For I am ready to fall,  my sorrow is continually before me.
Ps. For I will declare my iniquity. I will be sorry for my sin.
Ps. But my enemies are energetic,  are strong,  those who hate me wrongfully are multiplied.
Ps. They also who render evil for good are adversaries to me, because I follow the thing that is good.
Ps. Forsake me not, O Jehovah. O my God, be not far from me.
Ps. Make haste to help me, O Lord, my salvation.
Ps. I said, I will take heed to my ways, that I sin not with my tongue. I will keep my mouth with a bridle while the wicked man is before me.
Ps. I was mute with silence. I held my peace, even from good,  my sorrow was stirred.
Ps. My heart was hot within me. While I was musing the fire burned. Then I spoke with my tongue:
Ps. Jehovah, make me to know my end,  the measure of my days, what it is. Let me know how frail I am.
Ps. Behold, thou have made my days as handbreadths,  my life-time is as nothing before thee. Surely every man at his best condition is altogether vanity. Selah.
Ps. Surely every man walks in a shadow. Surely they are disquieted in vain. He heaps up,  knows not who shall gather them.
Ps. And now, Lord, what do I wait for? My hope is in thee.
Ps. Deliver me from all my transgressions. Make me not the reproach of the foolish.
Ps. I was mute. I opened not my mouth, because thou did it.
Ps. Remove thy stroke away from me. I am consumed by the blow of thy hand.
Ps. When thou have corrected man with rebukes for iniquity, thou make his beauty to disintegrate like a moth. Surely every man is vanity. Selah.
Ps. Hear my prayer, O Jehovah,  give ear to my cry. Keep not silent at my tears, for I am a stranger with thee, a sojourner, as all my fathers were.
Ps. O spare me, that I may recover strength before I go from here,  be no more.
Ps. I waited patiently for Jehovah,  he inclined to me,  heard my cry.
Ps. He also brought me up out of a horrible pit, out of the miry clay,  he set my feet upon a rock,  established my goings.
Ps. And he has put a new song in my mouth, even praise to our God. Many shall see it,  fear,  shall trust in Jehovah.
Ps. Blessed is the man who makes Jehovah his trust,  respects not the proud, nor such as turn aside to lies.
Ps. Many, O Jehovah my God, are the wonderful works which thou have done,  thy thoughts which are toward us. They cannot be set in order to thee. If I would declare and speak of them, they are more than can be numbered.
Ps. Sacrifice and offering thou did not desire,  a body thou have prepared for me. Whole burnt offering and sacrifice for sin thou did not require.
Ps. Then I said, Lo, I have come. In the volume of a book it is written of me.
Ps. I delight to do thy will, O my God. Yea, thy law is within my heart.
Ps. I have proclaimed glad tidings of righteousness in the great assembly. Lo, I will not refrain my lips. O Jehovah, thou know.
Ps. I have not hid thy righteousness within my heart. I have declared thy faithfulness and thy salvation. I have not concealed thy loving kindness and thy truth from the great assembly.
Ps. Withhold thou not thy tender mercies from me, O Jehovah. Let thy loving kindness and thy truth continually preserve me,
Ps. for innumerable evils have encompassed me around. My iniquities have overtaken me, so that I am not able to look up. They are more than the hairs of my head,  my heart has failed me.
Ps. Be pleased, O Jehovah, to deliver me. Make haste to help me, O Jehovah.
Ps. Let them be put to shame and confounded together who seek after my soul to destroy it. Let them be turned backward and brought to dishonor who delight in my hurt.
Ps. Let them be desolate because of their shame who say to me, Aha, aha.
Ps. Let all those who seek thee rejoice and be glad in thee. Let such as love thy salvation say continually, Jehovah be magnified.
Ps. But I am poor and needy, yet the Lord thinks upon me. Thou are my help and my deliverer. Make no delay, O my God.
Ps. Blessed is he who considers a poor man. Jehovah will deliver him in the day of evil.
Ps. Jehovah will preserve him,  keep him alive,  he shall be blessed upon the earth. And thou do not deliver him to the will of his enemies.
Ps. Jehovah will support him upon the bed of languishing. Thou will make all his bed in his sickness.
Ps. I said, O Jehovah, have mercy upon me. Heal my soul, for I have sinned against thee.
Ps. My enemies speak evil against me, saying, When will he die,  his name perish?
Ps. And if he comes to see me, he speaks falsehood. His heart gathers iniquity to itself. When he goes abroad, he tells it.
Ps. All who hate me whisper together against me. Against me they devise my hurt.
Ps. An evil disease, they say, clings firm to him. And now that he lies he shall rise up no more.
Ps. Yea, my own familiar friend, in whom I trusted, who ate of my bread, has lifted up his heel against me.
Ps. But thou, O Jehovah, have mercy upon me,  raise me up that I may requite them.
Ps. By this I know that thou delight in me, because my enemy does not triumph over me.
Ps. And as for me, thou uphold me in my integrity,  set me before thy face forever.
Ps. Blessed be Jehovah, the God of Israel, from everlasting and to everlasting. Truly,  Truly.
Ps. As the hart pants after the water brooks, so my soul pants after thee, O God.
Ps. My soul thirsts for God, for the living God. When shall I come and appear before God?
Ps. My tears have been my food day and night, while they continually say to me, Where is thy God?
Ps. These things I remember,  pour out my soul within me, how I went with the throng,  led them to the house of God, with the voice of joy and praise, a multitude keeping holyday.
Ps. Why are thou cast down, O my soul? And why are thou disquieted within me? Hope thou in God, for I shall yet praise him for the help of his countenance.
Ps. O my God, my soul is cast down within me. Therefore I remember thee from the land of the Jordan,  the Hermons, from the hill Mizar.
Ps. Deep calls to deep at the noise of thy waterfalls. All thy waves and thy billows have gone over me.
Ps. Yet Jehovah will command his loving kindness in the daytime,  in the night his song shall be with me, even a prayer to the God of my life.
Ps. I will say to God my rock, Why have thou forgotten me? Why do I go mourning because of the oppression of the enemy?
Ps. As with a sword in my bones, my adversaries reproach me; while they continually say to me, Where is thy God?
Ps. Why are thou cast down, O my soul? And why are thou disquieted within me? Hope thou in God, for I shall yet praise him, the help of my countenance,  my God.
Ps. Judge me, O God,  plead my cause against a profane nation. O deliver me from the deceitful and unjust man.
Ps. For thou are the God of my strength. Why have thou cast me off? Why do I go mourning because of the oppression of the enemy?
Ps. O send out thy light and thy truth. Let them lead me. Let them bring me to thy holy hill,  to thy tabernacles.
Ps. Then I will go to the altar of God, to God my exceeding joy,  I will praise thee upon the harp, O God, my God.
Ps. Why are thou cast down, O my soul? And why are thou disquieted within me? Hope thou in God, for I shall yet praise him, the help of my countenance,  my God.
Ps. We have heard with our ears, O God, our fathers have told us, what work thou did in their days, in the days of old.
Ps. Thou drove out the nations with thy hand,  thou planted them. Thou afflicted the peoples,  thou spread them abroad.
Ps. For they did not get the land in possession by their own sword, nor did their own arm save them,  thy right hand,  thine arm,  the light of thy countenance, because thou were favorable to them.
Ps. Thou are my King, O God. Command deliverance for Jacob.
Ps. Through thee we will push down our adversaries. Through thy name we will tread them under who rise up against us.
Ps. For I will not trust in my bow, nor shall my sword save me.
Ps. But thou have saved us from our adversaries,  have put them to shame who hate us.
Ps. In God we have made our boast all the day long,  we will give thanks to thy name forever. Selah.
Ps. But now thou have cast off,  brought us to dishonor,  go not forth with our armies.
Ps. Thou make us to turn back from the adversary. And those who hate us take spoil for themselves.
Ps. Thou have made us like sheep for food,  have scattered us among the nations.
Ps. Thou sell thy people for nothing,  have not increased by their price.
Ps. Thou make us a reproach to our neighbors, a scoffing and a derision to those who are round about us.
Ps. Thou make us a byword among the nations, a shaking of the head among the peoples.
Ps. All the day long my dishonor is before me,  the shame of my face has covered me,
Ps. for the voice of him who reproaches and blasphemes, because of the enemy and the avenger.
Ps. All this has come upon us, yet we have not forgotten thee, nor have we dealt falsely in thy covenant.
Ps. Our heart is not turned back, nor have our steps declined from thy way,
Ps. that thou have greatly broken us in the place of jackals,  covered us with the shadow of death.
Ps. If we have forgotten the name of our God, or spread forth our hands to a strange god,
Ps. will not God search this out? For he knows the secrets of the heart.
Ps. Yea, for thy sake we are killed all the day long. We are accounted as sheep for the slaughter.
Ps. Awake, why do thou sleep, O Lord? Arise, cast not off forever.
Ps. Why do thou hide thy face,  forget our affliction and our oppression?
Ps. For our soul is bowed down to the dust; our body clings to the ground.
Ps. Rise up for our help,  redeem us for thy loving kindness' sake.
Ps. My heart overflows with a good matter. I speak the things which I have made concerning the king. My tongue is the pen of a ready writer.
Ps. Thou are fairer than the sons of men. Grace is poured into thy lips. Therefore God has blessed thee forever.
Ps. Gird thy sword upon thy thigh, O mighty one, thy glory and thy majesty.
Ps. And in thy majesty ride on prosperously because of truth and gentleness and righteousness. And thy right hand shall teach thee awesome things.
Ps. Thine arrows are sharp. The peoples fall under thee. They are in the heart of the king's enemies.
Ps. Thy throne, O God, is forever and ever. A scepter of straightness is the scepter of thy kingdom.
Ps. Thou have loved righteousness,  hated wickedness. Therefore God, thy God, has anointed thee with the oil of gladness above thy companions.
Ps. All thy garments smell of myrrh,  aloes,  cassia. Out of ivory palaces stringed instruments have made thee glad.
Ps. Kings' daughters are among thy honorable women. At thy right hand stands the queen in gold of Ophir.
Ps. Hearken, O daughter,  consider,  incline thine ear. Forget also thine own people,  thy father's house.
Ps. So will the king desire thy beauty, for he is thy lord,  reverence thou him.
Ps. And the daughter of Tyre shall adore him with a gift. The rich among the people shall entreat thy favor.
Ps. Inside, the king's daughter is all glorious. Her clothing is embroidered with gold.
Ps. She shall be led to the king in broidered work. The virgins, her companions who follow her, shall be brought to thee.
Ps. With gladness and rejoicing they shall be led. They shall enter into the king's palace.
Ps. Instead of thy fathers shall be thy sons, whom thou shall make rulers in all the earth.
Ps. I will make thy name to be remembered in all generations. Therefore the peoples shall give thee thanks forever and ever.
Ps. God is our refuge and strength, a very present help in trouble.
Ps. Therefore we will not fear, though the earth changes,  though the mountains are shaken into the heart of the seas,
Ps. though the waters of it roar and are troubled, though the mountains tremble with the swelling of it. Selah.
Ps. There is a river, the streams of which make the city of God glad, the holy place of the tabernacles of the Most High.
Ps. God is in the midst of her. She shall not be moved. God will help her,  that right early.
Ps. The nations raged, the kingdoms were moved, he uttered his voice, the earth melted.
Ps. Jehovah of hosts is with us. The God of Jacob is our refuge. Selah.
Ps. Come, behold the works of Jehovah, what desolations he has made in the earth.
Ps. He makes wars to cease to the end of the earth. He breaks the bow,  cuts the spear in two. He burns the chariots in the fire.
Ps. Be still,  know that I am God. I will be exalted among the nations. I will be exalted in the earth.
Ps. Jehovah of hosts is with us. The God of Jacob is our refuge. Selah.
Ps. O clap your hands, all ye peoples. Shout to God with the voice of triumph.
Ps. For Jehovah Most High is awesome. He is a great King over all the earth.
Ps. He subdues peoples under us,  nations under our feet.
Ps. He chooses our inheritance for us, the glory of Jacob whom he loved. Selah.
Ps. God has gone up with a shout, Jehovah with the sound of a trumpet.
Ps. Sing praise to God, sing praises. Sing praises to our King, sing praises.
Ps. For God is the King of all the earth. Sing ye praises with understanding.
Ps. God reigns over the nations. God sits upon his holy throne.
Ps. The nobles of the peoples are gathered together, the people of the God of Abraham. For the shields of the earth belong to God. He is greatly exalted.
Ps. Great is Jehovah,  greatly to be praised in the city of our God, in his holy mountain.
Ps. Beautiful in elevation, the joy of the whole earth, is mount Zion, on the sides of the north, the city of the great King.
Ps. God has made himself known in her palaces for a refuge.
Ps. For, lo, the kings assembled themselves. They passed by together.
Ps. They saw it, then were they amazed. They were dismayed, they hastened away.
Ps. Trembling took hold of them there, pain, as of a woman in travail.
Ps. With the east wind thou break the ships of Tarshish.
Ps. As we have heard, so we have seen in the city of Jehovah of hosts, in the city of our God, God will establish it forever. Selah.
Ps. We have thought on thy loving kindness, O God, in the midst of thy temple.
Ps. As is thy name, O God, so is thy praise to the ends of the earth. Thy right hand is full of righteousness.
Ps. Let mount Zion be glad. Let the daughters of Judah rejoice because of thy judgments.
Ps. Walk about Zion,  go round about her. Number the towers of it,
Ps. mark ye well her bulwarks, consider her palaces, that ye may tell it to the generation following.
Ps. For this God is our God forever and ever. He will be our guide even to death.
Ps. Hear this, all ye peoples. Give ear, all ye inhabitants of the world,
Ps. both low and high, rich and poor together.
Ps. My mouth shall speak wisdom,  the meditation of my heart shall be of understanding.
Ps. I will incline my ear to a proverb. I will open my dark saying upon the harp.
Ps. Why should I fear in the days of evil, when iniquity at my heels encompasses me about?
Ps. Those who trust in their wealth,  boast themselves in the multitude of their riches,
Ps. none can by any means redeem his brother, nor give to God a ransom for him
Ps. (for the redemption of their life is costly,  it fails forever),
Ps. that he should still live always, that he should not see corruption.
Ps. For he shall see it. Wise men die. The fool and the brutish alike perish,  leave their wealth to others.
Ps. Their inward thought is that their houses are forever, their dwelling-places to all generations. They call their lands after their own names.
Ps. Even a man in splendor does not abide. He is like the beasts that perish.
Ps. This their way is their folly. Yet after them men approve their sayings. Selah.
Ps. They are appointed as a flock for Sheol. Death shall be their shepherd,  the upright shall have dominion over them in the morning. And their beauty shall be for Sheol to consume, that there be no habitation for it.
Ps. But God will redeem my soul from the power of Sheol, for he will receive me. Selah.
Ps. Be not thou afraid when a man is made rich, when the glory of his house is increased.
Ps. For when he dies he shall carry nothing away. His glory shall not descend after him.
Ps. Though while he lived he blessed his soul (and men praise thee, when thou do well for thyself),
Ps. he shall go to the generation of his fathers. They shall never see the light.
Ps. A man who is in splendor,  understands not, is like the beasts that perish.
Ps. The Mighty One, God, Jehovah, has spoken,  called the earth from the rising of the sun to the going down thereof.
Ps. Out of Zion, the perfection of beauty, God has shone forth.
Ps. Our God comes,  does not keep silence. A fire devours before him,  it is very tempestuous round about him.
Ps. He calls to the heavens above,  to the earth, that he may judge his people.
Ps. Gather my sanctified together to me, those who have made a covenant with me by sacrifice.
Ps. And the heavens shall declare his righteousness, for God is judge himself. Selah.
Ps. Hear, O my people,  I will speak, O Israel,  I will testify to thee, I am God, even thy God.
Ps. I will not reprove thee for thy sacrifices,  thy burnt offerings being continually before me.
Ps. I will take no bullock out of thy house, nor he-goats out of thy folds.
Ps. For every beast of the forest is mine,  the cattle upon a thousand hills.
Ps. I know all the birds of the mountains,  the wild beasts of the field are mine.
Ps. If I were hungry, I would not tell thee, for the world is mine,  the fullness thereof.
Ps. Will I eat the flesh of bulls, or drink the blood of goats?
Ps. Offer to God the sacrifice of thanksgiving,  pay thy vows to the Most High.
Ps. And call upon me in the day of trouble. I will deliver thee,  thou shall glorify me.
Ps. But to the wicked man God says, What have thou to do to declare my statutes,  that thou have taken my covenant in thy mouth,
Ps. since thou hate instruction,  cast my words behind thee?
Ps. When thou saw a thief, thou consented with him,  have been partaker with adulterers.
Ps. Thou give thy mouth to evil,  thy tongue frames deceit.
Ps. Thou sit and speak against thy brother; thou slander thine own mother's son.
Ps. These things thou have done,  I kept silence. Thou thought that I was altogether such a one as thyself. But I will reprove thee,  set them in order before thine eyes.
Ps. Now consider this, ye who forget God, lest I tear you in pieces,  there be none to deliver:
Ps. Whoever offers the sacrifice of thanksgiving glorifies me. And to him who orders his way aright I will show the salvation of God.
Ps. Have mercy upon me, O God, according to thy loving kindness. According to the multitude of thy tender mercies blot out my transgressions.
Ps. Wash me thoroughly from my iniquity,  cleanse me from my sin.
Ps. For I know my transgressions,  my sin is ever before me.
Ps. Against thee, thee only, I have sinned,  done that which is evil in thy sight, that thou may be justified when thou speak,  may prevail when thou are criticized.
Ps. Behold, I was brought forth in iniquity,  in sin my mother conceived me.
Ps. Behold, thou desire truth in the inward parts,  in the hidden part thou will make me to know wisdom.
Ps. Purify me with hyssop,  I shall be clean. Wash me,  I shall be whiter than snow.
Ps. Make me to hear joy and gladness, that the bones which thou have broken may rejoice.
Ps. Hide thy face from my sins,  blot out all my iniquities.
Ps. Create in me a clean heart, O God,  renew a right spirit within me.
Ps. Cast me not away from thy presence,  take not thy holy Spirit from me.
Ps. Restore to me the joy of thy salvation,  uphold me with a willing spirit.
Ps. Then I will teach transgressors thy ways,  sinners shall be converted to thee.
Ps. Deliver me from blood guiltiness, O God, thou God of my salvation. And my tongue shall sing aloud of thy righteousness.
Ps. O Lord, open thou my lips,  my mouth shall show forth thy praise.
Ps. For thou delight not in sacrifice, else I would give it. Thou have no pleasure in burnt offering.
Ps. The sacrifices of God are a broken spirit. A broken and contrite heart, O God, thou will not despise.
Ps. Do good in thy good pleasure to Zion. Build thou the walls of Jerusalem.
Ps. Then thou will delight in the sacrifices of righteousness, in burnt offering and in whole burnt offering. Then they will offer bullocks upon thine altar.
Ps. Why boast thou thyself in mischief, O mighty man? The loving kindness of God is continual.
Ps. Thy tongue devises wickedness, like a sharp razor, working deceitfully.
Ps. Thou love evil more than good,  lying rather than to speak righteousness. Selah.
Ps. Thou love all devouring words, O thou deceitful tongue.
Ps. God will likewise destroy thee forever. He will take thee up,  pluck thee out of thy tent,  root thee out of the land of the living. Selah.
Ps. The righteous also shall see,  fear,  shall laugh at him, saying,
Ps. Lo, this is the man who did not make God his strength,  trusted in the abundance of his riches,  strengthened himself in his wickedness.
Ps. But as for me, I am like a green olive tree in the house of God. I trust in the loving kindness of God forever and ever.
Ps. I will give thee thanks forever, because thou have done it. And I will hope in thy name in the presence of thy sanctified, for it is good.
Ps. The fool has said in his heart, There is no God. Corrupt are they,  have done abominable iniquity. There is none who does good.
Ps. God looked down from heaven upon the sons of men, to see if there were any who understood, who seek after God.
Ps. Every one of them has gone back. They have together become filthy. There is none who does good, no, not one.
Ps. Have the workers of iniquity no knowledge, who eat up my people as they eat bread,  call not upon God?
Ps. There they were in great fear, where no fear was, for God has scattered the bones of him who encamps against thee. Thou have put them to shame because God has rejected them.
Ps. O that the salvation of Israel came out of Zion! When God brings back the captivity of his people, then Jacob shall rejoice,  Israel shall be glad.
Ps. Save me, O God, by thy name,  judge me in thy might.
Ps. Hear my prayer, O God. Give ear to the words of my mouth.
Ps. For strangers are risen up against me,  violent men have sought after my soul. They have not set God before them. Selah.
Ps. Behold, God is my helper. The Lord is of those who uphold my soul.
Ps. He will requite the evil to my enemies. Destroy thou them in thy truth.
Ps. With a freewill offering I will sacrifice to thee. I will give thanks to thy name, O Jehovah, for it is good.
Ps. For he has delivered me out of all trouble,  my eye has seen it upon my enemies.
Ps. Give ear to my prayer, O God,  hide not thyself from my supplication.
Ps. Attend to me,  answer me. I am restless in my complaint,  moan,
Ps. because of the voice of the enemy, because of the oppression of the wicked. For they cast iniquity upon me,  in anger they persecute me.
Ps. My heart is greatly pained within me,  the terrors of death have fallen upon me.
Ps. Fearfulness and trembling have come upon me,  horror has overwhelmed me.
Ps. And I said, O that I had wings like a dove! Then I would fly away,  be at rest.
Ps. Lo, then I would wander far off. I would lodge in the wilderness. Selah.
Ps. I would hasten myself to a shelter from the stormy wind and tempest.
Ps. Destroy, O Lord, divide their tongue, for I have seen violence and strife in the city.
Ps. Day and night they go about it, upon the walls of it. Iniquity and mischief also are in the midst of it.
Ps. Wickedness is in the midst of it. Oppression and deceit depart not from its streets.
Ps. For it was not an enemy who reproached me. Then I could have borne it. Neither was it he who hated me that magnified himself against me. Then I would have hid myself from him.
Ps. But it was thou, a man my equal, my companion,  my familiar friend.
Ps. We took sweet counsel together. We walked in the house of God with the throng.
Ps. Let death come suddenly upon them. Let them go down alive into Sheol. For wickedness is in their dwelling, in the midst of them.
Ps. As for me, I will call upon God,  Jehovah will save me.
Ps. Evening,  morning,  at noonday, I will complain and moan. And he will hear my voice.
Ps. He has redeemed my soul in peace from the battle that was against me, for there were many by me.
Ps. God will hear,  respond to them, (even he who abides of old), Selah, men who have no changes,  who fear not God.
Ps. He has put forth his hands against such as were at peace with him. He has profaned his covenant.
Ps. His mouth was smooth as butter,  his heart was war. His words were softer than oil, yet they were drawn swords.
Ps. (Cast thy burden upon Jehovah,  he will sustain thee. He will never allow the righteous man to be moved.)
Ps. But thou, O God, will bring them down into the pit of destruction. Bloodthirsty and deceitful men shall not live out half their days,  I will trust in thee.
Ps. Be merciful to me, O God, for man would swallow me up. Fighting all the day long he oppresses me.
Ps. My enemies would swallow me up all the day long, for they are many who fight proudly against me.
Ps. What time I am afraid, I will put my trust in thee.
Ps. In God I will praise his word. In God I have put my trust. I will not be afraid. What can flesh do to me?
Ps. All the day long they wrest my words. All their thoughts are against me for evil.
Ps. They gather themselves together. They hide themselves. They mark my steps, even as they have waited for my soul.
Ps. Shall they escape by iniquity? In anger cast down the peoples, O God.
Ps. Thou number my wanderings. Put thou my tears into thy bottle. Are they not in thy book?
Ps. Then shall my enemies turn back in the day that I call. This I know, that God is for me.
Ps. In God I will praise his word. In Jehovah I will praise his word.
Ps. In God I have put my trust. I will not be afraid. What can man do to me?
Ps. Thy vows are upon me, O God. I will render thank offerings to thee.
Ps. For thou have delivered my soul from death,  my feet from falling, that I may walk before God in the light of the living.
Ps. Be merciful to me, O God, be merciful to me, for my soul takes refuge in thee. Yea, in the shadow of thy wings I will take refuge until calamities be passed by.
Ps. I will cry to God Most High, to God who performs for me.
Ps. He will send from heaven,  save me from the reproach of him who would swallow me up. Selah. God will send forth his loving kindness and his truth.
Ps. My soul is among lions. I lie among those who are set on fire, even the sons of men, whose teeth are spears and arrows,  their tongue a sharp sword.
Ps. Be thou exalted, O God, above the heavens, thy glory above all the earth.
Ps. They have prepared a net for my steps. My soul is bowed down. They have dug a pit before me. They are fallen into the midst of it themselves. Selah.
Ps. My heart is fixed, O God, my heart is fixed. I will sing, yea, I will sing praises.
Ps. Awake up, my glory. Awake, psaltery and harp. I myself will awake right early.
Ps. I will give thanks to thee, O Lord, among the peoples. I will sing praises to thee among the nations.
Ps. For thy loving kindness is great to the heavens,  thy truth to the skies.
Ps. Be thou exalted, O God, above the heavens, thy glory above all the earth.
Ps. Do ye indeed speak righteousness in silence? Do ye judge uprightly, O ye sons of men?
Ps. No! In heart ye work wickedness. Ye weigh out the violence of your hands in the earth.
Ps. The wicked are estranged from the womb. They go astray as soon as they are born, speaking lies.
Ps. Their poison is like the poison of a serpent, like the deaf adder that stops her ear,
Ps. which hearkens not to the voice of charmers, charming ever so wisely.
Ps. Break their teeth, O God, in their mouth. Break out the great teeth of the young lions, O Jehovah.
Ps. Let them melt away as water that runs with haste. When he aims his arrows, let them be as though they were cut off,
Ps. as a snail which melts and passes away, as the untimely birth of a woman, that has not seen the sun.
Ps. Before your pots can feel the thorns, he will take them away with a whirlwind, the green and the burning alike.
Ps. A righteous man shall rejoice when he sees the vengeance. He shall wash his feet in the blood of the wicked,
Ps. so that men shall say, Truly there is a reward for the righteous man. Truly there is a God who judges in the earth.
Ps. Deliver me from my enemies, O my God. Set me on high from those who rise up against me.
Ps. Deliver me from the workers of iniquity,  save me from the bloodthirsty men.
Ps. For, lo, they lie in wait for my soul. The mighty gather themselves together against me, not for my transgression, nor for my sin, O Jehovah.
Ps. They run and prepare themselves without my fault. Awake thou to help me,  behold.
Ps. Even thou, O Jehovah God of hosts, the God of Israel, arise to visit all the nations. Be not merciful to any wicked transgressors. Selah.
Ps. They return at evening. They howl like a dog,  go round about the city.
Ps. Behold, they belch out with their mouth. Swords are in their lips, for they say, Who hears?
Ps. But thou, O Jehovah, will laugh at them. Thou will have all the nations in derision.
Ps. O my strength, I will give heed to thee, for God is my high tower.
Ps. My God with his loving kindness will meet me. God will let me look upon my enemies.
Ps. Kill them not, lest my people forget. Scatter them by thy power,  bring them down, O Lord our shield,
Ps. for the sin of their mouth,  the words of their lips. Let them even be taken in their pride,  for cursing and lying which they speak.
