Ps. Consume them in wrath, consume them, so that they shall be no more. And let them know that God rules in Jacob, to the ends of the earth. Selah.
Ps. And at evening let them return, let them howl like a dog,  go round about the city.
Ps. They shall wander up and down for food,  tarry all night if they be not satisfied.
Ps. But I will sing of thy strength. Yea, I will sing aloud of thy loving kindness in the morning. For thou have been my high tower,  a refuge in the day of my distress.
Ps. To thee, O my strength, I will sing praises. For God is my high tower, the God of my mercy.
Ps. O God thou have cast us off. Thou have broken us down. Thou have been angry. O restore us again.
Ps. Thou have made the land to tremble. Thou have torn it. Heal the breaking of it, for it shakes.
Ps. Thou have shown thy people hard things. Thou have made us to drink the wine of staggering.
Ps. Thou have given a banner to those who fear thee, that it may be displayed because of the truth. Selah.
Ps. That thy beloved ones may be delivered, save with thy right hand,  answer us.
Ps. God has spoken in his holiness. I will exult. I will divide Shechem,  mete out the valley of Succoth.
Ps. Gilead is mine,  Manasseh is mine. Ephraim also is the defense of my head. Judah is my scepter.
Ps. Moab is my wash pot. Upon Edom I will cast my shoe. Philistia, shout thou because of me.
Ps. Who will bring me into the strong city? Who has led me to Edom?
Ps. Have not thou, O God, cast us off? And thou go not forth, O God, with our armies.
Ps. Give us help against the adversary, for vain is the help of man.
Ps. Through God we shall do valiantly, for he it is who will tread down our adversaries.
Ps. Hear my cry, O God. Attend to my prayer.
Ps. From the end of the earth I will call to thee when my heart is overwhelmed. Lead me to the rock that is higher than I.
Ps. For thou have been a refuge for me, a strong tower from the enemy.
Ps. I will dwell in thy tabernacle forever. I will take refuge in the covert of thy wings. Selah.
Ps. For thou, O God, have heard my vows. Thou have given me the heritage of those who fear thy name.
Ps. Thou will prolong the king's life. His years shall be as many generations.
Ps. He shall abide before God forever. O prepare loving kindness and truth that they may preserve him.
Ps. So I will sing praise to thy name forever, that I may daily perform my vows.
Ps. My soul waits in silence for God only. From him is my salvation.
Ps. He only is my rock and my salvation, my high tower. I shall not be greatly moved.
Ps. How long will ye set upon a man, that ye may kill, all of you, like a leaning wall, like a tottering fence?
Ps. They only consult to thrust him down from his dignity. They delight in lies. They bless with their mouth,  they curse inwardly. Selah.
Ps. My soul, wait thou in silence for God only, for my expectation is from him.
Ps. He only is my rock and my salvation, my high tower. I shall not be moved.
Ps. With God is my salvation and my glory. The rock of my strength,  my refuge, is in God.
Ps. Trust in him at all times, ye people. Pour out your heart before him. God is a refuge for us. Selah.
Ps. Surely men of low degree are vanity,  men of high degree are a lie. In the balances they will go up. They are together lighter than vanity.
Ps. Trust not in oppression,  become not vain in robbery. If riches increase, set not your heart on it.
Ps. God has spoken once, twice I have heard this, that power belongs to God.
Ps. Also to thee, O Lord, belongs loving kindness, for thou render to every man according to his work.
Ps. O God, thou are my God. I will earnestly seek thee. My soul thirsts for thee, my flesh longs for thee, in a dry and weary land, where is no water.
Ps. So I have looked upon thee in the sanctuary to see thy power and thy glory.
Ps. Because thy loving kindness is better than life, my lips shall praise thee.
Ps. So I will bless thee while I live. I will lift up my hands in thy name.
Ps. My soul shall be satisfied as with marrow and fatness. And my mouth shall praise thee with joyful lips
Ps. when I remember thee upon my bed,  meditate on thee in the night-watches.
Ps. For thou have been my help,  in the shadow of thy wings I will rejoice.
Ps. My soul follows close after thee. Thy right hand upholds me.
Ps. But those who seek my soul, to destroy it, shall go into the lower parts of the earth.
Ps. They shall be given over to the power of the sword. They shall be a portion for foxes.
Ps. But the king shall rejoice in God. Everyone who swears by him shall glory, for the mouth of those who speak lies shall be stopped.
Ps. Hear my voice, O God, in my complaint. Preserve my life from fear of the enemy.
Ps. Hide me from the secret counsel of evildoers, from the tumult of the workers of iniquity,
Ps. who have whet their tongue like a sword,  have aimed their arrows, even bitter words,
Ps. that they may shoot in secret places at a blameless man. Suddenly do they shoot at him,  fear not.
Ps. They encourage themselves in an evil purpose. They converse of laying snares secretly. They say, Who will see them?
Ps. They search out iniquities, saying, We have accomplished a diligent search. And the inward part of man and the heart are deep.
Ps. But God will shoot at them. With an arrow they shall suddenly be wounded.
Ps. So they shall be made to stumble, their own tongue being against them. All who see them shall wag the head.
Ps. And all men shall fear. And they shall declare the work of God,  shall wisely consider of his doing.
Ps. A righteous man shall be glad in Jehovah,  shall take refuge in him. And all the upright in heart shall glory.
Ps. Praise waits for thee, O God, in Zion. And to thee the vow shall be performed.
Ps. O thou who hear prayer, to thee all flesh shall come.
Ps. Iniquities prevail against me. As for our transgressions, thou will forgive them.
Ps. Blessed is the man whom thou choose and cause to approach, that he may dwell in thy courts. We shall be satisfied with the goodness of thy house, thy holy temple.
Ps. By awesome things thou will answer us in righteousness, O God of our salvation, thou who are the confidence of all the ends of the earth,  of those who are afar off upon the sea,
Ps. who by his strength sets firm the mountains, being girded about with might,
Ps. who stills the roaring of the seas, the roaring of their waves,  the tumult of the peoples.
Ps. They also who dwell in the outermost parts are afraid at thy signs. Thou make the outgoings of the morning and evening to rejoice.
Ps. Thou visit the earth,  water it; thou greatly enrich it. The river of God is full of water. Thou provide them grain when thou have so prepared the earth.
Ps. Thou water its furrows abundantly. Thou settle the ridges of it. Thou make it soft with showers. Thou bless the springing of it.
Ps. Thou crown the year with thy goodness,  thy paths drop fatness.
Ps. They drop upon the pastures of the wilderness,  the hills are girded with joy.
Ps. The pastures are clothed with flocks. The valleys also are covered over with grain. They shout for joy; they also sing.
Ps. Make a joyful noise to God, all the earth.
Ps. Sing forth the glory of his name. Make his praise glorious.
Ps. Say to God, How awesome are thy works! Through the greatness of thy power thine enemies shall submit themselves to thee.
Ps. All the earth shall worship thee,  shall sing to thee. They shall sing to thy name. Selah.
Ps. Come,  see the works of God, awesome in actions toward the sons of men.
Ps. He turned the sea into dry land. They went through the river on foot. There we rejoiced in him.
Ps. He rules by his might forever. His eyes observe the nations. Let not the rebellious exalt themselves. Selah.
Ps. O bless our God, ye peoples,  make the voice of his praise to be heard,
Ps. who holds our soul in life,  does not allow our feet to be moved.
Ps. For thou, O God, have proved us. Thou have tried us as silver is tried.
Ps. Thou brought us into the net. Thou laid a great burden upon our loins.
Ps. Thou caused men to ride over our heads. We went through fire and through water. But thou brought us out into a wealthy place.
Ps. I will come into thy house with burnt offerings. I will pay thee my vows,
Ps. which my lips uttered,  my mouth spoke, when I was in distress.
Ps. I will offer to thee burnt offerings of fatlings, with the incense of rams. I will offer bullocks with goats. Selah.
Ps. Come,  hear, all ye who fear God,  I will declare what he has done for my soul.
Ps. I cried to him with my mouth,  he was extolled with my tongue.
Ps. If I regard iniquity in my heart, the Lord will not hear.
Ps. But truly God has heard. He has attended to the voice of my prayer.
Ps. Blessed be God, who has not turned away my prayer, nor his loving kindness from me.
Ps. God be merciful to us,  bless us,  cause his face to shine upon us (Selah),
Ps. that thy way may be known upon earth, thy salvation among all nations.
Ps. Let the peoples praise thee, O God. Let all the peoples praise thee.
Ps. O let the nations be glad and sing for joy. For thou will judge the peoples with equity,  govern the nations upon earth. Selah.
Ps. Let the peoples praise thee, O God. Let all the peoples praise thee.
Ps. The earth has yielded its increase. God, even our own God, will bless us.
Ps. God will bless us,  all the ends of the earth shall fear him.
Ps. Let God arise, let his enemies be scattered. Let also those who hate him flee before him.
Ps. As smoke is driven away, so drive them away. As wax melts before the fire, so let the wicked perish at the presence of God.
Ps. But let the righteous be glad. Let them exult before God. Yea, let them rejoice with gladness.
Ps. Sing to God, sing praises to his name. Cast up a highway for him who rides through the deserts. His name is Jehovah,  exult ye before him.
Ps. A father of the fatherless,  a judge of the widows, is God in his holy habitation.
Ps. God sets the lonely in families. He brings out the prisoners into prosperity,  the rebellious dwell in a parched land.
Ps. O God, when thou went forth before thy people, when thou marched through the wilderness (Selah)
Ps. the earth trembled, the heavens also dropped at the presence of God, Sinai at the presence of God, the God of Israel.
Ps. Thou, O God, sent a plentiful rain. Thou confirmed thine inheritance when it was weary.
Ps. Thy congregation dwelt in it. Thou, O God, prepared for the poor from thy goodness.
Ps. The Lord gave the word. Great was the company of those who published it.
Ps. Kings of armies fled quickly,  she who remained at home divided the spoil.
Ps. Though ye lie between two boundaries, it is as the wings of a dove covered with silver,  her pinions with yellow gold.
Ps. When the Almighty scattered kings in it, it was as it snows in Zalmon.
Ps. A mountain of God is the mountain of Bashan; a high mountain is the mountain of Bashan.
Ps. Why look ye askance, ye high mountains, at the mountain which God has desired for his abode? Yea, Jehovah will dwell in it forever.
Ps. The chariots of God are twenty thousand, even thousands upon thousands. The Lord is among them, as in Sinai, in the sanctuary.
Ps. Thou have ascended on high. Thou have led captivity captive. Thou have received gifts among men, yea, among the rebellious also, that Jehovah God might dwell with them.
Ps. Blessed be the Lord, who bears our burden daily, even the God who is our salvation. Selah.
Ps. God is to us a God of deliverances,  escape from death belongs to Jehovah the Lord.
Ps. But God will smite through the head of his enemies, the hairy scalp of him who still goes in his guiltiness.
Ps. The Lord said, I will bring again from Bashan. I will bring again from the depths of the sea,
Ps. that thou may dash thy foot in blood, that the tongue of thy dogs may have its portion from enemies.
Ps. They have seen thy goings, O God, even the goings of my God, my King, into the sanctuary.
Ps. The singers went before, the minstrels followed after, in the midst of the damsels playing with timbrels.
Ps. Bless ye God in the congregations, the lord of the fountain of Israel.
Ps. There is little Benjamin their ruler, the rulers of Judah and their council, the rulers of Zebulun, the rulers of Naphtali.
Ps. Thy God has commanded thy strength. Strengthen, O God, that which thou have wrought for us.
Ps. Because of thy temple at Jerusalem kings shall bring presents to thee.
Ps. Rebuke the wild beast of the reeds, the multitude of the bulls, with the calves of the peoples, trampling under foot the pieces of silver. He has scattered the peoples that delight in war.
Ps. Rulers shall come out of Egypt. Ethiopia shall hasten to stretch out her hands to God.
Ps. Sing to God, ye kingdoms of the earth. O sing praises to the Lord (Selah),
Ps. to him who rides upon the heaven of heavens, which are of old. Lo, he utters his voice, a mighty voice.
Ps. Ascribe ye strength to God. His excellency is over Israel,  his strength is in the skies.
Ps. O God, awesome out of thy holy places, the God of Israel, he gives strength and power to his people. Blessed be God.
Ps. Save me, O God, for the waters have come in to my soul.
Ps. I sink in deep mire where there is no standing. I have come into deep waters, where the floods overflow me.
Ps. I am weary with my crying. My throat is dried. My eyes fail while I wait for my God.
Ps. Those who hate me without a cause are more than the hairs of my head. Those who would cut me off, being my enemies wrongfully, are mighty. That which I took not away I have to restore.
Ps. O God, thou know my foolishness,  my sins are not hid from thee.
Ps. Let not those who wait for thee be put to shame through me, O lord Jehovah of hosts. Let not those who seek thee be brought to dishonor through me, O God of Israel.
Ps. Because for thy sake I have borne reproach, shame has covered my face.
Ps. I have become a stranger to my brothers,  an alien to my mother's sons.
Ps. For the zeal of thy house has eaten me up,  the reproaches of those who reproach thee have fallen upon me.
Ps. When I wept in my soul with fasting, that was to my reproach.
Ps. When I made sackcloth my clothing, I became a byword to them.
Ps. Those who sit in the gate talk of me,  I am the song of the drunkards.
Ps. But as for me, my prayer is to thee, O Jehovah. In an acceptable time, O God, in the abundance of thy loving kindness, answer me in the truth of thy salvation.
Ps. Deliver me out of the mire,  let me not sink. Let me be delivered from those who hate me,  out of the deep waters.
Ps. Let not the water flood overwhelm me, nor let the deep swallow me up. And let not the pit shut its mouth upon me.
Ps. Answer me, O Jehovah, for thy loving kindness is good. According to the multitude of thy tender mercies turn thou to me,
Ps. and hide not thy face from thy servant, for I am in distress. Answer me speedily.
Ps. Draw near to my soul,  redeem it. Ransom me because of my enemies.
Ps. Thou know my reproach,  my shame,  my dishonor. My adversaries are all before thee.
Ps. Reproach has broken my heart,  I am full of heaviness. And I looked for some to take pity,  there was none,  for comforters,  I found none.
Ps. They also gave me gall for my food,  in my thirst they gave me vinegar to drink.
Ps. Let their table before them become a snare,  when they are in peace, a trap,  for a stumbling block,  for a retribution to them.
Ps. Let their eyes be darkened, so that they cannot see,  bow down their back continually.
Ps. Pour out thine indignation upon them,  let the fierceness of thine anger overtake them.
Ps. Let their habitation be desolate. Let none dwell in their tents.
Ps. For they persecute him whom thou have smitten,  they tell of the sorrow of those whom thou have wounded.
Ps. Add iniquity to their iniquity,  let them not come into thy righteousness.
Ps. Let them be blotted out of the book of life,  not be written with the righteous.
Ps. But I am poor and sorrowful. Let thy salvation, O God, set me up on high.
Ps. I will praise the name of God with a song,  will magnify him with thanksgiving,
Ps. and it will please Jehovah better than an ox, or a bullock that has horns and hoofs.
Ps. The meek have seen it,  are glad. Ye who seek after God, let your heart live.
Ps. For Jehovah hears the needy,  does not despise his prisoners.
Ps. Let heaven and earth praise him, the seas,  everything that moves therein.
Ps. For God will save Zion,  build the cities of Judah. And they shall abide there,  have it in possession.
Ps. The seed also of his servants shall inherit it,  those who love his name shall dwell therein.
Ps. Hasten, O God, to deliver me. Make haste to help me, O Jehovah.
Ps. Let them be put to shame and confounded who seek after my soul. Let them be turned backward and brought to dishonor who delight in my hurt.
Ps. Let them be turned back because of their shame who say, Aha, aha.
Ps. Let all those who seek thee rejoice and be glad in thee. And let such as love thy salvation say continually, Let God be magnified.
Ps. But I am poor and needy. Make haste to me, O God. Thou are my help and my deliverer, O Jehovah. Delay thou not.
Ps. In thee, O Jehovah, do I take refuge. Let me never be put to shame.
Ps. Deliver me in thy righteousness,  rescue me. Bow down thine ear to me,  save me.
Ps. Be thou to me a rock of habitation to which I may continually resort. Thou have given commandment to save me, for thou are my rock and my fortress.
Ps. Rescue me, O my God, out of the hand of a wicked man, out of the hand of an unrighteous and cruel man.
Ps. For thou are my hope, O lord Jehovah, my trust from my youth.
Ps. By thee I have been held up from the womb. Thou are he who took me out of my mother's bowels. My praise shall be continually of thee.
Ps. I am as a wonder to many,  thou are my strong refuge.
Ps. My mouth shall be filled with thy praise,  with thy honor all the day.
Ps. Cast me not off in the time of old age. Forsake me not when my strength fails.
Ps. For my enemies speak concerning me,  those who watch for my soul take counsel together,
Ps. saying, God has forsaken him. Pursue and take him, for there is none to deliver.
Ps. O God, be not far from me. O my God, make haste to help me.
Ps. Let them be put to shame and consumed who are adversaries to my soul. Let them be covered with reproach and dishonor who seek my hurt.
Ps. But I will hope continually,  will praise thee yet more and more.
Ps. My mouth shall tell of thy righteousness, of thy salvation all the day, for I know not the numbers.
Ps. I will come with the mighty acts of the lord Jehovah. I will make mention of thy righteousness, even of thine only.
Ps. O God, thou have taught me from my youth,  I have declared thy wondrous works until now.
Ps. Yea, even when I am old and gray headed, O God, forsake me not, until I have declared thy strength to a generation, thy might to everyone who is to come.
Ps. Thy righteousness also, O God, is very high, thou who have done great things. O God, who is like thee?
Ps. Thou, who have shown us many and great troubles, will revive us again,  will bring us up again from the depths of the earth.
Ps. Increase thou my greatness,  turn again and comfort me.
Ps. I will also praise thee with the psaltery, even thy truth, O my God. To thee I will sing praises with the harp, O thou Holy One of Israel.
Ps. My lips shall shout for joy when I sing praises to thee,  my soul, which thou have redeemed.
Ps. My tongue also shall talk of thy righteousness all the day long. For they are put to shame, for they are confounded, who seek my hurt.
Ps. Give the king thy judgments, O God,  thy righteousness to the king's son.
Ps. He will judge thy people with righteousness,  thy poor with justice.
Ps. The mountains shall bring peace to the people,  the hills, in righteousness.
Ps. He will judge the poor of the people. He will save the sons of the needy,  will break in pieces the oppressor.
Ps. They shall fear thee while the sun endures,  as long as the moon, throughout all generations.
Ps. He will come down like rain upon the mown grass, as showers that water the earth.
Ps. In his days righteousness shall flourish,  abundance of peace, till the moon is no more.
Ps. He shall also have dominion from sea to sea,  from the River to the ends of the earth.
Ps. Those who dwell in the wilderness shall bow before him,  his enemies shall lick the dust.
Ps. The kings of Tarshish and of the isles shall render tribute. The kings of Sheba and Seba shall offer gifts.
Ps. Yea, all kings shall fall down before him. All nations shall serve him.
Ps. For he will deliver a needy man when he cries,  a poor man, who has no helper.
Ps. He will have pity on a poor and needy man,  he will save the souls of the needy.
Ps. He will redeem their soul from oppression and violence. And their blood will be precious in his sight,
Ps. and they shall live. And to him shall be given of the gold of Sheba. And men shall pray for him continually. They shall bless him all the day long.
Ps. There shall be abundance of grain in the earth upon the top of the mountains. The fruit of it shall shake like Lebanon. And they of the city shall flourish like grass of the earth.
Ps. His name shall endure forever. His name shall be continued as long as the sun. And men shall be blessed in him. All nations shall call him blessed.
Ps. Blessed be Jehovah God, the God of Israel, who alone does wondrous things.
Ps. And blessed be his glorious name forever. And let the whole earth be filled with his glory. Truly,  Truly.
Ps. The prayers of David the son of Jesse are ended.
Ps. Surely God is good to Israel, to such as are pure in heart.
Ps. But as for me, my feet were almost gone. My steps had well nigh slipped.
Ps. For I was envious of the arrogant when I saw the prosperity of the wicked.
Ps. For there are no pangs in their death,  their strength is firm.
Ps. They are not in trouble as other men, nor are they plagued like other men.
Ps. Therefore pride is as a chain around their neck. Violence covers them as a garment.
Ps. Their eyes stand out with fatness. They have more than heart could wish.
Ps. They scoff,  in wickedness utter oppression. They speak loftily.
Ps. They have set their mouth in the heavens,  their tongue walks through the earth.
Ps. Therefore his people return here,  waters of a full cup are drained by them.
Ps. And they say, How does God know? And is there knowledge in the Most High?
Ps. Behold, these are the wicked,  those who always prosper. They have possessed wealth.
Ps. Surely in vain I have cleansed my heart,  washed my hands in innocence,
Ps. for all the day long I have been plagued,  chastened every morning.
Ps. If I had said, I will speak thus, behold, I would have dealt treacherously with the generation of thy sons.
Ps. When I thought how I might understand this, it was too painful for me,
Ps. until I went into the sanctuary of God,  considered their latter end.
Ps. Surely thou set them in slippery places. Thou cast them down to destruction.
Ps. How they have become a desolation in a moment! They are utterly consumed with terrors.
Ps. As a dream from awakening, O Lord, when thou waken, thou will despise their form.
Ps. For my soul was grieved,  I was pricked in my heart.
Ps. So I was brutish,  ignorant. I was a beast before thee.
Ps. Nevertheless I am continually with thee. Thou have held my right hand.
Ps. Thou will guide me with thy counsel,  afterward receive me to glory.
Ps. Whom have I in heaven? And there is none upon earth that I desire besides thee.
Ps. My flesh and my heart fails,  God is the strength of my heart and my portion forever.
Ps. For, lo, those who are far from thee shall perish. Thou have destroyed all those who go a whoring from thee.
Ps. But it is good for me to draw near to God. I have made the lord Jehovah my refuge, that I may tell of all thy works.
Ps. O God, why have thou cast off forever? Why does thine anger smoke against the sheep of thy pasture?
Ps. Remember thy congregation, which thou have gotten of old, which thou have redeemed to be the tribe of thine inheritance,  mount Zion, at which thou have dwelt.
Ps. Lift up thy feet to the perpetual ruins, all the evil that the enemy has done in the sanctuary.
Ps. Thine adversaries have roared in the midst of thine assembly. They have set up their ensigns for signs.
Ps. They seemed as men who lifted up axes upon a thicket of trees.
Ps. And now they break down all the carved work of it with hatchet and hammers.
Ps. They have set thy sanctuary on fire. They have profaned the dwelling-place of thy name to the ground.
Ps. They said in their heart, Let us make havoc of them altogether. They have burned up all the meeting-places of God in the land.
Ps. We do not see our signs. There is no more any prophet, nor is there among us he who knows how long.
Ps. How long, O God, shall the adversary reproach? Shall the enemy blaspheme thy name forever?
Ps. Why do thou draw back thy hand, even thy right hand? Remove it from the midst of thy bosom.
Ps. Yet God is my King of old, working salvation in the midst of the earth.
Ps. Thou divided the sea by thy strength. Thou break the heads of the sea-monsters in the waters.
Ps. Thou break the heads of leviathan in pieces. Thou gave him to be food to the people inhabiting the wilderness.
Ps. Thou split fountain and flood. Thou dried up mighty rivers.
Ps. The day is thine; the night is also thine. Thou have prepared the light and the sun.
Ps. Thou have set all the borders of the earth. Thou have made summer and winter.
Ps. Remember this, that the enemy has reproached, O Jehovah,  that a foolish people has blasphemed thy name.
Ps. O deliver not the soul of thy turtle-dove to the wild beast. Forget not the life of thy poor forever.
Ps. Have respect to the covenant, for the dark places of the earth are full of the habitations of violence.
Ps. O let not he who is oppressed return ashamed. Let a poor and needy man praise thy name.
Ps. Arise, O God, plead thine own cause. Remember how the foolish man reproaches thee all the day.
Ps. Forget not the voice of thine adversaries. The tumult of those who rise up against thee ascends continually.
Ps. We give thanks to thee, O God. We give thanks, for thy name is near. Men tell of thy wondrous works.
Ps. When I shall find the set time, I will judge uprightly;
Ps. when the earth and all the inhabitants thereof are dissolved. I have set up the pillars of it. Selah.
Ps. I said to the arrogant, Deal not arrogantly,  to the wicked, Lift not up the horn.
Ps. Lift not up your horn on high. Speak not with a stiff neck.
Ps. For neither from the east, nor from the west, nor yet from the south, comes lifting up.
Ps. But God is the judge. He put one down,  lifts another up.
Ps. For in the hand of Jehovah there is a cup,  the wine foams. It is full of mixture,  he pours out of the same, surely to the dregs of it. All the wicked of the earth shall drain them,  drink them.
Ps. But I will declare forever. I will sing praises to the God of Jacob.
Ps. All the horns of the wicked I will also cut off,  the horns of a righteous man shall be lifted up.
Ps. In Judah God is known. His name is great in Israel.
Ps. In Salem also is his tabernacle,  his dwelling-place in Zion.
Ps. There he broke the arrows of the bow, the shield,  the sword,  the battle. Selah.
Ps. Thou are more glorious and excellent than the mountains of prey.
Ps. The stouthearted are made a spoil. They have slept their sleep,  none of the men of might have found their hands.
Ps. At thy rebuke, O God of Jacob, both chariot and horse are cast into a deep sleep.
Ps. Thou, even thou, are to be feared. And who may stand in thy sight when once thou are angry?
Ps. Thou caused sentence to be heard from heaven. The earth feared and was still
Ps. when God arose to judgment, to save all the meek of the earth. Selah.
Ps. Surely the inward thought of man shall praise thee, even the residue of inward thought will observe a festival to thee.
Ps. Vow,  pay to Jehovah your God. Let all who are round about him bring presents to him who ought to be feared.
Ps. He will cut off the spirit of rulers. He is fearful to the kings of the earth.
Ps. I will cry to God with my voice, even to God with my voice,  he will give ear to me.
Ps. In the day of my trouble I sought the Lord. My hand was stretched out in the night,  slacked not. My soul refused to be comforted.
Ps. I remember God,  am disquieted. I complain,  my spirit is overwhelmed. Selah.
Ps. Thou have held my eyelids watching. I am so troubled that I cannot speak.
Ps. I have considered the days of old, the years of ancient times.
Ps. I call to remembrance my song in the night. I commune with my own heart,  my spirit makes diligent search.
Ps. Will the Lord cast off forever? And will he be favorable no more?
Ps. Has his loving kindness entirely gone forever? Does his promise fail for evermore?
Ps. Has God forgotten to be gracious? Has he in anger shut up his tender mercies? Selah.
Ps. And I said, This is my infirmity, the change of the right hand of the Most High.
Ps. I will make mention of the deeds of Jehovah, for I will remember thy wonders of old.
Ps. I will meditate also upon all thy work,  muse on thy doings.
Ps. Thy way, O God, is in the sanctuary. Who is a great god like God?
Ps. Thou are the God who does wonders. Thou have made known thy strength among the peoples.
Ps. With thine arm thou have redeemed thy people, the sons of Jacob and Joseph. Selah.
Ps. The waters saw thee, O God, the waters saw thee. They were afraid. The depths also trembled.
Ps. The clouds poured out water. The skies sent out a sound. Thine arrows also went abroad.
Ps. The voice of thy thunder was in the whirlwind. The lightnings lightened the world. The earth trembled and shook.
Ps. Thy way was in the sea,  thy paths in the great waters. And thy footsteps were not known.
Ps. Thou led thy people like a flock by the hand of Moses and Aaron.
Ps. Give ear, O my people, to my law. Incline your ears to the words of my mouth.
Ps. I will open my mouth in parables. I will utter dark sayings of old,
Ps. which we have heard and known,  our fathers have told us.
Ps. We will not hide them from their sons, telling to the generation to come the praises of Jehovah,  his strength,  his wondrous works that he has done.
Ps. For he established a testimony in Jacob,  appointed a law in Israel, which he commanded our fathers, that they should make them known to their sons,
Ps. that the generation to come might know, even the sons who should be born, who should arise and tell to their sons,
Ps. that they might set their hope in God,  not forget the works of God,  keep his commandments,
Ps. and might not be as their fathers: a stubborn and rebellious generation, a generation that set not their heart aright,  whose spirit was not steadfast with God.
Ps. The sons of Ephraim, being armed and carrying bows, turned back in the day of battle.
Ps. They kept not the covenant of God,  refused to walk in his law.
Ps. And they forgot his doings,  his wondrous works that he had shown them.
Ps. He did marvelous things in the sight of their fathers, in the land of Egypt, in the field of Zoan.
Ps. He divided the sea,  caused them to pass through. And he made the waters to stand as a heap.
Ps. In the daytime also he led them with a cloud,  all the night with a light of fire.
Ps. He split rocks in the wilderness,  gave them drink abundantly as out of the depths.
Ps. He brought streams also out of the rock,  caused waters to run down like rivers.
Ps. Yet they went on to still sin against him, to rebel against the Most High in the desert.
Ps. And they challenged God in their heart by asking food according to their desire.
Ps. Yea, they spoke against God. They said, Can God prepare a table in the wilderness?
Ps. Behold, he smote the rock, so that waters gushed out,  streams overflowed. Can he give bread also? Will he provide flesh for his people?
Ps. Therefore Jehovah heard,  was angry. And a fire was kindled against Jacob,  anger also went up against Israel,
Ps. because they did not believe in God,  did not trust in his salvation.
Ps. Yet he commanded the skies above,  opened the doors of heaven,
Ps. and he rained down manna upon them to eat,  gave them food from heaven.
Ps. Man ate the bread of the mighty. He sent them food to the full.
Ps. He caused the east wind to blow in the heavens,  by his power he guided the south wind.
Ps. He also rained flesh upon them as the dust,  winged birds as the sand of the seas.
Ps. And he let it fall in the midst of their camp round about their habitations.
Ps. So they ate,  were well filled,  he gave them their own desire.
Ps. They were not estranged from that which they desired. Their food was yet in their mouths
Ps. when the anger of God went up against them,  killed of the fattest of them,  smote down the young men of Israel.
Ps. For all this they still sinned,  did not believe in his wondrous works.
Ps. Therefore he consumed their days in vanity,  their years in terror.
Ps. When he killed them, then they inquired after him,  they returned and sought God earnestly.
Ps. And they remembered that God was their rock,  the Most High God their redeemer.
Ps. But they flattered him with their mouth,  lied to him with their tongue.
Ps. For their heart was not right with him, nor were they faithful in his covenant.
Ps. But he, being merciful, forgave iniquity,  destroyed not. Yea, many a time he turned his anger away,  did not stir up all his wrath.
Ps. And he remembered that they were but flesh, a wind that passes away,  comes not again.
Ps. How often they rebelled against him in the wilderness,  grieved him in the desert!
Ps. And they turned again and challenged God,  provoked the Holy One of Israel.
Ps. They did not remember his hand, nor the day when he redeemed them from the adversary,
Ps. how he set his signs in Egypt,  his wonders in the field of Zoan,
Ps. and turned their rivers into blood,  their streams, so that they could not drink.
Ps. He sent among them swarms of flies, which devoured them,  frogs, which destroyed them.
Ps. He also gave their increase to the caterpillar,  their labor to the locust.
Ps. He destroyed their vines with hail,  their sycamore trees with frost.
Ps. He also gave over their cattle to the hail,  their flocks to hot thunderbolts.
Ps. He cast upon them the fierceness of his anger, wrath,  indignation,  trouble, a band of agents of evil.
Ps. He made a path for his anger. He spared not their soul from death,  gave their life over to the pestilence,
Ps. and smote all the firstborn in Egypt, the chief of their strength in the tents of Ham.
Ps. But he led forth his own people like sheep,  guided them in the wilderness like a flock.
Ps. And he led them safely, so that they feared not,  the sea overwhelmed their enemies.
Ps. And he brought them to the border of his sanctuary, to this mountain, which his right hand had gotten.
Ps. He also drove out the nations before them,  allotted them for an inheritance by line,  made the tribes of Israel to dwell in their tents.
Ps. Yet they challenged and rebelled against the Most High God,  kept not his testimonies,
Ps. but turned back,  dealt treacherously like their fathers. They were turned aside like a deceitful bow.
Ps. For they provoked him to anger with their high places,  moved him to jealousy with their graven images.
Ps. When God heard, he was angry,  greatly abhorred Israel,
Ps. so that he forsook the tabernacle of Shiloh, the tent which he placed among men,
Ps. and delivered their strength into captivity,  their glory into the adversary's hand.
Ps. He also gave his people over to the sword,  was angry with his inheritance.
Ps. Fire devoured their young men,  their virgins had no marriage-song.
Ps. Their priests fell by the sword,  their widows made no lamentation.
Ps. Then the Lord awoke as out of sleep, like a mighty man who shouts because of wine.
Ps. And he smote his adversaries backward. He put them to a perpetual reproach.
Ps. Moreover he refused the tent of Joseph,  chose not the tribe of Ephraim,
Ps. but chose the tribe of Judah, the mount Zion which he loved.
Ps. And he built his sanctuary like the heights, like the earth which he has established forever.
Ps. He also chose David his servant,  took him from the sheepfolds.
Ps. He brought him from following the ewes that have their young, to be the shepherd of Jacob his people,  Israel his inheritance.
Ps. So he was their shepherd according to the integrity of his heart,  guided them by the skillfulness of his hands.
Ps. O God, the nations have come into thine inheritance. They have defiled thy holy temple. They have laid Jerusalem in heaps.
Ps. They have given the dead bodies of thy servants to be food to the birds of the heavens, the flesh of thy sanctified to the beasts of the earth.
Ps. They have shed their blood like water round about Jerusalem,  there was none to bury them.
Ps. We have become a reproach to our neighbors, a scoffing and derision to those who are round about us.
Ps. How long, O Jehovah? Will thou be angry forever? Shall thy jealousy burn like fire?
Ps. Pour out thy wrath upon the nations that do not know thee,  upon the kingdoms that do not call upon thy name.
Ps. For they have devoured Jacob,  laid waste his habitation.
Ps. Do not remember against us the iniquities of our forefathers. Let thy tender mercies speedily meet us, for we are brought very low.
Ps. Help us, O God of our salvation, for the glory of thy name. And deliver us,  forgive our sins, for thy name's sake.
Ps. Why should the nations say, Where is their God? Let the avenging of the blood of thy servants which is shed be known among the nations in our sight.
Ps. Let the sighing of the prisoner come before thee. According to the greatness of thy power preserve thou those who are appointed to death,
Ps. and render to our neighbors sevenfold into their bosom their reproach with which they have reproached thee, O Lord,
Ps. so we thy people and sheep of thy pasture will give thee thanks forever. We will show forth thy praise to all generations.
Ps. Give ear, O Shepherd of Israel, thou who lead Joseph like a flock. Thou who sit above the cherubim, shine forth.
Ps. Stir up thy might before Ephraim and Benjamin and Manasseh,  come to save us.
Ps. Turn us again, O God,  cause thy face to shine,  we shall be saved.
Ps. O Jehovah God of hosts, how long will thou be angry against the prayer of thy people?
Ps. Thou have fed them with the bread of tears,  given them tears to drink in large measure.
Ps. Thou make us hatred to our neighbors,  our enemies laugh among themselves.
Ps. Turn us again, O God of hosts,  cause thy face to shine,  we shall be saved.
Ps. Thou brought a vine out of Egypt. Thou drove out the nations,  planted it.
Ps. Thou prepared place before it,  it took deep root,  filled the land.
Ps. The mountains were covered with the shadow of it,  the boughs of it were like cedars of God.
Ps. It sent out its branches to the sea,  its shoots to the River.
Ps. Why have thou broken down its walls, so that all those who pass by the way pluck it?
Ps. The boar out of the wood ravages it,  the wild beasts of the field feed on it.
Ps. Turn again, we beseech thee, O God of hosts. Look down from heaven, , behold,  visit this vine,
Ps. and the stock which thy right hand planted,  the branch that thou made strong for thyself.
Ps. It is burned with fire, it is cut down. They perish at the rebuke of thy countenance.
Ps. Let thy hand be upon the man of thy right hand, upon the son of man whom thou made strong for thyself,
Ps. so shall we not go back from thee. Revive thou us,  we will call upon thy name.
Ps. Turn us again, O Jehovah God of hosts, cause thy face to shine,  we shall be saved.
Ps. Sing aloud to God our strength. Make a joyful noise to the God of Jacob.
Ps. Raise a song,  bring here the timbrel, the pleasant harp with the psaltery.
Ps. Blow the trumpet at the new moon, at the full moon, on our feast-day.
Ps. For it is a statute for Israel, an ordinance of the God of Jacob.
Ps. He appointed it in Joseph for a testimony when he went out over the land of Egypt, where I heard a language that I knew not.
Ps. I removed his shoulder from the burden. His hands were freed from the basket.
Ps. Thou called in trouble,  I delivered thee. I answered thee in the secret place of thunder. I proved thee at the waters of Meribah. Selah.
Ps. Hear, O my people,  I will testify to thee, O Israel, if thou would hearken to me!
Ps. There shall no strange god be in thee, nor shall thou worship any foreign god.
Ps. I am Jehovah thy God who brought thee up out of the land of Egypt. Open thy mouth wide,  I will fill it.
Ps. But my people hearkened not to my voice,  Israel would none of me.
Ps. So I let them go after the stubbornness of their heart, that they might walk in their own counsels.
Ps. O that my people would hearken to me, that Israel would walk in my ways!
Ps. I would soon subdue their enemies,  turn my hand against their adversaries.
Ps. (The haters of Jehovah feign obedience to him,  their time is forever.)
Ps. He would feed them also with the finest of the wheat. And I would satisfy thee with honey out of the rock.
Ps. God stands in the congregation of God. He judges among the gods.
Ps. How long will ye judge unjustly,  respect the persons of the wicked? Selah.
Ps. Judge the poor man and the orphan. Do justice to the afflicted and destitute man.
Ps. Rescue the poor and needy man. Deliver from the hand of the wicked man.
Ps. They know not, nor do they understand. They walk to and fro in darkness. All the foundations of the earth are shaken.
Ps. I said, Ye are gods,  all of you sons of the Most High.
Ps. Nevertheless ye shall die like men,  fall like one of the rulers.
Ps. Arise, O God, judge the earth, for thou shall inherit all the nations.
Ps. O God, keep thou not silence. Hold not thy peace,  be not still, O God.
Ps. For, lo, thine enemies make a tumult,  those who hate thee have lifted up the head.
Ps. They take crafty counsel against thy people,  consult together against thy hidden ones.
Ps. They have said, Come,  let us cut them off from being a nation, that the name of Israel may be no more in remembrance.
Ps. For they have consulted together with one consent. They make a covenant against thee:
Ps. the tents of Edom,  the Ishmaelites, Moab,  the Hagarenes,
Ps. Gebal,  Ammon,  Amalek, Philistia with the inhabitants of Tyre,
Ps. Assyria also is joined with them; they have helped the sons of Lot. Selah.
Ps. Do thou to them as to Midian, as to Sisera, as to Jabin, at the river Kishon,
Ps. who perished at Endor, who became as dung for the earth.
Ps. Make their ranking men like Oreb and Zeeb, yea, all their rulers like Zebah and Zalmunna,
Ps. who said, Let us take to ourselves in possession the habitations of God.
Ps. O my God, make them like the whirling dust, as stubble before the wind,
Ps. as the fire that burns the forest,  as the flame that sets the mountains on fire.
Ps. So pursue them with thy tempest,  terrify them with thy storm.
Ps. Fill their faces with confusion, that they may seek thy name, O Jehovah.
Ps. Let them be put to shame and dismayed forever. Yea, let them be confounded and perish,
Ps. that they may know that thou alone, whose name is Jehovah, are the Most High over all the earth.
Ps. How amiable are thy tabernacles, O Jehovah of hosts!
Ps. My soul longs, yea, even faints for the courts of Jehovah. My heart and my flesh cry out to the living God.
Ps. Yea, the sparrow has found her a house,  the swallow a nest for herself where she may lay her young, even thine altars, O Jehovah of hosts, my King and my God.
Ps. Blessed are those who dwell in thy house. They will still be praising thee. Selah.
Ps. Blessed is the man whose strength is in thee, in whose heart are the highways to Zion.
Ps. Passing through the valley of weeping they make it a place of springs. Yea, the early rain covers it with blessings.
Ps. They go from strength to strength; each one of them appears before God in Zion.
Ps. O Jehovah God of hosts, hear my prayer. Give ear, O God of Jacob. Selah.
Ps. Behold, O God our shield,  look upon the face of thine anointed.
Ps. For a day in thy courts is better than a thousand. I had rather be a doorkeeper in the house of my God, than to dwell in the tents of wickedness.
Ps. For Jehovah God is a sun and a shield. Jehovah will give grace and glory. He will withhold no good thing from those who walk uprightly.
Ps. O Jehovah of hosts, blessed is the man who trusts in thee.
Ps. Jehovah, thou have been favorable to thy land. Thou have brought back the captivity of Jacob.
Ps. Thou have forgiven the iniquity of thy people. Thou have covered all their sin. Selah.
Ps. Thou have taken away all thy wrath. Thou have turned from the fierceness of thine anger.
Ps. Turn us, O God of our salvation,  cause thine indignation toward us to cease.
Ps. Will thou be angry with us forever? Will thou draw out thine anger to all generations?
Ps. Will thou not revive us again, that thy people may rejoice in thee?
Ps. Show us thy loving kindness, O Jehovah,  grant us thy salvation.
Ps. I will hear what God, Jehovah, will speak, for he will speak peace to his people,  to his sanctified. But let them not turn again to folly.
Ps. Surely his salvation is near those who fear him, that glory may dwell in our land.
Ps. Mercy and truth are met together. Righteousness and peace have kissed each other.
Ps. Truth springs out of the earth,  righteousness has looked down from heaven.
Ps. Yea, Jehovah will give that which is good,  our land shall yield its increase.
Ps. Righteousness shall go before him,  shall make his footsteps a path.
Ps. Bow down thine ear, O Jehovah,  answer me, for I am poor and needy.
Ps. Preserve my soul, for I am devout. O thou my God, save thy servant who trusts in thee.
Ps. Be merciful to me, O Lord, for to thee do I cry all the day long.
Ps. Rejoice the soul of thy servant, for to thee, O Lord, do I lift up my soul.
Ps. For thou, Lord, are good,  ready to forgive,  abundant in loving kindness to all those who call upon thee.
Ps. Give ear, O Jehovah, to my prayer,  hearken to the voice of my supplications.
Ps. In the day of my trouble I will call upon thee, for thou will answer me.
Ps. There is none like thee among the gods, O Lord, nor like thy works.
Ps. All nations whom thou have made shall come and worship before thee, O Lord,  they shall glorify thy name.
Ps. For thou are great,  do wondrous things. Thou alone are God.
Ps. Teach me thy way, O Jehovah, I will walk in thy truth. Unite my heart to fear thy name.
Ps. I will praise thee, O Lord my God, with my whole heart,  I will glorify thy name for evermore.
Ps. For great is thy loving kindness toward me,  thou have delivered my soul from the lowest Sheol.
Ps. O God, the proud have risen up against me,  a company of violent men have sought after my soul,  have not set thee before them.
Ps. But thou, O Lord, are a God merciful and gracious, slow to anger,  abundant in loving kindness and truth.
Ps. O turn to me,  have mercy upon me. Give thy strength to thy servant,  save the son of thy handmaid.
Ps. Show me a sign for good, that those who hate me may see it,  be put to shame, because thou, Jehovah, have helped me,  comforted me.
Ps. His foundation is in the holy mountains.
Ps. Jehovah loves the gates of Zion more than all the dwellings of Jacob.
Ps. Glorious things are spoken of thee, O city of God. Selah.
Ps. I will make mention of Rahab and Babylon as among those who know me. Behold, Philistia,  Tyre, with Ethiopia: This man was born there.
Ps. Yea, of Zion it shall be said, this and that man was born in her,  the Most High himself will establish her.
Ps. Jehovah will count when he writes up the peoples: This man was born there. Selah.
Ps. Those who sing as well as those who dance shall say, All my fountains are in thee.
Ps. O Jehovah, the God of my salvation, I have cried day and night before thee.
Ps. Let my prayer enter into thy presence. Incline thine ear to my cry.
Ps. For my soul is full of troubles,  my life draws near to Sheol.
Ps. I am reckoned with those who go down into the pit. I am as a man who has no help,
Ps. cast off among the dead, like the slain who lie in the grave, whom thou remember no more,  they are cut off from thy hand.
Ps. Thou have laid me in the lowest pit, in dark places, in the deeps.
Ps. Thy wrath lays hard upon me,  thou have afflicted me with all thy waves. Selah.
Ps. Thou have put my acquaintances far from me. Thou have made me an abomination to them. I am shut up,  I cannot come forth.
Ps. My eye wastes away because of affliction. I have called daily upon thee, O Jehovah, I have spread forth my hands to thee.
Ps. Will thou show wonders to the dead? Shall those who are deceased arise and praise thee? Selah.
Ps. Shall thy loving kindness be declared in the grave, or thy faithfulness in destruction?
Ps. Shall thy wonders be known in the dark,  thy righteousness in the land of forgetfulness?
Ps. But to thee, O Jehovah, I have cried,  in the morning my prayer shall come before thee.
Ps. Jehovah, why do thou cast off my soul? Why do thou hide thy face from me?
Ps. I am afflicted and ready to die from my youth up. While I suffer thy terrors I am confounded.
Ps. Thy fierce wrath has gone over me. Thy terrors have cut me off.
Ps. They came round about me like water all the day long. They encompassed me around together.
Ps. Thou have put beloved and friend far from me,  my acquaintances into darkness.
Ps. I will sing of the loving kindness of Jehovah forever. With my mouth I will make known thy faithfulness to all generations.
Ps. For I have said, Mercy shall be built up forever. Thy faithfulness thou will establish in the very heavens.
Ps. I have made a covenant with my chosen. I have sworn to David my servant:
Ps. Thy seed I will establish forever,  build up thy throne to all generations. Selah.
Ps. And the heavens shall praise thy wonders, O Jehovah, thy faithfulness also in the assembly of the sanctified.
Ps. For who in the clouds can be compared to Jehovah? Who among the sons of the mighty is like Jehovah,
Ps. a God very awesome in the council of the holy ones,  to be feared above all those who are round about him?
Ps. O Jehovah God of hosts, who is a mighty one like thee, O Jehovah? And thy faithfulness is round about thee.
Ps. Thou rule the pride of the sea. When the waves of it arise, thou still them.
Ps. Thou have broken Rahab in pieces, as a wounded man. Thou have scattered thine enemies with the arm of thy strength.
Ps. The heavens are thine, the earth also is thine, the world and the fullness of it; thou have founded them.
Ps. The north and the south, thou have created them. Tabor and Hermon rejoice in thy name.
Ps. Thou have a mighty arm. Strong is thy hand,  high is thy right hand.
Ps. Righteousness and justice are the foundation of thy throne. Loving kindness and truth go before thy face.
Ps. Blessed is the people who know the joyful sound. They walk, O Jehovah, in the light of thy countenance.
Ps. In thy name do they rejoice all the day,  in thy righteousness are they exalted.
Ps. For thou are the glory of their strength,  in thy favor our horn shall be exalted.
Ps. For our shield belongs to Jehovah,  our king to the Holy One of Israel.
Ps. Then thou spoke in a vision to thy sanctified,  said, I have laid help upon a mighty man. I have exalted a chosen man out of the people.
Ps. I have found David my servant. With my holy oil I have anointed him,
Ps. with whom my hand shall be established. My arm also shall strengthen him.
Ps. The enemy shall not exact from him, nor the son of wickedness afflict him.
Ps. And I will beat down his adversaries before him,  smite those who hate him,
Ps. but my faithfulness and my loving kindness shall be with him,  in my name shall his horn be exalted.
Ps. I will also set his hand on the sea,  his right hand on the rivers.
Ps. He shall cry to me, Thou are my Father, my God,  the rock of my salvation.
Ps. I also will make him firstborn, the highest of the kings of the earth.
Ps. I will keep my loving kindness for him for evermore. And my covenant shall stand fast with him.
Ps. I will also make his seed to endure forever,  his throne as the days of heaven.
Ps. If his sons forsake my law,  walk not in my ordinances,
Ps. if they break my statutes,  keep not my commandments,
Ps. then I will visit their transgression with the rod,  their iniquity with stripes,
Ps. but my loving kindness I will not utterly take from him, nor allow my faithfulness to fail.
Ps. I will not break my covenant, nor alter the thing that is gone out of my lips.
Ps. I have sworn once by my holiness; I will not lie to David.
Ps. His seed shall endure forever,  his throne as the sun before me.
Ps. It shall be established forever as the moon,  as the faithful witness in the sky. Selah.
Ps. But thou have cast off and rejected. Thou have been angry with thine anointed.
Ps. Thou have abhorred the covenant of thy servant. Thou have profaned his crown to the ground.
Ps. Thou have broken down all his hedges. Thou have brought his strongholds to ruin.
Ps. All who pass by the way rob him. He has become a reproach to his neighbors.
Ps. Thou have exalted the right hand of his adversaries. Thou have made all his enemies to rejoice.
Ps. Yea, thou turn back the edge of his sword,  have not made him to stand in the battle.
Ps. Thou have made his brightness to cease,  cast his throne down to the ground.
Ps. The days of his youth thou have shortened. Thou have covered him with shame. Selah.
Ps. How long, O Jehovah? Will thou hide thyself forever? Shall thy wrath burn like fire?
Ps. O remember how short my time is, for what vanity thou have created all the sons of men!
Ps. What man is he who shall live and not see death, who shall deliver his soul from the power of Sheol? Selah.
Ps. Lord, where are thy former loving kindnesses, which thou swore to David in thy faithfulness?
Ps. Remember, Lord, the reproach of thy servants, how I bear in my bosom all the mighty peoples,
Ps. with which thine enemies have reproached, O Jehovah, with which they have reproached the footsteps of thine anointed.
Ps. Blessed be Jehovah for evermore. Truly,  Truly.
Ps. Lord, thou have been our dwelling-place in all generations.
Ps. Before the mountains were brought forth, or thou had ever formed the earth and the world, even from everlasting to everlasting, thou are God.
Ps. Thou turn man to destruction,  say, Return, ye sons of men.
Ps. For a thousand years in thy sight are but as yesterday when it is past,  as a watch in the night.
Ps. Thou carry them away as with a flood. They are as a sleep. In the morning they are like grass which grows up.
Ps. In the morning it flourishes,  grows up. In the evening it is cut down,  withers.
Ps. For we are consumed in thine anger,  in thy wrath are we troubled.
Ps. Thou have set our iniquities before thee, our secret sins in the light of thy countenance.
Ps. For all our days are passed away in thy wrath. We bring our years to an end as a sigh.
Ps. The days of our years are threescore years and ten, or even by reason of strength fourscore years, yet their pride is but labor and sorrow, for it is soon gone,  we fly away.
Ps. Who knows the power of thine anger,  thy wrath according to the fear that is due to thee?
Ps. So teach us to number our days, that we may get us a heart of wisdom.
Ps. Return, O Jehovah. How long? And relent concerning thy servants.
Ps. O satisfy us in the morning with thy loving kindness, that we may rejoice and be glad all our days.
Ps. Make us glad according to the days in which thou have afflicted us,  the years in which we have seen evil.
Ps. Let thy work appear to thy servants,  thy glory upon their sons.
Ps. And let the favor of the Lord our God be upon us. And establish thou the work of our hands upon us, yea, the work of our hands establish thou it.
Ps. He who dwells in the secret place of the Most High shall abide under the shadow of the Almighty.
Ps. I will say of Jehovah, He is my refuge and my fortress, my God, in whom I trust.
Ps. For he will deliver thee from the snare of the fowler,  from the deadly pestilence.
Ps. He will cover thee with his pinions,  under his wings shall thou take refuge. His truth is a shield and a buckler.
Ps. Thou shall not be afraid for the terror by night, nor for the arrow that flies by day,
Ps. for the pestilence that walks in darkness, nor for the destruction that wastes at noonday.
Ps. A thousand shall fall at thy side,  ten thousand at thy right hand,  it shall not come near thee.
Ps. Thou shall only behold with thine eyes,  see the reward of the wicked.
Ps. For thou, O Jehovah, are my refuge! Thou have made the Most High thy habitation.
Ps. There shall no evil befall thee, nor shall any plague come near thy tent,
Ps. for he will give his agents charge over thee, to keep thee in all thy ways.
Ps. They shall bear thee up in their hands, lest thou dash thy foot against a stone.
Ps. Thou shall tread upon the lion and adder. The young lion and the serpent thou shall trample under foot.
Ps. Because he has set his love upon me, therefore I will deliver him. I will set him on high because he has known my name.
Ps. He shall call upon me,  I will answer him. I will be with him in trouble. I will deliver him,  honor him.
Ps. I will satisfy him with long life,  show him my salvation.
Ps. It is a good thing to give thanks to Jehovah,  to sing praises to thy name, O Most High,
Ps. to show forth thy loving kindness in the morning,  thy faithfulness every night,
Ps. with an instrument of ten strings,  with the psaltery, with a solemn sound upon the harp.
Ps. For thou, Jehovah, have made me glad through thy work. I will triumph in the works of thy hands.
Ps. How great are thy works, O Jehovah! Thy thoughts are very deep.
Ps. A brutish man knows not, nor does a fool understand this.
Ps. When the wicked spring as the grass,  when all the workers of iniquity flourish, it is that they shall be destroyed forever,
Ps. but thou, O Jehovah, are on high for evermore.
Ps. For, lo, thine enemies, O Jehovah, for, lo, thine enemies shall perish. All the workers of iniquity shall be scattered.
Ps. But thou have exalted my horn like the wild ox's. I am anointed with fresh oil,
Ps. and my eye has seen my enemies. My ears have heard of the evildoers who rise up against me.
Ps. A righteous man shall flourish like the palm tree. He shall grow like a cedar in Lebanon.
Ps. Men who are planted in the house of Jehovah shall flourish in the courts of our God.
Ps. They shall still bring forth fruit in old age. They shall be full of sap and green
Ps. to show that Jehovah is upright. He is my rock,  there is no unrighteousness in him.
Ps. Jehovah reigns! He is clothed with majesty. Jehovah is clothed with strength; he has girded himself with it. The world also is established that it cannot be moved.
Ps. Thy throne is established of old. Thou are from everlasting.
Ps. The floods have lifted up, O Jehovah, the floods have lifted up their voice, the floods lift up their waves.
Ps. Above the voices of many waters, the mighty breakers of the sea, Jehovah on high is mighty.
Ps. Thy testimonies are very sure. Holiness befits thy house, O Jehovah, for evermore.
Ps. O Jehovah, thou God to whom vengeance belongs, thou God to whom vengeance belongs, shine forth.
Ps. Lift up thyself, thou judge of the earth. Render to the proud a recompense.
Ps. Jehovah, how long shall the wicked, how long shall the wicked triumph?
Ps. They prate, they speak arrogantly. All the workers of iniquity boast themselves.
Ps. They break in pieces thy people, O Jehovah,  afflict thy heritage.
Ps. They kill the widow and the sojourner,  murder the fatherless.
Ps. And they say, Jehovah will not see, nor will the God of Jacob consider.
Ps. Consider, ye brutish among the people,  ye fools, when will ye be wise?
Ps. He who planted the ear, shall he not hear? He who formed the eye, shall he not see?
Ps. He who chastises the nations, shall he not correct, even he who teaches man knowledge?
Ps. Jehovah knows the thoughts of man, that they are vanity.
Ps. Blessed is the man whom thou chasten, O Jehovah,  teach out of thy law,
Ps. that thou may give him rest from the days of adversity, until the pit is dug for a wicked man.
Ps. For Jehovah will not cast off his people, nor will he forsake his inheritance.
Ps. For judgment shall return to righteousness,  all the upright in heart shall follow it.
Ps. Who will rise up for me against the evildoers? Who will stand up for me against the workers of iniquity?
Ps. Unless Jehovah had been my help, my soul would have soon dwelt in silence.
Ps. When I said, My foot slips, thy loving kindness, O Jehovah, held me up.
Ps. In the multitude of my thoughts within me thy comforts delight my soul.
Ps. Shall the throne of wickedness have fellowship with thee, which frames mischief by statute?
Ps. They gather themselves together against the soul of a righteous man,  condemn innocent blood.
Ps. But Jehovah has been my high tower,  my God the rock of my refuge.
Ps. And he has brought upon them their own iniquity,  will cut them off in their own wickedness. Jehovah our God will cut them off.
Ps. O come, let us sing to Jehovah. Let us make a joyful noise to the rock of our salvation.
Ps. Let us come before his presence with thanksgiving. Let us make a joyful noise to him with psalms.
Ps. For Jehovah is a great God,  a great King above all gods.
Ps. In his hand are the deep places of the earth. The heights of the mountains are also his.
Ps. The sea is his,  he made it. And his hands formed the dry land.
Ps. O come, let us worship and bow down. Let us kneel before Jehovah our maker.
Ps. For he is our God,  we are the people of his pasture,  the sheep of his hand. Today, O that ye would hear his voice!
Ps. Harden not your heart, as in the provocation, as the day of trial in the wilderness,
Ps. where your fathers challenged me, proved me,  saw my work.
Ps. Forty years long I was grieved with that generation,  said, It is a people that do err in their heart,  they have not known my ways.
Ps. Therefore I swore in my wrath that they should not enter into my rest.
Ps. O sing to Jehovah a new song. Sing to Jehovah, all the earth.
Ps. Sing to Jehovah, bless his name. Show forth his salvation from day to day.
Ps. Declare his glory among the nations, his marvelous works among all the peoples.
Ps. For great is Jehovah,  greatly to be praised. He is to be feared above all gods.
Ps. For all the gods of the peoples are idols,  Jehovah made the heavens.
Ps. Honor and majesty are before him. Strength and beauty are in his sanctuary.
Ps. Ascribe to Jehovah, ye kindred of the peoples. Ascribe to Jehovah glory and strength.
Ps. Ascribe to Jehovah the glory due to his name. Bring an offering,  come into his courts.
Ps. O worship Jehovah in holy array. Tremble before him, all the earth.
Ps. Say among the nations, Jehovah reigns! The world also is established that it cannot be moved. He will judge the peoples with equity.
Ps. Let the heavens be glad,  let the earth rejoice. Let the sea roar,  the fullness thereof.
Ps. Let the field exult,  all that is in it. Then all the trees of the wood shall sing for joy
Ps. before Jehovah, for he comes. For he comes to judge the earth. He will judge the world with righteousness,  the peoples with his truth.
Ps. Jehovah reigns! Let the earth rejoice. Let the multitude of isles be glad.
Ps. Clouds and darkness are round about him. Righteousness and justice are the foundation of his throne.
Ps. A fire goes before him,  burns up his adversaries round about.
Ps. His lightnings lightened the world. The earth saw,  trembled.
Ps. The mountains melted like wax at the presence of Jehovah, at the presence of the Lord of the whole earth.
Ps. The heavens declare his righteousness,  all the peoples have seen his glory.
Ps. Let all those be put to shame who serve graven images, who boast themselves of idols. Bow yourselves to him, all ye gods.
Ps. Zion heard and was glad,  the daughters of Judah rejoiced, because of thy judgments, O Jehovah.
Ps. For thou, Jehovah, are most high above all the earth. Thou are exalted far above all gods.
Ps. O ye who love Jehovah, hate evil. He preserves the souls of his sanctified. He delivers them out of the hand of the wicked.
Ps. Light is sown for the righteous man,  gladness for the upright in heart.
Ps. Be glad in Jehovah, ye righteous,  give thanks to the memory of his holiness.
Ps. O sing to Jehovah a new song, for he has done marvelous things. His right hand,  his holy arm, has wrought salvation for him.
Ps. Jehovah has made known his salvation. He has openly shown his righteousness in the sight of the nations.
Ps. He has remembered his loving kindness and his faithfulness toward the house of Israel. All the ends of the earth have seen the salvation of our God.
Ps. Make a joyful noise to Jehovah, all the earth. Break forth and sing for joy, yea, sing praises.
Ps. Sing praises to Jehovah with the harp. With the harp and the voice of melody,
Ps. with trumpets and sound of cornet, make a joyful noise before the King-Jehovah.
Ps. Let the sea roar,  the fullness thereof, the world,  those who dwell in it.
Ps. Let the floods clap their hands. Let the hills sing for joy together
Ps. before Jehovah, for he comes to judge the earth. He will judge the world with righteousness,  the peoples with equity.
Ps. Jehovah reigns! Let the peoples tremble. He sits above the cherubim, let the earth be moved.
Ps. Jehovah is great in Zion,  he is high above all the peoples.
Ps. Let them praise thy great and awesome name. Holy is he.
Ps. The king's strength also loves justice. Thou establish equity. Thou execute justice and righteousness in Jacob.
Ps. Exalt ye Jehovah our God,  worship at his footstool. Holy is he.
Ps. Moses and Aaron among his priests,  Samuel among those who call upon his name, they called upon Jehovah,  he answered them.
Ps. He spoke to them in the pillar of cloud. They kept his testimonies,  the statute that he gave them.
Ps. Thou answered them, O Jehovah our God. Thou were a God who forgave them, though thou took vengeance on their doings.
Ps. Exalt ye Jehovah our God,  worship at his holy hill. For Jehovah our God is holy.
Ps. Make a joyful noise to Jehovah, all ye lands.
Ps. Serve Jehovah with gladness. Come before his presence with singing.
Ps. Know ye that Jehovah, he is God. It is he who has made us,  we are his. We are his people,  the sheep of his pasture.
Ps. Enter into his gates with thanksgiving,  into his courts with praise. Give thanks to him,  bless his name.
Ps. For Jehovah is good. His loving kindness is forever,  his faithfulness to all generations.
Ps. I will sing of loving kindness and justice. To thee, O Jehovah, I will sing praises.
Ps. I will behave myself wisely in a perfect way. O when will thou come to me? I will walk within my house with a perfect heart.
Ps. I will set no base thing before my eyes. I hate the work of those who turn aside. It shall not cleave to me.
Ps. A perverse heart shall depart from me. I will know no evil thing.
Ps. He who slanders his neighbor secretly, him I will destroy. He who has a high look and a proud heart I will not endure.
Ps. My eyes shall be upon the faithful of the land, that they may dwell with me. He who walks in a perfect way, he shall minister to me.
Ps. He who works deceit shall not dwell within my house. He who speaks falsehood shall not be established before my eyes.
Ps. Morning by morning I will destroy all the wicked of the land, to cut off all the workers of iniquity from the city of Jehovah.
Ps. Hear my prayer, O Jehovah,  let my cry come to thee.
Ps. Hide not thy face from me in the day of my distress. Incline thine ear to me. In the day when I call answer me speedily.
Ps. For my days consume away like smoke,  my bones are burned as a firebrand.
Ps. My heart is smitten like grass,  withered, for I forget to eat my bread.
Ps. Because of the voice of my groaning my bones cling to my flesh.
Ps. I am like a pelican of the wilderness. I have become as an owl of the waste places.
Ps. I watch,  have become like a sparrow that is alone upon the house-top.
Ps. My enemies reproach me all the day. Those who are mad against me do curse by me.
Ps. For I have eaten ashes like bread,  mingled my drink with weeping,
Ps. because of thine indignation and thy wrath. For thou have taken me up,  cast me away.
Ps. My days are like a shadow that declines,  I am withered like grass.
Ps. But thou, O Jehovah, will abide forever,  thy memorial to all generations.
Ps. Thou will arise,  have mercy upon Zion, for it is time to have pity upon her, yea, the set time has come.
Ps. For thy servants take pleasure in her stones,  have pity upon her dust.
Ps. So the nations shall fear the name of Jehovah,  all the kings of the earth thy glory.
Ps. For Jehovah has built up Zion. He has appeared in his glory.
Ps. He has regarded the prayer of the destitute,  has not despised their prayer.
Ps. This shall be written for the generation to come. And a people which shall be created shall praise Jehovah.
Ps. For he has looked down from the height of his sanctuary. From heaven Jehovah beheld the earth,
Ps. to hear the sighing of the prisoner, to loose those who are appointed to death,
Ps. that men may declare the name of Jehovah in Zion,  his praise in Jerusalem,
Ps. when the peoples are gathered together,  the kingdoms, to serve Jehovah.
Ps. He weakened my strength in the way. He shortened my days.
Ps. I said, O my God, take me not away in the midst of my days. Thy years are throughout all generations.
Ps. Of old thou laid the foundation of the earth,  the heavens are the work of thy hands.
Ps. They shall perish,  thou shall endure. Yea, all of them shall grow old like a garment. As a vesture thou shall change them,  they shall be changed,
Ps. but thou are the same,  thy years shall have no end.
Ps. The sons of thy servants shall continue,  their seed shall be established before thee.
Ps. Bless Jehovah, O my soul,  all that is within me, bless his holy name.
Ps. Bless Jehovah, O my soul,  forget not all his benefits,
Ps. who forgives all thine iniquities, who heals all thy diseases,
Ps. who redeems thy life from destruction, who crowns thee with loving kindness and tender mercies,
Ps. who satisfies thy desire with good things,  thy youth is renewed like the eagle.
Ps. Jehovah executes righteous acts,  judgments for all who are oppressed.
Ps. He made known his ways to Moses, his doings to the sons of Israel.
Ps. Jehovah is merciful and gracious, slow to anger,  abundant in loving kindness.
Ps. He will not always chide, nor will he keep it forever.
Ps. He has not dealt with us according to our sins, nor rewarded us according to our iniquities.
Ps. For as the heavens are high above the earth, so great is his loving kindness toward those who fear him.
Ps. As far as the east is from the west, so far has he removed our transgressions from us.
Ps. Like as a father pities his sons, So Jehovah pities those who fear him.
Ps. For he knows our frame. He remembers that we are dust.
Ps. As for man, his days are as grass, as a flower of the field, so he flourishes.
Ps. For the wind passes over it,  it is gone,  the place thereof shall know it no more.
Ps. But the loving kindness of Jehovah is from everlasting to everlasting upon those who fear him,  his righteousness to son's sons,
Ps. to such as keep his covenant,  to those who remember his precepts to do them.
Ps. Jehovah has established his throne in the heavens,  his kingdom rules over all.
Ps. Bless Jehovah, ye his agents, who are mighty in strength, who fulfill his word, hearkening to the voice of his word.
Ps. Bless Jehovah, all ye his hosts, ye ministers of his, who do his pleasure.
Ps. Bless Jehovah, all ye his works in all places of his dominion. Bless Jehovah, O my soul.
Ps. Bless Jehovah, O my soul. O Jehovah my God, thou are very great. Thou are clothed with honor and majesty,
Ps. who covers thyself with light as with a garment, who stretches out the heavens like a curtain,
Ps. who lays the beams of his chambers in the waters, who makes the clouds his chariot, who walks upon the wings of the wind,
Ps. who makes his agents spirits, his ministers a flame of fire,
Ps. who laid the foundations of the earth that it should not be moved forever.
Ps. Thou covered it with the deep as with a vesture. The waters stood above the mountains.
Ps. At thy rebuke they fled. At the voice of thy thunder they hastened away.
Ps. The mountains rose, the valleys sank down to the place which thou had founded for them.
Ps. Thou have set a bound that they may not pass over, that they turn not again to cover the earth.
Ps. He sends forth springs into the valleys. They run among the mountains.
Ps. They give drink to every beast of the field. The wild donkeys quench their thirst.
Ps. By them the birds of the heavens have their habitation. They sing among the branches.
Ps. He waters the mountains from his chambers. The earth is filled with the fruit of thy works.
Ps. He causes the grass to grow for the cattle,  herbage for the service of man, that he may bring forth food out of the earth,
Ps. and wine that makes glad the heart of man,  oil to make his face to shine,  bread that strengthens man's heart.
Ps. The trees of Jehovah are full, the cedars of Lebanon, which he has planted,
Ps. where the birds make their nests. As for the stork, the fir trees are her house.
Ps. The high mountains are for the wild goats. The rocks are a refuge for the conies.
Ps. He appointed the moon for seasons. The sun knows his going down.
Ps. Thou make darkness,  it is night, during which all the beasts of the forest creep forth.
Ps. The young lions roar after their prey,  seek their food from God.
Ps. The sun arises; they get away,  lie down in their dens.
Ps. Man goes forth to his work and to his labor until the evening.
Ps. O Jehovah, how manifold are thy works! In wisdom have thou made them all. The earth is full of thy riches.
Ps. Yonder is the sea, great and wide, in which are innumerable creeping things, both small and great beasts.
Ps. There go the ships. There is leviathan, whom thou have formed to play in it.
Ps. These all wait for thee, that thou may give them their food in due season.
Ps. Thou give to them, they gather. Thou open thy hand, they are satisfied with good.
Ps. Thou hide thy face, they are troubled. Thou take away their breath, they die,  return to their dust.
Ps. Thou send forth thy Spirit, they are created,  thou renew the face of the ground.
Ps. Let the glory of Jehovah endure forever. Let Jehovah rejoice in his works,
Ps. who looks on the earth,  it trembles. He touches the mountains,  they smoke.
Ps. I will sing to Jehovah as long as I live. I will sing praise to my God while I have any being.
Ps. Let thy meditation be sweet to him. I will rejoice in Jehovah.
Ps. Let sinners be consumed out of the earth,  let the wicked be no more. Bless Jehovah, O my soul. Praise ye Jehovah.
Ps. O give thanks to Jehovah, call upon his name. Make known among the peoples his doings.
Ps. Sing to him, sing praises to him. Talk ye of all his marvelous works.
Ps. Glory ye in his holy name. Let the heart of those who seek Jehovah rejoice.
Ps. Seek ye Jehovah and his strength. Seek his face evermore.
Ps. Remember his marvelous works that he has done, his wonders,  the judgments of his mouth,
Ps. O ye seed of Abraham his servant, ye sons of Jacob, his chosen.
Ps. He is Jehovah our God. His judgments are in all the earth.
Ps. He has remembered his covenant forever, the word which he commanded to a thousand generations,
Ps. which he made with Abraham,  his oath to Isaac,
Ps. and confirmed the same to Jacob for a statute, to Israel for an everlasting covenant,
Ps. saying, To thee I will give the land of Canaan, the lot of your inheritance,
Ps. when they were but a few men in number, yea, very few,  sojourners in it.
Ps. And they went about from nation to nation, From one kingdom to another people.
Ps. He allowed no man to do them wrong. Yea, he reproved kings for their sakes,
Ps. saying, Touch not my anointed men,  do my prophets no harm.
Ps. And he called for a famine upon the land. He broke the whole staff of bread.
Ps. He sent a man before them. Joseph was sold for a servant.
Ps. They hurt his feet with fetters. He was placed in iron.
Ps. Until the time that his word came to pass, the word of Jehovah tried him.
Ps. The king sent and released him, even the ruler of peoples,  let him go free.
Ps. He made him lord of his house,  ruler of all his substance,
Ps. to bind his rulers at his pleasure,  teach his elders wisdom.
Ps. Israel also came into Egypt,  Jacob sojourned in the land of Ham.
Ps. And he increased his people greatly,  made them stronger than their adversaries.
Ps. He turned their heart to hate his people, to deal craftily with his servants.
Ps. He sent Moses his servant,  Aaron whom he had chosen.
Ps. They set among them his signs and wonders in the land of Ham.
Ps. He sent darkness,  made it dark. And they rebelled against his words.
Ps. He turned their waters into blood,  killed their fish.
Ps. Their land swarmed with frogs in the chambers of their kings.
Ps. He spoke,  there came swarms of flies,  lice in all their borders.
Ps. He gave them hail for rain,  flaming fire in their land.
Ps. He also smote their vines and their fig trees,  broke the trees of their borders.
Ps. He spoke,  the locust came,  the grasshopper,  that without number,
Ps. and ate up every herb in their land,  ate up the fruit of their ground.
Ps. He also smote all the firstborn in their land, the chief of all their strength.
Ps. And he brought them forth with silver and gold,  there was not a feeble soul among his tribes.
Ps. Egypt was glad when they departed, for the fear of them had fallen upon them.
Ps. He spread a cloud for a covering,  fire to give light in the night.
Ps. They asked,  he brought quails,  satisfied them with the bread of heaven.
Ps. He opened the rock,  waters gushed out. They ran in the dry places like a river.
Ps. For he remembered his holy word,  Abraham his servant.
Ps. And he brought forth his people with joy,  his chosen with singing.
Ps. And he gave them the lands of the nations,  they took the labor of the peoples in possession,
Ps. that they might keep his statutes,  observe his laws. Praise ye Jehovah.
Ps. Praise ye Jehovah. O give thanks to Jehovah, for he is good, for his loving kindness is forever.
Ps. Who can utter the mighty acts of Jehovah, or show forth all his praise?
Ps. Blessed are those who keep justice,  he who does righteousness at all times.
Ps. Remember me, O Jehovah, with the favor that thou bear to thy people. O visit me with thy salvation,
Ps. that I may see the prosperity of thy chosen, that I may rejoice in the gladness of thy nation, that I may glory with thine inheritance.
Ps. We have sinned with our fathers. We have committed iniquity. we have done wickedly.
Ps. Our fathers did not understand thy wonders in Egypt. They did not remember the multitude of thy loving kindnesses,  were rebellious at the sea, even at the Red Sea.
Ps. Nevertheless he saved them for his name's sake, that he might make his mighty power to be known.
Ps. He also rebuked the Red Sea,  it was dried up. So he led them through the depths as through a wilderness.
Ps. And he saved them from the hand of him who hated them,  redeemed them from the hand of the enemy.
Ps. And the waters covered their adversaries; there was not one of them left.
Ps. Then they believed his words. They sang his praise.
Ps. They soon forgot his works. They did not wait for his counsel,
Ps. but lusted exceedingly in the wilderness,  challenged God in the desert.
Ps. And he gave them their request,  sent leanness into their soul.
Ps. They also envied Moses in the camp,  Aaron the sanctified of Jehovah.
