Ps. The earth opened and swallowed up Dathan,  covered the company of Abiram.
Ps. And a fire was kindled in their company. The flame burned up the wicked men.
Ps. They made a calf in Horeb,  worshiped a molten image.
Ps. Thus they changed their glory for the likeness of an ox that eats grass.
Ps. They forgot God their Savior, who had done great things in Egypt,
Ps. wondrous works in the land of Ham,  fearful things by the Red Sea.
Ps. Therefore he said that he would destroy them, had not Moses his chosen stood before him in the breach, to turn away his wrath, lest he should destroy.
Ps. Yea, they despised the pleasant land. They did not believe his word,
Ps. but murmured in their tents,  did not hearken to the voice of Jehovah.
Ps. Therefore he swore to them, that he would overthrow them in the wilderness,
Ps. and that he would overthrow their seed among the nations,  scatter them in the lands.
Ps. They also joined themselves to Baal-peor,  ate the sacrifices of the dead.
Ps. Thus they provoked him to anger with their doings,  the plague broke in upon them.
Ps. Then Phinehas stood up,  executed judgment,  so the plague was stayed.
Ps. And that was reckoned to him for righteousness to all generations for evermore.
Ps. They also angered him at the waters of Meribah, so that it went ill with Moses because of them,
Ps. because they were rebellious against his spirit,  he spoke ill-advisedly with his lips.
Ps. They did not destroy the peoples, as Jehovah commanded them,
Ps. but mingled themselves with the nations,  learned their works,
Ps. and served their idols, which became a snare to them.
Ps. Yea, they sacrificed their sons and their daughters to demons,
Ps. and shed innocent blood, even the blood of their sons and of their daughters, whom they sacrificed to the idols of Canaan. And the land was polluted with blood.
Ps. Thus they were defiled with their works,  played the harlot in their doings.
Ps. Therefore the wrath of Jehovah was kindled against his people,  he abhorred his inheritance.
Ps. And he gave them into the hand of the nations. And those who hated them ruled over them.
Ps. Their enemies also oppressed them,  they were brought into subjection under their hand.
Ps. Many times he delivered them,  they were rebellious in their counsel,  were brought low in their iniquity.
Ps. Nevertheless he regarded their distress when he heard their cry.
Ps. And he remembered his covenant for them,  relented according to the multitude of his loving kindnesses.
Ps. He also made them to be pitied by all those who carried them captive.
Ps. Save us, O Jehovah our God,  gather us from among the nations, to give thanks to thy holy name,  to triumph in thy praise.
Ps. Blessed be Jehovah, the God of Israel, from everlasting even to everlasting. And let all the people say, Truly. Praise ye Jehovah.
Ps. O give thanks to Jehovah, For he is good, for his loving kindness is forever.
Ps. Let the redeemed of Jehovah say so, whom he has redeemed from the hand of the adversary,
Ps. and gathered out of the lands, from the east and from the west, from the north and from the south.
Ps. They wandered in the wilderness in a desert way. They found no city of habitation.
Ps. Hungry and thirsty, their soul fainted in them.
Ps. Then they cried to Jehovah in their trouble,  he delivered them out of their distresses.
Ps. He also led them by a straight way, that they might go to a city of habitation.
Ps. O that men would praise Jehovah for his loving kindness,  for his wonderful works to the sons of men!
Ps. For he satisfies the longing soul,  he fills the hungry soul with good,
Ps. even those who sat in darkness and in the shadow of death, being bound in affliction and iron,
Ps. because they rebelled against the words of God,  scorned the counsel of the Most High.
Ps. Therefore he brought down their heart with labor. They fell down,  there was none to help.
Ps. Then they cried to Jehovah in their trouble,  he saved them out of their distresses.
Ps. He brought them out of darkness and the shadow of death,  broke their bonds apart.
Ps. O that men would praise Jehovah for his loving kindness,  for his wonderful works to the sons of men!
Ps. For he has broken the gates of brass,  cut the bars of iron apart.
Ps. Fools are afflicted because of their transgression,  because of their iniquities.
Ps. Their soul abhors all manner of food,  they draw near to the gates of death.
Ps. Then they cry to Jehovah in their trouble,  he saves them out of their distresses.
Ps. He sends his word,  heals them,  delivers them from their destructions.
Ps. O that men would praise Jehovah for his loving kindness,  for his wonderful works to the sons of men!
Ps. And let them offer the sacrifices of thanksgiving,  declare his works with singing.
Ps. Those who go down to the sea in ships, who do business in great waters,
Ps. these men see the works of Jehovah,  his wonders in the deep.
Ps. For he commands,  raises the stormy wind, which lifts up the waves of it.
Ps. They mount up to the heavens, they go down again to the depths. Their soul melts away because of trouble.
Ps. They reel to and fro,  stagger like a drunken man,  are at their wits' end.
Ps. Then they cry to Jehovah in their trouble,  he brings them out of their distresses.
Ps. He makes the storm a calm, so that the waves of it are still.
Ps. Then they are glad because they are quiet, so he brings them to their desired haven.
Ps. O that men would praise Jehovah for his loving kindness,  for his wonderful works to the sons of men!
Ps. Let them also exalt him in the assembly of the people,  praise him in the seat of the elders.
Ps. He turns rivers into a wilderness,  water springs into a thirsty ground,
Ps. a fruitful land into a salt desert, for the wickedness of those who dwell therein.
Ps. He turns a wilderness into a pool of water,  a dry land into water springs.
Ps. And there he makes the hungry to dwell, that they may prepare a city of habitation,
Ps. and sow fields,  plant vineyards,  get fruits of increase.
Ps. He also blesses them, so that they are multiplied greatly,  he does not allow their cattle to decrease.
Ps. Again, they are diminished and bowed down through oppression, trouble,  sorrow.
Ps. He pours contempt upon rulers,  causes them to wander in the waste, where there is no way.
Ps. Yet he sets a needy man on high from affliction,  makes him families like a flock.
Ps. The upright shall see it,  be glad. And all iniquity shall stop her mouth.
Ps. He who is wise will give heed to these things,  they will consider the loving kindnesses of Jehovah.
Ps. My heart is fixed, O God, I will sing, yea, I will sing praises, even with my glory.
Ps. Awake, psaltery and harp. I myself will awake right early.
Ps. I will give thanks to thee, O Jehovah, among the peoples,  I will sing praises to thee among the nations.
Ps. For thy loving kindness is great above the heavens,  thy truth is to the skies.
Ps. Be thou exalted, O God, above the heavens,  thy glory above all the earth.
Ps. That thy beloved may be delivered, save with thy right hand,  answer us.
Ps. God has spoken in his holiness. I will exult. I will divide Shechem,  mete out the valley of Succoth.
Ps. Gilead is mine. Manasseh is mine. Ephraim also is the defense of my head. Judah is my scepter.
Ps. Moab is my wash pot. Upon Edom I will cast my shoe. Over Philistia I will shout.
Ps. Who will bring me into the fortified city? Who has led me to Edom?
Ps. Have thou not cast us off, O God? And thou go not forth, O God, with our armies.
Ps. Give us help against the adversary, for vain is the help of man.
Ps. Through God we shall do valiantly, for he it is who will tread down our adversaries.
Ps. Hold not thy peace, O God of my praise,
Ps. for they have opened against me the mouth of the wicked and the mouth of deceit. They have spoken to me with a lying tongue.
Ps. They have also encompassed me about with words of hatred,  fought against me without a cause.
Ps. For my love they are my adversaries,  I make prayer.
Ps. And they have rewarded me evil for good,  hatred for my love.
Ps. Set thou a wicked man over him,  let an adversary stand at his right hand.
Ps. When he is judged, let him come forth guilty,  let his prayer be turned into sin.
Ps. Let his days be few,  let another take his office.
Ps. Let his sons be fatherless,  his wife a widow.
Ps. Let his sons be vagabonds,  beg,  let them seek out of their desolate places.
Ps. Let a creditor exact all that he has,  let strangers make spoil of his labor.
Ps. Let there be none to extend kindness to him, nor let there be any to have pity on his fatherless sons.
Ps. Let his posterity be cut off. In the generation following let their name be blotted out.
Ps. Let the iniquity of his fathers be remembered with Jehovah,  let not the sin of his mother be blotted out.
Ps. Let them be before Jehovah continually, that he may cut off the memory of them from the earth,
Ps. because he did not remember to show kindness,  persecuted the poor and needy man,  the broken in heart, to kill.
Ps. Yea, he loved cursing,  it came to him. And he did not delight in blessing,  it was far from him.
Ps. He also clothed himself with cursing as with his garment,  it came into his inward parts like water,  like oil into his bones.
Ps. Let it be to him as the raiment with which he covers himself,  for the belt with which he is girded continually.
Ps. This is the reward of my adversaries from Jehovah,  of those who speak evil against my soul.
Ps. But deal thou with me, O Jehovah the Lord, for thy name's sake. Because thy loving kindness is good, deliver thou me,
Ps. for I am poor and needy,  my heart is wounded within me.
Ps. I am gone like the shadow when it declines. I am tossed up and down as the locust.
Ps. My knees are weak through fasting,  my flesh fails of fatness.
Ps. I also have become a reproach to them. When they see me, they shake their head.
Ps. Help me, O Jehovah my God. O save me according to thy loving kindness,
Ps. that they may know that this is thy hand, that thou, Jehovah, have done it.
Ps. Let them curse,  bless thou. When they arise, they shall be put to shame,  thy servant shall rejoice.
Ps. Let my adversaries be clothed with dishonor,  let them cover themselves with their own shame as with a robe.
Ps. I will give great thanks to Jehovah with my mouth. Yea, I will praise him among the multitude.
Ps. For he will stand at the right hand of the needy, to save him from those who judge his soul.
Ps. Jehovah says to my Lord, Sit thou at my right hand until I make thine enemies thy footstool.
Ps. Jehovah will send forth the rod of thy strength out of Zion. Rule thou in the midst of thine enemies.
Ps. Thy people offer themselves willingly in the day of thy power, in holy array. Out of the womb of the morning thou have the dew of thy youth.
Ps. Jehovah has sworn,  will not repent. Thou are a priest forever after the order of Melchizedek.
Ps. The Lord at thy right hand will strike through kings in the day of his wrath.
Ps. He will judge among the nations. He will fill with dead bodies. He will strike through the head in many countries.
Ps. He will drink of the brook in the way, therefore he will lift up the head.
Ps. Praise ye Jehovah. I will give thanks to Jehovah with my whole heart, in the council of the upright,  in the congregation.
Ps. The works of Jehovah are great, sought out by all those who have pleasure in it.
Ps. His work is honor and majesty,  his righteousness endures forever.
Ps. He has made his wonderful works to be remembered. Jehovah is gracious and merciful.
Ps. He has given food to those who fear him. He will ever be mindful of his covenant.
Ps. He has shown his people the power of his works, in giving them the heritage of the nations.
Ps. The works of his hands are truth and justice. All his precepts are sure.
Ps. They are established forever and ever. They are done in truth and uprightness.
Ps. He has sent redemption to his people. He has commanded his covenant forever. Holy and reverend is his name.
Ps. The fear of Jehovah is the beginning of wisdom,  all who act accordingly have a good understanding. His praise endures forever.
Ps. Praise ye Jehovah. Blessed is the man who fears Jehovah, who delights greatly in his commandments.
Ps. His seed shall be mighty upon earth. The generation of the upright shall be blessed.
Ps. Wealth and riches are in his house,  his righteousness endures forever.
Ps. To the upright there arises light in the darkness. He is gracious,  merciful,  righteous.
Ps. It is well with the man who deals graciously and lends. He shall maintain his cause in judgment,
Ps. for he shall never be moved. A righteous man shall be had in everlasting remembrance.
Ps. He shall not be afraid of evil tidings. His heart is fixed, trusting in Jehovah.
Ps. His heart is established, he shall not be afraid, even until he looks over his adversaries.
Ps. He has scattered, he has given to the poor. His righteousness endures forever. His horn shall be exalted with honor.
Ps. A wicked man shall see it,  be grieved. He shall gnash with his teeth,  melt away. The desire of wicked men shall perish.
Ps. Praise ye Jehovah. Praise, O ye servants of Jehovah. Praise the name of Jehovah.
Ps. Blessed be the name of Jehovah from this time forth and for evermore.
Ps. From the rising of the sun to the going down of the same Jehovah's name is to be praised.
Ps. Jehovah is high above all nations,  his glory above the heavens.
Ps. Who is like Jehovah our God who has his seat on high,
Ps. and yet looks upon the low things in heaven and in the earth.
Ps. He raises up a poor man out of the dust,  lifts up a needy man from the dunghill,
Ps. that he may set him with rulers, even with the rulers of his people.
Ps. He makes the barren woman to keep house, a joyful mother of sons. Praise ye Jehovah.
Ps. When Israel went forth out of Egypt, the house of Jacob from a people of strange language,
Ps. Judah became his sanctuary, Israel his dominion.
Ps. The sea saw it,  fled. The Jordan was driven back.
Ps. The mountains skipped like rams, the little hills like lambs.
Ps. What ails thee, O thou sea, that thou flee? Thou Jordan, that thou turn back?
Ps. Ye mountains, that ye skip like rams, ye little hills, like lambs?
Ps. Tremble, thou earth, at the presence of the Lord, at the presence of the God of Jacob,
Ps. who turned the rock into a pool of water, the flint into a fountain of waters.
Ps. Not to us, O Jehovah, not to us,  to thy name give glory. For thy loving kindness,  for thy truth's sake.
Ps. Why should the nations say, Where is now their God?
Ps. But our God is in the heavens. He has done whatever he pleased.
Ps. Their idols are silver and gold, the work of men's hands.
Ps. They have mouths,  they speak not. They have eyes,  they see not.
Ps. They have ears,  they hear not. They have noses,  they smell not.
Ps. They have hands,  they handle not. They have feet,  they walk not, nor do they speak through their throat.

Ps. O Israel, trust thou in Jehovah. He is their help and their shield.

Ps. Blessed are ye of Jehovah who made heaven and earth.
Ps. The heavens are the heavens of Jehovah,  the earth he has given to the sons of men.
Ps. The dead do not praise Jehovah, nor any who go down into silence,
Ps. but we will bless Jehovah from this time forth and for evermore. Praise ye Jehovah.
Ps. I love Jehovah because he hears my voice and my supplications.
Ps. Because he has inclined his ear to me, therefore I will call as long as I live.

Ps. Out of my distress I called upon Jehovah. Jehovah answered me upon a large place.
Ps. Jehovah is on my side, I will not fear. What can man do to me?
Ps. Jehovah is on my side among those who help me. Therefore I shall look upon those who hate me.
Ps. It is better to take refuge in Jehovah than to put confidence in man.
Ps. It is better to take refuge in Jehovah than to put confidence in rulers.
Ps. All nations encompassed me around. In the name of Jehovah I will cut them off.

Ps. Thou thrusted greatly at me that I might fall,  Jehovah helped me.

Ps. The voice of rejoicing and salvation is in the tents of the righteous. The right hand of Jehovah does valiantly.

Ps. I shall not die,  live,  declare the works of Jehovah.
Ps. Jehovah has chastened me greatly,  he has not given me over to death.
Ps. Open to me the gates of righteousness. I will enter into them. I will give thanks to Jehovah.
Ps. This is the gate of Jehovah. The righteous shall enter into it.
Ps. I will give thanks to thee, for thou have answered me,  have become my salvation.
Ps. The stone which the builders rejected has become the head of the corner.
Ps. This is Jehovah's doing. It is marvelous in our eyes.
Ps. This is the day which Jehovah has made. We will rejoice and be glad in it.
Ps. Save now, we beseech thee, O Jehovah. O Jehovah, we beseech thee, send now prosperity.
Ps. Blessed be he who comes in the name of Jehovah. We have blessed you out of the house of Jehovah.

Ps. O give thanks to Jehovah, for he is good, for his loving kindness is forever.
Ps. Blessed are those who are perfect in the way, who walk in the law of Jehovah.
Ps. Blessed are those who keep his testimonies, that seek him with the whole heart.
Ps. Yea, they do no unrighteousness. They walk in his ways.
Ps. Thou have commanded thy precepts, that we should observe them diligently.
Ps. O that my ways were established to observe thy statutes!
Ps. Then I shall not be put to shame when I have respect for all thy commandments.
Ps. I will give thanks to thee with uprightness of heart when I learn thy righteous judgments.
Ps. I will observe thy statutes. O forsake me not utterly.
Ps. With what shall a young man cleanse his way? By taking heed according to thy word.
Ps. With my whole heart I have sought thee. O let me not wander from thy commandments.
Ps. I have laid thy word up in my heart that I might not sin against thee.
Ps. Blessed are thou, O Jehovah. Teach me thy statutes.
Ps. With my lips I have declared all the ordinances of thy mouth.
Ps. I have rejoiced in the way of thy testimonies as much as in all riches.
Ps. I will meditate on thy precepts,  have respect for thy ways.
Ps. I will delight myself in thy statutes. I will not forget thy word.
Ps. Deal bountifully with thy servant that I may live, so I will observe thy word.
Ps. Open thou my eyes that I may behold wondrous things out of thy law.
Ps. I am a sojourner in the earth. Hide not thy commandments from me.
Ps. My soul breaks for the longing that it has to thine ordinances at all times.
Ps. Thou have rebuked the proud, who are cursed, who wander from thy commandments.
Ps. Take away from me reproach and contempt, for I have kept thy testimonies.
Ps. Rulers also sat and talked against me,  thy servant meditated on thy statutes.
Ps. Thy testimonies also are my delight and my counselors.
Ps. My soul clings to the dust. Enliven thou me according to thy word.
Ps. I declared my ways,  thou answered me. Teach me thy statutes.
Ps. Make me to understand the way of thy precepts, so I shall meditate on thy wondrous works.
Ps. My soul melts for heaviness. Strengthen thou me according to thy word.
Ps. Remove from me the way of falsehood,  grant me thy law graciously.
Ps. I have chosen the way of faithfulness. I have set thine ordinances.
Ps. I cling to thy testimonies. O Jehovah, put me not to shame.
Ps. I will run the way of thy commandments when thou shall enlarge my heart.
Ps. Teach me, O Jehovah, the way of thy statutes,  I shall keep it to the end.
Ps. Give me understanding,  I shall keep thy law, yea, I shall observe it with my whole heart.
Ps. Make me to go in the path of thy commandments, for therein do I delight.
Ps. Incline my heart to thy testimonies,  not to covetousness.
Ps. Turn away my eyes from beholding vanity,  enliven me in thy ways.
Ps. Confirm to thy servant thy word, which is for the fear of thee.
Ps. Turn away my reproach of which I am afraid, for thine ordinances are good.
Ps. Behold, I have longed after thy precepts. Enliven me in thy righteousness.
Ps. Let thy loving kindnesses also come to me, O Jehovah, even thy salvation, according to thy word.
Ps. So I shall have an answer for him who reproaches me, for I trust in thy word.
Ps. And take not the word of truth utterly out of my mouth, for I have hoped in thine ordinances.
Ps. So shall I observe thy law continually forever and ever.
Ps. And I shall walk at liberty, for I have sought thy precepts.
Ps. I also will speak of thy testimonies before kings,  shall not be put to shame.
Ps. And I will delight myself in thy commandments, which I have loved.
Ps. I will also lift up my hands to thy commandments, which I have loved,  I will meditate on thy statutes.
Ps. Remember the word to thy servant, because thou have made me to hope.
Ps. This is my comfort in my affliction, for thy word has revived me.
Ps. The proud have had me greatly in derision, yet I have not swerved from thy law.
Ps. I have remembered thine ordinances of old, O Jehovah,  have comforted myself.
Ps. Hot indignation has taken hold upon me because of the wicked who forsake thy law.
Ps. Thy statutes have been my songs in the house of my pilgrimage.
Ps. I have remembered thy name, O Jehovah, in the night,  have observed thy law.
Ps. This I have had because I have kept thy precepts.
Ps. Jehovah is my portion; I have said that I would observe thy words.
Ps. I entreated thy favor with my whole heart. Be merciful to me according to thy word.
Ps. I thought on my ways,  turned my feet to thy testimonies.
Ps. I made haste,  delayed not, to observe thy commandments.
Ps. The cords of the wicked have wrapped me around,  I have not forgotten thy law.
Ps. At midnight I will rise to give thanks to thee because of thy righteous ordinances.
Ps. I am a companion of all those who fear thee,  of those who observe thy precepts.
Ps. The earth, O Jehovah, is full of thy loving kindness. Teach me thy statutes.
Ps. Thou have dealt well with thy servant, O Jehovah, according to thy word.
Ps. Teach me good judgment and knowledge, for I have believed in thy commandments.
Ps. Before I was afflicted I went astray,  now I observe thy word.
Ps. Thou are good,  do good. Teach me thy statutes.
Ps. The proud have forged a lie against me. With my whole heart I will keep thy precepts.
Ps. Their heart is as fat as grease,  I delight in thy law.
Ps. It is good for me that I have been afflicted, that I may learn thy statutes.
Ps. The law of thy mouth is better to me than thousands of gold and silver.
Ps. Thy hands have made me and fashioned me. Give me understanding that I may learn thy commandments.
Ps. Those who fear thee shall see me and be glad, because I have hoped in thy word.
Ps. I know, O Jehovah, that thy judgments are righteous,  that in faithfulness thou have afflicted me.
Ps. Let, I pray thee, thy loving kindness be for my comfort according to thy word to thy servant.
Ps. Let thy tender mercies come to me that I may live, for thy law is my delight.
Ps. Let the proud be put to shame, for they have overthrown me wrongfully. I will meditate on thy precepts.
Ps. Let those who fear thee turn to me,  they shall know thy testimonies.
Ps. Let my heart be perfect in thy statutes that I be not put to shame.
Ps. My soul faints for thy salvation. I hope in thy word.
Ps. My eyes fail for thy word, while I say, When will thou comfort me?
Ps. For I have become like a wine-skin in the smoke. Yet I do not forget thy statutes.
Ps. How many are the days of thy servant? When will thou execute judgment on those who persecute me?
Ps. The proud have dug pits for me, who are not according to thy law.
Ps. All thy commandments are faithful. They persecute me wrongfully. Help thou me.
Ps. They had almost consumed me upon earth,  I did not forsake thy precepts.
Ps. Revive me according to thy loving kindness, so I shall observe the testimony of thy mouth.
Ps. Forever, O Jehovah, thy word is settled in heaven.
Ps. Thy faithfulness is to all generations. Thou have established the earth,  it abides.
Ps. They abide this day according to thine ordinances, for all things are thy servants.
Ps. Unless thy law had been my delight, I should then have perished in my affliction.
Ps. I will never forget thy precepts, for with them thou have enlivened me.
Ps. I am thine. Save me, for I have sought thy precepts.
Ps. The wicked have waited for me, to destroy me. I will consider thy testimonies.
Ps. I have seen an end of all perfection. Thy commandment is exceedingly broad.
Ps. O how I love thy law! It is my meditation all the day.
Ps. Thy commandments make me wiser than my enemies, for they are ever with me.
Ps. I have more understanding than all my teachers, for thy testimonies are my meditation.
Ps. I understand more than the aged because I have kept thy precepts.
Ps. I have restrained my feet from every evil way, that I might observe thy word.
Ps. I have not turned aside from thine ordinances, for thou have taught me.
Ps. How sweet are thy words to my taste, than honey to my mouth!
Ps. Through thy precepts I get understanding. Therefore I hate every false way.
Ps. Thy word is a lamp to my feet,  light to my path.
Ps. I have sworn,  have confirmed it, that I will observe thy righteous ordinances.
Ps. I am afflicted very much. Revive me, O Jehovah, according to thy word.
Ps. Accept, I beseech thee, the freewill offerings of my mouth, O Jehovah,  teach me thine ordinances.
Ps. My soul is continually in my hand, yet I do not forget thy law.
Ps. The wicked have laid a snare for me, yet I have not gone astray from thy precepts.
Ps. I have taken thy testimonies as a heritage forever, for they are the rejoicing of my heart.
Ps. I have inclined my heart to perform thy statutes forever, even to the end.
Ps. I hate those who are of a double mind,  I love thy law.
Ps. Thou are my hiding place and my shield. I hope in thy word.
Ps. Depart from me, ye evildoers, that I may keep the commandments of my God.
Ps. Uphold me according to thy word, that I may live,  let me not be ashamed of my hope.
Ps. Hold thou me up,  I shall be safe,  shall have respect for thy statutes continually.
Ps. Thou have set at nothing all those who err from thy statutes, for their deceit is falsehood.
Ps. Thou put away all the wicked of the earth like dross. Therefore I love thy testimonies.
Ps. My flesh trembles for fear of thee,  I am afraid of thy judgments.
Ps. I have done justice and righteousness. Leave me not to my oppressors.
Ps. Be surety for thy servant for good. Let not the proud oppress me.
Ps. My eyes fail for thy salvation,  for thy righteous word.
Ps. Deal with thy servant according to thy loving kindness,  teach me thy statutes.
Ps. I am thy servant. Give me understanding, that I may know thy testimonies.
Ps. It is time for Jehovah to work. They have made void thy law.
Ps. Therefore I love thy commandments above gold, yea, above fine gold.
Ps. Therefore I esteem all precepts concerning all things to be right. I hate every false way.
Ps. Thy testimonies are wonderful, therefore my soul keeps them.
Ps. The opening of thy words gives light. It gives understanding to the simple.
Ps. I opened wide my mouth,  panted, for I longed for thy commandments.
Ps. Turn thee to me,  have mercy upon me, as thou used to do to those who love thy name.
Ps. Establish my footsteps in thy word,  let not any iniquity have dominion over me.
Ps. Redeem me from the oppression of man, so I will observe thy precepts.
Ps. Make thy face to shine upon thy servant,  teach me thy statutes.
Ps. Streams of water run down my eyes, because they do not observe thy law.
Ps. Thou are righteous, O Jehovah,  upright are thy judgments.
Ps. Thou have commanded thy testimonies in righteousness and exceeding faithfulness.
Ps. My zeal has consumed me, because my adversaries have forgotten thy words.
Ps. Thy word is very pure, therefore thy servant loves it.
Ps. I am small and despised. I do not forget thy precepts.
Ps. Thy righteousness is an everlasting righteousness,  thy law is truth.
Ps. Trouble and anguish have taken hold on me. Thy commandments are my delight.
Ps. Thy testimonies are righteous forever. Give me understanding,  I shall live.
Ps. I have called with my whole heart. Answer me, O Jehovah. I will keep thy statutes.
Ps. I have called to thee. Save me,  I shall observe thy testimonies.
Ps. I anticipated the dawning of the morning,  cried. I hoped in thy words.
Ps. My eyes anticipated the night-watches that I might meditate on thy word.
Ps. Hear my voice according to thy loving kindness. Enliven me, O Jehovah, according to thine ordinances.
Ps. They draw near who follow after wickedness. They are far from thy law.
Ps. Thou are near, O Jehovah,  all thy commandments are truth.
Ps. Of old I have known from thy testimonies that thou have founded them forever.
Ps. Consider my affliction,  deliver me, for I do not forget thy law.
Ps. Plead thou my cause,  redeem me. Enliven me according to thy word.
Ps. Salvation is far from the wicked, for they seek not thy statutes.
Ps. Great are thy tender mercies, O Jehovah. Enliven me according to thine ordinances.
Ps. Many are my persecutors and my adversaries. I have not swerved from thy testimonies.
Ps. I beheld the treacherous,  was grieved because they do not observe thy word.
Ps. Consider how I love thy precepts. Enliven me, O Jehovah, according to thy loving kindness.
Ps. The sum of thy word is truth,  every one of thy righteous ordinances is forever.
Ps. Rulers have persecuted me without a cause,  my heart stands in awe of thy words.
Ps. I rejoice at thy word, as he who finds great spoil.
Ps. I hate and abhor falsehood. I love thy law.
Ps. Seven times a day I praise thee because of thy righteous ordinances.
Ps. Great peace have those who love thy law,  they have no occasion of stumbling.
Ps. I have hoped for thy salvation, O Jehovah,  have done thy commandments.
Ps. My soul has observed thy testimonies,  I love them exceedingly.
Ps. I have observed thy precepts and thy testimonies, for all my ways are before thee.
Ps. Let my cry come near before thee, O Jehovah. Give me understanding according to thy word.
Ps. Let my supplication come before thee. Deliver me according to thy word.
Ps. Let my lips utter praise, for thou teach me thy statutes.
Ps. Let my tongue sing of thy word, for all thy commandments are righteousness.
Ps. Let thy hand be ready to help me, for I have chosen thy precepts.
Ps. I have longed for thy salvation, O Jehovah,  thy law is my delight.
Ps. Let my soul live,  it shall praise thee. And let thine ordinances help me.
Ps. I have gone astray like a lost sheep. Seek thy servant, for I do not forget thy commandments.
Ps. In my distress I cried to Jehovah,  he answered me.
Ps. Deliver my soul, O Jehovah, from lying lips, from a deceitful tongue.
Ps. What shall be given to thee,  what shall be done more to thee, thou deceitful tongue?
Ps. Sharp arrows of the mighty, with coals of juniper.
Ps. Woe is me, that I sojourn in Meshech, that I dwell among the tents of Kedar!
Ps. My soul has long had her dwelling with him who hates peace.
Ps. I am for peace,  when I speak, they are for war.
Ps. I will lift up my eyes to the mountains. From where shall my help come?
Ps. My help is from Jehovah, who made heaven and earth.
Ps. He will not allow thy foot to be moved. He who keeps thee will not slumber.
Ps. Behold, he who keeps Israel will neither slumber nor sleep.
Ps. Jehovah is thy keeper. Jehovah is thy shade upon thy right hand.
Ps. The sun shall not smite thee by day, nor the moon by night.
Ps. Jehovah will keep thee from all evil. He will keep thy soul.
Ps. Jehovah will keep thy going out and thy coming in from this time forth and for evermore.
Ps. I was glad when they said to me, Let us go to the house of Jehovah.
Ps. Our feet are standing inside thy gates, O Jerusalem.
Ps. Jerusalem, that is built as a city that is compact together,
Ps. where the tribes go up, even the tribes of Jehovah, for an ordinance for Israel, to give thanks to the name of Jehovah.
Ps. For there thrones are set for judgment, the thrones of the house of David.
Ps. Pray for the peace of Jerusalem. They shall prosper who love thee.
Ps. Peace be within thy walls,  prosperity within thy palaces.
Ps. For my brothers and companions' sakes I will now say, Peace be within thee.
Ps. For the sake of the house of Jehovah our God I will seek thy good.
Ps. To thee do I lift up my eyes, O thou who sit in the heavens.
Ps. Behold, as the eyes of servants to the hand of their master, as the eyes of a maid to the hand of her mistress, so our eyes are to Jehovah our God, until he has mercy upon us.
Ps. Have mercy upon us, O Jehovah, have mercy upon us, for we are exceedingly filled with contempt.
Ps. Our soul is exceedingly filled with the scoffing of those who are at ease,  with the contempt of the proud.
Ps. If it had not been Jehovah who was on our side, let Israel now say,
Ps. if it had not been Jehovah who was on our side when men rose up against us,
Ps. then they would have swallowed us up alive when their wrath was kindled against us,
Ps. then the waters would have overwhelmed us, the stream would have gone over our soul,
Ps. then the proud waters would have gone over our soul.
Ps. Blessed be Jehovah, who has not given us as a prey to their teeth.
Ps. Our soul has escaped as a bird out of the snare of the fowlers. The snare is broken,  we have escaped.
Ps. Our help is in the name of Jehovah, who made heaven and earth.
Ps. Those who trust in Jehovah are as mount Zion, which cannot be moved,  abides forever.
Ps. As the mountains are round about Jerusalem, so Jehovah is round about his people from this time forth and for evermore.
Ps. For the scepter of wickedness shall not rest upon the lot of the righteous, that the righteous not put forth their hands to iniquity.
Ps. Do good, O Jehovah, to those who are good,  to those who are upright in their hearts.
Ps. But as for such as turn aside to their crooked ways, Jehovah will lead them forth with the workers of iniquity. Peace be upon Israel.
Ps. When Jehovah brought back those who returned to Zion, we were like those who dream.
Ps. Then our mouth was filled with laughter,  our tongue with singing. Then they said among the nations, Jehovah has done great things for them.
Ps. Jehovah has done great things for us. We are glad.
Ps. Turn again our captivity, O Jehovah, as the streams in the South.
Ps. Those who sow in tears shall reap in joy.
Ps. He who goes forth and weeps, bearing seed for sowing, shall doubtless come again with joy, bringing his sheaves.
Ps. Unless Jehovah builds the house, they labor in vain who build it. Unless Jehovah guards the city, the watchman wake but in vain.
Ps. It is vain for you to rise up early, to take rest late, to eat the bread of toil, for so he gives sleep to his beloved.
Ps. Lo, sons are a heritage of Jehovah,  the fruit of the womb is a reward.
Ps. As arrows in the hand of a mighty man, so are the sons of youth.
Ps. Happy is the man who has his quiver full of them. They shall not be put to shame when they speak with their enemies in the gate.
Ps. Blessed are all who fear Jehovah, who walk in his ways.
Ps. For thou shall eat the labor of thy hands. Happy thou shall be,  it shall be well with thee.
Ps. Thy wife shall be as a fruitful vine in the innermost parts of thy house, thy sons like olive plants round about thy table.
Ps. Behold, thus shall the man be blessed who fears Jehovah.
Ps. Jehovah bless thee out of Zion,  see thou the good of Jerusalem all the days of thy life.
Ps. Yea, see thou thy son's sons. Peace be upon Israel.
Ps. Many a time they have afflicted me from my youth up. Let Israel now say,
Ps. Many a time they have afflicted me from my youth up, yet they have not prevailed against me.
Ps. The plowers plowed upon my back. They made long their furrows.
Ps. Jehovah is righteous. He has cut apart the cords of the wicked.
Ps. Let them be put to shame and turned backward, all those who hate Zion.
Ps. Let them be as the grass upon the housetops, which withers before it grows up,
Ps. with which the reaper fills not his hand, nor he who binds sheaves, his bosom.
Ps. Neither do those who go by say, The blessing of Jehovah be upon you. We bless you in the name of Jehovah.
Ps. Out of the depths I have cried to thee, O Jehovah.
Ps. Lord, hear my voice. Let thine ears be attentive to the voice of my supplications.
Ps. If thou, Jehovah, should note iniquities, O Lord, who could stand?
Ps. But there is forgiveness with thee, that thou may be feared.
Ps. I wait for Jehovah. My soul waits,  in his word do I hope,
Ps. my soul for the Lord more than watchmen for the morning, watchmen for the morning.
Ps. O Israel, hope in Jehovah, for with Jehovah there is loving kindness,  with him is plentiful redemption.
Ps. And he will redeem Israel from all his iniquities.
Ps. Jehovah, my heart is not haughty, nor my eyes lofty. Neither do I exercise myself in grand matters, or in things too wonderful for me.
Ps. Surely I have stilled and quieted my soul like a weaned child with his mother. Like a weaned child is my soul within me.
Ps. O Israel, hope in Jehovah from this time forth and for evermore.
Ps. Jehovah, remember for David all his affliction,
Ps. how he swore to Jehovah,  vowed to the Mighty One of Jacob:
Ps. Surely I will not come into the tabernacle of my house, nor go up into my bed,
Ps. I will not give sleep to my eyes, or slumber to my eyelids,
Ps. until I find out a place for Jehovah, a tabernacle for the Mighty One of Jacob.
Ps. Lo, we heard of it in Ephrathah. We found it in the field of the wood.
Ps. We will go into his tabernacles. We will worship at his footstool.
Ps. Arise, O Jehovah, into thy resting-place, thou,  the ark of thy strength.
Ps. Let thy priest be clothed with righteousness,  let thy sanctified shout for joy.
Ps. For thy servant David's sake turn not away the face of thine anointed.
Ps. Jehovah has sworn to David in truth. He will not turn from it: From the fruit of thy body I will set upon thy throne.
Ps. If thy sons will keep my covenant and my testimony that I shall teach them, their sons also shall sit upon thy throne for evermore.
Ps. For Jehovah has chosen Zion. He has desired it for his habitation.
Ps. This is my resting place forever. Here I will dwell, for I have desired it.
Ps. I will abundantly bless her provision. I will satisfy her poor with bread.
Ps. I will also clothe her priests with salvation,  her sanctified shall shout aloud for joy.
Ps. There I will make the horn of David to bud. I have ordained a lamp for my anointed.
Ps. I will clothe his enemies with shame,  upon himself his crown shall flourish.
Ps. Behold, how good and how pleasant it is for brothers to dwell together in unity!
Ps. It is like the precious oil upon the head, that ran down upon the beard, even Aaron's beard, that came down upon the skirt of his garments,
Ps. like the dew of Hermon, that comes down upon the mountains of Zion. For there Jehovah commanded the blessing, even life for evermore.
Ps. Behold, bless ye Jehovah, all ye servants of Jehovah, who stand by night in the house of Jehovah.
Ps. Lift up your hands to the sanctuary,  bless ye Jehovah.
Ps. Jehovah bless thee out of Zion, even he who made heaven and earth.
Ps. Praise ye Jehovah. Praise ye the name of Jehovah. Praise, O ye servants of Jehovah,
Ps. ye who stand in the house of Jehovah, in the courts of the house of our God.
Ps. Praise ye Jehovah, for Jehovah is good. Sing praises to his name, for it is pleasant.
Ps. For Jehovah has chosen Jacob to himself, Israel for his own possession.
Ps. For I know that Jehovah is great,  that our Lord is above all gods.
Ps. Whatever Jehovah pleased, that he has done, in heaven and in earth, in the seas and in all deeps,
Ps. who causes the vapors to ascend from the ends of the earth, who makes lightnings for the rain, who brings forth the wind out of his treasuries,
Ps. who smote the firstborn of Egypt, both of man and beast,
Ps. who sent signs and wonders into the midst of thee, O Egypt, upon Pharaoh,  upon all his servants,
Ps. who smote many nations,  killed mighty kings-
Ps. Sihon king of the Amorites,  Og king of Bashan,  all the kingdoms of Canaan-
Ps. and gave their land for a heritage, a heritage to Israel his people.
Ps. Thy name, O Jehovah, is forever, thy memorial, O Jehovah, throughout all generations.
Ps. For Jehovah will judge his people,  will relent concerning his servants.
Ps. The idols of the nations are silver and gold, the work of men's hands.
Ps. They have mouths,  they speak not. They have eyes,  they see not.
Ps. They have ears,  they hear not, nor is there any breath in their mouths.
Ps. Those who make them shall be like them, yea, everyone who trusts in them.
Ps. O house of Israel, bless ye Jehovah. O house of Aaron, bless ye Jehovah.
Ps. O house of Levi, bless ye Jehovah. Ye who fear Jehovah, bless ye Jehovah.
Ps. Blessed be Jehovah out of Zion, who dwells at Jerusalem. Praise ye Jehovah.
Ps. O give thanks to Jehovah, for he is good, for his loving kindness is forever.
Ps. O give thanks to the God of gods, for his loving kindness is forever.
Ps. O give thanks to the Lord of lords, for his loving kindness is forever,
Ps. to him who alone does great wonders, for his loving kindness is forever,
Ps. to him who by understanding made the heavens, for his loving kindness is forever,
Ps. to him who spread forth the earth above the waters, for his loving kindness is forever,
Ps. to him who made great lights, for his loving kindness is forever,
Ps. the sun to rule by day, for his loving kindness is forever,
Ps. the moon and stars to rule by night, for his loving kindness is forever,
Ps. to him who smote Egypt in their firstborn, for his loving kindness is forever,
Ps. and brought out Israel from among them, for his loving kindness is forever,
Ps. with a strong hand,  with an outstretched arm, for his loving kindness is forever,
Ps. to him who divided the Red Sea apart, for his loving kindness is forever,
Ps. and made Israel to pass through the midst of it, for his loving kindness is forever,
Ps. but overthrew Pharaoh and his army in the Red Sea, for his loving kindness is forever,
Ps. to him who led his people through the wilderness, for his loving kindness is forever,
Ps. to him who smote great kings, for his loving kindness is forever,
Ps. and killed famous kings, for his loving kindness is forever,
Ps. Sihon king of the Amorites, for his loving kindness is forever,
Ps. and Og king of Bashan, for his loving kindness is forever,
Ps. and gave their land for a heritage, for his loving kindness is forever,
Ps. even a heritage to Israel his servant, for his loving kindness is forever,
Ps. who remembered us in our low estate, for his loving kindness is forever,
Ps. and has delivered us from our adversaries, for his loving kindness is forever,
Ps. who gives food to all flesh, for his loving kindness is forever.
Ps. O give thanks to the God of heaven, for his loving kindness is forever.
Ps. By the rivers of Babylon, there we sat down, yea, we wept when we remembered Zion.
Ps. Upon the willows in the midst of it we hung up our harps.
Ps. For there those who led us captive required of us songs,  those who wasted us, mirth, saying, Sing for us one of the songs of Zion.
Ps. How shall we sing Jehovah's song in a foreign land?
Ps. If I forget thee, O Jerusalem, let my right hand forget.
Ps. Let my tongue cling to the roof of my mouth, if I do not remember thee, if I do not prefer Jerusalem above my chief joy.
Ps. Remember, O Jehovah, the day of Jerusalem against the sons of Edom, who said, Raze it, raze it, even to the foundation thereof.
Ps. O daughter of Babylon, who is to be destroyed, happy shall he be who rewards thee as thou have served us.
Ps. Happy shall he be who takes and dashes thy little ones against the rock.
Ps. I will give thee thanks with my whole heart. I will sing praises to thee before the gods.
Ps. I will worship toward thy holy temple,  give thanks to thy name for thy loving kindness and for thy truth. For thou have magnified thy word above all thy name.
Ps. Thou answered me in the day that I called. Thou encouraged me with strength in my soul.
Ps. All the kings of the earth shall give thee thanks, O Jehovah, for they have heard the words of thy mouth.
Ps. Yea, they shall sing of the ways of Jehovah, for great is the glory of Jehovah.
Ps. For though Jehovah is high, yet he has respect to the lowly. But he knows the haughty from afar.
Ps. Though I walk in the midst of trouble, thou will revive me. Thou will stretch forth thy hand against the wrath of my enemies,  thy right hand will save me.
Ps. Jehovah will perfect that which concerns me. Thy loving kindness, O Jehovah, is forever. Forsake not the works of thine own hands.
Ps. O Jehovah, thou have searched me,  known.
Ps. Thou know my sitting down and my rising up. Thou understand my thought afar off.
Ps. Thou search out my path and my lying down,  are acquainted with all my ways.
Ps. For there is not a word in my tongue, , lo, O Jehovah, thou know it altogether.
Ps. Thou have beset me behind and before,  laid thy hand upon me.
Ps. Such knowledge is too wonderful for me. It is high, I cannot attain to it.
Ps. Where shall I go from thy Spirit? Or where shall I flee from thy presence?
Ps. If I ascend up into heaven, thou are there. If I make my bed in Sheol, behold, thou are there.
Ps. If I take the wings of the morning,  dwell in the outermost parts of the sea,
Ps. even there thy hand shall lead me,  thy right hand shall hold me.
Ps. If I say, Surely the darkness shall overwhelm me,  the light around me shall be night,
Ps. even the darkness hides not from thee,  the night shines as the day. The darkness and the light are both alike to thee.
Ps. For thou formed my inward parts. Thou covered me in my mother's womb.
Ps. I will give thanks to thee, for I am fearfully and wonderfully made. Wonderful are thy works,  that my soul knows right well.
Ps. My frame was not hidden from thee, when I was made in secret, curiously wrought in the lowest parts of the earth.
Ps. Thine eyes saw my unformed substance,  in thy book they were all written, even the days that were ordained, when as yet there was none of them.
Ps. How precious also are thy thoughts to me, O God! How great is the sum of them!
Ps. I count them; they are more in number than the sand. When I awake, I am still with thee.
Ps. Surely thou will kill the wicked, O God. Depart from me therefore, ye bloodthirsty men.
Ps. For they speak against thee wickedly,  thine enemies take it in vain.
Ps. Do I not hate them, O Jehovah, who hate thee? And am I not grieved with those who rise up against thee?
Ps. I hate them with perfect hatred. They have become my enemies.
Ps. Search me, O God,  know my heart. Try me,  know my thoughts,
Ps. and see if there is any wicked way in me. And lead me in the way everlasting.
Ps. Deliver me, O Jehovah, from the evil man. Preserve me from the violent man,
Ps. and men who devise mischievous things in their heart. They gather themselves continually together for war.
Ps. They have sharpened their tongue like a serpent. Adders' poison is under their lips. Selah.
Ps. Keep me, O Jehovah, from the hands of a wicked man. Preserve me from violent men, who have purposed to thrust aside my steps.
Ps. The proud have hid a snare for me,  cords. They have spread a net by the wayside. They have set snares for me. Selah.
Ps. I said to Jehovah, Thou are my God. Give ear to the voice of my supplications, O Jehovah.
Ps. O Jehovah the Lord, the strength of my salvation, thou have covered my head in the day of battle.
Ps. Grant not, O Jehovah, the desires of the wicked man. Do not further his evil device. They exalt themselves. Selah.
Ps. As for the head of those who encompass me around, let the mischief of their own lips cover them.
Ps. Let burning coals fall upon them. Let them be cast into the fire, into deep pits, from where they shall not rise.
Ps. An evil speaker shall not be established in the earth. Evil shall hunt the violent man to overthrow him.
Ps. I know that Jehovah will maintain the cause of the afflicted man,  justice for the needy.
Ps. Surely the righteous shall give thanks to thy name. The upright shall dwell in thy presence.
Ps. Jehovah, I have called upon thee. Make haste to me. Give ear to my voice when I call to thee.
Ps. Let my prayer be set forth as incense before thee, the lifting up of my hands as the evening sacrifice.
Ps. Set a watch, O Jehovah, before my mouth. Keep the door of my lips.
Ps. Incline not my heart to any evil thing, to practice deeds of wickedness with men who work iniquity. And let me not eat of their dainties.
Ps. Let a righteous man smite me, as a kindness. And let him reprove me, as oil upon the head. Let not my head refuse it. For even in their wickedness my prayer shall continue.
Ps. Their judges are thrown down by the sides of the rock. And they shall hear my words, for they are sweet.
Ps. Like plowing and furrowing the earth, our bones are scattered at the mouth of Sheol.
Ps. For my eyes are to thee, O Jehovah the Lord. In thee do I take refuge. Leave not my soul destitute.
Ps. Keep me from the snare which they have laid for me,  from the traps of the workers of iniquity.
Ps. Let the wicked fall into their own nets, while I pass over.
Ps. I cry with my voice to Jehovah. With my voice to Jehovah I make supplication.
Ps. I pour out my complaint before him. I show my trouble before him.
Ps. When my spirit was overwhelmed within me, thou knew my path. In the way in which I walk they have hidden a snare for me.
Ps. Look on my right hand,  see, for there is no man who knows me. Refuge has failed me. No man cares for my soul.
Ps. I cried to thee, O Jehovah. I said, Thou are my refuge, my portion in the land of the living.
Ps. Attend to my cry, for I am brought very low. Deliver me from my persecutors, for they are stronger than I.
Ps. Bring my soul out of prison that I may give thanks to thy name. The righteous shall encompass me around, for thou will deal bountifully with me.
Ps. Hear my prayer, O Jehovah. Give ear to my supplications. In thy faithfulness answer me,  in thy righteousness.
Ps. And enter not into judgment with thy servant. For in thy sight no man living is righteous.
Ps. For the enemy has persecuted my soul. He has smitten my life down to the ground. He has made me to dwell in dark places as those who have been long dead.
Ps. Therefore my spirit is overwhelmed within me. My heart within me is desolate.
Ps. I remember the days of old. I meditate on all thy doings. I muse on the work of thy hands.
Ps. I spread forth my hands to thee. My soul is as a weary land for thee. Selah.
Ps. Make haste to answer me, O Jehovah, my spirit fails. Hide not thy face from me, lest I become like those who go down into the pit.
Ps. Cause me to hear thy loving kindness in the morning, for in thee do I trust. Cause me to know the way in which I should walk, for I lift up my soul to thee.
Ps. Deliver me, O Jehovah, from my enemies. I flee to thee to hide me.
Ps. Teach me to do thy will, for thou are my God. Thy Spirit is good, lead me in the land of uprightness.
Ps. Revive me, O Jehovah, for thy name's sake. In thy righteousness bring my soul out of trouble.
Ps. And in thy loving kindness cut off my enemies,  destroy all those who afflict my soul, for I am thy servant.
Ps. Blessed be Jehovah, my rock, who teaches my hands to war,  my fingers to fight,
Ps. my loving kindness,  my fortress, my high tower,  my deliverer, my shield,  he in whom I take refuge, who subdues my people under me.
Ps. Jehovah, what is man, that thou take knowledge of him? Or the son of man, that thou make account of him?
Ps. Man is like vanity. His days are as a shadow that passes away.
Ps. Bow thy heavens, O Jehovah,  come down. Touch the mountains,  they shall smoke.
Ps. Cast forth lightning,  scatter them. Send out thine arrows,  discomfit them.
Ps. Stretch forth thy hand from above. Rescue me,  deliver me out of great waters, out of the hand of aliens,
Ps. whose mouth speaks deceit,  whose right hand is a right hand of falsehood.
Ps. I will sing a new song to thee, O God. Upon a psaltery of ten strings I will sing praises to thee.
Ps. Thou are he who gives salvation to kings, who rescues David his servant from the hurtful sword.
Ps. Rescue me,  deliver me out of the hand of aliens, whose mouth speaks deceit,  whose right hand is a right hand of falsehood.
Ps. That our sons shall be as plants grown up in their youth,  our daughters as cornerstones hewn according to the fashion of a palace,
Ps. our garners are full, affording all manner of store, our sheep bring forth thousands and ten thousands in our fields,
Ps. our oxen are well laden, no breaking in,  no going forth,  no outcry in our streets,
Ps. blessed are the people who are in such a case. Blessed are the people whose God is Jehovah.
Ps. I will extol thee, my God, O King,  I will bless thy name forever and ever.
Ps. Every day I will bless thee,  I will praise thy name forever and ever.
Ps. Great is Jehovah,  greatly to be praised,  his greatness is unsearchable.
Ps. One generation shall laud thy works to another,  shall declare thy mighty acts.
Ps. I will meditate on the glorious majesty of thine honor,  of thy wondrous works.
Ps. And men shall speak of the might of thy fearful acts,  I will declare thy greatness.
Ps. They shall utter the memory of thy great goodness,  shall sing of thy righteousness.
Ps. Jehovah is gracious,  merciful, slow to anger,  of great loving kindness.
Ps. Jehovah is good to all,  his tender mercies are over all his works.
Ps. All thy works shall give thanks to thee, O Jehovah,  thy sanctified shall bless thee.
Ps. They shall speak of the glory of thy kingdom,  talk of thy power,
Ps. to make known to the sons of men his mighty acts,  the glory of the majesty of his kingdom.
Ps. Thy kingdom is an everlasting kingdom,  thy dominion is throughout all generations.
Ps. Jehovah upholds all who fall,  raises up all those who are bowed down.
Ps. The eyes of all wait for thee,  thou give them their food in due season.
Ps. Thou open thy hand,  satisfy the desire of every living thing.
Ps. Jehovah is righteous in all his ways,  gracious in all his works.
Ps. Jehovah is near to all those who call upon him, to all who call upon him in truth.
Ps. He will fulfill the desire of those who fear him. He also will hear their cry and will save them.
Ps. Jehovah preserves all those who love him,  he will destroy all the wicked.
Ps. My mouth shall speak the praise of Jehovah. And let all flesh bless his holy name forever and ever.
Ps. Praise ye Jehovah. Praise Jehovah, O my soul.
Ps. While I live I will praise Jehovah. I will sing praises to my God while I have any being.
Ps. Put not your trust in rulers, nor in the son of man, in whom there is no help.
Ps. His breath goes forth, he returns to his earth. In that very day his thoughts perish.
Ps. Happy is he who has the God of Jacob for his help, whose hope is in Jehovah his God,
Ps. who made heaven and earth, the sea,  all that is in them, who keeps truth forever,
Ps. who executes justice for the oppressed, who gives food to the hungry. Jehovah releases the prisoners.
Ps. Jehovah opens the eyes of the blind. Jehovah raises up those who are bowed down. Jehovah loves the righteous.
Ps. Jehovah preserves the sojourners. He upholds the fatherless and widow. But the way of the wicked he turns upside down.
Ps. Jehovah will reign forever, thy God, O Zion, to all generations. Praise ye Jehovah.
Ps. Praise ye Jehovah, for it is good to sing praises to our God. For it is pleasant,  praise is comely.
Ps. Jehovah builds up Jerusalem. He gathers together the outcasts of Israel.
Ps. He heals the broken in heart,  binds up their wounds.
Ps. He counts the number of the stars. He calls them all by names.
Ps. Great is our Lord,  mighty in power. His understanding is infinite.
Ps. Jehovah upholds the meek. He brings the wicked down to the ground.
Ps. Sing to Jehovah with thanksgiving. Sing praises upon the harp to our God,
Ps. who covers the heavens with clouds, who prepares rain for the earth, who makes grass to grow upon the mountains.
Ps. He gives to the beast his food,  to the young ravens which cry.
Ps. He does not delight in the strength of the horse. He takes no pleasure in the legs of a man.
Ps. Jehovah takes pleasure in those who fear him, in those who hope in his loving kindness.
Ps. Praise Jehovah, O Jerusalem. Praise thy God, O Zion.
Ps. For he has strengthened the bars of thy gates. He has blessed thy sons within thee.
Ps. He makes peace in thy borders. He fills thee with the finest of the wheat.
Ps. He sends out his commandment upon earth. His word runs very swiftly.
Ps. He gives snow like wool. He scatters the hoar-frost like ashes.
Ps. He casts forth his ice like morsels. Who can stand before his cold?
Ps. He sends out his word,  melts them. He causes his wind to blow,  the waters flow.
Ps. He shows his word to Jacob, his statutes and his ordinances to Israel.
Ps. He has not dealt so with any nation. And as for his ordinances, they have not known them. Praise ye Jehovah.
Ps. Praise ye Jehovah. Praise ye Jehovah from the heavens. Praise him in the heights.
Ps. Praise ye him, all his agents. Praise ye him, all his host.
Ps. Praise ye him, sun and moon. Praise him, all ye stars of light.
Ps. Praise him, ye heavens of heavens,  ye waters that are above the heavens.
Ps. Let them praise the name of Jehovah. For he commanded,  they were created.
Ps. He has also established them forever and ever. He has made a decree which shall not pass away.
Ps. Praise Jehovah from the earth, ye sea-monsters,  all deeps,
Ps. fire and hail, snow and vapor, stormy wind, fulfilling his word,
Ps. mountains and all hills, fruitful trees and all cedars,
Ps. beasts and all cattle, creeping things and flying birds,
Ps. kings of the earth and all peoples, rulers and all judges of the earth,
Ps. both young men and virgins, old men and sons.
Ps. Let them praise the name of Jehovah, for his name alone is exalted. His glory is above the earth and the heavens.
Ps. And he has lifted up the horn of his people, the praise of all his sanctified, even of the sons of Israel, a people near to him. Praise ye Jehovah.
Ps. Praise ye Jehovah. Sing to Jehovah a new song,  his praise in the assembly of the sanctified.
Ps. Let Israel rejoice in him who made him. Let the sons of Zion be joyful in their King.
Ps. Let them praise his name in the dance. Let them sing praises to him with timbrel and harp.
Ps. For Jehovah takes pleasure in his people. He will beautify the meek with salvation.
Ps. Let the sanctified exult in glory. Let them sing for joy upon their beds.
Ps. The high praises of God are in their mouth,  a two-edged sword in their hand
Ps. to execute vengeance upon the nations,  punishments upon the peoples,
Ps. to bind their kings with chains,  their ranking men with fetters of iron,
Ps. to execute upon them the judgment written. All his sanctified have this honor. Praise ye Jehovah.
Ps. Praise ye Jehovah. Praise God in his sanctuary. Praise him in the firmament of his power.
Ps. Praise him for his mighty acts. Praise him according to his excellent greatness.
Ps. Praise him with trumpet sound. Praise him with psaltery and harp.
Ps. Praise him with timbrel and dance. Praise him with stringed instruments and pipe.
Ps. Praise him with loud cymbals. Praise him with high sounding cymbals.
Ps. Let everything that has breath praise Jehovah. Praise ye Jehovah.
Proverbs
Prov. The proverbs of Solomon the son of David, king of Israel,
Prov. to know wisdom and instruction, to discern the words of understanding,
Prov. to receive instruction in wise dealing, in righteousness and justice and equity,
Prov. to give prudence to the simple, to the young man knowledge and discretion,
Prov. that the wise man may hear,  increase in learning,  that the man of understanding may attain to sound counsels,
Prov. to understand a proverb,  a figure, the words of the wise,  their dark sayings.
Prov. The fear of Jehovah is the beginning of knowledge. The foolish despise wisdom and instruction.
Prov. My son, hear the instruction of thy father,  forsake not the law of thy mother.
Prov. For they shall be a garland of grace to thy head,  chains about thy neck.
Prov. My son, if sinners entice thee, consent thou not.
Prov. If they say, Come with us. Let us lay wait for blood. Let us lurk secretly for the innocent without cause.
Prov. Let us swallow them up alive as Sheol,  whole, as those who go down into the pit.
Prov. We shall find all precious substance. We shall fill our houses with spoil.
Prov. Thou shall cast thy lot among us. We will all have one bag.
Prov. My son, walk not thou in the way with them. Restrain thy foot from their path.
Prov. For their feet run to evil,  they make haste to shed blood.
Prov. For in vain is the net spread in the sight of any bird,
Prov. and these lay wait for their own blood. They lurk secretly for their own lives.
Prov. So are the ways of everyone who is greedy of gain. It takes away the life of the owners of it.
Prov. Wisdom cries aloud in the street. She utters her voice in the broad places.
Prov. She cries in the chief place of concourse, at the entrance of the gates, in the city. She utters her words:
Prov. How long, ye simple ones, will ye love simplicity? And scoffers delight them in scoffing,  fools hate knowledge?
Prov. Turn back at my reproof. Behold, I will pour out my spirit upon you. I will make my words known to you.
Prov. Because I have called,  ye have refused, I have stretched out my hand,  no man has regarded,
Prov. but ye have made all my counsel void,  want none of my reproof,
Prov. I also will laugh at your calamity. I will mock when your fear comes,
Prov. when your fear comes as a storm,  your calamity comes on as a whirlwind, when distress and anguish come upon you.
Prov. Then they will call upon me,  I will not answer. They will seek me diligently,  they shall not find me,
Prov. because they hated knowledge,  did not choose the fear of Jehovah.
Prov. They wanted none of my counsel. They despised all my reproof.
Prov. Therefore they shall eat of the fruit of their own way,  be filled with their own devices.
Prov. For the backsliding of the simple shall kill them,  the careless ease of fools shall destroy them.
Prov. But he who hearkens to me shall dwell securely,  shall be quiet without fear of evil.
Prov. My son, if thou will receive my words,  lay up my commandments with thee,
Prov. so as to incline thine ear to wisdom,  apply thy heart to understanding,
Prov. yea, if thou cry after discernment,  lift up thy voice for understanding,
Prov. if thou seek her as silver,  search for her as for hidden treasures,
Prov. then thou shall understand the fear of Jehovah,  find the knowledge of God.
Prov. For Jehovah gives wisdom. Out of his mouth is knowledge and understanding.
Prov. He lays up sound wisdom for the upright, a shield to those who walk in integrity,
Prov. that he may guard the paths of justice,  preserve the way of his sanctified.
Prov. Then thou shall understand righteousness and justice and equity, yea, every good path.
Prov. For wisdom shall enter into thy heart,  knowledge shall be pleasant to thy soul,
Prov. discretion shall watch over thee, understanding shall keep thee,
Prov. to deliver thee from the way of evil, from the men who speak perverse things,
Prov. who forsake the paths of uprightness to walk in the ways of darkness,
Prov. who rejoice to do evil,  delight in the perverseness of evil,
Prov. who are crooked in their ways,  wayward in their paths,
Prov. to deliver thee from the interloping woman, even from the stranger who flatters with her words,
Prov. who forsakes the companion of her youth,  forgets the covenant of her God
Prov. (for her house inclines to death,  her paths to the dead;
Prov. none who go to her return again, nor do they attain to the paths of life),
Prov. that thou may walk in the way of good men,  keep the paths of the righteous.
Prov. For the upright shall dwell in the land,  the perfect shall remain in it.
Prov. But the wicked shall be cut off from the land,  the treacherous shall be rooted out of it.
Prov. My son, do not forget my law,  let thy heart keep my commandments.
Prov. For length of days,  years of life,  peace, they will add to thee.
Prov. Let not kindness and truth forsake thee. Bind them about thy neck, write them upon the tablet of thy heart,
Prov. so thou shall find favor and good understanding in the sight of God and man.
Prov. Trust in Jehovah with all thy heart,  lean not upon thine own understanding.
Prov. In all thy ways acknowledge him,  he will direct thy paths.
Prov. Be not wise in thine own eyes. Fear Jehovah,  depart from evil.
Prov. It will be health to thy navel,  marrow to thy bones.
Prov. Honor Jehovah with thy substance,  with the first-fruits of all thine increase,
Prov. so thy barns shall be filled with plenty,  thy vats shall overflow with new wine.
Prov. My son, despise not the chastening of Jehovah, nor be weary of his reproof.
Prov. For whom Jehovah loves he reproves,  he whips every son whom he receives.
Prov. Happy is the man who finds wisdom,  the man who gets understanding.
Prov. For the gain of it is better than the gain of silver,  the profit of it than fine gold.
Prov. She is more precious than rubies,  none of the things thou can desire are to be compared to her.
Prov. Length of days is in her right hand, in her left hand are riches and honor.
Prov. Her ways are ways of pleasantness,  all her paths are peace.
Prov. She is a tree of life to those who lay hold upon her. And happy is everyone who retains her.
Prov. Jehovah by wisdom founded the earth. By understanding he established the heavens.
Prov. By his knowledge the depths were broken up,  the skies drop down the dew.
Prov. My son, let them not depart from thine eyes. Keep sound wisdom and discretion,
Prov. so they shall be life to thy soul,  grace to thy neck.
Prov. Then thou shall walk in thy way securely,  thy foot shall not stumble.
Prov. When thou lie down, thou shall not be afraid. Yea, thou shall lie down,  thy sleep shall be sweet.
Prov. Be not afraid of sudden fear, nor of the desolation of the wicked, when it comes.
Prov. For Jehovah will be thy confidence,  will keep thy foot from being taken.
Prov. Do not withhold good from those to whom it is due, when it is in the power of thy hand to do it.
Prov. Do not say to thy neighbor, Go,  come again,  tomorrow I will give, when thou have it by thee.
Prov. Do not devise evil against thy neighbor, since he dwells securely by thee.
Prov. Do not strive with a man without cause, if he has done thee no harm.
Prov. Do not envy thou the man of violence,  choose none of his ways.
Prov. For the perverse man is an abomination to Jehovah,  his friendship is with the upright.
Prov. The curse of Jehovah is in the house of a wicked man,  he blesses the habitation of the righteous.
Prov. Surely the Lord is opposed to the arrogant,  he gives grace to the lowly.
Prov. The wise shall inherit glory,  shame shall be the promotion of fools.
Prov. Hear, ye sons, the instruction of a father,  attend to know understanding.
Prov. For I give you good doctrine. Forsake ye not my law.
Prov. For I was a son to my father, tender and only beloved in the sight of my mother.
Prov. And he taught me,  said to me, Let thy heart retain my words. Keep my commandments,  live.
Prov. Get wisdom, get understanding. Do not forget, nor decline from the words of my mouth.
Prov. Do not forsake her,  she will preserve thee. Love her,  she will keep thee.
Prov. Wisdom is the principal thing. Get wisdom, yea, with all thy getting get understanding.
Prov. Exalt her,  she will promote thee. She will bring thee to honor when thou embrace her.
Prov. She will give to thy head a garland of grace, a crown of beauty she will deliver to thee.
Prov. Hear, O my son,  receive my sayings,  the years of thy life shall be many.
Prov. I have taught thee in the way of wisdom. I have led thee in paths of uprightness.
Prov. When thou go, thy steps shall not be restricted. And if thou run, thou shall not stumble.
Prov. Take firm hold of instruction. Do not let her go. Keep her, for she is thy life.
Prov. Enter not into the path of the wicked,  walk not in the way of evil men.
Prov. Avoid it. Do not pass by it. Turn from it,  pass on.
Prov. For they do not sleep unless they do evil. And their sleep is taken away unless they cause to fall.
Prov. For they eat the bread of wickedness,  drink the wine of violence.
Prov. But the path of the righteous is as the dawning light, that shines more and more to the perfect day.
Prov. The way of the wicked is as darkness. They know not at what they stumble.
Prov. My son, attend to my words. Incline thine ear to my sayings.
Prov. Let them not depart from thine eyes. Keep them in the midst of thy heart.
Prov. For they are life to those who find them,  health to all their flesh.
Prov. Keep thy heart with all diligence, for out of it are the issues of life.
Prov. Put away from thee a wayward mouth,  put perverse lips far from thee.
Prov. Let thine eyes look right on,  let thine eyelids look straight before thee.
Prov. Make the path of thy feet level,  let all thy ways be established.
Prov. Turn not to the right hand nor to the left. Remove thy foot from evil.
Prov. My son, attend to my wisdom. Incline thine ear to my understanding,
Prov. that thou may preserve discretion,  that thy lips may keep knowledge.
Prov. For the lips of an interloping woman drop honey,  her mouth is smoother than oil.
Prov. But in the end she is bitter as wormwood, sharp as a two-edged sword.
Prov. Her feet go down to death. Her steps take hold on Sheol,
Prov. so that she does not find the level path of life. Her ways are unstable,  she does not know.
Prov. Now therefore, ye sons, hearken to me,  do not depart from the words of my mouth.
Prov. Remove thy way far from her,  do not come near the door of her house,
Prov. lest thou give thine honor to others,  thy years to the cruel,
Prov. lest strangers be filled with thy strength,  thy labors be in the house of an alien,
Prov. and thou mourn at thy latter end when thy flesh and thy body are consumed,
Prov. and say, How I have hated instruction,  my heart despised reproof.
Prov. Neither have I obeyed the voice of my teachers, nor inclined my ear to those who instructed me!
Prov. I was almost in all evil in the midst of the assembly and congregation.
Prov. Drink waters out of thine own cistern,  running waters out of thine own well.
Prov. Should thy springs be dispersed abroad,  streams of water in the streets?
Prov. Let them be for thyself alone,  not for strangers with thee.
Prov. Let thy fountain be blessed,  rejoice in the wife of thy youth:
Prov. a loving hind and a pleasant doe. Let her breasts satisfy thee at all times,  be thou ravished always with her love.
Prov. For why should thou, my son, be ravished with an interloping woman,  embrace the bosom of a stranger?
Prov. For the ways of man are before the eyes of Jehovah,  he makes level all his paths.
Prov. His own iniquities shall take a wicked man,  he shall be held with the cords of his sin.
Prov. He shall die for lack of instruction. And in the greatness of his folly he shall go astray.
Prov. My son, if thou have become surety for thy neighbor, if thou have struck thy hands for a stranger,
Prov. thou are snared with the words of thy mouth, thou are taken with the words of thy mouth.
Prov. Do this now, my son,  deliver thyself, since thou have come into the hand of thy neighbor. Go, humble thyself,  importune thy neighbor.
Prov. Do not give sleep to thine eyes, nor slumber to thine eyelids.
Prov. Deliver thyself as a roe from the hand,  as a bird from the hand of the fowler.
Prov. Go to the ant, thou sluggard. Consider her ways,  be wise.
Prov. Which, having no chief, overseer, or ruler,
Prov. provides her bread in the summer,  gathers her food in the harvest.
Prov. How long will thou sleep, O sluggard? When will thou arise out of thy sleep?
Prov. A little sleep, a little slumber, a little folding of the hands to sleep,
Prov. so thy poverty shall come as a robber,  thy want as an armed man.
Prov. A worthless person, a man of iniquity, is he who walks with a perverse mouth,
Prov. who winks with his eyes, who speaks with his feet, who makes signs with his fingers,
Prov. in whose heart is perverseness, who devises evil continually, who sows discord.
Prov. Therefore his calamity shall come suddenly. Suddenly he shall be broken,  that without remedy.
Prov. There are six things which Jehovah hates, yea, seven which are an abomination to him:
Prov. haughty eyes, a lying tongue,  hands that shed innocent blood,
Prov. a heart that devises wicked purposes, feet that are swift in running to mischief,
Prov. a false witness who utters lies,  he who sows discord among brothers.
Prov. My son, keep the commandment of thy father,  do not forsake the law of thy mother.
Prov. Bind them continually upon thy heart. Tie them about thy neck.
Prov. When thou walk, it shall lead thee. When thou sleep, it shall watch over thee. And when thou awake, it shall talk with thee.
Prov. For the commandment is a lamp,  the law is light,  reproofs of instruction are the way of life,
Prov. to keep thee from the evil woman, from the flattery of the stranger's tongue.
Prov. Do not lust after her beauty in thy heart, nor let her take thee with her eyelids.
Prov. For the price of a harlot is as much as a piece of bread,  the adulteress hunts for the precious life.
Prov. Can a man take fire in his bosom,  his clothes not be burned?
Prov. Or can a man walk upon hot coals,  his feet not be scorched?
Prov. So is he who goes in to his neighbor's wife. Whoever touches her shall not be unpunished.
Prov. Men do not despise a thief, if he steals to satisfy himself when he is hungry.
Prov. Yet if he is found, he shall restore sevenfold. He shall give all the substance of his house.
Prov. He who commits adultery with a woman is void of understanding. He who would destroy his own soul does it.
Prov. Wounds and dishonor he shall get,  his reproach shall not be wiped away.
Prov. For jealousy is a man's fury,  he will not spare in the day of vengeance.
Prov. He will not regard any ransom, nor will he be satisfied, though thou give many gifts.
Prov. My son, keep my words,  lay up my commandments with thee.
Prov. Keep my commandments and live,  my law as the apple of thine eye.
Prov. Bind them upon thy fingers. Write them upon the tablet of thy heart.
Prov. Say to wisdom, Thou are my sister,  call understanding thy kinswoman,
Prov. that they may keep thee from the interloping woman, from the stranger who flatters with her words.
Prov. For at the window of my house I looked forth through my lattice,
Prov. and I beheld among the simple ones, I discerned among the youths, a young man void of understanding
Prov. passing through the street near her corner. And he went the way to her house,
Prov. in the twilight, in the evening of the day, in the middle of the night and in the darkness.
Prov. And, behold, there met him a woman attired like a harlot,  wily of heart.
Prov. She is loud and headstrong. Her feet abide not in her house.
Prov. Now she is in the streets, now in the broad places,  lies in wait at every corner.
Prov. So she caught him,  kissed him. With an impudent face she said to him,
Prov. Sacrifices of peace offerings are with me. I have paid my vows this day.
Prov. Therefore I came forth to meet thee, diligently to seek thy face,  I have found thee.
Prov. I have spread my couch with carpets of tapestry, with striped cloths of the yarn of Egypt.
Prov. I have perfumed my bed With myrrh, aloes,  cinnamon.
Prov. Come, let us take our fill of love until the morning. Let us solace ourselves with love.
Prov. For the man is not at home. He has gone a long journey.
Prov. He has taken a bag of money with him. He will come home at the full moon.
Prov. With her much fair speech she causes him to yield. With the flattering of her lips she forces him along.
Prov. He goes after her straightaway, as an ox goes to the slaughter, or as a fool to the correction of the stocks,
Prov. till an arrow strikes through his liver, as a bird hastens to the snare. And he does not know that it is for his life.
Prov. Now therefore, ye sons, hearken to me,  attend to the words of my mouth.
Prov. Let not thy heart decline to her ways. Go not astray in her paths.
Prov. For she has cast down many wounded. Yea, all her slain are a mighty host.
Prov. Her house is the way to Sheol, going down to the chambers of death.
Prov. Does not wisdom cry out,  understanding put forth her voice?
Prov. On the top of high places by the way, where the paths meet, she stands.
Prov. Beside the gates, at the entry of the city, at the coming in at the doors, she cries aloud:
Prov. To you, O men, I call. And my voice is to the sons of men.
Prov. O ye simple, understand prudence, , ye fools, be of an understanding heart.
Prov. Hear, for I will speak excellent things. And the opening of my lips shall be right things.
Prov. For my mouth shall utter truth. And wickedness is an abomination to my lips.
Prov. All the words of my mouth are in righteousness. There is nothing crooked or perverse in them.
Prov. They are all plain to him who understands,  right to those who find knowledge.
Prov. Receive my instruction,  not silver,  knowledge rather than choice gold.
Prov. For wisdom is better than rubies,  all the things that may be desired are not to be compared to it.
Prov. I, wisdom, have made prudence my dwelling,  find out knowledge and discretion.
Prov. The fear of Jehovah is to hate evil. Pride,  arrogance,  the evil way,  the perverse mouth, do I hate.
Prov. Counsel is mine,  sound knowledge. I am understanding, I have might.
Prov. By me kings reign,  rulers decree justice.
Prov. By me rulers rule,  ranking men, even all the judges of the earth.
Prov. I love those who love me,  those who seek me diligently shall find me.
Prov. Riches and honor are with me, durable wealth and righteousness.
Prov. My fruit is better than gold, yea, than fine gold,  my revenue than choice silver.
Prov. I walk in the way of righteousness, in the midst of the paths of justice,
Prov. that I may cause those who love me to inherit substance,  that I may fill their treasuries.
Prov. Jehovah possessed me in the beginning of his way, before his works of old.
Prov. I was set up from everlasting, from the beginning, before the earth was,
Prov. when there were no depths. I was brought forth when there were no fountains abounding with water,
Prov. before the mountains were settled, before the hills. I was brought forth
Prov. while as yet he had not made the earth, nor the fields, nor the beginning of the dust of the world.
Prov. When he established the heavens, I was there. When he set a circle upon the face of the deep,
Prov. when he made firm the skies above, when the fountains of the deep became strong,
Prov. when he gave to the sea its bound that the waters should not transgress his commandment, when he marked out the foundations of the earth,
Prov. then I was by him, a master workman. And I was daily his delight, rejoicing always before him,
Prov. rejoicing in his habitable earth. And my delight was with the sons of men.
Prov. Now therefore, ye sons, hearken to me. For blessed are those who keep my ways.
Prov. Hear instruction,  be wise,  do not refuse it.
Prov. Blessed is the man who hears me, watching daily at my gates, waiting at the posts of my doors.
Prov. For he who finds me finds life,  shall obtain favor of Jehovah.
Prov. But he who sins against me wrongs his own soul. All those who hate me love death.
Prov. Wisdom has built her house. She has hewn out her seven pillars.
