Of Edom. Thus says Jehovah of hosts: Is wisdom no more in Teman? Has counsel perished from the prudent? Has their wisdom vanished?
Flee ye, turn back, dwell in the depths, O inhabitants of Dedan. For I will bring the calamity of Esau upon him, the time that I shall visit him.
If grape-gatherers came to thee, would they not leave some gleaning grapes? If thieves by night, would they not destroy till they had enough?
But I have made Esau bare. I have uncovered his secret places,  he shall not be able to hide himself. His seed is destroyed,  his brothers,  his neighbors,  he is not.
Leave thy fatherless sons; I will preserve them alive. And let thy widows trust in me.
For thus says Jehovah: Behold, those to whom it did not pertain to drink of the cup shall assuredly drink. And are thou he who shall go altogether unpunished? Thou shall not go unpunished,  thou shall surely drink.
For I have sworn by myself, says Jehovah, that Bozrah shall become an astonishment, a reproach, a waste,  a curse,  all the cities thereof shall be perpetual wastes.
I have heard news from Jehovah. And an ambassador is sent among the nations, saying, Gather yourselves together,  come against her,  rise up to the battle.
For, behold, I have made thee small among the nations,  despised among men.
As for thy formidableness, the pride of thy heart has deceived thee, O thou who dwells in the clefts of the rock, who holds the height of the hill. Though thou should make thy nest as high as the eagle, I will bring thee down from there, says Jehovah.
Edom shall become an astonishment. Everyone who passes by it shall be astonished,  shall hiss at all the plagues of it.
As in the overthrow of Sodom and Gomorrah and the neighbor cities thereof, says Jehovah, no man shall dwell there, nor shall any son of man sojourn in it.
Behold, he shall come up like a lion from the pride of the Jordan against the strong habitation. For I will suddenly make them run away from it. And he who is chosen, him I will appoint over it. For who is like me,  who will appoint a time for me,  who is the shepherd who will stand before me?
Therefore hear ye the counsel of Jehovah that he has taken against Edom,  his purposes, that he has purposed against the inhabitants of Teman: Surely they shall drag them away, even the little ones of the flock. Surely he shall make their habitation desolate over them.
The earth trembles at the noise of their fall. There is a cry; the noise of it is heard in the Red Sea.
Behold, he shall come up and fly as the eagle,  spread out his wings against Bozrah. And the heart of the mighty men of Edom at that day shall be as the heart of a woman in her pangs.
Of Damascus. Hamath is confounded,  Arpad, for they have heard evil news. They are melted away. There is sorrow on the sea; it cannot be quiet.
Damascus has grown feeble. She turns herself to flee,  trembling has seized on her. Anguish and sorrows have taken hold of her, as of a woman in travail.
How is the city of praise not forsaken, the city of my joy?
Therefore her young men shall fall in her streets,  all the men of war shall be brought to silence in that day, says Jehovah of hosts.
I will kindle a fire in the wall of Damascus,  it shall devour the palaces of Ben-hadad.
Of Kedar,  of the kingdoms of Hazor, which Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon smote. Thus says Jehovah: Arise ye. Go up to Kedar,  destroy the sons of the east.
They shall take their tents and their flocks. They shall carry away for themselves their curtains,  all their vessels,  their camels. And they shall cry to them, Terror on every side!
Flee ye. Wander far off. Dwell in the depths, O ye inhabitants of Hazor, says Jehovah. For Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon has taken counsel against you,  has conceived a purpose against you.
Arise, get you up to a nation that is at ease, that dwells without worry, says Jehovah, that has neither gates nor bars, that dwells alone.
their camels shall be a booty,  the multitude of their cattle a spoil. And I will scatter to all winds those who have the corners of their hair cut off. And I will bring their calamity from every side of them, says Jehovah.
Hazor shall be a dwelling-place of jackals, a desolation forever. No man shall dwell there, nor shall any son of man sojourn therein.
The word of Jehovah that came to Jeremiah the prophet concerning Elam, in the beginning of the reign of Zedekiah king of Judah, saying,
Thus says Jehovah of hosts: Behold, I will break the bow of Elam, the chief of their might.
upon Elam I will bring the four winds from the four quarters of heaven,  will scatter them toward all those winds. And there shall be no nation where the outcasts of Elam shall not come.
I will cause Elam to be dismayed before their enemies,  before those who seek their life. And I will bring evil upon them, even my fierce anger, says Jehovah. And I will send the sword after them, till I have consumed them.
I will set my throne in Elam,  will destroy from there king and rulers, says Jehovah.
But it shall come to pass in the latter days, that I will bring back the captivity of Elam, says Jehovah.
The word that Jehovah spoke concerning Babylon, concerning the land of the Chaldeans, by Jeremiah the prophet.
Declare ye among the nations and publish,  set up a standard, publish,  conceal not. Say, Babylon is taken. Bel is put to shame. Merodach is dismayed. Her images are put to shame; her idols are dismayed.
For out of the north there comes up a nation against her, which shall make her land desolate,  none shall dwell therein. They are fled. They are gone, both man and beast.
In those days,  in that time, says Jehovah, the sons of Israel shall come, they and the sons of Judah together. They shall go on their way weeping,  shall seek Jehovah their God.
They shall inquire concerning Zion with their faces toward it, saying, Come ye,  join yourselves to Jehovah in an everlasting covenant that shall not be forgotten.
My people have been lost sheep. Their shepherds have caused them to go astray. They have turned them away on the mountains. They have gone from mountain to hill. They have forgotten their resting-place.
All who found them have devoured them,  their adversaries said, We are not guilty, because they have sinned against Jehovah, the habitation of righteousness, even Jehovah, the hope of their fathers.
Flee out of the midst of Babylon,  go forth out of the land of the Chaldeans,  be as the he-goats before the flocks.
For, lo, I will stir up and cause to come up against Babylon a company of great nations from the north country,  they shall set themselves in array against her. From there she shall be taken. Their arrows shall be as of an expert mighty man; none shall return in vain.
Chaldea shall be a prey. All who prey upon her shall be satisfied, says Jehovah.
Because ye are glad, because ye rejoice, O ye who plunder my heritage, because ye are wanton as a heifer that treads out the grain,  neigh as strong horses,
your mother shall be utterly put to shame. She who bore you shall be confounded. Behold, she shall be the hindermost of the nations, a wilderness, a dry land,  a desert.
Because of the wrath of Jehovah she shall not be inhabited,  she shall be wholly desolate. Everyone who goes by Babylon shall be astonished,  hiss at all her plagues.
Set yourselves in array against Babylon round about, all ye who bend the bow. Shoot at her; spare no arrows. For she has sinned against Jehovah.
Shout against her round about. She has submitted herself. Her bulwarks are fallen. Her walls are thrown down. For it is the vengeance of Jehovah. Take vengeance upon her. As she has done, do to her.
Cut off the sower from Babylon,  him who handles the sickle in the time of harvest. For fear of the oppressing sword they shall turn each one to his people,  they shall flee each one to his own land.
Israel is a hunted sheep, the lions have driven him away. First, the king of Assyria devoured him,  now at last Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon has broken his bones.
Therefore thus says Jehovah of hosts, the God of Israel: Behold, I will punish the king of Babylon and his land, as I have punished the king of Assyria.
I will bring Israel again to his pasture,  he shall feed on Carmel and Bashan,  his soul shall be satisfied upon the hills of Ephraim and in Gilead.
In those days,  in that time, says Jehovah, the iniquity of Israel shall be sought for,  there shall be none,  the sins of Judah,  they shall not be found. For I will pardon those whom I leave as a remnant.
Go up against the land of Merathaim, even against it,  against the inhabitants of Pekod. Kill and utterly destroy after them, says Jehovah,  do according to all that I have commanded thee.
A sound of battle is in the land,  of great destruction.
How the hammer of the whole earth is cut apart and broken! How Babylon has become a desolation among the nations!
I have laid a snare for thee,  thou are also taken, O Babylon,  thou were not aware. Thou are found,  also caught, because thou have striven against Jehovah.
Jehovah has opened his armory,  has brought forth the weapons of his indignation, for the Lord, Jehovah of hosts, has a work in the land of the Chaldeans.
Come against her from the utmost border. Open her store-houses. Cast her up as heaps,  destroy her utterly; let nothing of her be left.
Kill all her bullocks. Let them go down to the slaughter. Woe to them! For their day has come, the time of their visitation.
The voice of those who flee and escape out of the land of Babylon, to declare in Zion the vengeance of Jehovah our God, the vengeance of his temple.
Call together the archers against Babylon, all those who bend the bow. Encamp against her round about; let none thereof escape. Recompense her according to her work. According to all that she has done, do to her. For she has been proud against Jehovah, against the Holy One of Israel.
Therefore her young men shall fall in her streets,  all her men of war shall be brought to silence in that day, says Jehovah.
Behold, I am against thee, O thou proud one, says the Lord, Jehovah of hosts, for thy day has come, the time that I will visit thee.
the proud one shall stumble and fall,  none shall raise him up. And I will kindle a fire in his cities,  it shall devour all who are round about him.
Thus says Jehovah of hosts: The sons of Israel and the sons of Judah are oppressed together,  all who took them captive hold them firm; they refuse to let them go.
Their Redeemer is strong. Jehovah of hosts is his name. He will thoroughly plead their cause, that he may give rest to the earth,  disquiet the inhabitants of Babylon.
A sword is upon the Chaldeans, says Jehovah,  upon the inhabitants of Babylon,  upon her rulers,  upon her wise men.
A sword is upon the boasters,  they shall become fools. A sword is upon her mighty men,  they shall be dismayed.
A sword is upon their horses,  upon their chariots,  upon all the mixed people who are in the midst of her,  they shall become as women. A sword is upon her treasures,  they shall be robbed.
A drought is upon her waters,  they shall be dried up. For it is a land of graven images,  they are mad over idols.
Therefore the wild beasts of the desert with the wolves shall dwell there,  the ostriches shall dwell therein. And it shall no more be inhabited forever, nor shall it be dwelt in from generation to generation.
As when God overthrew Sodom and Gomorrah and the neighbor cities thereof, says Jehovah, so shall no man dwell there, nor shall any son of man sojourn in it.
Behold, a people comes from the north,  a great nation and many kings shall be stirred up from the outermost parts of the earth.
They lay hold on bow and spear. They are cruel,  have no mercy. Their voice roars like the sea,  they ride upon horses, each one set in array, as a man to the battle, against thee, O daughter of Babylon.
The king of Babylon has heard the news of them,  his hands grow feeble. Anguish has taken hold of him,  pangs as of a woman in travail.
Behold, the enemy shall come up like a lion from the pride of the Jordan against the strong habitation. For I will suddenly make them run away from it,  he who is chosen, him I will appoint over it. For who is like me,  who will appoint a time for me,  who is the shepherd who can stand before me?
Therefore hear ye the counsel of Jehovah, that he has taken against Babylon,  his purposes, that he has purposed against the land of the Chaldeans: Surely they shall drag them away, even the little ones of the flock. Surely he shall make their habitation desolate over them.
At the noise of the taking of Babylon the earth trembles,  the cry is heard among the nations.
Thus says Jehovah: Behold, I will raise up against Babylon,  against those who dwell in Leb-kamai, a destroying wind.
I will send strangers to Babylon, who shall winnow her,  they shall empty her land. For in the day of trouble they shall be against her round about.
Against him who bends let the archer bend his bow,  against him who lifts himself up in his coat of mail. And spare ye not her young men. Destroy ye utterly all her host.
they shall fall down slain in the land of the Chaldeans,  thrust through in her streets.
For Israel is not forsaken, nor Judah, of his God, of Jehovah of hosts, though their land is full of guilt against the Holy One of Israel.
Flee out of the midst of Babylon,  save every man his life. Be not cut off in her iniquity, for it is the time of Jehovah's vengeance; he will render to her a recompense.
Babylon has been a golden cup in Jehovah's hand, that made all the earth drunken. The nations have drunk of her wine, therefore the nations are mad.
Babylon is suddenly fallen and destroyed. Wail for her. Take balm for her pain, if so be she may be healed.
We would have healed Babylon,  she is not healed. Forsake her,  let us go each one into his own country. For her judgment reaches to heaven,  is lifted up even to the skies.
Jehovah has brought forth our righteousness. Come,  let us declare in Zion the work of Jehovah our God.
Make sharp the arrows. Hold firm the shields. Jehovah has stirred up the spirit of the kings of the Medes, because his purpose is against Babylon, to destroy it. For it is the vengeance of Jehovah, the vengeance of his temple.
Set up a standard against the walls of Babylon. Make the watch strong. Set the watchmen. Prepare the ambushes. For Jehovah has both purposed and done that which he spoke concerning the inhabitants of Babylon.
O thou who dwell upon many waters, abundant in treasures, thine end has come, the measure of thy covetousness.
Jehovah of hosts has sworn by himself, saying, Surely I will fill thee with men as with the canker-worm,  they shall lift up a shout against thee.
He has made the earth by his power. He has established the world by his wisdom,  by his understanding he has stretched out the heavens.
When he utters his voice, there is a tumult of waters in the heavens,  he causes the vapors to ascend from the ends of the earth. He makes lightnings for the rain,  brings forth the wind out of his treasuries.
Every man has become brutish, without knowledge. Every goldsmith is put to shame by his image, for his molten image is falsehood,  there is no breath in them.
They are vanity, a work of delusion. In the time of their visitation they shall perish.
The portion of Jacob is not like these, for he is the former of all things,  Israel is the tribe of his inheritance. Jehovah of hosts is his name.
Thou are my battle-axe and weapons of war. And with thee I will break in pieces the nations,  with thee I will destroy kingdoms,
with thee I will break in pieces the horse and his rider,
with thee I will break in pieces the chariot and him who rides in it,  with thee I will break in pieces man and woman,  with thee I will break in pieces the old man and the youth,  with thee I will break in pieces the young man and the virgin,
with thee I will break in pieces the shepherd and his flock,  with thee I will break in pieces the husbandman and his yoke of oxen,  with thee I will break in pieces governors and deputies.
I will render to Babylon and to all the inhabitants of Chaldea all their evil that they have done in Zion in your sight, says Jehovah.
Behold, I am against thee, O destroying mountain, says Jehovah, which destroys all the earth. And I will stretch out my hand upon thee,  roll thee down from the rocks,  will make thee a burnt mountain.
they shall not take from thee a stone for a corner, nor a stone for foundations,  thou shall be desolate forever, says Jehovah.
Set ye up a standard in the land. Blow the trumpet among the nations. Prepare the nations against her. Call together against her the kingdoms of Ararat, Minni,  Ashkenaz. Appoint a marshal against her. Cause the horses to come up as the rough canker-worm.
Prepare against her the nations, the kings of the Medes, the governors of it,  all the deputies of it,  all the land of their dominion.
the land trembles and is in pain, for the purposes of Jehovah against Babylon stand, to make the land of Babylon a desolation, without inhabitant.
The mighty men of Babylon have ceased fighting; they remain in their strongholds. Their might has failed. They have become as women. Her dwelling-places are set on fire. Her bars are broken.
One post shall run to meet another,  one messenger to met another, to show the king of Babylon that his city is taken on every quarter.
the passages are seized,  the reeds they have burned with fire,  the men of war are frightened.
For thus says Jehovah of hosts, the God of Israel: The daughter of Babylon is like a threshing-floor at the time when it is trodden. Yet a little while,  the time of harvest shall come for her.
Nebuchadrezzar the king of Babylon has devoured me. He has crushed me. He has made me an empty vessel. He has, like a monster, swallowed me up. He has filled his stomach with my delicacies. He has cast me out.
The violence done to me and to my flesh be upon Babylon, the inhabitant of Zion shall say. And, My blood be upon the inhabitants of Chaldea, Jerusalem shall say.
Therefore thus says Jehovah: Behold, I will plead thy cause,  take vengeance for thee. And I will dry up her sea,  make her fountain dry.
Babylon shall become heaps, a dwelling-place for jackals, an astonishment,  a hissing, without inhabitant.
They shall roar together like young lions. They shall growl as lions' whelps.
When they are heated, I will make their feast. And I will make them drunken, that they may rejoice,  sleep a perpetual sleep,  not wake, says Jehovah.
I will bring them down like lambs to the slaughter, like rams with he-goats.
How Sheshach is taken,  the praise of the whole earth seized! How Babylon has become a desolation among the nations!
The sea has come up upon Babylon. She is covered with the multitude of the waves thereof.
Her cities have become a desolation, a dry land,  a desert, a land in which no man dwells, nor does any son of man pass thereby.
I will execute judgment upon Bel in Babylon,  I will bring forth out of his mouth that which he has swallowed up. And the nations shall not flow any more to him. Yea, the wall of Babylon shall fall.
My people, go ye out of the midst of her,  save yourselves each man from the fierce anger of Jehovah.
let not your heart faint. Neither fear ye for the news that shall be heard in the land. For news shall come one year,  after that in another year, news,  violence in the land, ruler against ruler.
Therefore, behold, the days come, that I will execute judgment upon the graven images of Babylon. And her whole land shall be confounded,  all her slain shall fall in the midst of her.
Then the heavens and the earth,  all that is therein, shall sing for joy over Babylon. For the destroyers shall come to her from the north, says Jehovah.
As Babylon has caused the slain of Israel to fall, so at Babylon shall fall the slain of all the land.
Ye who have escaped the sword, go ye; do not stand still. Remember Jehovah from afar,  let Jerusalem come into your mind.
We are confounded, because we have heard reproach. Confusion has covered our faces. For strangers have come into the sanctuaries of Jehovah's house.
Therefore, behold, the days come, says Jehovah, that I will execute judgment upon her graven images,  through all her land the wounded shall groan.
Though Babylon should mount up to heaven,  though she should fortify the height of her strength, yet from me destroyers shall come to her, says Jehovah.
The sound of a cry from Babylon,  of great destruction from the land of the Chaldeans!
For Jehovah lays Babylon waste,  destroys the great voice out of her,  their waves roar like many waters; the noise of their voice is uttered.
For the destroyer has come upon her, even upon Babylon,  her mighty men are taken. Their bows are broken in pieces. For Jehovah is a God of recompenses; he will surely requite.
I will make drunk her rulers and her wise men, her governors and her deputies,  her mighty men. And they shall sleep a perpetual sleep,  not wake, says the King, whose name is Jehovah of hosts.
Thus says Jehovah of hosts: The broad walls of Babylon shall be utterly overthrown,  her high gates shall be burned with fire. And the peoples shall labor for vanity,  the nations for the fire,  they shall be weary.
The word which Jeremiah the prophet commanded Seraiah the son of Neriah, the son of Mahseiah, when he went with Zedekiah the king of Judah to Babylon in the fourth year of his reign. Now Seraiah was chief chamberlain.
Jeremiah wrote in a book all the evil that would come upon Babylon, even all these words that are written concerning Babylon.
Jeremiah said to Seraiah, When thou come to Babylon, then see that thou read all these words.
say, O Jehovah, thou have spoken concerning this place, to cut it off, that none shall dwell therein, neither man nor beast,  that it shall be desolate forever.
it shall be, when thou have made an end of reading this book, that thou shall bind a stone to it,  cast it into the midst of the Euphrates.
thou shall say, Thus Babylon shall sink,  shall not rise again because of the evil that I will bring upon her,  they shall be weary. Thus far are the words of Jeremiah.
Zedekiah was twenty-one years old when he began to reign,  he reigned eleven years in Jerusalem. And his mother's name was Hamutal the daughter of Jeremiah of Libnah.
he did that which was evil in the sight of Jehovah, according to all that Jehoiakim had done.
For it came to pass through the anger of Jehovah, in Jerusalem and Judah, until he had cast them out from his presence. And Zedekiah rebelled against the king of Babylon.
it came to pass in the ninth year of his reign, in the tenth month, in the tenth day of the month, that Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon came, he and all his army against Jerusalem,  encamped against it. And they built forts against it round about.
So the city was besieged to the eleventh year of king Zedekiah.
In the fourth month, in the ninth day of the month, the famine was severe in the city, so that there was no bread for the people of the land.
Then a breach was made in the city,  all the men of war fled,  went forth out of the city by night by the way of the gate between the two walls, which was by the king's garden, (now the Chaldeans were against the city round about),  they went toward the Arabah.
But the army of the Chaldeans pursued after the king,  overtook Zedekiah in the plains of Jericho,  all his army was scattered from him.
Then they took the king,  carried him up to the king of Babylon to Riblah in the land of Hamath,  he gave judgment upon him.
the king of Babylon killed the sons of Zedekiah before his eyes. He also killed all the rulers of Judah in Riblah.
he put out the eyes of Zedekiah. And the king of Babylon bound him in fetters,  carried him to Babylon,  put him in prison till the day of his death.
Now in the fifth month, in the tenth day of the month, which was the nineteenth year of king Nebuchadrezzar, king of Babylon, Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard, who stood before the king of Babylon, came into Jerusalem.
he burned the house of Jehovah,  the king's house,  all the houses of Jerusalem. Even every great house, he burned with fire.
all the army of the Chaldeans, who were with the captain of the guard, broke down all the walls of Jerusalem round about.
Then Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard carried away captive of the poorest of the people,  the residue of the people who were left in the city,  those who fell away, who fell to the king of Babylon,  the residue of the multitude.
But Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard left of the poorest of the land to be vinedressers and husbandmen.
the pillars of brass that were in the house of Jehovah,  the bases and the brazen sea that were in the house of Jehovah, the Chaldeans broke in pieces,  carried all the brass of them to Babylon.
The pots also,  the shovels,  the snuffers,  the basins,  the spoons,  all the vessels of brass with which they ministered, they took away.
the cups,  the fire pans,  the basins,  the pots,  the lampstands,  the spoons,  the bowls-that which was of gold, in gold,  that which was of silver, in silver-the captain of the guard took away.
The two pillars, the one sea,  the twelve brazen bulls that were under the bases, which king Solomon had made for the house of Jehovah-the brass of all these vessels was without weight.
as for the pillars, the height of the one pillar was eighteen cubits,  a line of twelve cubits encompassed it,  the thickness of it was four fingers; it was hollow.
a capital of brass was upon it. And the height of the one capital was five cubits, with network and pomegranates upon the capital round about, all of brass. And the second pillar also had like these,  pomegranates.
there were ninety-six pomegranates on the sides. All the pomegranates were a hundred upon the network round about.
the captain of the guard took Seraiah the chief priest,  Zephaniah the second priest,  the three keepers of the threshold.
from the city he took an officer who was set over the men of war,  seven men of those who saw the king's face, who were found in the city,  the scribe of the captain of the army who mustered the people of the land,  sixty men of the people of the land who were found in the midst of the city.
Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard took them,  brought them to the king of Babylon to Riblah.
the king of Babylon smote them,  put them to death at Riblah in the land of Hamath. So Judah was carried away captive out of his land.
This is the people whom Nebuchadrezzar carried away captive: In the seventh year three thousand twenty-three Jews.
In the eighteenth year of Nebuchadrezzar he carried away captive from Jerusalem eight hundred thirty-two persons.
In the twenty-third year of Nebuchadrezzar Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard carried away captive of the Jews seven hundred forty-five persons. All the persons were four thousand six hundred.
it came to pass in the thirty-seventh year of the captivity of Jehoiachin king of Judah, in the twelfth month, in the twenty-fifth day of the month, that Evil-merodach king of Babylon, in the first year of his reign, lifted up the head of Jehoiachin king of Judah,  brought him forth out of prison.
he spoke kindly to him,  set his throne above the throne of the kings who were with him in Babylon,
changed his prison garments. And he ate bread before him continually all the days of his life.
for his allowance, there was a continual allowance given him by the king of Babylon, every day a portion until the day of his death, all the days of his life.
Lamentations
How the city sits solitary, that was full of people! She has become as a widow, who was great among the nations! She who was a princess among the provinces has become tributary!
She weeps bitterly in the night,  her tears are on her cheeks. Among all her loved ones she has none to comfort her. All her friends have dealt treacherously with her, they have become her enemies.
Judah has gone into captivity because of affliction. And because of great servitude she dwells among the nations. She finds no rest. All her persecutors overtook her in the distress.
The ways of Zion mourn, because none come to the solemn assembly. All her gates are desolate. Her priests sigh. Her virgins are afflicted,  she herself is in bitterness.
Her adversaries have become the head. Her enemies prosper. For Jehovah has afflicted her for the multitude of her transgressions. Her young sons have gone into captivity before the adversary.
from the daughter of Zion all her majesty is departed. Her rulers have become like harts that find no pasture. And they have gone without strength before the pursuer.
Jerusalem remembers in the days of her affliction and of her miseries all her pleasant things that were from the days of old. When her people fell into the hand of the adversary,  none helped her, the adversaries saw her; they mocked at her desolations.
Jerusalem has grievously sinned, therefore she has become as an unclean thing. All who honored her despise her, because they have seen her nakedness. Yea, she sighs,  turns backward.
Her filthiness was in her skirts. She did not think of her latter end. Therefore she has come down astonishingly. She has no comforter. Behold, O Jehovah, my affliction, for the enemy has magnified himself.
The adversary has spread out his hand upon all her pleasant things. For she has seen that the nations have entered into her sanctuary, concerning whom thou commanded that they should not enter into thine assembly.
All her people sigh. They seek bread. They have given their pleasant things for food to refresh the soul. See, O Jehovah, , behold, for I have become abject.
Is it nothing to you, all ye who pass by? Behold,  see if there is any sorrow like my sorrow, which is brought upon me. Therewith Jehovah has afflicted in the day of his fierce anger.
From on high he has sent fire into my bones,  it prevails against them. He has spread a net for my feet. He has turned me back. He has made me desolate and faint all the day.
The yoke of my transgressions is bound by his hand. They are knit together. They have come up upon my neck. He has made my strength to fail. The Lord has delivered me into their hands, against whom I am not able to stand.
The Lord has trodden under foot all my mighty men in the midst of me. He has called a solemn assembly against me to crush my young men. The Lord has trodden the virgin daughter of Judah as in a winepress.
For these things I weep. My eye, my eye runs down with water, because the comforter who should refresh my soul is far from me. My sons are desolate, because the enemy has prevailed.
Zion spreads forth her hands. There is none to comfort her. Jehovah has commanded concerning Jacob, that those who are round about him should be his adversaries. Jerusalem is among them as an unclean thing.
Jehovah is righteous, for I have rebelled against his commandment. Hear, I pray you, all ye peoples,  behold my sorrow. My virgins and my young men have gone into captivity.
I called for my loved ones,  they deceived me. My priests and my elders gave up the spirit in the city, while they sought food for themselves to refresh their souls.
Behold, O Jehovah, for I am in distress. My heart is troubled. My heart is turned within me. For I have grievously rebelled. Abroad the sword bereaves; at home there is as death.
They have heard that I sigh. There is none to comfort me. All my enemies have heard of my trouble. They are glad that thou have done it. Thou will bring the day that thou have proclaimed,  they shall be like me.
Let all their wickedness come before thee,  do to them, as thou have done to me for all my transgressions. For my sighs are many,  my heart is faint.
How the Lord has covered the daughter of Zion with a cloud in his anger! He has cast down the beauty of Israel from heaven to the earth,  has not remembered his footstool in the day of his anger.
The Lord has swallowed up all the habitations of Jacob,  has not pitied. In his wrath he has thrown down the strongholds of the daughter of Judah. He has brought them down to the ground. He has profaned the kingdom and the rulers thereof.
In fierce anger he has cut off all the horn of Israel. He has drawn back his right hand from before the enemy. And he has burned up Jacob like a flaming fire which devours round about.
He has bent his bow like an enemy. He has stood with his right hand as an adversary,  has slain all who were pleasant to the eye. He has poured out his wrath like fire in the tent of the daughter of Zion.
The Lord has become as an enemy. He has swallowed up Israel. He has swallowed up all her palaces. He has destroyed his strongholds. And he has multiplied mourning and lamentation in the daughter of Judah.
he has taken away his tabernacle violently, as a garden. He has destroyed his place of assembly. Jehovah has caused solemn assembly and sabbath to be forgotten in Zion. And in the indignation of his anger has despised the king and the priest.
The Lord has cast off his altar. He has abhorred his sanctuary. He has given up the walls of her palaces into the hand of the enemy. They have made a noise in the house of Jehovah, as in the day of a solemn assembly.
Jehovah has purposed to destroy the wall of the daughter of Zion. He has stretched out the line. He has not withdrawn his hand from destroying. And he has made the rampart and wall to lament, they languish together.
Her gates are sunk into the ground. He has destroyed and broken her bars. Her king and her rulers are among the nations where the law is not. Yea, her prophets find no vision from Jehovah.
The elders of the daughter of Zion sit upon the ground. They keep silence. They have cast up dust upon their heads. They have girded themselves with sackcloth. The virgins of Jerusalem hang down their heads to the ground.
My eyes fail with tears, my heart is troubled, my liver is poured upon the earth, because of the destruction of the daughter of my people, because the young sons and the sucklings faint in the streets of the city.
They say to their mothers, Where is grain and wine? when they faint as the wounded in the streets of the city, when their soul is poured out into their mothers' bosom.
What shall I testify to thee? What shall I liken to thee, O daughter of Jerusalem? What shall I compare to thee, that I may comfort thee, O virgin daughter of Zion? For thy breach is great like the sea; who can heal thee?
Thy prophets have seen false and foolish visions for thee. And they have not uncovered thine iniquity, to bring back thy captivity,  have seen for thee false oracles and causes of banishment.
All who pass by clap their hands at thee. They hiss and wag their head at the daughter of Jerusalem, saying, Is this the city that men called The perfection of beauty, The joy of the whole earth?
All thine enemies have opened their mouth wide against thee. They hiss and gnash the teeth. They say, We have swallowed her up. Certainly this is the day that we looked for. We have found, we have seen it.
Jehovah has done that which he purposed. He has fulfilled his word that he commanded in the days of old. He has thrown down,  has not pitied. And he has caused the enemy to rejoice over thee. He has exalted the horn of thine adversaries.
Their heart cried to the Lord. O wall of the daughter of Zion, let tears run down like a river day and night. Give thyself no respite. Let not the apple of thine eye cease.
Arise, cry out in the night, at the beginning of the watches. Pour out thy heart like water before the face of the Lord. Lift up thy hands toward him for the life of thy young sons, who faint for hunger at the head of every street.
See, O Jehovah,  behold to whom thou have done thus! Shall the women eat their fruit, the sons who are dandled in the hands? Shall the priest and the prophet be slain in the sanctuary of the Lord?
The youth and the old man lie on the ground in the streets. My virgins and my young men have fallen by the sword. Thou have slain them in the day of thine anger. Thou have slaughtered,  not pitied.
Thou have called, as in the day of a solemn assembly, my terrors on every side. And there was none who escaped or remained in the day of Jehovah's anger. My enemy has consumed those whom I have dandled and brought up.
I am the man who has seen affliction by the rod of his wrath.
He has led me and caused me to walk in darkness,  not in light.
Surely he turns his hand against me, again and again all the day.
He has made my flesh and my skin old. He has broken my bones.
He has built against me,  encompassed me with gall and travail.
He has made me to dwell in dark places, as those who have long been dead.
He has walled me around, that I cannot go forth. He has made my chain heavy.
Yea, when I cry,  call for help, he shuts out my prayer.
He has walled up my ways with hewn stone. He has made my paths crooked.
He is to me as a bear lying in wait, as a lion in concealed places.
He has turned aside my ways,  pulled me in pieces. He has made me desolate.
He has bent his bow,  set me as a mark for the arrow.
He has caused the shafts of his quiver to enter into my reins.
I have become a derision to all my people,  their song all the day.
He has filled me with bitterness. He has sated me with wormwood.
He has also broken my teeth with gravel stones. He has covered me with ashes.
thou have removed my soul far off from peace. I forgot prosperity.
I said, My strength is perished,  my expectation from Jehovah.
Remember my affliction and my misery, the wormwood and the gall.
My soul still has them in remembrance,  is bowed down within me.
This I recall to my mind, therefore I have hope:
It is of Jehovah's loving kindnesses that we are not consumed, because his compassions do not fail.
They are new every morning. Great is thy faithfulness.
Jehovah is my portion, says my soul, therefore I will hope in him.
Jehovah is good to those who wait for him, to the soul who seeks him.
It is good that a man should hope and quietly wait for the salvation of Jehovah.
It is good for a man that he bear the yoke in his youth.
Let him sit alone and keep silence, because he has laid it upon him.
Let him put his mouth in the dust, if so be there may be hope.
Let him give his cheek to him who smites him. Let him be filled full with reproach.
For the Lord will not cast off forever.
For though he causes grief, yet he will have compassion according to the multitude of his loving kindnesses.
For he does not afflict willingly, nor grieve the sons of men.
To crush under foot all the prisoners of the earth,
to turn aside the right of a man before the face of the Most High,
to subvert a man in his cause, the Lord does not approve.
Who is he that says,  it comes to pass, when the Lord does not command it?
Out of the mouth of the Most High does there not come evil and good?
Why does a living man complain, a man for the punishment of his sins?
Let us search and try our ways,  turn again to Jehovah.
Let us lift up our heart with our hands to God in the heavens.
We have transgressed and have rebelled. Thou have not pardoned.
Thou have covered with anger and pursued us. Thou have slain; thou have not pitied.
Thou have covered thyself with a cloud, so that no prayer can pass through.
Thou have made us an off-scouring and refuse in the midst of the peoples.
All our enemies have opened their mouth wide against us.
Fear and the pit have come upon us, devastation and destruction.
My eye runs down with streams of water, for the destruction of the daughter of my people.
My eye pours down,  does not cease, without any intermission,
till Jehovah looks down,  beholds from heaven.
My eye stirs my soul, because of all the daughters of my city.
They have chased me grievously like a bird, those who are my enemies without cause.
They have cut off my life in the dungeon,  have cast a stone upon me.
Waters flowed over my head. I said, I am cut off.
I called upon thy name, O Jehovah, out of the lowest dungeon.
Thou heard my voice. Hide not thine ear at my breathing, at my cry.
Thou drew near in the day that I called upon thee. Thou said, Fear not.
O Lord, thou have pleaded the causes of my soul. Thou have redeemed my life.
O Jehovah, thou have seen my wrong. Judge thou my cause.
Thou have seen all their vengeance and all their devices against me.
Thou have heard their reproach, O Jehovah,  all their devices against me,
the lips of those who rose up against me,  their device against me all the day.
Behold thou their sitting down,  their rising up. I am their song.
Thou will render to them a recompense, O Jehovah, according to the work of their hands.
Thou will give them hardness of heart, thy curse to them.
Thou will pursue them in anger,  destroy them from under the heavens of Jehovah.
How the gold has become dim, the most pure gold changed! The stones of the sanctuary are poured out at the head of every street.
The precious sons of Zion, comparable to fine gold, how they are esteemed as earthen pitchers, the work of the hands of the potter!
Even the jackals draw out the breast; they give suck to their young ones. The daughter of my people has become cruel, like the ostriches in the wilderness.
The tongue of the sucking child clings to the roof of his mouth for thirst. The young sons ask bread,  no man breaks it to them.
Those who fed luxuriously are desolate in the streets. Those who were brought up in scarlet embrace dunghills.
For the iniquity of the daughter of my people is greater than the sin of Sodom, that was overthrown as in a moment,  no hands were laid upon her.
Her ranking men were purer than snow. They were whiter than milk. They were more ruddy in body than rubies. Their polishing was as of sapphire.
Their visage is blacker than a coal. They are not known in the streets. Their skin clings to their bones. It is withered. It has become like a stick.
Those who are slain with the sword are better than those who are slain with hunger, for these pine away, stricken through, for want of the fruits of the field.
The hands of the pitiful women have boiled their own children. They were their food in the destruction of the daughter of my people.
Jehovah has accomplished his wrath. He has poured out his fierce anger,  he has kindled a fire in Zion, which has devoured the foundations thereof.
The kings of the earth did not believe, nor all the inhabitants of the world, that the adversary and the enemy would enter into the gates of Jerusalem.
It is because of the sins of her prophets,  the iniquities of her priests, who have shed the blood of the just in the midst of her.
They wander as blind men in the streets. They are polluted with blood, so that men cannot touch their garments.
Depart ye, they cried to them. Unclean! Depart, depart, do not touch! When they fled away and wandered, men said among the nations, They shall no more sojourn here.
The anger of Jehovah has scattered them. He will no more regard them. They did not respect the persons of the priests. They did not favor the elders.
Our eyes do yet fail in looking for our vain help. In our watching we have watched for a nation that could not save.
They hunt our steps, so that we cannot go in our streets. Our end is near, our days are fulfilled, for our end has come.
Our pursuers were swifter than the eagles of the heavens. They chased us upon the mountains. They laid wait for us in the wilderness.
The breath of our nostrils, the anointed of Jehovah, was taken in their pits, of whom we said, Under his shadow we shall live among the nations.
Rejoice and be glad, O daughter of Edom, who dwells in the land of Uz. Yet the cup shall pass through to thee also. Thou shall be drunken,  shall make thyself naked.
The punishment of thine iniquity is accomplished, O daughter of Zion. He will no more carry thee away into captivity. He will visit thine iniquity, O daughter of Edom. He will uncover thy sins.
Remember, O Jehovah, what has come upon us. Behold,  see our reproach.
Our inheritance is turned to strangers, our houses to aliens.
We are orphans and fatherless. Our mothers are as widows.
We have drunken our water for money. Our wood is sold to us.
Our pursuers are upon our necks. We are weary,  have no rest.
We have given the hand to the Egyptians,  to the Assyrians, to be satisfied with bread.
Our fathers sinned,  are not,  we have borne their iniquities.
Servants rule over us. There is none to deliver us out of their hand.
We get our bread at the peril of our lives, because of the sword of the wilderness.
Our skin is black like an oven, because of the burning heat of famine.
They ravished the women in Zion, the virgins in the cities of Judah.
Rulers were hanged up by their hand. The faces of elders were not honored.
The young men bore the mill,  the sons stumbled under the wood.
The elders have ceased from the gate, the young men from their music.
The joy of our heart is ceased, our dance is turned into mourning.
The crown has fallen from our head. Woe to us! For we have sinned.
For this our heart is faint. For these things our eyes are dim,
for the mountain of Zion, which is desolate. The foxes walk upon it.
Thou, O Jehovah, abide forever. Thy throne is from generation to generation.
Why do thou forget us forever,  forsake us so long time?
Turn thou us back to thee, O Jehovah,  we shall be turned back. Renew our days as of old.
But thou have utterly rejected us. Thou are very angry against us.
Ezekiel
Ezek. Now it came to pass in the thirtieth year, in the fourth month, in the fifth day of the month, as I was among the captives by the river Chebar, that the heavens were opened,  I saw visions of God.
Ezek. In the fifth day of the month, which was the fifth year of king Jehoiachin's captivity,
Ezek. the word of Jehovah came expressly to Ezekiel the priest, the son of Buzi, in the land of the Chaldeans by the river Chebar,  the hand of Jehovah was there upon him.
Ezek. And I looked, , behold, a stormy wind came out of the north, a great cloud, with a fire enfolding itself,  a brightness round about it,  out of the midst of it, as it were glowing metal, out of the midst of the fire.
Ezek. And out of the midst of it came the likeness of four living creatures. And this was their appearance. They had the likeness of a man.
Ezek. And each one had four faces,  each one of them had four wings.
Ezek. And their feet were straight feet,  the sole of their feet was like the sole of a calf's foot,  they sparkled like burnished brass.
Ezek. And they had the hands of a man under their wings on their four sides. And those four had their faces and their wings thus:
Ezek. Their wings were joined one to another. They did not turn when they went; they went each one straight forward.
Ezek. As for the likeness of their faces, they had the face of a man. And those four had the face of a lion on the right side,  those four had the face of an ox on the left side, those four also had the face of an eagle.
Ezek. And their faces and their wings were separate above, two wings of each one were joined one to another,  two covered their bodies.
Ezek. And they went each one straight forward. Where the spirit was to go, they went. They did not turn when they went.
Ezek. As for the likeness of the living creatures, their appearance was like burning coals of fire, like the appearance of torches. It went up and down among the living creatures,  the fire was bright,  out of the fire went forth lightning.
Ezek. And the living creatures ran and returned as the appearance of a flash of lightning.
Ezek. Now as I beheld the living creatures, behold, one wheel was upon the earth beside the living creatures, for each of the four faces of it.
Ezek. The appearance of the wheels and their work was like a beryl. And those four had one likeness,  their appearance and their work was as it were a wheel within a wheel.
Ezek. When they went, they went in their four directions. They did not turn when they went.
Ezek. As for their rims, they were high and fearful. And those four had their rims full of eyes round about.
Ezek. And when the living creatures went, the wheels went beside them. And when the living creatures were lifted up from the earth, the wheels were lifted up.
Ezek. Wherever the spirit was to go, they went; there the spirit was to go. And the wheels were lifted up beside them, for the spirit of the living creature was in the wheels.
Ezek. When those went, these went,  when those stood, these stood,  when those were lifted up from the earth, the wheels were lifted up beside them, for the spirit of the living creature was in the wheels.
Ezek. And over the head of the living creature there was the likeness of a firmament, like awesome crystal to look upon, stretched forth over their heads above.
Ezek. And under the firmament their wings were straight, the one toward the other. Each one had two which covered their bodies on this side,  each one had two which covered on that side.
Ezek. And when they went, I heard the noise of their wings like the noise of great waters, like the voice of the Almighty, a noise of tumult like the noise of a host. When they stood, they let down their wings.
Ezek. And there was a voice above the firmament that was over their heads. When they stood, they let down their wings.
Ezek. And above the firmament that was over their heads was the likeness of a throne, as the appearance of a sapphire stone. And upon the likeness of the throne was a likeness as the appearance of a man upon it above.
Ezek. And I saw as it were glowing metal, as the appearance of fire within it round about, from the appearance of his loins and upward. And from the appearance of his loins and downward I saw as it were the appearance of fire. And there was brightness round about him.
Ezek. As the appearance of the bow that is in the cloud in the day of rain, so was the appearance of the brightness round about. This was the appearance of the likeness of the glory of Jehovah. And when I saw it, I fell upon my face,  I heard a voice speaking.
Ezek. And he said to me, Son of man, stand upon thy feet,  I will speak with thee.
Ezek. And the Spirit entered into me when he spoke to me,  set me upon my feet. And I heard him who spoke to me.
Ezek. And he said to me, Son of man, I send thee to the sons of Israel, to nations that are rebellious, which have rebelled against me. They and their fathers have transgressed against me even to this very day.
Ezek. And the sons are impudent and stiff hearted. I send thee to them,  thou shall say to them, Thus says the lord Jehovah.
Ezek. And they, whether they will hear, or whether they will forbear (for they are a rebellious house), yet shall know that there has been a prophet among them.
Ezek. And thou, son of man, be not afraid of them, nor be afraid of their words, though briers and thorns are with thee,  thou dwell among scorpions. Be not afraid of their words, nor be dismayed at their looks, though they are a rebellious house.
Ezek. And thou shall speak my words to them, whether they will hear, or whether they will forbear, for they are most rebellious.
Ezek. But thou, son of man, hear what I say to thee. Be not thou rebellious like that rebellious house. Open thy mouth,  eat that which I give thee.
Ezek. And when I looked, behold, a hand was put forth to me, , lo, a roll of a book was in it,
Ezek. And he spread it before me,  it was written inside and outside. And there were written in it lamentations and mourning and woe.
Ezek. And he said to me, Son of man, eat that which thou find. Eat this roll,  go, speak to the house of Israel.
Ezek. So I opened my mouth,  he caused me to eat the roll.
Ezek. And he said to me, Son of man, cause thy belly to eat,  fill thy bowels with this roll that I give thee. Then I ate it,  it was in my mouth as honey for sweetness.
Ezek. And he said to me, Son of man, go, get thee to the house of Israel,  speak to them with my words.
Ezek. For thou are not sent to a people of a strange speech and of a hard language,  to the house of Israel,
Ezek. not to many peoples of a strange speech,  of a hard language, whose words thou cannot understand. Surely, if I sent thee to them, they would hearken to thee.
Ezek. But the house of Israel will not hearken to thee, for they will not hearken to me. For all the house of Israel are of a hard forehead and of a stiff heart.
Ezek. Behold, I have made thy face hard against their faces,  thy forehead hard against their foreheads.
Ezek. As an adamant, harder than flint, I have made thy forehead. Fear them not, nor be dismayed at their looks, though they are a rebellious house.
Ezek. Moreover he said to me, Son of man, all my words that I shall speak to thee, receive in thy heart,  hear with thine ears.
Ezek. And go, get thee to those of the captivity, to the sons of thy people,  speak to them,  tell them, Thus says the lord Jehovah, whether they will hear, or whether they will forbear.
Ezek. Then the Spirit lifted me up,  I heard behind me the voice of a great rushing, saying, Blessed be the glory of Jehovah from his place.
Ezek. And I heard the noise of the wings of the living creatures as they touched each other,  the noise of the wheels beside them, even the noise of a great rushing.
Ezek. So the Spirit lifted me up,  took me away. And I went in bitterness, in the heat of my spirit,  the hand of Jehovah was strong upon me.
Ezek. Then I came to those of the captivity at Tel-abib, who dwelt by the river Chebar,  to where they dwelt. And I sat there overwhelmed among them seven days.
Ezek. And it came to pass at the end of seven days, that the word of Jehovah came to me, saying,
Ezek. Son of man, I have made thee a watchman to the house of Israel. Therefore hear the word at my mouth,  give them warning from me.
Ezek. When I say to a wicked man, Thou shall surely die,  thou give him no warning, nor speak to warn the wicked man from his wicked way, to save his life, the same wicked man shall die in his iniquity,  I will require his blood at thy hand.
Ezek. Yet if thou warn the wicked man,  he does not turn from his wickedness, nor from his wicked way, he shall die in his iniquity,  thou have delivered thy soul.
Ezek. Again, when a righteous man turns from his righteousness,  commits iniquity,  I lay a stumbling block before him, he shall die. Because thou have not given him warning, he shall die in his sin,  his righteous deeds which he has done shall not be remembered,  I will require his blood at thy hand.
Ezek. Nevertheless if thou warn the righteous man, that the righteous man not sin,  he does not sin, he shall surely live, because he took warning,  thou have delivered thy soul.
Ezek. And the hand of Jehovah was there upon me,  he said to me, Arise, go forth into the plain,  I will talk with thee there.
Ezek. Then I arose,  went forth into the plain. And, behold, the glory of Jehovah stood there, as the glory which I saw by the river Chebar,  I fell on my face.
Ezek. Then the Spirit entered into me,  set me upon my feet. And he spoke with me,  said to me, Go, shut thyself within thy house.
Ezek. But thou, son of man, behold, they shall lay bands upon thee,  shall bind thee with them,  thou shall not escape from them.
Ezek. And I will make thy tongue cling to the roof of thy mouth, that thou shall be mute,  shall not be a reprover to them, for they are a rebellious house.
Ezek. But when I speak with thee, I will open thy mouth,  thou shall say to them, Thus says the lord Jehovah. He who hears, let him hear,  he who forbears, let him forbear, for they are a rebellious house.
Ezek. Thou also, son of man, take thee a tile,  lay it before thee,  portray upon it a city, even Jerusalem.
Ezek. And lay siege against it,  build forts against it,  cast up a mound against it. Also set camps against it,  plant battering rams against it round about.
Ezek. And take thou to thee an iron pan,  set it for a wall of iron between thee and the city. And set thy face toward it,  it shall be besieged,  thou shall lay siege against it. This shall be a sign to the house of Israel.
Ezek. Moreover lie thou upon thy left side,  lay the iniquity of the house of Israel upon it. According to the number of the days that thou shall lie upon it, thou shall bear their iniquity.
Ezek. For I have appointed the years of their iniquity to be a number of days to thee, even three hundred and ninety days. So thou shall bear the iniquity of the house of Israel.
Ezek. And again, when thou have accomplished these, thou shall lie on thy right side,  shall bear the iniquity of the house of Judah forty days, each day for a year. I have appointed it to thee.
Ezek. And thou shall set thy face toward the siege of Jerusalem, with thine arm uncovered,  thou shall prophesy against it.
Ezek. And, behold, I lay bands upon thee,  thou shall not turn thee from one side to the other, till thou have accomplished the days of thy siege.
Ezek. Also take thou to thee wheat,  barley,  beans,  lentils,  millet,  spelt,  put them in one vessel,  make thee bread of it, according to the number of the days that thou shall lie upon thy side, even three hundred and ninety days, thou shall eat of it.
Ezek. And thy food which thou shall eat shall be by weight, twenty shekels a day. Thou shall eat it from time to time.
Ezek. And thou shall drink water by measure, the sixth part of a hin. Thou shall drink from time to time.
Ezek. And thou shall eat it as barley cakes,  thou shall bake it in their sight with dung that comes out of man.
Ezek. And Jehovah said, Even thus shall the sons of Israel eat their bread unclean among the nations where I will drive them.
Ezek. Then I said, Ah lord Jehovah! Behold, my soul has not been polluted. For from my youth up even till now I have not eaten of that which dies of itself, or is torn of beasts, neither has abominable flesh come into my mouth.
Ezek. Then he said to me, See, I have given thee cow's dung for man's dung,  thou shall prepare thy bread of it.
Ezek. Moreover he said to me, Son of man, behold, I will break the staff of bread in Jerusalem,  they shall eat bread by weight,  with fearfulness,  they shall drink water by measure,  in dismay,
Ezek. that they may lack bread and water,  be dismayed one with another,  pine away in their iniquity.
Ezek. And thou, son of man, take thee a sharp sword. As a barber's razor thou shall take it to thee,  shall cause it to pass upon thy head and upon thy beard. Then take thee balances to weigh and divide the hair.
Ezek. A third part thou shall burn in the fire in the midst of the city when the days of the siege are fulfilled,  thou shall take a third part,  smite with the sword round about it,  a third part thou shall scatter to the wind. And I will draw out a sword after them.
Ezek. And thou shall take from it a few in number,  bind them in thy skirts.
Ezek. And of these again thou shall take,  cast them into the midst of the fire,  burn them in the fire. From there a fire shall come forth into all the house of Israel.
Ezek. Thus says the lord Jehovah: This is Jerusalem. I have set her in the midst of the nations,  countries are round about her.
Ezek. And she has rebelled against my ordinances in doing wickedness more than the nations,  against my statutes more than the countries that are round about her, for they have rejected my ordinances,  as for my statutes, they have not walked in them.
Ezek. Therefore thus says the lord Jehovah: Because ye are more disorderly than the nations that are round about you,  have not walked in my statutes, nor have kept my ordinances, no, ye have not even done according to the ordinances of the nations that are round about you,
Ezek. therefore thus says the lord Jehovah: Behold, I, even I, am against thee,  I will execute judgments in the midst of thee in the sight of the nations.
Ezek. And I will do in thee that which I have not done,  of which I will not do any more the like, because of all thine abominations.
Ezek. Therefore the fathers shall eat the sons in the midst of thee,  the sons shall eat their fathers. And I will execute judgments on thee,  I will scatter to all the winds the whole remnant of thee.
Ezek. Therefore, as I live, says the lord Jehovah, surely, because thou have defiled my sanctuary with all thy detestable things,  with all thine abominations, therefore I also will diminish thee, nor shall my eye spare. And I also will have no pity.
Ezek. A third part of thee shall die with the pestilence,  they shall be consumed with famine in the midst of thee,  a third part shall fall by the sword round about thee,  a third part I will scatter to all the winds,  will draw out a sword after them.
Ezek. Thus my anger shall be accomplished,  I will cause my wrath toward them to rest,  I shall be comforted. And they shall know that I, Jehovah, have spoken in my zeal, when I have accomplished my wrath upon them.
Ezek. Moreover I will make thee a desolation and a reproach among the nations that are round about thee, in the sight of all who pass by.
Ezek. So it shall be a reproach and a taunt, a lesson and an astonishment, to the nations that are round about thee, when I shall execute judgments on thee in anger and in wrath,  in wrathful rebukes-I, Jehovah, have spoken it-
Ezek. when I shall send upon them the evil arrows of famine that are for destruction, which I will send to destroy you. And I will increase the famine upon you,  will break your staff of bread.
Ezek. And I will send upon you famine and evil beasts,  they shall bereave thee. And pestilence and blood shall pass through thee. And I will bring the sword upon thee. I, Jehovah, have spoken it.
Ezek. And the word of Jehovah came to me, saying,
Ezek. Son of man, set thy face toward the mountains of Israel,  prophesy to them,
Ezek. and say, Ye mountains of Israel, hear the word of lord Jehovah. Thus says the lord Jehovah to the mountains and to the hills, to the watercourses and to the valleys: Behold, I, even I, will bring a sword upon you,  I will destroy your high places.
Ezek. And your altars shall become desolate,  your sun-images shall be broken,  I will cast down your slain men before your idols.
Ezek. And I will lay the dead bodies of the sons of Israel before their idols,  I will scatter your bones round about your altars.
Ezek. In all your dwelling places the cities shall be laid waste,  the high places shall be desolate, that your altars may be laid waste and made desolate,  your idols may be broken and cease,  your sun-images may be hewn down,  your works may be abolished.
Ezek. And the slain shall fall in the midst of you. And ye shall know that I am Jehovah.
Ezek. Yet I will leave a remnant, in that ye shall have some who escape the sword among the nations, when ye shall be scattered through the countries.
Ezek. And those of you who escape shall remember me among the nations where they shall be carried captive, how I have broken with their lewd heart, which has departed from me,  with their eyes, which play the harlot after their idols. And they shall loathe themselves in their own sight for the evils which they have committed in all their abominations.
Ezek. And they shall know that I am Jehovah. I have not said in vain that I would do this evil to them.
Ezek. Thus says the lord Jehovah: Smite with thy hand,  stamp with thy foot,  say, Alas! because of all the evil abominations of the house of Israel, for they shall fall by the sword, by the famine,  by the pestilence.
Ezek. He who is far off shall die of the pestilence,  he who is near shall fall by the sword,  he who remains and is besieged shall die by the famine. Thus I will accomplish my wrath upon them.
Ezek. And ye shall know that I am Jehovah when their slain men shall be among their idols round about their altars, upon every high hill, on all the tops of the mountains,  under every green tree,  under every thick oak, the places where they offered sweet savor to all their idols.
Ezek. And I will stretch out my hand upon them,  make the land desolate and waste, from the wilderness toward Diblah, throughout all their habitations. And they shall know that I am Jehovah.
Ezek. Moreover the word of Jehovah came to me, saying,
Ezek. And thou, son of man, thus says the lord Jehovah to the land of Israel: An end. The end has come upon the four corners of the land.
Ezek. Now the end is upon thee,  I will send my anger upon thee,  will judge thee according to thy ways. And I will bring upon thee all thine abominations.
Ezek. And my eye shall not spare thee, nor will I have pity. But I will bring thy ways upon thee,  thine abominations shall be in the midst of thee. And ye shall know that I am Jehovah.
Ezek. Thus says the lord Jehovah: An evil, an only evil, behold, it comes.
Ezek. An end has come. The end has come. It awakens against thee. Behold, it comes.
Ezek. Thy doom has come to thee, O inhabitant of the land. The time has come. The day is near, tumult,  not joyful shouting, upon the mountains.
Ezek. Now I will shortly pour out my wrath upon thee,  accomplish my anger against thee,  will judge thee according to thy ways. And I will bring upon thee all thine abominations.
Ezek. And my eye shall not spare, nor will I have pity. I will bring upon thee according to thy ways. And thine abominations shall be in the midst of thee. And ye shall know that I, Jehovah, do smite.
Ezek. Behold, the day, behold, it comes. Thy doom has gone forth. The rod has blossomed; pride has budded.
Ezek. Violence has risen up into a rod of wickedness. None of them shall remain, nor of their multitude, nor of their wealth. Neither shall there be eminency among them.
Ezek. The time has come; the day draws near. Let not the buyer rejoice, nor the seller mourn, for wrath is upon all the multitude of it.
Ezek. For the seller shall not return to that which is sold, although they be yet alive, for the vision is concerning the whole multitude of it. None shall return, nor shall any strengthen himself in the iniquity of his life.
Ezek. They have blown the trumpet,  have made all ready,  none goes to the battle, for my wrath is upon all the multitude of it.
Ezek. The sword is outside,  the pestilence and the famine inside. He who is in the field shall die with the sword,  he who is in the city, famine and pestilence shall devour him.
Ezek. But those of them who escape shall escape,  shall be on the mountains like doves of the valleys. All of them moaning, each one in his iniquity.
Ezek. All hands shall be feeble,  all knees shall be weak as water.
Ezek. They shall also gird themselves with sackcloth,  horror shall cover them. And shame shall be upon all faces,  baldness upon all their heads.
Ezek. They shall cast their silver in the streets,  their gold shall be as an unclean thing. Their silver and their gold shall not be able to deliver them in the day of the wrath of Jehovah. They shall not satisfy their souls, nor fill their bowels, because it has been the stumbling block of their iniquity.
Ezek. As for the beauty of his ornament, he set it in majesty,  they made the images of their abominations,  their detestable things in it. Therefore I have made it as an unclean thing to them.
Ezek. And I will give it into the hands of the strangers for a prey,  to the wicked of the earth for a spoil,  they shall profane it.
Ezek. I will also turn my face from them,  they shall profane my secluded place. And robbers shall enter into it,  profane it.
Ezek. Make the chain, for the land is full of bloody crimes,  the city is full of violence.
Ezek. Therefore I will bring the worst of the nations,  they shall possess their houses. I will also make the pride of the strong to cease,  their holy places shall be profaned.
Ezek. Destruction comes. And they shall seek peace,  there shall be none.
Ezek. Mischief shall come upon mischief,  rumor shall be upon rumor. And they shall seek a vision of the prophet,  the law shall perish from the priest,  counsel from the elders.
Ezek. The king shall mourn,  the ruler shall be clothed with desolation,  the hands of the people of the land shall be troubled. I will do to them according to their way,  according to their deserts I will judge them. And they shall know that I am Jehovah.
Ezek. And it came to pass in the sixth year, in the sixth month, in the fifth day of the month, as I sat in my house,  the elders of Judah sat before me, that the hand of the lord Jehovah fell there upon me.
Ezek. Then I beheld, , lo, a likeness as the appearance of fire, from the appearance of his loins and downward, fire,  from his loins and upward, as the appearance of brightness, as it were glowing metal.
Ezek. And he put forth the form of a hand,  took me by a lock of my head. And the Spirit lifted me up between earth and heaven,  brought me in the visions of God to Jerusalem, to the door of the gate of the inner court that looks toward the north, where the seat of the image of jealousy was, which provokes to jealousy.
Ezek. And, behold, the glory of the God of Israel was there, according to the appearance that I saw in the plain.
Ezek. Then he said to me, Son of man, lift up thine eyes now the way toward the north. So I lifted up my eyes the way toward the north, , behold, northward of the gate of the altar was this image of jealousy in the entry.
Ezek. And he said to me, Son of man, see thou what they do, even the great abominations that the house of Israel commit here, that I should go far off from my sanctuary? But thou shall again see yet other great abominations.
Ezek. And he brought me to the door of the court. And when I looked, behold, a hole in the wall.
Ezek. Then he said to me, Son of man, dig now in the wall. And when I had dug in the wall, behold, a door.
Ezek. And he said to me, Go in,  see the wicked abominations that they do here.
Ezek. So I went in and saw, , behold, every form of creeping things,  abominable beasts,  all the idols of the house of Israel, portrayed upon the wall round about.
Ezek. And there stood before them seventy men of the elders of the house of Israel. And in the midst of them stood Jaazaniah the son of Shaphan, each man with his censer in his hand,  the odor of the cloud of incense went up.
Ezek. Then he said to me, Son of man, have thou seen what the elders of the house of Israel do in the dark, each man in his chambers of imagery? For they say, Jehovah does not see us. Jehovah has forsaken the land.
Ezek. He also said to me, Thou shall again see yet other great abominations which they do.
Ezek. Then he brought me to the door of the gate of Jehovah's house which was toward the north. And, behold, there sat the women weeping for Tammuz.
Ezek. Then he said to me, Have thou seen this, O son of man? Thou shall again see yet greater abominations than these.
Ezek. And he brought me into the inner court of Jehovah's house. And, behold, at the door of the temple of Jehovah, between the porch and the altar, were about twenty-five men with their backs toward the temple of Jehovah,  their faces toward the east,  they were worshiping the sun toward the east.
Ezek. Then he said to me, Have thou seen this, O son of man? Is it a light thing to the house of Judah that they commit the abominations which they commit here? For they have filled the land with violence,  have turned again to provoke me to anger. And, lo, they put the branch to their nose.
Ezek. Therefore I will also deal in wrath. My eye shall not spare, nor will I have pity. And though they cry in my ears with a loud voice, yet I will not hear them.
Ezek. Then he cried in my ears with a loud voice, saying, Cause ye those who have charge over the city to draw near, each man with his destroying weapon in his hand.
Ezek. And, behold, six men came from the way of the upper gate, which lies toward the north, each man with his slaughter weapon in his hand,  one man in the midst of them clothed in linen, with a writer's case by his side. And they went in,  stood beside the brazen altar.
Ezek. And the glory of the God of Israel went up from the cherub, upon which it was, to the threshold of the house,  he called to the man clothed in linen who had the writer's case by his side.
Ezek. And Jehovah said to him, Go through the midst of the city, through the midst of Jerusalem,  set a mark upon the foreheads of the men who sigh and who cry over all the abominations that are done in the midst of it.
Ezek. And to the others he said in my hearing, Go ye through the city after him,  smite. Let not your eye spare, nor have ye pity.
Ezek. Kill utterly the old man, the young man,  the virgin,  little sons,  women,  come not near any man upon whom is the mark. And begin at my sanctuary. Then they began at the old men who were before the house.
Ezek. And he said to them, Defile the house,  fill the courts with the slain. Go ye forth. And they went forth,  smote in the city.
Ezek. And it came to pass, while they were smiting,  I was left, that I fell upon my face,  cried,  said, Ah lord Jehovah! Will thou destroy all the residue of Israel in thy pouring out of thy wrath upon Jerusalem?
Ezek. Then he said to me, The iniquity of the house of Israel and Judah is exceedingly great,  the land is full of blood,  the city full of perverseness. For they say, Jehovah has forsaken the land,  Jehovah does not see.
Ezek. And as for me also, my eye shall not spare, nor will I have pity,  I will bring their way upon their head.
Ezek. And, behold, the man clothed in linen, who had the writing case by his side, reported the matter, saying, I have done as thou have commanded me.
Ezek. Then I looked, , behold, in the firmament that was over the head of the cherubim there appeared above them as it were a sapphire stone, as the appearance of the likeness of a throne.
Ezek. And he spoke to the man clothed in linen,  said, Go in between the whirling wheels, even under the cherub,  fill both thy hands with coals of fire from between the cherubim,  scatter them over the city. And he went in in my sight.
Ezek. Now the cherubim stood on the right side of the house when the man went in,  the cloud filled the inner court.
Ezek. And the glory of Jehovah mounted up from the cherub, over the threshold of the house. And the house was filled with the cloud,  the court was full of the brightness of Jehovah's glory.
Ezek. And the sound of the wings of the cherubim was heard even to the outer court, as the voice of God Almighty when he speaks.
Ezek. And it came to pass, when he commanded the man clothed in linen, saying, Take fire from between the whirling wheels, from between the cherubim, that he went in,  stood beside a wheel.
Ezek. And the cherub stretched forth his hand from between the cherubim to the fire that was between the cherubim,  took,  put it into the hands of him who was clothed in linen, who took it and went out.
Ezek. And there appeared in the cherubim the form of a man's hand under their wings.
Ezek. And I looked, , behold, four wheels beside the cherubim, one wheel beside one cherub,  another wheel beside another cherub. And the appearance of the wheels was like a beryl stone.
Ezek. And as for their appearance, those four had one likeness, as if a wheel have been within a wheel.
Ezek. When they went, they went in their four directions. They did not turn as they went,  to the place where the head looked they followed it. They did not turn as they went.
Ezek. And their whole body,  their backs,  their hands,  their wings,  the wheels, were full of eyes round about, even the wheels that those four had.
Ezek. As for the wheels, they were called in my hearing, O wheel.
Ezek. And each one had four faces. The first face was the face of the cherub,  the second face was the face of a man,  the third face the face of a lion,  the fourth the face of an eagle.
Ezek. And the cherubim mounted up. This is the living creature that I saw by the river Chebar.
Ezek. And when the cherubim went, the wheels went beside them. And when the cherubim lifted up their wings to mount up from the earth, the wheels also did not turn from beside them.
Ezek. When they stood, these stood,  when they mounted up, these mounted up with them, for the spirit of the living creature was in them.
Ezek. And the glory of Jehovah went forth from over the threshold of the house,  stood over the cherubim.
Ezek. And the cherubim lifted up their wings,  mounted up from the earth in my sight when they went forth,  the wheels beside them. And they stood at the door of the east gate of Jehovah's house,  the glory of the God of Israel was over them above.
Ezek. This is the living creature that I saw under the God of Israel by the river Chebar,  I knew that they were cherubim.
Ezek. Each one had four faces,  each one four wings. And the likeness of the hands of a man was under their wings.
Ezek. And as for the likeness of their faces, they were the faces which I saw by the river Chebar, their appearances and themselves. They went each one straight forward.
Ezek. Moreover the Spirit lifted me up,  brought me to the east gate of Jehovah's house, which looks eastward. And, behold, at the door of the gate twenty-five men. And I saw in the midst of them Jaazaniah the son of Azzur,  Pelatiah the son of Benaiah, rulers of the people.
Ezek. And he said to me, Son of man, these are the men who devise iniquity,  who give wicked counsel in this city,
Ezek. who say, The time is not near to build houses. This city is the caldron,  we are the flesh.
Ezek. Therefore prophesy against them. Prophesy, O son of man.
Ezek. And the Spirit of Jehovah fell upon me,  he said to me, Speak, Thus says Jehovah: Thus ye have said, O house of Israel, for I know the things that come into your mind.
Ezek. Ye have multiplied your slain in this city,  ye have filled the streets thereof with the slain.
Ezek. Therefore thus says the lord Jehovah: Your slain whom ye have laid in the midst of it, they are the flesh,  this city is the caldron,  ye shall be brought forth out of the midst of it.
Ezek. Ye have feared the sword,  I will bring the sword upon you, says the lord Jehovah.
Ezek. And I will bring you forth out of the midst of it,  deliver you into the hands of strangers,  will execute judgments among you.
Ezek. Ye shall fall by the sword. I will judge you in the border of Israel,  ye shall know that I am Jehovah.
Ezek. This city shall not be your caldron, nor shall ye be the flesh in the midst thereof. I will judge you in the border of Israel,
Ezek. and ye shall know that I am Jehovah. For ye have not walked in my statutes, nor have ye executed my ordinances,  have done according to the ordinances of the nations that are round about you.
Ezek. And it came to pass, when I prophesied, that Pelatiah the son of Benaiah died. Then I fell down upon my face,  cried with a loud voice,  said, Ah lord Jehovah! Will thou make a full end of the remnant of Israel?
Ezek. And the word of Jehovah came to me, saying,
Ezek. Son of man, thy brothers, even thy brothers, the men of thy kindred,  all the house of Israel, all of them, are those to whom the inhabitants of Jerusalem have said, Get you far from Jehovah. This land is given to us for a possession.
Ezek. Therefore say, Thus says the lord Jehovah: Whereas I have removed them far off among the nations,  whereas I have scattered them among the countries, yet I will be to them a sanctuary for a little while in the countries where they have come.
Ezek. Therefore say, Thus says the lord Jehovah. I will gather you from the peoples,  assemble you out of the countries where ye have been scattered,  I will give you the land of Israel.
Ezek. And they shall come there,  they shall take away from there all the detestable things of it and all the abominations of it.
Ezek. And I will give them one heart,  I will put a new spirit within you. And I will take the stony heart out of their flesh,  will give them a heart of flesh,
