Ezek. that they may walk in my statutes,  keep my ordinances,  do them. And they shall be my people,  I will be their God.
Ezek. But as for those whose heart walks according to the heart of their detestable things and their abominations, I will bring their way upon their own heads, says the lord Jehovah.
Ezek. Then the cherubim lifted up their wings,  the wheels were beside them,  the glory of the God of Israel was over them above.
Ezek. And the glory of Jehovah went up from the midst of the city,  stood upon the mountain which is on the east side of the city.
Ezek. And the Spirit lifted me up,  brought me in the vision by the Spirit of God into Chaldea, to those of the captivity. So the vision that I had seen went up from me.
Ezek. Then I spoke to those of the captivity all the things that Jehovah had shown me.
Ezek. The word of Jehovah also came to me, saying,
Ezek. Son of man, thou dwell in the midst of the rebellious house, that have eyes to see,  see not, that have ears to hear,  hear not, for they are a rebellious house.
Ezek. Therefore, thou son of man, prepare thee stuff for moving,  move by day in their sight. And thou shall move from thy place to another place in their sight. It may be they will consider, though they are a rebellious house.
Ezek. And thou shall bring forth thy stuff by day in their sight, as stuff for moving. And thou shall go forth thyself at evening in their sight, as when men go forth into exile.
Ezek. Dig thou through the wall in their sight,  carry out by that.
Ezek. Thou shall bear it upon thy shoulder in their sight,  carry it forth in the dark. Thou shall cover thy face, that thou not see the land. For I have set thee for a sign to the house of Israel.
Ezek. And I did so as I was commanded. I brought forth my stuff by day, as stuff for moving,  in the evening I dug through the wall with my hand. I brought it forth in the dark,  bore it upon my shoulder in their sight.
Ezek. And in the morning the word of Jehovah came to me, saying,
Ezek. Son of man, has not the house of Israel, the rebellious house, said to thee, What are thou doing?
Ezek. Say thou to them, Thus says the lord Jehovah: This burden concerns the ruler in Jerusalem,  all the house of Israel among whom they are.
Ezek. Say, I am your sign. Just as I have done, so shall it be done to them. They shall go into exile, into captivity.
Ezek. And the ruler who is among them shall bear upon his shoulder in the dark,  shall go forth. They shall dig through the wall to carry out by it. He shall cover his face, because he shall not see the land with his eyes.
Ezek. I will also spread my net upon him,  he shall be taken in my snare. And I will bring him to Babylon to the land of the Chaldeans, yet he shall not see it, though he shall die there.
Ezek. And I will scatter toward every wind all who are round about him to help him,  all his groups. And I will draw out the sword after them.
Ezek. And they shall know that I am Jehovah, when I shall disperse them among the nations,  scatter them through the countries.
Ezek. But I will leave a few men of them from the sword, from the famine,  from the pestilence, that they may declare all their abominations among the nations where they come. And they shall know that I am Jehovah.
Ezek. Moreover the word of Jehovah came to me, saying,
Ezek. Son of man, eat thy bread with quaking,  drink thy water with trembling and with fearfulness.
Ezek. And say to the people of the land, Thus says the lord Jehovah concerning the inhabitants of Jerusalem,  the land of Israel: They shall eat their bread with fearfulness,  drink their water in dismay, that her land may be desolate of all that is in it, because of the violence of all those who dwell therein.
Ezek. And the cities that are inhabited shall be laid waste,  the land shall be a desolation. And ye shall know that I am Jehovah.
Ezek. And the word of Jehovah came to me, saying,
Ezek. Son of man, what is this proverb that ye have in the land of Israel, saying, The days are prolonged,  every vision fails?
Ezek. Tell them therefore, Thus says the lord Jehovah: I will make this proverb to cease,  they shall no more use it as a proverb in Israel,  say to them, The days are at hand,  the fulfillment of every vision.
Ezek. For there shall no more be any false vision nor flattering divination within the house of Israel.
Ezek. For I am Jehovah. I will speak,  the word that I shall speak shall be performed. It shall be no more deferred. For in your days, O rebellious house, I will speak the word,  will perform it, says the lord Jehovah.
Ezek. Again the word of Jehovah came to me, saying,
Ezek. Son of man, behold, those of the house of Israel say, The vision that he sees is for many day to come,  he prophesies of times that are far off.
Ezek. Therefore say to them, Thus says the lord Jehovah: There shall none of my words be deferred any more,  the word which I shall speak shall be performed, says the lord Jehovah.
Ezek. And the word of Jehovah came to me, saying,
Ezek. Son of man, prophesy against the prophets of Israel who prophesy,  say thou to those who prophesy out of their own heart, Hear ye the word of Jehovah.
Ezek. Thus says the lord Jehovah: Woe to the foolish prophets, who follow their own spirit,  have seen nothing!
Ezek. O Israel, thy prophets have been like foxes in the waste places.
Ezek. Ye have not gone up into the gaps, nor built up the wall for the house of Israel to stand in the battle in the day of Jehovah.
Ezek. They have seen falsehood and lying divination, who say, Jehovah says,  Jehovah has not sent them. And they have made men to hope that the word would be confirmed.
Ezek. Have ye not seen a false vision,  have ye not spoken a lying divination, in that ye say, Jehovah says, albeit I have not spoken?
Ezek. Therefore thus says the lord Jehovah: Because ye have spoken falsehood,  seen lies, therefore, behold, I am against you, says the lord Jehovah.
Ezek. And my hand shall be against the prophets who see false visions,  who divine lies. They shall not be in the council of my people, nor shall they be written in the writing of the house of Israel, neither shall they enter into the land of Israel. And ye shall know that I am the lord Jehovah.
Ezek. Because, even because they have seduced my people, saying, Peace,  there is no peace,  when a man builds up a wall, behold, they daub it with untempered mortar,
Ezek. say to those who daub it with untempered mortar, that it shall fall. There shall be an overflowing shower,  ye, O great hailstones, shall fall,  a stormy wind shall rend it.
Ezek. Lo, when the wall has fallen, shall it not be said to you, Where is the daubing with which ye have daubed it?
Ezek. Therefore thus says the lord Jehovah: I will even rend it with a stormy wind in my wrath,  there shall be an overflowing shower in my anger,  great hailstones in wrath to consume it.
Ezek. So I will break down the wall that ye have daubed with untempered mortar,  bring it down to the ground, so that the foundation thereof shall be uncovered. And it shall fall,  ye shall be consumed in the midst of it. And ye shall know that I am Jehovah.
Ezek. Thus I will accomplish my wrath upon the wall,  upon those who have daubed it with untempered mortar. And I will say to you, The wall is no more, nor those who daubed it,
Ezek. namely, the prophets of Israel who prophesy concerning Jerusalem,  who see visions of peace for her,  there is no peace, says the lord Jehovah.
Ezek. And thou, son of man, set thy face against the daughters of thy people, who prophesy out of their own heart,  prophesy thou against them.
Ezek. And say, Thus says the lord Jehovah: Woe to the women who sew pillows upon all elbows,  make headdresses for the head of every stature to hunt souls! Will ye hunt the souls of my people,  save souls alive for yourselves?
Ezek. And ye have profaned me among my people for handfuls of barley and for pieces of bread, to kill the souls who should not die,  to save the souls alive who should not live, by your lying to my people who listen to lies.
Ezek. Therefore thus says the lord Jehovah: Behold, I am against your pillows, with which ye hunt the souls there to make fly,  I will tear them from your arms. And I will let the souls go, even the souls that ye hunt to make fly.
Ezek. I will also tear your headdresses,  deliver my people out of your hand,  they shall no more be in your hand to be hunted. And ye shall know that I am Jehovah.
Ezek. Because with lies ye have grieved the heart of the righteous, whom I have not made sad,  strengthened the hands of the wicked, that he should not return from his wicked way,  be saved alive.
Ezek. Therefore ye shall no more see false visions, nor divine divinations. And I will deliver my people out of your hand. And ye shall know that I am Jehovah.
Ezek. Then certain of the elders of Israel came to me,  sat before me.
Ezek. And the word of Jehovah came to me, saying,
Ezek. Son of man, these men have taken their idols into their heart,  put the stumbling block of their iniquity before their face. Should I be inquired of at all by them?
Ezek. Therefore speak to them,  say to them, Thus says the lord Jehovah: Every man of the house of Israel who takes his idols into his heart,  puts the stumbling block of his iniquity before his face,  comes to the prophet, I Jehovah will answer him in it according to the multitude of his idols,
Ezek. that I may take the house of Israel in their own heart, because they are all estranged from me through their idols.
Ezek. Therefore say to the house of Israel, Thus says the lord Jehovah: Return ye,  turn yourselves from your idols,  turn away your faces from all your abominations.
Ezek. For everyone of the house of Israel, or of the strangers who sojourn in Israel, that separates himself from me,  takes his idols into his heart,  puts the stumbling block of his iniquity before his face,  comes to the prophet to inquire for himself of me, I Jehovah will answer him by myself.
Ezek. And I will set my face against that man,  will make him an astonishment, for a sign and a proverb. And I will cut him off from the midst of my people. And ye shall know that I am Jehovah.
Ezek. And if the prophet is deceived and speaks a word, I, Jehovah, have deceived that prophet. And I will stretch out my hand upon him,  will destroy him from the midst of my people Israel.
Ezek. And they shall bear their iniquity. The iniquity of the prophet shall be even as the iniquity of him who seeks him,
Ezek. that the house of Israel may no more go astray from me, nor defile themselves any more with all their transgressions,  that they may be my people,  I may be their God, says the lord Jehovah.
Ezek. And the word of Jehovah came to me, saying,
Ezek. Son of man, when a land sins against me by committing a trespass,  I stretch out my hand upon it,  break the staff of the bread thereof,  send famine upon it,  cut off from it man and beast,
Ezek. though these three men, Noah, Daniel,  Job, were in it, they would deliver but their own souls by their righteousness, says the lord Jehovah.
Ezek. If I cause evil beasts to pass through the land,  they ravage it,  it be made desolate, so that no man may pass through because of the beasts,
Ezek. though these three men were in it, as I live, says the lord Jehovah, they would deliver neither sons nor daughters, they only would be delivered,  the land would be desolate.
Ezek. Or if I bring a sword upon that land,  say, Sword, go through the land, so that I cut off from it man and beast,
Ezek. though these three men were in it, as I live, says the lord Jehovah, they would deliver neither sons nor daughters,  they only would be delivered themselves.
Ezek. Or if I send a pestilence into that land,  pour out my wrath upon it in blood, to cut off from it man and beast,
Ezek. though Noah, Daniel,  Job, were in it, as I live, says the lord Jehovah, they would deliver neither son nor daughter, they would but deliver their own souls by their righteousness.
Ezek. For thus says the lord Jehovah: How much more when I send my four severe judgments upon Jerusalem, the sword,  the famine,  the evil beasts,  the pestilence, to cut off from it man and beast!
Ezek. Yet, behold, there shall be left a remnant in it that shall be carried forth, both sons and daughters. Behold, they shall come forth to you,  ye shall see their way and their doings. And ye shall be comforted concerning the evil that I have brought upon Jerusalem, even concerning all that I have brought upon it.
Ezek. And they shall comfort you when ye see their way and their doings. And ye shall know that I have not done all that I have done in it without cause, says the lord Jehovah.
Ezek. And the word of Jehovah came to me, saying,
Ezek. Son of man, what is the vine tree more than any tree, the vine branch which is among the trees of the forest?
Ezek. Shall wood be taken of it to make any work? Or will men take a pin of it to hang any vessel thereon?
Ezek. Behold, it is cast into the fire for fuel. The fire has devoured both the ends of it,  the midst of it is burned. Is it profitable for any work?
Ezek. Behold, when it was whole, it was fit for no work. How much less, when the fire has devoured it,  it is burned, shall it yet be fit for any work!
Ezek. Therefore thus says the lord Jehovah: As the vine tree among the trees of the forest, which I have given to the fire for fuel, so I will give the inhabitants of Jerusalem.
Ezek. And I will set my face against them. They shall go forth from the fire,  the fire shall devour them. And ye shall know that I am Jehovah when I set my face against them.
Ezek. And I will make the land desolate because they have committed a trespass, says the lord Jehovah.
Ezek. Again the word of Jehovah came to me, saying,
Ezek. Son of man, cause Jerusalem to know her abominations,
Ezek. and say, Thus says the lord Jehovah to Jerusalem: Thy birth and thy nativity is from the land of the Canaanite. The Amorite was thy father,  thy mother was a Hittite.
Ezek. And as for thy nativity, in the day thou were born thy navel was not cut, nor were thou washed in water to cleanse thee. Thou were not salted at all, nor swaddled at all.
Ezek. No eye pitied thee, to do any of these things to thee, to have compassion upon thee,  thou were cast out in the open field. For thy person was abhorred, in the day that thou were born.
Ezek. And when I passed by thee,  saw thee weltering in thy blood, I said to thee, in thy blood, Live! Yea, I said to thee, in thy blood, Live!
Ezek. I caused thee to multiply as that which grows in the field,  thou increased and grew great. And thou attained to excellent ornament, thy breasts were fashioned,  thy hair was grown. Yet thou were naked and bare.
Ezek. Now when I passed by thee,  looked upon thee, behold, thy time was the time of love. And I spread my skirt over thee,  covered thy nakedness. Yea, I swore to thee,  entered into a covenant with thee, says the lord Jehovah,  thou became mine.
Ezek. Then I washed thee with water. Yea, I thoroughly washed away thy blood from thee,  I anointed thee with oil.
Ezek. I also clothed thee with embroidered work,  shod thee with a certain skin. And I girded thee around with fine linen,  covered thee with silk.
Ezek. And I decked thee with ornaments,  I put bracelets upon thy hands,  a chain on thy neck.
Ezek. And I put a ring upon thy nose,  earrings in thine ears,  a beautiful crown upon thy head.
Ezek. Thus thou were decked with gold and silver,  thy raiment was of fine linen,  silk,  embroidered work. Thou ate fine flour,  honey,  oil. And thou were very beautiful,  thou prospered to royalty.
Ezek. And thy renown went forth among the nations for thy beauty. For it was perfect, through my majesty which I had put upon thee, says the lord Jehovah.
Ezek. But thou trusted in thy beauty,  played the harlot because of thy renown,  poured out thy whoredoms on everyone who passed by; his it was.
Ezek. And thou took of thy garments,  made high places for thee, decked with various colors,  played the harlot upon them, things which should not come, nor should it be.
Ezek. Thou also took thy fair jewels of my gold and of my silver, which I had given thee,  made for thee images of men,  played the harlot with them.
Ezek. And thou took thy embroidered garments,  covered them,  set my oil and my incense before them.
Ezek. My bread also which I gave thee, fine flour and oil and honey, with which I fed thee, thou even set it before them for a sweet savor,  thus it was, says the lord Jehovah.
Ezek. Moreover thou have taken thy sons and thy daughters, whom thou have borne to me,  thou have sacrificed these to them to be devoured. Were thy whoredoms a small matter,
Ezek. that thou have slain my children,  delivered them up, in causing them to pass through the fire to them?
Ezek. And in all thine abominations and thy whoredoms thou have not remembered the days of thy youth when thou were naked and bare,  were weltering in thy blood.
Ezek. And it has come to pass according to all thy wickedness, (woe, woe to thee! says the lord Jehovah),
Ezek. that thou have built thyself a vaulted place,  have made thee a lofty place in every street.
Ezek. Thou have built thy lofty place at the head of every way,  have made thy beauty an abomination. And have opened thy feet to everyone who passed by,  multiplied thy whoredom.
Ezek. Thou have also committed fornication with the Egyptians, thy neighbors, great of flesh,  have multiplied thy whoredom, to provoke me to anger.
Ezek. Behold therefore, I have stretched out my hand over thee,  have diminished thy portion,  delivered thee to the will of those who hate thee, the daughters of the Philistines, who are ashamed of thy lewd way.
Ezek. Thou have played the harlot also with the Assyrians, because thou were insatiable. Yea, thou have played the harlot with them,  yet thou were not satisfied.
Ezek. Thou have moreover multiplied thy whoredom to the land of traffic, to Chaldea,  yet thou were not satisfied with this.
Ezek. How weak is thy heart, says the lord Jehovah, seeing thou do all these things, the work of an impudent harlot,
Ezek. in that thou build thy vaulted place at the head of every way,  make thy lofty place in every street. And have not even been as a harlot, in that thou scorn hire.
Ezek. A wife who commits adultery, who takes strangers instead of her husband!
Ezek. They give gifts to all harlots,  thou give thy gifts to all thy lovers,  bribe them, that they may come to thee on every side for thy whoredoms.
Ezek. And thou are different from other women in thy whoredoms, in that none follows thee to play the harlot. And whereas thou give a wage,  no wage is given to thee, therefore thou are different.
Ezek. Therefore, O harlot, hear the word of Jehovah.
Ezek. Thus says the lord Jehovah: Because thy filthiness was poured out,  thy nakedness uncovered through thy whoredoms with thy lovers,  because of all the idols of thy abominations,  for the blood of thy sons, that thou gave to them,
Ezek. therefore, behold, I will gather all thy lovers, with whom thou have taken pleasure,  all those whom thou have loved, with all those whom thou have hated, I will even gather them against thee on every side. And I will uncover thy nakedness to them, that they may see all thy nakedness.
Ezek. And I will judge thee, as women who break wedlock and shed blood are judged. And I will bring upon thee the blood of wrath and jealousy.
Ezek. I will also give thee into their hand,  they shall throw down thy vaulted place,  break down thy lofty places. And they shall strip thee of thy clothes,  take thy fair jewels,  they shall leave thee naked and bare.
Ezek. They shall also bring up a company against thee,  they shall stone thee with stones,  thrust thee through with their swords.
Ezek. And they shall burn thy houses with fire,  execute judgments upon thee in the sight of many women. And I will cause thee to cease from playing the harlot,  thou shall also give no wage any more.
Ezek. So I will cause my wrath toward thee to rest,  my jealousy shall depart from thee,  I will be quiet,  will no more be angry.
Ezek. Because thou have not remembered the days of thy youth,  have raged against me in all these things, therefore, behold, I also will bring thy way upon thy head, says the lord Jehovah. And thou shall not commit this lewdness with all thine abominations.
Ezek. Behold, everyone who uses proverbs shall use this proverb against thee, saying, As is the mother, so is her daughter.
Ezek. Thou are the daughter of thy mother, who loathes her husband and her sons. And thou are the sister of thy sisters, who loathed their husbands and their sons. Your mother was a Hittite,  your father an Amorite.
Ezek. And thine elder sister is Samaria, who dwells at thy left hand, she and her daughters. And thy younger sister, who dwells at thy right hand, is Sodom and her daughters.
Ezek. Yet thou have not walked in their ways, nor done according to their abominations, , like it was a very little thing, thou were more corrupt than they in all thy ways.
Ezek. As I live, says the lord Jehovah, Sodom thy sister has not done, she nor her daughters, as thou have done, thou and thy daughters.
Ezek. Behold, this was the iniquity of thy sister Sodom: pride, fullness of bread,  prosperous ease was in her and in her daughters,  she did not strengthen the hand of a poor and needy man.
Ezek. And they were haughty,  committed abomination before me. Therefore I took them away as I saw fit.
Ezek. Neither has Samaria committed half of thy sins,  thou have multiplied thine abominations more than they,  have justified thy sisters by all thine abominations which thou have done.
Ezek. Thou also, bear thou thine own shame, in that thou have given judgment for thy sisters, through thy sins that thou have committed more abominable than they. They are more righteous than thou. Yea, be thou also confounded,  bear thy shame, in that thou have justified thy sisters.
Ezek. And I will turn back again their captivity, the captivity of Sodom and her daughters,  the captivity of Samaria and her daughters,  the captivity of thy captives in the midst of them,
Ezek. that thou may bear thine own shame,  may be ashamed because of all that thou have done, in that thou are a comfort to them.
Ezek. And thy sisters, Sodom and her daughters, shall return to their former estate,  Samaria and her daughters shall return to their former estate,  thou and thy daughters shall return to your former estate.
Ezek. For thy sister Sodom was not mentioned by thy mouth in the day of thy pride,
Ezek. before thy wickedness was uncovered, as at the time of the reproach of the daughters of Syria,  of all who are round about her, the daughters of the Philistines, who do despite to thee round about.
Ezek. Thou have borne thy lewdness and thine abominations, says Jehovah.
Ezek. For thus says the lord Jehovah: I will also deal with thee as thou have done, who have despised the oath in breaking the covenant.
Ezek. Nevertheless I will remember my covenant with thee in the days of thy youth,  I will establish to thee an everlasting covenant.
Ezek. Then thou shall remember thy ways,  be ashamed, when thou shall receive thy sisters, thine elder sisters and thy younger,  I will give them to thee for daughters,  not by thy covenant.
Ezek. And I will establish my covenant with thee,  thou shall know that I am Jehovah,
Ezek. that thou may remember,  be confounded,  never open thy mouth any more, because of thy shame, when I have forgiven thee all that thou have done, says the lord Jehovah.
Ezek. And the word of Jehovah came to me, saying,
Ezek. Son of man, put forth a riddle,  speak a parable to the house of Israel,
Ezek. and say, Thus says the lord Jehovah: A great eagle with great wings and long pinions, full of feathers, which had various colors, came to Lebanon,  took the top of the cedar.
Ezek. He cropped off the topmost of the young twigs of it,  carried it to a land of merchandise. He set it in a city of merchants.
Ezek. He took also of the seed of the land,  planted it in a fruitful soil. He placed it beside many waters. He set it as a willow tree.
Ezek. And it grew,  became a spreading vine of low stature, whose branches turned toward him,  the roots of it were under him. So it became a vine,  brought forth branches,  shot forth sprigs.
Ezek. There was also another great eagle with great wings and many feathers. And, behold, this vine bent its roots toward him,  shot forth its branches toward him, from the beds of its plantation, that he might water it.
Ezek. It was planted in a good soil by many waters that it might bring forth branches,  that it might bear fruit that it might be a goodly vine.
Ezek. Say thou, Thus says the lord Jehovah: Shall it flourish? Shall he not pull up the roots of it,  cut off the fruit of it, that it may wither? It shall wither in all its fresh springing leaves, even without great power or many people to pluck it up by the roots of it.
Ezek. Yea, behold, being planted, shall it flourish? Shall it not utterly wither when the east wind touches it? It shall wither in the beds where it grew.
Ezek. Moreover the word of Jehovah came to me, saying,
Ezek. Say now to the rebellious house, Know ye not what these things mean? Tell them, Behold, the king of Babylon came to Jerusalem,  took the king of it,  the rulers of it,  brought them to him to Babylon.
Ezek. And he took of the seed royal,  made a covenant with him. He also brought him under an oath,  took away the mighty of the land,
Ezek. that the kingdom might be base, that it might not lift itself up,  that by keeping his covenant it might stand.
Ezek. But he rebelled against him in sending his ambassadors into Egypt that they might give him horses and many people. Shall he prosper? Shall he escape who does such things? Shall he break the covenant,  yet escape?
Ezek. As I live, says the lord Jehovah, surely in the place where the king dwells who made him king, whose oath he despised,  whose covenant he broke, even with him in the midst of Babylon he shall die.
Ezek. Nor shall Pharaoh with his mighty army and great company help him in the war when they cast up mounds and build forts to cut off many persons.
Ezek. For he has despised the oath by breaking the covenant. And, behold, he had given his hand,  yet has done all these things. He shall not escape.
Ezek. Therefore thus says the lord Jehovah: As I live, surely my oath that he has despised,  my covenant that he has broken, I will even bring it upon his own head.
Ezek. And I will spread my net upon him,  he shall be taken in my snare. And I will bring him to Babylon,  will enter into judgment with him there for his trespass that he has trespassed against me.
Ezek. And all his fugitives in all his groups shall fall by the sword,  those who remain shall be scattered toward every wind. And ye shall know that I, Jehovah, have spoken it.
Ezek. Thus says the lord Jehovah: I will also take of the lofty top of the cedar,  will set it. I will crop off a tender one from the topmost of its young twigs,  I will plant it upon a high and lofty mountain.
Ezek. I will plant it in the mountain of the height of Israel,  it shall bring forth boughs,  bear fruit,  be a goodly cedar. And all birds of every wing shall dwell under it; they shall dwell in the shade of the branches thereof.
Ezek. And all the trees of the field shall know that I, Jehovah, have brought down the high tree, have exalted the low tree, have dried up the green tree,  have made the dry tree to flourish. I, Jehovah, have spoken and have done it.
Ezek. The word of Jehovah came to me again, saying,
Ezek. What do ye mean, that ye use this proverb concerning the land of Israel, saying, The fathers have eaten sour grapes,  the son's teeth are set on edge?
Ezek. As I live, says the lord Jehovah, ye shall not have occasion any more to use this proverb in Israel.
Ezek. Behold, all souls are mine, as the soul of the father, so also the soul of the son is mine. The soul that sins, it shall die.
Ezek. But if a man be just,  does that which is lawful and right,
Ezek. and has not eaten upon the mountains, nor has lifted up his eyes to the idols of the house of Israel, nor has defiled his neighbor's wife, nor has come near to a woman in her impurity,
Ezek. and has not wronged any man,  has restored to the debtor his pledge, has taken nothing by robbery, has given his bread to a hungry man,  has covered a naked man with a garment,
Ezek. he who has not given forth upon interest, nor has taken any increase, who has withdrawn his hand from iniquity, has executed true justice between man and man,
Ezek. has walked in my statutes,  has kept my ordinances, to deal truly, he is just. He shall surely live, says the lord Jehovah.
Ezek. If he begets a son who is a robber, a shedder of blood,  who does any one of these things,
Ezek. and who does not do any of those duties,  has even eaten upon the mountains,  defiled his neighbor's wife,
Ezek. has wronged the poor and needy man, has taken by robbery, has not restored the pledge,  has lifted up his eyes to the idols, has committed abomination,
Ezek. has given forth upon interest,  has taken increase, shall he then live? He shall not live. He has done all these abominations. He shall surely die. His blood shall be upon him.
Ezek. Now, lo, if he begets a son, who sees all his father's sins, which he has done,  fears,  does not do such like,
Ezek. who has not eaten upon the mountains, nor has lifted up his eyes to the idols of the house of Israel, has not defiled his neighbor's wife,
Ezek. nor has wronged any man, has not taken anything to pledge, nor has taken by robbery,  has given his bread to a hungry man,  has covered a naked man with a garment,
Ezek. who has withdrawn his hand from a poor man, who has not received interest nor increase, has executed my ordinances, has walked in my statutes, he shall not die for the iniquity of his father. He shall surely live.
Ezek. As for his father, because he cruelly oppressed, robbed his brother,  did that which is not good among his people, behold, he shall die in his iniquity.
Ezek. Yet ye say, Why does not the son bear the iniquity of the father? When the son has done that which is lawful and right,  has kept all my statutes,  has done them, he shall surely live.
Ezek. The soul that sins, it shall die. The son shall not bear the iniquity of the father, nor shall the father bear the iniquity of the son. The righteousness of a righteous man shall be upon him,  the wickedness of a wicked man shall be upon him.
Ezek. But if a wicked man turns from all his sins that he has committed,  keeps all my statutes,  does that which is lawful and right, he shall surely live. He shall not die.
Ezek. None of his transgressions that he has committed shall be remembered against him. In his righteousness that he has done he shall live.
Ezek. Have I any pleasure in the death of a wicked man? says the lord Jehovah,  not rather that he should return from his way,  live?
Ezek. But when a righteous man turns away from his righteousness,  commits iniquity,  does according to all the abominations that a wicked man does, shall he live? None of his righteous deeds that he has done shall be remembered. In his trespass that he has trespassed,  in his sin that he has sinned, in them he shall die.
Ezek. Yet ye say, The way of the Lord is not equitable. Hear now, O house of Israel. Is not my way equitable? Are not your ways inequitable?
Ezek. When a righteous man turns away from his righteousness,  commits iniquity,  dies in it, in his iniquity that he has done, he shall die.
Ezek. Again, when a wicked man turns away from his wickedness that he has committed,  does that which is lawful and right, he shall save his soul alive.
Ezek. Because he considers,  turns away from all his transgressions that he has committed, he shall surely live. He shall not die.
Ezek. Yet the house of Israel says, The way of the Lord is not equitable. O house of Israel, are not my ways equitable? Are not your ways inequitable?
Ezek. Therefore I will judge you, O house of Israel, each one according to his ways, says the lord Jehovah. Return ye,  turn yourselves from all your transgressions, so iniquity shall not be your ruin.
Ezek. Cast away from you all your transgressions, by which ye have transgressed,  make you a new heart and a new spirit. For why will ye die, O house of Israel?
Ezek. For I have no pleasure in the death of him who dies, says the lord Jehovah, therefore turn yourselves back,  live.
Ezek. Moreover, take thou up a lamentation for the rulers of Israel,
Ezek. and say, What was thy mother? A lioness. She couched among lions. In the midst of the young lions she nourished her whelps.
Ezek. And she brought up one of her whelps. He became a young lion,  he learned to catch the prey. He devoured men.
Ezek. The nations also heard of him. He was taken in their pit,  they brought him with hooks to the land of Egypt.
Ezek. Now when she saw that she had waited,  her hope was lost, then she took another of her whelps,  made him a young lion.
Ezek. And he went up and down among the lions. He became a young lion,  he learned to catch the prey. He devoured men.
Ezek. And he knew their palaces,  laid waste their cities. And the land was desolate,  the fullness of it, because of the noise of his roaring.
Ezek. Then the nations set against him on every side from the provinces,  they spread their net over him. He was taken in their pit.
Ezek. And they put him in a cage with hooks,  brought him to the king of Babylon. They brought him into strongholds, that his voice should no more be heard upon the mountains of Israel.
Ezek. Thy mother was like a vine in thy blood, planted by the waters. It was fruitful and full of branches because of many waters.
Ezek. And it had strong twigs for the scepters of those who bore rule. And their stature was exalted among the thick boughs,  they were seen in their height with the multitude of their branches.
Ezek. But it was plucked up in fury. It was cast down to the ground,  the east wind dried up its fruit. Its strong twigs were broken off and withered. The fire consumed them.
Ezek. And now it is planted in the wilderness, in a dry and thirsty land.
Ezek. And fire has gone out of the twigs of its branches. It has devoured its fruit, so that there is no strong twig in it to be a scepter to rule. This is a lamentation,  shall be for a lamentation.
Ezek. And it came to pass in the seventh year, in the fifth month, the tenth day of the month, that certain of the elders of Israel came to inquire of Jehovah,  sat before me.
Ezek. And the word of Jehovah came to me, saying,
Ezek. Son of man, speak to the elders of Israel,  say to them, Thus says the lord Jehovah: Is it to inquire of me that ye have come? As I live, says the lord Jehovah, I will not be inquired of by you.
Ezek. Will thou judge them, son of man, will thou judge them? Cause them to know the abominations of their fathers,
Ezek. and say to them, Thus says the lord Jehovah: In the day when I chose Israel,  swore to the seed of the house of Jacob,  made myself known to them in the land of Egypt, when I swore to them, saying, I am Jehovah your God,
Ezek. I swore to them in that day, to bring them forth out of the land of Egypt into a land that I had searched out for them, flowing with milk and honey, which is the glory of all lands.
Ezek. And I said to them, Cast ye away every man the abominations of his eyes,  do not defile yourselves with the idols of Egypt. I am Jehovah your God.
Ezek. But they rebelled against me,  would not hearken to me. They did not every man cast away the abominations of their eyes, nor did they forsake the idols of Egypt. Then I said I would pour out my wrath upon them, to accomplish my anger against them in the midst of the land of Egypt.
Ezek. But I worked for my name's sake (that it should not be profaned in the sight of the nations, among which they were, in whose sight I made myself known to them) in bringing them forth out of the land of Egypt.
Ezek. So I caused them to go forth out of the land of Egypt,  brought them into the wilderness.
Ezek. And I gave them my statutes,  showed them my ordinances, which if a man does, he shall live in them.
Ezek. Moreover I also gave them my sabbaths, to be a sign between me and them, that they might know that I am Jehovah who sanctifies them.
Ezek. But the house of Israel rebelled against me in the wilderness. They did not walk in my statutes,  they rejected my ordinances, which if a man keeps, he shall live in them. And they greatly profaned my sabbaths. Then I said I would pour out my wrath upon them in the wilderness, to consume them.
Ezek. But I worked for my name's sake, that it should not be profaned in the sight of the nations, in whose sight I brought them out.
Ezek. Moreover also I swore to them in the wilderness, that I would not bring them into the land which I had given them, flowing with milk and honey, which is the glory of all lands,
Ezek. because they rejected my ordinances,  did not walk in my statutes,  profaned my sabbaths, for their heart went after their idols.
Ezek. Nevertheless my eye spared them,  I did not destroy them, nor did I make a full end of them in the wilderness.
Ezek. And I said to their sons in the wilderness, Walk ye not in the statutes of your fathers. Neither observe their ordinances, nor defile yourselves with their idols.
Ezek. I am Jehovah your God. Walk in my statutes,  keep my ordinances,  do them,
Ezek. and hallow my sabbaths,  they shall be a sign between me and you, that ye may know that I am Jehovah your God.
Ezek. But the sons rebelled against me. They did not walk in my statutes, nor kept my ordinances to do them, which if a man does, he shall live in them. They profaned my sabbaths. Then I said I would pour out my wrath upon them, to accomplish my anger against them in the wilderness.
Ezek. Nevertheless I withdrew my hand,  worked for my name's sake, that it should not be profaned in the sight of the nations, in whose sight I brought them forth.
Ezek. Moreover I swore to them in the wilderness, that I would scatter them among the nations,  disperse them through the countries,
Ezek. because they had not executed my ordinances,  had rejected my statutes,  had profaned my sabbaths,  their eyes were after their fathers' idols.
Ezek. Moreover I also gave them statutes that were not good,  ordinances in which they will not live.
Ezek. And I polluted them in their own gifts, in that they caused to pass through the fire all that opens the womb, that I might make them desolate, to the end that they might know that I am Jehovah.
Ezek. Therefore, son of man, speak to the house of Israel,  say to them, Thus says the lord Jehovah: In this moreover your fathers have blasphemed me, in that they have committed a trespass against me.
Ezek. For when I had brought them into the land, which I swore to give to them, then they saw every high hill,  every thick tree,  they offered there their sacrifices,  there they presented the provocation of their offering. There also they made their sweet savor,  they poured out there their drink offerings.
Ezek. Then I said to them, What does the high place to which ye go mean? So the name of it is called Bamah to this day.
Ezek. Therefore say to the house of Israel, Thus says the lord Jehovah: Do ye pollute yourselves according to the manner of your fathers,  play ye the harlot according to their abominations?
Ezek. And when ye offer your gifts, when ye make your sons to pass through the fire, do ye pollute yourselves with all your idols to this day? And shall I be inquired of by you, O house of Israel? As I live, says the lord Jehovah, I will not be inquired of by you.
Ezek. And that which comes into your mind shall not be at all, in that ye say, We will be as the nations, as the families of the countries, to serve wood and stone.
Ezek. As I live, says the lord Jehovah, surely with a mighty hand,  with an outstretched arm,  with wrath poured out, I will be king over you.
Ezek. And I will bring you out from the peoples,  will gather you out of the countries in which ye are scattered, with a mighty hand,  with an outstretched arm,  with wrath poured out,
Ezek. and I will bring you into the wilderness of the peoples. And there I will enter into judgment with you face to face.
Ezek. Just as I entered into judgment with your fathers in the wilderness of the land of Egypt, so I will enter into judgment with you, says the lord Jehovah.
Ezek. And I will cause you to pass under the rod. And I will bring you into the bond of the covenant.
Ezek. And I will purge out from among you the rebels,  those who transgress against me. I will bring them forth out of the land where they sojourn,  they shall not enter into the land of Israel. And ye shall know that I am Jehovah.
Ezek. As for you, O house of Israel, thus says the lord Jehovah: Go ye. Serve each one his idols,  hereafter also, if ye will not hearken to me. But ye shall no more profane my holy name with your gifts,  with your idols.
Ezek. For in my holy mountain, in the mountain of the height of Israel, says the lord Jehovah, there shall all the house of Israel, all of them, serve me in the land. There I will accept them,  there I will require your offerings,  the first-fruits of your oblations, with all your holy things.
Ezek. I will accept you as a sweet savor when I bring you out from the peoples,  gather you out of the countries in which ye have been scattered. And I will be sanctified in you in the sight of the nations.
Ezek. And ye shall know that I am Jehovah when I shall bring you into the land of Israel, into the country which I swore to give to your fathers.
Ezek. And there ye shall remember your ways,  all your doings, by which ye have polluted yourselves. And ye shall loathe yourselves in your own sight for all your evils that ye have committed.
Ezek. And ye shall know that I am Jehovah when I have dealt with you for my name's sake, not according to your evil ways, nor according to your corrupt doings, O ye house of Israel, says the lord Jehovah.
Ezek. And the word of Jehovah came to me, saying,
Ezek. Son of man, set thy face toward the south,  drop thy word toward the south,  prophesy against the forest of the field in the South.
Ezek. And say to the forest of the South, Hear the word of Jehovah. Thus says the lord Jehovah: Behold, I will kindle a fire in thee,  it shall devour every green tree in thee,  every dry tree. The flaming flame shall not be quenched,  all faces from the south to the north shall be burnt by it.
Ezek. And all flesh shall see that I, Jehovah, have kindled it. It shall not be quenched.
Ezek. Then I said, Ah lord Jehovah! They say of me, Is he not a speaker of parables?
Ezek. And the word of Jehovah came to me, saying,
Ezek. Son of man, set thy face toward Jerusalem,  drop thy word toward the sanctuaries,  prophesy against the land of Israel.
Ezek. And say to the land of Israel, Thus says Jehovah: Behold, I am against thee. And will draw forth my sword out of its sheath,  will cut off from thee the righteous and the wicked.
Ezek. Seeing then that I will cut off from thee the righteous and the wicked, therefore my sword shall go forth out of its sheath against all flesh from the south to the north.
Ezek. And all flesh shall know that I, Jehovah, have drawn forth my sword out of its sheath. It shall not return any more.
Ezek. Sigh therefore, thou son of man. With the breaking of thy loins and with bitterness thou shall sigh before their eyes.
Ezek. And it shall be, when they say to thee, Why do thou sigh? That thou shall say, Because of the news. For it comes,  every heart shall melt,  all hands shall be feeble,  every spirit shall faint,  all knees shall be weak as water. Behold, it comes,  it shall be done, says the lord Jehovah.
Ezek. And the word of Jehovah came to me, saying,
Ezek. Son of man, prophesy,  say, Thus says Jehovah: Say, A sword, a sword. It is sharpened,  also furbished.
Ezek. It is sharpened that it may make a slaughter. It is polished that it may be as lightning. Shall we then make mirth? It scorns the scepter of my son, every tree.
Ezek. And it is given to be polished, that it may be handled. The sword, it is sharpened, yea, it is polished, to give it into the hand of the slayer.
Ezek. Cry and wail, son of man, for it is upon my people. It is upon all the rulers of Israel. They are delivered over to the sword with my people. Smite therefore upon thy thigh.
Ezek. For there is a trial,  what if even the rod that scorns shall be no more? says the lord Jehovah.
Ezek. Thou therefore, son of man, prophesy,  smite thy hands together. And let the sword be doubled the third time, the sword of the deadly wounded. It is the sword of the great man who is deadly wounded, which enters into their chambers.
Ezek. I have set the threatening sword against all their gates, that their heart may melt,  their stumblings be multiplied. Ah! It is made as lightning. It is pointed for slaughter.
Ezek. Gather thee together. Go to the right. Set thyself in array. Go to the left, wherever thy face is set.
Ezek. I will also smite my hands together,  I will cause my wrath to rest. I, Jehovah, have spoken it.
Ezek. The word of Jehovah came to me again, saying,
Ezek. Also, thou son of man, appoint thee two ways that the sword of the king of Babylon may come. Those two shall come forth out of one land. And mark out a place. Mark it out at the head of the way to the city.
Ezek. Thou shall appoint a way for the sword to come to Rabbah of the sons of Ammon,  to Judah in Jerusalem the fortified.
Ezek. For the king of Babylon stood at the parting of the way, at the head of the two ways, to use divination. He shook the arrows to and fro. He consulted the teraphim. He looked in the liver.
Ezek. In his right hand was the divination for Jerusalem, to set battering rams, to open the mouth in the slaughter, to lift up the voice with shouting, to set battering rams against the gates, to cast up mounds, to build forts.
Ezek. And it shall be to them as a false divination in their sight, who have sworn oaths to them. But he brings iniquity to remembrance, that they may be taken.
Ezek. Therefore thus says the lord Jehovah: Because ye have made your iniquity to be remembered, in that your transgressions are uncovered, so that in all your doings your sins do appear, because ye have come to remembrance, ye shall be taken with the hand.
Ezek. And thou, O deadly wounded wicked man, the ruler of Israel, whose day has come, in the time of the iniquity of the end,
Ezek. thus says the lord Jehovah: Remove the miter,  take off the crown. This shall be no more the same. Exalt that which is low,  abase that which is high.
Ezek. I will overturn, overturn, overturn it. This also shall be no more, until he comes whose right it is. And I will give it.
Ezek. And thou, son of man, prophesy,  say, Thus says the lord Jehovah concerning the sons of Ammon,  concerning their reproach. And say thou, A sword, a sword is drawn. It is polished for the slaughter, to cause it to devour, that it may be as lightning,
Ezek. while they see for thee false visions, while they divine lies to thee, to lay thee upon the necks of the wicked who are deadly wounded, whose day has come in the time of the iniquity of the end.
Ezek. Cause it to return into its sheath. In the place where thou were created, in the land of thy birth, I will judge thee.
Ezek. And I will pour out my indignation upon thee. I will blow upon thee with the fire of my wrath,  I will deliver thee into the hand of brutish men, skilful to destroy.
Ezek. Thou shall be for fuel to the fire. Thy blood shall be in the midst of the land. Thou shall no more be remembered. For I, Jehovah, have spoken it.
Ezek. Moreover the word of Jehovah came to me, saying,
Ezek. And thou, son of man, will thou judge, will thou judge the bloody city? Then cause her to know all her abominations.
Ezek. And thou shall say, Thus says the lord Jehovah: A city that sheds blood in the midst of her, that her time may come,  who makes idols against herself to defile her!
Ezek. Thou have become guilty in thy blood that thou have shed,  are defiled in thine idols which thou have made. And thou have caused thy days to draw near,  have come even to thy years. Therefore I have made thee a reproach to the nations,  a mocking to all the countries.
Ezek. Those that are near,  those that are far from thee, shall mock thee, thou infamous one, full of tumult.
Ezek. Behold, the rulers of Israel, each one according to his power, have been in thee to shed blood.
Ezek. In thee they have made light of father and mother. In the midst of thee they have dealt with the sojourner by oppression. In thee they have wronged the fatherless and the widow.
Ezek. Thou have despised my holy things,  have profaned my sabbaths.
Ezek. Slanderous men have been in thee to shed blood,  in thee they have eaten upon the mountains. In the midst of thee they have committed lewdness.
Ezek. In thee they have uncovered their fathers' nakedness. In thee they have humbled her who was unclean in her impurity.
Ezek. And one has committed abomination with his neighbor's wife,  another has lewdly defiled his daughter-in-law,  another in thee has humbled his sister, his father's daughter.
Ezek. In thee they have taken bribes to shed blood. Thou have taken interest and increase. And thou have greedily gained from thy neighbors by oppression,  have forgotten me, says the lord Jehovah.
Ezek. Behold, therefore, I have smitten my hand at thy dishonest gain which thou have made,  at thy blood which has been in the midst of thee.
Ezek. Can thy heart endure, or can thy hands be strong, in the days that I shall deal with thee? I, Jehovah, have spoken it,  will do it.
Ezek. And I will scatter thee among the nations,  disperse thee through the countries,  I will consume thy filthiness out of thee.
Ezek. And thou shall be profaned in thyself, in the sight of the nations. And thou shall know that I am Jehovah.
Ezek. And the word of Jehovah came to me, saying,
Ezek. Son of man, the house of Israel has become dross to me. All of them are brass,  tin,  iron,  lead, in the midst of the furnace. They are the dross of silver.
Ezek. Therefore thus says the lord Jehovah: Because ye have all become dross, therefore, behold, I will gather you into the midst of Jerusalem
Ezek. as they gather silver and brass and iron and lead and tin into the midst of the furnace, to blow the fire upon it, to melt it. So I will gather you in my anger and in my wrath,  I will lay you there,  melt you.
Ezek. Yea, I will gather you,  blow upon you with the fire of my wrath,  ye shall be melted in the midst of it.
Ezek. As silver is melted in the midst of the furnace, so ye shall be melted in the midst of it. And ye shall know that I, Jehovah, have poured out my wrath upon you.
Ezek. And the word of Jehovah came to me, saying,
Ezek. Son of man, say to her, Thou are a land that is not cleansed, nor rained upon in the day of indignation.
Ezek. There is a conspiracy by her prophets in the midst of it, like a roaring lion ravening the prey. They have devoured souls. They take treasure and precious things. They have made her widows many in the midst thereof.
Ezek. Her priests have done violence to my law,  have profaned my holy things. They have made no distinction between the holy and the common, nor have they caused men to discern between the unclean and the clean,  have hid their eyes from my sabbaths,  I am profaned among them.
Ezek. Her rulers in the midst of it are like wolves ravening the prey, to shed blood, to destroy souls, that they may get dishonest gain.
Ezek. And her prophets have daubed for them with untempered mortar, seeing false visions,  divining lies to them, saying, Thus says the lord Jehovah, when Jehovah has not spoken.
Ezek. The people of the land have used oppression,  exercised robbery. Yea, they have vexed the poor and needy man,  have oppressed the sojourner wrongfully.
Ezek. And I sought for a man among them who should build up the wall,  stand in the gap before me for the land, that I should not destroy it,  I found none.
Ezek. Therefore I have poured out my indignation upon them. I have consumed them with the fire of my wrath. I have brought their own way upon their heads, says the lord Jehovah.
Ezek. The word of Jehovah came again to me, saying,
Ezek. Son of man, there were two women, the daughters of one mother.
Ezek. And they played the harlot in Egypt. They played the harlot in their youth. There their breasts were pressed,  there was handled the bosom of their virginity.
Ezek. And the names of them were Oholah the elder,  Oholibah her sister. And they became mine,  they bore sons and daughters. And as for their names, Samaria is Oholah,  Jerusalem Oholibah.
Ezek. And Oholah played the harlot when she was mine,  she doted on her lovers, on the Assyrians her neighbors,
Ezek. who were clothed with blue, governors and rulers, all of them desirable young men, horsemen riding upon horses.
Ezek. And she bestowed her whoredoms upon them, the choicest men of Assyria all of them. And on whomever she doted, with all their idols she defiled herself.
Ezek. Neither has she left her whoredoms since Egypt. For in her youth they lie with her,  they handled the bosom of her virginity,  they poured out their whoredom upon her.
Ezek. Therefore I delivered her into the hand of her lovers, into the hand of the Assyrians, upon whom she doted.
Ezek. These uncovered her nakedness. They took her sons and her daughters,  they killed her with the sword. And she became a byword among women, for they executed judgments upon her.
Ezek. And her sister Oholibah saw this, yet she was more corrupt in her doting than she,  in her whoredoms which were more than the whoredoms of her sister.
Ezek. She doted upon the Assyrians, governors and rulers, her neighbors, clothed most gorgeously, horsemen riding upon horses, all of them desirable young men.
Ezek. And I saw that she was defiled. They both took one way.
Ezek. And she increased her whoredoms, for she saw men portrayed upon the wall, the images of the Chaldeans portrayed with vermilion,
Ezek. girded with belts upon their loins, with flowing turbans upon their heads, all of them rulers to look upon, according to the likeness of the Babylonians in Chaldea, the land of their nativity.
Ezek. And as soon as she saw them she doted upon them,  sent messengers to them into Chaldea.
Ezek. And the Babylonians came to her into the bed of love. And they defiled her with their whoredom,  she was polluted with them,  her soul was alienated from them.
Ezek. So she uncovered her whoredoms,  uncovered her nakedness. Then my soul was alienated from her, just as my soul was alienated from her sister.
Ezek. Yet she multiplied her whoredoms, remembering the days of her youth in which she had played the harlot in the land of Egypt.
Ezek. And she doted upon their paramours, whose flesh is as the flesh of donkeys,  whose issue is like the issue of horses.
Ezek. Thus thou called to remembrance the lewdness of thy youth, in the handling of thy bosom by the Egyptians for the breasts of thy youth.
Ezek. Therefore, O Oholibah, thus says the lord Jehovah: Behold, I will raise up thy lovers against thee, from whom thy soul is alienated,  I will bring them against thee on every side:
Ezek. the Babylonians and all the Chaldeans, Pekod and Shoa and Koa,  all the Assyrians with them, desirable young men, governors and rulers all of them, rulers and men of renown, all of them riding upon horses.
Ezek. And they shall come against thee with weapons, chariots,  wagons,  with a company of peoples. They shall set themselves against thee with buckler and shield and helmet round about. And I will commit the judgment to them,  they shall judge thee according to their judgments.
Ezek. And I will set my jealousy against thee,  they shall deal with thee in fury. They shall take away thy nose and thine ears,  thy residue shall fall by the sword. They shall take thy sons and thy daughters,  thy residue shall be devoured by the fire.
Ezek. They shall also strip thee of thy clothes,  take away thy fair jewels.
Ezek. Thus I will make thy lewdness to cease from thee,  thy whoredom from the land of Egypt, so that thou shall not lift up thine eyes to them, nor remember Egypt any more.
Ezek. For thus says the lord Jehovah: Behold, I will deliver thee into the hand of those whom thou hate, into the hand of those from whom thy soul is alienated.
Ezek. And they shall deal with thee in hatred,  shall take away all thy labor,  shall leave thee naked and bare. And the nakedness of thy whoredoms shall be uncovered, both thy lewdness and thy whoredoms.
Ezek. These things shall be done to thee, because thou have played the harlot after the nations,  because thou are polluted with their idols.
Ezek. Thou have walked in the way of thy sister, therefore I will give her cup into thy hand.
Ezek. Thus says the lord Jehovah: Thou shall drink of thy sister's cup, which is deep and large. Thou shall be laughed to scorn and had in derision. It contains much.
Ezek. Thou shall be filled with drunkenness and sorrow, with the cup of astonishment and desolation, with the cup of thy sister Samaria.
Ezek. Thou shall even drink it and drain it out. And thou shall gnaw the shards of it,  shall tear thy breasts, for I have spoken it, says the lord Jehovah.
Ezek. Therefore thus says the lord Jehovah: Because thou have forgotten me,  cast me behind thy back, therefore thou also bear thy lewdness and thy whoredoms.
Ezek. Jehovah said moreover to me, Son of man, will thou judge Oholah and Oholibah? Then declare to them their abominations.
Ezek. For they have committed adultery,  blood is in their hands. And with their idols they have committed adultery. And they have also caused their sons, whom they bore to me, to pass through the fire for them to be devoured.
Ezek. Moreover they have done this to me: They have defiled my sanctuary in the same day,  have profaned my sabbaths.
Ezek. For when they had slain their sons to their idols, then they came the same day into my sanctuary to profane it, , lo, thus they have done in the midst of my house.
Ezek. And furthermore ye have sent for men who come from far, to whom a messenger was sent. And, lo, they came, for whom thou washed thyself, painted thine eyes,  decked thyself with ornaments,
Ezek. and sat upon a stately bed, with a table prepared before it, whereupon thou did set my incense and my oil.
Ezek. And the voice of a multitude being at ease was with her. And with men of the common sort, were brought drunkards from the wilderness,  they put bracelets upon the hands of those two women,  beautiful crowns upon their heads.
Ezek. Then I said of her who was old in adulteries, Now they will play the harlot with her,  she with them.
Ezek. And they went in to her, as they go in to a harlot. So they went in to Oholah and to Oholibah, the lewd women.
Ezek. And righteous men, they shall judge them with the judgment of adulteresses,  with the judgment of women who shed blood, because they are adulteresses,  blood is on their hands.
Ezek. For thus says the lord Jehovah: I will bring up a company against them,  will give them to be tossed to and fro and robbed.
Ezek. And the company shall stone them with stones,  dispatch them with their swords. They shall kill their sons and their daughters,  burn up their houses with fire.
Ezek. Thus I will cause lewdness to cease out of the land, that all women may be taught not to do according to your lewdness.
Ezek. And they shall recompense your lewdness upon you,  ye shall bear the sins of your idols. And ye shall know that I am the lord Jehovah.
Ezek. Again, in the ninth year, in the tenth month, in the tenth day of the month, the word of Jehovah came to me, saying,
Ezek. Son of man, write thee the name of the day, even of this selfsame day; the king of Babylon drew close to Jerusalem this selfsame day.
Ezek. And utter a parable to the rebellious house,  say to them, Thus says the lord Jehovah: Set on the caldron. Set it on,  also pour water into it.
Ezek. Gather the pieces of it into it, even every good piece, the thigh,  the shoulder; fill it with the choice bones.
Ezek. Take the choice of the flock,  also a pile of wood for the bones under the caldron. Make it boil well, yea, let the bones of it be boiled in the midst of it.
Ezek. Therefore thus says the lord Jehovah: Woe to the bloody city, to the caldron whose rust is therein,  whose rust has not gone out of it! Take out of it piece after piece. No lot has fallen upon it.
Ezek. For her blood is in the midst of her. She set it upon the bare rock. She did not pour it upon the ground to cover it with dust.
Ezek. That it may cause wrath to come up to take vengeance, I have set her blood upon the bare rock, that it should not be covered.
Ezek. Therefore thus says the lord Jehovah: Woe to the bloody city! I also will make the pile great.
Ezek. Heap on the wood; make the fire hot. Boil the flesh well,  make the broth thick. And let the bones be burned.
Ezek. Then set it empty upon the coals of it, that it may be hot,  the brass of it may burn,  that the filthiness of it may be molten in it, that the scum of it may be consumed.
Ezek. She has wearied herself with toil, yet her great scum does not go forth out of her, her scum by fire.
Ezek. In thy filthiness is lewdness. Because I have cleansed thee and thou were not cleansed, thou shall not be cleansed from thy filthiness any more, till I have caused my wrath toward thee to rest.
Ezek. I, Jehovah, have spoken it. It shall come to pass,  I will do it. I will not go back. I will neither spare, nor will I relent. According to thy ways,  according to thy doings, they shall judge thee, says the lord Jehovah.
Ezek. Also the word of Jehovah came to me, saying,
Ezek. Son of man, behold, I take the desire of thine eyes away from thee with a stroke. Yet thou shall neither mourn nor weep. Neither shall thy tears run down.
Ezek. Sigh,  not aloud. Make no mourning for the dead. Bind thy headdress upon thee,  put thy shoes upon thy feet. And do not cover thy lips,  do not eat the bread of men.
Ezek. So I spoke to the people in the morning,  at evening my wife died. And I did in the morning as I was commanded.
Ezek. And the people said to me, Will thou not tell us what these things are to us, that thou do so?
Ezek. Then I said to them, The word of Jehovah came to me, saying,
Ezek. Speak to the house of Israel, Thus says the lord Jehovah: Behold, I will profane my sanctuary, the pride of your power, the desire of your eyes,  that which your soul has compassion. And your sons and your daughters whom ye have left behind shall fall by the sword.
Ezek. And ye shall do as I have done. Ye shall not cover your lips, nor eat the bread of men.
Ezek. And your coverings shall be upon your heads,  your shoes upon your feet. Ye shall not mourn nor weep,  ye shall pine away in your iniquities,  moan one toward another.
Ezek. Thus Ezekiel shall be to you a sign, according to all that he has done ye shall do. When this comes, then ye shall know that I am the lord Jehovah.
Ezek. And thou, son of man, shall it not be in the day when I take from them their strength, the joy of their glory, the desire of their eyes,  that upon which they set their heart-their sons and their daughters-
Ezek. that in that day he who escapes shall come to thee, to cause thee to hear it with thine ears?
Ezek. In that day thy mouth shall be opened to him who is escaped,  thou shall speak,  no more be mute. So thou shall be a sign to them,  they shall know that I am Jehovah.
Ezek. And the word of Jehovah came to me, saying,
Ezek. Son of man, set thy face toward the sons of Ammon,  prophesy against them.
Ezek. And say to the sons of Ammon, Hear the word of the lord Jehovah. Thus says the lord Jehovah: Because thou said, Aha, against my sanctuary when it was profaned,  against the land of Israel when it was made desolate,  against the house of Judah when they went into captivity,
Ezek. therefore, behold, I will deliver thee to the sons of the east for a possession,  they shall set their encampments in thee,  make their dwellings in thee. They shall eat thy fruit,  they shall drink thy milk.
Ezek. And I will make Rabbah a stable for camels,  the sons of Ammon a couching-place for flocks. And ye shall know that I am Jehovah.
Ezek. For thus says the lord Jehovah: Because thou have clapped thy hands,  stamped with the feet,  rejoiced with all the spite of thy soul against the land of Israel,
Ezek. therefore, behold, I have stretched out my hand upon thee,  will deliver thee for a spoil to the nations. And I will cut thee off from the peoples,  I will cause thee to perish out of the countries. I will destroy thee,  thou shall know that I am Jehovah.
Ezek. Thus says the lord Jehovah: Because Moab and Seir say, Behold, the house of Judah is like all the nations,
Ezek. therefore, behold, I will open the side of Moab from the cities, from his cities which are on his frontiers, the glory of the country-Beth-jeshimoth, Baal-meon,  Kiriathaim-
Ezek. open to the sons of the east, against the sons of Ammon. And I will give them for a possession, that the sons of Ammon may not be remembered among the nations.
Ezek. And I will execute judgments upon Moab,  they shall know that I am Jehovah.
Ezek. Thus says the lord Jehovah: Because Edom has dealt against the house of Judah by taking vengeance,  has greatly offended,  revenged himself upon them,
Ezek. therefore thus says the lord Jehovah: I will stretch out my hand upon Edom,  will cut off man and beast from it,  I will make it desolate. From Teman, even to Dedan they shall fall by the sword.
Ezek. And I will lay my vengeance upon Edom by the hand of my people Israel,  they shall do in Edom according to my anger and according to my wrath. And they shall know my vengeance, says the lord Jehovah.
Ezek. Thus says the lord Jehovah: Because the Philistines have dealt by revenge,  have taken vengeance with spite of soul to destroy with perpetual enmity,
Ezek. therefore thus says the lord Jehovah: Behold, I will stretch out my hand upon the Philistines,  I will cut off the Cherethites,  destroy the remnant of the sea coast.
Ezek. And I will execute great vengeance upon them with wrathful rebukes. And they shall know that I am Jehovah when I shall lay my vengeance upon them.
Ezek. And it came to pass in the eleventh year, in the first day of the month, that the word of Jehovah came to me, saying,
Ezek. Son of man, because Tyre has said against Jerusalem, Aha, she is broken, the gate of the peoples. She has turned around to me. I shall be replenished, now that she is laid waste,
Ezek. therefore thus says the lord Jehovah: Behold, I am against thee, O Tyre,  will cause many nations to come up against thee, as the sea causes its waves to come up.
Ezek. And they shall destroy the walls of Tyre,  break down her towers. I will also scrape her dust from her,  make her a bare rock.
Ezek. She shall be a place for the spreading of nets in the midst of the sea, for I have spoken it, says the lord Jehovah. And she shall become a spoil to the nations,
Ezek. and her daughters who are in the field shall be slain with the sword. And they shall know that I am Jehovah.
Ezek. For thus says the lord Jehovah: Behold, I will bring upon Tyre, Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon, king of kings, from the north, with horses,  with chariots,  with horsemen,  a company,  many people.
Ezek. He shall kill thy daughters in the field with the sword. And he shall make forts against thee,  cast up a mound against thee,  raise up the buckler against thee.
Ezek. And he shall set his battering engines against thy walls,  with his axes he shall break down thy towers.
Ezek. Because of the abundance of his horses their dust shall cover thee. Thy walls shall shake at the noise of the horsemen,  of the wagons,  of the chariots, when he shall enter into thy gates, as men enter into a city in which a breach is made.
Ezek. With the hoofs of his horses he shall tread down all thy streets. He shall kill thy people with the sword,  the pillars of thy strength shall go down to the ground.
Ezek. And they shall make a spoil of thy riches,  make a prey of thy merchandise. And they shall break down thy walls,  destroy thy pleasant houses,  they shall lay thy stones and thy timber and thy dust in the midst of the waters.
Ezek. And I will cause the noise of thy songs to cease,  the sound of thy harps shall no more be heard.
Ezek. And I will make thee a bare rock; thou shall be a place for the spreading of nets. Thou shall be built no more, for I Jehovah have spoken it, says the lord Jehovah.
Ezek. Thus says the lord Jehovah to Tyre: Shall not the isles shake at the sound of thy fall, when the wounded groan, when the slaughter is made in the midst of thee?
Ezek. Then all the rulers of the sea shall come down from their thrones,  lie aside their robes,  strip off their broidered garments. They shall clothe themselves with trembling. They shall sit upon the ground,  shall tremble every moment,  be astonished at thee.
Ezek. And they shall take up a lamentation over thee,  say to thee, How thou are destroyed, who were inhabited by seafaring men, the renowned city that was strong in the sea, she and her inhabitants, who caused their terror to be on all who dwelt there!
Ezek. Now the isles shall tremble in the day of thy fall. Yea, the isles that are in the sea shall be dismayed at thy departure.
Ezek. For thus says the lord Jehovah: When I shall make thee a desolate city, like the cities that are not inhabited, when I shall bring up the deep upon thee,  the great waters shall cover thee,
Ezek. then I will bring thee down with those who descend into the pit, to the people of old time,  will make thee to dwell in the nether parts of the earth, in the places that are desolate of old, with those who go down to the pit, that thou not be inhabited. And I will set glory in the land of the living.
Ezek. I will make thee a horror,  thou shall no more have any being. Though thou be sought for, yet thou shall never be found again, says the lord Jehovah.
Ezek. The word of Jehovah came again to me, saying,
Ezek. And thou, son of man, take up a lamentation over Tyre,
Ezek. and say to Tyre, O thou that dwells at the entry of the sea, that is the merchant of the peoples to many isles, thus says the lord Jehovah: Thou, O Tyre, have said, I am perfect in beauty.
Ezek. Thy borders are in the heart of the seas. Thy builders have perfected thy beauty.
Ezek. They have made all thy planks of fir trees from Senir. They have taken a cedar from Lebanon to make a mast for thee.
Ezek. Of the oaks of Bashan they have made thine oars. They have made thy benches of ivory inlaid in boxwood, from the isles of Kittim.
Ezek. Of fine linen with broidered work from Egypt was thy sail, that it might be to thee for an ensign. Blue and purple from the isles of Elishah was thine awning.
Ezek. The inhabitants of Sidon and Arvad were thy rowers. Thy wise men, O Tyre, were in thee; they were thy pilots.
Ezek. The old men of Gebal and the wise men thereof were thy caulkers in thee. All the ships of the sea with their mariners were in thee to deal in thy merchandise.
Ezek. Persia and Lud and Put were in thine army, thy men of war. They hung the shield and helmet in thee. They set forth thy comeliness.
Ezek. The men of Arvad with thine army were upon thy walls round about,  valorous men were in thy towers. They hung their shields upon thy walls round about. They have perfected thy beauty.
Ezek. Tarshish was thy merchant because of the multitude of all kinds of riches, with silver, iron, tin,  lead. They traded for thy wares.
Ezek. Javan, Tubal,  Meshech, they were thy merchants. They traded the persons of men,  vessels of brass for thy merchandise.
Ezek. Those of the house of Togarmah traded for thy wares with horses and war-horses and mules.
Ezek. The men of Dedan were thy merchants. Many isles were the mart of thy hand. They brought thee in exchange horns of ivory and ebony.
Ezek. Syria was thy merchant because of the multitude of thy handiworks. They traded for thy wares with emeralds, purple,  embroidered work,  fine linen,  coral,  rubies.
Ezek. Judah,  the land of Israel, they were thy merchants. They traded for thy merchandise wheat of Minnith,  pannag,  honey,  oil,  balm.
Ezek. Damascus was thy merchant for the multitude of thy handiworks, because of the multitude of all kinds of riches, with the wine of Helbon,  white wool.
Ezek. Vedan and Javan traded with yarn for thy wares. Bright iron, cassia,  calamus, were among thy merchandise.
Ezek. Dedan was thy merchant in precious cloths for riding.
Ezek. Arabia,  all the rulers of Kedar, they were the merchants of thy hand, in lambs,  rams,  goats. In these they were thy merchants.
Ezek. The merchants of Sheba and Raamah, they were thy merchants. They traded for thy wares with the chief of all spices,  with all precious stones,  gold.
Ezek. Haran and Canneh and Eden, the merchants of Sheba, Asshur and Chilmad, were thy merchants.
Ezek. These were thy merchants in choice wares, in wrappings of blue and embroidered work,  in chests of rich apparel, bound with cords and made of cedar, among thy merchandise.
Ezek. The ships of Tarshish were thy caravans for thy merchandise. And thou were replenished,  made very glorious in the heart of the seas.
Ezek. Thy rowers have brought thee into great waters. The east wind has broken thee in the heart of the seas.
Ezek. Thy riches,  thy wares, thy merchandise, thy mariners,  thy pilots, thy caulkers,  the dealers in thy merchandise,  all thy men of war, who are in thee, with all thy company which is in the midst of thee, shall fall into the heart of the seas in the day of thy ruin.
Ezek. At the sound of the cry of thy pilots the suburbs shall shake.
Ezek. And all who handled the oar, the mariners,  all the pilots of the sea, shall come down from their ships. They shall stand upon the land,
Ezek. and shall cause their voice to be heard over thee,  shall cry bitterly,  shall cast up dust upon their heads. They shall wallow themselves in the ashes.
Ezek. And they shall make themselves bald for thee,  gird with sackcloth,  they shall weep for thee in bitterness of soul with bitter mourning.
Ezek. And in their wailing they shall take up a lamentation for thee,  lament over thee, saying, Who is there like Tyre, like her that is brought to silence in the midst of the sea?
Ezek. When thy wares went forth out of the seas, thou filled many peoples. Thou enriched the kings of the earth with the multitude of thy riches and of thy merchandise.
Ezek. In the time that thou were broken by the seas in the depths of the waters, thy merchandise and all thy company fell in the midst of thee.
Ezek. All the inhabitants of the isles are astonished at thee,  their kings are horribly afraid; they are troubled in their countenance.
Ezek. The merchants among the peoples hiss at thee. Thou have become a horror,  thou shall nevermore have any being.
Ezek. The word of Jehovah came again to me, saying,
Ezek. Son of man, say to the ruler of Tyre, Thus says the lord Jehovah: Because thy heart is lifted up,  thou have said, I am a god. I sit in the seat of God, in the midst of the seas. Yet thou are man,  not God, though thou did set thy heart as the heart of God.
Ezek. Behold, thou are wiser than Daniel. There is no secret that is hidden from thee.
Ezek. By thy wisdom and by thine understanding thou have gotten thee riches,  have gotten gold and silver into thy treasures.
Ezek. By thy great wisdom and by thy traffic thou have increased thy riches. And thy heart is lifted up because of thy riches.
Ezek. Therefore thus says the lord Jehovah: Because thou have set thy heart as the heart of God,
Ezek. therefore, behold, I will bring strangers upon thee, the terrible of the nations,  they shall draw their swords against the beauty of thy wisdom,  they shall defile thy brightness.
Ezek. They shall bring thee down to the pit,  thou shall die the death of those who are slain, in the heart of the seas.
Ezek. Will thou yet say before him who slays thee, I am God? But thou are man,  not God, in the hand of him who wounds thee.
Ezek. Thou shall die the death of the uncircumcised by the hand of strangers. For I have spoken it, says the lord Jehovah.
Ezek. Moreover the word of Jehovah came to me, saying,
Ezek. Son of man, take up a lamentation over the king of Tyre,  say to him, Thus says the lord Jehovah: Thou seal up the sum, full of wisdom,  perfect in beauty.
Ezek. Thou were in Eden, the garden of God. Every precious stone was thy covering, the sardius, the topaz,  the diamond, the beryl, the onyx,  the jasper, the sapphire, the emerald,  the carbuncle,  gold. The workmanship of thy tambourine and of thy pipes was in thee. In the day that thou were created they were prepared.
Ezek. Thou were the anointed cherub who covers. And I set thee, so that thou were upon the holy mountain of God. Thou have walked up and down in the midst of the stones of fire.
Ezek. Thou were perfect in thy ways from the day that thou were created, till unrighteousness was found in thee.
Ezek. By the abundance of thy commerce they filled the midst of thee with violence,  thou have sinned. Therefore I have cast thee out of the mountain of God as profane,  I have destroyed thee, O covering cherub, from the midst of the stones of fire.
Ezek. Thy heart was lifted up because of thy beauty. Thou have corrupted thy wisdom because of thy brightness. I have cast thee to the ground. I have laid thee before kings, that they may behold thee.
Ezek. By the multitude of thine iniquities, in the unrighteousness of thy commerce, thou have profaned thy sanctuaries. Therefore I have brought forth a fire from the midst of thee. It has devoured thee,  I have turned thee to ashes upon the earth in the sight of all those who behold thee.
Ezek. All those who know thee among the peoples shall be astonished at thee. Thou have become a horror,  thou shall nevermore have any being.
Ezek. And the word of Jehovah came to me, saying,
Ezek. Son of man, set thy face toward Sidon,  prophesy against it,
Ezek. and say, Thus says the lord Jehovah: Behold, I am against thee, O Sidon. And I will be glorified in the midst of thee. And they shall know that I am Jehovah, when I shall have executed judgments in her,  shall be sanctified in her.
Ezek. For I will send pestilence into her,  blood into her streets. And the wounded shall fall in the midst of her, with the sword upon her on every side. And they shall know that I am Jehovah.
Ezek. And there shall no more be a pricking brier to the house of Israel, nor a hurting thorn of any who are round about them, who did spite to them. And they shall know that I am the lord Jehovah.
Ezek. Thus says the lord Jehovah: When I shall have gathered the house of Israel from the peoples among whom they are scattered,  shall be sanctified in them in the sight of the nations, then they shall dwell in their own land which I gave to my servant Jacob.
Ezek. And they shall dwell securely therein. Yea, they shall build houses,  plant vineyards,  shall dwell securely, when I have executed judgments upon all those who do them spite round about them. And they shall know that I am Jehovah their God.
Ezek. In the tenth year, in the tenth month, in the twelfth day of the month, the word of Jehovah came to me, saying,
Ezek. Son of man, set thy face against Pharaoh king of Egypt,  prophesy against him,  against all Egypt.
