Ezek. Speak,  say, Thus says the lord Jehovah: Behold, I am against thee, Pharaoh king of Egypt, the great monster that lies in the midst of his rivers, that has said, My river is my own,  I have made it for myself.
Ezek. And I will put hooks in thy jaws,  I will cause the fish of thy rivers to stick to thy scales,  I will bring thee up out of the midst of thy rivers, with all the fish of thy rivers which stick to thy scales.
Ezek. And I will cast thee forth into the wilderness, thee and all the fish of thy rivers. Thou shall fall upon the open field. Thou shall not be brought together, nor gathered. I have given thee for food to the beasts of the earth and to the birds of the heavens.
Ezek. And all the inhabitants of Egypt shall know that I am Jehovah, because they have been a staff of reed to the house of Israel.
Ezek. When they took hold of thee by thy hand, thou broke,  tore all their shoulders. And when they leaned upon thee, thou broke,  made all their loins to be at a stand still.
Ezek. Therefore thus says the lord Jehovah: Behold, I will bring a sword upon thee,  will cut off from thee man and beast.
Ezek. And the land of Egypt shall be a desolation and a waste. And they shall know that I am Jehovah. Because he has said, The river is mine,  I have made it,
Ezek. therefore, behold, I am against thee,  against thy rivers. And I will make the land of Egypt an utter waste and desolation, from the tower of Seveneh even to the border of Ethiopia.
Ezek. No foot of man shall pass through it, nor foot of beast shall pass through it. Neither shall it be inhabited forty years.
Ezek. And I will make the land of Egypt a desolation in the midst of the countries that are desolate. And her cities among the cities that are laid waste shall be a desolation forty years. And I will scatter the Egyptians among the nations,  will disperse them through the countries.
Ezek. For thus says the lord Jehovah: At the end of forty years I will gather the Egyptians from the peoples where they were scattered,
Ezek. and I will bring back the captivity of Egypt,  will cause them to return into the land of Pathros, into the land of their birth. And they shall be a base kingdom there.
Ezek. It shall be the basest of the kingdoms, nor shall it lift itself up any more above the nations. And I will diminish them, that they shall no more rule over the nations.
Ezek. And it shall be no more the confidence of the house of Israel, bringing iniquity to remembrance, when they turn to look after them. And they shall know that I am the lord Jehovah.
Ezek. And it came to pass in the twenty-seventh year, in the first month, in the first day of the month, the word of Jehovah came to me, saying,
Ezek. Son of man, Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon caused his army to serve a great service against Tyre. Every head was made bald,  every shoulder was worn, yet he had no wages, nor his army, from Tyre, for the service that he had served against it.
Ezek. Therefore thus says the lord Jehovah: Behold, I will give the land of Egypt to Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon,  he shall carry off her multitude,  take her spoil,  take her prey. And it shall be the wages for his army.
Ezek. I have given him the land of Egypt as his recompense for which he served, because they worked for me, says the lord Jehovah.
Ezek. In that day I will cause a horn to bud forth to the house of Israel,  I will give thee the opening of the mouth in the midst of them. And they shall know that I am Jehovah.
Ezek. The word of Jehovah came again to me, saying,
Ezek. Son of man, prophesy,  say, Thus says the lord Jehovah: Wail ye, Alas for the day!
Ezek. For the day is near, even the day of Jehovah is near. It shall be a day of clouds, a time of the nations.
Ezek. And a sword shall come upon Egypt,  anguish shall be in Ethiopia, when the slain shall fall in Egypt,  they shall take away her multitude,  her foundations shall be broken down.
Ezek. Ethiopia,  Put,  Lud,  all the mixed people,  Cub,  the sons of the land that is in league, shall fall with them by the sword.
Ezek. Thus says Jehovah: They also who uphold Egypt shall fall,  the pride of her power shall come down. From the tower of Seveneh they shall fall in it by the sword, says the lord Jehovah.
Ezek. And they shall be desolate in the midst of the countries that are desolate,  her cities shall be in the midst of the cities that are wasted.
Ezek. And they shall know at I am Jehovah when I have set a fire in Egypt,  all her helpers are destroyed.
Ezek. In that day messengers shall go forth from before me in ships to make the careless Ethiopians afraid,  there shall be anguish upon them, as in the day of Egypt, for, lo, it comes.
Ezek. Thus says the lord Jehovah: I will also make the multitude of Egypt to cease by the hand of Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon.
Ezek. He and his people with him, the terrible of the nations, shall be brought in to destroy the land. And they shall draw their swords against Egypt,  fill the land with the slain.
Ezek. And I will make the rivers dry,  will sell the land into the hand of evil men. And I will make the land desolate,  all that is therein, by the hand of strangers. I, Jehovah, have spoken it.
Ezek. Thus says the lord Jehovah: I will also destroy the idols,  I will cause the images to cease from Memphis. And there shall no more be a ruler from the land of Egypt. And I will put a fear in the land of Egypt.
Ezek. And I will make Pathros desolate,  will set a fire in Zoan,  will execute judgments upon No.
Ezek. And I will pour my wrath upon Sin, the stronghold of Egypt,  I will cut off the multitude of No.
Ezek. And I will set a fire in Egypt. Sin shall be in great anguish,  No shall be broken up,  Memphis shall have adversaries in the daytime.
Ezek. The young men of Aven and of Pi-beseth shall fall by the sword,  these cities shall go into captivity.
Ezek. At Tehaphnehes also the day shall withdraw itself when I shall break the yokes of Egypt there,  the pride of her power shall cease in her. As for her, a cloud shall cover her,  her daughters shall go into captivity.
Ezek. Thus I will execute judgments upon Egypt,  they shall know that I am Jehovah.
Ezek. And it came to pass in the eleventh year, in the first month, in the seventh day of the month, that the word of Jehovah came to me, saying,
Ezek. Son of man, I have broken the arm of Pharaoh king of Egypt. And, lo, it has not been bound up, to apply medicines, to put a bandage to bind it, that it be strong to hold the sword.
Ezek. Therefore thus says the lord Jehovah: Behold, I am against Pharaoh king of Egypt. And I will break his arms, the strong arm,  that which was broken,  I will cause the sword to fall out of his hand.
Ezek. And I will scatter the Egyptians among the nations,  will disperse them through the countries.
Ezek. And I will strengthen the arms of the king of Babylon,  put my sword in his hand. But I will break the arms of Pharaoh,  he shall groan before him with the groanings of a mortally wounded man.
Ezek. And I will hold up the arms of the king of Babylon,  the arms of Pharaoh shall fall down. And they shall know that I am Jehovah when I shall put my sword into the hand of the king of Babylon,  he shall stretch it out upon the land of Egypt.
Ezek. And I will scatter the Egyptians among the nations,  disperse them through the countries. And they shall know that I am Jehovah.
Ezek. And it came to pass in the eleventh year, in the third month, in the first day of the month, that the word of Jehovah came to me, saying,
Ezek. Son of man, say to Pharaoh king of Egypt,  to his multitude, Whom are thou like in thy greatness?
Ezek. Behold, the Assyrian was a cedar in Lebanon with fair branches,  with a forest-like shade,  of high stature,  its top was among the thick boughs.
Ezek. The waters nourished it. The deep made it to grow. The rivers of it ran round about its plantation,  it sent out its channels to all the trees of the field.
Ezek. Therefore its stature was exalted above all the trees of the field,  its boughs were multiplied,  its branches became long because of many waters, when it shot them forth.
Ezek. All the birds of the heavens made their nests in its boughs,  under its branches all the beasts of the field brought forth their young,  under its shadow dwelt all great nations.
Ezek. Thus it was beautiful in its greatness, in the length of its branches, for its root was by many waters.
Ezek. The cedars in the garden of God could not dim it. The fir trees were not like its boughs,  the plane trees were not as its branches, nor was any tree in the garden of God like it in its beauty.
Ezek. I made it beautiful by the multitude of its branches, so that all the trees of Eden, that were in the garden of God, envied it.
Ezek. Therefore thus said the lord Jehovah: Because thou are exalted in stature,  he has set his top among the thick boughs,  his heart is lifted up in his height,
Ezek. I will even deliver him into the hand of the mighty one of the nations. He shall surely deal with him; I have driven him out for his wickedness.
Ezek. And strangers, the terrible of the nations, have cut him off,  have left him. Upon the mountains and in all the valleys his branches are fallen,  his boughs are broken by all the watercourses of the land. And all the peoples of the earth have gone down from his shadow,  have left him.
Ezek. All the birds of the heavens shall dwell upon his ruin,  all the beasts of the field shall be upon his branches,
Ezek. to the end that none of all the trees by the waters exalt themselves in their stature, neither set their top among the thick boughs, nor that their mighty ones stand up on their height, even all that drink water. For they are all delivered to death, to the nether parts of the earth, in the midst of the sons of men, with those who go down to the pit.
Ezek. Thus says the lord Jehovah: In the day when he went down to Sheol I caused a mourning. I covered the deep for him. And I restrained the rivers of it,  the great waters were stayed. And I caused Lebanon to mourn for him,  all the trees of the field fainted for him.
Ezek. I made the nations to shake at the sound of his fall when I cast him down to Sheol with those who descend into the pit. And all the trees of Eden, the choice and best of Lebanon, all that drink water, were comforted in the nether parts of the earth.
Ezek. They also went down into Sheol with him to those who are slain by the sword, yea, those who were his arm, that dwelt under his shadow in the midst of the nations.
Ezek. To whom are thou thus like in glory and in greatness among the trees of Eden? Yet thou shall be brought down with the trees of Eden to the nether parts of the earth. Thou shall lie in the midst of the uncircumcised, with those who are slain by the sword. This is Pharaoh and all his multitude, says the lord Jehovah.
Ezek. And it came to pass in the twelfth year, in the twelfth month, in the first day of the month, that the word of Jehovah came to me, saying,
Ezek. Son of man, take up a lamentation over Pharaoh king of Egypt,  say to him, Thou were compared to a young lion of the nations. Yet thou are as a monster in the seas,  thou broke forth with thy rivers,  troubled the waters with thy feet,  fouled their rivers.
Ezek. Thus says the lord Jehovah: I will spread out my net upon thee with a company of many peoples,  they shall bring thee up in my net.
Ezek. And I will leave thee upon the land. I will cast thee forth upon the open field,  will cause all the birds of the heavens to settle upon thee,  I will satisfy the beasts of the whole earth with thee.
Ezek. And I will lay thy flesh upon the mountains,  fill the valleys with thy height.
Ezek. I will also water the land, in which thou swim, with thy blood, even to the mountains. And the watercourses shall be full of thee.
Ezek. And when I shall extinguish thee, I will cover the heavens,  make the stars of it dark. I will cover the sun with a cloud,  the moon shall not give its light.
Ezek. All the bright lights of heaven I will make dark over thee,  set darkness upon thy land, says the lord Jehovah.
Ezek. I will also vex the hearts of many peoples when I shall bring thy destruction among the nations, into the countries which thou have not known.
Ezek. Yea, I will make many peoples amazed at thee. And their kings shall be horribly afraid for thee when I shall brandish my sword before them. And they shall tremble at every moment, each man for his own life, in the day of thy fall.
Ezek. For thus says the lord Jehovah: The sword of the king of Babylon shall come upon thee.
Ezek. By the swords of the mighty I will cause thy multitude to fall. They are all the terrible of the nations. And they shall bring to nothing the pride of Egypt,  all the multitude of it shall be destroyed.
Ezek. I will destroy also all the beasts thereof from beside many waters. Neither the foot of man shall trouble them any more, nor the hoofs of beasts trouble them.
Ezek. Then I will make their waters clear,  cause their rivers to run like oil, says the lord Jehovah.
Ezek. When I shall make the land of Egypt desolate and waste, a land destitute of that of which it was full, when I shall smite all those who dwell therein, then they shall know that I am Jehovah.
Ezek. This is the lamentation with which they shall lament. The daughters of the nations shall lament with that over Egypt,  over all her multitude. They shall lament with that, says the lord Jehovah.
Ezek. It came to pass also in the twelfth year, in the fifteenth day of the month, that the word of Jehovah came to me, saying,
Ezek. Son of man, wail for the multitude of Egypt,  cast them down, even her,  the daughters of the famous nations, to the nether parts of the earth, with those who go down into the pit.
Ezek. Whom do thou pass in beauty? Go down,  be thou laid with the uncircumcised.
Ezek. They shall fall in the midst of those who are slain by the sword. She is delivered to the sword. Draw her away and all her multitudes.
Ezek. The strong among the mighty shall speak to him out of the midst of Sheol with those who help him. They have gone down. They lie still, even the uncircumcised, slain by the sword.
Ezek. Asshur is there and all her company. Her graves are round about her, all of them slain, fallen by the sword,
Ezek. whose graves are set in the outermost parts of the pit. And her company is round about her grave, all of them slain, fallen by the sword, who caused terror in the land of the living.
Ezek. There is Elam and all her multitude round about her grave, all of them slain, fallen by the sword, who have gone down uncircumcised into the nether parts of the earth, who caused their terror in the land of the living,  have borne their shame with those who go down to the pit.
Ezek. They have set a bed for her in the midst of the slain with all her multitude. Her graves are round about her, all of them uncircumcised, slain by the sword. For their terror was caused in the land of the living,  they have borne their shame with those who go down to the pit. He is put in the midst of those who are slain.
Ezek. There is Meshech, Tubal,  all their multitude. Their graves are round about them, all of them uncircumcised, slain by the sword, for they caused their terror in the land of the living.
Ezek. And they shall not lie with the mighty who are fallen of the uncircumcised, who have gone down to Sheol with their weapons of war,  have laid their swords under their heads. But their iniquities are upon their bones, for they were the terror of the mighty in the land of the living.
Ezek. But thou shall be broken in the midst of the uncircumcised,  shall lie with those who are slain by the sword.
Ezek. There is Edom, its kings and all its rulers, who in their might are laid with those who are slain by the sword. They shall lie with the uncircumcised,  with those who go down to the pit.
Ezek. There are the rulers of the north, all of them,  all the Sidonians, who have gone down with the slain. In the terror which they caused by their might they are put to shame. And they lie uncircumcised with those who are slain by the sword,  bear their shame with those who go down to the pit.
Ezek. Pharaoh shall see them,  shall be comforted over all his multitude, even Pharaoh and all his army, slain by the sword, says the lord Jehovah.
Ezek. For I have put his terror in the land of the living,  he shall be laid in the midst of the uncircumcised, with those who are slain by the sword, even Pharaoh and all his multitude, says the lord Jehovah.
Ezek. And the word of Jehovah came to me, saying,
Ezek. Son of man, speak to the sons of thy people,  say to them, When I bring the sword upon a land,  the people of the land take a man from among them,  set him for their watchman,
Ezek. if, when he sees the sword come upon the land, he blows the trumpet,  warns the people,
Ezek. then whoever hears the sound of the trumpet,  takes no warning, if the sword comes,  takes him away, his blood shall be upon his own head.
Ezek. He heard the sound of the trumpet,  took no warning; his blood shall be upon him. Whereas if he had taken warning, he would have delivered his soul.
Ezek. But if the watchman sees the sword come,  does not blow the trumpet,  the people are not warned,  the sword comes,  takes any person from among them, he is taken away in his iniquity,  I will require his blood at the watchman's hand.
Ezek. So thou, son of man, I have set thee a watchman to the house of Israel. Therefore hear the word at my mouth,  give them warning from me.
Ezek. When I say to the wicked man, O wicked man, thou shall surely die,  thou do not speak to warn the wicked man from his way, that wicked man shall die in his iniquity,  I will require his blood at thy hand.
Ezek. Nevertheless, if thou warn the wicked man of his way to turn from it,  he does not turn from his way, he shall die in his iniquity,  thou have delivered thy soul.
Ezek. And thou, son of man, say to the house of Israel, Thus ye speak, saying, Our transgressions and our sins are upon us,  we pine away in them. How then can we live?
Ezek. Say to them, As I live, says the lord Jehovah, I have no pleasure in the death of the wicked man,  that the wicked man turn from his way and live. Turn ye, turn ye from your evil ways, for why will ye die, O house of Israel?
Ezek. And thou, son of man, say to the sons of thy people, The righteousness of the righteous man shall not deliver him in the day of his transgression. And as for the wickedness of the wicked man, he shall not fall by it in the day that he turns from his wickedness, nor shall he who is righteous be able to live by it in the day that he sins.
Ezek. When I say to the righteous man, that he shall surely live, if he trusts his righteousness,  commits iniquity, none of his righteous deeds shall be remembered,  in his iniquity that he has committed, in it he shall die.
Ezek. Again, when I say to the wicked man, Thou shall surely die, if he turns from his sin,  does that which is lawful and right,
Ezek. if the wicked man restores the pledge, gives again that which he had taken by robbery, walks in the statutes of life, committing no iniquity, he shall surely live; he shall not die.
Ezek. None of his sins that he has committed shall be remembered against him. He has done that which is lawful and right; he shall surely live.
Ezek. Yet the sons of thy people say, The way of the Lord is not equitable. But as for them, their way is not equitable.
Ezek. When the righteous man turns from his righteousness,  commits iniquity, he shall even die in it.
Ezek. And when the wicked man turns from his wickedness,  does that which is lawful and right, he shall live thereby.
Ezek. Yet ye say, The way of the Lord is not equitable. O house of Israel, I will judge you everyone according to his ways.
Ezek. And it came to pass in the twelfth year of our captivity, in the tenth month, in the fifth day of the month, that a man who had escaped out of Jerusalem came to me, saying, The city is smitten.
Ezek. Now the hand of Jehovah had been upon me in the evening, before he who escaped came. And he had opened my mouth until he came to me in the morning. And my mouth was opened,  I was no more mute.
Ezek. And the word of Jehovah came to me, saying,
Ezek. Son of man, those who inhabit those waste places in the land of Israel speak, saying, Abraham was one,  he inherited the land,  we are many; the land is given us for inheritance.
Ezek. Therefore say to them, Thus says the lord Jehovah: Ye eat with the blood,  lift up your eyes to your idols,  shed blood. And shall ye possess the land?
Ezek. Ye stand upon your sword, ye work abomination,  ye defile every man his neighbor's wife. And shall ye possess the land?
Ezek. Thus shall thou say to them. Thus says the lord Jehovah: As I live, surely those who are in the waste places shall fall by the sword,  he who is in the open field I will give to the beasts to be devoured,  those who are in the strongholds and in the caves shall die of the pestilence.
Ezek. And I will make the land a desolation and an astonishment. And the pride of her power shall cease. And the mountains of Israel shall be desolate, so that none shall pass through.
Ezek. Then they shall know that I am Jehovah when I have made the land a desolation and an astonishment, because of all their abominations which they have committed.
Ezek. And as for thee, son of man, the sons of thy people talk of thee by the walls and in the doors of the houses,  speak one to another, each one to his brother, saying, Come, I pray you,  hear what is the word that comes forth from Jehovah.
Ezek. And they come to thee as the people come,  they sit before thee as my people. And they hear thy words,  do not do them. For with their mouth they show much love,  their heart goes after their gain.
Ezek. And, lo, thou are to them as a very lovely song of he who has a pleasant voice,  can play well on an instrument. For they hear thy words,  they do not do them.
Ezek. And when this comes to pass, (behold, it comes), then they shall know that a prophet has been among them.
Ezek. And the word of Jehovah came to me, saying,
Ezek. Son of man, prophesy against the shepherds of Israel. Prophesy,  say to them, even to the shepherds, Thus says the Lord Jehovah: Woe to the shepherds of Israel who feed themselves! Should not the shepherds feed the sheep?
Ezek. Ye eat the fat,  ye clothe yourselves with the wool. Ye kill the fatlings,  ye do not feed the sheep.
Ezek. Ye have not strengthened the diseased, nor have ye healed that which was sick, nor have ye bound up that which was broken, nor have ye brought back that which was driven away, nor have ye sought that which was lost,  ye have ruled over them with force and with rigor.
Ezek. And they were scattered because there was no shepherd. And they became food to all the beasts of the field,  were scattered.
Ezek. My sheep wandered through all the mountains,  upon every high hill. Yea, my sheep were scattered upon all the face of the earth,  there was none who searched or sought.
Ezek. Therefore, ye shepherds, hear the word of Jehovah:
Ezek. As I live, says the lord Jehovah, surely inasmuch as my sheep became a prey,  my sheep became food to all the beasts of the field, because there was no shepherd, nor did my shepherds search for my sheep,  the shepherds fed themselves,  did not feed my sheep,
Ezek. therefore, ye shepherds, hear the word of Jehovah.
Ezek. Thus says the lord Jehovah: Behold, I am against the shepherds,  I will require my sheep at their hand,  cause them to cease from feeding the sheep. Neither shall the shepherds feed themselves any more,  I will deliver my sheep from their mouth, that they may not be food for them.
Ezek. For thus says the lord Jehovah: Behold, I myself, even I, will search for my sheep,  will seek them out.
Ezek. As a shepherd seeks out his flock, in the day that he is among his sheep that are scattered abroad, so I will seek out my sheep,  I will deliver them out of all places where they have been scattered in the cloudy and dark day.
Ezek. And I will bring them out from the peoples,  gather them from the countries,  will bring them into their own land. And I will feed them upon the mountains of Israel, by the watercourses,  in all the inhabited places of the country.
Ezek. I will feed them with good pasture,  their fold shall be upon the mountains of the height of Israel. There they shall lie down in a good fold,  on fat pasture they shall feed upon the mountains of Israel.
Ezek. I myself will be the shepherd of my sheep,  I will cause them to lie down, says the lord Jehovah.
Ezek. I will seek that which was lost,  will bring back that which was driven away,  will bind up that which was broken,  will strengthen that which was sick,  I will destroy the fat and the strong. I will feed them in justice.
Ezek. And as for you, O my flock, thus says the lord Jehovah: Behold, I judge between sheep and sheep, the rams and the he-goats.
Ezek. Does it seem a small thing to you to have fed upon the good pasture,  ye must tread down with your feet the residue of your pasture,  to have drunk of the clear waters,  ye must foul the residue with your feet?
Ezek. And as for my sheep, they eat that which ye have trodden with your feet,  they drink that which ye have fouled with your feet.
Ezek. Therefore thus says the lord Jehovah to them: Behold, I, even I, will judge between the fat sheep and the lean sheep.
Ezek. Because ye thrust with side and with shoulder,  push all the diseased with your horns, till ye have scattered them abroad,
Ezek. therefore I will save my flock,  they shall no more be a prey. And I will judge between sheep and sheep.
Ezek. And I will set up one shepherd over them,  he shall feed them, even my servant David. He shall feed them,  he shall be their shepherd.
Ezek. And I, Jehovah, will be their God,  my servant David ruler among them. I, Jehovah, have spoken it.
Ezek. And I will make a covenant of peace with them,  will cause evil beasts to cease out of the land,  they shall dwell securely in the wilderness,  sleep in the woods.
Ezek. And I will make them and the places round about my hill a blessing,  I will cause the shower to come down in its season; there shall be showers of blessing.
Ezek. And the tree of the field shall yield its fruit,  the earth shall yield its increase,  they shall be secure in their land. And they shall know that I am Jehovah when I have broken the bars of their yoke,  have delivered them out of the hand of those who made bondmen of them.
Ezek. And they shall no more be a prey to the nations, nor shall the beasts of the earth devour them,  they shall dwell securely,  none shall make them afraid.
Ezek. And I will raise up to them a plantation for renown,  they shall no more be consumed with famine in the land, nor bear the shame of the nations any more.
Ezek. And they shall know that I, Jehovah, their God am with them,  that they, the house of Israel, are my people, says the lord Jehovah.
Ezek. And ye my sheep, the sheep of my pasture, are men,  I am your God, says the lord Jehovah.
Ezek. Moreover the word of Jehovah came to me, saying,
Ezek. Son of man, set thy face against mount Seir,  prophesy against it.
Ezek. And say to it, Thus says the lord Jehovah: Behold, I am against thee, O mount Seir,  I will stretch out my hand against thee,  I will make thee a desolation and an astonishment.
Ezek. I will lay thy cities waste,  thou shall be desolate. And thou shall know that I am Jehovah.
Ezek. Because thou have had a perpetual enmity,  have given over the sons of Israel to the power of the sword in the time of their calamity, in the time of the iniquity of the end,
Ezek. therefore, as I live, says the lord Jehovah, I will prepare thee to blood,  blood shall pursue thee. Since thou have not hated blood, therefore blood shall pursue thee.
Ezek. Thus I will make mount Seir an astonishment and a desolation,  I will cut off from it him who passes through and him who returns.
Ezek. And I will fill its mountains with its slain. In thy hills and in thy valleys and in all thy watercourses they shall fall who are slain with the sword.
Ezek. I will make thee a perpetual desolation,  thy cities shall not be inhabited. And ye shall know that I am Jehovah.
Ezek. Because thou have said, These two nations and these two countries shall be mine,  we will possess it, whereas Jehovah was there,
Ezek. therefore, as I live, says the lord Jehovah, I will do according to thine anger,  according to thine envy which thou have shown out of thy hatred against them. And I will make myself known among them when I shall judge thee.
Ezek. And thou shall know that I, Jehovah, have heard all thy revilings which thou have spoken against the mountains of Israel, saying, They are laid desolate. They are given us to devour.
Ezek. And ye have magnified yourselves against me with your mouth,  have multiplied your words against me. I have heard it.
Ezek. Thus says the lord Jehovah: When the whole earth rejoices, I will make thee desolate.
Ezek. As thou rejoiced over the inheritance of the house of Israel, because it was desolate, so I will do to thee. Thou shall be desolate, O mount Seir,  all Edom, even all of it,  they shall know that I am Jehovah.
Ezek. And thou, son of man, prophesy to the mountains of Israel,  say, Ye mountains of Israel, hear the word of Jehovah.
Ezek. Thus says the lord Jehovah: Because the enemy has said against you, Aha! and, The ancient high places are ours in possession,
Ezek. therefore prophesy,  say, Thus says the lord Jehovah: Because, even because they have made you desolate,  swallowed you up on every side, that ye might be a possession to the residue of the nations,  ye are taken up in the lips of talkers,  the evil report of the people,
Ezek. therefore, ye mountains of Israel, hear the word of the lord Jehovah. Thus says the lord Jehovah to the mountains and to the hills, to the watercourses and to the valleys, to the desolate wastes and to the cities that are forsaken, which have become a prey and derision to the residue of the nations that are round about,
Ezek. therefore thus says the lord Jehovah: Surely in the fire of my jealousy I have spoken against the residue of the nations,  against all Edom, who have appointed my land to themselves for a possession with the joy of all their heart, with spite of soul, to cast it out for a prey.
Ezek. Therefore prophesy concerning the land of Israel,  say to the mountains and to the hills, to the watercourses and to the valleys, Thus says the lord Jehovah: Behold, I have spoken in my jealousy and in my wrath, because ye have borne the shame of the nations.
Ezek. Therefore thus says the lord Jehovah: I have sworn, saying, Surely the nations that are round about you, they shall bear their shame.
Ezek. But ye, O mountains of Israel, ye shall shoot forth your branches,  yield your fruit to my people Israel, for they are at hand to come.
Ezek. For, behold, I am for you,  I will turn into you,  ye shall be tilled and sown.
Ezek. And I will multiply men upon you, all the house of Israel, even all of it,  the cities shall be inhabited,  the waste places shall be built.
Ezek. And I will multiply upon you man and beast,  they shall increase and be fruitful. And I will cause you to be inhabited according to your former estate,  will do better to you than at your beginnings. And ye shall know that I am Jehovah.
Ezek. Yea, I will cause men to walk upon you, even my people Israel,  they shall possess thee,  thou shall be their inheritance,  thou shall no more henceforth bereave them of sons.
Ezek. Thus says the lord Jehovah: Because they say to you, Thou O land are a devourer of men,  have been a bereaver of thy nation,
Ezek. therefore thou shall no more devour men, nor bereave thy nation any more, says the lord Jehovah.
Ezek. Neither will I let thee hear any more the shame of the nations, nor shall thou bear the reproach of the peoples any more, nor shall thou cause thy nation to stumble any more, says the lord Jehovah.
Ezek. Moreover the word of Jehovah came to me, saying,
Ezek. Son of man, when the house of Israel dwelt in their own land, they defiled it by their way and by their doings. Their way before me was as the uncleanness of a woman in her impurity.
Ezek. Therefore I poured out my wrath upon them for the blood which they had poured out upon the land,  because they had defiled it with their idols.
Ezek. And I scattered them among the nations,  they were dispersed through the countries. I judged them according to their way and according to their doings.
Ezek. And when they came to the nations where they went, they profaned my holy name, in that men said of them, These are the people of Jehovah,  have gone forth out of his land.
Ezek. But I had regard for my holy name, which the house of Israel had profaned among the nations where they went.
Ezek. Therefore say to the house of Israel, Thus says the lord Jehovah: I do this not for your sake, O house of Israel,  for my holy name, which ye have profaned among the nations where ye went.
Ezek. And I will sanctify my great name, which has been profaned among the nations, which ye have profaned in the midst of them. And the nations shall know that I am Jehovah, says the lord Jehovah, when I shall be sanctified in you before their eyes.
Ezek. For I will take you from among the nations,  gather you out of all the countries,  will bring you into your own land.
Ezek. And I will sprinkle clean water upon you,  ye shall be clean. I will cleanse you from all your filthiness,  from all your idols.
Ezek. I will also give you a new heart,  I will put a new spirit within you. And I will take away the stony heart out of your flesh,  I will give you a heart of flesh.
Ezek. And I will put my Spirit within you,  cause you to walk in my statutes,  ye shall keep my ordinances,  do them.
Ezek. And ye shall dwell in the land that I gave to your fathers,  ye shall be my people,  I will be your God.
Ezek. And I will save you from all your uncleannesses. And I will call for the grain,  will multiply it,  lay no famine upon you.
Ezek. And I will multiply the fruit of the tree,  the increase of the field, that ye may no more receive the reproach of famine among the nations.
Ezek. Then ye shall remember your evil ways,  your doings that were not good. And ye shall loathe yourselves in your own sight for your iniquities and for your abominations.
Ezek. I do this not for your sake, says the lord Jehovah; be it known to you. Be ashamed and confounded for your ways, O house of Israel.
Ezek. Thus says the lord Jehovah: In the day that I cleanse you from all your iniquities, I will cause the cities to be inhabited,  the waste places shall be built.
Ezek. And the land that was desolate shall be tilled, whereas it was a desolation in the sight of all who passed by.
Ezek. And they shall say, This land that was desolate has become like the garden of Eden. And the waste and desolate and ruined cities are fortified and inhabited.
Ezek. Then the nations that are left round about you shall know that I, Jehovah, have built the ruined places,  planted that which was desolate. I, Jehovah, have spoken it,  I will do it.
Ezek. Thus says the lord Jehovah: For this, moreover, I will be inquired of by the house of Israel, to do it for them. I will increase them with men like a flock.
Ezek. As the flock for sacrifice, as the flock of Jerusalem in her appointed feasts, so shall the waste cities be filled with flocks of men. And they shall know that I am Jehovah.
Ezek. The hand of Jehovah was upon me,  he brought me out in the Spirit of Jehovah,  set me down in the midst of the valley,  it was full of bones.
Ezek. And he caused me to pass by them round about. And, behold, there were very many in the open valley, , lo, they were very dry.
Ezek. And he said to me, Son of man, can these bones live? And I answered, O lord Jehovah, thou know.
Ezek. Again he said to me, Prophesy over these bones,  say to them, O ye dry bones, hear the word of Jehovah.
Ezek. Thus says the lord Jehovah to these bones: Behold, I will cause breath to enter into you,  ye shall live.
Ezek. And I will lay sinews upon you,  will bring up flesh upon you,  cover you with skin,  put breath in you,  ye shall live. And ye shall know that I am Jehovah.
Ezek. So I prophesied as I was commanded. And as I prophesied, there was a noise, , behold, an earthquake,  the bones came together, bone to its bone.
Ezek. And I beheld, , lo, there were sinews upon them,  flesh came up,  skin covered them above,  there was no breath in them.
Ezek. Then he said to me, Prophesy to the wind. Prophesy, son of man,  say to the wind, Thus says the lord Jehovah: Come from the four winds, O breath,  breathe upon these slain, that they may live.
Ezek. So I prophesied as he commanded me,  the breath came into them,  they lived,  stood up upon their feet, an exceedingly great army.
Ezek. Then he said to me, Son of man, these bones are the whole house of Israel. Behold, they say, Our bones are dried up,  our hope is lost. We are clean cut off.
Ezek. Therefore prophesy,  say to them, Thus says the lord Jehovah: Behold, I will open your graves,  cause you to come up out of your graves, O my people,  I will bring you into the land of Israel.
Ezek. And ye shall know that I am Jehovah when I have opened your graves,  caused you to come up out of your graves, O my people.
Ezek. And I will put my Spirit in you,  ye shall live. And I will place you in your own land. And ye shall know that I, Jehovah, have spoken it and performed it, says Jehovah.
Ezek. The word of Jehovah came again to me, saying,
Ezek. And thou, son of man, take thee one stick,  write upon it, For Judah,  for the sons of Israel his companions. Then take another stick,  write upon it, For Joseph, the stick of Ephraim,  for all the house of Israel his companions.
Ezek. And join them one to another into one stick for thyself, that they may become one in thy hand.
Ezek. And when the sons of thy people shall speak to thee, saying, Will thou not show us what thou mean by these?
Ezek. say to them, Thus says the lord Jehovah: Behold, I will take the stick of Joseph, which is in the hand of Ephraim,  the tribes of Israel his companions,  I will put them with it, even with the stick of Judah,  make them one stick,  they shall be one in my hand.
Ezek. And the sticks on which thou write shall be in thy hand before their eyes.
Ezek. And say to them, Thus says the lord Jehovah: Behold, I will take the sons of Israel from among the nations where they have gone,  will gather them on every side,  bring them into their own land.
Ezek. And I will make them one nation in the land, upon the mountains of Israel,  one king shall be king to them all. And they shall no more be two nations, nor shall they be divided into two kingdoms any more at all.
Ezek. Neither shall they defile themselves any more with their idols, nor with their detestable things, nor with any of their transgressions,  I will save them out of all their dwelling-places in which they have sinned,  will cleanse them. So they shall be my people,  I will be their God.
Ezek. And my servant David shall be king over them,  they all shall have one shepherd. They shall also walk in my ordinances,  observe my statutes,  do them.
Ezek. And they shall dwell in the land that I have given to Jacob my servant, in which your fathers dwelt. And they shall dwell therein, they,  their sons,  their son's sons, forever. And David my servant shall be their ruler forever.
Ezek. Moreover I will make a covenant of peace with them. It shall be an everlasting covenant with them,  I will place them,  multiply them,  will set my sanctuary in the midst of them for evermore.
Ezek. My tabernacle shall also be with them,  I will be their God,  they shall be my people.
Ezek. And the nations shall know that I am Jehovah, who sanctifies Israel, when my sanctuary shall be in the midst of them for evermore.
Ezek. And the word of Jehovah came to me, saying,
Ezek. Son of man, set thy face toward Gog, of the land of Magog, the ruler of Rosh, Meshech,  Tubal,  prophesy against him.
Ezek. And say, Thus says the lord Jehovah: Behold, I am against thee, O Gog, ruler of Rosh, Meshech,  Tubal.
Ezek. And I will turn thee about,  put hooks into thy jaws,  I will bring thee forth,  all thine army, horses and horsemen, all of them clothed in full armor, a great company with buckler and shield, all of them handling swords,
Ezek. Persia, Cush,  Put with them, all of them with shield and helmet,
Ezek. Gomer,  all his hordes, the house of Togarmah in the outermost parts of the north,  all his hordes, even many peoples with thee.
Ezek. Be thou prepared. Yea, prepare thyself, thou,  all thy companies that are assembled to thee,  be thou a guard to them.
Ezek. After many days thou shall be visited. In the latter years thou shall come into the land that is brought back from the sword, that is gathered out of many peoples, upon the mountains of Israel, which have been a continual waste,  it is brought forth out of the peoples,  they shall dwell securely, all of them.
Ezek. And thou shall ascend. Thou shall come like a storm. Thou shall be like a cloud to cover the land, thou,  all thy hordes,  many peoples with thee.
Ezek. Thus says the lord Jehovah: It shall come to pass in that day, that things shall come into thy mind,  thou shall devise an evil plan.
Ezek. And thou shall say, I will go up to the land of unwalled villages. I will go to those who are at rest, who dwell securely, all of them dwelling without walls,  having neither bars nor gates,
Ezek. to take the spoil and to take the prey, to turn thy hand against the waste places that are now inhabited,  against the people who are gathered out of the nations, who have gotten cattle and goods, who dwell in the middle of the earth.
Ezek. Sheba,  Dedan,  the merchants of Tarshish, with all the young lions of it, shall say to thee, Have thou come to take the spoil? Have thou assembled thy company to take the prey, to carry away silver and gold, to take away cattle and goods, to take great spoil?
Ezek. Therefore, son of man, prophesy,  say to Gog, Thus says the lord Jehovah: In that day when my people Israel dwell securely, shall thou not know it?
Ezek. And thou shall come from thy place out of the outermost parts of the north, thou,  many peoples with thee, all of them riding upon horses, a great company and a mighty army.
Ezek. And thou shall come up against my people Israel, as a cloud to cover the land. It shall come to pass in the latter days, that I will bring thee against my land, that the nations may know me, when I shall be sanctified in thee, O Gog, before their eyes.
Ezek. Thus says the lord Jehovah: Are thou he of whom I spoke in old time by my servants the prophets of Israel, who prophesied in those days for many years that I would bring thee against them?
Ezek. And it shall come to pass in that day, when Gog shall come against the land of Israel, says the lord Jehovah, that my wrath shall come up into my nostrils.
Ezek. For I have spoken in my jealousy and in the fire of my wrath. Surely in that day there shall be a great shaking in the land of Israel,
Ezek. so that the fishes of the sea,  the birds of the heavens,  the beasts of the field,  all creeping things that creep upon the earth,  all the men who are upon the face of the earth, shall shake at my presence. And the mountains shall be thrown down,  the steep places shall fall,  every wall shall fall to the ground.
Ezek. And I will call for a sword against him to all my mountains, says the lord Jehovah. Every man's sword shall be against his brother.
Ezek. And I will enter into judgment with him with pestilence and with blood. And I will rain upon him,  upon his hordes,  upon the many peoples who are with him, an overflowing shower,  great hailstones, fire,  brimstone.
Ezek. And I will magnify myself,  sanctify myself,  I will make myself known in the eyes of many nations. And they shall know that I am Jehovah.
Ezek. And thou, son of man, prophesy against Gog,  say, Thus says the lord Jehovah: Behold, I am against thee, O Gog, ruler of Rosh, Meshech,  Tubal.
Ezek. And I will turn thee about,  will lead thee on,  will cause thee to come up from the outermost parts of the north,  I will bring thee upon the mountains of Israel.
Ezek. And I will smite thy bow out of thy left hand,  will cause thine arrows to fall out of thy right hand.
Ezek. Thou shall fall upon the mountains of Israel, thou,  all thy hordes,  the peoples who are with thee. I will give thee to the ravenous birds of every sort,  to the beasts of the field to be devoured.
Ezek. Thou shall fall upon the open field, for I have spoken it, says the lord Jehovah.
Ezek. And I will send a fire on Magog,  on those who dwell securely in the isles. And they shall know that I am Jehovah.
Ezek. And I will make my holy name known in the midst of my people Israel, nor will I allow my holy name to be profaned any more. And the nations shall know that I am Jehovah, the Holy One in Israel.
Ezek. Behold, it comes,  it shall be done, says the lord Jehovah. This is the day of which I have spoken.
Ezek. And those who dwell in the cities of Israel shall go forth,  shall make fires of the weapons and burn them, both the shields and the bucklers, the bows and the arrows,  the hand staves,  the spears. And they shall make fires of them seven years,
Ezek. so that they shall take no wood out of the field, nor cut down any out of the forests, for they shall make fires of the weapons. And they shall plunder those who plundered them,  rob those who robbed them, says the lord Jehovah.
Ezek. And it shall come to pass in that day, that I will give to Gog a place for burial in Israel: the valley of those who pass through on the east of the sea. And it shall stop those who pass through,  they shall bury Gog and all his multitude there. And they shall call it The valley of Hamon-gog.
Ezek. And the house of Israel shall be burying them seven months, that they may cleanse the land.
Ezek. Yea, all the people of the land shall bury them,  it shall be to them a renown in the day that I shall be glorified, says the lord Jehovah.
Ezek. And they shall set apart men of continual employment, who shall pass through the land. And, with those who pass through, those that bury those who remain upon the face of the land, to cleanse it, after the end of seven months they shall search.
Ezek. And those who pass through the land shall pass through,  when any man sees a man's bone, then he shall set up a sign by it till the buriers have buried it in the valley of Hamon-gog.
Ezek. And Hamonah shall also be the name of a city. Thus they shall cleanse the land.
Ezek. And thou, son of man, thus says the lord Jehovah: Speak to the birds of every sort,  to every beast of the field, Assemble yourselves,  come. Gather yourselves on every side to my sacrifice that I sacrifice for you, even a great sacrifice upon the mountains of Israel, that ye may eat flesh and drink blood.
Ezek. Ye shall eat the flesh of the mighty,  drink the blood of the rulers of the earth, of rams, of lambs,  of goats, of bullocks, all of them fatlings of Bashan.
Ezek. And ye shall eat fat till ye be full,  drink blood till ye be drunken, of my sacrifice which I have sacrificed for you.
Ezek. And ye shall be filled at my table with horses and chariots, with mighty men,  with all men of war, says the lord Jehovah.
Ezek. And I will set my glory among the nations. And all the nations shall see my judgment that I have executed,  my hand that I have laid upon them.
Ezek. So the house of Israel shall know that I am Jehovah their God, from that day and forward.
Ezek. And the nations shall know that the house of Israel went into captivity for their iniquity, because they trespassed against me,  I hid my face from them. So I gave them into the hand of their adversaries,  they fell all of them by the sword.
Ezek. I did to them according to their uncleanness and according to their transgressions. And I hid my face from them.
Ezek. Therefore thus says the lord Jehovah: Now I will bring back the captivity of Jacob,  have mercy upon the whole house of Israel. And I will be jealous for my holy name.
Ezek. And they shall bear their shame,  all their trespasses by which they have trespassed against me, when they shall dwell securely in their land. And none shall make them afraid
Ezek. when I have brought them back from the peoples,  gathered them out of their enemies' lands,  am sanctified in them in the sight of many nations.
Ezek. And they shall know that I am Jehovah their God, in that I caused them to go into captivity among the nations,  have gathered them to their own land. And I will leave none of them any more there,
Ezek. nor will I hide my face any more from them. For I have poured out my Spirit upon the house of Israel, says the lord Jehovah.
Ezek. In the twenty-fifth year of our captivity, in the beginning of the year, in the tenth day of the month, in the fourteenth year after the city was smitten, in the selfsame day, the hand of Jehovah was upon me,  he brought me there.
Ezek. He brought me in the visions of God into the land of Israel,  set me down upon a very high mountain, upon which was as it were the frame of a city on the south.
Ezek. And he brought me there, , behold, there was a man, whose appearance was like the appearance of brass, with a line of flax in his hand,  a measuring reed. And he stood in the gate.
Ezek. And the man said to me, Son of man, behold with thine eyes,  hear with thine ears,  set thy heart upon all that I shall show thee. For thou are brought here to the intent that I may show them to thee. Declare all that thou see to the house of Israel.
Ezek. And, behold, a wall on the outside of the house round about,  in the man's hand a measuring reed six cubits long, of a cubit and a handbreadth each. So he measured the thickness of the building, one reed,  the height, one reed.
Ezek. Then he came to the gate which looks toward the east,  went up the steps of it. And he measured the threshold of the gate, one reed broad,  the other threshold, one reed broad.
Ezek. And every little chamber was one reed long,  one reed broad,  the space between the little chambers was five cubits. And the threshold of the gate by the porch of the gate toward the house was one reed.
Ezek. He also measured the porch of the gate toward the house, one reed.
Ezek. Then he measured the porch of the gate, eight cubits,  the posts thereof, two cubits. And the porch of the gate was toward the house.
Ezek. And the little chambers of the gate eastward were three on this side,  three on that side; those three were of one measure. And the posts had one measure on this side and on that side.
Ezek. And he measured the breadth of the opening of the gate, ten cubits,  the length of the gate, thirteen cubits,
Ezek. and a border before the little chambers, one cubit on this side,  a border, one cubit on that side,  the little chambers, six cubits on this side,  six cubits on that side.
Ezek. And he measured the gate from the roof of the one little chamber to the roof of the other, a breadth of twenty-five cubits, door against door.
Ezek. He also made posts, sixty cubits. And the court reached to the posts, round about the gate.
Ezek. And from the forefront of the gate at the entrance to the forefront of the inner porch of the gate were fifty cubits.
Ezek. And there were closed windows to the little chambers,  to their posts within the gate round about,  likewise to the arches. And windows were round about inward,  upon each post were palm trees.
Ezek. Then he brought me into the outer court. And, lo, there were chambers and a pavement, made for the court round about; thirty chambers were upon the pavement.
Ezek. And the pavement was by the side of the gates, answerable to the length of the gates, even the lower pavement.
Ezek. Then he measured the breadth from the forefront of the lower gate to the forefront of the inner court outside, a hundred cubits, both on the east and on the north.
Ezek. And the gate of the outer court whose view is toward the north, he measured the length of it and the breadth of it.
Ezek. And the little chambers of it were three on this side and three on that side. And the posts of it and the arches of it were according to the measure of the first gate: the length of it was fifty cubits,  the breadth twenty-five cubits.
Ezek. And the windows of it,  the arches of it,  the palm trees of it, were according to the measure of the gate whose view is toward the east. And they went up to it by seven steps,  the arches of it were before them.
Ezek. And there was a gate to the inner court opposite the other gate, both on the north and on the east,  he measured from gate to gate a hundred cubits.
Ezek. And he led me toward the south. And, behold, a gate toward the south. And he measured the posts of it and the arches of it according to these measures.
Ezek. And there were windows in it,  in the arches of it round about, like those windows: the length was fifty cubits,  the breadth twenty-five cubits.
Ezek. And there were seven steps to go up to it,  the arches of it were before them. And it had palm trees, one on this side,  another on that side, upon the posts of it.
Ezek. And there was a gate to the inner court toward the south. And he measured from gate to gate toward the south a hundred cubits.
Ezek. Then he brought me to the inner court by the south gate. And he measured the south gate according to these measures,
Ezek. and the little chambers of it,  the posts of it,  the arches of it, according to these measures. And there were windows in it and in the arches of it round about. It was fifty cubits long,  twenty-five cubits broad.
Ezek. And there were arches round about, twenty-five cubits long,  five cubits broad.
Ezek. And the arches of it were toward the outer court,  palm trees were upon the posts of it. And the ascent to it had eight steps.
Ezek. And he brought me into the inner court toward the east. And he measured the gate according to these measures,
Ezek. and the little chambers of it,  the posts of it,  the arches of it, according to these measures. And there were windows in it and in the arches of it round about. It was fifty cubits long,  twenty-five cubits broad.
Ezek. And the arches of it were toward the outer court,  palm trees were upon the posts of it, on this side,  on that side. And the ascent to it had eight steps.
Ezek. And he brought me to the north gate. And he measured it according to these measures,
Ezek. the little chambers of it, the posts of it,  the arches of it. And there were windows in it round about. The length was fifty cubits,  the breadth twenty-five cubits.
Ezek. And the posts of it were toward the outer court,  palm trees were upon the posts of it, on this side,  on that side. And the ascent to it had eight steps.
Ezek. And a chamber with the door of it was by the posts at the gates. There they washed the burnt offering.
Ezek. And in the porch of the gate were two tables on this side,  two tables on that side, to kill on it the burnt offering and the sin offering and the trespass offering.
Ezek. And on the one side outside, at the going up to the entry of the gate toward the north, were two tables,  on the other side, which belonged to the porch of the gate, were two tables.
Ezek. Four tables were on this side,  four tables on that side, by the side of the gate, eight tables, upon which they killed the sacrifices.
Ezek. And there were four tables for the burnt offering, of hewn stone, a cubit and a half long,  a cubit and a half broad,  one cubit high, upon which they laid the instruments of which they killed the burnt offering and the sacrifice.
Ezek. And the hooks, a handbreadth long, were fastened inside round about. And upon the tables was the flesh of the oblation.
Ezek. And outside the inner gate were chambers for the singers in the inner court, which was at the side of the north gate,  their view was toward the south, one at the side of the east gate having the view toward the north.
Ezek. And he said to me, This chamber, whose view is toward the south, is for the priests, the keepers of the charge of the house.
Ezek. And the chamber whose view is toward the north is for the priests, the keepers of the charge of the altar. These are the sons of Zadok, who from among the sons of Levi come near to Jehovah to minister to him.
Ezek. And he measured the court, a hundred cubits long,  a hundred cubits broad, foursquare. And the altar was before the house.
Ezek. Then he brought me to the porch of the house,  measured each post of the porch, five cubits on this side,  five cubits on that side. And the breadth of the gate was three cubits on this side,  three cubits on that side.
Ezek. The length of the porch was twenty cubits,  the breadth eleven cubits, even by the steps by which they went up to it. And there were pillars by the posts, one on this side,  another on that side.
Ezek. And he brought me to the temple,  measured the posts, six cubits broad on the one side,  six cubits broad on the other side, which was the breadth of the tabernacle.
Ezek. And the breadth of the entrance was ten cubits. And the sides of the entrance were five cubits on the one side,  five cubits on the other side. And he measured the length of it, forty cubits,  the breadth, twenty cubits.
Ezek. Then he went inward,  measured each post of the entrance, two cubits,  the entrance, six cubits,  the breadth of the entrance, seven cubits.
Ezek. And he measured the length of it, twenty cubits,  the breadth, twenty cubits, before the temple. And he said to me, This is the most holy place.
Ezek. Then he measured the wall of the house, six cubits,  the breadth of every side-chamber, four cubits, round about the house on every side.
Ezek. And the side-chambers were in three stories, one over another,  thirty in order. And they entered into the wall which belonged to the house for the side-chambers round about, that they might be attached to it,  not be attached to the wall of the house.
Ezek. And the side-chambers were broader as they circled the house higher and higher, for the circling of the house went higher and higher round about the house. Therefore the breadth of the house continued upward,  so increased from the lowest chamber to the highest by the middle chamber.
Ezek. I also saw that the house had a raised basement round about. The foundations of the side-chambers were a full reed of six great cubits.
Ezek. The thickness of the wall, which was for the side-chambers, on the outside, was five cubits. And that which was left was the place of the side-chambers that belonged to the house.
Ezek. And between the chambers was a breadth of twenty cubits round about the house on every side.
Ezek. And the doors of the side-chambers were toward the place that was left, one door toward the north,  another door toward the south. And the breadth of the place that was left was five cubits round about.
Ezek. And the building that was before the separate place at the side toward the west was seventy cubits broad,  the wall of the building was five cubits thick round about,  the length of it ninety cubits.
Ezek. So he measured the house, a hundred cubits long,  the separate place,  the building, with the walls of it, a hundred cubits long,
Ezek. also the breadth of the face of the house,  of the separate place toward the east, a hundred cubits.
Ezek. And he measured the length of the building before the separate place which was at the back of it,  the galleries of it on the one side and on the other side, a hundred cubits,  the inner temple,  the porches of the court,
Ezek. the thresholds,  the closed windows,  the galleries round about on their three stories, opposite the threshold, paneled with wood round about,  from the ground up to the windows, (now the windows were covered),
Ezek. to the space above the door, even to the inner house,  outside,  by all the wall round about inside and outside, by measure.
Ezek. And it was made with cherubim and palm trees,  a palm tree was between cherub and cherub. And every cherub had two faces,
Ezek. so that there was the face of a man toward the palm tree on the one side,  the face of a young lion toward the palm tree on the other side, made through all the house round about.
Ezek. Cherubim and palm trees were made from the ground to above the door. Thus was the wall of the temple.
Ezek. As for the temple, the door-posts were squared. And as for the face of the sanctuary, the appearance was as the appearance of the temple.
Ezek. The altar was of wood, three cubits high,  the length of it two cubits,  the corners of it,  the length of it,  the walls of it, were of wood. And he said to me, This is the table that is before Jehovah.
Ezek. And the temple and the sanctuary had two doors.
Ezek. And the doors had two leaves apiece, two turning leaves, two for the one door,  two leaves for the other.
Ezek. And there were made on them, on the doors of the temple, cherubim and palm trees, just as were made upon the walls. And there was a threshold of wood upon the face of the porch outside.
Ezek. And there were closed windows and palm trees on the one side and on the other side, on the sides of the porch. Thus were the side-chambers of the house,  the thresholds.
Ezek. Then he brought me forth into the outer court, the way toward the north. And he brought me into the chamber that was opposite the separate place,  which was opposite the building toward the north.
Ezek. In front was the north door, the length of a hundred cubits,  the breadth was fifty cubits.
Ezek. Opposite the twenty which belonged to the inner court,  opposite the pavement which belonged to the outer court, was gallery against gallery in the third story.
Ezek. And before the chambers was a walk of ten cubits' breadth inward, a way of one cubit,  their doors were toward the north.
Ezek. Now the upper chambers were shorter, for the galleries took away from these, more than from the lower and the middlemost, in the building.
Ezek. For they were in three stories,  they did not have pillars as the pillars of the courts. Therefore the uppermost was narrowed more than the lowest and the middlemost from the ground.
Ezek. And the wall that was outside by the side of the chambers, toward the outer court before the chambers, the length of it was fifty cubits.
Ezek. For the length of the chambers that were in the outer court was fifty cubits. And, lo, of those on the front of the temple were a hundred cubits.
Ezek. And from under these chambers was the entry on the east side, as going into them from the outer court.
Ezek. In the thickness of the wall of the court toward the east, before the separate place,  before the building, there were chambers.
Ezek. And the way before them was like the appearance of the way of the chambers which were toward the north. According to their length so was their breadth. And all their exits were both according to their fashions,  according to their doors.
Ezek. And according to the doors of the chambers that were toward the south was a door at the head of the way, even the way directly before the wall toward the east, as entering into them.
Ezek. Then he said to me, The north chambers and the south chambers, which are before the separate place, they are the holy chambers, where the priests that are near to Jehovah shall eat the most holy things. There they shall lay the most holy things,  the meal offering,  the sin offering,  the trespass offering, for the place is holy.
Ezek. When the priests enter in, then they shall not go out of the holy place into the outer court,  they shall lay their garments there in which they minister, for they are holy. And they shall put on other garments,  shall approach to that which pertains to the people.
Ezek. Now when he had made an end of measuring the inner house, he brought me forth by the way of the gate whose view is toward the east,  measured it round about.
Ezek. He measured on the east side with the measuring reed, five hundred reeds, with the measuring reed round about.
Ezek. He measured on the north side five hundred reeds with the measuring reed round about.
Ezek. He measured on the south side five hundred reeds with the measuring reed.
Ezek. He turned about to the west side,  measured five hundred reeds with the measuring reed.
Ezek. He measured it on the four sides. It had a wall round about, the length five hundred,  the breadth five hundred, to make a separation between that which was holy and that which was common.
Ezek. Afterward he brought me to the gate, even the gate that looks toward the east.
Ezek. And, behold, the glory of the God of Israel came from the way of the east. And his voice was like the sound of many waters,  the earth shone with his glory.
Ezek. And it was according to the appearance of the vision which I saw, even according to the vision that I saw when I came to destroy the city. And the visions were like the vision that I saw by the river Chebar. And I fell upon my face.
Ezek. And the glory of Jehovah came into the house by the way of the gate whose view is toward the east.
Ezek. And the Spirit took me up,  brought me into the inner court, , behold, the glory of Jehovah filled the house.
Ezek. And I heard speaking to me out of the house,  a man stood by me.
Ezek. And he said to me, Son of man, this is the place of my throne,  the place of the soles of my feet, where I will dwell in the midst of the sons of Israel forever. And the house of Israel shall no more defile my holy name, neither they, nor their kings, by their whoredom,  by the dead bodies of their kings in their high places,
Ezek. in their setting of their threshold by my threshold,  their door-post beside my door-post,  there was but the wall between me and them. And they have defiled my holy name by their abominations which they have committed. Therefore I have consumed them in my anger.
Ezek. Now let them put away their whoredom,  the dead bodies of their kings, far from me,  I will dwell in the midst of them forever.
Ezek. Thou, son of man, show the house to the house of Israel, that they may be ashamed of their iniquities,  let them measure the pattern.
Ezek. And if they be ashamed of all that they have done, make known to them the form of the house,  the fashion of it,  the exits of it,  the entrances of it,  all the forms of it,  all the ordinances of it,  all the forms of it,  all the laws of it. And write it in their sight, that they may keep the whole form of it,  all the ordinances of it,  do them.
Ezek. This is the law of the house. Upon the top of the mountain the whole limit of it round about shall be most holy. Behold, this is the law of the house.
Ezek. And these are the measures of the altar by cubits (the cubit is a cubit and a handbreadth). The bottom shall be a cubit,  the breadth a cubit,  the border of it by the edge of it round about a span. And this shall be the base of the altar.
Ezek. And from the bottom upon the ground to the lower ledge shall be two cubits,  the breadth one cubit. And from the lesser ledge to the greater ledge shall be four cubits,  the breadth a cubit.
Ezek. And the upper altar shall be four cubits. And from the altar hearth and upward there shall be four horns.
Ezek. And the altar hearth shall be twelve long by twelve broad, square in the four sides of it.
Ezek. And the ledge shall be fourteen long by fourteen broad in the four sides of it. And the border about it shall be half a cubit,  the bottom of it shall be a cubit round about. And the steps of it shall look toward the east.
Ezek. And he said to me, Son of man, thus says the lord Jehovah: These are the ordinances of the altar in the day when they shall make it, to offer burnt offerings on it,  to sprinkle blood on it.
Ezek. Thou shall give to the priests the Levites who are of the seed of Zadok, who are near to me, to minister to me, says the lord Jehovah, a young bullock for a sin offering.
Ezek. And thou shall take of the blood of it,  put it on the four horns of it,  on the four corners of the ledge,  upon the border round about. Thus thou shall cleanse it and make atonement for it.
Ezek. Thou shall also take the bullock of the sin offering,  it shall be burnt in the appointed place of the house, outside the sanctuary.
Ezek. And on the second day thou shall offer a he-goat without blemish for a sin offering. And they shall cleanse the altar, as they cleansed it with the bullock.
Ezek. When thou have made an end of cleansing it, thou shall offer a young bullock without blemish,  a ram out of the flock without blemish.
Ezek. And thou shall bring them near before Jehovah,  the priests shall cast salt upon them,  they shall offer them up for a burnt offering to Jehovah.
Ezek. Seven days thou shall prepare each day a goat for a sin offering. They shall also prepare a young bullock,  a ram out of the flock, without blemish.
Ezek. Seven days they shall make atonement for the altar and purify it. So they shall consecrate it.
Ezek. And when they have accomplished the days, it shall be that upon the eighth day,  forward, the priests shall make your burnt offerings upon the altar,  your peace offerings. And I will accept you, says the lord Jehovah.
Ezek. Then he brought me back by the way of the outer gate of the sanctuary, which looks toward the east. And it was shut.
Ezek. And Jehovah said to me, This gate shall be shut. It shall not be opened, nor shall any man enter in by it, for Jehovah, the God of Israel, has entered in by it. Therefore it shall be shut.
Ezek. As for the ruler, he shall sit in it as ruler to eat bread before Jehovah. He shall enter by the way of the porch of the gate,  shall go out by the way of the same.
Ezek. Then he brought me by the way of the north gate before the house. And I looked, , behold, the glory of Jehovah filled the house of Jehovah. And I fell upon my face.
Ezek. And Jehovah said to me, Son of man, mark well,  behold with thine eyes,  hear with thine ears all that I say to thee concerning all the ordinances of the house of Jehovah,  all the laws of it. And mark well the entrance of the house, with every exit of the sanctuary.
Ezek. And thou shall say to the rebellious, even to the house of Israel, Thus says the lord Jehovah: O ye house of Israel, let it suffice you of all your abominations,
Ezek. in that ye have brought in foreigners, uncircumcised in heart and uncircumcised in flesh, to be in my sanctuary, to profane it, even my house, when ye offer my bread, the fat and the blood. And they have broken my covenant, to add to all your abominations.
Ezek. And ye have not kept the charge of my holy things,  ye have set keepers of my charge in my sanctuary for yourselves.
Ezek. Thus says the lord Jehovah: No foreigner, uncircumcised in heart and uncircumcised in flesh, shall enter into my sanctuary, of any foreigners that are among the sons of Israel.
Ezek. But the Levites who went far from me, when Israel went astray, who went astray from me after their idols, they shall bear their iniquity.
Ezek. Yet they shall be ministers in my sanctuary, having oversight at the gates of the house,  ministering in the house. They shall kill the burnt offering and the sacrifice for the people,  they shall stand before them to minister to them.
Ezek. Because they ministered to them before their idols,  became a stumbling block of iniquity to the house of Israel, therefore I have lifted up my hand against them, says the lord Jehovah,  they shall bear their iniquity.
Ezek. And they shall not come near to me, to execute the office of priest to me, nor to come near to any of my holy things, to the things that are most holy,  they shall bear their shame,  their abominations which they have committed.
Ezek. Yet I will make them keepers of the charge of the house, for all the service of it,  for all that shall be done in it.
Ezek. But the priests the Levites, the sons of Zadok, who kept the charge of my sanctuary when the sons of Israel went astray from me, they shall come near to me to minister to me. And they shall stand before me to offer to me the fat and the blood, says the lord Jehovah:
Ezek. they shall enter into my sanctuary,  they shall come near to my table, to minister to me,  they shall keep my charge.
Ezek. And it shall be that, when they enter in at the gates of the inner court, they shall be clothed with linen garments,  no wool shall come upon them, while they minister in the gates of the inner court,  within.
Ezek. They shall have linen headdresses upon their heads,  shall have linen breeches upon their loins. They shall not gird themselves with anything that causes sweat.
Ezek. And when they go forth into the outer court, even into the outer court to the people, they shall put off their garments in which they minister,  lay them in the holy chambers. And they shall put on other garments, that they not sanctify the people with their garments.
Ezek. Neither shall they shave their heads, nor allow their locks to grow long. They shall only cut off the hair of their heads.
Ezek. Neither shall any of the priests drink wine when they enter into the inner court.
Ezek. Neither shall they take for their wives a widow, nor her who is put away,  they shall take virgins of the seed of the house of Israel, or a widow who is the widow of a priest.
Ezek. And they shall teach my people the difference between the holy and the common,  cause them to discern between the unclean and the clean.
Ezek. And in a controversy they shall stand to judge. They shall judge it according to my ordinances. And they shall keep my laws and my statutes in all my appointed feasts,  they shall hallow my sabbaths.
Ezek. And they shall go in to no dead person to defile themselves. But for father, or for mother, or for son, or for daughter, for brother, or for sister who has had no husband, they may defile themselves.
Ezek. And after he is cleansed, they shall reckon to him seven days.
Ezek. And in the day that he goes into the sanctuary, into the inner court, to minister in the sanctuary, he shall offer his sin offering, says the lord Jehovah.
Ezek. And they shall have an inheritance: I am their inheritance. And ye shall give them no possession in Israel. I am their possession.
Ezek. They shall eat the meal offering,  the sin offering,  the trespass offering. And every devoted thing in Israel shall be theirs.
Ezek. And the first of all the first-fruits of every thing,  every oblation of everything, of all your oblations, shall be for the priest. Ye shall also give to the priests the first of your dough, to cause a blessing to rest on thy house.
Ezek. The priests shall not eat of anything that dies of itself, or is torn, whether it be bird or beast.
Ezek. Moreover, when ye shall divide the land by lot for inheritance, ye shall offer an oblation to Jehovah, a holy portion of the land. The length shall be the length of twenty-five thousand measures,  the breadth shall be ten thousand. It shall be holy in all the border of it round about.
Ezek. Of this there shall be for the holy place five hundred by five hundred square round about,  fifty cubits for the suburbs of it round about.
Ezek. And of this measure thou shall measure a length of twenty-five thousand,  a breadth of ten thousand. And the sanctuary shall be in it, which is most holy.
Ezek. It is a holy portion of the land. It shall be for the priests, the ministers of the sanctuary, who come near to minister to Jehovah,  it shall be a place for their houses,  a holy place for the sanctuary.
Ezek. And twenty-five thousand in length,  ten thousand in breadth, shall be to the Levites, the ministers of the house, for a possession to themselves, for twenty chambers.
Ezek. And ye shall appoint the possession of the city five thousand broad,  twenty-five thousand long, side by side with the oblation of the holy portion. It shall be for the whole house of Israel.
Ezek. And whatever is for the ruler shall be on the one side and on the other side of the holy oblation and of the possession of the city, in front of the holy oblation and in front of the possession of the city, on the west side westward,  on the east side eastward,  in length answerable to one of the portions, from the west border to the east border.
Ezek. It shall be to him for a possession in the land in Israel. And my rulers shall no more oppress my people,  they shall give the land to the house of Israel according to their tribes.
Ezek. Thus says the lord Jehovah: Let it suffice you, O rulers of Israel. Remove violence and spoil,  execute justice and righteousness. Take away your exactions from my people, says the lord Jehovah.
Ezek. Ye shall have just balances,  a just ephah,  a just bath.
Ezek. The ephah and the bath shall be of one measure, that the bath may contain the tenth part of a homer,  the ephah the tenth part of a homer. The measure of it shall be according to the homer.
Ezek. And the shekel shall be twenty gerahs. Twenty shekels, twenty-five shekels, fifteen shekels, shall be your maneh.
Ezek. This is the oblation that ye shall offer: The sixth part of an ephah from a homer of wheat,  ye shall give the sixth part of an ephah from a homer of barley,
Ezek. and the set portion of oil, of the bath of oil, the tenth part of a bath out of the cor, which is ten baths, even a homer, (for ten baths are a homer),
Ezek. and one lamb of the flock, out of two hundred, from the well-watered pastures of Israel, for a meal offering,  for a burnt offering,  for peace offerings, to make atonement for them, says the lord Jehovah.
Ezek. All the people of the land shall give to this oblation for the ruler in Israel.
Ezek. And it shall be the ruler's part to give the burnt offerings,  the meal offerings,  the drink offerings, in the feasts,  on the new moons,  on the sabbaths, in all the appointed feasts of the house of Israel. He shall prepare the sin offering,  the meal offering,  the burnt offering,  the peace offerings, to make atonement for the house of Israel.
Ezek. Thus says the lord Jehovah: In the first month, in the first day of the month, thou shall take a young bullock without blemish,  thou shall cleanse the sanctuary.
Ezek. And the priest shall take of the blood of the sin offering,  put it upon the door-posts of the house,  upon the four corners of the ledge of the altar,  upon the posts of the gate of the inner court.
Ezek. And so thou shall do on the seventh day of the month for each one who errs,  for him who is simple. So shall ye make atonement for the house.
Ezek. In the first month, in the fourteenth day of the month, ye shall have the Passover, a feast of seven days. Unleavened bread shall be eaten.
Ezek. And upon that day the ruler shall prepare for himself and for all the people of the land a bullock for a sin offering.
Ezek. And the seven days of the feast he shall prepare a burnt offering to Jehovah, seven bullocks and seven rams without blemish daily the seven days,  a he-goat daily for a sin offering.
Ezek. And he shall prepare a meal offering, an ephah for a bullock,  an ephah for a ram,  a hin of oil to an ephah.
Ezek. In the seventh month, in the fifteenth day of the month, in the feast, he shall do the like the seven days, according to the sin offering, according to the burnt offering,  according to the meal offering,  according to the oil.
Ezek. Thus says the lord Jehovah: The gate of the inner court that looks toward the east shall be shut the six working days,  on the sabbath day it shall be opened,  on the day of the new moon it shall be opened.
Ezek. And the ruler shall enter by the way of the porch of the gate outside,  shall stand by the post of the gate.
