Therefore the land shall mourn,  everyone who dwells in it shall languish with the beasts of the field and the birds of the heavens. Yea, the fishes of the sea shall also be taken away.
Yet, let no man strive, nor let any man reprove, for thy people are as those who strive with the priest.
thou shall stumble in the day,  the prophet also shall stumble with thee in the night. And I will destroy thy mother.
My people are destroyed for lack of knowledge. Because thou have rejected knowledge, I also will reject thee, that thou shall be no priest to me. Since thou have forgotten the law of thy God, I also will forget thy sons.
As they were multiplied, so they sinned against me. I will change their glory into shame.
They feed on the sin of my people,  set their heart on their iniquity.
it shall be, like people, like priest. And I will punish them for their ways,  will requite them their doings.
they shall eat,  not have enough. They shall play the harlot,  shall not increase, because they have left off taking heed to Jehovah.
Whoredom and wine and new wine take away the understanding.
My people ask counsel at their stock,  their staff declares to them, for the spirit of whoredom has caused them to err,  they have played the harlot, departing from under their God.
They sacrifice upon the tops of the mountains,  burn incense upon the hills, under oaks and poplars and terebinths, because the shadow of it is good. Therefore your daughters play the harlot,  your brides commit adultery.
I will not punish your daughters when they play the harlot, nor your brides when they commit adultery. For themselves go apart with harlots,  they sacrifice with the prostitutes. And the people who do not understand shall be overthrown.
Though thou, Israel, play the harlot, yet let not Judah offend,  come not ye to Gilgal, nor go ye up to Beth-aven, nor swear, As Jehovah lives.
For Israel has behaved himself stubbornly, like a stubborn heifer. Now Jehovah will feed them as a lamb in a large place.
Ephraim is joined to idols, let him alone.
Their drink has become sour. They play the harlot continually. Her rulers dearly love shame.
The wind has wrapped her up in its wings,  they shall be put to shame because of their sacrifices.
Hear this, O ye priests,  hearken, O house of Israel,  give ear, O house of the king, for to you pertains the judgment. For ye have been a snare at Mizpah,  a net spread upon Tabor.
the revolters have gone deep in making slaughter,  I am a rebuker of them all.
I know Ephraim,  Israel is not hid from me. For now, O Ephraim, thou have played the harlot; Israel is defiled.
Their doings will not allow them to turn to their God, for the spirit of whoredom is within them,  they do not know Jehovah.
the pride of Israel testifies to his face. Therefore Israel and Ephraim shall stumble in their iniquity. Judah also shall stumble with them.
They shall go with their flocks and with their herds to seek Jehovah,  they shall not find him. He has withdrawn himself from them.
They have dealt treacherously against Jehovah, for they have borne strange sons. Now the new moon shall devour them with their fields.
Blow ye the cornet in Gibeah,  the trumpet in Ramah. Sound an alarm at Beth-aven, behind thee, O Benjamin.
Ephraim shall become a desolation in the day of rebuke. I have made known that which shall surely be among the tribes of Israel.
The rulers of Judah are like those who remove the landmark. I will pour out my wrath upon them like water.
Ephraim is oppressed. He is crushed in judgment, because he was content to walk after man's command.
Therefore I am to Ephraim as a moth,  to the house of Judah as rottenness.
When Ephraim saw his sickness,  Judah saw his wound, then Ephraim went to Assyria,  sent to king Jareb. But he is not able to heal you, nor will he cure you of your wound.
For I will be to Ephraim as a lion,  as a young lion to the house of Judah. I, even I, will tear and go away, I will carry off,  there shall be none to deliver.
I will go and return to my place, till they acknowledge their offense,  seek my face. In their affliction they will seek me earnestly.
Come,  let us return to Jehovah, for he has torn,  he will heal us. He has smitten,  he will bind us up.
After two days he will revive us. On the third day he will raise us up,  we shall live before him.
let us know, let us follow on to know Jehovah. His going forth is sure as the morning,  he will come to us as the rain, as the latter rain that waters the earth.
O Ephraim, what shall I do to thee? O Judah, what shall I do to thee? For your goodness is as a morning cloud,  as the dew that goes away early.
Therefore I have hewed them by the prophets. I have slain them by the words of my mouth. And thy judgments are as the light that goes forth.
For I desire mercy,  not sacrifice,  the knowledge of God more than burnt offerings.
But like Adam they have transgressed the covenant. There they have dealt treacherously against me.
Gilead is a city of those who work iniquity; it is stained with blood.
as troops of robbers wait for a man, so the company of priests murder in the way toward Shechem. Yea, they have committed iniquity.
I have seen a horrible thing in the house of Israel. Whoredom is there in Ephraim; Israel is defiled.
Also, O Judah, there is a harvest appointed for thee when I bring back the captivity of my people.
When I would heal Israel, then the iniquity of Ephraim is uncovered,  the wickedness of Samaria. For they commit falsehood,  the thief enters in,  the troop of robbers ravages outside.
they do not consider in their hearts that I remember all their wickedness. Now their own doings have surrounded them; they are before my face.
They make the king glad with their wickedness,  the rulers with their lies.
They are all adulterers. They are as an oven heated by the baker. He ceases to stir the fire, from the kneading of the dough, until it is leavened.
On the day of our king the rulers made themselves sick with the heat of wine. He stretched out his hand with scoffers.
For they have made their heart ready like an oven, while they lie in wait. Their baker sleeps all the night. In the morning it burns as a flaming fire.
They are all hot as an oven,  devour their judges. All their kings are fallen. There is none among those who call to me.
Ephraim, he mixes himself among the peoples. Ephraim is a cake not turned.
Strangers have devoured his strength,  he does not know. Yea, gray hairs are here and there upon him,  he does not know.
the pride of Israel testifies to his face. Yet they have not returned to Jehovah their God, nor sought him for all this.
Ephraim is like a silly dove, without understanding. They call to Egypt. They go to Assyria.
When they shall go, I will spread my net upon them. I will bring them down as the birds of the heavens. I will chastise them, as their congregation has heard.
Woe to them! For they have wandered from me. Destruction to them! For they have trespassed against me. Though I would redeem them, yet they have spoken lies against me.
they have not cried to me with their heart,  they howl upon their beds. They assemble themselves for grain and new wine. They rebel against me.
Though I have taught and strengthened their arms, yet they devise mischief against me.
They return,  not to him on high. They are like a deceitful bow. Their rulers shall fall by the sword for the rage of their tongue. This shall be their derision in the land of Egypt.
Set the trumpet to thy mouth. As an eagle he comes against the house of Jehovah, because they have transgressed my covenant,  trespassed against my law.
They shall cry to me, My God, we, Israel know thee.
Israel has cast off that which is good. The enemy shall pursue him.
They have set up kings,  not by me. They have made rulers,  I knew it not. They have made themselves idols of their silver and their gold, that they may be cut off.
He has cast off thy calf, O Samaria. My anger is kindled against them. How long will it be ere they attain to innocence?
For even this is from Israel: the workman made it,  it is no God. Yea, the calf of Samaria shall be broken in pieces.
For they sow the wind,  they shall reap the whirlwind. He has no standing grain. The blade shall yield no meal. If so be it yields, strangers shall swallow it up.
Israel is swallowed up. They are now among the nations as a vessel in which no man delights.
For they have gone up to Assyria like a wild donkey alone by himself. Ephraim has hired lovers.
Yea, though they hire among the nations, I will now gather them,  they shall begin to be diminished because of the burden of the king of rulers.
Because Ephraim has multiplied altars for sinning, altars have been to him for sinning.
I wrote for him the multitude of my law,  they are counted as a strange thing.
As for the sacrifices of my offerings, they sacrifice flesh and eat it,  Jehovah does not accept them. He will now remember their iniquity,  visit their sins. They shall return to Egypt.
For Israel has forgotten his maker,  built palaces. And Judah has multiplied fortified cities. But I will send a fire upon his cities,  it shall devour the castles thereof.
Rejoice not, O Israel, for joy like the peoples, for thou have played the harlot, departing from thy God. Thou have loved hire upon every grain-floor.
The threshing floor and the winepress shall not feed them,  the new wine shall fail her.
They shall not dwell in Jehovah's land,  Ephraim shall return to Egypt,  they shall eat unclean food in Assyria.
They shall not pour out wine offerings to Jehovah, nor shall they be pleasing to him. Their sacrifices shall be to them as the bread of mourners. All who eat of it shall be polluted, for their bread shall be for their appetite. It shall not come into the house of Jehovah.
What will ye do in the day of solemn assembly,  in the day of the feast of Jehovah?
For, lo, they have gone away from destruction, yet Egypt shall gather them up. Memphis shall bury them. Their pleasant things of silver, nettles shall possess them. Thorns shall be in their tents.
The days of visitation have come. The days of recompense have come. Israel shall know it. The prophet is a fool, the spiritual man is mad, for the abundance of thine iniquity,  because the enmity is great.
Ephraim was a watchman with my God. As for the prophet, a fowler's snare is in all his ways,  enmity in the house of his God.
They have deeply corrupted themselves, as in the days of Gibeah. He will remember their iniquity. He will visit their sins.
I found Israel like grapes in the wilderness. I saw your fathers as the first ripe in the fig tree at its first season. But they came to Baal-peor,  consecrated themselves to the shameful thing,  became abominable like that which they loved.
As for Ephraim, their glory shall fly away like a bird. There shall be no birth,  none with child,  no conception.
Though they bring up their sons, yet I will bereave them, so that not a man shall be left. Yea, woe also to them when I depart from them!
Ephraim, just as I have seen Tyre, is planted in a pleasant place,  Ephraim shall bring out his sons to the slayer.
Give them, O Jehovah-what will thou give? Give them a miscarrying womb and dry breasts.
All their wickedness is in Gilgal, for there I hated them. Because of the wickedness of their doings I will drive them out of my house. I will love them no more. All their rulers are rebels.
Ephraim is smitten. Their root is dried up. They shall bear no fruit. Yea, though they bring forth, yet I will kill the beloved fruit of their womb.
My God will cast them away because they did not hearken to him,  they shall be wanderers among the nations.
Israel is a luxuriant vine that puts forth his fruit. According to the abundance of his fruit he has multiplied his altars. According to the goodness of their land they have made goodly pillars.
Their heart is divided. Now they shall be found guilty. He will smite their altars. He will destroy their pillars.
Surely now they shall say, We have no king, for we fear not Jehovah. And the king, what can he do for us?
They speak vain words, swearing falsely in making covenants. Therefore judgment springs up as hemlock in the furrows of the field.
The inhabitants of Samaria shall be in terror for the calves of Beth-aven. For the people of it shall mourn over it,  the priests of it, who rejoiced over it for the glory of it, because it has departed from it.
It shall also be carried to Assyria for a present to king Jareb. Ephraim shall receive shame,  Israel shall be ashamed of his own counsel.
As for Samaria, its king is cut off, as foam upon the water.
The high places also of Aven, the sin of Israel, shall be destroyed. The thorn and the thistle shall come up on their altars,  they shall say to the mountains, Cover us,  to the hills, Fall on us.
O Israel, thou have sinned from the days of Gibeah. There they stood. The battle against the sons of iniquity does not overtake them in Gibeah.
When it is my desire, I will chastise them. And the peoples shall be gathered against them, when they are bound to their two transgressions.
Ephraim is a heifer that is taught, that loves to tread out the grain. But I have passed over upon her fair neck. I will set a rider on Ephraim. Judah shall plow. Jacob shall break his clods.
Sow to yourselves in righteousness. Reap according to kindness. Break up your fallow ground, for it is time to seek Jehovah, till he comes and rains righteousness upon you.
Ye have plowed wickedness. Ye have reaped iniquity. Ye have eaten the fruit of lies. For thou trusted in thy way, in the multitude of thy mighty men.
Therefore a tumult shall arise among thy people,  all thy fortresses shall be destroyed, as Shalman destroyed Beth-arbel in the day of battle; the mother was dashed in pieces with her sons.
So shall Bethel do to you because of your great wickedness. At daybreak the king of Israel shall be utterly cut off.
When Israel was a child, then I loved him,  out of Egypt I called my son.
The more the prophets called them, the more they went from them. They sacrificed to the Baalim,  burned incense to graven images.
Yet I taught Ephraim to walk. I took them on my arms,  they did not know that I healed them.
I drew them with cords of a man, with bands of love,  I was to them as those who lift up the yoke on their jaws. And I laid food before them.
They shall not return into the land of Egypt,  the Assyrian shall be their king, because they refused to return to me.
the sword shall fall upon their cities,  shall consume their bars,  devour them, because of their own counsels.
my people are bent on backsliding from me. Though they call them to him who is on high, none at all will exalt him.
How shall I give thee up, Ephraim? How shall I cast thee off, Israel? How shall I make thee as Admah? How shall I set thee as Zeboiim? My heart is turned within me. My compassions are kindled together.
I will not execute the fierceness of my anger. I will not return to destroy Ephraim. For I am God,  not man, the Holy One in the midst of thee,  I will not come in wrath.
They shall walk after Jehovah, who will roar like a lion. For he will roar,  the sons shall come trembling from the west.
They shall come trembling as a bird out of Egypt,  as a dove out of the land of Assyria. And I will make them to dwell in their houses, says Jehovah.
Ephraim encompasses me around with falsehood,  the house of Israel with deceit,  Judah yet rules with God,  is faithful with the Holy One.
Ephraim feeds on wind,  follows after the east wind. He continually multiplies lies and desolation. And they make a covenant with Assyria,  oil is carried into Egypt.
Jehovah has also a controversy with Judah,  will punish Jacob according to his ways. He will recompense him according to his doings.
In the womb he took his brother by the heel,  in his manhood he had strength with God.
Yea, he had strength over the agent,  prevailed, as he wept,  made supplication to him. He found him at Bethel,  there he spoke with us.
Even Jehovah, the God of hosts, Jehovah is his memorial.
Therefore turn thou to thy God. Keep kindness and justice,  wait for thy God continually.
He is a Canaanite. The balances of deceit are in his hand. He loves to oppress.
Ephraim said, Surely I have become rich. I have found wealth for myself. In all my labors they shall find no iniquity in me that is sin.
But I am Jehovah thy God from the land of Egypt. I will yet again make thee to dwell in tents, as in the days of the solemn feast.
I have also spoken to the prophets,  I have multiplied visions. And by the ministry of the prophets I have used similitudes.
Is Gilead iniquity? They are altogether false. In Gilgal they sacrifice bullocks. Yea, their altars are as heaps in the furrows of the field.
Jacob fled into the field of Aram,  Israel served for a wife,  for a wife he kept sheep.
by a prophet Jehovah brought Israel up out of Egypt,  by a prophet he was preserved.
Ephraim has provoked to anger most bitterly. Therefore his blood shall be left upon him,  his reproach his Lord shall return to him.
When Ephraim spoke, there was trembling. He exalted himself in Israel,  when he offended in Baal, he died.
now they sin more and more,  have made themselves molten images of their silver, even idols according to their own understanding, all of them the work of the craftsmen. They say of them, Let the men who sacrifice kiss the calves.
Therefore they shall be as the morning cloud,  as the dew that passes away early, as the chaff that is driven with the whirlwind out of the threshing-floor,  as the smoke out of the chimney.
Yet I am Jehovah thy God from the land of Egypt,  thou shall know no god but me,  besides me there is no savior.
I knew thee in the wilderness, in the land of great drought.
According to their pasture, so they were filled. They were filled,  their heart was exalted. Therefore they have forgotten me.
Therefore I am to them as a lion. As a leopard I will watch by the way.
I will meet them as a bear that is bereaved of her whelps,  will rend the caul of their heart. And there I will devour them like a lioness. The wild beast shall tear them.
It is thy destruction, O Israel, that thou are against me, against thy help.
Where now is thy king, that he may save thee in all thy cities,  thy judges, of whom thou said, Give me a king and rulers?
I have given thee a king in my anger,  have taken him away in my wrath.
The iniquity of Ephraim is bound up. His sin is laid up in store.
The sorrows of a travailing woman shall come upon him. He is an unwise son, for it is time he should not tarry in the place of the breaking forth of sons.
I will ransom them from the power of Sheol. I will redeem them from death. O death, where are thy plagues? O Sheol, where is thy sting? Repentance shall be hid from my eyes.
Though he be fruitful among his brothers, an east wind shall come, the breath of Jehovah coming up from the wilderness,  his spring shall become dry,  his fountain shall be dried up. He shall make spoil of the treasure of all goodly vessels.
Samaria shall bear her guilt, for she has rebelled against her God. They shall fall by the sword. Their infants shall be dashed in pieces,  their women with child shall be ripped up.
O Israel, return to Jehovah thy God, for thou have fallen by thine iniquity.
Take with you words,  return to Jehovah. Say to him, Take away all iniquity,  accept that which is good. So we will render as bullocks the offering of our lips.
Assyria shall not save us. We will not ride upon horses, nor will we say any more to the work of our hands, Our gods. For in thee the fatherless finds mercy.
I will heal their backsliding. I will love them freely. For my anger is turned away from him.
I will be as the dew to Israel. He shall blossom as the lily,  cast forth his roots as Lebanon.
His branches shall spread,  his beauty shall be as the olive tree,  his smell as Lebanon.
Those who dwell under his shadow shall return. They shall revive as the grain,  blossom as the vine. The scent of it shall be as the wine of Lebanon.
Ephraim shall say, What have I to do any more with idols? I have answered,  will regard him. I am like a green fir tree. From me thy fruit is found.
Who is wise, that he may understand these things, prudent, that he may know them? For the ways of Jehovah are right,  the just shall walk in them. But transgressors shall fall therein.
Joel
Joel. The word of Jehovah that came to Joel the son of Pethuel.
Joel. Hear this, ye old men,  give ear, all ye inhabitants of the land. Has this been in your days, or in the days of your fathers?
Joel. Tell ye your sons of it,  let your sons tell their sons,  their sons another generation.
Joel. That which the palmer-worm has left the locust has eaten,  that which the locust has left the canker-worm has eaten,  that which the canker-worm has left the caterpillar has eaten.
Joel. Awake, ye drunkards,  weep,  wail, all ye drinkers of wine, because of the sweet wine, for it is cut off from your mouth.
Joel. For a nation has come up upon my land, strong,  without number. His teeth are the teeth of a lion,  he has the jaw-teeth of a lioness.
Joel. He has laid my vine waste,  barked my fig tree. He has made it clean bare,  cast it away. The branches of it are made white.
Joel. Lament like a virgin girded with sackcloth for the husband of her youth.
Joel. The meal offering and the drink offering are cut off from the house of Jehovah. The priests, Jehovah's ministers, mourn.
Joel. The field is laid waste; the land mourns. For the grain is destroyed, the new wine is dried up, the oil languishes.
Joel. Be confounded, O ye husbandmen. Wail, O ye vinedressers, for the wheat and for the barley, for the harvest of the field is perished.
Joel. The vine is withered,  the fig tree languishes. The pomegranate tree, the palm tree also,  the apple tree, even all the trees of the field are withered. For joy has withered away from the sons of men.
Joel. Gird yourselves with sackcloth,  lament, ye priests. Wail, ye ministers of the altar. Come, lie all night in sackcloth, ye ministers of my God. For the meal offering and the drink offering are withheld from the house of your God.
Joel. Sanctify a fast. Call a solemn assembly. Gather the old men and all the inhabitants of the land to the house of Jehovah your God,  cry to Jehovah.
Joel. Alas for the day! For the day of Jehovah is at hand,  it shall come as destruction from the Almighty.
Joel. Is not the food cut off before our eyes, yea, joy and gladness from the house of our God?
Joel. The seeds rot under their clods. The garners are laid desolate. The barns are broken down. For the grain is withered.
Joel. How do the beasts groan! The herds of cattle are perplexed because they have no pasture, yea, the flocks of sheep are made desolate.
Joel. O Jehovah, to thee do I cry. For the fire has devoured the pastures of the wilderness,  the flame has burned all the trees of the field.
Joel. Yea, the beasts of the field pant to thee, for the water brooks are dried up,  the fire has devoured the pastures of the wilderness.
Joel. Blow ye the trumpet in Zion,  sound an alarm in my holy mountain. Let all the inhabitants of the land tremble. For the day of Jehovah comes, for it is near at hand,
Joel. a day of darkness and gloominess, a day of clouds and thick darkness, as the dawn spreads upon the mountains, a great people and a strong, there has not ever been the like, nor shall be any more after them, even to the years of many generations.
Joel. A fire devours before them,  behind them a flame burns. The land is as the garden of Eden before them,  behind them a desolate wilderness. Yea,  none has escaped them.
Joel. The appearance of them is as the appearance of horses,  as horsemen, so do they run.
Joel. They leap like the noise of chariots on the tops of the mountains, like the noise of a flame of fire that devours the stubble, as a strong people set in battle array.
Joel. At their presence the peoples are in anguish; all faces have grown pale.
Joel. They run like mighty men. They climb the wall like men of war,  they march each one on his ways. And they do not break their ranks.
Joel. Neither does one push another. They march each one in his path,  they burst through the weapons,  do not break off.
Joel. They leap upon the city. They run upon the wall. They climb up into the houses. They enter in at the windows like a thief.
Joel. The earth quakes before them. The heavens tremble. The sun and the moon are darkened,  the stars withdraw their shining.
Joel. And Jehovah utters his voice before his army, for his camp is very great. For he is strong who executes his word. For the day of Jehovah is great and very fearful,  who can abide it?
Joel. Yet even now, says Jehovah, turn ye to me with all your heart,  with fasting,  with weeping,  with mourning.
Joel. And rend your heart,  not your garments,  turn to Jehovah your God, for he is gracious and merciful, slow to anger,  abundant in loving kindness,  relents of the evil.
Joel. Who knows whether he will not turn and relent,  leave a blessing behind him, even a meal offering and a drink offering to Jehovah your God?
Joel. Blow the trumpet in Zion. Sanctify a fast. Call a solemn assembly.
Joel. Gather the people. Sanctify the assembly. Assemble the old men. Gather the sons,  those who suck the breasts. Let the bridegroom go forth from his chamber,  the bride out of her closet.
Joel. Let the priests, the ministers of Jehovah, weep between the porch and the altar,  let them say, Spare thy people, O Jehovah,  do not give thy heritage to reproach, that the nations should rule over them. Why should they say among the peoples, Where is their God?
Joel. Then Jehovah was jealous for his land,  had pity on his people.
Joel. And Jehovah answered and said to his people, Behold, I will send you grain,  new wine,  oil,  ye shall be satisfied therewith. And I will no more make you a reproach among the nations.
Joel. But I will remove the northern army far off from you,  will drive it into a land barren and desolate, its forepart into the eastern sea,  its rear part into the western sea. And its stench shall come up,  its foul odor shall come up, because it has done great things.
Joel. Fear not, O land. Be glad and rejoice, for Jehovah has done great things.
Joel. Be not afraid, ye beasts of the field, for the pastures of the wilderness spring, for the tree bears its fruit, the fig tree and the vine yield their strength.
Joel. Be glad then, ye sons of Zion,  rejoice in Jehovah your God, for he gives you the former rain in just measure,  he causes the rain to come down for you, the former rain and the latter rain, in the first month.
Joel. And the floors shall be full of wheat,  the vats shall overflow with new wine and oil.
Joel. And I will restore to you the years that the locust, the canker-worm,  the caterpillar,  the palmer-worm has eaten-my great army which I sent among you.
Joel. And ye shall eat in plenty and be satisfied. And shall praise the name of Jehovah your God, who has dealt wondrously with you. And my people shall never be put to shame.
Joel. And ye shall know that I am in the midst of Israel,  that I am Jehovah your God,  there is none else. And my people shall never be put to shame.
Joel. And it shall come to pass afterward, that I will pour out my Spirit upon all flesh,  your sons and your daughters shall prophesy. Your old men shall dream dreams. Your young men shall see visions.
Joel. And also I will pour out my Spirit upon the servants and upon the handmaids in those days.
Joel. And I will show wonders in the heavens and in the earth, blood,  fire,  pillars of smoke.
Joel. The sun shall be turned into darkness,  the moon into blood, before the great and wonderful day of Jehovah comes.
Joel. And it shall come to pass, that whoever shall call on the name of Jehovah shall be saved. For in mount Zion and in Jerusalem there shall be those who escape, as Jehovah has said,  among the remnant those whom Jehovah calls.
Joel. For, behold, in those days,  in that time, when I shall bring back the captivity of Judah and Jerusalem,
Joel. I will gather all nations,  will bring them down into the valley of Jehoshaphat. And I will execute judgment upon them there for my people and for my heritage Israel, whom they have scattered among the nations. And they have parted my land,
Joel. and have cast lots for my people,  have given a boy for a harlot,  sold a girl for wine, that they may drink.
Joel. Yea,  what are ye to me, O Tyre,  Sidon,  all the regions of Philistia? Will ye render me a recompense? And if ye recompense me, I will return your recompense swiftly and speedily upon your own head.
Joel. Inasmuch as ye have taken my silver and my gold,  have carried into your temples my goodly precious things,
Joel. and have sold the sons of Judah and the sons of Jerusalem to the sons of the Grecians, that ye may remove them far from their border,
Joel. behold, I will stir them up out of the place where ye have sold them,  will return your recompense upon your own head.
Joel. And I will sell your sons and your daughters into the hand of the sons of Judah,  they shall sell them to the men of Sheba, to a nation far off. For Jehovah has spoken it.
Joel. Proclaim ye this among the nations: Prepare war. Stir up the mighty men. Let all the men of war draw near. Let them come up.
Joel. Beat your plowshares into swords,  your pruning-hooks into spears. Let the weak say, I am strong.
Joel. Hasten ye,  come, all ye nations round about,  gather yourselves together. Cause thy mighty ones to come down there, O Jehovah.
Joel. Let the nations bestir themselves,  come up to the valley of Jehoshaphat, for there I will sit to judge all the nations round about.
Joel. Put ye in the sickle, for the harvest is ripe. Come, tread ye, for the winepress is full, the vats overflow. For their wickedness is great.
Joel. Multitudes, multitudes in the valley of decision! For the day of Jehovah is near in the valley of decision.
Joel. The sun and the moon are darkened,  the stars withdraw their shining.
Joel. And Jehovah will roar from Zion,  utter his voice from Jerusalem,  the heavens and the earth shall shake. But Jehovah will be a refuge to his people,  a stronghold to the sons of Israel.
Joel. So ye shall know that I am Jehovah your God, dwelling in Zion my holy mountain. Then Jerusalem shall be holy,  no strangers shall pass through her any more.
Joel. And it shall come to pass in that day, that the mountains shall drop down sweet wine,  the hills shall flow with milk,  all the brooks of Judah shall flow with waters. And a fountain shall come forth from the house of Jehovah,  shall water the valley of Shittim.
Joel. Egypt shall be a desolation,  Edom shall be a desolate wilderness, for the violence done to the sons of Judah, because they have shed innocent blood in their land.
Joel. But Judah shall abide forever,  Jerusalem from generation to generation.
Joel. And I will cleanse their blood, that I have not cleansed. For Jehovah dwells in Zion.
Amos
Amos. The words of Amos, who was among the herdsmen of Tekoa, which he saw concerning Israel in the days of Uzziah king of Judah,  in the days of Jeroboam the son of Joash king of Israel, two years before the earthquake.
Amos. And he said, Jehovah will roar from Zion,  utter his voice from Jerusalem,  the pastures of the shepherds shall mourn,  the top of Carmel shall wither.
Amos. Thus says Jehovah: For three transgressions of Damascus, yea, for four, I will not turn away the punishment of it, because they have threshed Gilead with threshing instruments of iron.
Amos. But I will send a fire into the house of Hazael,  it shall devour the palaces of Ben-hadad.
Amos. And I will break the bar of Damascus,  cut off the inhabitant from the valley of Aven,  he who holds the scepter from the house of Eden,  the people of Syria shall go into captivity to Kir, says Jehovah.
Amos. Thus says Jehovah: For three transgressions of Gaza, yea, for four, I will not turn away the punishment of it, because they carried away captive the whole people, to deliver them up to Edom.
Amos. But I will send a fire on the wall of Gaza,  it shall devour the palaces of it.
Amos. And I will cut off the inhabitant from Ashdod,  him who holds the scepter from Ashkelon. And I will turn my hand against Ekron,  the remnant of the Philistines shall perish, says the lord Jehovah.
Amos. Thus says Jehovah: For three transgressions of Tyre, yea, for four, I will not turn away the punishment of it, because they delivered up the whole people to Edom,  did not remember the brotherly covenant.
Amos. But I will send a fire on the wall of Tyre,  it shall devour the palaces of it.
Amos. Thus says Jehovah: For three transgressions of Edom, yea, for four, I will not turn away the punishment of it, because he pursued his brother with the sword,  cast off all pity. And his anger tore perpetually,  he kept his wrath forever.
Amos. But I will send a fire upon Teman,  it shall devour the palaces of Bozrah.
Amos. Thus says Jehovah: For three transgressions of the sons of Ammon, yea, for four, I will not turn away the punishment of it, because they have ripped up the women with child of Gilead, that they may enlarge their border.
Amos. But I will kindle a fire in the wall of Rabbah,  it shall devour the palaces of it, with shouting in the day of battle, with a tempest in the day of the whirlwind.
Amos. And their king shall go into captivity, he and his rulers together, says Jehovah.
Amos. Thus says Jehovah: For three transgressions of Moab, yea, for four, I will not turn away the punishment of it, because he burned the bones of the king of Edom into lime.
Amos. But I will send a fire upon Moab,  it shall devour the palaces of Kerioth,  Moab shall die with tumult, with shouting,  with the sound of the trumpet.
Amos. And I will cut off the judge from the midst of it,  will kill all the rulers of it with him, says Jehovah.
Amos. Thus says Jehovah: For three transgressions of Judah, yea, for four, I will not turn away the punishment of it, because they have rejected the law of Jehovah,  have not kept his statutes,  their lies have caused them to err, according to which their fathers walked.
Amos. But I will send a fire upon Judah,  it shall devour the palaces of Jerusalem.
Amos. Thus says Jehovah: For three transgressions of Israel, yea, for four, I will not turn away the punishment of it, because they have sold a righteous man for silver,  a needy man for a pair of shoes-
Amos. those who pant after the dust of the earth on the head of the poor,  turn aside the way of the meek. And a man and his father go to the same maiden, to profane my holy name.
Amos. And they lay themselves down beside every altar upon clothes taken in pledge. And in the house of their God they drink the wine of such as have been fined.
Amos. Yet I destroyed the Amorite before them, whose height was like the height of the cedars,  he was strong as the oaks, yet I destroyed his fruit from above,  his roots from beneath.
Amos. Also I brought you up out of the land of Egypt,  led you forty years in the wilderness, to possess the land of the Amorite.
Amos. And I raised up of your sons for prophets,  of your young men for Nazirites. Is it not even thus, O ye sons of Israel? says Jehovah.
Amos. But ye gave the Nazirites wine to drink,  commanded the prophets, saying, Do not Prophesy.
Amos. Behold, I will press you in your place, as a cart presses that is full of sheaves.
Amos. And flight shall perish from the swift,  the strong shall not strengthen his force, nor shall the mighty deliver himself.
Amos. Neither shall he stand who handles the bow. And he who is swift of foot shall not deliver himself, nor shall he who rides the horse deliver himself.
Amos. And he who is courageous among the mighty shall flee away naked in that day, says Jehovah.
Amos. Hear this word that Jehovah has spoken against you, O sons of Israel, against the whole family which I brought up out of the land of Egypt, saying,
Amos. You only I have known of all the families of the earth. Therefore I will visit upon you all your iniquities.
Amos. Shall two walk together unless they have agreed?
Amos. Will a lion roar in the forest, when he has no prey? Will a young lion cry out of his den, if he has taken nothing?
Amos. Can a bird fall in a snare upon the earth, where no net is set for him? Shall a snare spring up from the ground,  have taken nothing at all?
Amos. Shall the trumpet be blown in a city,  the people not be afraid? Shall evil befall a city,  Jehovah has not done it?
Amos. Surely the lord Jehovah will do nothing unless he reveals his secret to his servants the prophets.
Amos. The lion has roared, who will not fear? The lord Jehovah has spoken, who can but prophesy?
Amos. Publish ye in the palaces at Ashdod,  in the palaces in the land of Egypt,  say, Assemble yourselves upon the mountains of Samaria,  behold what great tumults are in it,  what oppressions are in the midst of it.
Amos. For they do not know to do right, says Jehovah, who store up violence and robbery in their palaces.
Amos. Therefore thus says the lord Jehovah: An adversary shall be, even round about the land,  he shall bring down thy strength from thee,  thy palaces shall be plundered.
Amos. Thus says Jehovah: As the shepherd rescues out of the mouth of the lion two legs, or a piece of an ear, so shall the sons of Israel be rescued who sit in Samaria in the corner of a couch,  on the silken cushions of a bed.
Amos. Hear ye,  testify against the house of Jacob, says the lord Jehovah, the God of hosts.
Amos. For in the day that I shall visit the transgressions of Israel upon him, I will also visit the altars of Bethel,  the horns of the altar shall be cut off,  fall to the ground.
Amos. And I will smite the winter house with the summer house,  the houses of ivory shall perish,  the great houses shall have an end, says Jehovah.
Amos. Hear this word, ye cows of Bashan, who are in the mountain of Samaria, who oppress the poor, who crush the needy, who say to their lords, Bring,  let us drink.
Amos. The lord Jehovah has sworn by his holiness, that, lo, the days shall come upon you, that they shall take you away with hooks,  your residue with fish-hooks.
Amos. And ye shall go out at the breaches, each one straight before her,  ye shall cast yourselves into Harmon, says Jehovah.
Amos. Come to Bethel and transgress, to Gilgal and multiply transgression. And bring your sacrifices every morning,  your tithes every three days.
Amos. And offer a sacrifice of thanksgiving of that which is leavened,  proclaim freewill offerings,  publish them. For this pleases you, O ye sons of Israel, says the lord Jehovah.
Amos. And I also have given you cleanness of teeth in all your cities,  want of bread in all your places, yet ye have not returned to me, says Jehovah.
Amos. And I also have withheld the rain from you, when there were yet three months to the harvest. And I caused it to rain upon one city,  caused it not to rain upon another city. One piece was rained upon,  the piece upon which it did not rain withered.
Amos. So two or three cities wandered to one city to drink water,  were not satisfied. Yet ye have not returned to me, says Jehovah.
Amos. I have smitten you with blasting and mildew. The multitude of your gardens and your vineyards and your fig trees and your olive trees the palmer-worm has devoured. Yet ye have not returned to me, says Jehovah.
Amos. I have sent among you the pestilence according to the manner of Egypt. I have slain your young men with the sword,  have carried away your horses,  I have made the stench of your camp to come up even into your nostrils. Yet ye have not returned to me, says Jehovah.
Amos. I have overthrown cities among you, as when God overthrew Sodom and Gomorrah,  ye were as a brand plucked out of the burning. Yet ye have not returned to me, says Jehovah.
Amos. Therefore thus I will do to thee, O Israel,  because I will do this to thee, prepare to meet thy God, O Israel.
Amos. For, lo, he who forms the mountains,  creates the wind,  declares to man what is his thought, who makes the morning darkness,  treads upon the high places of the earth-Jehovah, the God of hosts, is his name.
Amos. Hear ye this word which I take up for a lamentation over you, O house of Israel.
Amos. The virgin of Israel is fallen; she shall no more rise. She is cast down upon her land; there is none to raise her up.
Amos. For thus says the lord Jehovah: The city that went forth a thousand shall have a hundred left,  that which went forth a hundred shall have ten left, to the house of Israel.
Amos. For thus says Jehovah to the house of Israel: Seek ye me,  ye shall live.
Amos. But seek not Bethel, nor enter into Gilgal,  pass not to Beersheba. For Gilgal shall surely go into captivity,  Bethel shall come to naught.
Amos. Seek Jehovah,  ye shall live, lest he break out like fire in the house of Joseph,  it devour,  there be none to quench it in Bethel.
Amos. Ye who turn justice to wormwood,  cast down righteousness to the earth,
Amos. seek him who makes the Pleiades and Orion,  turns the shadow of death into the morning,  makes the day dark with night, who calls for the waters of the sea,  pours them out upon the face of the earth (Jehovah is his name),
Amos. who brings sudden destruction upon the strong, so that destruction comes upon the fortress.
Amos. They hate him who reproves in the gate,  they abhor him who speaks uprightly.
Amos. Inasmuch therefore as ye trample upon the poor,  take exactions of wheat from him. Ye have built houses of hewn stone,  ye shall not dwell in them. Ye have planted pleasant vineyards,  ye shall not drink the wine thereof.
Amos. For I know how manifold are your transgressions,  how mighty are your sins-ye who afflict the just man, who take a bribe,  who turn aside the needy in the gate.
Amos. Therefore he who is prudent shall keep silence in such a time, for it is an evil time.
Amos. Seek good,  not evil, that ye may live,  so Jehovah, the God of hosts, will be with you, as ye say.
Amos. Hate the evil,  love the good,  establish justice in the gate. It may be that Jehovah, the God of hosts, will be gracious to the remnant of Joseph.
Amos. Therefore thus says Jehovah, the God of hosts, the Lord: Wailing shall be in all the broad ways. And they shall say in all the streets, Alas! Alas! And they shall call the husbandman to mourning,  such as are skilful in lamentation to wailing.
Amos. And in all vineyards shall be wailing, for I will pass through the midst of thee, says Jehovah.
Amos. Woe to you who desire the day of Jehovah! Why would ye have the day of Jehovah? It is darkness,  not light.
Amos. As if a man fled from a lion,  a bear met him, or went into the house and leaned his hand on the wall,  a serpent bit him.
Amos. Shall not the day of Jehovah be darkness,  not light, even very dark,  no brightness in it?
Amos. I hate, I despise your feasts,  I will take no delight in your solemn assemblies.
Amos. Yea, though ye offer me your burnt offerings and meal offerings, I will not accept them, nor will I regard the peace offerings of your fat beasts.
Amos. Take thou away from me the noise of thy songs, for I will not hear the melody of thy viols.
Amos. But let justice roll down as waters,  righteousness as a mighty stream.
Amos. Did ye bring sacrifices and offerings to me in the wilderness forty years, O house of Israel?
Amos. Yea, ye have borne the tabernacle of Moloch,  the star of your god Remphan, your images which ye made to yourselves.
Amos. Therefore I will cause you to go into captivity beyond Damascus, says Jehovah, whose name is the God of hosts.
Amos. Woe to those who are at ease in Zion,  to those who are secure in the mountain of Samaria, the notable men of the chief of the nations, to whom the house of Israel come!
Amos. Pass ye to Calneh,  see,  from there go ye to Hamath the great, then go down to Gath of the Philistines. Are they better than these kingdoms? Or is their border greater than your border?
Amos. Ye who put far away the evil day,  cause the seat of violence to come near,
Amos. who lie upon beds of ivory,  stretch themselves upon their couches,  eat the lambs out of the flock,  the calves out of the midst of the stall,
Amos. who sing idle songs to the sound of the viol, who invent for themselves instruments of music, like David,
Amos. who drink wine in bowls,  anoint themselves with the chief oils,  they are not grieved for the affliction of Joseph.
Amos. Therefore they shall now go captive with the first who go captive,  the revelry of those who stretched themselves shall pass away.
Amos. The lord Jehovah has sworn by himself, says Jehovah, the God of hosts: I abhor the excellency of Jacob,  hate his palaces, therefore I will deliver up the city with all that is therein.
Amos. And it shall come to pass, if there remain ten men in one house, that they shall die.
Amos. And when a man's uncle shall take him up, even he who burns him, to bring out the bones out of the house,  shall say to him who is in the innermost parts of the house, Is there yet any with thee? and he shall say, No, then he shall say, Hold thy peace, for we may not make mention of the name of Jehovah.
Amos. For, behold, Jehovah commands,  the great house shall be smitten with breaches,  the little house with clefts.
Amos. Shall horses run upon the rock? Will a man plow there with oxen? That ye have turned justice into gall,  the fruit of righteousness into wormwood,
Amos. ye who rejoice in a thing of nothing, who say, Have we not taken to us horns by our own strength?
Amos. For, behold, I will raise up against you a nation, O house of Israel, says Jehovah, the God of hosts,  they shall afflict you from the entrance of Hamath to the brook of the Arabah.
Amos. Thus the lord Jehovah showed me: And, behold, he formed locusts in the beginning of the shooting up of the latter growth, , lo, it was the latter growth after the king's mowings.
Amos. And it came to pass that, when they made an end of eating the grass of the land, then I said, O lord Jehovah, forgive, I beseech thee. How shall Jacob stand, for he is small?
Amos. Jehovah relented concerning this. It shall not be, says Jehovah.
Amos. Thus the lord Jehovah showed me: And, behold, the lord Jehovah called to contend by fire,  it devoured the great deep,  would have eaten up the land.
Amos. Then I said, O lord Jehovah, cease, I beseech thee. How shall Jacob stand, for he is small?
Amos. Jehovah relented concerning this. This also shall not be, says the lord Jehovah.
Amos. Thus he showed me: And, behold, the Lord stood beside a wall made by a plumb-line, with a plumb-line in his hand.
Amos. And Jehovah said to me, Amos, what do thou see? And I said, A plumb-line. Then the Lord said, Behold, I will set a plumb-line in the midst of my people Israel. I will not again pass by them any more.
Amos. And the high places of Isaac shall be desolate,  the sanctuaries of Israel shall be laid waste,  I will rise against the house of Jeroboam with the sword.
Amos. Then Amaziah the priest of Bethel sent to Jeroboam king of Israel, saying, Amos has conspired against thee in the midst of the house of Israel. The land is not able to bear all his words.
Amos. For thus Amos says: Jeroboam shall die by the sword,  Israel shall surely be led away captive out of his land.
Amos. Also Amaziah said to Amos, O thou seer, go, flee thou away into the land of Judah,  there eat bread,  prophesy there.
Amos. But do not prophesy again any more at Bethel, for it is the king's sanctuary,  it is a royal house.
Amos. Then Amos answered,  said to Amaziah, I was no prophet, nor was I a prophet's son,  I was a herdsman,  a dresser of sycamore trees.
Amos. And Jehovah took me from following the flock,  Jehovah said to me, Go, prophesy to my people Israel.
Amos. Now therefore hear thou the word of Jehovah: Thou say, Do not prophesy against Israel,  do not drop thy word against the house of Isaac.
Amos. Therefore thus says Jehovah: Thy wife shall be a harlot in the city,  thy sons and thy daughters shall fall by the sword,  thy land shall be divided by line,  thou thyself shall die in a land that is unclean. And Israel shall surely be led away captive out of his land.
Amos. Thus the lord Jehovah showed me: And, behold, a basket of summer fruit.
Amos. And he said, Amos, what do thou see? And I said, A basket of summer fruit. Then Jehovah said to me, The end has come upon my people Israel. I will not again pass by them any more.
Amos. And the songs of the temple shall be wailings in that day, says the lord Jehovah. The dead bodies shall be many. In every place they shall cast them forth with silence.
Amos. Hear this, O ye who would swallow up a needy man,  cause the poor of the land to fail,
Amos. saying, When will the new moon be gone, that we may sell grain? And the sabbath, that we may set forth wheat, making the ephah small,  the shekel great,  dealing falsely with balances of deceit,
Amos. that we may buy the poor for silver,  a needy man for a pair of shoes,  sell the refuse of the wheat?
Amos. Jehovah has sworn by the excellency of Jacob, Surely I will never forget any of their works.
Amos. Shall the land not tremble for this,  everyone mourn who dwells therein? Yea, it shall rise up wholly like the River,  it shall be troubled and sink again like the River of Egypt.
Amos. And it shall come to pass in that day, says the lord Jehovah, that I will cause the sun to go down at noon,  I will darken the earth in the clear day.
Amos. And I will turn your feasts into mourning,  all your songs into lamentation. And I will bring sackcloth upon all loins,  baldness upon every head,  I will make it as the mourning for an only son,  the end thereof as a bitter day.
Amos. Behold, the days come, says the lord Jehovah, that I will send a famine in the land, not a famine of bread, nor a thirst for water,  of hearing the words of Jehovah.
Amos. And they shall wander from sea to sea,  from the north even to the east. They shall run to and fro to seek the word of Jehovah,  shall not find it.
Amos. In that day the fair virgins and the young men shall faint for thirst.
Amos. Those who swear by the sin of Samaria,  say, As thy god, O Dan, lives, , As the way of Beersheba lives, they shall fall,  never rise up again.
Amos. I saw the Lord standing beside the altar. And he said, Smite the capitals, that the thresholds may shake,  break them in pieces on the head of all of them,  I will kill the last of them with the sword. There shall not one of them flee away,  there shall not one of them escape.
Amos. Though they dig into Sheol, from there my hand shall take them,  though they climb up to heaven, from there I will bring them down.
Amos. And though they hide themselves on the top of Carmel, I will search and take them out from there. And though they be hid from my sight in the bottom of the sea, from there I will command the serpent,  it shall bite them.
Amos. And though they go into captivity before their enemies, from there I will command the sword,  it shall kill them. And I will set my eyes upon them for evil,  not for good.
Amos. For the Lord, Jehovah of hosts, is he who touches the land and it melts,  all who dwell therein shall mourn. And it shall rise up wholly like the River,  shall sink again like the River of Egypt.
Amos. He who builds his chambers in the heavens,  has founded his vault upon the earth, he who calls for the waters of the sea,  pours them out upon the face of the earth, Jehovah is his name.
Amos. Are ye not as the sons of the Ethiopians to me, O sons of Israel? says Jehovah. Have I not brought up Israel out of the land of Egypt,  the Philistines from Caphtor,  the Syrians from Kir?
Amos. Behold, the eyes of the lord Jehovah are upon the sinful kingdom,  I will destroy it from off the face of the earth, except that I will not utterly destroy the house of Jacob, says Jehovah.
Amos. For, lo, I will command,  I will sift the house of Israel among all the nations, just as grain is sifted in a sieve, yet the least kernel shall not fall upon the earth.
Amos. All the sinners of my people shall die by the sword, who say, The evil shall not overtake nor meet us.
Amos. In that day I will raise up the tabernacle of David that is fallen,  close up the breaches thereof. And I will raise up its ruins,  I will build it as in the days of old,
Amos. that they may possess the remnant of Edom,  all the nations that are called by my name, says Jehovah who does this.
Amos. Behold, the days come, says Jehovah, that the plowman shall overtake the reaper,  the treader of grapes him who sows seed,  the mountains shall drop sweet wine,  all the hills shall melt.
Amos. And I will bring back the captivity of my people Israel,  they shall build the waste cities,  inhabit them,  they shall plant vineyards,  drink the wine of it. They shall also make gardens,  eat the fruit of them.
Amos. And I will plant them upon their land,  they shall no more be plucked up out of their land which I have given them, says Jehovah thy God.
Obadiah
Obad. The vision of Obadiah. Thus says the lord Jehovah concerning Edom: We have heard tidings from Jehovah,  an ambassador is sent among the nations, saying, Arise ye,  let us rise up against her in battle.
Obad. Behold, I have made thee small among the nations. Thou are greatly despised.
Obad. The pride of thy heart has deceived thee, O thou who dwell in the clefts of the rock, whose habitation is high, who says in his heart, Who shall bring me down to the ground?
Obad. Though thou mount on high as the eagle,  though thy nest be set among the stars, I will bring thee down from there, says Jehovah.
Obad. If thieves came to thee, if robbers by night (how thou are cut off!), would they not steal only till they had enough? If grape gatherers came to thee, would they not leave some gleaning grapes?
Obad. How are the things of Esau searched! How are his hidden treasures sought out!
Obad. All the men of thy confederacy have brought thee on thy way, even to the border. The men who were at peace with thee have deceived thee,  prevailed against thee. Those who eat thy bread lay a snare under thee. There is no understanding in him.
Obad. Shall I not in that day, says Jehovah, destroy the wise men out of Edom,  understanding out of the mount of Esau?
Obad. And thy mighty men, O Teman, shall be dismayed, to the end that everyone may be cut off from the mount of Esau by slaughter.
Obad. Shame shall cover thee for the violence done to thy brother Jacob,  thou shall be cut off forever.
Obad. In the day that thou stood on the other side, in the day that strangers carried away his substance,  foreigners entered into his gates,  cast lots upon Jerusalem, even thou were as one of them.
Obad. But look not thou on the day of thy brother in the day of his disaster,  rejoice not over the sons of Judah in the day of their destruction, nor speak proudly in the day of distress.
Obad. Enter not into the gate of my people in the day of their calamity. Yea, look not thou on their affliction in the day of their calamity, nor lay ye hands on their substance in the day of their calamity.
Obad. And stand thou not in the crossway, to cut off those of his who escape,  deliver not up those of his who remain in the day of distress.
Obad. For the day of Jehovah is near upon all the nations. As thou have done, it shall be done to thee. Thy dealing shall return upon thine own head.
Obad. For as ye have drunk upon my holy mountain, so shall all the nations drink continually. Yea, they shall drink,  swallow down,  shall be as though they had not been.
Obad. But in mount Zion there shall be those who escape,  it shall be holy,  the house of Jacob shall possess their possessions.
Obad. And the house of Jacob shall be a fire,  the house of Joseph a flame,  the house of Esau for stubble. And they shall burn among them,  devour them,  there shall not be any remaining to the house of Esau, for Jehovah has spoken it.
Obad. And those of the South shall possess the mount of Esau,  those of the lowland the Philistines. And they shall possess the field of Ephraim,  the field of Samaria,  Benjamin shall possess Gilead.
Obad. And the captives of this host of the sons of Israel, who are among the Canaanites, shall possess even to Zarephath. And the captives of Jerusalem who are in Sepharad shall possess the cities of the South.
Obad. And saviors shall come up on mount Zion to judge the mount of Esau,  the kingdom shall be Jehovah's.
Jonah
Jonah. Now the word of Jehovah came to Jonah the son of Amittai, saying,
Jonah. Arise, go to Nineveh, that great city,  cry against it, for their wickedness has come up before me.
Jonah. But Jonah rose up to flee to Tarshish from the presence of Jehovah. And he went down to Joppa,  found a ship going to Tarshish. So he paid the fare of it,  went down into it, to go with them to Tarshish from the presence of Jehovah.
Jonah. But Jehovah sent out a great wind upon the sea,  there was a mighty tempest on the sea, so that the ship was about to be broken.
Jonah. Then the mariners were afraid,  cried every man to his god. And they cast forth the wares that were in the ship into the sea, to lighten it to them. But Jonah was gone down into the innermost parts of the ship,  he lay,  was fast asleep.
Jonah. So the shipmaster came to him,  said to him, What do thou mean, O sleeper? Arise, call upon thy God, if so be that God will think upon us, that we not perish.
Jonah. And they said every one to his fellow, Come,  let us cast lots, that we may know for whose cause this evil is upon us. So they cast lots,  the lot fell upon Jonah.
Jonah. Then they said to him, Tell us, we pray thee, for whose cause this evil is upon us. What is thine occupation? And from where do thou come? What is thy country,  of what people are thou?
Jonah. And he said to them, I am a Hebrew,  I fear Jehovah, the God of heaven, who has made the sea and the dry land.
Jonah. Then the men were exceedingly afraid,  said to him, What is this that thou have done? For the men knew that he was fleeing from the presence of Jehovah, because he had told them.
Jonah. Then they said to him, What shall we do to thee, that the sea may be calm to us? For the sea grew more and more tempestuous.
Jonah. And he said to them, Take me up,  cast me forth into the sea, so shall the sea be calm to you. For I know that for my sake this great tempest is upon you.
Jonah. Nevertheless the men rowed hard to get themselves back to the land,  they could not, for the sea grew more and more tempestuous against them.
Jonah. Therefore they cried to Jehovah,  said, We beseech thee, O Jehovah, we beseech thee, let us not perish for this man's life,  lay not upon us innocent blood. For thou, O Jehovah, have done as it pleased thee.
Jonah. So they took up Jonah,  cast him forth into the sea,  the sea ceased from its raging.
Jonah. Then the men feared Jehovah exceedingly,  they offered a sacrifice to Jehovah,  made vows.
Jonah. And Jehovah prepared a great sea creature to swallow up Jonah,  Jonah was in the belly of the sea creature three days and three nights.
Jonah. Then Jonah prayed to Jehovah his God out of the sea creatures belly.
Jonah. And he said, I called because of my affliction to Jehovah,  he answered me. Out of the belly of Sheol I cried,  thou heard my voice.
Jonah. For thou cast me into the depth, in the heart of the seas,  the flood was round about me. All thy waves and thy billows passed over me.
Jonah. And I said, I am cast out from before thine eyes. Yet I will look again toward thy holy temple.
Jonah. The waters encompassed me around, even to the soul. The deep was round about me. The weeds were wrapped around my head.
Jonah. I went down to the bottoms of the mountains. The earth with its bars closed upon me forever. Yet thou have brought up my life from the pit, O Jehovah my God.
Jonah. When my soul fainted within me, I remembered Jehovah. And my prayer came in to thee, into thy holy temple.
Jonah. Those who regard lying vanities forsake their own mercy.
Jonah. But I will sacrifice to thee with the voice of thanksgiving. I will pay that which I have vowed. Salvation is of Jehovah.
Jonah. And Jehovah spoke to the sea creature,  it vomited Jonah out upon the dry land.
Jonah. And the word of Jehovah came to Jonah the second time, saying,
Jonah. Arise, go to Nineveh, that great city,  preach to it the preaching that I bid thee.
Jonah. So Jonah arose,  went to Nineveh, according to the word of Jehovah. Now Nineveh was an exceedingly great city, of three days' journey.
Jonah. And Jonah began to enter into the city a day's journey. And he cried out,  said, Yet forty days,  Nineveh shall be overthrown.
Jonah. And the people of Nineveh believed God,  they proclaimed a fast,  put on sackcloth, from the greatest of them even to the least of them.
Jonah. And the news reached the king of Nineveh,  he arose from his throne,  laid his robe from him,  covered himself with sackcloth,  sat in ashes.
Jonah. And he made proclamation and published through Nineveh by the decree of the king and his nobles, saying, Let neither man nor beast, herd nor flock, taste anything. Let them not feed, nor drink water,
Jonah. but let them be covered with sackcloth, both man and beast,  let them cry mightily to God. Yea, let them turn each one from his evil way,  from the violence that is in his hands.
Jonah. Who knows whether God will not turn and relent,  turn away from his fierce anger, that we not perish?
Jonah. And God saw their works, that they turned from their evil way. And God relented of the evil which he said he would do to them,  he did not do it.
Jonah. But it displeased Jonah exceedingly,  he was angry.
Jonah. And he prayed to Jehovah,  said, I pray thee, O Jehovah, was not this my saying, when I was yet in my country? Therefore I hastened to flee to Tarshish, for I knew that thou are a gracious God,  merciful, slow to anger,  abundant in loving kindness,  relent thee of the evil.
Jonah. Therefore now, O Jehovah, I beseech thee, take my life from me, for it is better for me to die than to live.
Jonah. And Jehovah said, Do thou well to be angry?
Jonah. Then Jonah went out of the city,  sat on the east side of the city,  there made himself a booth,  sat under it in the shade, till he might see what would become of the city.
Jonah. And Jehovah God prepared a gourd,  made it to come up over Jonah, that it might be a shade over his head, to deliver him from his misery. So Jonah was very glad because of the gourd.
Jonah. But God prepared a worm when the morning rose the next day,  it smote the gourd, that it withered.
Jonah. And it came to pass, when the sun arose, that God prepared a sultry east wind,  the sun beat upon the head of Jonah, that he fainted,  requested for himself that he might die,  said, It is better for me to die than to live.
Jonah. And God said to Jonah, Do thou well to be angry for the gourd? And he said, I do well to be angry, even to death.
Jonah. And Jehovah said, Thou have had regard for the gourd, for which thou have not labored, nor made it grow, which came up in a night,  perished in a night.
Jonah. And should not I have regard for Nineveh, that great city, in which are more than one hundred and twenty thousand men who cannot discern between their right hand and their left hand,  also much cattle?
Micah
The word of Jehovah that came to Micah the Morashtite in the days of Jotham, Ahaz,  Hezekiah, kings of Judah, which he saw concerning Samaria and Jerusalem.
Hear, ye peoples, all of you. Hearken, O earth,  all who are in it,  let the Lord Jehovah be witness against you, the Lord from his holy temple.
For, behold, Jehovah comes forth out of his place,  will come down,  tread upon the high places of the earth.
the mountains shall be melted under him,  the valleys shall be split, as wax before the fire, as waters that are poured down a steep place.
All this is for the transgression of Jacob,  for the sins of the house of Israel. What is the transgression of Jacob? Is it not Samaria? And what are the high places of Judah? Are they not Jerusalem?
Therefore I will make Samaria as a heap of the field,  as places for planting vineyards. And I will pour down the stones of it into the valley,  I will uncover the foundations of it.
all her graven images shall be beaten to pieces. And all her wages shall be burned with fire,  I will lay desolate all her idols. For she has gathered them from the wages of a harlot,  to the wage of a harlot they shall return.
For this I will lament and wail. I will go stripped and naked. I will make a wailing like the jackals,  a lamentation like the ostriches.
For her wounds are incurable. For it has come even to Judah. it reaches to the gate of my people, even to Jerusalem.
Tell it not in Gath. Weep not at all. I have rolled myself in the dust at Beth-le-aphrah.
Pass away, O inhabitant of Shaphir, in nakedness and shame. The inhabitant of Zaanan has not come forth. The wailing of Beth-ezel shall take from you the stay of it.
For the inhabitant of Maroth waits anxiously for good, because evil has come down from Jehovah to the gate of Jerusalem.
Bind the chariot to the swift steed, O inhabitant of Lachish. She was the beginning of sin to the daughter of Zion, for the transgressions of Israel were found in thee.
Therefore thou shall give a parting gift to Moresheth-gath. The houses of Achzib shall be a deceitful thing to the kings of Israel.
I will yet bring to thee, O inhabitant of Mareshah, him who shall possess thee. The glory of Israel shall come even to Adullam.
Make thee bald,  cut off thy hair for the sons of thy delight. Enlarge thy baldness as the vulture, for they have gone into captivity from thee.
Woe to those who devise iniquity and work evil upon their beds! When the morning is light they practice it, because it is in the power of their hand.
they covet fields,  seize them,  houses,  take them away. And they oppress a man and his house, even a man and his heritage.
Therefore thus says Jehovah: Behold, I devise an evil against this family, from which ye shall not remove your necks, nor shall ye walk haughtily, for it is an evil time.
In that day they shall take up a taunt against you,  lament with a doleful lamentation. And say, We are utterly ruined. He changes the portion of my people. How he removes it from me! He divides our fields to the rebellious.
Therefore thou shall have nobody to cast the line by lot in the assembly of Jehovah.
Prophesy ye not, they prophesy. They shall not prophesy to these, so reproaches shall not depart.
Shall it be said, O house of Jacob, Is the Spirit of Jehovah restricted? Are these his doings? Do not my words do good to him who walks uprightly?
But of late my people have risen up as an enemy. Ye strip off the robe with the garment from those who pass by securely as men turning back from war.
Ye cast out the women of my people from their pleasant houses. Ye take away my glory from their young sons forever.
Arise ye,  depart, for this is not your resting-place, because of uncleanness that destroys, even with a grievous destruction.
If a man walking in a spirit of falsehood lies, saying, I will prophesy to thee of wine and of strong drink, he shall even be the prophet of this people.
I will surely assemble, O Jacob, all of thee. I will surely gather the remnant of Israel. I will put them together as the sheep of Bozrah, as a flock in the midst of their pasture. They shall make great noise because of the multitude of men.
The breaker has gone up before them. They have broken forth and passed on to the gate,  have gone out there. And their king has passed on before them,  Jehovah at the head of them.
I said, Hear, I pray you, ye heads of Jacob,  rulers of the house of Israel. Is it not for you to know justice?
Ye who hate the good,  love the evil, who pluck off their skin from off them,  their flesh from off their bones,
who also eat the flesh of my people,  flay their skin from off them,  break their bones,  chop them in pieces, as for the pot,  as flesh within the caldron.
Then they shall cry to Jehovah,  he will not answer them. Yea, he will hide his face from them at that time, according as they have wrought evil in their doings.
Thus says Jehovah concerning the prophets who make my people to err, who bite with their teeth,  cry, Peace. And he who does not put into their mouths, they even prepare war against him.
Therefore it shall be night to you, that ye shall have no vision. And it shall be dark to you, that ye shall not divine. And the sun shall go down upon the prophets,  the day shall be black over them.
the seers shall be put to shame,  the diviners confounded. Yea, they shall all cover their lips, for there is no answer from God.
But as for me, I am full of power by the Spirit of Jehovah,  of judgment,  of might, to declare to Jacob his transgression,  to Israel his sin.
Hear this, I pray you, ye heads of the house of Jacob,  rulers of the house of Israel, who abhor justice,  pervert all equity.
They build up Zion with blood,  Jerusalem with iniquity.
The heads of it judge for a bribe,  the priests of it teach for a wage,  the prophets of it divine for money. Yet they lean upon Jehovah,  say, Is not Jehovah in the midst of us? No evil shall come upon us.
Therefore for your sake Zion shall be plowed as a field,  Jerusalem shall become heaps,  the mountain of the house as the high places of a forest.
But in the latter days it shall come to pass, that the mountain of Jehovah's house shall be established on the top of the mountains,  it shall be exalted above the hills,  peoples shall flow to it.
many nations shall go and say, Come ye,  let us go up to the mountain of Jehovah,  to the house of the God of Jacob,  he will teach us of his ways,  we will walk in his paths. For out of Zion shall go forth the law,  the word of Jehovah from Jerusalem.
he will judge between many peoples,  will decide concerning strong nations afar off. And they shall beat their swords into plowshares,  their spears into pruning-hooks. Nation shall not lift up sword against nation, nor shall they learn war any more.
But they shall sit every man under his vine and under his fig tree,  none shall make them afraid. For the mouth of Jehovah of hosts has spoken it.
For all the peoples walk each one in the name of his god. And we will walk in the name of Jehovah our God forever and ever.
In that day, says Jehovah, I will assemble that which is lame,  I will gather that which is driven away,  that which I have afflicted.
I will make that which was lame a remnant,  that which was cast far off a strong nation. And Jehovah will reign over them in mount Zion from henceforth even forever.
thou, O tower of the flock, the hill of the daughter of Zion, to thee it shall come. Yea, the former dominion shall come, the kingdom of the daughter of Jerusalem.
Now why do thou cry out aloud? Is there no king in thee? Has thy counselor perished, that pangs have taken hold of thee as of a woman in travail?
Be in pain,  labor to bring forth, O daughter of Zion, like a woman in travail. For now thou shall go forth out of the city,  shall dwell in the field,  shall come even to Babylon. There thou shall be rescued. There Jehovah will redeem thee from the hand of thine enemies.
now many nations are assembled against thee, who say, Let her be defiled,  let our eye see our desire upon Zion.
But they know not the thoughts of Jehovah, nor do they understand his counsel, for he has gathered them as the sheaves to the threshing-floor.
Arise and thresh, O daughter of Zion, for I will make thy horn iron,  I will make thy hoofs brass,  thou shall beat many peoples in pieces. And I will devote their gain to Jehovah,  their substance to the Lord of the whole earth.
Now thou shall gather thyself in troops, O daughter of troops. He has laid siege against us. They shall smite the judge of Israel with a rod upon the cheek.
But thou, Bethlehem Ephrathah, which are little to be among the thousands of Judah, out of thee he shall come forth to me who is to be ruler in Israel, whose goings forth are from of old, from everlasting.
Therefore he will give them up until the time that she who travails has brought forth. Then the residue of his brothers shall return to the sons of Israel.
he shall stand,  shall feed his flock in the strength of Jehovah, in the majesty of the name of Jehovah his God,  they shall abide. For now he shall be great to the ends of the earth.
this man shall be our peace. When the Assyrian shall come into our land,  when he shall tread in our palaces, then we shall raise against him seven shepherds,  eight principal men.
they shall waste the land of Assyria with the sword,  the land of Nimrod in the entrances of it. And he shall deliver us from the Assyrian, when he comes into our land,  when he treads within our border.
the remnant of Jacob shall be in the midst of many peoples as dew from Jehovah, as showers upon the grass, that tarry not for man, nor wait for the sons of men.
the remnant of Jacob shall be among the nations, in the midst of many peoples, as a lion among the beasts of the forest, as a young lion among the flocks of sheep, who, if he goes through, treads down and tears in pieces,  there is none to deliver.
Let thy hand be lifted up above thine adversaries,  let all thine enemies be cut off.
it shall come to pass in that day, says Jehovah, that I will cut off thy horses out of the midst of thee,  will destroy thy chariots,
I will cut off the cities of thy land,  will throw down all thy strongholds.
I will cut off witchcrafts out of thy hand,  thou shall have no more soothsayers.
I will cut off thy graven images and thy pillars out of the midst of thee,  thou shall no more worship the work of thy hands.
I will pluck up thine Asherim out of the midst of thee,  I will destroy thy cities.
I will execute vengeance in anger and wrath upon the nations that did not hearken.
Hear ye now what Jehovah says: Arise, contend thou before the mountains,  let the hills hear thy voice.
Hear, O ye mountains, Jehovah's controversy,  ye enduring foundations of the earth, for Jehovah has a controversy with his people,  he will contend with Israel.
O my people, what have I done to thee? And in what have I wearied thee? Testify against me.
For I brought thee up out of the land of Egypt,  redeemed thee out of the house of bondage. And I sent before thee Moses, Aaron,  Miriam.
O my people, remember now what Balak king of Moab devised,  what Balaam the son of Beor answered him. Remember from Shittim to Gilgal, that ye may know the righteous acts of Jehovah.
With what shall I come before Jehovah,  bow myself before the high God? Shall I come before him with burnt offerings, with calves a year old?
Will Jehovah be pleased with thousands of rams, or with ten thousand rivers of oil? Shall I give my firstborn for my transgression, the fruit of my body for the sin of my soul?
He has shown thee, O man, what is good. And what does Jehovah require of thee,  to do justly,  to love kindness,  to walk humbly with thy God?
The voice of Jehovah cries to the city,  the man of wisdom will see thy name. Hear ye the rod,  who has appointed it.
Are there yet treasures of wickedness in the house of the wicked,  a scant measure that is abominable?
Shall I be pure with wicked balances,  with a bag of deceitful weights?
For the rich men of it are full of violence,  the inhabitants of it have spoken lies,  their tongue is deceitful in their mouth.
Therefore I also have smitten thee with a grievous wound, I have made thee desolate because of thy sins.
Thou shall eat,  not be satisfied,  thy humiliation shall be in the midst of thee. And thou shall put away,  shall not save,  that which thou save I will give up to the sword.
Thou shall sow,  shall not reap, thou shall tread the olives,  shall not anoint thee with oil,  the vintage,  shall not drink the wine.
For the statutes of Omri are kept,  all the works of the house of Ahab,  ye walk in their counsels, that I may make thee a desolation,  the inhabitants thereof a hissing. And ye shall bear the reproach of my people.
Woe is me! For I am as when they have gathered the summer fruits, as the grape gleanings of the vintage. There is no cluster to eat. My soul desires the first ripe fig.
The devout man has perished out of the earth,  there is none upright among men. They all lie in wait for blood. They hunt every man his brother with a net.
Their hands are upon that which is evil to do it diligently. The ruler asks,  the judge asks for a bribe. And the great man, he utters the evil desire of his soul. Thus they weave it together.
The best of them is as a brier. The most upright is worse than a thorn hedge. The day of thy watchmen, even thy visitation, has come. Now shall be their perplexity.
Trust ye not in a neighbor. Put ye not confidence in a friend. Keep the doors of thy mouth from her who lies in thy bosom.
For the son dishonors the father. The daughter rises up against her mother, the daughter-in-law against her mother-in-law. A man's enemies are the men of his own house.
But as for me, I will look to Jehovah. I will wait for the God of my salvation. My God will hear me.
Rejoice not against me, O my enemy. When I fall, I shall arise. When I sit in darkness, Jehovah will be a light to me.
I will bear the indignation of Jehovah, because I have sinned against him, until he pleads my case,  executes judgment for me. He will bring me forth to the light,  I shall behold his righteousness.
Then my enemy shall see it,  shame shall cover her who said to me, Where is Jehovah thy God? My eyes shall see my desire upon her. Now she shall be trodden down as the mire of the streets.
A day for building thy walls! In that day the decree shall be far removed.
In that day they shall come to thee from Assyria and the cities of Egypt,  from Egypt even to the River,  from sea to sea,  mountain to mountain.
Yet the land shall be desolate because of those who dwell therein, for the fruit of their doings.
Feed thy people with thy rod, the flock of thy heritage, which dwell solitarily in the forest in the midst of Carmel. Let them feed in Bashan and Gilead, as in the days of old.
As in the days of thy coming forth out of the land of Egypt I will show marvelous things to them.
The nations shall see and be ashamed of all their might. They shall lay their hand upon their mouth. Their ears shall be deaf.
They shall lick the dust like a serpent. Like crawling things of the earth they shall come trembling out of their close places. They shall come with fear to Jehovah our God,  shall be afraid because of thee.
Who is a God like to thee, who pardons iniquity,  passes over the transgression of the remnant of his heritage? He does not retain his anger forever, because he delights in loving kindness.
He will again have compassion upon us. He will tread our iniquities under foot,  thou will cast all their sins into the depths of the sea.
Thou will perform the truth to Jacob,  the loving kindness to Abraham, which thou have sworn to our fathers from the days of old.
Nahum
The burden of Nineveh. The book of the vision of Nahum the Elkoshite.
Jehovah is a jealous God and avenges. Jehovah avenges and is full of wrath. Jehovah takes vengeance on his adversaries,  he reserves wrath for his enemies.
Jehovah is slow to anger,  great in power,  will by no means clear the guilty. Jehovah has his way in the whirlwind and in the storm,  the clouds are the dust of his feet.
He rebukes the sea,  makes it dry,  dries up all the rivers. Bashan languishes,  Carmel,  the flower of Lebanon languishes.
The mountains quake at him,  the hills melt,  the earth is up heaved at his presence. Yea, the world,  all who dwell therein.
