Who can stand before his indignation? And who can abide in the fierceness of his anger? His wrath is poured out like fire,  the rocks are broken apart by him.
Jehovah is good, a stronghold in the day of trouble,  he knows those who take refuge in him.
But with an over running flood he will make a full end of her place,  will pursue his enemies into darkness.
What do ye devise against Jehovah? He will make a full end. Affliction shall not rise up the second time.
For entangled like thorns,  drunken as with their drink, they are consumed utterly as dry stubble.
He has gone forth out of thee, who devises evil against Jehovah, who counsels wickedness.
Thus says Jehovah: Though they be in full strength,  likewise many, even so they shall be cut down. And he shall pass away. Though I have afflicted thee, I will afflict thee no more.
now I will break his yoke from off thee,  will burst thy bonds apart.
Jehovah has given commandment concerning thee, that no more of thy name be sown. Out of the house of thy gods I will cut off the graven image and the molten image. I will make thy grave, for thou are vile.
Behold, upon the mountains the feet of him who brings good news, who publishes peace! Keep thy feasts, O Judah. Perform thy vows, for the wicked one shall no more pass through thee. He is utterly cut off.
He who dashes in pieces has come up against thee. Keep the fortress. Watch the way. Make thy loins strong. Fortify thy power mightily.
For Jehovah restores the excellency of Jacob, as the excellency of Israel, for the emptiers have emptied them out,  destroyed their vine-branches.
The shield of his mighty men is made red. The valiant men are in scarlet. The chariots flash with steel in the day of his preparation,  the cypress spears are brandished.
The chariots rage in the streets; they rush to and fro in the broad ways. The appearance of them is like torches. They run like the lightnings.
He remembers his nobles. They stumble in their march. They make haste to the wall of it,  the mantelet is prepared.
The gates of the rivers are opened,  the palace is dissolved.
it is decreed. She is uncovered. She is carried away,  her handmaids moan as with the voice of doves, beating upon their breasts.
But Nineveh has been from of old like a pool of water. Yet they flee away. Stand, stand, they cry,  none looks back.
Take ye the spoil of silver. Take the spoil of gold. For there is no end of the store, the glory of all goodly furniture.
She is empty,  void,  waste. And the heart melts,  the knees smite together,  anguish is in all loins,  the faces of them all have grown pale.
Where is the den of the lions,  the feeding-place of the young lions, where the lion and the lioness walked, the lion's whelp,  none made them afraid?
The lion tore in pieces enough for his whelps,  strangled for his lionesses,  filled his caves with prey,  his dens with prey.
Behold, I am against thee, says Jehovah of hosts,  I will burn her chariots in the smoke,  the sword shall devour thy young lions. And I will cut off thy prey from the earth,  the voice of thy messengers shall no more be heard.
Woe to the bloody city! It is all full of lies and rapine. The prey departs not.
The noise of the whip,  the noise of the rattling of wheels,  prancing horses,  bounding chariots,
the horseman mounting,  the flashing sword,  the glittering spear,  a multitude of slain,  a great heap of corpses,  there is no end of the bodies. They stumble upon their bodies,
because of the multitude of the whoredoms of the well-favored harlot, the mistress of witchcrafts, who sells nations through her whoredoms,  families through her witchcrafts.
Behold, I am against thee, says Jehovah of hosts,  I will uncover thy skirts upon thy face,  I will show the nations thy nakedness,  the kingdoms thy shame.
I will cast abominable filth upon thee,  make thee vile,  will set thee as a gazing-stock.
it shall come to pass, that all those who look upon thee shall flee from thee,  say, Nineveh is laid waste. Who will bemoan her? From where shall I seek comforters for thee?
Are thou better than No-amon, that was situated among the rivers, that had the waters round about her, whose rampart was the sea,  her wall was of the sea?
Ethiopia and Egypt were her strength,  it was infinite. Put and Lubim were thy helpers.
Yet she was carried away. She went into captivity. Her young sons also were dashed in pieces at the head of all the streets. And they cast lots for her honorable men,  all her great men were bound in chains.
Thou also shall be drunken. Thou shall be hid. Thou also shall seek a stronghold because of the enemy.
All thy fortresses shall be like fig trees with the first ripe figs. If they be shaken, they fall into the mouth of the eater.
Behold, thy people in the midst of thee are women. The gates of thy land are set wide open to thine enemies. The fire has devoured thy bars.
Draw thee water for the siege. Strengthen thy fortresses. Go into the clay,  tread the mortar. Make strong the brick kiln.
There the fire shall devour thee. The sword shall cut thee off. It shall devour thee like the canker-worm. Make thyself many as the canker-worm. Make thyself many as the locust.
Thou have multiplied thy merchants above the stars of heaven. The canker-worm ravages,  flees away.
Thy rulers are as the locusts,  thy marshals as the swarms of grasshoppers, which encamp in the hedges in the cold day,  when the sun arises they flee away,  their place is not known where they are.
Thy shepherds slumber, O king of Assyria. Thy nobles are at rest. Thy people are scattered upon the mountains,  there is none to gather them.
There is no assuaging of thy hurt. Thy wound is grievous. All who hear the report of thee clap their hands over thee, for upon whom has not thy wickedness passed continually?
Habakkuk
The burden which Habakkuk the prophet saw.
O Jehovah, how long shall I cry,  thou will not hear? I cry out to thee of violence,  thou will not save.
Why do thou show me iniquity,  look upon perverseness? For destruction and violence are before me,  there is strife,  contention rises up.
Therefore the law is slacked,  justice never goes forth. For the wicked man surrounds the righteous man, therefore justice goes forth perverted.
Behold ye scoffers,  look,  wonder marvelously. For I am working a work in your days, which ye will not believe though it be told you.
For, lo, I raise up the Chaldeans, that bitter and hasty nation, who march through the breadth of the earth to possess dwelling-places that are not theirs.
They are fearful and dreadful. Their judgment and their dignity proceed from themselves.
Their horses also are swifter than leopards,  are more fierce than the evening wolves. And their horsemen press proudly on. Yea, their horsemen come from far. They fly as an eagle that hastens to devour.
They come all of them for violence. The set of their faces is forwards,  they gather captives as the sand.
Yea, he scoffs at kings,  rulers are a derision to him. He derides every stronghold, for he heaps up dust,  takes it.
Then he shall sweep by as a wind,  shall pass over,  be guilty; he whose might is his god.
Are not thou from everlasting, O Jehovah my God, my Holy One? We shall not die. O Jehovah, thou have ordained him for judgment,  thou, O Rock, have established him for correction.
Thou who are of purer eyes than to behold evil,  who cannot look on perverseness, why do thou look upon those who deal treacherously,  hold thy peace when the wicked man swallows up the man who is more righteous than he,
makes men as the fishes of the sea, as the creeping things, that have no ruler over them?
He takes all of them up with the hook. He catches them in his net,  gathers them in his drag. Therefore he rejoices and is glad.
Therefore he sacrifices to his net,  burns incense to his drag, because by them his portion is fat,  his food plentiful.
Shall he therefore empty his net,  not spare to kill the nations continually?
I will stand upon my watch,  set myself upon the tower,  will look forth to see what he will speak with me,  what I shall answer concerning my complaint.
Jehovah answered me,  said, Write the vision,  make it plain upon tablets, that he may run who reads it.
For the vision is yet for the appointed time,  it hastens toward the end,  shall not lie. Though it tarry, wait for it, because it will surely come. It will not delay.
Behold, his soul is puffed up; it is not upright in him. (But the righteous man shall live by his faith.
Yea, moreover, wine is treacherous.) He is a haughty man, who does not keep at home, who enlarges his desire as Sheol,  he is as death,  cannot be satisfied,  gathers to him all nations,  heaps to him all peoples.
Shall not all these take up a derision against him,  a taunting proverb against him,  say, Woe to him who increases that which is not his (how long?) and who loads himself with pledges!
Shall they not rise up suddenly that shall bite thee,  awake that shall vex thee. And thou shall be for booty to them?
Because thou have plundered many nations, all the remnant of the peoples shall plunder thee, because of men's blood,  for the violence done to the land, to the city and to all who dwell therein.
Woe to him who gets an evil gain for his house, that he may set his nest on high, that he may be delivered from the hand of evil!
Thou have devised shame to thy house, by cutting off many peoples,  have sinned against thy soul.
For the stone shall cry out of the wall,  the beam out of the timber shall answer it.
Woe to him who builds a town with blood,  establishes a city by iniquity!
Behold, is it not of Jehovah of hosts that the peoples labor for the fire,  the nations weary themselves for vanity?
For the earth shall be filled with the knowledge of the glory of Jehovah, as the waters cover the sea.
Woe to him who gives his neighbor drink, who adds thy venom,  also makes him drunken, that thou may look on their nakedness!
Thou are filled with shame,  not glory. Drink thou also,  be as one uncircumcised. The cup of Jehovah's right hand shall come around to thee,  foul shame shall be upon thy glory.
For the violence done to Lebanon shall cover thee and the plunder of the beasts (which made them afraid), because of men's blood,  for the violence done to the land, to the city and to all who dwell therein.
What profits the graven image, that the maker of it has engraved it, the molten image, even the teacher of lies, that he who fashions its form trusts in it, to make dumb idols?
Woe to him who says to the wood, Awake, to the dumb stone, Arise! Shall this teach? Behold, it is overlaid with gold and silver,  there is no breath at all in the midst of it.
But Jehovah is in his holy temple. Let all the earth keep silence before him.
A prayer of Habakkuk the prophet, set to Shigionoth.
O Jehovah, I have heard the report of thee,  am afraid. O Jehovah, revive thy work in the midst of the years. In the midst of the years make it known. In wrath remember mercy.
God came from Teman,  the Holy One from mount Paran. Selah. His glory covered the heavens,  the earth was full of his praise.
his brightness was as the light. He had rays from his hand,  there was the hiding of his power.
Before him went the pestilence. And fiery bolts went forth at his feet.
He stood,  measured the earth. He beheld,  drove apart the nations. And the eternal mountains were scattered. The everlasting hills bowed. His goings were as of old.
I saw the tents of Cushan in affliction. The curtains of the land of Midian trembled.
Was Jehovah displeased with the rivers? Was thine anger against the rivers, or thy wrath against the sea, that thou rode upon thy horses, upon thy chariots of salvation?
Thy bow was made quite bare. The oaths to the tribes were a sure word. Selah. Thou split the earth with rivers.
The mountains saw thee,  were afraid. The tempest of waters passed by. The deep uttered its voice,  lifted up its hands on high.
The sun and moon stood still in their habitation, at the light of thine arrows as they went, at the shining of thy glittering spear.
Thou marched though the land in indignation. Thou threshed the nations in anger.
Thou went forth for the salvation of thy people, for the salvation of thine anointed. Thou wound the head out of the house of the wicked man, laying bare the foundation even to the neck. Selah.
Thou pierced with his own staves the head of his warriors. They came as a whirlwind to scatter me. Their rejoicing was as to devour the poor man secretly.
Thou walked through the sea with thy horses, the heap of mighty waters.
I heard,  my body trembled. My lips quivered at the voice. Rottenness enters into my bones,  I tremble in my place, because I must wait quietly for the day of trouble, for the coming up of the people who invade us.
For though the fig tree shall not flourish, nor shall fruit be in the vines; the labor of the olive shall fail,  the fields shall yield no food; the flock shall be cut off from the fold,  there shall be no herd in the stalls;
yet I will rejoice in Jehovah. I will joy in the God of my salvation.
Jehovah, the Lord, is my strength. And he makes my feet like hinds' feet,  will make me to walk upon my high places.
Zephaniah
Zeph. The word of Jehovah which came to Zephaniah the son of Cushi, the son of Gedaliah, the son of Amariah, the son of Hezekiah, in the days of Josiah the son of Amon, king of Judah.
Zeph. I will utterly consume all things from off the face of the ground, says Jehovah.
Zeph. I will consume man and beast. I will consume the birds of the heavens,  the fishes of the sea,  the stumbling blocks with the wicked. And I will cut off man from off the face of the ground, says Jehovah.
Zeph. And I will stretch out my hand upon Judah,  upon all the inhabitants of Jerusalem. And I will cut off the remnant of Baal from this place,  the name of the Chemarim with the priests,
Zeph. and those who worship the host of heaven upon the housetops,  those who worship, who swear to Jehovah and swear by Malcam,
Zeph. and those who are turned back from following Jehovah,  those who have not sought Jehovah, nor inquired after him.
Zeph. Hold thy peace at the presence of the lord Jehovah, for the day of Jehovah is at hand. For Jehovah has prepared a sacrifice. He has consecrated his guests.
Zeph. And it shall come to pass in the day of Jehovah's sacrifice, that I will punish the rulers,  the king's sons,  all such as are clothed with foreign apparel.
Zeph. And in that day I will punish all those who leap over the threshold, who fill their master's house with violence and deceit.
Zeph. And in that day, says Jehovah, there shall be the noise of a cry from the fish gate,  a wailing from the second quarter,  a great crashing from the hills.
Zeph. Wail, ye inhabitants of Maktesh, for all the people of Canaan are undone. All those who were laden with silver are cut off.
Zeph. And it shall come to pass at that time, that I will search Jerusalem with lamps,  I will punish the men who are settled on their lees, who say in their heart, Jehovah will not do good, nor will he do evil.
Zeph. And their wealth shall become a spoil,  their houses a desolation. Yea, they shall build houses,  shall not inhabit them,  they shall plant vineyards,  shall not drink the wine of it.
Zeph. The great day of Jehovah is near. It is near and hastens greatly, the voice of the day of Jehovah. The mighty man cries there bitterly.
Zeph. That day is a day of wrath, a day of trouble and distress, a day of wasteness and desolation, a day of darkness and gloominess, a day of clouds and thick darkness,
Zeph. a day of the trumpet and alarm, against the fortified cities,  against the high battlements.
Zeph. And I will bring distress upon men, that they shall walk like blind men, because they have sinned against Jehovah,  their blood shall be poured out as dust,  their flesh as dung.
Zeph. Neither their silver nor their gold shall be able to deliver them in the day of Jehovah's wrath,  the whole land shall be devoured by the fire of his jealousy. For he will make an end, yea, a terrible end, of all those who dwell in the land.
Zeph. Gather yourselves together, yea, gather together, O nation that has no shame;
Zeph. before the decree bring forth, before the day passes as the chaff, before the fierce anger of Jehovah comes upon you, before the day of Jehovah's anger comes upon you.
Zeph. Seek ye Jehovah, all ye meek of the earth who have kept his ordinances. Seek righteousness, seek meekness. It may be ye will be hid in the day of Jehovah's anger.
Zeph. For Gaza shall be forsaken,  Ashkelon a desolation. They shall drive out Ashdod at noonday,  Ekron shall be rooted up.
Zeph. Woe to the inhabitants of the seacoast, the nation of the Cherethites! The word of Jehovah is against you, O Canaan, the land of the Philistines. I will destroy thee, that there shall be no inhabitant.
Zeph. And the seacoast shall be pastures, with cottages for shepherds and folds for flocks.
Zeph. And the coast shall be for the remnant of the house of Judah. They shall feed their flocks upon it. In the houses of Ashkelon they shall lie down in the evening. For Jehovah their God will visit them,  bring back their captivity.
Zeph. I have heard the reproach of Moab,  the revilings of the sons of Ammon, with which they have reproached my people,  magnified themselves against their border.
Zeph. Therefore as I live, says Jehovah of hosts, the God of Israel, Surely Moab shall be as Sodom,  the sons of Ammon as Gomorrah, a possession of nettles,  salt pits,  a perpetual desolation. The residue of my people shall make a prey of them,  the remnant of my nation shall inherit them.
Zeph. They shall have this for their pride, because they have reproached and magnified themselves against the people of Jehovah of hosts.
Zeph. Jehovah will be terrible to them, for he will famish all the gods of the earth. And men shall worship him, everyone from his place, even all the isles of the nations.
Zeph. Ye Ethiopians also, ye shall be slain by my sword.
Zeph. And he will stretch out his hand against the north,  destroy Assyria,  will make Nineveh a desolation,  dry like the wilderness.
Zeph. And herds shall lie down in the midst of her. All the beasts of the nations, both the pelican and the porcupine shall lodge in the capitals of it. Their voice shall sing in the windows. Desolation shall be in the thresholds. For he has laid bare the cedar work.
Zeph. This is the joyous city that dwelt carelessly, that said in her heart, I am,  there is none besides me. How she has become a desolation, a place for beasts to lie down in! Everyone who passes by her shall hiss,  wag his hand.
Zeph. Woe to her who is rebellious and polluted, to the oppressing city!
Zeph. She obeyed not the voice. She received not correction. She trusted not in Jehovah. She did not draw near to her God.
Zeph. Her rulers in the midst of her are roaring lions. Her judges are evening wolves. They leave nothing till the morrow.
Zeph. Her prophets are airy and treacherous men. Her priests have profaned the sanctuary. They have done violence to the law.
Zeph. Jehovah in the midst of her is righteous. He will not do iniquity. Every morning he brings his justice to light. He does not fail,  the unjust man knows no shame.
Zeph. I have cut off nations. Their battlements are desolate. I have made their streets waste, so that none passes by. Their cities are destroyed, so that there is no man, so that there is no inhabitant.
Zeph. I said, Only fear thou me. Receive correction, so her dwelling shall not be cut off, according to all that I have appointed concerning her. But they rose early and corrupted all their doings.
Zeph. Therefore wait ye for me, says Jehovah, until the day that I rise up to the prey. For my determination is to gather the nations, that I may assemble the kingdoms, to pour upon them my indignation, even all my fierce anger. For all the earth shall be devoured with the fire of my jealousy.
Zeph. For then I will turn to the peoples of a pure language, that they may all call upon the name of Jehovah, to serve him with one consent.
Zeph. From beyond the rivers of Ethiopia, my suppliants, even the daughter of my dispersed, shall bring my offering.
Zeph. In that day thou shall not be put to shame for all thy doings, in which thou have transgressed against me. For then I will take away out of the midst of thee those who rejoice in thy pride,  thou shall no more be haughty in my holy mountain.
Zeph. But I will leave in the midst of thee an afflicted and poor people,  they shall take refuge in the name of Jehovah.
Zeph. The remnant of Israel shall not do iniquity, nor speak lies, nor shall a deceitful tongue be found in their mouth. For they shall feed and lie down,  none shall make them afraid.
Zeph. Sing, O daughter of Zion. Shout, O Israel. Be glad and rejoice with all the heart, O daughter of Jerusalem.
Zeph. Jehovah has taken away thy judgments. He has cast out thine enemy. The King of Israel, even Jehovah, is in the midst of thee. Thou shall not fear evil any more.
Zeph. In that day it shall be said to Jerusalem, Fear thou not, O Zion. Let not thy hands be slack.
Zeph. Jehovah thy God is in the midst of thee, a mighty one who will save. He will rejoice over thee with joy. He will rest in his love. He will joy over thee with singing.
Zeph. I will gather those who sorrow for the solemn assembly, who were of thee, to whom the burden upon her was a reproach.
Zeph. Behold, at that time I will deal with all those who afflict thee. And I will save that which is lame,  gather that which was driven away,  I will make them a praise and a name, whose shame has been in all the earth.
Zeph. At that time I will bring you in,  at that time I will gather you. For I will make you a name and a praise among all the peoples of the earth when I bring back your captivity before your eyes, says Jehovah.
Haggai
In the second year of Darius the king, in the sixth month, in the first day of the month, the word of Jehovah came by Haggai the prophet to Zerubbabel the son of Shealtiel, governor of Judah,  to Joshua the son of Jehozadak, the high priest, saying,
Thus speaks Jehovah of hosts, saying, This people say, It is not the time for us to come, the time for Jehovah's house to be built.
Then the word of Jehovah came by Haggai the prophet, saying,
Is it a time for you yourselves to dwell in your paneled houses while this house lies waste?
Now therefore thus says Jehovah of hosts: Consider your ways.
Ye have sown much,  bring in little. Ye eat,  ye have not enough. Ye drink,  ye are not filled with drink. Ye clothe yourselves,  there is none warm. And he who earns wages earns wages to put into a bag with holes.
Thus says Jehovah of hosts: Consider your ways.
Go up to the mountain,  bring wood,  build the house. And I will take pleasure in it,  I will be glorified, says Jehovah.
Ye looked for much, , lo, it came to little,  when ye brought it home, I blew upon it. Why? says Jehovah of hosts. Because of my house that lays waste while ye run each man to his own house.
Therefore for your sake the heavens withhold the dew,  the earth withholds its fruit.
I called for a drought upon the land,  upon the mountains,  upon the grain,  upon the new wine,  upon the oil,  upon that which the ground brings forth,  upon men,  upon cattle,  upon all the labor of the hands.
Then Zerubbabel the son of Shealtiel,  Joshua the son of Jehozadak, the high priest, with all the remnant of the people, obeyed the voice of Jehovah their God,  the words of Haggai the prophet, as Jehovah their God had sent him. And the people feared before Jehovah.
Then Haggai, Jehovah's agent, spoke in Jehovah's message to the people, saying, I am with you, says Jehovah.
Jehovah stirred up the spirit of Zerubbabel the son of Shealtiel, governor of Judah,  the spirit of Joshua the son of Jehozadak, the high priest,  the spirit of all the remnant of the people. And they came and did work on the house of Jehovah of hosts, their God,
in the twenty-fourth day of the month, in the sixth month, in the second year of Darius the king.
In the seventh month, in the twenty-first day of the month, the word of Jehovah came by Haggai the prophet, saying,
Speak now to Zerubbabel the son of Shealtiel, governor of Judah,  to Joshua the son of Jehozadak, the high priest,  to the remnant of the people, saying,
Who is left among you that saw this house in its former glory? And how do ye see it now? Is it not in your eyes as nothing?
Yet now be strong, O Zerubbabel, says Jehovah,  be strong, O Joshua, son of Jehozadak, the high priest,  be strong, all ye people of the land, says Jehovah,  work. For I am with you, says Jehovah of hosts,
according to the word that I covenanted with you when ye came out of Egypt,  my Spirit abode among you. Fear ye not.
For thus says Jehovah of hosts: Yet once, it is a little while,  I will shake the heavens,  the earth,  the sea,  the dry land.
I will shake all nations,  the precious things of all nations shall come,  I will fill this house with glory, says Jehovah of hosts.
The silver is mine,  the gold is mine, says Jehovah of hosts.
The latter glory of this house shall be greater than the former, says Jehovah of hosts,  in this place I will give peace, says Jehovah of hosts.
In the twenty-fourth day of the ninth month, in the second year of Darius, the word of Jehovah came by Haggai the prophet, saying,
Thus says Jehovah of hosts: Ask now the priests concerning the law, saying,
If a man bears holy flesh in the skirt of his garment,  with his skirt touches bread, or pottage, or wine, or oil, or any food, shall it become holy? And the priests answered and said, No.
Then Haggai said, If a man who is unclean because of a dead body touches any of these, shall it be unclean? And the priests answered and said, It shall be unclean.
Then Haggai answered and said, So is this people,  so is this nation before me, says Jehovah,  so is every work of their hands. And that which they offer there is unclean.
now, I pray you, consider from this day and backward, before a stone was laid upon a stone in the temple of Jehovah.
Through all that time, when a man came to a heap of twenty measures, there were but ten. When he came to the wine vat to draw out fifty vessels, there were but twenty.
I smote you with blasting and with mildew and with hail in all the work of your hands, yet ye turned not to me, says Jehovah.
Consider, I pray you, from this day and backward, from the twenty-fourth day of the ninth month, since the day that the foundation of Jehovah's temple was laid, consider it.
Is the seed yet in the barn? Yea, the vine,  the fig tree,  the pomegranate,  the olive tree have not brought forth. From this day I will bless you.
the word of Jehovah came the second time to Haggai in the twenty-fourth day of the month, saying,
Speak to Zerubbabel, governor of Judah, saying, I will shake the heavens and the earth.
I will overthrow the throne of kingdoms,  I will destroy the strength of the kingdoms of the nations. And I will overthrow the chariots,  those who ride in them. And the horses and their riders shall come down, each one by the sword of his brother.
In that day, says Jehovah of hosts, I will take thee, O Zerubbabel, my servant, the son of Shealtiel, says Jehovah,  will make thee as a signet. For I have chosen thee, says Jehovah of hosts.
Zechariah
Zech. In the eighth month, in the second year of Darius, the word of Jehovah came to Zechariah the son of Berechiah, the son of Iddo, the prophet, saying,
Zech. Jehovah was greatly displeased with your fathers.
Zech. Therefore say thou to them, Thus says Jehovah of hosts: Return to me, says Jehovah of hosts,  I will return to you, says Jehovah of hosts.
Zech. Be ye not as your fathers, to whom the former prophets cried, saying, Thus says Jehovah of hosts: Return ye now from your evil ways,  from your evil doings,  they did not hear, nor hearken to me, says Jehovah.
Zech. Your fathers, where are they? And the prophets, do they live forever?
Zech. But my words and my statutes, which I commanded my servants the prophets, did they not overtake your fathers? And they turned and said, Like as Jehovah of hosts thought to do to us, according to our ways,  according to our doings, so he has dealt with us.
Zech. Upon the twenty-fourth day of the eleventh month, which is the month Shebat, in the second year of Darius, the word of Jehovah came to Zechariah the son of Berechiah, the son of Iddo, the prophet, saying,
Zech. I saw in the night, , behold, a man riding upon a red horse,  he stood among the myrtle trees that were in the bottom. And behind him there were horses, red, sorrel,  white.
Zech. Then I said, O my lord, what are these? And the agent who talked with me said to me, I will show thee what these are.
Zech. And the man who stood among the myrtle trees answered and said, These are they whom Jehovah has sent to walk to and fro through the earth.
Zech. And they answered the agent of Jehovah who stood among the myrtle trees,  said, We have walked to and fro through the earth, , behold, all the earth sits still,  is at rest.
Zech. Then the agent of Jehovah answered and said, O Jehovah of hosts, how long will thou not have mercy on Jerusalem and on the cities of Judah, against which thou have had indignation these seventy years?
Zech. And Jehovah answered the agent who talked with me with good words, comforting words.
Zech. So the agent who talked with me said to me, Cry thou, saying, Thus says Jehovah of hosts: I am jealous for Jerusalem and for Zion with a great jealousy.
Zech. And I am very greatly displeased with the nations that are at ease. For I was but a little displeased,  they helped forward the affliction.
Zech. Therefore thus says Jehovah: I have returned to Jerusalem with mercies. My house shall be built in it, says Jehovah of hosts,  a line shall be stretched forth over Jerusalem.
Zech. Cry yet again, saying, Thus says Jehovah of hosts: My cities shall yet overflow with prosperity,  Jehovah shall yet comfort Zion,  shall yet choose Jerusalem.
Zech. And I lifted up my eyes,  saw, , behold, four horns.
Zech. And I said to the agent who talked with me, What are these? And he answered me, These are the horns which have scattered Judah, Israel,  Jerusalem.
Zech. And Jehovah showed me four smiths.
Zech. Then I said, What are these coming to do? And he spoke, saying, These are the horns which scattered Judah, so that no man lifted up his head. But these have come to terrify them, to cast down the horns of the nations, which lifted up their horn against the land of Judah to scatter it.
Zech. And I lifted up my eyes,  looked. And, behold, a man with a measuring line in his hand.
Zech. Then I said, Where do thou go? And he said to me, To measure Jerusalem. To see what is the breadth of it,  what is the length of it.
Zech. And, behold, the agent who talked with me went forth. And another agent went out to meet him,
Zech. and said to him, Run, speak to this young man, saying, Jerusalem shall be inhabited as villages without walls, because of the multitude of men and cattle therein.
Zech. For I, says Jehovah, will be to her a wall of fire round about,  I will be the glory in the midst of her.
Zech. Ho, ho, flee from the land of the north, says Jehovah. For I have spread you abroad as the four winds of the heavens, says Jehovah.
Zech. Ho Zion, escape, thou who dwell with the daughter of Babylon.
Zech. For thus says Jehovah of hosts: After glory he has sent me to the nations which plundered you. For he who touches you touches the apple of his eye.
Zech. For, behold, I will shake my hand over them,  they shall be a spoil to those who served them. And ye shall know that Jehovah of hosts has sent me.
Zech. Sing and rejoice, O daughter of Zion, for, lo, I come,  I will dwell in the midst of thee, says Jehovah.
Zech. And many nations shall join themselves to Jehovah in that day,  shall be my people,  I will dwell in the midst of thee. And thou shall know that Jehovah of hosts has sent me to thee.
Zech. And Jehovah shall inherit Judah as his portion in the holy land,  shall yet choose Jerusalem.
Zech. Be silent, all flesh, before Jehovah, for he has arisen out of his holy habitation.
Zech. And he showed me Joshua the high priest standing before the agent of Jehovah,  Satan standing at his right hand to be his adversary.
Zech. And Jehovah said to Satan, Jehovah rebuke thee, O Satan. Yea, Jehovah who has chosen Jerusalem rebuke thee. Is this not a brand plucked out of the fire?
Zech. Now Joshua was clothed with filthy garments,  was standing before the agent.
Zech. And he answered and spoke to those who stood before him, saying, Take the filthy garments from off him. And to him he said, Behold, I have caused thine iniquity to pass from thee,  I will clothe thee with rich apparel.
Zech. And I said, Let them set a clean miter upon his head. So they set a clean miter upon his head,  clothed him with garments. And the agent of Jehovah was standing by.
Zech. And the agent of Jehovah testified to Joshua, saying,
Zech. Thus says Jehovah of hosts: If thou will walk in my ways,  if thou will keep my charge, then thou also shall judge my house,  shall also keep my courts,  I will give thee a place of access among these who stand by.
Zech. Hear now, O Joshua the high priest, thou and thy fellows who sit before thee, for they are men who are a sign. For, behold, I will bring forth my servant the Branch.
Zech. For, behold, the stone that I have set before Joshua. Upon one stone are seven eyes. Behold, I will engrave the graving of it, says Jehovah of hosts,  I will remove the iniquity of that land in one day.
Zech. In that day, says Jehovah of hosts, ye shall invite each man his neighbor under the vine and under the fig tree.
Zech. And the agent who talked with me came again,  awoke me, as a man who is awakened out of his sleep.
Zech. And he said to me, What do thou see? And I said, I have seen, , behold, a lampstand all of gold, with its bowl upon the top of it,  its seven lamps on it. There are seven pipes to each of the lamps, which are upon the top of it,
Zech. and two olive trees by it, one upon the right side of the bowl,  the other upon the left side of it.
Zech. And I answered and spoke to the agent who talked with me, saying, What are these, my lord?
Zech. Then the agent who talked with me answered and said to me, Do thou not know what these are? And I said, No, my lord.
Zech. Then he answered and spoke to me, saying, This is the word of Jehovah to Zerubbabel, saying, Not by might, nor by power,  by my Spirit, says Jehovah of hosts.
Zech. Who are thou, O great mountain? Before Zerubbabel thou shall become a plain,  he shall bring forth the top stone with shoutings of Grace, grace, to it.
Zech. Moreover the word of Jehovah came to me, saying,
Zech. The hands of Zerubbabel have laid the foundation of this house. His hands shall also finish it. And thou shall know that Jehovah of hosts has sent me to you.
Zech. For who has despised the day of small things? For these seven shall rejoice,  shall see the plummet in the hand of Zerubbabel, the eyes of Jehovah, which run to and fro through the whole earth.
Zech. Then I answered,  said to him, What are these two olive trees upon the right side of the lampstand and upon the left side of it?
Zech. And I answered the second time,  said to him, What are these two olive-branches, which are beside the two golden spouts that empty the golden oil out of themselves?
Zech. And he answered me and said, Do thou not know what these are? And I said, No, my lord.
Zech. Then he said, These are the two anointed ones, who stand by the Lord of the whole earth.
Zech. Then again I lifted up my eyes,  saw, , behold, a flying roll.
Zech. And he said to me, What do thou see? And I answered, I see a flying roll. The length of it is twenty cubits,  the breadth of it ten cubits.
Zech. Then he said to me, This is the curse that goes forth over the face of the whole land. For everyone who steals shall be cut off on the one side according to it,  everyone who swears shall be cut off on the other side according to it.
Zech. I will cause it to go forth, says Jehovah of hosts,  it shall enter into the house of the thief,  into the house of him who swears falsely by my name. And it shall abide in the midst of his house,  shall consume it, with the timber thereof and the stones thereof.
Zech. Then the agent who talked with me went forth,  said to me, Lift up now thine eyes,  see what this is that goes forth.
Zech. And I said, What is it? And he said, This is the ephah that goes forth. He said moreover, This is their appearance in all the land
Zech. (and, behold, a talent of lead was lifted up),  this is a woman sitting in the midst of the ephah.
Zech. And he said, This is Wickedness. And he cast her down into the midst of the ephah,  he cast the weight of lead upon the mouth of it.
Zech. Then I lifted up my eyes,  looked. And, behold, there came forth two women,  the wind was in their wings. Now they had wings like the wings of a stork,  they lifted up the ephah between earth and heaven.
Zech. Then I said to the agent who talked with me, Where do these carry the ephah?
Zech. And he said to me, To build her a house in the land of Shinar. And when it is prepared, she shall be set there in her own place.
Zech. And again I lifted up my eyes,  looked. And, behold, there came four chariots out from between two mountains,  the mountains were mountains of brass.
Zech. In the first chariot were red horses,  in the second chariot black horses,
Zech. and in the third chariot white horses,  in the fourth chariot strong grizzled horses.
Zech. Then I answered and said to the agent who talked with me, What are these, my lord?
Zech. And the agent answered and said to me, These are the four winds of heaven, which go forth from standing before the Lord of all the earth.
Zech. The chariot in which are the black horses goes forth toward the north country,  the white went forth after them,  the grizzled went forth toward the south country.
Zech. And the strong ones went forth,  sought to go that they might walk to and fro through the earth. And he said, Get you from here. Walk to and fro through the earth. So they walked to and fro through the earth.
Zech. Then he cried to me,  spoke to me, saying, Behold, those who go toward the north country have quieted my spirit in the north country.
Zech. And the word of Jehovah came to me, saying,
Zech. Take from those of the captivity, even of Heldai, of Tobijah,  of Jedaiah,  come thou the same day,  go into the house of Josiah the son of Zephaniah, where they have come from Babylon.
Zech. Yea, take silver and gold,  make crowns,  set them upon the head of Joshua the son of Jehozadak, the high priest.
Zech. And speak to him, saying, Thus speaks Jehovah of hosts, saying, Behold, the man whose name is the Branch. And he shall grow up out of his place,  he shall build the temple of Jehovah,
Zech. even he shall build the temple of Jehovah. And he shall bear the glory,  shall sit and rule upon his throne. And he shall be a priest upon his throne,  the counsel of peace shall be between them both.
Zech. And the crowns shall be to Helem,  to Tobijah,  to Jedaiah,  to Hen the son of Zephaniah, for a memorial in the temple of Jehovah.
Zech. And those who are far off shall come and build in the temple of Jehovah. And ye shall know that Jehovah of hosts has sent me to you. And this shall come to pass, if ye will diligently obey the voice of Jehovah your God.
Zech. And it came to pass in the fourth year of king Darius, that the word of Jehovah came to Zechariah in the fourth day of the ninth month, even in Chislev.
Zech. Now those of Bethel had sent Sharezer and Regem-melech,  their men, to entreat the favor of Jehovah,
Zech. and to speak to the priests of the house of Jehovah of hosts,  to the prophets, saying, Should I weep in the fifth month, separating myself, as I have done these so many years?
Zech. Then the word of Jehovah of hosts came to me, saying,
Zech. Speak to all the people of the land,  to the priests, saying, When ye fasted and mourned in the fifth and in the seventh month, even these seventy years, did ye at all fast to me, even to me?
Zech. And when ye eat,  when ye drink, do ye not eat for yourselves,  drink for yourselves?
Zech. Should ye not hear the words which Jehovah cried by the former prophets, when Jerusalem was inhabited and in prosperity,  the cities thereof round about her,  the South and the lowland were inhabited?
Zech. And the word of Jehovah came to Zechariah, saying,
Zech. Thus Jehovah of hosts has spoken, saying, Execute true justice,  show kindness and compassion every man to his brother.
Zech. And do not oppress the widow, nor the fatherless, the sojourner, nor the poor man. And let none of you devise evil against his brother in your heart.
Zech. But they refused to hearken,  pulled away the shoulder,  stopped their ears, that they might not hear.
Zech. Yea, they made their hearts as an adamant stone, lest they should hear the law,  the words which Jehovah of hosts had sent by his Spirit by the former prophets. Therefore great wrath came from Jehovah of hosts.
Zech. And it has come to pass that, as he cried,  they would not hear, so they shall cry,  I will not hear, said Jehovah of hosts.
Zech. But I will scatter them with a whirlwind among all the nations which they have not known. Thus the land was desolate after them, so that no man passed through nor returned. For they laid the pleasant land desolate.
Zech. And the word of Jehovah of hosts came to me, saying,
Zech. Thus says Jehovah of hosts: I am jealous for Zion with great jealousy,  I am jealous for her with great wrath.
Zech. Thus says Jehovah: I am returned to Zion,  will dwell in the midst of Jerusalem. And Jerusalem shall be called The city of truth,  the mountain of Jehovah of hosts, The holy mountain.
Zech. Thus says Jehovah of hosts: There shall yet old men and old women dwell in the streets of Jerusalem, every man with his staff in his hand for very age.
Zech. And the streets of the city shall be full of boys and girls playing in the streets of it.
Zech. Thus says Jehovah of hosts: If it is marvelous in the eyes of the remnant of this people in those days, should it also be marvelous in my eyes? says Jehovah of hosts.
Zech. Thus says Jehovah of hosts: Behold, I will save my people from the east country,  from the west country.
Zech. And I will bring them,  they shall dwell in the midst of Jerusalem. And they shall be my people,  I will be their God, in truth and in righteousness.
Zech. Thus says Jehovah of hosts: Let your hands be strong, ye who hear in these days these words from the mouth of the prophets who were in the day that the foundation of the house of Jehovah of hosts was laid, even the temple, that it might be built.
Zech. For before those days there was no wage for man, nor any wage for beast, nor was there any peace to him who went out or came in, because of the adversary. For I set all men each one against his neighbor.
Zech. But now I will not be to the remnant of this people as in the former days, says Jehovah of hosts.
Zech. For there shall be the seed of peace. The vine shall give its fruit,  the ground shall give its increase,  the heavens shall give their dew. And I will cause the remnant of this people to inherit all these things.
Zech. And it shall come to pass that, as ye were a curse among the nations, O house of Judah and house of Israel, so I will save you,  ye shall be a blessing. Fear not. Let your hands be strong.
Zech. For thus says Jehovah of hosts: As I thought to do evil to you, when your fathers provoked me to wrath, says Jehovah of hosts,  I did not relent,
Zech. so again I have thought in these days to do good to Jerusalem and to the house of Judah. Fear ye not.
Zech. These are the things that ye shall do: Speak ye every man the truth with his neighbor. Execute the judgment of truth and peace in your gates.
Zech. And let none of you devise evil in your hearts against his neighbor,  love no false oath. For all these are things that I hate, says Jehovah.
Zech. And the word of Jehovah of hosts came to me, saying,
Zech. Thus says Jehovah of hosts: The fast of the fourth month,  the fast of the fifth,  the fast of the seventh,  the fast of the tenth, shall be to the house of Judah, joy and gladness,  cheerful feasts. Therefore love truth and peace.
Zech. Thus says Jehovah of hosts: Peoples shall yet come,  the inhabitants of many cities.
Zech. And the inhabitants of one city shall go to another, saying, Let us go speedily to entreat the favor of Jehovah,  to seek Jehovah of hosts. I will go also.
Zech. Yea, many peoples and strong nations shall come to seek Jehovah of hosts in Jerusalem,  to entreat the favor of Jehovah.
Zech. Thus says Jehovah of hosts: In those days, ten men shall take hold, out of all the languages of the nations, they shall take hold of the skirt of him who is a Jew, saying, We will go with you, for we have heard that God is with you.
Zech. The burden of the word of Jehovah upon the land of Hadrach,  Damascus its resting-place (for the eye of man and of all the tribes of Israel is toward Jehovah),
Zech. and also Hamath, which borders on it, Tyre and Sidon, because they are very wise.
Zech. And Tyre built herself a stronghold,  heaped up silver as the dust,  fine gold as the mire of the streets.
Zech. Behold, the Lord will dispossess her,  he will smite her power in the sea,  she shall be devoured with fire.
Zech. Ashkelon shall see it,  fear, Gaza also,  shall be greatly pained,  Ekron, for her expectation shall be put to shame. And the king shall perish from Gaza,  Ashkelon shall not be inhabited.
Zech. And a bastard shall dwell in Ashdod,  I will cut off the pride of the Philistines.
Zech. And I will take away his blood out of his mouth,  his abominations from between his teeth. And he also shall be a remnant for our God,  he shall be as a chieftain in Judah,  Ekron as a Jebusite.
Zech. And I will encamp the army around my house, that none pass through or return,  no oppressor shall pass through them any more. For now I have seen with my eyes.
Zech. Rejoice greatly, O daughter of Zion. Shout, O daughter of Jerusalem. Behold, thy king comes to thee. He is just,  having salvation, lowly,  riding upon a donkey, even upon a colt the foal of a donkey.
Zech. And I will cut off the chariot from Ephraim,  the horse from Jerusalem,  the battle bow shall be cut off. And he shall speak peace to the nations. And his dominion shall be from sea to sea,  from the River to the ends of the earth.
Zech. As for thee also, because of the blood of thy covenant I have set free thy prisoners from the pit in which is no water.
Zech. Turn you back to the stronghold, ye prisoners of hope. Even today I declare that I will render double to thee.
Zech. For I have bent Judah for me. I have filled the bow with Ephraim. And I will stir up thy sons, O Zion, against thy sons, O Greece,  will make thee as the sword of a mighty man.
Zech. And Jehovah shall be seen over them. And his arrow shall go forth as the lightning. And the lord Jehovah will blow the trumpet,  will go with whirlwinds of the south.
Zech. Jehovah of hosts will defend them. And they shall devour,  shall tread down the sling-stones. And they shall drink,  make a noise as through wine,  they shall be filled like bowls, like the corners of the altar.
Zech. And Jehovah their God will save them in that day as the flock of his people, as for the stones of a crown, lifted on high over his land.
Zech. For how great is his goodness,  how great is his beauty! Grain shall make the young men flourish,  new wine the virgins.
Zech. Ask ye of Jehovah rain in the time of the latter rain, even of Jehovah who makes lightnings,  he will give them showers of rain, to everyone grass in the field.
Zech. For the teraphim have spoken vanity,  the diviners have seen a lie,  they have told false dreams. They comfort in vain. Therefore they go their way like sheep. They are afflicted, because there is no shepherd.
Zech. My anger is kindled against the shepherds,  I will punish the he-goats. For Jehovah of hosts has visited his flock, the house of Judah,  will make them as his goodly horse in the battle.
Zech. From him shall come forth the cornerstone, from him the nail, from him the battle bow, from him every ruler together.
Zech. And they shall be as mighty men, treading down their enemies in the mire of the streets in the battle. And they shall fight, because Jehovah is with them,  the riders on horses shall be confounded.
Zech. And I will strengthen the house of Judah,  I will save the house of Joseph,  I will bring them back. For I have mercy upon them,  they shall be as though I had not cast them off. For I am Jehovah their God,  I will hear them.
Zech. And Ephraim shall be like a mighty man,  their heart shall rejoice as through wine. Yea, their sons shall see it,  rejoice. Their heart shall be glad in Jehovah.
Zech. I will whistle for them,  gather them. For I have redeemed them,  they shall increase as they have increased.
Zech. And I will sow them among the peoples,  they shall remember me in far countries. And they shall live with their sons,  shall return.
Zech. I will also bring them again out of the land of Egypt,  gather them out of Assyria. And I will bring them into the land of Gilead and Lebanon,  until space shall not be found for them.
Zech. And he will pass through the sea of affliction,  will smite the waves in the sea,  all the depths of the Nile shall dry up. And the pride of Assyria shall be brought down,  the scepter of Egypt shall depart.
Zech. And I will strengthen them in Jehovah,  they shall walk up and down in his name, says Jehovah.
Zech. Open thy doors, O Lebanon, that the fire may devour thy cedars.
Zech. Wail, O fir tree, for the cedar is fallen, because the fine ones are destroyed. Wail, O ye oaks of Bashan, for the strong forest has come down.
Zech. A voice of the wailing of the shepherds, for their glory is destroyed. A voice of the roaring of young lions, for the pride of the Jordan is laid waste.
Zech. Thus said Jehovah my God: Feed the flock of slaughter,
Zech. whose possessors kill them,  hold themselves not guilty. And those who sell them say, Blessed be Jehovah, for I am rich,  their own shepherds pity them not.
Zech. For I will no more pity the inhabitants of the land, says Jehovah. But, lo, I will deliver the men each one into his neighbor's hand,  into the hand of his king. And they shall smite the land,  I will not deliver them out of their hand.
Zech. So I fed the flock of slaughter, truly the poor of the flock. And I took to me two staves, the one I called Beauty,  the other I called Bands,  I fed the flock.
Zech. And I cut off the three shepherds in one month, for my soul was weary of them,  their soul also loathed me.
Zech. Then I said, I will not feed you. That which dies, let it die,  that which is to be cut off, let it be cut off,  let those who are left eat each one the flesh of another.
Zech. And I took my staff Beauty,  cut it apart, that I might break my covenant which I had made with all the peoples.
Zech. And it was broken in that day,  thus the poor of the flock who gave heed to me knew that it was the word of Jehovah.
Zech. And I said to them, If ye think good, give me my wage,  if not, forbear. So they weighed for my wage thirty pieces of silver.
Zech. And Jehovah said to me, Cast it to the potter, the good price that I was valued by them. And I took the thirty pieces of silver,  cast them to the potter in the house of Jehovah.
Zech. Then I cut apart my other staff, even Bands, that I might break the brotherhood between Judah and Israel.
Zech. And Jehovah said to me, Take to thee yet again the instruments of a foolish shepherd.
Zech. For, lo, I will raise up a shepherd in the land, who will not visit those who are cut off, nor will he seek those who are scattered, nor heal that which is broken, nor feed that which is sound,  he will eat the flesh of the fat,  will tear their hoofs in pieces.
Zech. Woe to the worthless shepherd who leaves the flock! The sword shall be upon his arm,  upon his right eye. His arm shall be entirely dried up,  his right eye shall be utterly darkened.
Zech. The burden of the word of Jehovah concerning Israel. Thus says Jehovah, who stretches forth the heavens,  lays the foundation of the earth,  forms the spirit of man within him:
Zech. Behold, I will make Jerusalem a cup of reeling to all the peoples round about,  upon Judah also it shall be in the siege against Jerusalem.
Zech. And it shall come to pass in that day, that I will make Jerusalem a burdensome stone for all the peoples. All who burden themselves with it shall be severely wounded. And all the nations of the earth shall be gathered together against it.
Zech. In that day, says Jehovah, I will smite every horse with terror,  his rider with madness. And I will open my eyes upon the house of Judah,  will smite every horse of the peoples with blindness.
Zech. And the chieftains of Judah shall say in their heart, The inhabitants of Jerusalem are my strength in Jehovah of hosts their God.
Zech. In that day I will make the chieftains of Judah like a pan of fire among wood,  like a flaming torch among sheaves. And they shall devour all the peoples round about, on the right hand and on the left,  Jerusalem shall yet again dwell in their own place, even in Jerusalem.
Zech. Jehovah also shall save the tents of Judah first, that the glory of the house of David and the glory of the inhabitants of Jerusalem not be magnified above Judah.
Zech. In that day Jehovah shall defend the inhabitants of Jerusalem. And he who is feeble among them at that day shall be as David,  the house of David shall be as God, as the agent of Jehovah before them.
Zech. And it shall come to pass in that day, that I will seek to destroy all the nations that come against Jerusalem.
Zech. And I will pour upon the house of David,  upon the inhabitants of Jerusalem, the spirit of grace and of supplication. And they shall look to me whom they have pierced. And they shall mourn for him, as a man mourns for his only son,  shall be in bitterness for him, as a man who is in bitterness for his firstborn.
Zech. In that day there shall be a great mourning in Jerusalem, as the mourning of Hadadrimmon in the valley of Megiddon.
Zech. And the land shall mourn, every family apart, the family of the house of David apart,  their wives apart, the family of the house of Nathan apart,  their wives apart,
Zech. the family of the house of Levi apart,  their wives apart, the family of the Shimeites apart,  their wives apart,
Zech. all the families that remain, every family apart,  their wives apart.
Zech. In that day there shall be a fountain opened to the house of David and to the inhabitants of Jerusalem, for sin and for uncleanness.
Zech. And it shall come to pass in that day, says Jehovah of hosts, that I will cut off the names of the idols out of the land,  they shall no more be remembered. And I will also cause the prophets and the unclean spirit to pass out of the land.
Zech. And it shall come to pass that, when any shall yet prophesy, then his father and his mother who begot him shall say to him, Thou shall not live, for thou speak lies in the name of Jehovah. And his father and his mother who begot him shall thrust him through when he prophesies.
Zech. And it shall come to pass in that day, that the prophets shall be ashamed each one of his vision, when he prophesies, nor shall they wear a hairy mantle to deceive.
Zech. But he shall say, I am no prophet. I am a tiller of the ground, for I have been made a bondman from my youth.
Zech. And a man shall say to him, What are these wounds between thine arms? Then he shall answer, Those with which I was wounded in the house of my friends.
Zech. Awake, O sword, against my shepherd,  against the man who is my companion, says Jehovah of hosts. Smite the shepherd,  the sheep shall be scattered. And I will turn my hand upon the little ones.
Zech. And it shall come to pass, that in all the land, says Jehovah, two parts therein shall be cut off and die,  the third shall be left in it.
Zech. And I will bring the third part into the fire,  will refine them as silver is refined,  will try them as gold is tried. They shall call on my name,  I will hear them. I will say, It is my people,  they shall say, Jehovah is my God.
Zech. Behold, a day of Jehovah comes when thy spoil shall be divided in the midst of thee.
Zech. For I will gather all nations against Jerusalem to battle. And the city shall be taken,  the houses rifled,  the women ravished,  half of the city shall go forth into captivity. And the residue of the people shall not be cut off from the city.
Zech. Then Jehovah shall go forth,  fight against those nations, as when he fought in the day of battle.
Zech. And his feet shall stand in that day upon the mount of Olives, which is before Jerusalem on the east. And the mount of Olives shall be split in the midst of it toward the east and toward the west, a very great valley. And half of the mountain shall remove toward the north,  half of it toward the south.
Zech. And ye shall flee by the valley of my mountains, for the valley of the mountains shall reach to Azel. Yea, ye shall flee, just as ye fled from before the earthquake in the days of Uzziah king of Judah. And Jehovah my God shall come,  all the holy ones with thee.
Zech. And it shall come to pass in that day, that there shall not be light; the bright ones shall withdraw themselves.
Zech. But it shall be one day which is known to Jehovah, not day,  not night. But it shall come to pass, that at evening time there shall be light.
Zech. And it shall come to pass in that day, that living waters shall go out from Jerusalem, half of them toward the eastern sea,  half of them toward the western sea. In summer and in winter it shall be.
Zech. And Jehovah shall be King over all the earth. In that day Jehovah shall be one,  his name one.
Zech. All the land shall be made like the Arabah, from Geba to Rimmon south of Jerusalem. And she shall be lifted up,  shall dwell in her place, from Benjamin's gate to the place of the first gate, to the corner gate,  from the tower of Hananel to the king's wine-presses.
Zech. And men shall dwell therein,  there shall be no more curse,  Jerusalem shall dwell safely.
Zech. And this shall be the plague with which Jehovah will smite all the peoples who have warred against Jerusalem: their flesh shall consume away while they stand upon their feet,  their eyes shall consume away in their sockets,  their tongue shall consume away in their mouth.
Zech. And it shall come to pass in that day, that a great tumult from Jehovah shall be among them,  they shall lay hold each one on the hand of his neighbor,  his hand shall rise up against the hand of his neighbor.
Zech. And Judah also shall fight at Jerusalem. And the wealth of all the nations round about shall be gathered together, gold,  silver,  apparel, in great abundance.
Zech. And so shall be the plague of the horse, of the mule, of the camel,  of the donkey,  of all the beasts that shall be in those camps, as that plague.
Zech. And it shall come to pass, that everyone who is left of all the nations that came against Jerusalem shall go up from year to year to worship the King, Jehovah of hosts,  to keep the feast of tabernacles.
Zech. And it shall be, that of the families of the earth he who does not go up to Jerusalem to worship the King, Jehovah of hosts, upon them there shall be no rain.
Zech. And if the family of Egypt does not go up,  does not come, that there shall be the plague with which Jehovah will smite the nations that go not up to keep the feast of tabernacles.
Zech. This shall be the punishment of Egypt,  the punishment of all the nations that do not go up to keep the feast of tabernacles.
Zech. In that day there shall be upon the bells of the horses, HOLY TO JEHOVAH,  the pots in Jehovah's house shall be like the bowls before the altar.
Zech. Yea, every pot in Jerusalem and in Judah shall be holy to Jehovah of hosts. And all those who sacrifice shall come and take of them,  boil in it. And in that day there shall be no more a Canaanite in the house of Jehovah of hosts.
Malachi
The burden of the word of Jehovah to Israel by Malachi.
I have loved you, says Jehovah. Yet ye say, How have thou loved us? Was not Esau Jacob's brother, says Jehovah. Yet I loved Jacob,
but Esau I regarded inferior,  made his mountains a desolation,  gave his heritage to the jackals of the wilderness.
Whereas Edom says, We are beaten down,  we will return and build the waste places, thus says Jehovah of hosts: They shall build,  I will throw down,  men shall call them the border of wickedness,  the people against whom Jehovah has indignation forever.
your eyes shall see,  ye shall say, Jehovah be magnified beyond the border of Israel.
A son honors his father,  a servant his master. If then I am a father, where is my honor? And if I am a master, where is my fear? says Jehovah of hosts to you, O priests, who despise my name. And ye say, How have we despised thy name?
Ye offer polluted bread upon my altar. And ye say, How have we polluted thee? In that ye say, The table of Jehovah is contemptible.
when ye offer the blind for sacrifice, ye say, It is no evil! and when ye offer the lame and sick, It is no evil! Present it now to thy governor. Will he be pleased with thee, or will he accept thy person? says Jehovah of hosts.
Ye say, And now, I pray you, entreat the favor of God, that he may be gracious to us; this has been by your means. Will he accept any of your persons? says Jehovah of hosts.
Oh that there was among you who would shut the doors, that ye might not kindle my altar in vain! I have no pleasure in you, says Jehovah of hosts, nor will I accept an offering at your hand.
For from the rising of the sun even to the going down of the same, my name is great among the Gentiles. And in every place incense is offered to my name,  a pure offering. For my name is great among the Gentiles, says Jehovah of hosts.
But ye profane it, in that ye say, The table of Jehovah is polluted. And the fruit of it, even its food, is contemptible.
Ye also say, Behold, what a weariness it is! And ye have sniffed at it, says Jehovah of hosts. And ye have brought that which was taken by violence,  the lame,  the sick. Thus ye bring the offering. Should I accept this at your hand? says Jehovah.
But cursed be the deceiver, who has in his flock a male,  vows,  sacrifices to the Lord a blemished thing. For I am a great King, says Jehovah of hosts,  my name is feared among the Gentiles.
now, O ye priests, this commandment is for you.
If ye will not hear,  if ye will not lay it to heart, to give glory to my name, says Jehovah of hosts, then I will send the curse upon you,  I will curse your blessings. Yea, I have cursed them already, because ye do not lay it to heart.
Behold, I will rebuke your seed,  will spread dung upon your faces, even the dung of your feasts,  ye shall be taken away with it.
ye shall know that I have sent this commandment to you, that my covenant may be with Levi, says Jehovah of hosts.
My covenant of life and peace was with him. And I gave them to him that he might fear,  he feared me,  stood in awe of my name.
The law of truth was in his mouth,  unrighteousness was not found in his lips. He walked with me in peace and uprightness,  turned many away from iniquity.
For the priest's lips should keep knowledge,  they should seek the law at his mouth. For he is the messenger of Jehovah of hosts.
But ye are turned aside out of the way. Ye have caused many to stumble in the law. Ye have corrupted the covenant of Levi, says Jehovah of hosts.
Therefore I also have made you contemptible and base before all the people, according as ye have not kept my ways,  have had respect of persons in the law.
Have we not all one father? Has not one God created us? Why do we deal treacherously every man against his brother, profaning the covenant of our fathers?
Judah has dealt treacherously,  an abomination is committed in Israel and in Jerusalem. For Judah has profaned the holiness of Jehovah which he loves,  has married the daughter of a foreign god.
Jehovah will cut off out of the tents of Jacob, the man who does this: him who wakes,  him who answers,  him who offers an offering to Jehovah of hosts.
this again ye do: Ye cover the altar of Jehovah with tears, with weeping,  with sighing, insomuch that he does not regard the offering any more, nor receives it with good will at your hand.
Yet ye say, Why? Because Jehovah has been witness between thee and the wife of thy youth, against whom thou have dealt treacherously, though she is thy companion,  the wife of thy covenant.
did he not make one, although he had the residue of the Spirit? And why one? He sought a godly seed. Therefore take heed to your spirit,  let none deal treacherously against the wife of his youth.
For I hate putting away, says Jehovah, the God of Israel,  him who covers his garment with violence, says Jehovah of hosts. Therefore take heed to your spirit, that ye deal not treacherously.
Ye have wearied Jehovah with your words. Yet ye say, How have we wearied him? In that ye say, Everyone who does evil is good in the sight of Jehovah,  he delights in them, or Where is the God of justice?
Behold, I send my agent,  he shall prepare the way before me. And the Lord, whom ye seek, will suddenly come to his temple. And the messenger of the covenant, whom ye desire, behold, he comes, says Jehovah of hosts.
But who can abide the day of his coming? And who shall stand when he appears? For he is like a refiner's fire,  like fuller's soap.
he will sit as a refiner and purifier of silver. And he will purify the sons of Levi,  refine them as gold and silver. And they shall offer to Jehovah offerings in righteousness.
Then the offering of Judah and Jerusalem shall be pleasant to Jehovah, as in the days of old,  as in ancient years.
I will come near to you to judgment,  I will be a swift witness against the sorcerers,  against the adulterers,  against the false swearers,  against those who oppress the hireling in his wages, the widow,  the fatherless,  who turn aside the sojourner,  do not fear me, says Jehovah of hosts.
For I, Jehovah, do not change. Therefore ye, O sons of Jacob, are not consumed.
From the days of your fathers ye have turned aside from my ordinances,  have not kept them. Return to me,  I will return to you, says Jehovah of hosts. But ye say, How shall we return?
Will a man rob God? Yet ye rob me. But ye say, How have we robbed thee? In tithes and offerings.
Ye are cursed with the curse, for ye rob me, even this whole nation.
Bring ye the whole tithe into the storehouse, that there may be food in my house,  prove me now with this, says Jehovah of hosts, if I will not open to you the windows of heaven,  pour you out a blessing, that there shall not be room enough for it.
I will rebuke the devourer for your sakes,  he shall not destroy the fruits of your ground, nor shall your vine cast its fruit before the time in the field, says Jehovah of hosts.
all nations shall call you blessed, for ye shall be a delightful land, says Jehovah of hosts.
Your words have been stout against me, says Jehovah. Yet ye say, What have we spoken against thee?
Ye have said, It is vain to serve God,  what profit is it that we have kept his charge,  that we have walked mournfully before Jehovah of hosts?
now we call the proud happy. Yea, those who work wickedness are built up. Yea, they challenge God,  escape.
Then those who feared Jehovah spoke one with another,  Jehovah hearkened,  heard,  a book of remembrance was written before him, for those who feared Jehovah,  who thought upon his name.
they shall be mine, says Jehovah of hosts, my own possession, in the day that I make. And I will spare them, as a man spares his own son who serves him.
Then ye shall return and discern between the righteous man and the wicked man, between him who serves God and him who does not serve him.
For, behold, the day comes, it burns as a furnace,  all the proud,  all who work wickedness, shall be stubble. And the day that comes shall burn them up, says Jehovah of hosts, that it shall leave them neither root nor branch.
But to you who fear my name the sun of righteousness shall arise with healing in its wings,  ye shall go forth,  frolic as calves of the stall.
ye shall tread down the wicked, for they shall be ashes under the soles of your feet in the day that I make, says Jehovah of hosts.
Remember ye the law of Moses my servant, which I commanded to him in Horeb for all Israel, even statutes and ordinances.
Behold, I will send you Elijah the prophet before the great and fearful day of Jehovah comes.
he shall turn the hearts of the fathers to the sons,  the heart of the sons to their fathers, lest I come and smite the earth with a curse.
Matthew
Matt. A book of a genealogy of Jesus Christ, the son of David, the son of Abraham.
Matt. Abraham begot Isaac,  Isaac begot Jacob,  Jacob begot Judah and his brothers,
Matt. and Judah begot Perez and Zerah from Tamar,  Perez begot Hezron,  Hezron begot Ram,
Matt. and Ram begot Amminadab,  Amminadab begot Nahshon,  Nahshon begot Salmon,
Matt. and Salmon begot Boaz from Rahab,  Boaz begot Obed from Ruth,  Obed begot Jesse,
Matt. and Jesse begot David the king. And David begot Solomon from the widow of Uriah,
Matt. and Solomon begot Rehoboam,  Rehoboam begot Abijah,  Abijah begot Asa,
Matt. and Asa begot Jehoshaphat,  Jehoshaphat begot Joram,  Joram begot Uzziah,
Matt. and Uzziah begot Jotham,  Jotham begot Ahaz,  Ahaz begot Hezekiah,
Matt. and Hezekiah begot Manasseh,  Manasseh begot Amon,  Amon begot Josiah,
Matt. and Josiah begot Jechoniah and his brothers during the Babylonian exile.
Matt. And after the Babylonian exile, Jechoniah begot Shealtiel,  Shealtiel begot Zerubbabel,
Matt. and Zerubbabel begot Abiud,  Abiud begot Eliakim,  Eliakim begot Azor,
Matt. and Azor begot Zadoc,  Zadoc begot Achim,  Achim begot Eliud,
Matt. and Eliud begot Eleazar,  Eleazar begot Matthan,  Matthan begot Jacob,
Matt. and Jacob begot Joseph the husband of Mary, of whom was born Jesus, who is called Christ.
Matt. So all the generations from Abraham to David are fourteen generations,  from David to the Babylonian exile fourteen generations,  from the Babylonian exile to the Christ fourteen generations.
Matt. Now the birth of Jesus Christ was this way. For his mother Mary, who was betrothed to Joseph, before they came together she was found having in her womb from the Holy Spirit.
Matt. But Joseph her husband, being a righteous man,  not wanting to expose her to public disgrace, intended to dismiss her privately.
Matt. But while he considered these things, behold, an agent of the Lord appeared to him in a dream, saying, Joseph, thou son of David, fear not to take Mary to be thy wife, for that which was begotten in her is from the Holy Spirit.
Matt. And she will bring forth a son,  thou shall call his name JESUS, for he will save his people from their sins.
Matt. Now all this has come to pass, so that what was spoken by the Lord through the prophet might be fulfilled, which says,
Matt. Behold, the virgin will have in her womb,  will bring forth a son. And they will call his name Immanuel, which is, being interpreted, God with us.
Matt. And Joseph, being roused from his sleep, did as the agent of the Lord ordered him. And he took his wife,
Matt. and knew her not until she brought forth her son, the firstborn. And he called his name JESUS.
Matt. Now Jesus having been born in Bethlehem of Judea in the days of Herod the king, behold, wise men from the east came to Jerusalem, saying,
Matt. Where is he who is born king of the Jews? For we saw his star in the east,  have come to worship him.
Matt. And Herod the king having heard it, he was troubled,  all Jerusalem with him.
Matt. And having gathered together all the chief priests and scholars of the people, he inquired of them where the Christ is born.
Matt. And they said to him, In Bethlehem of Judea. For thus it is written through the prophet,
Matt. And thou Bethlehem, land of Judah, are in no way least among the rulers of Judah, for out of thee will come forth a man who rules, who will tend my people Israel.
Matt. Then Herod having called the wise men privately, ascertained from them what time the star appeared.
Matt. And having sent them to Bethlehem, he said, After going, search diligently about the child. And when ye find him, report to me, so that I also having come, may worship him.
Matt. And when they heard the king, they departed. And lo, the star that they saw in the east went before them until, having come, it stood over where the child was.
Matt. And when they saw the star, they rejoiced with exceedingly great joy.
Matt. And having come into the house, they saw the child with Mary his mother,  having fallen down, they worshiped him. And having opened their treasures, they brought to him gifts, gold and frankincense and myrrh.
Matt. And divinely warned in a dream not to return to Herod, they departed into their own country by another way.
Matt. Now after they departed, behold, an agent of the Lord appears to Joseph in a dream, saying, After rising, take the child and his mother,  flee into Egypt,  thou be there until I tell thee, for Herod is going to seek the child to destroy it.
Matt. And having awakened, he took the child and his mother by night,  departed into Egypt.
Matt. And he was there until the end of Herod, so that what was spoken by the Lord through the prophet might be fulfilled, which says, Out of Egypt I called my Son.
Matt. Then Herod, when he saw that he was scorned by the wise men, was exceedingly angry,  having sent forth, he killed all the boys in Bethlehem,  in all the borders of it, from two years old and under, according to the time that he had ascertained from the wise men.
Matt. Then that which was spoken through Jeremiah the prophet was fulfilled, which says,
Matt. A voice was heard in Ramah, lamentation,  weeping,  great mourning, Rachel weeping for her children. And she did not want to be comforted, because they are not.
Matt. But when Herod perished, behold, an agent of the Lord appears in a dream to Joseph in Egypt, saying,
Matt. After rising, take the child and his mother,  go into the land of Israel, for those seeking the child's life have died.
Matt. And having awaken, he took the child and his mother,  came into the land of Israel.
Matt. But when he heard that Archelaus was reigning over Judea in place of his father Herod, he was afraid to go there. And divinely warned in a dream, he withdrew into the parts of Galilee.
Matt. And having come, he dwelt in a city called Nazareth, so that what was spoken through the prophets might be fulfilled, that he will be called a Nazarene.
Matt. And in those days John the immerser comes, preaching in the wilderness of Judea,  saying,
Matt. Repent ye, for the kingdom of the heavens has approached.
Matt. For this is he who was spoken of by Isaiah the prophet, saying, The voice of a man crying in the wilderness: Prepare ye the way of the Lord. Make his paths straight.
Matt. Now John himself had his raiment of camel's hair,  a leather belt about his waist. And his food was locusts and wild honey.
Matt. Then Jerusalem,  all Judea,  all the region of the Jordan went out to him,
Matt. and they were immersed by him in the Jordan, confessing their sins.
Matt. But when he saw many of the Pharisees and Sadducees coming to his immersion, he said to them, Ye offspring of vipers, who showed you to flee from the coming wrath?
Matt. Therefore produce fruit worthy of repentance.
Matt. And think not to say within yourselves, We have a father, Abraham. For I say to you, that God is able from these stones to raise up children to Abraham.
Matt. And even now the axe is laid at the root of the trees. Every tree therefore not producing good fruit is cut down,  cast into the fire.
Matt. I indeed immerse you in water for repentance,  he who comes after me is mightier than I, whose shoes I am not worthy to bear. He will immerse you in the Holy Spirit.
Matt. Whose winnowing fork is in his hand,  he will thoroughly cleanse his threshing floor. And he will gather his wheat into the storehouse,  he will burn the chaff with unquenchable fire.
Matt. Then Jesus comes from Galilee to the Jordan to John to be immersed by him.
Matt. But John was preventing him, saying, I have need to be immersed by thee,  thou come to me?
Matt. But having answered, Jesus said to him, Allow it now, for thus it is fitting for us to fulfill all righteousness. Then he allows him.
Matt. And when Jesus was immersed, he went up straightaway out of the water. And lo, the heavens were opened to him,  he saw the Spirit of God descending like a dove,  coming upon him.
Matt. And lo, a voice out of the heavens, saying, This is my beloved Son, in whom I am well pleased.
Matt. Then Jesus was led by the Spirit into the wilderness to be tempted by the devil.
Matt. And having fasted forty days and forty nights, afterward he was hungry.
Matt. And after he who tempts came, he said to him, If thou are the Son of God, speak so that these stones may become bread.
Matt. But having answered, he said, It is written, Man will not live on bread alone,  on every word coming out through the mouth of God.
Matt. Then the devil takes him into the holy city,  stands him on the pinnacle of the temple.
Matt. And he says to him, If thou are the Son of God, cast thyself down, for it is written, He will command his agents about thee, , They will take thee up in their hands, lest thou dash thy foot against a stone.
Matt. Jesus said to him, Again it is written, Thou shall not challenge the Lord thy God.
Matt. Again, the devil takes him onto an exceedingly high mountain,  shows him all the kingdoms of the world,  the glory of them.
Matt. And he says to him, All these things I give thee, if after falling down, thou will worship me.
Matt. Then Jesus says to him, Get thee behind me, Satan, for it is written, Thou shall worship the Lord thy God,  him only thou shall serve.
Matt. Then the devil leaves him,  behold, agents came and served him.
Matt. Now when Jesus heard that John was delivered up, he departed into Galilee.
Matt. And having left Nazareth behind, after coming, he dwelt in Capernaum by the sea in the regions of Zebulun and Naphtali,
Matt. so that what was spoken through Isaiah the prophet might be fulfilled, which says,
Matt. The land of Zebulun and the land of Naphtali, way of the sea, beyond the Jordan, Galilee of the Gentiles,
Matt. the people who dwell in darkness saw a great light,  to those who dwell in the region and shadow of death, light sprang up to them.
Matt. From that time Jesus began to preach,  to say, Repent ye, for the kingdom of the heavens has approached.
Matt. And walking by the sea of Galilee, he saw two brothers, Simon who is called Peter,  Andrew his brother, casting a net into the sea, for they were fishermen.
Matt. And he says to them, Come behind me,  I will make you fishermen of men.
Matt. And straightaway having left the nets, they followed him.
Matt. And having gone on from there he saw two other brothers, James the son of Zebedee,  John his brother, in the boat with Zebedee their father, mending their nets. And he called them.
Matt. And straightaway having left the boat and their father, they followed him.
Matt. And Jesus went around all Galilee, teaching in their synagogues,  preaching the good news of the kingdom,  healing every sickness and every disease among the people.
