Matt. And his fame went forth into all Syria. And they brought to him all those faring badly with various diseases,  gripped with pain,  being demon-possessed,  being lunatic,  paralyzed. And he healed them.
Matt. And many multitudes from Galilee and Decapolis and Jerusalem and Judea and beyond the Jordan followed him.
Matt. And having seen the multitudes, he went up onto the mountain. And when he sat down, his disciples came to him.
Matt. And having opened his mouth, he taught them, saying,
Matt. Blessed are the poor in spirit, because the kingdom of the heavens is theirs.
Matt. Blessed are those who mourn, because they will be comforted.
Matt. Blessed are the meek, because they will inherit the earth.
Matt. Blessed are those who hunger and thirst for righteousness, because they will be filled.
Matt. Blessed are the merciful, because they will obtain mercy.
Matt. Blessed are the pure in heart, because they will see God.
Matt. Blessed are the peacemakers, because they will be called sons of God.
Matt. Blessed are those who have been persecuted because of righteousness, because the kingdom of the heavens is theirs.
Matt. Blessed are ye when they revile you,  persecute you,  say every evil word, being deceitful against you because of me.
Matt. Rejoice,  be exceedingly glad, because your reward is great in the heavens, for so they persecuted the prophets before you.
Matt. Ye are the salt material of the earth. But if the salt material becomes ineffective, by what will it be salted? It is potent for nothing further, except to be cast outside and to be trodden down by men.
Matt. Ye are the light of the world. A city setting on a hill cannot be hid,
Matt. nor do they light a lamp,  put it under the bushel,  on the lampstand,  it shines to all in the house.
Matt. Thus your light should shine before men, so that they may see your good works,  glorify your Father in the heavens.
Matt. Think not that I came to abolish the law or the prophets. I came not to abolish,  to fulfill.
Matt. For truly I say to you, until the heaven and the earth pass away, one iota or one tittle will, no, not pass away from the law, until all things come to pass.
Matt. Whoever therefore may relax one of these least commandments,  may teach men so, he will be called least in the kingdom of the heavens. But whoever may do and may teach them, this man will be called great in the kingdom of the heavens.
Matt. For I say to you, that unless your righteousness abounds more than of the scholars and Pharisees, ye will, no, not enter into the kingdom of the heavens.
Matt. Ye have heard that it was said to them in old times, Thou shall not murder,  whoever murders will be liable to the judgment.
Matt. But I say to you, that every man who is angry at his brother without cause will be liable to the judgment,  whoever speaks an insult to his brother will be liable to the council,  whoever says, Foolish man, will be liable to the hell of fire.
Matt. If therefore thou should bring thy gift to the altar,  remember there that thy brother has anything against thee,
Matt. leave there thy gift before the altar,  go. First be reconciled to thy brother,  then, after coming, bring thy gift.
Matt. Be agreeing with thine opponent quickly, while thou are with him on the way, lest the opponent deliver thee to the judge,  the judge deliver thee to the subordinate,  thou will be cast into prison.
Matt. Truly I say to thee, thou will, no, not come out from there, until thou have paid the last quadran.
Matt. Ye have heard that it was said, Thou shall not commit adultery.
Matt. But I say to you, that every man who looks on a woman to crave her has already committed adultery with her in his heart.
Matt. And if thy right eye causes thee to stumble, remove it and cast it from thee, for it is advantageous for thee that one of thy body-parts should perish,  not thy whole body be cast into hell.
Matt. And if thy right hand causes thee to stumble, cut it off and cast it from thee, for it is advantageous for thee that one of thy body-parts should perish,  not thy whole body be cast into hell.
Matt. And it was said, Whoever may divorce his wife, let him give her a divorce certificate.
Matt. But I say to you, that whoever may divorce his wife apart from a matter of fornication, disposes her to commit adultery,  whoever may marry her who has been divorced commits adultery.
Matt. Again, ye have heard that it was said to them in old times, Thou shall not swear falsely,  shall render to the Lord thine oaths.
Matt. But I say to you, not to swear at all, neither by heaven, because it is the throne of God,
Matt. nor by the earth, because it is the footstool of his feet, nor by Jerusalem, because it is the city of the great King.
Matt. Neither shall thou swear by thy head, because thou cannot make one hair white or black.
Matt. But let your word be, Yes, yes, No, no. And anything beyond these is from evil.
Matt. Ye have heard that it was said, An eye for an eye,  a tooth for a tooth.
Matt. But I say to you, not to resist what is troublesome,  whoever will strike thee on thy right cheek, turn to him the other also.
Matt. And to the man who wants to sue thee,  take away thy coat, thou shall leave him thy cloak also.
Matt. And whoever will draft thee for one mile, go thou with him two.
Matt. Give to him who asks thee,  turn thou not away from him who wants to borrow from thee.
Matt. Ye have heard that it was said, Thou shall love thy neighbor,  hate thine enemy.
Matt. But I say to you, love your enemies, bless those who curse you, do good to those who hate you,  pray for those who mistreat you and persecute you,
Matt. so that ye may become sons of your Father in the heavens, because he makes his sun to rise on the evil and the good,  makes rain on the righteous and the unrighteous.
Matt. For if ye love those who love you, what reward have ye? Do not even the tax collectors the same?
Matt. And if ye only greet your friends, what do ye extra? Do not even the tax collectors this way?
Matt. Ye therefore shall be perfect, even as your Father in the heavens is perfect.
Matt. Be careful not to do your charity before men in order to be seen by them, otherwise ye have no reward from your Father in the heavens.
Matt. When therefore thou do charity, do not sound a trumpet before thee, as the hypocrites do in the synagogues and in the streets, so that they may have glory by men. Truly I say to you, they have their reward.
Matt. But when thou do charity, let not thy left hand know what thy right hand does,
Matt. so that thy charity may be in secret. And thy Father who sees in secret will himself reward thee in the open.
Matt. And when thou pray, thou shall not be as the hypocrites, because they love to pray having stood in the synagogues and in the corners of the thoroughfares, so that they may be seen by men. Truly I say to you, they have their reward.
Matt. But thou, when thou pray, enter into thy private room,  having shut thy door, pray to thy Father in secret,  thy Father who sees in secret will reward thee in the open.
Matt. And while praying do not use vain repetitions as the heathen do, for they think that they will be heard by their much speaking.
Matt. Be not therefore like them, for your Father knows what things ye have need of before ye ask him.
Matt. Pray ye therefore this way: Our Father in the heavens, hallowed be thy name.
Matt. May thy kingdom come. May thy will happen on the earth as also in heaven.
Matt. Give us this day the bread sufficient for us.
Matt. And forgive us our debts as we also forgive our debtors.
Matt. And bring us not into temptation,  deliver us from evil, because from thee is the kingdom and the power and the glory into the ages. Truly.
Matt. For if ye forgive men their trespasses, your heavenly Father will also forgive you.
Matt. But if ye forgive not men their trespasses, neither will your Father forgive your trespasses.
Matt. And when ye fast, become not like the gloomy looking hypocrites, for they make their faces unsightly, so that they may appear fasting to men. Truly I say to you, they have their reward.
Matt. But when thou fast, anoint thy head,  wash thy face,
Matt. so that thou may not appear fasting to men,  to thy Father in secret. And thy Father, who sees in secret, will reward thee.
Matt. Lay not up for yourselves treasures upon the earth, where moth and rust deteriorates,  where thieves break through and steal,
Matt. but lay up for yourselves treasures in heaven, where neither moth nor rust deteriorates,  where thieves do not break through nor steal.
Matt. For where your treasure is, there will your heart be also.
Matt. The light of the body is the eye. If therefore thine eye is sound, thy whole body will be bright.
Matt. But if thine eye is bad, thy whole body will be dark. If therefore the light that is in thee is darkness, how great is the darkness!
Matt. No man can serve two masters, for either he will hate the one,  love the other, or he will hold to one,  disparage the other. Ye cannot serve God and mammon.
Matt. Because of this I say to you, be not anxious about your life, what ye may eat, or what ye may drink, nor yet for your body, what ye may wear. Is not the life more than the food,  the body than the clothing?
Matt. Look to the birds of the sky, because they sow not, nor do they reap, nor gather into barns,  your heavenly Father feeds them. Are ye not more valuable then they?
Matt. And which man of you by being anxious can add one cubit to his life span?
Matt. And why are ye anxious about clothing? Consider the lilies of the field, how they grow. They toil not, nor do they spin,
Matt. yet I say to you, that not even Solomon in all his glory was arrayed like one of these.
Matt. And if God so clothes the grass of the field, which today is,  tomorrow is cast into an oven, will he not much more you, O ye of little faith?
Matt. Be not therefore anxious, saying, What may we eat? or, What may we drink? or, What may we wear?
Matt. For the Gentiles seek after all these things, for your heavenly Father knows that ye need all these things.
Matt. But seek ye first the kingdom of God and his righteousness,  all these things will be added to you.
Matt. Be not therefore anxious for the morrow, for the morrow will be anxious about things of itself. Sufficient for the day is the evil of it.
Matt. Do not criticize, that ye may not be criticized.
Matt. For by what criticism ye criticize, ye will be criticized,  by what measure ye measure, it will be measured to you.
Matt. And why do thou see the speck in thy brother's eye,  do not notice the beam in thine own eye?
Matt. Or how will thou say to thy brother, Let me take out the speck from thine eye,  behold, the beam in thine own eye?
Matt. Thou hypocrite, first take out the beam from thine own eye,  then thou will see clearly to take out the speck from thy brother's eye.
Matt. Do not give what is holy to the dogs, nor cast your pearls before the swine, lest they trample them by their feet,  having turn back may lacerate you.
Matt. Ask,  it will be given you. Seek,  ye will find. Knock,  it will be opened to you.
Matt. For every man who asks receives,  he who seeks finds,  to him who knocks it will be opened.
Matt. Or what man is there of you, who, if his son may ask for bread, will give him a stone,
Matt. and if he may ask for a fish, will give him a serpent?
Matt. If ye therefore, being evil, know to give good gifts to your children, how much more your Father in the heavens will give good things to those who ask him?
Matt. All things therefore, as many as ye may want that men should do to you, so also do ye to them, for this is the law and the prophets.
Matt. Enter ye in by the narrow gate, because wide is the gate,  broad is the way, that leads to destruction,  many are they who enter through it.
Matt. How narrow is the gate,  restricted the way, that leads to life,  few are those who find it.
Matt. But beware of false prophets, who come to you in sheep's clothing,  inwardly are predatory wolves.
Matt. From their fruits ye will know them. Do they gather grapes from thorns, or figs from thistles?
Matt. Likewise every good tree produces good fruits,  the corrupt tree produces bad fruits.
Matt. A good tree cannot produce bad fruits, nor a corrupt tree produce good fruits.
Matt. Every tree not producing good fruit is cut down,  thrown into the fire.
Matt. So then from their fruits ye will know them.
Matt. Not every man who says to me, Lord, Lord, will enter into the kingdom of the heavens,  he who does the will of my Father in the heavens.
Matt. Many will say to me in that day, Lord, Lord, did we not prophesy by thy name,  by thy name cast out demons,  by thy name do many mighty works?
Matt. And then I will profess to them, I never acknowledged you. Depart from me, ye who work lawlessness.
Matt. Therefore every man, whoever hears these sayings of mine,  does them, I will compare him to a wise man who built his house upon the rock.
Matt. And the rain descended,  the torrents came,  the winds blew,  beat upon that house,  it fell not, for it had been founded upon the rock.
Matt. And every man who hears these sayings of mine,  does not do them, will be compared to a foolish man who built his house upon the sand.
Matt. And the rain descended,  the torrents came,  the winds blew,  beat upon that house,  it fell. And great was the fall of it.
Matt. And it came to pass, when Jesus finished these sayings, the multitudes were astonished at his teaching,
Matt. for he was teaching them as having authority,  not as their scholars.
Matt. And upon his coming down from the mountain, many multitudes followed him.
Matt. And behold, a leper who came, worshiped him, saying, Lord, if thou will, thou can cleanse me.
Matt. And having reached out his hand, Jesus touched him, saying, I will, be thou cleansed. And straightaway his leprosy was cleansed.
Matt. And Jesus says to him, See thou speak to no man,  go, show thyself to the priest,  bring the gift that Moses commanded for a testimony to them.
Matt. And upon his entering into Capernaum, a centurion came to him, beseeching him,
Matt. and saying, Lord, my boy has been laid down in the house, paralyzed, extremely tormented.
Matt. And Jesus says to him, after coming I will heal him.
Matt. And having answered, the centurion said, Lord, I am not worthy that thou should come under my roof,  only speak the word,  my boy will be healed.
Matt. For I also am a man under authority, having soldiers under myself. And I say to this man, Go,  he goes,  to another, Come,  he comes,  to my bondman, Do this,  he does it.
Matt. And when Jesus heard it, he marveled,  said to those who followed, Truly I say to you, not even in Israel have I found such great faith.
Matt. And I say to you, that many will come from east and west,  will sit down with Abraham,  Isaac,  Jacob, in the kingdom of the heavens,
Matt. but the sons of the kingdom will be cast out into the outer darkness. There will be the weeping and the gnashing of teeth.
Matt. And Jesus said to the centurion, Go thou. And as thou have believed, be it done to thee. And his boy was healed in that hour.
Matt. And when Jesus came into Peter's house, he saw his mother-in-law, having been laid down,  feverish.
Matt. And he touched her hand,  the fever left her. And she was raised up,  served him.
Matt. And having become evening, they brought to him many being demon possessed. And he cast out the spirits by word,  healed all those faring badly,
Matt. so that what was spoken through Isaiah the prophet might be fulfilled, which says, He himself took our infirmities,  bore our diseases.
Matt. Now when Jesus saw many multitudes around him, he commanded to depart to the other side.
Matt. And a certain scholar having come, he said to him, Teacher, I will follow thee wherever thou may go.
Matt. And Jesus says to him, The foxes have holes,  the birds of the sky, nests,  the Son of man has nowhere he may lay his head.
Matt. And another of his disciples said to him, Lord, allow me first to go and bury my father.
Matt. But Jesus said to him, Follow me,  leave the dead to bury their own dead.
Matt. And upon his entering into the boat, his disciples followed him.
Matt. And behold, a great tempest developed in the sea, so as for the boat to be covered by the waves,  he was sleeping.
Matt. And the disciples having approached, they awoke him, saying, Save us, Lord, we are perishing.
Matt. And he says to them, Why are ye cowardly, O ye of little faith? Then after rising, he rebuked the winds and the sea,  there became a great calm.
Matt. But the men marveled, saying, What kind of man is this, that even the winds and the sea obey him?
Matt. And upon his coming to the other side, into the country of the Gergesenes, two men being demon possessed met him, coming out of the sepulchers, exceedingly fierce, so that no man could pass by that way.
Matt. And behold, they cried out, saying, What is with us and thee, Jesus, Son of God? Did thou come here before the time to torment us?
Matt. Now there was afar off from them a herd of many swine feeding.
Matt. And the demons besought him, saying, If thou cast us out, allow us to go away into the herd of swine.
Matt. And he said to them, Go. And having come out, they went into the herd of swine. And behold, the whole herd of the swine stampeded down the slope into the sea,  perished in the waters.
Matt. And those who tended them fled,  having gone into the city, they told everything, also the things of the men being demon possessed.
Matt. And behold, the whole city came out to a meeting with Jesus. And having seen him, they besought him that he would depart from their regions.
Matt. And after entering into the boat, he passed over,  came into his own city.
Matt. And behold, they brought to him a paralyzed man who was placed on a bed. And having seen their faith Jesus said to the paralyzed man, Cheer up, child, thy sins have been forgiven thee.
Matt. And behold, some of the scholars said within themselves, This man blasphemes.
Matt. And having known their thoughts Jesus said, Why think ye evil in your hearts?
Matt. For which is easier, to say, Thy sins have been forgiven thee, or to say, Arise and walk?
Matt. But that ye may know that the Son of man has authority on earth to forgive sins (then he says to the paralyzed man), After rising, take up thy bed,  go to thy house.
Matt. And after rising, he departed to his house.
Matt. But when the multitudes saw it, they marveled,  glorified God, who gave such authority to men.
Matt. And passing forth from there, Jesus saw a man named Matthew sitting at the tax office. And he says to him, Follow me. And after rising, he followed him.
Matt. And it came to pass while he relaxed in the house,  behold, many tax collectors and sinners having come, they were sitting with Jesus and his disciples.
Matt. And when the Pharisees saw it, they said to his disciples, Why does your teacher eat with the tax collectors and sinners?
Matt. But Jesus having heard it, he said to them, Those who are strong have no need of a physician,  those who fare badly.
Matt. But after going, learn what this means, I desire mercy,  not sacrifice, for I came not to call the righteous,  sinners for repentance.
Matt. Then the disciples of John come to him, saying, Why do we and the Pharisees fast much,  thy disciples fast not?
Matt. And Jesus said to them, The sons of the wedding hall cannot mourn as long as the bridegroom is with them. But the days will come when the bridegroom will be taken away from them,  then they will fast.
Matt. And no man puts a patch of new cloth upon an old garment, for the patch of it pulls from the garment,  a tear becomes worse.
Matt. Neither do they put new wine into old wineskins. Otherwise the wineskins burst,  the wine is spilled,  the wineskins will perish. But they put new wine into fresh wineskins,  both are preserved.
Matt. While he spoke these things to them, behold, one ruler who came worshiped him, saying, My daughter has just now perished,  after coming, lay thy hand upon her,  she will live.
Matt. And having risen, Jesus followed him, also his disciples.
Matt. And behold, a woman having an issue of blood twelve years, after coming from behind, touched the edge of his garment.
Matt. For she said within herself, If only I may touch his garment, I will be healed.
Matt. But having turned around and seen her, Jesus said, Cheer up, daughter, thy faith has healed thee. And the woman was healed from that hour.
Matt. And Jesus having come into the ruler's house,  having seen the minstrels,  the crowd making a commotion,
Matt. he says to them, Depart, for the little girl did not die,  sleeps. And they ridiculed him.
Matt. But when the crowd was put out, having entered in, he took her hand,  the little girl arose.
Matt. And this report went forth into all that land.
Matt. And when Jesus departed from there, two blind men followed him, crying out,  saying, Be merciful to us, thou son of David.
Matt. And when he came into the house, the blind men came to him. And Jesus says to them, Believe ye that I am able to do this? They say to him, Yes, Lord.
Matt. Then he touched their eyes, saying, According to your faith may it happen to you.
Matt. And their eyes were opened. And Jesus strictly warned them, saying, See that no man knows it.
Matt. But having departed, they widely proclaimed him in all that land.
Matt. And after they departed, behold, they brought to him a mute man possessed with a demon.
Matt. And when the demon was cast out, the mute man spoke. And the multitudes marveled, saying, It was never so seen in Israel.
Matt. But the Pharisees said, By the ruler of the demons he casts out demons.
Matt. And Jesus went about all the cities and the villages, teaching in their synagogues,  preaching the good news of the kingdom,  healing every sickness and every disease among the people.
Matt. But when he saw the multitudes, he felt compassion for them, because they were troubled and dejected, as sheep having no shepherd.
Matt. Then he says to his disciples, The harvest truly is plentiful,  the workmen are few.
Matt. Pray ye therefore the Lord of the harvest, that he will send forth workmen into his harvest.
Matt. And having called in his twelve disciples, he gave them authority over unclean spirits, so as to cast them out,  to heal every sickness and every disease.
Matt. Now the names of the twelve apostles are these: First, Simon, who is called Peter,  Andrew his brother, James the son of Zebedee,  John his brother,
Matt. Philip,  Bartholomew, Thomas,  Matthew the tax collector, James the son of Alphaeus,  Lebbaeus who was surnamed Thaddaeus,
Matt. Simon the Canaanite,  Judas Iscariot, who also betrayed him.
Matt. These twelve Jesus sent forth, having ordered them, saying, Go not into a way of the Gentiles,  enter not into a city of the Samaritans,
Matt. but go rather to the lost sheep of the house of Israel.
Matt. And while going, preach, saying, The kingdom of the heavens has come near.
Matt. Heal those who are feeble, cleanse the lepers, cast out demons. Freely ye received, freely give.
Matt. Acquire no gold, nor silver, nor copper in your belts,
Matt. no bag for the road, nor two coats, nor shoes, nor staffs, for the workman is worthy of his provision.
Matt. And into whatever city or village ye may enter, inquire who in it is worthy,  there abide until ye go forth.
Matt. And while entering into the house, salute it.
Matt. And if indeed the house is worthy, let your peace come upon it,  if it is not worthy, let your peace return to you.
Matt. And whoever will not receive you, nor hear your words, while departing that house or that city, shake off the dust of your feet.
Matt. Truly I say to you, it will be more tolerable for the land of Sodom and Gomorrah in the day of judgment, than for that city.
Matt. Behold, I send you forth as sheep in the midst of wolves. Become ye therefore wise as serpents,  innocent as doves.
Matt. But beware of men, for they will deliver you up to councils,  they will scourge you in their synagogues,
Matt. and ye will be brought to governors and even kings because of me, for a witness to them and to the Gentiles.
Matt. But when they deliver you up, be not anxious how or what ye should speak, for it will be given you in that hour what ye will speak.
Matt. For ye are not who speak,  the Spirit of your Father speaking in you.
Matt. And a brother will deliver up a brother to death,  a father a child. And children will rise up against parents,  condemn them to death.
Matt. And ye will be hated by all men because of my name,  he who endures to the end, this man will be saved.
Matt. But when they persecute you in this city, flee into the other, for truly I say to you, ye will, no, not have completed the cities of Israel, until the Son of man comes.
Matt. A pupil is not above his teacher, nor a bondman above his lord.
Matt. It is enough for the pupil that he becomes like his teacher,  the bondman like his lord. If they have called the house-ruler Beelzebub, how much more those of his household.
Matt. Fear them not therefore, for there is nothing covered, that will not be revealed,  hid, that will not be known.
Matt. What I tell you in the darkness, speak ye in the light,  what ye hear in the ear, proclaim upon the housetops.
Matt. And be not afraid of those who kill the body,  are not able to kill the soul. But rather fear him who is able to destroy both soul and body in hell.
Matt. Are not two sparrows sold for a penny? And not one of them will fall on the ground independent of your Father.
Matt. But even the hairs of your head are all numbered.
Matt. Fear not therefore, ye are of worth more than many sparrows.
Matt. Therefore every man, whoever will profess in me before men, I also will profess in him before my Father in the heavens.
Matt. But whoever would deny me before men, I also will deny him before my Father in the heavens.
Matt. Think not that I came to spread peace on the earth. I came not to spread peace,  a sword.
Matt. For I came to divide a man against his father,  a daughter against her mother,  a daughter-in-law against her mother-in-law.
Matt. And a man's foes, are those of his own household.
Matt. He who loves father or mother above me is not worthy of me,  he who loves son or daughter above me is not worthy of me.
Matt. And he who does not take his cross and follow behind me, is not worthy of me.
Matt. He who finds his life will lose it,  he who loses his life because of me will find it.
Matt. He who receives you receives me,  he who receives me receives him who sent me.
Matt. He who receives a prophet in the name of a prophet will receive a prophet's reward,  he who receives a righteous man in the name of a righteous man will receive a righteous man's reward.
Matt. And whoever may give to drink one of these little ones merely a cold cup in the name of a disciple, truly I say to you he will, no, not lose his reward.
Matt. And it came to pass when Jesus finished directing his twelve disciples, he departed from there to teach and preach in their cities.
Matt. Now when John heard in the prison the works of the Christ, having sent two of his disciples,
Matt. he said to him, Are thou he who comes, or do we look for another man?
Matt. And having answered, Jesus said to them, After going, report to John the things that ye hear and see:
Matt. the blind receive their sight,  the lame walk, the lepers are cleansed,  the deaf hear,  the dead are raised up,  the poor are proclaimed good news.
Matt. And blessed is he, whoever will not be caused to stumble by me.
Matt. And while those men departed, Jesus began to say to the multitudes about John, What did ye go out into the wilderness to see? A reed shaken with the wind?
Matt. But what did ye go out to see? A man clothed in delicate clothes? Behold, those wearing delicate things are in king's houses.
Matt. But what did ye go out to see? A prophet? Yea, I say to you,  more than a prophet.
Matt. For this is he about whom it is written, Behold, I send my agent before thy face who will prepare thy way before thee.
Matt. Truly I say to you, among men born of women there has not been raised a greater than John the immerser. Yet the smaller in the kingdom of the heavens is greater than he.
Matt. And from the days of John the immerser until now the kingdom of the heavens is treated aggressively,  aggressors seize it.
Matt. For all the prophets and the law prophesied until John.
Matt. And if ye are willing to receive it, he is Elijah who is going to come.
Matt. He who has ears to hear, let him hear.
Matt. But to what shall I compare this generation? It is like children sitting in the marketplaces, calling to their companions,
Matt. and saying, We piped to you,  ye did not dance, we mourned to you,  ye did not beat the breast.
Matt. For John came neither eating nor drinking,  they say, He has a demon.
Matt. The Son of man came eating and drinking,  they say, Behold the man, a glutton and a drunkard, a friend of tax collectors and sinners! And wisdom is justified from her children.
Matt. Then he began to upbraid the cities in which most of his mighty works occurred, because they did not repent.
Matt. Woe to thee, Chorazin! Woe to thee, Bethsaida! Because if the mighty works that occurred in you occurred in Tyre and Sidon, they would have repented long ago in sackcloth and ashes.
Matt. Nevertheless I say to you, it will be more tolerable for Tyre and Sidon in the day of judgment than for you.
Matt. And thou, Capernaum, which was exalted as far as the sky. Thou will be brought down as far as Hades, because if the mighty works had occurred in Sodom that occurred in thee, it would have remained until this day.
Matt. Nevertheless I say to you that it will be more tolerable for the land of Sodom in the day of judgment, than for thee.
Matt. Jesus having responded at that time, said, I extol thee, O Father, Lord of the heaven and the earth, because thou hid these things from the wise and intelligent,  revealed them to the childlike.
Matt. Yea, Father, because this way it was done pleasing in thy sight.
Matt. All things were delivered to me by my Father. And no man knows the Son, except the Father, nor does any man know the Father, except the Son,  he to whomever the Son wants to reveal him.
Matt. Come to me, all ye who labor and have been burdened,  I will give you rest.
Matt. Take my yoke upon you,  learn from me, because I am meek and lowly in heart,  ye will find rest for your souls.
Matt. For my yoke is befitting,  my burden is light.
Matt. At that time Jesus went through the grain fields on the sabbath,  his disciples were hungry and began to pluck ears,  to eat.
Matt. But the Pharisees, when they saw it, said to him, Behold, thy disciples do what is not permitted to do upon the sabbath.
Matt. But he said to them, Have ye not read what David did when he was hungry, he and those with him,
Matt. how he entered into the house of God,  ate the loaves of the presentation, which was not permitted for him to eat, nor for those with him, except only for the priests?
Matt. Or have ye not read in the law, that on the sabbath the priests in the temple profane the sabbath,  are guiltless?
Matt. But I say to you, that a greater than the temple is here.
Matt. But if ye had known what this means, I desire mercy,  not sacrifice, ye would not have condemned the innocent.
Matt. For the Son of man is Lord of the sabbath.
Matt. And having departed from there, he went into their synagogue.
Matt. And behold, there was a man having a withered hand. And they interrogated him, asking if it is permitted to heal on the sabbath, so that they might accuse him.
Matt. And he said to them, What man of you will there be, who will have one sheep,  if this falls into a pit on the sabbath, will he not grasp it,  lift it out?
Matt. How much therefore a man is superior to a sheep. So then it is permitted to do good on the sabbath.
Matt. Then he says to the man, Stretch forth thy hand. And he stretched it forth,  it was restored whole, as the other.
Matt. But when they went out, the Pharisees held a consultation against him, how they might destroy him.
Matt. And having known it Jesus withdrew from there,  many multitudes followed him,  he healed them all.
Matt. And he chided them so that they would not make him known,
Matt. so that what was spoken through Isaiah the prophet might be fulfilled, which says,
Matt. Behold, my Boy whom I chose, my beloved in whom my soul is well pleased. I will put my Spirit upon him,  he will declare justice to the Gentiles.
Matt. He will not quarrel, nor will he shout, nor will any man hear his voice in the thoroughfares.
Matt. A bruised reed he will not break,  smoldering flax he will not quench, until he sends forth justice for victory.
Matt. And in his name Gentiles will hope.
Matt. Then a blind and mute man being demon possessed, was brought to him. And he healed him, so as for the blind and mute man both to speak and to see.
Matt. And all the multitudes were amazed,  said, Is this not the son of David?
Matt. But when the Pharisees heard it, they said, This man does not cast out demons, except by Beelzebub the ruler of the demons.
Matt. And having known their thoughts Jesus said to them, Every kingdom divided against itself is brought to ruin,  every city or house divided against itself will not stand.
Matt. And if Satan casts out Satan, he is divided against himself. How then will his kingdom stand?
Matt. And if I cast out demons by Beelzebub, by whom do your sons cast them out? Because of this they will be your judges.
Matt. But if I cast out demons by the Spirit of God, then the kingdom of God has come near you.
Matt. Or how can any man enter into the house of the strong man,  plunder his goods, unless he first binds the strong man? And then he will plunder his house.
Matt. He who is not with me is against me,  he who does not gather with me scatters.
Matt. Because of this I say to you, every sin and blasphemy will be forgiven to men,  the blasphemy of the Spirit will not be forgiven men.
Matt. And whoever speaks a word against the Son of man, it will be forgiven him,  whoever speaks against the Holy Spirit, it will not be forgiven him, neither in the present age, nor in the one that is coming.
Matt. Either make the tree good,  its fruit good, or make the tree corrupt,  its fruit corrupt, for the tree is known by its fruit.
Matt. Ye offspring of vipers, how can ye, being evil, speak good things? For out of the abundance of the heart the mouth speaks.
Matt. The good man out of his good treasure brings forth good things,  the evil man out of his evil treasure brings forth evil things.
Matt. But I say to you, that every idle word, whatever men may speak, they will render account about it in the day of judgment.
Matt. For from thy words thou will be justified,  from thy words thou will be condemned.
Matt. Then some of the scholars and Pharisees answered, saying, Teacher, we want to see a sign from thee.
Matt. But having answered, he said to them, An evil and adulterous generation seeks after a sign,  no sign will be given to it except the sign of Jonah the prophet.
Matt. For as Jonah was in the belly of the sea-creature three days and three nights, so the Son of man will be in the heart of the earth three days and three nights.
Matt. The men of Nineveh will rise up in the judgment with this generation,  will condemn it, because they repented at the preaching of Jonah,  behold, a greater than Jonah is here.
Matt. The queen of the south will rise up in the judgment with this generation,  will condemn it, because she came from the ends of the earth to hear the wisdom of Solomon,  behold, a greater than Solomon is here.
Matt. But when the unclean spirit goes forth out of the man, it passes through waterless places, seeking rest,  finds it not.
Matt. Then it says, I will return into my house from where I came out. And when it comes, it finds it empty, swept,  put in order.
Matt. Then it goes,  takes with itself seven other spirits more evil than itself,  having enter in, they dwell there. And the last state of that man becomes worse than the first. So it will also be to this evil generation.
Matt. While he was still speaking to the multitudes, behold, his mother and his brothers had stood outside, seeking to speak to him.
Matt. And some man said to him, Behold, thy mother and thy brothers stand outside, seeking to speak to thee.
Matt. But having answered, he said to the man who told him, Who is my mother,  who are my brothers?
Matt. And having stretched forth his hand towards his disciples, he said, Behold, my mother and my brothers.
Matt. For whoever does the will of my Father in the heavens, he is my brother,  sister,  mother.
Matt. And on that day, having departed from the house, Jesus was sitting beside the sea.
Matt. And many multitudes were gathered to him, so as for him (having entered in) to sit in the boat,  all the multitude had stood on the shore.
Matt. And he spoke many things to them in parables, saying, Behold, the man who sows went forth to sow.
Matt. And as he sowed, some fell by the wayside,  the birds came and devoured them.
Matt. But others fell upon the rocky places, where they had not much soil,  straightaway they sprang up because they had no depth of soil.
Matt. But when the sun was risen, they were scorched,  because they had no root they withered.
Matt. And others fell in the thorns,  the thorns grew up and choked them.
Matt. But others fell upon the good ground,  yielded fruit, some a hundredfold, some sixty, some thirty.
Matt. He who has ears, let him hear.
Matt. And the disciples having come, they said to him, Why do thou speak to them in parables?
Matt. And having answered, he said to them, Because it has been given to you to know the mysteries of the kingdom of the heavens,  to those men it has not been given.
Matt. For whoever has, to him will be given,  he will have abundance,  whoever has not, even what he has will be taken away from him.
Matt. Because of this I speak to them in parables, because seeing they see not,  hearing they hear not, nor do they understand.
Matt. And in them is fulfilled the prophecy of Isaiah, which says, By hearing ye will hear,  will, no, not understand,  seeing ye will see,  will, no, not perceive.
Matt. For this people's heart became fat,  their ears hear heavily,  their eyes are shut, lest they should see with their eyes,  hear with their ears,  understand with their heart,  should turn,  I will heal them.
Matt. But blessed are your eyes, because they see,  your ears, because they hear.
Matt. For truly I say to you, that many prophets and righteous men longed to see the things that ye see,  did not see them,  to hear the things that ye hear,  did not hear them.
Matt. Hear ye then the parable of the man who sows.
Matt. Of every man who hears the word of the kingdom,  does not understand it, evil comes,  snatches away what was sown in his heart. This is that which was sown by the wayside.
Matt. And that which was sown upon the rocky places, this is he who hears the word,  straightaway receiving it with joy,
Matt. yet he has no root in himself, instead it is temporary. And when tribulation or persecution develops because of the word, straightaway he is caused to stumble.
Matt. And that which was sown in the thorns, this is he who hears the word,  the care of this age,  the deceitfulness of wealth, choke the word,  he becomes unfruitful.
Matt. But that which was sown upon the good ground, this is he who hears the word,  understands it, who indeed bears fruit,  is productive, some a hundredfold, some sixty, some thirty.
Matt. He set forth another parable to them, saying, The kingdom of the heavens is compared to a man sowing good seed in his field.
Matt. But while the men slept, his enemy came and sowed tares in the midst of the wheat,  went away.
Matt. And when the blade sprouted and produced fruit, then the tares also appeared.
Matt. But the bondmen of the house-ruler having come, they said to him, Sir, did thou not sow good seed in thy field? From where then does it have tares?
Matt. And he said to them, A hostile man did this. And the bondmen said to him, Do thou desire therefore, after going, we would gather them up?
Matt. But he said, No, lest while gathering up the tares, ye uproot the wheat together with them.
Matt. Allow both to grow together until the harvest. And at the time of the harvest I will say to the reapers, Gather up first the tares,  bind them in bundles in order to burn them,  gather the wheat into my barn.
Matt. He set forth another parable to them, saying, The kingdom of the heavens is like a grain of mustard plant, which having taken, a man sowed in his field.
Matt. Which indeed is smaller than all seeds,  when it is grown, it is greater than the plants,  becomes a tree, so as for the birds of the sky to come and lodge in the branches of it.
Matt. He spoke another parable to them. The kingdom of the heavens is like leaven, which having taken, a woman hid in three measures of meal until it was all leavened.
Matt. Jesus spoke all these things in parables to the multitudes,  he did not speak to them independent of a parable,
Matt. so that what was spoken through the prophet might be fulfilled, which says, I will open my mouth in parables. I will utter things concealed from the foundation of the world.
Matt. Then having sent the multitudes away, Jesus came into the house. And his disciples came to him, saying, Explain to us the parable of the tares of the field.
Matt. And having answered, he said to them, He who sows the good seed is the Son of man,
Matt. and the field is the world,  the good seed, these are the sons of the kingdom,  the tares are the sons of evil.
Matt. And the enemy who sowed them is the devil,  the harvest is the end of the age,  the reapers are agents.
Matt. As therefore the tares are gathered up and burned in fire, so it will be at the end of this age.
Matt. The Son of man will send forth his agents,  they will gather out of his kingdom all the stumbling-blocks,  those doing lawlessness,
Matt. and will cast them into the furnace of fire. There will be the weeping and the gnashing of teeth.
Matt. Then the righteous will shine forth as the sun in the kingdom of their Father. He who has ears to hear, let him hear.
Matt. Again the kingdom of the heavens is like a treasure hidden in the field, which a man having found, he hid. And from the joy of it, he goes and sells all, as many things as he has,  buys that field.
Matt. Again, the kingdom of the heavens is like a man, a merchant, seeking fine pearls.
Matt. Who, having found one very valuable pearl, after departing, sold all, as many things as he had,  bought it.
Matt. Again, the kingdom of the heavens is like a net that was cast into the sea,  gathered from every kind,
Matt. which, when it was full, after dragging to the shore, having sat down, they gathered the good into vessels,  they cast out the useless.
Matt. So it will be at the end of the age. The agents will come forth,  separate the bad from among the righteous,
Matt. and will cast them into the furnace of fire. There will be the weeping and the gnashing of teeth.
Matt. Jesus says to them, Have ye understood all these things? They say to him, Yes, Lord.
Matt. And he said to them, Because of this every scholar who has been instructed in the kingdom of the heavens is like a man, a house-ruler, who brings forth out of his treasure things new and old.
Matt. And it came to pass, when Jesus finished these parables, he departed from there.
Matt. And having come into his fatherland he taught them in their synagogue, so as for them to be astonished,  say, From where is this wisdom and powers in this man?
Matt. Is not this the carpenter's son? Is not his mother called Mary,  his brothers, James and Joses and Simon and Judas?
Matt. And his sisters, are they not all near us? From where then are all these things in this man?
Matt. And they were offended by him. But Jesus said to them, A prophet is not without honor, except in his fatherland,  in his house.
Matt. And he did not many mighty works there because of their unbelief.
Matt. At that time Herod the tetrarch heard the report of Jesus,
Matt. and he said to his boys, This is John the immerser. He has risen from the dead,  because of this the powers work in him.
Matt. For Herod having arrested John, bound him and put him in prison because of Herodias, his brother Philip's wife.
Matt. For John said to him, It is not permitted for thee to have her.
Matt. And though he wanted to kill him, he feared the multitude because they held him as a prophet.
Matt. But Herod's birthday being brought, the daughter of Herodias danced in the midst,  pleased Herod.
Matt. Whereupon he promised with an oath to give her whatever she would ask.
Matt. And she, having been put forward by her mother, says, Give me here on a platter the head of John the immerser.
Matt. And he became sad,  because of the oaths,  of those dining together, the king commanded it to be given.
Matt. And having sent, he beheaded John in the prison.
Matt. And his head was brought on a platter,  given to the maiden,  she brought it to her mother.
Matt. And after coming, his disciples took up the body and buried it,  having gone, they informed Jesus.
Matt. Now when Jesus heard it, he departed from there in a boat into a desolate place in private. And when the multitudes heard of it, they followed him on foot from the cities.
Matt. And having come forth, Jesus saw a great multitude,  he felt compassion toward them,  healed the feeble of them.
Matt. And having become evening, his disciples came to him, saying, The place is desolate,  the hour is now past. Send the multitudes away, so that having gone into the villages, they may buy food for themselves.
Matt. But Jesus said to them, They have no need to depart. Give ye them to eat.
Matt. And they say to him, We have not here, except five loaves and two fishes.
Matt. But he said, Bring them here to me.
Matt. And after commanding the multitudes to sit down on the grass, having taken the five loaves,  the two fishes, having looking up to heaven, he blessed. And having broken them in pieces, he gave the loaves to the disciples,  the disciples to the multitudes.
Matt. And they all ate,  were filled. And they took up that which remained of the fragments, twelve baskets full.
Matt. And those who ate were about five thousand men, besides women and children.
Matt. And straightaway Jesus compelled the disciples to enter into the boat,  to go ahead of him to the other side, until he would dismiss the multitudes.
Matt. And having dismissed the multitudes, he went up onto the mountain in private to pray. And having become evening, he was there alone.
Matt. But the boat was now in the midst of the sea, being buffeted by the waves, for the wind was contrary.
Matt. And in the fourth watch of the night Jesus went to them, walking upon the sea.
Matt. And when the disciples saw him walking on the sea, they were troubled, saying, It is a ghost,  they cried out from fear.
Matt. But straightaway Jesus spoke to them, saying, Cheer up. It is I, fear not.
Matt. And having answered him, Peter said, Lord, if it be thou, bid me come to thee on the waters.
Matt. And he said, Come. And having come down from the boat, Peter walked upon the water to go to Jesus.
Matt. But seeing the boisterous wind, he was afraid,  having begun to sink, he cried out, saying, Lord, save me.
Matt. And straightaway having stretched forth his hand, Jesus took hold of him,  says to him, O thou of little faith, why did thou doubt?
Matt. And when they entered into the boat, the wind ceased.
Matt. And those who came in the boat worshiped him, saying, Thou really are the Son of God.
Matt. And when they crossed over, they came to the land of Gennesaret.
Matt. And when they recognized him, the men of that place sent into that whole region round about,  brought to him all those faring badly.
Matt. And they besought him that they might only touch the hem of his garment. And as many as touched were healed.
Matt. Then scholars and Pharisees from Jerusalem come to Jesus, saying,
Matt. Why do thy disciples transgress the tradition of the elders? For they do not wash their hands when they eat bread.
Matt. And having answered, he said to them, Why do ye also transgress the commandment of God, because of your tradition?
Matt. For God commanded, saying, Honor thy father and thy mother, , He who speaks evil of father or mother, let him perish in death.
Matt. But ye say, Whoever may say to the father or the mother, Whatever thou might have benefited from me is an offering.
Matt. And he will, no, not honor his father or mother. And ye have annulled the command of God because of your tradition.
Matt. Ye hypocrites, well did Isaiah prophesy about you, saying,
Matt. This people comes near me with their mouth,  honors me with their lips,  their heart is far distant from me.
Matt. And in vain they worship me, teaching as doctrines the commandments of men.
Matt. And having called in the multitude, he said to them, Hear and understand.
Matt. Not that which enters into the mouth defiles the man,  that which comes out of the mouth, this defiles the man.
Matt. Then having come near, his disciples said to him, Know thou that the Pharisees were offended when they heard the saying?
Matt. But having answered, he said, Every plant that my heavenly Father did not plant, will be uprooted.
Matt. Leave them. They are blind leaders of blind men,  if a blind man leads a blind man, both will fall into a ditch.
Matt. And having answered, Peter said to him, Explain this parable to us.
Matt. And Jesus said, Are ye also still without understanding?
Matt. Do ye not yet understand, that everything entering into the mouth goes into the belly,  is cast out into a toilet?
Matt. But the things coming out of the mouth come forth from the heart,  those things defile the man.
Matt. For from the heart comes forth evil thoughts, murders, adulteries, fornications, thefts, false witnessings, revilings.
Matt. These are things defiling the man. But to eat with unwashed hands does not defile the man.
Matt. And having gone out from there, Jesus departed into the regions of Tyre and Sidon.
Matt. And behold, a Canaanite woman having come out from those regions, cried out to him, saying, Be merciful to me, O Lord, thou son of David, my daughter is grievously demon-possessed.
Matt. But he answered her not a word. And his disciples having approached, they besought him, saying, Send her away, because she cries out behind us.
Matt. But having answered, he said, I was not sent except to the lost sheep of the house of Israel.
Matt. But having come, she worshiped him, saying, Lord, help me.
Matt. And having answered, he said, It is not right to take the children's bread and cast it to the house dogs.
Matt. But she said, Yes, Lord, for even the house dogs eat of the crumbs that fall from the table of their masters.
Matt. Then Jesus having answered, said to her, O woman, great is thy faith. Be it done for thee as thou desire. And her daughter was healed from that hour.
Matt. And having departed from there, Jesus came near the sea of Galilee. And having gone up onto the mountain, he sat there.
Matt. And many multitudes came to him, having with them the lame, blind, mute, crippled,  many others. And they placed them beside Jesus' feet,  he healed them,
Matt. so as for the multitudes to marvel seeing the mute speaking, the maimed healthy,  the lame walking,  the blind seeing. And they glorified the God of Israel.
Matt. And Jesus having summoned his disciples, he said, I feel compassion toward the multitude because they continue with me now three days and do not have what they might eat. And I do not want to dismiss them without food, lest they might faint on the way.
Matt. And his disciples say to him, From where are so many loaves for us in a wilderness so as to feed so great a multitude?
Matt. And Jesus says to them, How many loaves have ye? And they said, Seven,  a few small fishes.
Matt. And he commanded the multitudes to sit down on the ground.
Matt. And after taking the seven loaves and the fishes, having expressed thanks, he broke in pieces,  gave to the disciples,  the disciples to the multitudes.
Matt. And they all ate and were filled. And they took up seven hampers full of the fragments that remained.
Matt. And those who ate were four thousand men, besides women and children.
Matt. And having dismissed the multitudes, he entered into the boat,  came into the regions of Magdala.
Matt. And the Pharisees and Sadducees who came, testing, demanded him to exhibit to them a sign from the sky.
Matt. But having answered, he said to them, When it becomes evening, ye say, Fair weather, for the sky is red.
Matt. And at morning, Bad weather today, for the sky is red, being gloomy. Hypocrites! Ye indeed know how to discern the face of the sky,  the signs of the times ye are not able.
Matt. An evil and adulterous generation seeks after a sign,  no sign will be given to it, except the sign of Jonah the prophet. And having left them behind, he departed.
Matt. And his disciples having come to the other side, they forgot to take loaves.
Matt. And Jesus said to them, Watch and beware of the leaven of the Pharisees and Sadducees.
Matt. And they deliberated among themselves, saying, We took no loaves.
Matt. And having known it, Jesus said to them, O ye of little faith, why do ye deliberate among yourselves because ye brought no loaves?
Matt. Do ye not yet understand, nor remember the five loaves of the five thousand,  how many baskets ye took up,
Matt. nor the seven loaves of the four thousand,  how many hampers ye took up?
Matt. How do ye not understand that I spoke to you not about bread, to beware of the leaven of the Pharisees and Sadducees?
Matt. Then they understood that he said not to beware of the leaven of bread,  of the teaching of the Pharisees and Sadducees.
Matt. Now when Jesus came into the regions of Caesarea Philippi, he asked his disciples, saying, Who do men say I, the Son of man, am?
Matt. And they said, Some, John the immerser, others, Elijah,  others, Jeremiah, or one of the prophets.
Matt. He says to them, But who say ye, I am?
Matt. And Simon Peter having answered, said, Thou are the Christ, the Son of the living God.
Matt. And having answered, Jesus said to him, Blessed are thou, Simon Bar-jonah, because flesh and blood has not revealed it to thee,  my Father in the heavens.
Matt. And I also say to thee, that thou are Peter,  upon this rock I will build my church,  the gates of Hades will not prevail against it.
Matt. And I will give to thee the keys of the kingdom of the heavens,  whatever thou may bind on earth will be what is bound in the heavens,  whatever thou may loose on the earth will be what is loosed in the heavens.
Matt. Then he commanded his disciples that they should tell no man that he is Jesus, the Christ.
Matt. From that time Jesus began to show his disciples that he must go to Jerusalem,  suffer many things from the elders,  chief priests,  scholars,  be killed,  the third day be raised up.
Matt. And having taken him aside, Peter began to rebuke him, saying, Be merciful to thee, Lord. This will, no, not be to thee.
Matt. But having turned around, he said to Peter, Go thee behind me, Satan. Thou are my stumbling-block, because thou regard not the things of God,  the things of men.
Matt. Then Jesus said to his disciples, If any man wants to come behind me, let him deny himself,  take up his cross,  follow me.
Matt. For whoever wants save his life will lose it,  whoever will lose his life for my sake will find it.
Matt. For what does it profit a man, if he should gain the whole world,  lose his soul? Or what will a man give in exchange for his soul?
Matt. For the Son of man is going to come in the glory of his Father with his agents,  then he will reward each man according to his actions.
Matt. Truly I say to you, there are some of those who stand here, who will, no, not taste of death, until they see the Son of man coming in his kingdom.
Matt. And after six days Jesus takes Peter,  James,  John his brother,  brings them up onto a high mountain in private.
Matt. And he was transfigured before them,  his face shone as the sun,  his garments became white as the light.
Matt. And behold, Moses and Elijah appeared to them, talking with him.
Matt. And having responded, Peter said to Jesus, Lord, it is good for us to be here. If thou desire, we could make here three tabernacles, one for thee,  one for Moses,  one for Elijah.
Matt. While he was still speaking, behold, a bright cloud overshadowed them. And lo, a voice out of the cloud, saying, This is my beloved Son in whom I am well pleased. Hear ye him.
Matt. And when the disciples heard it, they fell on their face,  were exceedingly afraid.
Matt. And having come, Jesus touched them and said, Arise,  fear not.
Matt. And having lifted up their eyes, they saw no man, except Jesus only.
Matt. And while they were coming down from the mountain, Jesus commanded them, saying, Tell the vision to no man, until the Son of man will rise from the dead.
Matt. And his disciples questioned him, saying, Why then do the scholars say that Elijah must first come?
Matt. And having answered, Jesus said to them, Elijah indeed comes first,  will restore all.
Matt. But I say to you, that Elijah already came,  they knew him not,  did to him how many things they wanted. Likewise also the Son of man is going to suffer by them.
Matt. Then the disciples understood that he spoke to them about John the immerser.
Matt. And when they came to the multitude, a man came to him, kneeling to him,  saying,
Matt. Lord, be merciful to my son, because he is lunatic,  suffers badly. For he often falls into the fire,  often into the water.
Matt. And I brought him to thy disciples,  they could not heal him.
Matt. And having answered, Jesus said, O faithless and perverted generation, how long will I be with you? How long will I endure you? Bring him here to me.
Matt. And Jesus rebuked it,  the demon departed from him. And the boy was cured from that hour.
Matt. Then the disciples having come to Jesus in private, said, Why could we not cast it out?
Matt. And Jesus said to them, Because of your unbelief. For truly I say to you, if ye have faith as a grain of a mustard plant, ye will say to this mountain, Remove from here to there,  it will depart,  nothing will be impossible to you.
Matt. But this kind does not go out except by prayer and fasting.
Matt. And while they turned back in Galilee, Jesus said to them, The Son of man is going to be delivered into the hands of men,
Matt. and they will kill him,  the third day he will be raised up. And they were exceedingly sorry.
Matt. And when they came to Capernaum, those who receive the double-drachma came to Peter,  said, Does not your teacher pay the double-drachma?
Matt. He says, Yes. And when he entered into the house, Jesus anticipated him, saying, What think thou, Simon? The kings of the earth, from whom do they take taxes or tribute, from their sons or from strangers?
Matt. And Peter says to him, From strangers. Jesus said to him, Therefore the sons are free.
Matt. But, so that we might not offend them, after going to the sea, cast a hook. And take up the first fish coming up,  having opened its mouth, thou will find a four-drachma coin. After taking that, give thou to them for me and thee.
Matt. In that hour the disciples came to Jesus, saying, Who then is greater in the kingdom of the heavens?
Matt. And having called in a child, Jesus set it in the midst of them.
Matt. And he said, Truly I say to you, if ye are not turned,  become as children, ye will, no, not enter into the kingdom of the heavens.
Matt. He therefore who will make himself lowly as this child, this man is the greater in the kingdom of the heavens.
Matt. And whoever will receive one such child in my name receives me.
Matt. But whoever may cause one of these little ones who believe in me to stumble, it is advantageous for him that a donkey-powered millstone were hanged on his neck,  he were drowned in the depth of the sea.
Matt. Woe to the world because of stumbling-blocks. For it is necessary that the stumbling-blocks come, yet woe to that man through whom the stumbling-block comes.
Matt. And if thy hand or thy foot causes thee to stumble, cut them off and cast from thee. It is good for thee to enter into life crippled or maimed, than having two hands or two feet to be cast into the eternal fire.
Matt. And if thine eye causes thee to stumble, remove it and cast it from thee. It is good for thee to enter into life one-eyed, than having two eyes to be cast into the hell of fire.
Matt. See that ye not disparage one of these little ones, for I say to you, that in the heavens their agents do always behold the face of my Father in the heavens.
Matt. For the Son of man came to save that which was lost.
Matt. What does it seem to you? If it happens a hundred sheep are with some man,  one of them went astray, after going (having left the ninety-nine on the mountains), does he not seek the one going astray?
Matt. And if he happens to find it, truly I say to you, that he rejoices over it more than over the ninety-nine that have not gone astray.
Matt. So, it is not a purpose before your Father in the heavens, that one of these little ones should perish.
Matt. But if thy brother should sin against thee, go and reprove him between thee and him alone. If he should hear thee, thou have gained thy brother.
Matt. But if he should not hear, take with thee one or two besides, so that at the mouth of two or three witnesses every word may be established.
Matt. And if he is heedless of them, speak to the church. But if he is also heedless of the church, let him be to thee as the heathen and the tax collector.
Matt. Truly I say to you, however many things ye may bind on the earth will be things that are bound in heaven,  however many things ye may loose on the earth will be things that that are loosed in heaven.
Matt. Again I say to you truly, that if two of you should agree on the earth concerning every matter, whatever they might ask, it will happen for them from my Father in the heavens.
Matt. For where two or three are gathered together in my name, there am I in the midst of them.
Matt. Then Peter having come to him, he said, Lord, how often will my brother sin against me,  I forgive him? Until seven times?
Matt. Jesus says to him, I say to thee, not until seven times,  until seventy times seven.
Matt. Because of this the kingdom of the heavens is compared to a man, a king, who wanted to settle account with his bondmen.
Matt. And when he began to settle, one debtor of ten thousand talents was brought to him.
Matt. But of him not having to pay, his lord commanded him to be sold,  his wife and children,  all things, as many as he had,  payment to be made.
Matt. The bondman therefore having fallen down, worshiped him, saying, Lord, be patient toward me and I will pay thee all.
Matt. And having felt compassion, the lord of that bondman released him,  forgave him the debt.
Matt. But after going out, that bondman found one of his fellow bondmen who owed him a hundred denarii. And having grabbed him, he choked him, saying, Pay me if thou owe anything.
Matt. So his fellow bondman having fallen down at his feet, besought him, saying, Be patience toward me,  I will pay thee.
Matt. But he would not, instead, having left him, he cast him into prison until he would pay that which was owed.
Matt. And when his fellow bondmen saw the things that happened, they were extremely sorry. And after coming, they reported to their lord all the things that happened.
Matt. Then his lord having summoned him, he says to him, Thou evil bondman, I forgave thee all that debt because thou besought me.
Matt. Was it not necessary for thee also to be merciful to thy fellow bondman, as I also was merciful to thee?
Matt. And having become angry, his lord delivered him to the tormentors until he would pay all that was due to him.
Matt. So also my heavenly Father will do to you, if ye do not forgive each man his brother, from your hearts, their trespasses.
Matt. And it came to pass when Jesus had finished these sayings, he departed from Galilee and came into the regions of Judea beyond the Jordan.
Matt. And many multitudes followed him and he healed them there.
Matt. And Pharisees came to him, trying him,  saying to him, Is it permitted for a man to divorce his wife for every cause?
Matt. And having answered, he said to them, Have ye not read that he who made them from the beginning made them male and female,
Matt. and said, For this reason a man will leave his father and mother behind,  will be bonded with his wife,  the two will be in one flesh?
Matt. So that they are no longer two,  one flesh. What therefore God has joined together, no man shall separate.
Matt. They say to him, Why then did Moses command to give a writing of divorcement,  to divorce her?
Matt. He says to them, For your hard heart Moses allowed you to divorce your wives,  from the beginning it did not happen this way.
Matt. And I say to you, that whoever may divorce his wife, not for fornication,  will marry another, commits adultery. And he who married her who has been divorced commits adultery.
Matt. His disciples say to him, If the case of the man with his wife is this way, it is not advantageous to marry.
Matt. But he said to them, Not all men can accommodate this saying,  to whom it has been given.
Matt. For there are eunuchs who were born this way from their mother's belly,  there are eunuchs who were made eunuchs by men,  there are eunuchs who made themselves eunuchs because of the kingdom of the heavens. He who is able to receive it, let him receive it.
Matt. Then children were brought to him, so that he would lay his hands on them and pray,  the disciples rebuked them.
Matt. But Jesus said, Allow the children,  do not forbid them to come to me, for of such kind is the kingdom of the heavens.
Matt. And having laid his hands on them, he departed from there.
Matt. And behold one man having come to him, said, Good teacher, what good thing should I do so that I may have eternal life?
Matt. And he said to him, Why do thou call me good? There is none good except one, God. But if thou want to enter into life, keep the commandments.
Matt. He says to him, Which? And Jesus said, Thou shall not murder. Thou shall not commit adultery. Thou shall not steal. Thou shall not testify falsely.
Matt. Honor the father and mother, , Thou shall love thy neighbor as thyself.
Matt. The young man says to him, All these things I have kept from my youthfulness. What do I lack yet?
Matt. Jesus said to him, If thou want to be perfect, go, sell the things being possessed by thee,  give to the poor,  thou will have treasure in heaven. And come, follow me.
Matt. But when the young man heard the saying, he went away sorrowing, for he was having many possessions.
Matt. And Jesus said to his disciples, Truly I say to you, that a rich man will enter into the kingdom of the heavens difficultly.
Matt. And again I say to you, it is easier for a camel to pass through the hole of a needle, than for a rich man to enter into the kingdom of God.
Matt. And when his disciples heard it, they were exceedingly amazed, saying, Who then can be saved?
Matt. And having looked, Jesus said to them, With men this is impossible,  with God all things are possible.
Matt. Then having answered, Peter said to him, Lo, we have forsaken all,  followed thee. What then will be for us?
Matt. And Jesus said to them, Truly I say to you, that ye who have followed me, in the regeneration when the Son of man will sit on the throne of his glory, ye also will sit upon twelve thrones, judging the twelve tribes of Israel.
Matt. And every man who has forsaken houses, or brothers, or sisters, or father, or mother, or wife, or children, or lands, because of my name, will receive a hundredfold,  will inherit eternal life.
Matt. But many first will be last,  last, first.
Matt. For the kingdom of the heavens is compared to a man, a house-ruler, who went out in the early morning at the same time to hire workmen for his vineyard.
Matt. And having agreed with the workmen for a denarius a day, he sent them into his vineyard.
Matt. And having gone out about the third hour, he saw others having stood idle in the marketplace.
Matt. And he said to those men, Go ye also into the vineyard,  whatever would be right I will give you,  they went.
Matt. Again having gone out about the sixth and the ninth hour, he did likewise.
Matt. And having gone out about the eleventh hour, he found others who have stood idle. And he says to them, Why have ye stood here idle the whole day?
Matt. They say to him, Because no man has hired us. He says to them, Go ye also into the vineyard,  whatever would be right ye will receive.
Matt. And having become evening, the lord of the vineyard says to his manager, Call the workmen,  render to them their wage, having begun from the last until the first.
Matt. And those who came about the eleventh hour, each received a denarius.
Matt. But when the first came, they supposed that they would receive more. And they also received a denarius each.
Matt. And when they received it, they murmured against the house-ruler,
Matt. saying, These last did one hour,  thou have made them equal to us, who have borne the burden of the day and the heat.
Matt. But having answered, he said to one of them, Friend, I do thee no wrong. Did thou not agree with me for a denarius?
Matt. Take thine and go. But I want to give to this last man, as to thee also.
Matt. Is it not permitted for me to do what I want with my own? Is thine eye evil, because I am good?
Matt. So the last will be first,  the first last, for many are called,  few chosen.
Matt. And while going up to Jerusalem, Jesus took the twelve disciples in private on the way,  he said to them,
Matt. Behold, we go up to Jerusalem,  the Son of man will be betrayed to the chief priests and scholars. And they will condemn him to death,
Matt. and will deliver him to the Gentiles to ridicule,  to scourge,  to crucify. And the third day he will rise.
Matt. Then the mother of the sons of Zebedee came to him with her sons, worshiping,  asking something from him.
Matt. And he said to her, What do thou want? She says to him, Speak that these my two sons may sit, one at thy right hand and one at thy left hand in thy kingdom.
Matt. But having answered, Jesus said, Ye know not what ye are asking. Are ye able to drink the cup that I am going to drink, or to be immersed the immersion that I am immersed? They say to him, We are able.
Matt. And he says to them, Ye will indeed drink my cup,  ye will be immersed the immersion that I am immersed. But to sit at my right hand and at my left hand is not mine to give,  to whom it has been prepared by my Father.
Matt. And when the ten heard it, they were indignant about the two brothers.
Matt. But having summoned them, Jesus said, Ye know that the rulers of the Gentiles lord over them,  their eminent men have power over them.
Matt. But it shall not be so among you. Rather whoever wants to become great among you, he shall be your helper,
Matt. and whoever wants be first among you shall be your bondman.
Matt. Just as the Son of man came not to be served,  to serve,  to give his life a ransom for many.
Matt. And when they went out from Jericho, a great multitude followed him.
Matt. And behold, two blind men sitting by the wayside, having heard that Jesus was passing by, cried out, saying, Be merciful to us, Lord, thou son of David.
Matt. And the multitude rebuked them, so that they would be quiet,  they cried out greater, saying, Be merciful to us, Lord, thou son of David.
Matt. And having stood still, Jesus called them and said, What do ye want that I would do to you?
Matt. They say to him, Lord, that our eyes may be opened.
Matt. And having felt compassion, Jesus touched their eyes,  straightaway they received their sight,  followed him.
Matt. And when they came near to Jerusalem,  came to Bethsphage, to the mount of Olives, then Jesus sent two disciples,
Matt. saying to them, Go into the village opposite you,  straightaway ye will find a donkey tied,  a colt with it. Having loosed them, bring to me.
Matt. And if any man says anything to you, ye will say, The Lord has need of them,  straightaway he will send them.
Matt. Now all this came to pass, so that what was spoken through the prophet might be fulfilled, which says,
Matt. Say ye to the daughter of Zion, Behold, thy King comes to thee, meek,  mounted upon a donkey,  a colt the foal of a pack animal.
Matt. And the disciples having gone,  having done as Jesus commanded them,
Matt. they brought the donkey and the colt,  put their garments over them. And he sat upon them.
Matt. And the great multitude spread their garments on the road,  others cut down branches from the trees,  spread them on the road.
Matt. And the multitudes who went ahead and those who followed, cried out, saying, Hosanna to the son of David! Blessed is he who comes in the name of the Lord. Hosanna in the highest!
Matt. And when he entered into Jerusalem, all the city was shaken, saying, Who is this?
Matt. And the multitudes said, This is Jesus, the prophet from Nazareth of Galilee.
Matt. And Jesus entered into the temple of God,  cast out all those who sold and bought in the temple. And he overturned the tables of the moneychangers,  the seats of those who sold the doves.
Matt. And he says to them, It is written, My house will be called a house of prayer,  ye made it a den of robbers.
Matt. And the lame and the blind came to him in the temple,  he healed them.
Matt. But when the chief priests and the scholars saw the wonderful things that he did,  the boys crying out in the temple and saying, Hosanna to the son of David, they were indignant,
Matt. and said to him, Do thou hear what these are saying? And Jesus says to them, Yes! Did ye never read, Out of the mouth of children and those who suckle thou have perfected praise?
Matt. And having left them behind, he went out of the city to Bethany,  lodged there.
Matt. Now early while returning to the city, he was hungry.
Matt. And having seen a fig tree, one on the way, he came to it,  found nothing on it, except leaves only. And he says to it, Let fruit no longer be produced from thee into the age. And immediately the fig tree dried out.
Matt. And when the disciples saw it, they marveled, saying, How did the fig tree dry out immediately?
Matt. And having answered, Jesus said to them, Truly I say to you, if ye have faith,  doubt not, ye will not only do that of the fig tree,  even if ye may say to this mountain, Be thou taken up and cast into the sea, it will happen.
Matt. And all things, as many as ye may ask in prayer, believing, ye will receive.
Matt. And when he came into the temple, the chief priests and the elders of the people came to him while he taught, saying, By what authority do thou these things? And who gave thee this authority?
Matt. And having answered, Jesus said to them, I also will ask you one word, which if ye tell me, I also will tell you by what authority I do these things.
Matt. The immersion of John, from where was it, from heaven or from men? And they deliberated with themselves, saying, If we should say, From heaven, he will say to us, Why then did ye not believe him?
Matt. But if we should say, From men, we fear the multitude, for all hold John as a prophet.
Matt. And having answered Jesus, they said, We know not. He said to them, And neither do I tell you by what authority I do these things.
Matt. But what does it seem to you? A man had two children. And having come to the first, he said, Child, go work today in my vineyard.
Matt. And having answered, he said, I do not want to,  having repented later, he went.
Matt. And having come to the second, he said likewise. And having answered, he said, I, sir,  did not go.
Matt. Which of the two did the will of the father? They say to him, The first. Jesus says to them, Truly I say to you, that the tax collectors and the harlots go into the kingdom of God before you.
Matt. For John came to you in a way of righteousness,  ye did not believe him,  the tax collectors and the harlots believed him. And having seen it, ye did not repent afterward to believe him.
Matt. Hear ye another parable. There was a certain man who was a house-ruler, who planted a vineyard,  placed a hedge around it,  dug a winepress in it,  built a tower,  leased it to farmers,  went on a journey.
Matt. And when the time of the fruits approached, he sent his bondmen to the farmers to receive his fruits.
Matt. And the farmers having taken his bondmen, they beat one,  killed another,  stoned another.
Matt. Again, he sent other bondmen more than the first,  they did to them in like manner.
Matt. But finally he sent to them his son, saying, They will be made ashamed by my son.
Matt. But the farmers, when they saw the son, said among themselves, This is the heir, come, let us kill him,  possess his inheritance.
Matt. And having seized him, they cast him out of the vineyard,  killed him.
Matt. When therefore the lord of the vineyard comes, what will he do to those farmers?
Matt. They say to him, Evil men, he will miserably destroy them,  will lease out the vineyard to other farmers, who will render him the fruits in their seasons.
Matt. Jesus says to them, Did ye never read in the scriptures, The stone that those who build rejected, this came to be in the head of the corner. This happened from the Lord,  it is marvelous in our eyes?
Matt. Because of this I say to you, that the kingdom of God will be taken away from you,  will be given to a nation producing the fruits of it.
Matt. And he who falls on this stone will be shattered,  on whomever it may fall, it will grind him to dust.
Matt. And when the chief priests and the Pharisees heard his parables, they knew that he spoke about them.
Matt. And when they sought to seize him, they feared the multitudes, because they held him as a prophet.
Matt. And having responded, Jesus again spoke to them in parables, saying,
Matt. The kingdom of the heavens is like a man, a king who made a wedding for his son.
Matt. And he sent forth his bondmen to call those who were invited to the wedding festivities,  they did not want to come.
Matt. Again he sent forth other bondmen, saying, Speak to those who were invited, Behold, I have prepared my dinner. My oxen and my fatlings have been killed,  all things are ready. Come to the wedding festivities.
Matt. But having disregarded, they departed, one to his own farm, another to his merchandise,
Matt. and the others having seized his bondmen, abused and killed them.
Matt. But having heard that, the king was angry,  having sent forth his armies, he destroyed those murderers,  burned their city.
Matt. Then he says to his bondmen, The wedding is indeed ready,  those who were invited were not worthy.
Matt. Go ye therefore to the crossings of the ways,  as many as ye may find, call to the wedding festivities.
Matt. And those bondmen having departed into the roads, they gathered together all, as many as they found, both bad and good. And the wedding was filled with those who were dining.
Matt. But when the king came in to see those who were dining, he saw there a man who was not clothed with a wedding garment.
Matt. And he says to him, Friend, how did thou come in here not having a wedding garment? But he was speechless.
Matt. Then the king said to the helpers, After binding him hands and feet, take him away and cast him out into the outer darkness. There will be the weeping and the gnashing of teeth.
Matt. For many are called,  few chosen.
