John. Philip comes and tells Andrew,  again Andrew and Philip tell Jesus.
John. And Jesus answered them saying, The hour has come that the Son of man should be glorified.
John. Truly, truly, I say to you, unless the grain of wheat that falls into the ground dies, it remains alone,  if it dies it bears much fruit.
John. He who loves his life will lose it,  he who hates his life in this world will keep it for eternal life.
John. If any man serves me, let him follow me,  where I am, there my helper will also be. And if any man serves me, the Father will honor him.
John. Now is my soul troubled,  what shall I say? Father, save me from this hour. But because of this I came to this hour.
John. Father, glorify thy name. A voice therefore came out of heaven, saying, I both glorified it,  I will glorify again.
John. The multitude therefore that stood by and heard, said thunder occurred, others said, An agent has spoken to him.
John. Jesus answered and said, This voice occurred not for my sake,  for your sakes.
John. Now is the judgment of this world. Now the ruler of this world will be cast out.
John. And I, if I am lifted up from the earth, I will draw all men to myself.
John. And he said this, signifying by what death he was going to die.
John. The multitude answered him, We have heard from the law that the Christ remains into the age. And how can thou say, The Son of man must be lifted up? Who is this Son of man?
John. Jesus therefore said to them, Yet a little time the light is with you. Walk while ye have the light, so that darkness may not overcome you. And he who walks in the darkness knows not where he is going.
John. While ye have the light, believe in the light, so that ye may become sons of light. Jesus spoke these things,  after departing, he was hid from them.
John. But although having done so many signs before them, they did not believe in him,
John. so that the word of Isaiah the prophet that he spoke might be fulfilled: Lord, who has believed our report? And to whom has the arm of the Lord been revealed?
John. Because of this they could not believe. Because Isaiah said again,
John. He has blinded their eyes,  has hardened their heart, so that they would not see with their eyes,  understand with their heart,  be turned,  I would heal them.
John. Isaiah said these things when he saw his glory,  spoke about him.
John. Yet, nevertheless, even many of the rulers believed in him,  because of the Pharisees they did not confess, so that they would not become excommunicated from the synagogue,
John. for they loved the praise of men more than the praise of God.
John. And Jesus cried out and said, He who believes in me, believes not in me,  in him who sent me.
John. And he who sees me sees him who sent me.
John. I have come a light into the world, so that every man who believes in me may not remain in the darkness.
John. And if any man hears my sayings,  will not believe, I do not judge him, for I came not so that I might judge the world,  that I might save the world.
John. He who rejects me and does not receive my sayings, has that which judges him: the word that I spoke, that will judge him in the last day.
John. Because I spoke not from myself,  the Father who sent me, he gave me commandment, what I should say,  what I should speak.
John. And I know that his commandment is eternal life. Therefore what things I speak, just as the Father has said to me, so I speak.
John. Now before the feast of the Passover, Jesus, having seen that his hour has come that he would depart out of this world to his Father, having loved his own in the world, he loved them to the end.
John. And supper having occurred, the devil having now put into the heart of Judas Iscariot, Simon's son, that he would betray him,
John. Jesus, having seen that the Father has given all the things to him, into his hands,  that he came from God,  goes to God,
John. rises from supper,  set his garments aside,  after taking a towel, he girded himself.
John. Then he pours water into the wash-basin,  began to wash the disciples' feet,  to wipe them with the towel with which he was girded.
John. So he comes to Simon Peter,  that man says to him, Lord, do thou wash my feet?
John. Jesus answered and said to him, What I do thou do not know now,  thou will understand after these things.
John. Peter says to him, Thou may, no, not wash my feet into the age. Jesus answered him, If I may not wash thee, thou have no part with me.
John. Simon Peter says to him, Lord, not my feet only,  also my hands and head.
John. Jesus says to him, He who is bathed has no need to wash the feet either,  is entirely clean. And ye are clean,  not all.
John. For he knew the man betraying him. Because of this he said, Ye are not all clean.
John. When therefore he washed their feet,  took his garments, having sat down again, he said to them, Do ye understand what I have done to you?
John. Ye call me, Teacher, , Lord. And ye say well, for I am.
John. If I then, the Lord and the teacher, have washed your feet, ye also ought to wash each other's feet.
John. For I have given you an example, so that just as I have done to you ye also should do.
John. Truly, truly, I say to you, a bondman is not greater than his lord, nor is an apostle greater than he who sent him.
John. If ye have seen these things, blessed are ye if ye do them.
John. I speak not about you all. I have seen whom I chose,  that the scripture may be fulfilled, He who eats bread with me lifted up his heel against me.
John. From henceforth I tell you before it happens, so that when it happens, ye may believe that I am.
John. Truly, truly, I say to you, he who receives any man whomever I may send, receives me,  he who receives me receives him who sent me.
John. Having said these things, Jesus was troubled in the spirit,  testified and said, Truly, truly, I say to you, that one of you will betray me.
John. Therefore the disciples looked at each other, being uncertain about whom he speaks.
John. And one of his disciples whom Jesus loved was sitting at Jesus' bosom.
John. Simon Peter therefore gestured to this man to inquire whoever he may be about whom he speaks.
John. And that man, having leaned thus toward Jesus' breast, says to him, Lord, who is he?
John. Jesus replies, He is that man to whom I, having dipped the morsel, will give. And when he dipped the morsel, he gives it to Judas Iscariot, the son of Simon.
John. And after the morsel, then Satan entered into that man. Jesus therefore says to him, What thou do, do more quickly.
John. But no man who was sitting knew why he said this to him.
John. For some thought, since Judas had the purse, that Jesus said to him, Buy what things we have need of for the feast, or that he should give something to the poor.
John. Therefore having received the morsel, straightaway that man went out,  it was night.
John. When he went out, Jesus says, Now the Son of man is glorified,  God is glorified in him.
John. If God is glorify in him, God will also glorify him in himself,  he will glorify him straightaway.
John. Little children, yet a little while I am with you. Ye will seek me,  as I said to the Jews, Where I go, ye cannot come, I also now say to you.
John. A new commandment I give to you, that ye should love each other, just as I loved you, so that ye also should love each other.
John. By this all men will know that ye are my disciples, if ye have love among each other.
John. Simon Peter says to him, Lord, where do thou go? Jesus answered him, Where I go, thou cannot follow me now,  thou will follow me afterwards.
John. Peter said to him, Lord, why cannot I follow thee now? I will lay down my life for thee.
John. Jesus answered him, Will thou lay down thy life for me? Truly, truly, I say to thee, A cock will, no, not sound, until thou will deny me thrice.
John. Let not your heart be troubled. Ye believe in God, believe also in me.
John. In my Father's house are many dwellings,  if not, I would have told you. I go to prepare a place for you.
John. And if I go and prepare a place for you, I come again,  will take you along to myself, so that where I am, ye may be also.
John. And ye know where I go,  ye know the way.
John. Thomas says to him, Lord, we know not where thou go. How can we know the way?
John. Jesus says to him, I am the way,  the truth,  the life. No man comes to the Father, except by me.
John. If ye had known me, ye would have known my Father also. And from henceforth ye know him,  have seen him.
John. Philip says to him, Lord, show us the Father,  it is enough for us.
John. Jesus says to him, Have I been so long a time with you,  thou do not know me, Philip? He who has seen me has seen the Father. And how can thou say, Show us the Father?
John. Do thou not believe that I am in the Father,  the Father in me? The sayings that I speak to you I speak not from myself,  the Father who dwells in me, he does the works.
John. Believe me that I am in the Father,  the Father in me. But if not, believe me because of the works themselves.
John. Truly, truly, I say to you, he who believes in me, the works that I do, that man will also do. And he will do greater than these, because I go to the Father.
John. And anything whatever ye may ask in my name, this I will do, that the Father may be glorified in the Son.
John. If ye will ask me anything in my name, I will do it.
John. If ye love me, keep my commandments.
John. And I will ask the Father,  he will give you another helper, so that he may dwell with you into the age,
John. the Spirit of truth, which the world cannot receive, because it does not see nor know it. But ye know it, because it dwells with you,  will be in you.
John. I will not leave you orphaned. I am coming to you.
John. Yet a little while,  the world sees me no more,  ye see me. Because I live, ye will also live.
John. In that day ye will know that I am in my Father,  ye in me,  I in you.
John. He who has my commandments,  keeps them, that man it is who loves me. And he who loves me will be loved by my Father,  I will love him,  will manifest myself to him.
John. Judas (not Iscariot) says to him, Lord,  what has happened that thou are going to manifest thyself to us,  not to the world?
John. Jesus answered and said to him, If any man loves me, he will keep my word,  my Father will love him,  we will come to him and make a dwelling with him.
John. He who does not love me does not keep my words. And the word that ye hear is not mine,  the Father's who sent me.
John. I have spoken these things to you while remaining with you.
John. But the helper, the Holy Spirit that the Father will send in my name, he will teach you all things,  will remind you of all that I said to you.
John. Peace I leave with you. My peace I give to you, not as the world gives, do I give to you. Let not your heart be troubled, nor let it be cowardly.
John. Ye heard that I said to you, I go,  I come to you. If ye loved me, ye would have rejoiced because I said I go to the Father, because my Father is greater than I.
John. And now I have told you before it happens, so that when it happens, ye might believe.
John. I will no longer speak many things with you, for the ruler of the world comes. And he has nothing on me,
John. but that the world may know that I love the Father. And as the Father commanded me, thus I do. Arise, let us go from here.
John. I am the true grapevine,  my Father is the farmer.
John. Every branch in me not bearing fruit, he removes it. And every branch that bears fruit, he prunes it, so that it may bear more fruit.
John. Now ye are clean because of the word that I have spoken to you.
John. Dwell in me,  I in you. Just as the branch cannot bear fruit of itself, unless it dwells in the grapevine, so neither ye, if ye do not dwell in me.
John. I am the grapevine, ye are the branches. He who dwells in me,  I in him, this man bears much fruit, because without me ye can do nothing.
John. If any man does not dwell in me, he is cast out as a branch and is withered. And they gather them,  cast them into the fire,  are burned.
John. If ye dwell in me,  my sayings dwell in you, ye will ask whatever ye may want,  it will be done to you.
John. By this my Father is glorified, that ye may bear much fruit,  ye will become my disciples.
John. As the Father has loved me, I also have loved you. Dwell ye in my love.
John. If ye keep my commandments, ye will dwell in my love, just as I have kept my Father's commandments,  dwell in his love.
John. These things I have spoken to you that my joy may dwell in you,  your joy may be full.
John. This is my commandment, that ye love each other, just as I have loved you.
John. Greater love has no man than this, that some man lay down his life for his friends.
John. Ye are my friends, if ye do as many things as I command you.
John. I no longer call you bondmen, because the bondman does not know what his lord does. But I have called you friends, because all things that I heard from my Father, I made known to you.
John. Ye did not choose out me,  I chose out you,  appointed you, so that ye should go and bear fruit,  that your fruit may remain, so that anything whatever ye may ask of the Father in my name, he may give you.
John. These things I command you, so that ye may love each other.
John. If the world hates you, know that it has hated me before you.
John. If ye were of the world, the world would love its own,  because ye are not of the world (instead I chose you out of the world), because of this the world hates you.
John. Remember the word that I said to you, A bondman is not greater than his lord. If they persecuted me, they will persecute you also. If they kept my word, they will keep yours also.
John. But all these things they will do to you because of my name, because they have not known him who sent me.
John. If I had not come and spoken to them, they would not have had sin,  now they have no excuse for their sin.
John. He who hates me hates my Father also.
John. If I had not done among them the works that no other man has done, they would not have had sin,  now they have both seen and hated both me and my Father.
John. But, that the word that is written in their law may be fulfilled, They hated me without cause.
John. But when the helper comes whom I will send to you from the Father, the Spirit of truth that proceeds from the Father, that will testify about me.
John. And ye also testify, because ye have been with me from the beginning.
John. I have spoken these things to you, so that ye may not be caused to stumble.
John. They will make you excommunicated from the synagogues. But the hour comes that every man who kills you will presume to be offering service to God.
John. And they will do these things, because they have not known the Father nor me.
John. But I have told you these things, so that when the hour comes, ye may remember that I told you of them. But I did not tell you these things from the beginning because I was with you.
John. But now I go to him who sent me,  none of you asks me, Where do thou go?
John. But because I have spoken these things to you, sorrow has filled your heart.
John. Nevertheless I tell you the truth, it is expedient for you that I depart, for if I do not depart, the helper will not come to you. But whenever I go, I will send him to you.
John. And having come, that will convict the world about sin,  about justice,  about judgment.
John. About sin because they truly did not believe in me,
John. and about justice because I go to the Father,  ye see me no more,
John. and about judgment because the ruler of this world has been judged.
John. I have yet many things to say to you,  ye cannot bear them now.
John. However when that, the Spirit of truth, comes, he will guide you into all the truth. For he will not speak from himself,  as many things as he may hear, he will speak. And he will report to you the things that are coming.
John. He will glorify me because he will receive from me,  will report to you.
John. All things, as many as the Father has are mine. Because of this I said that he takes from me,  will report to you.
John. A little while,  ye do not see me. Again a little while,  ye will look at me, because I go to the Father.
John. Therefore some of his disciples said among themselves, What is this that he says to us, A little while,  ye do not see me, , Again a little while,  ye will look at me, , Because I go to the Father?
John. They said therefore What is this that he says, A little while? We know not what he says.
John. Therefore Jesus knew that they wanted to ask him,  he said to them, Do ye inquire among yourselves about this, because I said, A little while,  ye do not see me, , Again a little while,  ye will look at me?
John. Truly, truly, I say to you, that ye will weep and lament,  the world will rejoice. Ye will be sorrowful,  your sorrow will become into joy.
John. When a woman brings forth she has pain because her hour has come. But when she has given birth to the child she no longer remembers the anguish because of the joy that a man was born into the world.
John. And now therefore indeed ye have sorrow,  I will see you again,  your heart will rejoice,  no man takes your joy away from you.
John. And in that day ye will ask me nothing. Truly, truly, I say to you, that as many things as ye may ask the Father in my name, he will give you.
John. Until now ye have asked nothing in my name. Ask,  ye will receive, so that your joy may be made full.
John. These things I have spoken to you in veiled words. The hour comes, when I will no more speak to you in veiled words,  will inform you plainly about the Father.
John. In that day ye will ask in my name,  I do not say to you, that I will pray the Father about you,
John. for the Father himself loves you, because ye have loved me,  have believed that I came forth from God.
John. I came forth from the Father,  have come into the world. Again I leave the world,  go to the Father.
John. His disciples say to him, Lo, now thou speak plainly,  speak not one veiled word.
John. Now we know that thou know all things,  have no need that any man should question thee. By this we believe that thou came forth from God.
John. Jesus answered them, Do ye now believe?
John. Behold, the hour comes,  now has come, that ye will be scattered, each man to his own things,  ye will leave me alone. And yet I am not alone, because the Father is with me.
John. These things I have spoken to you, so that in me ye might have peace. In the world ye have tribulation. But cheer up, I have overcome the world.
John. Jesus spoke these things,  he lifted up his eyes to heaven,  said, Father, the hour has come. Glorify thy Son, that the Son may also glorify thee,
John. just as thou gave him authority over all flesh, so that all things that thou have given him, he will give them eternal life.
John. And this is eternal life, that they should know thee the only true God,  Jesus Christ whom thou sent.
John. I glorified thee on the earth. I finished the work which thou have given me that I should do.
John. And now, Father, glorify thou me with thyself with the glory that I had with thee before the world was.
John. I manifested thy name to the men whom thou gave me out of the world. They were thine,  thou gave them to me,  they have kept thy word.
John. Now they know that all things, as many as thou gave me are from thee.
John. Because the sayings that thou gave to me, I gave to them. And they received them,  knew truly that I came forth from thee,  they believed that thou sent me.
John. I pray about them. I do not pray about the world,  about whom thou have given me, because they are for thee.
John. And all my things are thy things,  thy things are my things,  I am glorified in them.
John. And I am no more in the world,  these are in the world,  I come to thee. Holy Father, keep them in thy name that thou have given to me, so that they may be one, just as we.
John. While I was with them in the world, I kept them in thy name. Whom thou gave to me, I kept,  none of them was destroyed, except the son of destruction, so that the scripture might be fulfilled.
John. And now I come to thee. And I speak these things in the world, so that they may have my joy fulfilled in them.
John. I have given them thy word,  the world hated them, because they are not of the world, just as I am not of the world.
John. I pray not that thou should take them out of the world,  that thou should keep them from the evil.
John. They are not of the world just as I am not of the world.
John. Sanctify them in thy truth. Thy word is truth.
John. Just as thou sent me into the world, so also I sent them into the world.
John. And for their sakes I sanctify myself, so that they may also themselves be sanctified in truth.
John. And I pray not about these only,  also about those who believe in me through their word,
John. so that they may all be one, just as thou, Father, are in me,  I in thee, that they also may be in us, so that the world may believe that thou sent me.
John. And I, the glory that thou have given me, I have given to them, so that they may be one, just as we are one,
John. I in them,  thou in me, that they may be fully perfected in one,  so that the world may know that thou sent me,  loved them, just as thou loved me.
John. Father, whom thou gave to me, I desire that where I am, they also may be with me, so that they may see my glory that thou have given me, because thou loved me before the foundation of the world.
John. And righteous Father, the world does not know thee,  I know thee,  these know that thou sent me.
John. And I made known to them thy name,  I will make it known, so that the love that thou loved me may be in them,  I in them.
John. After speaking these things, Jesus went forth with his disciples on the other side of the brook Kidron, where there was a garden into which he entered, he and his disciples.
John. Now Judas, the man betraying him, had also known the place, because Jesus also often gathered there with his disciples.
John. Judas therefore having received the band and subordinates from the chief priests and the Pharisees, comes there with lanterns and torches and weapons.
John. Jesus therefore knowing all the things that were coming upon him, after going forth, he says to them, Whom seek ye?
John. They answered him, Jesus the Nazarene. Jesus says to them, I am he. And Judas, the man betraying him had also stood with them.
John. When therefore he said to them, I am he, they went backward and fell to the ground.
John. Again therefore he questioned them, Whom seek ye? And they said, Jesus the Nazarene.
John. Jesus answered, I told you that I am. If therefore ye seek me, allow these men to go,
John. so that the word that he spoke might be fulfilled, Of whom thou have given me, I lost, no, not one of them.
John. Simon Peter therefore, having a sword, drew it and struck the high priest's bondman,  cut off his right ear. Now the servant's name was Malchus.
John. Jesus therefore said to Peter, Put up thy sword into the sheath. The cup that the Father has given me, shall I, no, not drink it?
John. So the band,  the chief captain,  the subordinates of the Jews, arrested Jesus and bound him,
John. and led him away first to Annas. For he was father-in-law of Caiaphas, who was high priest that year.
John. Now Caiaphas was the man who counseled the Jews that it was expedient for one man to die on behalf of the people.
John. And Simon Peter followed Jesus, also the other disciple. But that disciple was known to the high priest,  he went in with Jesus into the courtyard of the high priest.
John. But Peter had stood near the door outside. So the other disciple, who was known to the high priest, went out and spoke to the doorkeeper and brought in Peter.
John. Therefore the servant girl (the doorkeeper) says to Peter, Are thou not also of this man's disciples? That man says, I am not.
John. Now the bondmen and the subordinates had stood, having made a fire of coals because it was cold,  they were warming themselves. And Peter was also standing with them warming himself.
John. The high priest therefore asked Jesus about his disciples,  about his doctrine.
John. Jesus answered him, I spoke in public to the world. I always taught in a synagogue,  in the temple where the Jews always gather together,  I spoke nothing in secret.
John. Why question thou me? Question those who have heard what I said to them. Behold, these know the things that I said.
John. And when he said these things, one of the subordinates standing by gave a slap to Jesus, saying, Answer thou the high priest this way?
John. Jesus answered him, If I spoke wrongly, testify about the wrong,  if correctly, why strike me?
John. Annas sent him bound to Caiaphas the high priest.
John. Now Simon Peter was standing and warming himself. Therefore they said to him, Are thou not also of his disciples? That man therefore denied,  said, I am not.
John. One of the bondmen of the high priest, being a kinsman of him whose ear Peter cut off, says, Did I not see thee in the garden with him?
John. Peter therefore denied again,  straightaway a cock sounded.
John. They lead Jesus therefore from Caiaphas to the Praetorium. And it was early,  they did not enter into the Praetorium, so that they would not be defiled,  that they might eat the Passover.
John. Pilate therefore went out to them,  said, What accusation do ye bring against this man?
John. They answered and said to him, If this man were not an evildoer, we would not have delivered him up to thee.
John. Pilate therefore said to them, Take ye him,  judge him according to your law. The Jews therefore said to him, It is not permitted for us to kill any man,
John. so that the word of Jesus might be fulfilled that he spoke, signifying what kind of death he was going to die.
John. Pilate therefore again entered into the Praetorium,  called Jesus,  said to him, Are thou the king of the Jews?
John. Jesus answered, Do thou say this of thyself, or did others tell thee about me?
John. Pilate answered, Am I a Jew? Thine own nation and the chief priests delivered thee to me. What have thou done?
John. Jesus answered, My kingdom is not of this world. If my kingdom were of this world my subordinates would have fought so that I would not be delivered to the Jews,  now my kingdom is not from here.
John. Pilate therefore said to him, Then thou are a king? Jesus answered, Thou say that I am a king. For this I have been born,  for this I have come into the world, that I would testify to the truth. Every man who is of the truth hears my voice.
John. Pilate says to him, What is truth? And having said this, he went out again to the Jews,  says to them, I find not one cause in him.
John. But there is a custom for you that I should release to you one man at the Passover. Do ye wish therefore I would release to you the king of the Jews?
John. They all cried out again therefore, saying, Not this man,  Barabbas. But Barabbas was a robber.
John. Therefore Pilate then took Jesus and scourged him.
John. And the soldiers having woven a crown of thorns, they put it on his head,  put around him a purple garment.
John. And they said, Hail, king of the Jews! And they gave him slaps.
John. Therefore Pilate again went forth outside,  says to them, Behold, I bring him out to you, so that ye may know that I find not one cause in him.
John. Jesus therefore came outside, wearing the thorny crown and the purple robe. And he says to them, Look at the man!
John. When therefore the chief priests and the subordinates saw him, they cried out, saying, Crucify, crucify him! Pilate says to them, Ye take him and crucify, for I find no cause in him.
John. The Jews answered him, We have a law,  according to our law he ought to die because he made himself the Son of God.
John. When Pilate therefore heard this word, he was more afraid.
John. And he went into the Praetorium again,  says to Jesus, Where are thou from? But Jesus gave him no answer.
John. Pilate therefore says to him, Thou do not speak to me? Know thou not that I have authority to crucify thee,  I have authority to release thee?
John. Jesus answered him, Thou would have no authority against me, unless it were given thee from above. Because of this he who delivered me to thee has greater sin.
John. From this Pilate sought to release him,  the Jews cried out, saying, If thou release this man, thou are not Caesar's friend. Every man who makes himself a king speaks against Caesar.
John. When Pilate therefore heard this word, he brought Jesus out,  sat down on the judgment seat at a place called The Pavement,  in Hebrew, Gabbatha.
John. Now it was the Preparation of the Passover,  about the sixth hour. And he says to the Jews, Look at your king!
John. But they cried out, Away, away, crucify him! Pilate says to them, Shall I crucify your king? The chief priests answered, We have no king except Caesar.
John. Therefore he then delivered him to them, so that he might be crucified,  they took and led Jesus away.
John. And he went out bearing his cross to a place called, of a Skull, a place that is called in Hebrew, Golgotha,
John. where they crucified him,  two others with him, on this side and that,  Jesus in the middle.
John. And Pilate also wrote a title,  put it on the cross. And it was written, JESUS THE NAZARENE, THE KING OF THE JEWS.
John. Therefore many of the Jews read this title, because the place where Jesus was crucified was near the city,  it was written in Hebrew, in Greek, in Latin.
John. Therefore the chief priests of the Jews said to Pilate, Do not write, The king of the Jews, , That man said I am king of the Jews.
John. Pilate answered, What I have written I have written.
John. The soldiers therefore when they crucified Jesus, took his garments and made four parts, to each soldier a part,  also the tunic. But the tunic was a seamless weave, from the top throughout.
John. They said therefore among themselves, Let us not divide it,  cast a lot for it, whose it will be, so that the scripture might be fulfilled, which says, They parted my garments among them,  for my clothing they cast a lot. Therefore the soldiers indeed did these things.
John. And his mother,  his mother's sister, Mary the wife of Cleopas,  Mary Magdalene had stood near the cross of Jesus.
John. When Jesus therefore saw his mother,  the disciple whom he loved standing by, he says to his mother, Woman, behold thy son.
John. Then he says to the disciple, Behold, thy mother. And from that hour the disciple took her to his own place.
John. After this, Jesus, having seen that all things are now completed, so that the scripture might be fully complete, says, I thirst.
John. Therefore a vessel full of vinegar was set there. And having filled a sponge with the vinegar,  having put it around a hyssop, they brought it to his mouth.
John. When therefore Jesus received the vinegar, he said, It is finished,  after bowing his head, he gave up the spirit.
John. The Jews therefore, so that the bodies would not remain on the cross on the sabbath, since it was Preparation (for it was the high day of that sabbath), they besought Pilate that their legs might be broken,  they might be removed.
John. The soldiers therefore came,  indeed broke the legs of the first,  of the other man who was crucified with him.
John. But having come to Jesus, when they saw him now having died, they did not break his legs.
John. But one of the soldiers pierced his side with a spear,  straightaway blood and water came out.
John. And he who has seen has testified,  his testimony is true. And that man knows that he speaks true, so that ye may believe.
John. For these things happened so that the scripture might be fulfilled, Not a bone of him will be broken.
John. And again another scripture says, They will look toward whom they pierced.
John. And after these things Joseph of Arimathaea, being a disciple of Jesus,  secretly because of fear of the Jews, besought Pilate that he might remove the body of Jesus,  Pilate allowed him. Therefore he came and removed the body of Jesus.
John. And Nicodemus also came (he who at the first came to Jesus by night) bringing a mixture of myrrh and aloes, about a hundred pounds.
John. So they took the body of Jesus,  wrapped it in linen cloths with the spices, just as is the custom of the Jews to bury.
John. Now a garden was in the place where he was crucified,  in the garden a new sepulcher in which no man was yet laid.
John. Therefore because of the Jews' Preparation (because the sepulcher was near) they laid Jesus there.
John. Now on the first day of the week Mary Magdalene comes early, while it was still darkness, to the sepulcher,  sees the stone taken away from the sepulcher.
John. Therefore she runs and comes to Simon Peter,  to the other disciple whom Jesus loved,  says to them, They have taken away the Lord out of the sepulcher,  we know not where they have laid him.
John. Peter therefore went forth,  the other disciple,  they went toward the sepulcher.
John. And the two men ran together,  the other disciple ran ahead quicker than Peter and came first to the sepulcher.
John. And after stooping down, he sees the linen cloths lying, yet he entered not.
John. Simon Peter therefore comes following him,  he entered into the sepulcher. And he sees the linen cloths lying,
John. and the face cloth that was on his head, not lying with the linen cloths,  wrapped up in one place separately.
John. Therefore then the other disciple who came first to the sepulcher, also entered in,  he saw and believed.
John. For they had not yet known the scripture that he must rise from the dead.
John. So the disciples departed again to themselves.
John. But Mary had stood outside near the sepulcher weeping. So, as she wept, she stooped down to the sepulcher.
John. And she sees two agents in white, sitting, one at the head and one at the feet, where the body of Jesus was lain.
John. And those men say to her, Woman, why weep thou? She says to them, Because they have taken away my Lord,  I know not where they have laid him.
John. And having said these things, she turned backward,  sees Jesus standing. And she had not known that it is Jesus.
John. Jesus says to her, Woman, why weep thou? Whom seek thou? That woman, supposing that he is the gardener, says to him, Sir, if thou have taken him, tell me where thou have laid him,  I will take him away.
John. Jesus says to her, Mary. After turning around, that woman says to him, Rabboni, which says, Teacher.
John. Jesus says to her, Do not touch me, for I have not yet ascended to my Father. But go to my brothers,  say to them, I ascend to my Father and your Father,  my God and your God.
John. Mary Magdalene comes informing the disciples that she has seen the Lord,  he spoke these things to her.
John. Therefore being evening that day, the first day of the week,  the doors having been shut where the disciples were who assembled because of fear of the Jews, Jesus came and stood in the midst,  says to them, Peace to you.
John. And having said this, he showed them his hands and side. His disciples therefore rejoiced when they saw the Lord.
John. Jesus therefore said to them again, Peace to you. As the Father has sent me, I also send you.
John. And after saying this, he breathed on them,  says to them, Receive ye the Holy Spirit.
John. If ye forgive the sins of any, they are forgiven them. If ye retain of any, they are retained.
John. But Thomas, one of the twelve, called Didymus, was not with them when Jesus came.
John. The other disciples therefore said to him, We have seen the Lord. But he said to them, Unless I may see the mark of the nails in his hands,  put my finger into the mark of the nails,  put my hand into his side, I will, no, not believe.
John. And after eight days his disciples were again inside,  Thomas with them. Jesus comes, the doors being shut,  stood in the midst,  said, Peace to you.
John. Then he says to Thomas, Bring thy finger here,  see my hands,  bring thy hand,  put into my side,  do not become faithless,  believing.
John. Thomas answered and said to him, My Lord and my God.
John. Jesus says to him, Because thou have seen me, thou have believed. Blessed are those who have not seen,  have believed.
John. And indeed therefore many other signs Jesus did in the presence of his disciples, which are not written in this book.
John. But these are written, so that ye may believe that Jesus is the Christ, the Son of God,  that believing ye may have life in his name.
John. After these things Jesus manifested himself again to his disciples at the sea of Tiberias. And he revealed himself this way.
John. There were together, Simon Peter,  Thomas called Didymus,  Nathanael of Cana in Galilee,  the sons of Zebedee,  two other men of his disciples.
John. Simon Peter says to them, I am going to harvest fish. They say to him, We also go with thee. They went forth,  straightaway entered into the boat. And in that night they caught nothing.
John. But having now become morning, Jesus stood on the shore. However the disciples had not seen that it was Jesus.
John. Therefore Jesus says to them, Children, have ye anything eatable? They answered him, No.
John. And he said to them, Cast the net on the right side of the boat,  ye will find. Therefore they cast,  they were no longer able to draw it for the magnitude of fishes.
John. That disciple therefore whom Jesus loved says to Peter, It is the Lord. So when Simon Peter heard that it is the Lord, he tied the coat around himself (for he was undressed),  threw himself into the sea.
John. And the other disciples came in the skiff (for they were not far from the land,  about two hundred cubits off), dragging the net of the fishes.
John. So when they came to the land, they saw a fire of coals set,  fish laying on it,  bread.
John. Jesus says to them, Bring from the fishes that ye now caught.
John. Simon Peter went up,  drew the net to land, full of great fishes, a hundred and fifty-three. And being so many, the net was not broken.
John. Jesus says to them, Come, eat breakfast. And none of the disciples dared to query him, Who are thou? knowing that it is the Lord.
John. Jesus therefore comes,  takes the bread,  gives to them,  the fish likewise.
John. This is now a third time Jesus was manifested to his disciples after being raised from the dead.
John. So when they ate breakfast, Jesus says to Simon Peter, Simon, son of Jonah, do thou love me more than these things? He says to him, Yea, Lord. Thou know that I love thee. He says to him, Feed my lambs.
John. He says to him again a second time, Simon, son of Jonah, do thou love me? He says to him, Yea, Lord. Thou know that I love thee. He says to him, Feed my sheep.
John. He says to him the third time, Simon, son of Jonah, do thou love me? Peter was grieved because he said to him the third time, Do thou love me? And he said to him, Lord, thou know all things. Thou know that I love thee. Jesus says to him, Feed my sheep.
John. Truly, truly, I say to thee, When thou were younger, thou girded thyself,  walked where thou would,  when thou become old, thou will stretch forth thy hands,  another will gird thee,  carry thee where thou do not want.
John. Now he said this, signifying by what kind of death he will glorify God. And after saying this, he says to him, Follow me.
John. But Peter, having turned around, sees the disciple whom Jesus loves, following, who also leaned near his chest at the supper,  said, Lord, who is the man betraying thee?
John. Having seen this man, Peter says to Jesus, Lord,  what of this man?
John. Jesus says to him, If I want him to remain until I come, what is it to thee? Follow thou me.
John. This saying therefore went forth among the brothers, that that disciple does not die. And yet Jesus did not say to him, that he does not die, , If I want him to remain until I come, what is it to thee?
John. This is the disciple who testifies about these things,  who wrote these things. And we know that his testimony is true.
John. And there are also many other things, as many as Jesus did, which if they would be written every one, I suppose not even the world itself to make room for the books being written. Truly.
Acts
Acts. I indeed made the former treatise, O Theophilus, about all things that Jesus began both to do and to teach,
Acts. until a day in which he was taken up, having commanded, through the Holy Spirit, the apostles whom he chose,
Acts. to whom he also presented himself living, after his suffering, by many infallible proofs, being seen by them during forty days,  speaking the things about the kingdom of God.
Acts. And being assembled together, he commanded them not to depart from Jerusalem,  to wait for the promise of the Father, Which, he said, ye heard from me.
Acts. Because John indeed immersed in water,  ye will be immersed in the Holy Spirit after not many of these days.
Acts. Indeed therefore having come together, they questioned him, saying, Lord, do thou restore the kingdom to Israel at this time?
Acts. And he said to them, It is not for you to know times or seasons, which the Father established in his own authority.
Acts. But ye will receive the power of the Holy Spirit that comes upon you. And ye will be witnesses to me both in Jerusalem,  in all Judea and Samaria,  as far as of the extremity of the earth.
Acts. And having said these things, as they were watching, he was taken up,  a cloud received him from their eyes.
Acts. And while they were gazing at his going into the sky, behold, two men had also stood by them in white apparel,
Acts. who also said, Men, Galileans, why stand ye gazing into the sky? This Jesus who was taken up from you into the sky will so come, in that same way as ye saw him going into the sky.
Acts. Then they returned to Jerusalem from the mountain called Olivet, which is near Jerusalem having a sabbath day journey.
Acts. And when they came in, they went up into the upper floor where they were lodging, including, Peter and James and John and Andrew, Philip and Thomas, Bartholomew and Matthew, James the son of Alphaeus,  Simon the Zealot,  Judas son of James.
Acts. All these men were continuing with one accord in prayer and supplication, with women,  Mary the mother of Jesus,  with his brothers.
Acts. And in those days, Peter, having stood up in the midst of the disciples (and there was a multitude of names at the same place, about a hundred twenty), he said,
Acts. Men, brothers, it was necessary for this scripture to be fulfilled, which the Holy Spirit foretold through the mouth of David about Judas, who became a guide to those who arrested Jesus,
Acts. because he was numbered with us,  received a share of this ministry.
Acts. (Indeed therefore this man obtained a field from the reward of his unrighteousness,  having become headlong, he burst open in the middle and all his bowels gushed out.
Acts. And it became known to all those dwelling at Jerusalem, so as to call that field in their own dialect, Akeldama, that is, The field of blood.)
Acts. For it is written in the book of Psalms, Let his habitation become desolate,  let no man be dwelling in it, , Let another take his office.
Acts. It is necessary therefore, of the men who accompanied us during all the time during which the Lord Jesus went in and went out among us,
Acts. having begun from the immersion of John to the day that he was taken up from us, for one of these to become a witness with us of his resurrection.
Acts. And they put forward two, Joseph called Barsabbas, who was surnamed Justus,  Matthias.
Acts. And having prayed, they said, Thou, Lord, knowing the hearts of all men, show which one of these two thou have chosen
Acts. to take the place in this ministry and apostleship from which Judas transgressed to go to his own place.
Acts. And they gave their lots,  the lot fell upon Matthias,  he was numbered with the eleven apostles.
Acts. And while fulfilling the day of Pentecost, they were all together at the same place.
Acts. And suddenly there developed a sound from the sky as of a forceful wind moving,  it filled the entire house where they were sitting.
Acts. And there appeared to them dividing tongues, as of fire,  they settled upon each one of them.
Acts. And they were all filled of the Holy Spirit,  began to speak with other tongues, as the Spirit gave them to declare.
Acts. Now there were dwelling at Jerusalem, Jews, devout men from every nation under heaven.
Acts. And the sound of this that happened brought the multitude together. And it was bewildered because each one heard them speaking in his own language.
Acts. And they were amazed and marveled, saying to each other, Behold, are not all these men who speak Galileans?
Acts. And how do we each hear our own language in which we were born?
Acts. Parthians and Medes and Elamites,  those dwelling in Mesopotamia,  Judea and Cappadocia, Pontus and Asia,
Acts. and Phrygia and Pamphylia, Egypt and the parts of Libya along Cyrene,  those Roman aliens, including Jews and proselytes,
Acts. Cretes and Arabians. We hear them speaking in our tongues the great things of God.
Acts. And they were all amazed,  were perplexed, others saying to others, Whatever does this intend to be?
Acts. But others, mocking said, They are filled of wine.
Acts. But Peter having stood up with the eleven, raised his voice and spoke out to them, saying, Jewish men,  all who dwell at Jerusalem, be this known to you,  listen to my sayings.
Acts. For these men are not drunken, as ye suppose, for it is the third hour of the day.
Acts. But this is that which was spoken through the prophet Joel:
Acts. And it will be in the last days, says God, I will pour out from my Spirit upon all flesh. And your sons and your daughters will prophesy,  your young men will see visions,  your elders will dream dreams.
Acts. And also on my bondmen and on my bondmaids in those days I will pour out from my Spirit,  they will prophesy.
Acts. And I will give wonders in the heaven above,  signs on the earth beneath, blood,  fire,  vapor of smoke.
Acts. The sun will be changed into darkness,  the moon into blood, before that great and wonderful day of the Lord comes.
Acts. And it will be, that every man, whoever may call on the name of the Lord will be saved.
Acts. Men, Israelites, hear ye these words. Jesus the Nazarene, a man shown by God among you by miracles and wonders and signs, which God did by him in the midst of you, as ye yourselves also know,
Acts. this man, having been designated (by the purpose and foreknowledge of God) a man delivered up, ye, having taken by lawless hands, killed, having crucified,
Acts. whom God raised up, having loosed the pangs of death, because it was not possible for him to be held by it.
Acts. For David speaks for him: I beheld the Lord always before me, because he is at my right hand, so that I may not be moved.
Acts. Because of this my heart rejoiced,  my tongue was glad. And moreover my flesh will also rest in hope.
Acts. Because thou will not leave my soul in Hades, nor will thou give thy Holy man to see decay.
Acts. Thou made known to me the paths of life. Thou will fill me of joy with thy countenance.
Acts. Men, brothers, being permitted to speak to you with openness about the patriarch David, that he both perished and was buried,  his sepulcher is with us to this day.
Acts. Being therefore a prophet,  knowing that God had sworn with an oath to him, to raise the Christ from the fruit of his loins according to flesh to sit upon his throne.
Acts. Having foreseen this, he spoke about the resurrection of the Christ, that his soul was not left behind in Hades, nor did his flesh see decay.
Acts. This Jesus, God raised up, of which we are all witnesses.
Acts. Therefore, exalted by the right hand of God,  having received the promise of the Holy Spirit from the Father, he poured out this that ye now see and hear.
Acts. For David did not ascend into the heavens,  he himself says, The Lord said to my Lord, Sit thou at my right hand
Acts. until I place thine enemies a footstool of thy feet.
Acts. Therefore let all the house of Israel know assuredly, that God has made him, this Jesus whom ye crucified, both Lord and Christ.
Acts. Now having heard this, they were pierced in the heart,  said to Peter and the other apostles, Men, brothers, what will we do?
Acts. And Peter said to them, Repent ye,  be immersed each of you in the name of Jesus Christ for the remission of sins,  ye will receive the gift of the Holy Spirit.
Acts. For the promise is to you,  to your children,  to all those in afar, as many as the Lord our God may call.
Acts. And with many more other words he testified and exhorted them, saying, Be saved from this crooked generation.
Acts. Indeed therefore those who received his word gladly, were immersed. And there were added in that day about three thousand souls.
Acts. And they were continuing steadfastly in the apostles doctrine,  in fellowship,  in the breaking of bread,  the prayers.
Acts. And fear developed in every soul. And many wonders and signs occurred through the apostles.
Acts. And all who believed were together,  had all things common.
Acts. And they sold properties and possessions,  divided them to all, according as any man had need.
Acts. And continuing steadfastly, daily with one accord in the temple,  breaking bread from house to house, they partook of nourishment in gladness and evenness of heart,
Acts. praising God,  having favor with the whole populace. And the Lord was adding to the church daily those being saved.
Acts. Now at the same time Peter and John were going up into the temple, at the hour of prayer, the ninth.
Acts. And a certain man, being lame from his mother's belly, was carried, whom they laid daily at the gate of the temple, called Beautiful, to ask charity from those who entered into the temple,
Acts. who, having seen Peter and John intending to go into the temple, asked charity.
Acts. And Peter, having gazed intently at him, with John, said, Look at us.
Acts. And he gave attention to them expecting to receive something from them.
Acts. But Peter said, No silver and gold exists to me,  what I have, this I give thee. In the name of Jesus Christ the Nazarene, rise up and walk.
Acts. And after taking him by the right hand, he lifted him up. And immediately his feet and his ankles were strengthened.
Acts. And leaping up, he stood and walked. And he entered with them into the temple, walking,  leaping,  praising God.
Acts. And all the people saw him walking and praising God,
Acts. and they recognized him, that this was the man who sat for charity at the Beautiful Gate of the temple. And they were filled of astonishment and amazement at that which happened to him.
Acts. And as the lame man who was healed held Peter and John, all the people ran together to them in the porch that is called Solomon's, amazed.
Acts. And Peter having seen, he responded to the people, Men, Israelites, why do ye marvel at this man? Or why do ye stare at us, as by our own power or piety we have made him to walk?
Acts. The God of Abraham,  of Isaac,  of Jacob, the God of our fathers, has glorified his Boy Jesus, whom ye actually delivered up,  denied him in the presence of Pilate who preferred to release that man.
Acts. But ye denied the Holy and Righteous,  asked for a man, a murderer to be granted to you.
Acts. And ye killed the Pathfinder of life, whom God raised from the dead, of which we are witnesses.
Acts. And by faith in his name, this man whom ye see and know, his name has made strong. And faith through him has given him this complete soundness in the presence of you all.
Acts. And now, brothers, I know that ye did it from ignorance, as also your rulers.
Acts. But this way God fulfilled what things were foretold, through the mouth of all his prophets, the Christ was to endure.
Acts. Repent ye therefore,  be converted in order to wipe away your sins, so that times of refreshing may come from the presence of the Lord.
Acts. And he may send Christ Jesus who has been pre-ordained for you,
Acts. whom heaven must indeed receive until the times of restoration of all things, of which God spoke through the mouth of all his holy prophets from the age.
Acts. For Moses indeed said to the fathers, The Lord our God will raise up a prophet for you, from your brothers, like me. Ye shall hear him in all things, as many as he might speak to you.
Acts. And every soul, whichever it will be, if it will not hear that prophet will be utterly destroyed from the people.
Acts. And also all the prophets from Samuel and those in succession, as many as spoke, also proclaimed these days.
Acts. Ye are sons of the prophets,  of the covenant that God made for our fathers, saying to Abraham, And in thy seed all the patriarchies of the earth will be blessed.
Acts. To you first, having raised up his Boy Jesus, God sent him blessing you, in turning away each man from your evils.
Acts. And as they spoke to the people, the priests and the captain of the temple and the Sadducees approached them,
Acts. being greatly annoyed because of their teaching the people,  proclaiming in Jesus the resurrection of the dead.
Acts. And they threw hands on them,  put them in custody for the morrow, for it was now evening.
Acts. But many of those who heard the word believed,  the number of the men became about five thousand.
Acts. And it came to pass on the morrow, to be assembled in Jerusalem, their rulers,  elders,  scholars,
Acts. and Annas the high priest,  Caiaphas,  John,  Alexander,  as many as were of the high priestly family.
Acts. And after placing them in the midst, they inquired, By what power, or in what name, have ye done this?
Acts. Then Peter being filled with the Holy Spirit, said to them, Rulers of the people,  elders of Israel,
Acts. if we are examined today about a good deed, of a feeble man, by what this man has been healed,
Acts. be it known to you all,  to all the people of Israel, that in the name of Jesus Christ the Nazarene, whom ye crucified, whom God raised from the dead, by this, this man stands here before you healthy.
Acts. This is the stone that was rejected by you who build, which became into the head of the corner.
Acts. And salvation is not in any other man, for there is no other name under the heaven, that has been given among men, by which we must be saved.
Acts. Now when they saw the boldness of Peter and John,  having perceived that they are illiterate and uneducated men, they marveled. And they recognized them, that they had been with Jesus.
Acts. And seeing the man who was healed standing with them, they had nothing to contradict.
Acts. But after commanding them to go outside of the council, they conferred among each other,
Acts. saying, What will we do to these men? For that indeed a notable sign has happened by them, is apparent to all who dwell in Jerusalem,  we cannot deny it.
Acts. But that it may not spread on further among the people, let us threaten them with threats to speak no longer in this name, to not one man.
Acts. And having called them, they commanded them entirely, not to utter nor to teach in the name of Jesus.
Acts. But Peter and John having replied to them, they said, Whether it is right in the sight of God to hearken to you rather than God, judge ye.
Acts. For we are not able not to speak what we saw and heard.
Acts. And they, having further threatened, released them, finding nothing how they might punish them, because of the people. Since all glorified God for that which happened.
Acts. For the man was more than forty years old on whom this sign of healing had occurred.
Acts. And after being released, they went to their own men,  reported as many things as the chief priests and the elders said to them.
Acts. And those who heard lifted up a voice to God with one accord,  said, Thou Master, the God who made the heaven and the earth and the sea,  all things in them.
Acts. He who said through the mouth of thy boy David, Why do the nations rage,  the peoples meditate vain things?
Acts. The kings of the earth stood up,  the rulers were gathered together, against the Lord,  against his Christ.
Acts. For in truth, against thy holy Boy Jesus, whom thou anointed, both Herod and Pontius Pilate, with the Gentiles and the peoples of Israel, were gathered together,
Acts. to do as many things as thy hand and thy purpose predetermined to happen.
Acts. And now, Lord, look upon their threats,  grant to thy bondmen with all boldness to speak thy word,
Acts. by thy stretching forth thy hand for healing,  signs and wonders to happen through the name of thy holy Boy Jesus.
Acts. And when they prayed, the place in which they were assembled was shaken,  they were all filled with the Holy Spirit,  they spoke the word of God with boldness.
Acts. And the multitude of those who believed were of one heart and soul. And not even one man said that anything of the things that was possessed by him was his own,  all things were common to them.
Acts. And with great power the apostles gave back the testimony of the resurrection of the Lord Jesus,  great grace was upon them all.
Acts. For not even any needy was among them, for as many as were owners of lands or houses, selling, they brought the proceeds of the things that were sold,
Acts. and placed them at the apostles' feet. And it was distributed to each, according as any man had need.
Acts. And Joses, who was surnamed by the apostles, Barnabas (which is, being translated, son of encouragement), a Levite, a Cypriot by nationality,
Acts. having sold a field that was possessed by him, brought the money and placed it at the apostles' feet.
Acts. But a certain man named Ananias, with Sapphira his wife, sold property,
Acts. and kept back from the price, his wife also having joint awareness. And having brought a certain part, he placed it at the apostles' feet.
Acts. But Peter said, Ananias, why did Satan fill thy heart for thee to lie to the Holy Spirit,  to keep back from the price of the land?
Acts. While it remained, did it not remain to thee? And after it was sold, it was in thine authority. Why is it that thou have placed this matter in thy heart? Thou have not lied to men,  to God.
Acts. And Ananias hearing these words, after falling down he expired. And great fear developed in all who heard these things.
Acts. And after rising the young men wrapped him,  having carried him out they buried him.
Acts. And it came to pass after an interval of three hours, his wife also came in, not knowing that which happened.
Acts. And Peter responded to her, Tell me whether ye sold the land for so much. And she said, Yes, for so much.
Acts. But Peter said to her, How is it that it was agreed by you to challenge the Spirit of the Lord? Behold, the feet of those who buried thy husband are at the door,  they will carry thee out.
Acts. And immediately she fell down at his feet and expired. And after coming in the young men found her dead,  having carried her out, they buried her by her husband.
Acts. And great fear developed in the whole church,  in all who heard these things.
Acts. And by the hands of the apostles many signs and wonders happened among the people. And they were all with one accord in Solomon's porch.
Acts. But of the rest no man dared join them,  the people magnified them.
Acts. And more who believe were added to the Lord, multitudes both of men and women,
Acts. so as to bring the feeble to the thoroughfares,  to place them on cots and mats, so that while coming, the shadow of Peter might at the least overshadow some of them.
Acts. And also the populace of the cities round about came together to Jerusalem bringing the feeble,  those tormented by unclean spirits, who were all healed.
Acts. But after rising up, the high priest and all those with him (being the sect of the Sadducees) were filled of envy.
Acts. And they threw their hands on the apostles,  put them in the public prison.
Acts. But an agent of the Lord opened the prison doors by night,  after leading them out, he said,
Acts. Go ye,  after standing in the temple, speak to the people all the sayings of this Life.
Acts. And having heard, they entered into the temple at early morning,  taught. But the high priest having arrived,  those with him, they called the council together,  all the senate of the sons of Israel. And they sent to the prison for them to be brought.
Acts. But the subordinates who came did not find them in the prison. And having returned, they reported,
Acts. saying, We found the prison indeed shut in all security,  the guards standing before the doors,  after opening, we found no man inside.
Acts. Now when they heard these words, the high priest,  the captain of the temple,  the chief priests, were perplexed about them, whatever this would become.
Acts. But a certain man who arrived, reported to them, Behold, the men whom ye put in the prison are standing in the temple and teaching the people.
Acts. Then after departing, the captain with the subordinates brought them, not with violence, for they feared the people, lest they would be stoned.
Acts. And having brought them, they placed them in the council. And the high priest demanded them,
Acts. saying, Did we not command by an order for you not to teach in this name? And behold, ye have filled Jerusalem of your doctrine,  intend to bring upon us this man's blood.
Acts. And Peter and the apostles having answered, they said, We must obey God rather than men.
Acts. The God of our fathers raised up Jesus, whom ye murdered, having hung on a tree.
Acts. God exalted this man with his right hand, a Pathfinder and a Savior to give repentance to Israel and remission of sins.
Acts. And we are his witnesses of these things,  also the Holy Spirit whom God has given to those who obey him.
Acts. And when they heard this, they were as being split with a saw,  wanted to annihilate them.
Acts. But after standing up in the council, a certain Pharisee named Gamaliel, a law teacher, esteemed by all the people, commanded to make the apostles be outside a little while.
Acts. And he said to them, Men, Israelites, take heed to yourselves what ye are going to do against these men.
Acts. For before these days Theudas rose up saying himself to be somebody, to whom a number of men, about four hundred, bonded themselves, who was killed. And all, as many as were persuaded by him, were dispersed and developed into nothing.
Acts. After this man Judas the Galilean rose up in the days of the registration,  drew a considerable crowd behind him. That man was also destroyed,  all, as many as were persuaded by him, were scattered.
Acts. And now I say to you, keep away from these men,  let them go, because if the project or this work is from men, it will be overthrown,
Acts. but if it is from God, ye cannot overthrow it,  perhaps ye may be found to be fighting against God.
Acts. And they were persuaded by him. And after summoning the apostles, having beat them, they commanded them not to speak in the name of Jesus,  released them.
Acts. Indeed therefore they departed from the presence of the council, rejoicing that they were considered worthy to be treated shamefully for the name of Jesus.
Acts. And every day, in the temple and from house to house, they ceased not teaching and preaching good news, Jesus, the Christ.
Acts. Now in those days, the disciples being multiplied, there developed a murmuring of the Hellenists against the Hebrews because their widows were neglected in the daily assistance.
Acts. And the twelve, having summoned the multitude of the disciples, they said, It is not right for us, having left the word of God behind, to serve tables.
Acts. Therefore, brothers, seek ye out seven men from you being well reported, full of the Holy Spirit and of wisdom, whom we may appoint over this need.
Acts. But we will continue steadfastly in prayer,  in the service of the word.
Acts. And the word was pleasing before all the multitude. And they chose Stephen, a man full of faith and of the Holy Spirit,  Philip,  Prochorus,  Nicanor,  Timon,  Parmenas,  Nicolas, a proselyte, a citizen of Antioch,
Acts. men whom they placed before the apostles. And having prayed, they laid hands upon them.
Acts. And the word of God increased,  the number of the disciples multiplied greatly in Jerusalem,  a large company of the priests were obedient to the faith.
Acts. And Stephen, full of faith and power, did great wonders and signs among the people.
Acts. But some of those from the synagogue called Libertines,  of the Cyrenians,  of the Alexandrians,  of those from Cilicia and Asia, rose up disputing with Stephen.
Acts. And they were not able to withstand the wisdom and the spirit by which he spoke.
Acts. Then they instigated men who said, We have heard him speaking blasphemous sayings against Moses and God.
Acts. And they incited the people,  the elders,  the scholars. And after approaching, they seized him,  brought him to the council.
Acts. And they put forward false witnesses who said, This man does not cease speaking blasphemous sayings against the holy place,  the law.
Acts. For we have heard him saying that this Jesus the Nazarene will destroy this place,  will change the customs that Moses delivered to us.
Acts. And all who sat in the council, having gazed upon him, saw his face like a face of an agent.
Acts. And the high priest said, Are these things so?
Acts. And he said, Men! Brothers and fathers, listen. The God of glory appeared to our father Abraham when he was in Mesopotamia, before he dwelt in Haran.
Acts. And he said to him, Go forth out of thy land,  from thy kinfolk,  come into a land that I will show thee.
Acts. Then after coming out of the land of the Chaldeans, he dwelt in Haran. And from there, after his father died, God resettled him in this land in which ye now dwell.
Acts. And he gave him no inheritance in it, not even a footstep. And he promised to give it to him for a possession,  to his seed after him, although there was no child by him.
Acts. And God spoke thus: His seed would be alien in a foreign land,  they would enslave and mistreat them four hundred years.
Acts. And I will judge the nation to whomever they will be in bondage, God said,  after these things they will come forth and serve me in this place.
Acts. And he gave him the covenant of circumcision. And so he begot Isaac,  circumcised him the eighth day. And Isaac begot Jacob,  Jacob the twelve patriarchs.
Acts. And the patriarchs, being envious, sold Joseph into Egypt. And God was with him,
Acts. and delivered him out of all his afflictions,  gave him favor and wisdom before Pharaoh king of Egypt. And he appointed him governor over Egypt and his entire house.
Acts. Now a famine came on all Egypt and Canaan,  great affliction,  our fathers found no sustenance.
Acts. But when Jacob heard of grain being in Egypt, he sent forth our fathers the first time.
Acts. And during the second time Joseph was made known to his brothers,  Joseph's race became manifest to Pharaoh.
Acts. And Joseph having sent forth, he summoned Jacob his father. And all his kinfolk, in souls, were seventy-five.
Acts. And Jacob went down into Egypt,  he perished, he and our fathers.
Acts. And they were carried into Shechem,  laid in the sepulcher that Abraham bought for a price of silver from the sons of Hamor of Shechem.
Acts. But as the time of the promise approached that God swore to Abraham, the people grew and multiplied in Egypt,
Acts. until another king arose who had not known Joseph.
Acts. This man, who cunningly victimized our race, mistreated our fathers to make their infants be placed outside in order not to keep alive.
Acts. During which time Moses was born (and he was well-formed by God) who was reared three months in his father's house.
Acts. And when he was exposed, Pharaoh's daughter took him away,  reared him for a son to herself.
Acts. And Moses was reared in all the wisdom of the Egyptians,  he was mighty in his words and deeds.
Acts. But when a forty year time span was fulfilled by him, it came into his heart to go help his brothers, the sons of Israel.
Acts. And after seeing a certain man suffering wrong, he defended him,  did vengeance for the man being oppressed, having smitten the Egyptian.
Acts. And he presumed his brothers understood that, by his hand, God was giving them salvation,  they did not understand.
Acts. And on the next day he was seen by them as they fought,  he was reconciling them for peace, having said, Men, ye are brothers. Why is it that ye wrong each other?
Acts. But the man doing wrong to his neighbor thrust him away, having said, Who appointed thee a ruler and a judge over us?
Acts. Do thou not want to kill me, as thou killed the Egyptian yesterday?
Acts. And Moses fled at this word,  became an alien in the land of Midian, where he begot two sons.
Acts. And forty years having been fulfilled, an agent of the Lord appeared to him in the wilderness of Mount Sinai in a flame of fire of a bush.
Acts. And when Moses looked, he wondered at the sight. And as he approached to examine, a voice of the Lord came to him,
Acts. I am the God of thy fathers, the God of Abraham,  the God of Isaac,  the God of Jacob. But Moses, who developed trembling, dared not examine.
Acts. And the Lord said to him, Put off the shoes from thy feet, for the place on which thou stand is holy ground.
Acts. Having looked, I saw the oppression of my people in Egypt,  I heard their groaning,  I came down to deliver them. And now come, I will send thee into Egypt.
Acts. This Moses whom they refused, having said, Who appointed thee a ruler and a judge? This man God sent, a ruler and a liberator by the hand of the agent who appeared to him in the bush.
Acts. This man brought them forth after performing wonders and signs in the land of Egypt,  in the Red Sea,  in the wilderness forty years.
Acts. This is the Moses who said to the sons of Israel, The Lord our God will raise up a prophet for you, from your brothers, like me.
Acts. This is he who became in the congregation in the wilderness with the agent who spoke to him on the mount Sinai,  of our fathers who received living oracles to give to us.
Acts. To whom our fathers did not want to become obedient,  they thrust away,  turned back in their heart to Egypt,
Acts. after saying to Aaron, Make gods for us who will lead us. For this Moses, who brought us out of the land of Egypt, we know not what has happened to him.
Acts. And they made a calf in those days,  offered up sacrifice to the idol,  rejoiced in the works of their hands.
Acts. But God turned,  gave them over to serve the host of heaven, just as it is written in the book of the prophets, Did ye offer to me slain beasts and sacrifices forty years in the wilderness, O house of Israel?
Acts. And ye took up the tabernacle of Moloch,  the star of your god Remphan, the images that ye made to worship them. And I will deport you beyond Babylon.
Acts. The tabernacle of the testimony was with our fathers in the wilderness, just as he arranged (he who spoke to Moses), to make it according to the pattern that he had seen.
Acts. Which also our fathers, having received in succession, brought in with Joshua into the possession of the nations whom God drove out from the presence of our fathers, until the days of David
Acts. who found favor in the sight of God. And he asked to find a habitation for the God of Jacob.
Acts. But Solomon built him a house.
Acts. However the Most High does not dwell in man-made temples, just as the prophet says,
Acts. The heaven is to me a throne,  the earth a footstool of my feet. What house will ye build for me? says the Lord. Or what is the place of my rest?
Acts. Did not my hand make all these things?
Acts. Ye stiff-necked and uncircumcised in heart and ears, ye do always resist the Holy Spirit. As your fathers, ye also.
Acts. Which of the prophets did your fathers not persecute? And they killed those who foretold about the coming of the Righteous man, of whom ye now have become betrayers and murderers,
Acts. who received the law at directions of agents,  did not keep it.
Acts. Now when they heard these things, they were split with a saw in their hearts,  they gnashed their teeth against him.
Acts. But being full of the Holy Spirit, having gazed into heaven, he saw the glory of God,  Jesus standing at the right hand of God.
Acts. And he said, Look, I see the heavens opened,  the Son of Man standing at the right hand of God.
Acts. But they, having cried out in a great voice, held their ears shut,  rushed upon him with one accord.
Acts. And having expelled him out of the city, they stoned him. And the witnesses laid down their garments beside the feet of a young man called Saul.
Acts. And they stoned Stephen, who was calling and saying, Lord Jesus, receive my spirit.
Acts. And having knelt down, he cried out in a great voice, Lord, place not this sin to them. And after saying this, he slept.
Acts. And Saul was approving the killing of him. And on that day there developed a great persecution against the church at Jerusalem. And they were all scattered throughout the regions of Judea and Samaria, except the apostles.
Acts. And devout men arranged to bury Stephen,  they made great lamentation over him.
Acts. But Saul was ravaging the church, entering from house to house. Dragging both men and women, he gave them over to prison.
Acts. Indeed therefore those who were scattered abroad passed through proclaiming the good news, the word.
Acts. And Philip, who went down to a city of Samaria, proclaimed the Christ to them.
Acts. And the multitudes unanimously heeded the things that were spoken by Philip during their listening and seeing the signs that he did.
Acts. For of many of those who had unclean spirits, they came out, crying in a great voice. And many who were paralyzed,  who were lame, were healed.
Acts. And there became great joy in that city.
Acts. But a certain man in the city, Simon by name, was formerly practicing sorcery,  fascinating the nation of Samaria, saying himself to be some great man,
Acts. to whom they gave heed, from small to great, saying, This man is the great power of God.
Acts. And they heeded him, because he fascinated them for a considerable time with the sorceries.
Acts. But when they believed Philip preaching good news, the things about the kingdom of God and the name of Jesus Christ, they were immersed, both men and women.
Acts. And Simon himself also believed. And after being immersed, he was continuing with Philip. And seeing miracles and signs occurring, he was astonished.
Acts. Now when the apostles at Jerusalem heard that Samaria has received the word of God, they sent Peter and John to them,
Acts. who, when they came down, prayed for them, so that they might receive the Holy Spirit,
Acts. for it was not yet fallen upon any of them. They were only immersed in the name of the Christ Jesus.
Acts. Then they laid hands on them,  they received the Holy Spirit.
Acts. Now when Simon saw that the Holy Spirit was given through the laying on of the apostles' hands, he brought money to them,
Acts. saying, Give me also this power, so that on whomever I lay hands, he may receive the Holy Spirit.
Acts. But Peter said to him, Thy silver with thee, may it be for destruction, because thou thought to obtain the gift of God by money.
Acts. There is no part nor lot for thee in this matter, for thy heart is not straight in the sight of God.
Acts. Repent therefore from this thine evil,  beg God, if perhaps the thought of thy heart will be forgiven thee.
Acts. For I perceive that thou are in the gall of bitterness and the bond of unrighteousness.
Acts. And having answered, Simon said, Beg ye to the Lord for me, so that none of which things ye have spoken may come upon me.
Acts. Indeed therefore, having solemnly testified and spoken the word of the Lord, they returned to Jerusalem,  preached the good news in many villages of the Samaritans.
Acts. And an agent of the Lord spoke to Philip, saying, Arise,  go toward the south to the road that goes down from Jerusalem to Gaza. This is a desolate region.
Acts. And after rising, he went. And behold a man, an Ethiopian, a eunuch, a high official of Candace the queen of the Ethiopians, who was over all her treasure, who had come to Jerusalem to worship.
Acts. And he was returning,  sitting in his chariot,  reading the prophet Isaiah.
Acts. And the Spirit said to Philip, Go near,  be joined to this chariot.
Acts. And after running near, Philip heard him reading the prophet Isaiah. And he said, Do thou also really understand the things that thou read?
Acts. And he said, For how can I unless some man may guide me? And he encouraged Philip, after coming up, to sit with him.
Acts. Now the passage of the scripture that he was reading was this: He was led as a sheep to slaughter,  as a lamb, mute before shearing him, thus he opened not his mouth.
Acts. In his lowly condition his justice was taken away. And who will describe his generation, because his life was taken from the earth?
Acts. And having answered, the eunuch said to Philip, I ask thee, about whom does the prophet say this, about himself, or about some other man?
Acts. And Philip having opened his mouth,  having begun from this scripture, he preached the good news to him-the man Jesus.
Acts. And as they went on the way, they came to some water,  the eunuch says, Look, water! What prevents me to be immersed?
Acts. [This verse in not in the majority of the Greek manuscripts.]
Acts. And he commanded the chariot to stand still. And they both went down into the water, both Philip and the eunuch,  he immersed him.
Acts. And when they came up out of the water, Spirit of the Lord caught away Philip,  the eunuch saw him no more, for he went on his way rejoicing.
Acts. But Philip was found at Azotus. And passing through all the cities he preached the good news until he came to Caesarea.
Acts. But Saul, still breathing threat and slaughter against the disciples of the Lord, after going to the high priest,
Acts. he requested letters from him for Damascus, to the synagogues, so that if he found any who were of the Way, both men and women, he might bring them bound to Jerusalem.
Acts. And on going, it came to pass for him to approach Damascus. And suddenly there shone around him a light out of heaven.
Acts. And after falling to the ground, he heard a voice saying to him, Saul, Saul, why do thou persecute me?
Acts. And he said, Who are thou, Lord? And the Lord said, I am Jesus whom thou persecute.
Acts. But arise,  enter into the city,  it will be told thee what thou must do.
Acts. And the men who traveled with him had stopped, speechless, indeed hearing the voice,  seeing no man.
Acts. And Saul arose from the ground. And when his eyes were opened, he saw no man. But they brought him into Damascus, leading him by the hand.
Acts. And he was three days not seeing,  did not eat or drink.
Acts. Now there was a certain disciple in Damascus, named Ananias,  the Lord said to him in a vision, Ananias. And he said, Behold me, Lord.
Acts. And the Lord said to him, After rising, go into the street called Straight,  seek in the house of Judas, a man named Saul of Tarsus, for behold, he is praying.
Acts. And he saw in a vision a man named Ananias who came in and laid a hand on him, so that he might receive sight.
Acts. But Ananias answered, Lord, I have heard from many about this man, how many evil things he did to thy sanctified at Jerusalem.
Acts. And here he has authority from the chief priests to bind all who call upon thy name.
Acts. But the Lord said to him, Go, because this man is a chosen vessel to me, to bear my name before Gentiles and kings,  sons of Israel.
Acts. For I will give him a glimpse of how many things it is necessary for him to suffer for my name.
