John. And the world passes away,  the lust of it,  he who does the will of God abides into the age.
John. Children, it is the last hour. And as ye heard that the antichrist comes,  now many antichrists have developed, from which we know that it is the last hour.
John. They went out from us,  they were not of us. For if they were of us, they would have continued with us, -so that they might be made known, that they are not all of us.
John. And ye have an anointing from the Holy,  ye know all the things.
John. I wrote to you not because ye know not the truth,  because ye know it,  because no lie is of the truth.
John. Who is the liar if not he who denies that Jesus is the Christ? This is the antichrist, he who denies the Father and the Son.
John. Every man who denies the Son, also does not have the Father.
John. Therefore ye, let what ye heard from the beginning abide in you. If what ye heard from the beginning abides in you, ye also will abide in the Son and in the Father.
John. And this is the promise that he promised us: the eternal life.
John. I wrote these things to you concerning those who lead you astray.
John. And for you, the anointing that ye received from him abides in you,  ye have no need that any man teach you,  as the same anointing teaches you about all things,  is true and is no lie,  just as it taught you, ye will abide in him.
John. And now, little children, abide in him, so that when he is made known, we may have confidence,  not be shamed by him at his coming.
John. If ye know that he is righteous, know ye that every man doing righteousness has been begotten of him.
John. Behold what kind of love the Father has given to us, that we may be called children of God. Because of this the world does not know you, because it did not know him.
John. Beloved, now we are children of God,  it is not yet made known what we will be. But we know that whenever he is made known we will be like him, because we will see him as he is.
John. And every man who has this hope in him purifies himself, just as that man is pure.
John. Every man doing sin also does lawlessness,  sin is lawlessness.
John. And ye know that that man was made known so that he might take up our sins. And in him is no sin.
John. Every man abiding in him does not sin. Every man who is sinning has not seen him, nor has known him.
John. Little children, let no man lead you astray. He who is doing righteousness is righteous, just as that man is righteous.
John. He who is doing sin is of the devil, because the devil sinned from the beginning. The Son of God was made known for this, so that he might destroy the works of the devil.
John. Every man who has been begotten of God is not doing sin, because his seed abides in him,  he cannot sin, because he has been begotten of God.
John. By this the children of God are visible,  the children of the devil. Every man not doing righteousness is not of God,  he who is not loving his brother.
John. Because this is the message that ye heard from the beginning, that we should love each other.
John. Not as Cain. He was of the wicked,  murdered his brother. And why did he murder him? Because his works were wrong,  his brother's right.
John. Marvel not, my brothers, if the world hates you.
John. We know that we have passed out of death into life, because we love the brothers. He who is not loving the brother abides in death.
John. Every man hating his brother is a man-killer. And ye know that no man-killer has eternal life abiding in him.
John. By this we know love, because that man laid down his life for us. And we ought to lay down our lives for the brothers.
John. But whoever has the world's living,  sees his brother having need,  closes his bowels from him, how does the love of God abide in him?
John. My little children, we should not love in word, nor with the tongue,  in deed and in truth.
John. And by this we know that we are of the truth,  will assure our hearts before him.
John. Because if our heart should condemn us, that God is greater than our heart,  knows all things.
John. Beloved, if our heart should not condemn us, we have confidence toward God,
John. and whatever we may ask we receive from him, because we keep his commandments and do things pleasing in his sight.
John. And this is his commandment, that we should believe in the name of his Son Jesus Christ,  love each other, just as he gave command.
John. And he who keeps his commandments abides in him,  he in him. And by this we know that he abides in us, from the Spirit that he gave us.
John. Beloved, do not believe every spirit,  examine the spirits, whether they are of God, because many false prophets have gone out into the world.
John. By this ye know the Spirit of God: every spirit that confesses Jesus Christ having come in flesh is of God,
John. and every spirit that does not confess Jesus Christ has come in flesh is not of God. And this is that of the antichrist, which ye have heard that it comes,  is now in the world already.
John. Ye are of God, little children,  ye have overcome them, because greater is he in you than he in the world.
John. They are of the world. Because of this they speak of the world,  the world hears them.
John. We are of God. He who knows God hears us. He who is not of God does not hear us. From this we know the spirit of truth,  the spirit of error.
John. Beloved, we should love each other. Because love is of God,  every man who loves has been begotten of God,  knows God.
John. He who does not love does not know God, because God is love.
John. By this the love of God was made known in us, because God sent his Son, the only begotten, into the world so that we might live through him.
John. In this is love, not that we loved God,  that he loved us,  sent his Son, an atonement for our sins.
John. Beloved, if God so loved us, we also are obligated to love each other.
John. No man has ever seen God. If we love each other, God abides in us,  his love is in us, having been fully perfected.
John. In this we know that we abide in him and he in us, because he has given us from his Spirit.
John. And we have seen and testify that the Father has sent the Son, a Savior of the world.
John. Whoever acknowledges that Jesus is the Son of God, God abides in him,  he in God.
John. And we know,  have believed the love that God has in us. God is love,  he who abides in love abides in God,  God abides in him.
John. By this love has been fully perfected with us, so that we may have boldness in the day of judgment, because just as that man is, we also are in this world.
John. Fear is not in love,  perfect love casts out fear, because fear holds punishment,  he who is afraid has not been fully perfected in love.
John. We love him, because he first loved us.
John. If any man says, I love God,  hates his brother, he is a liar. For he who does not love his brother whom he has seen, how can he love God whom he has not seen?
John. And we have this commandment from him, so that he who loves God will also love his brother.
John. Every man who believes that Jesus is the Christ has been begotten from God,  every man who loves him who begot, also loves him who has been begotten from him.
John. By this we know that we love the children of God, when we love God and keep his commandments.
John. For this is the love of God, that we may keep his commandments. And his commandments are not burdensome.
John. Because everything that has been begotten from God overcomes the world. And this is the victory that overcomes the world, our faith.
John. And who is he who overcomes the world, if not he who believes that Jesus is the Son of God?
John. This is he who came by water and blood, Jesus Christ, not by the water only,  by the water and the blood. And it is the Spirit that testifies, because the Spirit is truth.
John. Because those who testify are three:
John. the Spirit,  the water,  the blood. And the three are in one.
John. If we accept the testimony of men, the testimony of God is greater. Because this is the testimony of God that he has testified about his Son.
John. He who believes in the Son of God has the testimony in himself. He who does not believe God has made him a liar, because he has not believed in the testimony that God has testified about his Son.
John. And this is the testimony, that God gave eternal life to us,  this life is in his Son.
John. He who has the Son has the life. He who does not have the Son of God does not have the life.
John. I wrote these things to you, those who believe in the name of the Son of God, so that ye may know that ye have eternal life,  that ye may believe in the name of the Son of God.
John. And this is the confidence that we have toward him, that, if we ask anything according to his will, he hears us.
John. And if we know that he hears us, whatever we may ask, we know that we have the requests that we have asked from him.
John. If any man may see his brother sinning a sin not toward death, he will ask,  he will give life to him, to those not sinning toward death. There is sin toward death. I do not say that he should make request about that.
John. All unrighteousness is sin. And there is sin not toward death.
John. We know that every man who has been begotten from God does not sin,  he who was begotten from God keeps himself,  the evil does not touch him.
John. We know that we are of God,  the whole world is set in the evil.
John. And we know that the Son of God comes,  has given us understanding, so that we may know the true. And we are in the true, in his Son Jesus Christ. This is the true God,  the eternal life.
John. Little children, guard yourselves from the idols. Truly.
II John
John. The elder to the chosen lady and her children, whom I love in truth,  not only I,  also all those who know the truth,
John. because of the truth that abides in us,  will be with us into the age.
John. Grace, mercy, peace will be with us from God the Father,  from the Lord Jesus Christ, the Son of the Father, in truth and love.
John. I rejoice exceedingly that I have found of thy children walking in truth, just as we received commandment from the Father.
John. And now I beseech thee, lady, not as writing a new commandment to thee,  what we had from the beginning, that we would love each other.
John. And this is love, that we should walk according to his commandments. This is the commandment, just as ye heard from the beginning, that ye should walk in it.
John. Because many deceivers have gone forth into the world, those not acknowledging Jesus Christ coming in flesh. This is the deceiver and the antichrist.
John. Watch yourselves, so that we may not lose what we have wrought,  may receive a full reward.
John. Every man transgressing,  not abiding in the doctrine of the Christ, does not have God. The man abiding in the doctrine of the Christ, this man has both the Father and the Son.
John. If any man comes to you,  does not bring this doctrine, do not receive him into a house,  do not speak to him to rejoice.
John. For he who speaks to him to rejoice, partakes of his evil works.
John. Having many things, I did not want to write to you by paper and ink,  I hope to come to you,  to speak mouth to mouth, so that our joy may be filled.
John. The children of thy chosen sister salute thee. Truly.
III John
John. The elder to the beloved Gaius, whom I love in truth.
John. Beloved, I pray for thee to prosper concerning all things,  to be healthy, just as thy soul prospers.
John. For I rejoiced exceedingly of brothers coming and testifying to the truth of thee, just as thou walk in truth.
John. I have no greater joy than these things that I hear my children walking in truth.
John. Beloved, thou do a faithful thing, whatever thou work for the brothers and for strangers,
John. who testified about thy love in sight of the congregation, whom thou will do well having helped send on their way worthily of God.
John. For they went forth on behalf of the Name, taking nothing from the Gentiles.
John. We therefore ought to welcome such men, so that we might become fellow workmen for the truth.
John. I wrote to the congregation,  Diotrephes, who loves to be first of them, did not accept us.
John. Because of this, if I come, I will remember his works that he does, prating against us with evil words. And not being satisfied in these, he himself does not even accept the brothers,  he forbids those who would,  expels them out of the congregation.
John. Beloved, do not imitate the evil,  the good. The man doing right is of God. The man doing wrong has not seen God.
John. Demetrius has been testified by all,  by the truth itself. But we also testify,  ye know that our testimony is true.
John. I had many things to write,  I did not want to write to thee by pen and ink.
John. But I hope to see thee straightaway,  we will speak mouth to mouth. Peace to thee. The friends salute thee. Salute the friends by name.
Jude
Jude. Jude, a bondman of Jesus Christ,  brother of James, to the called, sanctified in God the Father,  kept for Jesus Christ:
Jude. Mercy to you and peace and love be multiplied.
Jude. Beloved, making all diligence to write to you about the common salvation, I had need to write to you exhorting you to earnestly contend for the faith that was once for all delivered to the sanctified.
Jude. For certain men have sneaked in, those written about formerly for this condemnation, irreverent men, perverting the grace of our God into licentiousness,  denying our only Master God,  our Lord Jesus Christ.
Jude. Now I want to remind you, ye having known this once, that the Lord, having saved a people out of the land of Egypt, afterward destroyed those who did not believe.
Jude. And the agents who did not keep their own principality,  left their own habitation, he has kept reserved in eternal bonds under darkness for the judgment of the great day.
Jude. As Sodom and Gomorrah,  the cities around them, the same kind of way with these who indulged in fornication,  who went rear of queer flesh, are set forth an example, undergoing the punishment of eternal fire.
Jude. Nevertheless in the same way also these men who dream, indeed defile flesh,  reject lordship,  speak evil of dignities.
Jude. But Michael the arch-agent, when he disputed with the devil, contending about the body of Moses, dared not bring a railing judgment,  said, May the Lord rebuke thee.
Jude. But these men indeed revile whatever they have not seen. But whatever they understand naturally, as the irrational beasts, in these things they are corrupted.
Jude. Woe to them! Because they went in the way of Cain,  rushed to the error of Balaam's reward,  perished in the rebellion of Korah.
Jude. These are reefs in your love-feasts, feasting together, fearlessly tending to themselves, waterless clouds carried along by winds, autumn trees without fruit, who died twice having being uprooted,
Jude. wild waves of the sea foaming out their own shame, wandering stars for whom the gloom of darkness has been reserved into an age.
Jude. And Enoch also, the seventh from Adam, prophesied about these men, saying, Behold, the Lord came with his holy myriads,
Jude. to execute judgment against all,  to convict all the irreverent of them about all the works of their own irreverence that they have done irreverently,  about all the harsh things that irreverent sinners spoke against him.
Jude. These are grumblers, fault-finders, going according to their lusts,  their mouth speaks overblown things, marveling personages for the sake of advantage.
Jude. But ye, beloved, remember the sayings previously spoken by the apostles of our Lord Jesus Christ,
Jude. that they told you that there will be scoffers during the last time, going according to their own desires of irreverences.
Jude. These are those who make divisions, world-soul men, not having Spirit.
Jude. But ye beloved, building up yourselves in your most holy faith, praying in the Holy Spirit,
Jude. keep yourselves in the love of God, awaiting the mercy of our Lord Jesus Christ for eternal life.
Jude. And on some be ye merciful-being discerning.
Jude. And in fear save some, snatching them out of the fire, hating even the garment that was stained by the flesh.
Jude. Now to him who is able to keep them non-stumbling,  to present before his glory, unblemished in gladness,
Jude. to the only wise God our Savior, is glory, majesty, dominion and power, both now and into all the ages. Truly.
Revelation of John
The Revelation of Jesus Christ that God gave him to show his bondmen what must happen quickly. And he signified it, having sent by his agent to his bondman John
who testified the word of God and the testimony of Jesus Christ, as many things as he saw.
Blessed is he who reads,  those who hear the words of the prophecy,  who keep the things written in it, for the time is near.
John, to the seven congregations in Asia: Grace to you and peace from God, who is and who was and who is coming,  from the seven Spirits that are before his throne,
from Jesus Christ, the faithful witness, the firstborn of the dead,  the ruler of the kings of the earth. To him who loves us and washed us from our sins by his blood
made us a kingdom, priests to his God and Father, to him is the glory and the dominion into the ages of the ages. Truly.
Behold, he comes with the clouds and every eye will see him, even the men who pierced him. And all the tribes of the earth will wail against him. Yea, Truly.
I am the Alpha and the Omega, says the Lord, the God who is and who was and who is coming, the Almighty.
I John, your brother and companion in the tribulation and kingdom and perseverance in Christ Jesus, happened to be on the isle that is called Patmos because of the word of God,  because of the testimony of Jesus Christ.
I became in spirit on the Lord's day and I heard behind me a great voice like a trumpet
saying, What thou see, write in a book and send to the seven congregations: to Ephesus,  to Smyrna,  to Pergamos,  to Thyatira,  to Sardis,  to Philadelphia,  to Laodicea.
I turned there to see the voice that spoke with me. And having turned I saw seven golden lampstands.
in the midst of the seven lampstands, resembling a son of man, he who was clothed down to the foot,  girded about with a golden belt at the breasts.
his head and hair were white as wool, white as snow,  his eyes as a flame of fire,
his feet resembling highly refined metal, as in a furnace having been fiery hot,  his voice as the sound of many waters,
having in his right hand seven stars,  a sharp two-edged sword coming out of his mouth. And the sight of him was as the sun shines in its strength.
when I saw him, I fell at his feet as dead. And he laid his right hand upon me, saying, Fear not, I am the first and the last,
he who lives. And I became dead,  behold, I am living into the ages of the ages. Truly. And I have the keys of death and of Hades.
Therefore write the things that thou saw,  things that are,  things that are going to happen after these things.
The mystery of the seven stars that thou saw in my right hand,  the seven golden lampstands: the seven stars are agents of the seven congregations,  the seven lampstands that thou saw are the seven congregations.
To the agent of the congregation in Ephesus write, These things says he who holds the seven stars in his right hand, he who walks in the midst of the seven golden lampstands:
I know thy works,  thy toil,  thy perseverance,  that thou cannot tolerate evil,  thou examined those who say themselves to be apostles,  are not,  found them false.
thou have perseverance. And thou endured because of my name,  did not become weary.
Nevertheless, I have against thee because thou left thy first love.
Remember therefore from where thou have fallen,  repent and do the first works. And if not, I come to thee quickly,  will move thy lampstand out of its place, if thou do not repent.
But this thou have, that thou hate the works of the Nicolaitans, which I also hate.
He who has an ear, let him hear what the Spirit says to the congregations. To him who overcomes, I will give him to eat from the tree of life that is in the midst of the paradise of my God.
to the agent of the congregation in Smyrna write, These things says the first and the last, who became dead,  lived:
I know thy works and tribulation and poverty (but thou are rich),  the blasphemy of those who say themselves to be Jews,  are not,  are a synagogue of Satan.
Fear none of the things that thou are going to suffer. Behold, the devil is indeed going to cast some of you into prison, so that ye may be tried,  ye will have tribulation ten days. Become thou faithful until death,  I will give thee the crown of life.
He who has an ear, let him hear what the Spirit says to the congregations. He who overcomes will, no, not be hurt from the second death.
to the agent of the congregation in Pergamos write, These things says he who has the sharp two-edged sword:
I know thy works,  where thou dwell, where Satan's throne is. And thou hold firm my name,  did not deny my faith in the days in which Antipas was my faithful witness, who was killed among you where Satan dwells.
But I have a few things against thee, because thou have there men who adhere to the teaching of Balaam, who taught Balak to cast a snare before the sons of Israel, even to eat idol sacrifices,  to fornicate.
So also thou have men who likewise adhere to the teaching of the Nicolaitans.
Repent therefore,  if not I come to thee quickly,  will war against them with the sword of my mouth.
He who has an ear, let him hear what the Spirit says to the congregations. To him who overcomes, I will give him to eat of the hidden manna. And I will give him a white stone,  upon the stone a new name written, which none knows except he who receives it.
to the agent of the congregation in Thyatira write, These things says the Son of God, who has his eyes as a flame of fire,  his feet resembling highly refined metal:
I know thy works,  thy love and faith and service and perseverance. And thy last works are more than the first.
Nevertheless, I have against thee that thou tolerate thy woman Jezebel. She calls herself a prophetess,  teaches and leads astray my bondmen to fornicate,  to eat idol sacrifices.
I gave her time so that she would repent,  she did not want to repent of her fornication.
Behold, I throw her into a bed,  those who commit adultery with her into great tribulation, if they do not repent of her works.
I will kill her children in death. And all the congregations will know that I am he who searches the inner feelings and hearts. And I will give to you-to each-according to your works.
But I say to you, to those remaining in Thyatira, as many as have not this teaching, who do not know, as they say, the deep things of Satan, I do not cast upon you another burden.
But hold firm what ye have until I come.
he who overcomes,  he who keeps my works until the end, to him I will give authority over the nations.
he will tend them with a rod of iron (they will be shattered like ceramic vessels), as I also have received from my Father.
I will give him the morning star.
He who has an ear, let him hear what the Spirit says to the congregations.
to the agent of the congregation in Sardis write, These things says he who has the seven Spirits of God,  the seven stars: I know thy works, that thou have a name that thou live,  thou are dead.
Become thou watchful,  strengthen the remaining things that thou were going to throw away, for I have not found thy works made complete before my God.
Remember therefore how thou have received and heard,  be on guard,  repent. If therefore thou will not watch, I will come upon thee as a thief,  thou will, no, not know what hour I will come upon thee.
But thou have a few names in Sardis who did not defile their garments. And they will walk with me in white, because they are worthy.
He who overcomes, this man will be clothed in white garments,  I will, no, not erase his name out of the book of life. And I will acknowledge his name before my Father,  before his agents.
He who has an ear, let him hear what the Spirit says to the congregations.
to the agent of the congregation in Philadelphia write, These things says the Holy, the True, he who has the key of David, who opens,  none will shut it except he who opens,  none will open:
I know thy works. Behold, I have given before thee an opened door that none is able to shut it, because thou have little power,  thou keep my word,  did not deny my name.
Behold, I give of the synagogue of Satan, those who say themselves to be Jews,  are not,  lie, behold, I will make them so that they will come and bow down before thy feet,  may know that I have loved thee.
Because thou keep the word of my perseverance, I also will keep thee from the hour of trial that is going to come upon the whole inhabited world, to try those who dwell upon the earth.
I come quickly, hold firm what thou have, so that none may take thy crown.
He who overcomes, I will make him a pillar in the temple of my God,  he will, no, not go out any more. And I will write upon him the name of my God,  the name of the city of my God, the new Jerusalem (it comes down out of the heaven from my God),  my new name.
He who has an ear, let him hear what the Spirit says to the congregations.
to the agent of the congregation in Laodicea write, These things says the Truly, the faithful and true witness, the primacy of the creation of God:
I know thy works, that thou are neither cold nor hot. O that thou were cold or hot.
So because thou are lukewarm,  neither hot nor cold, I am going to spew thee out of my mouth.
Because thou say, I am rich,  have become wealthy,  have need of nothing,  do not know that thou are wretched and miserable and poor and blind and naked.
I counsel thee to buy from me gold refined from fire, so that thou may become wealthy,  white garments, so that thou may clothe thyself,  the shame of thy nakedness may not be made known,  eye-salve, so that thou may anoint thine eyes, so that thou may see.
As many as I love, I rebuke and chasten. Be zealous therefore,  repent.
Behold, I stand at the door and knock. If any man hears my voice and opens the door, I will come in to him,  will dine with him,  he with me.
He who overcomes, I will give him to sit with me in my throne, as I also overcame,  sat down with my Father in his throne.
He who has an ear, let him hear what the Spirit says to the congregations.
After these things I looked,  behold, a door opened in heaven,  the first voice that I heard like a trumpet, speaking with me, saying, Come up here,  I will show thee what must happen after these things.
straightaway I became in spirit. And behold, a throne was set in heaven,  him sitting upon the throne
similar in appearance to a jasper and a sardius stone. And a rainbow was around the throne, like an emerald in appearance.
around the throne were twenty-four thrones,  upon the thrones were sitting twenty-four elders clothed in white garments,  golden crowns upon their heads.
out of the throne proceeds lightnings and voices and thunders. And seven lamps of fire burned before his throne, which are the seven Spirits of God.
before the throne was like a glassy sea similar to crystal. And in the midst of the throne,  all around the throne, were four living creatures containing eyes in front and back.
the first living creature was similar to a lion,  the second living creature was similar to a young bull,  the third living creature having a face like a man,  the fourth living creature was similar to a flying eagle.
the four living creatures, one by one, each having six wings, are full of eyes around and inside. And they have no cessation day and night, saying, Holy, holy, holy, Lord, the Almighty God, he was,  who is,  who is coming.
whenever the living creatures give glory and honor and thanks to him who sits on the throne, he who lives into the ages of the ages,
the twenty-four elders would fall down before him who sits on the throne,  would worship him who lives into the ages of the ages,  would cast their crowns before the throne, saying,
Thou are worthy, our Lord and God, the Holy, to take the glory and the honor and the power, because thou created all things,  because by thy will they are,  were created.
I saw at the right hand of him who sits on the throne a book, written inside and outside, sealed with seven seals.
I saw a powerful agent proclaiming in a great voice, Who is worthy to open the book,  to loose the seals of it?
none in heaven above nor on the earth nor under the earth was able to open the book or to see in it.
I wept much because none was found worthy to open the book or to see in it.
one of the elders says to me, Weep not, behold, the Lion of the tribe of Judah, the Root of David, overcame to open the book and the seven seals of it.
I saw in the midst of the throne and of the four living creatures,  in the midst of the elders, a Lamb standing, like it had been killed, having seven horns and seven eyes, which are the seven Spirits of God being sent forth into all the earth.
he came and took it out of the right hand of him who sits on the throne.
when he took the book, the four living creatures and the twenty-four elders fell down before the Lamb, each having a harp and golden bowls containing incense, which are the prayers of the sanctified.
they sing a new song, saying, Thou are worthy to take the book and to open the seals of it, because thou were killed and purchased us from God by thy blood, out of every tribe,  tongue,  people,  nation.
thou made them kings and priests to our God,  they will reign over the earth.
I looked,  I heard as a voice of many agents all around the throne and the living creatures and the elders. And the number of them was ten thousands of ten thousands,  thousands of thousands,
saying with a great voice, Worthy is the Lamb that has been killed to receive the power,  wealth,  wisdom,  strength,  honor,  glory,  blessing!
every creature that is in the heaven,  on the earth,  under the earth,  is in the sea,  things in them all, I heard saying, The blessing,  the honor,  the glory,  the dominion is to him who sits upon the throne,  to the Lamb, into the ages of the ages. Truly!
the four living creatures were saying the Truly. And the elders fell down and worshiped.
I saw that the Lamb opened one of the seven seals. And I heard one of the four living creatures saying like the sound of thunder, Come and see.
behold, a white horse,  he who sits on it having a bow. And a crown was given to him,  he went forth conquering,  so that he might conquer.
when he opened the second seal, I heard the second living creature saying, Come.
another horse came forth, fiery red. And it was given to him (to him who sits on it) to take peace from the earth, so that they would kill each other. And a great sword was given to him.
when he opened the third seal, I heard the third living creature saying, Come and see. And behold, a black horse,  he who sits on it having a balance in his hand.
I heard a voice in the midst of the four living creatures saying, A measure of wheat for a denarius,  three measures of barley for a denarius. And thou may not harm the olive oil and the wine.
when he opened the fourth seal, I heard the fourth living creature saying, Come and see.
behold, a green horse,  he who sits on top of it. His name was Death,  Hades followed with him. And authority was given to him over the fourth part of the earth, to kill with sword,  with starvation,  with what is deadly,  by the beasts of the earth.
when he opened the fifth seal, I saw underneath the altar the souls of those who had been killed because of the word of God,  because of the testimony of the Lamb that they held.
they cried out in a great voice, saying, Master, Holy and True, how long do thou not judge and avenge our blood from those who dwell on the earth?
a white robe was given to them each,  it was said to them that they should still rest a time, until also their fellow bondmen,  their brothers,  those going to be killed as they too, would be fulfilled.
I looked when he opened the sixth seal,  a great earthquake occurred,  the sun became black as hairy sackcloth,  the whole moon became as blood.
the stars of the sky fell to the earth as a fig tree that casts its unripe figs being shaken by a great wind.
the sky departed as a scroll being rolled up. And every mountain and island were moved out of their places.
the kings of the earth,  the rulers,  the chief captains,  the rich,  the strong,  every bondman and freeman, hid themselves in the caves and in the rocks of the mountains.
they say to the mountains and to the rocks, Fall on us,  hide us from the face of him who sits on the throne,  from the wrath of the Lamb.
Because the great day of his wrath has come,  who is able to stand?
after this I saw four agents standing at the four corners of the earth, restraining the four winds of the earth, so that wind would not blow on the earth, or on the sea, or upon any tree.
I saw another agent ascending from the rising of the sun, having a seal of the living God. And he cried out in a great voice to the four agents to whom it was given to them to harm the earth and the sea,
saying, Do not harm the earth, nor the sea, nor the trees, until we may seal the bondmen of our God on their foreheads.
I heard the number of those sealed, a hundred and forty-four thousand sealed out of every tribe of the sons of Israel.
Twelve thousand were sealed from the tribe of Judah, twelve thousand from the tribe of Reuben, twelve thousand from the tribe of Gad,
twelve thousand from the tribe of Asher, twelve thousand from the tribe of Naphtali, twelve thousand from the tribe of Manasseh,
twelve thousand from the tribe of Simeon, twelve thousand from the tribe of Levi, twelve thousand from the tribe of Issachar,
twelve thousand from the tribe of Zebulun, twelve thousand from the tribe of Joseph, twelve thousand from the tribe of Benjamin, were sealed.
After these things, I looked and lo, a great multitude, which none could number, out of every nation,  tribes and peoples and tongues, standing before the throne and before the Lamb, clothed in white robes,  palms in their hands,
crying out in a great voice, saying, Salvation is in our God who sits upon the throne,  in the Lamb!
all the agents had stood all around the throne,  the elders,  the four living creatures,  they fell before his throne on their faces,  worshiped God,
saying, Truly! Blessing,  glory,  wisdom,  thanksgiving,  honor,  power,  strength, is for our God into the ages of the ages. Truly!
one of the elders answered, saying to me, Who are these who are clothed in white robes,  where did they come from?
I said to him, My lord, thou know. And he said to me, These are those coming out of the great tribulation,  they washed their robes,  made them white in the blood of the Lamb.
Because of this they are before the throne of God,  they serve him day and night in his temple. And he who sits on the throne will dwell among them.
They will hunger no more, nor will they thirst any more. The sun will, no, not fall upon them, nor any heat.
Because the Lamb in the midst of the throne will tend them,  will lead them to fountains of waters of life. And God will wipe away every tear from their eyes.
when he opened the seventh seal, silence occurred in heaven, like half an hour.
I saw the seven agents who stand before God,  seven trumpets were given to them.
another agent came and stood at the altar, having a golden censer. And much incense was given to him, so that he would give with the prayers of all the sanctified upon the golden altar before the throne.
the vapor of the incense, with the prayers of the sanctified, ascended before God out of the agent's hand.
the agent who took the censer, also filled it from the fire of the altar,  cast it to the earth. And there occurred thunders,  voices,  lightnings,  an earthquake.
the seven agents who have the seven trumpets prepared themselves so that they might sound.
the first sounded,  there occurred hail and fire mingled with blood,  they were cast upon the earth. And the third part of the earth was burnt up,  the third part of the trees was burnt up,  all green grass was burnt up.
the second agent sounded,  something like a great burning mountain was cast into the sea. And the third part of the sea became blood,
the third part of the creatures in the sea (those having lives) died,  the third part of the ships was destroyed.
the third agent sounded,  a great star fell from the heaven burning like a torch,  it fell upon the third part of the rivers,  upon the springs of the waters.
the name of the star is called Wormwood oil. And the third part of the waters developed into wormwood oil,  many of the men died from the waters, because they were made bitter.
the fourth agent sounded,  the third part of the sun was struck,  the third part of the moon,  the third part of the stars, so that the third part of them would be darkened. And the day did not shine the third part of it,  likewise the night.
I looked,  I heard one eagle flying in mid-heaven, saying in a great voice, Woe, woe, woe, to those who dwell on the earth from the remaining sounds of the trumpet of the three agents who are going to sound.
the fifth agent sounded,  I saw a star fallen from the sky to the earth. And the key of the pit of the abyss was given to him.
he opened the pit of the abyss,  smoke ascended out of the pit, like smoke of a burning furnace. And the sun and the air were darkened from the smoke of the pit.
locusts came forth out of the smoke upon the earth,  power was given to them, like the scorpions of the earth have power.
it was told them that they should not hurt the grass of the earth, nor anything green, nor any tree, except the men who have not the seal of God on their foreheads.
it was given them that they would not kill them,  that they would be tormented five months. And their torment was as the torment of a scorpion when it strikes a man.
in those days men will seek death,  will, no, not find it. And they will long to die,  death will flee from them.
the likeness of the locusts was similar to horses prepared for battle. And upon their heads were like golden crowns,  their faces were as men's faces.
they had hair like the hair of women,  their teeth were as of lions.
they had breastplates like iron breastplates. And the sound of their wings was like the sound of chariots of many horses running into battle.
they have tails similar to scorpions,  stings. And in their tails they have power to hurt men five months.
Having a king over them, the agent of the abyss, whose name in Hebrew is Abaddon,  in the Greek he has the name Apollyon.
One woe is departed, behold, two woes yet come after these.
the sixth agent sounded,  I heard a voice, one from the four horns of the golden altar before God,
saying to the sixth agent who has the trumpet, Loose the four agents who have been bound at the great river Euphrates.
the four agents were loosed, who were prepared for the hour and for the day and month and year, so that they would kill the third part of men.
the number of the armies of the horsemen was ten thousands of ten thousands. I heard the number of them.
thus I saw the horses in the vision,  those who sit on them having breastplates fiery red,  hyacinth color,  brimstone. And the heads of the horses are like heads of lions,  out of their mouths come fire and smoke and brimstone.
By these three plagues the third part of men was killed, by the fire and the smoke and the brimstone coming out of their mouths.
For the power of the horses is in their mouth,  in their tails. For their tails are similar to serpents, having heads,  by them they injure.
the rest of the men who were not killed by these plagues, did not repent of the works of their hands, so that they would not worship the demons,  the golden and silver and brass and stone and wooden idols, which can neither see nor hear nor walk.
they did not repent of their murders, nor of their sorceries, nor of their fornication, nor of their thefts.
I saw a mighty agent coming down out of heaven, clothed with a cloud,  the rainbow was upon his head,  his face was like the sun,  his feet like pillars of fire,
having in his hand an opened book. And he placed his right foot upon the sea,  the left upon the earth.
he cried out in a great voice as a lion roars. And when he cried out, the seven thunders uttered their voices.
when the seven thunders uttered, I was going to write. And I heard a voice from heaven saying, Seal up what the seven thunders uttered,  do not write them.
the agent whom I saw standing upon the sea and upon the earth raised his right hand to heaven,
swore by him who lives into the ages of the ages, who created the heaven and the things in it,  the earth and the things in it,  the sea and the things in it, that time would be no more.
But in the days of the voice of the seventh agent, when he is going to sound, even the mystery of God is finished, as he declared the good news to his bondmen the prophets.
the voice that I heard from heaven was again speaking with me,  saying, Go, take the little book that has been opened in the hand of the agent who stands upon the sea and upon the earth.
I went to the agent, telling him to give me the little book. And he says to me, Take and eat it. And it will make thy belly bitter,  it will be sweet as honey in thy mouth.
I took the book out of the agent's hand,  ate it. And it was sweet as honey in my mouth,  when I had eaten it, my belly was made bitter.
he says to me, Thou must prophesy again against many peoples,  against nations and tongues and kings.
there was given me a reed similar to a rod, saying, Rise,  measure the temple of God,  the altar,  those who worship in it.
leave out the court outside the temple,  do not measure it, because it has been given to the nations. And they will trample the holy city forty-two months.
I will give to my two witnesses,  they will prophesy a thousand two hundred and sixty days clothed in sackcloth.
These men are the two olive trees and the two lampstands, having stood before the Lord of the earth.
if any man wants to harm them, fire comes out of their mouth and devours their enemies. And if any man wants to harm them, he must be killed this way.
These men have authority to shut the sky, so that it may not rain the days of their prophecy. And they have authority over the waters to turn them into blood,  to strike the earth with every plague, as often as they may desire.
when they have finished their testimony, the beast that ascends out of the abyss will make war with them,  he will overcome them and kill them.
their corpses are in the thoroughfare of the great city, which spiritually is called Sodom and Egypt, where also their Lord was crucified.
out of the peoples and tribes and tongues and nations they see their corpses three and a half days. And they will not allow their corpses to be put in a sepulcher.
those who dwell upon the earth rejoice over them,  will celebrate,  will give gifts to each other, because these two prophets tormented those who dwell on the earth.
after the three and a half days a spirit of life from God entered into them,  they stood upon their feet,  great fear fell upon those who watched them.
I heard a great voice from heaven saying to them, Come up here. And they ascended up into heaven in the cloud,  their enemies watched them.
in that day a great earthquake occurred,  the tenth part of the city fell. And seven thousand names of men were killed in the earthquake. And the rest became afraid,  gave glory to the God of heaven.
The second woe departed. Behold, the third woe comes quickly.
the seventh agent sounded,  great voices occurred in heaven, saying, The kingdom of the world has become of our Lord,  of his Christ,  he will reign into the ages of the ages.
the twenty-four elders who sit before the throne of God, on their thrones, fell upon their faces and worshiped God,
saying, We thank thee, Lord God Almighty, who is and was, because thou have taken thy great power and reigned.
the nations were angry. And thy wrath came,  the time of the dead to be judged,  to give the reward to thy bondmen the prophets,  to the sanctified,  to those who fear thy name, the small and the great,  to destroy those who destroy the earth.
the temple of God was opened in heaven,  the ark of the covenant of the Lord was seen in his temple. And there occurred lightnings,  voices,  thunders,  great hail.
a great sign was seen in heaven. A woman clothed with the sun,  the moon under her feet,  a crown of twelve stars upon her head.
having in her womb, she cried out, suffering birth pains,  suffering to give birth.
another sign was seen in heaven. And behold, a great fiery red dragon, having seven heads and ten horns,  seven diadems upon his heads.
his tail drags the third part of the stars of the sky,  cast them to the earth. And the dragon stood before the woman who was going to give birth, so that when she gave birth he might devour her child.
she gave birth to a son, a male who was going to tend all the nations with an iron rod. And her child was taken up to God and to his throne.
the woman fled into the wilderness where she has a place there prepared by God, so that they may nourish her there a thousand two hundred sixty days.
war developed in heaven: Michael and his agents to fight with the dragon. And the dragon and his agents fought.
he did not prevail, nor was a place found for him any more in heaven.
the great dragon was cast out, the ancient serpent, called the Devil and Satan, he who leads the whole world astray. He was cast out to the earth,  his agents were cast out with him.
I heard a great voice in heaven, saying, Now it came to pass, the salvation,  the power,  the kingdom of our God,  the authority of his Christ. Because the accuser of our brothers was cast out, who accuses them before our God day and night.
they overcame him by the blood of the Lamb,  by the word of their testimony. And they loved not their life to the point of death.
Rejoice because of this, O heavens,  ye who dwell in them. Woe to the earth and the sea, because the devil has come down to you, having great wrath, knowing that he has little time.
when the dragon saw that he was cast to the earth, he persecuted the woman who gave birth to the male.
two wings of the great eagle were given to the woman, so that she might fly into the wilderness to her place. So that she might be nourished there for a time,  times,  half a time, from the face of the serpent.
the serpent cast water like a river out of his mouth after the woman, so that he might make her carried away by the flood.
the earth helped the woman. And the earth opened its mouth and swallowed the river that the dragon cast out of his mouth.
the dragon was angry toward the woman,  went to make war with the remnant of her seed, those keeping the commandments of God,  having the testimony of Jesus.
I stood upon the sand of the sea. And I saw a beast rising up out of the sea having ten horns,  seven heads,  ten diadems upon its horns,  upon its heads names of blasphemy.
the beast that I saw was similar to a leopard. And its feet were like a bear,  its mouth like the mouth of a lion. And the dragon gave to it his power,  his throne,  great authority.
one of its heads was as in death, having been killed. And its deadly wound was healed. And the whole earth marveled behind the beast.
they worshiped the dragon who gave authority to the beast. And they worshiped the beast, saying, Who is like the beast,  who is able to war against it?
a mouth was given to it speaking great things and blasphemy. And authority was given it to make war forty-two months.
it opened its mouth in blasphemy against God, to blaspheme his name and his tabernacle, those who dwell in heaven.
it was given it to make war with the sanctified,  to overcome them. And authority over every tribe and people and tongue and nation was given to it.
all who dwell upon the earth will worship it, whose name has not been written in the book of life of the Lamb who was killed from the foundation of the world.
If any man has an ear, let him hear.
If any man keeps in captivity, he goes. If any man kills with a sword, he must be killed with a sword. Here is the perseverance and the faith of the sanctified.
I saw another beast coming up out of the earth,  it had two horns similar to a lamb,  it spoke like a dragon.
it exercises all the authority of the first beast before it. And it made the earth and those who dwell in it so that they would worship the first beast, whose mortal wound was healed.
it does great signs, so that even fire would come down out of the sky upon the earth in the sight of men.
it leads my kind astray (those dwelling on the earth) because of the signs that were given it to do in the sight of the beast, telling those who dwell on the earth to make an image to the beast that had the sword-wound and lived.
it was given it to give a spirit to the image of the beast, so that the image of the beast would both speak,  would make as many as would not ever worship the image of the beast be killed.
it makes all, the small and the great,  the rich and the poor,  the freemen and the bondmen, that they would give them marks on their right hand, or on their foreheads.
so that not any man can buy or sell unless having the mark-the name of the beast or the number of its name.
Here is wisdom: He who has understanding, let him calculate the number of the beast, for it is a number of a man. And its number is .
I looked,  lo, the Lamb standing on the mount Zion,  with it a number, a hundred and forty-four thousand, having its name and the name of his Father, written on their foreheads.
I heard a sound from heaven as a sound of many waters,  as a sound of great thunder. And the voice that I heard was as of harpers harping with their harps.
they sing a new song before the throne,  before the four living creatures and the elders. And none could learn the song except the hundred and forty-four thousand, those who have been redeemed from the earth.
These are men who were not defiled with women, for they are virgins. These are those who follow the Lamb wherever he goes. These were purchased by Jesus, out of men, a first fruit to God and to the Lamb.
no lie was found in their mouth, for they are unblemished.
I saw an agent flying in mid-heaven having eternal good news to proclaim to those who sit on the earth,  to every nation and tribe and tongue and people,
saying in a great voice, Fear God,  give him glory, because the hour of his judgment has come. And worship him who made the heaven and the earth and the sea and springs of waters.
another, a second agent, followed, saying, Babylon the great has fallen, has fallen. She has given all the nations to drink of the wine of the wrath of her fornication.
another agent, a third, followed them, saying in a great voice, If any man worships the beast and its image,  receives a mark on his forehead or on his hand,
he also himself will drink of the wine of the wrath of God, which was mixed undiluted in the cup of his anger. And he will be tormented with fire and brimstone before the holy agents and before the Lamb.
the smoke of their torment ascends into the ages of ages. And they have no rest day and night, those who worship the beast and its image,  if any man receives the mark of its name.
Here is the perseverance of the sanctified. Here are those who keep the commandments of God,  the faith of Jesus.
I heard a voice from heaven saying to me, Write, Blessed are the dead who die in the Lord from henceforth. Yea, says the Spirit, so that they may rest from their toils,  their works follow with them.
I looked,  behold, a white cloud. And sitting upon the cloud, like a son of man, having a golden crown on his head and a sharp sickle in his hand.
another agent came out from the temple, crying out in a great voice to him who sits on the cloud, Send forth thy sickle and reap, because the hour has come to reap, because the harvest of the earth is ripe.
he who sits on the cloud cast his sickle upon the earth,  the earth was reaped.
another agent came out from the temple in heaven, also himself having a sharp sickle.
another agent came out from the altar having power over the fire. And he cried out in a great shout to him who has the sharp sickle, saying, Send forth thy sharp sickle,  gather the clusters of the grapevine of the earth, because its grapes are fully ripe.
the agent sent his sickle to the earth,  gathered the vintage of the earth,  cast it into the great winepress of the wrath of God.
the winepress was trampled outside the city,  blood came out from the winepress, up to the bridles of the horses, as far as a thousand and six hundred furlongs.
I saw another sign in heaven, great and marvelous: seven agents having seven plagues, the last, because in them the wrath of God is ended.
I saw like a glassy sea mingled with fire,  those who were victorious over the beast and over its image and over the number of its name, standing on the glassy sea, having harps of God.
they sing the song of Moses the bondman of God,  the song of the Lamb, saying, Great and marvelous are thy works, Lord God Almighty, righteous and true are thy ways, thou King of the nations.
Who will, no, not fear thee, O Lord,  glorify thy name, because thou alone are holy? Because all the nations will come and worship before thee, because thy righteous deeds were made known.
after these things I looked,  the temple of the tabernacle of the testimony in heaven was opened.
the seven agents came forth from the temple having the seven plagues, who were clothed in pure bright linen,  golden belts girded around their breasts.
one of the four living creatures gave to the seven agents seven golden bowls containing the wrath of God who lives into the ages of the ages.
the temple became full of vapor from the glory of God and from his power. And none was able to enter into the temple until the seven plagues of the seven agents were ended.
I heard a great voice out of the temple, saying to the seven agents, Go ye and pour out the seven bowls of the wrath of God into the earth.
the first went and poured out his bowl into the earth,  a bad and evil sore developed upon the men who have the mark of the beast and who worship its image.
the second agent poured out his bowl into the sea,  it became blood like of a dead man,  every living soul in the sea died.
the third agent poured out his bowl into the rivers and into the springs of the waters,  they became blood.
I heard the agent of the waters saying, Thou are righteous who is and was-the Divine-because thou judged these things.
Because they poured out the blood of the sanctified and prophets,  thou have given them blood to drink; they are deserving.
I heard the altar saying, Yea, Lord God Almighty, true and righteous are thy judgments.
the fourth agent poured out his bowl upon the sun,  it was given him to scorch men with fire.
the men were scorched with great heat. And the men blasphemed the name of God who has power over these plagues,  they did not repent to give him glory.
the fifth agent poured out his bowl upon the throne of the beast,  its kingdom became darkened,  they gnawed their tongues from the anguish.
they blasphemed the God of heaven from their pains and from their sores. And they did not repent of their works.
the sixth agent poured out his bowl upon the great river Euphrates,  the water of it was dried up, so that the way of the kings from the rising of the sun might be prepared.
I saw out of the mouth of the dragon,  out of the mouth of the beast,  out of the mouth of the false prophet, three unclean spirits like frogs.
For they are spirits of demons, doing signs that go forth to the kings of the whole world, to gather them together to the battle of that great day of the Almighty God.
Behold, I come as a thief. Blessed is he who watches,  keeps his garments, so that he may not walk naked,  they see his shame.)
he gathered them together into the place called in Hebrew, Armageddon.
the seventh agent poured out his bowl upon the air,  a great voice came forth out of the temple of heaven, out of the throne, saying, It has come to pass.
there occurred lightnings,  thunders,  voices. And a great earthquake occurred, such as did not happen from that time men came to be upon the earth, so mighty an earthquake, so great.
the great city became in three parts,  the cities of the nations fell. And the great Babylon was remembered before God, to give to her the cup of the wine of the wrath of his anger.
every island fled away,  the mountains were not found.
great hail, like a talent weight, descended out of the sky upon men. And the men blasphemed God from the plague of the hail, because the plague of it was exceedingly great.
one of the seven agents who had the seven bowls came and spoke with me, saying, Come, I will show thee the judgment of the great whore who sits upon the many waters
with whom the kings of the earth fornicated,  those who inhabit the earth were made drunken with the wine of her fornication.
he carried me away in spirit into a wilderness. And I saw a woman sitting upon a scarlet-colored beast containing names of blasphemy, having seven heads and ten horns.
the woman was clothed in purple and scarlet, adorned with gold and precious stone and pearls, having in her hand a golden cup containing abominations and the filthy things of her fornication,
upon her forehead a name written, MYSTERY, BABYLON THE GREAT, THE MOTHER OF WHORES AND OF THE ABOMINATIONS OF THE EARTH.
I saw the woman drunken from the blood of the sanctified,  from the blood of the witnesses of Jesus. And having seen her, I wondered with great amazement.
the agent said to me, Why did thou wonder? I will tell thee the mystery of the woman,  of the beast that carries her, which has the seven heads and the ten horns.
The beast that thou saw was,  is not,  is going to ascend out of the abyss and go into destruction. And those who dwell on the earth will wonder, whose names have not been written in the book of life from the foundation of the world, when they see the beast that was,  is not,  will come.
Here is the mind that has wisdom: The seven heads are seven mountains where the woman sits on them.
there are seven kings, the five are fallen, the one is, the other has not yet come,  when he comes he must remain a little while.
the beast that was,  is not, he also is an eighth,  is of the seven,  he goes into destruction.
the ten horns that thou saw are ten kings who have not yet received a kingdom,  they receive authority as kings one hour with the beast.
These have one mind,  they give their power and authority to the beast.
These will war against the Lamb,  the Lamb will conquer them, because he is Lord of lords and King of kings. And those with him are the called and chosen and faithful.
he says to me, The waters that thou saw, where the whore sits, are peoples,  multitudes,  nations,  tongues.
the ten horns that thou saw,  the beast, these will hate the whore,  will make her desolate,  will make her naked,  will eat her flesh,  will burn her with fire.
For God gave in their hearts to do his will. Even to do one will,  to give their kingdom to the beast until the words of God would be ended.
the woman whom thou saw is the great city having reign over the kings of the earth.
after these things I saw another agent coming down out of heaven having great authority,  the earth was illuminated from his glory.
he cried out in a mighty voice, saying, Babylon the great has fallen, has fallen,  became a habitation of demons,  a hold of every unclean spirit,  a hold of every unclean and hated bird.
Because all the nations have drunk from the wine of the wrath of her fornication. And the kings of the earth fornicated with her,  the merchants of the earth became rich from the power of her wantonness.
I heard another voice from heaven, saying, Come out from her, my people, so that ye may not participate with her sins,  that ye may not receive from her plagues.
Because her sins have reached as far as heaven,  God has remembered her iniquities.
Render to her as she also rendered to you,  double to her two-fold according to her works. In the cup that she mixed, mix two-fold for her.
In an amount she glorified herself and lived wantonly, give her so much torment and grief, because she says in her heart, I sit a queen,  am no widow,  will, no, not see grief.
Because of this her plagues will come in one day, death,  grief,  famine. And she will be utterly burned with fire, because strong is the Lord, the God who judged her.
the kings of the earth who fornicated and lived wantonly with her, will weep and will beat their breasts for her when they see the smoke of her burning,
having stood from afar because of the fear of her torment, saying, Alas, alas, the great city, Babylon, the mighty city! Because thy judgment has come in one hour.
the merchants of the earth will weep and mourn for her, because no man buys their merchandise any more,
merchandise of gold,  silver,  precious stone,  pearl,  fine linen,  purple,  silk,  scarlet,  all thyine wood,  every ivory vessel,  every vessel of most precious wood,  of brass,  iron,  marble,
cinnamon,  incense,  ointment,  frankincense,  wine,  olive oil,  fine flour,  wheat,  sheep,  cattle,  horses,  chariots,  bodies and souls of men.
the fruit of the lust of thy soul have departed from thee. And all the fat and bright things are destroyed from thee. And thou will, no, not find them any more.
The merchants of these things who became rich from her will stand from afar because of the fear of her torment, weeping and mourning,
saying, Alas, alas, the great city, which was clothed in fine linen and purple and scarlet,  adorned with gold and precious stone and pearls!
Because in one hour such great wealth was devastated. And every shipmaster,  every man who sails anywhere,  sailors,  as many as work by sea, stood from afar
cried out seeing the smoke of her burning, saying, What is like the great city?
they cast dust on their heads,  cried out, weeping and mourning,  saying, Alas, alas, the great city in which all who had ships in the sea became rich from her luxuriance! Because in one hour she was devastated.
Be glad over her, thou heaven,  the sanctified,  the apostles,  the prophets, because God has decreed your judgment of her.
one mighty agent took up a stone like a great millstone and cast it into the sea, saying, Thus in violence Babylon the great city will be thrown down,  will, no, not be found any more.
a sound of harpers and minstrels and flute-players and trumpeters will, no, not be heard in thee any more. And every craftsman of every craft will, no, not be found in thee any more. And a sound of a millstone will, no, not be heard in thee any more.
the light of a lamp will, no, not shine in thee any more. And a voice of a bridegroom and of a bride will, no, not be heard in thee any more. Because thy merchants were the chief men of the earth, because all the nations were led astray by thy enchantments.
in her was found blood of prophets,  of the sanctified,  of all who have been killed upon the earth.
after these things I heard as a great sound of a large multitude in heaven, saying, Praise the Lord, the salvation,  the power,  the glory of our God!
Because true and righteous are his judgments, because he has judged the great whore who ruined the earth by her fornication,  he has avenged the blood of his bondmen from her hand.
a second time they said, Praise the Lord! And the smoke of her ascended into the ages of the ages.
the twenty-four elders and the four living creatures fell down and worshiped God who sits on the throne, saying, Truly! Praise the Lord!
a voice came forth from the throne, saying, Praise ye our God, all his bondmen and those who fear him, the small and the great.
I heard as the sound of a large multitude,  as the sound of many waters,  as the sound of mighty thunders, saying, Praise the Lord! Because the Lord our God, the Almighty, reigns.
We should be glad and rejoice and give the glory to him, because the marriage of the Lamb has come,  his wife has prepared herself.
it was given her that she clothe herself in fine linen, bright and pure. For the fine linen is the righteous deeds of the sanctified.
he says to me, Write, Blessed are those who have been called to the supper of the marriage of the Lamb. And he says to me, These are the true sayings of God.
I fell down before his feet to worship him. And he says to me, See thou not. I am a fellow bondman of thee and thy brothers, those who have the testimony of Jesus. Worship God, for the testimony of Jesus is the spirit of prophecy.
I saw the heaven opened,  behold a white horse,  he who sits upon it called Faithful and True,  in righteousness he judges and makes war.
his eyes are a flame of fire,  upon his head are many diadems having names written,  a name written that none knows except he himself,
clothed in a garment dipped in blood. And his name is called The Word of God.
the armies in heaven followed him upon white horses, clothed in fine linen, pure white.
a sharp two-edged sword comes out of his mouth, so that he would smite the nations by it. And he will tend them with a rod of iron. And he treads the winepress of the wine of the wrath of the anger of the Almighty God.
he has on his garment and on his thigh a name written, KING OF KINGS AND LORD OF LORDS.
I saw one agent having stood in the sun,  he cried out in a great voice, saying to all the birds flying in mid-heaven, Come, gather together to the great supper of God,
so that ye may eat the flesh of kings,  the flesh of captains,  the flesh of mighty men,  the flesh of horses and of those who sit upon them,  the flesh of all men, both freemen and bondmen,  both small and great.
I saw the beast,  the kings of the earth,  their armies gathered together to make war against him who sits upon the horse,  against his army.
the beast was taken,  the false prophet with it who did the signs in its sight by which he led astray those who received the mark of the beast and those who worship its image. The two were thrown alive into the lake of fire that burns with brimstone.
the others were killed by the sword that comes forth out of his mouth (of him who sits upon the horse),  all the birds were filled from their flesh.
I saw an agent coming down out of heaven having the key of the abyss and a great chain in his hand.
he seized the dragon, the old serpent, who is the Devil and Satan, who leads the whole world astray,  bound him a thousand years.
he cast him into the abyss,  locked and sealed over him, so that he would no longer lead the nations astray until the thousand years were ended. After these things he must be loosed for a little time.
I saw thrones,  they sat upon them. And judgment was given to them and the souls of those who were beheaded because of the testimony of Jesus,  because of the word of God,  who did not worship the beast nor his image,  did not receive the mark upon their forehead and upon their hand. And they lived,  reigned with the Christ the thousand years.
The rest of the dead did not live until the thousand years were ended. This is the first resurrection.
Blessed and holy is he who has part in the first resurrection. On these the second death has no power,  they will be priests of God and of the Christ,  will reign with him a thousand years.
when the thousand years are ended, Satan will be loosed out of his prison.
he will come forth to lead astray the nations in the four corners of the earth, Gog and Magog, to gather them together to the battle, of whom the number of them is as the sand of the sea.
they went up on the breadth of the earth,  surrounded the encampment of the sanctified and the beloved city. And fire came down out of heaven from God,  devoured them.
the devil who leads them astray was cast into the lake of fire and brimstone, where also were the beast and the false prophet. And they will be tormented day and night into the ages of the ages.
I saw a great white throne,  him who sits upon it, from whose face the earth and the sky fled away,  no place was found for them.
I saw the dead, the great and the small, standing before the throne,  books were opened,  another book was opened, which is the one of life. And the dead were judged from the things that were written in the books, according to their works.
the sea gave up the dead in it,  death and Hades gave up the dead in them. And they were judged, each according to their works.
death and Hades were cast into the lake of fire. This is the second death, the lake of fire.
if any man was found not written in the book of life, he was thrown into the lake of fire.
I saw a new heaven and a new earth, for the first heaven and the first earth passed away,  the sea is no more.
I saw the holy city, new Jerusalem, coming down out of heaven from God, having been prepared as a bride adorned for her husband.
I heard a great voice out of heaven saying, Behold, the tabernacle of God is with men,  he will dwell with them,  they will be his people. And God himself will be with them.
he will wipe away every tear from their eyes. And there will not be any more death, nor grief, nor crying, nor will there be any more anguish, because the former things are gone.
he who sits upon the throne said, Behold, I make all things new. And he says to me, Write, because these words are true and faithful.
he said to me, I have become, I, the Alpha and the Omega, the beginning and the end. I will give to him who is thirsty of the fountain of the water of life freely.
He who overcomes will inherit these things,  I will be God to him,  he will be a son to me.
But for the cowards,  unbelieving,  sinful,  abominable,  murderers,  fornicators,  sorcerers,  idolaters,  all liars, their part is in the lake that burns with fire and brimstone, which is the second death.
there came one of the seven agents who had the seven bowls containing the seven last plagues,  he spoke with me, saying, Come, I will show thee the woman, the bride of the Lamb.
he carried me away in spirit to a great and high mountain,  showed me the great city, holy Jerusalem, coming down out of heaven from God,
having the glory of God, the light of it similar to a most precious stone, like a jasper stone being crystal clear,
which has a great and high wall having twelve gates,  at the gates twelve agents,  names inscribed, which are the names of the twelve tribes of the sons of Israel:
from the east, three gates,  from the north, three gates,  from the south, three gates,  from the west, three gates.
the wall of the city having twelve foundations,  on them the twelve names of the twelve apostles of the Lamb.
he who spoke with me had a measure, a golden reed, so that he might measure the city,  the gates of it,  the walls of it.
the city lies foursquare,  the length of it is as great as the breadth. And he measured the city with the reed, twelve thousand furlongs, the length and the breadth and the height of it being equal.
he measured the wall of it, a hundred and forty-four forearms, a measure of a man, that is, of an agent.
the structure of its wall was jasper. And the city was pure gold, similar to clear glass.
the foundations of the wall of the city adorned with every precious stone. The first foundation was jasper, the second, sapphire, the third, chalcedony, the fourth, emerald,
the fifth, sardonyx, the sixth, sardius, the seventh, chrysolite, the eighth, beryl, the ninth, topaz, the tenth, chrysoprase, the eleventh, jacinth, the twelfth, amethyst.
the twelve gates were twelve pearls apiece, each one of the gates was of one pearl. And the thoroughfare of the city was pure gold, like transparent glass.
I saw no temple in it, for the Lord God Almighty is the temple of it,  the Lamb.
the city has no need of the sun, nor of the moon, so that they might shine in it, for the glory of God illuminated it,  the light of it is the Lamb.
the nations will walk by the light of it. And the kings of the earth bring to them the splendor and worth of the nations into it.
the gates of it will, no, not be locked by day, for there will be no night there.
they will bring the splendor and the worth of the nations into it.
there will, no, not enter into it anything profane,  doing an abomination and a lie, since they are not written in the Lamb's book of life.
he showed me a pure river of water of life, bright as crystal, coming out from the throne of God and of the Lamb,
in the middle of its thoroughfare. And on this side of the river and on that was a tree of life, bearing twelve fruits, yielding its fruit according to each month. And the leaves of the tree were for the healing of the nations.
there will be no curse there. And the throne of God and of the Lamb will be in it,  his bondmen will serve him.
they will see his face,  his name is on their foreheads.
there will be no night there,  they have no need of a lamp and the light of sun, because the Lord God will illuminate them. And they will reign into the ages of the ages.
he says to me, These words are faithful and true. And the Lord, the God of the spirits of the prophets, sent his agent to show to his bondmen the things that must quickly come to pass.
behold, I come quickly. Blessed is he who keeps the words of the prophecy of this book.
I am John, the man hearing and seeing these things. And when I heard and saw, I fell down to worship before the feet of the agent showing me these things.
he says to me, See thou not. I am thy fellow bondman,  of thy brothers the prophets,  of those who keep the words of this book. Worship God!
he says to me, Do not seal the words of the prophecy of this book, for the time is near.
Let the man doing wrong still do wrong,  let the filthy man still be filthy. And let the righteous man still do righteousness,  let the holy man still be holy.
Behold, I come quickly,  my reward is with me to render to each man as his work will be
I, the Alpha and the Omega, the first and the last, the beginning and the end.
Blessed are those doing his commandments, so that their right will be to the tree of life,  they may enter in the gates into the city.
Outside are the dogs,  the sorcerers,  the fornicators,  the murderers,  the idolaters,  every man who loves and makes a lie.
I, Jesus, have sent my agent to testify these things to you for the congregations. I am the root and the offspring of David, the bright, the morning star.
the Spirit and the bride say, Come. And he who hears, let him say, Come. And he who is thirsty, let him come. He who desires, let him take the water of life freely.
I testify to every man who hears the words of the prophecy of this book, if any man should add to them, God will add to him the seven plagues that are written in this book.
if any man takes away from the words of the book of this prophecy, God will take away his part from the tree of life,  from the holy city, the things written in this book.
He who testifies these things says, Yea, I come quickly. Truly. Yea, come, Lord Jesus!
The grace of the Lord Jesus is with all the sanctified. Truly.
